sequence: This movie has all the ingredients of a great horror story and loses it in the last half. Few movies can actually give me chill bumps. This one did. Few horror movie give me a sense of dread. This one did. It kept me guessing. I cared about the story. I cared about the characters. The acting was decent. Unfortunately, about half way through the movie, the story just doesn't have many good directions it can go. It becomes evident that everything cool about the plot is going to self-destruct. It does.

The best thing I can say about the American version is that Jane Turner and Gina Reilly must be raking in the money for this crap. Yes, the American rip-off was shown for about two episodes in Australia but didn't rate; probably by curious viewers who were wondering how bad it would be. Answer: DEPLORABLE, a complete waste of time. The actors are relatively unknown and they don't take readily to the nuances of the Australian-written script. Bad luck for them as they are doomed to plummet with this turkey.

Mr. Kennedy should stop ExPeRiMeNtIng with bad movie scripts. What WAS he thinking? This is a movie that should not have passed the "hey, I've got an idea, let's make a sequel" stage of inception. If there was a ZERO rating, I'd give it, but I guess I'll settle for a generous 1. It seems these days that if there is a buck to be made, movie execs will dig up an old hit and run it by a set of writers and see what turns up. (Hey, I said "hit and run"!

This film with fine production values features secrets and how friends use each other . Henry May Long is a great director, he made this film with excellent acting, direction and a good story, it's really good! I'm really pleased with this movie and hope that you also will enjoy this. You can find it on DVD. It's one of the movies i'm really looking forward to watching and this year i'm also looking forward to watching other movies that will be released in 2015. Thank you for visiting my site. Peace and happy watching.

this is only the second time i have been moved enough to write a review . unfortunately , both times i have had problems getting the system up. this time around the system wasnt very happy . i have had to move the system in a different room from where it was on my desk and i think that was the cause of it being so slow.i was also given the choice to move to a new system , that would cost $300 . so i decided that since it was not the system that was causing problems , i would just have it fixed .

I've been strangely attracted to this film since I saw it on Showtime sometime in the early 80's. I say strangely because it is rather a ludicrous bit of soft-core fluff, a genre I'm not particularly interested in. The dialogue is pompously and nonsensically philosophical (making sense, no doubt, only to it's Franco-Italian producers)and the plot completely extraneous. What it does achieve is a wonderfully hypnotic and thoroughly pleasant mood. The scenery (the beautiful Philippines), soft-focus nudity and wonderful score all contribute to a strange and extremely watchable exercise in a sort of film making seldom seen today.

This BRASS EYE special PAEDO-GEDDON was swamped by complaints ( More on that later ) when it was broadcast in the UK in November 2009. So, what was it that got me so annoyed about it, you ask? Well, it would be a long story, but I’m hoping I can share some of that with you today. As well as all the usual complaints, it’s also got me a bit upset that there was no mention of how I was affected. This was not a simple matter of the eye being damaged, though.

I can get over the political parody; even if this was SUPPOSE to be a "Masters of Horror" flick.But, what I can't get over is the blatant usage of our war heroes (and their sacrifice) as pawns in some washed up horror maker's political statement.To me it was purely insulting to desecrate Arlington, and our heroes. I have family at Arlington. The idea that this guy (Dante) would even portray the Arlington graves being disturbed just makes me want to puke.I'm done with Dante, and done with MOH.

I have only praise for this film . From start to finish it captured the brilliance of Stephen Sondheim 's original score. This film has the ability to be enjoyed by both the classical and pop lovers. A wonderful film. This was a terrific film, that was very entertaining, and had a fantastic soundtrack. It's not an "easy" film to swallow, but it is so well written and acted, I couldn't wait to see it on video. This is one film that can be enjoyed by everyone! What a great movie.

This film is a very beautiful and slow film . There is nothing Hollywood about it . It is very different from the Hollywood films , because you will never see Hollywood stars in this film . I can see that this film has a very unique and beautiful story but it does not fit in the Hollywood mould . The acting is great . I really enjoy watching this movie . It has a great pace . It has great music . I can see that people from all over the world have enjoyed the film . 3.2 /
