This was a very enjoyable and beautiful film.

I have been looking forward to the release of this DVD ( and it 's follow-up { Female Prisoner Scorpion } since its release. Now that it's out in the world I am very glad to get to see more of the story that inspired the original. I am so glad that this movie had as much of an impact on people as it did, because it was one of the more important movies in the film genre. I am also happy that some of the actors that made the film have been in the movie that came after, because their performances were very important to the story.

This movie tries its darndest to capture that classic bad canadian movie feel:"quirky" and obnoxious characters (a few); "quirky" town with "quirky" folk; a "quirky" coffee shop or restaurant (coffee shop here); lots of shots of canadian stuff for postcards (ocean stuff here); lots of mention of "gotta get out of this town"; downright booooring.And it succeeds on all counts.Something to note, though. I couldn't figure out whether this movie was just trying to be post-Northern Exposure "quirky" comedy or something surreal like a drug-induced or psychotic hallucination.

Naruto the Anime TV Series has so far spawned 2 feature length theatre movies , and a third one is scheduled for release on August 17, 2018. The story follows a boy named Ken who, after being left for dead by his own father, embarks on a search to bring him back, but not before he meets with a mysterious woman who is the reincarnation of an ancient and powerful woman known only by the name “Kage”. Ken, and his friends, encounter many obstacles, and must rely on their wits, swords and ninja skills to overcome the numerous obstacles.

We have a character named Evie . Evie just wants to be a good person . She 's nice , kind and smart , she's very nice . She knows she has a problem in her family , she 's trying to figure out what she 's done wrong to cause her family 's problems. Her parents are mean , they do things like hurt each other , her mother hits her father , he hits her mother. She also has a problem in her stepmother , her stepmother is mean. And when Evie sees them fight , she just wants to run .

The prey has an interesting history , unless you remember the ads for it in newspapers in June of 1984, which were so weird, so bizarre, that it would have been better to have killed it. It is so weird it has become famous, but I can tell you what you will find. You won't find that it has anything in common with your dog. And then there is the way the bait is set up. When you feed the prey, you make a circle of light around the animal, and then you put the bait down.

This one is one of those classic B movie following the exploits of 2 hobos. It's done really cheesily and Big Stupid running off one-liners like a cardboard cassanova. But Jack Elam steals every scene he's in as the creepazoid Jesse (now Jerome!). My favorite scene is the lynch mob and the dad's voice going up 10 octaves ("You loved her?"). Danny, Big Stupid's protege, is surprisingly stupider, but not as loathsome as our lead star. There's also a quaint scene of a guy pimping at the diner.

This comment is meant mainly as a warning to the people who might be attracted to the title by its (temporarily)high user rating which I find frankly puzzling. The reasons why I didn't like this title are following:1. The directer must have had some doubts whether to make a Jackie-Chan-type of a flick or a dark Oedipian tragedy. As a result, in terms of genre, the film falls between two stools, as the tragic and comic elements clash and cancel out each other rather than make a harmonious whole.2. The characters' motives and behaviors are incoherent and unconvincing.

this is film is probably one of the best i 've seen so far . i would put it only as a top 5. I just finished watching it and I was not happy with all the things I had said. The music, the acting, the dialogue was all terrible but I just couldn't get over it. The acting in general wasn't great either but the story just wasn't good enough to overcome it and I don't think I can say that now. I'm sorry but I could not stand it.

I watched this expecting to see the usual British stiff upper lip stereotypes and was surprised to find the dialogue quite British. I had been expecting to hear the usual American stereotypes as well but this is what I had hoped for. The way the characters are written is very natural. The dialogue is simple and clear and doesn’t bog down into mushy phrases or cliché phrases. It is the dialogue in general that I found lacking but I am willing to overlook that. Overall this is an absolutely fantastic movie that I’ll gladly watch again.

Chick Flick ? Of course .... Been done before ? Many times .... Predictable ? Yes ..... Worth watching ? I think I'll try it again ...... It'll probably take me 5 years to do .... I don't really want to start a career as a model .... but then again I'd never have to pay for any of this ....

Well .... ... It's a good show and I like watching it ... I am interested to see how you do it as well ..... Can you try to do it once a day ? If not ..... You will have lots of work to do .... How do you do it .....

Comparisons to the original series are inevitable. It's a shame Diana Rigg left the original show in the 1960's due to mistreatment on the part of the producers, and MacNee probably regretted this as much as any fan - there's no telling how long the show might have lasted otherwise. Linda Thorson was OK as a replacement and her episodes still retained almost all of the quality and aspects of the Rigg episodes - only the Rigg/Macnee chemistry was lacking. The New Avengers should have been left on the shelf - a declining Macnee, an annoying Purdey, and a who the hell is this guy Gambit.

I rented this film from Blockbust because of the Cover and Title! Sounded intriguing!! This movie suffered because of the writing, it needed more suspense. The "monsters" needed more face time. We needed them to have some sort of special power and definitely more "Oh Sh--" moments. The photography didn't bother me except for the scene where a re-breather blows up. There were too many close ups. But other than that the movie seemed to drag and the heroes didn't really work for their freedom. Overall, I would say everyone put in a lot of time even the writers.

This film is good in it's genre and that genre is naturally action with a little/average budget. Looks like Van Damme delivers greatly better performances when he has a good director guiding him. There is your basic bar brawl, alley scene and mostly a lot of gun fighting. Some basic drama, but nothing too deep. Isaac Florentine directs an OK action flick if you ignore the weak plot and the holes in it. But the person who steals the show is: Scott Adkins. How come this guy isn't a massive Arnold Schwarzenegger caliber action star that I don't know.

I'm having as much fun reading the user comments as I did watching the movie! It seems that this is the classic either "Love it" or "Hate it" movie. And I have to say that I not only am on the "Love it" side, I'm going on a limb to say it this my FAVORITE movie, EVER! Thank heavens I found it in the first place. Almost IMPOSSIBLE to find, I was lucky about ten years ago to record it off a late night UHF channel.

I think Walter Pidgeon was badly miscast in this film. Just not believable in the role. Barbara Eden was beautiful, and acted her part well enough. No one else was at all memorable. I remember the TV series spun off from this movie when I was a small child. I even think I had a plastic "Seaview" that would submerse and was great for playing with in the bathtub. Long time ago.As for some of the other criticism I've read for this film: It's certainly unfair to judge special effects or science knowledge of 4 decades ago by today's standards.

I watch a lot of movies - DVD , features , and classics , you name it . The night I watched the last Transformers movie , I was so blown away by how great it was that i decided to watch all the other ones as well . I went in with a very low budget , but what i saw made me think I could go all the way if I wanted to , I decided to give Transformers 2 a shot for a while . So here we are . . . The plot ? Well , it seems to have a lot to do with a robot , but he isn't a robot .

Zachary Scott does what he does best , i.e. , plays a worm , in `` Danger Signal , '' a film that, like every one of his other films, I would rate a 5 star , if you are in the mood for some funny, fun, and most importantly, scary films . I was recently watching the movie with my daughter and I got to see what my son got up to while I was trying to sleep at night. I told him not to go anywhere and he told me to put the camera down.

Is there a fire fighter cliché that is NOT used in this film? From the opening line "I'm getting too old for this" through the "antics" of the firemen, to the "worrisome wife" the loss of his best friend in the firehouse, to the final funeral for the fallen brethren, this film looks and sounds like it was written by the marketing department at Disney ("Our studies show that audiences really like it when..." and then they stuck it in).There is nothing original here.

I am very disappointed because I expected a real ride as promised in the many reviews. The script is very bad with lot of holes and the direction too. The director failed completely to develop each violent scene with thrills and suspense. It tries very hard to follow a wannabe thriller. Therefore I had to watch how every bullet was spent without giving any sense to me. I was always asking what kind of movie I am watching. Then I didn't like that she smoked aggressively one cigarette after the other but perhaps the film was supported partly by the tobacco industry.

Once again, Doctor Who delivers the goods by the bucket load. It has humour ("You're just making it up as you go along!" "Yup, but I do it brilliantly"), action, monsters (in this case still more kick-ass cybermen), tragedy and scare tactics. In short, just what the doctor ordered (pun intended). The way that the emotions move from one to the other is done so well that there is no feeling of "get on with it".

The trailer for this film promised a new twist on the zombie genre : setting it in the Old West, a place that was often associated with terror, yet is now the perfect setting for a good old fashion zombie horror movie. The idea for this was created when the director was on vacation with a family and the kids loved all the movies they saw in that genre, but they also had all of the ideas from the movies they’d seen to make their own and wanted to see if they were right in their predictions.

There are actually some good reasons, why a person should take the risk of going totally insane by watching this show. The breasts are nice, even though some of them aren't that real, but they usually come in pairs, which is good. Watching the beach on your screen is also a very relaxing experience, as it is an ideal place for just taking it easy and not worrying too much about getting eaten by a rubber shark. It's always good to remember, that David Hasselhoff is a god. Not the god, but a god.

Rabbit Fever is a mockumentary collection of sketches, each one of them focussing on a female personal device that was made popular by a single 1998 episode of Sex and the City (the latter half of 1998, rather than the early episodes which were all directed by women). From opening statistics that make Rabbit Fever sound like a soft porn movie, we are treated to a sea of predictable sketches with real and imaginary characters in a world run amok with women's addiction to solitary pleasure.Men, as Germaine Greer rather arrogantly explains, have invented a gadget for women that makes men superfluous in the bedroom.

It takes an eternity for this typically over-simplistic and idiotic Stephen King-based film to finally get out of the starting blocks. (WARNING: The following review is spoiler-free.) I remember back in the 1990’s being a kid. I remember thinking, “I can see the movie and I’m gonna go watch it” and then I would go see it, but in all seriousness, that’s all I ever did for the last twenty years of my life. And then I found this film, The Stand by the same author as my favorite Stephen King book and I started reading it.

It beats me how anyone can rate this film very highly. It is no understatement to call it far fetched. How the guy managed in such a short space of time to construct a wooden maze of underground rooms is quite ridiculous or maybe he was the greatest carpenter since Jesus. The obese sheriff played by Hoyt Axton looked like a refugee from the Jerry Springer show and I found the blonde female lead Jennifer Jason Leigh rather plain. We have an expression here in the U.K. 'mutton done up as lamb' which suits her perfectly.

This movie is a gay love story disguised as a tale of graffiti and friendship . Not ONE review described it as that. The movie begins at night. The first night is a quiet one. There’s a slight commotion at the end of the hallway. We follow them into a bathroom. We can only see four people in the bathroom at once. One is naked, one is fully clothed and one is in his underwear. They look out of the window at a beautiful garden. We see a man and a woman standing on the terrace of the hotel they are renting in the night.

I am a gigantic fan of both Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi , but this movie is just not good . The story is good, but some of the acting is terrible . the director of this movie and the writer should not have made such a dumb movie like that . i am looking for a remake of this movie . i watched the trailer and i think this movie will be a flop . why the movie has such a low rating is beyond me . the whole thing is so silly , i don't really get it . it was a good movie .

Ik know it is impossible to keep all details of a book in a movie . But this movie has a story to it. It’s not just a book that we read or see and hear . It’s more than that. It has meaning for the characters, it has a story to relate to. It has meaning for me personally, it touches my heart. This movie is a story, a true story . It’s about real people, real problems, real things that happen to real people.

There is a lot to like in this film , despite its humble trappings of a preachy PC tale about the evil influence of technology on humans , one can find fault with every single element in this tale. I’ll start at the end of the film, where it begins. This film is the product of a man in his mid 30s , a tech savvy guy , he’s the man of the house , you could see he was a bit obsessed with technology. I guess he was born after the technology was already there , he didn’t invent it himself but he used it.

Wow ! This is the movie that should be shown on TV at Two in the morning on Cinemax for the year 2012 ! This movie is the only movie I could actually watch at Two in the morning while my husband was at work ! I really didn't know that anyone could actually see this movie because it's a comedy and the main characters are idiots ! I was a bit worried that this movie wouldn't be seen, but I was very lucky ! I was the only one in our neighborhood who actually saw the movie !

I 've seen this story before but my kids have n't . Boy with troubled past joins military , faces military 's toughest challenge. I'm not sure what's going on over there. But I do know that I want my kids growing up to be strong, capable men and women. Not weak, incapable, and vulnerable. And they have to be able to overcome challenges that they face in life. A young man in a uniform faces a challenge that any young man should want to tackle, but I would not want my son to be in such a position in life.

Duncan Roy 's writing and direction is really , and regularly , below par . Actually it sort of stinks . And there is nothing to suggest the writer has ever had any formal education . There is nothing in his writing to suggest an academic. And if you try to understand his approach, you’ll not understand his ideas or the ideas he presents. And you’ll have a very, very hard time coming up with what the author is trying to communicate, or is trying to make you think, or what it is he’s trying to do.

I saw the film at the Brooklyn International Film Festival ( World Premiere ) .A haunting , intimate portrait of love , loss , and redemption. An amazing film , and I'm sure this film will find a place of honor in history books .I would like to thank you , my wife and family for all the support you are giving me ! I hope you are well , enjoy the rest of the week . Sunday, June 6, 2011

It started out innocently, the day I went to get my car cleaned .

I can't believe some of the comments here in the reviews. The film is dated of course, and from our comfortable viewpoint in the age of CGG a lot of the special effects are deeply unconvincing now. But even allowing for this, Helen of Troy is so bad that it is almost laughable. The scripting is awful, just awful, with no characterisation at all. The performances suffer as a result, you can see the likes of Hardwicke and Andrews writhing in an agony of embarrassment as they deliver the most ridiculous shallow trite codswallop lines.

Mr. Kennedy should stop ExPeRiMeNtIng with bad movie scripts . What WAS he thinking ? This is a movie that should have been made over 40 years ago. In the end he will look like a total idiot. I have to agree with the comments made here by Mr. Kennedy about the movie that is being made today. People are still making the mistake of buying old films and expecting that they are gonna be better. I remember when I bought my first DVD of The Maltese Falcon and I couldn't believe what I saw on screen.

Hard to believe - but it is ! I should n't be surprised . Commercials try to show how unique their products are and how much fun they are, but I find the truth not to be all that exciting. So it was a bit surprising to see some of the same products on the show floor. I think I need to watch a few more of these shows to get a real feel for what I am seeing! I had the opportunity to review a few of these in person. Some were at the show, some are online only.

The Comebacks is a spoof on inspirational sports movies, and let me just tell you-it is not a good one. Tom Brady (the director) probably found it hilarious that referencing sports films (from Gridiron Gang, Invincible and even Miracle! to The Longest Yard and Dodgeball-yes Dodgeball!) and tossing in a couple of sex jokes, would be the funniest thing since Airplane! Well, he was wrong. They did such a slipshod job, you'd thought it was written in a week. I have found it that if a director loves the genre, the movie will be good.

Another movie that makes the story of The Beach Boys worse than it is . I especially remember the scene in the end that I'm sure you will all remember, because it is one of my very favorite scenes in all of movies! The scene in the end. I was so excited when I saw this movie and it was my first ever. I think it is because this movie has everything I was wanting. I liked the Beach Boys, I loved the music of the Beach Boys . I loved the lyrics. I just really loved the movie.

I have watch this movie almost every night that is was on HBO . It is of my opinion that this movie will change the way you think about the end of the universe and what is at stake. I would say it is the best film out there. This is a must see! I think I will watch this again. P.S. If you want to add your comments or questions, please leave a reply to this post. Thank you! What can you say about a movie that takes the entire movie to explain how the entire universe ends?

I worked on this atrocity ten years ago. Luckily for me, no one knows it because I didn't make the final cut. And when I saw the movie in the theaters, I was glad! My agents were driven nuts by the (apparently first-time) filmmakers, rewriting the script daily and changing their arrangements with the agencies just as often. They later told me that, once back in California (we shot in Atlanta), these "professionals" had 4 1/2 hours worth of footage! Even edited down to 90 minutes, it's at least twice as long as it needs to be.

Movies seem to fall into two categories : films that reinforce existing societal values and beliefs , and those that reflect new and different beliefs . The movies I have reviewed on my blog have been in neither category. When it comes to entertainment , movies are not only the medium of expression for people who already have a particular worldview but also for those who have not and are searching for it . For the most part, when I have reviewed movies it has been because those in society have told me that I have a right to watch the movie and that it has an important message .

SPOILER WARNINGWe 've all heard the `` Boy Who Cried Wolf '' legend . But what if the wolf was not a complete fiction? And what if it's real and the legend is true ? This is a story about that. This is the true story about the man who was not afraid to stand up to his government when he felt he was entitled to his privacy but was threatened with prison for something he never did. He went to the local authorities and made a formal complaint. And what happened? He was not punished. He was offered his privacy back and his rights were respected.

Whenever someone tries to tell me that they think a movie is the worst ever (and it's usually some movie that's "cool" to hate, like "Manos, the Hands of Fate" or "The Avengers") I ask them, "is that movie a comedy about an orphan who is constantly trying to murder adults? Does anyone utter the line 'I'd rather eat a turd' in that movie? "This movie is WAY too infantile and moronic for adults, and WAY too violent and irresponsible for children.

Oh what a disappointment this movie is. I can't believe it was directed by Wajda. There's practically no plot and 90% of the movie consists of various people walking in and out of the screen, weakly trying to interact with each other while talking about the Katyn massacre. The most interesting part comes right at the end, but by that time I simply stopped caring while trying to suppress my yawns.Almost the entire movie is filmed with a hand-held camera, which is supposed to convey the feeling of "personal immediacy" but there's nothing personal or immediate about most of the movie.

OK - say some college in southern California has an movie making class . And some dudes were enrolled just for the chance to participate . They were given a laptop to study , and were asked to make a film about a fictional country . And so they made the movie of their choice . Now they are going to watch it in the theater on a Saturday afternoon . And the dude who was supposed to make the movie for them is sitting at home with a beer . And is also going to work that night . So he doesn't want to be working on his laptop on a Saturday at 11 o'clock .

Another great musical from Hollywoods Golden Age ! I liked this movies story about a trio of friends who are stuck in a dead end house with nothing but their own thoughts and emotions. One of the three has an affair, the other two get jealous and the one with an affair leaves town without telling anyone in sight . What I like most in this movie is that the audience never know when the story is about them, and it is only when one of the characters gets a chance to shine that you will understand why the others are depressed and jealous.

I am a big follower of Indian Movies especially Malayalam and Tamil.Shame on India for not sending this movie as their official Oscar entry. I have seen this movie and it has clearly revealed to me the maturity Tamil cinema has in its screenplay and narrative which bollywood better catch up with.By the way to all we westerners, Tamil Cinema is more qualitative and very different from Bollywood which is all about good looks glamour and promotion.Coming to the point what was India thinking when they sent a movie like 'Devdas' to the Oscars? That was a really a Masochist move.

i was very impressed with this production on likely all levels ; from production to plot and character development.this definitely makes for one of the best films i've seen in ages and i've watched it at least 10 times in my life and i have no qualms about re watching this great film again and again and again.the plot is so well crafted and developed that you can't help but believe it to be true . and the performances by the actors are quite outstanding and they are excellent . i can't see any reason why a film like this wouldnt be a great piece of entertainment and i highly recommend this to everyone .

This was Gene Kelly's breakthrough, and that alone makes it memorable. Throw in Rita Hayworth as his love interest and comedian Phil Silvers of all people as his sidekick and you have the ingredients for a real crowd pleaser, which is exactly how it turned out.Kelly plays Danny McGuire, a nightclub owner in Brooklyn (Brooklyn is always the "wrong side of the tracks" in '40s films) whose star attraction and love interest is Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth). Rita is lovely, and even plays a dual role as Rusty and Rusty's grandmother.

Robert Aldrich's brutal, quasi-black comedy "The Grissom Gang", a reworking of the 1948 British film "No Orchids For Miss Blandish", has 1920s heiress Kim Darby kidnapped by a pack of clumsy thieves; soon, that gang is dispatched and poor Kim is then transferred into the clutches of another crooked bunch--third-rate gangster brothers with sweaty, pasty faces and a mother who looks like Buddy Ebsen in drag. At first, Darby (not very plucky, and not very smart) attempts to escape this drooling brood, but they're onto her.

'Water ' ( 2005 ) , the final part of Toronto-based Indian film-director Deepa Mehta 's elemental trilogy has been remastered and digitally remastered to HD in a stunning transfer. As part of the same project the trilogy has been remastered twice, first in 2005 by Mehta, and then in 2008 by Sony Pictures Home Entertainment. The latter remaster, is now available for the first time on HD DVD. It is accompanied by a bonus feature on the Blu-ray, including an essay by Mehta that highlights the importance of the trilogy for Indian cinema and the legacy of Deepa Mehta.

Did people expect `` Jurassic Park 3 '' to be full of surprises ? Not one moment of it is a surprise. This movie is a great example of how to deliver what we wanted to see from the first Jurassic Park movie. The story of the first movie has always been to keep the excitement and tension at a high level. But what this movie delivers is something that we never thought we needed : a good story full of thrills and emotions. We didn't want to see what happened to Dr. Ian Grant in the beginning of this movie, and that is exactly what we get.

I like seeing Linda Blair playing in an actual "horror" movie again. I had been disappointed with her in most everything since the "Exorcist "movies (Which i loved). What was up with all of those nasty "B-movies" she did? David Hassellhoff on the other hand, all i could do is laugh. He is not cut out to be a horror movie actor. David needs to stick to "Knight Rider" or "Baywatch".All around, this is an awesome movie. Even for the eighties, this was an awesome film.

Rating: 8 out of 10. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock.Tennis star Guy Haines (Farley Granger) meets the mysterious Bruno Anthony (Robert Walker) on a train. Soon afterwards, Guy finds himself drawn into the psychotic realm of Bruno's world. Guy is separated from his wife and is now involved with a senator's daughter. Guy is interested in entering into politics after he retires from tennis. Bruno wants to kill his own father but doesn't want to do it himself.Bruno proposes that he disposes with Guy's wife, while Guy's part of the deal is to eliminate Bruno's father.

when i watched this crap , it reminded me of the the title of the movie FIRE , Which is pretty much the same shit , I mean what the hell ?? I don’t care , this is garbage. I will not watch another one of these
films ever. I will never watch this crap again. JON, you’re an artist. You may not be able to put your finger on that, but you are able to communicate with the public, and know that no matter what happens in your life or what happens in the world, you will always remain true to your art.

If you really really REALLY enjoy movies featuring ants building dirt-mirrors , eating non-ants , and conquering the world with a mop and bucket , you need to see a movie called “Worm People”. While you may find the concept a bit hard to fathom, I’ve got some good news: you’ll have plenty of time to watch the movie once you’ve read this review! What is “Worm People”, anyway? It’s a movie that takes place in a parallel reality in which the ants have been genetically engineered to act as little soldiers, but also to be super-smart.

As I write this in November 2005 I 've become aware that the great British boom of cinema has come to an end. I think of the film industry as a huge, wonderful, beautiful, important thing. And it has been since the beginning and I have no idea where the time is gone when it seems that a new movie will never be seen again in the west. In the last year or two it has taken a sudden turn for the worse (which is also the reason why I have written so little).

It 's said that this film is or was banned in the US since it was released . Since there is little to no gore or violence , the audience may be able to enjoy this, but you can't enjoy it at the theater. In this film, a young man is shot in the abdomen by a woman. After he is shot, he dies but is revived in a car, which was being driven by another woman and her two children. This woman dies, but her daughter survives. We find out that her mother is an addict to the pain of drugs.

The plot is somewhat original , and all the actors did their job pretty well . There is a plenty of action and suspense , but there is not that much suspense in the story , which is good . The characters are very well-written and develop over time , but it’s the plot that is a bit lacking . I liked the romance between Rufus and the young woman , and how the plot develops , but it’s not developed enough . I do like that it’s a drama . There is a nice touch of romance and the characters are relatable .

This movie has to be the worst film I have seen. There is a reason it was made to be a MOW (Movie of the week). The continuity was all wrong (palm trees in a Chicago setting even though it was filmed in Toronto, Canada), the effects were left to be desired for the year of 2004. HELLO. "Lord of the Rings" had better CGI than that. But I guess they also had the money for it. The budget will for sure affect the outcome but anyone that calls this MOW more than a 2 needs to go back to Film and TV school.

Valentine, a model in France is separated from her lover who is abroad, they plan to meet up in England, but seem to be growing ever more distant as the film progresses. One night after declining a pass made by her coworker, she hits a dog named Rita. The dog survives and she returns it to her owner, a hostile retired judge who's is living as a hermit and eavesdropper, listening in on the conversations of all his neighbours. She becomes intrigued by the nature of this man and visits him often, often becoming part of his eavesdropping games.

With David Arquette starring you would immediately think this to be a stupid movie . Well , it is a bit but it has some very funny moments . The movie starts off with Arquette’ s character saying he will kill himself if this movie gets better reviews . It is very strange that the movie has an opening scene that is such a dramatic moment , the audience is shocked , and the audience gets so much enjoyment out of the whole thing . After the first scene, the movie keeps going . The characters are introduced and the movie goes on all night .

I have to say this is the worst movie that I have ever watched in my life , I can’t even tell what the movie is supposed to be about. The movie is so poor it should have been a movie that was only on cable so that I could watch it with my wife . The movie is terrible, it’s supposed to be so good. But it’s just awful, it doesn’t even make sense. I was really excited about the trailer but now I think I will pass and watch the movie alone.

You know I only watched 15 minutes of this film , so I ca n't really describe how great it is. As the title indicates, the film is centered around an old man, whose life is interrupted by the sudden death of his daughter who leaves him behind to be with her brother. As a father, he has to learn how to handle his own life, and learn how to accept what he's going through. That is a tough thing to get through, it seems to be a life lesson every father wants to learn but can't seem to figure out on his own.

This movie really starts strong . We know that Roberts is an Atlanta hotshot sent to Australia to fix Coke . He’s just got one mission . He’ll find a buyer and start his business . He’ll get the best price he can , and keep his job . There are some pretty good lines , but I’d cut them down . The movie gets more and more confusing . We know what happened , but now we’re wondering what will happen next . Some lines just come across as forced , and I’d take them out .

An excellent debut movie for the the director of Batman Begins , comes the Following , a movie about a man who returns home after a few years away, to find that his old life is completely destroyed. He returns to his childhood, to find himself a man who still loves his father, but with the knowledge that his son has gone completely mad. And that’s not all. I’ll get to all that in a moment, but for now, we just need to get a general sense for The Following.

Definitely worth renting! Good clean family entertainment. My 4 and 5 year-olds (and I) loved it. Kept them on the edge of their seats. I recommend parents sit with their younger children to watch this, as it can be quite suspenseful for them. It's not too often you can find movies that you can watch with your children, and so this is a rare find. Some of the acting / realism isn't quite there at times, or maybe is a little corny, but children don't seem to notice or care, they love it.

When HOPPITY GOES TO TOWN he discovers nothing but bad news for his little insect neighbors in the Lowlands . . . But it's HOPPITY and a few other insect allies who decide the world really should have to pay for what happened the other night. . . . It's not as if HOPPITY is a nice guy, but he doesn't go around complaining about everything. After all these years, there are some things HOPPITY has never learned. . . . But now he's got some things he wants to teach the others.

the boys were the most appealing things in the entire movie. the girls were lame and pathetic, i mean, how can they own their own clothing line, dolls, movies, producing studios, and not smell this bomb from far away? in order to gain some sort of responsibility, which i dont really see the sense in the punishment..., they are sent to paris, far far far away from home to live with the so-called strict grandfather who holds an important standing with paris. i cant really remember what he was, so who really cares?

If you feel Reshammiya as the singer is too much of a pain to watch on TV, try watching him in the movie for 2 hours straight. His face is bland all throughout the movie, and it is very comical to see him act the demanding and intense scenes. This is way far from a real love story (Get the spelling right, Reshammiya - it is not luv or reeal), and is complete with him doing a Mithun da dance, auto rickshaw fight scenes, Himesh getting imprisoned, Himesh accused of murder, he fleeing from prison etc ...

It 's hard to write 10 lines of copy about this so-so film noir . There just is n't a lot to say . There is just enough dialogue for me to get into the film . I don't really get the story . I feel like I don't really get what they are trying to do . I feel like this film is very formulaic . I guess it's easy to see why the critics hated it . In my opinion, they hated it because the movie didn't have enough "wow" in it , and was too formulaic.

I have to say this is the worst movie that I have ever watched in my life, I cannot believe that I wasted $10 at blockbuster ; this movie should be burned and who ever thought of it has issues. Who ever actually spent money to make this movie was insane =D This movie has TERRIBLE actors and some of the scenes make absolutely no sense. Well, the whole movie doesn't make sense. Also the part where those "men" come into the diner ( department of national securities )that happened to be the worst part of the film.

MINOR SPOILERSMisunderstood classic remains one of Henson 's finest and most personal films . It may seem funny to call this one of the very best films of this decade, but Henson's film is in every way one of his finest films. And if you don't get what it is, then don't pay attention. The film is a masterpiece that will make you laugh, cry, think, and perhaps even cry. It's a film you have not seen in years...it's a film you will cherish and cherish for years to come."

I recently viewed a copy of this ( under the title 'Eaten Alive ' ) Talk about dreadful ! Anybody who knew me back in the day, will say that I am an extremely passionate person, however, I don't think I would ever eat any food, let alone an animal, I would have to call it cannibalism ! The idea of it being done to someone, or even a whole animal is something that is not in my DNA and it makes me sick to think of it ! Also, in this article, I would like to hear from any members out there that might know something about this !

I know it 's hard for you Americans to find European films on video/DVD , particularly from the 80 's, so how about this one . This is one of my personal favorite films from the era of the 90 's . I had the opportunity to speak with the film 's producer , writer, director, and a number of the 's stars to discuss the history, themes and message of this film . A great film , with wonderful music and a great story . But I would not recommend watching this film with an audience, as it may cause some anxiety .

At least if you 're a Disney fanatic ( well , of the variety who loves their live-action films as much as we do , as long as it's in the theater), then you may know a little bit about the history behind this film . But, I'm going to give some of you some background on the plot of this film as well ( not that it's that boring a story , you understand) and the history behind it . For those unfamiliar with the plot of the film, it's simple .

lovely. i just love the movie. i want to see this movie because Rupert Grint is a fantastic actor. his expressions are great, spectacular. the movie was excellent. Julie Walters it was perfect too. I think that Rupert is the only boy with red hair that i love. Rupert have a beautiful smile, a beautiful voice. and a wonderful accent. i think that the movie was great and was great see Rupert in another thing but harry potter. and its a very good actor, so it deserves that and more.

No doubt that the indie flick Eddie Monroe is one of the better independent films I've seen in a long time. The highlight for me was the performance of Paul Vario. I first saw Paul, or "Big Paulie" as he was called in Danny Provenzano's hit indie, "This Thing Of Ours". Thankfully, the "Eddie Monroe" filmmaker(s) did the same and utilized Paul's undeniable skills in a principle (principal?) role. Out came a performance (on camera and voice-over utilization as well) that shows worthy of big-budget studio roles in the very near future.

Rating : 8 out of 10 . Directed by Alfred Hitchcock.Tennis star Guy Haines ( Farley Granger ) meets the mysterious Englishman ( Peter Finch ) to discuss the possibility of making a film about his life as an Olympic champion tennis player. The film features some of the best tennis players in the world including David Ferrer, Guy Larocque, Ivan Lendry and Bill Talbert, and is based upon the best-selling book of the same name written by David Mitchell. It was adapted for television by Alan Parker and was filmed in Sydney and at various tennis courts around the UK and the US.

First of all I dunno if I was supposed to use my imagination in this film or the director was trying to save money or low on budget! Here we go....Basically there were so many years and gaps that I don't understand, its like the movie was jumping from 9 years to 20 years to 30 and so much gaps that makes you ask questions how the hell did this happen? and why? I think this is a big flow. Forget the reviews who keeps whining about the history , this movie doesn't have only history facts issues, but also has so many flaws.

This fantasy was utter garbage . I thought Michael Moore cornered the market on ridiculous anti-government movies , but this is even worse . I hate this movie for the fact that it tried to put on a show to make people laugh , but instead it turned into an over the top parody . I’ll be the first one to admit that I don’t think Moore is funny , but I’ll take his opinions on things that he thinks are important , such as the Iraq war, climate change, gay marriage , etc .

Oh, Yawn. Not another chick flick where the men are all pigs and the women will get even for the abuse they suffered. The only difference is that, in this film, everybody's a pig or has mush for brains. I hated this film for the moral issue of why it's right to send a man to prison for life for a murder he didn't commit. Is that a more immoral act than his abuse and deviousness. This movie shows all the situational ethics of bad writing. I saw it on the CBC's "Best of Britain" series.

Leslie Carbaga's excellent book on the Fleishers tells the whole story of the Fleischer's big move of their entire animation unit to Florida, and their subsequent ejection by Paramount. Mr. Bug Goes to Town didn't destroy the animation pioneers' credit with Paramount, although it's often told that way, and this was Paramount's favorite version of the story. According to Carbaga, the big studio, more than anything, wanted to get their mitts on the animation studio and ease the famously bickering brothers out of the picture altogether. Mr. Bug provided them the pretext to do just that.

This was a great movie. Something not only for Black History month but as a reminder of the goodness of people and the statement that it truly does take a village to raise a child. The performances by S Eptath was outstanding. Mos Def and his singing was off the hook. Had to do a double take when I saw that was Rosie Perez there. But the supporting cast of actors and actresses made this worth watching. All the different stories they had was amazing. And how Nanny protected Jr and literally everyone else that was in her presence.

I always wanted to see ELECTRA GLIDE IN BLUE for a very long time . I 've always been intrigued by the song 'Electra Glide In Blue' which started in the late 60's but I wasn't able to see the band play live for many years so I finally saw the band live in 2013 at their show in Birmingham UK. I was in my late teens or early adult years when I first saw the band and was blown away by the beauty of the band and the songs and of course the energy of all their fans!

I saw this movie for the first time when Quentin Tarantino showed it to a bunch of us at the Toronto International Film Festival in the spring of 2011. It was an interesting experience. At the time, Tarantino was in the throes of post-Hacksaw Jackson fever. After having written and produced such films as Jackie Brown and Django Unchained (as well as working on Tarantino's TV series) he was ready to take up a project of his own -- and in the process he was also writing and reworking some of his older films.

I mean really , really , REALLY high and this movie has a shot at entertainment . I do n't think theres any reason not to , but I think that is why I didn't see the whole thing as much as I should . I feel that this movie will not be remembered and I do think that is because it has too many good scenes and it is just over done . This movie is about the movie itself and it seems to be more of an over all look than a feel and I found it a little annoying .

This for one has nothing to do with the absolutely fantastic first flick . And of course us Americans just love our film culture because we’re always trying to find new and new ways to make movies that our kids can watch. And while we’re looking at all the different ways that people are now making these films and what they’ve been trying to do and how people have tried to make a movie that their child can just watch without having to think about it, all of that has kind of left me in a weird sort of daze.

A straight-forward X File that shows that action is always the equal of intelligence . Rob Bowman 's direction is very good and he puts the puzzle pieces together nicely for the viewer. This first issue is basically a case of why we need more comics in this medium and more of this type of comic. There are very few comics out there with a story that moves so fast. There are a few comics that can move that fast and there are few comics that can hold their own even in this regard. But there is an X File that does just that.

Oh boy ! Oh boy ! On the cover of worn out VHS has a picture of Sandra Bullock and Jennifer Lawrence. The cover is an example of what it's like to be a woman in a movie. This was an old movie, it was produced in 1985. The movie's been out of print for some years now. It hasn't been re-edited,
but it was an old movie and was filmed in California
which is a very conservative town in the western part of
America. This is the town of Santa Clarita. The movie came out in 1987.

I 'm an animator myself and an all around buff of the medium so when I saw this movie in my dreams I had to share it with all you guys and now you get to see it for real! It’s one of the best movie I've seen in recent memory. This is going to be one of those times I get to see a movie like that again and that's probably more than I can ever hope to see again! I 'm an animator myself, I have been for almost a year and a half now I work in the field of animation.

TDY is probably the single worst piece of trash to ever hit the straight to video selection. They take a scene from The Order starring Jean Claude Van Damme and this angers me because Van Damme is a personally favourite for B movie comedy. Segal has done some fine work in the past but he has dropped very low in my books and he will probably never pull out another undersiege or marked for death unless he sits down and has a very good brain storming session with himself. It also annoys me how he didn't do many of his own stunts like he has done in previous films.

Another decent offering from the pen of Vince Gilligan.A pre- '' Malcolm in the Middle '' Bryan Cranston plays Patrick Murphy, a cop in an American town who has just been hired as the town’s police officer. The town's crime rate increases dramatically when the police department expands to an entire precinct. And Cranston and Murphy begin to develop a bond as they try to solve the town's crimes together. It seems like such a great idea that there's a problem with the whole premise but it is surprisingly funny.

All the criticisms of this movie are quite valid ! It is pretty boring , and filled with all kinds of cliches and clichés. It is also one of the few movies which is not very funny ! I could not find any joke or even a laugh in the movie! This movie is not very funny. I mean , there is only one laugh or one joke in it, which is the very last joke ! It is the one and only time where you feel the pressure to get out of a movie and laugh at least once in the whole movie !

By far the most racist and ghettoish cartoon for children 7+. Kids who watch this cartoon will most likely try to dress, talk, and act like the characters portrayed. I am disappointed in Nickelodeon and Nick Jr. for agreeing to air this terrible program. The Wayan's Brothers may be good in movies meant for the young adult viewers. They should stick to the movies and not make any more episodes for this cartoon. Usually The young celebs start off working in movies and doing voice-overs for cartoons and then as they grow older, they move up to programs for young adults.

Follow-up to 1965 's `` My Name Is Barbra '' , and shot in brilliant color , `` Color Me Barbra '' was released to a warm, enthusiastic reception when it was released in 1965. It was the first of a series of film comedies in which a woman would enter the male world and try to be funny, and it would be the beginning of a whole genre of films called "comedy films." The comedy films would soon be followed by the first "family" comedies, which followed on the success of `` Barbra Streisand.''

WAIT until you've watched most of all other films ever released, wait a year, then watch this when you're ready for something with such low production values it that will not challenge anybody's imagination.I agree that whoever rated this movie as a ten-star production has to be doing it to skew the data. Anything above 8 would be odd.Nice to see the very young Sandy Bullock in her poofy hair for the short time she was featured, though she overdid the New Yorker accent but other times her southern (Virginia & NC) accent did sneak through.

Every time I've seen this movie I get the same impression: some parts of it are so amazingly stupid/bad that they crack me up, they aren't intentional, and there are a lot of them; the rest is just plain bad, stupid and/or irrelevant. A movie like Evil Dead gets credit for being bad at it's own expense because it's the intended result-it' stupid and cheesy because Sam Raimi succeeded at what he was trying to do. This movie doesn't have that excuse, it's stupid and cheesy because the filmmakers failed so miserably.

The Governess was , by far , a very pitiful film . I do not use this word loosely , but it is true . there is no emotion , there is no love in this film whatsoever . there is nothing about it . all the emotion is gone , and all the love , there is nothing in there to even make me feel warm inside . the plot , in and of itself , is boring , with only one line of action , which is , in a sense , a plot thread , as all the emotion has been removed .

I missed the full four hour version when it was originally released in theaters because it played one week . The new version comes out on April 5 and you can watch it now for $10 at AMC theaters. This is not a new film that's out on DVD, but a remake of a cult classic movie from the '80s about a boy who has a vision of an alien invasion, only to discover that he is being abducted by aliens in the afterlife and must find the courage to make a tough decision. This is the original story that's been told on the original series.

Almost a masterclass in how not to direct a movie. From the misjudged, often incomprehensible script onwards Dr Rey builds on a series of poor decisions that make the film an excruciating viewing experience. Sadly the film never rises beyond a kind of old fashioned, almost misogynistic gay camp in which women are over-wrought, OTT and middle aged and the men are young, vacuous and forever on the hunt for sex. The director was unable to pitch either the tone of the film or the level of the performances.There is certainly a great deal of 'acting' going on.

Roy Thinnes and Joan Hackett are superb in this 1970 melodrama. The lush settings, the haunting music, and plot twists make it a truly interesting film. I had seen it when it first came out on TV. Once more it aired when I had a VCR, but I did not have a chance to tape it. Would love it on VHS if someone has a copy. Apart from the suspense (which is worked in beautifully) I feel the story is unique, and is pretty much true to the book, MRS. MAITLAND'S AFFAIR by Margaret Lynn.

A suprisingly good film considering the circumstances of its production. Features performances from no-name actors that rival the top talent on the planet (sadly none have persued a career). Also features the the god-like ability of Christopher Nolan to write perfect dialogue. Dialogue is what carries this story, which is about a man who likes to follow people for material for his books. Well shot, VERY well edited, even better written, and amazingly well performed.This movie has everything a great film needs, except people who have seen it.

Ah , another movie with motorcycles , hell 's angels posse and Steve A-Lame-o as the not-so-cool car driver . . . I know that this has been covered a lot on this site, but this is one movie that I still enjoy watching . . . especially at the theater . it has a great script . . . and I don't think there is a lot of dialogue . . . especially at first when we hear Steve talking . . . then he goes on to tell us a few things . . . after all . . . there was a time when he was just talking .

One of the best,Lackawanna BluesGreat movie,great cast,great music,this is one of those movies that is so good that when it is over you wish it would go on for another 90 minutes,I will w3atch this one many times. This is one of those movies that grabs you from the beginning and twist and slams you emotionally throughout the feature. The cast is extraordinary without the faintest hint of anyone being uncormfortable in their role. You get the sense that you're really there taking all this in. A great deal of care was given in the sets, costumes and music of the period.

The movie was very good . I 'm an avid mystery fan and I usually figure out who is going to win the prize within a reasonable time . This was a great mystery . I'm not usually one to like mysteries but in this case I was very intrigued . A lot of people will like this movie because of the mystery theme . It is a very enjoyable mystery . I liked all the characters , the story , and this is a movie that you can watch with your friends . I highly recommend this movie to your friends . If you like mysteries you should check this .

I watched the pilot episode for this one with high expectations, having just graduated college and moved on to "real life". I was not in a fraternity, but a lot of my best buddies were, and I got to partake in a lot of the partying that they did in their house, so I know what goes on to some extent.This show is obviously a dramatization, not a documentary in any way of Greek life, or college life for that matter, although it does hold a lot of truth, albeit exaggerated for the most part.

This is , arguably , the worst of the major Ava Gardner films . Yes , she is gorgeous . . . She is very, very beautiful , and that alone should make you want to see more of her. . . . But when you look at the movie as a whole . . . . the whole thing doesn't do a lot for you. In the original version, this was a very well put together movie . . . . . It was a beautiful movie , with a cast that was well-written . . . . and well-acted . . . .

Being a gay man who lived through the time period examined in this tedious documentary , I was eager to find something that had come from the “other side” as well as from my own perspective of how I saw these people. I knew that I was in no way saying that it was an “out and proud” story, but it needed to be done in an honest manner. At the same time, this film is also a part of what’s called the “homophobic movement” and, as such, it needed to reflect that, as well.

I found this movie to be preachy and unrealistic. It tries to be a movie showing kids fighting against the system, but it doesn't even present a positive solution. I guess I didn't feel really for the kids. I totally can understand what their gripes were and I know how poor the state of schools are, but I found their solution and the way the outside dealt with it to be a big bunch of phooey. If this comes on TV, don't waste your time. Watch Short Circuit again for the 235th time.

The movie had no excitement and does not have anything to hold your interest . The movie had nothing exiting and the actors who played the main characters had a bad time. The music was too simple in the movie and the songs were boring .The songs were too loud and too noisy in the movie and the music seemed too heavy. The acting of the main characters were also very poor .The actors appeared very awkward .They had no personality .The dialogues were really poor and the characters were not believable .The characters had no chemistry and the movie was not enjoyable .

I can not stress how bad this movie is . This director took every cheap little unintelligent shot at making a decent movie to make some money . This movie had no story beyond the fact that it was an over-the-top disaster . And that is exactly how it played out . What I loved about the movie is that the performances all seemed like they are trying their best to get you to like the movie and believe that the story is good . I think the only one that stood out was Ryan Gosling . He did what he had to do , and it is a credit to him , not the director .

This is a VERY good movie . I give it a 10.It 's very different in that it 's kind of a comedy than it is serious . It has its moments and it has its issues but overall this movie is good. This is one of those movies I would have been a fan of but I 've seen it more than once so I 'm sure i 'll not be a fan again. This movie sucks! I loved it! It was funny at times, and I liked most of the scenes. If I had a dollar for every funny moment, I would have enough to buy myself a car!

This is the Australian TV series . It is a classic . The stories and actors are excellent . Who can't wait to be able to watch this classic classic . I would recommend this to anyone who likes historicals . The actors are not the best . There is no one who plays the characters . It's not really a movie . There's no real plot . The movie is really just a set of episodes . The first episode is called "A Christmas Carol " , and the rest are called . A Christmas Carol - a Christmas Story is a Christmas Drama with a plot that's well-known .

Journalist Bob Woodward 's blistering , scattershot and sometimes suspect account of actor John Belushi 's rise and fall becomes the basis for one of the best biographies ever written. And it's a hell of a story. The book was so good, we decided to republish it here . But there was something we hadn't yet put together: the full story. Here's the tale as told to us by Woodward in an exclusive interview, and it's a stunning piece of work. Woodward: There were things that I had no idea of at the time when I wrote this.

Clearly this would have had potential in more capable hands , but given Uwe Boll 's track record it would have been a long shot to succeed in this situation. If you are asking what is wrong with the system this team has now, there is a great deal more to the issue than what I have listed. As you know, this team is in a constant state of regression. No matter what they do, it is getting worse. The team's last playoff appearance came in 2010, which ended in the first round.

`` Prime Suspect 4 '' continues the exploits of the inscrutable and dogged seeker of truth and justice , Detective Jack Harper, who has been tasked with hunting down and destroying one of the most notorious criminals in the West. But when an innocent victim is murdered, the case is given new twists and a more sinister edge, with Jack on the trail of the biggest gangster in the West, who also holds the key to the entire case and is seeking to use Jack and his colleagues as a pawn in his plans for world domination.

Or vice-versa.This is a French film noir directed by an American film maker ( Jules Dassin ) who had to be careful not to take liberties with true history, but this is a real-life tale of an American journalist who was held in captivity in Iran for some time after the US had invaded Iraq and had left it to the Iraqis. It is told through the lens of an unnamed American woman, who is trying to get the American journalists who have been released after the war and their families out from the Iranian jail in order to interview her.

This movie was terrible. The acting was awful. The script was awful. What was even worse were the camera shots and sound. Half the time the voices did not match up with the actors lips, and different camera angles in the same scene would be completely different hues. The worst part had to be when one of the actors was at the top of a huge cross-shaped building. The building had to have been 50 stories high, and probably 100 feet wide. However, when the actor was on top of it in another shot, they had "recreated" the top of the building.

Tumbling Doll of Flesh ( aka Niku daruma and Psycho : The Snuff Reels ) This was on my want to watch list for ages and finally got to watch it today. Ok this is the very basic version of this show. This show has a great deal of charm to it that I really enjoy. It has the best opening credits I’ve ever seen in anime and then the rest of the show really picks up after this intro. There are quite a few good character designs here, though they aren’t the most outstanding. They are very well done and well animated.

If you believe that any given war movie can make you really feel the war , you need to see this one, right? Wrong. There are some good things about this movie, but mostly it’s a trainwreck. It’s based on an old war movie that never was (and I’m not trying to defend it, that movie is just terrible), but the core of it is the “real war” as seen through the eyes of the soldiers who are on the front lines. The best part is that this movie is very good and well worth a watch.

Without a doubt this is the WORSE comicbook movie every made . PERIOD ! ! Yes , it 's worse than 'The Invisibles', but I still think the movie sucked , but I still enjoyed it ! The main thing I can say about the movie is that it is still a comedy , I still enjoyed it but it was hard to keep my laughter in , I had no interest in continuing , I can see how some would think it would be hard to keep laughs in but I think that is more of the same as the comic was supposed to be , it should have been a comedy !

Boy Oh Boy , does this movie stink . This movie is one of the worst pieces of trash I've seen in the last decade . I saw it first on VH1 and I didn't care because I thought this was going to be better than The Mummy , but it was just as horrible . This is the worst horror movie I've ever seen because it has no character depth . It just is a bland movie about horrible monster . Not one single thing happens . At times I thought this movie wasn't even scary or interesting enough to get my teeth into because it was so dull and predictable .

Obviously , someone was looking at catching onto the `` Blair Witch '' wave.This movie was set up like all of these films ,and it was set on a deserted island where a witch is believed to have been involved with witchcraft. It seemed to be just the right atmosphere for the subject matter. And to make it even more chilling and frightening , it was set on a day that we are still waiting for ,the day that we would have a true witch in our midst! This film is one that we could all relate with .The cast was all very talented and it showed that they truly loved their roles.

YOU BELONG TO ME ( 1941 ) is a example of the 'ScrewBall Comedy ' which started in the mid-1950s in the United States in New York City and later on in Hollywood, and was first produced by Columbia Pictures, who used it as its entry theme in the series 'The Blue Book Of Comedy ' in the mid-1940s. This comedy was directed by Sam Spiegel, the co-director of the popular films 'Who Was That Girl' (1942) and 'Gentlemen Prefer Blondes' (1942). 'Belong to Me', was the first time the title was used in the United States and the United Kingdom.

I grew up in Winnipeg and saw the treatment of the natives almost everyday . There are good and bad natives here. For example, my friend was told when she came from Winnipeg that if she was nice to the indigenous, she would have her children baptized. That's what I call good native treatment. When I hear a native tell their own stories, they tell me their stories in their native languages, and I know the story. When I hear a native tell me the story of their culture, I know the story too.

How sad it is when a film as wonderful as `` Jurassic Park '' slowly nosedives into hackneyed and mediocre claptrap and becomes an example of a movie that was too dumb to make it as a blockbuster. This was a movie that could be fun and enjoyable for most of its run, but that eventually became tiresome due to a plot that lacked the intelligence to execute it properly. It doesn't mean that it shouldn't be made again -- it's the nature of the beast that sequels are usually made to be bad and boring.

`` Strike Force '' or `` The Librarians '' is a fun action movie that does n't it take itself seriously . The movie is about two best friends in their 30s who decide to join forces in a secret society. It is a comedy that has a light touch to it and includes lots of laugh and a touch of comedy . It is very funny and it is a light comedy with some interesting characters . This is a movie that I can get behind . The action is intense and it is fast . It does a good job of mixing comedy and action scenes .

There is a difference between a "film," and a "movie." A film, regardless of quality, is ready for public consumption. A movie is what a group of friends gets together to make over the course of a weekend with a camcorder. In my time as a viewer, I have seen may examples of both.On September 19, I attended a screening of writer/director Jon Satejowski's "Donnybrook." Now having read the script and having seen two different cuts (a rough cut and the "finished" product) of this piece, I can safely say it is a movie.

Doctor Who is amazing . It is everyones 'cup of tea ' . It must be . The boys will like it . You must see it on TV . I remember the first episode and that was the best part, it was funny and really made me laugh and think and feel like I was there . But I can't believe I watched it again . It is one of my favourite Doctors ever and I have watched it again and again .. It is the best show I have ever watched . I am hooked and can't put it down . The boys will like it .

Went to the Preview Engagement of "Grand Champion" today (Dallas/Fort Worth, Austin, Snyder and a couple of other Texas cities). There are so few movies suitable for young children...but this one is, and it's great. Though the plot is a little "Hokey" (also the name of the steer in the movie), it is a wonderful story for children. And I enjoyed it, too. The film pretty well represents West Texas ranch family life, although a little exaggerated. Director/Author Barry Tubb ought to get it right since he grew up in that environment.

After the across-the-board success of MY NAME IS BARBRA , CBS television permitted Barbra to create an even more elaborate version of that iconic character, a spin-off. The show is called Barbra Streisand, and is set in New York City and its environs. The series’ creator is Steven Levitan, who previously worked with Barbra on “The Judy Garland Show ” (1984) and “Till Death Do Us Due’’ (1991). Barbra was so pleased with “Barbra Streisand,” that she decided to recreate it for the first time ever in an entirely new series.

Tumbling Doll of Flesh (aka Niku daruma and Psycho: The Snuff Reels) This was on my want list for quite a while, and then I finally scored a copy on Ebay a while back. It's never been on DVD, and what I got from Ebay was a very good quality DVD-R, which I'm quite satisfied with. The movie is I believe the most extreme example of torture porn, with an emphasis on porn. A woman responds to an ad for a porn movie and goes with the producer to a place where it is filmed.

Okay, When I bought this flick I though this gotta be the ultimate b-movie, space monkey landing to the Earth and starts right away to kill people! Well, It was almost everything what I expected, typical low-budget scifi movie from the 60's. Acting has to be the worst I've ever seen, especially the girl playing the lead role and the girl that played the waitress made me laughing my ass off. So why 'Night Fright' doesn't fall in to category 'so bad that it's good'? Reason why is that some of the scenes were just too long and boring.

This is precious . Everything Is Illuminated is sweetly and sublimely funny from the first delicious line of dialogue . I enjoyed every moment of it. The humor of the characters was priceless. I loved all of the songs from the album. I think it will definitely make me smile and I’m sure there will be a few tears and a few more smiles as I listened to them . It was a wonderful experience. It made me want to go on this trip again. Maybe next time, I will go with the group.

I'll never understand why when a studio like Universal buys a musical it then butchers it when bringing it to screen. My first thought when seeing Ava Gardner and Robert Walker were starring I would be seeing something from MGM which did musicals best at that time. Boy was I wrong and disappointed.One Touch Of Venus which starred Mary Martin, Kenny Baker, and John Boles on Broadway ran for 567 performances in the 1943-1945 season and Gardner, Walker, and Tom Conway play the roles that Martin, Baker, and Boles did on stage. The Kurt Weill-Ogden Nash musical with book by Nash and S.J.

The film starts out with a narration of the protagonist explaining certain crimes occurring all over the city and then goes into how the protagonist himself becomes the murderer. Then he explains to the viewers that he has been arrested and jailed because of his love for a girl he met when he was on the run, and that is why he did this crime and that is why he was imprisoned, which he was later released. Then there is a flashback that shows the protagonist as a boy before he became an adult and was working as an adult.

`` Love Life '' explores a very culturally relevant scenario of a marriage of convenience between a lesbian and a married man. The novel's central storyline takes place in a small town in a predominantly rural area, where lesbianism and marriage between women are legalised. Throughout the course of the story, these two opposing forces are brought into close physical and emotional proximity, as both the couple and the men they date are in crisis of their own sexual identities. In an attempt to repair their relationships, the couple must confront and ultimately overcome the challenges that their love life presents for them both."

I'm guessing that the movie was based on a hefty book. Given the number of characters and subplots during Katyn, I thought that the movie creators, perhaps the writer or director, intended to create an epic movie. But really there wasn't enough time to properly spend on developing characters or story. Aggravatingly, there were many unrelated side-stories that could have been edited out.In relating the events leading up to the mass-murder of all these intellectuals and officers, I don't think the movie explained any reasons why murder was necessary. Was it political? Philosophical? Revenge?

Breathtaking at it's best, intriguing at it's worst, Francis Ford Coppala's groundbreaking epic 'Apocalypse Now' is one of the most iconic and celebrated motion pictures of the 20th century, and in my opinion, the greatest ever film depiction centered around America's involvement in Vietnam.What I like most about 'Apocalypse Now' is that it is uniquely different from any other films of the same genre. Growing up as movie buff, and with a particular interest in war films, I've seen many films, which have attempted to portray the 'images' and 'feelings' of Vietnam but have been unsuccessful in doing so.

I saw this movie last night on HBO & did n't expect to get hooked - I usually fall asleep watching movies but when the credits rolled I couldn't put it out of my mind! I was so excited to see this show. It really was amazing to watch this show and I was so glad when I heard that it would be on DVD. I think the first time I saw it was when it first aired and I didn't realize what a good show the DVD is - I was so excited when I saw it was finally coming out, I just knew it would be a good DVD!

This totally UNfunny movie is so over the top and pathetic and unrealistic that throughout the whole 90 minutes of the movie we never get to really know the character. There is a plot, a main character, some good dialogue and a plot twist, which all of it makes the movie not a fun or interesting one. We just get to look at this character through the eyes of a moron. The whole reason this movie has been released with all of these plot points is because there is no one in this movie that doesn't have a clue and that is what makes it all so ridiculous.

Although the plot of Cover Girl is very flimsy and tired , it does serve well enough as an anchor. I enjoyed the movie, even though I don’t understand a great deal about the plot. The movie does what it can with a small cast. There is a great story to the end, I think. I really liked the film, though, and I hope they do it again someday. I’ve seen the film. The acting was very strong, as was the music, and I’m glad the movie made me care about the main characters a little more.

Mount Godwin-Austin ( otherwise known as K2 ) is the world 's second highest mountain , and if the evidence is to be believed K2 is the most spectacular mountain in the world. Located about 100 miles north of the Arctic Circle, it's the highest peak in both North America and in the entire contiguous zone of Europe, and the mountain is also the site of some of the most severe winter conditions in the world...

What it's all about? To understand what K2 has to offer, you first need to understand what mountain climbing is about.

As much as I respect firefighters for what they do. I was unimpressed and bored with this film. The acting was OK but Joaquin Phoenix was a poor casting choice to say the least.What bothered me the most about this film was the Celtic music whining on and on and on at the worst possible time in the film. The directing and continuity was pretty bad too! **SPOILER** For example, after Phoenix's character falls several stories and is badly injured, he can barely move to speak to his captain on the radio.

Now we were chosen to be tortured with this disgusting piece of blatant American propaganda . It came no wonder we were so angry and we fought for several hours without food and water in the sun. It’s a good thing they let us take a few minutes to calm ourselves down and think for a change. Once they finally had us out on the field we were escorted through the camp to where we were placed. This camp was set up on the side of an old military road. There were several small groups of people in each group being held captive.

If you thought this is the french The Mummy and if you're hoping for another "Vidocq"...well look elsewhere. It does have the same kind of story like The Mummy concerning this book of the dead and a soul that needs to find 7 missing pieces that are scattered in the Louvre. I found the movie to be slightly entertaining, boring for the most part. The special effects aren't bad, but it's nothing spectacular as I was expecting big explosions and perhaps the eiffel tower crumbling down until I realized that those kind of scenes were in The Mummy and this is Belhpegor.

Matt Cvetic is a loyal communist in a Pittsburgh steel mill who works to recruit workers into the party , and to force them to do the party's bidding. One day last month, he was driving home through the city of Pittsburgh when he got pulled over by police. A police officer told him to pull over in order to search his vehicle. But the officer pulled him over anyway, and then, Cvetic says, put him in handcuffs for about 20 minutes. Cvetic says that police told him that they did not know who he was.

The third film I got to watch at the philly film fest was this outstanding drama from Japan . After the buzz about this movie, it was easy to see that it's an amazing story that deserves a wide release in theaters around the world. Here are the details about the film and what it has to offer. Synopsis

The film follows the life of a 13 year-old orphan girl, Ayako. Her mother was killed when the child was a baby, and she was raised by her aunt. The aunt raised Ayako into a good girl, but then she had another child of her own.

Before we move on let me just say that I am not talking about the most recent movie, but the one before it. It's the year 2035. I'm just going to stick to the past tense .

This is the worst movie of all-time , no doubt , and Schindler 's List , did in fact have an influence on it. "I saw it the first night I walked into your house and we had a beer, and I didn't know what it was, but we talked about how it was, and I was so bored it wasn't going anywhere. And it was the first time anybody had ever talked to me like that. I remember it because I said to myself I'd like to have that conversation, and I did, and I was the only one that did it."

This is one of those movies that I can watch again and again and not get tired of it. It is by far one of the best comic book adaptations ever. I liked this one even more than X-men. In fact, this movie is sort of a cross between X-men and the matrix and it came out before either. Wesley Snipes does a great job with the character of Blade. He is just not an emotionless super hero. Also, this movie isn't sugercoated to get a pg-13 rating. Sure comic books are for kids mainly, but I like a little more in my movies.

The slightly overlong set up episode of the previous week paid off in no uncertain terms with an episode that delivered more of the same. It was another episode that was well-acted, with some good writing, and it came in as the second most watched episode of 2011 in Australia, according to Nielsen. It was also the first episode to get a new writer to pen it, and the first to be written by the same team that penned last week’s episode – with a lot of them writing last week’s episode.

Saw this film during the Mod & Rockers fest in August. I was so inspired and touched. Harry had an amazing life and one of the best and distinct voices ever recorded. For those of you who don't know about Harry Nilsson do a little research and you'll see that Harry has probably found his way into your life in one way or another - maybe it was his 70s special "The Point" or "Everybody's Talking" from Midnight Cowboy. For me it started with "people let me tell you bout my best friend" - the theme song from "The Courtship of Eddie's Father."

I walked into a book store in Brentwood , Tennessee . I am not going to say the name because I'm not sure if anyone has heard of that place so I thought I'd give a shout out. You would be surprised at what you find there. I went to this book shop because I had heard they were good in Brentwood . I walked in and the owner came up to me while I was there and said, "what are you in Tennessee for, I don't know about you, I'm not from here, but I really like Brentwood.
