Altioklar 's populist approach manifests itself in all his titles , from the worst to the best . He does not hesitate when the public mood is right , and gives full scope to his critics . He has been very successful in all areas except economics . In politics it is hard to find an example of his success . At least , we have seen very little of him in that field . Why does he have such popularity and power in politics ? The first reason is very obvious , as is the second : he is an educated man , an able and honest man, who does not resort to empty rhetoric .

I 'm a big fan of the demonic puppets . Looking at the surface of this one , it looks a bit more than just a kid's toy . So much to see and do with this , you will not want to be in the dark for too long . Overall , I love this . So much fun to play . The best part is when the demon appears and you have to figure out the solution . I like how it's not a little too easy to get bored . This will be an annual tradition , next year I will be purchasing more to add on .

A woman in love with her husband ( he 's suicidal ) decides to have a baby to save his life . the pregnancy doesn't work and the woman dies . what should you do? The story is very sad, not to be recommended. I recommend to read the story only. The plot is too dark and depressing and the outcome too unbelievable. I liked this short story so much that I read it again. And the second time as well. If you are able to do that, read the first time, but skip the second.

The 1980's 'My Dinner with Andre,' with Wallace Shawn and Andre Gregory, is essentially a dialog about the world and how it affects and can lift the spirit. 2005's 'You Are Alone' demonstrates how common worldly events can shatter the soul. The story revolves around three principal characters. There's Daphne, a pretty teenage student who frets about virtually every decision in her life. Then there's the prostitute, or paid escort, Britney, as self-confident as Daphne is self-conscious. What makes them interesting is that they share the same body, if not the same personae.

This owes a great deal to the plot of CAPTAINS COURAGEOUS. Although he is quite grown up, it is partly the story of a wealthy lad who is shanghaied as a crew member aboard a cargo vessel and becomes a man in the process. Moran of the title is a boyish young woman also brought up on a vessel owned by her father. When the cargo burns, she and crew members are evacuated to our lad's ship. However, the captain has smuggling on his mind and his intentions are not honorable where Moran is concerned.

Who really wants to see that ? Disgusting violence , disgusting sex , for such a long time . I am not a fan of violence . Not at all . I love violence . It keeps us on edge . Makes us go back to our screens and scream when we are sad . It makes us feel like something important is going wrong . But when it gets too much , when it gets to the point . . . when a child is dead . .. then that gets old for me . So yes , I am for sex and I have a problem with violence and it's all over the place .

What ? - that was it ? The town sheriff ( John Agar ) blows up the mutant gorilla with a sonic blaster. What was that all about ? It was the only time we had a shot, and we almost got blown up as the gorilla was so fast we could have been hit by the sonic blast. Oh. I love that scene. This movie was one of the best in my opinion. I loved that we saw so much that we didn't see just yet, and that there was so much we didn't know about the characters, or their past, or just about them.

I've lost count of the times I have seen this movie, but I love it and find it very funny each time I see it. The facial expressions, slapstick humor and the timing on the jokes makes it great. The characters, especially "Nitro", "Sonar" and "Stepanik" are hilarious. I thought Kelsey Grammar, Rip Torn and Bruce Dern did a great job. In fact, I think this movie was perfectly cast. I think it does need to be released in DVD before I wear my VHS version out.

I caught this during a brief run in a Philadelphia theater. Despite its local provenance (and its relation to a hometown tragedy, namely the beating death of Eddie Polec in 1994), I really have to come down hard on this movie. The director, for reasons best known to himself, decided to shoot the entire film guerilla-style, with nonstop handheld cameras and rapidfire cuts. Such technique might work for the scenes of jarring violence, but is utterly inappropriate for the rest of the material, which makes up the majority of the film.

After an astronaut dies in space, he is brought back to a military base. Inside the man are discovered alien embryos -- he is the host for what could be a terrible alien invasion! This film comes to us from director Bernard L. Kowalski, who also directed "Attack of the Giant Leeches" (see separate review) but may be better known for his work on "Columbo". Executive producer was Roger Corman, known as the creator of much better films than this one... particularly in the 1960s.This movie is cheesy and poorly constructed.

I am a Talent Manager. I have been for 15 years now. I have discovered some wonderful talent. They have been in Movies, Commericals, Braodway and Television. In my opinion Eddie Monroe was cast wonderful. I love seeing the ability of real people. Not just a name. The Actors in this movie were very natural and believable. I was very entertained by this film. I love a movie with a few twists. I also enjoy when at the end of the movie the puzzle is solved. I still would like to know what happened to the large sum of the money.

I was sitting at home and flipping channels when I ran across what potentially sounded like an interesting film . I clicked on the title to see a trailer that I knew was going to blow my mind and I laughed. I couldn’t put the film down and when the film finally ended and I finished it the first thing I did was put it on repeat. That’s what I’ve been saying for years. I’ve been saying that since the first episode of The Walking Dead was released and I still say it even today.

Beautiful .... that one word pretty much sums up this whole film . Everything from the cinematography , the directing , the costumes , the acting , the acting , the casting , the direction, the special effects .... I have a hard time watching films like this . The only good thing about this movie was the story , that story being the ending . The ending was truly heart wrenching . It was hard to believe that a guy like that was actually the villain of the movie , but that is what happened to him .

( May contain spoilers ) I find myself disappointed with the criticism this movie receives . While it is most definitely not bad , some aspects of it just fall flat. This isn’t a bad movie , but it isn’t that bad. So, here goes . . . I had originally planned to review this movie in part one of my reviews . However, because it is now available in IMAX, it is very hard to make a decision as to whether to watch it in 3D or in 2D. I do think both will be equally rewarding.

I have always loved The Muppets . Though most children 's entertainment then was n't that likable , The Muppet Babies would be my first introduction to this world . These were my first 'adults in diapers' . This was the first Muppet TV show that was ever produced , and to date remains my favorite . I don't know that it was a very big deal at the time , but today it is a cult classic and I love it . I have seen every show and every movie , so I am well aware of its history . It is a must see .

I was watching the sci-fi channel when this steaming pile of crap came on . While not as bad as the other channels it's still a bit crap, so I thought to myself - is this shit worth watching or am I going to see this shit a few more times before its over. So I did just that and watched this shit all the way through to the end. I don’t know why they didn’t do a bit more to make it interesting (as I’ve heard from several people who were watching and commenting on the channel).

I see that C. Thomas Howell has appeared in many movies since his heyday in the 80s as an accomplished director (“Shampoo” “The Godfather”). He has been a writer on a lot of television and radio shows, but has made little impact as a director. However, one of the more interesting things to discover about him and his career is that he wasn’t really interested in the movies, he just wanted to direct them. So he did. He was hired to direct the very first movie I saw, and in the process, discovered that he loved to write scripts.

`` Hollywood Cavalcade '' is a mildly entertaining 1939 film starring two staples of the 20th Century Fox roster , Clark Gable and Vivien Leigh , and directed by Richard Thorpe. There is little in the way of plot, as the film revolves around two men and their love for the same girl. But the movie has some interesting moments and an interesting cast that will keep you on your toes. The film was never a big hit with audiences, it was mainly a box office success and was released in the US only.

OK, I admit that I still associate Sophie Marceau with La Boum. That was the main reason I went to see this film. But it was so boring, that I nearly felt asleep. Sorry, but her talents as actress are not very convincing. Furthermore, this film was presented as having outstanding special effects and CGI. Yeah, for a B-Movie it is not that bad. After having seen her in "Marquise" some years ago (also a very crappy film), I thought that she would play more convincingly.

I am appalled to see that so many people have given positive reviews for this "film". This movie has no redeeming factors. The music is not good, the acting is pathetic, I have a difficult time understanding how someone could enjoy this movie, let alone sing its "praises". The idea is horrible, certain scenes linked to the plot (such as the continued love story even though the male romantic interest is a SHRUNKEN HEAD) are so bad that I wanted to do myself bodily harm while watching them.

Let 's get right to the heart of the matter ... This is a terrible movie . The story is awful and the acting bad. It's not that they don't deserve a bad film. I mean they are just so awful. But they have made a bad film that was supposed to be good. But I think that's what's so damn wrong with this film. The acting is so bad. The dialog is so terrible. The film is so bad. It's terrible. This is a really bad, terrible, bad, horrible, movie.

Would be promising if it were a student film . Never seems to know where it 's going next , but there's something for everyone here . I'd watch it again just to see the story unfold , and to see how the characters develop . But really , I think what made it a good film is that the characters are all there . I mean they don't just show up with one thing they have to say , they all do that ! It doesn't have to be perfect to make a film great , but I think it's more believable if it has at least that .
