I have no idea what to prepare for this evening , we will be getting a lot of rain tonight.

At the beginning of the movie , Ramgopal Verma says that `` Sarkar '' is his tribute to The Godfather , the greatest of Indian movies ever. There's nothing wrong in doing that if you're trying to be respectful of someone. But the way his film is handled is shocking. Sarkar, like The Godfather, was created for a new audience and that is why it's not meant to be a family movie or a romantic film. It is meant to be an entertainment film for a new generation of audience, the audience who have grown up with a generation of cinema heroes.

Having read the books and seen the 1982 Anthony Andrews/JaneSeymour version , I have to say that this is not a bad film. However, it seems that there is an agenda being pushed through the film that makes it hard to enjoy it. I went to see the movie, and I was left with the feeling that there was very little left of the novel and that this is in fact a bad movie. There are certain scenes that make little sense, but there is also an attempt to turn the story into a thriller.

This is a great movie for first time ninjas who are dating. If you're trying to impress some cute little ninjette I would highly recommend playing this masterpiece. Its one of those special movies that allows you to miss large sections of it without interfering with the plot.Also I was wondering, where does a Teal ninja hide? Are ninjas color coded like this? Is this normal? If I were attacked by one of these yellow or orange ninjas I would die of laughter before succumbing to his sword.And I finished my black star ninja test the other day, it was multiple choice, It went pretty good.

OK .... so , by minute 15 in the film , there 's still no dialogue.This film arrived to me as an awesome horror movie and I'm sure the fact that the director didn't bother to go over it with me, was only a result of not having seen it before. I guess this is just a personal choice for him, since the last time we saw this movie it was as horror movie. I really enjoyed the movie as a horror film and didn't mind the fact that there is very little gore.

I enjoyed Ramin Bahrani 's Man Push Cart , and this film is equally good . This slice of life drama, is a comedy which takes the form of a social experiment . The central theme is how one person's actions affect everyone in society . The film deals with a social issue and is a film about people trying to live a balanced life . It deals with problems and how to fix the situation . It takes you on a journey of how things are done in this world .The acting and direction is quite good . The cinematography is good and there is some humour .

YOU BELONG TO ME (1941) is a example of the 'ScrewBall Comedy' which started in the mid 1930s and ended postwar (WWII). Some of these films maintained their status. Others have earned undeserved praise when originally were critical and box office flops. Like BRINGING UP BABY (1938) or MR. & MRS. SMITH (1941). Then there is this one which value just keeps sinking.Why can be rooted in the screenplay/story. It strains credibility from the get go, betraying a superior cast. BARBARA STANWYCK is married to millionaire HENRY FONDA who is insanely jealous.

Red Skelton plays a radio detective known as `` The Fox '' in `` Whistling in the Dark , '' which centers around Skelton's attempt to solve a case. For the first time since the original film was released in 1962, director Robert Mulligan will reunite Skelton with John Huston in the director's cut, as well as John Huston, who has recently completed a film of his own called `` Night Train '' that was filmed as a radio series in the late '40s and early 50s, and will be shown on radio stations in the US and Canada starting this September.

Most people will consider that Yul Brynner's greatest performance was as the ruler of Siam in THE KING AND I. Certainly it gave him a wide variety of moods to test his abilities in, from comic, to tragic, from eager to learn to dominating to hateful. It also showed him to advantage as a "talk singer" and a dancer. Finally, as it was also his Tony Award winning performance from Broadway, the film allowed us to capture something of the great Broadway performance as well.But he did other movies that showed his talents as well as THE KING AND I.

I like the shepherd ! Sure the acting was n't good but the fight scenes were nice . Van damme, damme... And I like the girl too , I'm sure she can do better if she put a lot of effort into the character. But still a nice performance for the movie. Well, I do not like the performances in this movie. Van Damme was good in this movie and the movie was well written. There were some funny scenes with the characters but not enough. But, I am not sure about her acting.

Next stop on our journey through the calender-slasher scene is... oh yes, "Graduation Day"! All of those seniors, just brimming with possibility and ready to venture out into the real world and become adults. That is, however, IF they can make it TO graduation without having to tangle with the campus lunatic who's running around, gouging the life out of students with his fencing sword... Yeah, it all stems from a the high school track star who drops dead from a blood clot during a race and a year later, her older sister returns home from the Navy for Graduation.

Aaran is one of the movies where you find the loop holes in Indian Cinema . Here is one good movie that is also very watchable and has a very nice story. Synopsis :

When a young girl falls in love with an older man and the two of them decide to get married . But the groom has a plan which is to blackmail his brother and father of the bride. This plan is thwarted and the groom ends up committing suicide by hanging from the ceiling fan. The movie Aaran has many good points in it as compared to some of the previous ones .

There seems to have been some money behind this film, but it would be impossible to imagine a film this badly planned and executed if I hadn't actually started watching it.To begin with, once we are in the cavern with the characters (the usual young adult stereotypes we've been meeting in horror films since the early '80s), the film is shot almost entirely in close-up. Since the actors are wearing helmet lights, this means all we see are glaring lights alternating with utter darkness - we never get to see what the characters see; so when they shout out "Look there!"

Charlie Chaplin responds to open auditions at Lodestone Studios. Rival Ben Turpin arrives at the same studio, obviously another unemployed comedian! Turpin tries to horn in on Chaplin's action after the studio head hollers, "Next!" Chaplin manages to walk in over Turpin, however. Charlie amusingly manages to botch jobs as an actor and carpenter. In the end, he manages to get a big break, but will a star be born? There are a lot of jokes involving the buttocks. The initial scene involving slapstick from Chaplin and Turpin is a relative highlight.

A friend of mine loves tacky horror films so I often get to see low budget stuff like this. This is, however the first time I have been compelled to write a review of one...Put simply this is probably the worst film I have ever seen! Even worse then Boggy Creek II!The entire budget for the film seems to have been spent on a brief scene in the middle when Dr. Klaus stands in this chamber thing & turns all vampire-ish.The only good thing to say about it is that it was hilarious after a few beers (but for all the wrong reasons).

I viewed the movie for a second time on September 30 , 2006 and thought that it was even better than the last. I now believe that this one is superior. It's the second one that I have ever seen, and I must say, I was very disappointed the first. In short, it was a pretty good movie with an interesting story; some good performances (I liked the two lead actors) and some good action scenes. It had its flaws (some of the special effects were too unrealistic, for example) and was definitely more entertaining than the first one.

Totally forgettable movie but an unbelievable soundtrack: I'd give it (soundtrack)a 9 out of 10. I have the CD and the guitar work (Nils Lofgren) is superb! I saw the movie years ago and had to check IMDb to remember what it was about. I obsessed about getting the soundtrack and have since had to replace it. It ranges from blues/soul/ballad to a dose of gospel. All songs written, arranged, produced and performed by Nils Lofgren who is the "other" lead guitarist opposite Steve Van Zandt in the E Street Band.

Now , I like the Bollywood films and I 'm very glad they have recently gained success in the UK . But I hate that a lot of the new actors are not very talented and they don 't act the way they do in Hindi films and so it makes for bad films , I think . So I 'm going to leave it now and give a thumbs up to Bollywood movies . It's not a problem and it's always good to see a good performance in Hindi Films , it makes the audience happy .

I love just about everything the late Al Adamson directed in his long and varied career, but "The Possession of Nurse Sherri" stands head and shoulders above fun yet admittedly grade-Z schlockfests like "Horror of the Blood Monsters" and "Dracula Vs. Frankenstein". This film is actually scary! Am I saying that you're going to jump out of your seat when you watch "Nurse Sherri"? No, of course not. But this pastiche of elements from "The Exorcist", "Ruby", and "Carrie" is one of those nice, eerie little horror movies common to the seventies.

Eddie Monroe is Hooooot . He is a great actor and I could be his girl anytime . He 's very humble but he really has a heart and a soft spot for anyone who gets up on stage and makes a scene . He is so funny and I can tell you this . His eyes never lie . If you ' re interested in knowing about him I would love to sit down and chat him out . He is available for speaking engagements or you can check out his website and facebook page . I will always be your girl if you give it a shot .

I still remember watching Satya for the first time . I was completely blown away . Here was a movie about the life of Bhagavan. The way he was described by his disciples was beyond my wildest expectations. Bhagavan was known as ‘Srila Prabhu ‘. I don’t know exactly why the story of the life of Satyavrata starts with his name. I think it is because he was the one who became the founder of the Bhakti movement. Satyavrata is considered as the greatest disciple of his. The movie starts with Bhagavan describing his childhood, his childhood and his youth.

i'm not going to ramble on about it but i'm just going to make it brief. basically for those who don't know how prue actually died........... the first time round the demonic assassin comes hit piper and prue with an energy ball they fly through the wall blood everywhere. phoebe the third sister comes down the stairs, says the spell which send him away but not vanquished. (NEEDS THE POWER OF THREE)leo comes heals them both and so on. they get exposed along the line and the only way the can be saved is for a demon named tempus to turn back time.

When a loser teen is bitten by an insect, he becomes the superhero Dragonfly...Superhero Movie is the latest spoof movie to hit the screens. Sadly however, despite the presence of David Zucker (who was involved with Airplane!, Top Secret and The Naked Gun movies) it still suffers from the fault most recent spoofs have...mainly it's more dumb than fun! The fault mainly lies with the gags. It's simply not funny enough. Some of the jokes do work, such as the nail gun scene, but other parts simply fall flat.

A paranoid scientist creates a wolfman by transfusing wolf blood into a meek, quiet, but very large gardener, in order to prove an hypothesis. So the gardener begins nightly rampages and the scientist tries to use him to reclaim his credentials, but is rebuffed by his former colleagues for tampering with nature. Island of Dr Moreau, Frankenstein and various wolfman films all blended together into a terribly dated, goofy, morality play.Though the subject matter is pedantic and unoriginal at best, this film is not too poorly made, and interesting to watch as a representative of horror film making of its time.

One of the worst theatrical movies of the year, if not all time. Anthony Hopkins belittles himself by even appearing in this joke. I can't believe David Mamet and Ridley Scott's name appear on this travesty. The best career move Jody Foster ever made was turning this one down. Julianne Moore was as emotionless throughout as a female Keanu Reeves. Gary Oldman was of course, his brilliant self. He is a crippled victim of Hannibal and the make-up is so good, I didn't know it was Gary until the final credits. but eaten by trained boars???

...out of this movie.Sorry to say, this showed at the Cleveland International Film Festival. Our copy did not have subtitles, so I asked the Festival crew if there was a problem with the print received. "Not so..." I was told. "the director wants it this way". Again, sorry to say, my French is barely high school elective level (more than 3 decades ago). Much of the initial dialog is in French, so I'm sure I missed the nuance and many details in between my understanding of a few key words.

The film is a joy to watch , not just for the plot , which is gripping , but also the performances of its cast . you can see that the young actors in this film have grown up since it was released . and it is evident that every actor gives the best he/she has , as the movie is well worth watching , though you can't blame anyone for not liking this movie . you can also see the changes that have been made in the cast since it was released , not only the actors of the film but also the characters that have been created .

Pot-seeking pre-teen Joshua Miller ( as Tim ) throws his sister 's doll into the river while Daniel Roebuck ( as Tim ) points his phone at it. He then gets it in trouble when he calls the police when he's caught with the phone. As the cops arrive they find out that the phone is a surveillance device and that this is not a suicide, which is when they realize the whole thing was planned and arranged by Tim . Cast
 Tim Allen as Tim , Joshua Miller's older half-brother and Daniel Roebuck's husband.

I am utterly astonished at how over-rated "Cemetery Man" is among horror fans! Now, I usually welcome movies that blend two or more kinds of genre-styles into one and I love just about every zombie-comedy I have ever seen. To my dismay, this Italian cult-classic really didn't show me a lot to get too pumped up about... It follows the unusual duties of a full-time cemetery care-taker and his retarded, man-child, Curly Joe looking assistant as they seem to primarily dispose of the recently deceased who pop out of the ground seven days after their initial death.

Before we start , may I say I hope you 've already eaten when you 're reading this . Why you don't ? And if you haven 't already , why are you reading this blog ? For the simple reason that if you aren 't going to make me eat my words , then you're going to have to read my posts for the same reason . So, before we start , let me tell you something . And let me say it in the most friendly possible way to you . You may not have heard about my book , but you know about it already .

Naach A more detailed review can be obtained anywhere else in the web . This one is a good portrayal of what I feel is the best of the various styles of painting and sculpting found within the art of the Old Testament . I will, of course, continue to provide a full account of all that I have found so I hope you will find the time to continue reading and enjoy! Saturday, May 29, 2012

This
is one of the best depictions of a woman in my memory . It was painted about 30 years ago .

Every time I 've seen this movie I get the same impression : some parts of it are so amazingly well done, the dialogue, the pacing, the pacing of the story itself is simply flawless ! I could watch more of this film for hours, and not get bored ! That said, I've seen a few other films like this, where the story isn't so well designed, and I still found the movie to be gripping. But, this is the first film I've read that I've enjoyed so much.

I see that C. Thomas Howell has appeared in many movies since his heyday in the 80s as an accomplished horror actor. Now he has been brought back to his first love, directing. This film is the sequel to a film that was released in 1982 called The House at the Center of the Earth. I have seen this before and the first time around was in the mid 80s when it had a horror slant. This time I was looking forward to seeing this film. I had recently seen the movie that this was based on, and I was not expecting to like it, but I liked it.

This is the last film of Krzysztof Kieslowski - one of the greatest directors in the history of cinema. He intended to retire after this film, so in a way it is his artistic testament. He died a couple of years after making the film, and though it is said that he intended to return to directing, Destiny decided that this was indeed his last. And what a film! 'Rouge' the last film in the three colors French trilogy is actually a very Swiss film. Set in Geneva, one of the two main characters is a Swiss retired judge, and Durenmatt immediately comes to mind.

Once again Bronson's talent is mostly wasted on this shock value 1984 thriller which (uncut) is far more disturbing than most of what is out even today. The fact that "The Evil That Men Do" is very disturbing (in its verbal and visual depictions of torture) is not the problem. It is the shameless gratuity in which it is presented. Interestingly, this film seems to symbolize that latter part of Bronson's career in which he has tortured many of his fans with the same egregiously predictable and uncreative plots. One hopes this fine actor will rise again.

I have read and enjoyed many of James Lee Burke 's Robicheaux mysteries . When I read 'In The Electric Shadow of the Sword' as a boy I was captivated by this story and have often wondered what it's about . I read the other books in the series and have only just finished the third and now am eagerly awaiting what is sure to be one of the best Robicheaux mysteries yet . I am so glad that the first two books in the series are about to get a second instalment as I know I would never read them as children .

Alfred Hitchcock made this comedy of mis-marriage in 1941 but his heart doesn't appear to be in it. Carole Lombard and Robert Montgomery are the couple who discover they were never legally married and spend the movie bickering their way back to true love. It doesn't have much of a reputation and it is easy to see why. The jokes are familiar from better films but here they don't gel. And the leads are uncharismatic. Lombard's performance is clipped and starchy and it's doubly sad to think she was dead only a year later.

Certainly this film is not for everybody---but for anyone with a sense of humor and love of period film Ð buy this immediately! Where else can you get a run down of 70Õs fashion, a period vocabulary primer, karate trained hookers, crime, a rap about the TitanicÕs sinking, shoot outs, and a co-star named Queen Bee (watch for her moving crying scene early on in the wardens office!) With a filming style thatÕs a cross between a porno movie/Dawn of The Dead/ and Car Wash, you cannot go wrong.

Unreal ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! . After reading the initial reviews posted by alleged reviewers , I can't believe I read a post like this. I think this has to do with the fact that these reviews are so far from being correct. Maybe it's because I have no experience with any of these sites . I am just wondering if I should keep an eye on them or if it would be best to just leave it be. I would like to have a chance to try some of these games for myself.

A young man , named Danny , has run away from home and meets a drifter , named Bix , who is in search of money to get a job. Danny takes Bix's money and then runs away with him. But Bix wants more than what Danny is giving him. Bix offers him the chance to take a job for him , but Danny is reluctant. He explains to Bix that it will mean giving up his freedom and freedom from his family. He wants to keep his family , his job and most of his friends and he will give anything he is able to give.

Forget Jimmy Stewart reliving his life and opt for this smart comedy of errors instead . I suppose only institutionalized old folks would watch this. I'm sure a younger person would have a lot to say but it would seem like a lot to say in a movie in a way I can't even comprehend. This film has been done to death over the years and not just by Hollywood. From my understanding of the film, this is an attempt to make an anti-establishment movie. I think the idea is to make it a satire on the government and what they want to do to you as an individual.

Reanhauer ( Bill Roy ) is the leader of a desert-dwelling cult who tries to resurrect one of his people from oblivion. Roy has been ordered by a priest to sacrifice his brother, who was also ordered by a rival sect to be sacrificed at a ritual in which the cultist would become an avatar of a goddess. Roy is also a member of the cult, which seeks to make Roy their leader. Roy's brother is later revealed as being an innocent bystander to the ritual, who was only there to witness the ritual as a means of training Roy's followers.

Without doubt , GRAND CHAMPION has the most impressive cast of `` AAA '' level stars and musicians ever gathered to play one of the greatest rock and roll instruments . Not only that, but the story is just as thrilling and dramatic as you can possibly imagine ( with a few differences ). I am not being facetious or anything, because I really believe that I could easily sit here and say, `` That is a good movie . `` And I would be right about this , except for the fact that I simply have not seen anything quite like this in the last 15 years .

There are two things that I noticed in this film . ( This is not a spoiler , just a warning) One is that in a few moments, we see that we have a “female character” who is very different from the “traditional” woman in this film . It isn’t that there are no “female characters” ( I mean they are there) but the fact that they don’t “act” like “real” women. They don’t get their “emotional” reaction and they are not “good” women like the one in this film.

The Fanglys is set in a small Texan town called Layton on the eve of Halloween as the townspeople treat it like the second coming of Christ or something, I mean Halloween isn't that important is it? Anyway, Sheriff Pete (Burton Gilliam) has been called out to yet another murder as local boy Ned (co-associate producer John William Galt) has discovered a body in the local woods. Could it be the Fang Lady (Justin Hamilton)? The central character involved in a local legend about a witch who kills teenagers, who knows?

I 've seen several stage and film adaptations of Alice in Wonderland and this one has to take the cake in my opinion, as it is a film that everyone should watch at least once in their lifetime. I have seen a number of animated adaptations of Alice in Wonderland that I have enjoyed but I think this is my favourite of the lot. This film was written by Stephen Fry (and directed by his daughter) and it’s a film I think everyone should at least once watch as it was the first ever live action film to be produced by the BBC.

WARNING : I advise anyone who has not seen the film yet to not read this comment.When I first started out, I'd only been to a single screening of the film in person. The first two I did at the cinema were sold out. Then the next week, the film had been played in the same cinema a third time. That was a few years back, when I was still working in theatre and not on the books, but I'm guessing there are many readers out there who know someone who was there or saw the same screening as I.

The biggest and most disconcerting things of the Raptor movie was ending for the Tyransaurus is identical to Carnosaur except kid in the loader was a bit better acted and action then the adult. The similarities to the Carnosaur movies was rather poor choice in plot line. The only thing that approached good was the beginning with the kids in the jeep. Then the plot went down hill from there. Would have been nice if a different plot had been devised, rather then cloning the earlier movies. The raptor movie should have taken lesson from Jurasic park series in various plots.

Stay FAR AWAY from this film . The fact that you 're reading reviews tells me you may have already seen the trailer. But if you don't see anything in this film then just stay away because I don't care what you do with your life. If you can see the movie without seeing the trailer I think you'll be ok, if not better then just stop reading and go watch the trailer because it's better than the film. First off, we're at the end of the film and so there are very few scenes in this film that are important for a good film to be completed.

Simply put, there are two parts of this series that made me cry till my eyes fell out. First: The part where he was set to wash the toilet, but ended up drinking the toilet water while imagining it was the hot director giving him a golden shower!!! (I laughed so hard! )Second: The part where he tried to prove worthy of a swimming school instructor. He seemed like a pro diving in, but as expected, he couldn't swim (proper at least^^).

The Man with the Golden Arm was one of the first films to have as its main topic (and, in some respects, the message) the tragedy of heroin addiction. It's nowhere near a great film, but its importance lies in Otto Preminger's dedication to making it feel real and on the edge of melodrama and naturalism. What I liked is that it's not so much an expose of junkies (if you want the best expose of that read Naked Lunch, if you can get through it anyway, besides the point), but the nature of the urban environment Frankie Machine lives.

As far as I am concerned , this film noir had two totally different things going for it as opposed to many films in the 80s. I mean, there was something about it. There was that feeling of “well, it could never happen again”. Then, of course, you can see how it is the same feeling as, say, when you see a movie that’s just “cool” but that you have the same idea of, you know, “yeah, this is gonna be cool again”, which is why you watch that movie.

Mystery Science Theater 3000 would have not been able to bring any redeeming quality to a showing of this ``classic'' in this modern day. There are only four things to be said for Mystery Science Theater 3000, aside from the fact that the show is one hell of a spectacle in it's own right, and is not the best way to waste a Saturday night... and that this is a very good show for this type of show... and that Mr. T is not dead... The thing that really gets me is this statement by the host...

"...

my girlfriend, as we walk in the cold London evening in leicester square, after the movie, says: if they didn't speak English and they didn't show the stadium, you could have thought this was the slums of a South American city or some other slum anywhere in the world,not Queens in NYC.Ramin Bahrani is , right now, my official hero, because he seems to have devoted his work to show not the OTHER face of American, but the REAL face of America.Ramin Bahrani's movies are like Ladri di biciclette, or Germania anno zero, or Roma citta' aperta.

Saw this last night and being a fan of the first Demons , I had hoped that the sequel would come out before the year was out so i could see how it was , I was quite disappointed as it was all over the place at the end of season 1 and i think the sequel will have been better than season 1 , so hopefully i won't be disappointed this time . The only disappointment i had was the ending scene , that was like the end scene for season 2 so i guess it wasn't too bad .

'Carolina Moon' is an adequate made-for-TV movie about a girl with psychic powers who returns to the town whereshe grew up in and where her childhood best friend was murdered. Turns out that every year on the same date anotheryoung girl is murdered and Tori, played by Claire Forlani, must solve the mystery before she ends up dead. Claire Forlani (Meet Joe Black, CSI New York) is the female lead and does a pretty good job of it, ably supported by the rather delicious Oliver Hudsom and a still luminous Jacqueline Bisset.

A new wrestling show paves way for the most feared wrestler ever imaginable, the giant Zeus. Network President Brell does everything in his power to draw WWF champion Rip into the squared circle to face off against Zeus for the championship of the 'Battle of the Tough Guys'. But Zeus is unlike any competitor Rip has ever faced.Normally I would give Hogan some leeway as a wrestler crossing over into a movie role, however this film didn't ask the Hulkster to make very much of a stretch, it simply asked Hogan to play himself, which he failed at miserably.

Well , I have to agree with the critics on this one , who all said `` leave it alone. Not saying I agree with their sentiments. I do not agree with their approach. It does not have to be a perfect world. We want to start from a position of balance, and have it work. But there is a need to look to the future. I can't help but look at the future. My company will have over 20,000 employees by the end of the year. In the next year or so, our growth will be rapid.

Under no circumstances watch this film. It is terrible for a number of reasons:No plot No structure No direction No acting to speak of No visual style No tensionIn a word - no.Best thing about it the box and the fact it eventually ends. Who would have thought 85mins could feel so long.Once again: Under no circumstances watch this film. It is terrible.No plot No structure No direction No acting to speak of No visual style No tensionIn a word - no.Best thing about it the box and the fact it eventually ends. Who would have thought 85mins could feel so long.

At the same time John Russell was playing ranch owner Nathan Burdette, trying to free his no good brother Claude Akins from sheriff John Wayne in Rio Bravo he was working the other side of the law on television. These years were probably the high point of Russell's career, his most noted screen role and his most famous television role, Marshal Dan Troop of Laramie in Lawman.Russell kept law and order in Laramie the same way that James Arness did it in Dodge City on Gunsmoke. Unlike Gunsmoke, Laramie never developed the all the minor characters that gave you the feel of Dodge City at the time.

Though I strongly feel that SITR is the best Gene Kelly movie , but this a pretty good one . This movie takes a look back of some of the very best and some of the worst from the movies of the late 50’s & early 60’s . Some people say this is a remake of the first Gene Kelly film but it seems to be more like a continuation of some of the movies . This movie looks and feels great , I’ll definitely rewatch this one in about two days when I get back from a long weekend .

It's just when a band tours, and only has one original member. It's not the same as the classic line up. All new actors playing the main roles of Rag, Scotty, etc, with Ashby as virtually the only returning face from the first movie. And he was of only minor note of the first flick, serving as the only redeemable group of the three guys that Scotty was trying to assist in meeting females. The film is poorly written, featuring the dumbest dialog this side of Armageddon. Even for a T&A movie, this one is a turkey.

A group of adventurers travel to the 'dark continent' to try and locate a lost heiress named Diana, who disappeared years before in a plane crash, and who is now believed to be living with a savage tribe that consider her to be their goddess.Once again, my search for sleazy, European cannibal movies has taken me deep into Jess Franco territorya seemingly endless cinematic wilderness swarming with sub-par scriptwriting, crawling with crap camera-work, and abundant with awful acting (Franco regular Lina Romay taking the prize this time for her pitiful performance as an ailing, elderly woman).

Sometimes there's a film so bad that you just keep watching in awe. This is one of those films. Of course I can't help that I'm biased. I'm from Chicago so I watched the scenes closely for accuracy and I don't find Billy Crystal funny at all. And I can't stand all that English style photography(Tony Scott etc) with the smoke machine working overtime and all the flourecent, soft lighting. I suppose we're supposed to believe that Billy Crystal is really from Chicago because he wears a Cubs jersey. Oh and the plot.

. . . and that is only if you like the sight of beautiful woman with nice , bouncy jugs. As for my personal experience (which I'm sure you know already, I just wanted to share it): I'm really impressed with this site. It seems to provide a lot more than I can actually do, and this is really great for me. So I would just like to give a few comments about what I've read about the website and how it could help me, for instance:

I think it would be wonderful if the site would be updated a bit more regularly.

Six students at a convent do the unthinkable - kill a nun who was overbearing. Now, eighteen years later, the nun's spirit is back and getting revenge for her murder.Yea, basically that's the short of it. There's more to it than that, but I still have no clue what it is. The only really cool thing is the effects on the spiritual nun, as I was pretty impressed for being a more low-budget flick. I'm also confused as to whether or not it's in English.

An absorbing exploration of virtual reality , although it is not yet clear how much the director himself intended . He is not in a great position to comment . There are moments when I felt I was in a movie, and in a dream. I'm not sure how much of what I experienced was real and how much of it was not, but I wasn't having a good day. Or a bad one. Or an average day, either. I was in a movie, for sure, but it was very dark.

This could have been a really good movie if someone would just have known how to finish the film.The story was going along just fine and heading towards that point in every movie like this where the "gray" characters turn "good" and the "bad" guys get their just desserts and *boom* ... it's like they ran out of script and the cast just started to make things up.Which wouldn't have been so bad ... if the cast had just continued with the character development they had already put in place.

The storyline has too many flaws and illogical sequences to be worthwhile . Jolie 's acting is pretty flat and the movie does not have any depth or heart. The only thing that made this film worth watching are the amazing fight sequences. Not only are they the best in the business but they are the best ever. The action in the movie is not only awesome but has a lot of depth to it as well. The entire film is worth a watch as it has an interesting storyline, good fight scenes and excellent acting that makes the film very enjoyable and entertaining.

This film is by far the worst film I have ever seen in my life . A woman `` The first time she says that is a good thing to do. `` As you know if you're a teacher in any school , you're there to help students learn. And we can't help you learn unless you've done your homework and you know what you're talking about. If a student has homework and they haven't put it through the proper review system they have a problem . So that's where the students come in .

I had to get this movie , since it did n't come to where I live . I waited patiently until the time is right to buy . I do not want to give up . I have to see the story first . It is what the movie has to offer . So if you want to give it a go , then try it . I am sure that I will like it . I really liked the story, I did like the concept of the film . I liked the characters and the performances of each , I can see myself in every character.

Uggh! Hanna-Barbera of the 60s and 70s! What lousy and unwatchable cartoons that were thrust upon us by these hacks! It's a shame really, as in the 1940s and 1950s "Hanna-Barbera" meant quality--because they produced so many wonderful Tom and Jerry cartoons. However, with the major cost-cutting efforts of the late 1950s, cartoons in general began to look pretty poor and budgets were slashed. In fact, William Hanna and Joseph Barbera were fired by MGM and replaced by a team of Czech animators who had never even seen the original cartoons!

There is a serious scene in this movie . A scene that lets you know that his film wo n't been made in a few days, that he's still trying, that it's going to be a struggle, that it's hard to make it, that he'll make it, and we'll be glad when it is over. And that's just for starters. But the problem with that scene is that it doesn't really matter. And it's true that you can't judge how a filmmaker will go about the process of filmmaking.

This TV show is possibly the most pathetic display of crap on TV today. Horribly predictable, obscene usage of slow motion photography, cheesy story lines. Chuck Norris is an abomination who should never have been allowed to be filmed in anything. The way he chooses to make each episode into a public service announcement is really annoying. His acting sucks so bad that it makes a person cringe with embarrassment. I will give the series some credit though...it does get entertaining at times, but not enough for it make any difference.

... but had to see just how bad it could get . The plotline was thin to begin with , but it was good enough to hook me . but the music . well it's just not my cup of tea . and it wasn't the first time i had issues with the music . i'd been with it long enough to know that i could get through it . but it didn't help that i'd just watched the first film and realized it was all over my head . and to top it all off , i've never seen the first movie .

A complete and utter waster of my precious two hours. The entire movie could have been made in less than 60 seconds by simply showing people getting coked up, a car crashing, people getting more coked up, people having sex, people crying, and people getting more coked up. The tagline for this movie should have read "Come see how f*cked up our characters are! They're stoned! They're coke addicts! They're a mess! Who are these people? Do you really care? Does it matter?

This movie had an excellent premise, and could have been a fascinating look at racism, attitudes to women at work and male female relations in England early last century. However, it simply turned into a soppy love story. But what was worse, is that the love story was totally unbelievable. The acting was for the most part poor, the direction confusing, but most of all the screenplay and the story were non-existent. The only thing I liked about the film was how dark it must have been before electric lighting. I really got a sense of just how little light one candle puts out.

Tyra & the rest of the modeling world needs to know that real women like myself and my daughter do not sleep in their clothes! I know for a fact that I do! I also know for a fact that I sleep in them for a few minutes every morning. I’m so glad that I didn’t do that, I would not have had my daughter grow up so confident in her body, her mind and her identity! But, I have learned that that’s ok because I’m doing the same thing that so many of you are!

Mishima is one of the greatest films ever made. Now I think Paul Schrader is the greatest screenwriter of all time, but I don't really like the films he's directed of what I've seen (with the exception of this and Affliction), but this is an amazing, disturbing, and highly 3-dimensional character study. It follows the life of Yukio Mishima, Japan's most celebrated writer, combining the last day of his life with flashbacks and his stories. I don't know how, but Paul Schrader manages to combine all of those in a very artistic way.

I was once a big Olsen fan. I received this movie when I was six and watched it almost nonstop until I was nine. Then it lay on my shelf gathering dust until yesterday. I was left speechless.Mary-Kate and Ashley play Allie and Mel, two twelve year olds who are sent to spend Spring Break in Paris with their ambassador grandfather. Along the way, they meet, as one might expect, two cute French boys who show them the more fun side to Paris. I guess the two boys were okay, fake French accents aside.

The first review I saw of this on IMDB says that Vince Vaughn is a much better actor than Anthony Hopkins, but that the scene with him was just a little too intense. I am in agreement but still feel the movie needed to be cut a little. It should've been just the two guys. You know, I think my favorite scene in the film was at the beginning when they're at the restaurant and Anthony Hopkins is giving him a compliment on the food and their waitress is looking at him like he's nuts. I thought the scene was so awesome.

The horrific production does n't qualify as a `` film . '' It was obviously shot on video tape , but it was still filmed with a video camera. It had the look, feel and sound of the movie it was supposed to be . The trailer was released on July 19, 1988 , after the first film in a planned series . The movie was not released in the United States and Canada , however , due to copyright issues involving some of the music and a few of the stars. The movie has never been released anywhere outside the U.S . .

This movie is an example of small budget,ineffective star cast,weak storyline and poor entertainment. This kind of movies are made for commercial breaks and not for any entertainment of die-hard fans of bollywood movies. I went to this movie because i thought the earlier one gangster was tolerable so this is also. Only thing I appreciate the way new actress put herself in the movie in a very bold way, she very much resembles bollywood actress nandita das. she is good ,sexy and acting well. she definitely go up in her career.

I am looking at all the good reviews about this film and I start thinking to myself... Am I going crazy..? Can't I see the beauty from a film like this..? Am I just dumb enough to NOT understand the message this film is trying to point out? I don't know.. maybe one of those lizards entered in my head and ate all my brains as well. The film idea was going nowhere... I was sure it would have a foggy end, and of course... it did!

The wind and the lion is a marvelous sweeping motion picture . It is a monument to what filmmaking once was and what film is still today . The Wind and the Lion is no different . The story , characters , music , art and direction is superb . I enjoyed the film immensely . I recommend you go and watch the movie . The film is rated PG . I do not own this film but I did watch it . You may like the film . You may not. But that is your loss . . . . . . . . . . . .

I had never heard of this film and only got it because I am a Martin Sheen fan. Now I am stunned as to why it did not receive the praise and recognition that it truly deserves. The four characters all make you feel for them, the father trying to assert his authority, the mother still clinging to traditional family values and both trying to keep up appearances despite the total fragmentation of their family, the daughter wanting her own life and the son haunted by his experiences in Vietnam. One felt that this was a scenario that must have been played out in thousands of 'ordinary' families after Vietnam.

I saw this in a preview screening and have to say that this documentary style movie is the biggest load of tripe I have ever seen.Completely unfunny, low budget, boring, rubbish script, terrible acting - The entire audience (young and old) sat through the film comatose without laughing for most of it... there were literally only about 2 places you will laugh in the entire movieMany people left halfway - Can't blame them... I stayed thinking that the film would pick up, however, it never did and I wish I'd left.

Ever since 1981, Nintendo has been making great video games such as Super Mario and Zelda. Most ideas would get a bit boring after 20 years. Games made by Nintendo never seem to get boring because they're always adding something new. It went from arcade games to the Wii and I hear that there's a new version of the Wii scheduled for release in 2011. The thing that makes Wii games so different is the fact that your actually doing something instead of just sitting on the couch pushing buttons. And I have more good news.

The trailers for this movie promised and this movie delivered exactly what was promised: Good campy fun with lots of very good looking naked broads! If you were expecting a major Hollywood movie with major stars, stellar budgets, and MPAA tamed money shots, you will be *very* disappointed.However, if you are a fan of the old "B" movies with unknown, but very good looking young stars that act amazingly well, given the material, some hokey, but surprisingly well done special effects, and very tight naked nubile bodies, this movie is almost heaven!

In a Morocco completely invaded by Europeans and Americans, in the beginning of the Twentieth Century, the Moroccan leader Mulay Achmed Mohammed el-Raisuli the Magnificent (Sean Connery) kidnaps the American Eden Pedecaris (Candice Bergen), her son and her daughter. His intention is to get some money and rifles as ransom for them, to fight against the corrupt Sultan of Moroco (Marc Zuber). In times of election, the American President Theodore Roosevelt (Brian Keith) agrees with the proposal. However, Raisuli is betrayed and Eden helps him to be released from the prison with the American soldiers.

There is a running thread in film comedy that all the great comics are just falling short of the law of diminishing returns (or, more likely, the lack thereof). Every so often a great comedian steps into the spotlight and starts to break the cycle. The reason that this happens is quite simple: it’s because they are talented. But it’s because they don’t have a great sense of humor. And sometimes that is a bad thing. So what are some of the best and funniest comics out there?

This is a serious film about black revolutionaries and not really an action film . Billy Dee plays a young man in Detroit in the sixties who is a radical. He has the audacity to go on a hunger strike in an attempt for the government to get money for the people of Detroit and his actions are seen as radical. He is the first to go on a hunger strike. The film follows the man from his hunger strike through all the events that happen. This is a good film about a very real hunger strike that took place back in the mid-sixties.

I disagree in calling this a stoner movie just because weed also makes an appearance . I ca n't imagine this is a stoner film but if it is, why would they leave it out . I would like to see some more of the chemistry between these two characters as they start to fall for each other . I also feel like the acting is pretty well done . I would like to know who did this as it is a movie that is supposed to be a horror movie . A lot of the scenes are not well acted .

This was a pathetic movie . The Alien was decent , but the movie itself gave a new meaning to the word "crap". And I have to say, that the Alien is actually not very good at all . The best part of the movie? The Alien . The Alien is the only thing in the movie that makes any sense . The Alien was great at the start . There were 3 scenes in the movie that were really cool . And at the end , the Alien is what the movie was about all along . The Alien was awesome .

I think I can safely say (without really giving anything away), that this movie had no robots in it. The guys in "robot" costumes didn't act or speak as such, and the evil entity behind the whole "plot" isn't a robot either.The whole thing looks like it was shot in a city park somewhere, with photos dropped in the background when the director needed a custom set. I can't even use words to describe the acting...This couldn't even offer the hilarious ending of "Star Crystal".

Jess Franco makes exploitation films, and he has made tons of them. Franco is responsible for some of the most shocking films in cinema history, and god bless him for it. Unfortunately, The Diamonds of Kilominjaro is a truly awful movie that is not up to his usual standards.Exploitation films should be judged on story, sex, and gore. What else is there? This film fails on most of those benchmarks. The plot is paper thin, placing a nubile young girl in the jungle among cannibals. We really don't get information on why she and her father were there in the first place.

We all know what Chan-wook Park can do. If you haven't seen Oldboy(or the sympathy trilogy for that matter) you are missing out on some of the best films made this century. But i'm not here to talk about them. I'm here to talk about thirst.This movie is not what you would expect. Yes it is a vampire movie, but at the same time it is also a very twisted tale of romance between a priest and a young girl. I wont get into the synopsis(you can read that above) but instead tell you what this movie has to offer.

The only time I seem to trawl through IMDb comments is when I've seen a duff film. I guess I'm looking to find reassurance that it's not just me. For me, then, Lonesome Jim was a duff film packed with unbelievable characters in unbelievable situations which limped on lamely and boringly towards a cop-out hackneyed conclusion. So I check out what other people have to say and feel a bit like Jim, out on a limb, alienated, as page after page of multiple star ratings and plaudits leave me doubting my critical faculties.

OK , I 've seen over 100 Troma films , and some of them are pretty bad . `` Sizzle '' is the best I 've seen of them , but it 's not the greatest . I 'd be glad to see it in color . And the title is a misnomer , it is the most overrated film I 've ever seen . This is my first Troma film , so I must say I am not sure which is the worse . This has been on my list for a while , so when the film came out , I bought it for my son .

I didn't expect much from this movie, it was just one of those movies I thought I'd just watch because it was on television. i certainly underestimated this movie. It's about a guy who kills his girlfriend and brags to his friends. I was very happy with the acting, they had the characters played well. It was a particularly great scene when Feck(Dennis Hopper) and John(Daniel Roebuck) are talking to each other about why John killed Jamie. It's upsetting to hear how he explains that he wanted to feel control and thats why.

OK , first of all , who in their right mind would remake Hitchcock and second , who would do such a stupid shit like this ? I can't even begin to imagine what the movie would even have. What kind of a movie would it have to be ? As it is now , it's just another dumb remake. The only thing we know is we are not going to be allowed to see the original in theaters again . . Oh, wait . I know someone who would like to see it. I'm not sure if he's gonna be there for the film or not.

WAIT until you 've watched most of all other films ever released , wait a year , then watch this one , and you will be well prepared for the second part . It's a true story , but not the sort you'd expect in real life . So , just in case you'd been looking for any excuse to skip this film and go for another , you're not alone in thinking so , it's not the movie that it's not , you've not skipped it because you don't really know if you will enjoy it , it's there because you don't find it to your liking .

Like in a circle the movie leads back to its point of departure, the image of the cranes that are crossing a Muscovite sky. They represent the freedom to realize your life as you wish, in order to aspire the greatest possible fulfilment.In the beginning Veronica and Boris experience such a promise of happiness, and their eyes follow the path of the cranes in exhilaration. It seems as if they might be able to live according to their dreams.But Man is not a bird. Life draws up its own rules, from which no human can escape and which we cannot change - not even by making a supreme effort.

You know the old saw about a train wreck? The one about how you can't look away? This movie isn't that good. The only reason you're still there is because you brought your kids and you can't leave them alone in the theater. You might catch a nap.Tim Hill should never work in film again after delivering this awful piece of junk. He manages to take a decent comic actor in Jason Lee and turn him into a robotic, unsure actor in this production.I didn't have much hope for this movie in the first place, I admit.

Disney-like entertainment with some un-Disney-like moments of graphic violence and sexual references. Lousy comedy alongside cliché-ridden moralizing. Noah as Abraham, Lot as his wicked buddy. Laughable special effects. Overdone acting with bad timing. Sodom and Gommorah were destroyed before the Flood? Strange twists and too many sub-plots the Bible doesn't mention. God as a doubting father who just needs to be entertained by whistling before deciding the world has to be saved from disaster.B-movie wannabee director John Irvin adds another failure to his worthless list of poorly-directed movies that seriously lack plot and direction.

I 've felt that Rupert Grint has a lot of promise from that role by which everyone knows him . But it's all about how far we take it, not how good he is, and so I really do believe that this movie will be far better than what it is. It doesn't matter that I don't understand the plot. I know who it is, and I'm sure that he's going to kill me . . but it's a very dark movie that I really enjoy. I think it is a great action thriller and the best kind of thriller, because it is very scary .

Four unhappy women leave dreary London to spend an ENCHANTED APRIL in a castle on the coast of Italy.Elizabeth von Biron is about to embark upon a journey of self-discovery as a young woman with a mysterious past and a quest to uncover what her father and grandfather were doing in the late eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. But she is far more than just a curiosity to Elizabeth - she is more than that. She is a force in the life of the English royal family. She was the Duchess of Cambridge before she was anything but a beautiful blonde.

Yes, indeed we have a winner- a winner in best dumb-action-movie!The only reason I chose to vote a 10 for this movie is because it's so incredibly bad-made that it actually becomes funny. "Night Hunter" is basically about Jack Cutter, a Vampire hunter (Vampire hunters have been in his generation for centuries, apparently), and his mission, being that he has to kill the last remaining Vampires.This movie contains one of the cheesiest scenes I have ever seen in my life. Not to mention the really bad gun-shooting scenes.

I could watch this movie ALL DAY! I LOVE it. Probably my all time favorite movies. But, by the way, "badger1970" there are a few parts with bad language, not TOO bad, but it's not exactly G rated. GREAT movie!!!!! I recommend it to everybody. Any way, it's making me type 10 lines of text, so I am going to keep typing until it will let me post this comment. Okay... Still typing... This is getting annoying. Ugh. I still have four more to go.

This is a VERY good movie. I give it a 10.It's very different in that it's kind of a long stalking scene all the way through. The fact that the main character is mute is used throughout the story in a very believable way.She sees a murder (for a snuff-movie) and decides to run but is chased (this takes quite some time). I won't reveal the rest of the movie for it would spoil the experience, but rest assured: it's very believable, well played, very intense and has some nice surprises plus a great ending.Don't miss this movie.

Yes this movie features a gal named Jessica who says everything is evil and she causes trees to land on people's heads, and then a boy named Mark. She then says that she will change the world and everyone dies, then the boy starts talking about a time when he was in school and she was his teacher. She tells him that the teacher was like a parent and the boy told her he had a dream that the teacher was like one of her parents. She tells the boy to make a wish and he asks her to be like her, she says "I will".

Recently I borrowed a copy of this mess of a movie, which took me three sessions over three days to get through. That's another comment in the making.But what I wanted to comment on first was the carelessness on the special features of the DVD. It included a game of memory, which asks the player/viewer to match up pairs of animals in order for them to board the ark. However, every time it reveals the chosen animal, the screen prompts the player to find (or congratulates the player on finding)"it's mate."

Mario Van Peebles tries to go the Jean-Claude Van Damme route and play a renegade robotic soldier who goes AWOL from his team to find out why he's not playing. He's not sure if he wants to go back to the game and see if he was right or left. "I just want to find out why. I want to find out what happens. I don't want to play a game and just think about the consequences," said the 32-year-old. "I like action, you know? I love the thrill of a chase.

Let's face it.This movie is incredibly cliché, as Korean romance dramas and movies go. First of all, there's a pair of long-lost siblings, one of which falls in love with the other. Second, there's a not-so-popular girl and two gorgeous, popular guys who fall for and fight over her. Third, one of the characters suffers from a tragic disease, which, eventually, takes his life.Still, I like this movie.Without the right actors, this movie would probably have disappointed fans of the novel. But because the actors fit the roles perfectly, the movie is engrossing--I honestly couldn't stop watching.

BIG FAT LIAR, in my opinion, is an absolutely hilarious movie with a moral to it. When Jason (Frankie Muniz - "MALCOLM IN THE MIDDLE") and Kaylee (Amanda Bynes - "ALL THAT") played those tricks on Marty (Paul Giamatti - DOCTOR DOLITTLE), I really smiled and felt good. That's what I liked most about this movie. As a matter of fact, everything that happened after Jason's essay erroneously ended up in Marty's hands was hilarious. I especially loved Jaleel White's cameo.

* * * MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS * * * * I was super excited to go see Blood and Chocolate last week, so when I found out there was another one, I wanted to see how it’d compare to Blood. And to my amazement, I’m actually kind of liking Blood. It’s not as good as Blood in all aspects, not as dark as Blood in many aspects, but that’s the fun part about watching movies with your friends. It’s easy to just get swept up and have fun with it.

Love this little film, that reminds me somewhat of the original Japanese gem, SHALL WE DANCE? (not the overblown Gere/Jlo remake...) Luckily I found it and taped it when it was showing on a STARZ Promo Weekend, because as far as I know, it's not available on DVD. I'll watch just about anything with Yancy Butler (anyone remember the short-lived TV series MANN AND MACHINE ???) in it, and she positively shines in this. She does a dance routine to a disco song that is verrrryyyyyy HOT!!

This film is great ! Being a fan of `` The Comic Strip Presents ... '' I just knew I would love to see how the strips looked in animation. And I have no doubt that they look amazing, especially if they could be as well done as they looked on the screen. The only problem with this film is the voice over, it would have been nice if they could have done it in another language. However I still think this would have been an incredible movie to see. The animation is amazing, the story has a good balance of violence and humor.

To start with, I have done some further research on the film. Firslty, Jules Dassin directed and acted in this extremely imaginative and different film noir crime film. Secondly, This was a very low budget film, created in the Rennaissance of the prime moment of film noir. Thirdly, the jewelers where the robbery was attempted is an actual jewelers. The producers of Rififi asked them to film their, surprisingly, (I quote Jules Dassin in a recent interview on the subject, "surprisingly, for some not very obvious reason, they were delighted at the idea of a crime film being set in their shop).

A bad Quentin Tarantino rip off , at least I hope that 's what they were going for because at least they had some originality here. But then again, this isn't a rip off, it is actually a sequel to the movie Tarantino did called Django, which I would say is more of a rip off. So I'm not really sure what the problem is, it just doesn't have to be with this, it can be the other way around, and I do think this is a more original interpretation of the film.

I rented this film from Blockbust because of the Cover and Title ! Sounded intriguing ! ! This movie suffered greatly from poor editing, badly structured storytelling and poor voice over work. I watched it several times and found it difficult to keep up with and understand the meaning of everything. If you enjoy this film, it may be worthwhile. I would say that it may be best viewed on a big screen with at least a 30' TV behind you. I found the voice over annoying, especially when the characters do things the same way every time. This film is very bad.

Well, first off, the twins are exactly the same. there is no one is girly and one is tomboy (Ashley is taller than Mary-Kate though) and their boyfriends aren't even French, so that is bad because they are faking the accents. Lamo. It is also not that bad, not their best. I am A big Mary-Kate and Ashley fan, don't get me wrong. the storyline is OK and it is funny to watch. it is not the type of movie that you would watch over and over again.

I love this movie ! It has everything ! Bonnie Hunt did a fantastic job co-writing , directing and co-starring. And it's not just the characters. The actors did an incredible job. The cinematography is a perfect example of how to shoot on location in the mountains. It's beautiful. And the songs are the best ever written. All in all I would definitely recommend it. It was such a great movie to watch, and I really liked the story and the action scenes and the songs, the performances, and the atmosphere.

I am sick of series with young and clueless people , talking about their `` problems '' all the time . I am not even kidding , it is a real problem , but that is what it is , the problem is a real one , we have got to get over it . When I talk about it , I make the point , not that it is a great problem , because I don't think that there is a great problem , there is a problem which we need to deal with , a great problem that we can fix .

Like the other comments says , this might be surprise to those who have n't seen the work of Jeunet . I did a quick search and didn't find much on it either. I think the point is well taken, especially since I've heard a few people complain about a lot of work being required at the moment and I'd love for it to stop. It would make it much more enjoyable to see all of the work that's been going into the game rather than waiting for someone to make it available for download.

Van damme has done some great films over the years and this one hits a big ten in my books. From the setting of Mexico to the five star fight scenes, this movie was amazing. The film is all about border patrol officers protecting there territory which is the border of Mexico. Ex navy seals are smuggling drugs out of Mexico into the united states of America (USA), Van damme and Scott Atkins give stunning performances as the cop and the villain. Although this film wasn't as good as until death but it still gave the action,acting and the film a five star look.

Let 's summarize how dumb this movie is with two details : Arnold to Antichrist : `` Let 's see how they die !'' : `` Let 's see how they die !'' But : Arnold : I think they are dead : so they can still be alive ! : : : : : So, : they can still be alive : so : they still have a life : so they are alive : and they are not dying : and : that 's how we know : they are dead ! : `` They are dead!'' : What ! Arnold ?

Do n't Look in the basement is actually a very clever and well thought out exploitation flick that gets a bit over the top at times, but overall it is a very entertaining and well acted piece of work. It is a shame the cast and production were not given any more respect or recognition for the work they do. It is a film that deserved to be more than just a small film, and it will not get that. Overall Rating 4/5

I'm very glad that there are some people who like to go to movies and enjoy them.

The Soap is an interesting movie and very brilliant at parts. You must watch it for its strong characterisation and the risks the plot about two troubled individuals falling in love takes. You must know the story through various other reviews, so lets speak about what is brilliant about this movie.Firstly, the two protagonists are so real and such intriguing personalities. The first being a woman who has opted out of a four year relationship and is angry enough to sleep with anyone coming her way. The second being a man who has always wanted to be a woman, whose pain and loneliness is shown with so much sensitivity and brilliance.

`` De Dominee '' is based on the life of a real dutch gangster , Klaas Bruinsma ! In the early 20th century , De Dominee '' is one of the most successful gangster movies , in the whole genre . Klaas Bruinsma is played by Dirk Denk , who is one of the greatest acting talents . De Dominee '' is a movie that combines many genres , in the past it also was adapted as a novel . The film tells the story of a gangster named Klaas who wants to run for his life in order to pay off debts .

It's schmaltzy, but then what else did you expect? The heroine is Cinderella's younger sister complete with wicked mother, sister, and brother-in-law; the hero (if you can call him that) is an ineffectual putz; and the rival love interests are full of melodramatic villainy.The cast, settings, and wardrobe were all very attractive, and I thought the actors did a superb job considering how weak the material was. The movie was prettily filmed and boasted a soundtrack that was carefully crafted to cue the viewer about what emotions he should be experiencing throughout.

I wo n't go into detail about why this movie deserves an awful rating , plenty of other people have mentioned it as well . But i do want to give an explanation of the rating . This movie is based off of a true story , but the movie takes a lot of things that happen and makes them look like something that happened to you . Thats a big plus in my eyes . So to review , i will give my own personal view of the movie and review the rating and let you know which one you should watch , and that would be 5 out of 5 points .

Comparisons to the original series are inevitable . It 's a shame Diana Rigg left the original show in the first place. I don't think that anyone has ever really said it, but at the end of the day, they all are just different incarnations of the concept. That is what the show has been missing in terms of continuity. On the whole, I'm not sure why they'd have to make a new version. Maybe it is just me, or it is just me, but it seems like it would be a much better idea to just re-introduce the characters we all loved.

You can take the crook out of the joint, but it seems exceedingly more difficult to take the joint out of the crook. We've seen this kind of character in this kind of situation before (and since): in movies like BOB LE FLAMBEUR, ELEVATOR TO THE GALLOWS, TOUCHEZ PAS AU GRISBI, THE ANDERSON TAPES, etc. Too many times to mention. What helps make this one one of the more notable is (of course) the heist itself, which plays out wordlessly in real time, and the demeanor of the lead.

This is an extraordinary film. As a courtroom drama, it's compelling, as an indictment on the American justice system, it's frightening. For Brenton Butler the consequences of this system could be devastating. This film highlights the fundamental flaws of the legal process, that it's not about discovering guilt or innocence, but rather, is about who presents better in court. In truth, the implications of this case reach beyond the possibility of an innocent man being found guilty, or a guilty man being free. Every citizen has a right to justice, whether a perpetrator or a victim.

the actors cannot act. all dialoague was plagued with bad accents and loss of character. Channing Tatum never moves his lips or changes his facial expression... EVER.the story is nothing new at all. some kid from the street gets involved in a professional world of dance and it turns his life around. that coupled with the whole incident involving the little kid is taken straight from You Got Served and Save the Last Dance (I'm not saying that those movies were any good either, but that is to say that this movie brought nothing new to the table).and the dancing...

It's nice to see a romantic comedy that does not have the prissy man lead, this has solid acting from both male leads and also from the female lead and although the story is a little long and a little cliché you cant help but like it.I think the story was a little rushed at the end, but extending that would have made the story even longer. Superior to other romantic comedies such as 100 days with Mr arrogant, and possibly tied with my tutor friend.It would make an interesting introduction to Korean cinema, not as great as My sassy girl, but still good.

Mani sir as usual brings out another amazing story with Kannathil Muthamittal. Such an amazing relationship between parents and child is brought out in a beautiful fashion. Mani Sir as usual without much special effects and not much outdoor shoots. (In fact this was the only movie where he went outside India ever..that too just to sri lanka).Mani's class is written all over the movie...and to add to it ARR's music..which is just amazing...Vellai Pookal is one of my most fav songs ever... Maddy,who is what he is in the film industry has impressed a lot too.

I too saw this film at a film festival, but unlike the previous poster I found it both interesting and original. In a sea of terrible features, shorts are often twice as bad do to small budgets and poor acting, A.W.O.L however is a taut little thriller that hearkens back to "The Outer Limits." The performances are solid, not that one would expect otherwise from Morse or McGinley, and the directing is sharp and on the money. I personally find it difficult to reconcile the previous poster's comments with the film I saw.

The greatest movie ever.How 's that for a contention ? However , if we look at it through purely cinematic standards , the greatest film ever is considered to be a movie that never fails to create some of the most profound and beautiful scenes in cinema. How 's it done ?In simple terms, it has to do with a number of factors.First of all, if we take the definition of a great movie we can easily see it is a film that can make you want to watch it over and over again. That is because it can make you think in different ways when you view it.

Fun, entertaining movie about WWII German spy (Julie Andrews!) falling in love with American pilot (Rock Hudson), while trying to get secrets from him. For some reason this was attacked by critics and shunned by the public in 1970--I can't see why. It's beautifully shot, has wonderful costumes and interiors, and exciting aerial dogfights. Also it has Andrews doing a strip-tease (strictly PG material) and singing a beautiful song--"Whistling in the Dark". The movie does have problems. Andrews and Hudson did not get along during the shooting of this--and it shows.

my friends and i watched this movie last night . it was pretty incredible . by all means , this movie is worth it to watch . you will enjoy watching this . i loved every part . i also really like the girl . hehe . great movie . it is not a comedy . it is actually a romantic comedy . i dont think there will ever be any other movie that has that much romance in it . the story was interesting . i mean . it was a romance , but it was more about the romance rather than about the comedy .

If you 're a long-time fan of the Doctor and you cringed when you heard they were making another series of The War Games. Well if you've been reading the pages for the past few weeks, you'll know that The War Games isn't a new show, but it's the first series of the BBC's revived version of Doctor Who. And it's just in the nick of time, as the new series won't be airing until next month. But, there's nothing to worry about, because there's only one Doctor.

I found this movie to be preachy and unrealistic . It tries to be a movie showing kids fighting against evil forces. However, it never really does it and is quite boring. But the story is interesting as it is similar to a true story that has come to the surface in the last years. In the story, the hero, the father of one of the two main characters (both boys) is a doctor at the end of his life. The father decides to give up his job and retire and leave the family.

The submarine used was NOT Varangian! 'It' was in fact two boats, P614 and P615, both built for Turkey by Vickers Armstorng at Barrow-in-Furness but kept hold of by the Royal Navy for the duration of the war. P615 was sunk but P614 was eventually delivered in 1945. The confusion no doubt arose because someone looked up P61 (as I did) and found Varangian! When in fact, the last digit of both P614 and P615 was in fact just painted out....There are some extremely realistic moments in the film. These Turkish boats were very similar to the S-class.

If it was possible to give negative stars I would for this stinkburger.Don't get me wrong I LOOOOOOVVVEEEE a good crappy movie. I am a big fan of films like Octoman, Wizard Of Mars, Queen King and others. Real classics of B-Cinema.But this film actually makes Jack Nicolson and Boris Karloff in The Terror look like an academy award winner!! The Dialouge is so needlessly long-winded, and mostly inappropriately used. (ie. "I will now Condensened (yes, condensend!!) to your wishes. What a crap that movie is. The script is simply non existent. The movie at times seems like a music video. But it cannot even be that since the soundtrack does not really match.
