The scene when Harlan is interrogated by some policeman is merely pitiful. Generally speaking, recent Seagals films are hardly watchable. What the hell happened to the guy?

A wasted effort. On the surface it's a typical disaster movie: we're involved in the lives of a few people who get caught up in the Big Event. However, the script is so awful and there's so much explaining of the characters' background within the dialogue that we feel we're being treated like morons. Even Sesame Street didn't explain the origins of Mr Snuffleupagus or how Mr Hooper died: we can work it out. Someone thought that entering 'Enron' into the script would give it currency when discussing power companies.

I think the manuscript of this movie was written on the piece of toilet-paper. No respect whatsoever to many important details which intrinsically make the movie. For example, the names of some Serbian terrorists (that I remember) are Caradan Maldic, Ivanic Loyvek and Leo Hasse. What kind of names are that? Certainly not Serbian! By the way, Caradan Maldic!!! What a name, I laughed for days thinking about it. Probably an implication on Karadzic and Mladic. Secondly, there have never been any cases of terrorism done by Serbians.

This is good movie that is flawed in many ways with low production . Martha Coolidge herself said she only made the movie because there is no way she could sell it at Sundance (which is what she did last time she was a producer in this capacity). A lot of the credit goes to this cast who are fantastic as they really get into these roles. Let’s hope it does well with Sundance as it is an excellent movie and worth a watch in the context of what the film does well and doesn’t do well at.

When a bomber , a patricide , a pornographer , and a mad biker , together with various other forms of terrorist activity, spread the terror of the state to millions of Muslims and many of them have been killed in the bombing of the Twin Towers and in the subsequent carnage at the American embassies and other installations in Beirut, London, Rome, Paris, and elsewhere. No doubt, the actions of the various terrorists has caused more death to their victims than any other single event in history . It is true, the actions of these terrorists has not created the state of terror with which it is claimed.

Hahahahah Probably one of the funniest movies i've even seen. Obviously this isn't intentional though. It takes about half the movie for the main characters to realize what the big hilly thing is in the middle of the city is spewing hot red stuff, and the other half spent diverting the lave flow through the city using fire trucks (yer right). It certainly made me laugh. The acting makes Arnie look like a RSC thespian. It is amazing that films like this get commissioned. A more interesting version would be someone going near an active volcano and filming it, and would probably cost about £20 to make.

This film is terrible . Not only is the story unbelievable , the situations the characters put themselves in are unbelievable , and I can't believe that the actors in this movie are all over the place . I was hoping for some comedic scenes , and I got some great laughs . This is probably one of the worst films you could possibly see . I am going to give this a 3/5 - not really the worst film that you will ever see , but I can't even say that I recommend this movie - not even close .

I'm a huge fan of zombie movies and this is just a pathetic attempt at one. I find the best features of zombie flicks to be the sense of solidarity and a need to survive. This movie focused more on a "let's just make it gory" view.The movie was full of bad acting and even worse special effects. When the zombies emerge from the floor and take the guy down, there is blood just spraying out of the hole. I wasn't aware that holes in airplane floors bleed so extensively.

I 'm almost embarrassed to admit to seeing CALIGULA twice . The problems with the production are almost too numerous for one person to mention . I'm not going to name any names for fear of causing them more grief and frustration . But, I will try to put them all into a chronological order in the order of a production. The first set (the set that was to be released) is dated January 31, 1991, in Los Angeles, CA. For some reason, it was originally called THE GIRLFRIEND'S CUT.

Spend your time any other way , even housework is better than this movie . The jokes are n't funny . It was an interesting ride , and it did a pretty good job at it . I thought this movie was better than The Wiggles . What a waste of money , the only person in it was the star , and all he did was smile at the camera . This was not a great movie , that's for sure . But its still a good movie . And I hope you enjoyed this review . Please leave your thoughts on the film below .

From the start of "The Edge Of Love", the viewer is transported to the striking world of WW2 London. We follow the lives of four people who might have been created just for this movie, an exploration of female friendship and the strains caused on it by marriage and infidelity. Except one of the characters is named Dylan Thomas, perhaps the greatest English poet of the 20th century. And his reactions to the world around him were not only selfish, but at times truly despicable. This movie is based on Thomas' writings about love and romance.

`` Valley Girl '' launched Nicolas Cage 's career and was an 80 's version of `` Romeo and Juliet. '' She played a lesbian who 's mother (Gwynyth Walsh) and sister (Julie Christie) were both women. She starred opposite Richard Cawthorne in the 1976 film `` ``Love'' and later was nominated for an Oscar and a BAFTA. She had an on-screen couple in `` ``Mildred'' (1993) and had a lead role in a remake of '' ``Gigi'' (1999) and was married to Robert Duvall 's brother John Duvall 's son Ben.

Eaten Alive plays out like a bad rehearsal for the following year's Cannibal Ferox. The characters are universally bland, the locations are criminally under-utilized, there's no attempt to create tension or suspense, the physical effects are either laughably bad or shamelessly stolen from other movies, and the ubiquitous tribal rape scenes are barely worthy of a PG-13. Even the scenes of animal 'cruelty' are more tedious than usual. The only mildly shocking scene involves crazy Jonas, going a bit Goldfinger, wielding a blood soaked dildo; a scene that is just plain bizarre rather than graphic.

This is definitely a touching movie, and a great expression of Charles Darwins personal struggle. The movie is not only about his struggle to get his book "the origin of Species" published, but also his relationship with his oldest daughter. His daughter was at start the only person in his family to approve of his views, something that she as well had to pay for. Een more than him at times.Now, this is not an evolutionary propaganda film, as a matter of fact I think it managed to stay very neutral. A hard thing to do in my opinion.

I absolutely adore this film about a lady columnist ( Barbara Stanwyck ) for a major homemaking magazine who delivers an incredible performance as she tries to cope with what it's like to live with a guy who is not your average husband. In addition to the incredible acting, this movie was a huge commercial success as it brought in $1,000,000 for the studio and became a favorite of critics. It is a rare film where women are the main characters and are treated as equal, and that is what I appreciate most about it. It's not just a story about a real life story.

Finally ! Third time lucky . This film has been always been on my mind , but my first viewing was last week . This one is the best . Not only for the performance but for the story as well . I loved the story , the music , and the performances of each cast . I couldn't wait to see the movie . So I didn't wait long . I'm happy with it . The story , music , the acting , and the acting performances are really good . This was a good experience , I didn't regret anything . I really like it !

I was expecting a lot from this movie, and I can say I haven't been disappointed. First of all, this movie, as a world tour of wine making, let the spectator enjoy beautiful places. The people interviewed are really interesting and funny too, in particular Hubert de Montille. The shooting may be confusing, the camera always being unsteady and often focusing on secondary elements in the backgrounds. You may not like it, but I don't consider it as a defect.The themes raised in the movie may be kind of confusing as well, since globalization isn't the only issue discussed.

There are two things that I noticed in this film. (This is not a spoiler, just a mistake in storytelling.) When Cole takes Bill to his first B&E, he finds the "box". As soon as Cole finds it he says, "The box. Everyone's got a box". A minute later, just before he dumps the contents on the floor he says, "We're actually very fortunate. You don't see these often".Observation #2 (Spoiler Alert! )I had to watch the thing three times, I couldn't figure a couple of things out.

Detective Dave Robicheaux is trying to link the murder of a local hooker to New Orleans mobster Julie Balboni . . . But he needs to prove she was involved in the killing. If he can do that, he might get a life sentence . . . or, at the very least, a life in jail. When his boss is murdered by his own brother, Detective Robicheaux can't stop thinking about a case he never thought he would be involved in - one of the biggest organized crime cases in the history of Louisiana.

Realistic Master-Piece . thirty years later , the pictures can look a bit old , but actually , it only takes a moment to understand the beauty in them. the only thing that is different for the next generation, is that there are a lot of new technologies available now, which can be used to take this master piece of art to the next level (and beyond , as well). This is just the beginning, and we hope you will enjoy it , and will be inspired to start doing things the same way as they were in the '80s.

This short subject gathered kudos from all kinds of places for its plea for religious toleration . After a session in which the Catholic church and the state agreed to keep religion out of school, President Donald Trump's first act as president was to undo it. That's how it began. At a rally in Wisconsin in June, Trump used the word "radical Islamic terrorism" and accused President Barack Obama of giving Muslims "tremendous latitude to radicalize and spread their evil throughout our land." He ended the remarks with a threat to shut down the country if necessary to keep Muslims out.

I 'm not sure whether i like this film or not . I think it is creepy and completely weird.Crispin : I really like this film , but i dont like the way it was done. I feel like it was very forced and i really dont think that the way this film is done is a good idea to make the film a "horror" film. I was expecting some sort of horror movie to happen. The way the film was made is just weird. So I am really confused on what I am watching here, and I don't even really know which films I have seen so far.

Five Fingers is so bad, that I hardly know where to begin. So let me admit first, that I have only seen the first half hour. When the first finger had been chopped off, I thought sleeping a more useful activity. I told my girlfriend the meaning of "five fingers" and she immediately followed my example.Couldn't the producer, the director and/or the scriptwriter consult a chess-amateur? Like me? They should have used a digital chess-clock and not an analogue. This major goof makes the mental pressure put on Martijn just a laugh.

I just finished up this unofficial adaptation of H.P . Lovecraft 's `` The Lurking Fear '' that was shot on a large 16mm film back in 1992. I couldn't remember how it was made, so I sent it in to see what I got. Here are the basic plot points and the actors who played in it, along with my own notes on the film and some of the technical aspects that made up its success. Some of it is from my own notes as well as the notes from the actors and production company that made this movie.

How any of you gave this more than 2 stars amazes me. I made an account on IMDb just to comment on this cr@p film. The acting is cr@p and the plot is cr@p. It would deserve no stars at all if it weren't for the descent soundtrack (and yet there are still some outrageously clownish tracks in there too, most notably the ones featuring the oboe and sound like black and white cartoon comedy background music and in no way fit the intended mood of the scenes that they haunt) and quality cinematography.

Even a bad Julie Andrews Musical is worth watching and this isn't bad! In fact it's quite entertaining. Actually it's a fascinating study on trying to manipulate a star's personae.To break Julie's "goody two shoes mold" she plays a German Spy/English Musical Hall Actress. She subsequently went on to take her top off in the movie S.O.B. and play a drag queen in Victor Victoria and other not so goody girls usually under hubby Blake Edward's direction.The movie is admittedly problematic It is hard to feel for her character because she's a German Spy.

Ah the sci-fi channel . How often do you disappoint me ? Quite often I think , do you ever actually expect people to be like this ? Well the same can be said of sci-fi TV. For the record I do like sci-fi so maybe it’s just me who is being a little bit cynical here? When I first heard the news about the impending cancellation of The Expanse it left me in utter disbelief. I had to watch every single episode after I first watched it for the first time and then again when I had finished it a few times after that.

This movie was bad on so many levels. The writing was horrible so even the best actors could not have made this movie watchable. It's a shame because they did have some good actors in this movie. I mean if anyone has seen any of the Police Academy movies, you would know that Steve Guttenberg was good. His Character in this movie was very serious, which was a big difference from Characters i have seen him play before, so that was a plus. And I did think that Steve Guttenberg was extremely hot in this movie.

Return to Me is a movie you will want to own. It is a story of inspiration and family love that appeals to all ages. The story, though seemingly impossible, aspires to divine intervention when a man looses his wife in a tragic accident and finds that love again in the woman who receives his wife's heart. David Duchovny and Minnie Driver give warm hearted performances as the designated to-be-lovers who meet by chance. But the real story lies in the friends and family around them who love and support them in times of trial. Carol O'Connor as Minnie Driver's grandfather, is authentic in every scene.

If there are people that do n't like this movie , I do n't think they are human . This is a very well done film for the first time ever . I thought this was well put together , but could have done with a bit more action in it . I don't even know how to describe , it was just boring and there was just so little interesting to see . There just weren't many twists in the film that were really worth watching . Now if they can do more in the sequel , so be it , but this one just disappointed .

After an astronaut dies in space , he is brought back to a military base . Inside the man are a dozen men who have lost everything. But when the soldier realizes the dead man is not a man at all , he finds his own body . In the process, the body is found to be his own son from a long-dead wife. In a way, it is no less a murder than his own father , whose life he took . But there is no justice in this world. The son is taken to prison for life, along with the woman he killed .

It's a bit unnerving when a studio declines to screen a film for the press before it goes into wide release. That many movies suck is no surprise, but when a studio itself admits as much ahead of time, the process of movie-going becomes a passion play of sorts. Consider it an early Christmas gift from Hollywood, then, that "Aeon Flux" isn't nearly the affront to taste and decency one might expect, given the above. Though ultimately overwhelmed by its flaws, it at least has (sort of) an idea with which to toy around.

In a world full of films -- like `` You Got Served '' -- that blow your mind with its sheer scope, imagination and impact, you can't possibly go wrong watching one. There's so much to take in and so little time to do it justice that the choice is an easy one. ``You Got Served'', directed by Alex Proimos and released in the United States on Friday, September 7, is a movie that brings to life what is an extremely important story: how a girl with nothing and an army of strangers helped save the lives of fellow soldiers.

Not a box office success ; no-one really knows why . It may have failed simply because of its title or its marketing strategy . The movie has become a talking point over the past couple of years, due to the fact that it is considered to be the worst movie ever. A lot of this may be due to the fact that this film has been compared unfavorably with other “great” films that have been made, and that have failed miserably. This may also be due to the fact that this movie doesn’t have a very good story or a very good film overall.

Going into the movie with the right expectations, I somewhat liked this movie. Like most reviewers who have seen this movie, I fully agree that the plot was razor thin, clichéd, and I could predict every plot twist from the very beginning of the movie. But, the dancing sequences were VERY well done, and I really enjoyed the fusion of classical and hip-hop dance (both which I enjoy watching). The music/soundtrack of the movie was also very good, which made the "drama" scenes more bearable.

One of the best of the 'kitchen-sinks'. Fantastic views of London and invaluable snippets of working class life of the 60's. Loach's eye seems to capture everything, yet makes no judgment - a taste of things to come. As with 'Kes', 'Riff-raff' and 'Sweet Sixteen', it serves as a cinematic social history of Britain. Carol White is completely convincing, you love her, fancy her, want to take care of her, but hold your head at her self-destructive decisions and still follow her in some vain hope.

This movie twists the facts of Anne and Mary 's lives into something unrecognizable . To make Mary Boleyn , the story would have to be told first . But who was Anne of Cleves, anyway? The truth, it turns out, is much stranger than many people would ever believe. When the film premiered in New York in March, I went to see it immediately. I was struck by the sheer number of things I'd heard about Anne. I knew she was a woman who lived a life far beyond the ordinary.

Oh dear! The BBC is not about to be knocked off its pedestal for absorbing period dramas by this one. I agree this novel of Jane Austens is the difficult to portray particularly to a modern audience, the heroine is hardly a Elizabeth Bennet, even Edmund is not calculated to cause female hearts to skip a beat. However I must say I was hoping for an improvement on the last and was sadly disappointed. The basic story was preserved, but the dialogue was so altered that all that was Jane Austen's tone, manner, feeling, wit, depth, was diluted if not lost.

My friends and I saw the movie last night in Austin at a showing for AGLIFF (a film festival). This movie was one of the best I've seen this year. It was a great comedy - very original and heartfelt - and FUNNY AS HELL! Everyone in the audience was laughing throughout the entire movie. Texas is a big state - with LOTS of small towns - and of course, plenty of teenagers who grew up as "fat girls." I know a lot of people will relate to this film on a personal level.

This Christmas gift arrived courtesy of TCM . We had never seen the film , even though we have seen and enjoyed it on television for decades. We have never been able to watch it on a regular basis so it was a real treat for us to receive the DVD and the Blu-ray. As soon as the DVDs arrived I began to search for it and eventually found it at the library. It was an easy decision. The Blu-ray has the full length of the film. I had been wanting to have the Blu-ray of this movie for many, many years, and it was finally here in December.

I was hoping that Pulp would be a interesting movie, but was profoundly disappointed.Pulp has very little storyline, and what there is never holds your interest. It was a real struggle to keep watching it. When its over you say to you self "huh? that's it?!?". This is one where you think after watching it - why did they ever bother?Its too bad since Michael Caine is a good actor. I was also hoping to see the great Lizabeth Scott in this, but she only appears on screen for a total of perhaps one minute.

Naturally Sadie is by far the worst show i have ever seen, it is such a piece of sh** and loaded with complete bullsh**. I didn't find any of the gags to be funny or somewhat clever, it was all awful jokes.The acting sucks, many of the characters sucked at acting, Charlotte Arnold (Sadie) is such a terrible actor, the other characters suck too (Magaret, Rain, Hal).The plot isn't unique and creative at all and the show is soo very much predictable.

This movie was, of the 67 of 71 best pictures I have seen, by far the worst. First of all, I found the plot line somewhat absurd - the absent husband for 25 years/ still in love/ not even a letter! Give me a break. And why was the guy who was absent for so long coincidentally working on an oil rig next door to the congress-woman's party? This film also exhibited some of the worst stereotyping of African-Americans that I have ever seen. It makes Gone With the Wind (see Prissy) look downright progressive!

After seeing this film I felt sick to my stomach and if I had seen one more minute I would have had to rush to the bathroom and vomit til dawn. A sick film that was NOT funny and was NOT worth the money, any money at all. If anybody ever wants to see this movie don't! Your kids will never forgive you and will claim sickness for a week. So if you value your child's education and want to stimulate your child's mind please don't see this movie. I beg of you, DON'T!

I watched this movie a couple of weeks ago and must say: I was not impressed, not at all. I do side with the other posters when it comes to the fine performances, but some good performances do not make a good movie.On the discussion board, I found a review by an anonymous poster that captured some of the main points. It says: "'Deed Poll' is a movie that raises many questions but hardly answers even a few; a movie that is disturbing and above every attempt at categorizing; an experiment and a very conventional sexual drama despite some shocking scenes.

The title , although singular , will undoubtedly remind real horror fans of Tod Browning 's immortal classic about a boy who becomes the monster he had been raised to hate and fear. And yet, the movie is so much more than that, so much more than a child who has become one. Tod is a haunted, haunted man, and the movie tells the story of him trying to make sense of all of the ghosts that surround him, but finding that there are no ghosts if you just look at him.

The sort of `` little '' film which studios used to excel at but seldom make anymore . Sort of the kind of movie you see on television now , not in the theater. Not even the kind of movie I want to watch . Like, oh, well, I guess, this time I will have to see it . Not like that . There is nothing I don't want to see , or that I don't want to have . I just wish I could . But , well, that's all there is .

... why watch a TV drama ( billed as a comedy ) in which none of the characters are likable? If you haven't read the books, it's unlikely you've come close to finding the character you're in, let alone getting a good laugh. As for the new series, the first series was not that good and there's more that I'd like to see from that team but it's not because they're new or different. They're just a bit behind the times and I'd like an episode or so to do them some justice.

I LOVE THIS MOVIE!! !This beautiful, charming love story drew me in immediately with its lovable characters and heart-warming romance. I became so attached to the characters throughout the film that I felt as if I knew them personally. The storyline is very enchanting, and it brought me to tears in several touching moments. Duchovny and Driver have a very cute, chaste relationship that you can't help getting involved in. This one's worth watching more than once, and showing to all your friends. I'm just curious, why wasn't this a big hit?I give this a 10 out of 10!

The worst film I have seen in the last 12 months. The plot of the story was uninteresting, the movie ended when he became gingesh khan, i always thought there happened something really interesting afterwards. i knew that Mongolia and all the areas where the movie played have beautiful landscapes but the movie didn't profit from that. The jokes where really poor. The narrator, gingesh himself, could have told a bit more about Mongolian history, traditions etc. My co-viewer knew nothing about that at all so he was a bit lost.

Susan Sarandon and Natalie Portman play Adele and Ann August , a single mother who 's the working definition of the perfect woman. Adele, it turns out, has 'sad' eyes. She is a terrible mother, a terrible daughter and she doesn't know it. But her best friend, Ann August (Portman), has an uncanny way with words and she knows that Adele is different. Adele has come to New York to meet a man she has been hoping for for years. She has come because she wants to meet a man, who she can love and trust.

This movie took me by surprise . I first saw it more than 10 years ago , and it stays in my memories . The story is still the same as the previous movies in this trilogy , but the screenplay and the acting are quite different . But this time a lot of action and suspense is in the way . The best thing is the music and the sound effects . I recommend this movie , because the story is interesting , the story is interesting , the story is interesting , the story is interesting . I got this movie from a TV series , which I never watched before .

MASTER PLAN : have the winning team in a deadly tournament . One of several martial arts action pictures that will be hitting your screens in May . Don't forget to check back in May for more action movies and a whole lot more martial arts films . JUDGE JUAN PONCE is a Brazilian judge with a sharp eye for talent. After a chance meeting with someone he can not stand, Juan decides to bring that talent into his home. But is it possible for talent to bring a bad thing to the good life? One of the few judges in the world to see talent go bad.

I agree with all the comments posted so far: This movie was a waste of time and energy, for viewers as well as those who made it. Terrible CGI, awful script, stupid plot and hey, the setting is Alabama but it looks like California. But the worst thing has got to be the Native American angle on this, which pulls in every stereotype you can think of, from the chief surrounded by smoke, the angry warrior, people speaking without using contractions ("Do not do this thing! "), Native American pipes playing in thin air, etc.

My favourite movie of all time. This was a flawed piece of work by Coppola and seeing the documentary 'Heart of Darkness' made it even more compelling. Coppola at this point was king of Hollywood after making 'the Godfather' and 'GodfatherII' and had developed the ego necessary to even dare try to make a movie like 'Apocalypse Now'. Through sheer arrogance he went to the Phillipines with a partial script and thought he would know what he would do when he got there. Just as Captain Willard thought he would know what to do once he got to Col. Kurtz's compound.

Like Margot in `` Fear of Fear '' falls victim of her ambitious husband , like Fox in `` Foxes , she falls for the first time and has to get rid of her virginity before she can regain her equilibrium. There are a few more scenes that will add to this movie but I will leave this here as it is one of the best romantic movies I have ever seen. It’s an emotional roller coaster and I have seen so many films in my lifetime but this one is my favorite. You will not be disappointed with this movie.

I have watched Grand Champion all the way through at least twice now. I enjoyed the movie's story, the characters and the actors were not bad. It is refreshing to see a G rated movie. This is a feel good movie. The story is mostly from the view of the children. The interactions between the kids and the adults makes the story interesting. I recommend this movie if you are looking for a family film. If you liked the Little Rascals, you will probably enjoy this. I viewed this movie on cable. Either on Encore or Showtime family.

* * * SPOILERS * * * * * * SPOILERS * * * There 's not much that can be said right now because I don't want to spoil the whole series. In order to answer this question, I need to explain something. Let's begin with the first thing I want you to think of. I'm going to tell you what you'll find in each episode. What I'm trying to tell you about the first episode is this, you will only be able to figure it out in the next two episodes of The Walking Dead Season 4.

This flick was the introduction for a lot of us to the works of K Gordon Murray . That 's the name of his most recent flick, which will be seen on a few of the film festivals around the UK. The flick follows the story of a young man whose life has just been ripped away from him forever. He now has to start over, again, as a normal person. The plot of the film is pretty straight forward. A girl has gone missing. She had been working for a private detective, but he's been told that he's not wanted, that he's being investigated.

After the failure of `` Hellraiser III : Hell On Earth , '' the chapter that served as a kind of "opening act" for the first four films, it would have been impossible not to conclude this film as a kind of "sequel." While the franchise seemed to have exhausted itself in its effort to find another "next movie," it could at least be said to have had a few more chances. After all, there were still some very promising elements in the sequel. The franchise has proven to be not only resilient, but even more interesting than it was in its first two outings.

I must say : out of all modern korean martial arts movies this one is worth checking out . It’s a remake of the original from the 80s but the production values are so much better . It really is an all around fantastic martial arts movie that I really enjoyed . A great action flick with a lot of thrills and excitement. I hope you do as well . The movie begins with an introduction to Kim Soo Hyun, the film’s primary protagonist. She is a high school girl who works hard in her classes in order to keep her grades and become popular in high school.

This film has made e mad . I believe the original of this film , 'The Mask ' , was a very great film and one of the better horror movies . It was also made by Hammer Studios . A lot of people liked this movie and after watching it they were very intrigued by it . However , i did not want this to be just another good horror flick . While watching this film i came across an advert for the film. This was not for the film as it said but i think it was the advert for the remake of 'The Mask ' , the film they are working on .

I have seen this movie 4 times in 5 months and i never get tired of it just because it is really good. I love the main characters of the movie, its very realistic and not a fake. I have only seen 2 parts in this movie but I enjoyed them both a lot. The first part of the movie, where everyone is dancing. I like that very much because it is funny and realistic. The second part where they are building a pyramid is very good because it makes me feel good because of how realistic everything is.

I 'll never understand why when a studio like Universal buys a musical it then butchers it when bringing it on the air. But it is done. The film is great. It has the potential of being the greatest musical of the last 20 years and I think that is because it is the one that many of you who have seen the film are most familiar with, i.e. it has been played and seen a lot. It is the musical that everyone who sees the film or is involved in the movie can relate to.

High school female track star dies of a blood clot after winning a race with the community in an uproar against Coach George Michaels(Christopher George playing him as a major butt-head who is VERY demanding of the athletes under his watch). He'll be canned after school lets out providing the flick with his motive as a possible killer. Some twisted psychopath in sweats(much the same as what Michaels is often seen wearing), using a stop watch to time his executions, murders the members of the track team the dead female runner was a part of.

"Tumbling Doll of Flesh" by Tamakichi Anaru is a Japanese shocker about three thugs who sexually abuse,torture and dismember a young woman whilst filming their horrible actions.Typically twisted Japanese porno sickie that offers plenty of sadistic sexual violence and grisly gore.There is no plot to speak of,just plenty of hard core sex scenes(optically censored again)and lots of blood.The special effects are quite impressive-the dismemberment of Japanese porn actress is shown in unflinching detail.The tongue cutting scene really made me squirm.Her arm is also chopped off and her stomach is graphically sliced open and finally one of the sickos is having sex with her intestines.

This film is one of my fondest childhood memories . Seeing the Muppets ( at the height of their popularity in the '70s ) with my dad, it was an event that we will never ever forget. There is not one scene, nor one thought, in the film that could be repeated. It was one of the most amazing and unforgettable film experiences I can remember. A great many Muppet lovers around the world are very lucky to know this film is now available on blu-ray in 1080p, and on DVD in anamorphic 1.78:1.

This movie is a terrible attempt at a spoof. Its attempts to parody various sports movies are half-baked and not at all funny.Even things that should be funny - like the female kicker from India who's always wearing traditional dress over her uniform - aren't really funny. The fact that the football team studies and gets good grades which makes the coach mad didn't get any laughs either.The plot of having a traditional loser get one more chance by coaching a loser high school football team really had potential as a spoof. It's a classic and trite sports theme.

The worst movie I have ever seen . The sound quality was bad , the cutting of the scenes was poor and the quality of the music was bad. All I remember about the movie was that I was bored out of my head. And I'm sure you could say the same for most people watching this. That's for sure. Just because you are bored in the movie does not mean it is bad or worth watching. There are so many better films out there and they deserve to be more appreciated than this.

A traveling couple (Horton and Hamilton)stumble onto the town of Gatlin, where kids have slaughtered the adults and are always eager to slaughter more, along the way they're separated and Peter Horton of course must save his wife from these tiresome, er terrible tykes in this very bad adaption of one of King's best short stories. In the original story King managed to create tension and draw personality of his characters, however all of that has been zapped from the production and all that is left is a repetitive bore which is far too predictable to be all that suspenseful.

Some sort of accolades must be given to ` Hellraiser : Bloodline ' . It 's actually out Full-Mooned Full-Mooned Full Mooners Full Mooners Hellraiser: Bloodline is the first chapter of a five-part series based on the original comic book series Hellraiser II : Hell on Earth . In the comics, Hellraiser : Bloodline takes place the same as the original Hellraiser II : Hell on Earth . Hellraiser : Bloodline was published in May of 2000. Hellraiser was published in December of 2003. It is also published in Europe, North America and Asia .

This is an interesting , hard to find movie from the early 70 's starring Jan Michael Vincent as a detective. Vincent, of course , is the father of the iconic character "Vincent from Chinatown" . I saw it back in the 80's and had to look for a copy , luckily I have a copy with a VHS label and not a DVD label. I have not watched the DVD because I prefer the VHS version, but if it was any good , I would've bought it. The movie, though not a huge action flick , is good and well produced.

...not to waste your time watching this vanity project. I've had my comment deleted twice now, for reasons that I have yet to understand, other than the suspicion that someone involved with "Gone" isn't happy with what I had to say. So, I've pared things down to the nitty-gritty this time with an excerpt of my original comments that can in no way be taken as a personal attack on anyone, nor unfair commentary: ""Gone" is the sort of train wreck that gives new meaning to the words.

Whoever likened this one to RAIDERS OF THE LOST ARK certainly knew whereof he spoke . He might , as he often does , say I am talking out my ass . but there are those that believe that this raiders-of the-loved-lost-ark raid will not only turn out to be a game changer in this digital age. The raiders are the raiders. We have not yet heard from those that are behind the scenes . I am not sure what they are planning to do now , but the raiders have had enough. It's time that those that have given them money come to the table and pay their dues .

Sorry to say but was disappointed in the film . It was very very rushed , as I suppose you would expect a film to be , to be so that it can be shown at the cinema and be seen by a small number of customers. It is disappointing , though not surprising. What a wonderful film. I have never seen a film as powerful as this, not in the cinema and certainly not on DVD or VHS - and that is without the music. I've never been so excited about any film, really, other than a very special one I saw in my very own home.

I watched this movie again yesterday with a 20-year-old intern from my office ( OK - it was the quiet one). I can't believe that there were scenes that made me cry. I could not stop watching the movie again until the credits rolled. I'm glad to hear that the movie is still making you cry even though it was a short, intense experience. If I remember correctly, there was a scene with a young couple in which one of the actors was supposed to kiss the other. That was the first I've ever heard of a scene where one actor kissed another.

This movie contains the worst acting performance of all time. Spilsbury lacks energy to say the least. Energy is what Clayton Moore gave us in spades. I never felt once in this movie that Spilsbury was anxious for anything. Revenge, love, justice? Not in this guy's portrayal.There is also no chemistry between Tonto and LR. If the plot did not force them to be friends, you don't get the impression they want to hang out with each other. Plus, the sidekick has the more interesting personality.

I hope the writer, director, editor, and composer (and let's not forget producer) read this... because their work was truly incredible on this movie. Let me start by saying that I am in no way affiliated with this movie. I am only a regular guy who has been a fan of this movie for about 12 years and have seen it about 8 times.Every second of this movie is touching. Every scene is classic. The acting is real. The movie is honest. You can relate to these characters as people, not actors.This tale follows three distinct killers at different stages in their lives.

Altioklar : Master of the thieves . Watch some movie , steal some parts of them , write a script , make the movie into something real . and after you did that , you want money ? . then they are not real ! you can steal them from people . 1) How do you know what is real ? It depends on who has created them. 2) They can be fake. Some movies have been made by the director. Or a part of the crew. But it's not the movie director who has created them !

Many experienced and excellent actors mixed together in an ongoing plot of an untold part of world war II on the eastern front. Characters well portrayed and unforgettable. One episode leaves you wishing for the next. Pay attention to the closing credits were the thousands of Shtrafbat battalions are listed. An untold story involving hundreds of thousands of individuals. Sometimes brutal, sometimes romantic, always filled with real people and dialog. Produced with excellent sets and camera work. Heroes and villains, criminals and priests, patriots and traitors. Portrait of people struggling to survive and overcome a most terrible time.

In my analysis of "Trois couleurs: Blanc" I wrote that its tone is much lighter than the tone of "Trois couleurs: Bleu". I think it's the same with this film. This time it's not because of a tragic comedy-element, but much more because of the main character Valentine. Although her boyfriend is living abroad and is ridiculously jealous, she manages her life with lightness and optimism, it seems to me that she might be Kieslowski's image for a carefree youth. The opposite seems to be the judge, who is very pessimistic, a grumpy old man, who experiences big loneliness.

I really like the show!! As a part of Greek Life, I can say that some things are over-exaggerated, but overall it's still pretty damn funny.Rusty is a likable lead character, his roommate is HILARIOUS and the entire cast is entertaining in their own rights. I like that it focuses on individual situations as well as interpersonal relations with the organizations.This show covers it all, and they do it without cursing or anything else that bad (how else could it be on ABC Family? ).My favorites are Cappie (of course), Rusty's roommate and pretty much all of Kappa Tau.

Man oh man, this was a piece of dog sh#t. I read a few reviews on here after seeing the case in the local video store, and thought to myself........ Ah this seems like a half decent movie.Vampires.Swords. Thailand.How can you go wrong? Right? No,no,no way f*cking wrong. Jesus, if only I could gouge out my eyes and not remember this film, I would be happy. The lead actor had THE whiniest, gayest voice ever.Man!It really was bad...."Amandaaaaaaaa....","I gotta save my girlfriend...." F*ck off!

Much as I really like Catherine Zeta-Jones , I wondered once again , why remake a good movie ? This is a film that has been well-loved for decades now , and the only reason this remake doesn’t get made is because of the quality , of course. But at this rate , the film will never get made. If that happens , there will probably be no more sequels or remakes , only more of the same. I hope there are no sequels or remakes and that everyone just settles for this film once again.

I just saw this movie and all I can say is, where are the drive in's these days. This seems like it would have been a great 2nd feature at a drive in in 1977 (maybe playing with one of those Joan Collins movies), but it's only worth watching now if you're feeling nostalgic for the 70's. Silly plot that is full of holes, but it does remind one of the era it was made in. Interesting to see Melanie Griffith so young and Anne Lockhart is quite attractive, though not much of an actress.

A killer (John Karlen) with a penchant for really bad disguises (afro wig on a white dude?) cruises around in his van looking for victims. Detective DeCarlo (James Luisi) is on the case and finds the killer rather easily by just hanging out by the local pool and looking for anyone looking weird (again, the afro wig comes into play). Tracking the killer to his home, DeCarlo decides to set up a risky sting involving a female police psychologist.Inspired by the crimes of Ted Bundy before he was caught, KILLER'S DELIGHT is a pretty predictable and cheap serial killer flick.

I looked forward to spending part of my Independence Day weekend watching a good film about Jefferson. This film was not it. It was rather long, drawn out, dull and unbalanced. Too much time was spent exploring Jefferson's relationship with Cosway and not enough time was spent on his relationship with Sally Hemmings. The lady who played Sally, Thandie Newton, was absolutely awful. Her acting was so bad it was like watching an A1 airhead trying to recite Shakespeare. Her constant whining voice grated the nerves! Nolte's accent made Jefferson sound like an ignorant man, rather than a genius.

A couple of clarifying comments are in order. Herschell Gordon Lewis contributed a brief introduction to the video release of DOCTOR GORE (aka THE BODY SHOP), wherein he touched upon his collaborative efforts with J.G. "Pat" Patterson, director and star of DOCTOR GORE. Patterson concocted the "gore effects" for THE GRUESOME TWOSOME and a few other Lewis movies in the late 60s. Lewis remarks that whereas 2,000 MANIACS was a "five gallon" film (referring to the amount of stage blood required), the Lewis-Patterson productions were "fifteen gallon" pictures.

This movie is certainly one of the greatest films ever made. It is a story told in a steady pace, told mostly not by words but by cinematic means of expression. Perfect blend of spectacular special effects and classical music bring to life creations of human imagination in both realistic and poetical way. The story itself is quite simple at a first glance. As the title implies, there is an archetypal journey, a motive repeated for thousands of years. This motive was always used not only to depict a trip in space and time, and beyond, but also had rich philosophic meaning.

I chose this movie because I was looking for a triangle friendship between a girl & two boys . As for the story, it's about a friend of a friend, the three friends try to create a new world . The movie has many layers, and this is just the beginning of what I've seen . I've enjoyed it immensely . The movie is based on a series of short stories written by Michael Chabon. The story was based on the author's life, in fact it's his favorite book, The Goldfinch.

I am not familiar with the producer's other works, but this movie is a piece of crap. I never saw the MST3K version, but I can tell you, Mike and the Bots probably didn't save it. I love a grade-z movie as much as the next bad movie fan, but this was almost unwatchable.There was no credit for who did the voice of "The Dark One". Sounded a bit like Patrick Stewart at times.A group of high school students who found a junk super-8 camera in the trash heap could make a better movie than that.

As if the world needed another Seagal movie . Add a bunch of actors who , well ... are not real actors, you know . The problem with The Mummy Returns is that it just doesn't feel like anything else out there right now. I mean , I'm not trying to complain that it's the only film in this list that I've not yet seen . But ... I'm still not sure I want to spend the rest of my life watching it. You see , it's a lot like an old horror movie of the '40's and '50's.

I had seen this movie when I was a boy (Before WWII) and was surprised that the local library had a copy. Saw it again after some sixty years and forgot how bad it was. This is an example of a movie that was not a "A" movie. No editing, poor script, weak acting and not much directing. Should not even be as high as a "B" Had a laugh at how jaded I've become over the years. Seems to me I thought it was good when I originally saw it.

When this series aired I watched most of it. I think it was supposed to be a long running series in the vein of "The Fugitive" and "The Incredible Hulk" where the protagonist is being chased around the country looking for a solution to his problems. In this case the hero's problem is his progressive aging in reverse. I liked what I saw of these shows. The acting was good especially the sorrowful relationship between the lead character and his wife. Problem is: They cancelled it before it had a chance to end.

When the film started I got the feeling this was going to be something special . The acting and camera movement was very impressive. I was looking forward to this as it is a well made movie, with a strong plot and interesting characters. The director was very good to work with too and did a excellent job of keeping it interesting. All in all I found the film to be good and I liked the way the story was carried out. I'm not going to post too much though as I don't have enough hours in me for that.

I kind of like JAG. It do have it´s charm but lately it´s to much propaganda in it. For an outsider (a non American) the patriotic feeling can be a bit to much.I don´t like that Rabb and MacKenzie goes from being lawyers (as they were in the early parts of the TV show) to become super heros that stops wars and rescues entire continents. Its almost like watching a recruitment video from the US army.I still watch the show, so it´s not that bad. But i would prefer more episodes when Rabb and MacKenzie investigates military accidents and don´t save the world in the future.

Lucio Fulci , a director not exactly renowned for his subtlety , ill-advisedly tries his hand at black humour in the first chapter of ’’The Book That Was Not”

It seems to me that I have come to one of those times where I can no longer do what I am meant to, and what I want to be doing has come to an end: I am in a good place, but it is not one where I get to do what I was meant to do. It is not a time for making new memories, and I no longer know what the future holds.

... what a porn movie would look like if you took out the sex and just left in the bad dialog, cheap sets and bad acting, you would have Galaxina.This film came out when the Original Star Wars proved there was a market for Science Fiction. This in turn lead to some gems such as Alien and a revitalized Star Trek. Unfortunately, it also led to some bad movies, and this was obviously one of them. (I say obviously, because I hadn't even heard of this film until a few days ago.I missed it when it came out in 1980.)

I was hoping to like this movie, to settle in for an evening of goofy fun. I like Judy Davis and Juliette Lewis, and the premise seemed off the wall enough to be entertaining.Unfortunately, I found myself dozing over and over again. Judy Davis gave a fine performance, but had very little to work with. Juliette Lewis was fabulous as expected, but had very little to do. The plot was full of "twists" that were just plain silly, and as so often happens in movies of this type, nobody acted the way a real human being would act.

whomever thought of having sequels to Iron Eagle must be shot . In this case once was enough . Iron Eagle and Iron Eagle 2 were made by the same person. If the guy who made Iron Eagle and Iron Eagle 2 was the man who made Iron Eagle, then there can be no question as to the fact that he has made his own sequels. If you know of someone who had a first sequel, I think you should give them a call if they are still alive. I think it is extremely unlikely that someone would be interested in making a sequel.

Yeah , a long time ago it turned into a tourist attraction . Now it 's a prison again . And you can see more prisoners than you can ever see on the outside of your cell . I don 't mind , it is fun to look at . There is lots of work to do . I don 't get out much anymore . I don 't mind , I am glad to get out . I guess I can see the prison in a way . It 's still there , and I see more than the rest of you here . I just wish we could go back to normal .

The good news for IMDb is that this movie was so very bad that it compelled me to register and vote with them. And I’m so pleased that so many of you did. Thanks again to all of you who made this movie such a memorable and worthwhile viewing experience. This movie is so much more than a standard thriller. It is also a romance, a western, a period piece, a historical drama, and even an action thriller, if you like that last one, which IMDb did not bother to do.

Are you kidding me? This is quite possibly the worst, amateur movie I've ever seen. The casting was horrible, the acting was worse than horrible and I'm sorry, the guy at the picnic speed loading his plate full of food was somewhere near pointless and the demonic turd and chamber pot chasing Drew around was nothing more than comical. When I herd about the Bell Witch, I wanted to believe. I read some literature on it and thought it sounded like it was possible a plausible story. But this movie just destroyed that.

Naruse is typically considered one of the 3 master founders of Japanese film , the other two being Ozu and Nakajima, who are considered the founding fathers of Hollywood in the late 1920s and 1930s respectively. His films have been called "classic Japanese films of the 20th century," "the first Japanese movies," "the masters," and "the films of a lost generation." He is the first person in Japanese history to win the Kodansha Manga Award and the first person to win an award for a full-length anime film.

I awarded this presentation 4 stars . They are all for the script , which has been butchered beyond recognition. It’s all just a set up to make you believe that something important will happen at a specific time, and the writers are not even thinking about the consequences of this plot . They just have a script that the producers want you to take a look at and enjoy. If you’re like me and are in the dark, you may well go back to your book or movie or whatever you are watching . You’re not even reading the scripts or watching the movie.

This 1955 heist film follows Tony le Stephanois , recently released from prison for theft , as he undertakes the theft of a gold shipment with a crew consisting of a couple of bums and an assortment of thugs. The film’s tagline of “A Little Crime, A Big Payback” was not an exaggeration, for not only is Le Stephanoi involved in a crime, he’s done it before. He’s been convicted and served a year in prison for stealing from a bank. He’s also been at it again, and in fact, he stole from a different bank.

If you feel Reshammiya as the singer is too much of a pain to watch on TV , try watching him on youtube, because that’s what he is all about. He loves to share his knowledge about Indian culture, and his videos are full of cultural and historical insights that you can find on YouTube. It is important to note that his name, Reshammi, is the Hindi word for “Respected”. So it is very interesting to watch his videos when he is discussing the topic of Indian Culture, history, and history in India, and Indian history in India.

What we know of Caravaggio suggests a strutting brawler with a healthy sense of entitlement who lived amongst whores and thieves and hustlers and put them on canvas. His works' themes were sex, death, redemption, above all, finding the sacred within the profane. He lived at a time where homosexuality carried a death sentence and political intrigue normally involved fatalities in a society defined by the maxim "strangling the boy for the purity of his scream".You can't fault Derek Jarman for his cinematography, nor his recreations of Caravaggio's paintings and you certainly can't accuse the man of shying away from the homosexuality.

But it 's not . The plot is n't all that bad , the actors are n't all terrible so why . What is the point in the first place ? What makes the plot interesting ? And it is the same for all the other books by the same author. They are good stories , but what makes them memorable is the characters . They are real and deep . They are flawed . They make you laugh , and make you cry. The author is good . The story is good . And the characters are real and deep.

OK, to start with, this movie was not at all like the book. I read the book when I was 13 and since then it has always been my favorite. When I'm waiting for a different book to come out, this is the book I turn to to fill in the time. I have 3 copies for god's sake. anyways, I knew this was not going to be anything like the book but come on! They could have done a little better than this. I mean seriously if I wanted to watch American werewolf in Paris or London than I would watch those movies.

I saw the world premiere at the Toronto International Film Fest, this is a great film.Real-life husband and wife Paul Bettany and Jennifer Connelly star as Charles and Emma Darwin in the midst of their struggle through the writing of and decision to publish "Origin of Species". Their consideration of the ramifications it may have for their family and the future of humankind are conveyed in such a manner that one suspects only an off-screen couple could achieve.Jon Amiel (who gave a heart-felt introduction) and John Collee do and excellent job of bringing Randal Keynes' biography to life.

If you 're like me and you occasionally enjoy watching terrible movies ( I guess it 's kind of like watching bad horror movies ) - you probably already know that they're called " horror " movies. This week 's list is for a horror movie from the 80's, in fact it's one of the last ones from the 90's and I guess the first one I saw, in theaters. I've seen most of these movies and I'd like to put them here because they're great and they make a lot of history.

Although i don't like cricket at all and i have seen this movie 13 years ago, I still think it is one of the best coming-of-age movies ..i remember the day i returned home from my school and sat down to have my lunch, I saw the opening titles of that movie and then....i was so immersed in it that i felt i was there, it really affected me personally. i still remember how i felt when i first saw it ,i felt that the poor boy was a friend of mine, going through the same adolescent experience we were having in those days.

This was Gene Kelly 's breakthrough , and that alone makes it memorable . Throw in Rita Hayworth as his love interest ( and lover ), and you have a masterpiece of film noir . But the movie is also an homage to a very different time in American life. Kelly is no stranger to movies that center around the Depression era. In fact, the movie he made about the Depression era may have had some similarities to the movie that he made before about the Great Depression. The difference? Kelly went out of his way to make sure he was able to pay homage to that time period .

Although I was hoping that I'd like it a little more, this was still certainly an impressive film. There were great performances by all the leads, and the story, while not what I'd call chilling, was still effective and it kept me interested. For me, the best part of this film was the look of the picture, for it always looked cold and damp and it just really seemed to suit the film well. I also thought that the low budget suited this movie, for I don't think that a crisp picture and clear sound would have worked as well in a film this grim.

This film is absolutely appalling and awful. It's not low budget, it's a no budget film that makes Ed Wood's movies look like art. The acting is abysmal but sets and props are worse then anything I have ever seen. An ordinary subway train is used to transport people to the evil zone of killer mutants, Woddy Strode has one bullet and the fight scenes are shot in a disused gravel pit. There is sadism as you would expect from an 80s Italian video nasty. No talent was used to make this film.

I absolutely love the first three movies , they were great ! I once caught Part 5 on VHS 10 years ago, I thought that was the last time I would see him, it's not! If anyone is interested in Part 5, please email me, it may take some time to arrange. __________________"It's easy to sit around a campfire. It's hard to ride a bike"

I'm really happy about the movie, I was really worried that it was going to suck (it does) but I think it's really great.

Even with only 6,000 bucks and a cast of part-time actors , Christopher Nolan was a master . Nolan is certainly the master in what he did to Batman , but the real genius of his work, and the reason his film stands alongside the greats of cinema , is in what he did not do , not with his film but with how it was done . His film, ‘‘Batman’’, had a couple of very interesting moments but there were some really stupid choices made in the story of the film.

Blackwater Valley Exorcism is set on a small town ranch where teenager Isabelle ( Kristin Erickson ) is found wandering the ranch house with an unusual ability. She is possessed by an entity, known as "the Devil". Isabelle soon develops a strong bond with the boy who is staying at the house. As Isabelle gets closer to revealing herself as the Devil's spirit, she becomes convinced that the boy is the Devil. After some time in bed with the boy at her ranch, Isabelle begins to realize that she has lost touch with her human side.

There is really no way to compare this motion picture to any other movie because no one has ever made anything like it and no one ever will. And it really should be seen in a theater to be fully appreciated. At the very least it deserves to be seen with a great sound system.I saw this movie on the day it opened in 1968, my senior year in high school. I went because I like science-fiction and wanted to see a "space" movie. Remember this film was made before the first moon landing.There we sat, waiting for it to begin.

Acting 10 , Script 1 . `` Hurlyburly '' is from that unfortunate postmodern school of theatre that has declared the end of all theatricality as a stagecraft. In '' Hurlyburly ' ', the audience, in the first act , of this play, is treated to the most unspeakable tableau. I think I may have said the same thing. I do, but I've been too busy lately with work and other things, and I haven't been watching the series. I should. Last night when I got home (after the performance), I went down to the basement.

This is one of those movies the critics really missed the mark on . This movie is practically McHale 's Law, a film about how you never have to pay your rent. This is the first film I've ever seen that was a satire on the whole mortgage situation. This isn't a "what the hell are you doing making a movie!" type of film. Instead, this film is really about how much your life is worth, and what it means for you to live in a society that values money over people.

This representation of the popular children's story on film is pretty pathetic to watch. I know it is one of the earliest efforts at moviemaking, but this 15-minute picture is unimaginative and poorly shot. "The Great Train Robbery" (1903), which I also commented on, is much more creative and exciting to watch.We see little long-haired Jack trade a cow (2 men in a cow-suit) for a hatful of beans from a merchant and later a beanstalk grows from where his mom throws them in the yard (I guess poor Jack attained the wrong kind).

I think this is a pretty good movie, but one thing makes it VERY interesting to me. It is blatantly obvious once you look out for it: the main characters in this movie are the inspiration for the bullies on The Simpsons. Layne is Jimbo, John is Kearney, and Tony is Dolph. There is even an episode of The Simpsons where Jimbo uses the line "I poked her with a stick. "The Jimbo-Layne connection is the most obvious with the knit hat and long hair and the voice. Kearney has the shaved head, unlike John, but is the big, dumb one.

A man kicks a dog 2' in the air.A woman kicks a cow out of her bed.A man kicks a violin down the sidewalk.A woman sucks on a statue's toe for 15 seconds.A man kicks a blind man in the stomach.Jesus rapes a young girl.There you have it. I just saved you an hour of your life. Surely there are those to whom this "shocking vanguard of cinematic expression" would appeal. But I found it no different from the puerile, disconnected videos I used to shoot with my friends in the 9th grade.

Hellraiser : Bloodline is only a so-so film . I believe it 's the fourth installment in the Hellraiser series.I do believe the last movie was the one with the 3rd part movie and the 2nd part part 1 and part 2. I've heard that the 2nd part part 3 film is not good . __________________The most important thing is how you treat those who you love the most. A man who lives by his sword is a dead man to all who approach him with a sword. I have been waiting for this film to come out for over 5 years and it finally was released last month.

If you have ever shopped at Wal-Mart, then you probably know about the $5 DVD bin that sits by the electronics department. Well, that is where I found this movie. However, I was tricked! You see, the cover of this particular DVD had a big picture of Sandy Bullock on it and even listed her name as a "headliner". I picked it up thinking, "Wow, I didn't know Sandra Bullock did this movie?!?!" So I was pumped to go home and watch a cool Sandra Bullock movie.

I do n't really know why so many persons love this movie : maybe it 's funny , OK , maybe it 's a bit boring , OK , but I love the movie soo much! It was the best film I've seen in the last years and I am happy I found it

It is not funny. It is actually quite sad. It is an emotional film with great acting. The film tells a lot about the
loss of a loved one and shows the struggle between humanity and the
grief, anger and sorrow of a family that loses someone very important to
them.

This is a pretty obscure, dumb horror movie set in the 1970s Everglades. It is really stupid and lame for the first half, then it actually starts to get good for the last half. There is a scene with the hero running to save his friends interspersed with shots of a church group singing, I don't know. It is mesmerizing. I was impressed with the night time scenes, because it actually looked like night, unlike most low budget horror films where it still looks like daytime. I feel like the director was really talented but was working with a miniscule budget and a tough schedule.

"Ghost Son" is Lamberto Bava's best film and, at the same time, also his worst. I suppose that statement requires some slight clarification. It's his best because it's well directed, ambitious, accessible and very stylish, but his worst because it's a dull, unoriginal movie and undeniably a huge letdown to all the real fans of Bava's past efforts. Let's face it: many fans, myself certainly included, wouldn't have been interested in this film judging by the plot, the famous names attached to it and even the boring sounding title.

I loved this movie but then again I am a big Cronenberg fan . If you have not seen a Cronenberg movie before then you will need a refresher on how he works and he is a master of this craft. You may have seen his “Tales From The Crypt” series and he really is not afraid to make the audience uncomfortable and get them talking. In his first film I did not think that the movie did a great job and this one does not look as good as “The Brood” but I enjoyed it and I hope you will too, so sit back, relax and take a breath.

I kind of like JAG. It do have it´s charm but lately it´s to much propaganda in it. For an outsider (a non American) the patriotic feeling can be a bit to much.I don´t like that Rabb and MacKenzie goes from being lawyers (as they were in the early parts of the TV show) to become super heros that stops wars and rescues entire continents. Its almost like watching a recruitment video from the US army.I still watch the show, so it´s not that bad. But i would prefer more episodes when Rabb and MacKenzie investigates military accidents and don´t save the world in the future.

I usually don't categorize a moving as boring. I am not big on action flicks and my senses do not need to be stimulated during a movie. In fact I enjoy a good rational logical dialogue and story line. Unfortunately, this movie has none of those characteristics. Diane Lane is the only saving grace in this movie and even her beauty cannot save it. Terrible overbearing music equals the moronic dialogue and acting. None of the actors actually connect with each other and as a result the movie does not connect with the audience.

Awful Star Wars knock-off with a slightly more comic tinge . Robert Urich stars as the leader of a group of mercenaries hired to fight in a Star Wars themed tournament. It's really fun and has a strong sense of humor. The movie is set to be released on September 18, 2015 in the United States, the UK and the European Union. The film will also be released in Japan. Watch it on Netflix and you'll get the full length version, as well as a new bonus feature titled The Best of Robert Urich: Episode 1: The Final Countdown.

As someone who was in a Pan-Hellenic sorority, I wasn't sure what to expect when I tuned into this show. After seeing so many over dramatizations in "made for TV movies" and the craziness of the reality shows, I was curious to see if Greek would be able to show the true College and Greek life experience.I was very pleasantly surprised at how the show was able to give the viewer the satisfaction of identifying the ever-familiar characters of this genre, but it was also able to add depth to the characters. Greek life isn't just about parties and petty conflict.

Christian Propaganda ... Lots of fear mongering ... This is not SciFi , this is ChriFi ( Christian fiction )

The book is a work of fiction but it's a very realistic book . I'm not saying this because I like the book , it's more about the message that the book conveys . The book is very well written , I would recommend it to anyone who wants to learn about the Gospel and see for themselves the true meaning of what the Bible is really teaching . Here's a little bit about me . I'm from Colorado , I'm a pastor and evangelist for over 15 years .

I saw this movie last night on HBO & didn't expect to get hooked - I usually fall asleep when I watch HBO. But it happened & you will too. It's a tragic documentary (2002 Oscar winner) about a murder of an elderly female tourist in Jacksonville, Florida and subsequent investigation, arrest, & trial of a 15 year old boy.Watch this movie today & get a feel for how we have progressed as a society. This film was most deserving of an esteemed Oscar - you'll be moved to tears.

Six out of seven people who took the time to comment on this movie have very positive responses. The one negative review happens to reside (or did) on the first page of the movie's location in the IMDb.I found "What Alice Found" to be one of the best movies almost no one's heard of that I have seen this year. It's 6.4 rating is misleading and may be more a function of the difficult subject matter than the quality of the movie. Who would think that a movie purportedly about truck stop prostitution would be worth seeing?

I really do n't think producer George Lucas did n't really set out to make such a horrible sequel as The Force Awakens. What's even worse is how many people have tried to blame Lucas for the horrible story. Here is just one example of the ridiculousness of the debate going on. I don't recall there being any debate when Lucas first suggested that the new trilogy would be based on a prequel story. He even had a bit of a cameo appearance in The Phantom Menace as an old man. It's almost as if people don't get it.

I cant go for long describing this tittle , simply because I do not feel strong about it . I do not see why I should be interested in writing this, but it is true, i am interested , and you know , if it were me , I would want to put it in my resume and make sure I got the job . So , why should i write this , if i don't think it can help ? I think it is not going to make me rich, so that is not my concern . But it is going to make me happy.

Since I 'd bought the DVD , I watched as much of this as I did out of a sense of curiosity and enjoyment. But I do not plan to buy it again . I had some issues with the story and characters as I am sure others will have as well, but I was very impressed by how I felt about all the people and how the story unfolded . If you enjoy this type of film then I highly suggest you watch it . I have only watched 2 of the films so I will be adding a review soon but I did enjoy all of the characters.

This movie and several other movies from the 1950s with a religious overtone, such as The Robe, Quo Vadis, and Samson and Delilah, unfortunately depict all pagans or anybody who isn't a Jew or Christian as morally depraved and decadent. The focus is only on biblical-related stories that ignore the world outside the Bible. As far as they are concerned, nothing good came from pagan Egypt, Greece or Rome.Any movie that preaches about the "one true god" gives a short shift to freedom of religion. The movies ignore the fact that ancient Judea's lack of religious freedom made it a fertile ground for religious extremism.

Imagine what it must have been like for John Agar . One of Hollywood 's handsome leading men . Married to one of the all-time most beautiful actresses on earth, and the father of nine . But John Agar had something he wasn't expecting. The woman he thought was all he had to give. And it was all gone. He had no idea who it was that he was sleeping with. No idea what they had done behind her back. No idea how she had found out. And the best thing she did was get him to pay attention to what was really going on with his life.

I can envision the writers of this story thinking up this script:1.Let 's make a serial killer movie like Se7en, and have it be based on a TV show from the 90s called Dexter. It will be fun to watch a guy who is obsessed with serial killers. 2.I get that they'd like to use Dexter's methods and methods from other fictional characters, but I don't know why they can't do it in a movie. It seems like they want to do it, but I think they're doing it just to annoy me. I know they will make the movie eventually.

Spoiler with plot explanation: a poor family is being thrown in the middle of war between the evil guy (that pops out from nowhere, and no questions asked... ) that went wacko, and Casper the friendly ghost trying to avenge his death. With every frame movie gets more and more predictable, a big disappointment. Ending seams completely dumb, it has nothing to od with the movie itself, i think someone run out of ideas or just get to the point that movie is s**t this way or other, so it may as well have a stupid ending.

I was a fan of Buffy and hoped it would come to a proper end when Angel got only one more season. But when the end came closer I was exited to see that. And what did we get? This episode called "NOT FADE AWAY" was the very last one.I was so disappointed by this episode. This is absolutely the worst way to this series. Why couldn't it get a happy ending? Why did have a few of the main characters to die? Why did Angel not become a human and was reunited with Buffy again? No.

Five Fingers relies heavily on barbaric , shock value Hollywood tactics to elicit apparently a positive movie-going response . This is the kind of film where you feel like you’re being led by a blind pony down a dark, twisty alley with no other light than the glowing red of the film itself. In Fingers, we follow two high-school friends who are stuck with each other for the duration of most of their summer, and who are trying to complete an online dating service. This is not to suggest that it is a bad movie, in fact, you will likely enjoy it.

There was a time when not all animation was Disney or Pixar . Its so nice to see this wonderful little studio getting back into the business with this fantastic series. The story, acting, animation, cinematography and production values are all really quite good. If you enjoy the works of these animators then this series is just the ticket to get the most out of your time with your children. But, you have to remember that its a series of animation not a film. I think its really good to see the older studio back into the business with these series.

The Other Boleyn Girl - not to be confused with the book it claims to be based upon. This movie is not even close to a faithful adaptation. I could understand them changing or elaborating on a few things. The book is not perfection, but it was well-written and became very popular. I could understand if the BBC wanted to make this a little more faithful to what actually happened, who Anne Boleyn really was - but it's not even close to being historically accurate either. It's just fluff. Mindless, made-up fluff.

I saw `` Sweeney Todd '' on Broadway in 1980 . It starred George Hearn and featured most of the actors in the cast who would be seen on Broadway and on television later in that century. I thought it a great show. And I thought the music was fine, especially in the finale . But I have always been reluctant to see the film version . For some reason . When I saw the film in 1999 I had the feeling . . I didn't know it at that time . . it was like being in the presence of God .

This is another Sci-Fi channel original movie staring Rhys Davies where its hard to decide whats worse , the acting or the story? I really enjoyed this movie but not for the reasons people think it is... its hard to judge an action film when the acting is so bad! But I liked that the film does not take itself too seriously. The acting in the movie is pretty terrible, especially Davies who is not too bad at it, but his acting in the film seems so forced that I don't want to watch the film again.

A new wrestling show paves way for the most feared wrestler ever imaginable , the giant Zeus . Network President Kevin Gable and co-promoter Scott Steiner, who have worked together for 12 years , were recently at a press conference where they announced the start of the first ever “Tower of Zeus” show , which will be aired on January 15th on the WWE Network . The official description of what is being offered on the program is: “The World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) debut show of the most fearsome monster in the world!

Regarded as another one of the recent over-the-top drama's brought upon us by Hollywood, this movie excels where others have totally failed(especially considering the most underrated performance in recent dramatic character portrayal by that of Natalie Portman), this film is almost unanimously driven by the chemistry that both Susan and Natalie share. They seem to be so natural during the movie that you would mistake them for a real family. They go through so many mother-daughter conflicts in the story its kind of hard not to pick up on their acting abilities.

Of the thousands of movies I've seen so far, this is the first one which made me think of the "wasted talents" expression. I had never EVER seen so many fine actors giving so dreadful performances (Frédéric Pierrot, Elsa Zylberstein,and so on). The "aging" make-up is quite awful and, to make it worse, lit broadly. The use of music (e.g. love at first sight for the young aide de camp) is at times so caricatural that I could feel most spectators around me smile awkwardly.
