They would think this was really stupid because they would be too afraid to think that they were alive. This is just plain stupid. Why? It makes sense that they would come to their senses.

With David Arquette starring you would immediately think this to be a stupid movie. Well, it is a stupid movie with a horrid script. But the F/X, namely the eight legged freaks, makes this flick a hoot to watch. A tribute, albeit on the silly side, to those great mutant creature features of the 50s. Arquette and Sheriff Sam(Kari Wuhrer)summon help in fighting off the toxic waste induced giant spiders wreaking havoc on their tiny town in Arizona. Also in the cast are Doug E. Doug, Rick Overton, Leon Rippy and the charming Scarlett Johansson.

What some Hollywood-movies try and practically never succeed , creating somehow metaphysical connections between persons ( without becoming unrealistic ) . For example , the first film by David Mamet , The Book Thief , and its sequel The Book Thief II ( with a new story ) were very good . But it was not a film , a novel , an idea , that was a real success . The film was actually a lot better than the first novel , because the original novel was written in the form of an autobiography , so the author did not have to describe his own life .

This is a spin off of Pulp Fiction . I thought that it would be good for a few decent sci-fi movie plots, but I feel that it is not that well done. I have to admit that I really love it, as it was my very first movie that I watched and it was a great movie, and it is a good film in general. It is worth the watch. I am glad that it was made, as it is really good, but it is not my favorite movie that I watched in the last year.

Okay so there were the odd hole in the plot you could drive a zeppelin through, but how well was the emotional stuff handled? It would have been so easy to descend into cheesiness but the writer pulled it off. The image of the ex female cyberman making crying noises as she/it saw her reflection after regaining her emotions is one that will stay with me forever. That's twice now the monsters have shown a soft side and been presented fleetingly sympathetically, the previous being the last Dalek from series one, but by Jove it's worked.

The Girl in Lovers Lane is one strange little low-budget film . On its surface , the movie tells the story of a teenager named Kate, who travels to London to spend some time with a boy from her hometown. However , the film is not very well received , and I have heard that it has only been out for around a year before it was banned in Germany. The film was shot over a 12 day period in the summer of 2000 and was the first ever low-budget feature film to get banned by Germany .

I love pop culture , but I was a little apprehensive when I first heard about this . Then , I got one and it sounded pretty good . Then , I got two . I love it . Then , I got three . And , now , we've got our fourth . Now , you know me , so , you know that , when it comes to these things , this is where I go first . This is one of the things that I've always had in my back pocket . If it was something I had to take somewhere , I always just put it there .

Like the beauty of the jungle , Jessica Alba 's gorgeous smile and sultry looks loom over the film , and it looks like it won't hurt to try. That's why we are here. This is the movie to watch when you know nothing about Jennifer Lawrence. The actress has been in a bit of a scandal lately because of all the things going on in her life and what they mean to her. And now, the new film she has coming out on November 7th, she is going to finally get everything out in the open.

If you're a long-time fan of the Doctor and you cringed when you heard they were making another series, rest easy -- it more than meets the high expectations of the original. The pacing is much quicker than the original shows, fitting more often into 50 minutes episodes rather than the average 90 minutes. The writing is excellent, the acting superb. The hardest - and best - thing to get used to is the production values of the new series. Compared to the original, it's got some now. (Although I will always have fond memories of bubble-wrap and hand-puppet monsters.)

As a fan of Henriksen (I liked him in the "Millennium" series) and of course Lorenzo "Renegade" Lamas, I had expected at least SOMETHING from this film. Sadly, the plot is predictable, the acting is bad and the computergraphics used for most stunts don't work out. Sometimes it even looks like they've captured some shots from Microsoft Flight Simulator.The cinematography sucks as well. Unnecessary funky camerawork in the beginning only detracts (from the cheesy dialogue) and gives the film a cheap, made-for-video-look.

What crack are you smoking ? This movie , while gloriously entertaining , is awful ! The action scenes are too long , the jokes are dumb , the special effects are flat , the acting is horrible , the acting is horrible , the acting is awful ! There is only one reason why you are going to waste your precious time watching this , you will find it extremely boring . It is the only reason why I would not recommend this ! I would not waste my time watching it ! I would rather watch an action movie for a few weeks than watch this movie for more than 5 years !

This is the worst movie that I have ever seen. At first i thought that it was going to be good because I'm interested in the bermuda triangle, but instead it was terrible. All it did was offer a bunch of lame explinations that didn't make sense (if time moves differently there how come the woman didn't age, and her son aged rapidly), and have a horrible sappy ending. Next time the guys who made this go to Bermuda they should take all copies of this movie with them. Please everyone vote for this movie so it can get on the worst movie list.

John Knowles modern masterpiece, A Separate Peace, are one of many subtle, and subtly is the watch word, themes of love, hate, jealously, denial and regret. The 1972 version does attempt to address this style and what the book is - A love story with war looming in the background. The 2004 version does not use subtly at all but overtness in the portrayal of the story. What is staring you in the face when you read the novel - is a love story, and yes maybe it is arguable, a gay love story.

With its rerelease by ADV Films, I've had a chance to watch "The Giant Majin" for the first time without the deep cuts and unkind words of a late night Horror Chiller Theaters. Guess what? It's a pretty damn good movie!The sets are authentic, the acting in subdued and believable, and the giant Majin is stately, powerful, and unstopable. I loved the subtle fantasy touches (the enchanted wood, luck charm, etc), and the potrayal of the god as a little less than 'good'.This movie is begging for a remake in the new century!

Most American remakes of European films are pretty poor , but this is in a league of its own . it isn't just about being bad remakes of old films . this is about remaking movies that aren't really "good" at all . it is the worst remake of a "good" film in the last 20 years . now, we don't call this the worst remake , because that is ridiculous . it is the best remake of a film with zero stars . in fact , it is as good as the original , and even better .

I 'd liked the Takashi Miike films I 'd seen so far , but I found this pretty disappointing . It's still fun , but not the way I expected . I liked it a lot . I thought the characters were interesting , and they all had their good points . But I thought that there were some weak points in the plot and in the acting . This is very much the way that I felt when watching movies in my early twenties , but in a better way than that. I 'm hoping that there is more to this .

I watched this on HBO because it won the Oscar a week earlier . It compares favorably with fictional courtroom drama True Detective, which is now available on HBO Max. While both films are set in the same time period, there are notable differences. While True Detective follows a trial, The Postman is told by a newspaper journalist. Both films offer a different take on police work. It’s not that they aren’t similar. They are. When I first saw True Detective, I really wanted to see The Postman.

This movie was terrible. It is not something that people should have to pay to see. It looks like some Christian group made it to convert people. I don't understand why it was released to theaters and not to TV.It started out like an old fashioned B movie sci-fi film from the 50s, but quickly changed. About 30 minutes into the movie the characters start talking about "God" and "Do you believe in Jesus?" It quickly moves into pure religion territory.I thought I was going to a Sci-Fi movie. The film has poor acting; bad camera angles and is amateurish.AVOID IT!

I really enjoyed this movie - I like prison movies in general ( I 'm not sure why -- I know that some people have great ideas about why they are bad and why they are good )

I think it has to be at least a little bit about the prison (the place in which we live), I like to think that there is some place in the world (or in your head) that you like, some place/people that you think are beautiful, some places that you would like to escape to, all sorts of little things.

Sappy.I liked how they went to the "Haaavaad baaa" to quote books at each other to impress the ugliest girl there.Probably the janitor at my school is a genius too but is waiting to land that big construction job.Just because you keep your nose to the grindstone is no reason to try to cut a steak with it. "Do you like apples? "the guy nods or something. "Well, how'd ya like DEM APPLES!" Wow, that IS genius.Duh, Minnie Driver would give her number to anybody. Robin Williams can't paint and keeps the good books on the top shelf.

I waited a long time to finally see what I thought was going to be a fun caper flick and it wasn't even funny, that is, hilarious, so it wasn't funny. It wasn't fun to sit through, either, so that's what I'm calling it. I'm calling it because I'm done being scared of this movie and I'm tired of being afraid of this movie and this movie. Because it's a movie I don't want to be afraid of no matter what, so that's what I'm calling it.

When a friend and I saw this in the recent releases, we decided to get it despite the fact that neither of us had heard of it before. We both like Costas Mandylor and it had James Coburn so we figured it couldn't be that bad. We were wrong. It was. It was REALLY that bad. No actor or actress could have made this film worth seeing. It was like taking Titanic, The Poseidon Adventure and some nuclear bomb film and trying to cut and paste it all together.I must admit that there were a couple of chuckles.

Lackawanna Blues is a moving story about a boy who is raised in a house by some pretty unusual people: his own mother and her mother, both widows living with their husbands in the East End; his grandmother, the only person in the house who knows him as “Uncle John”. He has never had a home of his own, but is taught by these people that he will someday be able to move into an actual home. But first he must find a place to hide out, in a house and neighborhood that he never knew he could exist in.

I went to see this on the strength of Albert Finney alone. He's one of my favorite actors and he rarely fails to deliver. I'm not sure if the plot is interesting or just silly: it's about a little boy who is about to be born, but as his mother goes into labor, he refuses to come out! This sends God and the whole human being factory into a crisis and Albert Finney is called out of purgatory to try and convince the boy to change his mind and decide to want to be born.

Yet another in the long line of "Don't" films of the late 70's and early 80's yet this one is much more than that. This film is a highly underestimated low budget schlocker with a twist. It has the grainy quality and bizarre soundtrack that is typical of horror films of the time period but it's the highly underestimated performances of the surprisingly talented actors/actresses that make this movie good. A young nurse arrives at Dr. Stephens' progressive mental hospital right after he has been murdered by one of his patients and all is not what it appears to be.

I saw this film when it premiered in LA . I think I laughed 2 or three times . The premise of the film is amazing . However, the dialogue, the acting , the directing and the production were all not up to par. I am not complaining as it was a great film. I just think that all of the people who made this film have to learn some more acting / directing / writing skills. It would have made this film better. I am sorry if I am sounding negative . I am a critic . You can call me crazy .

This movie should have come with a disclaimer that it was akin to the Left Behind series. I did not know it would be a Bible-thumping movie. I expected it to truly be a movie about UFOs and alien abduction for entertainment's sake. As previous reviewer comments, it would be fine to show at a church, but not at a public theater, at least not without the consumer's prior knowledge of what the premise of the movie is about. I felt deceived out of my $$ spent for this movie, as nothing in the summary refers to its religious overtones.

I 've never made one of these before , but this movie was literally so bad I had to say it had to be watched in order, and it wasn't half bad. At least I don't have to be the asshole who says, "this is the most terrible movie ever"

Lol I'm the same way, I've only seen an episode of The Office, and I've probably only seen like, about 2 episodes in total, and I'm still like, that's not a movie, I need to have a better idea about what I'm looking at.

Low-budget murder mystery about a Public Defender trying to clear his client of a murder the man had been convicted of 12 years previously. Complicating things is the fact that he escaped custody after his conviction, but the PD believes the man to be innocent of the murder and works to find the real killer. Gig Young as the PD is okay, and James Anderson as the convicted killer is actually pretty good, but the picture as a whole just rambles along with little suspense, and despite some good character actors in the cast, the performances are generally below par.

This story starts at the end ! So the film 's opening credits advise us . Unfortunately that 's not exactly how it happened. Instead, the film opens with a quote from the film's narrator . He's the one who tells us what he thinks about the story as a whole. So when the opening credits appear at the very end of the film, there 's nothing wrong with that ! In the first place, the quote was in the title of the film , and that would have made no difference .

I did have a good time the first 45 min . or so , but then suddenly it was all downhill . and I couldn't find the right words to express what was going through my head . I felt like I was on the run , I was so excited , but I felt like a coward . It was like my heart wasn't in my head , it was in my throat . I just couldn't breathe. But I didn't want to give up , I didn't want to let the day get to me like I had before .

Director Kinji Fukasaku is perhaps best known , in his homeland at least , for his Japanese gangster films , and for the series of samurai films which have been the most consistent of the series ever since the 1960s and early 70s , and continue to the present day . The first film in this series, the 1965 film The Karate Kid , marked the first appearance of the Japanese actor Keiko Honda. It also introduced many of his many successors in the role of the Karate Kid . It also introduced a very famous karate karate movie which is often seen in American cinemas , the 1967 film Karate Kid.

I watched this movie on TCM last night, all excited expectation, having last seen it (twice) in its memorable 1957 release in Toronto. I told my wife, who hadn't seen it before, to watch for the thrilling long tracking shot, no cuts, where Veronika is seen on a bus on her way to find her Boris. In a hand-held frame that certainly predates the modern Steadicam, the shot then pulls back up and cranes (pun unintended) over the street as she exits the bus, and darts among the tanks to cross the road.

Back in August , '81 there was a country-ish buzz to movies , big hits like `` Urban Cowboy '' and `` Midnight Run`` ( a.k.a. `` D-E-E-DROP`` ) were being produced . Then in March , '82 , the buzz started to slow . The big hit films that were expected to bring in $1 million, and were going to do so quickly, were just sitting in a pile and not being made . So what was wrong ? For the last decade, there has been a major problem with film production in the USA .

This film wasn't good at all. I was able to catch it at a film festival and didn't appreciate the content I was forced to watch. It's a well shot film about family looking to reconnect after the death of the family's cornerstone (Gabrielle Union) dies. the film stars Billy Dee Williams as Gabrielle's Union's brother. Well, actually, Gabrielle Union portrayed the woman in her early years, which should help explain why the woman was Billy Dee Williams older sister. This had to be Billy Dee William's worst performance in his career, ever.

This film is Engaging and Complex while maintaining simple beauty .Our two characters come together sharing the base of curiosity and loneliness, but it is a springboard for learning these people, they 're life styles and pasts which support this.The two lead actors (Bohl, Brundruge) were in the moment as any two actors I have ever seen. %100 believable, they transport the audience seemingly effortlessly, into their world. The actors' seamless acting teamed with Bechard's Beautiful, realistic dialog and his truthful direction drives the story forward into a striking and moving finale.This film is visual treat- soft ,increasing the intensity of The story.

This is a classic continuation to Bleu, the likewise excellent film, with Juliet Binouche as a main star, moreover, she is a cameo appearance here, in Rouge, just for a second at the very end. But this film, truly red and very sweet although very sad, is a real winner. The main heroine, played by ever great Irene Jakob, is a successful photo / fashion model. She leads a full, active life, only darkened by her traumatic relations with her weird friend Mike, who is in England.

Yet again, director J. Lee Thompson unites with actor Charles Bronson for a violent and uncompromising action flick. In fact, this is probably Bronson's most brutal film (quite a feat for a man who appeared in Death Wish, Ten To Midnight and Chato's Land). However, brutality doesn't on its own make for a good film, and The Evil That Men Do is ultimately a disappointment. If you were to take away its brutality the film would have precious little else of interest. The story is about a retired hitman (Bronson) who lives a cosy life on a Caribbean island.

Until today, I thought there only three people, including me, who considered Heaven's Gate (1980)to be a masterpiece and perhaps the last great western, (since the 1970), after, Little Big Man (1970), Jeremiah Johnson (1972), The Outlaw Josey Wales (1976) and The Long Riders (1980). I was stunned and pleased to see that 22.5% of those voting at IMDB rate this movie a 10, as do I. A recent book, the Worst Movies of All Time, includes Heaven's Gate.

Okay , it features one lovely blink-and-you-miss-it-joke ( when the dead are rising from their tombs , the names of these people come to life on your computer ) . You'll find this one at the end of your video . Thanks for checking out this one , and sorry to have it end before you came to it . It's just something I had to do with the title . This is my little hobby . It can get me in trouble . But I am trying to take this thing seriously . . . . I hope you liked it . If you did enjoy it .

After all the hype I had heard about the Jane Austin novel and different film versions of the book I found myself very disappointed with the movie. I had expected a classic drama but that was not the case. First of all let me preface my review with the fact that I love old movies, particularly mysteries and dramas, but not female oriented movies. This probably makes a huge difference, so take my review with a large grain of salt. I thought the acting was a bit over the top, but that is very common in movies of this era.

This particular film was one that I wanted to see in theaters, but never got around to it. When I finally rented it in the summer of 2001 I enjoyed it so much that I went out and bought the DVD soon after. Bonnie Hunt and Don Lake did a wonderful job with the screenplay and are wonderful to listen to on the audio commentary that is included on the DVD. They did a great job in creating characters that you really care about. I really felt a whirlwind of emotions watching this film including sadness, anxiety and joy.

Started watching this but didn't believe in any of the characters. In particular the relationship between the bakery assistant and the waitress just didn't work for me at all. The scenes between the bakery owner and the assistant were nice but the rest was just very slow. It was a very superficial movie and it gave me the feeling that I was watching play rather than a film. The characters were very 'stagey' and the storyline was a lot like a stage farce. By the time the pyromaniac waylaid the assistant I was bored and didn't care what happened next and so I switched off.

The idea behind Dead Silence is great: zombie outbreak takes place during an edgy paranoia radio talk show. There was so much going for this film. Unfortunately, as soon as the zombies made their appearance, all was lost.The film is ridiculous and only those with a passion for cheesy, b-flick horror will enjoy it. The zombies were soooo stupid! They ran around flailing their arms. They looked like a bunch of people putting on a haunted house for elementary students.I know this is a brief review, but I just don't see the need to invest much into this.

For a moment , let 's put aside the cultural aspects of this movie , even if it is a comedy , because I want to tell you what I think happened. I think I know why it didn't work. First , let me be perfectly clear, I was never asked to review this, this film was never even made , so I've got nothing to review. But let's take a second to discuss the movie itself, and then we can start discussing the issue. I don't know if it really did work or not.

This is a piece of cinematic beauty , and it shows more of Quebec culture to others than probably any other film I know. It is one of those movies where it is hard to separate the movie from the characters, but it’s still an entertaining story. I really enjoyed it. It is a movie that I would like to see all the way through with a friend, it’s got great action. If you want a movie like this in your collection, there is no better place to start! It is the story of a young man who is trying to get his life straightened out.

In my opinion, a good documentary - especially one dealing with controversial political issues - should be informative and as unbiased as possible. The point should be revealing the truth. This means, in particular, having among the interviewees experts on the subject and representatives of all sides. This film is a failure in this regard. Most of the interviews included in this film consist of "men off the street" expounding on the question of peace in the Holy Land. The wall itself, the supposed subject of the film, is given no serious treatment at all.

MINOR SPOILERSMisunderstood classic remains one of Henson's finest and most personal films. It may seem funny to call a movie as beloved as this one 'misunderstood,' but people do seem to remember this one mostly for Jerry Juhl's snappy screenplay and Paul Williams's knockout songs. Now while these things are admittedly great, as is the movie's formal playfulness (screenplay-within-the-screenplay, film break, etc. ), what distinguishes 'The Muppet Movie' from the other Muppet films is the serious, wistful thread that runs through the picture.

I really enjoyed BG Seasons 1-3 and really couldn't understand those who didn't like it. But I can't defend this nonsense. Spoilers follow.The first problem is that the characters are now doing inexplicably stupid things on a regular basis: So if Starbuck thinks she knows where Earth is why not send her out in a Raptor? Would the Admiral accept the resignation of his third most experienced officer? Would the Quorum elect their newest member, the non-elected Adama Junior? He has about three weeks political experience under his belt, and is the son of a man they distrust.

Norm(an)ally I don't mind remakes. There are some pretty good ones out there, BUT this one is a stinker! Considering it was practically scene for scene, it had a good story and great actors. Van Sant copied Al's direction virtually flawlessly, and it added color (I'm not one of those who think it has to be B&W to be classic). It should have been at least a mediocre movie... but it was pee-pee caa-caa! I don't understand how it could have been screwed up so badly.

Do NOT avoid this movie . Simply because it is so bad that it is absolutely hilarious . It possibly deserves a rating higher than "D" so that we know that it's not that bad . But if you want to laugh out loud while you watch this movie , then go ahead and download it . I have to admit that I laughed the most at the end of this movie, but it's because I don't understand why they do that. At first it's because the writer thinks that the character has no life, and they need to write that way to make it make sense .

(This has been edited for space)Chan-wook Park's new film is a complex film that is not easy to classify. Nominally a horror movie, the central character is a vampire, the film actually has elements of comedy, theology, melodrama, cultural invasion (and its analog of viral invasion of a body), romance and few other things as well. It's a film that has almost too much on its mind. The film takes its own matters and mixes them with classic European literature, in this case Emile Zola's "Thérèse Raquin".

Until today , I thought there only three people , including me , who considered Heaven 's Gate ( 1980 ) to be a masterpiece. But after a while it seems like I have come to like the way it all fits together, the way it seems like it's not just a really great film, it's part of a whole larger narrative. It seemed like a shame not to include it in this review, but I didn't want to make a huge ode to it, I just thought it was a fascinating piece of work, and I thought it'd be great if you'd check it out!

i can't even describe it. it's the worst movie i've ever seen (i'm being a nice guy when i call it movie).Just another big-budget-made-to-someone-who-doesn't-like-to-think-much.It's not even scary. It's revolting when there are great movies that never reach the big screen and then comes this..."thing" to trick movie fans. I guess big producers make whatever they want.Just get a big producer, hot chicks (allthough horrible actresses) and a ton of horror movie clichés and cook it for a week or so, and you'll get "The Nun".And I thought Bad Boys 2 was horrible!!!

Ho Hum. Just another flick with Steven Seagal pretending to be some spiritual being, but bashing heads and killing like it was nothing. He, of course, justifies it in the end by donating the money to an orphanage., How sweet. Lay the world to waste and we'll ignore it if you take care of a little girl. Jeesh! This time, he is partnered with Ice Cool (Anthony 'Treach' Criss). Gotta have someone to lay all those cringe-inducing lines on, man, and there are plenty.

Yesterday I watched this tv production, and I was very disappointed.I didn't have big expectations when it was a tv production, but the complete movie was pain with no ending. I felt it lasted for 3 hours, but it was just me who was bored to death. Every minute was a long struggle and I really fought hard to stay away from the "turn off"-switch.The movie is about a doctor (Dr. Verghese) who gets a lot of AIDS-patients, and most of them die during the movie. It is hard for Verghese to live with, so his family gets punished with his frustrations.

'The Mill on the Floss' was one of the lesser novels by Mary Ann Evans, who wrote under the male pseudonym George Eliot. I tried to read this dull and very turgid novel years ago, but was unable to finish it. I'll review this film version solely on its own merits, as I don't know how faithfully it follows the original novel.The film's opening credits are printed in an Old English typeface that suggests the mediaeval period, and so it's a very poor choice for a film with a 19th-century setting.

Another Son of Sam is definitely not an Oscar winner. Technically, it's horrible. The acting is not too good either. But there is something about it that makes you want to watch more (sort of like a car wreck). The ridiculous close-ups of the killers eyes are more funny than anything. If you are looking for a scare...this ain't the flick for you. It's very obscure and nearly impossible to find. I'm sure there's a reason for that. For a while, it was titled HOSTAGE.

To paraphrase the previous reviewer's comments, if you're a Stooges fan, avoid this one at all costs! My basic question is, being the experienced troopers of comedy that Moe and Larry were, why did they insist on attempting to continue the act when it was so obvious that their home studio, Columbia, was so clearly not interested in giving them serious writers and veteran comedy directors? This movie plays like someone who's giving a pale imitation of the trio and you can see how very hard Moe and Larry are working to make every little bit of slapstick relevant.

Although this movie (and I use the term loosely) was made in 1997, we just watched it tonight for the first time. My husband commented that a Tommy Lee Jones movie that we'd never heard of made him a little apprehensive. I blithely watched anyway, certain that if Jones was in the movie, it must at least be worth two hours of my time. After all, he has been one of our go-to actors for years. Although Heche isn't one of my favorite actresses, I was additionally reassured by seeing another well-known face.

Helen (Kate Capshaw) owns a bookstore in the sleepy, coastal town of Loblolly by the Sea. Divorced, Helen has a young daughter who is going to camp for the summer, giving mother a bit more freedom. Working at Helen's store are the manager, Janet (Ellen DeGeneres), a man-crazy village-gossip girl who has eyes for the handsome fireman, George (Tom Selleck), and two young college students, Jennifer (Julianne Nicholson) and Johnny (Tom Everett Scott). One day, Helen stumbles across a romantic, tender love letter and she suspects that Johnny has written it for her.

Frederick Forsyth's books are always so intricately plotted, with twists and turns, and usually a great surprise ending. This adaptation had none of that.So much of what was great in the book (the history of Monk and the betrayed agents; the plot to influence the outcome of the Russian election) were completely missing in this adaptation. Instead, there's this completely new plot about bio-weapons that was a yawner.Forsyth's protagonists always operated in the shadows, forever just slightly beyond the reach of the antagonists. The joys of his books have always been the machinations of carrying out their mission.

We picked this up as a part of a Brentwood set , under the title `` The Broken Skull . `` I don’t own it myself , although I think I got a good copy from somebody else . The artwork is excellent , the cover is excellent , but as you’ll find out on the next page , this is actually the first book I’ve owned that isn’t in trade . I’ve had the book since I was about 12 , and have had the original for over a year .

I remember when this show came out . It was originally advertised as a mini-series . At the end of the day it was more like an hour long tv movie . I was so happy that I ended up enjoying the movie . I have always loved this show and this is my favorite anime yet . This show is so amazing . You should go and watch this anime with your kids and their friends . I really think you will find it to be the greatest show ever . It has all the best bits and is so funny .

`` Problem Child '' was an okay movie , but did it really merit a sequel ? I do n't know if the original is much better than a sequel . It's not terrible , but there's a reason why it was only rated PG . I do n't think anyone would give the movie the A rating and not give it a sequel . They should try again , and see how many times it works . I don't have the time to look at it . The original was fun , but not great . It did have good acting and some very funny parts .

Piranha starts out as expected, stupid white people going to discover new lands and exploit them. I thought for a while it might be a cannibal film. It starts off like so many others, showing nothing but shots off untouched Amazon rain forest. For all I know it could be Florida. At this point you figure some animal mutilation or natives will pop up. Instead you get the acting talents of William Smith, who starred in L.A. Vice and Angels Die Hard. He plays Caribe, an acclaimed hunter, who I would describe him as Jack Palance Light.

Unfortunately a boring flick , and obviously the only way to see it is the butchered bootleg Public Domain version. This has nothing to do with the movie and the film is very much in need of a DVD release. This is only available on the internet because of its obscurity. This is not to say the film does not have its merits, it's just very rare to find. The plot is not as convoluted as a typical "Action" movie, but rather just another mindless action flick about a woman and a group of thugs.

It's unlikely that anyone except those who adore silent films will appreciate any of the lyrical camera-work and busy (but scratchy) background score that accompanies this 1933 release. Although sound came into general use in 1928, there are no more than fifty words spoken to tell the story of a woman, unhappily married, who deserts her husband for a younger man after a romantic interlude in the woods.The most vividly photographed scene has the jealous husband giving a lift to the young man for a ride into town, proceeding to drive normally until he realizes the man is his wife's lover.

I thought this was a great action flick. A very good role for Geena Davis. She is a very versatile actress. One of my favs next to Angelina Jolie. I actually watched The Long Kiss Goodnight right after seeing the new Tomb Raider movie. It got me thinking, Charlie or Lara? Which one would win in a fight??? Either way, both women are very strong, intelligent characters that are fun to watch. Especially when they're kicking butt. I just hope to see Geena in another film soon. Seems like she's been out of the spotlight a bit too long.

Love and war did happen on the other side of the iron curtain and by looking losely at it love was just as strong as in the West and war was often more poignant (should I say more realistic ? ).This film is as much about war and love as it is about the Soviet thaw of Mr K's era. It also reminds us than the best war movies were not necessarily made in the 1990's with rivers of hemoglobin and millions of USD spent on special effects and marketed actors.This movie is a classic of Soviet cinema and a outstanding picture of one of the greatest human tragedies : war.

I loved this movie but then again I am a big Cronenberg fan. If you have not seen a David Cronenberg film then this is not a good place to start. Scanners, The Fly, Rabid would be a place to start and then work up to Videodrome before checking this one out. This is certainly one of his best and takes the interactive game phenomena one step beyond.In this game the players plug a bio-engineered game pad through a jack inserted into their spinal cord and get into the game directly through their nervous system.

Assy McGee is an out-of-control , hard-nosed detective based on the countless examples from late 20th century police dramas . . . and a character so powerful and indestructible his name is used in film and TV shows , TV movies , and comics . . . as the name implies, McGee is an unstoppable, hard-nosed, smart-aleck, hard-living, and hot-headed cop who goes by the code name “Sarge”. But when he gets a new assignment, that code name is no more, and so McGee goes on a berserk quest to take back the badge and the woman who was once his soul mate .

You may not believe this , but when the credits to this movie rolled , I looked for the director. And I was not disappointed ! The story was told through the eyes of an old man that lived to see this day, and it had all the hallmarks of what I wanted from the movie. I love that movie ! Even though there are few scenes where the camera is moving around the entire set, the editing and sound effects were masterful. The story was interesting and the pace was very good. In conclusion , I think this movie is a wonderful watch.

Talking about competition features at the Split Film festival , we have titles from all over the world . China is the first to be featured in the competition and we are thrilled to have had the opportunity to talk to a lot of the festival’s organizers and presenters in Shanghai. We spoke to the festival organizers at the festival as well as a number of China’s best directors, writers and producers about how they plan to introduce competition features to Chinese audiences. First we would like to say that we want to thank them for hosting such an amazing event with over 500 films in competition.

Honestly, how hard can it be to make a good remake? Obviously pretty hard! I was soooo excited to see this because I loved the original, and my friends go and see it and tell me it really sucks. Well, I finally see it and I was sooo disapointed. Ok, the shower scene was more realistic...that's why I gave it a 3. Otherwise, it did suck. Vince Vaughn does a terrible job playing Norman, he's just too dense or something. I don't know, it was just terrible. Don't see it!

When I saw the trailers for this movie , it looked like a good romantic comedy . I expected some funny lines and witty dialogue but I did not expect this to be a love triangle . The script is so well written that you can tell a lot of thought went into the movie. It is quite funny and entertaining which you can see for yourself by checking out the trailer below . The film is based on the famous Japanese manga "Bakuman ", written by Yuriko Yoshitoyo and illustrated by Toshio Suzuki, which tells about the romance between the protagonist Kanna and her love interest Yukie .

This marvelous short will hit home with everyone who , as a child , specifically asked for something because it was just so special. As a person , I have not only been blessed with great teachers and other great teachers in our school but also, great mentors. One of the greatest of these mentors is a woman who has helped to shape my life to be the best that it is possible to be. She is the inspiration for this short story. A woman with a vision and an example for our children to follow.

You do n't have to be a tamilian to appreciate this gem of a movie.I do n't know a word to describe this film. I've seen many films, but this one has to be top notch. The film has an amazing cast, and all of them have a certain charisma and ability to carry the film to its end. One of the main highlights of the film is the end scene, which is probably the best of the whole film. I think there is a possibility that it could go in any movie, but this is definitely one of the better movies I've ever seen.

"No one really knows how the Power came to be. Not even the Book of Damnation recorded its beginning, but those who mastered it have always been hunted The families of Ipswich formed a Covenant of Silence bla bla bla" After this intro, we suddenly see Take That. Or was it N'Synch? The Backstreet Boys, perhaps? Well, I don't know which of these they belong to, but one thing's for sure: the descendants of Salem are a boy-band. Can you tell them apart? I couldn't.

I was enticed into watching Shark Hunter by the comments posted on IMDB. The movie was bad but the shark was cool blah blah blah. So I rented it. Bad idea. This movie was bad on so many levels that I'm glad that I had the option to fast forward. The shark itself is ok. It's appearance is decent and it is the only thing saving this movie from getting a 1, (I gave it a 2). The acting is incredibly bad and the dialogue is just as deplorable. I wasn't expecting much but I was continually surprised by this suckfest.

This review is for the UK DVD three-disc box set. Disc one is called Caught in the Act and contains Model Behavior, Chasing Jamie and Fast and Curious. Disc two is called Bedroom Fantasies and contains Blue Plate Special, Falling in Lust Again and Love Potion No. 10. The final disc is called Anything Goes and contains Chatroom, She's the Boss and Legally Yours. Why the other four episodes in the series are not included is a mystery because there is surely enough room on the discs for a lot more material.Each episode opens with the hotel manager Chloe (Lauren Hayes) reading a letter from a satisfied customer.

I believe this film was made for the not so princely sum of £8000 but that didn't really show. There wasn't anything amateurish about the production or the acting, the characters were gritty and real and the location could have been any desert area in the world instead of a not too warm beach just north of Aberdeen. The actors were quite easily acceptable as a bunch of mercenaries stranded on a mysterious, deserted and uncharted planet, none of them seemed to be particularly friendly with each-other but were willing to fight to keep themselves and their comrades alive.

* * * * * I reveal two 'twists ' at the end of the film . Do not read them as such. They are not a twist . . . a 'twist . . . at all . . ."' B.R. 's "Twists"

In the middle of _A View from the Bridge,_ the credits roll. Suddenly, we are confronted with the following two titles:

**THE THIRD THIRD**

**A View From the Bridge,** directed by Robert Redford and starring Robert Duvall and Jane Fonda in a cameo appearance.

Back in the 70 's , a small-time Texas filmmaker named S.F . Brownrigg directed a handful of surprisingly decent comedies in the horror genre -- and they were all, at one time, considered the best of his generation. For a while, Brownrigg was a star. From his first film, Texas Chainsaw Massacre, through the first and second installments of The Ring, Brownrigg was able to sell a small-screen movie that audiences would soon come to know better as Freddy Vs. Jason, but those comedies never took off the way other horror comedies did, and many of his comedies failed to make back a decade later.

I don't normally go out of my way to watch romantic comedy, and maybe I will in the future after seeing Return to Me. The plot was simple and no secret after the publicity. You don't have to be Einstein to guess what will happen after the first 15 minutes. What you can do is relax and let the cast take you into a world where the "chemistry" abounds and the good guys win and you can just laugh and have a good time. I LOVE this movie....and have the DVD on order!

Though it 's a Christmas movie , `` Christmas in Connecticut '' could have been done any time of year. But it was not a Christmas movie that made the film so special, but a different Christmas that made it that special. This was the same year when the film ``It'' won the Academy Award for Best Picture , and it won the Golden Globe for Best Motion Picture Score. The same year, John Wayne was nominated as the best-dressed movie star and the same year , a girl named Marilyn Monroe won the Oscar for Best Actress .

A bit too much Mediterrenean machismo for me . The cast was beautiful , lovely to watch in all of their different colors. I didn’t get to see a lot of the scenery in the area either , but i’ll be taking some time to do it some day before i go back. A few people said they’re staying longer, so it would be good if they do. It’s a gorgeous trip to be on , and i really look forward to next year. I only wish it would be shorter than it has been.

I remember seeing a clip of this movie on HBO when I was a kid and it scared the ever living shit out of me. There was just so much blood and gore and terror that it was beyond belief. My parents didn’t have cable so we watched the film on VHS tapes. I think it was an early 70’s TV show that aired in Canada and I have a vague memory it was on Channel 9 or something like that. It must have been in the early 90’s though.

The producers of this picture are Hungarians . It 's not by crazy artistic momentum that X and Z are dancing in a circle . I have never seen them dance like that before . But they are not dancing to a song , rather it's the dancing of the moment . I can not describe how much I love these two in this film . There are so many great songs in this video that it is impossible to pick out a favourite . Let me talk about some of these . X and Z just dance . But there is a dance between Z and Z and X and X .

My Take: Steven Seagal is obviously too boring to be a lead in an action thriller, even a totally dull one. Remember Steven Seagal? You don't? Don't worry, there's not much to catch up on. After starring in admittedly enjoyable crowd-pleasing films like UNDER SIEGE and EXECUTIVE DECISION, Seagal hits the low grounds of the bad movie abyss. Now, he stars in low-budgeted B-level action vehicles, some of which are made-for-TV "Movie of the Week" entries that lost their way to the big screen. HALF PAST DEAD is among these, shall we say, dead action movies.

Years ago, I used to watch bad movies deliberately. Somehow I missed this one. No gesture rings true. No facial expression fits the scene or the action. I've never heard such inappropriate music for a film. At the final scene, I was rooting for the car to run over that ridiculous kid - one of the worst child actors ever.Only one name in it I ever heard of - Wilford Brimley. He must've been very hungry to take this part.DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, WATCH THIS MOVIE!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!! !

The first time I saw this was when I was with a date , and she thought it was an interesting thing on its own. She had just finished reading about it and said she really wanted to learn about it. I knew right away I would love to learn more about this, so we decided to get together and teach it to her and then take a tour of her city. I had never done a tour before. I was very excited to do something like that. But it turned out she really didn't need a tour.

I have been an avid Jane Austen fan for many years . I had never seen this adaptation , so after watching part one of the series , I was extremely excited. I was told that I would like this adaptation and I had no reason to doubt it. This adaptation is very well thought out. The storyline is intriguing and there are a couple of surprises that I was anticipating . This is the first series I have seen and I enjoyed it. It is well produced and is well put together. I was a little unsure of the direction and I thought that the book was slightly better than the movie.

For several reasons, this movie is simply awful. Other posters have listed some of this movie's historical errors. Well, I have a layman's knowledge of Roman history and even I found the inaccuracies flagrant. I usually forgive errors in historical movies because I understand that the purpose is to entertain not educate. And shrinking a long saga down to a two hour feature requires some, let's say, historical license. But this movie goes well beyond mere rounding.There's worse. To tell a story from a distant period, the movie uses flashbacks which just make the story more confusing.

Ok, when I rented this several years ago I had the worst expectations. Yes, the acting isn't great, and the picture itself looks dated, but as I sat there, a strange thing happened. I started to like it. The action is great and there are few scenes that make you jump. Brion James, maybe one of the greatest B-grade actors next to Bruce Campbell, is great as always. The story isn't bad either. Now I wouldn't rush out and buy it, but you won't waste your time at least watching this good b-grade post apocalyptic western.

And so it started with "Shreik" a send up of horror films, then we had Scary Movie, a genuinely good attempt at a new kind of genre, the illustrious send up. however....now we have: Scary Movie* Scary Movie 2 Scary Movie 3 Scary Movie 4* Date Movie Meet The Spartans Not Another Team movie* plus many more (genuinely funny movies marked with *)and.....Super hero movie.... it seems the people that make these movies cannot yet grasp what makes the send-ups funny.

Cowboys and Indians is an excellent film. The writing, acting, directing could not have been better. This was a story that begged to be told, and this group of talented individuals and teams did a superb job of doing so. Stories like this one are not pleasant ones, but serve to remind people of the social injustices that exist all around the world. It is my hope that when this film is seen that attitudes and prejudices will be changed. A film that can do that is a rare a special thing.

I read on the web that this film is being remade into a theatrical feature. Finally!!!!! It's about time Hollywood got their act together. The big Studios always frown at edgy material, with Oscar written all over it. Go figure! !JERICHO MILE was made ahead of it's time. It's a masterpiece.Michael Mann, a true visionary, found a way to engage an audience without overindulgence. Peter Strauss' Emmy award performance is probably the best character role I've seen in my film-viewing lifetime.

I'm not a big musical fan, but this is one of the few I really love. Unlike many other musicals, such as "The Sound of Music," none of the songs are about gratuitous stuff. Each song is social commentary, acumen on war, sexuality, recalcitrance, spirituality, and freedom. Especially amazing songs are "Easy To Be Hard," "Age of Aquarius," "Hair," "Flesh Failures/3-5-0-0," "Walking In Space," and "Hare Krishna." Totally revolutionary and wonderful. I can't wait to someday see it live!

Half Past Dead was unlike any Steven Segal film I've ever seen. Very little of Segal, himself in action and I agree with the last review I read, Nia Peeples steals the show.I saw nothing really new here, just the same old stuff from other flicks changed around a little. The best action scenes were Nia's as she once again kicked butt. It was interesting seeing her as the bad guy after watching her for two seasons on Walker, Texas Ranger, still kicking butt, but for the good guys.

I have been looking forward to the release of this DVD (and it's follow-up {Female Prisoner Scorpion: #701's Grudge Song}) for some time. I very much enjoyed the first two movies of this series. After just watching this film, I would have to say that this is probably my favorite of the three. All three of these movies were directed by Shunya Ito. What is great about them, though, is that, even though they all feature the same lead character (wonderfully played by Meiko Kaji), they are each vastly different from the others.

The film is a pathetic attempt to remake Ingmar Bergman 's `` Autumn Sonata '' ( 1978 ) starring Ingrid Bergman as the young Bergman in the role of a woman who had an affair with a man. However, with this remake, Bergman appears as he was when he filmed the film. Borgman is in his mid-fifties at the time, with gray hair, bushy mustache and beard. He had the most beautiful eyes and the most intelligent face. But, after the film, he seems to be in his seventies, with the same eyes and beard.

One of the commenter's is wrong. This is not the only Pat Patterson film and he didn't die two years after this was made. He shot a film called the "Electric Chair" in Pineville, NC. He shot this a few years after Doctor Gore. Patterson died in the late 70's. I know this because he used my house and he left a cat there!! It sucked also. This was a big deal when the movie came out. No independent horror films were being made in NC. This movie didn't help matters.

Although I saw this movie in Korea , in Korean , and therefore did not understand the language , images , and all that, but if I may say , it is a very beautiful story and I do agree with you that it is one of the best Korean movies on the list of the best Korean movies . I would have to agree as well . This review contains explicit images of violence, which are not my choice. If you have seen the film and find this review unacceptable, please write in your own review, so it can be posted on the main site and get more visitors.

When i went to see this i thought, i liked the first two and thought that they were very suspenseful so this one should be good also. WRONG! There was NO suspense and they don't explain about the new dinosaurs! When i was done watching this i had lost all respect for Steven Spielberg and Michael Crichton but then it turned out that it wasn't directed by Spielberg or written by Michael Crichton! This movie was going through "the motions." i thought that this movie had absolutely no plot and i thought that no one should waste their money to see it.

We are in a small town, a homely widow (Ida Lupino) hires a handyman (Robert Ryan) to look after her house. She soon starts to regret it as Ryan grows erratic by the hour, it appears that she is host to a dangerous schizophrenic, and now she is unable to escape her house.Beware, My Lovely is adapted from Mel Dinelli's {The Spiral Staircase} story and play called "The Man". Pretty much a one set movie and a two character driven piece, the film boasts two great central performances and offers up an interesting take on mental illness.

This film basically try to portray the heroism of firefighters by making the whole movie revolve around a American dad saving his kid from burning house. I really didn’t like the story and it was quite predictable for me, but I was glad that I saw the movie so I can relate to their struggle to save their daughter’s life. This film has some great scenes but the whole movie was too much to watch for me. This is a classic film and you should watch this one. What to Watch For

I would recommend this movie for anyone who love watching the American Dad movie with his daughter.

You know you're watching softcore with the wrong attitude when the poor dubbing bothers you. I'm okay with the crappy lip syncing but the sound mix is really of too. Every time someone says anything it sounds like there's a narrator. Either way, this is pretty much the purgatory between boring French professionalism and the heavenly campy Joe D'Amato flicks involving cannibalism and whatnot. Don't get me wrong, there's a fair dose of exploitation in this one, but there's always room for more. Laura Gemser stars, and that's good because she's hot.

This movie has been a classic in my part of the country because it was filmed in my own small town. I now have many friends who are guards at Dixon Correctional, and I myself worked for 3 yrs at the SuperAmerica store next to the Krogers store the old lady was at. However, this is still the dumbest movie ever made, destined to be introduced by Gilbert Godfreid or Rhonda Shearer, if it hasn't been already. A bit of trivia, Illinois doesn't even have parole hearings, and Dixon Prison is a medium security facility housing burglars and vending machine vandals.

Rarely does a film capture such intense drama and emotion. What makes this film so unsettling is that the drama feels so real, it's almost hard to remember that it's only a movie. This is by far Madeline Stowe and Alan Rickman's performance of their careers. The film almost feels like a theatrical production the way it is staged and lit. The only bad thing about this movie is that it's very difficult to get a copy of it. I have yet to see it other than on Laserdisc. This truly powerful film deserves a digitally remastered transfer and special edition treatment on DVD.

I did n't understand the people who rated it over 5 . I think it 's a horrible film from start to finish , and i had a difficult time figuring out who the villains are . The only character that i could relate to was the little boy in a wheelchair who is the only person on the ship that doesn't scream . The rest of the crew are all like this . What made this film so terrible was that most of the people on the ship were like this . The ship is destroyed after the end and everyone is trapped on it .

Jewel Thief is *THE* crime thriller of Bollywood, and why should it not be? It is directed by the biggest exponent of the crime thriller art in Indian Cinema Vijay Anand ('Johny Mera Naam' and 'Teesri Manzil.) I could watch this movie for any of the following reasons (in order of importance):1 Vijay Anand's direction 2 R D Burman's music 3 Dev Anand 4 Vyjayanthimala 5 Ashok Kumar 6 Majrooh Sultanpuri's lyricsEven if Jewel Thief is not a Bond Movie it definitely has bond babes. Helen, Tanuja, and the mysterious Vyajanthimala (and some cameos.)

I've seen a lot of movies in my time and this one really stands out as being the absolute worst movie ever made in the history of film making anywhere in the world. It took me 3 efforts to watch this movie. The first time I fell asleep after 15 minutes from boredom, possibly because I was already tired as it was late at night. The second effort I managed to get through 35 minutes but yet again I found myself asleep. I can go on and on like this but I think you're getting the point......nothing happens ever in this movie.

For reasons I can not begin to fathom , Dr. Lorenzo Cameron ( George Zucco ) begins injecting wolf 's blood in humans. These people go mad , turning into werewolves and are eventually hunted down. The only two people who survive are Dr. Cameron, and the two wolves who turned on him. The story is told through both the point-of-view of Dr Cameron as he watches the story unfold, but also through that of the wolves who survived his blood. It is a slow, suspenseful story of suspense, but one that is also beautiful and powerful at the same time.

There wasn't much thought put into the story line on many fronts. This is a good action movie but that's about it.- The movie states that the lycans were kept to protect the vampires during the day. Yet they are kept in cages and have collars on their necks. So they can't turn into their wolf form or do anything any other slave can't do. How does this protect the vampires during the day? Who are they protecting the vampires from? The uncontrollable lycans? The slaves in human form are nothing more than peasants.- My understanding is that vampires are immortals and don't age.

I really should have learned more about this movie before renting it . It was one of those movies where it really hit the spot and there were a ton of great parts to it . the script is fantastic and the actors are great . there's really nothing that I can think of that is not really in the movie . There's some really good comedy in here , a ton of emotion and drama and even some sex . I think that there is something about this movie that I just haven't seen before or seen in the past two weeks .

I saw this movie when I was about 12 when it came out. I recall the scariest scene was the big bird eating men dangling helplessly from parachutes right out of the air. The horror. The horror.As a young kid going to these cheesy B films on Saturday afternoons, I still was tired of the formula for these monster type movies that usually included the hero, a beautiful woman who might be the daughter of a professor and a happy resolution when the monster died in the end. I didn't care much for the romantic angle as a 12 year old and the predictable plots.

`` Ahh ... I did n't order no amazing hit show '' ..... '' We 'll you got one '' I'm so excited '' I got it '' it's on now. I'm like '' I don't care '' I feel like I should be there ... I am I'm not that way when I was younger, I'm like '' I 'll see you around''. I'm here, I 'm ready, you 're welcome, and that's the best I can say. I 'm still the same kind of guy who was the first person in my family when I got my license ...

Saw this at the video store and thought I 'd give it a try . Sounded like a good story . There is so much misinformation in the community about the dangers of drinking coffee, that I thought this might be a good place to clarify things . Coffee drinking is an easy, natural way to cut back on the caffeine you are consuming each day. The caffeine in coffee is the same caffeine that the body has to make every day so the only difference between a coffee drinker and their coffee drinker is in the amount of the caffeine .

The Priest , into profound love and suffering showed not the result of love , but the process of love. The Priest is not the object, but the subject, and what he does and how he does it and what his suffering is. So the Priest is both the object and the subject. His suffering is the object but his love is also the subject. His sufferings are the object. His sufferings is the object of love. The object is the Priest. He is not the subject and subject is not the object.

How anyone can praise this crude film version after seeing the marvelous WATERLOO BRIDGE with Vivien Leigh and Robert Taylor, it was a long time ago. That said, it’s still amazing, and very much worth seeing, especially if you haven’t seen it, but you should make it a priority to see it. A lot of stuff in the film was very clever, but some scenes in particular just don’t hold up very well:

Robert Taylor is very good as Mr. Hyde. And the scene where Taylor sings “When you’re ready to run”?

Wow , Kiss the Bride was n't that bad , but it was n't that good either . It sure was not as good as I had thought it to be . i think there is a bit to much going on , but i still liked it . . . though i liked it , not as much as i would like it to be . there is also , i would say a little bit too much going on . i liked the first three episodes , but didn't really find anything good about them . and the way in which they presented the idea of the bridal shop .

A lot of actors have a multitude of good movie roles in their soul. Some, a handful. Others, maybe a couple.Then there's Linda Blair. "The Exorcist". That's it.When you see "Chained Heat" and watch Linda Blair in it, you have to wonder what, if anything, was running through her mind.Certainly not, "Oh boy: Oscar for Best Actress, here I come! "Just another women in prison film like they used to make for the cheap in the '70s, this one actually has names you may recognize.

This film was very different form the previous films and I had to wonder, "Where is Ralph Macchio?" he could have been involved in the plot somewhere as Myiagi's old friend who teaches Julie what he already knows, then Myiagi can come along and add some more! Macchio could've been the love interest for Julie in this film! Never mind!On a serious level, I enjoyed this film because it involved teaching a teenage girl how to do Karate, and her feelings are very different to what Daniel's were.

This terrible moovie is fun on many levels - the moost obvious is the lame , fake-looking bird puppet which is just a bit too silly to make it to the final film - but also that it doesn't need to do any of this. It could just be that we all have some things we love and some things which make us scratch our heads wondering what the f**k they are. I will never understand why anyone would love this movie, and I have to admit that while watching the trailers, I almost fell asleep at the very end.

I knew it was going to be awful but not this awful! !, as it's one of the most boring movies i have ever seen, not a damn thing happens!. All the characters are dull, and the story is stupid and incredibly boring!,plus The ending is especially lame!. The only reason i rented this piece of crap because i am a big fan of Michael Dudikoff, however he is wasted here, and looks extremely bored and shows no emotion what so ever!, plus i cheered out loud when the movie was over!.

Apparently this movie was based on a true story. I'm not sure how accurate it is, though. But it really reminded me of how when I see that someone has been murdered on the news, it's amazing how much it doesn't affect me. Sure, I think it's terrible, but I honestly don't care. I move on. It seems that murder is trivial now. This is what River's Edge shows. Nobody really seems to care about this girl and her death, not even the killer. Then what's the point?

Let 's face it , a truly awful movie , no ... I mean a `` truly '' awful movie , really. I don 't say that just to put out fires, but because the film is so poorly done. I will not even go further into detail here because it's a spoiler. It 's just something I have to watch. Now that I have got to see it , I don 't know whether I am going to love it or leave it. There are a couple of things in it that I didn't really like and there are some really bad acting.

My friends and I saw this at the San Diego Black Film Festival . It was great . Stormy is the name of the film. You can see the film on youtube . The film is available for free on iTunes and Amazon . I’m not sure if I will ever finish it or not, it’s too much for me. If you are interested , here is my review of the film . You can buy the film for a couple bucks. It is one of the first films I have ever watched as a kid.

Awesome Movie! Great combination of talents! I'm a HUGE fan of David Duchovny and he is outstanding in this movie! I would love to see him in more movies of this nature. His talents are definitely under-used and has SO much more to offer besides "Agent Mulder" (although I'm a huge fan of that series too), Anyway, I want to see more of him. He is easily the Cary Grant of our generation. If you haven't seen this movie, you MUST! Great love story that shows love never dies... it's with you forever.

While out divining for water, a young psychic woman named Jessica Burns (Carolyn Kearney) stumbles upon something else altogether. She discovers a chest that has been buried for centuries on her aunt's ranch. Instead of the treasure her aunt is hoping for, the chest contains the head of Gideon Drew, a devil worshiper who was beheaded by Sir Francis Drake. Telepathically controlling the hired-hand who opened the chest, Drew's head goes on a murderous spree in search of the rest of his body  also buried on Jessica's aunt's farm.

At first sight, I must say already, watch The Contractor, 2007. With Wesley Snipes too. A better action movie and with a more dramatic plot.The Detonator has an horrendous plot focusing in some sort of atomic bomb, set in Romania and with awful directing for an action movie-- there is no thrilling moments and an action movie is turned in to boredom.Really, what you expect Wesley Snipes to do, when awful screenplays like this one are offered to him? Don't blame him, he needs the money.This was the first impression when I saw the movie, 3 years ago.

... and in this series , I 've been reduced to an annoying jock with a gay hairstyle . Remember that time I got so excited when a girl walked by my house in my pajamas ? Yeah . It was so awesome , but a few hours later I realized the girl was a boy . . . . . . and I thought it was all the funniest joke ever , so I 've forgotten it. Anyway , I 'd really appreciate it if we could all stick around for a bit longer. I 'm not in any pain , but I 'd sure like to get a good night\'s sleep.

Well ... it 's about time ! Van Damme is back and kicking in this action thriller that 's his big return since the first one ... with a new star on the box ! We 've seen the movie before ... so it'll be interesting to see what 's going to go on in this sequel ... as it's not like the original one where the whole movie was about one guy ... and this 's a bigger action movie ! This is the second movie Van Damme has worked on since he returned from the army ... the first one came out in 1999 ... his next one ...

I can only think of one reason this movie was released . To capitalize off the upcoming fame of Guy Ritchie. This movie is the only film I have ever seen where he is not the lead star and the only movie that I know about where he wasn't the main star. I'm not sure how Ritchie is able to get away with this movie. He is a director with little or no actual directing ability. The only thing that makes this a great film is the acting. Not that I'm a big Guy Ritchie fan but I like all his films.

Throughout watching "End of Days", I got the sense that the film makers were perhaps trying to make this unique to the average Hollywood action film. They failed, of course, but you have to give them credit for trying. Peter Hyams actually tried directing this time, instead of just churning out another flat action film. He attempted to inject atmosphere into the movie by darkening the lights and adding tons of blood. This method can work if used correctly (see "Se7en") but here it just feels like a cheap trick to try and scare us.

Computer savvy John Light ( as John Elias ) goes from Stanford drop-out to successful young Dotcom-era tycoon . But he doesn't know the first thing about the Internet . So when the dotcom bubble blows and he's left with a bank balance as a result, he struggles to keep a lid on his greed , paranoia and power hungry paranoia . . . and it all gets worse when his teenage love turns into a teen-age dotcom millionaire and his dot.com empire crashes . . . , right when the Internet is supposed to be going global .

This movie reeks . No money , no acting , no nothing . I caught this on on the 3am and i dont know what the story line is all about but i have no idea. The only thing that i think about is the character of the guy in front of the bar and what his face shows. I dont want to see anything bad happen but it just reeks of something bad. I wish there was more than one. The only thing that I’m not really sure of is why this movie isn’t on Disney Channel.

From the portrayals of Andy Warhol in the films I Shot Andy Warhol and Basquiat , this is the type of art that gets seen on the street. And yet, we don’t talk about Warhol like this. And yet that’s all he is, an icon. Warhol’s art is so much bigger than Andy Warhol. Because of the popularity of the Andy Warhol phenomenon, some people think we shouldn’t be talking about Andy Warhol, and that we should talk about something else entirely. What is this art we talk about when we discuss the Warhol phenomenon?

After reading some of these reviews , it is apparent that some have missed the point . What is great is that when you see how great the product actually is , you don't even notice that you have the chance to save a buck or two. I agree with the above review. I have been using this item for nearly 2 years and would still recommend it to anyone. The reason I purchased it over the competition is that this product has never broke, it is in perfect working order and I have never had a problem with it.

many people said this was a great movie with Hoffman delivering a great performance. i went from suspended disbelief, to fidgety boredom, to almost walking out. there is no there there.Hoffman does go all out. he is committed to the performance. but sometimes him playing an affected man looks just like affected actor chewing on the scenery.no characters in the movie other than capote are much more than placeholders - nell, jack, perry, shawn, the sheriff are all one-dimensional.yes the film shows the manipulative, preening, dishonest sides of capote.

Rivalry between brothers leads to main story line. Navy Commander Chuck Prescott(Marshall Thompson)has developed the Y12 aircraft to test how far man can go up in the atmosphere. His brother, Lt. Dan Prescott(Bill Edwards), seems to be the best test pilot around and is chosen to go up in the Y12. Dan of course has a problem with taking orders and is also an over confident dare devil. On Dan's second flight, he hits over the 300 miles up comfort zone and his craft passes through a meteor dust storm.

Less Than Zero could have been the 80s movie that reveals teenage apathy in its most extreme form had they only been allowed to make it to the ’80s in America. It is, without question, the worst movie I have ever seen, but there are a few things that the movie tries to explain and it fails miserably at doing so. If there ever were an opportunity to show how the world has become more and more violent and stupid by the time you are 13, this is the movie to do that.

A severe backwards step for the puppets in this mainly dull and tedious outing . Guy Rolfe , so fantastic that I will be watching more of him. However there is something about the movie that sets it apart. This is an odd mixture of comedy, drama, sci-fi/fantasy and horror. We start off with one of the best bits of the movie, but we get so many little moments that you can’t tell where it’s coming from and the direction it is heading in, or if it will go in any direction.

Your ability to enjoy The Ashes of Time may depend on our expectations before stepping into the theater. Even its most strident supporters seem to agree that audiences can be split right up the middle in their appreciation of this unique film.Unlike most HK actioners, the battle scenes are curiously kept at a distance. When they do happen, they're rendered in a jerky style in which it's difficult to make out exactly what's occurring on screen. The dramatic scenes can be extravagantly beautiful, with the of Maggie Cheung, Brigitte Lin, and a roll-call of HK's top acting talent chewing up the scenery.

The plot has something about white hunters captured by a tribe of white women in the African jungle/ plains.Its a turkey and the some. What it really is is wildly mismatched footage from early sound and silent films mixed with badly shot recent(to the release) footage of men on a safari. There are scenes of a man in a gorilla suit, south seas natives at sea (used to represent people in the middle of Africa), women in bikini's, horrible narration and a guy in a loin cloth with make up all over his body (racially insensitive I think so).

`` I remember waiting to be born ... '' `` Vision quest that was the American West . '' `` There was a place you went to when you weren't allowed to be an adult . '' `` He didn't see you. He doesn't have a vision of what it means to be a man. He doesn't see how it makes him a man .

'' `` There was a time you weren't allowed to be an adult . Now you are,   
And maybe that's just as bad . '' `` You know you're part of a community where you never had to be a kid before . ''

I completely understand WHY this movie was made . Silence of the Lambs was an incredible film - a gruesome masterpiece in the tradition of the great French films of the late 60's, early 70's - but one of the greatest films I've ever been involved in. In fact, I went to see it in the theater with my wife when it came out. I was in shock the entire time and it left a bad taste in my mouth after seeing it. My favorite scene: the rape and murder of Sarah Polley. That scene was absolutely haunting.

I ran across this movie on a local TV channel last night . Frankly , I have never heard about this movie so I am surprised. Well it was at a drive-in movie theater in the 70's and I remember the movie . Well , it was not very well seen so I have not seen it on TV since then

So anyway I am going to tell you about it and then we will see if it still holds up . Now for those who don't know about it . What you will see is that a boy falls into a hole which leads him down into a black void .

One of the most successful shows in television history is back . Now I admit I never got into the Star Trek series very early. I watched the first season of The Next Generation, that's all I watched in my entire childhood. But I loved every single episode of the first series. Every single episode. I grew up with Spock, William Riker, Uhura, and the Enterprise crew. This was the first series I watched in my whole life, and as I said, I grew up watching the show. I didn't know there was a second series though.

I, being a fan of Rupert Grint, rented this film a few months ago. I thought it was a very well written movie with a bunch of great actors. It was entertaining, and showed that Rupert Grint could play more than his most well known character of Ron Weasley. His subtle portrayal of Ben and everyone else's great acting made this film very likable.Ben, a very shy boy with a extremely religious and sensitive mother, is looking for a job. He finds one and becomes the, I guess you could call "assistant" to Evie, a retired actress.

This movie is something horrible . I was laughing all the time . I was forced to stop in some moments . This is one of the most horrible movie i have ever see and i have been watching it since a long long time ago. This is the only reason why i will watch this movie ever and it will be my last ever. This is an abomination. I really do not understand why people do not realize that this movie is an abomination. This is supposed to be a romantic comedy, but it ends up turning into an awful, terrible movie.

What to say about `` Dead End Road '' ... Lets just say that Edgar Allen Poe would have been very happy to have been wrong. Thursday, July 11, 2009

I had the privilege of writing an introduction to this site some three years ago, and this is one of the reasons I consider this to be the finest of all my blog sites, in my humble opinion. A lot has changed over the years, but one thing that has not -- at least in my humble opinion -- has changed, however, is the quality of the writing.

Walt was particularly fond of quality . So how come the producers at Disney would release such a terribly edited version of _The Jungle Book_ , but no one was allowed to watch it? As Walt himself said, it was originally intended for an audience "that could not watch the film itself"—but the censors wouldn't permit the film to be shown. And that's just what they did, so Walt could finally see _The Jungle Book_ in its entirety, and it was as if the whole of the film was taken off the air.

I really should have learned more about this movie before renting it. It was one of those movies where you keep watching it figuring it's got to get better. Then, when it ends, you feel stupid for having wasted precious time in your life that you can never get back. Ice-T did his bad guy thing and, well, that was the highlight of the evening. The pictures of the shuttle looks like it was done with a little toy inside of a box and the spacewalking scenes were funny because you could see the strings attached to the space suits.

I readily admit that I watch a lot of really bad movies. But there are very few that I can think of that are quite as bad as When Women Had Tails. It's a stinker of epic proportions. What should have been a sexy comedy about a group of cavemen discovering a woman for the first time is instead a dull, lifeless affair without a single laugh to be had. The comedy is extremely weak.
