I suppose if you think bashing someone in the head is funny, you might find a laugh or two. The guys in this movie make the Three Stooges look like high art.

I generally loved the Carry on movies but this one is actually pretty awful . There are very few laughs in the entire film and the film’s overall quality leaves a lot to be desired , especially with how awful it is to begin with. The story follows two women that are struggling to make ends meet and the way they deal with the problems they face is ridiculous. I’m not gonna get into the plot because I don’t even care for it , I’m just getting too excited to see the movie so this review is just for enjoyment.

This is absolute drivel , designed to shock and titillate the 60 's mindset . The acting is completely wooden . The plot is as bland as it is predictable . The dialogue consists of little more than the same stock lines of " we need to change the world" , " we need to change the world, " " we don't need to do nothing , " " we don't need to change nothing , " and the ever so popular " you're just like everyone else " . What's wrong with you , people ? I've never been so disgusted with a movie.

I believe this film was made for the not so princely sum of £8000 but that did n't really show, this was very well made and acted, there were some interesting moments but I think I would rather have seen it again with a better budget, this is a great film and worth a look. I really liked all the actors in it, the best were the ones who weren't the stars so far as acting is concerned. I like this film, but I am afraid it will get a bad review in a few weeks.

Although it was dark, depressing, and at times hard to watch, You Are Alone held my attention and was refreshingly honest in its dialog. It truly captured the angst of teenage romantic relationships. In addition, the soundtrack was amazing. The lyrics and the tone of the songs complemented the sadness of the film so well that it made you wonder if the tracks were created specifically for the movie. Jessica Bohl is the best actress I have ever watched. Her compelling and believable performance made the movie. It made me wonder if she really IS a prostitute. Who knows.

I realize most people don't know who Solomon Kane is and that the film is pitched at that much larger audience. But then why bother to call it "Solomon Kane" in the first place when the name has no marketable value? The characters certainly has NOTHING whatsoever to do with the R.E. Howard character. Except he has a big hat. That's where the resemblance ends.It's always a bad sign when any superhero/fantasy/sci-fi movie lingers over an origin story, but when you invent one whole cloth like this for a character who didn't have one at all, you've already missed the point completely.

All I can do is laugh . Wow . I like Jim Wynorski 's movies , I really do . However , his acting is so bad , and the character he plays in these films is so boring . He's the first person I have ever complained to about a bad actor . If you have read my blog you'll know I love his movies . If you've not then I suggest you go and have a look ! The only thing he can do is laugh . Wow . This is the first time in my whole life I've ever been this upset .

As long as you go into this movie with the understanding that it's not going to contain any historical fact whatsoever, it's not bad.It's on par with Sam Raimi's "Hercules: The Legendary Journeys", as far as plot, acting, humour, and production values are concerned. You'll see the similarities at several points. Most of the fight scenes are not as good however and the film suffers from that.Jack Palance commands the screen as well as ever, and at no time do you have the impression he's giving anything less than his level best.

This film is on my list of worst movies ever made . The story is disconnected and it is difficult to understand it. It is like watching one of those science fiction films, but not the same. I could care less if it was good or not, it is what it is. In fact, I have not watched any of the films on this list. They are there so I can say that I have seen them all and I have a good opinion on them. In the end all I can say is that the films on this list are horrible .

This movie was definitely on the boring side . The acting was decent and the film looks pretty nice , but it was a bit weak in its storyline and it had some weak dialogues . I did find this film very enjoyable , but not as amazing as its predecessor. I think the sequel would have been better . I found it very enjoyable but it would be nice if the sequel is a little bit stronger too . Overall i think it is a decent horror movie . 1 out of 1 people found this review helpful.

I was watching the sci-fi channel when this steaming pile of crap came on. While not as bad as Wynorski's "Curse of the Komodo", this still sucks...BAD. Wynorski uses the same island as in "Curse of the Komodo", as well as the same actors and house. The effects are top notch (suprising) but thats about it........I don't know what else to say about this movie.......oh yeah! As in "Curse of the Komodo", the government gets involved and decides to bomb the island!

I enjoyed very much the movie wooden camera. I think it's a little bit influenced by the Brazilian movie "City of God", but maybe this parallelism between the two tracks possible to follow (crime and art) in social neighborhood are a reality. I think the films made by Madiba are really beautiful. I don't think it's unreal that he shoot such good films, because there's a lot of artists that don't have any type of education and can be really genius. I enjoyed very much the soundtrack.

Whoever filled this stupid idea of acting and producing a movie in Himesh's head, which is always hidden under a cap, covering almost half of his face all the time ? Only hope this is first and the last as well, for God's sake ! From Assalam Valekum to Gayatri Mantra, Himesh has tried every thing, to create an aura of his so-called singing talent, which is nothing but atrocious pronunciations of words like Tanhaiyya, which completely kill the beauty of the terms, so commonly used for love songs. Why does Himesh not smile ?

Cheezy? Yep. Poorly filmed? You betcha. Zero budget? They proudly claim it on their posters. Brilliant anyway (or because of it)? For sure.This movie celebrates (and makes fun of) everything that was classic about the 80s teen horror genre: Characters with absolutely no depth, fitting into a stereotyped roll they never escape for a moment; teenagers trying to survive a slaying by some mysterious force they disturbed by doing something lamely adolescent; completely gratuitous nudity; impossible amounts of blood coming out of victims; slow moving zombies; great one-liners... and our hero even wears a Michael Jackson jacket!

Philistines beware , especially American ones ! This has all the elements you 'll hate - a langorous approach to language, a desire to make others do something they 're not willing to do themselves and it all starts to get rather muddled , messy , confusing at times . It all has to start somewhere so here are the basics:

The language is used in various ways throughout the game, which will be explained later in this article . However , as the langauge is the basis of gameplay , it is used here to explain the mechanics of the language and the general use of the language by players.

Anyone who critiques 'Jacqueline Hyde ' as anything more than the playful and undeniably erotic romp that it 's intended to be, is doing it in good faith, because she's a woman and a writer, but it doesn't take much effort to look at her in this way. There's a lot of that in the piece, and the tone she employs is not always the most gentle. But she is, to me, one of the very best things you could do with a person, a person you love, if that's the right way to look at her.

George Hearn really went all out and over the top which in this case was great. I've heard the Len Cariou version but it was too tame. George was great in that character - very expressive.Angela Lansbury was perfect for the part. She gave a great performance. She gave the Mrs. Lovett a great devious and comical personality which balanced out the dark story.I love the dark humor when Angela Lansbury sings her songs as well as her physical expressions and the angry emotions of George Hearn in his songs of rage, vengeance and distress.I've watched this play 20 times since 1985 when I saw it on PBS.

It´s long time that I and my wife didn´t see such a boring thriller. It´s definitively NOT a gripping story and it is paced so slowly that we nearly fell asleep. This could be instead a very low budget TV crime series. There are some ridiculous scenes like the one where mafia boss Pirano wants to see the jury lady in a red clothes or another mafioso cannot stop to think about her and so on. Okay perhaps this should have been a romantic thriller but believe me you really don´t miss anything. We gave 4/10.

With the war not going well for the Soviet Union , Stalin accepted volunteers from the prisons and used the Gulag to train them. By Joseph H. Whaley

On a warm September day in 1952, a few weeks before his 70th birthday, I was sitting with two other journalists in the offices of the British-based Soviet newspaper, the New Statesman. It was early in the afternoon, and the mood was cheerful. We all had our notebooks in front of us, and our conversation had been edited so as to omit any references to any unpleasant incidents that had occurred during the past two weeks.

THE worst movie I've ever seen, and I've seen allot. Acting is horrible, plot is awful, idea is terrible, and no research was done what's so ever! Ok, I admit, `Air Bud' was a pretty good movie, but not `Soccer Dog'. This "dog" is smaller than my cat! How can he possibly play soccer? Even for 10 years old kids it won't be a problem to kick the ball hard enough to brake the stupid dog in half! It's horrible, don't watch this movie.

This is one of the worst anime series I have ever seen . When I watched the manga review in english it said that this anime is terrible and had no plot whatsoever. And now that I have read the manga I feel that it is a much better anime . The plot has some good elements such as good fight scenes , good animation , and interesting characters . But the plot is boring , the characters are boring and there are only five episodes to an anime . And the worst thing about this anime is that they can't decide which of the five episodes are the bad episodes .

In the mid 1800s, Irishman Dennis Hopper (as Daniel Morgan) emigrates to Australia, seeking a share of the continent's gold. Instead, Mr. Hopper finds himself branded, and thrown in a torturous prison; there, he is gang-raped. Upon release, Hopper hooks up with aborigine David Gulpilil (as Billy), with whom he seeks revenge upon sadistic Bill Hunter (as Sergeant Smith), Jack Thompson (as Detective Mainwaring), and others. Eventually, vengeance becomes heroism; Hopper is admired and assisted by the common people, and hunted by corrupt and powerful authorities.

"A research scientist is experimenting with human DNA in an attempt to create the perfect human being. His work has made it to the point where he can take a human fetus and accelerate its growth to that of an adult within a few days. His latest creation is a (spoiler omitted), but side effects from the process (spoiler omitted)," according to the DVD sleeve's synopsis. "Embryo" opens by promising: "The film you are about to see is not all science fiction. It is based upon medical technology which currently exists for fetal growth outside the womb.

It's the Sooooouullltakaaaa!Wow. What a skin peeling bad movie. Honestly, this is one of my favorite episodes of MST3K.... Just some things to point out...1) The incestuous lesbian mother-daughter exchange was weird. I do need counseling now.2) There is no God, there is just Dude.. I love that quote from Crow.3) Whatever did happen to the Nuns that took the bus home, will we ever know? I have a horrible emptiness in my stomach.4) Lastly, don't watch this movie un-MSTied... It has Joe Estevez as the main star.. Yikes..1/10 for un-MSTied 8/10 for MSTied.

I almost laughed out loud when during the commentary the director said this movie is original with a strong plot, but it seems like most of you think that's not a good idea. What is so bad about it, other than it's a generic "movie". I'm sure you could have a great story and a plot with this movie, but what's wrong with making it a "movie"? I wouldn't be surprised to find you were wrong about that. The film is original and it's the best of what we've seen.

I have seen nearly all the films of Kurosawa and dozens of other Japanese films as well . Compared to those of today, I’d say most of his works are good, and his films are usually very good. The problem is that we have so many films from different time periods made in the past, and we often get lost in our own world. And it’s not just that we don’t understand the language, we also don’t get a very good grasp of the culture in which the films were made.

The plot: Michael Linnett Connors has done everything in films but direct, and is looking for his 1st big chance. He discovers Molly in a play and at once knows she will be a big film star. He signs her to a contract with the stipulation that he must direct. The producer agrees and their big time careers are under way. What follows is a recreation of the silent film era and early sound movies with great emphasis on comedy. And, oh yes, there's romance, and a little sadness too. The performances by Don Ameche and Alice Fay are top notch.

Hey what a great idea to open a film - show someone`s home movie . Drama schools must be full of idiots ! , there they are taking drama lessons hoping to become the next big thing in Hollywood when all you have to do is send a home movie to a studio . Hey I think I`ll send in the video of my wedding and call it THE GREATEST ROMANCE EVER SEEN or send in a tape of my honeymoon and call it THE GREATEST SEX EVER SEEN . Oh hold on I`m not married and I`ve never been on honeymoon !

Yes sure, this is a Friday the 13th rip off but I have no problem with it. It's a good effort, the killings aren't that gory but the acting of one girl carries the movie, what a scream queen, Jennifer Ritchkoff. For a low budget movie the effects are nicely done, okay, sometimes you can guess how it is done. Some people have problems with the use of the camera, I can't see what's wrong with that. It's so strange that so many people dislike this movie, I really enjoyed it.

This proves just how awful the WB Network was in the last few years of its existence. As a homeschooler, I of course deplore this show for its ridiculous, fantasy land, obscure & unfunny stereotypes about the kids being "weird hippies who are so smart they're alienated from the super-cool high school students". Sorry TV writers, the world as viewed from inside your ass (containing your heads apparently when you wrote this show)is NOT the world we talented people see with our eyes as we live in a little thing called reality.

I was forced to watch this film for my World Reigonal Geography class. This film is what is wrong with America today, instead of figuring out the best way out of hard times or situations we would rather complain about how it is someone else's fault. This film goes through the downfall of Flint, Michigan and blames it 100% on General Motors. In the process of doing so Moore goes to great lengths to make the executives of General Motors out to be villains just because they are doing their job in a capitalist society.

This movie is very disappointing for one who has read the book. As written by Rafael Sabatini, this was a clean cut tale of piracy in the Caribbean, and it would have made a grand motion . Also, it would have been very simple to make. All the action takes place aboard ship and on a deserted island. Unfortunately, the screen writers took the title from Sabatini then threw the rest of the book away. Even the name of the main character was changed, and his screen personality was completely different from that of the individual described in the novel.

"Graduation Day" is a result of the success of "Friday the 13th." Both of those films are about creative, bloody murders, rather than suspense. If you enjoy that type of film, I'd recommend "Graduation Day." If not, I wouldn't. There's nothing new here, just the same old killings.Even though I've given the film a 4 out of 10, I will say that it's not a repulsive film. It is watchable if your curious about it, just not creative.

Okay , so this series kind of takes the route of 'here we go again ! ' Week in , week out its always going to end with some of the same old boring posts, so this series is gonna be different each and every week, I will try my best to cover a wide variety of subjects, so check it out and see what I got up for you ! I will try to do it in such a way as that there will be some of the same posts, but at least they will be interesting ones !

I can admit right away that this is one of the worst movies i have seen in my life . it's not that the plot is bad, or that it is hard to tell the story , it is just that it is just so damn boring . i just don't understand what the problem is , it seems to be just the fact that i can't get my head around this film . i did like the first one , but this one makes me want to walk out of the movie . there is no point in doing this , there is nothing to get accomplished here .

Well, it took them 4 tries, but they finally got it right! In this 4th sequel to the Karate Kid franchise, the producers really hit a home run! Well first of all I applaud them for finally getting rid of Ralph Macchio. I felt he never did service to the role of the Karate Kid. I would have rather have seen Danny 'Ralph Mouth' Most in that role. Macchio turned out what proved to be the best movie in the series, and look where his career is now! Instead they put in a girl!

The Adventures of Hercules has to be one of the lamest excuses for a movie I 've yet run across, if not one of the most ridiculous. The plot involves Hercules trying to rescue a kidnapped Princess of Thrace, but after he rescues her and then discovers she is the daughter of Zeus, they go out of the city, where the people start to fight. That is where the film's problem begins. The first part of the movie consists of the people fighting and Hercules fighting a dragon, so we know that the script is at least semi-written.

This great film never showed up in my town, so actually I didn't have any opportunity to watch it until the late 80'es when I caught it on German television. I was expecting something of a disaster, and found instead a well-acted grand western with superb location work. The tiny tube couldn't really damage it and there's almost not a dull moment in this 4-hour film, so I hope to see it once again on the big screen. What a spectacle that would be! Don't miss it, if you ever have the chance.

So bad, it's entertaining, especially during cocktail hour, and believe me, you'll need a beer, a drink, or whatever to get through this turkey. Where do they get the financial backing for such paint-by-the-numbers "horror" flicks? The fun in this movie is predicting which characters will get eaten and in what order, and trashing the so-called "uniforms" the "military" jokers wear. The raptors, by the way, are not the same raptors we met in "Jurassic Park," but a cousin species. (Sorry, no spoilers here.

the movie is complete disaster . i do n't know who write scripts for movies like this one , but this is a movie about a man who has to take care of his 3 year old son , who is dying and has no money . it would be a great idea if someone could make a film like this for real , because as far as movies go , it's an abomination . I loved it. The story and characters of the movie were great. I can see how some would be angry about it and think it was poorly written and the director didn't know what they were talking about.

Here is a movie of adventure, determination, heroism, & bravery. Plus, it's set back in the late 1800s which makes it even more interesting. It's a wonderful, adventurous storyline, and Alyssa Milano is wonderful at playing the wholesome, confident, no-nonsense Fizzy...a great role-model. This is one of my favorite movies. It is a movie to be watched again and again and will inspire you and enrich your life without a doubt. Not only is the storyline excellent, but the movie also has fabulous scenery and music and is wonderfully directed.

This film is just another waste of time. The plot is ridiculous, forced USA drama. The characters were all really weak, especially the uncharismatic Goya and the bad interpretation of Bardem, who only was alright in his classic interpretation, when acting as french ally.Just another chance lost of have spent the money in a good film. I guess it was no a low budget film. Definitely not recommended. Maybe the director's should think a bit whether the film has sense or not before wasting so that money. Maybe they do not bother as they have profits before launching them in the cinema.No more hope in cinema...

If you were enjoyed by watching `` Guinea Pig '' - then you 'll like this movie to ! `` `` ''

I really liked the characters that were playing, but I wasn't satisfied with the story because it was a bit confusing at times. But overall it was a good movie, the story and the acting were good. It's a little bit different from most horror flicks as there are more than one character that is being killed off, but it was still okay to watch. It's rated PG-13 for some reason.

This is an odd movie . On the surface it 's no different to many other d-grade gore movies but there are enough elements to set it apart and the performances are outstanding. There is a strong story, well thought out, well acted and acted as well as the acting. It has it all with a great soundtrack. A great movie that you don't have to rent to watch for free. Check this movie out for a fun time. Rating: 4.5 out of 5

Genre: Horror, Blood, Gore, Slasher

Runtime: 113 mins.

There is a solid group of people that have lives like this girl going through the admissions process at school and not having the courage to go in and apply for that dream job that you're going to get at a certain point in time. I feel like you just have to be strong and just go with your gut. I've been in the same position as you. I was told by someone who I respected that they didn't want to tell me what they wanted, that I was the one who would have to convince them.

8/2008. When I originally wrote my comments, shortly after first seeing this film, I took a critical view, feeling that Lemmon and Matthau had basically "phoned-in" their performances, which paired them in a manner they'd done several times previously.But upon seeing it again, it seemed different, especially in view that neither of the two main mega-stars lived a great deal longer after its release.With the exception of Spiner, all of the eight principals are performers with considerable experience, and likewise unavoidably a lot "longer in tooth" than we've seen in many of their other film and t.v.

The best thing about this flick is that it seems like they used a lot of stuff left over from the Pearl Harbor attack in Tora Tora Tora. My favorite was the shot of the P-40 crashing into the row of parked P-40s but filmed from the top of a hangar or crane. Unfortunately it just gets worse from there.There's two black guys and two white guys as American POWs, as well as some Filipinos POWs and Japanese guards. The ranking POW of the Americans is a white naval Lieutenant, which is of course an O-3 in the navy.

Franco films can be divided into 4 categories- the "earlies" (often black and white and inventive), the "naughties" (late 1960s/early 1970s often involving Soledad Miranda), the "nudies" (of various periods, but using full frontal female nudity as plot drive)and "the rest".This is part of the "rest". It is not really a cannibal movie at all. It is certainly no gorefest. The few women in the picture dont even lose their loin cloths and there is little full frontal stuff at all.

I don't know what neighborhoods the folks who wrote the rave reviews for this movie live in, but I'm glad I'm not there if they don't comment on the cartoonish-ness of this thing. Okay, we learn to suspend our disbelief in films like the "Die Hard" series, but seeing little Jodie knock off a whole street gang, with a Glock, as a NOVICE yet...c'mon. All she needed was a bald head and a ripped T-shirt and she would BE Bruce Willis. Apparently, Jodie being the executive producer blinded her to what a joke and waste of her money this would be.

If you have seen the Telugu version of Gilli "Okkadu" you will find this to be very similar in story line, but Gilli has different songs and takes place in Tamil Nadu not Andra pradesh. Although this is a remake of "Okkadu" you will find that Vijay and Trisha make this a unique film, Vijay and Trisha make a great pair. A few negatives were when Vijays character slaps Trishas character for going to buy a present for him, he never apologizes and she still stays with him in the end.

This film is so 1980's and that is what I like so much about it. It does an excellent job of conveying the feel of that odd decade. The reality that Russian nukes could wipe you out at any time. Reagan in the White House telling everybody that things were great, while more and more social programs were slashed. Young people dropped out, but not as far as their parents of the 1960's did. Young people still went to school, they just smoked so much dope that their sensetivities were all but dead.

Before I saw this movie I believed there were two kinds of bad cinema. (1) Your average, completely uninspired fare (i.e. "Constantine"), and (2) the work that is charmingly bad, or so-bad-it's good (a la "Manos The Hands of Fate"). Now that I've seen "Dr. Gore" I know there is a third kind of bad movie: the utter crap sandwich. That will be irrevocably tattooed on your memory. A work that is mind-bendingly execrable.

Well, that was sure a waste of Dave McKean's talents, wasn't it? Don't get me wrong: when it comes to graphic design, Dave McKean may be the best in the world right now. The layered, textured look he can accomplish with just a few pencil lines on rough paper make the efforts of people like Peter Greenaway and David Fincher look like what they are: hackwork. McKean has been the godfather of a revolution in the look of comics, film, even magazine ads which borrow the distinctive collage effect he has pioneered.But this movie?

If you like your films to pull your emotions out of you , if you like your films with a message , if you like your films you can’t sit there and accept it as the best film of the year, the best film of the decade, it’s got to be so much better. I know I can’t sit there and accept it but I love the fact that we now have the chance to tell stories in a way that is true to life, so that it’s very real for the audience and very powerful.

I watched the movie with tears and smiles alternatively. Anger surged in me to see the ruin of Hanoi after the 12-day bombard. And by living in the country right now with my parents, who's been living in Saigon for 50 years, I understand that we're much better off now, and would have been better if the American didn't bring war here. Watching the movie, I learned more of the different kinds of wars that the America planned in Vietnam, and what disasters they caused.The series seems to do well with the interviews with the real people.

This was touted as a sequel to Crash Dive, which was a very good film in the low budget category. I assumed this movie would be good also, but boy was I wrong. First, this movie has nothing to do with Crash Dive other than they both take place on submarines. Secondly, the plot can be slow, tedious, and in some cases, totally preposterous.This movie will not hold most people's attention. (I remember reading a book during the slow, boring scenes.) There will be scenes that are supposed to be used for dramatic effect that will make the viewer laugh out loud.

Saw this at the Hong Kong International Film Festival, over three years ago. I went in with no expectations since Christopher Nolan was a no-name at the time, but it sounded interesting and turned out to be one of the best things I saw at that festival. It worked well on the big screen, with the technique of cutting the scenes out of sequence adding to the mood. Mr.Nolan gave a good account of its making at the end, enough to put anybody off starting out as a film-maker! I liked it better than Memento although this was, perhaps, due to the lower expectations.

I was lucky enough to see this film at a festival last year and had half expected it to get mixed reviews. It made it into the finals and got some attention for the first half of the year. After that it fell off my radar for a few months. When it came back, I was pleasantly surprised. I thought it had potential. It was an interesting look at a character in the film and showed a lot of potential for a film that I really liked. That being said I was very disappointed in the ending. There was not enough development for the character.

The inspiration for the "Naked Gun" movies casts Leslie Nielsen - who had only recently started doing comedy* - as the incompetent but heroic Frank Drebin, always having to solve an absurd case. Like "Airplane!" and the movies based on the series, the humor relies on Mel Brooks-style spot gags and silly comments (namely the "yes it is" remarks), along with the fact that Nielsen remains very serious despite the nonsense around him. And of course, the final frame, in which something keeps moving.It's too bad that the show only had six episodes.

The movie was very good. I'm an avid mystery fan and I usually figure out who is going to be killed and who did the killing. While I did figure out who was going to be killed I didn't figure out who did it. I wasn't happy with the portrayal of the Gerda character but given the year the movie was supposed to take place it is possible the woman would have been that 'cloying'. Please know that while these Poirot movies are good, they just don't have the same dynamic to them as the series does because they don't have Japp, Ms.

Katharine Hepburn as a mountain woman who mixes prayer with positive thinking -- and is thought by the local folk of East Africa to be one of the founding figures of the new religion. The story is told in "The Heart of the Matter," a recent documentary film about one of the founding figures of the new religion of the mountain people, a group that is still called by the local people "the Christians" despite the fact that they are Muslims. "This is not something that was created by humans," explains Hepburn, who co-directs the documentary with her husband, director William G. Dietz.

In the ever growing film genre of comic book adaptations , Blade is by far one of the best realised , most stylish and entertaining of them . I have seen a great number of great film adaptations of novels , television series and comics since I first became interested in the genre, and Blade stands out as my favorite , in a great variety of ways . I’m not usually one for “ what’s good for the film ” reviews , as this is not a film that “ should be made ” at all .

It is not uncommon for a celebrity to be faced with the proverbial `` wake-up call '' . And , as with many people who are confronted with these kinds of situations, he or she might just as easily turn the tables and say that it is time for them to `` get a life '' or `` get off the soapbox '' . This may be because, as is the case with many celebrities , they are famous because they are in a certain type of situation. Or it may just be that these situations are what they really enjoy doing.

... why watch a TV drama (billed as a comedy) in which none of the characters are likable or even interesting people ? I can sort of see what the writer David Renwick was trying to achieve: the misdirections and bad-taste surprises that he put into "One foot in the grave", etc. I admit that the script made a bit more of an effort than most on British TV at the moment. But really ... who cares about these people ? They are cold bores.Another poster mentioned the scene in which the woman sits down to watch a video of herself and her deceased ex-boyfriend shagging.

I like seeing Linda Blair playing in an actual `` horror '' movie again . I had been disappointed with her last movie, but I don't mind that this one has a different focus. I don't know what makes me think it's a bad movie - I'm only watching it to make sure. I'm still a little bummed about the ending. What I am looking forward to is getting to see Jodie Foster once again. But that is not what makes me love this movie. It's not just the acting. You see that in the trailer.

The movie starts with a Spiderman spoof which is your introduction to Rick Riker ( played by Drake Bell of Marvel fame). The man has become a superhero due to the success of his superhero comic books and then his career is destroyed when he was found to have a connection to a crime that occurred on his turf. He ends up getting killed by an unknown assailant but the police refuse to investigate. He then reappears in this movie to lead a group of superheroes and villains in an effort to take down the crime lord that is trying to take over New York City.

It 's rare to see film that strikes out in every aspect but `` Caligula '' surely must hold this distinction. Here are some thoughts that I had after seeing this movie. It's a good one. It had me laughing out loud the entire way. This movie is one that you don't expect to laugh at, but do it nonetheless. One of the best films I've seen for awhile. If you haven't seen it you're missing out a lot. It's funny and a bit scary at the same time.

SPOILER ALERT ! Do n't read on unless you 're prepared for some spoilers.I think this film had a lot of great potential. It started with interesting characters and some interesting action. Then, the film took an interesting direction and the characters changed drastically, and now the film is stuck in a middle ground where the audience can only guess at what is going to happen next.The director had a great script and cast. There were some great scenes in the first act, but now the action becomes a chore. The characters are so boring.

One of the worst theatrical movies of the year , if not all time . Anthony Hopkins belittles himself by claiming he’s not a movie director , he’s merely a stage actor . He’s actually in the same boat with his next movie , The Descent . He’s an actor who is not able to direct , but at least he can do one of the things he excels at, which is being an actor . Unfortunately , this is not an issue that Anthony Hopkins can deal with , which makes it an excellent opportunity for him to do a character-study about himself.

Honestly, on the subject of the death penalty, I could take it or leave it. The problem I have with this documentary lies in the fact that it is a complete love-fest for the murderer, with absolutely no sympathy for the family. The Execution of Wanda Jean, with it's completely one sided view, only reinforced my view that she should have been executed for her crimes. It tried to argue that she was mentally retarded, but nothing in the video supported that view. She seemed uneducated, but so did her entire family, but that doesn't mean they were all retarded.

Obabakoak is a bunch of short stories with an only common point: the little Vasque town of Obaba. In this film, the director tries to explain some of these stories by using a young reporter as a continuum. The result is a strange film, as it has any main character (the movie spends about 20 min. to each tale) other than the town of Obaba. Any story is really well explained and the fact is that they result very boring. It was by far the best film of the year in Spain, but, well, that's not saying too much.

I do not like Himesh Reshamiya . I do not like his singing too . But his songs are a part of Pakistani culture and we love him for his songs . I am proud that he has been selected as the new chief minister of the Punjab . I am happy and proud of my people too . I know my people are not like that . That does not mean that they do not like me either . I am very happy that they like me . I respect and support the Punjab Government and the Prime Minister and all other people in and outside Pakistan .

Historically awful . Scarcely an accurate moment in 4 hours of ridiculosity . One can not keep track of the various examples . But I have the best of intentions for the video . But in the end it turned out worse then expected . This should be a warning . So please do not make the video to much worse then it is meant to be . There is a warning here . I hope you enjoyed it . Well that was not what was expected . I had no intentions of making it as bad as it was . I just wanted to try my best to make an entertaining video .

This is one of the most unoriginal, cliche-ridden movies I have ever seen. Even if you didn't like this film's antecedents, 'The Bad News Bears' and 'The Mighty Ducks,' they are bound to have done a better job than this one. From the moment the new teacher greets her class and they tell her, "Don't bother with us, we're all losers," you can see everything that's coming twenty miles away for the rest of the film. All the usual suspects are here.

I watched this film mistakenly thinking that it was that other radio station zombie flick . The shonky production values are way to overplayed for what it is but it was funny enough to keep you chuckling till the end . As I said above I have to admit it was funny in that way it is meant to be but it was still disturbing enough to get my stomach churning as well as my heart racing

It's a horror film, that is what I am saying. I am not a horror person. I think a lot of horror films can be funny.

Just in case the title did n't give it away - this movie is garbage.Short review ? Yeah.I decided to watch this movie the day before I came home from New York. It came to the conclusion that I should just skip it, since it doesn't have a plot. So I did. And I was very disappointed. There's no plot at all. It just seems to be a lot of random actions and explosions that happen, and I've had enough. It's a bunch of random movies, most of which are very boring.

Well well , I had seen a lot of reviews on this one , and a lot of promo always. So I thought it was time to show how I was going to do it, and here is the link of the review I just wrote. http://forum.manajordainseo.com/index.php?showtopic=61916

My goal is to build a site , where you can see what kind of things I was thinking and doing when designing the site. Also , I will be posting the design of the site regularly. I was doing the same thing a few months back, and it was fun to do it again .

This is a strong recommendation to anyone who reads this review who has never seen the film Total Reality , a movie in which a man goes back into time to rescue his mother from the Nazi’s who took her from him on the eve of the liberation of the concentration camps. It is a very compelling movie, and I do not have anything else to say on it, except to say that there is so much more that can be said about what happened in Europe on the night of June 8/9 1945.

First the premise stinks ... little boy likes to dress in girls clothes . It reminded me of Norman Bates in Psycho. Then the second premise ... well, he is a nice guy ..... and so is his grandmother. But she was not so nice to the little boy, she was mean to him and his family ... she told them they would be the first to go hungry. He didn't say that to her ! She was mean to her grandson and his family and that made him mad ... he was mean to little boy ! He was mean to his grandmother.

Although Embryo could have been a potentially thought provoking examination of bioethics, it degenerates into a stereotypical Frankenstein parable, putting across the by now monotonous lesson that there were some realms man was not meant to enter or study.Scientist Rock Hudson is experimenting with ways to prevent miscarried babies from dying. After success with a dog, he immediately jumps to humans-violating medical ethics and any sense of plausibility-with the equally unrealistic assistance of a hospital administrator. His experiment works too well, with some decidedly unpleasant side effects.Although Barbara Carrera is reasonably good in her role, and some of the animal training is spectacular, the film suffers from being too fantastical.

Produced by Nott Entertainment , this movie is `` nott '' very good at all . I sat through the whole movie and i could only watch part of the movie , because it was so long and it has soooo much story , but there are no characters or any real story in it . And i could only imagine this movie , because i am watching a movie , and i want to watch something that has characters and stories in it , and the only stories in it are about these characters , and the main character in this movie is sooo boring .

I 'm not going to say the story of the movie as some people do . I 'm pretty sure you could do that as well . And I 'd be willing to bet that there is a lot you could do as well. What I can say is that it is a pretty funny, funny movie. It has some really funny moments. What I have to say about that movie and the movie that I have in the works is that I find it very difficult to write a positive review of this movie. It is a very funny movie.

Well I guess I know the answer to that question. For the MONEY! We have been so bombarded with Cat In The Hat advertising and merchandise that we almost believe there has to be something good about this movie. I admit, I thought the trailers looked bad, but I still had to give it a chance. Well I should have went with my instincts. It was a complete piece Hollywood trash. Once again proving that the average person can be programed into believing anything they say is good, must be good.

Rabbit Fever is one of those film oddities . It 's an enjoyable 90 minutes , demands little of the viewer . The film follows the lives of three rabbits which have become infected with a virus that can cause them to lose their hair, lose consciousness and die. The rabbits are treated by a small team of vets who have no idea of what they are dealing with, as the animals can not speak, but the team work with them from within. There is a great deal of humour , good acting , some good acting , good special effects .

No blood, no sex (though it oozes passion), no special effects, but just one of those pearls that comes across your movie screen when you're not really looking and grabs your attention. Great acting, great sets, great music, beautiful storyline. If only there were a lot more movies made like this one!The sets move us through time and make us feel like we were there.The acting appears like real life, and elevates us to the level of awareness of "Nanny", to whom no-one is a lost cause, least of all the inhabitants of her own "Halfway" house.

Help ! Once again , Paul Schrader has sabotaged his own intentions with dull , pedantic storytelling . I rearranged the chapters for this review , to help avoid spoilers. For those unfamiliar with Paul’s story, I’ve outlined the background of the plot here . If that’s any help, I would suggest that you read it . I’ve also read the book, and it has been a bit of a slog . I’m not going to spoil any of that, but I would like to point out that the book starts off fairly well, but quickly descends into a very bad plot .

I 've been strangely attracted to this film since I saw it on Showtime sometime in the early 80 's and it got me hooked. So I decided to see this one in a theatre. It was a long day for me to go see it. I watched it during the day and at night on TV. I didn't have a projector and I couldn't get up in time to do the film. So I left it in the DVD player and the next morning when I opened the box it looked like a movie poster. That's how it looked to me.

Although this has to be the nadir of season six , this schmaltzy episode is n't badly written or acted. For starters, I love the way the episode begins and ends, it's got a great story and it doesn't feel quite as forced or forced as seasons one or three. It also has a really great beginning, which we can't say the same of season three. For me the beginning of the episode was really good, I just wish that the whole thing didn't end there. It's a little too long and it has too much buildup and not enough payoff.

Good Film.I managed to pick this up on DVD in a local store sale . £2.99 seems like a good value for the effort. It's got plenty of film in it , and some nice extras. The DVD is not in the best quality for the money. I am going to go ahead and buy a Blu Ray copy and see what I can do with it .I'm a fan of the movie.I'm not sure about this movie though . It's a bit weird , and the ending seemed a bit forced. It's not the worst film I've seen but I don't remember it being that good.

So what is one to do if you are a porno star with fading looks ? I know , become a porno artist. What else should you do ? Well , here is the answer. First, you must find something that you would like to be in the nude , something that will give you an opportunity to express yourself and make your own style. It is always advisable to be in front of a camera, even when you are working from the side. There are many porno scenes where you can show off a lot of skin.

Having enjoyed Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqatsi I was looking forward to this third part of the Qatsi trilogy and seeing what direction it had taken. Rarely has a film so spectacularly failed to live up to its predecessors and lost its way. Although it tries to represent "civilised warfare" in the form of sport, science, trade and other forms of competition, it lacks the global scope and even the coherently developed themes of its predecessors. War is chaos, but even wars have an aim in mind and this film had little structure and unclear goals.Naqoyqatsi is flawed by being a chaotic melange of images that does little to develop its theme.

A group of adventurers travel to the 'dark continent ' to try and locate a lost heiress named Diana , a beautiful princess kidnapped by a ruthless wizard and sold as a slave by him to an evil wizard in exchange for the life of his own son. In the middle of a dangerous, ancient battle, Diana narrowly avoids being taken by her captors. But she soon finds herself on the road to ruin. Is she the victim of evil, or evil is winning? This is the story of a young woman who finds herself being taken away by the Dark One.

This movie makes `` Glitter '' look like `` Schindler 's List . '' Tarantino and the Weinsteins really need to spend some extra money to make this one look more attractive to a wide audience, but it does have its moments. As with most movies of this nature, it's best to watch it first to get the key plot points and not the movie. So here are my thoughts on what you need to know before this movie. * The title is very clever. I don't know why we've been waiting so long to hear this and now it's finally here.

I just finished watching this ( last weekend ) and found it absolutely hillarious , some of the scenes I had in my head were not in this show , but I am glad I picked up the first episode , I enjoyed the story that much more. There is so much history in this series, I can hardly wait until Season 2 , I can't wait to meet these characters and really get to see what they do on a day to day basis. I saw this episode before I saw episode 12, and I agree, it's one of my favs.

Made with film stock left over from the production of Nana, 1927's Sur un Air de Charleston is described as a holiday film for all concerned, and that's the best way to view it. Jean Renoir seems never to have thought enough of it to even edit the footage together. The plot is a simple reversion of racial stereotypes  in 2028 a black explorer travels to a post-holocaust Paris where a white native girl teaches him the Charleston (naturally he assumes she's a savage whose dancing is a prelude to her eating him before giving in to the seductive beat of 'White Aborigine' music).

The Quick and the Undead is , finally , the first movie to actually render its own storyline null and void of any meaning other than being a fun bit of horror that's not going to make you want to run to the nearest store to buy a copy of the DVD. This movie has been one of the best horror movies on my radar for the last year, and I have been waiting for it for so long, I had to finally make it my first priority this weekend. I was not disappointed. It's a well constructed story full of scares and the kind of scares I like.

This film is absolute cinematic genius . It has a well brought together cast who give an almost magical performance . Some have said it was the best performance of the whole cast . It's not a film for the whole family . Some may find it very hard to watch at the beginning . For those who want to try watching it you can download the dvd and watch it in 720p . The movie is a great film to take your kids to see . The music is excellent . And the special effects and editing are absolutely amazing .

Rather than go on location and make a realistic film about drug addiction in the Windy City, contrarian director Otto Preminger decided to go the opposite way and make his movie appear as artificial as possible, thus flying in the face of the fashion set by men like Kazan, Huston and Zinnemann, who were making their pictures all over the world. Nelson Algren, on whose novel the movie is based, went on record as despising it. What, one wonders, was Preminger up to, and why did he do the movie this way?The sets in the film are so minimal as to suggest a Mr. Magoo cartoon.

The untold origin of the Lone Ranger . It shows who he was and how and why he became the most popular hero in film history! Who was the Lone Ranger, who was his father and what role did they play? Who is he today and why is he the biggest star of Hollywood? Why did he not become a Hollywood star? Find out more and see how this classic Hollywood movie helped bring the Lone Ranger to the world and how he came to be one of the most iconic characters ever to emerge from the silver screen.

'The 4th Floor' is a decidedly mediocre film starring Juliette Lewis as a young interior designer with a heck of a problem neighbor. Jane (Lewis) has recently inherited a terrific 5th floor apartment from her grandmother, and per agreement with the landlord, gets a ridiculously low renting rate. Her boyfriend (William Hurt as a creepy weather man) wants her to move in with him, but she wants her own space. So she moves in, and weird stuff starts happening, and because this is a B-grade horror flick, there's a dumb, not-to-be-found-in-reality reason why.

As I read the script on-line, I thought "Capote" needed a trim. Having just seen it on PPV, I can tell you it wasn't trimmed, it was butchered like that poor family! Example: in the script, Truman dubs Shawn "Adorable One"; here, he is "Mr. Shawn".Bad enough the amateurs behind this movie de-flame Capote and bash his circle (are we to really believe they thought so little of Nelle, they mangled her little opus like an obnoxious in-joke? ), they turn Perry Smith into this oh-so-sensitive victim, even as he's shown dispatching the Clutters.

First of all , i have nothing against Christianity . i believe , every person has the right to believe in what he/she wants to believe in . but i think you are trying to compare Christianity to Islam when the only difference , is in the name of that religion , not the person . i have no problems with people , regardless of their religious beliefs , being able to live in peace with anyone , regardless of their religion . and if you want to talk about Jesus , i will also believe that he has the right to say that there is no deity or god .

When I was younger I saw the end of HAIR on TV. I just watched the last 5 minutes of the film. And I was really impressed by it. I got goose pimples and I said to myself that I HAD to watch this film.And I did, and I've to say: This film is amazing. The songs are great, the actors are very good and the message... The message of this film is one of the most important ones: "Make love, no war". This film is a real masterpiece.

Taken the idea out of a true diplomatic incident "The Wind and the Lion" is a very good adventure film set in the deserts of Africa.El Raisuli (Sean Connery) head of an Arab tribe kidnaps an American woman(Candice Bergen) and her two children to obtain some concessions for his country out of American president Theodore Roosevelt (Brian Keith). Out of this simple plot John Milius gets a very complete and enjoyable movie in the genre.The outdoor dessert locations, an impressive color photography, very well handled action sequences and perfect settings turn the picture in a sort of epic one with an undeniable sense of greatness.

I consider myself to have a decent sense of humor , but this `` movie '' left me stunned in its lack of wit , or at least that is what I feel it should have. For the record I enjoyed the first movie, but the second movie I found rather tedious. I have been told that a sequel may be in the works, but I am skeptical. I understand that there is a script, but I think there is no reason that the film should have so many plot twists that make it impossible to watch.

I saw this version of Hamlet on television many years ago, and have seen every other version since, whether television or movie. However, this is the one that remains the truest depiction of the story for me. Most excellent Derek Jacobi made Hamlet *real* for me. Before I saw this version, Shakespeare was simply gibberish to me and I never tried to understand the Elizabethan English. Having seen Jacobi's Hamlet several times not only increased my knowledge of literature, but also that of my family. I promptly checked the play out of Library and read it, and poured over the accompanying recording.

The 1979 film musical of HAIR was loosely based on the infamous 1960's Broadway musical that became famous because of its infamous nude scene. The stage musical isn't really much more than a group of skits strung together with some amusing musical numbers; however for the film director Milos Foreman (who won an Oscar for directing ONE FLEW OVER THE CUCKOO'S NEST) and the writers have taken the basic premise of the play and the score and constructed a real story to make the show more "user friendly" for the big screen.

The MTV sci-fi animated series `` Æon Flux '' is brought to life with Charlize Theron playing the title character as she takes on a new challenge of fighting a deadly virus that will take her to the outer reaches of space. The show is directed by David Slade, whose credits include the award-winning film ``The Chronicles of Riddick: Dark Fury.'' Slade said: ``I feel like there's a certain level of freedom for Charlize to play the role. It's not something she's doing in a specific time or place.

To date this is still the worst piece of rubbish I've ever viewed. So annoyed I even complained to Blockbuster for stocking it. Me and some friends rented it after looking at the back cover thinking we were in for a good horror film. The plot line seem to change during the film and there was lots of irrelevant padding. The film ended quite abruptly, I'm guessing they ran out of film. Sound quality was dire and the first female character had a very thick Spanish accent although she talked utter nonsense anyway. The guy provided a brief bit of eye candy until his bizarre attempts at murder.

the worst sequel I 've ever seen . really awful songs which is upsetting considering how fantastic the first films are . the only positive is that the movie was well acted and it was nice to see an adult movie made by teenagers . and the ending was cool as well . the rest was a disaster . and the only reason it got a 7 is because I have to agree with a lot of its opinions

The biggest problem with this movie was it was made for children. The main characters are all teenagers and it just isn’t realistic or believable for them to go on a murder spree like that.

No matter what other people have said you ca n't review this movie without comparing it to the original , you cant help but say it is better and better . Its really a movie you cant get out of your head . Theres nothing like it on the shelf anywhere ! And you know you have to have it , its better than all of the movies in the world . And you know whats even better . How do you feel , when your a complete and total loser and you know you are in this movie , you can't get enough of this .

This film is not only the last piece of the Three Colours trilogy, but also the best of the three and one of the best movies of the 90s. There's hardly another movie that so wisely and consequently asks for humanity and respect for every human being. Valentine (Irene Jacob) lives in Geneva, where she works as a model. Though she has a boyfriend, she seems to be rather lonely. One night she has an accident and injures a dog and who leads her to his owner, a retired jugde (Jean-Louis Trintignant), who is cynical and spies his neighbors phone calls.

First of all , I personally adore Demons and Demons 2 , I saw them although it was hard to get into the cinemas , but now I can get into them . The movie was a really good one and the director has put in a lot of effort into making it a decent film . I really enjoyed the story . The cinematography , acting and music were all good . There were some problems , I will not go into details in this review . If you liked it , do give it a try . The movie is also available in various languages .

Ben Affleck , about to be married , is shaken up by a plane accident and gets involved with one of his friends in a deadly car accident . when they get back to his home he is shocked to discover that his wife of a few months , Anne Hathaway , has been killed , leaving him a young child , his only child , who , like his mother , has never left home before . his friends are trying to get to the bottom of the incident and he starts to try to figure out why things were so messed up when the investigation finds that he and his wife had a secret love affair .

Wow , there are no words to describe how bad this movie truly is . I usually pride myself on how well written I have been, but this movie sucked. I just couldn't take any more. I really liked the book, though, which is why I loved the movie . I can't even describe what happened to me. There was one character in the book , but I don't think I'll ever find her. I think it was a book by the same author , so I wouldn't be surprised if that character was the same .

During the making of this movie I once caught a statement on television about it. Something like: "Is Killinggänget now taking off Nazism? "So, my comprehension of this movie, was from the beginning to get a notion of Nazism. When recently seeing this movie in the TV-version I had this filter before me and it wasn't difficult to see this.Strangely enough I haven't met this way of interpreting the film ever since I first heard it.These are the things I found in "Four shades of brown". In all four of the stories the lack of empathy leads to disaster:1.

Heh...I'm surprised this movie still exists in any form, let alone it being available for rent! This flick is one of the many bad slasher flicks that exist only for the T&A and the cheap laughs. The story line crosses a bit of "Texas Chainsaw massacre" with a screwy mamma-centred back story reminiscent of "Psycho", and a bit of the good old women-in-chains, tough-as-nail-ex-con broads tossed in for good measure - in other words, complete unoriginality wrapped up in half naked women spiced with a dash of utter idiocy!

This is by far the most vapid, idiotic, insanely stupid show that has EVER been on the air, and this is coming from someone who remembers "San Pedro Beach Bums".My wife loves watching reality shows--and there was one episode of this drivel where the wannabes had to develop a "walk". The end result was straight out of Monty Python's "Ministry of Silly Walks" sketch. I couldn't laugh hard enough.And then there's the ubiquitous Ms. Banks (as in laughing all the way to the...).

I just got back from "AGS". After seeing it, I'm convinced that no matter how much it's written how he extensively researched the film, Stone NEVER has watched an NFL game in his life. Great cinematography ? Give me a break. The game montages were almost unviewable and 90% of the other shots in the film were close-ups. Was there ANYTHING in this movie that wasn't brought up in "North Dallas Forty" ?Aging star player ... check. Young hot shot .... check. Painkillers .... check. Owner who doesn't "get it" .... check.

A kooky, but funny bit of diversion. You kind of have to see it from the beginning to follow what's happening, but each report to earth has it's own little joke. Pretty good special effects for a very low budget sci-fi t.v. show. It's fun to watch. Sort of in the vein of Red Dwarf, but even more low budget. For someone who's just coming in in the middle of one of the episodes, what you have to realize is that these guys are all incompetent, because they've been moved up the ladder of command, because the other officers died.

Young, ambitious nurse Ms. Charlotee (Rosie Holotik) is sent to work at a mental asylum out in the middle of nowhere. During the course of 3 days, she encounters strange happenings, even a patient in her bedroom watching her, yet she still stays. The mental patients are all a little eye rolling (espically by the Judge), but my favorite was the old crazy biddy (Rhea MacAdams). The storyline is okay at best, and the acting is surprisingly alright, but after awhile it's gets to be a little much.

Shot in my former home town by a couple of college kids, this movie centers around some freak named "luther". Luther, recently paroled (revealed to us by an arguing parole board in one of the most laughably scenes of all time), runs amuck at the local Kroger grocery by eating an old woman's neck with his metal teeth.Luther runs to farm where he eats a guy, steals a car, ties up an old woman, and gets chased, and gets killed. Oh, and the chick from the SUPERBOY tv show gets naked.

I watched this cooking show for a few times before I wanted to pull my hair out . Just one episode . It is a show I like . There is not a lot of chemistry between the host , the two guests , the two chefs . The host is very informative about the food they serve . And the guest chefs is very humble and very kind . The host , I think has a point of view , he knows how the food should be . So , that is why I like this kind of cooking . It is not only good , but it is also beautiful .

I absolutely adore this film about a lady columnist (Barbara Stanwyck) for a major homemaking magazine who delivers a welcoming article each month that includes details about her awesome home life as a wife and mother in a beautiful Connecticut home. The trouble happens when the owner of her monthly publication demands that she have him and a WW2 hero as guests during the Christmas Holidays. Why is she worried? Because she lives in a small New York apartment, isn't married, and doesn't have a baby - and can't cook at all!

A terrible deception : controversial film , winner of the Teddy in Berlin 2003 , Mil nubes de paz turned to comedy in 2006, the first of three films to be filmed with a camera phone . The first time , I watched it was a few years ago . I had an hour-long break from my studies when I started to go to the movies , and I had seen a lot of funny movies before. But the first time I saw the film it made me want to watch all the other films that I have seen in that time and the first thing I noticed is that they are not funny.

I just called my brother Paulie on the phone and he said he was watching Hoods and it was funny! I am going to go back to my room, and do my laundry, then I will come back and watch Hoods at 6pm tonight. It will be awesome!!! I hope it's not too cold, I know I would like to wear a coat, so that I can stay warm. I love the sound of thunder and lightning, so that I am warm! Oh well! Thursday, December 13, 2012

Okay, so last week was pretty cold!

This is the worst movie I have ever seen. The story line is a joke, the effects are terrible, the cinematography doesn't fit the tone of the movie, the dialogue is cheesy, and the actors do a good job at screwing up the rest. People just don't act that way in real life situations. My question is: Who would fund such crap?The movie starts where some miners fall down a mine shaft after a fireman fails to save them. Next we join some bikers in a forest who ride around doing stunts on their bikes.

I picked up this movie and was horrified to find out that the movie is based on a rape of a little girl that the parents knowingly take their daughter to. My first thoughts were that I have never been more ashamed to be an Indian as well as a Hindu. I found this movie to be down right appalling. Please don't waste your time. As for the music, there are at most 2 horrible songs and the film used is cheap. The beautiful scenes are not what India is known for. I just hope that I have shed some light on how disgusting this movie really is.

Having lived in Michigan's Upper Peninsula (30 miles from Escanaba) in the mid-1990s, I was eager to see this film. It begins promisingly enough, with some superficial understanding of the values and quirks of U.P. life. But Jeff Daniels apparently was not content with a low-key approach that would have been fitting given the place and the people. Instead, he introduces extremely crude humor and some wildly inappropriate mystical/supernatural elements. Although there is a good movie to be made about this practically unknown region of the U.S., this is NOT it.

I didn't understand the people who rated it over 5. I think it's a horrible film from any point of view. Plots, acting, art, dialog, music, whatsoever! I don't mind a low budget..However you have to get some point. Wandering, wondering..pointless..then two boys started kissing in bed. awful,,just awful. I love indie films, don't mind it is slow. However this movie disappointed me from any perspectives. Even the Graffito, not artistic.I was wondering what kind of people would like it.

Creepy facemasks and slasher movies have gone together like cheese and chives throughout the lengthy lifespan of the cycle. People often assume that it was John Carpenter that started the trend, but as is the case with many of the genre's clichés - the Italians did it first. Movies like Eyeball, Torso and Blood and Black Lace were the originators of a hooded maniac in a murder mystery. There were also a couple of American pre-Halloween slashers that warrant a mention. Classroom Massacre, Keep my Grave Open and Savage Weekend clearly pre-date 1978, whilst The Town that Dreaded Sundown is widely regarded as one of the first teen-kill movies.

I saw this movie because every review I read of it said that it was one of the scariest movies of the new millennium. I really don't understand what all of the hype was about. For one thing, the dialogue in this movie was laughably bad ("What if something strange is going on?"...what????). The acting didn't blow my socks off either. It could have been because the script barely gave the actors anything to work with....the characters are purely 2-dimensional to me and I didn't give a hoot about them at all.

Rock Star is a `` nice '' movie . Everyone is nice . Even the guys who are n't supposed to be - they are nice , they are the bad guys . Then you hear this - and you think what the hell is going on ? You can almost see it , because it's too bad that you are in the right place to see it , you know the bad guys are trying to pull some kind of move , and then all of a sudden the good guys suddenly have to say - what happened ? Where are the nukes now ?

... but had to see just how bad it could get. The plotline was thin to begin with, but it just kept getting worse. A female genetic engineering grad student uses her research on accelerated mitosis to artificially create a male, because a biological weapon used in WW3 killed off 97% of the worldwide male population. The surviving men are either high prices gigolos in back alley clubs, or crazed lunatics in run down football stadiums plotting to overthrow the 'Lesbian Conspiracy'. The entire process resembled the microwaving of a large bowl of jello. Press a few buttons and ding you get a baby.

This is a Laurel & Hardy comedy short with some great and funny moments but overall the movie relies a bit too heavily on comedy. Laurel & Hardy is all about comedy and the only reason they don’t get better is because the director doesn’t give them credit for making a good comedy movie. In this film, they try too hard to make their movies funny. There are a lot of fun lines in the movie but ultimately it doesn’t make for a good movie. If they had tried to make this movie more funny, I think the movie would have been a lot more enjoyable.

Plodding , maybe that should have been the title . Bad dialogue delivered at a snail 's pace . All I really had to go on is the opening shot , a guy walking along in the middle of nowhere looking up at some trees , one of the most idiotic sounding scenes in cinema . And then the ending , all the characters getting killed off . Why do we have to kill each other in these movies ? And what the hell do they do all the time when they don 't get to kill each other ?

A good story about Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth) who dreams of being on broadway which means she would have to leave the small dinner theater where she works with Danny (Gene Kelly) and Genius (Phil Silvers). Rusty is in love with Danny. All three are good friends and every Friday night they go to a local bar where they get oysters so they can look for a pearl (they never eat them). The story line provides numerous opportunities for songs and dancing. The movie has two questions that Rusty must answer: Is fame all that it is cracked up to be?

Even by the lowered standards of '80s slasher movies , this one stinks . The usual gaggle of oversexed teens and a guy with a shotgun who thinks he's in charge are in charge of these teens. They are being led around and forced to watch and watch as the lead teen gets beaten and raped and a bunch of them end up in the woods with an axe. You know what would be cool though? To see a bunch of other guys beating a bunch of girls to a pulp and a bunch of them ending up in a cabin with an axe in their hands.

I watched this film on ITV and I enjoyed it a lot . It was very watchable and very funny . The plot was a bit confusing at the beginning and I thought it was a bit slow at certain points. I would definitely recommend it. If you have any thoughts about the movie, let me know them in the comments. And of course, feel free to write reviews on it as well 🙂

If you enjoy films that are really funny and are good at suspense, you will like this. I would highly recommend this movie .

I was hoping that Pulp would be a interesting movie , but was profoundly disappointed.Pulp has very little storyline , it feels like an average action film and the characters just stand off the screen .I really thought there would be a lot of depth to it, but no. Pulp has no depth whatsoever. The acting was really, really bad, and the characters did nothing but talk to each other and say " I'm going to kill you" , which I found extremely disturbing . It was extremely annoying. The story wasn't good , the action was just really, really, really boring.

There 's a certain irony in a parody of the Gothic genre being turned into a mess of clichés by a fan base that knows it doesn't belong. "We all want to see a good Gothic film, but what if the director just doesn't have the nerve to finish it?" That's exactly what happens in The Shining, one of the scariest movies you will ever see. After the events of the first act, Jack Nicholson and his friends are sent into the woods to "help" a grieving group of young boys who have all been brutally murdered by a madman.

This turned out to be more of a women 's romance-soap-suspense film than what I hoped it was .... simply because the subject matter wasn't about love or passion. Instead, it was about how it affected the heroine's family. I think it would be easy to blame the film's plot for this, but it was really the plot that led me down this path. It made me realize that I don't know enough about the genre to properly critique it. It's hard to know whether what I'm seeing on the screen was real or just made-up stuff.

This is an apocalyptic vision of the hell of our contemporary world. The social criticism of our shallow, commercially oriented values is what makes this film an exceptional vision of the "war is hell" cliché, underscored by a mythical journey upriver to Cambodia by a special forces captain whose mission is to eliminate (with extreme prejudice) a rogue colonel, who's left behind the army's concepts of justice to create his own world. When I saw Apocalypse Now in 1980, I thought it was a deeply flawed masterpiece.

I was enticed into watching Shark Hunter by the comments posted on IMDB . The movie was bad but the reviews weren't. I read a lot of reviews. I know the general consensus of the movie was that the movie was poorly written. That's why I didn't review the movie on IMDB, I just watched it and posted some of the thoughts on it on my website. What struck me about the reviews I read for this movie was the fact that many reviewers said the film would be a better movie if it were written better but it was really bad.

I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and to date , this year , it is one of my favorites . The story , the acting , the plot , the music . So many reasons to go and see it . Well i loved it as well but then again i love all sci fi and fantasy movies. I think it was a good sequel to a great movie. However , it still needs a sequel . It is a little bit slow to the film but not enough to ruin the movie. I really did enjoy this movie. I am not saying that it is good but it IS good.

This movie is # 1 in the list of worst movies I have ever seen , with `` Lessons for Love '' the worst movie you will ever see in my entire life I have watched every single episode of the TV series on my DVD player after I finished the movie, but the only one I actually enjoyed was the second part, that was the best movie I have ever watched! I watched the entire first part in one night and the second in one night and I still have my DVD player from the second time, because I felt the whole movie was fake.

If you have never heard of Jane Austen, seen the original movie or the 1995 BBC adaptation, or even seen a pop up version of the book, then this farcical attempt to show this classic love story may be considered vaguely endurable.From the opening scene, this film must be remembered for its awful acting, abominable miscasting and complete lack of the classic wit of Jane Austen.Whoever decided to cast actors (with the exception of the excellent Judi Dench) who have obviously never heard of Jane Austen, let alone read her, should be punished!

This is the kind of movie which is loved by 50-year old schoolteachers and people who consider themselves aware in social issues - but really haven´t got a clue. The actors - I think all of them are amateurs - do their best, but the script is so full of cliches and stupidities that they can´t save it.Worst of all though is the scool cabaret that the kids are working on - brings back all your worst memories from acting classes in school. The lyric to one of the songs goes something like this in a fast-translation 2.30 in the morning: "I´m the dwarf of society, an emotionally crippled individual.

I watched this film on ITV and I enjoyed it a lot. It was very watchable and very funny. Julie Walters and Rupert Grint were perfect in their roles. Julie Walters gets a special mention since she creates a wonderful diverse interesting character to watch. Ben's character is kinda shy and Stoic but the changes he goes through are wonderfully acted out by Rupert Grint, I would definitely say he has a future in acting after Harry Potter.Laura Linney is quite good in her role as Ben's over protective mother, the only thing they went wrong with is by making her too....Villain-y.

Distributor : GOODTIMES home video Plot : A pretty high school student is marked for unrelenting terror in this suspense thriller based on the best-selling novel by Stephen King

Distributor : GoodTimes home video Plot : Three years earlier, her brother had been murdered by an insane man who had tormented them for years. She has become the sole caretaker of his body, and finds herself living in a house owned by a mad doctor. She also has the ability to hear the past. As the film opens, the house is still owned by her brother's killer. It will soon become a home once more.

In terms of historical accuracy , this is the absolute worst Roman film I have ever seen . The list of inaccuracies goes on. I’m sure I can do better, but I just don’t see it as being all that accurate. Also, it’s been a few months since I wrote this, but let me state that this is NOT a review . I am NOT a film critic and don’t claim to be . I just like a film and wanted to get a list of all the inaccuracies, which I did.

We sought out this hard-to-find VHS after watching two excellent Merchant-Ivory pictures back to back. Knowing it was an instant box office failure, a failure as a rental, I thought it might be worth seeing anyway based on M-I's reputation. Too bad! Nine years ago, it was very much a Liberal Agenda objective to trash the Founding Fathers and indeed they had some success in eradicating the Founding Fathers from many American classrooms including, for example, New Jersey; whose eradication of our great founders quickly ended when the Washington Times shone the spotlight of truth into the NJ School Board and their subversive deed.

This one was truly awful . Watching with fascinated horror , I kept on asking `` why have they done that ?'' This guy was obviously not as smart as his image. He didn't know the difference between the words `` we'' and `` we have made you''

I can imagine that he would be a very successful businessman , I just don't see that he was that smart . If he was , he'd have learnt something. It's funny , but I've been saying that for ages , and you still just keep giving the same reasons .

I was surprised to discover Michael Moore or Bill Maher wasn't involved with this "movie". An American leftist laundry list of axes to grind, with a distinct sparseness of democrats in Hell. Mao Zedong and Karl Marx didn't make an appearance in Hell, but Ronald Reagan is in the same room with Hitler? Perhaps we'll have to wait for these California spin doctors to butcher Paradiso for them to show all of their pet ideologue political figures.Cheap shots at religion, right-wing politicians, corporations and their lobbyists, Fox News, even SUVs.
