Of course I am going to think it was a great movie . I recognized several people I did n't know from their film work . I was a kid when this movie came out . The only thing I didn't know is the name , so I had to search for the film . I found it on youtube . I'm hoping you can find a copy . Thank you for your reply , I'm glad I found it . You may see it on here . I would appreciate your response . Thank you once again .

First and foremost I'd like to state - for the record - that it's incredibly dumb to call your movie "Embryo" when the subject matter exclusively revolves on scientific research performed on fetuses (animal as well as human) aged 12-16 weeks. The embryonic stage is over at the end of the eighth pregnancy week and from that moment on the unborn critter enters the fetal phase. Okay, in all honestly, I didn't know all this, but I took the effort of looking it up and that's the also the least thing the creators of "Embryo" could have done.

So im not a big fan of Boll 's work but then again not many are . I enjoyed his work and am happy to have found his work at the library

A lot of this is the fault of the internet and the internet itself. It has become a breeding ground for a lot of bad writing. If there is something that you have to say, and you can say it in an honest and open manner, then people will take it seriously. Then people will get angry, and if they're angry, then people will start shouting.

A brash , self-centered Army cadet arrives at WEST POINT with a dangerous wise guy attitude towards the Corps.In a rare moment of candor the narrator admits that his father worked for the CIA . He also claims that, while he believes the world was saved by the Soviets, they didn’t save it for long enough to save him. But he knows that it’s better to blame it on the “evil system” than to admit his own role, as he does in the first scene, in helping save his father.

Never mind the serious logic gaps, never mind the achingly cliche character portrayals, never mind the haphazard writing, and you might like this movie. The main character Alyssa was supposed to be endearing, the heroine who you root for to be saved,(or in this case, save herself) But instead she merely grates, and makes one wonder, are all pro ballerinas really that stupid? Her busybody mother was obviously only necessary to further propagate the illusion that ballet companies are evil monsters ready to snatch your poor, innocent, young girl from your grasp, with an ever present, biting artistic director/villain.

Frank Sinatra did so many excellent things in the world of entertainment that it's hard to single one out as the best. If I had to name the best thing he ever did, though, it would be his performance as Frankie Machine, the heroin- addicted musician and poker dealer who is saved, just barely, by the love of a good woman (played by an exceptionally babelicious Kim Novak). The "cold-turkey" scenes between Sinatra and Novak are terrifying and heartbreaking. The movie is very nearly perfect, in fact, from Saul Bass's title graphics to the ground-breaking jazz score by Elmer Bernstein.

This is a well-crafted piece from everyone's favorite master of suspense. As usual, the technical elements such as camera work and lighting are outstanding (especially for the film's time). I did not find the first part of the film very exciting, but the latter one certainly made up for it with one thrilling scene after another.The only thing I did not like about this movie was the choice of Farley Granger for the part of Guy Haines. Somehow, I didn't find him very believable. On the other hand, Robert Walker shines as sinister 'bad guy' Bruno Anthony.Overall, I would highly recommend this.

Although this was the first Hunter S. Thompson documentary I have seen it was average at best despite the involvement's of huge star appearances such as Johnny Depp, Bill Murray, Gary Busey, and a few others. I was let down by this and yet it was still a little interesting. What kept me watching was some of the old clips from Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas and Where the Buffalo Roam. Not that good mostly because of the old guys rambling and things any fan would already know. I still think they were milking it because it could have been compressed down by at least half.

Lucio Fulci was famous for his Italian splatter movies , mostly his undead films like Zombie or The Beyond . His work was also used in many films and TV serials and documentaries about the Italian Mafia, and many of these works are still very popular among people. In one of his films , Fulci plays a vampire who tries to survive in a real world that he is not supposed to live in. In another, he is a serial killer and in another he is the main villain of the whole film. In still another part, he is a murderer with the power of telepathy.

The only pure life , is one that ends with a signature in blood.So says Mishima anyway , a young writer in his early thirties in a Tokyo suburb in 1972, on a summer break from college, his first novel to be published since 1958's "Toward the Final Battle". A book he would return to, over the course of many years, as an essay and film , before his final masterpiece in 2000. Now published in its entirety (in English) and in Japanese by New Directions (Dover Books) as The Buried Giant - The Novels of Mishima.

I had the dubious opportunity to view this movie on TV. It's the perfect example of how to take a terrible script and turn it into one of the worst films ever made. Not only is the acting bad and the effects terrible, the movie has more logical holes than ten pounds of imported swiss cheese.I would highly recommend this film as an example of how NOT to make a movie and what director not to use in one of yours.I turned off the TV during the last ten hideous minutes of the show. Calling it "pathetic" is a gross understatement.

There were nice characters in here, played by pleasant-looking actors and actresses, plus it had a famous band and some famous dancers.....yet the film just didn't work. By the time this was almost over, I was bored to death. The dialog was dumb, the humor (mainly Milton Berle's) was downright stupid and the music was just not up my alley.I've never been a big-band fan, anyway, and if I hear "In The Mood" one more time I'll puke.This was my first look at famous skater-actor Sonja Henie and I have no complaints about her.

Most of the critiques on this flick have been pretty damn accurate. It is an hour and half waste of time, following a bunch of very pretty high schoolers whine and cry about life. There is about twenty minutes of magic, and absolutely no scary or thrilling moments. Our actress are treated like pieces of ass, and seem to be perfectly happy with their position. The lead characters, these sons of ipsmith are walking poster boys for any pop culture clothing store. You can't relate with them, hell you barely can understand them.

This is a movie from Toilet Pictures . If the name of the production company is any indication how stinky the name is then the film is disgusting . If it is any indication as to how this film was made I'm sure that a few of you have read a few of my reviews about this film so I won't be surprised if there is a bit of spoiler for you as to where this review will end up. It's not going to be pretty . Let me tell you right off the bat that this is a movie that will be disturbing to you.

The greatest movie ever.How's that for a contention? However, if we look at it through purely cinematic terms, it is clear that Three Colours Red is a masterpiece. It is not enough to merely say this - Three Colours Red is the masterpiece of world cinema. If you accept that Citizen Kane is not human enough, if you accept that Star Wars is not actually very good, if you accept that Ozu and Mizoguchi both have to take a step back - then Three Colours Red is the foremost masterpiece of all time.

Everyone has their choice for `` worst movie they 've ever seen . '' Some like to pick on Gigli - but there is one movie I like a lot . . . I think I'll start at the beginning: Gigli, the documentary by Robert De Niro and Robert De Niro , is based upon the life of actor and director Robert De Niro . De Niro , in a role which he played in several of my favorite films in the 1970s, has said in interviews that he never really wanted to be an actor, but wanted to play a character .

The recent DVD release of Good Humor Man labels the film as comedy . It 's hardly a comedy , I don't know what it is , I don't watch it , and neither do you. However , I find this film to be very much of its time. This is the same film that was released in 1953, just a few years later. In fact this was also one of the first horror/comedy movies that was made. Good Humor Man was directed by William Witney who was already famous for his work on the television series The Man from U.N.C.L.E.

The series does not start as it means to go on . Although it 's first two seasons are crammed to the gills with action and romance, you need to get out to a place where the action is quiet. The first three episodes of this new series were shot and edited in New York, and so the series takes place a little over 5 years after the last one ended. It starts out with two of the main characters, Ethan Cressy (Colin Baker) and his wife, Sara (Cate Blanchett), getting together.

This film really used its locations well with some amazing shots , dark and disturbing the film moves very slowly. The first scene has an eerie effect on you. The second one is quite disturbing and it really makes you question things that are not clearly explained. I thought it was an excellent film and I can't wait for more! First of all, I would like to congratulate on the first movie of the series, "V for Vendetta" which I saw in theaters on the weekend of April 1st. The movie is great and the story is interesting and well told.

A group of environmentalists travel to an island to uncover a secret lab that is experimenting on animals. When they arrive, they discover that they are to late. Apparently the government made a scientist test his experiment on a komodo and, yes, you guessed it, a cobra which made them grow very large. I'm not sure that this movie really needed or deserved explaining since it is almost identical to Curse of the Komodo which also sucked. The computer effects are as cartoony as ever an the komodo roars like a dinosaur which really got on my nerves.

It 's nice to see a romantic comedy that does not have the prissy man lead , this has solidity in every aspect . not much action in here , a little romance , a few good lines ,and a good plot . but still , i like that it is a romantic comedy . it will appeal to anyone , it does not need much plot . and it does not have to make you laugh , it is just a romantic comedy , it can be light and funny even with the romantic comedy . this movie is fun .

Riotously cheesy lunacy about lava spewing from the La Brea tar pits in Los Angeles . Even if you attempt to follow the official story of LA’s recent eruptive activity, you are immediately thrown head-long into yet another mind-bogglingly insane story. What is the story? The story revolves around the recent eruptions at the La Brea Tar Pits. As you read along, you will undoubtedly hear one or two or three or four of the following, or some combination of them, but it is impossible for any one story to be told with complete precision.

Unfortunately a boring flick, and obviously the only way to see it is the butchered bootleg Public Domain version, which is so blurry and dark that at times you have hard time making out where the screen is. The leading actors are a nuisance. The man spends most of his screen time trying to appear nonchalant, charming and sexy, forgetting totally what the film is about and that he is a murder suspect because of some dame who played him for a goose to start with. The dame herself merely walks through the flick, being dignified if she's not busy appearing cute.

This is, arguably, the worst of the major Ava Gardner films. Yes, she is gorgeous. But that can wear thin over time, especially after the corny and predictable movie ending.In this turkey, Robert Walker has to pretend that he's Eddie Bracken (which surely embarrassed him). Olga San Juan plays the Jane Powell (golly, gee) part. Dick Haymes plays a sort of dim sidekick (! ), and Eve Arden plays Helen Broderick (and a host of other wise-cracking female semi-comedians). Yes, the film contains a major popular song, "Speak Low."

While caricatures and/or references to entertainment industry people or things or even brands of products is usually a staple in shorts like this one, they aren't used in quantity here. Most of the individual gags are rather generic. As I'm going to give examples, there will be spoilers below: There are only three (well, technically four-there's a quick one at the very end of the cartoon) caricatures that I spotted, which is kind of low for this type of short, though one is a featured character with a fair amount of activity.

Even the trailer for this movie makes me cry, like the first time I saw this movie. Not for people who are easily upset by intense material! The finest performances by Alan Rickman and Madelaine Stowe, without a doubt. This dreadful tale of a society with the power to kidnap and torture it's citizens for ANY reason, whether they are anarchist's or the writer of children's books will chill you to the bone. I saw it when it first came out 1991 and I remember every frame. It still scares the hell out me today.

This is a really silly job of miscasting--about as bad as Hepburn playing a Chinese woman in DRAGON SEED. The lead part Hepburn plays is a combination of Granny from the Beverly Hillbillies and a faith healer! This film is even worse than Bogart's Swing Your Lady, because at least Bogart didn't play a hillbilly--he was just surrounded by them. And the dialog sounds as if it comes right from a Li'l Abner strip! The problems don't really end with the outrageous casting, though, as the plot is completely muddled and the "love story" might make your head hurt.

If you can stomach the campiness , this movie should make you laugh out loud several times . It did for me . The acting was average to good , but you have to like it to like it . The story had me laughing and wanting to see where it would go for the rest of this series . The first movie was fun , but now the sequel is better , with the same characters , same story and the same humor . I liked the first movie , but this sequel was so much better , that it makes the first movie almost worthless .

Certain aspects of Punishment Park are less than perfect, specifically some of the acting. However I feel that this is probably the most important movie of the "war on terror" era. I grew up hating hippies and in some respects I still do. It wasn't until the United States was started down the path of an unnecessary and deceitful war in Iraq that I began to see the world through their eyes. I can feel what they must have felt. Although the film is somewhat dated, watching it brings those uncomfortable emotions about our present situation right to the surface.

This noisy, dizzying football film from director Oliver Stone seems to have everyone in the cast - well, everyone except William H. Macy, who could have tackled the role played by Mr. Stone, the team doctors, or the "fruitcake" selling cereal. If you're a fan of the foul-mouthed, there are some great, profanity-laden knock-down, drag-out, put-down phrases you can try-out on two-faced friends and way-ward lovers. The film is sometimes good as lively background party atmosphere, especially during the first two hours; it even features some MTV-styled music video scenes.

Okay , now I know where all those boring cop/homicide TV shows came from . I do believe they can’t take any of us seriously . I did like that part about the cop looking down at the screen and not seeing anything … ” oh that’s my wife!” … ” you’re a cop. What do you want!”

I’ll probably watch this movie again. I was hoping it had been released before the election but I think it was only released around the first of the year so hopefully this will make it to the top of the box office list.

I tried watching this movie, but I didn't make it past the first 15 minutes. It's a terrible disappointment, considering the cast, but I can't look past the fact that the dialogue is in English and some of the actors pretending to be Indian are not even close (read: Kristin Kreuk). Considering that India alone has 1/6th of the world's population and one of the biggest movie industries, I don't think it would have been hard for the film-makers to have found an excellent Indian actress to play the part.

After an undercover mission in Bucharest to disclose an international gang of weapon dealers , the agent Sonni Griffith (Gaby Hoffmann) infiltrates a secret society called the ‘League’ and becomes a member. In the midst of an investigation into the activities of this group, Griffith discovers that it is actually a criminal organization that has been hiding its true motives. As Griffith begins her undercover work she finds herself in danger when she is attacked by the League’s enemies. Sons of Anarchy (season four)

Written by: Jon J Muth. Directed by: Kurtis J. Chapman.

`` The Journey '' is a romantic version of the cold war . It 's about an English woman ( Gwynneth ) and a Russian soldier ( Roman Polanski ) who have a passionate love affair with one another. When Polanski dies and his wife remarries, Gwynneth is left to face a future without Roman. But this is not to be the last time she sees her former lover. Written by <hk@hkchris.co.uk> on 06/05/2000 08:30 PM

Movies I Have Watched That I Liked - Part 1 of 5

I like watching movies.

This is a semi fictional memoir of an `` international man '' who have witnessed various political upheavals in recent years. The memoir of one of the most powerful people in Pakistan, is the autobiography of a `` global man '' who have witnessed major political revolutions in recent years. This book is a detailed description of what it is like to be a `` world man '' who has lived and seen all kinds of political upheavals in recent years. He has experienced everything from war and peace to economic hardship and social upheaval, in which he got involved, and has been a participant in many of the political revolutions.

I normally do n't like romantic films , but I love this film very much . The story is really very well told . You will not get tired of seeing this film . I don't like to say much , except to say , that I was very pleased with this movie . I think it has a good plot . And it has an excellent score too . I like the story . If you want an excellent romantic film , I recommend you to go watch this movie . I know you won't find another such film in the world .

One of the last films DIRECTED by Lionel Barrymore , `` Ten Cents a Dance '' stars Barbara Stanwyck as a stripper played by Lionel Barrymore (the leading man) . She plays herself, but in a very different way , and the film has all of Lionel Barrymore's old movies at his fingertips. Barrymore was also an actor whose career was inextricably linked to that of the leading ladies he played. Barbara Stanwyck was born July 15, 1906 in New Orleans, La., and was raised in New York by her father who was an accountant.

Sorry about that. But if you have seen this "epic", you will obviously know of the utter disregard for the actual text of the Bible. Now, I'm not exactly the next in line for sainthood, but I do know the basics. And the basics were this. God wanted to wipe everyone of the face of the Earth because he believed they have been corrupted to the point of no return. He chose Noah, the diamond in the rough, and his family to be spared due to their uncorrupted ways.

First off , the editing of this film consisted of one major flaw which I do n't understand how was it allowed , the reason being is that this was supposed to be a children's story with an adult cast , this was not the case . I do not understand this . So please explain to me , what was wrong with it . The original story was about three very naughty boys who were having fun with a younger boy . The older kid was the leader of the gang, the youngest of the boys was the follower .

I find it disconcerting that in an era when satisfying and fulfilling spirituality is unknown and we are all scattered to the four winds, you would think that you are a part of some kind of church or mosque or cult. Instead you find that the religion that you worship is more like the cult that you are trying to distance yourself from. But why is this? I feel the same way about Islam as a religion. I am so disgusted by the religion that I don't want to believe in it. Why then would I go to a mosque?

The positives: It's shot pretty well. Has some interesting peripheral characters. Likable main character (albeit weak).The bad: Plot/story. Editing. Characters wasted. Jessica Alba.I'm a fan of sappy movies, but this movie is cringe-inducingly bad. I don't understand how anyone can hand over $12M to this Guy Jenkin. And before I go any further, I just want to say that I don't dislike Jessica Alba--I really wanted to like her in this film. However, Jessica Alba in her fake accent and her model poses made me miserable.

Frederick Forsyth 's books are always so intricately plotted , with twists and turns , and usually a great surprise . I'm a fan of Frederick Forsyth's books and can't wait to see what he writes next . He's a one-book writer and I would highly recommend giving him a listen . I read this in one sitting , so I know there is a story to be told . I am very excited . This novel is a good example of what can be done when a story is told well, and this novel will have readers wanting to reread it again .

I am very impressed by the reviews I 've read of this film - generally well-read , thoughtful and informed. I've seen a few things about this film and think you might get the same response, but you might have a different view, or a different opinion. To be honest I'm not going to spend the time to read all the reviews, as I think it will be a bit of a slog. There are some good points and I think you'd be wise to consider some of them in the first place. I like it.

This is one of the most unoriginal , cliche-ridden movies I have ever seen . Even if you did n't know about the plot, you'll find it hard to watch without feeling the need to laugh at the cliche plot devices and the general absurdity of the characters involved . This film has nothing new to offer . There are no characters you would recognize . I was disappointed that this was only available on home media. This movie should have been available on the big screen . I do not recommend that you purchase this movie . I did not like this movie , and it has nothing to do with me .

Way back at the dawn of human civilization cavemen sat around and made lame jokes , hit each other over rocks with sticks and threw spears to see who was stronger. But it wasn’t until the dawn of civilization did they actually learn to use tools. After the development of tools and writing the Bible, the human race began to learn to make them and use them. Over the years we have moved from making tools to learning to make them. This includes learning to use the bow and arrows, pot, and cooking tools. It has been quite a journey.

It 's true , no one really expects anything from sequels . But even by that low standard this is a pretty good effort . I like how the film keeps you guessing at who is real , and who isn't . You have to look at every aspect of the story , which is a bit tricky to do in a sequel . I would have been more impressed if the film was less predictable , as some have suggested. But it isn't a bad sequel by any means . Still , it has it's flaws . This is a solid film , worth checking out .

"Chupacabra Terror" is saved from a '1" by the presence of Canadian cutie Chelan Simmons as the heroine. She is a delight to watch, from the front, back and side. Otherwise, what you have here is your standard monster movie, playing like a low-budget, shipboard version of THE RELIC. John Rhys-Davies plays the captain of the ship on which the monster is being transported. And the very nonscary monster is simply a man in a suit. He does commit about 100 senseless, gory killings, at least, so the body count in this one is pretty awesome.

I have a hard time putting into words just how wonderful this was. Once in a while you see a film that just sticks with you. "You Are Alone" is that movie (for me). The film is constantly in my head and in my heart. I replay the scenes mentally every day and analyze them and go through the emotions all over again, as if I am seeing it for the first time.There is nothing I did not like about the movie. Amazing soundtrack!!! The ending was perfect. Very emotionally stirring!!!

The story of Sweeney Todd evokes memories of the work of classic writers like Charles Dickens , and more contemporary works like the Stephen King books or the Stephen King movie trilogy, which are still very popular today. However, it also has a great deal to recommend it, not only as a great movie, but also for the wonderful costumes and sets they’ve chosen for the film. I think the sets were one of the things that set the film apart from others like it — not only because of the great acting, but also because they were so beautifully designed and decorated.

I have been wanting to see this since my French teacher recommend it to me over forty years ago. Perhaps the long wait was worth it, since the Criterion Collection DVD restoration is impressive.In its outline this movie follows the time-worn script: a quartet of men diligently plot a difficult heist of a bank vault, the heist takes place, a small seemingly insignificant event leads to the ultimate demise of all. Even though the heist footage is transfixing, it occurs rather early and is ultimately not at the core of the film.

Why did they have to make such a dreadful adaptation ? The whole `` Complete Jane Austin '' series as we know them. It’s all there. There’s more. There are no spoilers in this article. It’s all out there. Here it is. But I want to do this anyway. What I want to do, in a very roundabout way, is present you, if you’ve been following this project in some capacity, with an idea of how to read the Jane Austin universe.

A couple of friends and myself visited the video shop a few years back and we were in one of those moods to rent some cheesy non seen flicks. My friend grabbed Head of the Family and we were greeted by a head sitting in a wheelchair. Well that set us off laughing and we decided to have a bet to see who would be the one who had to go to the desk and pay for the movie. Well you guessed it, it was me!!!!!!!! I have never been so embarrised in all my life.

I'd like to point out these excellent points in favor of this movie:#1 Angelina Jolie sex scene #2 Foley artist outdid themselves #3 plot was quite thick #4 DVD does includes trailers and chapter stops#5 no animals were harmed in the making of the movie #6 homages to blade runner through out the film #7 burning trash cans #8 funny guy with no legs #9 Voice overs by Jack Palance added a real dynamic element to the film. #10 Sage advise, for example "When you dine with the devil bring a long spoon".

Forget Jimmy Stewart reliving his life and opt for this smart comedy of errors instead. I suppose only institutionalized sexism explains why this flick and Stanwyck's other great Christmas story, "Meet John Doe" aren't revered with the same level of love as...well, you know it's name.Stanwyck plays a food writer for a McCall's-type rag who has been lying for years to her pompous publisher about the folksy setting for her recipes. She's an ace b.s. artist until the day Morgan's sailor is pulled from the ocean after 18 days afloat & 6 weeks recuperation in a Navy hospital.

Seems to me that Joe Estevez spends most of his time hidden under the shadow of his rather successful brother. I think he's very good at what he does and can do, but he can't hide that he does it from people for the wrong reasons. I'm not saying I'm going to agree with everything he says, but that he's a good writer. He's not afraid to tell his personal feelings about a movie or character in a bad light, he's not afraid to be honest, so I can't say he sucks at it.

Screen treatment of the comedic Broadway success `` The Gay Divorce '' ( a title which was considered too scandalous for television). In the early 1970s, a new format, the ``Broadway Family Hour,'' was launched in New York to replace The Gay Divorce, as well as other long-running primetime programs, such as The Philco Hour, the ABC Family Playhouse and the Merv Griffin Show. This new show, which is now seen almost exclusively on public television in the United States, was broadcast on ABC's "Duck Dynasty," a half-hour children's sitcom, from 1998 to 2003.

I guess this is the first time I have seen a Roscoe 'Fatty' Arbuckle movie. I really liked him in his (title) role as a butcher boy. The way he moves is very funny in my opinion, for example how he handles his knife and the way he rolls a cigarette. I think he is a good actor; his facial expressions really suit the role he plays, for example how he winks at the audience in the end. But one might add that that was probably not too difficult. Anyway I think he would have deserved a longer career.

In my opinion, the ending is what completely ruined the whole thing. The initial idea of having someone suddenly realize they were the son of god and the second coming was somewhat clever. People started to believe him and his friends became the new disciples. People went nutty, demons were possessing people, all kinds of fun. Of course then it all went wrong. It was bad enough that they had to take on the impossible task of looking through a vast amount of writings to find the "third testament" in five days, but then at the end it became this ridiculous humanist fantasy.

Stephanie Meyer is going to be so ticked ! Now , her book `` Breaking Dawn '' will not be published any more , she is very disappointed. I mean , she was so thrilled when the first trailer was released . Now , the movie has already been released. It is an amazing movie . And the trailer for it is the bomb! I can't wait to see the movie . I bet it will be so great . I am sure it will be really good . It will also make her happy !

OK - say some college in southern California has an movie making class. And some dudes were enrolled just to film girls, and they gave them a camera. And then they were drunk/stoned/ or just to plain stupid to actually use a camera, and they turned this in for their grade. AND FAILED.That is my only explanation for this, this, thing. Good God they left the date and time counter on during some of it. The picture started in new scene way before the sound, and forget about a plot.

A ghost story on a typical Turkish high school with nice sound and visual effects. Taylan biraderler(taylan brothers) had made their first shots on a tv-show a couple of years ago, as far as i know. That was kind of a Turkish X-Files, they had very nice stories but lacked on visual effects. This time it seems they had what they needed and used them well. This movie will make you laugh that's for sure, and as well it might have you scared. It has a nice plot and some young, bright actors in it.

While not as bad as some movies ( like the horrible `` Atomic Twister '' ) , `` Meltdown '' has a lot of fun going on in it. The story takes place in a town in Germany where the only thing that is ever good about it is, well , beer! A group of Germans who are not too bright try to do their job right, and try to change the world for a little bit by making the city better. Things don't go as planned, and it leads to a group of young people from a town that is just a bit too different.

I 'm a big fan of Patricia Hodge and Mariam Margolyes , so I watched this show when it came out and had high hopes to be a part of it but I was so disappointed. There are so many mistakes made in this movie that I can't even begin to list the ones I found. The story itself isn't bad at all, but this movie is so poorly written and directed that I couldn't even watch it because of its terrible writing and direction. If you love to see movies that don't suck, I would recommend this movie to absolutely everyone.

Well, this latest version of Mansfield Park seemed to try and take the edginess of the 1999 theatrical version (outright copied some of the ideas from it in fact), but tone things down a bit to bring it more in line with the original story. Unfortunately, the result is a rather lackluster, and schizophrenic, production. And, as with all the other versions of Mansfield Park out there, the character of Fanny Price is no where to be found. Instead there is a strangely child-like, bleached-blond woman running around who never really fully develops as a character.

... but you probably have seen it or else you would n't be here . It 's so obscure that I have no clue who this person is or how to describe his/her/their work. So I will describe a little of his work for you, and this description may be quite a bit different from what he actually says. I hope you find it interesting if I may, but please do not tell me who you are and where to find them. They are in my blogroll so please follow them. I hope that some day they will write about you, or I will.

"Mr. Bug Goes To Town" was the last major achievement the Fleischer studios produced. The quality of the Superman series produced at the same time is evident in this extraordinary film.The music and lyrics by Frank Loesser and Hoagy Carmichael (with assistance by Flieshcer veteran Sammy Timberg are quite good, but not as much as the scoring of the picture by Leigh Harline who also scored Snow White for Disney. Harline's "atmospheric music" is superb, and a treat for the ears.The layout and staging of the picture was years ahead of it's time, and once again the Fleischer's background artists outdid themselves.

I have to agree with the previous author 's comments about the excellent performances and plot . Started watching this anime when it aired last month. I didn't want to put it down. I'm glad I did because I've been wanting to see the ending. The characters are awesome and I'd like to see how they will do in an end. Also, one thing I was looking for but couldn't find is the name of the guy in the school uniform ( I know it's the only character to not take it off ).

Now we were chosen to be tortured with this disgusting piece of blatant American propaganda. It came no wonder for me that this is admired by most American viewers and hated by Europeans. This show is made for Americans - it is too stupid and full with hatred and clichés to be admitted elsewhere. Almost everyone involved must be return to school, acting is utterly predictable and bad, script is pile of garbage all round. operator work is ground zero etc. etc.You have been warned. It doesn't even have "guilty pleasure" entertainment for those brainwashed iq=0 human beings.I wish I could enter negative values, admins?

I say Ben Johnson and my fellow Canadians say , `` Ben Johnson ? ! '' - he was a Canadian. They didn't ask for it. They didn't ask for our country. And when we ask for our country they don't know. They don't know. It doesn't work like that, they just know they don't get it. They just do. So, that's why I say you have to go on and you have to fight for it, because they don't even know it. You have to say, `` We know it.

I was trying to work out why I enjoyed this film?? Its not because of money spent on it that's for sure!! Did I see a painted water pistol in there? Maybe they don't have the same sort of visual effects houses in the Scotland? Or maybe they just didn't have any money? The making of clearly shows a gang of very plucky guys making a movie against the odds. Awesome! But what I really liked was the grit of the performances. Mike Michell and Patrick White play the lead parts like 2 normal guys.

As I peruse through the hundreds of comments that loyal readers of the IMDB have posted on this film, I find it very interesting how few ,"middle of the road" comments there are. Everyone either loves it, or they hate it. Having seen Apocalypse Now approximately 30 times, and having recently dissected it on DVD (how did we ever live without those magical digital machines????? ), I can say without hesitation that I am one of those who have a very special place in my heart for this film.

It 's 1913 . A studio prop boy spies the actress who is going to become Hollywood 's next great love. He follows her all night to the theater, from the beginning of the play until her curtain call, and she is always the best dressed. When she returns home, she is different. She doesn 't dress as often, doesn 't have her own maid, doesn 't always have her shoes polished, and even if she does, not always the right way. But one night, she meets someone she ' s never expected to meet.

this show is pretty alright and fun to watch, its a great Disney channel shows and sometimes entertaining.I really enjoyed the first season but i hated the second and third seasons. This show has completely changed around. In the first season it was more about science and animals, all that is gone now in the season and third season. Its more about her life and dating. Ever since that gay kid (Ben) came along, this show has sucked. The writers took a perfectly good kid show and changed it to a crappy teen comedy. Disney took a turn for the worse.

No , no , no . That is my advice to you if you are wanting to see this film. It’s one of those films that we can all agree is good and will bring a little something different to an audience that might have otherwise been bored. While it’s a little confusing at first, the more you think about it, the more you’ll come around. It’s an extremely funny movie and it makes for a very interesting viewing experience. This is a great film that will blow you away if you look for it.

Brass pictures (movies is not a fitting word for them) really are somewhat brassy. Their alluring visual qualities are reminiscent of expensive high class TV commercials. But unfortunately Brass pictures are feature films with the pretense of wanting to entertain viewers for over two hours! In this they fail miserably, their undeniable, but rather soft and flabby than steamy, erotic qualities non withstanding.Senso '45 is a remake of a film by Luchino Visconti with the same title and Alida Valli and Farley Granger in the lead. The original tells a story of senseless love and lust in and around Venice during the Italian wars of independence.

Hello all! I went to this movie without any expectation though I knew Maniratnam would've given an excellent film! I was stunned!! The backdrop is the struggle between the tamils settled in Sri Lanka and the government. The story is about how an young girl Amudha who lives with her foster parents at Chennai, India leaves to Sri Lanka in search of her real mother. The high points of the film are the performances of every actor and actress and ofcourse, the cinematography, editing and all other technical details. Full marks to the cast and crew.

I haven't seen so many people packed outside a theater since Star Wars Episode III. Both shows sold out, and for good reason. The Man With the Screaming Brain was the best movie to see with a crowd full of geeks. (Hey, I'm a dork too.) Bruce Campbell was present and had the whole crowd in stitches! The movie was cheesy in the best possible way. It may be the funniest movie that Bruce has done. Ted Raimi steals the show with his Bulgarian hip hop-itude and zany facial expressions, he is a laugh riot!

If you want to see a brilliant performance of Mikado, played to perfection with expert timing and panache, don't watch this version. If you want to see a hammy version with Eric Idle strutting around in 1930's english gentlemen's private club society, this is the one to watch. It's a lot of fun and a good intro to Gilbert and Sullivan, but after this, rush out and rent the Canadian Stratford version. You'll see the difference between good and great. Nobody does G&S better than Brian McDonald and the Stratford group.

The cast and crew of this cheap horror potboiler are more interesting than anything that occurs throughout the movie itself; we have Barbara Payton, Raymond Burr, Lon Chaney Jr., Tom Conway, Paul Cavanaugh and Woody Strode in front of the camera and writer-director Curt Siodmak, cinematographer Charles Van Enger, editorial supervisor Francis D. Lyon and production assistant Herman Cohen behind it. The ill-fated Payton turns the head of virtually every male she comes in contact with deep in the African jungle where she lives on husband Cavanaugh's plantation: doctor Conway secretly desires her while hot-headed foreman Burr's approach is, quite literally, more hands-on.

It seems like an exciting prospect , a modern-dress `` Othello '' with Christopher Eccleston , who was so frighteningly good as the title character in the film . It was also his first full-length role. And the film was based on an original book , by Stephen Gwynn-Jones . And in addition, it was directed by the Oscar-winner , who starred in his first film , and directed in the process. It seems as though he would be a good choice to helm a new version of ` Othello . After all, we know this story so well already and we know it will continue to make us laugh .

A small-town schoolteacher (Geena Davis) slowly begins to realize that she has suffered amnesia and really use to be a secret government assassin! Soon, there are men after her and a small-time private detective (Samuel L. Jackson).This was action-packed, with some great special effects and really funny one-liners (especially from Jackson). Although the action may get a little silly at times, who cares? After all, aren't movies meant to be a good time?Craig Bierko is fun as a ruthless villain. The movie itself was an all-around good time.

When I bought 4 DVDs for £5.oo in a local shop it should have been warning enough that this movie was not up to the usual standard of David Selznick Productions. With a cast containing such names as James Stewart and Carole Lombard I was looking forward to a real treat. As many other commentators have said it is an odd mixture of plot and scenes that doesn't quite convince. HOWEVER, I am so glad that I did view this film as I now have the memorable saying 'Never let the seeds stop you from enjoying the watermelon.' to live by.

Wrestlemania 6 , is an entertaining Wrestlemania , if not an entirely successful one . The Ultimate Challenge , is one of the highlights of the show , with over 60 wrestlers battling it out in the first match of the night for the WWE Championship . The match also featured the tag teams of the Undertaker , Triple H and Stone Cold Steve Austin , who would later form the tag team of Stone Cold , Kane and Christian . This would be followed by the WWE World Heavyweight Championship , which will be defended for the second time by Stone Cold Steve Austin and Kane , and the WWE Cruiserweight Championship .

I was looking through TV Guide last night and saw a movie starring Heather Grahm on, who I liked in movies like Boogie Nights, and Austin Powers, so I decided to watch it. It started out ok, but you could tell the story was lacking, and at about half way through, it started to deteriorate. I do not remember this movie being in the theaters, and I'm sure if it was, it wasn't there long. The acting was stale and unconvincing, the dialogue was silly and predictable, and the story was confusing and stupid.

... I ca n't believe there are actually people here who recommend this movie ... This is such a slow movie that you really wonder if anybody is even watching this. If they are, they might as well be doing it on a napkin. As always, there is such a disconnect between the story in the script, and the film that I couldn't tell if I was really watching this or watching a movie I just had to see. I understand that I need to get into it but I think there's just enough of it to get to know what this is.

It 's a puzzle to me how this turd of a film ever got distribution.Sure , it 's horror and I liked that . But it also has elements of comedy , drama , and social commentary all wrapped in a neat package. And yes , it does a decent job at it all, and it has a lot to say, and it doesn 't sugar-coat it either.But unfortunately, it does a bad job of all three, and this is due to the story itself, and how it plays itself out on the screen .

I first saw this movie in the theater. I was 10. I just watched it a second time and I must say it was amazing. The music, the dancing, the acting. It is a great story and told extremely well. I fell absolutely in love with Treat Williams when I was a kid after seeing him in this movie. One of my favorite parts was when his mom kept yelling at him to give her his pants, and then finally said "how much do you need"? (money). That was classic. ; ).

The basic plot is good and can be engaging . The music is so great that it became the theme song for The Amazing Spider-Man . It's not perfect by any means and there are many songs I would like to change but overall, the movie was worth a watch. The acting was very good and a lot of it could be a credit to the cast. There was a few things that bothered me but nothing really seemed to bother the audience and I think most people would give this a very favorable review but I think I would rate it as less than average.

I actually liked this movie even though this movie seems to be so hated and i think it's even better then The Deer Hunter, which was overrated. Both this movie and Year Of The Dragon are very underrated although i could see why someone would not like this movie. At three and a half hours the movie just goes on too long and the second half of the movie is much better than the first half. Kris Kristofferson and Christopher Walken are fighting over Isabelle Huppert but she can't make up her mind about which one to be with.

"The death of a performer at a Broadway stage play brings a theatre critic and a police detective together as an unlikely crime-solving duo. The dead performer's niece becomes not only the object of affection for our critic, but also a prime suspect in this death, and some other murders that occur at the theatre. 'The Phantom Killer' sets his sights upon the young woman as his next victim; so, it is a race against time for our heroes to catch the killer," according to the DVD sleeve's synopsis.Milton Raison's screenplay puts a little spark in this low-budget mystery whodunit.

This movie has been a classic in my part of the country because it was filmed in my own small town and in one of the few movie theaters I have been able to see since I moved here. Not only does it have great acting throughout the entire story, but also, a great plot to boot. It is my favorite film I have ever seen! I recommend this movie to everyone and anyone in any form of entertainment! This movie was so good. Not only do I rate this movie a 3 but also a perfect 10 because I really loved this movie so much and the acting is fantastic.

I did n't even watch this whole movie . Now , I like 50 's sci-fi movies even when they don 't involve aliens. I have no complaints . I have a few issues with 50 's films, however , and some of them are pretty bad. The first is the script , which is very bad. I think 50 's writers wrote a bad script from the get go . 50 's scripts tend to be very confusing . This script was confusing and hard to follow . I don 't know if the story is supposed to be a sci-fi story , or if it is just another story of aliens .

Hellraiser: Bloodline is only a so-so film. I believe it's the fourth installment in the Hellraiser series.I missed the beginning, and all I remember from there was some topless women and a box-shape thing on a computer screen. But, using my wit and intelligence, (and the Info Button) I soon found out that the villain (Pinhead) was released from Pandora's Box, which, I believe is a gateway straight to Hell.So, anyways, Pinhead somehow comes out of the box and terrorizes the "Toymaker's" family. And, that's about it.

I 'm not a big musical fan , but this is one of the few I really love . Unlike many others that I've listened to I really like the style of this band and their overall performance . The instruments they play all sound really nice . It's a very good show and very well done , especially for its size . The band consists of 4 musicians (1 male and 3 females) with a total length of about 27 minutes. All of the instruments are played with some really nice technique and the songs are all sung by their lead singer (female) .

I just watched this move for the 5th or 6th time and am still in love with it . It was an improvement on my original, but I think I would prefer this. After watching this video, I decided to get in a fight against someone in the park. I took off my shoes before I went in to do this, and I'm glad I did. It felt so much better walking around in my new sneakers than I did on my normal shoes. I took a lot of photos. This is why I don't feel bad about walking around in sneakers at work.

Secret Service agent Jay Killion ( Charles Bronson ) has been assigned to protect the President-elect 's wife , the Vice President , Ivanka Trump , in the aftermath of the Russian election hack , which has revealed classified details of her life and career . Ivanka Trump has been called ‘ the most guarded woman in America ‘ . It's not fair , but the truth is that she's guarded more than her husband . A lot more than she's been able to hide. Ivanka and the President-elect have been married for nearly a year.

Mild spoilers below.The prospect of war was clearly on the horizon when TFW was filmed . From the opening scene of TFW to the ending, it had no doubt been a very, very long time coming. And yet we have a story that seems to have no end. Not even a vague idea of how the war is supposed to end. In fact, TFW ends with no explanation whatsoever, with no indication that the world has ended. We know it’s coming, but there is absolutely nothing in sight to point us in the direction of what to expect from the story.

I recently had to watch this for a project in a Sociology class and thought it was absolutely the worst film ever. It had some interesting ideas, but it’s the acting that made it truly awful. I’ve seen the film many, many times and still can’t seem to shake the memory of it. The first time I watched, I found it really difficult to watch, it seemed so dark and grim. I knew it was a bad film as soon as I saw the trailer.

I have n't laughed this much in a long time - or seen a film so ineptly made ! Talk about a film with a huge cast and crew that didn't want to work for a day or two before finding themselves in a terrible accident ! The script was written in a rush from day one, with no one given a chance to polish it in between, just so everyone can get a cheap laugh and sell a few DVD's ? ! Thats the same script that ended up winning the best picture Academy Award this year.

I ca n't believe I even tried to watch this filth . As an avid B-Horror movie fan , I was completely disgusted with this film . Why didn't anyone make a film about this? It is the type of film that can be done only with the most hardcore horror fan . I don't give a crap what some people say , but as an amateur , I've never seen anything that has the level of disgusting filth that this film is capable of . The only good thing that comes to my mind about it is the fact that this film is the only horror that has ever crossed my radar.

Yet again , director J. Lee Thompson unites with actor Charles Bronson for a violent and uncompromising action flick . This is not your father's B-movie , but with the right director and screenplay , this is definitely something you don't see every day . The movie is based on true story , the story is based on , and you can see it all here , check it out here , or read the article on Wikipedia , here , just don't expect to see any violence , this is very PG-13 . It is definitely a movie that will make you want to kill , and have a good time doing it .

it's hard to make a negative statement here after all this raving about how great deed poll is, how wonderful the actors did and so on and so on. i did not like the film. it's crappy!there are orgies, they have taboo sex (gay sex, bi sex, oral sex, rape, anal sex, masturbation, brother-sister-sex, brother-brother-sex, sex on drugs, sex without drugs, sex, sex, sex seems to rule their world. i guess the director is desperately in need of a getting laid.) the story is just dirty and shameful.

Anyone that is looking for an episode of "Law and Order" or "CSI" would have to look elsewhere as the most basic elements of police or forensics work were totally ignored in this case.A murder took place, and all the police did was to grab a 15-year-old boy off the street and take him to the only witness - a 65-year-old man - and say is this the guy who did it? Sure, the old man thought that the kid in the back of the police car had to be guilty. never mind that he looked nothing like the real killer and was dressed completely differently.

The girls might be prettier if you 're their accompanist or a $ # ! +-faced onlooker . What I think is more likely is that you're not paying too much attention . What do they do to get attention ? You're the one telling them . You have a job, you have an audience . You have to pay attention. You're supposed to be a professional! Look at all the time you spend worrying about it, and all the trouble it makes you to spend your precious free time worrying about it.

Distributor: GOODTIMES home video Plot: A pretty high school student is marked for unrelenting terror in this suspense filled made for TV movie. Gail Osborne is new in town. She makes friends, has a boyfriend and everything seems to be going her way. That is until she gets an ominous and frightening phone call while babysitting. After more and more phone calls, she is raped. throughout most of the movie, she tries to find proof that the person did rape her.Audio/Video: This 1987 VHS edition from Goodtimes stinks.

The first review I saw of this on IMDB says that Vince Vaughn is a much better actor than Anthony Perkins was in this role. Makes me wonder if he saw the original. It's tough to review Psycho if you don't have the perspective of how revolutionary the movie was in 1960. You have a heroine who isn't very likable and is killed not far into the movie and a villain who is creepy, but makes you feel for him. Add to that some graphic violence and you have a blue print for some of the slasher films of the 80s and 90s.Where does this film go wrong?

I have heard that Novo was compared to Memento for the simple fact they both rely on main characters suffering the most terrible circumstances imaginable. But I thought that the main difference between them is the fact Memento is an RPG whereas Novo is a survival horror, so maybe there is something that makes the difference. But what I don't get why Novo would be considered a "game" and Memento would be considered a "horror" game, because both of them are in the same genre, and there is a huge difference between both, which I can't understand.

An obvious cash-in on the *Insert Monster Here* On A Plane gimmick, Flight Of The Living Dead is about what you'd expect it to be. The film has little or no plot, which is what you'd expect from a film of this type. Although, it is fun in parts, I must say. The Zombie-action is particularly entertaining. Once the film picks up, it never stops; the pacing is solid.The practical special effects are pretty good, but the CGI is terrible and distracting. The ending seems to leave the film open to a sequel.

What crack are you smoking? This movie, while gloriously entertaining, is awful! The action scenes are so obviously fake it's kind of sad. The colonel's daughter is painfully irritating. The ninja training camp is so hilarious it is almost not worth mentioning. And when Joe puts the bucket over his head and beat up the other army guy, I just about peed myself. I could go on...Entertaining, arguably so. Good, no. Well made, certainly not.As a commentary on America as empire, it's actually pretty good.

Ken Russell directed this weird ( Not very ) erotic thriller and if I had n't known that I would have called it porn I would probably have never seen it. The plot is pretty good for a movie. A young couple is in the throes of passion with each other. After they break up they have sex in the bathroom of a hotel room. Later that night, they try to sneak out of the hotel room and have a drink at a bar. They are interrupted by the hotel bellman. They have to go to the next door room to make sure that their room isn't occupied.

This is a pretty simplistic romance . Girl finds boy , girl loves boy , girl loses boy , girl falls in love . Boy has a big heart for girl . Girl wants him as much as he wants to be with her . Boy wants to be the one guy she'll love forever . It's a pretty good romance that I thought. The story was very enjoyable . The only issue that I had was that I missed a few things. I also thought the romance went a little overboard at the end of the story. I thought it was a little rushed .

The slightly overlong set up episode of the previous week paid off in no uncertain terms with an episode that hit the heights. There was a certain deus ex machina flavour to the resolution of the cliffhanger, but it was a good start for all that. As is now common with this Doctor the moral, ethical and emotional considerations of his actions were centre stage. They were always there in the classic series, but they were a side issue, to be glossed over when the Doctor was in the heat of battle. This regeneration even says sorry to a cyberman during the battle!

For a TV movie this was definately worth seeing. All the acting was very well done and the story itself had a touching universal theme. I have not read/seen the original and as a rule I can't stand Shakespeare, but I enjoyed this movie(the civil war setting was very well done as well). Dont expect to see an epic, however you should find it moving enough to enjoy. By the way (on a side note) don't compare this (or any other movie for that matter) to the original work.

Well , this is about as good as they come . There are arguments about whether Hitchcock was only a producer or a writer or a director but the point is that he produced a film that is widely regarded as one of the best in the past decades and is also among his best. There is a movie that I have just seen, and it is very good, and I would recommend you watch it . I was at an art exhibit and I was talking to one of the people there and it was like she had known him for years.

With its rerelease by ADV Films , I 've had a chance to watch `` The Giant Majin '' for the past year. Now I feel the time is ripe to give it another chance. What do I have to say? Well, for one, I want to point out that the movie has been well received, and I 'm glad that I did see it. If you saw it, I hope this is what it 's coming out of you. For instance, I like the way the action is paced. I have to say, I like this movie too.

I agree that this movie is about sex without any seduction or love. In fact, it makes sex seem so boring and makes me wonder why bother. I actually don't think at all this remotely speaks of how Canadian Indian second generations feel about sex. At any rate, did you know the first hotel/drunk idea was copied from a Korean movie, Yopgijogin gunyo, made in 2001 or thereabouts? That Korean film was actually brilliant as comedy but at the same time compels the audience to reflect on the complexity of man-woman relationships and man-woman difference in experience and thinking.

The Hollow is a wonderful murder mystery that provides all you can expect from Agatha Christie and of course Poirot. Poirot in the Hollow is my favorite play for many reasons but I would say one of them is this. For the first time ever you can see a full length of the original stage play that was created by Irene Castle. This is my first experience seeing the play and I loved every second of it! Agatha Christie wrote the most famous play, the “Hollow” and I know I will be a huge fan of it!

Okay,I had watched this movie when I was very little and the day that we were cleaning out the closet I see this!I thought,"I have no idea of what this movie was like,"so I went ahead and put it in.OH MY GOD!!!! !This film is so darn bad!I never thought that this film could ever get as close to my least favorite film as it did,but I did laugh,because all the jokes were so corny and ridiculous,not funny!!!

My mom and I went to the Ft Worth Premiere mainly to see George Strait, but ended up getting the chance to see the movie premier at Bass Hall. What a wonderful, beautiful film which not only depicts the beautiful Texas landscape, but also had a great feel-good storyline. It was well written, directed and produced and my mom and I loved it from start to finish!. Thank you Jay for giving us the opportunity to be a part of the premiere of this wonderful movie. It was a night we will never forget.

Breathtaking at it 's best , intriguing at it 's worst , Francis Ford Coppala 's groundbreaking epic 'Apocalypse Now' is a true classic of the cinematic canon. The story follows two Americans who are sent to a remote island to investigate a series of mysterious murders and the bizarre rituals associated with the so-called 'pyramids of Mars.' The film is based on the book 'Viking Legacy: A Novel by John Connolly' which is one of my favorite books ever written. It is not, however, one of my favorite movies because it doesn't do nearly enough for the story in a single movie.

Thomas Mann 's controversial novel is the basis for the film `` A Death in Venice. `` Although in the film the character played by John Wayne is the same as the one played by Bruce Lee in the `` Bruce Lee vs. Bruce Lee `` action film starring Bruce Lee in the lead. This is the same Bruce Lee of the comic book, however this is not the same comics Bruce Lee, this Bruce Lee in the film is a fictional Bruce Lee, the same comic book comic book Bruce Lee, this is a film about a fictional film character.

This film is not only the last piece of the Three Colours trilogy , but also the best of the trilogy. One of the reasons it has such a positive reception is that it gives the viewers a more in depth and complete look into the life of the trio and their relationship with themselves. It also makes the audience feel as if they have stepped back and seen it first hand, rather than just having to read about it. The actors are great and the story itself has a great story-line. I found it an enjoyable and worthwhile film that is easy to watch, with some interesting twists along the way.

The book is great . It 's one of my favorite books ever . The film , on the other hand , is one of the most boring . It doesn' t have much of anything to say and the movie is not well thought out at all . I don' t like the book either , but that' s only because I like the book but not the film . I know the book is not well written and there is nothing original or exciting about it but that' s not what made me love the book . I really don' t think there is anything to learn from it .

I had heard good things about `` States of Grace '' and came in with an open mind . I had a few questions and decided to try it for two weeks. I tried it, but it was no good. I thought that I would read some books that I would love to get a hold of and would be happy to spend money on my next trip. It was not to be. After two weeks of trying to read the book I finally decided to give it a try. What I learned is that it was really hard to read, very boring and full of typos.

The acting made you feel like you were watching a kindergarten play. The story is full of holes and gaps and skips around so you have no idea as to what just happened. Half the scenes are pointless. There is not an inkling of character development. The score/soundtrack consists of about three songs one in particular is played in about 70% of the scenes. I'm glad I only rented the movie yet I still feel cheated. Avoid this movie at all costs unless you want to see some decent actors give horrible performances.

Oh how awfully this movie is! I don't know if it is a horror film or a drama, cause the story and the both genres are not established very well! The story is not moving, it is slow, boring, and sleepy from the beginning to end. This movie really bores me! But I really liked the camera work, it is authentic, fresh and clear, the acting is great too, the little boy was the great performer in this movie, but it hasn't made me to jump from my seat.

Well the previews looked funny and I usually don't go to movies on opening night especially with my kids because ......well you never know. Here is a movie that doesn't appeal either to children or adults as the jokes are too perverse for children and falls completely flat for entertainment purposes for adults. I was actually embarrassed to be with my 9 and 6 year old and having to explain to my 6 year old what S H * T spells. Essentially what happens here is a total twisting of Dr. Seuss's classic.

In Fassbinder's earlier films, his ideas sometimes surpased his ability to execute them. He was always a great writer, but it took him some time to get his style of camera work and storytelling down pat.The Merchant of Four Seasons is one of Fassbinder's first movie to make great use of color, from the bright green pears in the merchant's cart to the bright red roses at the funeral (a funeral in a Fassbinder movie? who'd have thought).His camera work was getting there too, but it was still fairly minimalist.

This movie made me want to bang my head against the wall. It is hard to compare such badness as this to anything, but some say that watching this movie is similar to bleeding from under your fingernails. And that comment comes from the writer's cousin. This movie was so flipping bad, it made "Hulk" (The second worst movie ever) look like "The Departed" (One of the greatest movies in cinematic history). If you like boring family movies with predictable plot lines, then you will absolutely love this movie.

I went to see this because I 'd never seen Tel-Aviv , where the story is set . I was very impressed, the characters, the setting, and the style of writing is perfect . I 'm sure you'll love it as well . And I 'll recommend you to see it , it's so great ! You have no idea who wrote this and you were very impressed? And how many of us are going to see this? This is a movie that may get a couple of million dollars. Is there anyone who will go see this, let alone buy it?

Susan Sarandon and Natalie Portman play Adele and Ann August, a single mother who's the working definition of the word "dreamer" and her solemn, pragmatic daughter. Adele, wanting to make a fresh start in a big city, moves them from Wisconsin to California.Decent, if not exceptional or particularly memorable, with some serious and sad moments. It pushes some emotional buttons, that's for sure. Best thing it offers is a solid cast, and Sarandon and Portman are quite good in the leads - even if their characters are one-dimensional at times.Could be better, could be worse.I gave this one seven out of ten.

**** MILD SPOILERS _ BUT YOU PROBABLY KNOW THE PLOT ****Woman gets raped and decides to take out her rage on all of mankind . Oh did I mention the rape victim was mute ? That`s the problem with MS 45 , Thana the rape victim decides she`s going to kill men but is there any logical explanation to any of this ? Surely the whole film would have better if we had Thana give a voice over as to why she`s bumping off any man she comes across ?

The great thing about Thirst , Chanwook Park 's latest film , is that it 's the anti-Twilight . Some have likened it to ' The Hunger Games ' , while others, like Jodi Benson, say it 's an ' Inception '. But the fact is, it has no equal , no matter how many people you know who 've been disappointed by Twilight or Inception . That 's because, while each movie has its own story and characters, both are based on franchises . They 're stories about two people falling in love and becoming one.

A CBS radio program entitled "We the People" assists in finding an American home for Vienna refugee Charles Coburn (as Karl Braun), a skilled surgeon and pool hustler. He arrives with beautiful daughter Sigrid Gurie (as Leni), who is "studying" to become a nurse. Relocated to a small, dusty Midwestern village, they are welcomed at the station by burly John Wayne (as John Phillips) and his uncle Spencer Charters (as 'Nunk' Atterbury), a veterinarian. Ms. Gurie is unhappy in the dustbowl, and wants to leave. Immediately.

This film was really terrible.However , it 's worth seeing , as it features the worlds most unnecessarily extended sex scene.And I love the ending . I liked that it left it open till the end . -

It is a film, directed by Timo Savioni.It has been released in 2000 in Germany on DVD, and in 2002 on Blu-Ray.It has been screened twice on TV.It was nominated for 3 Golden Globe Awards, winning for best picture, director, and screenwriting.It had a worldwide release in 2001, and a North American DVD and VHS release in 2002. I don't know why people say that this film was awful.

No spoiler needed to steer you clear of this...well, bizarre film. Canada becomes part of the USA. OK. So, I guess I'm unusual, but I expected something about the implications of Canada becoming part of the USA. Silly me. Continue with this movie and you are off to cloud coocoo land. The opening premise has nothing to do with the rest of the film in which you will (trust me) not care a squat for any of the characters. Slings and Arrows and Due South have to be among the most imaginative series ever.

Rififi is a great film that is overlooked . It 's a crime drama where a man gets out of prison because he was wrongfully imprisoned , and he begins to make amends to his ex girlfriend and her family. Rififi is an amazing film because it takes the story and makes it believable. The film opens with a close up of a group of men and women standing outside a building , as the camera pans to one of the people , who looks up to a man dressed as a priest and wearing a white hoodie , who is praying in his head.

Watched this film at a local festival , the Silver Sprocket International Film Festival Florida . What a lovely film , and with great production value! This film follows two couples through their relationship. It was filmed on location in Florida and Arizona in the early 80s and I found it very moving, especially since I was the same age in the 80s and 80s. This is a great film , and it was a pleasure to see the couple on screen. I also loved the fact that so many of the women in the film played themselves.

In Reunion Island in the Indian Ocean, the owner of a cigarette factory Louis Mahé (Jean-Paul Belmondo) is engaged through correspondence with Julie Roussel and he does not know her. When Julie arrives in the island to get married with Louis, he waits for her in the docks but Louis does not recognize Julie in the passenger vessel and finds that she is totally different from the picture she had sent to Louis. They get married and Louis shares his bank accounts with her. When Julie's sister writes a letter to Louis asking her sister to write to her, Louis discovers that the woman is not Julie that is missing.

CAUTION : SPOILERSAlthough this film moved a bit slow at times , the brilliant scenery , richness of the characters , and heartwarming moments are well worth the investment of the time and money to see it..

What I was looking for :1. Great story2. Great acting3. Great acting skills4. Great music and soundtrack5. The plot is a good balance between action and comedy6. The characters all have one thing in common- they all want to win the world.7. The ending was a pleasant ending for a good story8. It is a movie which is worth seeing9.

This is a spin off of Pulp Fiction. I thought that it would be good for a few decent laughs. Well it turns out that this movie really was terrible. The whole plot doesn't follow on the Pulp Fiction plot. It turns to other movie like Forrest Gump and more. Some laughs came out of this movie, but all and all it totally took 90 minutes of my life away from me. If you are thinking of renting this movie, please don't it will waste 90 minutes of your life. Reconsider renting this and go on and find a movie that actually makes sense.

Rowan Atkinson delivers an unforgettable performance as the clueless Mr. Bean who never goes far without his Teddy Bear. The appeal of Mr. Bean is largely his childish behavior and innocence. We don't know if he came from the sky or another planet. He is the kind of strange character that you can't make up quite easily. He is often alone and used to it. He has a hard time communicating through speech which might be why we only hear his grunts at times. There are other characters who speak to him and he responds. The character of Mr. Bean is a mystery and still is.

This film holds 7.0 rating on IMDb , so even I sensed something rotten in it 's synopsis I decided to watch the movie as it opened. I didn't expect it to hold such a high review , but the way it ended and the story is not very interesting I was hoping for something better. I am still waiting for this movie to come out though I am pretty sure this film will have to wait a long time for release. This is an original work of fiction, based on a true story. The characters and locations mentioned in the movie are fictitious.

The only reason for me for watching this little known Irish film was the question could Mike Myers have played a normal, dramatic character. Well, he could and his acting was pretty good but unfortunately that was probably the only good thing that I can say about this film. In the beginning film follows life of twelve years old orphan Mickey who lives with his brother and sister with their somewhat eccentric grandma. Despite some strong language it looks like a family film but after a while it becomes clearly that Pete's Meteor is a hardly suitable for young audience drama.

The prey has an interesting history, unless you remember the ads for it in newspapers in June of 1984 you might have caught it on the Movie channel back in summer 85, but little else is remembered. The plot is your basic killer in the woods again. But ironically this was filmed before Friday the 13th. The prey was actually shot sometime in 1978 according to one of the actors in an interview years later. But released for about a week at some drive ins, (yes Jim, namans drive in showed this in June of 84).

This movie was * good * relatively during the first parts of it.We have a story , from 3 points of view , the main character is not the main character but the other 3 points of view in a story. And all the points of the story are related by each other. But in the second part of the movie, i can't tell you about the story, it's not that good , but in the end, it was okay. It was okay .But the first part of it was really good.

I have to agree with the previous reviewer. Although the Kristin Erikson did a great job of playing the possessed girl, I seriously don't think that Isabelle, the character she was playing, was possessed. I have seen people have psychotic breaks due to sexual abuse, and they never made it clear whether or not the father had actually abused her or not. I also had to watch some parts of it over again, to make it clear as to what the letter said, what the characters' names were, and I'm still not clear on a few things that happened, whether they were real or not.

This film started off really tense when a poor young boy is set upon by a pack of savage dogs. After a tense chase he is saved by said grandpa with magic whip.We are then introduced to a string of annoying house mates, including one tart who is always half dressed. During this stage the film heightens tension with strange "plinky plinky" background noises that had me on the edge of my seat.I stopped paying attention for a while but when I looked back on the screen there where weird creature type things going around grunting and killing.

This movie was pathetically awful . The sound was terrible , the action was ridiculous and the effects were nauseating. I am not going to say that I would not have liked it if its not this awful, but its definitely one I wont be making fun of and I am sure it would be fun for me to see again. I saw this movie on opening night for my birthday. After seeing it the first time I didn't want to see it again. The movie was not good. This is why I didn't watch it that night.

Why ca n't a movie be rated a zero ? Or even a negative number ? Some movies such as The Godfather, The Terminator or even The Passion are rated a 1/2+ ,and other ones are rated a 3.5. I'm not saying these movies are better than those. I'm saying that it is not a good system to use. Just a question. The Godfather, The Terminator, and the Passion, are not bad movies. I'm not saying they are not good. The Godfather is in my opinion a great film.

All right , let me start by saying I love the original RS for the 64 . The graphics were very good , especially the new ones from a few years back. They just never quite reached the levels I wanted them to. I liked the 3D models a lot , the new ones have been improved but I don't think I'm ever going to use those anymore. I don't see a problem with using the 64 and 64 GBs. If that were the case, then we would all be stuck with 32 GBs and no 64. We will still have 16GBs available.

Screen treatment of the comedic Broadway success "The Gay Divorce" (a title which was considered too scandalous for American moviegoers, though it was used in the U.K.) concerns a man and woman (Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers) meeting under embarrassing circumstances while she's in the process of divorcing her spouse; they dance, argue, make up, dance, argue some more and dance some more. Betty Grable is very appealing in a brief bit (singing and dancing in the number "Let's K-nock K-nees" with overtly sissified Edward Everett Horton), but the star-couple looks distressed and unhappy throughout.

Or anyone else have noticed the fact that first bunch of episodes are inspired too much by 90 's flicks? (and that was already a bad thing)

I think I might be going off track here but I can not think of any good reasons why we are not doing the same for our show. I think the reason that we are doing it is that we have a very good reason - we are trying to emulate the style of old 90s and early 00's movies/tv/shows and we feel that it will be much cooler than anything that comes out now.

I watched this movie which I really thought had a promising beginning but then it just led me to feel like I'm watching something from a bad 90s sitcom. And what's with the bad acting? I guess I just don't see any talent. It seems like all the actresses in this film are really bad and not really likeable, but I don't really know that to be true. I just don't like anything about this movie. It just seems really cheesy. I mean, I know you can make a movie out of anything.
