Put simply, this mini-series was terrible. Let me count the ways. 1. Absurd plotting. 2. Over-acting. 3. Scattershot approach to characters. 4. Annoying narration. 5. Inability to create viewer interest.This film can't even pass the "Soap Opera for Dummies" test. I'm sorry I have not read this award-winning novel, so I am judging it only as a film, but it really stinks. Imagine going to a party where they show you dozens of appetizers. You look at the wide variety and want to taste them, but suddenly they are withdrawn, and you wonder where they went.

It's another variation on the oft-told tale of two people getting married and having to share their brood of kids. WITH SIX YOU GET EGG ROLL is directed by Howard Morris (from television) and it shows, because it's the kind of tale that plays like a half-hour situation comedy padded out to feature film length--but with a scarcity of laughs, or to put it differently, only the number of laughs that would have been possible within the half-hour limits of a TV show.DORIS DAY decided to call it quits after this film--and it's rather easy to see why.

Early talkie feature based on a popular stage play. A murder has been committed and a bunch of people hire a medium to conduct a séance to see who the murderer is. While the lights are out there's ANOTHER murder...so it's someone in that room.What follows is an obvious, dull and creaky murder mystery. Most of the cast overacts to a ridiculous degree. They act like they're on stage (where you have to overdo things) and it looks silly on screen. Most embarrassing is Bela Lugosi (two years before "Dracula") who REALLY overdoes it as a police inspector.

Tarentino should be ashamed to be involved with this awful film . The acting , directing and script are all so bad the film has nothing to recommend it. I mean what is there to be ashamed of ? The movie is awful. What a waste.”

“So what did I miss? Well I’m afraid I can’t point out anything in particular that didn’t live up to it’s hype. I can, however, offer this comment. This film is an abomination of horror that cannot be justified at all.

I have always loved bad creations , rhetorical criticism and my film professor validated that for me in college . Here’s a quote from my college film professor:

“Bad is not the word I use to refer to it, it means that the quality of what is being created is not always good. That’s it. It’s all a matter of preference. “If you can find a way to improve upon the film you are going to love you will have found the art form that you are seeking.

For me , this is another one of those films that I got to see off of the Los Angeles Film Center DVD, this time in 2D. If you’re not familiar with it, I recommend that you check out the Film Center site (link is in my bio), which has detailed descriptions of the films. The story of the film is a simple story of a young couple that’s in their 50s and who move from their hometown and move to a larger city. They have no children of their own, and have a couple of kids who are teenagers.

I just discovered this obscure '70s horror movie while browsing on YouTube. For a low-budget effort, it has plenty of compelling moments in gradual pacing in leading to the surprisingly shocking finish. While there is one woman who takes off her shirt constantly, the fact that she's a nymphomaniac makes those scenes important to the story and there's one scene with the curly-haired young man as he attempts to seduce her that turned me on before his pulling back made her screaming mad. The young nurse who comes in and gets hired is alluring herself and I'm not surprised she posed for the cover of Playboy.

The narrative was clear and concise but overall the film never caught my interest- scenes felt flat and uninspired .. it wasn’t bad but definitely not memorable. The story isn’t really that interesting. There were so many subplots going on and I didn’t feel I was paying attention to most of them. The whole thing just seems to be a lot of back and forth between these two sides. The only really interesting element in the whole story is about these two guys who want the money from each other but neither one can get it.

This is simply a good ole fashioned western..not overly complex or long. It doesn't deceive itself in thinking that it was made but for entertainment. Still, it is one of those westerns you can watch once and be done with without returning. It features former partners Randolph Scott and Glenn Ford whose friendship is strong despite the fact that Ford's Cheyenne Rogers has been part of bank robbing(he even steals Scott's Sheriff Steve Upton's horse without knowing it his good friend for which he is thieving). In Red valley, Upton is under heavy scrutiny for a bank robbing that ended with several dead.

This film flopped miserably in the UK , and it did n't deserve to . The trailer of this film is a mess, it looks like it's made of cardboard, the colours are dull, the animation looks bad . There's not much else to say about this film and I'm pretty sure it was a waste of time and money , especially when compared with the trailer. It doesn't even get any credit for being the best film of this year . What's your favourite film of 2016 so far? What's your favorite movie of 2016?

After reading some of these reviews, it is apparent that some have missed the point. What is great about this film (here comes the point), what is incredible about this film, what is astonishing about this film is that there is no proselytizing. There is no preaching. There is no preaching. There is no preaching. Life goes on. It is a masterpiece in letting an audience think for its collective self. These are just kids doing what kids do - without consciousness. We all went to school with kids like these.

Synopsis: the sequel to the acclaimed Silence Of The Lambs, Hannibal is a big budget production that totally fails to deliver; not only is it not as clever as its predecessor, it is not even a splatter or suspense or horror movie, just a totally boring time waster. Do not be fooled by the media hype, and particularly the stories about people throwing up in cinema and being mentally scarred for the rest of their lifes because of the brain - eating scene: in the movie it just comes across as laughably bad SFX.

Probably because this is Columbia's first film in color, the colors look different specially in the indoor scenes. They seem to be stronger, sharper and the result is a bit unrealistic, but very pleasing. Randolph Scott is the sheriff, a good guy but the real star of the movie is a very young Glenn Ford, who is an outlaw that wants to change. Evelyn Keyes is the woman that starts falling for Ford and Claire Trevor is the Countess that runs the saloon. There is a funny character called Nitro that does not think twice before blowing it.

The plot involves a new, hipper franchise barbershop that is moving across the street from Calvin's barbershop. So, he feels like he has to change and improve his shop by getting newer stuff and such. Sounds real exciting huh. As for the rest of the film, a lot of it involves the same material from the first film. The people that work at Calvin's stand around, talk loud, and mouth off to each other and the customers. Once again Cedric the Entertainer was mildly funny, but it is more like he's doing a stand-up routine than anything to do with the movie.

Well, SWORD IN THE MOON finally got a DVD release in Korea, and despite the mostly negative responses I've heard to it, and the suspiciously tardy DVD release, I couldn't help but pick it up - any wu xia film is better than most non-wu xia films in my eyes :D Perhaps low expectations were an advantage, because I was quite pleasantly surprised to find the film pretty enjoyable.An assassin is killing a number of ministers who were involved in a revolution that usurped the throne, and the government's top swordsman is tasked with identifying the culprit.

This film is truly a sorry excuse for film making . The pacing is poor , the budget must have been much higher that what its budget was for the most part , and the production value is not at the same level as other films of this genre. But, it does have a lot of fun action scenes that aren’t in other films of the genre and some decent character development. And the one thing I think it needs most in the way of improvement, would have been a bit more of a budget for the story.

It 's unlikely that anyone except those who adore silent films will appreciate any of the lyrical camera-work and busy editing. But it’s certainly a work of art worth watching for its technical perfection. And you will, because that’s what you’ll remember when you’re older. The opening scene of The Sound of Music, a film in the tradition of the silent films, is a beautiful scene of snow. There is a bright sun in the background. The camera pans to the far edge of the frame. The camera is stilled for a while as the scene unfolds.

this really is an "okay" series.. everyone in it is pretty good. but i just can't take Reba. she's trying to be funny but she just isn't and then she got a stupid accent!! if they took her out of the show i would love to see it every day..i have been watching the show in 10 min now and as i said before, Reba IS destroying the show. however the 20 year old guy (dont know his name) but he's soooo funny, and he's really saving it all..so here's the recipe to get a great show.

This is a movie that should be viewed and treated as a piece of art. This is an oblivious labour of love by the Schrader brothers about the life of Yukio Mishima that is full truly artistic elements. The movie jumps from color to black and white, past to present, fictional works by Mishima to him. All without being confusing in the least bit. The only thing that gets me is that the entire movie, with the exception of the narrator's spoken parts is in Japanese. Still a masterpiece that deserves an audience but hasn't found won.

My blurred childhood memories have kept the echo of the cult serie of Belphégor in the French 60's... so I was eager to see the big screen adaptation. I should have kept my money and gone for a stroll in the Louvre.The idea of the scenario is still very apt and interesting (the fantom of Le Louvre) but the adaptation is ridiculous. The dialogues hesitate permanently between French irony and serious "American business" without achieving neither but not without sounding asinine.Acting leaves somehow to be desired and special effects are meager compared to what one could expect (low budget ?

Once again, I've been duped by seemingly intelligent reviews making seemingly intelligent comments about an obviously crappy movie. I actually put my shoes on, got in my car, burned expensive gasoline and drove to the nearest rental place AFTER reading said reviews and paid the requisite 4 dollars and change to rent this thing. I'm telling you, this one's not worth the minuscule kilo-calories spent on lifting one's index finger to switch channels on a TV remote. I even gave it a few more minutes after seeing all the tell-tale signs of a pedigree dog-pile.

I love dissing this movie . My peers always try their best to defend it , probably out of love . Well this time , I did my very best to fight it and I succeeded. I’ll just post some highlights of my favorite scenes below . I have never really seen this movie before and after watching the first five minutes of it , I couldn’t understand what was going on. I guess I have to watch this one again and see how it is different and how is it going to change the way I feel about the movie.

Death in Venice is a movie I need to see once every ten years . It is always different , but there's always something different about the way it's done . I'm not talking about the music score (which I have watched several times) , but the way it looks . Sometimes the colors are brighter , and sometimes they seem to go a bit dimmer . Sometimes there seems to be a lot of fog in the background , and on other occasions there is just a lot of bright lights shining . I have to admit it is an odd movie .

the actors can not act . all dialoague was plagued with bad accents and loss of character . Channing Tatum has never been bad in any of the roles . . . but she is not a very good actress. She really should go back to do what she had been doing before and become an actor. i think the problem lies with the producers. i was thinking that they were doing the best they could for her and the character . they should not have put that much time and energy into the project . i do not think that it will ever be accepted as the final movie.

I very much enjoyed this movie and I think most fans of Lauren Ambrose will too . Her character is a very complicated and layered character with an interesting backstory that you will have to experience with this movie to fully understand. Lauren’s character and her mother are some of the better characters that I have personally had the pleasure of watching and experiencing with. Lauren Ambrose is one of the best actresses to work with, as an actress, director, screenwriter or just a woman that I feel like I want to spend time and get close to her.

I must say: out of all modern korean martial arts movies this one is worth checking out. It wasn't as epic as Musa-The Warriors and didn't develop the characters as well, but it had many nice ideas. Simple story: a elite soldier thought dead, returns after years to end the reign of the Japanese in Korea in medieval days. His counterpart was formerly the best friend he had and now he is out to stop him. The fight scenes are all with sword or different weapons and very entertaining to watch. The motives of the figures are discovered first near to the end.

I spent many a sleepless night after watching 2001 . Not only because of the psychological horror ( of which there is no end to) but for a more direct reason. It was the best film I'd seen for years, so I wanted to see a new one. That's what movies do, right? If you haven't seen it, take your chances with something that might be worth it. I've never regretted watching it again, because it was as good as I remembered and there were many wonderful scenes I forgot. But it did change the way I look at movies.

Although its plot is taken from the history of ancient Rome , 'Caligula ' is not made in the style of the best of historical dramas; the characters and the events do not carry any weight with the viewers. As a dramatic spectacle, it is rather like an episode of the TV series 'Lost In Space' : the plot has no substance to it at all and the story does not interest the audience either. This is also what makes 'Caligula ' so disappointing for those who enjoy such historical epics : it is not a historical story.

This is a low budget stop motion monster movie from Brett ( A Nymphoid Barbarian in Dinosaur Hell ) Piper, with a bit of horror thrown in, and I love it. Brett has some awesome stop motion animation skills. He is really talented at this and makes this a great watch. I haven't really thought about this movie too much, but it would make a great Christmas gift idea. I can say, however, that it takes some time for things to get moving on the screen, and that means that you have to watch it a couple of times to see how it's done.

I don't care what anyone says, this movie is hilarious! It combines the bleak seriousness of Threads with an anarchic blend of alternative comedy, and the results are a severely dark, but outrageously funny satire on the brinkmanship policies of both the Western and Eastern blocs at the time. You gotta give the filmmakers credit for even attempting to top the real life lunacy of "Duck and cover" or "Protect and survive"!Imagine someone made a movie based on the Dead Kennedys track 'Kinky Sex Makes The World Go Round', and you're pretty close to Whoops!

Dictated by thin experience ( of both life and industry ) and no cash Sofia Coppola 's early short is now a short film, with the movie debuting at TIFF, on Thursday, November 1st. This is the first film by an actor to debut this early on a Canadian film fest, in addition to her last film The Bling Ring, but it’s not the first time we have seen Coppola work in a film. In 2009, she had her first feature length film, A Simple Plan, just after finishing up production on an untitled project she was originally attached to direct.

This movie was lacking in a lot of areas . It 's about this Elvis type guy who races cars and loves his girls . He gets into a car accident that kills the girl he was in love with . It then goes downhill after he gets back together with his girlfriend . The girl 's still in love with him so the story has a lot of plot holes . I thought it was pretty good because of the storyline . But it had a few weak parts . For example , the part when he is chasing the girl he really wants .

This movie was never intended as a big-budget film but was a cute little picture that pretty much anyone could watch and enjoy. The only problem I found with this film is that the plot was a bit clunky. This was my second movie that I have seen, so I had to try to learn the plot line before watching the movie because I had already seen it before. This movie could have been more exciting, and the story may have been more interesting if it had not been rushed in the middle of the movie.

This is a low budget, well acted little gem. Alice, a small town Massachusetts teenager, fed up with her existence, takes to the road to escape her mother who flips burgers and her own job as a check out in a super market. She sets out for Florida and to stay with her wealthier high school friend who is a freshman at Miami. After her car suspiciously breaks down on the thruway and she loses all her money, she ends up with a retired couple in an RV who also happen to be traveling to Florida..

The finest short I've ever seen. Some commentators suggest it might have been lengthened, due to the density of insight it offers. There's irony in that comment and little merit. The acting is all up to Noonan and he carries his thankless character perfectly. I might have preferred that the narrator be less "recognizable", but the gravitas lent is pitch perfect. This is a short for people who read, for those whose "bar" is set high and for those who recognize that living in a culture that celebrates stupidity and banality can forge contrary and bitter defenders of beauty.

The only good thing about Persepolis is the shadows created in the German Expressionism-style of animation and a hint of history. This movie bored me. It was about a woman dissatisfied with her culture who tries everything else and then goes back to her roots. Here she finds great discontentment once again and finally leaves for final to let everyone else in her country figure out the situation and what they will do now that she is not there to support them. It comes to no conclusion and leaves us with a feeling that this woman has no loyalties.

Ridiculous , nauseating doggerel with terrible acting ; ineptly , superficially , and condescendingly trawling all the most banal clichés of the modern novel in search of a story , but to no avail . This review is not a review of the original novel but a review of the book itself . The title comes from an article that was posted a while ago but the author and its author do not believe it was actually published . I think this title should have the following quotation :-

“It’s the doggerel, the rubbish, the rubbish-crap .

It would be quite easy to make this movie sound fun: a call girl gets shot in the forehead by a North Korean spy, but survives. The bullet that is embedded in her brain makes her long for knowledge, as well as sex. Unbeknownst to her, she walks away from the shooting with the cloned finger of George W. Bush in her purse, a key which can unlock the power to use nuclear armaments. Just call it a romp, and at least a few people will show up to the theater.

Well Folks, this is another stereotypic portrayla of Gay life however, the additional downside includes poor acting, horrible script, no budget, terrible sound and let us not forget the impossible storyline.It is Christmas in New York City and our story immediatly "focuses" on two male individuals, apparently lovers for some time. One of them has not let his parents (the right wing, religious zealot types) know that he is gay (adding to the impluasability of the story 'cause this guy is as efeminant as gay guys come these days) and his parents are coming to viusit him.

Like another poster mentioned Ch . 56 ( a local Boston TV station ) showed this multiple times over the years but I don't think there is any way to see it, and also I have never watched much of his stuff. Maybe it was during his last years. Quote:

I was just wondering if there is a chance that he is on the record as to his whereabouts. I can't say for sure if I remember it or not, but I did find a couple places that show his name, but it seems that most of them were before his death.

This film is the most impressing turkish film that I have ever seen. Probably "Okul" is the first turkish horror film. I must say that I were excited while watching the movie because of some reasons, The first reason is that the story is impressive, I mean that at the end of the film you realised all the details about movie, this makes the film attractive and the other reason is that no turkish man made such a movie like that before. This shows that turkish film improves itself by time. Although the first trial to make a horror movie, It was really successful.

River 's Edge is an extremely disturbing film written by acclaimed American screen writer Neal Jimenez.It is based on an actual incident during the Second World War.The film tells the story of seven young people who lived on the outskirts of a small town in the USA during World War 2. They have been separated from their families and placed in the care of a local psychiatrist who was trying to restore order and sanity. He had no intention of letting these teenagers leave his home and he was doing everything possible to make the situation as comfortable as possible for them.

I posted on IMDb on this series recently , giving a snail mail address at the commercial arm of the company. A few people had written back, and then I decided to post it on my own website, at the end of the first series. Well, that didn't last too long, but I hope you can find this on the net somewhere if you want to see a full review and comment. This time I have no intention of rehashing the story, it is a well know tale and has been thoroughly covered by most sources.

Even though this film 's trailer and poster imply that Sally Hemmings was an important character , I might not agree with that, since the role was not one that would have been very popular back in the '40's and '50's. Of the many films about Sally Hemmings in that time, this is the only one where her character doesn't seem all that important. However, I think it's an interesting and thought provoking piece of art. I really like that this film is set in the present day and that she is still trying to make contact with people who can help her.

This movie, with all its complexity and subtlety, makes for one of the most thought-provoking short films I have ever seen. The topics it addresses are ugly, cynical, and at times, even macabre, but the film remains beautiful in its language, artful with its camera angles, and gorgeous in its style, skillfully recreating the short story of the same name written by a master of short stories, Tobias Wolff.Not wishing to spoil anything of the movie, I won't go into any details, other than to say that this movie is magnificent in and of itself.

Well every scene so perfectly presented . Never before had I seen such a movie that has meaning in almost every word . My favorite scene :

The scene when the mother and her son arrive at the house of the man she loves. She brings a gift for him from her son . She gives it to her son and he opens the door and goes inside . The man sees her and she says,

" I love you son, I just want to hug you. I have so much I want to show you" . And then he embraces her .

So I was sick with the flu one Saturday and the silver lining was that SciFi Channel was having a marathon of dinosaur movies that day - the "Carnosaur" trilogy, "Pterodactyl," "Raptor Island." Then I flicked ahead on my cable remote to see which movie SciFi placed in its glamorous, Saturday prime-time slot. Some movie I had never heard of before called "Raptor." I was pretty excited. The movie begins with some teens driving around in a jeep, when they get stalked and killed by a Velociraptor.

I was n't sure where this was headed until the ending . when it turned out that this was all a set up to be killed off later . well you're welcome to take it, as I'm enjoying it. and thanks for the comment . I'll leave it to you, as I'm not sure where this will go in a few months and I want to have more of it finished. . at least now i know i have more ideas for it , so i may go back and work on a little more stuff . and that's it for now .

The opening scene really got me into watching the movie . However , not more than 5 minutes later , I realized that I was still sitting there with the movie playing over in my head . At this point I was hooked and have watched the entire film at least 20 times , and even more times with the soundtrack playing. The acting and chemistry between the actors was perfect and it is clear from the trailers and interviews that this is going to be a movie that will make you want to be a character you can relate to.

It 's complete nonsense . I 've studied Nazism and read many manuscripts from the day - the `` parallels . I know there are similarities . But it is all nonsense . Hitler 's ideas are different . I can not see how anyone can compare Nazism to Christianity . Its the same as communism or any other belief system . The Church is the Church . They are the Church - it is the Church I can tell the difference between them . The Church is a religion - it is a belief system and not a religion .

What a mess -- and I 'm not referring to the `` destruction '' in the title . I could be talking of a nuclear-weapons attack . Or of a terrorist action , or of some other event that might have the same effect . These are all possible ways of ending the war in the Middle East . If you add it all together , what do we really have . It's almost impossible to say what will happen . Now , I am not saying that the conflict in the middle east can't be won . There are many things that can be achieved by diplomacy .

As I read the script on-line , I thought `` Capote '' needed a trim . Having just seen it in the movie , I know this is true . I also read his novel in a bookstore , but did not have a chance to get a copy of the movie . Maybe I will find the time later . Maybe not . I guess you get my drift . I just watched the movie . I have to say that it was not the movie that I was expecting . There is a story to the movie but it is a very poor movie .

I went into this movie hoping for an imaginative twist on the Second Coming . Boy , was I ever disappointed. I would have preferred to be in that movie , and if that movie had been shot this year I think I might be a little more impressed. I would also have liked to see the same kind of special effects that are used in Avatar. I know I saw some of them , and I am sure they would have been cool, but I think Avatar has the edge on that because they had a better budget, a better team, and it was much cheaper to film it.

In my opinion of this movie the entire video portion of this movie was absolute trash!!!! However the soundtrack that was used contained the music of a great heavy metal rock band, I recognized the music as being a band called Firstryke and the album was "Just a Nightmare" and it was very well written!! and I am curious to see what the rest of you movie buffs out there think of it, if can remember back that far I would appreciate the feed back, I collect old movie, and obscure movie sound tracks.

One of Chaplin's longest films up to that point, Burlesque on Carmen is a clever and surprisingly complex parody of what was then "Prosper Merimee's" well-known story about "Carmen." I was a little confused about the difference between the IMDb's listing of the 1915 Burlesque on Carmen and the 1916 version. Based on the running time I assume that it was the 1915 version that I saw, since the 1916 one is a good 20 minutes longer, and from what I've read, those are 20 unnecessary and unimpressive minutes.

Hearkening back to those "Good Old Days" of 1971, we can vividly recall when we were treated with a whole Season of Charles Chaplin at the Cinema. That's what the promotional guy called it when we saw him on somebody's old talk show. (We can't recall just whose it was; either MERV GRIFFIN or WOODY WOODBURY, one or the other!) The guest talked about Sir Charles' career and how his films had been out of circulation ever since the 1952 exclusion of the former "Little Tramp' from Los Estados Unidos on the grounds of his being an "undesirable Alien".

Bloody Birthday plays on the assumed innocence of children and shows them as bloodthirsty monsters. Steven (Andy Freeman), Curtis (Billy Jayne;credited as Billy Jacoby), and Debbie (Elizabeth Hoy), were all born on the same day during an eclipse. Besides sharing a birthday, they also share a love of murder (and they're not picky about who they kill either). Young Billy, Elizabeth, and Andy play the parts of these emotionless monsters quite well but they know when to put on the charm too. But they can't go on fooling everyone.

No spoiler needed to steer you clear of this ... well , bizarre film . Canada becomes part of the United Kingdom when it's time for the royal wedding. And there's much, much more . . . like a lot more. I was lucky to have an insider to give me a heads up that this film was coming . And now I have to say , I didn't know it would be so bizarre . And now it's been announced that the movie is going to come out August 28th, 2010 . This is going to be an odd time of year.

This is only the fourth effort I’ve watched from this director (whom I met and found quite genial at the 2004 Venice Film Festival Italian B-movie retrospective) and also, possibly, the worst. As was the case with THE BRONX EXECUTIONER (1989), which preceded it, this is a prime example from the tail end of the Euro-Cult era – prime because it shows the depths to which the previously invigorating style had fallen by this time! Here, in fact, we get a plot revolving around – I’m not kidding, folks – a killer phone!

In the 1940s, Veronica Lake made a meteoric rise to film stardom, thanks to her sultry beauty and, her highly exploited "peekaboo" hairstyle. She starred opposite big names like Alan Ladd and Fredric March, scoring screen successes in films like "This Gun For Hire" and "I Married A Witch". She held her own with female stars as well, and she surprised even her detractors with her performance as a bitter navy nurse in "So Proudly We Hail". But changing times and her own failings caught up with her, and by the end of the decade, her heyday was over.

ALERT: This review contains major SPOILERS. Do not read on if you plan to see this film.Judging from the amount of votes this got (my vote was the fifth one) very few people know or care who Mimi Lesseos is. Well, back in the late 1980s, professional wrestling was pretty decent. An all-woman's federation called the Ladies Professional Wrestling Association opened. It was a great league, and Mimi Lesseos was one of the names on the roster. I always thought she was one of the best people the LPWA had in terms of ring skill and acting ability.

Step Up is a fair dance film about some kids that get their big performance break . The film is made up of short scenes and lots of dance numbers . It’s pretty funny and has great choreo. It also looks quite good in the cinematography . The story of the film starts with a couple of children who have some kind of talent . There’s always some sort of competition going on in these type of competitions. There’s always some sort of challenge. It’s kind of interesting .

The movie starts with a Spiderman spoof which is your introduction to Rick Riker (played by Drake Bell of "Drake & Josh" fame, personally I'd have given the movie to Josh who is much funnier) and the "Rick Punchers" joke is lifted right out of Airplane so the writers were obviously already scraping the barrel for ideas for this film. Rick's class is on a science trip to The Amalgamated Genetics lab and this is where we get to meet the 1st star name in the film, Brent Spiner (Data in Star Trek TNG) playing Dr Strom.

I actually liked certain things about this game. I loved the first person perspective and wish we had had that choice in the first three games. There's nothing like seeing the monsters up close, in your face. The graphics really weren't bad, but I would have liked more things to interact with even though it was just a shooter. The music was fine. The things I hated were: The movement kind of sucked and aiming was a total pain. The story was too lame for words and too much of the same old thing with no originality.

The Priest, into profound love and suffering showed not the result of love, but the process of love and salvation has high-souled beauty of human(or vampire?). http://plaza.rakuten.co.jp/confuoco/diary/200911290000/And the love of Femme fatale is not notorious, but lovely in taking the responsible death as a vampire. She did not keep falling deep into the paradise lost, but decided to leave human alone. Fragile, but lovely Femme fatale! This movie made me think about suffering between human and vampire, that far beyond priest, and salvation. Also I thought about love.

The first time I saw this film I was a kid. I was ten years old when it was released but since my family never went to movie theaters I saw it on Network TV. I remember watching it aloneand crying afterward. It was only the second film to illicit that response (Rocky was the first) and there haven't been many since. I can't say why exactly; Larry "Rain" Murphy didn't deserve to win any more that Rocky Balboa or anyone else. I know I admired Murphy, not so much for what he did, but for the way he did his time.

I really wanted to like this film, especially after all the buzz I'd heard revolving around it. But, sadly, it just didn't work for me. Paranoid Park suffers from the same delusion Lost In Translation did--If you use very little dialogue, be heavy on the slow motion close ups and concentrate on pieces of fabric in the setting, then your story will magically come across as deep and thoughtful. Much of the plot line, if you can find a plot, of this film is contrived.

Im warning you people out there , this is just a waste of your time . I am being honest . It's just not worth it , even if you have some sort of interest or affinity for these kind of things. You are going to lose people that care about these kind of things and it doesn't help to be told by a person with your interests that they're stupid , ignorant , uneducated and are probably in the pay of Satan . Even if you did have some sort of interest in this kind of thing and didn't have an axe to grind you'd be dead wrong in all ways.

Think 'Charmed' with testosterone instead of estrogen and you get the general idea for this picture. A very lame story with mediocre effects and an anti-climax ending to let the door open for a part 2. Let's hope someone has the sense to spend their money wiser. I'd suggest a 'Charmed - the movie' because compared to this 'Charmed' kicked ass and I only watched that show to please my girlfriend!!!! Wait and watch it on DVD on a rainy Sunday when you've got nothing better to do. Or better yet download it so you don't waste your money.

Wow. I just saw Demon Wind a little while ago, and I don't think I'll ever be the same. It has the power to inspire nightmares, but for all the wrong reasons, actually.Never before has humanity seen such a gratuitous change in make-up, for no damn reason. Or, similarly, so much bad zombie (?) makeup that makes you hungry for those Halloween green marshmallows.Or so much naked old lady, for that matter. But then, there was "The Shining. "The plot here is so amateurish that it actually almost holds a little bit of charm, as does the dialog.

This is one of my three all-time favorite movies. My only quibble is that the director, Peter Yates, had too many cuts showing the actors individually instead of together as a scene, but the performances were so great I forgive him.Albert Finney and Tom Courtenay are absolutely marvelous; brilliant. The script is great, giving a very good picture of life in the theatre during World War II (and, therefore, what it was like in the 30s as well). Lots of great, subtle touches, lots of broad, overplayed strokes, all of it perfectly done.

I LOVE Sandra Bullock-She's one of my all-time favorite actresses-but this is a movie that she should have paid a long time ago to be trash-canned. I realize that it's almost 20 years old-but my dead grandmother can act better than these people did. Beware-it's not even worth the $ 5.50 WalMart rack...You know that when the acting stinks this bad that it's not even worth a couple of bucks-the sound quality is horrendous-there's no closed captioning to even hear the hideous dialog, and it looks as if it were filmed on a $ 1.98 budget.

A couple of years before SCREAM spoofed the slasher/horror genre with savvy, self-conscious young things knowing every trick in the book of what to do and not to do in a precarious situation, a little movie produced in Russia hit the theatres without any grandiose pretensions.This movie was MUTE WITNESS. Starring a cast of unknowns (except an extremely brief cameo by Sir Alec Guiness whose scenes were purportedly filmed eight years prior to the actual filming of this movie), it told the story of a mute make-up artist, Billie, who is working on a film on location in Russia produced and directed by her sister's boyfriend Andy.

I saw this at my in-laws' house one night when it popped up on TV and my mother-in-law said it was one of her favorite movies. Well, she can have it.Look, I can enjoy a chick flick now and then, as long as it's good. But this one's extra-sappy, unrealistic, and just plain predictable, despite some decent performances from Rock Hudson and Jane Wyman. It's uncanny how quickly a woman can accept having her eyesight taken away from her. Oh well, they say love is blind...The neat and tidy happy little ending nearly made me gag, too.

The only reason I checked this film out was to see the `` early '' Kim Bassinger . That , to my mind , is a bad idea , because the story doesn 't work . The way the film works , I didn 't see any `` early '' , and I don 't know if I'm missing something or it just wasn 't `` good ''. The story is kind of slow . It makes little sense , there isn 't any sense of story progression , there 's only so much you can get in one film . There 's not much suspense .

I wasn't sure where this was headed until the ending. when it turned out that this was all a liberal conspiracy to hand the world over to European wimps and the United Nations. What a load of right-wing crud! Incidentally, the bit about Canada joining the US didn't really have much to do with the plot at all and the idea was never developed. The only point of it seems to be that it made the main character eligible to run for President(but they could have just made him American and dispensed with that).

This movie was *good* relatively during the first parts of it.We have a story, from 3 points of view. So let's find some clues and complete the story.Oh wait...none of that stuff matters because the FBI guys are the bad guys! Though that was a great twist...it was almost a terrible twist. I immediately downgraded the film from a 7 maybe 8 to 3 based on the last 10-15 minutes of it.Does anyone else not see why the twist is so bad? Yes, it's a good shock.

The first time I ever saw this movie was when I was four years old. I remember loving it and everything about it. 13 years later, I am now 17, and decided to watch it about a month ago because I am taking a 1960's class in school. I didn't really know what to expect, since it had been 13 years since I last saw it, but I was completely blown away by it. The actors were amazing, the music was so fun, and I now find myself singing along to every song.

Of all the movies in the history of movies I ca n't imagine someone sitting down and saying , I am really going to go and see it this time. I don't think I could handle that feeling. I think I would freak out for a few days. For those of you asking what the title of the film is: I had the idea for a short film on the title of the film I wanted to make. But I could not come up with a good title until I had made the actual film.

This formulaic film (hero's girlfriend marries the villain) just didn't move along fast enough given some of the circumstances of the story. Scott seems too old in this one, and too many times his character turns away from decisive action, deflating the scenes. He responds to the deaths of some of his hands weakly; he escapes from Knox's gang by hiding in a full rain barrel; his escape to the high country and pursuit by John Russell seem superfluous, as does much of the film. The plot could have been tightened.

I hardly know where to begin in writing about this gem, except to say that it represents young Buster Keaton at the peak of his powers and must certainly rank with the half-dozen best short comedies ever made. THE GOAT is twenty minutes of smoothly paced, expertly photographed, beautifully executed gags; two reels of non-stop comic invention driven by an unmistakable undercurrent of paranoia and yet somehow leading to a happy ending -- which wasn't always the way with Buster's comedies. (See COPS for one case where Fatalism ultimately got the better of him, or ONE WEEK for the victory of Defeatism.)

In my opinion the directing , editing , lighting , and acting ( minus Franco ) were very good . But in my opinion, the music and the story were so bad it was a shame to even include it. I would give this a 4 but it's a low point. I would of loved to have seen more depth in the film but it just didn't make sense to be so bad . If you like this film , it's worth the watch but don't bother with it, you will be glad to find out why it sucks .

Arnold fans will holler in joy , fans of brainless action will holler in astonishment , and Catholics will just sit there and do nothing . That is the way it goes in America and in England . It doesn’t matter how good or bad you think your team is going to be, when you get out of bed you have to go through the motions of putting on the same old outfit, the same old outfit, the same old outfit, the same old outfit . When you’re out of your bed you go to the same routine every day .

If you have ever shopped at Wal-Mart , then you probably know about the $ 5 DVD bin that sits next to the drive-in. In fact, some might even think that this is something that Wal-Mart would offer to Wal-Mart customers in the United States for free. But what is the $ 5 DVD bin? Is it some kind of special promotion for Wal-Mart or just a DVD bin for other types of movies? Here’s what we do know. The $ 5 DVD Bin

First of all, what is a $ 5 DVD bin?

Shtrafbat is the story only Russians could tell about the Second World War . The largest front of the whole war took place between the German and the Soviet armies. This is why we need to start telling the story of our country and its people, that is, the Second World War. The Second World War is still a mystery today, but if you are a person who lives in Russia, then you have an opportunity to learn a bit of the history of that war that will help in your everyday life. I will start the story of the Second World War in the first chapter.

I was duped as well . Here I was expecting all sorts of man eating Pirahnas and what the hell do you think happened to me. The thing is, I had seen a guy just the same way before. The thing I was looking for in my dream was that the guy I was seeing could see me from a long way up. In reality I was looking up at him from all around . I was so shocked and confused that I couldn't move or think straight. I didn't even know I was paralyzed. I was just frozen and not able to move anymore.

"The Journey" is a very good film. Produced in the spring of 1958, in Vienna, and released in 1959, this movie was quite popular in his early years. Despite the political problems, which influenced the movie's success (because the story happens during the Hungarian Revolution, the Cold War), "The Journey" is a very good film, but not well-known. I think it should be released immediately on DVD, because most of the people who have seen it so far want to have it at home.

It may be hard to explain how, but this film is a masterpiece. Perhaps, because i never imagined that a plot like this or a film with so few words would convey all this poetry. The true poetry and aristocracy of human passions and obsession. Bogard is amazing and needless to say that Venice is utilised as a perfect scenery: dark, sinking and dreary just like Bogard's soul. And classical music is more that a simple background escort to human feelings. In my opinion, a classic masterpiece of european film-making.

Great acting , great production values , good direction.But the script starts out with great pacing and interest in the main storyline but then you get bogged down, and you can't get past the end credits sequence . The acting was good but some of the parts were hammy .I just wasn't into the movie , but I do think it would have been good had he made more of it and it is worth seeing just to see what he can do with the material , if you have seen other movies with him , then you'll understand why I wasn't into him .

Arnold fans will holler in joy, fans of brainless action will holler in astonishment, and Catholics will just holler.Illogically written by Andrew W. Marlowe and ham-handedly directed by Peter Hyams, *End of Days* gets The Terminator out of his open-backed hospital gown (Arnold Schwarzenegger's return to the big screen after his heart operation), whilst blowing things up in Mysterious Ways and blaspheming Biblical verse to give Catholics something more to whine about.It is 1999 and doom-sayers the world over live in trepidation of their computers going fritz and losing their downloaded porn.

This is one odd film . It seems to be aimed at a younger audience , but is filled with violence, language , profanity and sexual images . Even in its early stages , I was shocked that a director would be able to take two teenagers on a quest to uncover the origins of their family, only to find that they are not the only ones involved in that family . We are sent into this world with no knowledge of the history we are supposed to be uncovering , but with only our imaginations as guides.

When I first saw this movie back in the middle of January (2005) I didn't like it. I thought it was too weird and thought that some parts that the main star, Judith Light, acted were so unlike her. (Which of course is true) And then I watched bits of it the next day when it re-aired and I felt pretty much the same. Then I watched it again two Sundays ago (March 20th, 2005) and I began to really enjoy it and this time I taped the entire thing.

A group of young filmmakers with virtually no budget set out to make something clever and original -- and while there is a bit of originality and some skilled drawing in this slacker puppet show take on "Dante's Inferno," there is nothing especially clever. Dante's "Divine Comedy" was a brilliant piece of social commentary. This film is a vaguely moralistic student film with pretensions to High Art.I suspect those who loved this film were those readily amused by the sophomoric pokes at some icons of the political and/or religious right, and that those who hated it took offense at seeing their favored icons poked.

Negative numbers are not available to convey how bad this movie is ! Wooden acting coupled with a story line that doesn't feel real is what I was expecting from the first third of the film and I wasn't even expecting to be a little dissapointed by the end. When you've got to take a shot in the dark, you've got to take it for what it is and what it stands for rather than what it did, and that doesn't happen here. This is the kind of story that makes you forget about all the things you know that this movie has been trying to tell you.

Ah ! When good actors take on bland material ! If you are thinking of this movie as a tight thriller, think twice. Its an adventure story of a beautiful girl, who is being blackmailed by the devil. Her parents were killed in a brutal murder and the father is locked up in jail for his crime. Then he comes to her rescue. She becomes the victim of a vicious plot of Satan. And he also wants her to be his queen, even if that means he can't keep his distance from her .

A young couple decides to runaway to sunny California. They never reach their destination as they decide to pull over at the Rest Stop.After a fight with her boyfriend, Nicole Carrow insists on pulling in to a rest stop. When she is ready to leave, she exits the bathroom to find her boyfriend has disappeared with their car, leaving her trapped on the back roads of Texas with only an abandoned camper van to keep her company.Rest Stop is one of those cheap and tacky horror movies that could become a cult classic. Will Rest Stop become a cult classic you may ask?

Sometimes you ignore that little voice in your head that says "stay away from this movie". We should all pay more attention to that little voice. This may be the worst movie I've ever had the non-pleasure of sitting through, or it may be the best reason to remember that your DVD player has a fast-forward button. Made on a budget somewhere in the vicinity of $1.99, "The Cavern" is obviously a quick cheapie made to piggyback on the current bunch of scary cave-lots of darkness-claustrophobic spelunkers-unknown menace flicks like "The Cave" and "The Descent".

This movie is simply bad . First of all the story is just weird and it 's not good written or made. And second, I don't even know if it's true, but I think you can check it for sure . In my opinion this movie has no plot at all . I think the plot of this film is too confusing to understand at all . At the end you might feel a little bit confused . I do not watch horror movies anymore but this one, I think this movie is a good Horror movie but I don't know how good the story is .

`` Go Fish '' garnered Rose Troche rightly or wrongly the reputation of a film maker with much promise.Its then that I realised the greatness of the cast and the talent that has made this a unique experience. I will not spoil anything, except to say - I am looking forward to every moment with this movie. From the moment I first saw the film I knew right away I had to have it, and this is only the beginning of my love for the movie. I am glad to have this opportunity to review a movie I really love.

Hulk Hogan stars as a champion wrestler (A real acting stretch...) named Rip, who is forced to defend his honor, his title and his girlfriend from a greedy corporation that wanted him to sign for their network (Because wrestling sells!) however when Rip declines, the network gets a circuit fighting championship called (and i'm totally serious) "Battle of the tough guys" who's champion Zeus (Played by Tiny Lister Jr) maybe the deadliest man alive. Rip refuses to fight, until his brother is attacked and put in a hospital.

This thing, directed by french sensation Patrick Sebastien,is worst than all the turkeys that you may have seen. Forget Independence Day, Kazaam, The patriot, etc... you get the picture, this one's the pits. Sebastien is a TV celebrity in france, (if you need an equivalent, let's say he's Jerry Springer with an I.Q of 13), this is his first movie let's hope it's the last. I hope Troma or someone would distribute this film in the States, so that you guys out there can excperience the French stench at it's worst.

What? - that was it? The town sheriff (John Agar) blows up the mutant gorilla with a stick of dynamite hidden in a mannequin? Did I just write that? Did I just see that? With instrumentals by The Wildcats, "Night Fright" is one flick that never deserved to be made as late as 1967. The heyday of the gorilla was well over, and anyone other than Ray Corrigan in an ape suit is just asking for trouble. Remake this in black and white and set the story about thirty years earlier and you'd have at least a 4.0 rating on the IMDb.

I 've lost count of the times I have seen this movie , but I love it and find it absolutely brilliant. It has the right mix of suspense , horror , comedy , and it has a heart of gold and it has just enough heart to make you cry. It has some great scenes and it is worth the time to watch all 4 episodes if you haven't. If I could, I would give this movie 5 stars out 5 and tell you how great it is, but it won't be easy, trust me, there are some people that will not like this movie.

So I decided to watch the entire Puppet Master series , and had just watched parts 1-3 , which I think was great to start. But there was something wrong with me. I’ve watched the first 4 movies , the entire series, and thought the movie had been done well , and the story and characters were great. Then I watched part 5 and then went to watch parts 6-8 and I’m not really a fan of those movies or the characters . I mean I liked the first 3 movies and thought they had just the right amount of horror , but after that the whole movie got boring .

What a wonderful film, filled with eccentric, unique characters who are wonderfully realized by a great ensemble cast. The director also did a great job keeping the story held together, getting those wonderful performances (on not messing with them) and using music (and what wonderful music it is) to great effect. S. Epatha in the lead role is great. I had always heard what a brilliant stage actor she is, and although I have enjoyed her on Law and Order, this really shows what she can do with a filled out, complex role.

There are so many things wrong with this movie I don't even know where to begin. The story is not cohesive AT ALL. I guarantee that five minutes into the movie the average viewer will be scratching his/her head in confusion.Here's what I remember of the movie before I was bored into unconsciousness: A quasi-abusive dad chases some pre-teen sisters through a house but turns out to be not that abusive after all. In the next scene, the girls are about 15. They're driving with their parents and hit a deer.

Right up (or down) there with Toys and Jurassic Park 2 and The Phantom Menace.The premise sounded cool, some of the commercials looked semi-promising, but alas, the entire movie had about 30 seconds of neat shot-ness, and that was shown on the small screen's 30 second slot.If you want amateur writing, second-rate effects, ridiculous costumes, and an all-around snoozefest by all means watch it. The plot is recycled sci-fi fodder. Too bad too, because coming in I thought it would be bad but held out hope. It may be the worst movie I have ever seen, and I have seen a lot.

I'm a big fan of Patricia Hodge and Mariam Margolyes, so I watched this show when it came on A&E some years ago. The show was strange to say the least, but I gave it a chance because I liked these actresses. This has got to be one of the worst shows I've ever seen. I wouldn't watch it again and certainly wouldn't waste money on buying the video. The storyline of this TV version is ludicrous and just plain stupid! The "kicker" (pun intended) comes when Ruth has surgery done on her leg bones.

LCDR Tom Dodge, despite having a reputation among submariners as a renegade and maverick (*note to reader: Maverick does not mean "Tom Cruise". Maverick means "non-conformist". ), is actually an intelligence operative for the Vice Admiral of his submarine fleet. The Vice-Admiral is concerned about our old friends the Russians hosting yard sales with their old diesel fleets. Countries like Lybia, North Korea or Iraq would love to get their hands on this baby and slip a nuclear warhead into Norfolk Harbour or Mayport, Florida.

Christian Propaganda...Lots of fear mongering...This is not SciFi, this is ChriFi (Christian fiction).The movie started out OK but took a sharp Christian right turn. From then on it was all about god, jc, the holy bible and the devil . The ufo's are really just demonic deception to fool people in to believing that there is other intelligent life in the universe. Satan's idea is to trick you in to thinking that there could be more to life than what is in the bible.The abductions could be used to explain away the rapture.

I was attracted to this film by its offbeat , low-key , 'real life ' story line . That is all it was . I did a quick check of Wikipedia about the plot line of the film where it says , The movie is a mystery . But as you may have guessed , the movie makes sense in a lot of points . So I must be in the wrong movie . But here it goes . The movie begins with a young journalist, played by Aishwarya, being brutally murdered by the criminals on the street .

Well , I 've watched this movie for over 25 years now and it 's still almost as interesting as it was when I was a child. In my opinion the main reason to rewatch it is that if you didn 't see it, you can always rewatch the original version. You can also see all the little clips and special features that were added, as they are available on the DVD. However, the point I would like to bring to everyone 's attention today is that I do not own a VHS tape or DVD player.

This was the next to last film appearance by Jill Ireland , who died of cancer in 1990 after four decades in the business. She returned to play the role of her mother in the 1991 film adaptation of Margaret Mitchell's story, A Tree Grows in Brooklyn (1991) . She was replaced in the lead role by Dolly Levi , who had appeared as a child in the film's pre-release publicity. In May 2009, Irish, who was 83, made a surprise visit to a New York hospital where she underwent surgery for pancreatic cancer

In January 2012, she appeared on NBC's Last Man Standing.

Imagine an exploitive remake of The Defiant Ones with a black chick and a white chick attached to each other and you’ll get my reaction. No seriously, you’ll want to go have your own mind blown by the fact it’s happening, I mean, just look at her in that outfit, not to mention her face! What I’m getting at here is that, even if we all agreed that this remake of the original was the best of the series, I just can’t agree with the rest of the world. Why?

This movie baffled me. I could not get a grip on it. Thought I might be missing something. Glad to see that most of you agree with me. This isn't always the case (see my recent review of RE: Extinction).To expound upon the faults of this film any further would be a glorious waste of time...so I will...They're dressed like cowboys, but it's modern times, right? No? I don't get it??? When I picked up the box, I thought: ZOMBIE WESTERN! COOL!

Never mind the serious logic gaps , never mind the achingly cliche character portrayals , never mind the haphazard writing and plotting , there were some fine moments ( I am talking here of course , not about the film ) to be had. But all in all , I would not say that I felt the film would be greatly improved by the addition of the sequel. One of my favourite movies of this year , and one which I will not hesitate to watch again next year or the one after ! As for the cast , it was not bad really but not great .

I have no idea why people are so crazy about the show. It is so boring. The jokes are not even close to what we usually say funny. It's like, Alex say something that is not funny nor interesting and then suddenly there's a laughing sound background. My friend and I just looked at each other with blank look as if we asked each other, "What's so funny?!!". Seriously, every time we watched that show, you wouldn't hear any laughing or coughing. Just a blank look. So we stop watching it.

This is my first "awful" rating ever on IMDb and I couldn't think of a more deserving film to honor it with. I hoped for entertaining trash and found trash of the saddest, dullest kind. I found a film which no one can possibly have cared a bit about, including its creator. "Hell Ride", directed, written by and starring Larry "Friend of QT" Bishop, has a simple plot about a hidden treasure and a trio of keys, two bands of bikers and a gruesome murder in 1976 which has yet to be avenged.

I agree that this movie is about sex without any seduction or love . In fact , it makes sex look silly and pathetic , for me that’s a big reason for not liking it . There is just nothing to see in this movie . The only good thing is that you’ll have a good time watching it with your friends . The story itself is a little predictable , but I guess you have to like that , right ? 😀 Well , I didn’t 😦 😦 😦 It’s not the end of the story . There’s still more .

I ca n't understand why IMDb users would rate this movie 5.2/10 ? It really is great , very funny and not too much to the point. The only thing I wouldnt like it if it was longer

I was watching this movie and thought it had the potential to be an award winning film. I didn't know it had been released yet. There were a few times I didn't even bother to watch it, and I was pretty impressed when I did. It's very good! I really liked this film.

This movie does n't have any pretense at being great art , which is good . But it is a great piece of entertainment , because of a few things . This movie is based in a fictional world , so that it is believable . The characters have a great chemistry between them , which makes it easy to believe in all of them . But , there could be a lot of problems , because the movie doesn't do anything really well . I found it hard to take it seriously . But , I will admit , it is entertaining , because the characters are interesting .

The main problems of 'Saw ' are related to the tremendous script mistakes that only a uncritical spectator will justly point out. In my opinion, those errors are the consequence of an author who wanted to make a joke on his readers. I won't rehash all the mistakes I spotted, since the errors are all pretty well known, and they are usually explained in the comments. But there are two things I have found of interest, and I would be pleased if any of my readers could point out one or two mistakes in the film that are not covered in the comments.

Director Jeremiah Checheck who brought us big budget debacles like "The Avengers" and the remake of "Diabolique" has directed this ripoff of the Die Hard concept, done on - what looks like - a Blair Witch budget. A California nuclear reactor is overtaken by Arab terrorists. But - are you ready? - the terrorists aren't Arab; they're really disgruntled American soldiers masquerading as Arabs! We find out that they don't really intend to blow up the reactor just make a statement. We're not sure what the statement is but never mind.

I had expected a fairly straightforward R-rated graphic, sexual, crude teen-comedy when I sat down to see this... it turned out to be fairly accurate... only it was far more sick and disgusting than I would have thought. I don't know if the director/writer Gregory Poirier is sick or deeply messed up sexually, but I doubt that a normal person could have made a movie like this. I could probably have taken it if it was just that, if the only thing that was wrong was it was that it required a tough stomach... but it isn't.

then the second half of this movie is hard to follow. I got the first part with the Spanish Inquistion, but the film skipped many years forward with the French ruling Spain. The movie does little to fill you in on what happened, and I don't remember much about it. So, the movie gets confusing then. The movie begins when Ines, daughter of a rich merchant, is accused of Judiasm by the church, specifically Father Lorenzo. She is put to the Question and forced to confess. Even her family's wealth can not buy her out of prison.

This movie was made on a relatively small budget ( 10-20 million dollars ? ) with almost no promotion at all. I think everyone involved knew the film had potential but chose not to go to the lengths of promoting and marketing it. The only reason anyone would come out and say they loved the film would be because they knew someone was going to watch it, right? Wrong! I watched the entire film on Youtube and was blown away by its quality, the acting, the acting from all of the supporting actors. It’s not a bad film.

This is a magnificent , and in many ways impressive film . I saw it on TV as a little kid , and it took me ages to really see the beauty of its filmic presentation . The film was also in English with no dubbing , which is a pity , but it really works in the film . The music is awesome . The story is interesting and the film is interesting . And the casting is good . What made the film great for me, and which I found particularly interesting, was not the story itself , and which was not the music, but its editing .

This movie was included in the Six Wives of Henry VIII BBC miniseries DVD . I loved those six movies. I saw them all except for Henry IV. __________________"There are two sides to every coin; there are three sides to every question!" "Who is your daddy?" "Who's my daddy?" "I want my daddy." "Who's my daddy?" “It's all right, Mrs. Hargreaves.”

__________________
I think I need a little time to collect myself. I’m looking for a place to go.

eXistenZ is an exploration of reality and virtual reality , wherein characters run from realm to realm , landscape to landscape in search of answers to their real-time quests. The player is able to control the game world by turning and scaling the environment. The gameplay is similar to many other first-person shooters in the genre, which makes it enjoyable to play but may be considered a niche game. Rez is a platform game. The game was developed on the platform Xbox One, and the game was later ported to the PlayStation 4, Windows 8, and Linux on Steam.

"Carlito's Angels" is a spoof of "Charlie's Angels" that is not afraid to spoof even itself at times, however that does not mean that the film is above criticism by the viewers as well - it is amateurish and juvenile (I think "fast-motion" stopped being funny around 1914). The assaulting rap music often drowns out the dialogue, and the film feels longer than it is, even though it runs barely over an hour! The girls themselves are hot & adorable, with wonderful lean bodies, and even though they never get naked, their outfits leave little to the imagination.

A friend of mine loves tacky horror films so I often get to see low budget stuff like this . I am not trying to give anything away and all I am doing is giving my opinion as I am in love with the film. If anyone knows more than I am sure I have seen this movie before then please tell me your experience. The plot is pretty good . A young man goes to a creepy house and then ends up being in trouble . The house is creepy, creepy, creepy and it has a killer at it. The way they kill is good as well .

I knew it was going to be awful but not this awful ! ! , as it 's one of the few times i've actually watched a movie where it felt like the story actually happened. I was actually really excited for it to begin as this is the first movie i have actually ever seen where i felt like i was actually there. For those curious, the first thing that happened after i watched the movie was when i was in the shower after i did my own thing and my friend was trying to wake me up.

That is what this movie is . Good God the special effects suck in this movie . It is difficult to tell what is going on on screen with this movie . If you like the story then the story might be good . If you don't like the story then maybe you are better off to go to see a film that might have better effects . The special effects in the film just sucks. The only good thing is that this movie might not have much action but that's not saying much. The story is alright but the special effects are the reason this movie sucked.

I feel terribly sorry! Where the Lubitsch-pic was enchanting, marvelous, full of spirit and elegance, this one here is only - colored! Lana looks like 51 (in fact she was 31 at that time, but obviously depressive) and tries to play a shy and dull girlie. Think of Jeanette McDonald, who gave the role of the widow a double-faced depth by "playing" with Count Danilo. That Lana had to play an operetta although unable to sing - crazy! She only sings one song - the title role of an Lehar-operetta, that is really funny!

I sat down through 2 hours of pure boredom. I look here on IMDB, even though it is not high on the list, it is in the top 250. I was a little surpised. Even though, yes. I am very impressed with Robin and Matt's acting abilities, they still didn't save the movie. I'm not sure what I really didn't like about the movie. Maybe it's because I dispise math. Maybe I'm not too much for dreary talking for 2 hours. Even though I loved "American Beauty", but that was it.

Set mostly in the back streets of Toronto NG is a dark , mysterious journey that takes the viewer into the minds of a young man and woman ( Vern and Sarah ) , each of whom has a fascination with riddles and a disastrous incident in their past . Fine dialogue and first-rate casting propel this low key, noirish journey into the girl's search for the meaning behind the word puzzles that keep appearing in her life. Aided by her , anything but enthusiastic, male friend, the two of them reach the end of their quest , but with a price to be paid.

I saw this late at night on a minor channel and I put it on expecting a laugh or two, only to be disappointed by the quality. I know, I'm a sucker! And so it was that, in the wee morning hours, as I sat in front of my television set, I couldn't get through a second episode without a laugh. It didn't help that there were four episodes in the series. I was just glad to hear I wasn't going to have to wait that long to see the rest.

New guy at an armored car company gets talked into becoming involved in an armored car heist by his fellow drivers in order to score some quick cash. The problem is that they really don't have much of a plan and when complications arise things turn deadly.Fast moving popcorn action film has a great deal going with it. First off the film is under 90 minutes so the film doesn't really have the time to bog down in plot. It cranks everything up and just goes. Next the film has some great action sequences so one moves towards the edge of ones seat.

This is an excellent , little known movie . Tom Selleck does an outstanding job of acting in this movie , I can’t deny it . The whole film was great , as expected . However I felt a bit disloyal to some of the actors that did not get all of the screen time . I don’t know how others felt , I really didn’t . It was a great experience . There was an excellent cast in this film , but the only two who really made it are Tom Selleck and John C. McGinley , who has an amazing performance .

That is the answer . The question is : What is the single reason to watch this movie ? I am going to tell you my personal reasons and not a summary. The story is very very good. There are so many good things in this movie. The acting is very good as well. There are so many great things in it that I can't even remember all of it. So I will tell you all about it. First , the plot

There's a very good story in this movie. I don't really know why I am doing this.

I really like this film because of all the stars and the dancing and the story that goes along with it. It’s fun. It’s interesting. It’s cool. And I’d really like to read the script because, you know, I just don’t like it. You know, I love the book. But the movie, it just doesn’t grab me. Do you have to read it? No. No I don’t have to read it. I could read it and I would like to, but I don’t think I need to.

I loved so much last Bellocchio's movie, the masterpiece "L'Ora di Religione". It had a great screenplay, great actors (well, have to say Castellitto is so much greater than others), a brillant use of lights for a great cinematography.Well, Buongiorno Notte is a different story. Ridiculous screenplay erupting tons of morals (and we could speak weeks about politics, you know we are italians...). Poor cinematography (it's too simple representing '70s dark years with dark colors and dark lights, do some efforts more peoples!!!!).

This is an excellent, little known movie. Tom Selleck does an outstanding job of acting in this movie, with the Japanese 'Clint Eastwood'. I'd love to see if this movie has come out on DVD yet, there are some spots that clearly have been cut. Hiroku (Tom's love interest) has clearly had some parts chopped. It would be interesting to see more of Japan in the film. The baseball sequences are far and away the most realistic of any baseball movie, I'm quite sure most of the actors were current or former baseball players.

I have been watching movies from i think last 10 years , and I must say that i never felt so bad for the villain or the hero when it came to killing the person who has given you this gift. The story is great, the music is amazing, and the acting is just plain bad. I can’t stand when it’s so obvious to everyone that something terrible is going to happen, and I’ve seen all of those movies where they end up shooting each other off and then the hero gets shot too, which is what happens to me and some other people.

I saw this at the BendFilm Festival Friday amid an unsettled crowd of people , not helped by a poor sound quality. "We're going to send a letter to you," says a guy who appears to be in his 30s. I ask what his intentions are. He tells me he's a film producer. We talk some more. It turns out he's working with his friend at Bend. A friend of his at Bend is trying to create an app for the festival that will allow fans to vote for what they want to see.

I normally don't like romantic films, but I love this film very much. The story is really touching, and the ending is very appropriate. I feel I really care for many characters in this film. I feel I can feel their feelings. While most romantic films always make me feel detached and bored, this one completely makes me feel involved, starting from the scene of Capshaw running along the beach with Scott until the ending scene. I want to rate this film 11 out of 10, because I want to give an extra one point for the ending.

I am writing this review simply because I am a huge fan of the book, Prozac Nation, and was appalled by the film.I think that if you hadn't read the book, you would have been lost watching the film, as it provided no real back story to Wurtzel's depression. There was no real mention of her childhood (her relationship with her father, her experiences at summer camp, her first therapists (in fact, the film gives the impression that she has never been in therapy until Dr. Sterling)...).

Its my favourite film because there 's so much going on that you do n't see at first and so much that you get excited about. I love the characters, the plot, the way it ties into all the other things. This is just a wonderful film and it is so much fun to listen to the soundtrack and it's great to see it on the big screen too. I have no problems with the soundtrack. I love a great soundtrack. I don't listen to my music for a while before I go out and get the soundtrack.

I only comment on really very good films and on utter rubbish. My aim is to help people who want to see great films to spend their time - and money - wisely.I also want to stop people wasting their time on garbage, and want to publicize the fact that the director/producer of these garbage films can't get away with it for very long. We will find out who you are and will vote with out feet - and wallets.This film clearly falls into the garbage category.The director and writer is John Shiban. It's always a bad sign when the writer is also the director.

This is the worst movie I have seen to date. 85 minutes of utterly bad acting,(half the cast seem to be suffering from Asperger's syndrome) ghastly wigs, strange make-up (including tide lines around wig areas) and holier than thou characters with holier than thou dialogue that makes you want to puke. One comical aspect of this film, if you have the patience to watch it, is the sheer overwhelming number of costume changes the unfortunate cast appear in from scene to scene - was this film backed by a catalogue manufacturer of desperately dodgy pastel casual wear?

This film has recently been televised by Turner Classic Movies. It may have been considered racy in its time, and may have made money, but even the most die-hard Jane Russell fan will find it hard to sit through this dreck.There are many movie musicals from the 1950s which can withstand the test of time, even though dated by current standards, but which can still be enjoyed because of good music or dancing or an amusing plot. "The French Line", however, fails at all of these aspects.It doesn't matter that Russell was a fine singer when she is given lousy vocal material.

Great 1980s Comic Strip comedy set in the South West of England . It is a tale of sex , love and murder with the stars of the 1960s and 1970s in it . Some of the action is set in the present day but there are plenty of references to the 1970s and 1980s so it makes for good comedy. The characters are the main focus in this comic strip as they try to navigate between their past and present but they also have a life outside of the comic strip as they struggle to cope with some very modern problems .

Julie Delpy stars in this horrific film about a sadistic relationship between a father and a daughter in France of the 14th Century. The film attempts to shatter the romantic chivalry image of the heroic medieval knight, by showing a rather dreary image of the period, defined by psychological dysfunction, and violence. The movie opens with a child, François, growing up in the shadow of the Hundred Years' War, told by his father to keep his mother safe and to wait for his return. François takes action when he discovers his mother with a lover in bed.

Animated shorts just don't get much better than this wonderful Canadian film. This short feature is dripping with Canadian references, and so, this film will probably be appreciated by Canadians most of all. But the basic story is universal, and it is told lovingly by writer Roch Carrier. It is a hilarious story that I have known for quite sometime, and I was recently fortunate enough to see it again, so I simply HAD to write a hearty recommendation for it. This is a masterpiece, and a must-see whether or not you are Canadian.

Take your video camera , turn out all the lights in your house and film people running around with flashlights in their hair. Why do that to your camera and then turn on your camcorders to shoot them? The answer is easy: You have a camera phone. And that is what they are.
