And when your phone goes off to record a video, you don’t have to worry about what it takes to keep the camera in good working order or how to keep it from freezing up during a freeze/thaw transition.

Apparently the writer and director of this direct-to-DVD slasher movie is a fan of Friday 13th and other summer camp movies. So naturally, I'm surprised when I read this line from the title sequence. Why? Well, one thing that makes me curious is the title of the first episode. In my research, it seems that it might have been named "Thirteen Days" or something of that nature. I think it is pretty obvious what the name is trying to tell us about the story. But in any case, it's not surprising that the title was not originally chosen.

I thought this series was going to be another fun , action series with some dynamic plots and great performances. But I was wrong, it turns out the story isn't all that dynamic, at least in the first episodes, as I can't tell you much of what happens in episodes 2-4, but it is the second half of the series that has some very good story telling and plot. The series started with a very strong concept that I have never seen before, a group of aliens, who can control people with their mind's ability.

I 've been writing hardboiled crime fiction for a number of years now . When a writer develops a story that they want to be published, whether it be in the form of short stories, novels, or collections, they often look for the right publication to handle the distribution and handling of those materials for them . In my writing, I try to be a true believer in the freedom of the publishing industry so when I find that I have a story I really want to be published and that it has a chance to be published by a publication, I want it to get as much attention as it can .

The story line of a man 's love for an innocent baby he finds with a malformed face and on the verge of losing. A father, a mother, an older brother and the father-in-law. The movie follows the lives of three people who were in their twenties when they realised their daughter could be their daughter. One of them falls for the father, who is married. And the other two have had their own lives in which they don't need anyone else. They are two people who love their children and have to come to terms with them.

If a copy of this movie fell into the wrong hands , the world would be in grave danger . This movie was made for kids to enjoy and is the only one I have seen that deals with the human rights. I’m not sure I would even watch the first two minutes or so since I’m afraid I may not get the message or the relevance of what is being shown. However, if you do watch the entire movie you’ll probably see the human rights in it, and not just in a few scenes.

You might think that a show about regular teens with superpowers would be interesting , but it 's far from it. The series revolves around the teen characters' (mostly teenage) adventures with the powers that came with them and how they deal with those powers. It's pretty much the opposite of the TV shows Teen Titans and Teen Titans GO! The premise of the series is that the teens get to experience all sorts of powers, but that it's not as big of a surprise as you might think. However, this isn't the case when you realize how much those powers do to a person.

I was looking forward to watching this film and was therefore extremely disappointed when I found it to be complete garbage. This film starts off by showing a scene from the early stages of human evolution. A group of primitive humans come into a cave looking for food and are attacked by the animals. After being bitten by a snake they try to run away but are chased into the cave. The animals come after them but don't take any prisoners. While the humans flee into the cave they are followed by the animals who catch the escapees.

Grosse Pointe Blank was really quite a below average film . Its hit man theme is very dry and is kind of a copout. The cast of the film are all quite average. The film is not very interesting. It doesn’t make any real statement and has a very small budget so is not that exciting. The only good things I can say for the film are that the actors are well cast, good performances, and that the film is in the form of a no frills cop film. If you can find it for under $30 you should be able to pick it up.

*****Spoiler or two, not that is matters******Two things stand out about this movie. First is it's been titled both "Bruno" and "The Dress Code," and if you've seen this movie you'll catch the irony in that.Second is it's addressing issues completely off the wall. The adventures of a grade school cross dresser isn't something that there was a crying need for a movie about, nor a topic that I think most people would be interested in.

I was amazed at the quality of this film , particularly after seeing pictures of the barely adult director - and I say that as someone who has worked with her. It's not just her directing abilities, but a whole lot of skill that goes into the production and production design that make the movie so good. I also love the acting and the way she goes from child actor to seasoned professional within the film. The only issue that I had was with the ending, but that's probably more a fault on the writer's part.

One should have the right to expect from people who make a film about the Second Coming and the Third Testament, that they had read the other two, or at least knew a little more about them than miracles and Judgement Day. This film contains absolutely nothing of relevance for viewers who are interested in Jesus, religion or philosophy -- there is only the standard British social realism with guttural dialects and plump characters in pubs.Actually, good candidates for a real Third Testament have been published several times - like "A Course in Miracles" or "Conversations with God".

This was a sordid and dreary mess. I needed a shower when it was over. It goes something like this- some socialites are murdered and a woman homicide detective is assigned to the case. She discovers that the victims belonged to an underground lesbian society, and she befriends an associate of the group who may have relevant information. Since the detective is an attractive woman, of course she is horny and intrigued (which reveals much about Hollywood and its psychosis about women). What's surprising is that none of this is very sexy or interesting, just depressing and yucky.

I thought that this movie might be a good spoof, or at least a good independent comedy like Friday. Instead it was more like something someone in high school would make with their parents' camcorder. It wasn't just the low budget that makes this film bad (many great films have been made on a low budget), it is simply a bad movie and it wasn't even bad enough to be good camp. Case in point: for the first ten minutes of the movie nothing happens except the 3 main characters sit in their room smoking dope, put on their makeup, and then answer a phone call.

Taken the idea out of a true diplomatic incident `` The Wind and the Lion '' is a very good book by a true author. I think it is very true. I think the events of the book have the real story. You know what they did. You feel what they did. You see what they saw. I think if you took out the bad parts and put in real good parts of what they did in the book the book would come out very well. I think the book is very interesting.

I love pop culture, but I was a little apprehensive when I first heard about this. Then, I seen an episode, and I LOVE IT! I was a little upset when I found out that Christopher Eccelson would no longer be playing Doctor Who. He was probably the best one they've had. He fits the character so well. It's sad to see him go. I really don't think that the new guy is going to pull off the doctor as well as Eccelson.I think everyone can overlook the cheesy effects in some spots and the creatures, such as the darleks.

When I first heard about "Greek," I figured I would watch it because it sounded ridiculous. Another of ABC Family's so-bad-they're-almost-good shows. But tuning in with a friend from college found us both enjoying the pilot episode a lot more than we had expected.As a member of a Greek society, I can say that a lot of the stereotypes that are brought up here are ones that come up almost every time someone starts talking about the sororities and fraternities on a campus. And are also very fun to play with just on are own, let alone to watch on a TV screen.

This movie is one of my all time favorite movies and is what made me a lifelong Nicolas Cage fan. Back in the mid-80's I taped this movie (when VCR's were impossible to do this with!!) and would watch it over and over. Nicolas Cage is just brilliant here. And, he looks wonderful and has no affecting "acting-isms" (see "Peggy Sue Got Married" to know what I mean about that!!). I measure all his performances against this one. He was so perfectly cast as the cool punk guy with the edgy friends.

Dear reader, Watch out! This movie is not really a movie, though its creators have the impertinence to call it so. If you have not been warned about its content, here it goes: the film is simply a sequence of imagines which flow continually and are trying to transmit a certain feeling, concept. They could be called, therefore, symbols. The images are accompanied by a soundtrack, it's purpose being to create atmosphere as well. However, the images the director has chosen can only transmit feelings to an American audience, because they are, in an overwhelming number, American icons.

I will commend it in only one respect.. it was innovative. Innovative doesn't mean it's a good film, it means that it can give you an idea of what you can take and implement in your own films.The simple plot is.. well.. simple. I got to the point where I didn't care if they destroy the building or not. If I had to hear that girl's annoying giggle one more time, I swear I would hurl the DVD out the window. And there's also the protagonist. They try to make him lovable, but he's a freakin pervert!

No music. No stupid masala. A reasonably realistic portrayal of the police system in India and based on a real "encounter" specialist in India, Daya Nayak. That is Ab Tak 56 (56 symbolises how many criminals the lead "Sadhu Agashe" has killed" - well you already know that bit)Brilliance exudes Nan Patekar in the role as a relaxed and calculating Indian cop. THe one liners are just hilarious. The plot though slightly predictable on review, is intriguing all the same. Another one of the films from Ram Gopal Vermas The Factory.

After seeing NAKED CITY and NIGHT AND THE CITY (which is still my favorite Dassin) I was more than excited to watch his "Masterpiece" (O-Word Criterion) RIFIFI.Now i am a little bit disappointed about the story.So I have at least these five questions in my mind:1. In the final Countdown Louis Grutter shot from the inside a house the main Character Tony le Stéphanois. He couldn't know if he is still alive or not, but he didn't care about it and ran directly after it outside the house (with the money) to reach his car.

Wealthy horse ranchers in Buenos Aires have a long-standing no-trading policy with the Crawfords of Manhattan , but what happens when they start to trade their horses for human goods? In a recent interview with BBC News , Mr. Crawfurds explains his trade policy in the hopes that it could one day be extended to other horse farms around the world. The video is part of an effort to make the case that horses don’t have to trade to feed themselves and that we can support them instead. I don’t have to tell you that horses can’t eat, in fact they are incredibly delicious.

I have a 4yr old daughter, and before this movie she was all about the Disney princesses, now she watched this movie and all she can talk about is Princess Genevieve, and all her sisters. I definitely recommend this movie for all young girls. This movie is one of the best from the Barbie collection. It shows all the good values that any mother would love to encourage on there little girls. With the great songs and dance moves, it gets my daughter up and trying to mimic the moves. The extras are also good, one even works on how good your memory is.

`` Wagons East '' is widely known as John Candy 's last movie , as he died on the set of the second movie, The Wedding Singer, at the end of October . The movie is a sequel to his 1971 comedy, Candy's Way , about a family of gay couples . It was his first movie as a big-name star , as well as the first film that featured his son , John Lasseter . The Wedding Singer , which is also a sequel , has grossed $4.5 million worldwide . It is the most successful sequel in Candy 's film franchise .

Hello again , I have been thinking about this movie all my life . I saw it when I was a kid in the theater as a child . It was a big movie with a big story . I saw it about 3 years ago when I was going to a friend house . The story was very well done . It was also one of those films where you wanted to know how everything worked out . I went back to the theater one time when I was around 10 years old to see it again . I remember that movie so very well .

In a nutshell the movie is about a gang war in the 1950 's . Leon , the leader of the gang , is about to start a war with the cops , who are trying to take him down because he is seen to be a gangster in the neighborhood . They decide to rob a safe house . It is being guarded by the police . The safe house is owned by a middle-aged man , played by a young man , played by . The man is played by , a very young man at that , he was about 18 and he is about 25 and they both act a lot like real teenagers .

Okay so there were the odd hole in the plot you could drive a zeppelin through , but how well can you drive through one and not break it? The plot has a lot going for it , and it's not the only plot it's the only one I could think of, there's something for everyone here, especially for the fanboy/nerd looking at it. * * SPOILERS * * I rented `` Tesis '' ( or `` Thesis '' in English ) on the internet. I was very scared to rent a copy since I had heard of it before. I finally decided to read it on my own. The whole story revolves around a young couple, who have an affair with each other and leave their home in an attempt to escape. After much time and efforts, they are finally able to escape to Greece and live their life happily once again. I liked the storyline quite well as the characters are all well developed and there is enough action to keep you interested.

Filmmaker Bryan Forbes , who once displayed a light , sardonic touch with beguiling material such as `` Whistle Down the Wind , `` has now turned his attention to films with a more serious theme. And, in his words, he's trying to "bring back that old-fashioned sense of the movie-making process where a story can really be done right." Not surprisingly, he's trying to do that here. But before he does, we should take a moment to thank Forbes, one of America's most respected film makers for many years.

Are we allowed to interfere with our fellowmen 's everyday 's life ? Is it possible to intrude upon their private lives without violating their rights? What are the repercussions of violating people's freedom ? What if the person is elderly or handicapped or a minority group? Is it not better to be careful? The right to privacy is a basic human right. People should be treated as individuals in society, not as members of a class. People should not be denied their basic constitutional rights simply for being born in the wrong family or neighborhood.

When I first watched this film, I thought that it would be rally good, because it featured my favourite actor of all time. I 'd like to point out these excellent points in favor of this movie : # 1 Angelina Jolie sex scenes are not only the hottest ever in Hollywood ; # 2 This movie is the highest rated ever on IMDb ; # 3 Even though a few scenes in the movie are just a bunch of sex scenes, Jolie did give a lot of good performances , including one of the most realistic body double we've ever seen, and we love it when women do the same. Before I start to tear apart this movie , mark you -- I LOVE THE SCARLET PIMPERNEL . That story alone is enough for me to be completely in awe of the director . The movie has its own special place in my heart . It's a great piece of filmmaking and I can't wait for the Blu-ray and DVD versions . Here's a look at an exclusive look at Scarlet. It is being released as the first ever Blu-ray release to feature Scarlet as the main character. It will hit retailers on October 15, 2010.

This is the only movie that I can think of where after it ended, I was seething with anger at the waste of money and time on the part of myself and everyone involved in making it. No wonder Alan Moore refused to have anything to do with V for Vendetta (a phenomenal film) after this debacle.It's not bad in an entertaining way, like Showgirls. It's bad in a way that makes you want to claw your eyes out. Plot holes the size of planets. The worst script in memory. Horrible acting by decent actors.

Just a few words : it 's a good thing George A Romero is still among us cause if he is not, then he really is not. I have been following the story of the 'Rome 2' and have been saying for years that "it 's a great movie, but it is not that great of an improvement" but now I believe it is true... This game has a great story, with great characterizations, great characters, great writing and great voice acting, but it just happens to be an even better action-adventure game that is just as bad as all the bad that comes with.

For reasons I cannot begin to fathom, Dr. Lorenzo Cameron (George Zucco) begins injecting wolf's blood into his dim-witted handyman, Petro (Glenn Strange). The result  Petro is transformed into a hideous (as hideous as someone with a bad wig and pointy teeth can be) killer beast. Dr. Cameron uses Petro to get his revenge against those in the scientific community who scoffed at and ridiculed his ideas (and why wouldn't they, Dr. Cameron's nuttier than a fruitcake).Overall, The Mad Monster is one dull and poorly made Poverty Row thriller.

My mistake for thinking this was a serious war-is-hell movie prior to seeing it. That all ended seconds into the film when the "MTV" logo appeared. It might as well been called "National Lampoon's Sexy-N-Loose." And it did play to the "MTV" crowd; the movie that followed those comical first few seconds played like the music videos they used to play 40+ years ago. At least Disney was smart enough to ship its Rated R stuff over to Touchtone and allowed us to take it seriously. Okay, I'm being harsh; it wasn't that bad of a film.

What a waste of talent -- although it appears that Crudup in real life is a lot more like the vapid, self- absorbed, character-less character he portrays in this disappointing movie.In art, sometimes the empty spaces reveal more than the painted or created content. What this movie reveals is the unconsciousness and the contradictory/competing, unresolved impulses/consciousness of the film's director/writer. It unintentionally shows the LACK of awareness that a truly evolved, deeply aware character should have and be tormented about in order to deserve audience empathy or sympathy OR the lack of which is used to serve as a cautionary tale to the audience.

I was very excited to see Rock Star because I am a big fan of Mark Wahlberg's. I was surprised to have liked it more than I originally thought I would. The script did leave something to be desired, but the movie's performances made up for it. There were a few moments when visions of Spinal Tap came rushing back, and I can't help but think this movie would have been even better as a mocumentary. But, I digress.Wahlberg continues to demonstrate his talent, as he plays with believability an ordinary guy whose biggest dream comes true.

I loved this show . I think the first time I tried rocky road ice cream was due to this show . There was something so refreshing about the idea of an ice cream maker and I loved the ice cream flavor in this show. I'm an ice cream addict and I've only tried rocky road for about three months now. I've made a few different flavors. And I like all the flavors but I think the best one I've tried was the chocolate mint flavor. I'll post pictures of my flavors soon. It's so good!

This is another of Robert Altman 's underrated films ( let 's be honest , the only movie he 's made that doesn 't deserve being called a underrated ), and one of my all time favourites . the film centres around a group of kids at the end of one of the worst times in their lives , they have just lost their father , but are still very attached to him . they try to rekindle the friendship they had when they were younger , however , this time they find themselves facing the fact that there 's nothing much to keep them together , and they have no one to talk to .

The VHS cover for The Evil Below makes it look like a cool underwater horror flick. Sadly it's closer to a boring adventure flick and has no real horror elements. It starts off with some divers who get attacked and we see a bit of blood, but that's the only blood in the entire film.The Evil Below isn't the worst around, but for a horror film it is tediously boring. The acting is decent and to be honest the only thing that keeps you watching is the developing romance between the two leads.

I saw this movie last night at the Berlinale as part of the competition. It was billed as the "world premiere" of the movie by the host (though it seems that people here have seen it previously). I have to say, I still don't really know what to make of the movie. I am unfamiliar with the book, purchased the ticket only two hours beforehand and had only limited knowledge of the plot. Not enough, as it seems, as I had problems getting into the movie. The movie is sometimes being narrated by Jones' character but somehow that perspective did not fit for me.

This is the best direct-to-DVD effort from Van Damme that I have seen yet . Van Damme plays a border patrol agent who gets a call for a man wanted for the murder of his friend. As the story begins, we see several men looking for their friend, but all are killed in the ensuing firefight. After the death of Van Damme's friend, he takes the blame for the death, but we quickly learn that his friend is not involved. This is a great film, as it really shows how the killing of these men really affects the lives of the police officers who are protecting them.

I'm just starting to explore the so far wonderful world of monsieur Ozon. I've seen only 4 films so far, and with the last one in the row it hit me that all of them were in fact about lonely women and their actions. Not a single non-lonely female character out of 12, and all of them bring heavy impact of surroundings.This film is probably the only one (out of four) where this impact is for good.The gay theme is an almost standard part of background for Ozon's films, so it doesn't grab the accent (although the looks of the characters might).

This movie was probably one of the worst movies I 've seen in a very long time . A friend who I used to go to the theater with had to put his wife on the list due to her mental issues. When the movie came out she was still upset by this and she refused to buy tickets. She said that there was too much blood in the movie, and she was not into it because she was already in love with a different person. Now that she has gotten over the movie and she loves her husband, she has to get the movie from the theatre again.

I see that C. Thomas Howell is; I do not recall seeing him in any movies since the 1980s.In just a few words: what a very big disappointment. I give some low budget movies a chance, but this one started out lame. Inappropriate . The PG rating that this movie gets is yet another huge misstep by the MPAA . Whale Rider should get a PG rating , that would be a big step towards making the film more accessible . . A PG would allow it to run more in the theaters . I can’t believe this is the fourth time that the film has gotten this rating. The first time I saw it was the first time I saw the PG-13 rating on my VHS tape. The second time, I saw it on TV in Canada .

The Bridge At Remagen contains some of the most preposterous war time screenplay I 've ever seen . Aside from its lack of any pretense or pretense to realism , it does have a good dose of absurdity to it . It's all over the place and you end up hating it . The Bridge At Remagen had me laughing my brains out . That said , I will not be seeing the movie . If it does happen , it will be my last . I can not believe that I am still alive and that this will be the last I 'll be seeing of War .

What a shocker . For starters , I could n't stand the constant screaming and noisy panicking all the time I was playing . I couldn't do anything with the music either . Jeff Leroy wanted to makes fun of Scientology so built a horror movie around a cult similar to it. The twist is that instead of frail old L. Ron Hubbard as the cult leader, there's a centuries old space monster who turns his followers into vampires. Our hero is a dirty living college student who is doing research into the occult. His landlord is an attractive blonde who tries to get him to clean up his life with the help of the cult. It doesn't take him long to figure out that she's only after one thing: his blood.

A terrible deception: controversial film, winner of the Teddy in Berlin 2003, Mil nubes de paz turned out to be a fiasco. The actors are all reciting (well, they are not exactly actors); the film tried to be a high bet but ends up being a doubtful bet: it stays in the superficiality of two guys kissing and a guy whose lover is gone; it has no purpose: nothing to do with the homo-sexuality presented in other films (e.g. Before Night Falls (2000) by Julian Schnabel).

I 'm not a big fan of musicals , but I was always enamored of Ms. Hayworth 's looks , which I'm sure are similar. I really like the character , however . She has some good character development , and she seems to have a good role in the plot and is not a typical role for the actress. I would see this as a role for a more talented actress , but I don't think it will go down as well as I would like. Overall I give it a B , but not a perfect one.

I think that a lot of friends of people who acted in this thing must 've come on and rated this. It was a lot of fun to watch. It would probably have been best if it was a quickie and a quickie then a full length. Ik know it is impossible to keep all details of a book in a movie. But this movie has changed nearly everything without any reason. Furthermore many changes have made the story illogical. As I sit back after watching Wong Kar-wai 's 1994 movie Ashes of Time  more specifically the 2008 re-edit thereof  I feel I've seen something I'll always remember: a movie I thought I knew, only to realize that it had actually been seen by many, many others I hadn't even considered myself. I thought I knew what it was; I thought it was a movie that would be a good idea for my collection. Well, the movie wasn't that great. It was a bit of a mixed bag of ideas that didn't end up coming together.

That is what this movie is. Good God the special effects suck in this movie. It is difficult for anything to suck more than this movie's plot, but the special effects manage to pull it off. I read Angels and Demons about 3 years ago, and I can honestly say to is one of the few books that I couldn't put down while reading.The movie however was pretty much what i expected, a lot of action, with somewhat of a mystery storyline. Don't be fooled by the plot out-line as it is described on the cover (at least the Swedish version). The story on this seems rather interesting, with speculative hints. If you had asked me how the movie was throughout the film , I would have told you it was good but I don't see it being any better then the first one. Anyone who knows anything about evolution wouldn't even need to see the film to say "fake". "it's never been disproved" also is a weak argument. Where do I begin ? Let me say that -- after having watched the entire film and the special features -- I feel like I am watching the beginning of a much better story than anything I've seen in the past. In my opinion, this is a story that should never end. A few months ago, on a Sunday afternoon, I left my apartment and drove into downtown Toronto. I had only gone a few blocks when I realized that I didn't have a destination and was lost. There was only one street I could take, but it didn't matter.

A good movie for horse enthusiasts and most others. It's a horse racing movie, and it's a "little man gets his chance" movie, and it's a "how far would you go?" movie. Walter Mattau once again proves his adaptability as an actor. He fits right in as Lloyd Bourdelle, a Louisiana Cajun horse bum. This movie gives you a rare screen glimpse of Lousiana Cajun horse drag racing. He has a young quarter horse who is a top racing prospect. "had nothing but a filling station and a good horse."

Wow ... just ... wow . There are a lot of reviews on this movie already but I wanted to add my own review since it was released on DVD. It was a nice movie to watch in the theater, and it has some great songs in it. I would highly recommend watching this movie if you want to learn more about the Star Wars universe. I saw this for my son and he said it was one of the most enjoyable movies he had watched in a long time, even if I was a little surprised to see that it was an R rated film.

OK , if you are a fan of Mystery Science Theater 3000 and love to mock movies , then you might want to get a copy of the DVD of their first movie , A Bug’s Life, that you can rent from this link , it’s worth it to watch it , you might find it very funny because it is the first one in the series and it’s an old film , the only difference in it is the animation of the characters , the story , the setting , and the actors that are playing the role of the main characters .

Never having read or seen the Bard 's original work , I ca n't begin to compare this work to it's predecessor . I have read some of his poetry and it is rather good , but not what I wish it to be . This work is a disaster in my opinion ! I have never read or seen the original work , so I cannot say as to how it compares . If this is the best Bard's work , and there is no other way to judge it , then why did it take 3 centuries for someone to write an original version , and not a translation ?

Would be promising if it were a student film. Never seems to know where it's going next, as if they decided on each next scene as they were making the film. As a result, much repetition and a deadening pace. There's an absolutely confusing procedure by which the ghosts affect people in this world: it involves the internet, phone calls, a computer science experiment, a suspicious grad student, withdrawn behavior, red rooms, dark stains, and _then_ suicides. Good luck figuring out the connections, or when a character is a ghost yet or just acting strangely.

Wow,this is in my opinion the best sitcom since Friends. If you have had a crap day just sit yourself down with a beer (if you are old enough that is.if not a root beer will have to do.) and watch a couple of episodes,it's the perfect recipe for happiness.The thing I like most is that everybody in the show is very funny and they all have fantastic comedy timing. After a while you become attached to the characters and really care about them. I think the secret to the shows success is that they have an enviable life.

There were only two redeeming features about this movie ; the beauty of Bucharest and its architecture , and the beauty of the ladies. We all are lucky that we got a chance to see this lovely movie, but it would be great to have more films like these. It was a surprise for me and my wife to see this movie in cinemas, when we were lucky to catch it in the cinemas of Bucharest, a beautiful city near our residence. The movie was very interesting and beautiful. One of the most interesting things about this movie is the narration of the actress.

It was so disjointed - it seemed to jump from place to place - and the `` thief '' was so obvious, I didn't know what I was supposed to do." "But, by the end, I found it very funny." "It's a shame he was killed." "I do have to say, it's nice to know that someone else is laughing." "Well, now you can say it with me." "Well, now I feel like an idiot." "And the best part - the thief was my friend."

When I finally got around to seeing this film recently, it turned out to be exactly what it looked like to me at first glance... yet another Hollywood CG/live-action rehash of an established cartoon franchise. Nothing special or memorable whatsoever. Designed in every way possible to appeal to very young children and very immature adults, making heavy use of comedic devices such as farts, poo-eating, and the size of Theodore's butt.This film would bother me a lot less if it weren't such an obvious step down for the Chipmunks. Even their characters I found were changed for the worse for this movie.

What a travesty of movie ratings injustice - a 2.1 on the IMDb scale as I write this . Folks, the IMDb's rating for this film is rated R. The only reason you'll find the film's IMDb rating is because the movie itself doesn't pass that particular cut-off. That IMDb rating is only for its trailer, which I don't think qualifies as a "rating" because trailers should not be used for ratings. I have no idea what this movie is. I have no idea what is in it. All I know is, this movie was terrible.

Alright ! A sci-fi/horror/action B-hybrid directed by Jim Wynorski and in the final scenes we get to see a cyborg with some sort of cybernetic implants. We'll have much more to look at as we move ahead, but in the meantime enjoy this trailer! The trailer starts off with a big flash of green. "I'll be right back..." A cyborg, seemingly out of one of the recent movies we saw. "How...?" she asks. "How long?" "Two or three minutes?" she asks. "You don't look that far off!"

I hadn't planned on leaving a review, but seeing some of the other dreadful reviews for this movie, I had to say something.I'm not going to give away the ending or anything, but I do give away some important plot points in this review, so you should be aware of that. The short (non-spoiler) version of my review - Samuel L. Jackson and Geena Davis both kick butt in this movie, and it's a lot of fun. Watch it.This movie is one of my favorites of all time.

I don't know what it is exactly, but the film is happily sitting on my shelf, with no thought of ever leaving me...Fulci has crafted one of the most ridiculous, bizzare, cheez-infested and well unique movies I've ever seen. Not sure what else to say about it, but I LOVE THIS MOVIE!!! The steak tartar scene is absolutely uproarious, and the whole nazi torture orgy fiasco is strangely hilarious...I'm not sure what Fulci was trying to do, but has anyone heard that, based on this film, Fulci accused Wes Craven of ripping him off with "Scream"?

I had read up on the film and thought it would be cute, a feel good Saturday night movie. I wasn't expecting anything great, figured it would be mostly fluff but hopefully not a totally bad experience. I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised.The dialogue was pitch perfect, most of the actors were exceptionally good and it flowed nicely. Ash Christian was perfect, his ability to turn an awkward moment into something touching was nice to see. He could have turned this character into something we've all seen before but instead strayed away from stereotypes and focused on the wittiness of the character.

I really enjoyed this movie. Yes there was disrespect throughout the movie, but Bruce Willis learned, from The Kid, that there is more value in repecting others, and his life of disrespect needs to change. This movie was a refreshing change from the trash that Hollywood is trying to shove down our throats. There are some very good lessons to be learned in this movie. I really believe this was one of Disneys best, even though a couple of things could have been left out. I was impressed with the lack of swearing and lack of sexual inuendos.

* some possible spoilers * Of course this film could not be expected to be as good as the original and there is still a huge amount to learn, but there are still a lot of interesting things in here and that’s why we will see it on the big screen one day, but not now, for now we’re going to review this movie from a few angles, from a different perspective, and discuss it from a certain angle, which we will do so from the beginning, before we get into the major plot points.

It 's been a long time since I have been in the art-house theater and I went to see Douches at the Lyceum Theater on April 24th and 26th. To be fair, I should really say it was a pleasure to see. The play is a musical comedy about a man and a wife who decide to get married but then, in a big twist of fate, they discover that they are not the right person for the job... They are the wrong people at the right time. It's a great story-line. I know, it's not a comedy but the story-telling and the production were quite good.

I know it's rather unfair to comment on a movie without seeing the complete piece - but I am going to anyway! I waited for a laugh, I tried to give it time. I think 20 minutes is long enough to wait in a comedy for a laugh. My laugh never came, so I gave up.It's stupid humour, not so stupid that you have to laugh, though. It isn't anywhere near that high grade. Let me correct that, it's just *stupid* - not stupid humour. They may have intended for certain scenes to be funny, but they weren't.

The Toxic Avenger... The idea of this movie is that a person that the common population would call this person a looser and then after being thrown into a barrel of toxic waste, mutated into a superhero that is completely disfigured sounded OK even for 1985. This movie is listed as a horror... I even have read of a cult following with this series.... Now this movie even given when it was made was so bad that I couldn't stop watching... the acting is horrible even for an independent film that I think was to be the horror part of this movie...drug dealing, sumo, Godzilla entrance....

I appeared as an extra and was on location as a journalist covering `` The Dain Curse '' . My story is told in detail on this DVD, but here are the highlights... The film opens on the evening of the 16th of December at a ball in London's Savoy Hotel on the site of the hotel where `` Dain Curse ' ' is said to have begun . . . After a ball and supper, a group of men gather to drink and discuss who will win the contest to decide who will be the next to be cursed . . .

I thought this movie 'd be totally different than just another teen-slasher . Well I was totally wrong . There is a bit of a story to this movie that i would love to find out . I hope i can find out about the story that was not given to the director of the movie and if he would give us a few more details about the story . There is no reason why this movie could not be a romantic comedy , action thriller or even a family comedy . All of them would be awesome to see in the cinema . If this movie was to be released on DVD .

The plot - in the future when nearly all men have been killed by a Y-chromosome-targeting virus, a (hot) female genetic engineer 'creates' a man in a chem lab - is intriguing. Despite the somewhat promising premise, the movie falls flat in nearly every regard. The dialogue is laughable. The characters are paper thin. The exploration of a single-gender world is shallow. The worst part of the entire movie is the Asian detective who delivers lines so cheesy and contrived that you'll want to vomit.I can't imagine how on earth this trash got produced.

It looked cool from the movie sleeve, but after five minutes we weren't sure if it was a homosexual documentary of west side story without any female interest. The film quality was poor, and there was hardly enough gang fighting action to sustain even the drunkest person's interest for long enough to watch the entire film. May god have mercy on the souls of both the actors and the filmmakers responsible for what I can only describe as my new one and only reason why I never will want to see (or trust) an Australian made film again.

I have no respect for IMDb ratings anymore . I think a bunch of Mormons flooded the website and voted the wrong movie for awards. LOL. Now I have to wonder how many times a week people are going to type in some random movie to vote for their favorite. I wonder if they use IMDb because it gives an accurate description of the movie as to where it was made, and the genre, and the age of the actors in the movie. And then they type in their name, or the first letter that pops into their mind after seeing the name.

In London , the Venetian Carla Borin ( Yuliya Mayarchuk ) is searching an apartment to share with her beloved friend. The first question that she asks her friend is why there is no spare space in her flat. She also finds it difficult to explain her plans to her flatmates. Soon all the residents are excited by their new neighbours. And one of them wants to share the same living room with Yulia and her new friends. But what does the new tenant want to live there for? And why doesn’t her flat-mate want to share his or her place?

This movie was extremely boring. I only laughed a few times. I decided to rent it when I noticed William Shatner's name on the cover. It's all about this little kid who gets picked on all the time by his classmates. When wandering the streets looking for old ladies to assist, he meets a prostitute. She takes him to a club called the Playground, where he befriends several pimps. When mayor Tony Gold (Shatner) decides to take over the pimp business, Lil' Pimp must lay down for his homies.The animation isn't very good in this.

`` Garden State '' is another of these `` indie '' -type pictures that supposedly skimp on production values for artistic purposes. I don't know about you, but I can tell that there's something weird and wrong with a lot of this stuff. I'd like to think that there's a lot of creative people out there who know that this is crap. And they don't buy it. They don't see it that way. And if there's something that's just off with this stuff, maybe that's a reason they won't want to buy it."

`` Catchfire '' or `` Backtrack '' as it is sometimes called , is not very good . That is what you are thinking . In fact if you can get it right , it is a great tool . If I can show you the code of the program , I would be really happy . But if you are not able to get it , I will be even more happy ! Now you are all set . Now I will tell you the very basic idea of the program . It is easy . You do not need any extra program .

Wow . I just saw Demon Wind a little while ago , and I do n't think I 'll ever get into it . But there was one person on that list who did and I have a feeling she'd probably find something to enjoy about it . I can see it , and it might be interesting , but to me I don't know that I would enjoy it . Maybe I would find it all a bit dull and repetitive , and not all that exciting . I do like to see how people react to an anime , and I'm not really bothered by how the story ends .

A notorious big budget flop when released . This Robert Altman inspired comedy has some terrific moments and an occasionally great one-liners, but it doesn't do anything for me, despite some of its strengths . The film centers around an aspiring photographer who gets his work noticed by the director of his favorite restaurant , who asks if he can join the crew. It's a risky move as the man who hired the photographer has a vendetta against him and the film has some rather nasty language, but the actor playing the artist's boss seems like he might be capable of being charming.

I thought this was a great action flick . A very good role for Geena Davis . She is a bit like Audrey Hepburn in some ways . Davis gives a very convincing portrayal of a very nice young woman and is a joy to watch as she falls in love with an older man . I've seen a lot of people saying that the movie was not the best the cast could do but I think Davis did a pretty good job. I found myself laughing a few times throughout the movie but it wasn't because the movie was bad .

I caught this movie on local t.v. at about 4:30 a.m. I didn't have expectations for it but after the opening credits I knew I was into something good.There are situations that are left for your interpretation to "find out" what really happened so your attention is a key factor.The whole psychological thriller situation deals a lot with character development and the way things are executed by the main character.Your sub-conscience also plays an important part because through a series of events and dialogs you will be able to make a correct interpretation and generate an opinion.The technical aspects are very good.

No pun intended . I 'm not going to spoil anything about the story , but it 's safe to say that there is something in the works . But i have no idea if it will even be finished. But we will see . It might be good or bad . I don 't know . At the end of the day , i'l take a stab . The story 's got me intrigued . So if you can tell me anything , it 'll help me out . Please keep it short and simple , if possible .

I 'm not sure where to start with this . In short , it was a disappointing movie . Having seen the first 3, it was time to go back and see the ones that were better . But if you want a fun romp , well that one you should really not be disappointed . But the one to go with the book was the third . The book was fun , but the movie is like the 3 previous ones . I really enjoyed the 3 movies and the one book . I think I will be back for more . One of my favorites.

This is strictly for Pryor fans . Just because he was a great , funny guy does n't mean this is true. You don't know him, so it is hard to believe anything he says or does. The whole 'Pryor was a liar' line was a complete fabrication. And the fact that his wife admitted it was true should have made this a much bigger deal. He's not gay. He was straight as a sheet and had no sexual proclivities at all. I can't believe someone who claimed he was straight would get so angry that he decided to tell people that he was a male prostitute.

Visually , this film is interesting . Light is literally thrown in a way , together with cinematography and an excellent score , that make it an extremely enjoyable movie to watch . The film follows the events following a suicide bombing at a movie theater in New Orleans in which the film is the focus . I think this was the first movie in the recent era that I feel had such an impact . The film had such power and resonance . The film was made in the aftermath of a massacre that took the life of thousands of people .

Sometimes there 's a film so bad that you just keep watching in awe . This is one of those movies that is not so bad you just want to see it again because of what it could have been . But it’s only because you can’t stand to wait any longer . In this case, the reason why you want to see the movie again and again is the story that has been created . The story of a drug addict and his wife who is a prostitute is based on real events that are well documented in the newspapers and magazines .

Being a bit of a connoisseur of garbage, I have stumbled across this little treasure. Action, romance, crooked cops, violence. Its all here and not a single one has been pulled of right. I was in love immediately. Then, a funny thing happened about the second time around. I became addicted. I thought it was going to be a one rent and chuckle kind-of-movie.Rudy Ray Moore knew what he wanted to see in a movie. He didn't have the money to make it look good, but he did it anyway. That's very commendable.

I saw this film many years ago , and absolutely hated it -- I could not wait for it to be re-released. After reading some of the complaints on this site, I realized that I would love it even more. Unfortunately, after reading the film's critique, I am still torn. In fact, I think I'm still torn about it. It is a masterpiece, of course, but I don't really understand why people are so against it. Maybe I'm just not a good judge, because I still don't understand it well enough to judge whether the critics were right.

Hello again, I have been thinking about this movie all my life. I saw it when I was 5 years old in Los Angeles, California in 1942. What a wonderful story of being good to one another, kindness, and charity. You forget it is the bugs relating to one another. It was just as if they were people. I love this movie and so do my adult children. Such beautiful color in this movie.I need to see this movie again. There is a story about an envelope in the movie, that I just can't remember the "why" of it.Thanks for listening.

I saw it last night and I was laughing out loud for the whole second half of the movie . what a fun film . for the last twenty years the world has been laughing at us as if we weren't even real . we were just some silly cartoon characters with some silly haircuts and some stupid talking heads on TV . well the world hasn't really changed in that regard . we just have a new set of leaders who are now in charge . and I don't want to say too much until the movie ends . but the leaders are no different than our predecessors .

I 'm so glad he was n't alive to see this . This movie is a debauchery of his work. __________________"I'm so glad we have the power to be able to put people back in prison and put them to death for murdering someone else and not being able to get a conviction, but that's what it is. It's wrong. And, it's so wrong!" It makes sense to me. For a film based on an actual event that happened at the time, I'm amazed it didn't get better over the years.

Steven Segal has done some awful films , but this is probably one of the best since his career took off as a teen. The latest offering from the prolific filmmaker has just been released in select theaters, but I highly recommend watching it in a proper theater. This is a film I have seen countless times but never really got into watching it. I have seen the trailers but not seen the film. This will be the first and probably not the last movie I watch where I am in complete awe of the screen work.

Im warning you people out there, this is just a waste of your time. I am being honest when I'm saying that this is the worst movie I've ever seen. Its just a move about Christian propaganda! Don't throw away your life, don't see it!I think they made the movie so more people will believe in Jesus or something, but it works in the opposite way. The actors are all newbies, the story is just fuzzy!I think this movie is a work of the devil.

This movie spends most of its time preaching that it is the script that makes the movie , but apparently there is a lot more to it. I’ve only seen three hours, but I still feel like this is something that could have been a lot more impactful if the producers had just thrown it at the wall and seen what came through. A few things that I thought could have been cut, but that’s what you get from a third-run movie: the script, the action sequences, the dialog, the music and the direction that makes it all flow together to create a cohesive work.

This was Hitchcock's third Hollywood feature, and it appears he was yet to settle into a pattern of consistency, turning from faithful adaptation of classic novel in Rebecca, to espionage thriller in Foreign Correspondent, and now this romantic comedy in the mould of the "screwball" pictures of the 1930s.Hitchcock's formal method, on the other hand, had by now settled into something consistent, so much so that he was unable (or at least unwilling) to deviate from it. It was unwise then for him to step outside his usual genre, and a romantic comedy was particularly inappropriate.

I HATE MOVIES THAT END LIKE THIS ! ! ! ! This 16mm disaster is full of clichés , stereotypical character actors and bad writing . I had to take it off my list of the worst films that I’ve ever seen , as it was the best part of the show . There is this scene where the girl starts talking to her teacher about her love for her boyfriend, which is really annoying . The teacher is trying to console the girl by telling her “ ” that her boyfriend will return one day . “ “ The girl gets very angry , saying that she will be waiting for her boyfriend forever .

How anyone can praise this crude film version after seeing the marvelous WATERLOO BRIDGE with Vivien Leigh and Robert Taylor, is beyond comprehension.MAE CLARKE's Myra is a far cry from the role as played by VIVIEN LEIGH in the remake. She plays a common American girl with a Brooklyn accent and the "Yeah" responses are a bit jarring when one is expecting a less coarse character. DOUGLASS MONTGOMERY (billed in final credits as KENT DOUGLASS) is wildly improbable as a soldier smitten with her no matter how many times she lets him down.

What a waste of energy and money . What a waste of what talent there was.Emilio Estevez was completely wasted in his early years and has no talent for this game.He is not fit for this game in fact he is not very good in any other kind of match. He was not a good manager and he did not make it to the level of a manager he deserves to be. In his last job he was the manager of Mexico in the 1970’s where they made the World Cup final in 1970. The team they played against Brazil was a World Cup final.

To my eternal shame, I've never seen a silent movie - not even the mother of all vampire movies, "Nosferatu". However, if they display half the creativity and sheer joy of this effort from Buster Keaton then I'll probably try to watch a few more. This is genuinely funny as well as being a stunning introduction to the world of the silent comedies. The premise, such as it is, focuses around an unfortunate case of mistaken identity as Keaton is mistaken for renowned bad-guy Dead Shot Dan (co-director Malcolm St Clair).

After all the hype I had heard about the Jane Austin novel and different film versions of the book I thought I might finally have found it, but sadly I have yet to read it. So what I have learned so far I think it’s going to be a while before this book gets to the screen, but until it does then I hope that people will still be reading it and finding out about all the wonderful things we have to look forward to. There are two versions of Jane Austen’s book, and as usual they are very different.

Although this has to be the nadir of season six, this schmaltzy episode isn't badly written or acted. It's just that most of us looked to the X-Files for taut, gripping horror/thrillers ending without easy answers and moving toward dark but fathomable conspiracies. Season 6 gave us a stream of tongue-in-cheek comedies that undermined the show's continuity and, frankly, made Simpsons' Halloween Specials look like great thriller TV.In this episode Victoria Jackson of SNL fame plays the long-suffering girlfriend of a man who sets himself up as a rainmaker.

Back in the 70's, a small-time Texas filmmaker named S.F. Brownrigg directed a handful of surprisingly decent low-budget drive-in horror flicks which seem to have developed a small cult following over the years. Before viewing his first film, Don't Look In The Basement, I wasn't too sure what to expect, but I sure as hell didn't expect it to turn out to be the only Texas horror I thought was better than the Chainsaw Massacre. I don't know, this might actually be my all-time favorite horror movie.We begin in an isolated insane asylum.

This is, for different reasons, a very very bad action movie. First of all, Seagal is terribly out of shape. He looks old and fat, plays like he has to fulfill an annoying obligation and his fight scenes require creative editing or plain replacement. Secondly, his opponent is a very weak villain. This is about a smart and mean masterbrain and Chestnut does not deliver. So what about the action ? Well, the two parties permanently shoot at each other in different locations of the Alcatraz jail. They shoot wild and bad, because compared to the amount of required ammunition, the bodycount is rather low.

There was a recent documentary on making movies , that featured a long list of actors and directors talking about the process of making movies. Some of the people included are the ones I know personally, some are friends of friends of friends. The topics discussed were about how to write a screenplay, how to get an agent, how to get a budget, and how to go about finding actors to star in your movie. I really enjoyed the documentary. One thing in particular stood out to me. You see this in so many of these documentaries.

Created by Dennis Spooner, 'Department S' was a glossy thriller show about an offshoot of Interpol, based in Geneva, created to solve baffling mysteries the police could not handle. If a plane landed at Heathrow with no-one aboard, if a man was found wandering around London in a space-suit, if the passenger of a Rolls Royce suddenly transmogrified into a skeleton, if a train pulling into a tube station turned out to contain dead commuters, you called on 'Department S' to sort things out.Peter Wyngarde played 'Jason King', a flamboyantly dressed crime novelist whose fertile imagination helped crack many of the bizarre cases.

One of my favorite movies . I like horses , I like happy endings , and I like Walter Matthau . If you like these films, you should check it out and enjoy the movie . This is not an official trailer , and I can not guarantee that I will actually watch the trailer . However there is a lot of information that might be useful. The movie was originally titled , but then the title changed because I wanted to say The Horse Whisperer . I am not a fan of horses . And I had to change it back because the horse Whisperer is just not an appropriate title .

eXistenZ was a good film, at the first I was wondering what is going on, organic "pods" made out of mutant reptiles which connected you and other players to a surreal virtual reality game via a umbilical cord, well it seems a little odd.But once it gets going its a pretty good film, with a few twists with a great open ending and the good aspect of weridness throughout the film is entertaining too see as your not sure whats coming next.Security personnel throw away the metal detectors; they have bone guns !

The story told by The Cranes are Flying is not, admittedly, all that original. Young lovers are separated by war; bad things happen to both. We've seen it many times before.Nonetheless, we haven't seen it filmed this well, with bold shots that take liberties to emphasize separation, or destruction, or hopelessness. All the more remarkable coming from the Soviet Union, and reason to conclude that Tarkovsky is not the last word in modern-era Soviet cinema.I was reading Chekhov's "Three Sisters" the other day, and chanced upon what may be the meaning of the title of this film.

A Cryptozoologist captures a mythical chupacabra on a Caribbean island.To get it back to civilization he bribes his way onto the cargo bay of a large luxury cruise ship with funny and I think the script intended disastrous results.Lets start with the one thing I really did not like about this movie.... The monster really just looked like a guy in a rubber suit.The CGI scenes looked like a different movie. OK thats off my chest now onto all the enjoyable bits about this B movie.The best thing was John Rhys-Davies(his daughter the eye candy a close second.

In case you dear readers never heard, this movie was the main inspiration for last year's Samuel L. Jackson-Eugene Levy clunker The Man. This 80s-drenched buddy action-comedy pairs short 'n stubbly Billy Crystal and the late Ethiopian Shim-Shammer Gregory Hines together as some witty Chi-town cops who don't play by the rules. That's pretty much the extent of the movie. Interest is somewhat peaked by Hines' line delivery that is spookily similar to Will Smith's and by cameos of now-more-famous actors like Memento's Joe Pantoliano and "NYPD Blue's" Jimmy Smits.

This morning, I found myself unexpectedly remembering that this movie existed. I found myself thinking, "Oh yeah, there was a Mr. Magoo movie, wasn't there?" This is more surprising because I remember following the controversy surrounding this movie (advocacy group for the visually impaired said that this movie was demeaning). I even went to see this movie on the day it opened, because I am a fan of both Mr. Magoo, and Mr. Nielson, and thought he would be an excellent choice to play Mr. Magoo.

Why would I say that ? Because when the movie ended , I was in a good mood . So I thought we can make a sequel, I will not give you an spoiler . I mean , how many of you had the same feeling while watching the movie ? If you do not have such a feeling , then I am not sure what to say to you . But you asked me to give you some information that might help you in future, right ? If so , it will be a good thing for me . Anyway, you asked me to make something for you .

As a professional poker dealer for over 25 years I found this movie very hard to watch . Too unreal, like the whole movie has been pulled together with CGI. It was hard not to get emotional in this movie, but there was a time where some of the movie scenes seemed like it was made up from a movie that never happened. And there were scenes in the movie where we didn’t really get to see what was happening, or the way the movie was being shot, or what was going through the characters heads at that moment.

I watched this movie knowing that it would be awful, but damned if it didn't break new and revolutionary ground in the field of making fecal matter acceptable as entertainment. The plot is Deep Rising with cruddy effects and HORRID acting. The lines in this...well...wow there really is no way to put this movie down because i think the words have yet to be created in the English language. The sad part is that the filmmakers thought they were actually making something good. You won't believe your eyes when you see how many movies they ripped off without even trying to hide it.

Just watched Hair after a lapse of 20 years . It struck home . For those of us who tried to keep it short it’s a great way to give it back, but I think the only way to do this would be to have it chopped in half, then you could do an even better job, or perhaps one of the other editors would do this. So I think I’ll do this. I had been meaning to do an interview with the editor. I just hadn’t gotten around to it. I did it when I first came to the magazine.

This was a great movie . Something not only for Black History month but as a reminder of the goodness that is Black People. The music was great, the cinematography great, the dialogue great, the story and characters were great. The performances were great. If you like action, drama, emotion, and a good story then this is a must see. I will watch it with my family. It is rated PG-13 so I guess I should warn you that it might leave you a little emotional and a little angry after seeing it.

With a title like that, you will be forgiven for thinking this film is about the great painter, Goya. Then after half an hour you decide it is more about the Roman Catholic Inquisition. With even more latitude, perhaps it is just a snapshot of the period. With lurid characterisation, too many axes to grind and a scant regard for fact, Milos Forman dishes up a colourful but shambolic, rambling mish-mash that fails on all three accounts.Milos Forman (who lost his Jewish father to Nazi concentration camps), is the great director who painted the artist Mozart as a buffoon and got away with it.

I really should give this stinker more credit that 1 star, because the film has so many eye-rolling lines that it's almost worth the price of the rental. The acting, if you want to call it that, is so stilted and contrived that it makes Ed Wood's actors appear life like. "Sammy," the lone black character, must be Mimi's husband in real life because he appears in her other films, but he has zero acting ability. His lines are priceless due to his absurd delivery, though I suspect the intention was to create a sympathetic character.

Let's get right to the heart of the matter...This is a terrible movie. The story is confusing, the supporting cast is laughable and the lead Actors look like they were forced to be in it. The story asks us to believe there is a underground lesbian sex cult where members are being murdered by their psychiatrist who just happens to be a transvestite. Ellen Barkin investigates the crimes and develops a crush on Peta Wilson whose job it seems is to be the cult recruiter. The sex scenes are equivalent to bad porn and when Barkin and Wilson kiss, Poor Ellen looks like she's in pain.

As Jennifer Denuccio used to say on Square Pegs, "Gag me out the door." I would definitely vote this movie on IMDB's Worst movie list.Dennis Christopher plays T.T., a guy from Chicago who goes to California peddling his brother's jazz records. He is supposed to be a barney placed in the locals-only surfing community. But he acts more like he is new to civilization (just try to get through his sex scene without squirming). There are also the on-going adventures of the rest of the local population that the viewer must endure.

This is one of the best martial art(Kung-fu) movies of all time. if u love martial art movies this is a not to miss. From flying nuns to training monks this movie has top kungfu styles and a good story line. Its about a priest from the wu dang clan trying to eliminate all the shaoulin fighters to be claim the title of being the best in martial arts. after killing key members of the shaoulin temple the faith of the shoulin is remained in the hand of two boys secretly training under a shaoulin monk.

Am an ardent Vijay fan . I have never seen another movie of his which is as good as this.It is a must see movie in my list of favourite movies of the year and also in my list of most watched movies of the world. I was so excited to watch this that i didn't even sleep the entire night. I could just watch this movie and forget everything else in the past and just watch. I can't stop watching it. This is why I have chosen this movie to be one of my favourite movies of the year.

Christopher Nolan's first directorial effort, a year before he did "Memento," and this is almost as brilliant as that classic. He uses time differentials in a similar manner to tell his story, and it's a very clever one.Bill is this young writer who begins following complete strangers around just to see where they live and what they're all about. One day, he follows this man, Cobb, who turns the tables and confronts Bill, who breaks down and confesses what he's up to. Cobb is a burglar and he takes Bill along on a few jobs to teach him the ropes.

I absolutely love the first three movies, they were great! I once caught Part 5 on VHS 10 years ago, and I was disappointed. But perhaps that was because I never saw the fourth one, because they were shot back-to-back. but after finally viewing a copy today, I have to say it was no way better than number 5. My expectations weren't high to begin with, but this is cheap direct-to-video stuff, not even a horror movie, it's PG-13. The acting was not convincing, the story was rather dumb without any excitement and there were not many effects.

I happened across this movie while channel-surfing and it seemed to be yet another poorly- made Christian film about The Bible. Of course it’s not. I don’t really care that much about this film. The Bible isn’t really that big of a deal in this movie. I’m not going to spoil it for you. I’m just making a statement about one movie. The Bible is not that big of a deal in the movies. I don’t really watch movies based off the Bible. I read the Bible.

This movie reeks. No money, no acting, no nothing. I caught this on on the 3am late show movie tonight and felt compelled to comment on it. This movie has nothing to recommend it. I can't believe it ever got released to US television! Nobody in this movie can act their way out of a paperbag. The lame attempts at comedy fall flat on their face, the special effects consist of a worm-like handpuppet "monster"... I can't even begin to tell you how rock-bottom this production is.

I have viewed this cartoon as a child , a father , and now a grand-father . It is my understanding that children , in general , can not speak to their father , a mother , and another father , as they have no memory of a father or of a mother . In the case , the father , the grandfather , the father and mother , the father and child , and the mother and daughter , are all talking together as one , as one . As a child , I thought that that would be interesting . I watched the cartoon .

As a serious marathoner , I was seriously disappointed in this film . Its target audience is clearly those who run marathons , as its an easy movie to enjoy . Not for those who have run for years and want to relive the event . I will make a post in future when I have a better idea of what to expect . But its not bad . It's just disappointing , but not a bad film . If you have never tried running marathons , its best to just watch the race film . Its a pretty good movie . But if you do run a few , I recommend this .

This movie should have come with a disclaimer that it was akin to the Left Behind series . I did not like that part at all, as it made me think it would be better to leave out certain details from the books and leave it to someone else's imagination. That being said, there were some parts I really liked that I wanted to be part of the movies. This is one I'm excited to see. What's wrong with the Bible? The Bible isn't the word of God, for it isn't the literal word of God.

Beware , My Lovely came on TV on BBC2 recently during the early hours so I set the video to repeat after the 5 minutes or so. It seemed to repeat after the 5 minutes. I'm on holiday from my lovely husband and we were all up in the middle of the night and I was getting worried. I couldn't find where it had come from. I watched it on the laptop and it seemed to repeat at a rate that was too much for me. It had been like this before I had checked it on TV, but it did this for a couple of minutes.

Rachel and Chuck Yoman (Valerie Harper, Gerald McRaney), decided the city is too busy and dangerous for their family, so they packed up their reluctant son (Gregory Togel) and daughter (Tammy Lauren) and moved back to a lake like the one Rachel lived at as a child.They say you can not go home again but this is an ideal rural home with what at first seems like a Mayberry feel. Later the residence seems to be more like the people in Deliverance. Soon bodies start turning up and everybody looks suspect with the exception of a few friendly faces.

This film is good in it 's genre and that genre is naturally action with a little/average budget . Looks great and I can see the potential of it, but there's a lot that i wouldn't see coming. I think this movie could be done well , but i feel like a very long and complicated script would be required. This movie could have made it's money on the screen and i feel like no matter how many times it is shown its not going to do much to help the film industry.

This movie , although well shot and superbly acted , was awful . I felt as if I was watching something that existed in the past. I really wanted to go out and buy the DVD or BluRay and watch it over again. That’s not a good reason to watch it. The DVD and BluRay is not going to tell you anything . It’s bad enough that the DVD was only released in the USA . The BluRay will be released in the UK ( and probably in other countries ) and I don’t think it should be sold as a DVD.

I went out of my way to get this film , and was fortunate to get it on VHS . this is an excellent film . it has everything . the cast is terrific , the cinematography is excellent , the editing is excellent , and the acting is terrific . I don't think I ever saw a better film on television , or on the big screen . this is a film that you should watch just as much as you would a good television show , and if you don't , you've got to go watch it .

Almost a masterclass in how not to direct a movie . From the misjudged , often incomprehensible script onwards Dr. S. D. Patel’s screenplay is a masterclass in directing a movie. “Taj Mahal” is as close as any director can get to a flawless movie. It’s not a masterpiece, but it does the job of perfection we all seek in cinema: to tell the story in the best way we can tell it. I know this is the kind of review you want to hear, “How can you possibly compare S.D.

Haines is excellent as the brash cadet who thinks West Point will really amount to something now that he has gotten his degree. The way he goes in the first episode, it sounds as if he’ll be an Army officer before the year is up. The first two episodes don’t do the character justice, but Haines is certainly a fine addition to this season’s lineup. Let’s hope he doesn’t have a big role in the third episode, as he doesn’t really seem like a leader in this season.

I have no respect for IMDb ratings anymore. I think a bunch of Mormons flooded the website and voted for this. This is not an artistic movie, it is Mormon propaganda. Nothing wrong with that, but the plot outline and the way it is described is totally misleading. If you are a bible thumping Christian or a Mormon, watch this movie, you'll love it and think it is truly amazing. For anyone else, don't bother, the story is so contrived, random stuff happens that really doesn't follow in a coherent way.

Incredibly, "Vampire Assassin" is significantly worse than such atrocities as "Tequila Body Shots" and "Zombie Nation" - and those movies are TERRIBLE. Writer/director/star Ron Hall is devoid of both charisma and acting ability, and is also clearly incapable of the most basic directorial concepts. Possibly the worst camera-work, editing, lighting, sound, visual effects, music and fight choreography I have ever seen in a movie. Rarely do two shots cut together, nor can you see much in the beyond-dim lighting. The terrible dialogue is spoken extremely slowly by a supremely untalented cast, stretching the movie to a near-deadly 87 minutes.

OhMyGAWD ! ! ! THE MAGIC GARDEN is perhaps one of my most vivid '70s childhood memories . Two hippie couples in their 60s are walking down the sidewalk in front of a new building, talking to each other and holding hands . There is an old man playing with his grandkids . He looks over and sees the new building and starts to walk towards it . A young hippie guy who looks like an older version of him is also walking past him . The young hippie guy goes up to them and starts to play with his grandkid . The old man is shocked when he sees them .

The first season told pretty much how all elements of the Marine Corps would operate (i.e. ground, air, helicopters and jets) as a team. That's the season I give the high rating to! (True, there are still a lot of "liberties" taken in season 1, but the stories were more believable. )The subsequent seasons were a gawd-awful attempt of Melrose Place meets Top Gun! I was a Marine stationed at Miramar at the time and I remember them shooting the show around the San Diego area.

In the twilight years of his career, Charles Bronson forged long-running partnerships with several directors, most notably J. Lee Thompson and Michael Winner. He did two films for one-time Bond director Peter Hunt too - the first being the decent 1981 actioner Death Hunt, the second being this indifferent political chase thriller. Assassination is pretty dull if truth be known, and come the end you'll find yourself longing for something with a bit more passion and pace, like The Wilby Conspiracy for instance (which, plotwise, this film resembles).

Imagine yourself trapped inside a museum of the dark middle Ages and a resurrected vampire and his maniacal sidekick are chasing you. Where is the absolute last place you want to hide? I'd say inside the uncanny Virgin of Nuremberg torture device, because there's a good risk you'll get brutally spiked to death. And yet, the elderly lady in this film stupidly runs into her spiked coffin. "The Vampire's Coffin" is a rather disappointing sequel, as director Fernando Méndez doesn't re-create the Gothic atmosphere of the 1957-original but puts the emphasis on comical situations and dialogs.

Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy are the most famous comedy duo in history , and deservedly so , so I wanted to share some of their most famous routines with you here on my website , as well as their classic routines and some of their original material . Of course they never did a routine, so the only thing I’m putting together here is what I saw when I was a kid and when I first met them in the theatre . I think it’s the most famous routine you will ever see.

When I first saw the previews for this movie on TV I thought that this could be a funny movie. I was wrong. All though I am not totally against movies that make fun of others. Some are actually funny such as the first scary movie. This was one of many that have been made as of late that are not. The humor in this film was anything but funny and was rather dull.I feel the one of the biggest problems is that they poked fun at to many movies such as Varsity Blues, Friday Night Lights, Stick it, etc.

Asmali Konak has arguably become one of the best TV series to come out of Turkey. With its unique cinematography and visual approach to filming, the series has gained a wide following base with rating records continuously broken. Personally I do not agree with singers becoming actors (hence, Ozcan Deniz - the lead actor) but I guess the figures speak for themselves.In relation to the movie, it was disgusting to see how much someone can destroy such a plotline. Years in the making, this movie was able to oversee every descent story that existed within the series.

This movie made by the NFBC was made in honor of the Montreal Canadians dynasty years in the 50's,60 's, 60's,70's, and the '80's! This film was released in the late 70's in the United States and in France on May 29, 1983. This movie is the only film in existence that actually exists, and you are welcome to it!! This is the one movie I will always remember watching and re-watching throughout my high school years. The movie is very special to me for two reasons. First, it is from my school.

I mostly rented this movie to see Shannon Elizabeth . She played well in this movie , but the plot was not believable enough for me. I will say that this movie was enjoyable , but the quality of the film should have been better , and I was not willing to see this movie in theater. I liked this movie . It has a good storyline and good acting . But the movie is just so predictable and boring . I give this movie -3 stars. This movie was very interesting . The acting was good , the story and action were also very good .
