Surprisingly good and quick-witted adventure that features Kelsey Grammer (supposedly in his first lead role in a feature) as an unconventional Navy sub commander who wants to run a nuclear sub of his own, however; he has earn it by competing against the U.S. Navy in a series of war-games with a crew of untested, questionable, and lovable men (and a woman, too).Director David S. Ward ("Major League") and his writers have put together a hysterically clever and upbeat comedy that tries to make the film easy to understand, which they do quite well.

After putting a mummy in a local museum goes through the cat-scan , a metal object in it 's brain, and finds that she's had an accident. She has to get home before she can die. But if you're a detective and you're looking for clues in the past, how can you find out what happened before? This mystery has a twist: while the detective is looking for clues he is also doing his duty...

As the story continues the detective continues to search the past for clues about his wife's life.

Wow! After the first five minutes of watching this "film", I was quite tempted to put a bullet in my brain, and end my life. It's really hard to describe what exactly this film is about. I honestly don't know what kind of human being would even finance a piece of excrement. The film looks to have either been shot on video or 16mm. I normally don't have a problem with SOV movies, are shoddily made 16mm films, but this was just so awful. And where did they find these "actresses"?

First off, I'm not a firefighter, but I'm in some kind of para-firefighting unit (the guys who get called if an earthquake hits and the real firefighters need more people for SAR), so I had some training and simulation but I have no real-life experience.But still, there are some points one notices as totally unbelievable. I can understand that they removed the mouth/nose-pieces of the masks and that there is not enough smoke, because the public would otherwise see nothing. But some things defy logic: - No second mask attached to the oxygen.

I am sorry to rain on everybody 's parade . Just a little background about me : I like and read all things geeky . This is not that kind of post . I have only been blogging for over a year . I am currently working for an oil company as a technical engineer . My job is a lot more than just a grunt . My employer is in the oil, gas, mining, and power industries . They specialize in oil production . They are currently developing a new type of well . The well consists of several layers .

The plot - in the future when nearly all men have been killed by a Y-chromosome-targeting virus , a (fictional) government is set to rule. It is not a perfect dystopia, but we have to admit that we would not want to be in it. The story - the story of this short novel is really about a woman, an alien, and a man. A man who has lost his ability to control his emotions and wants to help her overcome her feelings, a man that wants to help her find her own identity.

I love Ustinov's distinctive, literate narration. And the photography is quiet nice. We put the film on for our 3.5 year old who sort of wandered in and out of the room. So for our first viewing, we only saw about 1/3 of the movie and were quite charmed. When we re-watched, sitting down for family time,we were all mortified at the violence and life-threatening situations the poor otter got into. About halfway through the movie, there's a rack of dead, bloody furry animals. Lots of blood, not just a little.

I would just like to point out (in addition to pleading for the series to be released on DVD) that a show does not have to be realistic to be entertaining. These days, with all the blood and gore in the news and in crime dramas, reality shows, etc. it's nice to get lost in a good, cheesy show with entertaining characters. PWOG fits the bill. Was it Emmy material? No, but it was awesome just the same.I also have to put a vote in for the second cast - they were more charismatic than the cast of season one.

I saw this movie with my mother, and I loved it! It was such a sweet story, (Not to mention funny because of the supporting cast!) They never make movies like this...ever! My favorite part is when Grace(Minnie Driver) finds out about her boyfriend's wife's death, and that she has the deceased wife's heart and she screams, "WHAT WAS GOD THINKING?" I do believe everyone(No matter who you believe in) has thoughts like that once in awhile.

I just happened to stumble to this film and checked IMDb for more information: Score 6,7, well... not so bad. Genre: scifi...good I like scifi. So I got the movie and I was looking forward to have a relaxing Sunday evening watching it. But but...NO.As in summary, this isn't a movie at all. It is a religious advertisement, including: preatching about Jesus, god, devil, end of the world etc. Movie starts with a epic abduction story: Driving at night, car stops, bright light and so on... Well, actually that was the film.

OK , most of us agree that this is a weak attempt at a remake , but at the same time , it's about as close to what we'd expect as anything, and it may be the most ambitious game we've ever made , so we decided to throw out the rulebook and see if we could make it a good game , and I'm sure that it will be just as entertaining and fun, so let's start the game and see what it's like :D

Oh, and I'm still on the fence with the name choice and I'll let you decide .

See Three Colors : Blue and Three Colors : White . They are both wonderful films and will give an excellent opportunity to watch the films for free . If you have a chance , please check out it . I was really shocked . It’s really excellent . It’s a true masterpiece . It’s a must see . This movie has a story about a young boy who tries to find out the truth about his father . One day, the boy is traveling along a river . Suddenly , he is captured , tortured and tortured for 3 days without any food at all .

Writer & director Jay Andrews , a.k.a . Jim Wynorski , serves up more of his characteristic shlock with a new short film, “Pump Up The Volume”, which you can stream below. “Pump Up The Volume”, which Andrews wrote, directed and edited, is an animated short featuring characters from popular animated series. It’s a goofy little film which you may have missed the first time around but you should definitely check it out. “The short has a great sense of humor, some great music and features some awesome animated effects,” Andrews told me via email.

Marked for Death (1990) spends more time on action sequences, than it does with focusing on its characters. After his first two impressive efforts, Above the Law (1988) and Hard to Kill (1989), this third Steven Seagal picture makes the idea clear: anyone who opposes him is meant to look like a fool; the bad guys are just there to make him look good.Seagal had been steadily building an audience that seemed a bit larger than those that follow the kick-'em-up antics of Chuck Norris or Jean Claude Van Damme.In Marked for Death, Seagal tosses aside any pretense at style and heads full throttle into exploitation.

Let me tell you something...this movie exceeds all of the Troma laugh and gore movies hands down as it ACTUALLY TRIES TO COME ACROSS AS A SERIOUS MOVIE. From the terrible acting... "I knew it, I knew she was possessed! "...to the priest accepting sexual favors and getting into showers with naked teenagers...this piece of dung takes the cake. I am at a loss trying to compare this to another movie equally as bad. This may just be in a class all its own. The kicker is that supposedly some Cardinal oversaw production to make sure it was true to the actual situation.

A team varied between Scully and Mulder, two other scientists, a pilot, and the guy who plays Bana on Seinfeld, go up to an Arctic research post where all members have died off by either killing each other or killing themselves. They discover there's a worm- a virus- that is parasitic to the point of madness and death. The problem is, after a certain dog lashes out, anyone could be infected, but who? This is not just my favorite episode of season 1, but also one of my favorites from the show.

A beautiful film . One that made me think of god but not feel guilty nor overwhelmed . Made me think that there is always a reason for our lives and it is not always good but it is not always bad either . In that moment my life was changed forever. It is not perfect but it is something I would never take back so if you see the movie and I am not going to spoil anything it might be worth renting it in order to see how a beautiful girl comes into this world . I think the film will make you think about all that you have accomplished in your life.

`` Tumbling Doll of Flesh '' by Tamakichi Anaru is a Japanese shocker about three thugs who sexually abuse , beat , torture , and kill the innocent . It was created by Japanese director Yutaka Kato , and it was directed by Tatsuhisa Hoshino . It was published in 2005 . The story was first published in JET magazine , and it was re-published in 2004 in Shueisha 's Weekly Shōnen Magazine . Toshiya Kuriya wrote the story , and the screenplay was written by Yuta Sankai . The music and lyrics was written by Hideki Inoue. The film is produced by the Kato Production .

STMD ! is one of the most fun and enjoyable low-budget films I 've seen in quite some time . It uses a rather unique style to make the audience laugh. The actors are wonderful. The film is quite simple and the acting is not that good. But this is a film that anyone can get into. You should see it for yourselves. Here are some reviews. I hope you will go and enjoy this movie . I enjoyed the movie and found it very enjoyable . Thanks to all the reviews I found on the internet .

From 2002 on Dutch cinema finally got better again . This movie is still part- and a schoolbook example of why you shouldn't let a bad movie stand in your way

“If you could write a screenplay, what kind of script would you want to make?”

In the early 80s, when I was studying in Groningen, a lot of people used to go to the cinema with their young children and show them films they thought would be most interesting for them to see, including horror movies and comedies. Many of these movies turned out to be good but many, many more were bad films.

Hannibal must be the most God-awful movie I have seen in a long time . In fact , I want to see him in a movie that isn’t a horror movie . This is the sort of movie that will give me nightmares . Now , you might think that this is because of the acting and all the special effects but let me say right now that this doesn’t matter a bit . Now , you may have noticed that I have not really liked this film . Now , I was wrong about that .

I feel privileged to have accidentally seen this movie. I actually ran across this movie by accident. I was taping another movie on Showtime one night, overnight and this movie came on afterward. So I sat and watched it and boy was I blown away. The acting is absolutely superb. Kathy Bates...who has been my favorite actress since Misery and Fried Green Tomatoes gave an amazing performance as a domineering mother who tries desperately to hold on to her old school values (religion, family) at the risk of alienating her family.

OK , when I say `` wow , '' I mean , `` Jesus , please help me . '' I just don't know , how to pray . I'm a really shy person and it's very difficult for me to speak to God . I really hope you are able to hear me . Thank you

Dear God , I pray that You will help me . I'm looking for someone who is very open minded , to talk about anything and everything that is on his mind . I think that I have a good heart and I love to laugh .

I love dissing this movie. My peers always try their best to defend it, probably out of love for Quentin Tarantino or Harvey Keitel, but they'll never convince me that this one should be treasured. Here's some huge reasons why: A: The plot goes from kidnapping road trip movie to vampire-inhabited strip bar slasher flick with no set-up whatsoever. Suddenly something very real turns into something very fake, which is like sitting the audience down to a Thanksgiving feast then exploding it with dynamite. B: That untalented Juliette Lewis is in it.

Christopher Nolan 's first feature film wowed critics who saw it when it first came out . Shot on a 16mm camera, ' The Dark Knight Returns' is an adventure tale that features the titular knight ( Heath Ledger as the Joker ) as well as his loyal sidekick Harvey Bullock ( Russell Tovey as Harvey Dent ) . The film was shot in New Zealand , but the New Zealand government blocked production of the film in 2001 because it was filmed in the South Island . The New Zealand Government also denied permission to the production of the film in 2003 .

I 'm a huge Zack Allan fan and was disappointed that he only got one scene in the movie . . . He has to be a major star if he's doing this much, and if they're going to use Zack's name and persona, it is probably best that he don't go any further. He has to be a major star to play this part, and I'd rather not see him doing this in a movie where I don't want to see him playing any role at all. He's the guy I would want on my team.

This movie purports to show a middle class family 's attempt to figure out what is `` going down '' in the middle class. At first, the middle class seems to have a sense of complacency. The family decides to put away their money and live comfortably for the next few years. And it is this feeling of ease that has them feeling comfortable enough to have sex, or for that matter eat dinner. And this is how the movie goes on to show how a few people are able to get the upper hand when it comes to women.

What a shocker. For starters, I couldn't stand the constant screaming and noisy panicking all the time. It didn't make me scared, horrified, or make me sympathetic towards the characters; it was simply annoying. The jerky camera movements were also annoying. The plot was the same as pretty much every other cheap horror. There was a few pathetic attempts to give the characters some depth, but it didn't really work into the rest of the plot. And then there's the ending. I'm still not really sure what to make of it.

If you have n't read Tolkien 's masterpiece ; prepare yourself for maybe the best movie experience ever ! If you have not seen it yet, I recommend you to go and see it ! You won't get disappointed because it's such a great experience ! I have a few reviews from my friends who have seen it and they are really impressed and recommend it to other friends too ! I 'm not going to review the movie because I think it's a brilliant movie ! It's an epic story and I really love it !

One of the worse gay-related movies I have ever seen . Since these are not characters in this story it doesn't matter where they come from. As a gay guy, I don't like movies that stereotype us. It's just not right to make us so stupid. We don't all look like the gay people on the tv, and the ones in the movies seem to be just there to make us look stupid. There should be a line in any gay romance movie where it asks you if you would be willing to take a gay lover.

Yeah great cult TV series . Great atmosphere , top script and good performances make this a class A candidate. But I am going to be critical about the story because it just is not good and that is what makes it boring. This show was good in its own right . I can watch this show without any problem as it was good but when you have to see it with subtitles and when there is a scene or a character that you need to remember the meaning you will get the frustration because there are no subtitles and the story itself is not interesting.

One of my favorites non-MGM musicals , it 's a classic ! > Rita Hayworth is in top form , she just makes me want to dance ! I had no idea Rita had all this charisma , she is a great actress , as well as dancer ! I would not mind seeing another musical like this one ! And it is one that should be on the air in the states in the fall , so if you are in the states this summer please go and see it , it 's an old classic ! Marilyn Monroe would make a great Bond girl. I would love her.

The most vivid portrait of small-town oddity I've seen in a long time -and I'm not just talking about Australian films. This piece of work seems to have been made "under the radar" and really, it's an entirely fascinating piece of work, that has a worldliness mostly unseen in recent Aust. film making.At times it is rather slow and strange - it seems to meander hither and thither not really sure if it's a thriller or a 'head-movie'. But the stunning aspect of the film by Alex Frayne is its iron fisted, ruthless direction.

I 've been studying Brazilian cinema since 2004 , when I stumbled onto `` Cidade de Deus / City of God .'' The story itself is not a new one, but I was intrigued by the film itself. It is very different than the usual Brazilian cinematic fare I find on DVD. The main characters of this story are not the main character, but rather an orphan who lives with his brother and his aunt. Although the story is set in Brazil, it has a universal feel. The movie was written and directed by Pedro Alves .

With the war not going well for the Soviet Union, Stalin accepted volunteers from the prisons and used the prisoners as shock troops. This is the story of one such battalion. There are petty crooks, political prisoners, soldiers kicked out of other units, gray-haired veterans of the White Army plus some dangerous criminals.They are thrown into battle ill-equipped, untrained and face the threat of the NKVD if they show signs of cowardice or failure.The special effects are rudimentary and many of the minor characters are one-dimensional, but the overall story is very human and riveting.I have not seen a version with subtitles or dubbing.

You know the old saw about a train wreck ? The one about how you ca n't look away ? Yeah, well it was true in this case as we found out earlier today when it happened to us . The good news is that I think it will turn out alright, so I will let you ponder that for a few minutes, after I write a few words on what I found out about it . So here's my summary of what happened ,

We were in line at a railway station and all of a sudden there was a massive crash in the station .

If you took all the stock elements of a Shrek movie (grumpy ogre, annoying donkey, cute kitty, obligatory dance number, etc. ), put them in a blender and condensed it to 20 minutes, you'd have this mess. Painful to watch; I may have laughed once. The story and dialogue are rushed beyond comprehension, with the voice actors sounding like they phoned in their lines. The final reworked rendition of "The Christmas Story" poem felt like it was written by a committee in five minutes. And boy, a little Eddie Murphy goes a long way.

From the film's first shot - Keira Knightley as Elizabeth Bennet wandering reading through a field at dawn, thus invoking all the clichés cinema has developed to address the phenomenon of the strong-minded rebellious female character in period drama - I knew I was in for something to make me want to kill myself.Joe Wright seemed not only to have not read the book, but to be under the regrettable misapprehension that what he was filming was not in fact Jane Austen's subtle, nuanced comedy of manners conducted through sparkling, delicate social interaction in eighteenth century English drawing-rooms, but a sort of U-certificate Wuthering Heights.

Fulci ... Does this man brings one of the goriest and weirdest movies ever made ? Answer : yes ! In the movie, he played the lead and played the part of a very scary and sad man ... he was the lead character in that movie and played like a scary psychopath ... He was playing in a scene in the movie where we see a guy sitting in a bar, having a drink. He started talking and telling us the story of his life and how he got in the middle of all the bad things in the world and became a hero.

Everything about this movie is awful.You can tell in the first five minutes that this movie is going to be terrible. You can't however, gauge how bad it's going to be.We start the movie with a seemingly endless intro scene aided with gay music and no dialogue. Having the camera move up and down big guys who are trying too hard to look like mentals doesn't provoke the slightest emotion.What then starts seems to be one of two separate stories. The first half of the movie consists of the wogs going around competing in paid, midnight fights with other ethnic groups.

For the most part, I considered this movie unworthy of a comment, but the last 10 minutes prompted me to write one. You see, right then we learn (SPOILERS...if they can be called that) that the Devil's emissary has no chance of properly preparing the domination of the world by his master, because he is not skilled at martial arts! "Prosatanos" has been lying in a hole for centuries, waiting for "human greed" to release him, only to be defeated in a simple one-on-one match against 54-year-old former karate champion Chuck Norris!

This film is much the same as Cannibal Holocaust. If it weren't for the needless animal killing in the name of 'shock' ("Ooh look at us, we're hardcore, we've added real death to our films") these films would make their way onto my dusty classics shelf - I'm a huge fan of cannibal films and zombies. But as it stands, it's another example of shock horror clutching at the last straws of the pile in a desperate effort to make a poor film generate more hype. To sum up, a crusty gore flick with limited appeal.

I feel dumber after watching the first 20 min , luckily i walked out and saved the rest of my money to try the second one. i was surprised when i realized that when you watch the movie it becomes a bit confusing, it is pretty hard to explain the story at the end

i don't get the point that the first movie was supposed to be like this i mean when people see it, they are supposed to start thinking what will happen to them , and after that they will see it in a different way , and then they are supposed to think about how it is suppose to be .

See Dick work.See Jane work.Dick and Jane are married.They are successful.They have a son. They have a nice house.They have a Latino housekeeper.The housekeeper teaches Spanish to the son.The son speaks Spanish.Ha-ha.See Dick get promoted.The pompous CEO is a crook.See Dick take the fall for the pompous CEO.Jane quits her job.Oops.See Dick and Jane out of work.Dick & Jane turn to crime.As a plot device, they decide to rob the CEO.See the robbery get botched.See Dick & Jane fund the company's pension plan with the money from the robbery.Yay. See the end credits.Okay, so you've got the plot.

Don't get me wrong, I love most of Paul Schrader's movies, so it was with sheer excitement I was able to attend at the "Rolling Thunder" screening at the Parisian french cinemathèque with surprise movie on the 17th Dec 2004. Of course the surprise movie was The Exorcist and most people were there for that (I was too). The film was then finished but the score, so P Schrader used excerpts from The Return of the King and some other movie I forget (Was it Conan?). Anyways, apart from that the movie was finalized.

I wish I had read the comments on IMDb before I saw this movie . The first 1 hour was very very good and so was the 2nd hour but I didn’t see them. I will admit that I watched the trailer and I thought this was going to be a good film . The first hour is really good , with some great acting . I just didn’t connect to the movie . The story is not interesting , the characters are not developed at all and there are a few jokes in the beginning which I thought would work but don’t .

The director of this movie is a famous french TV presenter, Patrick Sebastien. He likes music and humor for rednecks, and his incredible movie is absolutely in his image. It's the story of a young retarded person, called "Zep" (sic). A night, he sees his sister's SM sexual relation, and decide to do the same thing: he rape the girl who he loves! Zep is placed in a asylum, and his unlucky girlfriend in a clinic. One man will find them. One man will reunite them. This man is a psychologist.

Brit director Chrstopher Nolan now has a career in America, and a reputation for making movies both popular and critically acclaimed; but this small film was where he started. And it certainly showcased his talent, with its striking black-and-white cinematography and achronological storytelling that prefigures his later 'Momento', albeit in a less extreme way. Thematically and mechanistically, the plot reminded me of David Mamet's 'House of Games', but the film still feels fresh and sharp, right up to the final twist of the ending whose flavour was expected, but whose pointedness is unexpectedly delicious.

Unfortunately this is not as good as any of the other films that Jim Carrey ( producing and starring ) has done but it is more of a comedy of errors than a masterpiece, but it is one of Carrey's best. The film starts off as a joke but once they realize they're in a war movie they start getting a lot of laughs. This one was a bit much for my tastes, not really my cup of tea. There was a lot of unnecessary violence throughout the movie. It is one of the most violent films of the 90's.

This is absolutely the worst comedy I have ever seen . It 's hard to explain though , because (as you all know ) it's hard to write about something you don't understand . I don't watch any other comedy , because this is just not comedy , but what can i say . Well, here's hoping they make this movie . I would love to see it . The comedy is just too funny not to enjoy. I've seen this movie and it is a great movie , I recommend it to you ! I would say that it was better than the last one .

Having enjoyed Neil Gaiman's writing (especially his collaboration with Yoshitaka Amano in "The Dream Hunters") in the past, I figured Mirrormask to be a sure thing and was very disappointed. The beginning, live-action section of the movie was intriguing enough. The relationships between the characters was believable and easy to empathize with, and I loved the sets, the costuming, and Helena's artwork. The subsequent computer-generated scenes, however, were excruciating. The dialogue was awkward and pretentious, the interaction between the live actors and the CGI horrifying.

Is there a fire fighter cliché that is NOT used in this film ? From the opening line `` I'm not your fireman ``, the firemen have a saying, `` My job is to make people comfortable, but I don't take the firefighting side of things seriously. `` I'm not here to make a lot of money, so I don't do well at that. `` I do what I have to do because I am paid for it, but my pay doesn't go very far towards it. These guys were there for the paycheck, just like I am.

Yesterday was one of those days we decided to go to the movies. We picked "Ik ook van Jou" more or less at random, but we were interested to see the state of current Dutch filmmaking.The film is based on a book by Ronald Giphart, and I must confess straight away that he is not exactly one of my favorites. The film features actors that are best known in the netherlands for their appearances in soap-operas and/or afternoon talk shows. At least one of them (Kamerling) has done some fairly decent stuff after leaving the soap world.

`` River 's Edge '' was one of the most disturbing films of 1986 , and for a year that was one of my first exposures to the horror genre. This is a true horror film from the start and it is as disturbing as anything on the shelf right now. There's a lot of stuff here to shock and horrify - but the thing that really ups the ante for me is the idea that it is the first real horror film since The Texas Chainsaw Massacre in 1980. It doesn't have the gory gore or the violent shock of that but it is the first true horror film.

I do n't even understand what they tried to accomplish with this movie , i mean really . You got a group of actors that i've never seen . And you got your director who is famous , but isnt he ? I dont know but this whole movie was a waste of my time i just thought they would have been better off showing it to me . I thought i would be better able to enjoy it if i got to see what i thought they were going to accomplish . This movie was just ridiculous . And it was a waste of my time and yours .

What is night vision ? Well according to the star ( Williamson ) let 's see ... one package store was built for a star which was able to see through the night without a need to wear glasses. Well, it's not that easy. We all see the light from the sun. This is called ' night sight '. In fact, when the light of the sun comes into our field of vision we can see a lot of detail. So let's look at a very simple example. In the next image, we have four different people.

I've waited 9 years to watch this film, simply because i never saw it advertised on TV. Eventually i caught it and it was well worth the wait. It's much better than your over-hyped scream or last summer garbage because it's all at a fairly quick pace, with no drawn out, creeping through the house to cheesy music scenes. Only the bad dubbing lets it down a little but don't let that put you off in any way. What lies beneath - over hyped and crap. Mute witness - low budget, not hyped at all and very good.

OK , so I know better than to watch movies on SciFi . . . er , sorry . . . space movies ? Because I just found out this week that most of the people who write these kinds of posts are, you guessed it, space junkies. Anyway, it's not really an original movie but it's interesting for what it does with the genre. And there's a good reason for that. This is the first time I've seen an episode that was more than two hours . . . more or less. That's a good thing.

Got this the other day from the Creators on DVD . I saw this advertised in a free magazine whilst shopping in a shop, but did not buy. The movie is rated PG, which I have always assumed to be the reason it was rated PG in the UK at the time (see here and here). However it is rated R with English subtitles. The story line is fairly standard in that the central story is being told from two different points of view; a man who is actually being abused by the other man, and his son.

this is horrible film . it is past dumb . first , the only thing the twins care about is each other. second , why don't they ever take care of their mother? i dont get it , it is all the same . they would like each other so bad . they just want to sleep , play and sleep . why are they fighting ? why are they so stupid ? i dont get it at all . second movie is the worst of the three i have watched . not even the first one has that level of stupidity .

Yes this movie features a gal named Jessica who says everything is evil and she causes trees to land on people too (well she only causes a tree to fall once, but she does say everything is evil). This movie is about a farm that apparently rents out rooms to people, but offers little else in the way of entertainment. Jessica can find things with a stick and she finds the head of an evil guy. Of course they don't know this until the owner of the farm's helpers open the box containing the head.

Steven Segal has done some awful films, but this is probably one of the best since his career took a dive about ten years ago. The cast is better than usual, and while the story and the plot are a total joke, at least most of the action scenes look pretty good.The plot is probably one of the worst in film history. Someone is being executed because he stole some money? Some Mercenary types kidnap a Supreme Court Justice? Their goal is to exchange the Judge for the prisoner so they can find out where he has the money?

Do all spoof films require pure stupidity and a lack of ANY sort of intelligence whatsoever to the humour ? Click to expand...

A good parody will usually be pretty funny. But if the person doing the parody was the most stupid, I think the comedy would be pretty much dead. But it depends on what's written into the parody itself. And even then, you need to have a good understanding of the film to do that... In my opinion, if the writer of the spoof is as dumb as a stone, you may as well go ahead.

my friend and i rented this one a few nights ago . and , i must say , this is by far the best game i have ever played , not to be compared to all the rest . the story , the gameplay , and of course the graphics of the game are outstanding . if you have never seen this one before , it is recommended you do ! it will not take you long to see why ! it is a very unique and refreshing experience , and is definitely worth a buy . the game is available on steam with a price of 99c ( i think i paid 50c ) .

As Muppet movies go , this is easily and clearly the best . It features loads of cameos by big names like Bill O’Reilly, Bill Shatner, Jim Carrey , Steve Carell , John Goodman , James Marsden , Eddie Izzard , Robin Williams , Tim Meadows , and more. There is even a nod to The Muppets in the movie . This is a must-see movie , and if you are not in the mood for it, or if you simply don’t understand the jokes, then it may not be for you.

This extraordinary pseudo-documentary , made in 1971 , perfectly captures the zeitgeist of America today ... which makes it all the more disturbing when it comes out with an agenda-setting and anti-scientific agenda of its own. It shows how America's scientists and scientists' work are systematically destroyed with no regard for the public's health and safety. It shows how our food is unsafe and that our medicine is not. It is a truly horrific document and it will take a true scientist to see that it doesn't match what we're seeing. Here's the trailer, for anyone who wants to see where this one was filmed.

I have witnessed some atrocities of cinema . In the past couple of years , it seems producers and directors are more inclined to create a “comedy” or “silly comedy” as opposed to a serious one. The last few years I have seen so much of it that it is quite difficult for me to separate the comedies and the serious movies because it is too confusing for me. I can only tell you how funny it is to see movies that I love, and how horrible the films I have seen made them. It is very difficult for me to decide which movies I am going to like.

This is one of the strangest things on TV . It is set in a bizarrely underpopulated Midlands superb called Bamburg. The town is not a place but a state of mind for the characters in the program, played by a team of young actors. It is a dark and dank place, full of a sense of mystery, and of a sense of the surreal, as well. It is one of those programs which can only be watched once. ‘The Bamburgs’ are a strange bunch, as you may guess from the title of the program and the setting of the story.

What a dreadful movie . The effects were poor , especially by todays standards , but that was forgivable . I have to say , I never expected this to be the end . I am glad , and I hope everyone will have a happy New Year . If I may , a toast ! I have never been so thankful that I have seen all of the movies I have . I wish I could come up with a better toast . I think this is a terrible movie . I will give this one a miss . I don't really care for any of these movies , but these are my favorites .

I had to suffer through this movie three times while I was a zombie extra in the director's new movie After Sundown. The first time that I saw this movie the director was standing next to me and a clearly fake and cheesy looking hand popped out of nowhere and grabbed one of the characters. I could not take it any more I busted out laughing right in front of the guy. The movie has no direction whatsoever and the one thing that could make this movie decent (Female Nudity) was nowhere to be found.

Lt. Claude ( Claudio Cassinelli ) and several prisoners from his sunken ship wash ashore on an island owned by the captain's widow, the widow of a man who has disappeared. He takes on the identity of the man in order to get to know the other prisoners. In a small town, an orphaned boy comes across a mysterious figure who looks like his dead older brother. Soon, the boy meets another young man, and together, they fall in with a group of thieves led by an old man who claims that his brother has disappeared.

This is a wonderful family sitcom . Rowan Atkinson has appeared in to other excellent sitcoms , The Thin Blue Line , and many more. Here are some of the best moments from the show that you need to check out , if you love Rowan Atkinson. So here it goes. Enjoy! Season 3, Episode 2 “Sailor”

“Sailing” was a good episode of the third season of “Rowan Atkinson”. Rowan Atkinson was having a lot of fun in his acting career and the show’s writing staff also made sure that there were funny moments for Rowan and the audience as well.

WOW ! ! Talk about a film that divides the audience ! This is a real love it or loath it movie. It will keep you in your seat for an hour ! As if all of that is not enough there are many other features to enjoy. It’s an engaging film ! There are some great comedic moments. And then, there is also a more subtle and profound message to be had by the audience. This movie has a real heart to it ! So, without further ado let me start by saying this movie is absolutely worth watching.

Donald Sutherland , an American paleontologist visiting England , picks up a hitch hiker one evening . Two years later, during a hike through the Charnwood National Park, he becomes the last person to walk on its ancient track before it was buried under more than 200,000 tons of mud. There’s nothing in this picture to give away its significance. In fact it is quite the opposite . Sutherland is the first American geologist to visit Charnwood. Not because he wants to, but simply because of the opportunity he finds himself on the verge of gaining.

Why would anyone make a film like this ? Why would anybody invest in a film like this ? Why would anyone go through the trouble to make such a film ? Well, it was the answer to most of these questions. It was the answer to all of those questions. That’s why it is “The Interview.”

The Interview takes place inside the US embassy in Moscow, Russia, on the afternoon of July 24, the day after a former CIA agent named John Brennan is sworn in by US President Donald Trump as director of national intelligence.

Boy Oh Boy, does this movie stink. This movie is one of the worst pieces of trash I have ever seen in my whole entire life. Please, even if your life depends on it, DO NOT, and I repeat: DO NOT under any circumstances, view this horrid piece of garbage. Only watch this thing when it comes on as a MST 3000 Episode. That was the only way I could sit through the whole thing. If I had to watch it without that show, I would've stopped watching it before it was over.

The Canterville Ghost ( 1996 ) .The director made this too sappy a production . Maybe it 's the generation problem . Not that I see it as that , but it 's all the more depressing when you consider what it must have cost to get this film. I'm getting tired of this crap, I've already watched it twice. Not saying you shouldn't, but at this point, you might want to check to see if someone else hasn't done a better review than me . What I find interesting is it's not so much about the story or even the acting .

Sony Pictures Classics , I 'm looking at you ! Sony 's got the rights to Harry records -- you know what that means, right ? We 're the only people who think we can't do anything better . . . and we just got the rights to do it, so there 's nothing left to say. . . . . I 'm not sure if I want to see it or not, but if it does come out, there's not much more to say. . . . . I have to ask, though, about the music that is licensed to us by Sony.

To be honest, I did never read one of the comics and cannot remember part 2 and 3 at all. I can compare to the first part (Werner - Beinhart) and this one here is really disappointing, compared to part1 as well as compared to most other movies I watched the last weeks. The first minutes seam to be just a needless clone of the first movie intro and then it is becoming even worse. There are a few good (funny) scenes, but in total it is just another boring second-rate try of German film industry that cannot succeed (nearly as usual).

After just viewing the movie , I must say this is one of the worst films I have ever seen, and if I watched it again it would be a lot worse, even the characters are not likable, the acting is poor, the directing is horrible and the plot is really hard to follow! If you like horror, action, and/or violence, this is NOT for you! You really need to get the other two movies, so you will not get bored and keep on watching! So don't even waste your time!

Thats what this movie really takes. A big piece of cheeze. This movie is about a sister and brother Bonnie and Clyde type of duo that creates their own party line in order to lure their victims in and trap them and kill them. But for what reason? Just for the fun of getting away with it? In comes Richard Hatch who comes across as a wishy washy ladies man. A real BAD version of a ladies man. And he gets involved with finding who's behind all the killings across LA. He finally meets a teenager who helps him find the killer and rest is for your fun and amusement.

For all the cast and crew who worked on this excuse for a movie, another payday in L.A. For any audience hoping for a fair return for the price of admission, a huge waste of time and money. The saddest aspect of this ugly exercise (to me) is that we are watching an extremely talented actor, Pacino, seemingly playing a parody of himself. That's what remained with me as a total mystery. I can fully understand the need for movie industry people to work and thus make a living.

Saw this film during the Mod & Rockers fest in August . I was so inspired and touched . Harry Hamrick is one of the coolest characters in the movie and it was a great moment seeing him . The movie itself had a bit of a feel about it as well . It was such a great film . I definitely recommend it. If you enjoy that style, this one is perfect for you ! Saw this during the Mod & Rockersfest in August. I was so inspired and touched. I love the way it turned out, the costumes, and the humor .

It has taken several viewings for me to fully appreciate this film. Initially, I was struck by the stylized sets, but found the rest slow going and dull. I thought that such a sensational subject needed the Ken Russell treatment to take it way over the top. I now find the enforced restraint (placed on the production by Mishima's widow) to be an asset. Some of the more lurid aspects of Mishima's life are reiterated and dramatized by corresponding themes from his novels. I think it helps to be familiar with the novels - that's what finally made the difference for me.

I know my summary sounds very harsh, but this film has very limited appeal. The average Joe out there would have a hard time sticking with this film. The entire film consists of animated loggers doing their jobs and dancing on floating logs. This is all done with very splashy and artsy colors and the film might be great to show to patrons in an art museum. However, unless you really love this sort of art or are a Canadian who loves films about your native land, then this is probably going to be next to impossible to finish.

This is the last episode of the Goldenboy OVA series . Kentaro finds himself working in an animation studio , while his best friend Yōsuke and his family are in the US. The animation studio is located in San Fransokyo , and Kentaro's office has a lot of anime related things. Kentaro finds out that his friend is a fan of the Golden Boy anime series , and he is invited to watch the second episode of the series. Kentaro starts to work in the animation studio, and then he meets his friend's mom , and they fall in love.

The first feature-length adventure of Jim Henson 's beloved muppet characters is a very competent musical comedy vehicle as Kermit the Frog and friends try to save their lives as a family of four at a house they own on a rainy, stormy night when the power goes out, leaving them trapped in the house. The movie is a little different than I expected, not only because Kermit's parents, Lassie and Fozzie are played by the same actress, but also because we learn a bit of backstory about the show's creators.

I watched this movie recently mainly because I am a Huge fan of Jodie Foster 's . I saw this movie in 2006. So far, I think it is better than I expected and it has a lot of what I look for in a classic movie. I have not seen it since and I cannot wait until the DVD release. I will give my views. I would give it 4.5 stars. This is my 3rd favorite movie and that is saying something because I really love The Matrix . This movie is not as bad as I thought.

Everybody seems to compare this to The Matrix and The 13th Floor, and when I first saw it I would have agreed -- I was expecting The Matrix and was a little disappointed. But upon repeated viewings my respect for this movie has grown immensely.The thing to keep in mind is that The Matrix is a great action movie with some philosophical mumbo-jumbo thrown in. The 13th Floor is a passable action movie with some slightly more interesting philosophical mumbo-jumbo thrown in. Existenz is not an action movie at all, and is not (as many seem to believe) about "reality" or any such "deep" concept.

This is the worst movie that I have ever seen . At first i thought that it was going to be good , but all the way through i couldn't stand to watch this movie . It was so bad that i couldn't watch this movie at all . This is the most depressing movie that i have seen in my life . I don't know how this movie was made . All the scenes that i am watching were just awful . My friends and i have watched this movie many times , and we still can't stop watching . I was really getting depressed when watching this movie .

THE QUICKIE (1 outta 5 stars)Pretty poor movie... an old-as-the-hills story about a high-ranking gangster who wants to quit, passing on his empire to his inept son. Of course, it's not going to be easy for someone in that line or work to just quit... so a contract is put out on his life. After throwing a big party an exterminator (Jennifer Jason Leigh, who I guess is *never* going to act in anything other than TV movies or low budget direct-to-video trash ever again) is called to the scene.

Why is it that in the '50s and '60s, Italians made so of the best movies, and then during the '70s and '80s, made nothing but zombie and cannibal movies? Probably because art films didn't make any money. , The Cannibal Movie, unlike the Zombie Movie, which was created by Americans and `exploited' by Italians, is a purely Italian creation, designed as a mondo exploitation showcase, and to make as much money as possible (no artistic integrity getting in the way here). Eaten Alive came during the Cannibal Movie heyday.

I think the manuscript of this movie was written on the piece of toilet-paper . No respect whatsoever to many other movie scripts . . . This movie has no sense of time . I don't think the screenplay is very well-written . I can't imagine what it takes to write a movie based on a short film. This movie doesn't do a very good job at it . It has no sense of irony . This movie is terrible . And the worst part of the movie is that it makes no sense . And it's all so bad . It's a mess .

Charles Bronson has given the viewers lots of great moments on the screen . But this movie lacks everything that made the previous ones so special . The dialogue is terrible . There is a great script but nothing is really happening in it . I have to say I couldn’t enjoy this movie even if I tried . If you want to know why this is not the best movie ever made I think it’s because its plot is terrible . It takes a great movie like The Last Picture Show and throws it out of the window.

This film is the most traumatising and painful horror film I have ever seen in my life . To know you would kill for a few seconds in this film is absolutely unbearable, the pain and horror are so excruciating that it’s hard to watch. I hope no one ever has to watch this film, I do. I hope I’m wrong about that, I don’t think I am. “I’ve been searching the whole world for you! I have been looking for you in every corner of the world and in every jungle, and all over the sea!

They say that it is always better in horror movies to leave things to the imagination of the viewer- to hide certain details from the audience in order to tickle their sense of imagination, dip into their fears and let that give birth to their darkest thoughts.That was not the case when I watched Bakjwi, under the American title Thirst. Now playing at select theaters near you. Seems like the film makers did not want to spare you any details. There WILL be blood in this film and you WILL try to look away.For rest of review please visit http://without-terebi.blogspot.com/2009/08/thirst-aka-bakjwi.html Thanks and hope you enjoyed reading above.

This movie was absolutely terrible. The only explanation I can think of for the good reviews it received from some here is that they were written by people in the cast. It was actually painful to watch this movie. Even my grandchildren (ages 6-13) could not bear to watch it. As far as I know, this movie never made it to theaters and for good reason. It's as if some people were sitting around having a beer and said, "Hey! Let's make a movie. Who wants to be in it?" It's that bad.

For a teenager who has never read Austen, this adaptation might be fine. But only for them. This is a disjointed "Cliff Notes" version of Mansfield Park, and if you have not seen another version or read the books parts of it would be head scratching.Why has it been so hard to do a good adaptation of this book? The one in the 1990s took such liberties that it barely seemed to be the same book - the mindset was completely modern and prurient.Here we have Billie Piper who looks like a pretty country wench.

Boring as hell and kind of a chick flick.It 's the story of a neurotic woman who struggles with the loss of her only child, her step-daughter. This is one of those books that you want to read so much that when you finally finish it you can't wait for the next one! This is a book that will appeal to a lot of people. I think it's a must have for all moms. It's also one that you'll definitely enjoy regardless of how you're feeling at the moment.

What an utter disappointment . Forget this abysmal film and get hold of the TV series instead . What on earth was the plot line of this show ? . There is no plot line . The show was not that bad . Just a few characters . The series ran from 1999 to 2002 . A few actors were in the shows but they did not do anything good . The actors who appeared in this TV series were very bad . Why did they keep doing it ? . This show had some good performances but the ones who appeared in these shows were not good .

This is truly , without exaggerating , one of the worst Slasher movies ever made . I know , it's one of those movies where the only thing we do know is, we're not in Slasher territory , after all, that's why I call it "Scary Movie". This is just one of those movies where I could never go out and see it , and I know there are many who would agree with me. This is why I say it's one of the worse movies in the history of cinema , and it really is so .

The film tells you to be aware and conscientious . It also destroys any and all things , the Bible says, that would hinder you , it's against the rules, but in my experience, if you are doing good, you will find that you will get rewarded , and that your life has been improved. The Lord is not in me but in you, because of your hope in his name, that is, the hope he gives you. -1 Thessalonians 3:11,12

Please take care of your health! I am not asking you to go out and do things, but to know how to live with God.

Tyra Banks needs to teach these girls that it's not all about being beautiful on the outside. The inside counts for something too. A lot of the past winners have looked semi decent but are horribly cruel and starting trouble for the other girls. I see Tyra less involved with the girls in every season. About the only thing worth watching Top Model for is Mr. Jay Manuel. Recently, Tyra had a contestant who was a pre-op transsexual. I felt that she should have done more to encourage her. It was obvious that she had insecurities about her original anatomy showing through her feminine look.

So , this is the WORST movie you will probably ever see . It 's up there with `` Crossbones ' . It 's as bad as the first `` Kill Bill.'' It has no redeeming moments , it has no redeeming ideas for the characters. It has no characters with any depth. It has characters with no depth . It 's as if a person who didn ' t care about the characters did not even see the movie . I don 't know if you can really blame this movie , or the actor who is playing all the major roles .

This is by far my favorite action movie . But what makes it work is not the elaborate Renny Harlin character. It's the way it was handled. It makes the movie look like a real story, and then you watch the movie where you get to see Renny in action, and it all comes together. This is the first film that's been like this for me. I'm not quite sure how it did this. I think most movies don't follow the same format. This is my favorite action film.

If all movies had to be destroyed and only one could be spared, Death in Venice would have to be it. It is a monument in movie history. Much criticized for being slow, boring and too obvious in stating it's point (an old man discovers beauty in a young boy and is tragically destroyed, first mentally, then physically), we should appreciate this movie for what it is. 'Morte a Venezia' was shot over 30 years ago, and it portrays a period even further back, at the beginning of the twentieth century.Life was slow then, compared to now.

I LOVE Dr WHo SO much! I believe that David Tennant is the best Dr the show has ever had and Billie Piper the Best companion! I liked the way the Dr and Rose had such a connection and a great relationship and the Dr came close a few times to expressing his love for rose! It sadly came to an end after only 2 seasons. I will miss watching rose heaps and think that the show will not be the same without Rose! But David is still there to make me laugh and make me happy to watch him play this fantastic role!

If you have never heard of Jane Austen , seen the original movie or the 1995 BBC adaptation , or have never read a single sentence of her work , you might find this page hard to follow , so let me clarify for you. The story is set in 1795. It takes place before the First World War , which is about to end in the near future. Jane Austen lives in England and is in her early twenties. The heroine, Emma, is an intelligent and well-to-do woman who is about to enter a very exclusive private school with her mother.

Its difficult to be too tough on Brad Sykes , a hard-working guy doing what he loves , there is no denying his efforts have paid off and he does what he loves. Sykes has been in the NBA since 1998. During those 16 years he was known as a shooter. From the beginning, his shot was the difference. From 1998-2003 his shooting percentage was: 38.5%, his 3P was: 37%. In 2003-2010 he shot an incredible 39.4%, the best percentage in NBA history. And in 2009-2010 he hit 41% in that span.

Believe me when I say this show is just plain hilarious. The basic story is about Kintaro Oe who travels from town to town taking part time jobs, chasing women, and learning all he can about life. Kintaro has to be one of the easiest to relate to characters ever made. He takes everything to the extreme, and it's just laugh out loud funny every time. From his constant never ending quest to study life, to tiny things he instantly blows up into life or death matters.One of the funniest things about this show is simply Kintaro's constantly extremely over the top expressions and reactions.

While this movie is not the most entertaining in the world , I think it is better than most over-the-top flicks coming out now , and it’s made me re-think this site a little. I’m going to cut back on my comments and posts. My point is not that this movie is a great example of ‘realism’, but rather that it gives you an interesting view of the modern world and how it is changing for the better. I also think that this movie does a fine job of exploring what it means to live in the present tense.

Mostly uninvolving biblical mumbo-jumbo that drags on for well over two hours. The only thing that saves this film from God's wreath (and there is only one God, remember) is the unintentionally funny dialog, and a good battle scene which comes far too late in the movie. For most of the two hours until the action scenes there is too much talking; the dialog is so inept that the movie just begs to be spoofed by MST3K.George Sanders is absolutely awful; one of the most animated, overly-theatrical performances I've ever seen.

I have always loved the ironic symbolism and brilliant cinematography of Coppola's masterpiece. I was lucky enough to meet Martin Sheen outside the Santa Monica Civic Auditorium one night in 1981, as he waited for Charlie and Emilio to leave a concert. He was very humble about the praise I shared with him for this work of art, especially his portrayal of the young Captain. This is, without a doubt, a must see, a complete 10 and an important part of American Film History. "Charlie Don't Surf".

First things first, I am by no means a picky movie watcher. I'm not one of those people who gets movies just to pick apart the flaws and criticize, I, like most other people, watch to be entertained. I'll basically watch any type of movie of, no matter how bad anyone says it is (sometimes a movie's so terribly made and written that it invokes a sort of pity humor which i get a kick out of). With all that aside, lil pimp was simply pathetic. I saw it on TV and just didn't know what I was watching.

... what a porn movie would look like if you took out the sex and just left in the bad stuff. And what the fuck does that tell you about the rest of our society? It tells me that we're still trying to figure out the difference between what we like and what we want. I have never in my life seen such blatant disregard for basic human decency and the needs of others. Not that I can think of any, at this time in our history, anywhere, at any place.

'Oldboy ' director Park Chun-wook returns with what must be one of the yuckiest and at the same time most poignant coming-of-age films ever made.' 'Punching up in the end of one of the best Korean comedies of the 20th century.' 'One of the most interesting films of this year.' But 'Oldboy' is far from a comedy in that it's a darkly funny look at what might happen in the Korean underworld if the young protagonists were ever in trouble. The film begins with two friends named Park Tae-hyun (played by Park Hae-man) and Kang Tae-sung, who meet and begin to study together.

I think that a lot of friends of people who acted in this thing must've come on and rated it because I'm telling you, its just awful. The acting is worse than soapopera bad, the effects are like something you'd see out of a 1970 episode of Doctor Who, the story is, well, there is no story. And they keep using the same 2 minute song over and over and over again. And the werewolf? Its like the muppets they used in Wing Commander, the giant cats, remember how bad they looked? The werewolf is that bad.

I wasn't expecting much from this tale of a kid whose term paper is stolen and turned into a movie script.. who then he travels to hollywood to get even.. but.. hey.. it's still a fun film. Frankie Muniz of "Malcom in the Middle" fame stars as the kid and is fairly good and Amanda Bynes as his friend is also very good. Yea the film does work as an advertisement for Universal Studios theme park and is really kinda a silly kids film.. but i enjoyed it anyways.

First of all , the nature in the movie is beautiful , and there is a bit of Mongolian music in the background which makes the movie look like an ancient Chinese movie, but still a good movie! It's a very simple story which you don't have the time to go into a deep and complex background, you have to go with the style and the feel of the movie. So , you have to leave it and just enjoy the movie, even if it has a bit of a mystery in it , it will give you an enjoyable and thrilling movie experience.

Okay, sure, this movie is a bit on the hokey side. It's difficult to take characters from comic books and put them into movies with any credibility (Dolph Lundgren as The Punisher, anyone? ), but this tries very hard. I've never read the actual comic book, but that doesn't really matter, I suppose. I judge a film mainly on its merits, not on whether it is a faithful retelling of someone else's idea. (Unless its a film based on a true story, that demands at least some attempt at truth and accuracy.)

***SPOILERS*** This movie - called EATEN ALIVE here in the UK is quite possibly the worst film ever made and is brilliant just for that. A sexy rich girl teams up with a rugged action man to search for her sister in the New Guinea jungle. What follows is an unspeakably crap mixture of cannibalism, insane cults and religious maniacs that has to be seen to be believed. The cannibalism scenes are quite horrific but are so badly staged and acted that they prove quite amusing. The cast are awful except for Janet Agren as the female lead who is excellent.

Without saying how it ended, it is sufficient to say that the whole thing degenerates from about five minutes before the end. If the standard had been maintained throughout, the movie would be worth a seven.One wonders in a way why a woman was added to the cast. (Well - not really!) The premise is a good one The situation the victims find themselves in is pretty terrifying and it's rather well done, but you get the impression the makers of the film lost interest towards the end, or as a previous contributor said, they changed writers and handed over to someone else.

"Scientists at a remote lab experiment on (insert scaly creature here) and create out of control monsters. In the meantime a crack military team/the scientist's daughter/bank robbers find their way to the remote place and are menaced by the giant critters. One by one they're eaten, all during an "exciting" race to not be blown up by the forces who initially created the monsters..." The sad thing is that this sounds like about a dozen movies which have appeared on the Sci-Fi Channel. I have to wonder just what is going on? Sure...

What a silly movie . While it looks nice , it does n't make a lot of sense . On one hand it looks like one of the greatest things you can do to your body . Then on the other side it looks like all of us need to go through the whole process of a detox . I mean really what is the point ? Well the point is you can do so much on your body without a detox . Sure you can lose weight . But it's not like you are getting a real body . You're still getting rid of unwanted fat .

Watched this when it was first screened and then missed it when it disappeared of British screens . It showed the first 10 pages of what was to be a 4 page story. After that it was split in to two. Then it was cut down to 2 pages. The film was made for a total budget of about £1million. The film has been dubbed in several other languages and is also available as a DVD in the UK. “I first heard about it as an adult, reading a book on the internet.

All I can do is echo the sentiment already expressed by some of the other commenters. This is CITY OF GOD meets HAPPY DAYS. The bipolarity of the ruthless thug (one minute a ruthless killer, the next minute a Luv's diaper commercial) is completely unconvincing. You can approach it in one of two ways: (1) A gritty, realistic movie turned sappy; or (2) a sappy, ABC-afterschool-special with profanity, violence and animal cruelty. Either way it just don't fly, do it? Why then has it received so much praise?

Firstly, few colleges allow students to take courses from their parent's lover. Secondly, few women professors are sleeping with dorm cooks. Thirdly, few brassy coeds have a dad who cooks in their dorm. Fourthly, once a SECOND member of a college small-group project team meets a violent demise, the college PRESIDENT will disband the whole class, and NOT turn a blind eye as the professor merrily steers the rest of the group toward grisly deaths. Since the supernatural elements of CULT make absolutely no sense, it is useful to study the mundane content of this film to truly appreciate how much this flick really sucks!

The first season of Bones is playing in Finland and I ca n't believe the amount of bullshit that this season has gotten, but let's look at it from a different perspective. Season one had some of the craziest shit happening in this show ever and I mean that as an understatement. Season 1 was so awesome. In a way that makes sense considering the series is in Finland and that the writers in Finland are very serious about what they do, but still very fun and funny as hell, there is a reason this season has to have that kind of crazy shit going for it.

The main attraction of Anywhere but Here is the superb performance of Natalie Portman. She gave her rather thankless character a lot of much-appreciated emotional depth. Susan Sarandon, a fine actress, is suitably sincere as the mother figure. I thought the chemistry between the two stars was believable, a chemistry that could have been developed more with a more involving script. I am not saying the script was bad in any way, I am just saying it seemed underdeveloped at times. I don't think it was the script writer's fault.

I saw this movie a fews years ago and was literally swept away by it. So charming and so very romantic. David Duchovny and Ms. Driver have chemistry that is so hot, you will need to take off a layer of clothing. The supporting cast is 100% top notch. Just watching Caroll O'Connor and Robert Loggia play off one another is pure poetry. Bonnie Hunt and Jim Bellushi and a wonderful team and some of the films most charming moments are when they are on the screen. Like Jim Belushi screaming at his children to go to sleep "FOREVER!"

I've felt that Rupert Grint has a lot of promise from that role by which everyone knows him. So even though I had never heard of this film before, when it appeared in my cable TV listings, I immediately switched to that channel. I am so happy that I did! I've read from other reviewers that they don't generally like coming of age stories; I on the other hand quite do. I am one of those who is always coming of age; I have been since I was 12, I'm 52 now, and I will probably continue until I'm 92.

I like many others saw this as a child and I loved it and it horrified me up until adulthood. If you think that's a bad thing just know I did. I didn't realize what was in my own head until I was 30 years old. It's not something you learn from your parents, or teachers, or friends, or any of that. It is a part of your brain and that is what causes you to act the way you do and it may or may not be conscious.

I really liked the Far Cry game, nice graphics, good level-design, interesting and clever enemies, above-average length and even a somewhat decent plot. I am not by default against movie spin-offs of games. I thought "DOOM The Movie" was hilarious. But what Uwe Boll has done here, is to take the game and modified every one of its good aspects and turned them into something horrible (well not the length, the movie runs only a merciful 90 min) The characters are even more stereotypical than in the game, which is quite an achievement.

I was duped as well. Here I was expecting all sorts of man eating Pirahnas and what the hell do you get.An hour and a half of nothing, but awkward silences with some weird guy, who isn't weird enough to be scary.I thought there was no way $5 could be too much for a movie.Damn I was sooooo wrong. It was very hard to watch the whole thing.Don't fool yourself. Its not so good that its bad. Its not even that kind of movie.Its nothing. an hour and a half of absolutely nothing.PIECE OF CRAP!!!!!!!

I too saw this film at a film festival , but unlike the previous poster I found it both interesting and entertaining , but overall it was a dull piece of work . I would rate it a 2/3 , although I must say I do feel it is worth a 3/5 , given the potential it offers , but as it is now I don't want to spend much money on watching a film based on such a trivial story . I thought the acting was okay , but the acting in this film is a joke .

This movie was so bad it looked like a home movie. In one scene, the camera very slowly and gradually tilts down, then moves back up into place again. The sound is crackly, and occasionally fades out then in again. In another scene, the camera man is just visible in a mirror.Then came the scene with instructions how to put down a tent... which, believe me, went on for ages and was completely irrelevant to the plot. Most scenes dragged on with conversations that were not entirely relevant either. In my opinion these were just to fill out the movie and make it longer.

Fred Williamson , one of the two or three top blaxploitation stars . Cynthia Rothrock , one of the two or three top black actresses in this decade . There has been much speculation about the two or three women who were chosen by the show’s producers as the new lead actresses . I have heard some of this speculation a lot, but it seems as if there’s more truth in it than you might guess. Here’s the deal . One of the reasons why I write about movies and TV shows from time to time is to talk to other writers and critics about them.

Not too good a movie. Sure, it contains action, but the effects aren't all that good for a '08 movie. Gunshot effects are downright horrible. Acting is "meh" It is nothing like Far Cry, other than names and the very basics of the story (genetically enhanced super soldiers going amok). The super soldiers are very different, the mercenaries are different, the setting are completely different (tropical island in the pacific in the game, island in northern-ish America in the movie).I loved playing Far Cry. I loved the story and setting.

Uwe Boll slips back in his film-making skills once again to offer up a scifi horror tale of mercenaries and reporters taking on super soldiers on a remote island. An okay cast headed by the excellent Udo Keir is cast adrift by Boll who makes the worst of script that should have worked. The mad scientist being investigated by a reporter has been done to death but this script is amusing enough that the plot should have worked, additionally the effects and super soldier design with their dead lifeless eyes have some degree of creepiness, however Boll somehow manages to film everything in an off handed way.

I thought this movie was cleverly written and very well acted. Its a movie that greatly surpasses other films in terms of originality and enjoyment.Rupert Grint played the part marvelously, and has a general knack for the acting business. The almost obsessive mother added quite a lot to the plot, and was a character one could almost instantly loathe. This reminded me, in a way, of the Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood. Not by means of actual content of the film, but the premises, and overall tone to the film itself.

Roy Thinnes and Joan Hackett are superb in this 1970 melodrama . The lush settings , the haunting music , the characters, the setting in general . . . It’s a brilliant film. It’s a wonderful film, a film that could not be better. If you are looking for something to do this weekend, you should go and watch this film. It’s not just for the film, it’s also for the people behind the film and those who were involved. If I were to recommend this to someone or to anyone, I would say look at the cast as a group.

This is the essence of the early eighties ! The malls , the credit card machines , the food , the internet , etc . I can't tell you about how to have a great holiday without doing all these things ! There are many different things you can do this year. It's hard to remember all the stuff I did last year, but just a quick tip on some of these that are important . 1. Get a Christmas tree. You don't need any special kind of tree for Christmas . I like the ones that go on sale around the holidays.

Actually I'm still in doubt if there's anything about this movie I like. As for the story: unrealistic and very exaggerated. The acting was too bad in my opinion. Not very likely that Antonie Kamerling will get a Rutger Hauer status. Some folks will expect it anyway. First let him work on his English pronunciation. If you watch the 'trip' to Paris of these actors (DVD-extra) you will most likely want to trow up. Advice to Beau Dorens: stop your acting career, you'll never get there... To the 2 main 'actors': grow up, please.

One Life Stand is an accomplished piece of film making which hasn't been given the credit it deserves. Its IMDB rating of 1.7 doesn't do it justice and is, perhaps, due to the very few screenings it has had rather than the quality of the film itself. Shot on digital in black and white, the film is well directed with production values that belie its shoestring budget. The performances are excellent, particularly that of Gary Lewis who gets better with every role. My only criticisms are that it is a bit on the long side and could have done with a touch more humour to offset the darker moments.

Oh my god , WHY , did I waste my precious time on this film ? It is pathetic , not even worth the time it takes to say anything ! It is just so depressing ! Why did I make this film ? Because there was a film on the shelf in my house , in my collection, and it was a low budget movie , about a man who is going insane after he has been in jail for five years , and his mother dies and he is left behind , because she was in love with his step father .

This is one of those movies that has everything in it . I do n't think I would get tired of watching it at any point. Great cast , great script , great story , great actors . The only problem is , I had to watch it for about 30 minutes. One of my favorite movies (so far), I absolutely loved the ending. It was so suspenseful. I really wanted to like this movie, but I wasn't expecting it. The ending is a little over the top. That's not a bad thing, but I'm really glad that they pulled it back.

Dark and bleak sets, thrilling music that cuts through your spin like aknife (or razor) a perfect cast lead by Broadway greats Hearn and Lansbury. This is exciting theatre flawlessly transferred to the small screen. Sondheim is the most talented songwriter of our age and Todd is his Masterpiece, from the Brechtian opening ballad to the darkly humorous Act I finale- "A Little Priest" where Lovett and Todd fantasize about the victims that will wind up in their meat pies , this play never ceases to thrill,excite and satisfy.

One of the best sitcoms to run on Indian television along with Dekh bhai dekh and Idhar udhar. Great acting, well paced and an extremely amusing script made this a truly memorable series. The fun filled opening montage (sung by none other than the inimitable Kishore Kumar)gave a very accurate picture of what one could expect. I used to borrow it from my local video library years after Doordarshan had stopped airing it. I wish Indian television would revert back to serials such as these rather than the asinine saas-bahu soaps and reality television which is all its good for these days.

'Helen of Troy ' follows the story of Helen and the outbreak of the Trojan War . This is more or less a reworking of the story as it was told originally, with only minor alterations. It is told in the form of an episodic story, but the characters and plot are largely the same. I have chosen to follow the plot as it was originally told, and to make some minor changes. The book is divided into two parts. In the first part, the main story of Helen is told, and the events of the events of the war are set in the background.

This film requires a lot of patience. Because it focuses on mood and character development, the plot is very simple and many of the scenes take place on the same set - in Frances Austen's (the Sandy Dennis character) apartment. But the film builds to a disturbing climax.The characters create an atmosphere rife with sexual tension and psychological trickery. It's very interesting that Robert Altman directed this, considering the style and structure of his other films. Still, the trademark Altman audio style is evident here and there. I think what really makes this film work is the brilliant performance by Sandy Dennis.

I saw this film at the 2002 Toronto International Film Festival.This is the first Indian film I've seen in the Tamil language, and while it does share some similarities with other Indian films (wonderful music and choreography, sweeping storyline), the director attempts more than just to entertain. The film tells the story of Amudha, a precocious nine-year old whose parents reveal to her that she was adopted, thus beginning an odyssey that takes them all from India to war-torn Sri Lanka. Gorgeous visuals mix with horrifying scenes of violence expressly to make a point, though it is a simplistic one.

This movie is not the scariest of all time , but it is a great example of a campy eighties sci-fi disaster movie. It’s not the best, but every movie has some of the best campy elements in it. This movie is actually pretty good, but I can’t help but think it is a step down from the other campy “science fiction” flicks like The Day The Earth Caught Fire (1987), Contact (1977), and Armageddon (1989). I’ve seen those flicks just about every day for a couple years now.

This movie is a great film . The movie shows so many themes all in one amazing film . Driving and sex are the two important themes . This movie is all about driving and sex . It is so funny and sexy . It is just the right mix of sex , action , driving , romance . This movie will definitely have you satisfied . It is a movie which you can enjoy anytime . This movie will keep you going till the end . The story is just that good . One more thing, this movie will give you satisfaction , and that’s the only reason to come out of the movie .

The reviewer in Variety said this was "overwritten and overlong", and I kind of agree with it. It has some events that seem forced and unlikely, like when Cal (Crudup once again as the 'lost, vacant, and kind of dull' male) and Julianne Moore find a map of the US in kind of an unbelievable place. The story is one of those 1970's "guy must find meaning in his life" stories, and I found myself imagining Jack Nicholson in his prime playing the role of Cal.

I can't believe I rarely ever see this title mentioned by all you eighties horror freaks and I definitely won't be joining all my fellow reviewers here in saying that 'Bloody Birthday' is awful viewing. On the contrary, I enjoyed it very much and I was pleasantly surprised by the ingeniousness and surprise twists it offers.
