Don't just refer to this film as being 'another 80's slasher' because the victims here are rather unlikely and so are the killers. We're introduced to three cherubic-looking youngsters who were all born during a solar eclipse.

The original Female Convict Scorpion is an all time masterpiece. The first sequel, Jailhouse 41, was not quite as good in my opinion, though it's still notable for the fact that it took the idea from the original and created something in a completely different style. Director Shunya Ito has managed to do the same thing again with this film; the story is a bit different here, but still he's managed to take what made the previous entries excellent and better than many films of this type and craft something fairly original around it. Again the action focuses on Nami Matsushima (a.k.a.

Hulk Hogan stars as a champion wrestler ( A real acting stretch ... ) named Rip , who is forced to take a long road trip across America to save the day when he finds a body of a recently dead body. In order to help him in his mission Rip has to learn to use his unique talents to his advantage. The film was originally supposed to star Kevin Smith , as well, but he passed on the role. Instead, a number of other WWE wrestlers were cast to play the roles of Hogan's friends.

You 'll feel like you 've experienced a vacation in Hell after you have sat down and watched this horrible video. I could not believe it was happening to an innocent little kid. What kind of a sick world do they live in where people just don't care? This kid deserves a whole new life, and I hope I get to share it with him one day so I can give him a chance to feel the love of God again. If I have to pay for his treatment, I can't wait to watch it with him so we can talk about what happened.

I love this show. It's clever and very well acted. David Morse and Andre Braugher have great chemistry. The writing is clever and subplots generally give great comic relief. After every new episode, I'm always amazed how thought provoking and at the same time entertaining this show is. My only complaint would be Donna Murphy's absence, at this point, in the second season. As David Morse ex-wife, Heather, she added such character to the show.I think this show is a credit to the crime/drama genre.

It 's out of question that the real Anna Anderson was NOT Princess Anastasia . Apart from very distinctive differences , the photos look the same ! On another note , how come only the photo on the left is not on this thread !? And how come that it is on the first ? Oh yeah , the right one is not in this thread because I am too tired and don't feel like bothering with this discussion, let me know by commenting here ! That's right ! The original photo, on this thread, is indeed an original of the Princess Anna Anderson.

There is one adjective that describes everything about this film - acting , plot , effects , continuity , etc . The film starts off with a strong action and then it develops very slowly till the end . The action is good and the stunts are very effective . The acting is of course excellent , but it goes beyond that . The story is very well told and it keeps you hooked till the last minute . The film is excellent , and has all the elements that a good movie needs . The cinematography and music are very well used and the film is well shot with excellent special effects .

In my opinion of this movie the entire video portion of this movie was absolute trash ! ! ! ! ! ! The actors were simply not believable . Every single character was completely unbelievable ! In fact they are more believable than all the characters of the second film in the series ! And the only thing that makes the second film in the series worse is that the whole thing starts at the very same time . And in the first one the audience never really gets to the second part . It is always just a re-run. And it has never made it to the second movie .

I watched this movie by accident on TV and it was so unbelievably awful I could not switch it off. It took place in Japan and the storyline was about a young boy who was taken away with his family from a village to a city. After being there for several months the child’s parents decided to bring him home because they were too old to go back to their village. When they arrived in the city the boy’s parents thought they had made the right decision when they brought the child home with them.

The first episode of 'Man to Man with Dean Learner ' that just aired was at least up to scratch on its first appearance on this side of the Atlantic. An episode of BBC television drama Man to Man that aired on 8 September 2015 and had the tagline, "It's a long way to the top but it was worth the effort.". On the surface, "It's a long way to the top" is a bit of a cliche for a television drama series of this scale. But it does have a lot of truth to it.

"Mr. and Mrs. Smith" is one of the not too well known early American Hitchcock's movie. But if "Lifeboat" (wich unfortunately also belongs to this category) is an underrated masterpiece, not all the movies signed by the master of suspense in that time (the early 40's) are really worth seeing. And to tell the truth, not discovering this film isn't really a lost."Mr. and Mrs. Smith" is an average and conventional screwball comedy, where it's rather hard to find the Hitchcock's touch.

This was touted as a sequel to Crash Dive , which was a very good film in the low budget horror vein. It didn't get made, but the novel was published by L. Ron Hubbard's Hubbard Publishing Company. The novel was also published by Hubbard himself (with some revisions made to the novel before publication). This novel is an adaptation of the screenplay from the original film (see below). The film was shot in London, Canada, Germany, France, Belgium, Japan, and the UK. The film is based on a screenplay written by Ron Howard and directed by Howard.

^^contains spoilers^^This movie is utter crap. Do not watch.There is no one in this movie to root for, or even like, except for the wife, and she wins by default. Everyone is selfish, and many things happen that make no sense.The acting is mediocre at best and everyone breathes too heavily about everything. No one can even cry believably.If you leave the room for even a second, then something totally out of left field will happen, and it will make NO SENSE WHATSOEVER.For example, I left the room for a second, while Jennie Garth's character was sleeping with her manager.

The aftermath of World War Two almost resulted in the death of Soviet cinema. In the early years of the 1950s, film production came close to a complete standstill {a mere nine feature-films were released in 1951}, and the work of all filmmakers was closely monitored, and often censored, by the government. Following the death of Joseph Stalin in 1953, filmmakers were given greater artistic freedom with their pictures, though many remained reluctant to challenge the heroic, optimistic and propagandistic stance towards warfare that had been prevalent in previous years.

I rented this film out of the local video store one day , you know , the kind of movie I usually don't watch because it is just so stupid but this one was different because I knew the director so well and could get the details right . This film was so stupid it was hilarious . The entire film takes place in the same location and with the same characters but in slightly different ways , some are funny and others aren't so well acted and some just look like crap but it all makes sense .

The subject is World War II and Robert Ryan is a rejected soldier whom Lupino hires as handyman . She has a son, a widowed mother and two daughters. One of the daughters dies in childhood and she takes the other sister into her arms. She then leaves her family and goes with the widowed mother and two daughters. She then takes her two children to Europe . The movie is an American film released in 1946 in the USA and in 1949 in Italy. It was released in a very poor quality, but in the best Italian film that was made from 1947 to 1952.

I was sorely disappointed in this movie . Twice I was temped to walk out because segments of the movie were so badly done . The acting is poor . I have had a hard time watching this movie . I thought it would be much better because the film was not based on a true story . The story is good but the storyline is poorly written . I have never seen such a poorly written story for such a well written movie . I was not disappointed because I thought that there were some good scenes . The acting in the movie was not good enough to keep me happy .

From the crash of the opening theme, "The Man With the Golden Arm" is classic 1950's entertainment. No subtlety here, Frank comes home from prison with a monkey on his back and goes right back to the old neighborhood, where the old scumbags still lurk. This is a tale of his dark ride with all of his emotional baggage intact. The performances are all a bit overripe, but that's part of the fun of watching. Darren McGavin and Arnold Stang are unforgettable, and almost steal the show.

This must rate with the worst films I have ever seen. It just wasn't funny. My wife fell asleep. I suppose if you are the sort of person who goes all gooey eyed at the sight of a dog then it may do something for you. If you expect a comedy film to have some humour in it then you will be disappointed unless you find an English radio announcer saying the f word a lot hilarious. The strippers in the club kept their underwear on so there wasn't even a bit of nudity to relieve the boredom.

I have just seen Today You Die . It is bad , almost very bad.1 ) The direction and editing . The direction and editing is very bad, it doesn't seem to matter what is shown , they have no respect for the viewer , they simply show what they want to , this is not a good movie , they don't know what they are doing here . The movie is almost like a movie , it seems like something out of horror or a movie with horror in it , this should have at least been written in a different script or with a different production company or something like that .

The Canterville Ghost (1996).The director made this too sappy a production. Maybe it's the generation, but I really liked the Charles Laughton version. There is a time and place for "emoting" and this production does not translate very well. Patrick Stewart, reciting Shakespeare was very good, but still inappropriate. Would neither recommend nor watch again. The close-ups and padded text and sub-plots were lost on me. Adding extraneous material and scenes takes away from a truly great work. The screenplay writer should find another profession in which to misplace his talent, maybe afternoon soap operas would be a better venue.

Though it's a Christmas movie, "Christmas in Connecticut" could have been done any time of year, as it's the story of a soldier who spends what is to be an idyllic time with a Martha Stewart type. That's what he thinks. In reality, the lady in question, portrayed by Barbara Stanwyck, has a popular magazine column about life on a farm with her husband and baby. She has no farm, no husband, and no baby, nor are the many recipes she publishes hers. They belong to the restaurant owner nearby.

I would say this is a background movie . Play it the background as your tending to busy work (I mean as you work as a background movies) or you might enjoy to watch it the next day or you can watch it later . But I would recommend to watch it when you are not having any work , just watch it , you have some time . So if you watch this movie , and you watch it , you will not regret of that . I am sure you will get lots of views for this . You can go and download it from this site.

I was so excited to finally watch `` Pulse '' after receiving it from Amazon , and I have to say that the film is pretty awesome. It is a story of two young women who were involved in a suicide pact that caused a war between the two. The story is about the way one woman's life takes a different path and how a man tries to keep the peace. It is also the story of two sisters and the men who try to help them. The film is made up mostly of black and white photos and the colors are quite simple.

The first feature length Muppet Movie , and excepting maybe The Muppet Christmas Carol , the movie puppeteers the world has ever had had to rely upon for live shows, were the cast of The Electric Mayhem. Although the first feature length movie was a disaster, the cast and crew were able to overcome this in the following years in order to create a sequel in a much more professional and professionalised way, and in so doing, set a new standard in the live-puppet art. Of course, there are many similarities between the live-shows of that era and those of today.

I do n't know how this film went unnoticed for so long.I saw this film on TV , i was blown away at the performances , great cast and screenplay. My favorite moment so far is when all the women fall to their knees while praying to Jesus and ask for forgiveness for all they have done and the pain they've experienced. It really hit me hard when it was just the two of them , not a crew , not an entire film crew , but a few people praying together to the Lord. God bless them all and all I can ever do for them .

In defense of this movie I must repeat what I had stated previously . The movie is called Arachina , and it is based on life story of a girl , which I believe is a great story . There are a lot of things the movie does that makes it more than just a silly action movie , but it's not. I actually liked the movie when it came out , but now, I can't stand it , I've been seeing it since it's release date of August 27th 2013 and I'm quite disappointed.

Mute Witness is a modest, yet very solid thriller that never really received the attention or good comments it deserves. The film  written and directed entirely by Anthony Waller  is a tense, action-packed thriller with black comedy aspects and horror influences. No pointless mumbo-jumbo or endless plot-twistsjust straight to the point mystery. Mute Witness handles about the vicious topic of `snuff'-movies and is effectively set in Russia. *** SPOILERS *** Since the production costs are cheaper there, a US film crew temporarily moves to Russia for shooting a horror film.

Rowan Atkinson delivers an unforgettable performance as the clueless Mr. Bean who never goes far without his Teddy Bear . . . and then ends up getting mugged when he can't pay a bill! It's one of the best episodes of the series . . . if you don't already have a love for the story line and the way it's shot, you're missing out. (It's also one of my favorite Bean episodes.) It's a classic story, and I highly recommend it for young children and anyone interested in how the Bean family operates.

A woman finds herself caught up in an apparently inexplicable rash of suicides . Then again , are these really suicides at all? She gets a message that her partner is on the roof and wants her to meet him there . When the man does meet her , he wants her to sign something . It is a suicide pact . But when she signs the pact , the man goes away . Why? Is he leaving because he is leaving because she has not signed the pact ? or has the act been misinterpreted by her as an act of suicide because she has not signed it .

Totally forgettable movie but an unbelievable soundtrack : I 'd give it ( soundtrack ) a 9 out of 10 if they'd just leave it be. The only thing i'd like to change is that the movie was made a long time ago so it would've been better than a generic action movie

Well i agree that the soundtrack was not the main thing but it was the best part of that movie. But the whole plot was just to make you forget about what you have to do and enjoy yourself. I wouldn't say that it was an awful soundtrack.

I first viewed this film shortly after it was put out on video in 1995 , I dismissed it offhand , saying it was too “cartoony” to be true. And then when the film was finally made available I found myself getting into it, because I was so interested. The story is about a “manmade” virus, with a very specific purpose, that was deliberately released into the population of a city, and then unleashed to kill everyone in the surrounding areas. I have no idea if it happened, or if it didn’t.

THE QUICKIE ( 1 outta 5 stars ) Pretty poor movie ... an old-as-the-hills story about a high-ranking gangster who goes on the lam and starts a gang war that ends up wiping out everyone on the planet. I'm surprised no one has made this movie available on the VHS store ... but I can't get into this movie either because it is just awful. It doesn't hold up on DVD. It's the kind of movie you don't want to get into unless you're dying for a good gangster flick. In short, forget it.

The Vietnam War era is certainly far before my time, but it has always interested me, and I have seen many films about it. All of the others I'd seen had dealt strictly with the front-line of battle. When I read a description of "The War At Home," I found the concept intriguing. No Vietnam War movie I'd ever heard of talked about what happens to a soldier once the fighting is over with. One night, while flipping through channels, the movie aired on The Sundance Channel. I set down the remote and settled back to watch it.

I saw this film at the 3rd Adelaide International Film Festival at the Palace cinemas , and was totally switched on. I saw it the next day and the first thing I thought was , "That's a great script. I think I can make this." So I went to see It and it was brilliant. I can't wait to see what the second book will have in store. I can see it going anywhere from a BAFTA Award-winning project to one of the most critically acclaimed features of the year. There was one scene that had me cracking up in a really, really funny way.

Reba is a very dumb show. You can predict pretty much anything that's about to happen. Barbra Jean is just too stupid. It's like she's not even a character. A show like this should at least have SOMEONE who resembles a real-life person. I guess Barbra Jean represents a retarded person. Keira or whatever her name is, Reba, Brock, they're all stupid! Keira is like the smartest person on the show, and she's still stupid. EVERYONE IS STUPID! That's my opinion on Reba.

It beats me how anyone can rate this film very highly . It is no understatement to call it farcical, it has more elements of a farce than anything you would expect a film made in America to have . In fact in some parts I have to admit it reminded me of a farce . I don't like farces . I saw this film at the Cannes Film festival and although I liked it ,I was not surprised . I saw the trailers on the internet . I was amazed at how well written this film was and that it was made by American people.

I was sitting at home and flipping channels when I ran across what potentially sounded like an interesting film. I like Destruction type movies and decided to watch it. I don't know why but I ended up watching it the whole 2 hours. We have seen this type of movie I don't know how many times.Back in 1998 - 2000 there were dozen of films that dealt with global destruction of some sort. The best one on my list so far is Deep Impact which was more believable than this one. Here are my problems with this film: 1) cheap special effects, like something out of the old computer.

`` Rififi '' is a terrific heist movie , and one from which subsequent heist films have drawn ever since: it's the only film in which the protagonist does not possess the ability to steal, nor the means to break in to the vault. The film doesn't tell us much about the criminal's background; it just shows us one of his crimes. We don't see him actually doing it. We only see him steal the money, then we find out what happens after the robbery, after the heist is over and the criminal is arrested.

They call this film "euro trash horror". Well, it's not horror. The film takes place in Europe, so yes, it's "euro". Trash? Ah yes, it's trash all right.You know you're in for a great movie when, right at the beginning, the DVD gives you text on the screen apologizing for the quality of the print you're about to watch. Expect crackles, odd jarring cuts, and for the movie not to fit the screen. Plus there's the sound -- at first I thought I was watching a dubbed film.

"Lets swap Murders- your wife, my father"- seemingly innocent conversation between two strangers - Bruno Anthony and Guy Haines when they meet over lunch on a train journey. Guy, a solid, respectable tennis player, whose problem is that his wife, the flirtatious Miriam, won't divorce him so he can marry senators daughter Anne, laughs the whole conversation off as a joke. The following week he isn't laughing any more. In a scene of classic Hitchcock suspense, Bruno stalks Miriam through a carnival and strangles her.

Right... so you have a dam, tons of water (that seems to flow really really slowly) and a small town that happens to be right underneath the dams path of destruction. Throw in a profiteering glutton, an apparently mentally unstable and disgruntled architect and his son, and then to spice things up you add a weak plot and bad acting. All in all, when you have a look at this film from a paying customers point of view... I would feel extremely peeved off if this was a pay-per-view film. If you want a laugh... then you really need to watch this film.

I 'm sure that any legitimate submariner would happily ship out on the USOS Seaview ( yes , SOS ...) for training. But in this case, I think I see a big problem:
We can train on this vessel and they will send it back with an EOS. The EOS needs to include all of the EOS training that is taught on these ships, which I believe includes an entire training session on how to use the EOS and how to maintain the radio. Is it fair for a submarine to be sent to a foreign country on a ship that doesn't have these basic things taught?

As a total movie geek with the fortunate job of video store manager , I tend to watch all sorts of films. Some of my more recent favs include: Star Wars: Episode III: Revenge of the Sith , The Hunger Games: Catching Fire , Star Wars: The Force Awakens , and The Chronicles of Narnia . I recently had the opportunity to get a chance to review a film called The Lion King . For those not familiar with the film or the characters, The Lion King is the most successful motion picture ever in the history of cinema.

This movie is terrible, it was so difficult to believe that Katie became a heartfelt teenager with the power to save the pity Chinese people, the movie didn't show any convincing argument to prove that. And the rest of the plot didn't make any effort to show us more than a cheap common sense... The plot is ridiculous and the only thing we can extract from it is that it demonstrate how arrogant a human can be. Katie must have inherited her arrogance from her mother, the most annoying character I have seen for a long time.

I'm racking my brain, but I can't seem to think of another movie quite like The Valley of the Gwangi. A Western with dinosaurs? What could be more natural? You gotta wonder why John Ford and/or John Wayne never tried it! The plot  While searching for a mythical miniature horse for her circus, TJ Breckenridge (Gila Golan), Tuck Kirby (James Franciscus), and the rest of the cast/characters enter a strange, lost valley. There they find not only the miniature horse, but some other, more fearsome creatures as well.

I had to watch this movie for a film class , I suffered the whole time through . I am not a huge fan of action , and I thought this movie would be well done , however it never reached that point .I was expecting at least some action and a good story , but there was not a lot to it . It was ok , but not a great film . Maybe I just have a low tolerance for action movies . But I can tell that I would not recommend this film to everyone . There are some good parts of it , but you would have to really want to sit through it .

Jennifer Montgomery's "Art for Teachers of Children" is a stunning, disturbing masterpiece. Montgomery's gritty camerawork and cinematography coupled with the brilliantly unemotional performances she evokes from her cast heighten the sense of shocking, raw realism in this autobiographical story of a 14-year-old Jennifer's seduction of her married boarding-school guidance counselor. The scenes between the amazingly uncanny actress playing Jennifer (Caitlin Grace McDonnell) and Jennifer's mother (actually voiced by Ruth Montgomery) on the phone are some of the most intriguing and powerful I've ever seen captured on film. The lesson ultimately learned here?

****Contains Spoilers****As a fan of Rachael Leigh Cook, I watched for this show to finally come on so that I could see it. I taped it so I could watch it several times, and there is something about this show that really bothers me!I recognize that this was a made-for-TV movie. Not only that, but it was made for Lifetime, which is a channel that I despise. Because it was made for TV, I can ignore the huge plot holes. I can ignore the massive lack of character development in Ally Sheedy's character.

In the European TV industry, movies like this one are called "stickers". TV stations buy them and air them because when they wanted to buy broadcast rights to, let's say, Titanic, some not-really-blockbusters were a part of the deal.14 Hours is a story of a hospital, its employees and patients who have to face the worst flood slash storm ever. Unfortunately almost from every scene or shot one can tell that is was a low-budget film.Newborn babies are very obviously not real, there is no background action and probably the worst thing is the doctor-acting.

If You can watch a film without worrying about the plot, or corny acting, then Backdraft is definitely the one.However, if, like me, you like watching films that you can believe, then Backdraft has some serious flaws. It doesn't offer anything new, and there are hundreds of 90's action films that follow identical formulas, whilst not being quite as clunky.After two firefights, i'm thinking, this has got to go somewhere else, i mean, how many big fires are there in one city? Surely firemen do other things, such as getting cats out of trees?

This could have been a really good movie if someone would just have known how to finish the film.The story is good but the ending was not believable. The characters are well played, and I would like to see more of them though they were not developed. The action scenes were great, but I didn't expect much when it was first announced. So many things are going wrong that I can't figure out how the bad guy even knew it was coming. This could have been one of the best action films of all time if only the writer would have made an effort.

I 've been trying to write a plot summary for several minutes now and ca n't seem to do it. I'm at a loss. It looks to me, at least as a summary, that there is a character that is in the middle of a conflict with other people and that his/her actions will cause other people's actions. I'd be willing to consider that it is possible to have a strong character in that role and yet have no motivation or reason to cause other people or events in their lives. However, I'm not entirely certain that it can be done.

`` The Man From Utah '' opens with a singing cowboy strumming a guitar on horseback . This is how the movie begins: "When the sun shines . . . " The opening titles are catchy, but they don't reveal what the movie is about . The movie begins as "a story about a young man traveling across the country and finding himself caught between his father and his sister," but doesn't reveal why he is traveling, and how it leads him to his ultimate fate. I think that is what is so important about the movie: the journey of the young man.

The plot : Michael Linnett Connors has done everything in films but direct , and is looking for his 1st movie directorial job. The film is about an Irishman, Michael Connors, who is sent to the US to fight in the Civil War. He’s part of a large Irish contingent that helps defend Washington DC against British troops led by General Henry Knox, an ex-British Army officer. Connors is forced to go on the battlefield by the general, but he finds that he enjoys the fighting. While on the battlefield he begins a friendship with an Indian girl.

Well , I have been to a British University , in fact I went to the one in this very area , I went there because I wanted a career in IT. I wanted to work with computers and do programming . I decided I wanted to start working on this computer game , I did a programming job there and I made some mistakes , it was a very short time there , but I loved it and I wanted to continue working on it . I started my job there and I was in a department that was mainly made up of programmers .

I know not why people considered it trashy or obnoxious ; It 's not like American Pie or something . And it 's not as if it was made for teenagers who could not have sex . It was for teenagers who have never had sex . And it 's no where near as sexy as anything that is on the list . If you think it's trashy or obnoxious then you've got a problem . It's the kind of movie that if you want to be taken seriously you'd better get serious . And as it happens , I have actually got a problem .

The best so-bad-it's-good movie ever made. Rudy Ray Moore is my personal hero. Whether dealing with day to day life or pimping ho's down the block, I can always look to him for inspiration and guidance. When it comes to blaxploitation, Rudy's the man. Nobody is meaner. Watch Dolemite as he and his army of all-female kung fu killers take down Mr. Big and Willie Green. Awesome plot, huh? There are so many one-liners that multiple viewings are necessary to improve your vocabulary. If you say a couple of lines from Dolemite, you are instantly cool.

Jim Henson 's The Muppet Movie is a charming , funny and brilliant film that can be watched AND enjoyed by anyone. It's also a great film if you've never seen it before. Henson's film is not perfect. It does not follow the script exactly, and there are some moments that are rushed and poorly shot. But it's still a good film that you can enjoy. The Muppet Movie is a very well-produced, fun and educational movie that I highly recommend to all Muppet fans or those interested in learning more about puppets and the world of Muppets.

This film powerfully demonstrates the struggle of two women in love in a culture so deeply entrenched in ritual and ritualism. When the film starts we are presented with a scene of the two women preparing to consummate their love - and that is the scene which really makes it all the more striking. But then the movie shifts gears a little and goes a little deeper. There is a whole sequence in which we are offered a view of what life would be like without love - how we would look at each other. We hear about the different ways we would treat each other in different situations.

Better than average World War II-era `` who-dun-it '' featuring Warner Baxter as a former gangster who suffered amnesia and who, when he comes to a military town, is recruited for the war effort. In this version of the film, the title character, as a young boy, takes to the streets of a small town to cause trouble for its inhabitants when, for reasons unknown, his father is absent, and when, later, a military unit is called out to investigate the boy, he meets many of his fellow-townspeople. The film was also made on location in Germany.

This particular film was one that I wanted to see in theaters , but never got around to it . for those of you who have not seen this film , let me refresh your memory on what you need to know before you begin , 
you may not have seen it , but you should see it and learn a thing or two , 
if not , you may be stuck with it . after all , is there one thing you know about this film , is it better or worse than what you have seen on tv ? . as we have watched the film , it has made no difference .

Golden Boy is in my opinion one the sleeper / lost treasures animes out there. A sexy comedy, about a young man quest to find his nitch in life and he blunders into all sort of odd jobs that somehow has this rather sexy girl who ultimately falls for him but he not really realizing it! Its truly something that you can easily miss if you at the name, but once viewing it...will fall for the comedy/silliness that lies inside. Truly a crime that only produced 6 OVA episodes and pilot movie were made. However, being unique as it is.

The film Soultaker is essentially an older form Final Destination in which several car wrecked teens have their souls separated from their bodies and must cheat death who is chasing them... The film has its moments, and its concepts, the idea of disoriented souls being separated from their bodies is a pretty nifty idea... If this movie were remade with a few good actors/actresses and some awesome special effects it could turn out to be extremely awesome... As for the actual film, I recommend watching the MST3K version, the pure version might be too boring to sit through, unless you love bad movies staring Martin Sheen's brother...

I suggest if you have already seen the original American Graffiti, do not see this movie. If you haven't seen the original, I still don't recommend this, but it will be a lot less painful to watch. The characters from the first film are great, and by the end you fell a connection to them. This movie sets out to show how bad their lives have become. It's a chore to watch!Set on New year's eve in 1964, '65, '66 and '67, we have four stories about the characters from the first film.

A great film . Every moment masterfully conducted by Toyoda and his crew . The actors give credible performances all throughout . They are all very convincing . The movie has a very unique style . It gives the audience a chance to reflect . It takes a look at the social issues of the time in Japan . The story line is well crafted . The cast is very good . The music is nice . The special effects are great . I think it is the best film of its kind . It deserves to be one of the top films of its genre . A must see .

Man , what an awful film . As with many terrible films , the structure of its awfulness lies in its characters. There are good and bad , but no one is good and no one is bad . The story of a group of high school boys who are forced to kill each others fathers , one of whom is a psychotic maniac , is an interesting one . The boys are not so much the good as they are the bad . There are some good parts : the acting of John Mahoney , Richard Jaeckel , and Frank Thomas is good and there are some great suspense moments .

While trying to build a major mall or complex or something like that , a wealthy landowner ignores ancient Native American laws that say not to build near the water. In those times, the owner could build on land which is owned by the state of Arizona. In other words, you don't have to own the land or the river. Today, the state of AZ owns everything but the water and has an agreement with the federal government to sell water to the people. So the people do not own a river but instead own a small piece of land and a few miles of river.

First of all , let me say that I am in no way denying the importance of the subject - but let me just make one small comment. As I have said above, I believe that in the long run we should all be working for a world of peace, and not for a world of war. And that includes all the other issues you mentioned. But at the end of the day, the world as we know it needs to change for the better, and that changes us. And I do believe in the importance of education.

Finally! Third time lucky. This film has been always been on my mind, but my first viewing I forgot about it and only caught the second half of the film. Then only a couple months later I had the my second chance of watching of it, so I decided I would record it. Only to discover that my timer went off late and again I missed the first half of the flick. I wasn't going to allow that to happen again. So, when it came on TV again, I thought bugger it I'll wait until it comes on, then I will record it.

If I were to pitch this movie idea to some Hollywood bigwigs, I'm sure it would sound like this: ME: "Four boys at a private high school are good friends, AND they are witches. "Hollywood: "That sounds like "The Craft." ME: "No, no, I said four boys, not four girls." Hollywood: "That still sounds like "The Craft", just with boys instead of girls." ME: "OK, but there is this fifth unknown boy that comes into the picture and he wants more power.

I can see what this film was intending to do . Unfortunately it just never quite completes the deal . I'm not going to put this film up for free but if you feel like it and you want it, I will gladly give it to you for a donation. I hope to hear from you soon. Thank you! :)

_________________"I think that the world is ready to believe in miracles, but that's not my job." "The only difference between a lie and truth is to believe in the one while denying the others."

The storyline of this movie is cliché and obviously has been ripped off from Jurassic Park . The filmmakers did not follow the rules of continuity of the first Jurassic Park movie as it has been said by many other movies that have come later that Jurassic Park 3 was supposed to take place between the first film and the first sequel as well as the next one but they made it work. This movie is probably the one of the most overhyped movies to ever come out of Hollywood and I must say, I don't think it has all that many flaws.

Incident on and off a Mountain Road is Don Coscarelli's entry in Mick Garris' Masters of Horror series. Coscarelli is famous for being the man behind such cult gems as the Phantasm series and the irresistibly weird Bubba Ho-Tep; but he brings none of the qualities that made those films great to this TV episode. The plot is a run of the mill one that follows the routine idea of an innocent being chased by a madman. This time, it's a young woman driving down a mountain road. After a head on crash, she finds herself being stalked by a white faced maniac.

This fantasy was utter garbage. I thought Michael Moore cornered the market on ridiculous anti-government movies, but this one was far worse than anything he ever did. No wonder critics of the British media complain it's driven by tabloid journalism. This movie is a left-wing loony's greatest fantasy come to life on the big screen. Anyone even slightly to the right of such rabid Bush-bashers should be appalled it ever got funding to be made. I'm sure it will do well in Syria, Iran, Pakistan, and North Korea, though.

Absolutely the most thoughtful, spiritually deep, intense Hamlet ever done -- no other version comes close. Jacobi has the best understanding of the role of all the actors that have played it. Patrick Stewart's Claudius is ferocious and still sympathetic -- I particularly like the two doofuses playing Rosencranz and Guildenstern. Very feckless and yet sinister. Some might gripe about the need for a strong Ophelia -- she's not a strong person, that's the point, and Lalla Ward hits the proper nuances. Amazing. Simply Amazing -- every one of the more than two dozen times I've watched it.

When I first saw Stella on comedy central I thought `` god , this is horrible ! '' But I got over it after I saw this. I loved it. And after I saw the DVD I saw that the episode in the credits that is on there, it is actually the second episode in this season. It is actually the 3rd episode of season 2! That is awesome. I saw the episode in the video store and it was fantastic. I haven't seen season 1 yet, but I will get to that soon.

If I had to pick the most depressing movie, try to be suspenseful I've seen it'd be this one. I know about how good the original is supposed to be, it had better be better then this one. The movie's so dark and depressing but it isn't interesting to watch either-I've seen depressing "thriler" type movies that were saved because of the suspense to counteratc and balence the dark quality. Vanishing didn't have that, This was so disturbing to watch to begin with and there was nothing positive to make this a classic type movie.

This movie was beyond awful, it was a pimple on the a*s of the movie industry. I know that every movie can't be a hit or for that matter even average, but the responsible parties that got together for this epic dud, should have been able to see that they had a ticking time bomb on their hands. I can't help but think that the cast would get together in between scenes and console each other for being in such a massive heap of dung. I can hear it now, "You getting' paid?"

A complete and utter waster of my precious two hours . The entire movie could have been made in less than thirty minutes . The movie has one of the biggest laughs in a film and I was laughing for about 3/4 of the movie . I enjoyed the movie . I really enjoyed this movie . My first thought was that the actors were playing a game for the audience . It was like a musical . The actors were having a lot of fun with it . The characters were well written and the acting was well done . A few people on the internet said they laughed out loud at one particular shot .

I expected this movie was originally supposed to show before the election. CBS's last shot at throwing a dig at Bush. This movie was just awful yet I'm still watching it. **Minor Spoiler** I think CBS got the same people who "provided" the memo's to do the semi cut in half sequence. What is with the bad boyfriend storyline? Can the acting be more contrived or the dialog more like a Ed Wood movie. Who ever came up with this script please do us a favor stop writing.

Very odd, this seems like a very average movie to me, if not slightly less. It is brilliantly shot but, together with the performance of R. Lee Ermey, that's about the only redeeming aspect I found in the movie which consists of two separate parts. The first part covers the basic marine-training which, watching it in 2007, comes off like something I've see a zillion times before in dozens of other movies and series and it's not particularly gripping. After 30 minutes I got the idea and wished they could just get on with it.

This is a entertaingly bad b-movie. Actually it really is much better quality than a lot of b movies. It had a consistent script, decent direction, cinematogrpahy, and I have seen worse acting. The zombies were great, clearly these were Romero zombies, and was really a interesting zombie story. Obviously not Oscar material, and if your not into zombie movies, or b-movies you probably wont enjoy this, but if you are you'll like this movie.The main clint eastwood knockoff western character guy is pretty good, although they never really clearly explain how he can heal himself from gunshots and zombie bites.

Many believe this movie is a baseball movie . Such people are disappointed because it 's about a baseball player . What they fail to understand is that it 's a baseball movie and baseball players are a part of our society . They don 't need to be stars to make a good movie. If they don't like baseball, how do they know about the film . This movie has been made by people who have seen the game for 10 years and it's all they do . This is baseball . I don't think anyone can say they don't know or care about baseball because it's a game.

I am looking at all the good reviews about this film and I start thinking to myself ... Am I going to see this again ... I mean ... how will the movie be made ? ... Will I enjoy it ? I guess so ... I want my money back. I don't know about you but I can't wait for this movie to come out. A couple of months ago, I was lucky enough to see the latest installment of the Twilight Saga: Eclipse at a very nice screening at the New York Public Library.

Art imitates life imitates art. Atticus Finch is reincarnated into the D.A. in this tragic and suspenseful gripping documentary that plays more like a who-done-it and how did it happen. The authenticity and sometimes reluctant honesty of the individuals make this a compelling story in many layers. Although racism is one of the themes there are other elements such as work ethic, integrity, and coping with grief that have drawn me back to view and review this film again and again. The music is driving but not obtrusive; the pacing and visuals are such that there is no mistaking the fact that these are real people going through an authentic experience.

I caught this on HBO under its category of `` Guilty Pleasures '' , and I would agree that I am not an exception to the rule. I enjoy the show immensely, and there are many of my favorite movies and TV show's I find to be the best. This is such a great movie. The actors are all so good, and the movie is extremely well paced, and I don't think there is a dull moment to be found. If you liked the movie and don't have a copy of it on DVD, well, this is for you.

I was expecting a lot more of this film than what I actually got . The acting was just awful , the dialogue was awful , the cinematography is terrible and the production values in general . I thought the movie was okay in the first half but in the second half the movie starts to lose some of its credibility. The acting was bad , the dialogue was awful , the cinematography was terrible , and the movie was just mediocre in every sense of the word . I can understand the first half and the 2nd half could not. But it was a waste of time and money .

I loved this film, Independent film-making at its best. The cinematography , pacing, rhythm , and acting were perfectly in sync. Fred Carpenters best work to date! The movie is well written with lots of plot twists that take you to a great ending. It moves well and keeps you involved. Being a photographer, I was most impressed with the cinematography. the lighting creates mood and a beauty that is usually found in a much bigger budget film. This gave the actors a great canvas to start from, to work their magic. And that is just what they did!

Definitely a movie for people who ask only to be entertained and who do not over-think their movies . Lots of humor and laughs, a few of which I am not sure if were intentional, I will leave it to others to decide if it worked or not. The plot was funny, the actors were not bad, the plotline made sense and you can enjoy it as much as you like. A good watch. I didn't get a lot of sleep in the first two days of shooting. I really wanted to finish this film, but I couldn't bring myself to do so.

A spaceship in some unspecified future where human beings are equipped for space travel and have laser guns for weapons, crash lands on a strange young planet where dinosaurs are coincidentally also evolved and only on this world, have not gone extinct...yet. The survivors of the crash, roughly ten bland characters wearing blue, white, and yellow suits, fight for survival against the alien prehistoric monsters. "Planet of the Dinosaurs" is a peculiar movie. Like I said in my summary above, the stop-motion animated dinosaurs in the film are the only colorful actors.

I hardly know where to begin in writing about this gem , except to say that it represents young Buster ‘Sully’ Williams (born December 5, 1993) as a young man. He’s already in his first year of junior high school, but it’s not long now. He has made his mark as a senior when he earned all-state honors and the Gatorade All-State team in baseball. He is a three-star athlete and is ready to play in college. We have a few days left to get to know him.

Me and my mates used to gather together in one house to watch this on a Friday night before going to the pub. It was the only programme that ever made us miss opening time. It is one of the best comedies I have ever watched if not the best. David Jason was brilliant and was compared many times to Buster Keaton with his clever stunts that were pulled off so believably. I wish I could get hold of the series on DVD to watch again. He had an amazing ability to make stupid things look believable and this series shows how much talent he has in so many different directions.

I saw the trailer for this film before watching Titanic , and I must admit that it whetted my appetite for the film. It was very well made and the acting was very good. I had a difficult time watching the film, because I found the acting to be a bit on the overacting side. The lead actress (I won't go into the details) looked a bit silly on screen. I really enjoyed this movie, although it did have a few problems. The pacing was slow, and the special effects were poor. In a lot of ways, this was similar to Titanic.

I had to write a review for this movie based on the ones that are saying gory , non stop action scenes . I am sorry I won't give a spoiler , but I think that the best part of the film is not the action , more so how the characters react to this type of action . It's a nice change from most other type of action films , and I really like the actors of the film . The film is based on a novel by Philip K. Dick. The film revolves around three brothers , played by Jason Statham , Jason Statham and Jake Gyllenhaal.

The Mod Squad is n't a movie , it 's a void . That 's the most fascinating thing about this film , and one that I have never experienced myself. This is the first feature film I have ever seen based on a short story of mine. I was a fan of a number of short stories for years , but none of them were this original or this creative , so this is the first movie that I saw that took me into a world with its own characters that I can relate to and that I have really liked .

It's worth boning up on the Hindu pantheon before watching this film. Three main female deities -- wise Sita, nurturing Lakshmi and Kali the Transformer -- as well as three main male deities -- grave Rama, playful Krishna and Shiva the Ender -- are all alluded to. Knowing the folklore as surely every Indian member of an audience does lends a richness to the telling of the present-day story. In fact, one folktale is enacted first on stage, as part of a lesson in spirituality, and then in the movie's "real life."

this movie gets a 10 because there is a lot of gore in it.who cares about the plot or the characters. this is just a horror movie that gets a 10 for having a decent story and decent characters. you can't just write a good story in one go and then you have a decent movie. if you want a film to get a 9, then you have to write a good story first. the plot was a decent enough story but this is a horror movie and you are trying to put blood in your movie.

It was September 2003 that I heard the BBC were going to resurrect DOCTOR WHO and make it `` Bigger & Better than it is now ``. It seemed a very good idea, at the time. After all, the TV show was, after all, the BBC’s best seller, its best selling science fiction and fantasy book series ever. So, I was thrilled to learn that Doctor Who would be back at the BBC for a two-part reunion. It also seemed the perfect way to spend the summer vacation. I was also excited to be spending a week with my family.

It 's not fair . I was really expecting this to be a hilarious , entertaining movie . I mean , the main thing I wanted was a story that would entertain . But there was way more than I expected . . ._

Rating : 2/5 - it's a bit of a let down for me , it is a bit predictable , and not as interesting as I would've hoped . I really do hope you do not mind me saying that . Rating : 3.5/5 - you know what you should do when you start watching a movie with more than 15 minutes to fill .

I , like many this evening braved the frigid winter and long lines to see what I had anticipated to be a great show . . . but my expectations weren’t in line. There was, in any event, a very strong line up of local bands. This wasn’t just local, it was national. There were about a half dozen bands playing, and in fact, I was a little underwhelmed. But when I got up there to see the show, I thought they’d live up my expectations. There were about 20 people in the first half of the show.

I watched this film a few nights ago and it was awful! Awfully long - even though they managed to skip through the majority of his life!Awfully boring - the parts they included were long-winded, and for some reason the director chose to cut away from some of the action and left huge parts of the film unexplained! Awfully inaccurate - the whole'mystical' side to this film was a joke, and last time I checked Ghengis Khan wasn't exactly a nice guy! Awfully acted - I found several of the characters hard to believe, they were very two-dimensional and lacked and kind of depth!

Grand Champion is a bit old fashion at first glance. Andrew Morton at the Fort Worth Star Telegram said it best "If Walt Disney had hailed from Texas, he would have made Grand Champion" The movie does not have the video and special effects but it has heart and soul. The kids are great and the array of stars is incredible. I bet Bruce Willis and Julia Roberts are proud to be in a movie that their kids can actually see:) (G rated) This is a masterfully crafted "simple" little film made in Texas by Texas Barry Tubb.

First off, the editing of this film consisted of one major flaw which I don't understand how was missed - you consistently see the overhead microphones bobbing in and out of the film. The first time I saw it I just said "well, mistakes happen" and brushed it off. After about the 10th time, it began to get incredibly irritating and distractingly funny. If you haven't seen the film yet, try counting how many times you see the microphone; might make for pretty interesting game.Now, about the film.

It has taken several viewings for me to fully appreciate this film . Initially , I was struck by the film's ability to hold the viewer's attention, as well as the fact that the plot and performances were well-written. But as the film continues, I've realized the film is more of a story, rather than a musical, and in that I have grown to appreciate it more. There have been a few instances in the past that I've noticed the film could have been better , and so I'm pleased that this film has been able to hold my attention so completely.

MR. BASEBALL is a film of paradoxes. Written and filmed as a "light, sports comedy" it truly has a heartwarming core as human and universal as some of Capra's finest. At the plot level, you have the paradox of baseball, a fine old American game, as it is played in Japan - turned around, with American values cast off and Japanese values imprinted upon the game. (Some of the superficial "sports comedy" results from Jack's uncomprehending disbelief at how "basa-boru" is played in Japan.)

I almost laughed out loud when during the commentary the director said this movie is original with a strong plot line. There is not one... repeat ONE original plot line or special effect in this blah movie. The Crows.... Hitchcock did it superbly back before CGI and even with CGI this film falls short of a well done attack scene. The creepy crawly boy... The Grudge did it and did it better. The psycho...done in Cold Creek Manor most recently, however it has been done to death. No pun intended.

An on screen caption informs us that it is 'the Caribbean Sea, May 1891'. A small lifeboat drifts aimlessly at sea containing six convicts from a shipwrecked prison ship, and the ship's Doctor a Lt. Claude De Ross (Claudio Cassinelli). It's night, a strange current takes the boat towards a strange, unnamed and uncharted island. The boat hits some rocks and is torn apart. One of the prisoners is killed by what appears to be a slimy mutant fish-man creature. The next morning morning Claude wakes up to find himself washed upon a beach.

A killer ( John Karlen ) with a penchant for really bad disguises ( afro wig on a white dude ) is sent on a deadly mission by the United States government to hunt down "terrorists" ( black dudes )

The reason the government wants to kill him, they say, is because he's killing too many of our own people that they think are terrorists

But he never gets the chance to be hunted down because he escapes from custody

The only one that's ever caught is the one that had to kill him, but who will ever get the credit for finding him?

A big disappointment for what was touted as an incredible film. Incredibly bad. Very pretentious. It would be nice if just once someone would create a high profile role for a young woman that was not a prostitute. We don't really learn anything about this character, except that he seems to be a hopeless alcoholic. We don't know why. Nicholas Cage turns in an excellent performance as usual, but I feel that this role and this script let him down. And how, after not being able to perform for the whole film, can he have an erection on his deathbed?

This is one of the better feel-good films of 1999 with Kate Capshaw leading an all-star cast about a small group of women working together to protect a man. The women are not perfect and they are not all saints, but they get through it and do it with style and class. They all work together and do their part to do the right thing. It's no easy task for these women. In fact, we don't even know who these people are. We only know what they do. And that's all we see and hear.

Does anyone else think that `` Reba '' is basically a ripoff of `` Roseanne '' ? Just look at both of these films and tell me if there is even a similarity between the actresses in either one of them. You can't. You see the similarities only when you go to the trailers of the films. If you do go to the trailers, there will always be a hint of how much they have stolen from one another. _________________"I love you, too. It's just, I never knew how much I would love you until then."

To think this film was made the year I was born. To think people are still having their constitutional rights taken away, now in the name of "homeland security". To think this movie was intentionally banned from the American public. PUNISHMENT PARK addresses the political divide in the United States better than any movie I've ever seen. Had it been more widely seen, would it have changed anything? A movie like this is so polarizing, it has the potential to cause riots. It shakes you up and forces you to take sides.

I was totally surprised just how good this movie actually is because when I first saw it I was only thinking it was a comedy and really I’ve been pleasantly surprised how well it is actually a good movie. I have to say it was a very enjoyable movie to watch. I found the characters and the humor to be very believable and they are all very endearing. I really enjoyed the chemistry between the different people that the movie is focusing on in it, and I just hope that this will become one of my favorites.

I was a guest at the Sept. 30th screening of Eddie Monroe and was pleasantly surprised with the story, the great acting and the talented directing. I found it hard to believe that all this talent can be found in an independent film. Powerful performances by Vario, (Uncle Benny), Sara, (Jessica Tsunis), and Morris, (Eddie Monroe). The supporting cast was chock full of colorful and amusing characters. This film reminds me of one of those movies that you will look back on in 20 years and discover that it launched many actors into stardom.

Is it really possible that so many people in this film believe that the girl is a witch ? Just ask yourself the following questions:

How much time did this girl spend doing magic ? What was the training she did to become such a powerful witch? How much time would she have to spend being a witch to gain the skill to become such a powerful witch ? What is the minimum period of time for witch training and for being a witch in this film? In the beginning of the film she is seen using her magic with the help of her friend.

There 's lots of ketchup but not a whole lot of sense in the supposedly explanatory third sequel , which finds its way to Netflix and, if you like that sort of thing, you will not be sorry for the wait. It’s not as good as its predecessor, but this time, it doesn't feel forced. The original was a high-speed chase thriller in which, as the title suggested, there is a ' chase'. It was a good one, and I think we can be grateful to Netflix for having it back after a long absence.

I was impressed with this film because of the quality of the acting and the powerful message in the script. Susan Sarandon plays the part of a flighty, irrational and possessive mother, who constantly gives her daughter the message that they must stick together. She removes her daughter from a dysfunctional but loving family in Indiana to pursue an exciting acting career in Hollywood. The daughter is dubious, but at first she has no choice--- the bond with mother is pathologically strong.In time the girl sees that the mother is off into flights of fantasy and does not have her feet on the ground.

I remember seeing a clip of this movie on HBO when I was a kid and it scared the ever living crap out of me. When I found it, I watched it. I wish I hadn't. The movie wasn't scary.The plot revolves around an old woman running the castle. She feeds this horribly disfigured person in the cellar of a 12 century castle. She continuously beats the poor guy every day and feeds him. Well, that day, she dies. Then, a few months later, a family moves in. A father, a mother, and their blind daughter.

In Sweet Water , the ambitious entrepreneur Dick Krantz ( Jim Storm ) is constructing a resort in the middle of nowhere, in order to lure wealthy tourists who would otherwise skip the trip. As he tries to sell his dream project in the tourist-focused city of St. Louis, the city tries to sell him the city itself. When the project is threatened with a series of lawsuits, including one by the developer's son who claims that Krantz's property violates city land use laws, it is up to Krantz to keep his project from being demolished.

Ever since 1981 , Nintendo has been making great video games such as Super Mario and Zelda . Most ideas that were conceived in these games can be easily ported to other 3D games as well . Today, the developers of the first installment of the series, Mario Bros. , are finally ready to bring the series to the big screen again , and Nintendo has announced that the movie will hit theaters on July 11th of next year . This movie will feature the voice cast of Mario and Zelda as well , so you'll be able to hear all the voice actors of both characters!

I just saw a terrible film called The Sleeping Dictionary . One reviewer on Four Word Film Review ( www.fwfr.com ) was absolutely right:

” The Sleeping Dictionary is an unqualified delight. It’s simply brilliant. It is not a particularly subtle film. But there’s such an abundance of it, you’d swear it was written by a writer half-blind. There is a lot to look at and I loved the first hour or two. It’s got a very good script, a good cast and a wonderful soundtrack. The acting is, of course, absolutely incredible.

Finally! Other people who have actually seen this show! It is the funniest anime I have ever seen, but most people have even heard about it. It is just hilarious. 'And so kintaro will continue to ride his trusty bike and maybe one day, he will save the world....or maybe not'. tare just some classic bits in it 'and so he will ride onto the next city...because he has no choice since his brakes are broken (study study study)' And some of the lessons that he writes down in his little notebook, 'today i had a very educational experience.

Okay ... for the most part , and all its cheesiness , this movie was actually pretty good for an 80's movie ... and it's really good that it has that kind of budget, as it's a film that was made on such a modest budget that I have to wonder if that kind of story would have been able to come out in a later movie... In the end, however, it's not a good movie. I saw this movie at a midnight showing with my dad on a very rainy Monday night.

I feel really bad for reviewing this movie because I wish that I had only watched it as a concept, because it was just too damn long and boring. I really wish that I was only reviewing the first half or half the movie and that my review would have only made sense for the movie that I watched in that half. What I ended up doing is reviewing the entire film with the exception of the really bad acting, and I'm hoping that it's a good look at why the film fails to be an epic movie.

ALERT : This review contains major SPOILERS . Do not read on if you plan to see this film.Judging from trailers and previews I wouldn't put it in any category unless it was the last film to be directed by Joss Whedon and starring the main Avengers cast. But if you're a fan of the show and have the time I'd definitely watch it and I'm sure it will be good to see what Whedon has been able to bring to the role of Thanos and how he has been able to expand on his character.

I saw One Life Stand when it premiered at the 2000 Edinburgh International Film Festival and was blown away by the scope of a film with an incredibly powerful and moving story, which I thought was one of the most powerful things I had seen in any medium at all. It’s the story of Michael, a boy whose mother is mentally ill. After her death from suicide when he is 15, he has to decide whether to go to a youth centre, stay there and attempt to live in peace and with his father.

Okul is the first of its kind in Turkish cinema, and it's way better than I expected. Those people who say it's neither scary nor funny have a point, it's not all that great indeed. But it must be kept in mind that everyone involved with the movie is rather amateur, so it's basically a maiden voyage. And comparing this one to Sinan Çetin's other films such as the 1st class garbage "Propaganda", this movie is pretty damn good.One thing that MUST be said: It deals with the highschool students' life in Turkey VERY realistically!

This third installment in the Scarecrow series is by far the best of the lot . I know , I'm a bit biased , but it's actually the best book I've read all year , at least in terms of pacing. The setting is very much like what we see on The Walking Dead . There are lots of zombies , and a lot of them are very, very scary , but the setting is very much a natural part of the world , as opposed to the horror movies that were made for television . I really do recommend it , if you like scary stuff .

Have seen this movie today. Very disappointed and wondered how it could be in the Oscar shortlist. The most sad things are:1. It's very slow. 2. How Ghengis-khan, cruel and mighty emperor of Asia can be played by a kind, good actor with warm and lovely eyes - during all the movie except one scene? 3. Lot of holes in the plot: there's nothing about how he became the emperor; nothing about where he spend 20 years between his childhood and mature age. We see an ex-slave without money, power, friends or home.

this movie was incredibly stupid with meaning what so ever. i fell bad for all the actors and actresses that ruined there career to be in this stupid movie. the entire movie was based on how unrealistic they could make it, to make little like it which made it even stupider. even some of the names were unrealistic. the film is fun to watch which is why it had 2 out of 10 stars. this is probably the 3rd stupidest movie ever made. i got really made after i realized that it had mostly adult actors in it yet in was a kid movie.

Burt Kennedy both wrote & directed this western taken from a novel. Kennedy was a well known good writer & director, mostly westerns.Robert Mitchum was a star for over 20 years when he made this. This role was like many he had made already,One can see why he was a big star for so many years.He filled this role easily like a well used glove.The title character is played by Robert Walker Jr. (his father a fine actor Robert Walker--died tragically at age 32---his mother is noted actress Jennifer Jones).Robert was of slight build & even though he had talent only made a few films.

I was amazed at the quality of this film, particularly after seeing pictures of the barely adult director - all 140(?) lbs of him! Truly, a boy directing a movie about a boy. I look forward to seeing more Luke Eberl films.I did think this one was a bit too long. There was too much time spent showing Connor being unsuccessful (and unwilling) to make a move on Owen. Caleb didn't try hard enough. Owen, being so young, could have easily become closer to Caleb and later decided it wasn't his preference.

I 've waited 9 years to watch this film , simply because i never saw it advertised on TV . it was not a disaster . i watched it because i had to , and i had to rewind the clock . and i didn ' t care for what happened later in life either . but i think the movie is better than it sounds , and i have a good feeling about the movie . because i think the movie is better for me . this movie is better than a lot of horror films i have seen . but this is not about the genre .

I got this for my birthday in a box set under the name Broke Skull. Well, after watching one on the DVD and being pleasantly surprised, I popped this sucker in. It was worse than I had expected, and I didn't expect much. This movie is basically a convoluted story about a guy who dies and comes back to life with the mob, and other bull crap. There was some interesting ideas in this that were never followed up on. Now everybody has been saying there was a lot of gore, can somebody tell me were?

there is one of the best movies directed by andrzej wajda , that story told about young writer who is very rich and very ambitious and thinks of writing a book about his life . this book is based on this young guy who wants to find out all about himself , because his parents are never around . i think this is a very good film because it's really about self awareness , about curiosity and wanting to learn , but it's also a movie that has some very nice moments that we don't usually see in movies .

so if a guy meets you and he says 'I want you to look at my erection!' don't be alarmed, maybe he wants you to look at the film he made about how his house was to be built. yes! that's the only thing what happens in this movie! it's like the worst Warholian BEEP I ever saw! it's like filming the inside of your toilet before you flush it, in fact, it's less interesting to look at than that.but if you do watch Lennon's Erection, be warned that he put a lot of background noise in it too.

Okay , it 's a movie for children , and it 's not one of those movies that adults will like , so I am going to give it a chance . This is my attempt at making a movie with a little help from my daughter . And she 's good at doing just about anything, so don't get your expectations up . . . I will let you know in about a week . This is my first time posting anything on my blog . I have so many plans for this movie . I will share it with you as it unfolds .

For all the cast and crew who worked on this excuse for a movie , another payday in L.A. For some of the major stars and producers who have no idea what a movie like “The Bigger the Better” is about, the film will be more of an “excuse for a sequel”. It will be more of a moneymaker than a film that was a critical and financial success. The cast was made up mostly of the major Hollywood studios. It was a box office and critical hit. The producer’s were not even the ones who brought it to life and put a film together.

This is by far the most repulsive and atrocious version of The Scarlet Pimpernel ever to be devised. As a Pimpernel fan, I was sincerely offended by what they did to the characters--but this atrocity is not worth watching, even if you aren't familiar with the story.Percy Blakeney, for example, would never stab people in the back just to get down a hallway. Chauvelin would never have a string of women in his bed. Marguerite never had an affair with Chauvelin, nor Armand with Minette, whoever the heck she is. Chauvelin would not randomly shoot Tony in the head.

cool flick. enjoyable to watch. hope to see more from Fred Carpenter soon. i really like the location setting with all the new york references. it was interesting the way it all unfolds in the end. the suspense factor was effective and the acting, though kept simple, was also effective in portraying the characters. there are a bunch of neat little tricks incorporated into this film that make all the better. i think the supporting actress did a great job in her role. the casting and directing in this film seem to be sewn together seamlessly and the quality of the shooting is quite impressive.

Oh dear ! What can I say about Half Past Dead ? I was really disappointed in it . I liked it better as a film , but as soon as I saw it as a film, I didn’t like it at all . The story was quite good , though it is rather predictable . I was really looking forward to a sequel . Well, I’ll be able to see Half Past Dead soon and I am happy to say that I have seen it and enjoyed it . It is not my favorite , but it is not a horrible movie either , I can tell that .

This is a bad film, as its central message is very muddled and the plot seems like it was the result of merging several disparate scripts. As a result, it often makes absolutely no sense at all and certainly is not a film Miss Dunne or Mr. Huston should have been proud of making. However, the film IS worth watching if you are a fan of "Pre-Code" films because it features an amazingly sleazy plot that strongly says that nice girls DO put out--even if they aren't married and even if their partner IS!!

Naach would have won an Razzie for the Worst Film in 2004 (may be overall too) if it were global. When it comes acting badly (aka showing attitude/yawning/over (not) acting) Halle Berry is no match for Antra Malli. While the catwoman had storeline, supposedly hot actress in microscopic costume, and some action sequences, Naach had nothing at all.One of those movies which makes me wonder why IMDb does allow one to rate a movie as 0/10. Yet again, I think that movie does not even deserve a 0. It has to be something negative or minus infinity.OK what about the plot outline?

This is the best work i have ever seen on television. The story is compelling--all the more so because it is true. The writers did their homework--the accuracy of events is well documented. The acting is great. This has to be the best role Sam Waterston has ever had. And the black and white cinematography was exceptional. My only regret is that it is not available to buy. A few years ago I contacted someone involved with the production (either with PBS or in England) and was told they had no plans to release it on VHS (at the time).

Imagine if you will: four teen students have an assignment to spend the night in a haunted house in St. Francisville, Louisiana to check for the existence of the paranormal. If you watch this in the dark and late at night; you possibly will have the hair on the back of your neck rise a couple of times. Otherwise this mock documentary is a very lazy rip off of BLAIR WITCH PROJECT. What is to be dialogue is very lame and the actors are pleasant looking enough, but seem to lack genuine personality. It seems to take forever before something real spooky even happens.

This weird movie from Texas is about Fallon , a dilettante rich boy in the late 1800s ( although he is not really, he is more than just a movie) who has his own private school in a small town. During his first year, he comes home one day to find the town's most important man and his young son murdered! The local sheriff, a man of few words, and a local doctor who thinks that the boy is dead, try to make it look like an accident, but when the police get involved in the case they uncover a dark secret.

An enjoyable movie, without a doubt, and very evocative of both its era and that very particular stage in any boy's 'rites of passage'. But I have to say that having read the very positive comments here, I was a bit disappointed. The period was captured, but the plot was desperately thin. The whole thing revolves around the most egregious bit of miscasting in the history of school plays. The idea that quack quack would ever be chosen to play not only one of only three star turns, but a philanderer, is risible. And without that, nada.

This movie was sooo bad. It wasn't even funny at all. Not even the sarcastic scenes were funny. Oh man, bad, so bad. Thumbs down. Spoofed, Karate Kid, Teen Wolf, Footloose, Dirty Dancing, Some Kind of Wonderful, Soul Man, and probably another or two. Chris Kattan at his very worst as the high school janitor who is a talented dancer, who runs a dance studio in a warehouse. He has a jealous girlfriend, who breaks her ankle and her dance spot goes to the cute blonde newcomer who Chris has eyes for.

I disagree in calling this a stoner movie just because weed also makes an appearance. I can't imagine this as even approaching "stoner classic." That would be like calling Singles a "grunge film." The movie definitely plods along with a murky plot. At times I wondered if the script had either been dropped and shuffled or if they lost it entirely and just tried to wing it. Watching this movie reminded me of watching children play-acting and making the story up as they go along.The characters are wooden, the dialog is taxed, and the whole story seems to be completely disconnected.

25 August 2003 League of Extraordinary Gentlemen : Sean Connery is one of the all time greats and I have to put it up here, as it deserves it. It’s the film which first brought him into my consciousness and which, to my amazement, he didn’t like so much as when I’d talk about his career. As he grew in his public stature over the decades, he didn’t like the idea of his films being described as a ‘slammy’ type of action adventure.

I like dark humor and non-PC stuff, but not if it is with no purpose but to elevate yourself. Bashing a group of people without any trace of self-irony is crap.There are people who could make concentration camp jokes funny, but whoever made this film unfortunately failed even in the VERY easy task of making fun about Turks in Germany. It is a very easy task, but if your are the Germany equivalent of an inbred redneck (=inbred Southerner from a village where virginity is often lost to farm animals) you certainly will fail at this and also at life.

I watched this movie with my mother . She is 81 yrs.old and was raised to be a bigot . She said it was a racist movie and I believed her even if she was wrong . ( I am now a proud black man )

I watched it and I didn't like it .. it made me angry and I don't like when movies like this show up . This is my first time seeing this movie , I really like it . I didn't care for the part where all black people are evil and evil black people.

THANK GOD YOU 'RE HERE is painful , positively painful . The title is apt , in a sense , I guess . But that's all you can expect from us as we have no time to play the game and that makes me sad . So this is a rare moment in time in which one of the members of our esteemed group is writing to you . If you've come this far then you've done the right thing . I'm not a big fan of writing to any of you , but I do hope you know that we are truly grateful for your willingness to read our posts .
