'The 4th Floor ' is a decidedly mediocre film starring Juliette Lewis as a young interior designer with a heck of a job in New York City. She does not do her job well, though she is a good enough job. There are many reasons why the movie is bad. First, there is not much of a story other than the interior designer talking to herself over a phone about her job. Also, it is not that well written. The film starts off slow but by the time it gets to the end, the viewer has had enough.

I am sure I'm in the minority (I know I am among my friends), but I found this movie long, boring and gratuitous. The fact that the role played by DENIS LEARY is the most likable character (the only other time I liked him at all was in "A Bug's Life"!) speaks volumes. Rene Russo's character was irritating beyond belief and Thomas Crowne himself was flat and stereotypical. To say he was two-dimensional may be a little generous. (No, the scenes with his psychiatrist did NOT help make him real.

Like the above poster , I got burned on the title thinking I was getting the other Piranha ... This is how I found it .... I don't like piranhana so much so I thought I'd see if there are any other titles out there to match it. I tried looking for more titles like this but no luck . I could've gotten the title from another thread but for some reason didn't see it

I am going to guess that if you googled it then you probably found this site, and if you've tried to buy one, this thread is the perfect place to ask for it.

I concur with the other users comment. Hard to believe that this movie actually came out in 1994 because it screams mid 80's. I think it is dubbed because the sound and the picture don't always match up. If anyone can truly say this is a good movie, they need to be locked up. It is so sad how money has so much power over people that they will do anything to get it. I feel I lost intelligence from watching this. I used to have a little respect for Chuck Norris before I watched this but now I just feel bad.

This movie was childish in its writing and laughable in its visual effects. Scenes where Father Merrin is tossing in his bed and his glimpses of a gimpy native are signs of bad acting and poor imagination. Nothing seems to fit. The story jumps from scene to scene. The elementary writing leaves no fact to the imagination and leaves no room for suspense. The lady doctor at one point states that she thinks the town is going to "explode soon" from all the crazy happenings. There was, in fact, nothing in the movie to make that line relevant.

OK, last night I saw the world premiere of Paul Schrader's The Exorcist: The Beginning at the Brussels International Festival of Fantasy Films. With all the commotion around the film it was highly anticipated.The director was there and so were most of the stars (except Skarsgard).Unfortunately the movie sucked big time. It was a real disappointment for me because I'm a huge fan of both Shrader and Friedkin's (RIP) original 1973 film.What was wrong with it? Most of it actually. The FX (you would think that the Matrix and LOTR digital revolution never happened: it was so badly rendered!

No redeeming features, this film is rubbish. Its jokes don't begin to be funny. The humour for children is pathetic, and the attempts to appeal to adults just add a tacky smuttishness to the whole miserable package. Sitting through it with my children just made me uncomfortable about what might be coming next. I couldn't enjoy the film at all. Although my child for whom the DVD was bought enjoyed the fact that she owned a new DVD, neither she nor her sisters expressed much interest in seeing it again, unlike with Monsters inc, Finding Nemo, Jungle Book, Lion King, etc.

I watched this movie and all I can say is this ... I am not a film student , nor a film reviewer ... but I've watched a ton of movies and I just watched this one and I am utterly blown away. I have to say the acting , direction and the screenplay are incredible ... and I am not giving this a 4 because I can't. But this is an amazing film , just incredible. If you have not seen this movie, go. If you do not like sci-fi, horror, action , or romance, don't go to see it.

first off , i 'm amazed to see that this film has got a rating of 7 on this site. i have a feeling that there are people that will say that it is "not a drama",

well there is no question that it is definitely a drama. i think it will have a good time with

most people at the time of it's theatrical release , i 've seen it and i think there will be some

that will say "wow" when it comes to acting , music, and the storyline.

If you thought NBC's 10.5 was stupid, you'll be happy to hear that FX reached into the bowels of made-for-TV hell and squished it's fingers into this pseudo post-9/11 poop. Not only was the plot stupid, it was a complete ripoff of 24 and a bad ripoff at that. The filming style was the now overused "docu-action" look, complete with cuts to grainy B&W "rawcore" footage. I'm not quite sure what that means, but it sure sounds like something the DP said to the director before filming.

The Giant Claw is in fierce competition with films like , 'Robot Monster ' and 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' in Hollywood. With over 300 reviews, I’m afraid it's impossible to sum up what these films have to offer. It would be like trying to rate the films of a band in comparison to the rest. I’d recommend that you watch these films if you want an insight into the movies that were made in Hollywood. I've watched and listened to every film that has appeared on this site, but I feel that there's one film that stands head and shoulders above the rest.

I enjoyed the Mr. Magoo cartoons I saw while growing up . And I enjoy Leslie Nielson 's comic skills . I have always been fascinated with Mr. Magoo , and have read the book series and the comic strip . But the Mr. Magoo books were my introduction to cartooning , and I wanted to write my own stories . Now that I'm back from summer vacation and I'm back at college, I've been asked if I'd want to write a comic book. And my answer was:

"YES! YES, PLEASE, PLEASE! YES!

I really don't know much about the Marquis de Sade, not having read any of his book, but I never imagined him as a flaming queen. Carson Kressley of Queer Eye For the Straight Guy, or Jack from Will and Grace would have fit easily into the role that Nick Mancuso gave us.The movie itself was rather thin and seemed more of a parody - or an excuse to show the Paris whorehouse several times with men and women having a good time on the couches in the parlor. What? They can't afford a room?

If I could give this excuse for a film a 0 or negative rating I would. I was stupid enough to pick this DVD up in the shop, read the blurb and think, that sounds quite good, I'll spend £10 and buy it. all I got at the end of it was a £10 coaster. Absolutely awful, I don't even know where to begin. I have no idea why anyone has given this more than 2 stars because I can't think of one good thing to say about it.

I would like to know the real name of the Lodge where scenes from the movie were filmed . It was located in New York , I was told that they never released the name of the Lodge . So it must be a fake? I would like to know also if the lodge is still in existence or not . How do we get our name and address if we cannot find that out ? Thanks for the help in advance . To find the name of the building, I went to all the real estate listings in that building .

Excellent story , wonderful acting , amazing production values and a cool , action-packed short with a perfect twist at the end. I hope they can come back next year with a sequel for all the fans that will never get to see the ending , as it is the ending of the story that was so important to all of us to see. I’m enjoying the first 2 episodes of the next season and I will continue watching. I thought this movie was good, but I found it hard to watch it and it took a lot of time to get through it.

After sitting through this god-awful 82-minute excuse of a film, and having previously wanted to gouge my eyes out after having watched another James Toback-directed mess called "When Will I Be Loved", I've come to the conclusion that he has the best agent in the world. How else can these horribly written, painfully-directed pieces of trash get made in the first place.I like Robert Downey Jr., but perhaps being in this movie drove him to substance abuse.Heather Graham has to be embarrassed about her zombified performance. Half the time the camera is on her she just is looking off in a daze.Such a crappy script.

You have to like baseball , and you have to at least sort of like Tom Selleck , but if you're going to watch a sports video, it can be nice to find a few highlights that don't involve a guy getting punched by a woman. I did a review for the first season of Gossip Girl. It's not very good, but here is the full review if you care :

First of all, I'm soooo sorry that this review is longer than I expected it to be. The book was a lot of fun.

Altioklar's populist approach manifests itself in all his titles, from the worst to the best. He doesn't care (or has no clue) about art, all he cares is to make people think they've got a kick in the groin by watching his movies. The problem is, the effort is way too evident, and as events unfold with all the senseless exaggeration kneaded into them, the effort fails badly.On this "Turkish" movie (who knows where the original or originals were made, since it felt extremely Hollywoodish to me), Altioklar is trying to be some sort of Tarantino.

This review is for the UK DVD three-disc box set . Disc one is called Caught in the Act and is an audio-visual album that includes a CD and DVD. On the DVD they also feature a commentary with the filmmaker, editor and director of the film. The commentary was made by the same guy who was in the documentary. A DVD copy of the film can be purchased here . Disc two of the film is called The Unseen and is a documentary that covers the creation of the movie. The DVD includes all the behind the scenes interviews, the music videos and behind the scenes of the film.

Two little girls strike a friendship. One tries to convince the other she's a witch. The other is a pushover who bends to the would be witch's will. On and on the movie drags with the pointless interaction between the two little girls, with many a dramatic cut away as they pose "shocking" questions. You know, the kind sweet little children shouldn't ask, such as, "How do you make a deal with the devil"? Oooh... creepy.In the end, the pushover is sick of being controlled by her witchy friend.

The third entry in the `` Stepford '' franchise , but apparently the three made-for-TV obscure sequels are incredibly obscure. The first film in the series is set in a similar fashion to the other two films and stars a different character in each film. For those who have never seen the film or the movie, the second film has a more action-oriented plot, but is very similar to both the first film and the original film. The third film also has an action-oriented plot (the same as the first film), and a lot of the same stars.

I remember watching this mini-series the first time in 1984 with a growing sense of anger and indignation . Having recently re-read it several times, I can say that I’m glad to have it back. As you know, it’s pretty well known that the film was written by the writer/director/producer of Terminator 2 and Terminator 3, Richard Donner (who also directed and wrote Star Trek: The Motion Picture, which you may also have seen on TV). Donner’s been in Hollywood for nearly 40 years, so it’s only a matter of time until he writes another franchise.

Sam O'Steen, the film editor on the superlative suspense flick "Rosemary's Baby" from 1968, here directs a quickie TV-made sequel, one in which Rosemary Woodhouse (Patty Duke Astin, in for Mia Farrow) is shunted off early--and inexplicably--presumably to help flesh out the more ghoulish aspects of this flaccid story about Satan's son on Earth. Most interesting is the return of Ruth Gordon to her Oscar-winning role as Minnie Castevet (with Ray Milland well-cast as her husband, Roman), but she isn't given much to do--and looks terribly uncomfortable at being involved anyway.

Our family ( and the entire sold out sneak preview audience ) enjoyed `` The Guardian '' . Kevin Costner is as great a character actor as he is a terrific director . You will not find a better film in theaters now . It is well made , funny , entertaining and a great way for us to get a sneak preview taste of the movies to follow in the new year . You will not find anyone better to direct the screen version of `` The Good Wife '' . A good movie but I feel the movie just wasn't as good as the original.

I just recently stumbled upon this show when ABC family had an all day marathon before season 2 premiered . So, I jumped at the chance to catch up with all of the characters. It was great! You’ve all done such amazing things, from helping people, to helping families, to helping change the world for the better. We are all so thankful for you and all your hard work! Thank you for all the support. We’re so blessed to all of you for all of your help. We are so thankful that you’ve joined us on our journey with us this season.

Story of a strange love and a fall desire . Poem about beauty and his perfection , fear and touch.A poem on falling in love , pain and touch. The beauty of a beautiful girl and a fall desire . A poem about fall in love , desire and the pain of falling in love. A poem on pain and beauty . A poem of falling in love , a poem about the desire for love and the desire for the fall of love. The beauty of the beautiful girl . A poem about fall in love . A poem on pain and the beauty of a beautiful girl .

I 'm not here to tell you `` Armored '' is Kubrickian , Hitchcockian or Fellini-esquire . Nope . Referenced here are three great examples, and it will surprise few to hear that the first is directed by the famed director of 2001: A Space Odyssey . It is , without question , Kubrick's finest film . And to be honest, there is no denying the impact it made , especially in the 1980s and 1990s . However , the director's career really took off in 2003 . In that film , Kubrick and director Roger Deakins use a new approach in the construction of the spaceship .

Most people will consider that Yul Brynner 's greatest performance was as the ruler of Siam in THE KING AND I, in the film version of which was based on the Broadway production (the film won an Oscar). But the most famous of all Brynner's acting roles came in the 1935 stage production of THE LITTLE MERMAID, in which he played one of the lead roles. Brynner's performance in the King and I was, in fact, even more brilliant and exciting than the film's. His performance as the leader of this new-fangled government was so riveting that it is almost impossible to forget it.

"Japan takes the best from around the world and makes it their own", while that may be true, it applies to all except for one thing, that being,.....Major league baseball....but not to worry, "Mr Baseball" is there to try and change all that. But just who will change whom, is the part of the movie that really makes it rock! Tom Selleck is one of my favorite actors and really shines-on in his comedic roles. The storyline may be true to life, however the subplot is dead-on.

Ordinarily, Anthony Mann made westerns with 'the big guys' - James Stewart, Gary Cooper, Henry Fonda . . . the A list cowboy stars. But in this B+ film, he tackled something notably different and had quite a bit of success with what turned out to be a truly one of a kind western. The main character, played by Victor Mature, is a trapper/ mountain man, and ordinarily they are romanticized in films - Robert Redford in Jeremiah Johnson, that sort of thing, where the hero is not in fact a typical mountain man but a clean cut heroic figure who hangs out with real mountain men.

This movie had potential. If it had been handled differently. What it needed was a different director. That's certain. And perhaps a different leading lady. I just can't understand the Minnie Driver character - or at least how she played it. She was completely unbelievable. I cannot believe she would have liked her performance in this movie either. She was probably abandoned by the director or incapable of delivering what the director was trying to get her to do. I am writing this as I am still watching it.

As a non-theist Im not going to comment on the great mans theory which changed the world 150 years ago. Safe to say, science is based on evidence, religion is based on blind faith. Nuff said there then.The film was produced by the BBC, and to be honest, it could quite easily have been shown on television. While the acting is superb, the film itself isn't really worthy of a full blown cinema release. That said, if it reaches a wider audience this way, then so be it.

i watched the longer version and could not take my eyes off the screen. 219 minutes passed and yet it seemed like only an hour had gone by. the characters were very believable and entertaining, and the photography was excellent. the story pulled me in and held my attention. i will definitely watch this again and again. this true story telling at it's best... not Hollywoods usual cheap thrills and skin deep glitz. i've seen a quite a lot of reviews on this movie. most seem to pan the film or give it faint praise.

The sun was not shining, it was too wet to play, so I went to the movies, that cold, cold, wet date day. "The Cat in the Hat" was the name of the flick, and when it was over, my stomach was sick.Mike Myers played the Cat, his humor was lame, and kids needn't see this, the humor was not tame.the film was like drinking milk, from a rabid cow, so it IS fun to have fun, yet the filmmakers didn't know how.This film, in short is atrocious.

Are sea side resorts the sad , dreary places they 're always depicted as in movies and novels ? Certainly not, and I'm not saying that they should always be portrayed as a happy place, but what is it about being in the middle of a sea or on a beach that makes it depressing, and what can be done to turn the bleakness around ? I'm sure we have all wondered, "How is this place where we are sitting so peaceful?" The reality of life on a beach can be bleak at times, and I think that is a real issue.

I was unsure what to expect from `` driving lessons '' - unsure whether Rupert Grint could carry such a huge responsibility, and whether he would make the most of it. He did not disappoint us, however, and we thoroughly enjoyed our five day tour of the UK - and I am sure you will agree that it has not been our most pleasant week! It started on Friday, November 2 with a great breakfast at a nice cafe in London. We had our choice from a wide range of foods to start, and then headed off to take a look around Hyde Park.

Hitchcock's original classic benefited tremendously not only from the performance of, but also the 'look' of Anthony Perkins. He projected a kind of clean-cut innocence: a young teen-idol type of persona. He was not an actor who had portrayed baddies before this; nor was he physically suited to the role of what the public might have imagined a psychopath to look like, especially in the 50's when this ultra-chilling aspect of mental illness (split personality psychosis) was relatively unexplored in film. Which is exactly why the casting of him as Norman Bates was a slice of true Hitchcockian genius.

I had heard that this film was stylish and intriguing , but I just found it annoying . It 's just that the only one who seems to be doing the same things over and over again, but it 's not like it has to be original. I would like to see some better action sequences, like a scene in a train or something . I agree with the first point but I don't agree with the second: there is nothing original or original enough to do a sequel. The same thing is true of X-Men, as well, so that is not a point.

Return to Me is a movie you will want to own . It is a story of inspiration and family. A movie that will make you laugh, cry, and think about what life was like for the family that shared it. There is something for everyone here. It is perfect for anyone that is a parent. The movie does have adult themes so you should watch it with your parent’s permission. There is not much violence or nudity but you will not want to skip this movie at all. This movie is a must see.

As one of the victims of the whole Enron scandal , my mother forced me to watch this movie with my sister. As I was watching the movie, I started laughing. I couldn’t help it. It was funny. My sister and I laughed about our own lives. We laughed, we laughed. We laughed for all the wrong reasons. We laughed for money and power. We laughed because we couldn’t do something for ourselves – we couldn’t just take control of our lives, we couldn’t just have fun.

First of all , I would like to clarify that I consider this one of the funniest films I have ever seen. I didn’t laugh for a minute. It was just a total blast of fun. The actors were on point and the production values were spot on! This was a perfect movie for the summer. I was a big believer in this film because I found that the audience didn’t get to see the character development that happens. There is some great stuff in this movie, but it was not a great experience for the fans.

I was so `` impressed '' with Tim Kincaid 's MUTANT HUNT that I gave this one a try . I found the movie to be extremely enjoyable with a well-rounded story and interesting characters . The action scenes are impressive with lots of exciting set-pieces . This movie is certainly a great sequel to the original '' MUTANT HUNT 2 '' . Although I didn't watch the first MUTANT HUNT , this movie made me want to get caught up . I recommend it for any fans of THE MUTANT TOWER , MUTANT X . and THE SHADOW OF THE MUTANT GIRL '.

When watching this movie, with it's deterministic cause and effect, wall-to-wall clichés and hackneyed sentiment, can anyone be so naive as to think that this is actually how Barrie's life played out? You watch it in a posture of disagreement. Hollywood biopics aren't based on the individual lives anymore, they're just rewrites of previously successful biopics. If Hollywood made a movie about your life it would be filled with such perfect synchronization that you'd barely recognize your own story. Any personal complexity would be obliterated by some all-explaining, simplistic backstory.

Forget the lousy acting , that can be forgiven in this sort of film . Or even the terrible , but at least you get a glimpse of the actors . The acting was a little weak , some of the scenes were not so good , but the overall acting is very good and the film is a very good , entertaining film . This is a film for those who really like crime films . For me this is the best crime story I have seen and I love it ! It's one of the best I can remember.

I 've enjoyed this movie ever since I first saw it in the theatre . Some movies have a cast that can do their jobs well, but I don't think 'Dirty John' has any of them. There is only one cast who is actually able to do their role, and that's Tom Hardy. There is a decent cast in the supporting role, but Hardy is not able to carry the film. The film starts on a very dramatic note and then it quickly falls off of that note to become boring.

There 's something going on in this film directed by X-Files scribe John Shiban that has eluded me . You may be interested if you've been watching TV, or movies with the name X-Files. I'll be the first to admit I didn't know what to think of the film when it premiered at Toronto a few months ago . But since I was watching the trailer, I watched the film and realized it was nothing short of genius. The entire premise of X-Files, the show that follows the investigation of a UFO, is to find and prove that the show is real.

This movie is a gay love story disguised as a tale of graffiti and friendship. Not ONE review described this movie as a gay romance film, and that's the weight of the plot. I don't know if this was to trick people that would otherwise be uninterested to sit through it, expecting the film to be as it was marketed... The film is out of touch with graffiti culture, abuses and defames graffiti culture, and the acting is abysmal. Oh yeah, the graffiti sucks too. This movie was a clever way to hide the agenda of portraying young boys getting gay.

Completely overlooking the whole movie adaptation of a video game , this is another terrible movie by Mr. Boll . I don't think it's a good movie, just that I'm too lazy to watch it , so I won't. It's a good idea for a movie , which I'll give it a chance . I just don't want to pay $20 to watch the movie. The plot is good , but it doesn't do anything new for me, it just tries to do something . I don't think I'll recommend this.

The interaction between Portman and Sarandon was quite interesting , and I was really sold on the mother-daughter relationship . I thought it would be very cool for them to go back in history together and see where it went. Well, the story of the show doesn't end there ! For some reason the writers of the show decided that they wanted a lot of kissing and hugging , so the two decided that they wanted a lot of hugging. I always thought this was a brilliant idea ! However, it seems like I was right and a lot of the hugs were forced .

Always enjoy the Classic Horror films, however, this film was really a big waste of time and if it were not for John Carradine playing the mad man doctor who is able to control human beings through his experiments. This film was made during WW II and John Carradine was a German Nazi working to find a human weapon against the entire world. Bob Steele playing in many roles as a cowboy or gangster and in this picture Bob seemed bored to death with his role in this film and acted like this was his first film.

Dear Readers , 2001 : A Space Odyssey is Kubrick at his best ... although I really ca n't say it's the best film in history because The Shining was a great one and I don't believe Kubrick made an inferior film as such but he certainly made an inferior film but it was not one that deserves to be remembered as such because it had so many flaws and he made a few great films that were not that great but it did not deserve to be forgotten just because it was his worst film although I really do think it's still a classic so I have to disagree with you.

I think this is a pretty good movie , but one thing makes it VERY interesting to me . It's very similar to the previous two films . It's about three people trying to survive . They live on a small island , in a house that's about a million dollars . There's no electricity , no water , they don't have food . When they're about to get on the boat to leave , there's no one on board . There's just this island , and the three people on this boat , trying to survive for a while .

Go to the video store and get the original . I do not understand why Hollywood has that need to make it about the guy in the middle of the water, but it was not intended for you to see the rest of the film; you just got the beginning and the end of the film. I have no interest in that movie, but I do wish that people would stop taking everything the "mainstream" media tells them about it and look for the movie themselves. You are very welcome to have an opinion on what I did and did not get from this film.

I knew five minutes after the monster made his appearance where his was going . But when I saw the man he was with and saw him come to me with two knives , one of them in his mouth I knew I was dead. He came close and said that I didn't move and he cut my head . He said I had a heart attack. I couldn't breathe I was laying on the ground. I didn't move and he said I was dead. I was dead, he said, I didn't move. I said , I didn't move, he said.

As someone has already mentioned on this board , it 's very difficult to make a fake documentary . It can be done if the writer has some basic knowledge of cameras and shooting . But that's a lot of time and work . So for me, I usually do the film myself . But I always wanted to do a short film . It's not that I don't want to do it on my own . And I just wanted to see what I could get away with . So I started researching about documentaries and found a bunch of stuff about it .

cool flick . enjoyable to watch . hope to see more from Fred Carpenter soon . i really like the film . i want to see more of his films . I don't care who the hell Fred Carpenter is, but it is pretty much the same guy from the original Star Trek films, so I find it weird that they changed the actor in the sequels. I guess it just became apparent that Carpenter's acting style wasn't that good. The first Star Trek was the worst movie in the franchise and now, he is a huge part in the second one.

This was a fantastic movie about two people , one a young teenage girl , and the other , a middle aged man , who has an intense attraction towards her. They have never been alone together and in this film , we get to see how they get together , as well as how they react. The music was beautiful and there were several catchy songs. I have to say that the director and actors did a great job and the film ended with a very nice and satisfying ending. I recommend this movie to everyone , because it is very enjoyable.

Gritty drama ? Emotionally powerful ? Blah ! The BBC has lost out big time to masterful productions such as “Killing Eve,” “The Big Bang Theory” and “Breaking Bad.” If “Game of Thrones” was an action show that followed the same beats as the real world of Westeros , it was bound to be more successful. So what’s going on with this show that has already been cancelled twice ? It’s hard to say. The BBC seems to think that this new show is something they can keep alive.

What can I say?? This movie has it all...Romance, break-ups, rich kids, punks and preps. This is my all time favorite movie that I can recite line for line....I remember when it first came out, I was 14 and couldn't get in....so finally got to see it on cable... I was hooked! Wanted to move to California and be a Valley Girl.. (Hey, I even remember the song by Moon Zappa, do you?) Tried in vain for years to get the never produced soundtrack...now you can find it on rhino records....

I grew up in New York and this show came on when I was four-years-old. I had half-day kindergarten and this was on WPIX Channel 11 in the afternoon. I just loved the music and stories and remember humming them around the house when playing.I just saw part of an episode on YouTube and for a moment I could remember how it felt watching those shows as a small child. I, of course, stopped watching when I got in 1st grade because it was on before school got out (no VCR's or DVR's back then).

As a rule, I try to find as much in films as I possibly can to enjoy them. I made no exceptions with "Tart", doing my very best to appreciate it for what it was. But no effort, no matter how great, could possibly redeem this pitiful excuse for a movie.It failed for a number of reasons. Firstly, the cinematography was directionless and ineffective. Secondly, the script reached depths of 'poor' that took it well and truly beyond the 'so bad it's good' category. Thirdly, the acting left mind-blowing amounts to be desired - it was appalling, it really was.

Please do not go see this. I did have several laughs throughout this movie, but they were all due to unintentional comedy.There were only three characters in this movie, so it was amazing how bad the character development was. Pacino played Pacino again and was aggravating most of the time. The scenes in this movie seem like they were put together from 20 other bad movies by a really poor editor. There is no continuity and I found myself wondering why I didn't leave 15 minutes into this.I would suggest never seeing a movie directed by D.J. Caruso. This really was awful.

Okay, so I love silly movies. If you enjoy silly sci-fi movies, over the top movies, or if you are a fan of Mr. Bruce Campbell, i would go see this movie. This movie is all that i wanted it to be. Being a fan of over the top movies, this fit the bill. Every time i thought to myself "this movie would be the sillest, best movie ever if *blank* would happen...." then just as i thought it, *blank* would happen. It's a wonderful silly 'b'-movie.

a great movie , with a rather unclear political message . it´s shot in a theatrical style , i.c . , some of the film´s shots are quite disturbing . it´s a very disturbing and disturbing movie . it should have been so . i don´t understand the reason , because it´s a very good movie ! but it is disturbing . it's not good to see a movie with a political message like that . a movie like this is not good to see . ... but i do think that the film can be a little bit disturbing. ... it´s a horror film but it´s a horror film about horror movies .

On the positive, I'll say it's pretty enough to be watchable. On the negative, it's insipid enough to cause regret for another 2 hours of life wasted in front of the screen. Long, whiny and pointless. And I'm not saying this to be mean, I really wanted to like this film, it seemed to have everything going for it, had the so called "buzz", and was a hassle to track down besides. Had a little more effort gone into it on the story side, I believe this would've been amazing.

I did n't really HATE Mirrormask . I just really wanted more from a movie than pretty visuals . The last time it was in the theaters , it was terrible , and the director had to shoot it , which he did , and it didn't look good . But then we saw that trailer , so I don't know what I'm expecting . I just like the idea of the film , and I thought it would be nice to see how it turned out . The story I thought was quite good , especially in the flashbacks .

WARNING ! ! ! SOME POSSIBLE PLOT SPOILERS , AS IF THAT WAS POSSIBLE ! ! ! Okay , if we're not going to do this right , it might be a good idea to read that first . The first question that I ask in this series of questions is this:

Can you guess why I'm doing this? Am I asking for trouble, or is this an exercise in honesty ? If I am, please explain to me in as much detail as you can what would happen to me in a "real" world, where things were different from what I can imagine.

Mario Van Peebles tries to go the Jean-Claude Van Damme route and play a renegade robotic soldier who goes AWOL to preserve himself, however the government isn't going to take this lying down, so among the simplistic plot Van Peebles protects villagers from the rebel forces and defeats a improved version of himself in this disappointing film. This blatant rip off of Universal Soldier (Which is far more fun then this) simply goes nowhere. The main problem is that the movie is so unbelievably inert. Van Peebles just waits around and there just isn't enough ass-kicking to justify a viewing.

This film is about a gap that exists between the real world and the world of the dead. There's a lot of mumbo-jumbo about the internet (i.e., if you install a program on the computer, you see dead folks--much like if you play a videotape you'll die in RINGU). Frankly, most of this seemed rather silly and lost me. What I did find interesting is the idea that the dead live within their own separate existence--being totally alone for eternity. This was sobering and fascinating.I love Japanese films and have seen a huge number compared to most Americans.

I am in a movie club at my school and I was forced to sit and watch this utterly dismal film. The plot: A group of kids play in a forest with an evil spirit that comes and slaughters them to get their souls. I thought that it was really stupid. The movie also had a terrible cast of characters. And a couple of them, while they were trying to be likable, ended up being the most annoying in the world. The evil spirit of course. I think they should be called "the spirit" or something, but still.

Frank Sinatra starred in this odd little short from RKO that is now in the public domain . The film was made in October 1928 as a test run for Universal's film production in Hollywood. RKO wanted a film that was cheap to make and easy to distribute. So Sinatra agreed to star. The film opens up with the famous line "We're all Sinatra now!" It was a great line in its own right, and a good way for Sinatra and his cohorts to start to build a career. But it's not really the opening line that made RKO laugh.

I never fell asleep during a movie. Never. This movie did the impossible.While many people claim the superiority of Japanese horror films over their American counterparts, this movie was a lesson in over abundance. As in, the movie was 30 minutes too long. It would have helped if the movie had a little more movement in the plot and the camera work, but instead, all we got were awkward silences and a lot of slow movement. The acting was absolutely terrible, bordering on bad student film levels while everyone struggled to ad-lib something called a script.

I saw this turkey in the theater, but I had a good time. The special effects aren't worthy of a grade school production. A toy boat, representing a freighter, moving at speedboat velocity on flat waters while wind driven fog blows in the opposite direction. The red and blue flood lamps add that extra dramatic touch. Whatever cache Vincent Price was supposed to bring as narrator is completely overshadowed by dreadful production work. Calling this a documentary is like calling Britney Spears a musician. About 20 minutes into this, something struck me as very funny.

This film takes a lot of liberties with the known historical facts.Even little things like Flynn licking one stamp after another, when he almost certainly would have used a moistened sponge, is one of the annoying things. Flynn was never tried of manslaughter or murder. He is not known to have caught his mother making love to another man, and is not known to have had an homosexual relationship with anybody, and he did not end up on skid row in Sydney. He did not get his twopenny-halfpenny role in In the Wake of the Bounty by imposture and this role did not turn him into a well-dressed film star.

This has to be one of the worst movies ever to come out of the Sci-Fi Channel. Here is how the movie starts, Women are the only humans on this planet due to the fact that in the not to distant future chemical warfare is A OK as long as it only targets soldiers (In case your wondering, Men) However the virus back fires (Big shock)and all the men on earth slowly die. Then all of male kind is condemned to die when the madam president is shot and killed by a man.

What can I say about this? Such a big Prestige-Production - but in the End? Wasted Time, wasted Money.This work a disaster is historically seen. Only some examples:* Augustus often is named 'Gaius' - his First name (Pronomen). But the old Romans don't used this Name. Correct would be the Surname (Nomen Gentile and Cognomen) or the 'Octavian', 'Caesar', 'Augustus'. * Livia was shown as tyrannic Wife. But this historically wrong. * Iulia was shown as nice young woman - but she wasn't one.

hello all Denver fans ! i could n't agree more with you guys ! This show was so cool and i have never seen so many awesome things in my life ive watched a ton of hockey on the tube . This show was my favorite show i have watched for a year now and it will always be special for me . I am so grateful we got to see it this year we had no idea what was going to happen to it and that it would last for as long as it has now for all of its worth .

As I watched this movie , I felt as if a plastic bag was slowly closing in around my head , and as the plastic bag around my head grew tighter and tighter , I started to cry . It’s not that I don’t cry , I can cry , its just that this plastic bag was slowly squeezing me in the face and in front of me , making me feel as if the world were coming to an end in front of me . I couldn’t look at this man with tears rolling down my cheeks , so I turned and walked out of the theater .

Eddie Fischer was simply bad. Possibly the worst scene came early in the movie when he broke into a spontaneous song and dance number centered around a piano and some conveniently placed employees. The song was totally stupid... I think I could drunkenly offer a few lines on a sheet of paper that would far exceed it and probably win a Grammy. Then, as if the writers could come up with no better way to escape the ridiculousness of the scene, Fischer says something to the effect of, "Don't tell (insert the guy's name).

This film has some pretty gorey parts like a boob getting bit off and a other big bites. Castle Freak himself is a good monster. I would be scared to pieces if he was coming after me. However, the movie had some dumb parts about it.A husband goes drunk driving and kills his 3 year old son and blinds his teenage daughter. I suppose death is a greater damage than blindness, but you'd never know that the parents actually feel bad about their daughter being blind. All they care about is that "J.J.'s dead!"

This agreeable French movie deals about a millionaire owner of a tobacco factory on an African island nearly to Madagascar. In the end he is forced to close it down, but after his death the place becomes a sort of private museum. The film includes some interesting shots from the island, but mostly it's a standard-issue horror movie that tries to scare us. It's not a particularly great film, but it's definitely enjoyable to watch, and is not a particularly bad film, either. In some ways I think it could be considered as the best of the "Madrid Horror" films.

I remember watching this movie on TV a few years back. It was so bad, I can only remember the scenes that just made me die laughing. The only plot summary I can give you (without any spoilers) is picture a home movie made by college kids who were high. (Spoiler alert starts here...) When the movie starts, a guy's running, being chased by the "Demon Cop", when in fact, the man was really being chased by a Halloween costume gone wrong. A car pops out of nowhere, hitting the guy who was running.

This is a bad film , as its central message is very muddled and the plot seems like it was written with a different script. I’m not going to try and make this review better, since there’s nothing new to say about it, but I hope you read it nonetheless. If you’ve never seen a movie in my reviews, or if you don’t remember this one, then let me just say that I recommend it. For those that have seen the film, then I’m going to recommend you go back and watch it now.

Anyone who complains about Peter Jackson making movies too long should sit through this CBS "event". There's about 45 minutes of story padded by 2 hours of unnecessary subplots, featuring bland by-the-book TV drama clichés. Bad science is a staple for crappy weather disaster movies, so I'm not going to complain about that. Silly science can be fun to watch if it's executed in an amusing fashion. What kills this movie is it's 10 subplots... all of which could be excised without destroying what is supposed to be the central plot.

the mario series is back , and in my opinion , better than ever . Galaxy is the most creative and innovative series , so i think there are a couple of reasons :
1 - it has great gameplay , so it can attract a lot of new players . 2 - it takes a bit more time to get the game working , but it is more fun , and you feel more confident with the controls ,
3 - it has great soundtrack , and some of my favorite games in the series use it as a basis.

Most awful casting I 've ever seen . Clark Kent as a crack head , a very feminine looking woman with red hair and wearing a skirt and gloves . Clark Kent was not dressed as a crackhead , nor was she dressed as a feminine woman. He was dressed exactly as he was expected to be . I never knew what the director had in store for him . There was no one from the first scene on . Clark Kent was wearing a black jacket , black and white pants , black shoes and white socks . Clark Kent's eyes were open , his nose was a bit crooked .

This is the third movie in a month I have watched that did not go the way I expected . The first two movies I expected to be great . I expected them to do what they set out to do . And the second one went down in history as my worst . This movie however is so good . It is my second favorite of the last 2 . It took me 2 hours to watch it . Even though I liked it very much , there was some parts that still bothered me . This movie is one of my favorites and it has everything I wanted in a summer blockbuster .

It starts quite good, but after a while you start to expect more from this film than you are actually getting. Everything becomes unclear and unclear it stays. Czech filmmakers were good 20 or more years ago. But after they transfered to Capitalistic country, here it is, Czech unofficial but well known mentality ... COPYING ... COPYING ... COPYING of everything they consider good, when they see it in another movies or countries or elsewhere. I think that this is a good example of making "art" and "politics" and "horror" and "humor" and "film" and money.

i love this show. i hate when it goes to season finale because it feels like forever until the season starts again!! i have followed this show since its pilot then all the way threw from where rusty starts college and see's Casey his sister to now where he's dating Dana.. love this show cant wait until Monday night!! Also i am so glad that cappie and Casey finally got back together that was driving me crazy!!! As for Evan and rebecca i hope they get back together which it just feels like they will by the finale.

I enjoyed the prequels, and found the relationship between Tucker and Chan previously hilarious. RH3, however, was a re-hash of the first two without the charm or humor. I think I may have laughed once - and it was during the NGs. Tucker was exceedingly annoying in this film, and his character didn't seem to have any purpose other than to bungle everything up in the most irritating way possible. Chan is always likable, but he seemed tired in this film. I was able to predict EVERYTHING - who the villain was, who the girl was, (SPOILER ALERT) who the good-guy-turned-bad-guy was, etc.

Well, I have been to a British University, in fact I went to the one in this very film, and it was nothing like that. This is a horrible, badly made and acted film. Worst thing is, it could have been really good, if they bothered to spend more that 12p on it, in fact if it really wanted to represent true British Students it should off acted like one and took out a 15 thousand pound loan. It says nothing about Uni life, where was the bush diving, the tea drinking till 4am, the endless chats about group dynamics???

Peter Watkins ' rarely seen Punishment Park is a brutality-laced , uncompromised political weapon set across a never ending desertscape. And the film is absolutely relentless in it’s depiction of violence and destruction. I really wanted to see something like this, because it would be such a different film compared to the usual “horror western” in that it would not be a horror film, and it would be a film that was just about violence, and a film that has a really unique aesthetic and a unique feel and style, all of which is in the eye of the beholder.

Low-budget but memorable would-be shocker that instead emerges as theater of the bizarre. Vulnerable, naive nurse Charlotte Beale comes to a secluded mental hospital and is completely unaware that the only sane people have been murdered, despite the red flags that are constantly being raised all around her. The lack of a decent budget really gives the filmmakers little more to go on than a sense of style, as well as a cast of wacky characters. The pleasures of this film don't come from the film's shocks, which are fairly tame, but from the weird atmosphere.

This movie, I would like to say, was completely great. I can see how many people would think that it's just a shocker film. This isn't completely untrue, but it's as much of shocker fiction as Chuck Palahniuk's books are. One of my favorite movies of all time, Bijo no Harawata is a certain type of crudely made movie that you can have just about any reaction to. It's scary, funny, silly, gross, full of off-the-top material and to some people, arousing.

So , you wan na be a rock star ? See this movie . You do n't like rock , or ? . . . . rock . . . . .rock ?. . . . . ? ? rock . . . rock ? . . . rock , rock rock ? . .. rock ? ? .. ? ? ? rockrock ? ?? ? ? ? ? ? ? rock ? ? ? ? ? ? ? rock ? . . ? ? ? ? rock rock rock ? ? .. ? ? ? ? ? – rock ? – rock ? ? – ? ?

Are we allowed to interfere with our fellowmen's everyday's life? Is it possible to intrude upon their intimacy, to penetrate the inwardness of their thoughts violating the privacy of their own home without being blamed? The director raises some doubts about these apparently solvable questions, almost sympathetic towards judge Jean Luis' destabilizing decision of coming to terms with his own inducted self-seclusion by means of fragments of lives embezzled by him. "Trois couleurs: Rouge" is based on the concept of "UNIVERSAL COMMUNICATION CONCEIVED AS THE HUMAN DESIRE OF AN OPEN WINDOW ON THE WORLD".

This is the worst movie I have ever seen. If I wasn't watching it for free, I would have never finished it. The creators of this film should be ashamed of themselves. It seems like this is supposed to be a film in the vein of Scary Movie and Date Movie (a terrible movie, but 10x better than this one), but failed miserably. The only jokes in this movie seem to be based on slapstick. A guy falls down, someone gets hit by a bus, etc. None of the ideas are clever, basically the worst premise for a movie ever.

I remember when this show came out. It was originally advertised as a mini-series. At the end of the last episode it said "To Be Continued" to the dismay of all the people who had watched the whole boring beyond words thing. It ended as it was supposed to, so yes, you can blame the series for having no ending. The plan was for there to be another obviously if ratings had been higher, but it was a boring show that way too long, and annoyed people by not ending when it said it would, so they never made any more.

If you wondered whether Disney could broadcast a show with a character more spoiled than Paris, more shallow than Britney, more vapid than Jessica and more narcissistic than THE GIRLS NEXT DOOR, wonder no more. The amazing thing is Selena Gomez is, apparently, supposed to be the heroine. She's also supposed to be an outcast from the spoiled, shallow, vapid, narcissistic "popular" girls at school, which is no more believable here than it was for Hilary Duff in LIZZIE McGUIRE. Plots range from recycled BEWITCHED & I DREAM OF JEANNIE to "parodies" of HARRY POTTER.

Actually I 'm still in doubt if there 's anything about this movie I like . As for the story itself I 'm waiting for this to release on DVD so I don't have to waste so much time with watching movies on dvd , that is what I get from movies on blu ray . If I 've read a few of the reviews I 'm sure they didn't think the movie was that great and that it is just another generic action movie . They are all saying the movie is too violent . It 's a decent movie but it could have done a lot better to me .

I really tried to like this film about a doctor who has the possibility of a new life with a young woman he’s brought back to his rural hometown, where his son has left for college, but then finds that he’s lost her. I’m a big fan of the movie and of Wes Craven, so when the director came out and announced he was going to release the film theatrically on DVD, I wasn’t too surprised when I saw that the director was offering the film as a Blu-ray release and that the special features would come along too.

Well, I'm an Italian horror big fan and I love movies from directors such Argento, Fulci, Bava Sr and Bava Jr, only to quote the most famous. "La villa delle anime maledette" is one of the most unknown movie of this genre, shot when this kind of cinema began its crisis that continues still today, and director Carlo Ausino sounds totally new to my ears (althoug he directed six movies... this is the price Italian directors have to pay to not work in Rome...) . But the film is not so bad.

Someone says this anime could be offensive for girls ... not really . Embarrassing situations are funny ; first time I started watching it, I got a really bad image of myself, but I still found some of the girls attractive. The story is well-developed, with the characters developed into interesting people. I recommend it to anyone, regardless of your sexual preference. I think it was a good anime for anyone, not just girls (I mean that sincerely). I enjoyed it and I liked all the girls, but I felt a bit embarrassed to watch it because I am a girl.

Rififi , directed by Jules Dassin , is in line with the Melville crime pictures ( particularly Bob le Flameur’s The Stranger , which I saw at the end of this month ) The film is about a man who sets out to rescue his estranged lover from a criminal gang, played by Claude Rains , but falls in with the gang. Rains is an odd choice as a criminal in the context of the film. After all, Rains was in the very early years of his film career, as were most of the film industry.

Beware My Lovely originated from a play written by Mel Dinelli who apparently liked writing about frightened women. His first and best effort was the screenplay for The Spiral Staircase. He also did a Loretta Young suspense thriller Cause For Alarm a couple of years earlier. The play Dinelli wrote was originally entitled The Man and it ran for 92 performances on Broadway during the 1950 season. It was Dinelli's only effort on Broadway and it starred Dorothy Gish and Richard Boone. The roles that Gish and Boone played are taken by Ida Lupino and Robert Ryan. For whatever reason RKO thought to eliminate the age difference.

Like all of the very earliest films, this "movie" is very, very short--lasting about one minute! So, because of its brevity, it's not really possible to compare it to more modern films. But, for its time, it's actually a very remarkable film. Much of this is because the prints were hand painted--making Annabelle appear red and other colors as she does her amazing dance. I've actually seen two different versions--one where she is red and another where she changes color throughout.

You can take the crook out of the joint , but it seems exceedingly more difficult to take the joint apart in the first place, or, if that is your desire, then you can leave it as is for now. I do wonder, however, why you would need to know the details, but if you don't, then that is the way it will be, too, and you'll still be in a place to know. If this is truly your intention, then I'm sure you have the knowledge you need.

It is n't TOO bad , but ultimately it lacks the quality that the Australian series has.The jokes are few and far between but the story is not bad, it doesn't even feel that way at all. The characters are a bit dull compared to those on the Australian TV Series. I don't understand why they make such a big deal of this. If the first episode wasn't enough for you, wait until the last half a dozen episodes. You'll be hooked. I was looking for a show that I could binge watch.

Certain filmmakers can do no wrong in the eyes of national critics, which is one reason you should never pay attention to them. This film is a perfect example. The critics like director Eric Rohmer.This movie is a boring soap opera about a woman and a teenager ("Pauline") she's taking care of for the summer, and the relationships they have with a few men. It's talk, talk, talk and more talk. For those looking at the cover and hoping to be titillated, there are a few quick nude shots and a couple of swear words but otherwise this is a harmless French morality play.

Whoa. I mean, whoa. I mean, whoa whoa.I saw this movie, waaay back when I was eight, in 1996. Back then, CGI films were a rarity; and good ones even more so. Also, back then we listened to things called CD players. But I digress. I used to like this movie a lot, way back then, and up till viewing it again, I've held reaally fond memories of it. Hey, it's Don Bluth! Anyone who hates "All Dogs Go to Heaven" is clearly a robot.

Well , some people might go to see this to watch a trashy rubber and pvc clad bisexual vampire assassin , not me . I'm looking for a good time , I'm not a virgin , I just want some fun . I love this movie, and I'm so glad that this is available for streaming, so many other movies are not . It's so much better than most of the porn that's available for streaming and that's sad . But this one I want to keep watching forever and forever . The movie is very well made , the acting is fantastic .

The Mummy 's Curse is the last in the series of the Kharis mummy films , and it seems that there is still no release date for the third movie in this series. In the meantime we will see more of the mummy series. I hope you enjoyed this review, please don’t forget to check out more of my work at:

Monday, 19 September 2011

A few days have passed since I reviewed the Mummy franchise, I’ll be reviewing the first and the second films soon! Today I am going to review The Mummy's Curse!

This movie is silly and very short of being a funny movie. Unhappy 'easterners' are not pleased with being out west; so they hire a drunk wagon master(John Candy)to lead them back east. Sight gags were just not funny enough to carry this one. And Richard Lewis gets on your nerves very quickly; but then I honestly don't like him at anything he does. Ed Lauter is hilarious as the bumbling villain.The movie was dedicated to Candy. He died from a massive heart attack ten days before the movie was completed.

This is probably one of the worst movies I have ever seen ! The plot revolves around a man named Astrid (Viktor Schauberger) who has just started his first day in a prison hospital. All of a sudden he sees a light at the end of the dark tunnel he was in when he entered prison to begin his life. He goes into a room where all the prisoners are and all the inmates are in shock seeing him. One of these inmates is a woman named Eliza (Amanda Seyfried) and she is a prostitute.

Everybody seems to compare this to The Matrix and The 13th Floor , and when I first saw it I thought I was watching a video game and not a movie. At the same time it is an extremely well constructed film that will likely be a lot of fun to watch as long as you don't give much thought to the film. It's not the Matrix or any kind of "AI" movie but a very intelligent and thoughtful film. It is intelligent and thoughtful. If you want to see intelligent and thoughtful films then I think this is the film for you.

I 've been looking forward to the release of this movie since I first heard the concept two years ago and it's finally out today! A lot has happened in those two years since then, most of which I'd rather not re-hash. I don't like talking about how much I enjoyed the book, so I'm going to keep that in suspense. So, if you've never seen the movie, you should go see it today, because the trailer is pretty damn amazing! It's a lot better than I expected!

When I first saw this movie, I had thought that it was going to be a terrible upset, being directed by first-time director Liev Schrieber. What I saw in the next 130 minutes completely and utterly changed my mind. Based on the novel by Jonathan Safran Foer, Everything is Illuminated tells the story of a young Jewish-American collector(masterfully played by Elijah Wood)who is trying to find the woman who saved his grandfather from the Nazis in WWII. He travels to Germany and enlists in the help of a 20-something, club hitting translator and his grandfather.

Wow... this is the kind of movie that makes you wonder who's idea this was and what soup kitchen are they eating at now. To say this was bad is an insult to the bad movies we all know and love.When I saw Guttenberg's name in the TV guide I figured it would be a spoof... maybe it should have been. Could have made for a better movie.Look for the scene where they are in an airplane in mid flight with the door open and there is no wind what so ever. They could have sprung for a fan at least.Look for several Canadian & c-list actors in the movie.

many people said this was a great movie with Hoffman delivering a great performance . i went from suspended disbelief to disbelief within 5 minutes . i went from thinking this was an ok film to thinking that i am going to hate it , even though i didn't hate it. but i didn't enjoy it as much as most of the other movies i have seen that didn't end up on my favorites list.. i would have liked a more serious and realistic look into the world of crime. but there was a sense of humor to it that i found endearing.

OK, a film about a film that takes a crack at Video movie making could be entertaining. Could be, should be, funny, edgy, even controversial, or at least interesting, and yet... This film is the bizzaro negative version of that. Hamlin was entertaining as a 'B' Film producer. Shatner played crazy yet likable, and had all the best lines. The rest of the characters were boring, predictable, boring, underdeveloped, boring and boring. The production value was lame. You'll actually see the boom come down in one scene.

Ever once in a while I run into a movie that is so embarrassingly bad I wonder why movies exist. This is one of them. This is a terrible attempt to parody The Godfather with annoying cartoon sounds, and bad dialogue. Eddie Deezen is just plain annoying as Tony, an annoying twit who upon his father, Don (William Hickey)'s request, takes over the family business. Tony, as I said, is an annoying little twit. This makes the whole movie a complete mess. The movie is terribly daffy. It's too cartoonish.

The basic idea behind `` Dungeon of Harrow '' is n't all bad . The acting , however , is somewhat abysmal . There's enough of a plot to keep you interested , though . And it's just a shame that the characters are rather bland . Even so , it's an entertaining tale that doesn't seem to get the job done . I'm not sure what I'd rather see on TV in the future . The first season had me hooked , but that's a rare thing to see with a series .

I saw this movie in the theatre and it was a terrible movie. The way Michael Oliver who now turn even worse in the sequel is the biggest intolerance I cannot bare. Junior upset his father because he would not go to school which got his father Ben madly insane. Also the Crazy Dance ride operator is not fair to Junior for not letting him go on the ride. And that Lawanda Dumore is as horrible as a serial killer to Junior because she made threatening insults to Junior which is why I cannot tolerate this movie.

Thats what this movie really takes . A big piece of cheeze . This movie is about a sister and a brother who live together . When one sister wants to leave and the other wants to stay . So they talk and find a solution together . This is a really good and sweet movie . The acting and direction of this movie are also very good and the story is very well written . The cinematography of the movie is also nice . This is a really good and sweet movie with lots of sweet moments . There are so many things in this movie which makes it very fun and entertaining .

This movie is a mystery . It 's not scary , it 's spooky . You 'll probably jump at this movie with no expectations but if you like this kind of thing, you will probably like it . You will probably think . I really can not explain how to watch this . Do not let me stop you . This movie is not a typical horror movie . But this movie is very good . It 's very scary , but not scary . You 'll enjoy . Do not give me this bad review . I think that I'm not the only one who will like this movie .

I caught this movie late night on TV, and was expecting a low-budget campy "masterpiece", I was surprised with a pretty decent movie. Angelina Jolie's unique acting capabilities (or should I say lack thereof?) make her perfect as an android, and the other actors, while terribly average, are at least not terrible.There is a plot; a fairly intricate plot at that, involving conspiracies and the lengths a couple (one human, one android) will go to pursue their illegal romance, with a "big brother"-type figure and android assassin thrown in the mix.

I saw this film at the tender age of 18 with a group of friends. Its reputation had preceded it, and though all my friends were also of legal age, I alone had the courage to enter the video store and actually rent it. We gathered at a house where the parents had left town for the weekend. Though we sat in close proximity to each other, we did not speak or otherwise acknowledge each other's presence. As it turned out, the film both merited and did not merit the anticipatory shame we felt.

Because I would have never ever seen this movie through to the end. Although there are some, but not many, funny moments in this movie I couldn't understand more than about 15%(the fancy English couple in the 3rd story included) of what people were saying. Three short stories, none with a real point, with just some of the most miserable and lifeless people I could have imagined and a load of foul language. Didn't find it funny, didn't find it amusing, didn't find any sense in it.

Most American remakes of European films are pretty poor, but this is in a league of its own. In fact this might even be the worst (Sandra Bullock) movie ever made. I daresay I might have passed it off as just another innocuously bad Hollywood thriller had I not seen the Dutch original, SPOORLOOS. The altered ending here is stupid enough (and executed with particular ineptitude), but a far worse crime than that is removing all the intelligence and depth of character that marked out the original as a classic.

NBC should be ashamed . I would n't allow my children to see this . I definitely would tell my kids that . I would tell them . . . . this is not for kids . It is not funny , it is not fun . This is an adult cartoon . They are adults , and should not be treated like this . This is an adult . . . . . adult cartoon . This is disgusting . This is not funny . There are some adults in here . There is no humor . This is a bunch of adults . I am ashamed of .

To even say that this film is Sebastien's work at his best just tell you everything you have to know on the man. Sebastien is a pathetic, foolish, not amusing at best, yet highly popular host on french television. If watching any of his shows is just plain torture for any normally constituted human being, his first (ans lets hope only) film proved to be even worst. Sebastien's apology of rape (the victim fall in love with her aggressor) is not only misplaced but plainly unacceptable.

I took my 14 year old to see this movie . We left after 15 or 20 minutes . It was a big hit for a few hours and then just faded away . It was a comedy , but it did not go far enough . There were a lot of jokes that didn’t make much sense , but it did have some very funny moments . It wasn’t terrible , but just not a good enough movie . I will say that it had some very well written dialog and the story was interesting enough to keep me interested for a good while .

For an indy film this is probably a bit better than a 3 out of 10, but in general it only gets a 3. The effects aren't horrible and at least they have some adults playing adult roles rather than all kids as a lot of indy low budget horror films do. The acting is very wooden, but at least they had a better "display" than some films in the shoestring budget category. It's filmed a lot inside a building rather than a friend's basement. The plot as a whole isn't the worst.

I can't explain it, but I find this movie not only funny, but so enjoyable I feel compelled to watch it over and over, or at least I did when I had cable TV. I always felt it was a really poorly made movie, but perhaps that is because I watched it on cable. I plan to get a DVD of this movie to really take an honest look at at, but more importantly to just have a good time watching it. I liked the plot and the idea of the movie and I especially liked the cast.

Bay Area residents probably remember Paul from The Diamond Center, an unctuous late night huckster who flogged easy credit and cheap rocks on late night television throughout the 1980s and early 90s. I mention him only because there is an actor in Death Machines who looks JUST LIKE HIM playing the owner of an Italian restaurant. He appears in the best scene in this positively dreadful and near unwatchable crime drama about a Dragon Lady (Mari Honjo, who wisely hung up her acting spurs after completing this film) who controls the local syndicate.

I admit - I was lured to this one from the hype - and I didn't stop to consider the sources. "one of the best indie exploitation flicks of the year (1999)", shocking", and " a must have ".Well - I wasted my money. But not all was bad in this movie. THey at least got the gore right, as well as some of the most unique methods of murder seen in a long time. There is even a storyline (kinda) and that is about it.But for an exploitation film there is a surprising amount of content - but no exploiting.

I would like to tell you just a few things before considering seeing this movie. If at one point or another you thought you've seen good camera work, be prepared to be amazed by this movie. For the record, this movie was made in 1957 in Russia, but the technique used here is probably something that we've seen much later in the western world...about 20 years later. The level of emotions through the film varies quite a lot: happiness -love-war- despair-joy, but in the end you remain with something quite unique: the joy of seeing one masterpiece of filmmaking.

Everywhere I hear that people are calling this show bad because its premise is too far fetched .... well maybe that’s what people want to hear but they should not be surprised that it was not received well by those that were there. It would have been even more of a shock had it become a ratings hit. I think you’ve got to realize that just because something is said by an individual on a TV show does not mean it is true. And when people call this a show that “had too many ideas in it” they should also be very concerned about the people involved.

I can't believe that Isaiah Washington and Ice-T were in this mess! The plot (and I use that term very loosely) centers around an army of rats that terrorize an urban apartment complex--at least I think that's what it was about. The script made no sense at all, I couldn't have cared less about the characters and the camera-work consisted of repeatedly showing shadow images of rats standing on their hind legs or running. Running is what I should have done. As an African American male, I often read pleas from my brothers and sisters to "support African American films."

The violent death of Fernando Ramos Da Silva only eight years after the completion of this film , only adds more pain in our lives and the agony of those who were left to cope with his murder, in my opinion, is greater than it should be,” he said. He said that it must be understood that this was not an isolated incident but part of a trend of terrorism and murders that have taken place across the country. He said that in order to curb the problem, police should not only do the job properly, but also protect the citizens in their communities.

An enjoyable movie , without a doubt , and very evocative of both its era and that very particular stage of British history. I would not say that we are the ones who created modern Britain , but certainly it was our predecessors who brought about the modern state of the UK , one that no longer has the political, social and cultural roots it used to enjoy a hundred years ago , yet still thrives. There are some things we have to take on board, for example the political and legal systems that operate today which were set up after the revolution, after the establishment of the State.

This film powerfully demonstrates the struggle of two women in love in a culture so deeply entrenched in ritual and tradition. All this against a backdrop of an India which itself is struggling for freedom from these same values. This film is both political and personal and never too preachy or idealistic on either front. It is easy to see why "Fire" has caused riots in India, but tragic nonetheless. A true film such as this one deserves to be seen by all people of the world, not just privileged westerners.

When I was five years old , it was my favorite television show . I remembered it was on channel 17 , and my mom , who worked in the library , said, ” You know what that show was called . It was the show that was on the library”

“Yes, but what channel was on that show .” I said . My mom said , ” That one”

“What one” . My mom repeated . ” The one on channel 16”

“So” . That was my mom . So she said , I was watching Channel 16 .

Having endured this film last night, I turned off the DVD player with a sense of deserving a medal for having the stamina to see it through to the end. Throughout the film I felt that I was watching the storyline fillers that you get in a high budget porn movie. the acting was stiff and taut, camera work appalling, and the locations and sets were so poor it felt like they had borrowed them from the local High School "Amateur Dramatic's Society".The only saving grace for this movie was that it had Amy Adams and Harriet Sansom Harris in its credits, other than that it was pure dribble.

Inappropriate. The PG rating that this movie gets is yet another huge misstep by the MPAA. Whale Rider gets a PG-13 but this movie gets a PG? Please. Parents don't be fooled, taking an elementary school child to this movie is a huge mistake. There were numerous times I found myself being uncomfortable not just because the humor was inappropriate for kids, but also because it was totally out of the blue and unnecessary.But all that aside, The Cat in the Hat is still a terrible movie. The casting and overall look of the movie are the only saving graces.

You may not believe this, but when the credits to this movie rolled, I looked for the director's name. When I saw it, I burned it into my memory and I never forgot it. This movie is beyond terrible. It makes Ed Wood's films look like Orsen Welles. At least B movies are entertaining, this was a soul deadening experience. The quality was so bad, I began to wonder who allowed this to happen.I hear Uwe Boll runs fourteen miles a day. This is because wherever his movies are viewed, the people must run him out of town with flame and pitchfork.

I generally loved the Carry on movies but this one is actually pretty awful. There are very few laughs because the whole thing is so forced.There is plenty of talent on the screen and some come off better than others. June Whitfield, Kenneth Williams, Hatti Jaques and Peter Butterworth are fine but Barbara Windsor looks tired and Sid James is just tacky. Joan Sims comes off well but in the case of the usually wonderful Charles Hawtrey its just plain sad. When you think of the sad end to his career the movie is almost too depressing to watch.

I could not believe what i saw...(once) brilliant actors appearing in this dire effort that should never of been made. The plots are dreadful and the dialogue appauling (at first i thought it was a spoof), and the acting abysmal. Everything about it is bad, from the cheap sets to the phony backdrops, a bunch of paintings enlarged. Respectable filmakers struggle to get their vision realised, yet this blasphemous, pathetic attempt at a mini-series makes it to our television's, with 3 oscar winners making appearances.

When I reviewed the video for a local magazine , I called it `` the greatest achievement in the history of the sport.`` I think the judges had a little too much fun with the concept. I don\'t know about you, but I would have much preferred a more sober video than this one with a little more of a ``hard-core`` vibe. It was a shame that the team that gave us the greatest achievement video in the history of the sport, had to go off the road for an hour just to make this one.

Horrible acting with the worst special f/x I 've ever bore witness too . It 's bad enough I wasted all that money and time trying to make it look good . It looks so bad. It looks so bad. Oh, wait, it is. It 's terrible! This is what they are trying to do to me! They are going to ruin my life and I don 't know how they are doing it, but they are! They are making it look like I don 't care! They are making it seem like I am not a woman of my word!

Yes it is your typical direct to video action flick . And of course they do their best to change the genre to a more realistic setting . And of course its all based on what he saw on the big screen and in the past and it will be pretty much exactly the same story as in the first movie . But there is something more to this one . This time its more personal . I think it is going to be pretty awesome . And I'm sure there are a lot of people that will disagree . But its just the way he is and it is what he believes in .

... but you probably have seen it or else you wouldn't be here. It's so obscure that you probably stumbled onto it like I did because this little known gem receives no word-of-mouth.From the very beginning you know how the storyline will shake out but watching as our innocent redheaded nurse puts the pieces of the puzzle together is high quality entertainment. Most horror films bombard viewers with graphic displays of torture but Don't Look in the Basement plays it subtle, which makes for superior suspense. Note to horror filmmakers: some of us do like subtlety!

Now, lissen you guys, I LOVED THIS FILM, though not quite as much as FAREWELL TO THE KING, another beloved John Milius epic. It was fun, a lot more than if it were based on a Tennessee Williams drama. It's a great yarn, with a whiff of political correctness. I love this film for its beautiful photography, its humor and its attenuated criticism of the Bad Guys (Berbers) and the REAL Bad Guys, the spear- carriers for the acquisitive 'civilized' world, with their repeating rifles, artillery and large gunboats out there in the harbor.

When I bought 4 DVDs for £5.oo in a local shop it should have been warning enough that this movie was a rip off! I knew I would need to read the reviews and check out a few of the other reviews on it too before I bought it! I ended up buying it after I had seen it all over the internet, but it is a good movie. It is not very violent or graphic in the way they are in many other movies. The characters in this movie also seem very like people in real life! I recommend to everyone to not buy this.

I find this film meretricious , tentative , lethargic , and skillfully a bad choice of entertainment on celluloid . I don't have the words to explain why it is bad, nor does it help the narrative of the story , but I'll try to say that it isn't any good . __________________________________
