This is the second part in a three part series. This part is the third part in a series. In this part , we will discuss the three main characters , their motivations , and how they are motivated by what they see happening around them to make them act.

Whenever someone tries to tell me that they think a movie is the worst ever ( and it 's usually me), I say "No, I think that movie is pretty good." They say it's not good enough, so therefore it must not be good. I don't think so, I think it's good. It's just one of those movies. You have to look at it from the perspective of the characters themselves, not the director or anyone else. For me, in order to make the most of what I've seen, I look to the characters first.

I honestly don't know what words IMDB will allow me to use in this review, as a result, I'm having a hard time describing these shorts. Let's just say there's a good amount of gay sex, some necrophilia, some incest, a fair amount of masturbation, and several artificial.... members. And I loved every minute of it.Not that it's ALL crude humor. It isn't. They stray away from fart gags for the most part, with the exception of one sketch entitled "Pizza" in which they use one very well.

O boy , was this really bad.I saw this on videotape.In scenes that had soundtrack music , it was hard to understand what exactly he was saying.Also , I couldn't understand what he was saying that he was doing in some scene. The first scene he said that I can't understand , but later it becomes clear he was talking about me.The next time he says this to me , it became clear he was talking about me.In the final scene , he did this in a scene , which made me understand more what he said. This has happened several times till now.He always says I can't understand.

I rented this movie expecting it to suck , and it did n't let me down . I rented it because I could not find the original version. This is my first time seeing the film , and I am very impressed. It is very well acted , very well written , and it is very well directed . I have to say that the entire cast did an excellent job. I can't wait until the end of the film . I am a huge action movie fanatic , and this is easily one of the best movies that I have ever seen.

I expected this movie was originally supposed to show before the election . CBS 's last shot at throwing a monkey wrench under President Obama has been a bit of a mystery to date . But now the network has put the first trailer online for a drama set in 2016 . In the trailer for CBS 's political drama “Crazy Ex-Girlfriend,” there’s no shortage of political action . The trailer for the film depicts the first presidential campaign meeting for “The Good Wife” , the series “The Good Wife” . I was not surprised that the first trailer was a bit of a mess .

When I think of a 1970s-period film, this is not what I think of. I don't want a monotonous, one-song Robin Trower soundtrack; I want a soundtrack punctuated with the top-40 bubblegum songs of the day that epitomized the '70s. The generic karaoke-style disco music during the prom scene was especially annoying. The acting (if you can call it that) was very wooden, and seemed just read from script in monotone. The film quality and camera work was horrid; the dialog murky, the script seemed thrown together without much thought and the plot was thin if not nonexistent.

This movie did n't do it for me , an avid SNL fan for the past 14 years . Jamie Kennedy did not do it for me . It seemed as if he wasn't giving us what we were hoping for . I would have had the feeling that if he didn't have his head out the window then I was sure I would have had the feeling. I did not have the feeling either . I am not one to go into someone else's movies thinking I will like them . I had seen them before and I have enjoyed them too .

One of my favorites non-MGM musicals, it's a classic!> Rita Hayworth is in top form, her beauty leaps out of the screen. Gene Kelly shows off his dancing skills and introduces to musicals his edgy and innovative choreography that eventually would change the way musicals are choreograph. Phil Silvers is the perfect second bananas, and Eve Arden injects this movie with a lot of class. The structure is so theatrical that one has to wonder why, in this era where major Broadway shows come from the movies, Cover Girl hasn't been adapted to theatre.

this is an alright show to watch, its not the best nor the worst. I've watched it for a long time and i don't like any of the new stuff. This show has changed into some teen trash and is living much differently. I dislike that crap..i have no IQ why they completely changed the theme of this show. The first season was really enjoyable to watch and is was partly amusing. The 2nd season is just out of this world dumb. I seriously don't know why the writers/directors changed this show up.

why oh why did i ever waste my time watching this film? it was given to me on video by a friend and i thought i'll watch it, it can't be that bad surely. firstly the acting is simply appalling and we're supposed to believe this is real? secondly this film is blatantly trying to copy the Blair witch project (yawn) and does so very poorly. so if you want the fright of your life i would suggest that a Simpson's Halloween special would be far scarier. but, if you just wanted to a laugh then maybe the general crapness of this film would suffice.

Aside from the fact that this movie was filmed mostly in Rockport MA, which is a beautiful town where my mother once rented a small storefront and I spent many a pleasant summer as a child, it is fun and cute little film. I must admit that I had no desire to actually see this movie even though I have a weakspot for romantic comedies (I don't know why). The trailers I saw were not appealing, the cast did not look that interesting and I had no idea what the plot would be about.

I HATE MOVIES THAT END LIKE THIS!!! !This 16mm disaster is full of clichés, stereotypical characters, a generic, over done "plot" and terrible dialog.In this "Movie" we have the Aggressive Black Guy, The Black Guys Girlfriend, The Blonde Bitch, The Possible Lesbian "hacker chick", the Pedophilic teacher...Blah, Blah, Blah....And then the Pumpkin Man. "Do you think someone is taking the legend too far?" This question is asked towards the end of the film.

Being a fan of Saint Etienne and the City of London , I was very excited to see this movie in London , and I was even more excited when I saw it at the cinema in my country, England. It was a great experience for me because the city and the country were in such close proximity, and it was nice to experience both the London and the Paris atmosphere. The movie started at a very intense and emotional pace. The story follows two brothers who are the main protagonists of the film. They live a hard life but have a love for their father.

The recent DVD release of Good Humor Man labels the film as comedy. It's hardly a comedy, rather a dull indie film about a group of losers. Supposedly set in the 70s, there is scant attention paid to period details, with overly muted color correction taking its place. The monotonous soundtrack only serves to accentuate the repetitiveness of the film (perhaps that is the point, but it does not add to the enjoyment of the viewing experience.) Apprarently the clique of losers only like to hang out at one location, the bleachers.

The storyline of this movie is cliché and obviously has been ripped off from Jurassic Park. The filmmakers didn't even try to hide that. It seems as though there was not enough budget to make decent dinosaur-dolls, so instead the viewer sees some robot-like toy-dinos (from a cheap toystore) which move in a very unnatural way. It's funny though, because it's so bad. The acting is almost as unnatural as the dinos are. No one seems really excited to be in this movie (which I totally understand).

Police Squad ! ( 1982 ) was a funny show that ended too soon . But I guess it had to be a comedy show . There was nothing else for it . I don't really remember the plot . But there were at least two interesting characters in the show . I still love this show as I think there is enough of a humor in the show . I just hope it would continue . The only thing that can be done about the end of the show is that the characters should not have been in the ending .

Eh . This is a popcorn movie , nothing more . I watched this with a bunch of friends ( and it is not my favourite ) but I have to say it was a really fun movie to watch . You can't get bored . the script is well written , the acting is solid , and it has a great concept . I love the idea of popcorn being a way to get everyone to eat together . It seems like a very silly idea but it really works . I like the fact that popcorn is eaten with one bite .

I was at a friends house for Thanksgiving and watched a DVD of the movie, Eddie Monroe. I've been a fan of Indie Films for almost 20 years, (I loved the Brothers McMullen), and was impressed how good this movie is. My friend, who works at Magno Sound, told us that this movie was shot on Super 16. The photography was so good, it looked as though it was a 35mm shoot. Furthermore, the music combined with Fred Carpenter's direction, was art. The storyline was original and led up to an ending that surprised all of us watching...very cool.

Or vice-versa.This is a French film noir directed by an American film maker (Jules Dassin) who had to leave the country because of being blacklisted by Hollywood thanks to HUAC. The premise of the story is rather familiar--one last jewel heist for Tony le Stephanois and his buds--and so is the ending with everybody getting... Well, no spoilers here, for sure, since this is the sort of film in which tension toward the ending is important.Dassin filmed in realistic lighting in black and white on the streets of Paris using actors and actresses who are not glamorous.

This film was very different form the previous films and I had to wonder , `` Where is Ralph Macchio now?" I was just curious. There is a scene I would love to see where Ralph goes on a cruise. I just want to see that scene and all the action. It was very funny , I enjoyed the movie. I do not usually like movies with women and I thought it was kind of funny , but it was not offensive at all. There were not too many scenes that were overtly sexual , but every scene had a subplot that was sexual , including a scene that was sexual.

I should have realized that any two-video set being sold for only $ 6 would be bad . I even considered getting it as a gift for my family members but then I decided that it should be mine . For the price it is worth and I like the way it is . This is the reason I have decided to get it. It has a very low price. It is not for every collector and there are more who will appreciate this than the average person . I think that this is an amazing gift for your family members or friends . Thank you so much .

I saw this movie on my flight from Philly to Denver. The screen was three rows in front of me and about 12" x 10". So I really wasn't going to watch it. But I like Malcolm in the Middle, so I thought I'd watch just a few minutes. Next thing I know I'm sucked in, having a great time, and was pleased as how good it was and how fast it seemed to make the time go by. I agree with that the acting is very good for this level of entertainment.

Jewel Thief is * THE * crime thriller of Bollywood , and why should it not be ? It is so well done , so entertaining , and so much heart , that it is a real page turner. And the way the movie ends - it leaves the audience breathless. I have to say I enjoyed the movie a lot. The performance and the storyline is really good , and the acting is on the level of the leading actors in the film. The storyline is also well thought out . It is a classic of Bollywood.

Everyone has their choice for "worst movie they've ever seen." Some like to pick on Gigli or Battlefield Earth. Some pick on classics like Plan 9 From Outer Space. Ever since I was 14 I have been very vocal in saying that to me, it is Problem Child 2, and 9 years later, I feel the exact same way. It's not "one of the worst," it's not just an expression. It is THE ACTUAL worst movie I have ever seen.How much farting, pooping, peeing, and puking can you put in a single movie?

How offensive ! Those who liked this movie have probably never opened a bible . I can imagine those at church who hate the idea of using the Bible because they don't know how to use it. The Bible was made by the first man on the scene, the Lord. He didn't want it to be used for political and religious agendas. He wanted it as a book for the heart, for study and for personal reflection. We are not the first to use the Bible in the service of a political agenda, but I don't think we should condemn those who use it.

`` Christmas in Connecticut '' is an absolute gem , and a must-see for Christmas ! Elizabeth Lane , a former Miss Connecticut and current columnist for '' The Hartford Advocate, is a very busy lady . She has been writing extensively about her family and friends for many years , in a variety of different topics. She lives in Hartford. Wednesday, December 5, 2011

I like to think of this little town as a little paradise, but I can't deny there are times when it's a bit of a pain.

this is the worst movie in the world. the only reason i gave it a 2 was because the first 10 minutes were hysterically funny in a "is this for real??" sort of way. it was so cheesy and low budget...they should not have even bothered. there was nudity and violence for the pure sake of having nudity and violence, and the effects were just so so bad you would not believe it (think ketchup as blood, and cabbages for severed heads). do not rent this! !

Norris plays a Chicago cop who stumbles upon a devil 's apprentice ? who wants to , well , create havoc on earth ...

"I don't know where they get these from" ? the devil's apprentice ? I was never told where they came from , but the way they are acting they make me think they are all from heaven , but they're not , not from hell, but hell is hell and they are there to do their job in hell

Nah ... I don't see them as "heaven's messengers"

I know they're from the hellside of heaven .

`` The Dresser '' is perhaps the most refined of backstage films . The film is brimming with wit and charm . It's a pleasure to watch '' as a film , as it is an enjoyable viewing experience . But it's also a pleasure to see it on screen . But the fact is that '' is a boring film . That's not to say that it's bad . But '' is not to say that it's a masterpiece . It's a good film , but it's nothing special . But it's a film , but it's not much fun . ''

This movie is an abortive, stillborn attempt to stitch together several bad movies and make some sort of extra-bad movie. It fails at even this, since there's way too much "plot", and not nearly enough goofy puppets and ridiculous gore. Seriously, the puppets are sweet, and the guys in suits crack me up pretty good. The performances are C-grade at best and lame throughout, with special props to the Spec-Ops guy who spoke some sort of bizarre East Coast/Venusian dialect that was almost impossible to decipher. Not that you really care what he says, as only the curse words are distinct.

'The Shining' has wit, visual flair and an iconic performance by Jack Nicholson. 'Ausentes,' however, has none of these things; although it does borrow from its classic forebear; to wit, a man hacking through a door and a woman running around shrieking while clutching a huge kitchen knife. Unlike Stanley Kubrick's great psychological horror film, 'Ausentes' is a work which resonates with a singular lack of genius. It is magnificently, comically awful; it makes the Spice Girls movie look like a work of vital art.

As the title suggests there is a philosophical , meritocratic thread running through this film : if a man has done good deeds , he has an advantage over a woman who hasn’t done good deeds . And a girl has the same advantage over a man who has done good deeds . However , I think that this film has a problem with its philosophy . First of all why do we need a theory to explain it? Why do we need any explanation? Secondly why is the theory needed? How can we use it to understand what’s going on in this story?

This is not exactly what I would call a Mad Max film , after seeing Road Warrior and experiencing the hellish violence of The Road Warrior, which I’d like to compare to, I’ve developed a new set of expectations. But in this film, I really enjoyed, and if you’re wondering why I’ve decided to keep the title, I think that’s what you should do. If you’re reading this, I hope that you’ve had enough time to get to the good stuff.

I finally saw LAURE and I have to say that I equally enjoyed it and was dismayed by it . I think I'll wait until I hear how it pans out. I don't think it was a bad show but it didn't get any of the best of what was there. I did think it was well-made and entertaining but just wasn't up to the standard of what I wanted from a horror show. It's hard to say which is more annoying, that it wasn't good enough or that it wasn't good enough for it to be worth watching.

.... OK , small-town , clueless sheriff ? Check . Sheriff 's hot daughter ? Check ? Ne'er-do-well boyfriend of his high-school sweetheart's younger sister ? Check , check , check . Now that you mention it , I 'm curious , why do you have this on your Facebook . I can't believe he got this . It looks like a joke to me . . I have seen the video, and I have heard the comments and I can't really say how I feel about this. However I can tell you a lot of people have told the sheriff they're not laughing with him.

An under-appreciated , unseen gem . Estevez does a remarkable job of illustrating in poignant , heartbreaking fashion , the trials and suffering of the American people , as a whole , at the end of World War II . But , more than that , he gives hope to a nation that is on the precipice of a new , better future . That future can be found , and it is the future of hope in the United States . I first noticed Estevez’s film when it first came out , and since then I have read and seen several of his films , and this one is by far the most important .

Like some other people wrote , I 'm a die-hard mario fan , and I loved this game . This game is so much fun to play. The graphics are great. The gameplay itself is easy and fun. This game is not as good as the original but still great. I have to agree with people in other blogs who have said this game is not as good as the original. If you are a gamer then you have to play this game if you love this type of game . I think it's a little unfair, though, to compare this game to Mario 64.

The only good either of the Problem Child films caused was bringing together Amy Yasbeck and the late John Ritter. Aside from that, the flicks are as demonic as their hero. In this basically unnecessary sequel, freshly separated Ben (Ritter) and his little hellraiser Junior (Michael Oliver, who never needs screen-time ever again) move to a new town infested with willing bachelorettes. Ben eventually picks Lawanda (played by the most underused original SNL-er Laraine Newman), whose Blanche DuBois tendencies don't suit Junior in the least.

I left the theater , and I was only 10 years old . That 's how bad it sucked . I don't remember exactly where , but it had been raining , so there was a pretty big chance of rain . There was this line . A woman was on the other side of that line . She told me about the movie . She got to the front of it . It was raining , so I thought I might have a chance to go out for the first time . It was raining too hard , but I could see it all along .

Hubie -- like Stanely the troll from Bluth 's A Troll in Central Park -- lacks the spark of personality, so we won't see it again. We won't see it from any other of our trolls, either. This time, as the story goes, Stanely, who we'll refer to as H.O., did it on purpose. He was so caught up with all the craziness going around that he did not even realize that he had been the target of some deranged prank. For a troll, H.O. makes the most of every moment of the day.

Stealing is a crime, and these guys, Kenny Yakkel and Corbin Bernsen look like their going to get away with it. I haven't even seen this film, but not only do i know it sucks, but the fact that it steals the story of another film, or 2 films for that matter, is such bull crap (and if IMDb would allow profanity much more than just bull crap) that I become filled with rage and feel as though I should just throw myself out the window and just end it all. O.k that's a little much but stealing is worse.Ever seen Pontypool?

For this movie , based off of a TV show , and a serious finale . I thought that it might be a bit too hard for a first film , but I can't complain for my second . In the first film , I think the director let the audience know what he was trying to do . In this movie , the director seemed to show more ambition , to the point that I think the movie is not that hard to watch in the end . Overall , I thought that the movie was a very good ending , considering that the first one was .

This episode of Charmed changed everything! The show is about to end it's third season, and all hell IS breaking loose in this episode. The Charmed ones bring an Innocent named Dr. Griffiths to the manor the protect him from Shax, The Sources assassin. When Shax attacks, he blasts in as a tornado and then corporealizes into his demon skin. He blasts Prue threw a wall which totally knocks her out and practically kills her. Then blasts Piper threw what is left of the wall. Phoebe comes from the attic and says the vanquishing spell before Shax came kill the doctor.

The most die-hard worshippers of John Wayne will cringe when they watch The Lawless Frontier. Even for a poverty row studio, this one is one stinkeroo.Unusual for a western we have a criminal who is a sex crime perpetrator. Earl Dwire plays a halfbreed white and Indian who for reasons that are not explained, pretends he's a Mexican, hokey accent and all. Dwire sounds like the Frito Bandito of advertising fame back in the day.He and his gang happen upon Gabby Hayes and his daughter Sheila Terry. They really don't have anything worth robbing, but Dwire just wants an excuse to kidnap Terry and have his way with her.

A film by Almodovar- sends a tingle down my spine every time . The capitalized print which opens the Spanish thriller, “Para el Amor”, makes me yearn to write something so poetic as it was intended . The film begins with the voice of one of the main characters describing a scene they have witnessed in which his wife, who has just died, tells him that his children need to move to another country to avoid having to deal with the aftermath of the death of their mother, who had also been killed when they were very young.

Korean cinema has the ability to turn genres on its head , and the latest by the celebrated director Chan-wook Park (1947–) shows just how he does this when it comes to women. Park’s first feature “Hands of Gold” (1961) was set in the near future in a world ruled by men, when women have no choice but to keep to the shadows in order to keep the population alive. Park was inspired to write the piece after being told by his female character that women in Korea would be raped by their husbands if she dared speak her mind.

Visconti 's Death in Venice qualifies as one of the most beautiful films ever made . While watching , we can only wonder why some of the film makers could not leave their mark behind . The story may be fictional but it certainly is based on true events. It is based on the events that happened in the year 1612 , the year the Holy Roman Empire lost the Italian colonies in North America to the English and their colonists , and the events that are still unfolding today in South America . The film's plot revolves around the life of the Italian nobleman Visconti , who was married to a Portuguese princess.

`` The Long Kiss Goodnight '' is an enjoyable and very cool action thriller , and a career breakthrough for Michael Fassbender. It shows his versatility to play both hero and villain, and the film shows just why he will be a major Hollywood star in the future. " Michael Fassbender and Marion Cotillard in '' The Long Kiss Goodnight . Michael Fassbender and Marion Cotillard star in this action-thriller. The film follows a man who kills his wife when he learns she has been unfaithful. Michael Fassbender stars as the husband, Marion Cotillard as the wife, and Academy Award Winner Brad Pitt is the villain.

Intelligent summary , is n't it ? If Mad Max was something of a simple , straight forward , nothing more , I would be more than happy to see it come to America. But since it's not and that's a good thing in itself , I still think that the movie would have been better off if it were in English, and American audiences would go out and get it . . . . . I'm still a bit disappointed, however , when I find myself writing about the film when I should be watching some other film . . . .

'Blade ' would be an extremely above-average comic-book , vampire-hunter action/horror if it were n't for two minor flaws . First and foremost, the comics themselves are fantastic . I've been reading them for well over 20 years and have never encountered anything this good . This is not a criticism . I have read many, many, many, MANY other comics and none of them compare . So why would a comic-book be this great if these flaws don't apply ? They are flaws that I have encountered numerous times over the years . And the reason why they apply to the comic is because of the content .

The Outsiders is undoubtedly a classic Australian TV series . Well defined characters , tight scripts , varied and interesting story lines and fantastic acting . The cast includes an impressive group of Australian actors , and was one of our favourite programs on the Australian TV scene of the 80’s , and in fact the series has been broadcast on TV in Australia for almost 30 years . But it is the writing that has really been the standout part of the series . The story is about two strangers who meet each other in Sydney and decide they want to go to the other side to escape the world that they have come into.

Has anyone found a way to purchase copies of this series yet ? I can see that a lot of people would like to buy the original version but the fact that they can only buy 1 copy doesn’t seem to make much sense. If this is the case why not have the original series and have people who have never seen them buy the originals in a physical format so they can share it among their friends. I am not sure about the format, I would be more interested if someone could help me out on this.

Imagine you have the opportunity to see yourself again as a kid. Now think what would happen if you had the chance to speak with your younger self, or even change him/you. Would you try to influence or try to change your younger self's beliefs in light of your future experience? Or perhaps the encounter would change your older self's perception of life and reality? Walt Disney's The Kid tries to engage this complex thought by putting "older self" Bruce Willis in a collision course with "younger self" Spenser Breslin (from The Santa Clause 2 and The Cat in the Hat "fame").

Man, what an awful film. As with many terrible films, the structure of its awfulness lies in the script. This is such a pathetic attempt at a psychological thriller that it gives the entire genre a bad name. Okay, here's one major problem: Sandra Bullock's character is abducted by Jeff Bridges in his car at a busy convenience store in broad daylight. Somehow, her boyfriend Kiefer Sutherland doesn't find a single witness to this act and subsequently spends most of the movie completely clueless as to her whereabouts. Come on!

Bay Area residents probably remember Paul from The Diamond Center , an unctuous late night huckster who flogged easy credit-card debit cards from a window in a parking garage. It was a scam, according to a court filing. But it was a good scam. Then there’s his friend, a “sneaky guy” who “always kept his head down and worked,” according to his LinkedIn profile. It turns out Paul didn’t have a job after all, so he did his best to keep that reputation up. “I worked from home,” he told me.

As is the case with many films of this ilk, my non Catholicism got in the way of my understanding it. The church has this mass of rules which have been put together over centuries. We have a short time to learn them and have to accept them at face value. Then, throw in some bad guys getting revenge for a long distant act against them, working under these rules and attempting to circumvent them, and you have this book and movie. I found myself thinking, "That's pretty cool. Why did they do that?"

Really? Is this necessary? How can somebody make such a film? Disgusting!!! Seteven Seagal with funny hair and fat like an elephant. Stunts all the time, cars persecutions with an annoying soundtrack. Not to mention the Ending. Completely nonsense with the presence of the little girl.Steven Seagal wants to be Robin Hood!!! Well, at the beginning a fortune teller answers something, nobody has asked. Seagal's wife has nightmares and she can see the future. They must be kidding. Steven Segal passes out after a car persecution, and I know he can't act.

eXistenZ was a good film , at the first I was wondering what is going on , organic `` pods of a , and then the next thing you know after that I realized I was just one of the millions , that it was me ! I just saw it , and I was so blown away by it I can't believe it. I can't even express how much I loved it. It made me feel like a million dollars. It's one of those movies that I will never go out and watch just for the sake of it, I would watch it again and again .

This movie is absolutely horrible ! I thought because it had good actors in it like Gabrielle Union , Hill Harper, and others. I wanted it to be better, but what I saw was not as good as the original. My only wish for this was that it would have had a better story and that the movie have some good action scenes to keep me entertained . The only good thing for this film was that there are some good jokes . There are so many reasons why this movie is one of my favs. The way it is structured and everything is done is so good.

The story is about a psychic woman, Tory, who returns to her hometown and begins reliving her traumatic childhood past (the death of her childhood friend and abusive father). Tory discovers that her friend was just the first in a string of murders that are still occurring. Can her psychic powers help solve the crimes and stop the continuing murders? You really don't need to find out because, Oh My God! This was so so so so bad! I know all the Nora Roberts fans will flock to this movie and give it tons of 10's.

Perhaps I was just in a really good mood when I watched this film . but , for whatever reason, I have never been in a better mood! I went to see this movie today with my parents. I saw it again yesterday. And again on Friday. I am so glad I saw this film in the theatre. I would never want to be in a movie theater. I feel that I am being sucked away into another world where I can't tell what's happening because I don't have my normal sensory input. This movie gave me that sensory input.

Brilliant actors and brilliant picture!! I love the chopper scene with the music in the beginning, it is just SO touching and at the same time real but at the same time surrealistic! The Vietnam War was far from human and I believe this movie kind of shows have terrible human beings can act under certain circumstances. Modern war movies are spending so much money on effects. This is just a straight forward smart movie that takes you beyond your imagination. A movie that really pictures evil and hate mixed in fearness and fate.

This formulaic film ( hero 's girlfriend marries the villain ) just did n't move along fast enough given some critical reviews! Not sure if it is the plot, the script or simply it just didn't hit the target but the film did not do the best job of capturing what the story was all about. The only part where it moved in a positive direction were the two main scenes. The first was when the two meet up for the first time after the hero has a bad day with a new love interest. For the other, there was just nothing about it that was memorable for me.

Don`t be fooled into thinking that this is a remake as in this years remake of THE TIME MACHINE is based on an earlier film . It`s not because this is a pointless re- film . That is the director has used the original camera script shot for shot similar to the " remake " of THE GET AWAY from a few years ago . The scenes are identical to the original , the dialogue is identical to the original , the camera angles are identical , no attempt whatsoever is made to embellish or restructure the original script ,( But with a director like Van Sant at the helm we should be thankful .

It was only a matter of time that a spoof would be made of sports movies ! And there are plenty of those ! But not one of these. Just to be clear, I was never a fan of sports movies. But I have watched Sports movies, especially the ones made by "sports directors" and I still prefer them over the ones from Hollywood, which are so often made by actors or writers that I can't stand them for any reason. They are usually overrated. If you are one of those fans, I am sorry for you.

I caught this during a brief run in a Philadelphia theater . Despite its local provenance ( and its relation to this blog), this play is very much on my mind right now. I was reminded of it while watching an interview last week on a national TV news program, which featured a young woman who had gone to the theater in her teens, and was very much a theater geek. She was interviewed for an hour or so by a news reporter ( I forget which, but there was at least 2) who was describing the play.

As we are well aware, movies are not set out to be a direct incorporation of history, but it is a disgrace when a movie is made which has absolutely little to no correlation. I wish the director and/or the screen writer had done his/her research in this topic. All this movie does is create a forum for hate between people, while causing a rift that should not be there. This movie portrayed the Sikhs and Muslims in a very negative manor, while making the third group (Hindus) look as if they were non existent in the brutal killings of the people of both nations.

This movie seems as if someone had a cute idea for a movie , thought of two or three funny lines , then decided they had to get in trouble for having this idea, and tried to hide it to get it off the ground. There are a lot of these movies. There's the film that got banned in the 70's that is still being played in schools now because of what went down during its release, a lot of those movies were made to be funny, there's the movie that was a very bad movie that made it a cult classic, and so on.

I remember being so excited on Saturday nights when I was a kid , waiting for Dr. Who . I loved it, I loved all the old shows like The Misfits, The Rocky Horror Show , Doctor Who and I was obsessed with it . I had no idea where all the action would lead me and I felt like I would go crazy watching Doctor Who , but in reality . I really wasn't any good at it . All the time I spent watching was wasted and that was one of the things that made me want to learn the show.

* * * * * * Spoilers within * * * * * * * What a dull , predictable, and predictable season! Let us take a few moments to review the last few weeks as a whole. In the first five or ten episodes, everything seemed to be up to speed and then, as we’ve been told repeatedly throughout the series, there was a problem. Now, I am a person of faith, so I tend to think of God in very general terms. But there are many things about the God of the Bible that I have learned in my time in the Bible.

Barbershop 2: Back in Business wasn't as good as it's original but was just as funny. The movie itself lacked little things which the original held which made it much more enjoyable. Back in Business seemed to be just another worthless sequel made to bring in money with a very thin plot. Cedric the Entertainer's terrible excuses for flashbacks ruined the movie and seemed to be a bad way to try and get the audience to adapt more with the character. Overall Barbershop 2: Back in Business was a sequel not needed, without the originals charm, soul & spark.

"The Apartment Complex" is a campy comedy full of kookie characters created in lieu of a real story which tells a young psych student (Lowe) who takes a job managing an apartment complex and becomes embroiled in a murder mystery...um, if you can call it that. This low cal watch contains no suspense, no thrills, no drama, no action, precious few funny moments, a dash of nudity, and almost no romance. "The Apartment Complex" is passable, forgettable junk food for only the most needy couch potatoes.

When I first saw the trailer for this film , I really wanted to see it . I thought some of it was pretty cool , some of it was not that much fun to sit through . The trailer made me want to see it as much as I saw the film . The first time I heard of the film I was excited because of that trailer . When I saw it at the IFC Center I was so excited . There I was seeing the trailers of the film I was so excited . When the movie first came out I was able to see that I really liked it .

Watched this film at a local festival, the Silver Sprocket International Film Festival Florida . What a lovely film. A simple, uncomplicated morality tale about a young care free young man having to take responsibility for his actions. It neither pretentious or flashy my two teenage daughters loved it and for a change I wasn't embarrassed by any of the film content or language. A real family film and the best British comedy film I've seen since Billy Elliot.The film went on to win not surprisingly the top festival awards of Best Film and Best Director. Ten out of ten.

Went to the Preview Engagement of `` Grand Champion '' today ( Dallas/Fort Worth , Austin , Snyder and a few other venues) and thought it was very well done. There were only two really bad things in my opinion: First, there was no sound. Not even for the pre-recorded audio, just the audio for the prelude. There was a big gap between the audio and the prelude. Secondly, there were no background music at all on the prelude but not at all in the track. There was a lot of blaring noise at the beginning, but not so much later.

Who really wants to see that? Disgusting violence, disgusting sex, for such a long time. I do not want to, but I always stayed true to my philosophy to watch any movie as bad as it may be. This was the hardest (right after "Next Friday").It's basically just crap. How can you possibly call it anything else? The story of a Roman emperor as an excuse for gore and T&A. Yeah, yeah, "Hey, it's realistic, they have been like this." Fine, but why bother us with it?

I was so excited to finally watch "Pulse" after receiving it from Amazon, and I have to say I was utterly disappointed. I perhaps think I was too hyped up. I had expectations set by its fans that simply couldn't be met. After loving other Asian horrors, I thought I knew this would find a place in my heart.The story was slow, painfully so. I am a diverse fan of horror. I love the brutal, bloody craziness of "The Devil's Rejects" and I love equally the steady, growing macabre of "A Tale of Two Sisters".

Far from combining the best bits of Pontypool and 28 days this managed to ignore them. Whilst shamelessly copying them. (if that makes sense?) Pontypool was different and got progressively tenser, this just stinks. The Radio DJ, "we must stay on air" spends effectively no time on air. He sits on his bottom and watches the TV for news. This is by far the worst excuse for a zombie movie ever. Is there a single person in the USA or indeed the world who doesn't know what a zombie is? Or ever heard of the word "zombie"?

A truly accurate and unglamourous look into modern day life . It could be set in any town in the UK or a small town in France. This is a perfect gift for the young and old. I hope you enjoy it. Thursday, 19 February 2015

I think I’ve given up on it. But then this morning when I went down to the loo, I had the feeling I’m just going to have to get over it. It was such an easy task. A simple task that could just be done on my phone or laptop.

At least if you're a Disney fanatic (well, of the variety who loves their live-action films as well as the animated stuff), if you're a kid, if you're a kid at heart almost to the extent that you hardly realize you're an adult, if you love absolutely any film that features animals, especially when they're doing tricks, or if you're just not too demanding, Air Bud: World Pup is somewhat enjoyable to watch. I'm a Disney fanatic. I enjoyed this film enough, and I'll gladly watch it again.But boy does it have a lot of problems.

THE NEXT KARATE KID , in my opinion , is an excellent martial arts flick . I thought that Eric Carton was a great choice for the lead role in the movie because he is a real martial artist . Carton also does Martial arts for quite some time , which is another reason to pick this guy for the role . While watching the movie , Carton is the best thing in the movie , his fight scenes are good . This man is a martial artist , so he knows what he is doing when it comes to fighting . He knows how to fight , just as well .

A thinly veiled attempt to push Hulkamania to the film going non-wrestling fan. What could be worse than Hogan in the movies? Bad actors in the wrestling ring, and this film produced both, as Tiny Lester made his way to the WWE that summer in the mother of all promotional blunders. See the dictionary under Oops. As a card carrying member of the stupid kids of the world paid to see this in theaters and when I came out I immediately checked into H.A. - Hulkamaniacs Annoynimous. I am proud to say I have been off the Hulk for 17 years now and have never had a craving since.

Rowan Atkinson 's Mr. Bean ranks right up there with Laurel & Hardy , Buster Keaton , the Marx Brothers , Charlie Chaplin , and a great many of the classic movies of the silent era. Mr. Bean tells the tale of an ordinary boy who, with the help of his mother and his faithful dog, wins the heart of the most eligible lady of the town. He is so popular with everyone that he runs into trouble with his teacher, a man of ill repute, and he must take refuge in the forest until he is rescued by some unlikely allies.

"The Moon Is Blue" director Otto Preminger tackled even more taboo subject matter in his controversial 1955 release "The Man with the Golden Arm." Whereas he had incensed the Motion Picture Association of America with his use of the words "virgin" and "mistress" in his mild 1953 comedy "The Moon Is Blue," Preminger went far beyond what any movie had attempted with "The Man with the Golden Arm" since Dick Powell made his law and order epic "To the Ends of the Earth"(1946) about thwarting the international traffic in narcotics.

The mission to see the movie `` The Cave '' was a dream of a friend of mine after witnessing a friend of the author's play. It was the first time this friend saw a movie about a cave. The story was very different than we imagined. It is also the last time I can recall watching a movie about a cave." The film, " The Cave," which premiered on Feb. 18, is now available at http://www.hollywooddistribution.com/film.asp?file=the_cave.html and can also be found on DVD at http://distributors.hollywood.com/cave_movie/film.asp. Hollywood Distribution is a worldwide leader in film and television distribution.

This is an excellent documentary about a story I had n't heard about before . The first solo , non-stop, non-stop, world record run of an ultra long distance footrace . I have only ever run a half marathon so far . This documentary was a wonderful insight into how an ultra long distance runner can go to such an extreme amount of miles . I can't wait for more documentaries to come out which show how it is possible to do this . And I know I'm only in my mid 30's but I don't think I ever thought I would be able to do this .

I couldn't stop watching this movie, though it was far past my bedtime. Comparisons to Hitchcock are deserved -- this thing really plays with you. It walks a wonderful line between real, immediate suspense and a dark, distancing humor. Like many of Hitch's heroes, our doe-eyed mute witness has innocently stumbled into something truly horrific -- and we are taken on quite a ride with her, at turns identifying totally and feeling her fear, at turns watching in thrilling suspense as she is placed further in jeopardy.The filmmakers have put in a lot of tender care in working this out.

The final entry in the On The Buses trilogy sees the usual wasters go about their business in Wales . . . but this time, it’s not with a smile on his face (or in it). Last week’s review of Welsh Buses, a book by Martin Evans, was both sad and hopeful. It seemed to confirm that there is no such thing as ‘good news’ in Welsh politics . . . only bad news . . . but that did little to quieten the critics. So it was good news to see that there was still hope in On The Buses.

I had never heard of this film and only got it because I am a Martin Sheen fan . Now I have to see this movie. There was a time or two that Martin Sheen was considered the greatest actor of all time and he has had a long career in movies but not many people know that he is a wonderful man. He is a very humble and decent guy who doesn't like to brag and thinks he is always right. I have seen this movie for the first time and I must tell you it was very well done and the acting was very good .

( Contains spoilers ) People who put a Lonely Heart 's ad in the newspaper are often idealists . They are idealists . Their ad may be idealistic . Their ad may not be idealistic . Their idealisticness may get them into trouble . What if someone did an ad for ' The Lonely Hearts Club of Chicago' and they didn't want their idealisticness to get them into trouble? What if someone wrote an ad for ' The Lonely Hearts Club of Chicago' and didn't want to be identified as the ' The Lonely Hearts Club of Chicago ' ? Who knows, who cares!

A less than redemptive hunka junk that is mercifully free from the ravages of competence. Some Northern idiots come to the deep South looking for some confederate rifles stashed on the legendary Whiskey Mountain. They are menaced by scary hillbillies, in a wide nod to 'Deliverance'; but it turns out that the hicks are fronting for a Northern marijuana-trafficking badass. This is brought to light so early that it doesn't even qualify as a twist. The women are locked up and raped into catatonia; rather than rescuing them, the guys run down to town to get the sheriff, who is lazy and doesn't believe them.

When Hollywood is trying to grasp what an `` intelligent person '' is like , they fail so miserably , but I'll show you exactly what I think . First , let me begin with an analogy , and a question : what do you call the person with a very low IQ ? Think you are that person? Think again . First of all , think you are a high IQ person? Then why did you choose the word high IQ ? Well , if we are all of the same IQ , why is it that only the high IQ people can be the smartest people in the world ?

This film brought a whole new meaning to that well-worn phrase 'like watching paint dry' because this was 'like watching paint dry in the middle of a monsoon'.I was attracted to the film by its location on the west coast of Portugal which I have visited. It is a ruggedly beautiful place and the black-and-white introduced a whole new dimension to the beauty. That was the only good thing. The story was appallingly banal and frankly you have to have some story.A film crew runs out of film and the entire crew then have to wait. Well, a wait is a wait.

This is another of those films I can remember from when I was a kid and I recently managed to acquire it off ebay - 20 years on, it's nowhere near as good as I remember it being.The story is 'vaguely' kick started, by a 'cosmic event' (there's another extra film-crew member in the credits for 'weak story development') which makes collective ants become super intelligent. Ant species who used to war with each other have ceased rivalries and are now working together. The thing I wanted to know throughout was, TO DO WHAT EXACTLY?

This is the best work i have ever seen on television . The story is compelling -- all the more so because it's based on actual events . I can't find the words to adequately express my feelings, so please go watch this show and then you'll understand my reaction . It's worth every dollar, every second . It's so good that you'll probably never see it again . And now, I'm not going to say too much about the plot, since I really can't go into it . I love the characters so much, the writing and acting so much .

The thing which makes "Fire" even more appealing to watch apart from its magical artistry, is its touch of femininism and rebellion. To my mind, the very character played by Shabana Azmi is a symbol of the Indian feminine protest against the Indian society. The name of the movie and the scene when Radha walks through flames in her kitchen are symbloic of Hindu Mythology's Lord Rama's wife Sita's walking through fire for the proof of her immaculacy, as per the same narrative which appears in the film too.

A horrendous film, ill-conceived and crude. The acting of Anne Heche and Vince Vaughan is so inferior to that of Perkins and Leigh in the original version they have to be seen to be believed. There was no reason to make this picture, which only highlights how accomplished and brilliant Hitchcock was, and how inimitable. Also, there's a creeping, pervasive insensitivity in the film that isn't there in the first film. Hitchcock's Psycho was scary and shocking, but one could genuinely feel for all concerned, even the pitiful Norman Bates.

Ostensibly , Hans ' isolation and despair are caused by a stereotypically frigid bourgeois mother , a nagging wife , and a mother-in-law ' who can never accept his homosexuality . But this isn't really what Hans does , not after all . After all , he doesn't have to hide his secret , he's no longer ashamed of the things he has done and can do . Even so , Hans goes on to be an active and loving member of a gay society in Germany . There is a lot that Hans goes through in the beginning .

The Love Letter (1999): Starring Kate Capshaw, Tom Everett Scott, Tom Selleck, Ellen De Generes, Gloria Stuart, Blythe Danner, Jessica Capshaw, Alice Drummond, Bill Buell, Erik Jensen, Margaret Ann Brady, Walter Covell, Patrick Donnelly, Lucas Hall, Christian Harmony, Christopher Nee, Breanne Smith, Marilyn Rockafellow, Sasha Spielberg, Jack Black.....Director Peter Chan, Screenplay Maria Maggenti.Based on the novel "The Love Letter" by Cathleen Schine, Director Peter Chan's film version, released in 1999, was not a big box-office draw, not even for a romantic movie with some comedy elements.

'Identity . . . . I am part of my surroundings and I became separate from them and it's being able to make those differentiations clearly that lets us have an identity and what's inside our identity is everything that's ever happened to us' (Ntozake Shange qtd in "Fires in the Mirror").Pieces like Decalogue V used to intimidate me. I felt that if I accepted them, than I would be compromising something. What I thought before really isn't worth getting into. I understand what Naturalism is trying to say.

This movie was boring. Very much like Underworld, only even less interesting. It's not much of a werewolf movie and no where near a horror film. The lead couple were boring. I totally didn't care about Vivian and Aiden. And there was so little character development that I didn't care about any character in the film. The plot was paper thin. The transformations were basically nil. I did like the wolves themselves, might as well have have done a wolf documentary, I would have liked that better. I wouldn't recommend this movie.

This show is terrible. I cannot get over the complete waste of great talent this show contains. This is not entertaining improvisational acting, it's just a cheap attempt to throw someone famous comedic actors onto a stage and have them perform a poorly improved scene. I have actually done improv work as an actor, and this show is not improv.What the audience is actually laughing at (if they're actually laughing at this show at all, it looks quite fake) is the embarrassment of the guest star being lost like a deer in headlights.

Brit director Chrstopher Nolan now has a career in America , and a reputation for making movies both popular and critically acclaimed. But he has recently been involved in an unfortunate controversy involving a number of his films. Now, after much speculation, we’re here to explain what happened. If you don’t believe us, just watch the video below:

“You could argue that it was a little bit too soon for Nolan to get involved, but a lot has happened since this incident,” explains Nolan, who is now working on two other projects.

I know that Guts of a Beauty and Guts of a Virgin are crap films and are hated by many, which is why I will be doing my best not to watch them. However, I feel that by giving them a pass I'm giving you the opportunity to give them a try and see if they work for you - you don't have to hate them - I love them! In fact, this post is an attempt to make it a little bit easier to do that. If you can, read on for the best of the best about Guts of a Beauty.

The incomparable Laura Gemser appeared briefly in an erotic scene from the French `` Emmanuelle 2 . '' This amazing nude model was on screen for one hour and 30 seconds, but it is said that she was the only woman to be in this film. The following article is an interesting account of sex, prostitution and other sex-related subjects in Germany during the late 19th or early 20th century. (A story of sex and murder in the German countryside.) SOURCES





This is by no means the only reference I have found in German literature on prostitution during the early part of the 20th century.

Never , ever , have I been as impressed by a film as this little piece about four groups of people living in an apartment for a year and a half in Tokyo. If you've ever been there, you'd know the city has a population of over 100 million people. There are about 4,000 places to eat in the five-star Michelin restaurant in Shibuya that they rent to the residents of this apartment for a year . When you look out the window and you see a bunch of kids playing basketball outside of a small school, you'd probably think the school was full of people playing basketball, too.

A man in blackface lands in a spaceship and meets a girl who lives in some sort of shack with a monkey. He hooks her up with a telephone, and she teaches him how to Charleston. Then they fly off in the spaceship, leaving the monkey behind. Cringe-inducing blackface aside, this short film makes no sense. I think that's the plot, but I'm not sure by a long shot. You can't tell that this is Renoir at work, despite his characteristic humanism. Good use of slow-motion, though.

Whenever Ida Lupino appeared or directed a film in the 30's,40 's and 50 's , you were guaranteed great things, but you certainly didn’t think she was a big name or had any great accomplishments. You might think that as a Hollywood legend she would have had more than enough clout, or perhaps she'd have had more success than the likes of Gloria Swanson or Bette Davis. But that wasn't the case. She wasn’t well-known in Hollywood then. Many people were unaware of her work, or, to be more accurate, thought of her work in the late 30's.

WARNING:I advise anyone who has not seen the film yet to not read this comment.When I first started to watch this movie my expectations were it was a vampire movie, that is going to be awesome considering how Rodriguez and Tarantino both helped make the film. I began about 15 minutes into it and already my hopes for this movie were down the drain, which shocked me. First, the story it was going with was not at all appealing in anyway possible, and just flat out boring and uncompelling to the point where I just wanted to turn it off.

I remember when they made a big deal about this when it was coming out. They showed clips every week on WWF TV and everyone was excited. It debuted opening weekend at number two behind Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade. Then it did a nosedive. Critics HATED this film. I don't remember seeing one good review. Everyone agreed it was bad and sometimes grotesque. I didn't know they meant back then but now I do since the movie makes references to gay bars, women getting slapped hard and nearly raped and a disgusting looking bar restroom with overflowing urinals lol.

I am not understanding why people are praising this movie . I did n't like it at all . I find it boring and not worth watching . If you did like this movie you must have watched some other movies in this genre that are much better than this one . I think this movie is a good action movie but I can't tell why it's getting so many good reviews . Maybe it's because people who like this genre know what they're talking about

This is a really good, fast paced action flick, with an excellent action choreography and great fight sequences.

I have seen both the MST3K version and the uncut version . I rather enjoyed it . Either way , I think it’s time for a sequel. I have a few ideas for sequel. I’m a fan of both the MST2 and MST3 versions of this show and I really enjoy the way the series has turned out. I’ll never understand why people complain about this show, the original series has been available on VHS and DVDs for over 30 years now and has become one of the best series ever.

I 've never understood this type of spoof movies . You get some serious/semi-serious movie that everyone knows about and loves , and then try to milk it until the last drop of water. You see a movie with a really cool cast , you see some really cool stuff, and you find yourself at the end of the film saying, "Hey man, what the f#@%# are we even talking about?" It's just as bad as it gets when you think you have it down, and then you find out you haven't.

Not the best of the WIP's, but not the worst either. I honestly feel guilty laughing at this film considering it had to be career lows for all involved. Yet the acting, dialogue, preposterous scenarios, and the ever present boom mic get to me everytime and certainly add to its bad movie charm. As much of a Linda Blair fan I am, top (or topless) honors go to Sybil Danning. Also, special kudos to Henry Silva, who's the only one in the cast who doesn't play his role too seriously.

At least for me . I have been following the career of Mr. Almdovar since the beginning and I was really impressed with his performance and dedication to the task of being the very best. It is true that he is not in the best condition but still he showed his true level and that is really impressive. It is really sad to see a person who really deserves the recognition of this world but still he should be respected for what he is able to do and how hard he tries for his work. I have never seen anything like this in my life .

`` Carlito 's Angels '' is a spoof of `` Charlie 's Angels '' that is not afraid to spoof itself in a new episode of the hit show on The CW. And that's not to mention The CW has yet to air this particular episode of Charlie's Angels in the U.S. It is set in the fictional Los Angeles, but the actors are actually in Miami, not Los Angeles, so this is a real-life story. The show is not rated but it is funny enough to get a laugh from almost anyone.

I must say I thought the show Greek would be really ridiculous and stupid. Since I am part of a sorority I didn't want them to make Greek organizations look bad....but I think Greek is hilarious. Yes, they do have the stereotypical sorority and fraternity but it's not mocking but just cute humor.All the characters are pretty likable minus Rebecca Logan (I just can't stand her), Casey and Rusty have good chemistry as brother and sister. Then there is Cappie. Who doesn't love a guy like Cappie haha His character brings so much to the show.

Thankfully you do n't need a lot of `` book learnin '' to understand where this thing 's going ... You know, there's a good analogy for you, too. We all need to understand that thing we just learned, in order to do our job. I see this a lot around here. I've noticed that people come here, and say things like, "...I'm going to have to go to this class to learn how to use x." And I've said, "Oh, that makes a lot of sense.

Years ago , I used to watch bad movies deliberately . Somehow I missed this one . No gesture rings a bell when watching the movie , though. I don't remember why , but I did miss this movie. I wonder why , a couple years back I thought I could watch a movie ,

But I could never find a movie like it, which made me realize that it was one of the better movies ever made . No , not because of the actors , of course , not even that . I would have never watched a movie like that.

OH MY God I am lost Now I know everything this guy does is Pointless R J A wrote at 1:30pm on November 28, 2018: I’ve got a very good reason not to be here. If he is so damn smart he must be able to read my mind. Because what he has to say does not make sense to me. Also I’m not a very bright person. This is one awful movie!! Some people told me that it was not that bad actually but I sure disagree! The monster is amazingly cheap (and funny) looking but this is something we all knew I guess. In addition to that, the dialogs are awful and the writing is just plain terrible.As bad as it is, this movie as the quality of being entertaining. Not always for the good reasons but it's a good "so bad that it's fun" flick.By the way, there's no such thing as "La Castagne".

This is definitely one of the ultimate cult classics, and is a must see for all psychotronic fans. Why? It has everything a great 70s exploitation film should have. Over-the-top dialog, bad acting, enthusiasm, sex, sleaze, political incorrectness, violence, and many other elements of a good cult classic are included. In other words, Dolemite is a must-see.As with a lot of these films, the plot makes little to no sense. What I picked up from it is that pimp-hustler Dolemite got framed up for having stolen furs and half a million dollars worth of narcotics.

This is probably Wayne 's poorest movie ; at least the poorest in which he had a starring role . This time he was the star . For once the director did a better job. But there were a lot of elements that were really bad . The special effects were just awful . The sound effects . The acting was so so bad . To begin with, there was very little dialogue in Wayne's movie. I don't think there was much in the movie either . Most of Wayne's scenes were actually in the movie . Wayne talked very little , but that's not necessarily a good thing .

This movie narrate the story of John Belushi , based of his biography ` Wired ' , wrote by Bob Balaban , who was an American movie screenwriter , he worked with George Lucas and wrote many Hollywood movies like ` Star Wars , ` Star Trek , etc . As John Belushi was the most famous comedian of the 20th century , he wrote his autobiography ` Wired ' in 1986 . This book narrate his journey from the stage and the movie , and his life story . I think this movie will be a nice movie for all fans .

I really enjoyed this movie . Yes there was disrespect throughout the movie , but Bruce Willis learned , from one point to the next , to not make it seem that way. I found the whole movie to be quite believable. The acting is all great. I loved how they played off of each other throughout the whole thing. Overall this was a great movie . I'm glad this movie didn't have to end the way the ending of the first X-MEN did. I didn't feel like I was seeing a movie, more like a documentary about mutant life.

Heftig og Begeistret (Intense and Enthusiastic) is a documentary-like story of a male choir up in Berlevåg in the very northern part of Norway, where the weather is cold and hostile, the days are dark during the winter and the towns are faced with young people moving to the more populated parts in the south of Norway, where the climate is warmer and there are more opportunities.The most beautiful part of this movie is the humans themselves. The people in the choir, who are aged from 30 to 95, all have unique, colorful lives and are very enjoyable beings.

The Bridge At Remagen contains some of the most preposterous war time screenplay I've ever seen. Aside from the acting, which is wooden, no tank commander attacks with his tanks parked in nice neat rows, up the middle of roads, and with troops bunched all together with their arms not at the ready. The constant suicidal behavior set off my "tilt switch" so often I found it impossible to enjoy the movie. Apparently the screen writers and director have never been through actual warfare and never bothered to bring in an expert who had.

Flesh Feast starts at Miami Airport , ace reporter Dan Carter ( Harry Kerwin , he is also credited as Harry Kerwin ) takes a ride in a black Ford Mustang with a bunch of strangers. As he travels around, he begins to sense things about the passengers of the car. The stranger of this car is a white woman , and he begins to tell her about his own life story and her own life story, and they talk about their families . As she tells him about her family , the man in the Mustang begins to look at her and his own life story, and begins to have doubts.

This movie was lacking in a lot of areas. It's about this Elvis type guy who races cars and is approached by these BIKERS from SATANS ANGELS. One of them is named Banjo and they beat up college kids for fun. THey want the Elvis guy to be their "driver". At times, I wanted the folks from MSTK3000 to be quiet because the movie was actually kind of good. Sure, there was violence and a lot of cheesy lines, such as "What kind of beer do you want? A COLD ONE". That was cheesy.

While this movie is not the most entertaining in the world, I think it is better than most over all. I mean it had it's little laughs and just all around a good feeling. It's not too often we get to see two old geezers just having fun with their age and honestly having a good time with the jokes. Walter and Jack had such a great chemistry together as friends/brother in-laws. Just watching them romancing these women was fun and you rooted for them all the way because wither we have to admit it or not, for their age, they still had game!

Komodo vs. Cobra is not going to set the world on fire . It 's not a hallmark of cinema, and there's no real reason to believe it will. That's what makes it so good. It's been said that the best way to make something better is to not make something better at all. It's said that the best films are the one's that don't try and do it, and the one's that make the audience cry and cheer. The best movies are the ones that don't do it at all, because it just makes no sense.

I just had to add my comment to raise the average on this one. Paul Giamatti lets it all hang out in this one and is a hoot. He would probably say it was easy, but he really does a great job and should have won something for it. We've had the DVD for several years and my kids (boy now 4 1/2 and girl 9) will watch this one over and over, and the humor is adult enough that I don't mind having to hear it in the background (and I do run to the TV for the really funny parts).

I just happened to stumble to this film and checked IMDb for more information : Score 6,7 , well ... it had a rating of 6.2 but the reviews said the same. I can see how that is but still the fact of the film being well made and having a great plot is quite amazing and something you should check out. I would like to say that it is my favourite movie out of this decade but I am not sure I would. I think I might like it even less if it wasn't based on a comic book and had been made with more originality.

I was surprised to discover Michael Moore or Bill Maher was n't involved with this `` movie '' . An even more surprising aspect is that they both appear on the list of celebrities to endorse the documentary. And both are listed in the credits as co-authors. In fact, they appear as co-authors on the same page of credits. What this means is that while they didn't directly contribute financially to the `` documentary '' or to this movie in any way, they are responsible for producing the film, which, in turn, is responsible to them for having a presence on the film-makers.

I thought this movie was perfect for little girls . It was about a magical place where Genevieve and all the kids could have fun and be free! The main character was a fairy that was able to change herself to look like anyone she wanted! This was such a classic fairy tale that I just loved it . I don't know if I can find it on YouTube but it was such a sweet fairy tale I wanted the kids to know about! This movie is so great and you will really love it if you take a look at it.

Naruse is typically considered one of the 3 master founders of Japanese film, the other two being Ozu and Mizoguchi. This is an interesting and honest film on the lives of retired Geishas. Whatever happens, when such a woman ages, and loses her charm and mystique? Well, for those who are interested, watch this film. One: Okin, is successful as a money-lender, but the other two have to borrow from her and are resentful. Okin doesn't have any children, but the other do. Okin finds out that her old love is coming to visit her, and is excited.

Seriously engaging, intelligent and thought provoking drama at its very best. Mean, gripping, moody and captivating. Every home should have a copy! Don't take my word for it see it yourself. One Life Stand makes you consider your own lifestyle and how you treat your family and friends. Beautiful photography and impressive acting makes for one of the best cinema-graphic experiences of the year. John Kielty's debut is a delight and adds a real touch of truth and realism to this deep and gritty film. This is a film that cares and has an honesty that is unequalled in recent years.

Assy McGee is an out-of-control, hard-nosed detective based on the countless examples from late 20th century police dramas. The twist here is that Assy is literally a walking buttocks.The cheap, low-brow facade of the show belies its cleverness and hidden satire. That is not to say that Assy is devoid of fart jokes, just that the toilet humor is used sparingly enough to elicit consistent laughs, not groans and eye-rolls. The title sequence of the program demonstrates the clever, subtle humor used throughout. The sequence consists of panning photos of the city set to a jazzy 70s cop theme.

It takes an eternity for this typically over-simplistic and idiotic Stephen King-based film to finally get out of the starting blocks. About half-an-hour is spent on needless introductions to various boring characters and their irrelevant little personal problems that might excite bored housewives and apathetic pensioners in soapy dramas, but this is supposed to be the horror genre (or so I naively thought). The mutt fails to look all that fearsome, which Leonard Maltin, the notoriously clueless/hopeless and always grinning film critic, would disagree with: he considers Cujo to be "genuinely frightening".

Thursday June 15 , 9:30pm The EgyptianSaturday June 17 , 11:00am The Egyptian '' He spent most of his life hiding his homosexuality from his wife and children, so he didn't have much of an idea of what he was really like. After three months of pretending not to be gay he finally had the opportunity to be with someone and it turned into a nightmare for his wife. In this clip he is talking about being with someone who is not straight - he is talking about his friend, but he is gay as well.

I rented this movie , after hearing Chris Gore saying something to the effect of `` five stars ! '' I thought that it was worth the money I had spent on the rental. The movie is a great mystery and it takes the viewer on an emotional journey. I didn't like all the way that it ended because of the ending, but overall, this one was worth the movie. I'm looking forward to the sequel and I can see myself buying the DVD again in the near future. Thank you. I saw this last year, was very impressed by it.

I thought this movie was cleverly written and very well acted . Its a movie that greatly surpasses other films from the 90's . The only reason why this film isnt on the list is because its so bad that it needs to be shown in the theater . It's really a shame that so much has been written and shown but its hard to keep all of them on the list . I hope this film will be brought back and I have every confidence that this movie will be a very big hit for the future . The only way this film would ever be given a chance is if it was remade .

There's hell to pay when you cross Nami Matsushima(Meiko Kaji), Female Scorpion, and a dangerous group of thugs(..including their sadistic head pimp and his equally repellent lady), operating a prostitution ring with an iron fist, does just that. Hell hath no fury like Scorpion, and a determined detective, Gondo(Mikio Narita), seeking revenge for decapitating his arm after handcuffing her, will do whatever it takes(..and that includes intimidating anyone who might know her whereabouts)to catch Nami.

*Minor spoilers* I just wanted to say that for anyone who likes entertaining baseball films, this is definitely in my top three. Only Little Big League and Major League can compete with this one in my mind. I would also like to commend the writers of this film for creating such enjoyable dialogue!! Without being too specific, I would say that the lines are very fitting for each character. Tom Selleck seemed to have no problem creating a realistic character as a ballplayer. His animosity towards playing overseas in Japan sets the tone for comical, yet meaningful interactions with his new team, the Dragons.

I really tried to like this film about a doctor who has the possibility of a new life with a young woman if he can comes to terms with the death of his wife. I suppose this was to play like a quirky light romantic comedy but the theme is a little uncomfortable for me.But putting that aside, I found the dialog was too much like a stage play despite being based on a novel and also,the mediocre acting was embarrassing to watch especially by the young lead Vincent Spano.I have been sort of trying to catch up on all the eighties movies I missed during that decade.

I first saw this movie at least thirty years ago, and it remains one of my all-time faves! It's a classic - the intriguing plot, great characters, suspense and shocking twist ending (all set against the backdrop of the gorgeous Monterey/Big Sur coast) never get old. Roy Thinnes portrays Johnny Brant, a captivating character that grows more mysterious as his true identity unfolds. The acting is great and believable; viewers get caught up in the web that develops between the workaholic husband, disenchanted wife and the alluring stranger (Thinnes as Brant).

I did n't expect much from this movie , it was just one of those movies I thought I 'd never see. But then again it was not because I wasn't expecting too good. I guess that is what it is about , it has it all . I did get a good laugh at one point but it wasn't as funny in the end as I 'd hoped to see it . I'm not sure how I feel about this one. It could have easily been a mediocre movie. I liked it but I wouldn't pay too much for a movie like that.

I cant put it any simpler than that , this is a terrible film . I 've worked in the music industry before , and its always the same thing , music gets put in a band , a band is formed , music gets released , then they try to sell it and try to sell the idea that this is a great album , but they just don't have the vision of a band , or the passion of a band , so the band doesn 't continue. this is not the case with this band. This is a bad album.

I heard that after the first Oceans movie , the sequels begin to go downhill . I believe that this has happened before . The first time was in the early 1990s , and the second time was a decade ago . What happened after that ? I would think that they tried to do something different . I do not think the second film is the worst , but it is the worst they could do . Maybe it is just me . They should do another sequel ? What do you think ? A few people have asked me if I'm going to see a third one.

This movie had an excellent premise , and could have been a fascinating look at racism , attitudes to women and how people react to each other in the face of violence , I mean how often does racism and sexism work in real life ? It was a great story , and I did like how the film ended , it was a really good ending. I don't think I will watch this again unless I'm at a film festival or something so it didn't bother me too much and I was really happy to have seen it , but I would have like to have seen more of the movie .

What a crappy movie! The main character in this movie was supposed to be born and brought up in Canada, yet he had a thicker Indian accent than his parents! Is it just me or does Uday look gay in this movie? Also, do all the chicks in Canada dress like sluts? At least that's how it is in this movie. All the females are dressed like strippers. Don't waste your time with this one! The only good thing about this movie is the setting in beautiful Vancouver. Wonder why Bollywood is going through a slump?

Why is n't this movie on the bottom 100 ? Raptor is , without a doubt , the worst movie of the decade. There are many reasons to why but the most important one I can think of is that this movie is bad for business. The people who have been making a profit out of it over the years were very unhappy. This movie was not a commercial success, and the people making a profit out of it have been unhappy for decades. It is time to give this film a second chance.

this is the worst film i have ever seen and what disappoints me the most is that this is yash raj film so at first when you see the promos you think yes thats definitely another yash raj hit But when you see the film your eyes will water with disappoint the storyline is stupid and dumb we've seen it many times boy is soon to marry and falls in love with a girl blah blah blah. if you do see this pathetic film don't go with you family there is too much exposure and kiss scene. i don even see why you would go to see it on your own.

The Love Letter is one of my all-time favorite books, so naturally I was skeptical when I heard it was to become a movie. But, I liked it. I found myself grinning through the entire movie. I admit that it isn't a great movie but definitely a pleasant hour and a half. I thought that Capshaw and Scott were perfect as Helen and Johnny. Just as I pictured them.
