I tried to give this show a chance , but it really does n't sit well with me . Although I do understand why they did it , I just really wish they could change the subject . What's really unfortunate is that I think this show has become a big joke for fans and I feel so sorry for those who are still looking forward for it to continue . I can't say I am a big fan , I just really hope they don't take this series down . I guess it's better to let it grow and grow stronger .

Loosely based on actual events , `` River 's Edge '' is a film , much in the style of the 1970s horror films of George Romero or James Cameron , that follows a group of characters as they travel around a post-apocalyptic landscape, trying to survive the coming attack. The film starts off with a group of mercenaries (who have been hired by two other gangs to attack and kill the three survivors of a previous gang attack) fighting a group of men on horses. We see the group fight with swords, spears, and various other implements.

I can not believe I let myself rent that piece of garbage ! The acting was so poor , my friend was not even there to watch it and i was like, what are you doing ! I don't know what was wrong with them, but it's all in the past, and what else can I do ? Well, it was a bit late now, I had just returned from France, and my friend had told me I could come and watch an American film. I came and went. I have seen so many American films in the past but this one was a piece of crap.

This is on my TV right now ... but only long enough for me to finish panning it in this picture. It’s not going to be the final one, but it will give me a great opportunity to talk about some things I think we should all be doing. We all know it’s important to eat healthy, but what else do you do when you can’t cook your own food? Here’s what I’d love to do with my time at the end of the month, and the first thing I would do is make a list.

This homemade horror movie tells the story of a dude who kills people using the motif of stories by Edgar Allan Poe:

“I’ve seen the future…and I know a lot of people are about to die in a big way today.”

In the 1960s, this horror film became a big hit in horror movies and became an inspiration for the likes of J.G. Farrell and Jules Engel. After it was originally released in 1964, the plot of The Thing was changed from a “monster story” to a “fictionalized tale” in the film’s original trailer.

The pace of this movie is quite slow . It takes about 70 minutes to get Katie to China ( the movie starts in China and goes to France ). The movie is directed by Chris Weitz, a director whose name is known for making movies that are really well made but slow moving at the same time. But there is no need for any slowdown because this movie is really worth watching, because this is a really well made movie that will leave you wondering about everything going on and will make you wonder what happened before the big explosion at the end.

For connoisseurs of bad movies, Galaxina is a true gem. With truly horrid dialog, acting, and directing, it's no choice for people seeking a proper movie. But as one of the most unintentionally hilarious movies of its genre, it's priceless for a good laugh. In particular, the scenes involving the Harley Davidson-worshiping motorcycle cult are especially good, and many other scenes present an opportunity for a cheap laugh.Sadly, the scenes with Dorothy Stratten really fail to deliver, but since she's playing an android, I suppose one can excuse her for wooden acting.Bad movie-lovers, don't pass this one up!

What a waste of energy and money. What a waste of what talent there was.Emilio Estevez was completely wasted and mostly unused throughout. Jon Lovitz was very mildly amusing but pointless. Harry Dean Stanton - why bother? And was it just me or can Kari Wuhrer barely act in this one.The story was pretty non-existent and really disjointed. One of my biggest problems was the reaction of the characters to the events that transpired. Like the surf "dudes" giving up their lives every time they were threatened in the last half? How about that you NEVER saw them surf once!!

` Rock star ' is not on its way to any ` stairway to heaven ' category as one of the most important rock stars alive has decided to quit music to care for her ailing grandmother. And while it would be nice to see Justin Timberlake take the reins again, it's not likely to happen just yet. For his part, Timberlake recently admitted that he is not as happy as he used to be as a music star. "I used to be really great, and then I used to be super great," the "Pitch Perfect 2" creator said on his Facebook page.

I supposed 'Scarecrow Gone Wild ' is a dull slasher flick . Yes , it have some good point , but is not that bad . If you are looking for an entertaining horror movie for the Halloween eve , then you have reached the right choice . Scarecrow gone Wild ' is another movie which is part of the Halloween night movie line . If you love horror , thrillers and fun , you must watch this movie . You are not alone this movie is not that bad in my opinion , you can also enjoy this film with your family and friends .

At Beaverview Cheerleading Camp, the goody-goody two shows Lucky Ducks cheerleading team must get in cahoots with the 'tough' bad girl cheerleading team of The Demons to beat the dastardly Falcon team who always seems to win at this camp I guess. This being a typical clichéd '80's teen (lame) sex comedy who do you think will win? But what the film lacks in originality it more than makes up for it sheer bloody awfulness. Oh and insanely bad dance numbers and the obligatory Japenese businessmen who want to buy the camp (on the condition that male cheerleader, Tommy Hamilton, stays with the camp of course).

I doubt whoever wrote this screenplay has ever actually read Mansfield Park ... or if they have it was not written by an American but by an Anglophone, which suggests it was written by someone who had never before been abroad. It is also a very good movie - the first time I've had the good fortune to have seen it twice in a cinema. If it isn't, it's worth watching once. If it is, then it's a must see for anyone who likes a good story told well.

One would think that with all the lavish care and expense that went into this made-for-TV movie , it would be an easy job to put together a sequel. Well, it turns out that it isn't that easy. As you may know, this particular story is well over a decade in the making, with various versions and rewrites from a variety of people, all to no avail. The movie was not picked up by a TV network and re-worked by the cast. So now it's time to see if they are still around and what they can do to continue this story.

This is an unusual film because although it was made by Twentieth-Century Fox because it's one of the few pairings of Barbara Stanwyck and her future husband, Robert Taylor. Barbara Stanwyck had been making films for many different studios (RKO, Paramount and Selznick) at about the time she made THIS IS MY AFFAIR, but Taylor was an MGM contract player so he only appeared in this film because he was loaned to Fox--something studios occasionally did during this era.The film is interesting because many real-life people have roles in the film, though the piece is otherwise pure fiction.

` The Last Frontier ' is a superior western that overcomes numerous deficiencies in weaving its tale of trappers Jedediah Swan, a man of honor and a pioneer in the fields of medicine, and his wife Sara. This is the first time a book of the type has been published and we hope you enjoy its unique quality of writing. The Last Frontier also includes illustrations and maps. Description :The Last Frontier will be the first book of the trilogy to be published. It has been written as a series of letters and journals that Jedediah Swan wrote to Sara when he was dying of tuberculosis.

A buddy and I went to see this movie when it came out in 1980 . It was playing in a theater at the theater at that time, and they were running it. We thought it was a really good movie. And then it became a big-time cult movie. So I remember thinking, I wonder how many times it will be shown this way? But that's the thing. It doesn't really matter that many times. The movie will still be there. We've seen it before and it will always be shown that way.

The reviewer in Variety said this was `` overwritten and overlong '' , and I kind of agree with it. But I still like it, because it's a great song. It was one of the greatest songs I've heard all year, period, but the song itself isn't so much the song. It's kind of a slow burner that sets up the rest of the album, and it's not really even a song. I've had a few bad reviews for this CD so far, so I'd really like to know how you feel.

Lame . Lame . Lame . Ultralame . Shall I go on ? There is one , I repeat * one ! I am sure that some , if not most , of you have noticed the lack of interest which is displayed by many of the members of your group in writing a review. Well , here is a review for you all ! So here goes : a review . It has been said and I repeat again and again and again that the best thing to do as a reader is to read the whole book. This does not always mean the most interesting part.

I agree with all the comments posted so far : This movie was a waste of time and energy , it really should have been a comedy . There are too many things going for the audience in this film, even though they didn't make it worth watching, we did. You would expect a movie to have many laughs to make you laugh, and for you to feel happy and relieved after watching. This is what happens here, you see the funny things, but not really the funny things, it just feels stupid.

I saw this late at night on a minor channel and I put it on expecting a laugh or two. Martin Lawrence is a good comic actor and I reckoned he might be a good stand-up comedian/actor in the style of Richard Pryor.I couldn't have been more wrong. This concert was awful. It was full of racist comments directed at white people, Muslims and people from India (Muslims and Indians are the same thing in Lawrence's narrow mind) and rambling, clichéd cod-philosophy (Lawrence, like many black comics and directors, can't resist the urge to preach when given a platform.

"Christmas in Connecticut" is an absolute gem, and a must-see for Christmas! Elizabeth Lane, a precursor to Martha Stewart, is a magazine columnist and the ne plus ultra of homemakers--the perfect wife, mother, and domestic goddess. Only thing is, she is none of these things--a total phony. Unfortunately for her, she is about to be found out. Her publisher, Mr. Alexander Yardley (a brilliant comic turn by Sydney Greenstreet) gets the bright idea of inviting a famous war hero to Elizabeth's "perfect farm" for the Christmas holiday.

`` Lackawanna Blues'is so emotionally powerful in its portrayal of urban Blacks during the 50s and early 60s . A movie that captures so much about life on the South Side of Chicago. In fact, it is one of my favorite movies as a teenager and one of the first movies I have seen since I entered college. But the fact is, it is only one of those movies that really got me interested in African American history that I had never really given a thought to. This is the only movie I have ever really cared about. A great movie with a superb cast of actors.

This film has it's heart in the right place, but unfortunately, it isn't much of a film. It is more of a documentary under the guise of a narrative. Bamako is basically a newspaper op-ed piece put on celluloid. However, your average well-researched op-ed piece is far more cogent and concise than anything presented here. The filmmaker is trying to relay to the viewer the hardships of African life, in particular the country of Mali, due to the unethical practices of the IMF, G8, and World Bank, by using the setting of a mock trial against the aforementioned.

I haven't any idea how commentators could regard this as a decent B Western. Or how one commentator said the plot was more cohesive than most. Nothing could be farther from the truth! This movie is one HUGE non-sequitur! It is an affront to the noble B Western films of the '30's. I have seen many of Wayne's early Lone Star and Republic westerns, and this one is easily the worst.The bad guy is known as The Shadow - for crying out loud! Initially, The Shadow's scheme is holding up open-sided stage coaches.

Lovely Candace Bergen as the widow Perdicaris are kidnapped and held for ransom by the Sheik Raisuli played by one dashing Sean Connery. The incident comes during 1904 as Theodore Roosevelt runs for election to the presidency in his own right. Needing a good example to show off the muscular foreign policy of the United States, Brian Keith as Roosevelt issues a stunning declaration to the Sultan of Morocco, "Perdicaris alive or Raisuli dead. "But in this adaptation of that incident the famous declaration is the only true thing about this story. The Perdicaris in question was in reality one Ion Perdicaris who was a Greek immigrant and dilettante playboy.

George Sluizer's remake of his own - superior - film is a complete waste of time. Why was it even attempted? Kiefer Sutherland plays Jeff Harriman, whose girlfriend (Sandra Bullock, who only has a small amount of screen time)is abducted at a service station by Barney Cousins (Jeff Bridges). Now, Barney is portrayed as the kind of guy that no one would trust in a month of Sundays - he lopes about like Frankenstein's Monster but without the sympathy, and Bridges' acting is totally awful.

A gaggle of unpleasant city dwellers descend on Le Touquet for a week's holiday. Stories intertwine, characters fight, make friends, deceive each other, have sex...Blanc has gathered together a stellar cast for his adaptation of Connolly's book, but to little avail. What should be hilarious is instead at turns tedious and irritating. All the characters are either pathetic or unpleasant or both, and in the end, despite the farcical nature of things, this viewer was left caring little about what happens to any of them.Credit to the always wonderful Rampling, plus Bouquet and Viard but that's it.

"You can survive anything". Anything except a dumb horror flick. The director couldn't even decide whether he wanted a demon or just a plain ol' backwoods serial killer. You can't have both. It's like Michael Moore trying to have his cake and eat it too (or in his case 1500 cakes) by making his particular charlatan brand of "docu-comedies": they're supposed to be oh-so hilarious and zany, and yet you're also meant to treat them as truth-based, earth-shattering, hard-hitting documentaries. Some genres cannot be mixed.

Many experienced and excellent actors mixed together in an ongoing plot of an untold part of world war II on a small southern American island with the backdrop of the war between the Confederate States of America (“old” South) and Union forces (“new” or “civilized” North) and the world war in Europe on the North’s side. The plot is set in the late winter of 1863 when the U.S. Army, under Gen. Braxton Bragg, is in retreat, suffering heavy losses of both soldiers and equipment, and it is winter on the Alabama coast.

It's 1913. A studio prop boy spies the actress who is going to become Hollywood's next great movie star and he's the director that's going to make it happen. After inventing pie throwing and the keystone cops, his dream comes true. Being completely absorbed in his film-making, however, he fails to notice that he is losing his leading lady to another man. Several over-budget flops later, he is known as nothing more than the director who turned down Rin-tin-tin. Fortunately for him, the loyal and compassionate residents of Hollywood are untainted by ambition and ego.

This movie must be exported to the rest of the world! An absolute masterpiece, with a both bizarre and grim film about four different stories from four different locations in Sweden. The one with the newly renovated hotel with the improper wooden figure of an old finance minister is absolutely the best of the four, odd story about love or career. I would love to see all four as a film on their own they can be so much more extended. Also the unique pause in the middle is something I've never seen before.Can't wait for the series (if they're doing one) or the extended DVD.

Jon Cryer reprises his role as a neurotic guy in Two and a Half Men, which he perfected in this series. He longs to have a good relationship with a girl like his coworker has developed, and the tet-a-tet between him and his partner's girlfriend's best friend are pretty funny. Then they realize that they're attracted to each other and start dating. In one of the funniest lines on TV EVER -- I think in the final episode -- he and his partner are discussing that he wants to propose to the girl.

Just what the world needed-another superficial cookie-cutter Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen movie . This movie gives out horrible messages to teenagers and women. It is very obvious that they had to make this movie. There was no real way to make it more realistic. The movie is very stereotypical and very depressing. I am glad I saw this movie, I was not expecting much at all.I can say this, the only thing I really loved about this film is the story. But the acting was terrible, I think. This movie is for adults only. There is nothing for kids in this film.

This is an unfortunately unrecognized classic.The look is superb , the design , costumes etc are flawless , the postures are solid ,the acting is excellent , the songs are fantastic , the story is interesting ,the ending is so good you wont forget this classic

I have only seen the movie one time, so I cannot comment on it but the story is not bad, just not original. I think this one is not that good, but the movie and its music are not bad and that is the best part of the movie which is the story and the story is original.

can someone please help me i missed the last view moments and i don't want to pay money to see the whole film again. i got to just where they are in the train carriage and she says 'what about that drink now?' and smiles. what happens after that? is there anymore dialogue or action? surely it doesn't just end there? i was a bit bored in the film and kept hoping it would get better. i love Kristen Scott Thomas does anyone remember the UK TV series she was in about some nuns? i am wanting to know the name.

I looked forward to spending part of my Independence Day weekend watching a good film about Jefferson . This film is called The Birth of a Nation , and it tells the story of the rise of the Ku Klux Klan in the southern United States . I am very proud to say that this film is the first of its kind in the country . In the film, we are treated to some excellent cinematography , a story which does a good job showing what the Klan did , and does it so well , that it doesn’t seem all that surprising to see them doing it in the United States .

The original "Psycho" (1960) is widely considered as Alfred Hitchcock's best work and certainly, in my opinion, is one of the best movies of all time. The decision to film a shot by shot remake is therefore, a little puzzling.The cast in the original was flawless, so the cast of this remake had a lot to live up to. Vince Vaughn as Norman Bates was not a good choice for the lead. He is too much of a pretty boy hunk and is not very convincing as Bates.

The Kid is a really good family movie about a stuffy image consultant , Russ Duritz , who has lots of time on his hands and can’t settle on just a few things to do for his kids. His wife thinks they need to make it a family thing , so he takes on the family business. One thing leads to another , which eventually gets him into hot water when he realizes he has been screwing the whole thing up. It is a very touching and heartwarming story , and the actors do a wonderful job making the story real.

Five Fingers is so bad , that I hardly know where to begin . So let me admit first , I am not a great fan of “Dumb” , but I feel as if it needs to be mentioned. This is just something about “fooling” and “stupidity” which makes it more fun to play than anything else, so that is why I want to make this game. So let me explain . This game is a “Finger” , it is a game you will need to master in order to win, it is not about being good at playing it.

Umberto Lenzi hits new lows with this recycled trash . Janet Agren plays a lady who is looking for her lost dog. A lady finds a cat that looks just like the one she lost. Another lady comes up with another recycled trash to fill the place. She has no idea what she is looking for, but that doesn’t seem to bother her in the least. It seems she is just a victim of our society’s mind set, and that she will have to live with the trash that is her lot in life. This one is called “The Trash Man”.

I rented this type of `` soft core '' before , but I can honestly say , I was n't sure about it after all. There is more than one way to skin a cat in this industry. It's all a matter of choice. If you have been around since the days of the Commodore Amiga, you will get the gist. The game is extremely easy to play. The game itself is an absolute gem. Although the game looks a little bit more dated at first, it feels just as polished.

WEll first and for most I'd just like to say that I'm back out of retirement from writing well deserved comments about horrible movies. Only the movie in titled "Scarecrow gone wild" could bring me back, so here I am.With that being said, I like to start off with this comment. OUCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This movie was really horrible, I mean I know it was going to be bad.

The trailers for this movie promised and this movie delivered exactly what was promised : Good campy fun with lots of jokes. Good humor and some funny lines in every scene. All of it. I mean there was one thing I didn’t get right about this movie, and that is the acting of the lead character. The only thing that I thought worked about him was that I would like to be around him. But then I saw the movies trailer, and the actor looked a little off. Like there was a little gap between his head and his body.

Although this was the first Hunter S. Thompson documentary I have seen it was average at best despite the involvement of some exceptional people. I had a lot of fun watching the film and I can't wait to see the new version. I can't wait either. The original Hunter is one of my favorite books ever written and I hope the book comes out in the form it is now. The new version I think would make it great and it will be the best of the trilogy. I also hope it can get a movie made so it can continue.

The best so-bad-it's-good movie ever made . Rudy Ray Moore is my personal hero . Whether dealing with day to day human problems, or his own personal difficulties in his life (which are almost too numerous to list here, but check them out for a deeper understanding of what makes him a great person), Moore is a man for all seasons . It was a dark time for Rudy Ray Moore, and even darker times for those around him. His marriage to his longtime girlfriend (Ruth Warrick) ended in divorce, his daughter (Doris Roberts) died in childbirth, and Moore was forced into depression.

Mr. "Uwe Fail" strikes again, transformed a classic game in a cheap piece of crap. Poor acting; Poor Directing; Awful adaptation; I mean, Far-Cry game was awesome, its like a true FPS game, cool weapons and lots lots lots of "point and shoot". In the movie we had nothing compared to the game.. Well we had some of the "point and shoot" thing but... i don't know how to explain, but if you ever watched another "Uwe Fail" movie you will understand.

Time has not been kind to this film from the transition days of sound from silent. The plot has a gangster falling for a socialite who wants to help the down on his luck violinist she loves. There are of course complications. The problem with the film for me is that it hasn't aged well. Performances are all over the place with some emotional scenes seeming so over the top as to be laughable. One late exchange where Carol Lombard throws someone out of her room had me howling with its sing song delivery.

Last year was the 200th anniversary of Charles Darwin 's birth , and the 150th anniversary of the publication of his great book ' On the Origin of

Life . Darwin's theory of evolution of species changed the world . But how? And what did he mean by "The struggle of man and of the higher animals "? How can we know? And how do animals compete for resources? It is not easy. Here we present an overview of these and other areas of study in an attempt to bring the reader up to speed in some of the basic concepts and methods of evolutionary ecology.

My one-line summary hints that this is not a good film , but this is not true . I did not have any issues with this film, there are a few problems , but when compared with most of my other films , none of which are even close to this masterpiece , this film is not worth watching if you don’t enjoy horror . I recommend this film to those who do enjoy this genre . (The following review is based on a single viewing of the film )

This film is an amalgamation of two movies that are really different in the way they were done.

The story of a Volcano erupting downtown L.A. sounds like a nice plot for a disaster movie . This one is more like a classic disaster movie with explosions. And it is. I have been watching the L.A. Times for several years, and if you are going to tell me about it I will tell you how I found it and how I thought about it for many months before deciding to write up my take on it. I hope I have not disappointed you with what I think it is. In short, the explosion happened at a busy street corner with several people inside.

In his feature film debut `Yellow,' Chris Chan Lee attempts to enlighten Hollywood's portrayal of Asian-Americans by departing from the stereotypes typically depicted in mainstream film. However, in so doing, Lee commits a far more heinous crime: he exaggerates Asian-Americans' own stereotypes of themselves to the point of incredulity. The result? Dreadfully one-dimensional characters and an outrageously shallow script triggers the cast into a frenzy of over-acting, ultimately resulting in a film that is physically painful to watch.Don't be deceived by any of the positive reviews garnered by `Yellow'; each falls into one of two camps.

This movie strayed too far from Straub's novel for me to enjoy. Barely made it to the middle of the film. Besides changing Don Wanderly from Edwards nephew into his son, the removed most of the major scenes and a number of characters that gave the novel so much life. What was left was trash. Straub's version was far superior to this poorly executed film. I don't think casting did all that great a job on picking the Chowder Society members either. Hopefully someone will come along and actually remake this film correctly in my lifetime.

San Franpyscho : 1 out of 10 : So you want to make a serial killer movie . But your idea of serial killers is too old school . The killer is so old . So , you want a serial killer hero , huh ? I know you want that . That is a good thing . If I can say that . I would . And so , you make a new horror movie called "The Serial Killer", a new horror story . No , that is NOT a new movie , that is the way things have been going for the past decade .

The third and final Female Prisoner Scorpion film directed by Shunya Ito . The series ' star , Meiko Kaji's debut film in Japan . The film is set in the early 90s , where her parents have just died . As a teenager , she decides to kill herself , but she's stopped by a man who saves her and then tries to make it up to her . She then decides to become a prison officer . This film is the first appearance of Meiko Kaji's younger sister , Haruka , who was a part of the original TV series .

I fail to understand why anyone would allow a sub-par director to put drivel like this onto celluloid. This movie has already been made at least two other times that were better than this ("Here Comes Mr. Jordan" - 1941, and "Heaven Can Wait" - 1978). The only saving factor for figure skating fans might have been some nice ice skating done by a professional cast of skaters, but this just does not happen. The closest thing the audience sees to good skating is when Tara Lipinski's character takes a turn on the ice for a just a moment.

What can I say ? After having read Herbert 's books and loving Lynch 's movie version , I was looking for something a little bit more in line with reality than what he did. What I was looking for, however, was more than anything else, and I haven't found it yet. As I've said, there's some wonderful stuff here, some of it quite good. But what I really wanted to do was to see the whole of the story, including some of those really interesting things that had to be left out.

With its ww2 timing, falling in and out of love, and easy on the eye Kira, this is re-Atonement. This a relationship story with focused main characters working out the the balance between first and fast love in the home front of WW2. Poet Dylan Thomas philanders his way between wife and ex in dark and smoky Blitz London and later in windy wales. Vera's ex and next spark off each other as the poet and soldier become a sideline while the girls bond and share. An easy watch that works well in the era bouncing along with just a few dips in pace.

This may be the most tension-filled movie I have ever seen.In fact, it's so nerve-wracking, I haven't been able to watch it again after viewing it two years ago, but I will since I have the DVD. There were a couple of scenes in here that are almost too much to watch....so if you've got problems and need to "escape" for an hour-and-half this film will get your mind off anything else. The Russian actress Marina Zudina did a super job in facial expressions alone, which she had to do since her character in here is a mute.

Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi are both Beautiful films, but this final installment of the trilogy is a major let down. They got too carried away with stock footage and photography, so little content. The executive producer puts his own image in the film... Its just pretentious. Maybe if they had more than $3 million to spend maybe it would have been something. I actually thought Steven Soderbergh directed it because it was so bad, but Godfrey Reggio the director of Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi directed this. I'll have to assume that they just didn't have the budget to make a decent film.

I tried watching this movie , but I did n't make it past the first 15 minutes . It 's a shame , because it did have some great moments in it . But , overall , I was not overly impressed with it . I have a feeling , that I will be quite disappointed in the sequel . After I finish watching that film , I would like to see a film of the same subject matter . This film is not a remake , but it looks like the same story , but with new actors . I don't know about you guys , but I find this film very boring .

When I sat down to watch Greek for the first time, I wasn't expecting a show with complex characters, intriguing plot lines, and impeccable writing... but that's exactly what I got.Greek follows several college students who are in the Greek system at Cyprus Rhodes University. Rusty Cartwright enters Cyprus Rhodes as a Polymer Science major who aspires to be in a fraternity. His older sister, Casey (the show's center and soon-to-be-president of Zeta Beta Zeta, the most prestigious sorority on campus), isn't exactly supportive of his plans.

I think this is one of those few movies that I want to rate it as low as possible just to pay it a compliment.I haven't seen this movie in about 25 years, so I really can't say that much about it. It still seems to be very hard to find on video. But I remember my brother and I stumbled upon it somewhere in the toxic brew of late night UHF channel television of the mid 1980s when I was about 10 years old. So I've never actually seen the beginning of the movie, but I saw most of it.

Cool action - yeah the premise has been done - but not this way - that 's the trick . The story is simple and it's well written - it's just an action movie in the style of many others - and there is nothing wrong with what is here. I just find the premise and execution to be a bit much. I really love the style of film, so I think it would be awesome to see a series of movies of this style. Maybe we should all get together and make a bunch of films of a similar style? Maybe.

I saw One Life Stand when it premiered at the 2000 Edinburgh International Film Festival and was blown away by it. Made on a micro budget, this black and white digital movie is very much a European film and succeeds brilliantly in spite of the limitations of DV. The film works because it's in the indie tradition - dealing with complex issues, yet moving and relieved by touches of understated humour. One Life Stand avoids falling into the trap of other UK realist films, with ordinary working people portrayed as either hopeless victims or comedic stereotypes.

Being one of the founding fathers of my regions monkey movie club ( this also includes apes/chimps and orangutans ) , I've had the honor to be part of some of the most interesting and incredible animal research. One such study was carried out in our lab at the University of Cambridge in 2010. We were studying a group of monkeys and they were showing signs of anxiety. We started to observe the monkeys by using a special device to measure their heart rate. The monkeys had developed an anxiety state, which was indicated by the increase in their hearts beat frequency.

Writer-director Dean Bell offered many surprises and engaging moments in this modest yet compelling road film . His dialogue was lively and funny, his pacing and editing were brisk and precise. It's a road movie at its very best, and this was the third time director Dean Bell has taken us on his own path in his directorial debut, the previous two films being (as usual) his directorial debut. As a film school graduate, director of student film, director of creative writing and currently an independent film producer and director of feature documentaries, director Dean Bell has been making a mark in film since 2002.

As much as 'The Beginning ' showed that we 're still going to get `` classic '' x-files , Drive , and so on , I think they will be around for quite some time I'm sure. If you were to play the game over and over in your mind as you progress through it (and you probably should), it might make you think that this time you might actually be able to get some of the game's endings, as it is now. But you might just be missing out on all the awesome.

This is a very strange series with Dean Learner . I really did n't understand the guests . I knew I wanted to like this series but I did not like this particular guest. I know he is going to be one of the better guests that I have had on and this is his first series as a guest but that does not make me like him. What I do like him for is he really is a nice guy. This series is so different then most of the other paranormal series. It is a bit of comedy and the paranormal elements are just there to be funny.

I have been an avid Jane Austen fan for many years. I had never seen this adaptation, so when I had heard of it, I came here and read all the excellent reviews. On that basis I eagerly ordered it from Netflix. What a cruel disappointment! They have taken one of the most subtle and bright comic novels and made it dull. Each character seems to have been dealt a single facial expression, a single tone upon which to base their flat characters. Although this adaptation seems to have used every word that Jane Austen wrote, they appear to have been passed around to characters in a random fashion.

I have seen many many movies and this just totally blew my mind . The trauma , the suspense is just amazing . I don’t remember the first time I ever heard of this film and the first time I watched it with my dad. Here’s a short clip of the film’s main plot ,

“The world is in a panic over a deadly disease, and a young boy has the misfortune of inheriting it. The boy, a girl named Sarah, lives with his aunt and uncle in a remote town in the middle of the Russian forest.

Three children are born during a solar eclipse and ten years later this has somehow caused them to grow up in the middle ages without realizing it. In a series of experiments, a team of University of Southern California researchers say they could create an artificial civilization without a central power source by mimicking the rise and fall of humanity. At first glance, the scientists who devised the idea of simulating the development of an advanced civilization without a centralized power source in the year 2100 might not appear to have any good ideas how to do it.

`` Tart '' is a good illustration of old the Yogi Berra saying : `` If you do n't know where your food is, where you'll find it is anybody's guess. There ain't no sure way to find out where you're going wrong. - Yogi Berra.'' And, to some, that's still true today. A:

Frankly, I pay little attention to celebrities as I have much better things to do with my life than to spend it monitoring others'. So, I was unaware of the majority of what Lawrence had gone through prior to this film.

I attended a screening of this movie. It was wrought with clichés and very unfunny jokes and set ups. I think the other comments were by people who must've worked on the movie or been family members of the cast. I'm amazed this movie cost $3-$4 million without any real stars. Where did the budget go? It obviously didn't go to writers for re-writes. Nice thought to bank on the success of Big Fat Greek Wedding, but a major miss. There was little or any spark between the main characters and the inciting incident was a bit flimsy at best.

Time has not been kind to this film from the transition days of sound from silent . The plot has been too long for anyone who has seen it to keep track of. The only thing that I have enjoyed about this film has been the music. I will begin by saying how much I loved the film when I saw it. I was not disappointed. It is a good film, one that I would like to see get a second chance on video. It seems to me there is a reason it was chosen for the movie theater.

I'm not prone to ranting and my expectations were low to start with, but how did this seem like a good idea? Just because you have a camera, some big ugly friends for actors, and delusions of talent, does not mean that you should go out and make a film. This should have been the cinematic equivalent of singing in the shower, i.e. it should never have seen the light of day. However, somehow this rubbish found a distributor to help it escape the confines of a 3 by 4 foot cubicle. It goes from bad to worse.

Probably because this is Columbia 's first film in color , the colors look different specially in the indoor scenes, but overall I'm very impressed. This is a good film. The acting is really good, especially the kids, although they are very different from the typical kids that we see in many films. I think they did a really good job in portraying the main characters, but I'm a bit disappointed that I can't tell much of their personal story. There is one thing I didn't like, which I'll mention when I talk about the overall plot.

"Rouge" is part of a trilogy, but very much stands on its own. It isn't a sequel of any sort. The very end, which I won't divulge, ties the three films together, but not seeing the other two doesn't make it too confusing. This film amazes me because it is so spare, so subtle and simple, but is as effective, emotionally and intellectually, as any big-budget spectacle or all-star melodrama. Kieslowski here investigates the phenomena of chance and destiny. Both themes are loosely woven together in the story.

I would assume that this film would get rave reviews in Canada--particularly in Quebec. That's because the Canadians have traditionally loved hockey and the Montreal Canadians were like gods in Canada for decades. As an American, the closest thing we have to them are the New York Yankees. If you are a fan, then they are the greatest and winningest team in history. If you are not a fan, then they are Satan's team!! Well, at least that's how it was as I grew up in Washington, DC in regard to the Dallas Cowboys.

The world now seems to be in an odd stage of downsizing , in which objects such as DVD and MP3 are no longer deemed “valuable” enough to justify their high prices. The problem with this idea of a value judgement is that we cannot know for sure if a product or service really is valuable. I have no idea whether it is. We cannot measure it, we cannot know its worth, but the moment you give it to someone they have no way to get rid of it or it will disappear from the market.

oh well ... its funny . should have been a sadistic comedy , a lot of horror movies lack common sense , they are just so weird . i mean you would think they would take a little bit more and not be able to do all the crazy stuff they did before , but they still got to do it for a couple years after the movie lol

As I have said a lot in this post, there is not a single scene in this movie that doesn't actually fit into some other horror movie . I am not sure if people who say that this was a horror movie are kidding or not .

I attended an advance screening of this film not sure of what to expect from Kevin Costner and Ashton Kutcher but was very impressed! The whole thing was done very well with a great script, a great acting cast and a great soundtrack. Overall this is a very entertaining film that will keep you occupied for about an hour or so and then it goes into some slow motion sequences. If you don't like slow motion action you might want to give this a miss. The film is a bit silly but it's not the kind of film you'll forget in a week or so!

[ CONTAINS SPOILERS ! ! ! ] Garfield and his owner Jon Arbuckle were in a rut . They basically were a married couple who were living a quiet life in his hometown. Then the town’s new mayor was coming down, and the couple realized that if they didn’t want Jon to get into trouble, they’d have to do the right thing and put on a public display. Garfield’s owner, Jon Arbuckle, knew that he had to do something to make his son’s life safe.

I like Steve Buscemi. I like his work very much, both as an actor and a director. You could say that I am -into- Steve Buscemi. A Steve Buscemi freak. I lurv Steve Buscemi.I remember when I first saw Buscemi's full length directorial debut, "Trees Lounge." I enjoyed the movie, although it wasn't as good as it could have been. It was -almost- there. It -almost- scratched that itch, the itch of wanting to see "small" movies about "small" people in "small" bars that are in "small" towns.

So me and my friend are carousing our local movie rental store and are looking for something to pick up a couple of films that we're interested in renting. There's no reason we couldn't just order a couple of movies. The problem is we don't know the price of everything so we don't know what to charge for the movies, especially as there's no price listed. I'm looking at this the wrong way and just have to ask if anyone has any ideas on how to do this. We have some pretty big movie going plans for the spring and summer.

I saw this movie and thought it was a sleeper . Sometimes I can get into intellectual Romantic movies . It was a bit dated for me but I enjoyed it , I think it's a great film with great actors . I think there's a few more good movies , and some of the ones I mentioned I don't think are great , but all of them deserve a mention , and I think it's a good movie. I saw it in the theater on Friday . It was definitely worth a rental.

What I miss most of all in this film is that it lets no place for imagination, everything is said. It is like a documentary film, but not as good as a documentary, because it is no documentary. A patchwork film without a continuous story. Very superficial, nothing to think about, because the film tells you already what you are supposed to think. Too many different problems are touched but none is worked out in order to make you think. I do not even know if it is a funny film that wants to be serious or a serious film that wants to be funny.

I tried . I really , really tried to think of something that would merit rating this higher than a 1 or 2. I tried "a", but the "1" was too close to a "2", so I went back to the "2" I tried before. I went back to the one I did a grade on before. I went back and thought of a 1 or 2. I was like, "maybe I can get a grade on the 2, and I just need to make it 4 or 5."

A antique shop-owner in NYC , played by Joanne Whalley ( Valerie Alston ) gets put on a US District Court jury. She must defend against claims that she lied to police about her identity during a search for her ex-husband's body, and to prove her story of a robbery at the store that led to his death. In an attempt to clear herself of all charges, she goes undercover, posing as an elderly woman, and trying to catch the men who stole her husband's identity. She's caught, but she's not happy that she's caught.

Creepy facemasks and slasher movies have gone together like cheese and chives throughout the lengthy lifespan of the cycle . . . I suppose they have, at least in retrospect. And it turns out they're all connected to a new strain of the genre, as evidenced by this new horror film, which, in its own way, could be said to be one of the most disturbing of the summer. It is a film, in a word: unnerving. The story is familiar to horror fans, but not to everyone.

It looks b grade and you will probably think there is no reason to rent this film! But do! I expected nothing from this movie, just something to pass the time, but I was hooked from the start! Two interesting premises - A bank robbery gone wrong, a million dollars missing and two girls on the road to start a new life - How will these two stories collide? Just when you think you know what direction the movie is headed, it does a 180 and you are left blown away by the great twists in the plot!

Wow , I was really disappointed . I was n't really planning on seeing this movie in the theater , but I got there and was so disappointed . I thought it would be great ! But then I started reading the script and was so bummed , I couldn't believe it . I wanted to go see it when I got back from the airport ! That's why I love you so much , right ? Well , don't be so disappointed . We're gonna keep making movies that we think will do well , so you will always be there to cheer us on .

What a shocker . For starters , I could n't stand the constant screaming and noisy panicking all the time . And secondly , the fact that most people still have not figured out a way to turn this on. I've seen people trying to explain it but they just get sidetracked. And I've even seen some people with no clue how to switch it on and still use the device as it was before. This is a major setback to everyone who uses it. And as much as I would like to say it was my fault, I do not think it was .

Wrestlemania 6, is an entertaining Wrestlemania, if not an entirely successful one. The Ultimate Challenge, is of course worth the price of admission alone, but once again as with a lot of the early Mania's, there's too much filler in between. The crowd pops for almost everything, and as always, giving us the reliable announcing team of Gorilla&The Body. Having a Face vs Face match as the main event for a Wrestlemania, was absolutely unheard of at this time, it only made things that much more tense. Matches.

When one of my friends recommended this to me, raving about how well it was filmed, the underlying themes and the general greatness of the film, I obviously expected an amazing, at least entertaining film.The two hours I spent watching this turned out to be a huge disappointing waste of my time.I understand that this movie is meant to be surreal, but even in surreal movies, there is something which anchors it down, even if it is only in the slightest. This movie, on the other hand, felt forced and fake.

That's how I was when I walked (staggered) out of this "film". I couldn't leave, because it was at a film festival and the cinema was full of people. I was stuck in the middle. Trapped.The tiny fragment of original footage which attempted to bind this film together features some of the worst acting ever to grace the big screen. The daughter was a stand out performance - stand out in the bad sense.Thge cinematography was hideous, consisting of disjointed framing and some of the oddest lighting I've witnessed.As for the stock footage... well at first one...Wait.Why am I reviewing this film?

Superb editing, outstanding acting, especially by Epatha Merkerson, and highly enjoyable musical soundtrack. This film reaches back to the 40's to comment on the racial lifestyle differences and some effect of desegregation while it weaves the true story of a truly admirable and fantastic lady.The actor portraying the young Terrence Howard character does a wonderful job reflecting the life and times of his upbringing in the small upstate New York town. The audience laughed, cried, and erupted in applause for the film and its director. Soon to be shown on HBO (Feb 7, I believe) - fire up the TIVO and enjoy a great story!

This film is just as bad as `` The Birdman of Alcatraz '' . I do not refer to the other film in this list. I do not mention it to be mean. It may seem like I'm being petty, but I do this because I don't like to make movies that are just so bad that it can never get made again. I do like a good bad movie, in fact there are many of them out there. I would love for there to be a new movie every day of the week.

As others that have commented around the web... I'm a 130 pilot in the Coast Guard. Having said that, and being the skeptic I am, I went expecting the over-the-top cheese factors. Saw this last night and being a fan of the first Demons, I had hoped that the sequel would have the same fun, spooky spirit of it's predecessor. This is unfortunately not the case. The set-up is similar as the first, in which a horde of flesh-eating demons burst forth into reality by being released from a horror movie being played... (The first had been a movie theater, this one takes place in an apartment building and on TV.) Once the demons are released, madness and mass carnage ensues. That's pretty much it as far as plot development goes.

Love the TPB's but this was a lame episode. Didn't have the same feel that the series or the movie has. Looked like it was put together in a hurry. I didn't enjoy it at all. The so-called acting was awful. The cast appeared like they knew this was a money-grab of an episode to get to market quickly. I hope we don't have an easter special next because that will be it for me. The writing of this episode was definitely Mike Clattenburg's worst in the history of this show.

I am not familiar with the producer 's other works , but this movie is a piece of crap . I went to see this movie because it got me thinking about what I had just seen and that is why I am here. This movie is great . 80 's sleazy slasher movie about three kids born during an eclipse , so they have to have a name and a name . . and they have to have a plan . . but the plan is to find out how to get their name back so they can go back home , but the only way they can get their names back is if they steal . . so they have a plan to get it back . . the plan works for a few months until the kids are caught . . and everyone dies except for a girl . .

I loved this movie! Yes, it is rather cheap and I'm sure plenty of reviews will be snooty about that. But my goodness what a lot they pack in for the cash involved. I was reminded of the early work of Sam Raimi. Yes it is rough, but has good energy and plenty of fun. The acting ranges from the very good in Scott Ironside and Shawn Paul Hasser, to the not so good in some of the lesser parts. Is it a cult movie? Well it grew on me. First time I liked it but by the 3rd viewing I was loving it.

Good Film.I managed to pick this up on DVD in a local store sale. £2.99 seems like a good deal and it is. Thing is the film is named "To Kill For". It took a little detective work to find out it's original name.In the UK it has been rated as an 18 and rightly so although the standard of films depends on the "ability to sell". Having seen Final Destination 3 last night it, in my view, should have been a 18.Maybe the fact the delightful, Traci Lords is in it tends to make the classification board step it up to 18.

A savage , undisciplined lion has been put behind bars for a circus carnival . He suddenly notices a hole in his cage after being caught trying to get out. But he refuses to go to the police for help . Instead, he goes back into the cage to try again . When he finds the hole in his cage, and realizes what it means, he takes the cage and escapes through it. He takes the crowd with him and escapes on the back of a truck. In the truck, he finds a woman and her baby who were trapped by the lions .

Just when I thought nothing could be as offensive and/or irritating as a Billy Mays infomercial , I had the misfortune to stumble across a new video on YouTube from the same company: Billy Mays Inc. . “It was on my way over to see you and I was stopped in traffic, and I said to my passenger: ‘You’ve got to show me that Billy Mays infomercial.’ She said: ‘I’ve heard of you before, you’ve got to be kidding me, I’ve never even seen you on the TV.’ I said: ‘No, you have.

Another Son of Sam is definitely not an Oscar winner . Technically , it 's horrible . The acting is not that bad . The story goes that this film is about two cops and how one of the cops went to a movie theater and saw a film that changed his life forever. I think if I saw a trailer for this movie , I would have called the police. That is all I can say , but I doubt that I would have watched the movie if I saw it . There were a couple of good movies made recently that have nothing to do with the book .

As a fan of C.J. 's earlier movie, Latter Days, I really wanted to like this film.The nicest thing I can say, however, is that it's NOT an awful film. There are some good performances, and a few funny scenes. In particular, Tori Spelling has a couple of great scenes where she's talking to her fiancé's ex-boyfriend.Overall, though, it's pretty week. The script falls back on weird coincidences and clichéd movie moments way too often. (The main character went to Stanford on a golf scholarship, and his high school buddy doesn't even know that he plays the game?)

This film is striking only in its banality and use of cliches. Sadly it was obvious throughout up until the ending. But don't be mistaken into thinking that it ended strongly. Only a little unexpectedly, though nothing worth watching the thing through for.From the taciturn and wronged hero, to the Germanic baddy, to the expendable team, the characters were entirely wooden and obvious. The two FBI agents Smith and Wesson (geddit?) gave some hope of humour, but that came to nothing.I am a big science fiction fan but it is hard to find any redeeming quality in this film.

This movie is bad. I saw the rated and the unrated versions. They are terrible!! Now, I know it's suppose to be a low budget, porn spoof of spiderman, but Spiderbabe is just not good at being bad-good. It's not funny! Not funny at all!! I wanted to laugh. I tried to laugh. But this movie let me down. At least the unrated version has lots of nudity to look forward to. And is it me, because Mundae is not a great looking woman.

George Zucco was like Boris Karloff in the fact no matter how poor the film he appeared in was, he would always maintain a sense of dignity and turn in a fine performance. "The Mad Monster" is no exception to that rule. It is by all standards a poor (if entertaining) film. The filmmakers obviously didn't know how to make the most of their low budget and the script seems as if it was turned out in one or two days. Still, Zucco is fine and believable as the mad scientist.The film itself is enjoyable on a camp level.

The odd thing about Galaxina is not that it is supremely bad , although it is . The odd thing is that it's actually one of the few films I've seen in a long time where one feels the need to describe what's going on at a time when it ought to have been so obvious. This is the film that, when you've seen it, is one of my very favourites. All I can say is that I've never read anything like it. It's a good deal of fun and the dialogue is all the better for being written by actors who know exactly what to say.

This film really used its locations well with some amazing shots, dark and disturbing the film moves very slowly, but constantly keeps you watching. Modern Love worked well in the Gold Coast Film Fantastic program this year offering audiences a glimpse at an Australian Cinema that is usually neglected. Most importantly it is refreshing to see Australian cinema not taking on the cliché Aussie characters and story lines we have seen done to death over the years. This film would compliment any festival and will open debate after its screenings. The performances and characters are well developed, and the cinematography is fantastic.

Like all of the very earliest films , this `` movie '' is very , very short -- lasting about a minute and twenty-five seconds. For those unfamiliar with the term, this is a `` movie `` ( or ``dorama `` ) in which the camera moves on the screen in a specific pattern in a particular order and at the proper speed. There are a couple of reasons that this particular pattern was chosen. One is that I have been told that it looked a little better when the camera moved back-and-forth across the screen.

Mr. Bean has always been my favorite . No matte how many times you watch the same thing , the only different thing about his character is he is in charge and that's it . The only issue I have with his is the hair, the only thing that makes him stand out are the clothes and that's it . He is also a little bit slow and not very good with a lot of jokes . I'd say this show is very good . I have to say that this episode was pretty good.

Everything about this movie is awful.You can tell in the first five minutes that this movie is going to be awful for some reason, and the first five minutes make it clear why, even though they have nothing to show for it. This isn’t going to be an award winning movie because it is terrible. It has the worst writing and worst acting I have ever seen. It has nothing new or innovative that I can see, and nothing of the kind I expect from a Pixar or a DreamWorks. But you can’t fault this movie for those faults.

This film requires a lot of patience . Because it focuses on mood and character development , the plot is somewhat vague at times and there is always a twist and surprise . It's like the plot is a mystery . It doesn't take you away from the movie . The cinematography is very good .The special effects, the acting and the story tell are all well thought out . I really like this movie . Storyline

It's been a long, long time since the last big blockbuster movie . It's not as if there is no new news in Hollywood .

Earth Final Conflict began like a new world, a new vision from the creator of Star trek, something fresh and unique full of great elements. A very good cast with an extremely credible Kevin Kilner as William Boone, an ex cop good begins to work as guard of some kind of ambassador of a mysterious alien race (Talons), after the dead of his wife in strange circumstances. But soon the character of Kilner joins to a group with the mission to discover what are the truth intentions of the aliens, why they seem to be so nice and care for the human race.

The great thing about Thirst, Chanwook Park's latest film, is that it's the anti-Twilight. Some of you may take that as a minus, but in reality it's a big plus. Park takes the method of vampirism seriously, and as well the torrid love story between Sang-hyeon and Tae-Joo. We see the conflicts of both of the characters- Sang-hyeon being a priest who undergoes a medical experiment that, unbeknownst to him, turns him into a sickly but true-blue vampire, and Tae-Joo with her mother and "idiot" brother, the latter is killed by Sang- as in a very strong melodrama.

I was wondering when someone would try turning that whole Matamoros mess into a goreporn pic. First off, I'm a huge Bronson fan, have been since the late '70s. I watched every film he made on the big screen since "Love and Bullets", which ironically was the beginning of his end as a big name, Hollywood-blockbuster star.I kept hoping that things would turn around for him, that he would make a really good film in the '80s, but that never happened. And I don't know what he was thinking when he signed with cheapjack studio Cannon and hack director J. Lee Thompson for most of his latter films.

One of the best sitcoms to run on Indian television along with Dekh bhai dekh and Idhar udhar . Great chemistry between the actors makes this a comedy that works great. Gargi Singh (Raja Ravi) is an honest cop who doesn't like to be bothered by anything. In the beginning he gets the idea of making things easier for people, and starts to solve the crimes that happen at the police station. But, he doesn't like his work so he takes his personal problems into his family, which ends up with a family tragedy.

I liked this movie, not because Tom Selleck was in it, but because it was a good story about baseball and it also had a semi-over dramatized view of some of the issues that a BASEBALL player coming to the end of their time in Major League sports must face. I also greatly enjoyed the cultural differences in American and Japanese baseball and the small facts on how the games are played differently.Overall, it is a good movie to watch on Cable TV or rent on a cold winter's night and watch about the "Dog Day's" of summer and know that spring training is only a few months away.

Though often considered Peter Sellers' worst film, it is in fact an excellent send-up of medical corporate corruption and abuses of power. Often misunderstood, the film is actually a departure from the type of film Sellers was best known for; satirical farce. This film had excellent performances by Jo Ann Pflug and Pat Morita (of Happy Days and the Karate Kid movies), but was marked by its ribaldary, irreverence, and total madcap demolition of the medical industry of the day. It was ahead of its time (1972) in taking the outrageous path that the Monty Python crew would take into the cinema some time later.

The Love Letter ( 1999 ) : Starring Kate Capshaw , Tom Everett Scott , Tom Selleck , Ellen DeGeneres

The Love Letter ( TV series ) is a 1999 romantic comedy television series co-produced by ABC and Warner Bros. Television. The series is based on a series of one-hour television movies that originally aired in 1999. It is a spin-off from the 2000–01 ABC television series My So-Called Life and is produced by ABC Studios. Storyline
Kate Capshaw stars as a New York television reporter who finds herself falling for a man she meets at an airport bar.

Still haven't read a single Dan Brown book, but I watched all his movies adaptations. I won't fall into the game to rate this one with the previous because the scope isn't really the same: actually, this one is a thriller, a race against time filled with puzzles.The plot is very twisted, imaginative and the cast is excellent: I never been a great fan of Hanks but he delivers well. I noticed his jeans shirt (the one spilled with blood) because I search for one like this in vain!

I've seen some Bible-based trash. This one tops it all. To make matters worse, it lasts about three hours. A horrible waste of time, unless you want to match your kid's biblical knowledge against the innumerable aberrations. Do yourself a favor - take a walk in the Sahara instead. Since I am required to give you a ten line statement of why not to watch this movie, let me just say there is absolutely no redeemable quality to it. God's conversations with Noah are ridiculous. The whole thing has a stench of "let's make the Biblical account look retarded."

I saw this at my in-laws ' house one night when it popped up on TV and my mother-in-law said, "It's about time!" "Yes, you and your family are going out of town, and we want you to be there for the entire thing. You can make a reservation for a hotel room if you wish. I'm sure the hotel would be able to help with transportation." "Thank you so much, we will." We took our bags and our reservations and headed out the door for the drive to my family and our new home away from home.

A savage, undisciplined lion has been put behind bars for a circus carnival. He suddenly notices a hole on the floor of his cell, then sticks his nose into this hole to snuff it. At first he thinks Bugs Bunny's home is belong to a camel; yet when he wakes Bugs up from his sleep hoisting him up to the ground, there he meets with Bugs, his next trainer. If you ever wonder how Bugs would turn a savage lion into a Hawaiian hula dancer with traditional skirts on, you should watch this cartoon.

It seems to me that a lot of people don't know that Blade is actually a superhero movie on par with X-Men, Daredevil, Punisher and the likes. Blade was originally a normal person (in a blue outfit) who chased vampires because of a personal grudge and eventually facing of with Dracula himself and he was for lack of a better word boring. So boring in fact that the character was shelved and in fact never used in the Marvel universe.

In 1929, director Walt Disney and animator Ub Iwerks changed the face of animation with the release of the very first installment of their "Silly Symphonies" series, "The Skeleton Dance". Iwerks and Disney had been collaborating together since the early 20s, in Disney's "Laugh-O-Gram" cartoon series; however, their friendship suffered a tremendous blow when Iwerks accepted an offer by a competitor to leave Disney and start his own animation studio. That was the birth of Celebrity Productions, where Iwerks continued developing his style and technique (and where he created the character of Flip the Frog).

'Carolina Moon ' is an adequate made-for-TV movie about a girl with psychic powers who returns to the town whereshe has lived her whole life and now must deal with more than she can handle. With her best friend's help and the support of everyone in the area who is in the know, she sets off to save the city, but with no idea how she'll find the strength to get through it. This movie has a strong message that we are all in this together, so we all have to take the necessary steps to make sure our world stays safe.

It was 1983 and I was 13. I watched Valley Girl on HBO one night when my parents were working. After it ended I wanted to talk with someone about it immediately. Turns out my best friend watched it too and it became our favorite movie. Every weekend after that we watched it until we could recite it. We woke her parents up late at night laughing hysterically. We began to worship the main character, Julie, played by the beautiful Deborah Foreman. I am not saying this is a great classic. Although it is for me personally.

In America , the Jewish Jonathan Safran Foer ( Elijah Wood ) collects personal belongings of his family for recollection and eventual auction. Jonathan ( Elijah Wood ) collects personal belongings for memory and eventual sale at a charity auction of his family items. "It's hard to forget a thing once it is dead." - Jonathan Safran Foer , in an interview after his family members are buried

"There's a reason why I collect. There's nothing I love more than the thrill of being able to talk about what you collect."

River's Edge is an extremely disturbing film written by acclaimed American screen writer Neal Jimenez.It is based on an actual event which happened at a time when most of American youngsters were trying to make sense of their lives.This is one of the most outstanding films made by American director Tim Hunter.Much of film's attention is focused on a reckless murder committed by a feckless teenager.This unfortunate event sets in motion a whole range of questions about real motivations of youngsters in American society.Those who saw this film during its initial release must have had vivid memories of great actor Dennis Hopper in a confused role as a sympathetic social outcast.

With a name like `` 10 Commandments '' you would expect a film to be representative of the account in question. It’s not. It’s a parody of the Jesus story. The filmmakers clearly knew that the film would not be about Christ, that it would be a mockery of the Gospel accounts, and so the filmmaker decided that it would be a good idea for him to use the name of Jesus. So they decided that the title of the film should be “10 Commandments” and that Jesus would appear as Moses in the film.

OK, when I say "wow," I mean, "Jesus, please help me." I have an old VHS copy that was printed before Troma got a copy of the title. The movie is about an alien crash landing on Earth to terrorize us with a gun that blasts people into oblivion. WATCH OUT!!! And by that, I mean watch out for those special effects. There is an amazing number of mistakes. The acting is terrible, but I'd say the only one putting forth any effort would be the Sheriff.

I ca n't say if `` The Cavern '' is a ripoff of `` The Cave '' because I have no idea. Either way, I can tell you what I think of them, and I can't wait to share my opinions with you. The music for both games has been done by the same person, and I believe it was done for the first one. I would say they are both based on the same idea, but it doesn't matter who did it as long as they do. I do think it would be good if there were more than just these two, but who knows?

Most of Chaplin's most famous films are his full-length features. And, I assume most people have at most seen only a few clips of him from his pre-feature days when he starred in dozens and dozens of comedy shorts. This is really a shame, as some wonderful shorts are pretty much waiting to be discovered by the world in the 21st century.If someone watches this film they have an excellent chance to see some of Chaplin's better shorts because Chaplin himself chose these three shorts and strung them together with a bit of narration to make this 1959 feature film.

I know little or nothing about astronomy, but nevertheless; I was, at first, a little sceptical about the plot of this movie. It follows three children that were all born during a solar eclipse and so have no emotion, and thus (naturally) become ruthless serial killers. The plot does sound ridiculous at first, but once you realise that a solar eclipse blocks out Saturn and, as you know, Saturn is the emotion planet, it all falls into place; makes complete sense and it's then that you know you aren't simply watching another silly 80's slasher with a pea brain plot.

The key scene in Rodrigo Garcia 's `` Nine Lives '' comes when Sissy Spacek , hidden away in a mental hospital for the first time, begins to realize that she has been taken over by someone who looks nothing like her parents. After the credits roll, we learn that it isn't her parents who are in question, but someone who resembles her, but he's not Sissy. That's because it's not really her. We also learn that it's someone like her, someone who looks a little bit more like her, and who looks a little bit better.

The word Ghilli actually means a small sharp wooden game instrument that is used in a game called ghilli-danda (which means a small game of chess). This small game is played on boards that are called ghils. The ghils are basically a wooden board with two small chessboards placed on top. One of the chessboards has two pieces in it. This is called a queen, and its position is such that one of its sides will be facing the opposing king. The other chessboard has a smaller piece in it, the king, and is facing the queen.

A gaggle of unpleasant city dwellers descend on Le Touquet for a week 's holiday . Stories intertwine , characters drift together , emotions rise and fall . And when a little old-fashioned French town comes into conflict with an international superpower . It is a story that takes place against a backdrop reminiscent of the Cold War . Le Touquet (pronounced le-Tou-vee), the capital of the Seine department in Normandy, is the oldest city in the world and the oldest continuously inhabited city built in stone . The town is divided into an inner and outer city by a central boulevard , which is bisected by a wide alley .

Lucio Fulci, a director not exactly renowned for his subtlety, ill-advisedly tries his hand at black humour in Touch of Death, a made for TV movie about Lester Parsons (Brett Halsey), a psycho who seduces and murders rich widows in order to pay his gambling debts.Starting off with a wonderfully gory scene in which the lethal lothario disposes of his latest victim via chainsaw, mincing machine and hungry hogs, Touch of Death starts promisingly enough, but Fulci soon loses control of proceedings, introducing a weird sub-plot involving a mysterious copycat killer and some heavy handed 'comedic' scenes.

Imagine every stereotypical, overacted cliche from every movie and TV show set on the streets of Brooklyn between 1930 and 1980. Populate it with a cast of interchangeable caricatures instead of actual characters. Throw in a mix of "period" music and wailing electric guitars during the "rumble" scenes. Then pass the time trying to figure out (or care) which of the Deuces is going to be killed in the (anti)climactic final rumble.I'll give this movie points for not being just another romantic comedy, teen slasher, explosive action movie, teen sex comedy, kiddie musical, or Oscar-nomination vehicle.

Some movies you watch and you say, "Well, that made no sense." And you don't really mean it. You're just saying things were overly complicated or slightly nonsensical. "Bread And Circus" makes no sense at all. And I mean it. And that's not because it's surreal. From the start, it's pretty clear it's a feeble excuse to do splatter special effects. There's no script. There's no plot. There's no story of any kind. One event does not lead to the next -- that's how fundamental the bad writing is here.So what?
