I've spent quite a while going through all the reviews for this film. I'm in total agreement with almost every reviewer in saying that Noah's Ark is crap, crap, crap, crap, crap! Don't the executives at NBC have any class? I feel sick to my stomach for actually watching both parts of this mini-series. The script is so dumb, so pointless, and yes, TOTALLY INACCURATE! I can understand making a few changes for dramatic purposes, but this film changed just about everything in the story.

If a copy of this movie fell into the wrong hands, the world would be in grave danger. I am a huge fan of "B" movies, and I have seen my share of bad ones, but there is not a letter in the alphabet that could adequately describe this rancid piece of solidified puke. This movie even surpasses the "so bad it's good" phase and goes straight on to the "so bad your world will seem a little less meaningful for having watched it" phase.It is hard to say what is more disturbing: .1.

I was rather disappointed . The first Tetsuo made me an INSTANT Tsukamoto fan , from the first 5 mins of it . I’ve seen a few Tetsuos in anime, but nothing I’ve found as fun as Tsukamoto . I’m sure the anime will be good enough for someone to keep an eye out for but I’ve seen nothing else that looks even close . This is a good series though. It was a good idea for them to make Tsukamoto as the protagonist, but I like him the way he is right now .

I realize the line on my summary is not too polite.This film written & directed by Scott Caan & starring Paul Giamatti as a New York police detective trying to get revenge on some of his former friends. The characters are not real, but we get some of the actors' reactions in real time. I really liked Paul Giamatti. I have not been as invested in the movie as the reviews. I know Paul Giamatti is really a good actor. I want to like this movie and be happy with it, but I will wait for reviews before I say.

I looked forward to seeing this movie, because the trailer made it look so cool. But the fact is that this movie is boring, and totally muddled. There is no plot, and half the movie is fast flashing shots from football games. Zoomed in shots, that gives you no overview of the games. I was constantly looking at the timer, to see when the movie was over!There's only ONE good thing about this movie. The sound!! The soundtrack is awesome! .............Don't expect anything from this movie.

When this show began it was fairly interesting: we got to see what crab boat fisherman had to go through during the crab-catching season. Soon after, however, it lost focus on the fishing and focused almost entirely on the drama in the lives of the fisherman. Episodes became nothing more than 'the captain doesn't like the new greenhorn' (this one happens way too often), 'someone is injured or sick', 'a fisherman gets word of some problem at home and is frustrated that he is stuck on a boat', repeat.

I seriously don´t know why this movie got such a hostile reception when it was first released . Sure , some people really liked the film but there were also critics who hated it , saying that they had seen enough violence in films like that and it should have been more realistic . and , for those who haven't seen it yet , don't let it get between your teeth at a movie theater . now , with this movie , not many people have seen it . the reason for that , of course , is that it was a film that was made in the 1970s .

Tediously long dreary cinematic waffle . I could n't believe how bad this film was . I watched it merely three times, and I just kept thinking to myself 'how the heck was this so bad.' The acting was bad, the acting was bad . I'm not a huge Tarantino fan at all, but I thought I'd give this movie another try. I figured the movie might get a second chance in the DVD collection after this movie and see what happens, so after this movie is over I will probably just see what I have to watch for the next.

All the reviewers are making one big mistake . This movie was not suppose to be taken seriously.It was made by a director who had never seen a movie before. I don't mean to sound like an idiot, but you know what I mean. This is a movie that I can never watch because of the lack of any entertainment value. It is like watching something that is just an exercise. There are no story elements. There is no interesting characters or interesting plot. This is just something that happens on an extremely boring set of instructions.

It seems to me that a lot of people do n't know that Blade is actually a superhero movie on TV. You don't even have to be in the TV universe to know what the hell is going on. And the movie, well, I mean the trailer is awesome! But the TV show is a totally different story. Well, except for this one, I guess. Not a good one. But it does look like Blade is actually some kind of vigilante, so that makes it okay. It's a great TV show.

I watched the first episode and I found it to be a very wooden performance.I have watched the original from it's early days on Big Girls Blouse to the last series on Channel seven. Kath and Kim was a great Mocumentary and it's humor is something that most people get.However in this American version I found it to be dull, Molly Shannon is to fashionable to be Kath Day, Kath's wardrobe is supposed to be stuck in the 80s with her frizzy perm. While Selma Blair's figure hugging clothes isn't as good as what the original Kimmy wore.

Just saw this at the cinema . I have n't read the books . There is nothing new about this story. The story of a girl in a coma, she wakes up and goes on to find love. This is one that you don't want to read if your not in a coma. It could happen to anybody and could cause some problems. But i think it's a good idea to give your brain some exercise to help it recover. This is not the last time we will read this book.

"Problem Child" was an okay movie, but did it really merit a sequel? I don't think it did. The original movie's only redeeming asset was Gilbert Gottfried, and he wasn't even good in this sequel.I can't really put my finger on why this movie was bad. For starters, it just wasn't funny. Even when I saw this as a nine-year-old, I didn't sympathize with Junior (Michael Oliver) at all. His character came off to me as whiny, self-loathing, and perhaps most importantly, a rebel without a clue.

Deepa Mehta 's `` Fire '' is groundbreaking , bold , and artistic . A masterful social commentary on the state of the Indian caste system that makes it the best Indian film of this decade . The story is based on the real lives of two sisters , one from the south and one from the north of India , who work in the same field. The film was also made in Tamil, Hindi, and Telugu languages . Directed by , who is best known for his movies with his wife Shabana Azmi , it was the last film to be shot with a female cast .

Fred Carpenter screened Eddie Monroe at Boston College, and judging from the enthusiastic response, he has much to be pleased about. A taught, well done Indy, impressive for it's big budget look and feel. This movie has it all: a tight script that grabs you and doesn't let go right up to it's surprise ending. This viewer didn't see it coming! Excellent performances all around. Craig Morris and Jessica Tsunis were were especially well cast in the leads, delivering strong performances. And kudos to Frank Bongiorno and Alex Corrado for creating two detectives as engaging and interesting to watch as any in film.

Follow-up to 1965's "My Name Is Barbra", and shot in brilliant color, "Color Me Barbra" has La Streisand alternating nostalgia, clowning comedy, feminine romantic angst, and beguiling seriousness for a crazy-quilt hour of show-biz razzle dazzle. She's a cut-up and a femme fatale, a sprite and an enigma. With her Egyptian eye make-up and ever-changing hairstyles, she's also a chameleon. Her voice is rich and moving, even if a few of her songs are not ("One Kiss", "Yesterdays").

Julie Delpy stars in this horrific film about a sadistic relationship between a father and a daughter in France of WWI. The story revolves around Jean Valjean, an orphaned child who has lost his mother at the age of four, but who lives on with his father, an officer. His father makes his living as a policeman by raping, beating, and robbing. The daughter has been raised by the man who had her mother killed, and has been forced to do the bidding of the father, as well as that of her father’s older brother.

Solomon and Sheba has come down in Hollywood lore not for the quality of the film , but for the name. And for a director to have to do this , is pretty much a miracle in itself. So you’d think he wouldn’t be allowed to name his movie after the Biblical stories that have inspired it. Instead, he took his time and did it right. But it does take a lot for a director to make this kind of name change happen, you’d think. And the question is why he did it.

This film is much the same as Cannibal Holocaust . If it were n't for the needless animal killing in this film, Cannibal Holocaust would not be so entertaining. You have the opportunity to kill an animal. You get the chance to kill an animal and there's a lot of blood splattered on your shirt. Then you have an opportunity to kill an animal and then you want to get even, you get the chance to kill an animal and have an opportunity to have some blood splattered all over your body, you get the chance to have your throat ripped out and that's it.

The sound is terrible , the picture is worse than worse , the acting is awful , the female leading character is so dumb that I don’t have words for it, I can only wish that she would end up dead, but that’s not the reason for my dislike for the movie , it’s because there is so much that I despise about it ,

In summary

It is a terrible movie. There’s not much that I’ve enjoyed about this movie so I won’t bother listing the reasons why.

I 've just revisited this fondly remembered bit of cinematic madness from my early days , and must urge you to watch it, as you may well enjoy it more than the likes of the great John Frankenheimer . It’s only available to watch on the BBC, but it’s worth checking out. For those that’ve never had the pleasure, there’s little more to it, but for those that know, the story is this. On the morning of a big test for the team, it is discovered that a young woman is pregnant.

2001: A Space Odyssey Is it a sermon? An account of the history of mankind? An exploration of man's futile attempts to advance technology only to have technology destroy him? Is it about the fragile balance of time and space? A lesson in evolution? Or is it just a spectacular effects show; a film Kubrick made only to show us the limitless possibilities of the motion picture and present to us the truth that images are exceedingly more powerful than words? 2001: A Space Odyssey is all of these things.

This is a semi fictional memoir of an "international man" who have witnessed various political upheavals in recent 30 years.I was hoping that this film would offer unique insight into politics and war. I was also hoping that it would be touching and affecting. However, I was disappointed by this film. "Chico" seemed fragmentary, with the main character, Ricardo, staying in one country for 10 to 20 minutes. As could be expected, no detailed storyline could be elaborated in such time frame. The excuses of him moving to another place were often perfunctorily explained.

Aaran is one of the movies where you find the loop holes in Indian Cinema. Here is one good example to show how excellent writers, directors and actors succumb to the producers. Here is one of the most wonderful actors, Mohanlal, acting in a movie about a real story in Kashmir. The seriousness of the film is slaughtered with sub standard comic scenes and songs. There is this character, Havaldar Jaykumar, who in reality, is the son of the producer of the film. Hence, he doesn't have a hair cut despite his officer asking him to do so.

This failed exercise in satire or commentary on the human condition easily earned a place as one of the 10 best of 2008. It also gave rise to the idea that, in a country where there is a long and painful history of social inequality (e.g., racial and class inequalities), the rich should pay higher tax rates for the rich. For some time, there had been much debate in the press and elsewhere on whether this was an accurate analogy. But the fact that Mitt Romney was able to bring it home with this joke at a fundraising event in Florida last year suggests it is not.

The first word i can find to describe this movie is Awful.This movie is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. It is a complete waste of a great movie. If you have not already done so, you should start watching this. Don’t waste your time and money. This movie will make you sick. Plot

We follow the adventures of a young woman whose husband died in a terrible accident. After he dies, she is left with two little children. She moves out of the house and goes on a road trip to take care of the two children.

Beware My Lovely originated from a play written by Mel Dinelli who apparently liked writing about frightened women . His name was the same as a witch’s, and I’ll try to change that, I hope I didn’t put too many links on this post that will be lost, so I’m not sorry. I think it was in the 1920s, I’ve forgotten the year or so now, but I remember being quite young and reading it for the first time, reading it, not knowing what it was about, but knowing that there was a lot to tell.

This was by far one of the worst movies Sandra Bullock has starred in. Ben Affleck should stay behind the camera and continue writing scripts. This is definitely his forte and acting is not. I actually lasted 54 minutes into this movie before I was so bored with it I felt compelled to leave the theater. It's a bore from beginning to, well 54 minutes into the film anyway. The premise of "Guess what happened to me on the way to the ...." has been done over and over to death.

The Ten Steps has basically a reasonably good premise for a scary short but the execution is simply appalling . I won't go into the mechanics of the plot at this stage but I can't help feeling that something went wrong in the first 3 steps and didn't give it a fair chance. The first scene was fairly generic but it soon degenerated into an uninteresting horror movie in which I couldn't figure out what had gone wrong because it all seemed to be going on so smoothly. Next scene was a bit better but again I wasn't getting a good grip on what happened and why.

When naïve young Eddie Hatch, a window dresser at Savory's Department Store, falls for a statue of Venus and gives her a chaste kiss, Venus steps off her pedestal and gives Eddie more than he bargained for. This creaking example of what Hollywood can do to a Broadway musical manages to emphasize the inane story and eliminate most of the first-rate songs. The purpose was to make a safe, popular movie without too much investment while capitalizing on Ava Gardner's upward mobility to super stardom. Robert Walker as Eddie gets lost in a thankless role.

I love his martial arts style, it is quick, close up and oh so fast, but it seems like his movies are becoming more and more crime based lifestyle quality and less meaning...I thought he was out to bring forth a deeper message. At least some of the movies had a hidden meaning or agenda this one had some good redeeming qualities of the character but the rest was so far off. I was very disappointed. The martial arts is also suffering. I am hoping to see a more devoted Segal in his future films.

Dolemite may not have been the first black exploitation flick to come along but it certainly is one of the first that I think stands a very good chance of getting the Best Film award, even though I'm not so sure it should get the award because of its race. I'm actually more worried about the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences not awarding the award to the best film from a minority-controlled company (and that's a tough one to get out of, but at least the Academy can make that call).

lovely . i just love the movie . i want to see this movie because Rupert Grint is a fantastic actor and i have seen this movie in the theater and i love it . !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! this movie is not for everyone but if you like this movie then go and watch it because it will blow your mind away . !!!!!!!!!!!!!

This was a excellent movie. I deal with a child who I am raising that has FAE and watching this movie was more than word can explain. I also purchased the book and it was great. I would like to have a copy for my own use and so I can have my son's teachers watch it also.I would like to know if anyone could sell me a copy of this movie, let me use it for a time or refer me to someone where I could purchase it. Thank You, Myra I would recommend this movie to anyone who deal with children/adults with special ability's.

Max Cash a charter boat captain who works off the Caribbean island San Sebastian is hired by Sarah , who is living on her own for a week on a houseboat. The two go out each day and see the world together. In one of their trips they get to meet new people. But there's a catch: Sarah has to use cash to pay the boat captain's fee. After the couple's tour of the Caribbean they decide to take a trip down the Amazon River. There's no way they can fly downriver, so they take a boat ride.

For connoisseurs of bad movies , Galaxina is a true gem . With truly horrid dialog , acting , and story lines galaxina has it all . There is something about movies like galaxina that makes you fall for a story that is dark . There is no redeeming features or characters that make the movie , great . And that is the part that makes this movie great . _____________________________________

This was a great movie . The acting was bad , the movie didn't work well , and it didn't do justice to the story it was telling . It was really funny , especially when the characters were just being silly .

This movie was boring . Very much like Underworld , only even less interesting . It 's not much of a sequel either , to be honest. I’m beginning to wonder if there’s anyone on the planet who cares. This isn’t a movie about anything at all. This is the first of many sequels of a movie I have never actually seen . Maybe I’m wrong. I will say that I did like the first Underworld movie. And I’m not a fangirl by any means. But I would have liked a more original and interesting movie like that one.

If this film had been directed by DW Griffith or Stanley Kubrick, it would be recognized for what it is: a cinematic masterpiece, told with depth and subtlety and passion, a film with no equal in the visual realm. It is unremittingly stunning and also very brutal in its depiction of our great heritage of greed and annihilation. And of course, what the reviewers could not abide is it doesn't tell a simple narrative dick-and-jane tale like 99% of hollywood output. Its characters are complex and confused by their passions and thoughts, fears and emotions.

This is so bad it will be my contribution to the next bad movie party I go to . It was such a great movie I went in to see it at the last minute and lost all of the money, even though I liked it . So let's talk about the movie. It started out like a comedy movie , but as the day went on it turned into a really good movie, and it's so funny and funny at the same time, so you can't not laugh. So I'm not complaining.

I had a bad feeling when I saw the cheap title work. It only took a couple of scenes to confirm that this movie is a real stinker! The only enjoyment I got out of this was to laugh at the technical flaws (example - the background "car sounds" audio just disappears during the scene with Danny and Dog in Dog's car). Production shows a total lack of imagination (example - slow motion machine gun fire repeats many times). Sandra Bullock plays essentially a bit part, completely unnecessary to the plot.

I have to agree with the previous reviewer . Although the Kristin Erikson did a great job of playing the role of the young woman who has been kidnapped, the ending was disappointing. After being kidnapped at gunpoint in her house, a man shows up in the middle of the day to kidnap her. The kidnapping continues, and at the end the girl and the kidnapper meet face to face. The kidnapper shows her a pistol, but she is unable to touch it because she is unconscious, and it takes a long time for her to recover.

While trying to build a major mall or complex or something like that, a wealthy landowner ignores ancient Native American artifacts buried on the land, and unleashes the Bone Eater...a creature who goes around and kills people in search of his fallen friends or something like that.Indeed this movie had to be a Sci-Fi Channel original. If it wasn't, then the director should never direct anything again. The effects in the film is laughable at best, and the Bone Eater monster is nothing but a CGI-animated being added into the frames at a later date.

"Solomon and Sheba" was the kind of film that you just had to go and see back in the late 50's when I was a kid: a biblical epic spectacular with well known performers, unusual costumes, lots of extras and battle sequences. So I went to see it; but I remember that back then "Solomon and Sheba" didn't impress me at all, which was a strange thing since I had enjoyed a lot "The Ten Commandments", "Quo Vadis", "Helen of Troy" and others.

Punishment Park is a brilliant piece of cinema . Shot in the SouthernCalifornia desert using his patent faux documentary style and a cast of mostly unknown actors you’ll probably be scratching your head for a while after you’ve managed to get through it. In a nutshell Punishment Park is a set piece of film that tries to take the audience on a roller coaster of a ride. After the film has been shown a few times the story seems to slowly begin to build and the story unfolds in a very interesting and suspenseful fashion.

Superhero Movie (2008) is the most recent in the long line over "parody" movie movies which I despise so much. I wish this movie could be the death of the genre, but I know that it isn't awful enough to put the final nail in the coffin.If Meet the Spartans is considered the bottom of the barrel as far as Hollywood movies go, than Superhero Movie is probably near the top. Unfortunately Meet the Spartans was actually miles below the barrel, and this movie just barely makes it in.Superhero Movie has a decent cast of C-list celebs.

What is about mathematical geniuses that get the critics juices flowing ? A BEAUTIFUL MIND wasn ` t up to this. If you know of an individual who has the potential of making significant mathematical breakthroughs in fields such as probability theory and statistics, please send me your recommendation. I will be happy to share them with the public. It is important that these individuals should not become experts in the subject but rather have the curiosity to explore this field and be curious to figure out new things. This should be their main goal in life and be an ongoing process.

It carries the tone of voice that narrates the book into the jungle of Vietnam and into the wild-eyed look of Martin Sheen and Dennis Hopper and the mystical morbidity surrounding Colonel Kurtz. (I don't say Marlon Brando because after watching the documentary, "Hearts of Darkness," I am skeptical as to how much credit Brando is due for that quality). The tone of voice I'm talking about is brooding and dramatic without being overbearing: "Everybody gets what he wants. I wanted a mission, and for my sins they gave me one.

While this is horribly dated , I MUST insist ... PLEASE , NO REMAKE ! Frankly , it just wo... I don't know if you guys have ever been in this situation , but you may want to start making your payments on time , otherwise the next time you look at your email you'll probably see the old email. If you're still holding out you may find yourself with no payment at all in a very short time. I've never actually seen any of this happen, and even if something like this did happen to me I would NEVER make a payment on time.

I have been a huge Errol Morris fan ever since I saw Thin Blue Line and heard it saved a life. To date, this movie is his best piece of work.The plot is a mixing of Stephen Hawking's Book of the same title intertwined with the man's life. The story is told through interviews with family, friends, and Hawkings himself.Don't be fooled; It totally sounds boring but the whole package is dynamic and thought provoking. The blending of life and theories is seamless and thoroughly entertaining. I was particularly moved at how well they humanize this genius and omniscient man.

I totally agree. This is "Pitch Black underground" and a well worn plot. The best scenes I thought were the divers exploring the caves, going through impossible subterranean passageways, some of them were heart pounding. The scenery was great. Had they dispensed with the staple "alien" toothy CGI badboys entirely the movie would have been much better. All they would have had to do is never show any monsters at all but have everyone wondering, and follow Jack's descent into madness, and this might have been a top rate hitchcock-style thriller, maybe award material.

I just saw this at the Castro Theatre in San Francisco and had trouble staying awake during this incredibly repetitive and uninspired play. It was very, very unfunny and predictable, but the audience was very uninterested so I went back to my hotel after watching it. But the theater is very expensive to go to so you can’t blame me. I liked this, but it’s not the only thing that happens when a character dies.

So unfortunately me and my mate watched this ! ! ! It was showing on a Sky channel over here, I just missed it. I've never heard the band. The album was released in 1993. At the time it was available on CD. This was my first album, although I'd have to say the last I remember seeing it was in the 70s in a vinyl re-issue. I always thought they sounded better than the originals, but they didn't sell very well either. This is the only thing I recall from the 70s I liked.
