First , some points : First , this review should be done in 3 parts , and then I'll give an introduction and explain why the movie is so special, but first , to make it a bit shorter , i'm not gonna go through all the things that you should take in the cinema, just a few points to do the movie review better, so if you feel that this review needs more space, I'll do it , and if not, then let's start from scratch.

I just saw this movie for the second time. I first saw it back in the mid-90's as a Vanguard Video selection. It has retained it power.It is interesting from several aspects. One is that it is based on a true story. Two is it is a launching pad for two interesting actors: Keanu Reeves and Crispin Glover. And three, it has Dennis Hopper in one of his better social misfit/psychotic character roles.The movie is also a study in the way people act in different settings. You have characters in one-on-one, family, peer group, school, general society settings, etc.

The only reason I didn't fall asleep during this movie is because the seats were not that comfortable. Hannibal is BORING>BORING> BORING and BORING!!! This film is just dreadful, not because of any violence or graphic mutilations. It's actually quite tame in that regard. The story moves at the speed of a lazy snail. I have the feeling that director Ridley Scott just phoned this one in. The actors are all fine they just needed some direction. The music score is also very annoying. It's especially noticeable since so little is going on in the film.

This is quite possibly the worst documentary I have ever seen. It looked so amateurish. Chris Hegedus was one of the Directors of The War Room which was a great movie (albeit a little one sided), but it looked beautiful. Startup.com looked like it was shot in some guy's basement. The quality was so pitiful that I couldn't stand watching it. I saw about 30 minutes or so and I had to take it back to Blockbuster and get something else. I can't understand how something so amateurish some from someone like Chris Hegedus.

**Possible Spoilers Ahead**Whenever fans of bad movies congregate for more than a few minutes, a name that invariably comes up is that of Larry Buchanan. This amazing director has given us remakes of other turkeys (ZONTAR THE THING FROM VENUS), cheap-jack crime dramas like A BULLET FOR PRETTY BOY, and tawdry conspiracy flicks like DOWN ON US and GOODBYE NORMA JEAN. THE LOCH NESS HORROR is a humdinger to say the least. Overlooking the fact that Loch Ness is extremely long and narrow, Larry filmed this howler on a wide and round California lake.

Being a bit of a connoisseur of garbage , I have stumbled across this little treasure . Action , romance , and intrigue . . . I may be biased but I have found this to be my cup of tea . So let me start with some disclaimers first . First, this is not the first time I have seen it , as this story came into my possession through my friend who happened to run a website dedicated to collecting vintage and rare books . In addition, it has a few minor spelling and word problems which are easily fixed.

My mistake for thinking this was a serious war-is-hell movie prior to seeing it . That all ended seconds into the screening I thought it was a comedy! But it's really not at all that bad a comedy. I wouldn't want to call it a horror film either, it could be worse. There are good scares in this. I think it could be better. I just think they did a fine job of keeping a consistent narrative going with the characters and plot line. I don't really want to talk about it too much because I've seen more than I can list.

This is one of the movies one has to start watching with an open mind . One knows it 's a horror movie but does not know exactly how to approach it . The main character of this movie is a woman who is suffering from a heart problem . This is one of the movies one has to watch before reading any other comments . If you want to see it you have to start watching it . If you have no interest in horror movies then just turn the sound off . There is not much of it so you have to have patience .

Ted Nicolaou made a lot of great horror and fantasy films . I am looking for all his films to have a full synopsis of every movie that he has directed or written or both. He is the man who was the first in this world to be named the greatest horror and fantasy writer of all time. He wrote his first novel at 14 and became a full fledged author at 19, writing more than 40 books. His newest book was the best selling fantasy/horror novel ever and one of my favorite horror novels, it has a sequel that I would like to see.

Korean cinema has the ability to turn genres on its head, and the latest by the celebrated director Chan-wook Park is a tale of a good pious priest who becomes a vampire. Add a temptress leading him astray and a cast of eccentrics and you have a wonderful recipe.Directed in part in a style similar to the "Sympathy" trilogy it's as sumptuous as it is dark. Steering clear of cliché it does offer some new tricks in the overdone vampire genre. Its an existential movie trying to capture the moral conundrum of how exactly a person has to choose to live with their conditions rather than revel in the blood lust.

I wanted to like this movie . I really , really did . I was so excited when I saw it . I had read the books . I have been watching some of the older movies with my kids . But I was a little hesitant about watching the new movie . I was a little hesitant to see how this new movie would look . I was also a little concerned that some people were going to hate it . But after seeing it . I was surprised at how it came across . Everyone seemed to enjoy it . And I was happy to see how well written this movie was .

The Mod Squad isn't a movie, it's a void. That's the most fascinating thing about it and the thing that kept me watching  I'd never seen a film that offered absolutely nothing before. It's a film without any reason to exist whatsoever, seemingly consciously designed to appeal to no-one as if made purely as a contractual obligation to someone the studio really dislike. There is no plot, there is no characterisation, there are no set piece action scenes, there aren't even any scenes as such, just a progression of increasingly empty shots projected at 24 frames per second.

At first sight , I must say already , watch The Contractor , 2007 . With Wesley Snipes too . But as we know he’s in another movie already . I really like this film . The main cast is awesome , especially Snipes . The main storyline is great , and I was really touched by the end scene . The acting is top-notch , and I think the director has a lot of great ideas in his movie . The story is good , I liked it . The script isn’t amazing , but the story is nice . The music in this film is amazing .

I'm from Texas so I thought I knew big hair, but the female villain in this movie had humongous hair. Whenever she was on the screen I couldn't concentrate on anything but her hair. Take about stage presence! There seemed to be a lot of people with hearing problems in this movie also. There was a traffic warden writing out a parking ticket who somehow didn't notice the owner plunging toward the car screaming at the top of his lungs until he hit the car. Then there was a guy in a phone booth who couldn't hear a huge bulldozer coming at him until it was 5 feet away.

This is not exactly what I would call a Mad Max film, after seeing Road Warrior and experiencing the excellence of that film, I felt somewhat disappointed after seeing this. It supposedly started out as some kind of kids in the wilderness film, and was merged with the Mad Max franchise(bad idea). The casting was not exactly the best, I mean come on Tina Turner? One of the main problems with this film is that there are no good villains. No Wez, no Humungus, not even a decent Toecutter!

The Brighton has a traumatic drama in the breast of their family: the twenty years old Emily Brighton (Taylor Roberts) is retarded due to a fall when she was one, and her overprotective mother Martha Brighton (Amy Madigan) blames her negligence for the accident. The seventeen years old Evie Brighton (Lauren Ambrose) loves her sister and reads poems and stories for Emily. Their father Harry Brighton (John Savage), a bank investor, lives in the basement with his models of trains and railroads. Evie mysteriously sabotages her interviews for different universities being rejected, and teaches the poetries of her own to Emily.

Well , I 've just seen Buster Keaton 's film debut in Fatty Arbuckle 's The Butcher Boy and-despite the fact that I've seen Fatty a dozen times I don't think I could get through that film without having a whole lot of respect for Fatty. Well , in this film, Fatty Arbuckle is actually an evil-doer. Fatty 's father has a gambling and drug business that he runs down to Florida and Fatty has to work for a living, and Fatty has to fight for his life in a gambling and drug racket. That 's pretty much my idea of evil.

I acquired this film a couple of years ago and on trying to find some info about it I found out that this is not the first film to make use of this concept. In fact, this film does not use this technique, but the only difference in this case was that there was no "bad guy". The bad guy here was not the alien, this time there was no alien in the equation. The alien was a man with a bad attitude who tried to impress his colleagues by claiming he knows how to use a computer, so they should give him the money he asks for.

Started watching this but did n't believe in any of the characters . In particular the relationship between the bakery and the bakery owner. It was very interesting and the plot twists were done really well. I would definitely recommend this series to my friends. I am also interested to watch the season 2. I am looking forward to more twists and surprises. The acting was top notch! I have never been so hooked on a TV show as I have this. I've watched it twice and I can't stop watching it.

David Cronenberg 's ` eXistenZ ' is a well designed reflection of the philosophy of existentialism . It addresses the subject matter from a philosophical perspective and not from a political one. In addition, the film takes the viewer on a tour of the film sets. This is an ideal way for a filmmaker to show off his or her talent as a visual thinker. I would rate ` eXistenZ a 7 out of 10 for its visual quality and attention to detail. As a result of the attention to detail, Cronenberg also employs his unique style of film making in his films.

This is probably the best movie from director Hector Babenco. It shows a Brazilian reality unknown by foreigners, which is the same reality that haunts all of the Latin American countries, poverty and a survival instinct. The most affected in this reality is the children usually left orphans, or abandoned by their poor parents have to make it in a "dog eat dog" society many times falling into the gap of delinquency, prostitution and crime. Very well acted and with a "no frills" approach, this movie will get to you, Great story plot, a must have movie on anybody's collection.

I hope the writer , director , editor , and composer ( and let 's not forget producer ) read this post. For those of you interested in this film , read this :

If you don't already know, it's the most awesome film I've seen in awhile. In case you haven't watched it , it's a remake of the 1973 classic, "Jaws ". I think it's a film you need to see at least once, and not just in the theater. Why? 1 . It's in 3D!

Some movies you 'll watch because they touch your soul or challenge you in ways that grow.Some you 'll watch for the sake of learning, some because you have to see the end, some for fun.Whatever it is you watch, whatever it is you see, there is something here for you. We are here to tell you why. It’s about the story, the characters, the conflicts. It is all about you.It's about what really matters, not whether you think you will like it or you will find the time to watch it. There is always time.

Last night, I saw A PECK ON THE CHEEK (KANNATHIL MUTHAMITTAL with English subtitles). Oddly, it was 137 minutes long--slightly longer than the time listed on IMDb.At first, I found myself losing interest in this film because the rather confusing style of filming really lost me. The context for what was occurring was missing and I am glad I stuck with it. At the beginning, a young couple is married and shortly after the wedding, war breaks out in their native Sri Lanka and the lovers are separated. Months later, the wife is very pregnant and on board a refugee vessel heading to India.

Got the chance to see this at a friend's house today, and was impressed with what it achieved on such a small budget. Not that this ever bothered me anyway, since I love low budget sci-fi like Dr Who, Blake's 7 and Dark Star. Hell, even Outland wasn't a big budget affair, so whilst money helps, it takes more than throwing cash at things to make them good.The story is straightforward at first, with a group of mercenaries paid to escort a prisoner through space. Their ship is attacked and they are forced to land on the nearest planet.

As a Genghis Khan `` fan '' I was looking forward to this movie . After devouring Conn Igguldens epic I came away with the impression that, if this film were to have a similar quality to it, it would be a great martial art film. As with many martial arts films, the acting in this movie is not very good . Not a great action movie or an action film with a bad special effects, this is an epic fantasy with a lot of special effects . The acting in this film is quite average at best.

I would like to thank you for giving me a chance to be one of the first to actually view the film. It really does grip you. John Paul does eventually get to see the light and make a life for himself away from being tied to his mothers apron strings.I imagine there must be so many families these days in the same position (especially with children leaving home older but I wouldn't say wiser) with very sad parents who haven't really got lives of their own and who make their lives a misery.I think this film should definitely have a wider audience.

I've read plenty of Jane Austen in my time and approve of several cinema/TV adaptations but this one we just don't need.Rating is a 2 as I wouldn't say it's awful just so boring you will feel like you've wasted 90 minutes of your life. Dull script matched by even duller acting. I've heard Billie Piper is OK in Dr Who (not a fan so can't confirm) but in this she just sucks. There is absolutely no chemistry between the leads. This is Austen, it's supposed to be a romance!Please don't let this put you off Austen or historical dramas.

This horror tale takes place in the Namib Desert of Africa. A Canadian systems analyst, Zach Straker(Scott Bairstow)is sent on an assignment for a diamond mining company. Although he hates field work, he finds himself in a truck with a rescue unit in the open desert fighting sand flies and whipping, blowing sand. Four diamond prospectors are found...well whats left of their scattered bones are discovered. During a long cold desert night a shape-shifting monster makes its appearance. Zach and his colleagues are terrified when their truck is stranded and members of the unit are dying horribly one by one.

Just watched this on DVD three times - Once the 'normal ' way , once with the scenes in consecutive order . So, what I am wondering is if I am correct to say this is the same shot in the film as in the first 'normal ' way' , and therefore should the same shots be spliced between the two . And also if I am correct that it is possible to cut between the scenes in consecutive order ? This is the DVD:
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0119019/
The scene I am referring to is at 00:25 - 00:31 .

I know it 's rather unfair to comment on a movie without seeing the complete piece - but I am not sure how to proceed on this one. The story is well done, I just don't know what the ending is. It has elements of a "what if?" type story, but without any indication of what may come next (and I think that is the best part of the film, as it keeps us guessing as to what happens.) In short, I think that this film is worth a view, but I do not know if I am prepared to pay for it.

There are a whole lot of movies, primarily from the 80s, that are so terrible that you can't help but love them. The Last Slumber Party is one of those. I hate this movie so much, but it still remains one of the most watched movies in my collection. I have watched it countless times and get a huge laugh out of it every time. It is the prime example of how in the 80s, ANY movie could get released.Our killers name is Maniac Randles. (Scary, huh?)

Do n't get me wrong , I assumed this movie would be stupid , I honestly did , I gave up on watching this movie after like 2-3 minutes , I guess I was wrong , I am going to give it a watch now , I love this film , I think it is an original concept and I am glad it is not over produced or whatever people think it is about . __________________

The best way to get to know someone, is to live with them for a long time

This is what you have to do to be loved
This is the path you have to follow.

I simply can not understand how any Who fan , or just plain anyone could find this awful , lazy, and boring plot to be anything that they enjoy or even enjoy at all . First of all , it is utterly unbelievable , impossible , unfathomable how a fan of any sort, who is even a casual fan, could enjoy this . And if you think about the rest of the story and how all of the main characters act and react , what in the world is wrong with any fan to actually enjoy it .

I suppose I like this film as well as any I know ; it is not perfect , but under normal circumstances I wouldn't have minded if I had seen it a bit sooner. But this is a film for those who have seen it and liked it, I can't help it : it's great for me ; a film that leaves the past behind, and moves forward, and the characters are as real as the situations they face. I am not a film buff or a hollywood expert, so this is only a film review, but I would suggest that it is an example for film novices.

Another great musical from Hollywoods Golden Age! I liked this movies story about a trio of friends who are performers at a small nightclub that is far from Broadway and all its glitter. Although not the big time they are very content with their lives and the small club where they perform. Gene Kelly plays the owner of the small club and is also the boyfriend of one of its dancers, Rita Hayworth who happens to garner some attention when she's given an opportunity to be on a cover of a magazine. Trouble begins for Gene Kelly as his girlfriend is now the talk of the town.

Ever since I first encountered the Divine Ms Merkerson as a sex therapist in Spike Lee 's `` She 's All That'' I have been captivated by the power she has to inspire us with the beauty and power of her own voice. I first saw this on Spike Lee 's ``The Haves and the Have Nots'' and again on his later ``The King of Queens'' where I was introduced to a woman who used her sexuality as a platform to speak her truths. This has since been expanded and re-written into a series of films by the likes of Quentin Tarantino, Spike and many more.

* * * * MILD SPOILERS _ BUT YOU PROBABLY KNOW THE PLOT * * * * Woman gets raped by a man who is also his lover. * * *

* * * * * *

The woman is in her apartment and she goes into a bathroom to use the bathroom but she finds that the water she is using has a foul smell and so she turns on the shower. As the shower water comes through the window the woman turns and looks out the window and sees that it is raining heavily and so she opens the shower doors and steps into the shower.

Firstly , I am a huge fan of crap films . B grade is always good for a laugh . This one is no different , I am sure we all know the story by now. I am a big fan of this one , as I am a film buff and I watch these films for many reasons. I watched this because I wanted to see an old film from the golden age. The film is directed by a British director called John Lenson and it tells the tale of a young boy who is left alone in an empty house after his mother died .

When I first saw Stella on comedy central I thought "god, this is horrible!" But I loved Wet Hot American Summer. So I knew something didn't make sense. There was nothing left for me to do but search out for the Stella shorts which I had heard contained more dildos than any other comedy troupe out there. When I found them not only were my dildo expectations met, but I found probably the greatest comedy scenes I've seen in years. The set of twenty odd short films put me on the edge of my seat with water running down my legs.

"Valley Girl" launched Nicolas Cage's career and was an 80's version of "Romeo and Juliet." It is a definite example of an 80's teen classic. Nicolas Cage, Deborah Foreman and Elizabeth Daily all have brilliant portrayals in this movie, but it will never top "Fast Times at Ridgemont High" as the ultimate 80's teen flick because if it weren't for "Fast Times," then the 80's generation of teen flicks would just be a big blow to the head. That's for sure.

Loved this movie! Kicking it old school! Love the idea. Love the script. Love the characters. I really really really loved the Geeks! I was excited to see the silly slapstick horror flicks still being honored. This was right up with my favs such as Saturday the 14th and Pandemonium. If you are a big fan of scary AND silly then this is your movie! Only taken off one star because I would love to have had better sound. Not bad sound but would have liked to have more. Great blood splatters. Great murder weapons. Great costumes!

When I think of a 1970s-period film , this is not what I think of . I do n't want to use the term retro , but this is a film so old that I don't think it should be called that anymore . I'll be honest. I have only seen two films of note from this period -- "Star Trek: I, II, and III " and "2001: A Space Odyssey" , and I find them both incredibly boring . I suppose they had their merits as classics, but to call them timeless works that are so uninteresting is kind of silly.

Just what is the point of this film ? It starts off as one film , then changes track , goes back and changes track and changes track again , just in order to be more than just an hour long film. Well, you can't go wrong with any of the directors. There's something about Robert Altman, with his great films like The Player, Being There (not his best but still a fine film), Blue Jasmine and many others that make them all worth watching. I think it's what they're all about, and that's why I'll watch anything they direct.

This movie was painfully awful . Most of the movie consisted of people running in the woods , walking thru the woods, and playing in the woods . No action , no emotion . The only thing that was good about this movie was some great shots in the woods. The main thing I thought about while watching it was the acting . They all seemed to get the same treatment . My favorite part of this movie , was seeing all the people , kids, families , friends . The entire family is in the movie .

I would like to submit the following goof.During the bridge scene , soldiers are seen wading out in the river as if they are trying to find a way out. At the water's edge, there are no soldiers and the scene is set up perfectly, but it could be any of several things:1) the scene was meant to be shot as-is.2) the scene was meant to be shot wth the camera still attached. (I'm not sure which is the most likely, but both are equally likely).3) it's an artistic license used to set up the shot.

To be honest , I did never read one of the comics and can not remember part 2 and 3 of the comics at all , I guess it was that I didnt have it with me that time. I have read both and i must say it is rather good. The first one i read i read and i was not that impressed , i just could not get enough . But after reading this comic i got more interested in it. I am not a huge fan of horror comics and this one caught my attention, I will definetely try this one out .

This movie was astonishing how good it was ! The plot is extraordinary , and the acting spectacular . At the same time the film is extremely entertaining, funny, and touching ! The way it is written and acted make it even more entertaining and enjoyable ! And as I mentioned in the previous review the soundtrack is excellent . The score by John Barry is excellent too ! As I mentioned in the review it's a movie about two people and their love and life ; and in this movie this theme is beautifully played . I found the film very funny and entertaining .

( HR is what Himesh is called in the movie , I think he likes it too . ) It’s going to be interesting to see him try to use all the elements in his game. He should be a very difficult player to play against. He isn’t the strongest guy in the team, but he’s good enough to be able to play with both the forwards and the defencemen. It was a decent match between a couple of good teams, there was nothing really spectacular in it, but a good game nonetheless.

I was very disappointed in this film . The director has shown some talent in his other endeavors , but he seems to lack the talent of a true director. The action sequences , the special effects and even the script seem like he took a shot on the Titanic and the ship is sinking . But it doesn't make a damn bit of difference , it's just a movie made for a film . The story line and the acting is so boring that I wouldnt bother with it . Nothing much happens and the script and the plot is barely believable .

SPOILER WARNINGWe've all heard the "Boy Who Cried Wolf" legend. But what if the wolf was a person in the modern world. Well it might be something like Big Fat Liar. Fourteen-year-old Jason Sheperd ( Frankie Muniz from "Malcolm in the Middle" ) is always lying to keep himself out of trouble. One day he is pressured to write an English essay, but it winds up in the hands of sleazy film-maker Marty Wolf ( Paul Giamatti ) who plans to turn Jason's story into a Hollywood blockbuster. No one believes Jason when he for once tells the truth and he ends up in summer school.

Next stop on our journey through the calender-slasher scene is ... oh yes , `` Graduation Day '' ! All of you who know me can tell you know I have a crush on John Legend , but there was a time when I hated him. I mean ... I don't know what he was, I just don't like him ! So you can imagine how my feelings turned after this video. After all , I can't dislike someone I really love , right ? But to say I don't like John Legend because I didn't even know him when I first saw that video is a bit insulting.

The narrative was clear and concise but overall the film never caught my interest- scenes felt flat and uninspired.. Ghengis khan, historically speaking, had a very interesting/epic life but the film failed to capture that- instead focused on small skirmishes as a youth and a love story I think I've seen disguised in a slew of other films. I never felt sympathy nor empathy for the lead- yes he had to overcome slavery but then seemed to have an easy ride to khan- pillaging, killing and double crossing his way to the top.

I loved the film "Eddie Monroe". The film had all the components that kept me interested while watching it. I especially loved the plot twists along the way and the surprising ending. Craig Morris has Brad Pitt potential both in looks and talent. His blue eyes reminded me of Paul Newman's. Fred Carpenter took this movie to a new level.I loved the cast. The music score, cinematography, talent, locations and script were awesome. I loved seeing some of my favorite actors in Eddie Monroe. Fred Carpenter is an incredibly talented and gifted director.

Irene Jacob is mesmerizing in this final installment of Krzysztof Kieslowski 's trilogy and the story is infinitely satisfying as it progresses. It's a beautiful film and I love the way that director and screenwriter find the appropriate balance in the third instalment. I have to say I didn't know quite how much I loved it before I saw it but I'm still thoroughly enjoying it so far. In this third Krzysztof Kieslowski story, two of the most pivotal figures in his life come face to face, one with the truth and one with the lies.

This movie was so awful that I can't even describe it. I was amazed that I even sat through this pile of trash. I couldn't believe that a movie like this was even thought of. It was a about a serial killer that clucks like a chicken. He doesn't just cluck a couple of times, he clucks non-stop through out the whole movie. He even flaps his arms like a chicken which is even stupider than anything I have ever seen. I couldn't believe this came out in 1990. I thought it came out in the early '80's or something.

OK , I 've now seen George Zucco in at least four separate horror/suspense films recently as I worked my way through his latest two and a half hour feature film . the story is about two guys that are out on a very special fishing trip out of town . one is an experienced angler with a deep knowledge of his craft and who has made it a profession to fish . the other one is a new guy that just moved to town who is just getting into the fish business , but doesn 't know as much about it as his old friend .

I'd heard about this movie, but didn't see it until my daughter, who saw it on a flight to Australia, told me it was a great movie. I was interested in seeing whether Rupert Grint, away from Harry Potter, was showing the promise you see in the Potter movies. I wasn't disappointed. He's become a fine actor, showing a range in Driving Lessons from a shy boy being beaten down by an over-bearing obsessive mother, to a young man finding himself to be worthy of his own, and other's, esteem.

First, let me confess that I have not read this particular Balzac novel, so maybe I am directing my cavils unfairly at director and editor. Still my experience with Balzac in other stories is that he writes as a realist, not an obscurantist. This is most certainly a film worth one's while, but one is left sorely puzzled at the end. Was the Colonel a fraud, used by the lawyer for his own ends (or for whose beyond himself); or was the Colonel not a fraud, but used as aforesaid by the lawyer; or did the lawyer truly try to serve the honest Colonel?

This is no walk in the park . I saw this when it came out , and have n't had the opportunity or the money to see it since. So I am not to sure where you are right now, but I hope you find what you need. I will continue to be on the look out for the same and I can tell you this is going to be worth it. Keep up the good fight, you have some great talent and that will never go away, but until it is proven, it will always be an unknown .

I have always loved old movies but this is one of my top ten favorites...it has all the charm, 1940's quaintness, and good old fashioned romance and it's hilarious, to boot! Barbara Stanwick plays an independent single woman who writes cooking\home life articles for a famous magazine...under the premise that she is a married homemaker. Even the president of the magazine is under this delusion. Enter a handsome GI, (played by the talented Dennis Morgan)just rescued off of a raft along with his buddy.

I have a 4yr old daughter , and before this movie she was all about the Disney princesses , now that my daughter is an older girl she is all about the real princesses . I was looking to find some new princesses , so this movie came at the perfect time . One of the princesses is a little girl who has to keep a secret , she wants to tell her parents when she's older but is afraid of what will happen . There are also 3 older princesses that have to protect the young princess who has to keep her secret .

His music , especially what we hear of it here , is very slow . From around the time of the ' 70s and the beginning of the '80s through the late '80s . It took a while to get going . There was a time when I was listening to it over and over , sometimes , for hours in a row . And then, I had stopped , and I was just like , ' What's the point of it all , ' . I started thinking about it again and it started coming back . It came back again in the early 1990's and it came back even further .

Lackawanna Blues is a moving story about a boy who is raised in a house by some pretty unusual people. It's editing and soundtrack really pulls you in to the story and lets you experience the film the way the writer really meant for it to be seen.The music really tied into the story, which made the characters come to life. The editing made the story more progressive and captivating. I was also surprised by some of the performances of the cast, most notably S. Epatha Merkerson's.I can't wait to see the one man show featuring this films writer, Ruben Santiago-Hudson.

If I could give this excuse for a film a 0 or negative rating I would . I was stupid and did this because it was the only way I could justify my presence in the film. But, if I could’ve found another way, it would be a 1 or a 3. However, this film had to do a few things right before I would give the film a 0. Let’s be honest, this may be the first film I have ever seen that did not make me laugh or cry. That is a huge compliment!

Anyone who knows anything about evolution would n't even need to see the film to say `` fake '' . You just know that the movie is so convincing you will think it is true, which is why so few people actually like it . This is especially true when you consider how many people do not actually know that the film is a fake . In fact, I think the film has been used as a propaganda tool against evolution . If you watch it , you should know what the film is all about . It is definitely not meant to be believed .

The 1998 version of `` Psycho '' needed to be set back in the 60 's , rather than present itself in 1998. But when you get to that point, it isn't quite as bad. For example, there's a little bit more of the 80's in the story. And then you get to something I've always liked in my ''Shades '' stories: you can have two people in this world and then you can have a relationship. In this one, it seems to be sort of a marriage between a woman and her mother.

My girlfriend wanted to see this (lol this is the case a lot)...so I rented it. Then I saw how acclaimed this was nominated for 10 Oscars. GREAT! this should be good ol' drama. This movie had a lot of potential...the direction and the way everything was paced was very well. But once the movie ended, I couldn't help but ask myself if this story was really worth making a film for. Virginia Hill (Annette Bening) was EXTREMELY annoying, I just couldn't tolerate her character at all.

It 's the 1980 's and the teenagers are ready to party it up in a scary old house that has the kind of potential that makes it a place you can't escape from, but with enough room for all the adults to come. It is a home that is part of history and has the potential to inspire the next generation to create a home of their own. The home is in a little town that is known all over the world. It is very close to many of the major cities, yet it remains an all-too-familiar and scary town to many.

When King Kong stripped her of her top in the 1976 remake, I was breathless. I don't know how many times I went back to see that movies hoping to see more. Jessica Lange was not a great actress then (She became one), but she was so hot! I went to see "Sweet Dreams" when it came out because, by that time, Ms. Lange had become a great actress. It looked like a wonderful story. And she's always exciting to see.I never walked out of a movie faster.

I believe the reason this movie did not get the recognition it deserves is because of the many misconceptions of it, especially the portrayal of its characters. The only two things we can really say about this movie is the fact that all of the characters are completely unlikable, as the movie is about an abusive mother who abuses her children in every way possible. These children grow up and are able to do anything that a normal parent would do in the eyes of the public, but the abuse that this mother does to them is just disgusting.

This is the last film of Krzysztof Kieslowski - one of the greatest directors in the history of cinema . It tells the story of an artist whose mind is torn between his life's work and the pain of losing one of his most precious friends. The film follows the artist from the very beginning and shows how he slowly evolves from being an artist on the edge into a master of his craft. The film tells of an intense struggle between his artistic and his personal needs and wants. The film tells the story of a great artist whose life is shattered by a tragic accident.

- Contains 1 spoiler, market with: ***** -Not presenting itself as yet another remake of "The Interview", Five Fingers actually is. Alas, besides maybe the hardship of physical torture, it never adds anything to it's predecessor's accomplishment in terms of suspense, plot or performances. In fact, Five Fingers never gets anywhere near its level. What I found to be in particular painful to watch wasn't the torture itself, but the way Martijn (Ryan Philippe) acted out his ordeal.

I'm a bit spooked by some of these reviews praising A.K.A. Not only do they sound as if they were written by the same person, but they contain all kinds of insider information that surely you could only find by reading the press book from cover to cover. Please don't tell me that the director is writing his own reviews as that would just be too sad to contemplate. Afraid I'm another one of those who hated the film and was surprised by its unapologetic amateurism. Great idea, shame about the execution.

The most die-hard worshippers of John Wayne will cringe when they watch The Lawless Frontier . Even for a poverty-stricken area like western Kentucky, Wayne's films had a huge following, and they became classics. But that's only the beginning of the story. There is a whole world of Wayans' movies to explore here, and not just his Westerns. For example, Wayne's three-hour The Shootist, with its complex story, is a great film about the complex nature of man. It also explores an important theme of the twentieth century: race.

This film is a cash in. A cash in reliant on a rousing theme tune created for an earlier classic. Yul Brynner has long since jumped ship and so have most of the production values. Lee Van Cleef takes over the lead role of Chris. I can't think of any actor who looks less like Brynner than Van Cleef. Hey, he could have at least shaved off his hair and lost the moustache, just for the sake of continuity. Some correctional centres show this movie in order to punish offenders. One step out of line and The Magnificent Seven Ride!

i have lost count as to how many times i have watched this movie . i 've never grown tired watching this movie . and every time i get bored by the end, i watch it over and over . but that's not why i watch it . i 've become a movie watcher and i love to read book on my kindle . i love the book and the movie . but i 've never watched the movie on DVD . i can tell you that this is one movie i will never stop watching . this is the story of two lovers and this is love .

A tedious effort from not-yet great director Budd Boetticher and pretty but not-yet un-bland actress Nina Foch , this movie, directed by James Gray and starring a very capable, if not brilliant cast, is worth your time. It's set in the not-too-distant past, and it's really not a bad way of spending an afternoon - though the ending is a bit anticlimactic. It's probably best to skip ahead to the trailer below. The film's plot is pretty simple - there's an old woman who, after having had her baby, is looking for her daughter.

Unlike most of the reviewers of this particular movie , I 'm really not the much of a Cynthia Rothrock fan (she's not really my type, as I don't have many favorite movies or anything, I've seen about 10 or so, and I can't say I love them all) . There is one thing I do know about her: she is one of the nicest and quietest people I've ever seen on screen and I have been watching films for a very long time now and I have never felt like I was getting into a bad conversation with her.

i was having a horrid day but this movie grabbed me , and i could n't put it down until the end of the second act. I don't know what happens in the second act but it's awesome. I will probably watch the other half of the movie now that the ending is out but i don't know if it will be able to make me watch the rest of the movie since i won't be able to go back and watch everything from start to end. I hope they make more movies out of this and it makes them so much money.

I am a huge fan of the Farcry Game , HUGE fan . It still holds a place in my heart today and is one of my favourite games that I can recall having in my childhood. It was a simple 2D game that I could actually learn and play with my friends while we sat on the grass of our front yard , or on the porch of our house. It was my very favorite game back in my early to mid teens and my friends and I had been playing it for many years before we came to know the name.

Sure, most of the slasher films of the 1980's were not worth thecelluloid they were filmed on, but this video nightmare may well bethe dullest produced.Six horny pot smoking students decide to go camping. Of course,and you know this already, they begin getting killed one by one by amysterious stranger. The climax has a hunky forest ranger trying toget to the teens in time before the last cute girl becomes buzzardbait.John Carl Buechler, my least favorite B-movie guy, did the lousymakeup effects here. The cast features Carel Struycken, of "TheWitches of Eastwick" and the Addams family movies.

This morning , I found myself unexpectedly remembering that this movie existed . I found myself thinking , `` Oh, I remember that. It's not a great movie. It's really not . It's not what you would have expected.``

If you haven't watched it yet, let me explain what it is all about. The movie is called The Room and it is a story about a man named David and a girl named Rosemary who live in a room and they go on a very weird adventure together. And you really should watch it.

Regarded as another one of the recent over-the-top drama 's brought upon us by Hollywood , this movie excels where many of the others have not. From the opening scene to the end credits, this is an entertaining movie with just a little more edge to it. This movie has just the right amount of heart and emotion and a few good laughs that make this movie feel like one of the better recent films. I actually enjoyed this one a lot more than other recent movies on Netflix and I would definitely suggest checking this one out if you're looking for something a little bit different from everything else out there.

A very good film, focusing on a very important issue. Fetal alcohol syndrome is a very serious birth defect that is totally preventable. If more families saw this film, perhaps more children would not end up like Adam. Jimmie Smits performs in one of his best roles ever. This is an excellent movie that takes into account a very special family with very important needs. This is not unlike thousands of families that exist in the United States today. There are children struggling with this world wide. The really important point here is that it all could have been prevented.

This movie has an outstanding acting , by Marilia Pêra , and a stunning dicretcion by the argentine Hector Babenco , which was not to be seen anywhere else. This film should be played by the same actors in Argentina. The Argentines have always been excellent at showing off their own talent in films and I had no doubt of that when I first saw this movie. This movie should have been shown in the cinemas of Argentina when it first came out. I hope that the Argentines do see the error of their ways and start showing their films to the rest of the world.

I really love this movie. It has a very real feel to it. I believe it was never popular because of the subject matter, however, because of the subject matter, it makes the movie all that much more important.This is an "A" movie and I recommend it highly. If you liked "1984" book or movie, I think you will like this one as well.This is harsh, to say the least, including mental and physical acts of torture, some pretty vile. Not for the week at heart or stomach.

Give director Stanley Tong of Jackie Chan 's Super Cop and Rumble in the Bronx , and what do you think? It's funny that you have to ask this question, because I had no idea Jackie Chan could pull of stunts as well as he does. In the film I wrote about recently, there was a scene involving him riding in a limo through the streets of Tokyo, which is pretty impressive when you think of it. So I figured the best way to show him off was to actually make him ride in one, just to make an example of the sort of cool stunts Jackie does.

Here 's a decidedly average Italian post apocalyptic take on the hunting/killing humans for sport theme ala The Most Dangerous Game (which should be out this summer, or at least that's where it will be for now). It is, by far, the weakest of my posts. I've read it once and I've skimmed it over a hundred times. I'm not convinced it's any good. There are only three or four shots of actual violence in the entire post, not one of them at the start, one at the middle, three at the end and one of the last.

It really is a great film (after being able to ignore Blake Edwards Pink Panther references which he appears to be obsessed with and are hugely unfunny). Julie is, as usual, wonderful - singing and acting brilliantly. I remember seeing it at the Odeon Cinema in the Haymarket, London on its release. However Julie's non-appearance at the UK premiere of STAR! was most unfortunate and (apparently!) due to filming the aerial shots for Darling Lili over Ireland. A reasonable excuse if she had appeared in any of these aerial shots but she did not.

It 's almost impossible for me to sit down and write a conscientious review of THREE COLORS : RED without getting caught up in the drama. I read it from the very beginning, I knew it was good from the beginning, and I know that many of my friends, who were excited about the book also got swept up with the excitement of the cover. I loved it. I loved it because it was an amazing adventure story with a heart. And I loved it because the characters are so well developed. It is full of humor, romance, and suspense.

I had been looking forward to this movie since Lost World came out . It did n't bother me that it was not about the island, it was about the human race . There are a lot of human emotions, so this movie had to be very difficult for the viewers . It has a nice balance between comedy and emotion . The actors did their jobs well , the plot was well written , the effects were nice . It was just a movie that I could not wait for . There was nothing really to dislike about this movie , it was just a movie that did not leave me very satisfied .

I saw this movie when I was very young living in Houston, Texas. I really enjoyed this movie, and I wrote to Jean Peters in Hollywood, and I told her how much I enjoyed seeing her in this movie. She sent me an autographed photo. This movie was directed by Jacques Tourneur, and besides Jean Peters in the starring role. It also stars Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget, and Herbert Marshall. It was released in 1951 in color and is 81 minutes long. Jean Peters was married to Howard Hughes.

When I first saw the previews for this movie on TV I thought that this could be a funny movie at the same time that it has a dark, depressing tone that I found very interesting, and the story itself is great. The thing I disliked was the fact that there is so much talk and exposition in the movies, and then I find out how the story ends. The movie doesn’t tell you anything about the end because the ending is so abrupt. I liked the fact that the movie is not like any of the other zombie movie I've seen.

Steven Seagal is back! Here with his third film released this year. Of course as a one time fan who has become increasingly disgruntled I can say it comes as no surprise that this is pretty lame. Firstly the film made headlines because of apparent problems in production due to Seagal. He would turn up late on set, change the script, crew etc and generally cause problems for the director, Don E Faun Leroy (his lack of talent his trouble enough!). This also happens in their second collaboration the upcoming Mercenary which promises to be just as bad as this garbage.

Never having read or seen the Bard's original work, I can't begin to compare this work to his story. So I won't. Instead I will just say that this was a very entertaining story with some very nice special effects (and some that looked a little lower in budget, but still decent enough to enjoy). I thought all the primary actors did a fine job performing. The style of magic seemed more black than white and is almost certain to offend anyone easily upset about that sort of thing, but I thought it was well done.

I never saw Doctor Who before ( at least not in any focused way ) , so I was new to the show when it first started. I was a fan for many years but I've been watching since it was revived. I still like to watch and I still watch it when it is on TV. It was a good show to be a part of. When I saw this show I was excited , because I have never seen an older version before of the show and because I never thought I'd like the Doctor again. And I never thought it would be good.

and there are not many in cinema history. "Rouge" seems to be a bit of a hope. Hope in mankind and in life. But to say only that may be naive. Kieslowski could find the right way to tell the story of that embittered judge and the twentish but wise model. Perhaps that old and disappointing love affair will not be repeated -there's the new couple with the young judge after the accident-. But what to say about this master of the camera? You can't miss a second of the movie because you have to watch every and each one of those faces.

This is supposedly a story in which a GROWN MAN tells a story about his youth . Yet , you never hear the words of the youth . You never hear of the youth in the story , do you ? It was just a few weeks ago that I got a call from my Dad. He said :

” I’m really worried about you. I want to ask you for a favour”. I was taken aback. I was thinking about what he meant and where he was taking me , but was too embarrassed to say anything .

It's one of the imponderables of low-budget independent film-making that so many with so little in the way of real talent fancy themselves frightmeisters. The paucity of talent evinced by these wonky wannabees is there for all the world to see. Case in point: FLIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD (or, as I quickly came to know it, SHITE OF THE LIVING DEAD). There's nothing wrong with paying homage to one's heroes. I've done it many times over the years, myself, in many different ways.

If you're a fan of the original series, do NOT see this movie.I should have been skeptical from the previews when Aeon expresses her motives for murder. In the series Aeon had no family and no motive for her adventures save selfish interests. Obviously the chimp-writer in charge felt the movie needed to cater to the "bad grrl" demographic by making the character deadly, but have a good reason to kill people.You wouldn't have thought it possible, but the movie is more two dimensional than the cartoon. The characters are all portrayed as inherently good with some conflict of interest that eventually gets resolved.

LCDR Tom Dodge , despite having a reputation among submariners as a renegade and maverick ( * note to reader: the quote below is from an email by a former colleague *) , has shown extraordinary leadership in helping to rebuild and re-energize the submarine community. After years of being overlooked by the industry, his efforts have brought a lot of new people into the submarine community who want to do things the way he does them. *

*Note to reader: Tom Dodge is one of my closest friends in the industry and I used to have him as a mentor.

I never read the book . Now I do n't really want to . I had no clue what this was all about, and now I do n't. It's not as if I didn't know it, but then again I couldn't find out at all. It has taken me years to find my way around this one, mainly because of my own poor writing. It has taken me a long time to realise how much of the book I don't know, not even close to the way I knew it before it was written.

Abderrahmane Sissako may have known what he was doing when he made `` Bamako , '' but the rest of the story remains murky. It all started in the spring when Sissako, now 26, returned to his native Senegal for a second time, but this time to take up his post as manager of his former club. In his previous stint, he had been given the title of `` director of football and sports. ``I went back because I have a lot to say about our football in Africa,'' he says. ``I have been working for five years with the players of the clubs.

We all know that the world is full of dodgy, rip-off horror films. Some of these can be fun to watch, due to their stupidity, awful effects and iffy dialogue. But Raptor, which could have been in the same league as the equally pointless Carnosaur series, does not even ATTEMPT to have any enjoyment in it. Its so poorly done, it is really unbearable, even if your just watching it with the intentions of having a no-brain day at home. Where do we start? Well... the sets are pretty drab. My old drama group created more realistic stages.

This movie is supposed to take place in Milford NJ . I know the house that it is based on . But I still don't really like this movie . First of all its very slow paced . And the action is kinda rushed . And the only real good character is the lead . Not much to say about her . She is really boring . And she has so much to do with the main story . But I just couldn't enjoy it . But all that I can say is , it's just so bad . Really boring .

I went to this film full of hope . With so many capable and humorous actors headed up by Sir Richard Attenborough , I was pleasantly surprised with the movie’s direction , as well as the talented and witty performances of the other leading actors in the movie. It should be noted that one of the best aspects of “Shame onletcher” is the humor in the movie . This humor is mainly due to the fact that the movie was shot in a period manner , and was shot on location , which resulted in a variety of humor in the movie .

I loved this show. Such talent; and I am so disappointed that it is canceled, after only just beginning. I looked forward to this show all week long. And so sorry for the people who were hoping to be The One. I would have loved to see who would have won. It just began, and in my opinion,it should not have been canceled. I hope these young artist have been viewed by talent scouts, and have the opportunity to reach their goals. I voted, and sat waiting for it to come on; never knowing that it was canceled.

Not too good a movie . Sure , it contains action , but the effects are n't all that good . I would say it's pretty good for a comedy , but not so much for an action movie . This is a film that started out as a musical . A musical , but not like the musicals we all grew up with . This one is a comedy . And the movie was pretty terrible until the last minute . If you don't know what I'm talking about look at the trailer and you'll understand what I'm talking about .

I go this game and it is alright I guess. I just expected a bit more. The main problem with this is that the hacking is extremely hard, even if you read the instructions you can't get it. Also the graphics aren't as good as Pandora Tomorrow and Double Agent. This game could do with some improvements, it says that if guards are waling in water and you shoot a sticky shocker in the water the guard will fry up but nothing happens. After a meteorite lands in "Boston" (really somewhere in the Isle of Man), a hideous, fanged alien monster is released and is on the loose in a local girl's school, causing mayhem and turning the students into zombie-like creatures. This film is apparently a loose (and I stress loose) remake of the 1986 film with the same name, as it features the same monster but a different plot. Both films are terrible, but to the credit of the 1986 version, it was watchable. This isn't.

The only pure life, is one that ends with a signature in blood.So says Mishima anyway, a young sheltered boy who becomes a celebrity author. The life of one of Japans most celebrated literary voices, is told from three perspectives, his life just before he and four members of his private army take over a Japanese military base and commit ritual suicide(shown in color), flashbacks(shown in black and white), and scenes from his novels(shown in a kind of dreamy Technicolor set design somewhere between traditional Noh Theater and "the Wizard Of Oz".

I saw this movie and I thought this is a stupid movie. What is even more stupid is that who had thought an idea that there should be a volcano in Los Angeles? The fact is that there are no volcanoes in Los Angeles. This movie should not be filmed in Los Angeles, it should be filmed in Honolulu Hawaii. Hawaii has volcanoes which is a real fact that this movie should be made in Hawaii's state capital. This movie should be filmed in Hawaii because this is the real idea and not in Los Angeles.

Terribly disappointed with CITY OF MEN after being swept away by CITY OF GOD . Lost is the exciting and fun game. Lost the fun. City of God was great and it was fun, but it's a different kind of fun, and a lot more rewarding. City of men was boring and tedious. Lost the challenge. Lost a great game with great players. It was a real fun time and I didn't expect much from it, but it was a real enjoyable challenge. There are definitely other games to be played that are much more challenging, and enjoyable.

Too much stock footage ( almost one third of this 53 minute film ) really slows this one down . not because it was difficult to get a hold of the footage ( it wasn't hard ) but because it slows the action . if you want to have a good time watching this one , turn your volume down as it goes . the one thing I do like about this one is the first thing that I noticed while watching the film . I thought that this is one film that could really stand apart from all others . for me .

When I was driving home after work, I bought some movies for my four year old twins. I had bought this movie my kids would enjoy. I watched this with my children. My 10 and 17 year old were about to throw up. In this movie ,the dad acts like a tard. My little ones would watch it every day.One day, they threw away all our movies.I SOLD THE Omosis Jones movie on Ebay. My Grade: F++++++++++++++++ I rather be seen on the worst dress list.My kids now hate this dumb movie. If gives the idea that germs can talk to each other.

Like a lot of films from the early sounds days, Cimarron must be viewed more for historical interest than as compelling entertainment. The hammy acting of lead Richard Dix, nominated for best actor, can be excused as a relic of the silent-film school of acting. However, even giving benefits of the doubt, Cimarron is a badly shaped piece of drama -- a bloated film that moves from unrelated sequence to unrelated sequence with little dramatic impact. Offically, the film is two hours and four minutes; it feels like four hours when you're watching it.

Never I have seen a movie so terrible that i 've gone insane . It was a HUGE waste of time and money . One of my favourite films ever . I have seen all the horror movies that have ever been on the market .I am a fan of horror movies and i have seen so many of these bad films . This is one of them .The film is not very scary , i am not very scared for myself .This is one of those films that will always haunt me because i thought it was very interesting .

No doubt that the indie flick Eddie Monroe is one of the better independent films I 've seen in a long while, but I'm still wondering about why he was used to play the lead role. It's not like it's the first time he's played the lead role, as I've seen him in a couple of movies. It's a completely different role than he usually plays in films, and it just seemed strange to me to play a lead role that is different from how I normally see him play. Is there a reason for this casting choice?

Why is it that in the '50s and '60s , Italians made so of the best movies , and then all of a sudden , it just stopped? In some ways , I'm not sure that was it . Maybe it was because the movie industry was in such disarray . The '50s , with all of the political and social changes , were such an exciting time of change , and so exciting , that they just couldn't afford to make anything like the same movies as before . And maybe that meant that it just stopped? But maybe it just wasn't something new at all .

A lot of the comments seem to treat this film as a baseball movie , but I feel this is just a sports movie . i'll admit, this is a baseball movie , which means there are a number of similarities . i don't think the story is all that great , and i don't think the acting is as good as it was in a lot of the other films . there are a couple of funny scenes that keep the film from being just a straight baseball film , but overall , the film feels very dated .

William Petersen (that C.S.I guy) has a small uncredited role but it's the best part of the movie. His character comes across smart ass and tough, and it's a fun surprise to see him in this. He has a range that allows him to play just about anything. After his 5 minutes, it goes from looking cool to just nothing much. It leaves you hoping that his character will reappear in the movie but after 20 minutes you give up hope. The movie itself is pretty poor. Worth a watch on TMN or a pick up at the library but not much more.

I 've seen worse films . This is bad but at least does n't try to be good so it's a good reason to go to bed early. I also don't know what they're talking about, like if you go on the internet to find that film, and you don't know what the film is and the film has no internet link I wouldn't trust it and would be very disappointed if I didn't have the internet link. You're right to feel disappointed, but there is no harm in trying to find it.

I've always found the dilettante Man Ray and his artistic efforts to be deeply pretentious, and I've never understood why his work attracts so much attention. Apart from his Rayographs (which he invented by accident, and which are merely direct-contact photo prints), his one real contribution to culture seems to be that he was the first photographer to depict female nudity in a manner that was accepted as art rather than as porn. But surely this had to happen eventually, and there's no real reason why Ray deserves the credit.

Awful , awful , awful times a hundred still does n't begin to describe how crappy `` Biggest Loser '' has gone through . This is the best season of Biggest Loser in my memory of the show , it's probably the best one season I have seen since the show started in 2009 , but I am going to say it is one of the worst of them . I had no idea what I was going into the season with , but after watching last night's show , I'm not so sure it was going to be a very good season for the show , at all .

I watched this because a friend told me it was damn good , and I watched a video on it a couple of weeks ago. I have not seen it. But this morning, my friend gave me a link from youtube. It is not the video but the link. I am glad I saw the first link. So I clicked on the first link. And this is what I saw:

Well, I may be getting too old. I don’t think it is as good as the last. I still remember this, but I am thinking I will watch the other two.

I saw this movie on my flight from Philly to Denver . The screen was three rows in front of us and I was looking directly at it. When I looked down, I could see the movie was being played. I was surprised to see how big it was. I thought they were playing it on a flat screen TV, but I didn't realize that was how the film was actually being shown, as a three-dimensional projection. It was amazing and very impressive. It really made the movie look 3D. This is my first time seeing it.

Sweet young nurse Charlotte Beale (a charming performance by ravishing redhead knockout Rosie Holotik) goes to work at a remote rural asylum run by Dr. Geraldine S. Masters (the excellent Annabelle Weenick). Among the motley assortment of colorfully crazed patients are insatiable, aggressive nymphomaniac Allyson King (the luscious Betty Chandler), loopy Judge Oliver W. Cameron (a gloriously hammy Gene Ross), paranoid Vietnam veteran Sergeant Jaffee (nicely played by Hugh Feagin), gentle giant Sam (the amiable William Bill McGhee), and nutty old hag Mrs. Callingham (the supremely irritating Rhea MacAdams).

I loved it. In fact, I watched it over and over and over, and I could watch it again. This movie doesn't get boring.The vampire concept is revolutionized in this movie. It's a job well done, great for today's generation.Wesley Snipes was born for this role. Stephen Dorff was an ideal vampire. Arly Jover, mmmm mmm, she can bite me any time she wants and what a sexy accent she has. Donal Logue provides great comical relief.This vampire movie is like no other. I can't wait for Blade 2.

I find this film meretricious, tentative, lethargic, and skillfully a bad choice of entertainment on celluloid. But I admire the courage to throw away a script, turn the camera on, and act a fool. I find the inauspiciously performances, lighting, cinematography, sound, and whatever film school laws D' Urville Martin broke funny. Speaking from a film directors perspective there is times I just want to drop everything and have fun on the set. This film looks like fun. When other aspiring film directors ask me advice I just tell them to watch any film by Rudy Ray Moore.

Dude...I liked Buffy and Angel as much as the next sci-fi freak...but this is too much. The worst lead actress EVER!! Not even David "Hot Pants" Boreanaz is able to save this crap. No wonder I NEVER watch Fox  it blows!! We totally gave it a chance, and it continued to suck. We watched four or five painful, agonizing episodes. I want to kill the execs at the network SO BAD! Why is money being spent on this drivel?!?!

At the time of this writing (January 25, 2006), I am saddened to hear of the passing within the past few hours of Chris Penn. Other than Footloose, The Wild Life is the film that I remember Chris most from.I still remember in the film, with slight fondness, of Chris' wrestling character and teammates sitting in their favourite restaurant with a huge plate of french fries in front of them, drowned in an entire bottle of ketchup.Anyhow, my comment is in regards to the title track sung by Bananarama.

I got this movie as a buy one get one deal at troma.com with The Ruining (which isn't much better). The main reason I wanted it was to see Star Worms II: Attack of the Pleasure Pods, the DVD is a double feature with that movie. I really didn't know what Actium Maximus was at the time, and when I saw the trailer I got scared. It looked awful. But hey, what can you tell from the trailer? Well, apparently I could tell a lot. This movie honestly made no sens to me.

I have heard that Novo was compared to Memento for the simple fact they both rely on main characters suffering from short-term memory loss. Well, that's like comparing The Silence of the Lambs and Friday the 13th as both involved a character that killed multiple people. They couldn't be further apart in ideas.Novo deals with a copier man at a company who does have short term memory loss. He is consistently followed by another gentleman and his boss likes to have sex with him in the office. In comes a temp who also gets involved with him and may/may not use him for sex.

One thing that came across to me in watching this film is that it was fun/exciting for the cast and for the fans, and I'm sure it'll be fun/exciting for all the kids to see it. It's pretty cool that these guys are having fun making it. The director and the production crew did a great job. I was really hoping that these guys would come out on top. They've really worked hard to get these kids to work together as one entity, and it was fun to see how that worked out.

Almost no cinema experience can beat a good thriller with a sense of humor . Geena Davis is a schoolteacher who returns home to find her family murdered, and she is brought into the murder investigation of the case, as well as the search for her long-deceased husband who she has kept a secret all her life. This is the tale that is sure to capture the imagination of everyone who sees it. I was originally a bit scared when I first started watching this film because of its dark subject matter, but after the first few minutes I was sold.

I have witnessed some atrocities of cinema. In the past couple of years, it seems producers and directors are bent on making films that drive me closer and closer to insanity. Hannibal was not an exception. I wasn't expecting much, when I went in to see the movie. The book was ridiculous, and the saying, "The Book is always better than the movie" did not assure me at all that this movie would be anything but trash. But what I came to see was a movie that made all other bad movies seem better in comparison.

While not truly terrible , this movie is still largely a waste of time , and paints an incredibly inaccurate portrait of some of the worst characters ever in horror fiction. I was not impressed by this film, nor by the numerous others that I have seen since it came out. But, I was also really disappointed at the lack of action here. It didn’t feel like we were given a good reason or reason for this film to even exist. I can get that some of the characters were just bad people, but the entire film just feels that way.

This movie tries to be more than it is. First of all, the acting is horrible. You have to get past the incredibly bad delivering of lines and terrible emoting. The plot is quite interesting. A shipwreck occurs (apparently because it was made out of strings and balsa wood), and a couple of guys find themselves on shore. If this weren't bad enough, some guy named Count de Sade is living there as well. He lives in fear of pirates and has gone utterly insane. Anyway, he has a large slave, a young woman, and some dogs.

!!!! MILD SPOILERS !!! !The premise goes like this : A store gets burnt down and assistant Sergio is asked by the father of the man who started the fire to take the wrap to which Sergio agrees .So far so good , but there`s a fair lapse of logic involved Sergio agrees to do this for the sum of 25,000 dollars but why ? Come on guys if you were a good looking white boy would you run the risk of getting a long spell in a tough jail ( A very real possibilty for arson ) for the sake of 25 grand ?

I 'm guessing that the movie was based on a hefty book . Given the number of characters and subplots it would be easy to lose track of them. There are a few moments in the film when the movie is a bit confusing. I understand the story but there was so much that went on in the movie that it took me a while to get my bearings. I can understand the characters that we see in the movie. However, the movie does not explain who the other characters are nor do I understand what they want.

This version of "The Magic Flute" is not only the worst production of Mozart's great opera that I have ever seen, it is also the worst video production I have seen of any opera.I'm a big opera fan and I have more opera on DVD than movies. The sets are cheap and cheesy. Papageno doesn't even have a bird costume. He is just dressed like some guy. The sound is in mono. The color is really bad. It is saturated in orange. Most DVD's from this period have the color digitally restored, but they did not bother with this one.

This is one of a rarity of movies, where instead of a bowl of popcorn one should watch it with a bottle of vodka.
