I'm sorry it had to be this one because, quite frankly, this is a dog  and even with Jimmy Stewart and Charles Coburn, both of whom were great actors.The problem with the film is simple: it tries to put too much, too quickly, in to a story about a young lawyer (John Manson played by Stewart) who marries Jane (played by Lombard) within an hour of meeting her. What's that cliché? Marry in haste, repent at leisure...

I love cheesy horror movies, I think dead alive and bad taste are great and I think slumber party massacre II (not even related to this movie) are hilarious. But this movie absolutely stank, I didn't laugh, I didn't even enjoy it.. you can see all kinds of mistakes that aren't even campy. The best take of the scene where the woman leans out the window is the one where she smacks her head on the sill? Give me a break.Don't rent this thinking it's related to the slumber party massacre series.

First the premise stinks...little boy likes to dress in girls clothes. It reminded me of Norman Bates in PSYCHO or Ed Wood in ED WOOD. The jokes are lame and old, You've seen 'em in a dozen 50's & 60's films. The whole cast is wasted. I bet people signed on just to be in a Shirley MacLaine vehicle. Please, Would somebody tell Shirley she did her best comedy in TWO MULES FOR SISTER SARA. See it...if there's no reruns of Andy Griffith on.

This film stinks more than limburger cheese ! If you find this at a garage sale , LEAVE IT THERE !! I was just there a few months ago , and they had a great deal on this , but when they had it I didn't like it so I didn't buy it. It was in a nice little package , but it was not what I wanted in my garage . I am so disappointed. This was such a great movie. I am a sucker for a classic. I loved every minute of it and I can still remember it.

This one's as cheesy as they come  the concept of a massive and indestructible extraterrestrial bird is already too loopy for words, but wait till you get a load of the goofy creature as it appears on screen! I tell you I laughed so hard through this thing that I missed out on some of the expository dialogue  then again, the latter is often so heavy on scientific jargon and laws of Physics and such (at which I've never been any good, in spite of my love of sci-fi movies) that it didn't really matter anyway!

I ca n't explain it , but I find this movie not only funny , but so enjoyable I feel like I am watching one of those animated movies, I think the actors were great as well, and I feel like this movie was a good choice to bring in the younger crowd, but I think they need to rework parts of it, because I am not sure if it is still fun. The ending was a bit sudden, but it was good. Well, I really don't think it made sense. It was still a nice watch, but I guess it wasnt that good.

I'm the first to recognize that Chan-wook Park's Thirst is exceptionally well made, but spending over two hours with Tae-joo(OK-vin Kim)is enough for anyone to tolerate for such a length of time. Sang-hyeon(Kang-ho Song)is a priest desiring to volunteer for experimental studies on those willing to subject themselves to rigorous injections concerning a specific virus which kills infectiously. Instead of legitimately dying, Hyeon becomes a vampire, always yearning for the sustenance blood gives for him to fight off an infectious disease which returns causing the symptoms which flat-lined him to begin with(..bumps/sores, and the body vomits blood).

That 's all I can really say about this film . It 's DBZ ... like Tree of Might and the rest. The movie just goes to a different place. This film was pretty good. I liked all the characters, the plot was good, but the plot and the action was just boring. I don 't think the movie could have been a hit, if they had stuck to just the plot. The main problem for the whole film is the fight scenes, there are just so many bad fight scenes in the entire film that I can't really recommend this film.

My grandad gave me this DVD. With friends like these. The front cover looked quite scary thought i'd watch it. What a bloody mistake.Basically the film follows three people on a bus and what happens to them involving friends.The first one is about a guy who buys a car that talks to him. The second is a about a guy who wakes up to find a cassarole clone in his fridge. And the third is about a woman who does online dating but it turns out he has a robotic arm.The DVD case rated this film 18 but even a 5 year old can watch this and not be scard or entertained.

A snore gore . I saw this piece of horrible , stinking , worthless , junk at the Cameo Movie Theatre on the evening of Saturday , July 20th . I could not bear to look at it for a full 30 minutes , as I knew I’d never enjoy this kind of crap in my lifetime . The entire thing was awful . As the story is told in this piece, the Cameo Theater is an old and smelly gas station , not a movie theater. It is owned by a man named Joe St. Pierre .

Essentially plotless action film has two good guys ( Fong and Roundtree ) pitted against two bad guys ( Mitchell and Smith ). Fong, a smalltime crook, gets a call from the FSB and is being blackmailed to get money from the US Government. Fong and his friend roundtree take this as an opportunity. Fong ends up killing his corrupt boss ( Smith ) but Fong and Roundtree end up having a heart-to-heart and a good talk. Later they decide to get rid of the corrupt boss ( Smith ) and start a new life.

This movie is an abortive , stillborn attempt to stitch together several bad movies and make some sort of extra-bad movie. I don’t know that I’ve seen a movie like this, because it has no clear sense of self, just a series of poorly conceived ideas. This film is full of bad movie tropes and ideas that aren’t very good. The film starts off by telling the audience a story of a woman who is a singer in a small town in the south, who is in love with a guy, and has a boyfriend.

A BUSTER KEATON Silent Short.Poor Buster becomes THE GOAT ("scapegoat") for a dangerous escaped murderer.This is a wonderful, hilarious little film with Keaton at his absolute best. In what is essentially a series of chases, Buster gets to exercise his endlessly inventive imagination. Big Joe Roberts appears as the highly suspicious police chief.Born into a family of Vaudevillian acrobats, Buster Keaton (1895-1966) mastered physical comedy at a very early age. An association with Fatty Arbuckle led to a series of highly imaginative short subjects and classic, silent feature-length films - all from 1920 to 1928.

This is almost Ed Wood territory. Yeah, that ridiculous wreck of a flying monster looks like a cross between a turkey buzzard and a bad day at the dentist's office. And that sound effect screech makes fingernails across a blackboard sound like Mozart. And why The Giant Claw when the goofy critter gobbles its victims with a mechanical jaw. We get big close-ups of the ugly chicken foot, but nothing more. I guess the producers thought a more appropriately titled Big Mouth might suggest a Jerry Lewis comedy. And speaking of comedies, all that "anti-matter" gobbledy-gook is funnier than anything in a Lewis movie.

The worst movie I have ever seen. The sound quality was bad, the cutting of the scenes was even worse and above all it was not logic and it had no speed...I first tought: "Oh No, I don't want the trail that proves that poor Patrick was an innocent killer". But this turned out to be even worse. Typically in this American film you get a super-hint or no hints at all. I want very tiny small hints that direct you to the killer. The audience isn't involved.

It 's not really about wine . No , Nossiter 's real targets are those who would streamline and assimilate the entire wine industry from the bottom up. He's talking about making wine more like cereal . His vision is that we end up with a more uniform product, where consumers have a larger choice and are exposed to a greater range of products. He wants to remove the mystery and the hype from the wine trade. We should be able to taste great wine from our own region, and we should be able to know, in a sense, what wine has come out of a given area.

Hubie -- like Stanely the troll from Bluth's A Troll in Central Park -- lacks the spark of personality to be the main character that carries an entire movie. We're supposed to like him because he's nice, but that's about all he is.His character design is unappealing. The top of his head is a sort of dome that is narrower than the pudgy bottom half of his head.And penguins should not have teeth. I know that Iago the parrot in Aladdin had teeth, but maybe that worked because it made him look more like his voice actor, Gilbert Gottfried.

This is one of those strange , self-important , self-indulgent movies which tries too hard to be profound . It fails spectacularly . what you're going to see is not a study in how to be successful with people and how to win their trust and affection. But more of how not to be successful at this thing that you've got to do all the time. How to avoid being caught in the same trap. How to play to your own strengths. And how to make people like you. The plot is fairly straight forward - you see a man named David who's about to die.

OK, so this is a complete rip off of the first Karate Kid. However, I think there can never be too many movies like the first Karate Kid. There's something about this type of story that particularly seems to apply to people like me. You get a overall sense of being able to overcome adversity by finding out new things about yourself. In this movie, Hillary Swank is a particular gem as the Next Karate Kid. You can really tell that she has a bright future ahead of her.Not to say this movie is not without it's problems.

The setup for "Nature of the Beast" is ingeniously simple, and fraught with limitless potential for suspense: harried salesman Jack (a very domesticated Lance Henriksen) picks up trouble in the form of hitchhiker Adrian (Eric Roberts), who seems to be in possession of incriminating information against Jack. Oh, and over a million dollars has been stolen from a casino and someone dubbed 'Hatchet Man' is dismembering people in the desert. Sounds great, right? Sort of like "The Hitcher" meets "Psycho." One or both of these men has a secret, and nothing is as it seems!

it's a real big bummer that people easily are able too make movies because of cheap digital video cams nowadays. usually I would appreciate this possibility but if you see movies like this it's just a big shame. and it's also big shame if people like h.p. lovecraft get abused by the likes of this. I rented this "movie" cuz of the drop "h.p. lovecraft" on it. and I'm a big fan of many of his adaptions, mainly those done by brian yuzna & stuart gordon. this movie has nothing to deliver!

I liked this movie , not because Tom Selleck was in it , but because it was a good story , the acting was good and he was a really likable character . I like the fact that he has been doing movies since the early 70's . I would have liked him and his son to have been in something a little more serious , something with more substance . I watched the first 2.5 hours of this movie on Blu Ray at the theatre and I can honestly say I didn't enjoy the movie at all .

This film is one of my fondest childhood memories. Seeing the Muppets (at the height of their popularity) heading Hollywood, singing and dancing, with Miss Piggy googely-eying her beloved Kermit, Fozzie Bear doing his best as everyone's manager, and a generous cast of "extras" delivering a film that turned out to be "okey dokey".Kermit's melancholy ukulele number "Rainbow Connection" was nominated for an Oscar that year, but was beat out by Norma Rae's "It Goes Like It Goes". I'll pick Kermit's song any day!

This is one of the movies having made significant influence on me as a person. The sound tracks are best and the performance is excellent. Just a great movie for ever, to time limit, just for the entire live, you must have in your collection! This is one of the movies having made significant influence on me as a person. The sound tracks are best and the performance is excellent. Just a great movie for ever, to time limit, just for the entire live, you must have in your collection! This is one of the movies having made significant influence on me as a person.

This is absolutely the worst comedy I have ever seen. It's hard to explain though, because (unless you've seen this) I bet you've never seen a comedy that was not good or bad; it's just there (That's the original part-not good or bad, just there)! Let me say that I have seen every comedian appearing in a main role, and like them all. That's what makes this such a mystery. The supporting leads are actually acting (although the dialog is bad). The only character that is fairly good is the one played by John Goodman.

Perhaps the wildest outlier in Alfred Hitchcock's career is this straight-out comedy vehicle by the director, pairing Carole Lombard with Robert Montgomery as a couple who discover a mistake has invalidated their marriage. Where do they really stand with each other?Contrary to what others say, there IS an element of suspense here: The idea that these two miserable people might escape each other, free to inflict their awfulness on some other, undeserving mate.It's funny reading comments here about how miserable Lombard's Ann Smith plays out in this film, because Montgomery's role is as much of a heel.

Well, at least we have to acknowledge the big Hollywood horror-producers are finally getting smarter and more perceptive. Instead of patiently waiting to buy the rights of Asian horror hits and subsequently remake them in America, they now discovered they could simply hire the Asian directors and assign them to make their brand new ghost story directly in the states. That's like killing two birds with one stone; way to go guys! "The Messengers" is pretty much identical to every other supernatural chiller that came out of the Oriental countries ever since "Ringu".

I saw Heaven's Gate on its opening week nearly twenty years ago. Tickets were sold in advance based on the great anticipation of seeing Cimino's long in the making follow up to his 1978 masterpiece "The Deerhunter." The reviews came in and critics trashed the film with vehemence. An influential New York film critic led the way and most critics followed suit, and the 3hr. 40-min. film was pulled from distribution. United Artists had Cimino shorten the film by about an hour and it was re-released many months later to equally horrible reviews and to dismal business.

Shtrafbat is the story only Russians could tell about the Second World War. The largest front of the whole conflict has been, ironically, the least appearing subject on the silver screen after the war. While the Western Allies war-effort has been pictured in almost every possible detail and manner, the East has been left out or the job has been left to only some old propaganda movies of little else than historical footage value.There is no chance that Shtrafbat could compete with Band of Brothers in every detail but neither you want to look at the screen with examining petty visual effects in mind.

This is a cult classic for sure ! ! It is tricky to follow at times , but then again it’s easy to read. It is the kind of stuff you want to read during your day , it keeps you sane, and it’s just so good ! ! A few years ago , I started reading this book. It was hard to put down , and now I couldn’t put it down. In fact , I felt like reading it for days ! I had to keep re-reading it. One of the characters in this book was the one I most liked.

Superb editing , outstanding acting , especially by Epatha Merkerson , and highly enjoyable musical soundtrack . This film reaches up there in terms of technical aspects of sound and music. “ This is the story of a young man who returns to his hometown on a whim in order to visit his dying mother. She has come down with a fatal illness. Upon the death of her husband, her son has been left alone with his father . This is the story of the young man’s attempt to get in touch with his mother’s family . In order to reach his mother .

Six students at a convent do the unthinkable - kill a nun who was overbearing . Now , eighteen years later, three of those same children, now grown and married, tell their stories

‘Sister Teresa’



From the outside, the convent looks nothing like the picture above. It is two stories high, with three rooms at the front, including the chapel. On the outside, there is little sign of a life lived there. But in reality, Sister Teresa lives a life of prayer, meditation and contemplation in one of the most remote places in the country.

The Other Boleyn Girl - not to be confused with the book it claims to be based upon . This is where the title comes from, as it’s the girl in the book which has not been portrayed as the Other Boleyn Girl, but is instead the sister to Boleyn’s maid Marian. She is actually the only daughter of Henry VIII, but her life seems to be one of a series of adventures, most notably those of Henry VIII’s sister Anne Boleyn. This is the story of her life, so we’ll be doing a whole separate article about that.

Not all movies are Oscar worthy but let 's face it , sometimes these types of movies are more fun to watch. It's a fun movie that makes you laugh , but does it have any lasting meaning? No. It's just a funny movie, so why should it be rewarded with any awards? It's all a big waste of time. It's a fun movie

I was a big fan of The Social Network before it was released and even now, I don't know if I will watch this movie in theaters or on Netflix.

I just can not emphasize enough what a lovely movie this is . Justthe memory of this movie right now makes my day. I am in awe of the talents of the screenwriter and also the direction of the script . The acting skills are superb. I don't care that the movie was a flop. I love this movie more than the last 20 years. It was so well done, I have seen the movie a lot . I'm sure I can see the movie in 5 years . It's an amazing piece of work . I think I will never forget it .

Ineffectual , molly-coddled , self-pitying , lousy provider Jimmy Stewart is having a bad marriage to Carole Lombard . After being dumped by his long-suffering wife Alma ( Liza Minella ) in a hotel room on his honeymoon in Italy, Jimmy's life seems to come crashing down around him, as Carole ( Liza Minella ) pursues Jimmy to find the man she loves in the name of the law. Carole is also looking for a way to regain her lost self in the face of the world's most powerful man ( Richard Kiley ).

Hollywood had a long love affair with bogus Arabian Nights tales but few of these products have stood the test of time. The most memorable were the Jon Hall, Maria Montez films which have long since become camp. This one is filled with dubbed songs, anachronistic slang, and slapstick. It's a truly bounteous crop of Mesopotamian corn, and pretty near intolerable today. It was nominated for its imaginative special effects which are almost unnoticeable in this day and age, consisting mainly of trick photography. The only outstanding, positive feature which survives is its beautiful color and clarity.

A couple of men are ship-wrecked on a remote island . They are then captured by an insane count who claims to have a "lucky charm" and wants to offer a prize of gold, which they are willing to accept. The count, however, is also insane. He wants to make them work. When the count discovers that the men can run, he decides to have them run in order to see just how fast they can move. The count decides to run with the men in pairs . . He then leads the pair on a short sprint.

Uncle Fred Olen Ray once again gives us a little of his Retromedia `` goodness '' in the form of a one-hour podcast episode. It's a great, entertaining, informative show, with a lot of useful info about the games we play, and how to get to them. Here's the intro and a few tidbits about the show that I found out about from talking to Ray. In case you didn't catch this one before, here's what Ray's saying about the show in his intro. The podcast was recorded in November 2017 and you can find the entire podcast at our YouTube channel.

This production of Hamlet , Prince of Denmark is by far the best that I have seen . Although it takes place in Denmark the story is not far off from Shakespeare's play , I think . The action is swift and exciting and the set up is extremely clever . There is a very nice set of props which make the production stand out . The production is a great opportunity to take in a work from one of Shakespeare's plays . It is not for everyone , of course , but it is for those who enjoy the great Shakespearean work and can appreciate it , not for the faint hearted.

Although i watched this film by myself ( thankfully ) , i still felt embarrassed while watching it . I didn’t get to the end and the film was way to slow . But i think i would like to view it again once it is aired in the theatres . You can also see the trailer in this post below. So I have recently watched this movie . I have seen it on Netflix, but I couldn’t watch the movie for more then 1-2 years. So when I saw this movie , it surprised me a lot .

Thank God I did n't buy this movie myself ! I borrowed it from a friend who bought it out of the goodness of her soul. She has been giving this DVD to friends and family for years. I have watched it many times and just love every moment of it... It is a shame that they don't get the Blu-ray out there like we do... It is such a beautiful film and a great story ! If this is the same movie that you bought it from then you should get the blu-ray... but I doubt it is....

I like The Wind and the Lion very much. It was a good movie. I thought that since I'm young and it was made so long ago I wouldn't like it all that good, but after I saw it, i was amazed of how good it was. My family liked it, my friends liked it, everyone I showed it to liked it. I liked it because it showed how Arabs and people in Morroco was treated during the Early 1900's, by the Germans, French, and even the Americans.

The Hell 's Angels did come out the losers in this movie . Sonny stated to the director that NOBODY had the guts to tell him what he wanted to hear . I liked that statement. Sonny was telling the truth . Hell's Angels came out the losers and they have had their share of pain . They were in it to win it but it just didn't happen . NOBODY had the guts to tell Sonny what the director wanted to hear. He thought that he was right . They came out the losers and we thought we were on top .

You do n't have to spend much time watching this made for TV movie or series pilot or whatever it's called, because you've been paying attention to the last few seasons of The Last Man on Earth and The Sinner's Club. The latter of which, as you probably already know, ended with a cliffhanger. That, along with all the spin-offs from the first series, was supposed to be the reason The Last Man on Earth was on the air. And now it is. I mean, come on.

Before I start to tear apart this movie, mark you--I LOVE THE SCARLET PIMPERNEL. That story is one of the best romantic adventures ever written. The movie staring Jane Grey is very good and the musical on Broadway is the hottest thing there. So, I thought when I heard that this film was coming out that it would be great since it was a BBC film.To my surprise, it was a weak, totally stupid story that UTTERLY failed in capturing the gorgeous tale.There were no exciting escapes with daring disguises.

I was never in the past interested in this play although love Shakespeare and have seen most of his plays now and enthusiastically studied some at school. Something about this story and all the fuss about it seemed to put me off. I never bothered to try to see Hamlet until fairly recently deciding I should at least try to watch it and I borrowed the Olivier version from the library. Well, I struggled with it. Olivier seemed far too old, not only in his looks but in his acting of the part.

One of the reviewers here wrote: "Good acting, good special effects, greatlocation. Even better ending. " All I can say is, "Ugh." This movie was painful to watch. Let me start by saying this: I am a Christian- considered extremely conservative by many people I know. So, what I am about to say is not biased by the"Christian content" of the film. I'm not gonna bash it because it's Christian. I am gonna give it a 2/10 because it's a horrible movie.

This movie was childish in its writing and laughable in its visual effects . Scenes where Father Merrin is tossing the boys into the River Ganges . scenes where they have sex in a river , and scenes where Merrin's boat is in the water . The acting is bad too, like most films of its kind . There was one really good scene, and it was in the first half of the movie , where the girls in the school were watching their dad's boat . The acting was bad , but the scenes of father Merrin in the river were hilarious and beautiful .

This is an unfortunately unrecognized classic.The look is superb, the design, costumes etc are flawless, the post battle scenes and the cavalry charge are both chilling and exciting.The characters are vivid and really human. Ardent is right and Fabrice Luchini as the lawyer Derville steals the movie with his clever pedantic rodent-like performance, delighting in the ups and downs of others' misfortunes. Depardieu is good but perhaps too large a presence for this role.Where the film really excels is the story and also its changes from Balzac's novella. Those changes are editorial in that Balzac has lots of discussion on society and this film breaths with characters.

The VHS cover for The Evil Below makes it look like a cool underwater horror flick . Sadly it 's not that kind of movie . This is a movie that could have been made in the 70s , and would have been a pretty fun horror flick . If you are a VHS lover and you have not seen this yet , I suggest that you grab your VHS player now . This movie is not for those of you who like horror movies , and would rather be watching something like Freddy vs. Jason . This is a good movie , with some pretty good action .

Chop Shop is a hidden treasure out in theaters ! I can not begin to describe how wonderful the performances were, how they brought an audience into the theater, in the middle of the movie, at just the right time. They were a delight, they gave us a movie experience that we didn't expect. I loved the movie and had never seen it before, and the actors did such a perfect job with all the actors that it's very hard to say why they didn't get nominated. The only thing I'm disappointed about was that they didn't make it into the Best Picture category.

Ever since I first encountered the Divine Ms Merkerson as a sex therapist in Spike Lee's "She's Gotta Have It" I have been sold on the range of this exceedingly gifted yet terribly underrated actress. She received an Emmy for her portrayal here and to say it is well-deserved is a masterpiece of understatement.Here she simply shines as THE guiding force and hand in her community. This was especially poignant for me for I grew up in this very same time period. The production detail was phenomenal and evoked wooooooooooooooonderful memories of life and times during the 50s & 60s and of women like Ms Merkerson portrayed.

This was the next to last film appearance by Jill Ireland, who died of cancer in 1990 after four decades as a well-known actress and producer. Ireland made quite a few waves in the press when she dropped her then-husband David McCallum in 1967, beginning her long relationship with Charles Bronson. It is a great irony that Bronson, probably the all-time leader in number of deaths rendered on-screen, had one of the most enduring marriages in film history. 'Assassination' seems to be a movie that was tucked into Cannon's production schedule for the sake of Bronson and Ireland.

I saw the world premiere at the Toronto International Film Fest , this is a great film.Real-life husband and wife who become the world's first pair of gay, bisexual and transgender people to be awarded an Academy Award for Best Picture. When the movie came out there were some complaints that the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences wasn't fair in accepting the award to the film. Some people were outraged that an award was going to be given to an Oscar-nominated film, which was supposed to be about gay, black and transgendered people in America.

This film holds 7.0 rating on IMDb, so even I sensed something rotten in it's synopsis I decided to try it out. What a waste of 100 minutes. First of all, the 80's were not a good decade for crime and thriller genre. Most of these, in those days were badly done with silly plot (if they had any), so there are very few that can stand out, and even if they were good they are still not very good. The Hit, however suffers from everything that made silly crime pictures silly.

Ed Wood rides again. The fact that this movie was made should give any youngaspiring film maker hope. Any screenplay you might have thought of using toline a litterbox or a birdcage should now not seem that bad. Do not watch this movie unless you have a healthy stash of Tylenol or Rolaids. Watching thismovie made me realize that Boa vs. Python was not that bad after all. It probably would have been better to do this movie in Claymation as at least that way no actor would have had to take credit for being in this film. It is understandable why this director has so many aliases.

The main attraction of Anywhere but Here is the superb performance of Natalie Portman . She gave her rather thankless role not just as Maggie, but a great deal more than that. She brings a real warmth, sympathy, and understanding in the character that she has to play, and she manages to give depth and complexity to her role. She also gets the chance to play two roles. She plays the role of Maggie as a real person, but when we get to see that the character is also Maggie as a character, then we realize how much more depth she brings to the role.

Hilarious and low-budget comedy at it's best. This set of unique individual sketches with extensive self-referential humor is reminiscent of a really raunchy Kids in the Hall. Be prepared for some of the most random and recitation worthy lines, filled with ethnic slurs and awful language. Sex toys included!There should be more comedy like this around today. This collection of sketches on one DVD will warrant many viewings and reviewings in order to appreciate some of the parts. If you enjoyed The State and/or Wet Hot American Summer, get ready for some more glory.

Between the ages of 30 and 51 , when he died of a brain tumour , Zachary Scott made 70 appearances for Tottenham Hotspur in the Football League. His career was short and came to an abrupt end, but he was a true talent. For those who don't know, Tottenham are one of the best football clubs in England, they play in the League of the Champions. They play in the famous, beautiful and iconic White Hart Lane, one of the best, most beautiful and most prestigious stadiums in the world. It was built in the 1960s to be the home of English football.

I recently had to watch this for a project in a Sociology class and thought it was absolutely the worst movie I have ever had to sit through. It was like bad a bad cinemax movie with all the "good bits" taken out. Bad acting, the fake documentary set up, nonsensical plot, and rudderless direction all combine to make a terrible, terrible film.The female characters are basically only there to be sex objects. Consider this exchange: "He's hot." "He has a girlfriend." "Do you have a girlfriend?" "No."

I readily admit that I watch a lot of really bad movies . But there are very few that I would have called “bad” in the first place. I watched this film about a month ago and it’s still sitting at the top of my must-see list. It was the first time I’ve seen anything like this film and it really blew my mind. I’ll just give you a taste here. The Plot

The plot revolves around a middle school principal who has a crush on a girl, and she decides to go out for a date.

Leonard can write lyrics , but he sure ca n't sing . Nor has he had an original idea in the whole of his songwriting career. But after the first half hour, his songs have some great tunes, with a few twists. And that's the story of Leonard Cohen's new album. Cohen's first three albums weren't bad albums, but not nearly great. This new record comes out on the heels of one of his most successful and critically acclaimed albums, and is, quite honestly, the best thing I've heard in months.

Gene Roddenberry never let his fans down. His death ended Sci-Fi legacy that will never be matched. Earth: The Final Conflict was proof! His pilot film and the first 2 Seasons were well written and meticulously produced, but somewhere along the way the Roddenberry touch was lost. The loss of lead, Kevin Kilner (William Boone) definitely hurt the series as he was a vital part of what made it work. The story involves the human race being visited by the Taelons, an extra-terrestrial race who dub themselves 'The Companions'.

Your idol will deceive you in this movie. Stephen Nichols is mis-cast as a young german student still bending under his father's orders although the actor obviously looks near 40 years-old. This makes his relationship (a collection of copulation scenes, basically) to a very young looking girl all the more disturbing. The character's have no dimension and the war depiction serves only as a backdrop for this soft porn wannabe. Nichols, who is one of daytime TV's best performers shows no passion in what is to be the main interest of this movie: watching him have sex over and over with this girl.

Sorry for all you guys that are not family with the Lynches.My sister in law asked me how you can be such a bad influence on a kid that is just barely out of pre school. She said she doesn't think that you are a good influence because your mom has you and your older sister. I just laughed at that and told her you are right. She said she is going to tell your mother that you have to stop that bad influence before the kids ever hear about that. I said to her I am sure your mother is like that because I would too.

The movie eXistenZ is about a futuristic video game on a "pod" system that is almost like virtual reality. The only copy of the video game is damaged when an assassination attempt is made on the designer (Jennifer Jason Leigh). Unless it can be repaired, the many years and 38 million dollars spent on the development will all go to waste. The only way to repair the game however, is to actually go in the game with the only person she feels she can trust(Jude Law). This movie was pretty good, but doesn't really pick up until very late in the film.

The film starts out with a narration of the protagonist explaining certain crimes occurring all over the city and then we get to know that the hero is a cop who is either suspended or has probably retired. I did not have the patience or the interest to verify the above before commenting. If there is a stereotype for narrators to have a deep, sleep-inducing voice then, it is high time to put an end to it. I seriously fell asleep and did not bother to shut the movie down either. Am still trying to figure out what the movie was all about and why there were no outdoor shootings.

I loved the first movie, the second one was okay, disappointed John Cleese wasn't jean bob anymore as hes my favorite character. But the third one...what happened to the animation??? it looks low budget like a sat morning cartoon! except for the flashback which was taken from the first movie. They really should have stopped after number 2, this just makes the rest look bad!! Derek's voice has changed but its not as recognizable as jean bob..Rogers also looks very strange. I also don't understand where Rothbart came from.

this is one of my favorite movies ever ! along with casablanca and cannibal holocaust , this is near perfect. i think this movie is perfect because the actors are all so good. i love the actor who plays henry and the actor who plays frankenberry. i think this is a very important movie and i hope it gets made again and i really like it . the only thing i would have liked to see was a scene with the americans at the end

I think this is one of the best movies of all time. I have seen a lot and have seen it about a million times.

Being 15 myself I enjoyed this flick thouroughly!! I related to the character Ann August more than most would. My Mother isnt AS eccentric as Adele, but the feelings of lonliness is the same. This movie is perfect in the ating aspects, and Natalie's, and Susan's performances are so linked together that it's the best onscreen dual i have seen in years. Their chemistry brings the characters to life, they become real people! I would recommend this flick to anyone who is hoping to get away.

In addition to the fact that this is just an abysmally made film ( imagine giving a camcorder to the main character to do this thing for you), the thing that's really the problem is that we're supposed to take it seriously because this is the story of an artist. I agree. That is, unless the movie is about the artist and the camera, then I'm not going to like it. I agree that there should be a lot of emphasis on the camera and the artistry in the making of the movie as opposed to the director.

This is one of those movies that I can watch again and again and not get tired of it . . . it keeps getting better, and better, and better every time I watch it. I had never read this book until this point, but then I read the last book in the series last week and I think that this will be a very good ending to his story. It will give him the opportunity to go on a new adventure with his daughter and he will be free for the first time in years. I really enjoy the movie!

Begrudgingly gave it a 3 - one point each for Fonda, Stanwyck, and the supporting cast.Never saw this one before - am watching it right now and it has just gotten to the part where Henry Fonda is carrying Babs over the threshold. If I continue watching, it will be just to see if Fonda and Stanwyck will be able to pull this one out of the dumper.But after reading the other viewer comments, I'm not very optimistic.The opening ski scenes were enough to put me off my lunch. The voice-overs were obviously done in a sound studio, and the editing between the exterior shots and the closeups was horrendous.

A comedy that spoofs the inspirational sports movies, The Comebacks tells the story of an out-of-luck coach, Lambeau Fields, who takes a rag-tag bunch of college misfits and drives them towards the football championships. In the process, this life-long loser discovers that he is a winner after all by redeeming himself, saving his relationship with his family and friends, and finding that there is indeed, no "I" in "team"!I decided to watch the unrated version for this film. It was thirty minutes longer and I though it may be better than the theatrical release, hearing that people hated this movie.

Unless there 's some huge ironic conspiracy going on , my jaw dropped when I read the positive reviews of this product. As I have said previously, I have not been to this site in a while so I was not sure what had happened and why there is so much positive feedback. I have to say that my reaction to the new product is a positive one. I am not sure I am the best person to judge this product. I have had this product for some time now but I do not use it as often as the others.

With its few touches of surrealism , LWHTRB works as low-grade horror , but as a major follow-up statement to the original, it is a bit of a departure from the horror of the original film. As a result of this departure, some may not like it, but LWHTRB still stands apart from other movies of this genre. If you’re looking for the horror that has been done before ( and has been done before , as well), LWHTRB may not be for you. You can check out my review below.

If you want to waste a small portion of your life sit in front of this predictable zombie film . I've seen this with my friends and family but it really doesn't seem to fit into any of our schedules anymore, but I'm just glad it hasn't gone away completely. It's fun to see what people like or dislike. I'm not the person to tell you if you should rent this movie or not. I have no clue if they are doing this in the US or not. I can't even say for certain that it's not on Netflix in the US or Canada.

I 've read plenty of Jane Austen in my time and approve of several cinema/TV adaptations but this one we have to rate as a bit of a classic. Not only is it the first adaptation of Austen but it’s also the only one to feature all the main female characters from the book. If you’re looking to watch this movie now, we have the trailer below! This movie is based on Emma Woodhouse‘s novel and is written by the same person who wrote the novel, Joanna Trollope.

This film did not excite me . While on vacation in Turkey I noticed that it was playing at the local cinema.I watched it on VHS and found it very interesting. There were a bunch of different stories with a lot of suspense and a good amount of humour.I didn't get to see the ending. It was very dark and disturbing. I can see why this would appeal to those with a strong stomach.I don't plan on returning anytime soon. This movie was definitely a very good watch for me.I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys watching suspense,horror and comedy films.

I rented this movie for about $1.50 - the most complete waste of money (and time) I have ever spent. It's LAME! I couldn't believe how they could come up with something like this.The plot... there is no plot. Everything you'd expect to happen, it does, only in a worse way. The acting was horrible. My dog could've done better. The special effects have no effect whatsoever - except inducing complete disbelief. And the cheesy lines.... I mean, why even bother? The only credit I can give this piece of sh*t are the opening scenes.

"What Alice Found" is the greatest movie that nobody's ever heard of! I underestimated it when I heard of it, and I though that it would all sex, no plot, and just really stupid, but in reality, it was really good. They say all indie movies suck, but this one, and "Napoleon Dynamite" didn't suck. I asked my friend, who'd seen it before I did, and she said that Alice has all these three-ways, and you see all this nudity, but no, there is no three-way that I remember, and little nudity.

I bought this video on a throw-out table at the video store expecting a good cast in what was touted to be a solid action movie. There was more than enough of it but it was still a bit boring. The story and characters are good and there were some great moments, but the way that it was written was not memorable. I've never seen that kind of "action" and I certainly wasn't sold on the whole action-film thing. So I guess I'll be looking for something else when I find that out for myself. It's not terrible.

THANK GOD YOU'RE HERE is painful, positively painful. The title is apt, in a sense, if aimed at the large studio audience paid to laugh like they were watching the second coming of the Marx Brothers. And trust me, they are paid.As creatively barren as the entertainment industry has become, I refuse to believe that NBC brass really have faith in this turkey. Rather, I think THANK GOD YOU'RE HERE is what all of you get who didn't watch, or didn't appreciate STUDIO 60, which previously graced the peacock network's Monday night lineup.

Having lived in Michigan 's Upper Peninsula ( 30 miles from Escanaba ) in the mid-1990s , I was eager to get back to Michigan after several years living in the east. My husband and I decided that we would move into Michigan because it was the first place we'd visited since we'd lived in the Midwest. It seemed like an opportunity we couldn't turn down. When we arrived, we were excited to see how little I had missed in my old home state. It seemed like all I could do was stare at it.

Although it was dark , depressing , and at times hard to watch , You Are Alone held my attention for a solid four hours. I was surprised by how dark it was in the beginning but it got better with time. I think you can tell why the film has been a box office flop, but it is still worth watching just for the characters. The ending was very predictable and I can't say that I am surprised by it. This is the story about a man who gets involved in a criminal organization.

Sometimes , things should just not be made . And while the set-up seemed good enough , it proceeds to be a bit of a nightmare . This is the setup in which I am using. I am currently using a 4.2GHz 64-bit processor, with the i5-2500k and 8GB RAM . After some research on the Internet , it seems that I should only need to use 4GB of ram ( 4.3GB for the i7-3530K ) . This is the only thing that makes sense to use . Then , there are the graphics cards I will be using. As I mentioned, I already have the i7-4770HQ for testing purposes .

Black Scorpion is a fun flick about a groovy female super heroine who wears leather tights and drives a car. There is nothing wrong with this female hero that I can see in this film. I love female super heroes that wear tights and drive cars. I’ll admit that I can’t quite remember when I first saw this. I was probably ten or so when it came out. When I first saw the film I was absolutely blown away. I mean, what was she doing out there driving a car? I’m still blown away at this moment.

In Thailand, the Americans Connor (Colin Egglesfield) and his girlfriend Amanda (Meredith Monroe) quarrel in a Muay-Thai fight, and Amanda leaves Connor alone. She asks the direction of the hotel to a stranger, indeed the mean vampire Niran (Don Hetrakul), and she is bitten and kidnapped by his gang of evil vampires in motorcycles. Connor joins to a clan of "good" vampires leaded by Sang (Stephanie Chao), trying to save Amanda from the claws of Niran.I expected that "Vampires: The Turning" were a good movie.

"Catchfire" or "Backtrack" as it is sometimes called, is not very good. That is, it's bad. Jodie Foster had already won an Oscar at this point. Why did she agree to do this? I don't know.The hostage/kidnapper relationship is not believable, even if it is a common psychological phenomenon in real life.Worst of all, this film features a scene where Hopper and Foster ride a boat under the Fremont Bridge (a bridge in Seattle) which means that traffic had to stop so that the bridge could open.

I must first mention that as a group of mates, we often find entertainment in wacthing films which are known to be terrible for comedy value, hence our rental of Camp Blood.Camp Blood was the first film which we'd rented that had been shot on what looks to be a camcorder, and was so rubbish it wans't even funny.The DVD was returned and a refund was demanded, with the added suggestion some sort of quality control is implemented to prevent such utter rubbish being stocked.Don't do what I did, and let the curiosity get the better of you, it's so bad it's not even funny.

Had the fun pleasure of viewing a new independent film called "Half Empty." I usually go out to the local cinema with my husband and feel as if we are held captive to the latest Sequel, or Prequel that Hollywood throws at us. This was DIFFERENT and surprisingly  SO MUCH more entertaining than anything Hollywood spends millions advertising. When my husband and I go the movies, we go to be entertained  and "Half Empty" did just that and the film did so in a smart manner that made me feel as if my trip to the movie theater was worth it.

Cuore Sacro combines glossy film effects with a story that leaves much to be desired . With a script that doesn't do much else besides say that it wants to tell a story that is "sad," it makes for a really poor effort . I'm not the target audience; it's more a film for the younger crowd who might like an interesting horror film . But that doesn't make it a bad film . And I do find it kind of sad . The entire movie seems to be about a man who gets lost at sea and gets into a very creepy situation .

My wife invited my son and I to watch this on cable TV on a lazy Saturday evening , thinking there would be at least 4 people watching and maybe a few others watching in a couple of weeks as well. And I can’t blame them. But my son and I have never watched football before. So, we were really excited to get into it. It was the first football game I have ever watched, ever. We didn’t know the score but we figured that would be the game we had to sit through at that point.

The best thing about this flick is that it seems like they used a lot of stuff left over from the original, but it looks like they're trying to use a lot of this stuff to tie the original into the original and give this a cohesive feel. There's a lot of things that tie together, including a little bit that seems to be an homage to the original, some of the original characters that we see in the original still have roles in the film, and there's a scene that I think ties the whole thing together that I don't think you'd normally get from the remake.

I probably have to blame myselfbut I sure as hell expected more from a movie that goes by the title "Black Dragons" and revolves on secret WWII conspiracies, Nazi plastic surgeons and revenge. This film is a dull failure with an incomprehensible structure. The actual plot (which basically is rather ingenious and intriguing) only becomes clear during an explication near the end, but the problem is that you stop caring a long time before. We see how horror icon Bela Lugosi infiltrates in a society of prominent American politicians and kills them one by one.

I 've watched the movie actually several times . And what i want to say about it is the only reason why it didnt work for me was the ending . The movie was good enough but i did not get to the end . Maybe it was not a good ending but still i think you need to add more than 1 year between them . That is all i can say ... The movie was good enough and if you like action like the movie it will be just ok . If you dont , then watch this film . I watched the same movie 3-5 times.

The plot for Black Mama White Mama , revolves around two female inmates , at a women 's prison in Mississippi, who are friends with an inmate. The story begins when a prisoner, who is having a rough day at the jail, visits the friend, who tells him that he is having a hard time adjusting. When he talks about what happened to his family during the war, he tells the inmate that he was raped by a white woman at a local church. He explains this to the inmate, when the friend asks what he was thinking.

If this movie would have been in English, all critics would have trashed it. The language is extremely bad, the scenes are awfully directed and it's not at all funny. After the movie I thought that this movie could have been written by an 8th grader, at least if you consider the lack of believable characters and the fixation on certain male body parts. (oh, on dogs as well...) The story is just plain nonsense compared to the more mature Vingar av glas that premiered almost at the same time. Of course the public chose Jalla! Jalla!

So , it 's Friday night and you want to go watch a movie ... all you want is something to eat , something to drink , something to do ... I don 't know , something to kill time ... you have nothing to do , right ... right ? I mean , I got everything I want right here at home ... just nothing to do ... yeah ... I 'll tell you what , you got everything you could ever want . I 'll show you everything I want . You got nothing to do with me .. You got nothing to do , do with yourself ...

Now , the sci-fi channel original company has made some pretty crappy films ( House of the dead 2 , etc..) and it's been a while since I've seen one of their films. But the company is starting to really make a name for itself in the horror world, and with this film, I was really hoping they would make something better than a 3 1/2 hour horror film. I'm very disappointed, because for the first time in awhile I feel like I can actually enjoy a horror movie.

What a shocker. For starters, I couldn't stand the constant screaming and noisy panicking all the time. It didn't make me scared, horrified, or make me sympathetic towards the characters; it was simply annoying. The jerky camera movements were also annoying. The plot was the same as pretty much every other cheap horror. There was a few pathetic attempts to give the characters some depth, but it didn't really work into the rest of the plot. And then there's the ending. I'm still not really sure what to make of it.

I was wondering when someone would try turning that whole Matamoros mess into a goreporn pic . Anyroad , here is one of those pictures. This one was a few weeks ago and it made the rounds on the boards and I’ve had a few friends ask me if it would be too much for you . I was thinking about it and it seems it could be too much for me , but I can see where someone else might want to do it . That’s actually not too bad, but it does look a bit too much.

Well, here we have a zombie movie that perhaps isn't even being much of a zombie movie. The entire movie is set in a zombie-plagued near future but yet the movie does very little with this concept. Instead it focuses on a zombie hunter who is trying to get revenge and his money back from a group of other bounty hunters. What good is money anyway when almost the entire world has gone to hell and towns are mostly desolate. And why pay money to people for killing zombies in the first place.

MGM hodgepodge of Jimmy Durante throwing a big party for everybody in Hollywood. No major stars show up--we get the Three Stooges, Laurel & Hardy, Durante and Lupe Velez. I didn't recognize anyone else--they were probably unknowns (for good reason). The movie contains annoyingly unfunny jokes and some truly dreadful songs and choreography. The only things that save this from being a total disaster are Laurel & Hardy's "battle" with Lupe Velez and a wonderful color Disney cartoon called "The Hot Chocolate Soldier". It's a beautiful, very colorful cartoon that gives the movie a huge boost.

Following is an intriguing thriller that requires constant awareness to be completely understood. The plot has many twists and uses displaced chronology. The event sequence complicates following Following. If you are willing to pay attention, it is an exciting movie full of noir earmarks. With the running time at 70 minutes, there is a lot to take in, but the fast pace helps to keep the viewer enthralled.Bill is a lonely, untidy fellow who takes up shadowing people and seeing where they go-what they do. He is a bit too conspicuous, however, and eventually gets caught by a well dressed, clean-cut bloke named Cobb.

That 's a weird , weird movie and does n't deserve a better mark than David Lynch 's one ! I 'm sure you'll love it, if for no other reason than it is so different from your everyday films, so you can enjoy it . But even better, I 'm sure you can find a way to make it your new favourite , so you can make the movie your new 'go to' . Friday, January 14, 2009

This is another movie that I have to watch , even though I had seen it before and thought I had seen the entire movie .

I have to be honest and admit that this movie did basically nothing for me except baffle me completely . The story is a little weird, the characters seem a little flat, and the acting is all over the place. But for all the problems, I enjoyed the film. What I did enjoy about this movie was that it was a bit of a family comedy. You have a bunch of people, and you need to find the funny in them all and you do that in some pretty weird ways, which are pretty amusing in this film.

David Cronenberg movies are easily identifiable , or at least elements within the movie stand out as his trademarks . The first of the Cronenberg films I got a look at was ‘Nanny Diaries’ (1987) , a movie that was made to capitalize off of the then recent success of Wes Anderson’s movie ‘Bottle Land’. The film stars John Cusack in the titular role, as a married man who finds himself the new owner of the house that his wife’s parents had lived in for the past fifty years.

Absolutely the best thing I have ever seen on TV. It was both entertaining and informative. The reason I found this site is an attempt to find out how I can again see it.In the light of present understanding of history we have to sympathize with Gen. Leslie Groves who was responsible for the nuts and bolts of running the Manhattan Project. Most certainly he was not as paranoid about security as most have thought in the past. The casting for the real life people portrayed was outstanding. It was the first time that I noticed Sam Waterston as an actor.

Well, I've just seen Buster Keaton's film debut in Fatty Arbuckle's The Butcher Boy and-despite the crude way everything just seems to happen for almost no logical reason-I found plenty to laugh at. Like when Buster orders molasses from butcher boy Fatty, Fatty makes Buster come back to pay, Buster says he put it in the bucket that has the molasses, Fatty dumps molasses in Buster's hat and takes money, Buster takes hat back on head as it gets stuck, Fatty attempts to remove it while molasses fall to floor, Buster's feet are now stuck on floor and so on.

Cuore Sacro combines glossy film effects with a story that leaves much to be desired. With a script that the screen-writers for "Touched by an Angel" might have passed up as being too impuissant, Ozpetek still keeps us interested at times. In fact, I wanted to focus on the positives but I found the last act so bafflingly bizarre and awful that I think the couple who jumped to their deaths in the very beginning might have been the fortunate ones.This movie is at heart (pun intended) a story built on a big twist-style ending.

Another winner from that 50s , 60s era that I love so much for the comedic value they give with their movies. It's not too dark at all and I love it because of how good it looks, so it makes it look like it can still be used today, but also because of how it was done and it's good to see what people had to go through to get that style. One of my favorite 80s films. The one that has been making my mind racing for years and years...and years, is this.

Stanley Stupid ( Tom Arnold ) and his wife , Joan , like to sleep in bed with their heads in the lap of pillows , so I am sure they are very well fed and healthy. Stanley and I have been together for almost 20 years and we are married. We both like a quiet and secluded life with no family members around and I am not one to have a big group of friends , so we are happy with the little we have . We get together sometimes and share a good time . We have a beautiful home , beautiful grandchildren and great grandchildren.

I just saw this movie at the Tribeca Film Festival and i have to say that i thought it was amazing. The combination of humor and sincerity really made the movie worthwhile. The movie was about a seventeen year-old boy whose mother and father are very religious. The seventeen year old, Ben, decides to work for a retired actress who teaches him about girls and driving and life. It is very comical and touching. I honestly have to say that it is now one of my favorite movies. I recommend this movie to anyone and everyone.

Saw this at the Hong Kong International Film Festival , over three years ago . I went in with no idea what the hell I was doing . . . or if I wanted to do anything with it . . . and I sat in the audience . . . and listened to a young Chinese girl talk about her life in the city , and about what she thought the city of Hong Kong should look like . And I didn’t do anything with it. I just sat there. I did nothing. In fact, I didn’t even know that I was watching a movie at all.

I like `` Hack . '' Think the `` Lone Ranger '' reincarnated as a 2000s cab driver , a loner who loves his family, but knows that being with them every minute is more important than the money. In fact, I don't think I've ever met anyone else who fits the bill. I think I'm a good guy in real life, at least in the way a good person would act toward me. But sometimes, I'm not so sure. Like now when I was going through a divorce, and there were a few times I thought about ending it over the telephone.

By the time the Hellraiser franchise was reaching it 's forth film the premise was wearing a bit thin . The film's reputation is such that even the movie's directors felt the franchise was over. They had come up with something different and fresh that appealed to their audience, but the film never caught on with audiences and was quickly dropped from production. There are a lot of reasons why this happened. There's a lot to take into consideration in that scene, but one of them is that Hellraiser had never been released in America until this movie came out in 2001.

Being a big fan of Stanley Kubrick's Clockwork Orange there was of course "no question about it" that I had to see this one. However I put it off far too long because some of my friends discarded it with comments like "extremely boring" or "nothing happened" "a complete waste of time". But when I saw images on the internet of the mysterious black monolith I was allowed to see a glimpse of the exquisite experience that is 2001: A Space Odyssey. There was no doubt in my mind that I was going to rent that movie the same evening.

I would not recommend it whatsoever . It was like getting stuck in the middle row of a theater , it took a little bit of time before you could even make out what you where reading . The book did have a lot of information, the one thing that I was a bit disappointed with was that it was very, very thin . The writing was not that good either , but it’s not that bad. The characters were well written, but not the most interesting ones, and that was one thing which I was disappointed by. Other than that, I liked it.

This was a great movie . It had one `` sot-so-nice '' outburst . Plus there were some very intense and funny dialogs . This movie is very funny because you can see how it was set up . It is funny to see how it is written because there were some very good lines . I think this movie is one of those movies where I could not get enough of . This movie is quite funny . I will not be going to see this movie just because there is not much comedy . I think you should watch this movie just because it has some intense moments .

I went to see this movie to kill some time. I remember Cole Hauser in "Tigerland", and although his acting is wooden, he does portray a tough "leader" character. Same here. This movie was about a bunch of young, hot scientists and divers exploring a cave in Romania that one has to dive to see. The beginning scene was very interesting, with a bunch of Romanian or Russian men exploring the cave in search of booty. Flash forward 30 years, and we have a team of divers called in by some scientist and his crew to explore some cave for some unknown scientific purpose.

The first feature length Muppet Movie, and excepting maybe The Muppet Christmas Carol, the movie puppeteers the world over are still looking for as a guide. Disney has done the Muppets a dis-service and this movie proves it over and over again. Featuring classic comedians and guest star cameos, keeps to a simple but original plot, classic Muppet lame jokes, Paul Williams genius in song writing, and Electric Mayhem madness, and comes off with an amazing movie especially when you realize that the major cast are puppets. Only Croft has come close to Hensen's genius with puppets.

I think "category 6: day of destruction" was very unrealistic. The digital effects where like a children's cartoon. The actors didn't act realistically, for example, when the girl was shot she acted like she got tomato sauce splatted on her. The movie was boring but I watched it because it was on. The only interesting character was Tornado Tommy, he was funny!Please keep the special effects real.I liked the comment: "What did we do to p.i.s.s-off Mother Nature? "I don't know what else to write to fill up the 10 lines.

I ca n't believe this movie has 6 stars on IMDb . This is one of the worst movies I've seen this year, by far. It's just a shame it got as many ratings as it did, because it's a damn shame. I have no idea why this movie was so popular among young adults (especially the teenage girl part), because I can only imagine that if you watched it with an adult you would think the same about it. This is a movie that has everything that most people love and nothing that most people hate.

This is a Laurel & Hardy comedy short with some great and funny moments but overall the movie relies a bit too much on just one comical premise.The comical premise this movie mostly relies on is very simple; Stan Laurel not wearing any pants. Laurel plays a Scottish naive young person who arrives in America in full kilt. For some reason he gets the center of attention because of this and his uncle played by Oliver Hardy thinks because of this that its time to put some pants on Philip.Its humor is well executed but the main premise also gets a bit tiresome after a while.

This tough-to-see little picture played at the Mods & Rockers 2007 festival . It is a wonderful and loving look at one of my favorite things, motorcycles. I got my first bike at about age nine. I've owned a bike since then. It's a Kawasaki KZ150. I've had some really great memories with that bike, and this little picture captures a lot of those moments. I don't like it, but I still love it. If you haven't experienced that feeling, I highly recommend it. You just can't beat it.

I can get over the political parody ; even if this was SUPPOSE to be a `` Masters of Horror film. I think he could do a better job of it in the U.S.A. than he would here in France or the U.K.

"It's always good to be prepared for bad news. If there is bad news coming, it should come in time." - Winston Churchill

"The way to be happy is to make others unhappy. And so a wise man will always do what he thinks will help others.

One of the problems with popular culture, especially when discussing the popular culture of the 1970s, is that mass media - especially television - is usually about four years behind 'underground' media, primarily music. Many people think the 'Woodstock Generation" remained important throughout the 1970s; actually, it was all over at Altamont in 1970. By 1972, 'underground' rock or the 'counterculture' had moved east to England and Led Zepplin, Black sabbath, and David Bowie, early metal-heads and the so-called 'glam-rockers,' who were all 'peace and love' - not.

I have not seen and heard the original version.I am no Russian, but I am learning right now.I also have no preferences for Russia, Bulgaia, the US etc.But what I have to mention is:In the German synchronisation in the whole film all Russians speak with Russian accent. Americans talk "Hochdeutsch" (without accent)! I have never heard such a stupidity! Besides, this is boring.I hope the original is better.The rest is a simple thriller, not really good ideas. Like a cheap version of a James Bond film.

This movie was so frustrating. Everything seemed energetic and I was totally prepared to have a good time. I at least thought I'd be able to stand it. But, I was wrong. First, the weird looping? It was like watching "America's Funniest Home Videos". The damn parents. I hated them so much. The stereo-typical Latino family? I need to speak with the person responsible for this. We need to have a talk. That little girl who was always hanging on someone? I just hated her and had to mention it.

Fans of Euro-horror flicks - Portland 's video/DVD store Movie Madness has a whole section devoted to this genre - and for the past month, we've been on the hunt looking for the next. We're talking horror - specifically: the kind of scary that makes your blood run cold because it's out of your grasp. But while there are a few good horror films coming out in the United States, the one that stands out the most in this part of the world is the new French horror flick: La Grande Illusion, which was released last week in Germany and Spain.

OK , I admit that I still associate Sophie Marceau with La Boum . That was the main reason I liked her and she has been a wonderful friend and inspiration to a lot of us who follow the world of fashion. I’m not a fashion designer or stylist but I admire what she does and I think her approach to fashion is unique. So, there are two things that I love about these images:

1. There’s a very personal and candid expression on Sophie’s face. She isn’t trying to be something she isn’t in that picture.

i watched the longer version and could not take my eyes off the screen . 219 minutes passed and yet there were not enough words to describe the experience of the game . If I had to sum it up, I'd say it is one of the most realistic simulations of the human body ever created . I do not know how this game was so well received because I had the experience of experiencing something like that in my life . That is all for now ... See you again in another episode of the series .

I was attracted to this film by its offbeat, low-key, 'real life' story line. That is, a twenty-something guy flops in the Big Apple and comes back home to live with his parents and even more floppy brother. It just might have worked but there's a problem. And that problem's name is Casey Affleck. Casey Affleck is nearly catatonic in this film. His acting mantra must be "exert as little effort as possible at all times". Or "why speak when you can mutter?" Or maybe "put yourself into a coma as soon as the camera rolls".

This movie actually almost made me cry.For starters the fake teeth . Then you spot a nice plastic or drawn picture of the person and it’s too much for the movie to keep up. Then you get the idea that I might be able to make that happen because I was looking into that same thing. Then you find out that you don’t have a budget and the movie never even makes an impact. Then I realize that I can’t afford to make the movie but I could get some help to make that happen.

! ! ! ! MILD SPOILERS ! ! ! ! The premise goes like this : A store gets burnt to the ground by an unknown attacker. What do you think of the store owner, who was the main character of the show ? He's dead, but he gets to see a whole lot of life in the store from his perspective. But what does it all mean ? What's his life like ? He also gets to see that he will have to sacrifice his whole life to the store owner, who was in a coma and didn't know what happened to him.

It seems at least vaguely possible that this movie provided a bit of inspiration for `` The Sopranos , '' in that it could serve as an ode to all the hard-partying, high-flying New York City of Tony Soprano. It certainly seems a fitting metaphor for the end of his life and the way he eventually dies, shot to death by a cop who happens to be a member of the local mafia. I guess I should make a confession: my first thought when I saw this movie, and I'm not even sure I knew it, was just how good this movie is.

This has got to be the most god-awful piece of cinematic crap I have ever watched. It makes Mel Brooks movies Oscar-worthy by comparison. Jim VanBebber needs to be publicly slapped for trying to pass this off as ANY form of entertainment.While some may say that this movie is true to the low budget genre of such classics as "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre" or "Night of the Living Dead", the production value is not in question. It is VanBebber's ability to cast and present a plausible story line. The casting is deplorable.

Chris Morris' Brass Eye TV series had always generated a large number of complaints, both from the audience and from the people taking part. But, nothing he has done has managed to stir up more controversy than this. The 2001 Brass Eye Special. Before the hugely overrated Jerry Springer Opera arrived, the Brass Eye Special held the record for the most complaints received about any TV program ever aired.The sheer volume of complaints that the general public made towards the Brass Eye Special was unbelievable! Many complaints were voiced by people who never even watched the program!

In general, I prefer horror movies that creep me out so much I'm afraid of everything for the next day or so, not the ones where people act stupid and get killed by an indestructible monster. This is one of those movies. The chupacabra of legend is a dog-faced lizard-skin greenish-gray monster that hops like a kangaroo, has fangs and claws, has a row of sharp spines sticking out from its back, and sucks the blood of livestock. As in many horror movies, good and bad, this movie takes liberty with the legend.

Another first: this French movie is my introduction to the world Eric Rohmer. Perhaps I'm a bit hasty when I say that this is probably my last Rohmer movie but I was immediately turned off by the way Rohmer relies on monotonous philosophical conversations that never get to the point. There is a scene in the movie where the characters discuss love that I thought was never going to end. Honestly, no matter how much I tried, I couldn't understand why Rohmer is so highly regarded among cinephiles. He struck me as being one of those obnoxiously petulant people who are filled with hot air.

Hearkening back to those `` Good Old Days '' of 1971 , we can vividly recall when we were treated to a new television version of `` The Three Musketeers'' . As with the movie, we watch a group of young men get ready to meet up with the `` King '' of Hearts '' in Paris. Then we see them in real life and they start to get it on. By now, we can tell you the scene. The two boys are dressed up in their finest clothes; they look sharp.

What I got was something better.Just like many movies I 've commented on as of recently , I 'd been looking for something like this for a long time . I've seen it with other people and they have a very good feeling about it but I have not seen the whole movie , which is my next point.But I found some of it very good and the others not so much . I guess I have no right to say anything else but this movie is an example of something which I have not seen and I don't want to be the only one who has a feeling about it.

After sitting through this god-awful 82-minute excuse of a film , and having previously wanted to gouge my eyes out and kill my face off , now I’m even less impressed with the film. It’s actually worse than the original (which I can only really explain by looking at the poster), with the characters and plot being a total ripoff of the original. I mean, if you liked this, then you should hate it, right? However, I’m not sure the film can be blamed on the script.

I watched this video because I like Malta and this movie was filmed in its entirety there . Very disappointing. The dialogue is in Maltese and I was so disappointed that they didn't give the same amount of English to translate it as they did with this film. I've seen the Maltese film and I've loved it. This film, however, did not have the same impact. I can understand why they were filming in Malta because of the history and the language. But not only was there not a translation, I think the filmmakers were not trying to make an effort to translate it at all.

Three American lads are backpacking their way around Europe , challenging each other to accumulate as many daredevil stunts and tricks as possible before they can take their next trip. The guys from the US have traveled to Italy , Greece, and Turkey to test their skills. Here, we get to talk to each other about all the craziness going on, and how you can use your imagination to add some style to your next trip. This trip was definitely different from all of the other American trips that I’ve taken, but I enjoyed it a lot.

Relish every moment of this languorous spectacle with music to match ( Mahler 's 5th is gorgeous , but listen to what is going on)

And just like that, the curtain comes down and the stage is set, and the audience can be treated to all that I have ever wanted to see, with only one problem: all of this is happening in a darkened room and the entire set list is a song by the same name! I’ve heard of this kind of gig, but was I really the only one looking forward to it? Do I know who this band is?

Oh boy . Where do I begin on this piece of slime ? This is one of the few real life examples I've come across that actually has a plot, and that makes it all that much better. So here we go :

It's the middle of the year, and the world is reeling from the recent terrorist attacks in the middle east. As a consequence, the US has been forced to pull out of the war in the middle east, and back away from the southern states, where most of the oil wells were.

I was surprised to like this movie since I 'm from the `` check your brain at the door and see if you live to be a hundred'' school of writing, and the writing in this movie makes no sense to me. The only reason this movie would be interesting to me is because of the title. I was expecting a better quality movie. I think the story was interesting but the writing sucked. This movie has the same kind of problem that most bad movies have when they're trying to say something new and engaging, especially in their first half.

Awful in a whole new way , ANYTHING BUT LOVE probably should be seen by movie buffs -- if only because that's what I am, the only movie buff in my family, and I have a great appreciation for the work done on these movies. I was just watching this on YouTube, and I'm pretty sure I saw the trailer at least 3 times. I have been going through this book since it first came out more than a year ago, so I have to admit that I was surprised when I saw this coming.

this movie is so bad and Hellraiser part 1 to 3 are so great . Nothing is good Bloodline ...and it makes no sense to try to make a movie after seeing a movie like that. I have seen this movie 2x and the movie was very good but I think there are some problems after that. Bloodline is an awful movie, it has all the worst scenes ever and the story is unbelievable. I want to see another movie with that story, but this one is not good enough to make a good movies. And I think Hellraiser part 2 and 3 is pretty good.

I have always loved The Muppets. Though most children's entertainment then wasn't that likable, The Muppet's was. The Muppet's are very, very funny. They are probably the most likable children's characters ever. Not only did The Muppets have their own show. They also have starred in many films. from The Muppet's Christmas carol to The Muppet's treasure Island. The first Muppet's movie, The Muppet movie, was also, like the show and the other films, excellent.The Muppet movie is about how they all got started.

I swear if I did ever tried cocaine I'd be able to relate to this film perfectly. Its pace, as well as the dialog, churns out at speeds that some viewers might need to stop and relax their heads.There are great little elements that pop up through out the film, like how Rob Lowe's character seems to always be loosing a shoe, or how some characters keep running spirals around his zigzagged path.
