The story was put together extremely well and the direction seems flawless.The movie reeks of clumsy and cuteness. This is one I think most could enjoy.

Ed Wood rides again . The fact that this movie was made should give any youngaspiring film maker hope . . . I have never understood why people think that if a movie is based on real life people its not good because its a fake . It has always been this way since the earliest days of cinema . I think that a movie is good if it tells a story and gives the characters and situations that you could identify with . I am also a movie fan and have always been interested in what real people would think about this movie .

This is one of those strange, self-important, self-indulgent movies which tries too hard to be profound. It isn't. Instead, it spouts cliches that try to pass for Profundity. Typical is the scene where Peter (Kelsey Grammer) explains to protagonist and best friend Adam (Dwier Brown) how man starts life breast feeding, then moves on to sucking the breast of his girlfriend, and finally his wife, thus concluding ultimately that life sucks. So deep. We are treated to a variety of characters who offer their perspective of life, the universe, etc.

One of the more prominent/popular episodes, but clearly one of the worst. A red-shirt female falls for Khan (instead of dropping dead - for a change) and then proceeds to betray Kirk and the Enterprise as if loyalty were a non-existent character trait on the ship. Makes one wonder what kind of psychology tests this supposedly brilliant Starfleet uses to test people when hiring. We have the same kind of absurd lack of loyalty in "Wink Of An Eye", when a red-shirt male takes the enemy's side just because he falls in love! Same as in SS.

With a cast like this, I knew the acting would be amazing. Still, I was cautious, as I always am of sequels. Would it sustain the feeling of the first film? Could they possibly replicate the tension and thrill of the masterful heist of Ocean's 11? We'll never know, because they didn't try. At least, not in the way I expected. Instead, they made a light and truly funny parody of the heist genre. If you want a gripping, logical heist, don't watch this.

Altioklar: Master of the thieves. Watch some movie, steal some parts of them, write a script... It must be very easy to be a director in Turkey. I think Altioklar watched "Identity (2003)", "Saw (2004)", a few series which is about crime, murder etc. then he said "Eureka, eureka"(i have found it!) after that he wrote the script of the movie.You can guess the murderer at the beginning of the movie. It took only 10 minutes for me.

Frank Sinatra starred in this odd little short from RKO that is now in the public domain. The film came out at about the same time the war ended and is a nice plea for religious tolerance.The film begins with Sinatra on stage singing. After leaving the stage, he walks out into the alley and finds a group of kids picking on another because of his religion. Instead of yelling at the boys (or helping them for that matter), Sinatra delivers a nice civics lesson on religious toleration and equates prejudice with fascism.

One of my all-time favourite movies . Nothing can beat watching this movie for the first time . If I had to be in that room with them at the time, it wouldn't be enough to have seen it before. I'm talking about the first time when your eyes first come to see this film . Then when the tears come, you have to let it all go, and you're glad you got to see it first. If you liked this, please give it a Like . Thank you so much .

You know, I really hate IMDb's censor system, since my entire review is almost gone if you take out the cursing. But here we go. Editing time!Holy moley is this bad. I thought it might be a cool little movie, judging by the plot summary, since yknow I've blindly rented such gems as Frailty and American Nightmare before. But this is just abominal. It's about a killer who uses Edgar Allen Poe's works as reference for his murderous exploits, and the story of a detective who has to stop him.

I suppose I like this film as well as any I know; it is not perfect, but under the title "The Americanization of Lily" this charming and memorable semi-musical satire might I suggest have been appreciated more, and still loved by those who recognized its special Blake Edwards'-produced spirit of gentleness, clever humor and solid narrative. The improbably but delightful story-line follows Lili Smith, a fringe-type spy for the Germans in a much simpler and less black-and-white war; Lili Schmidt passing as Smith is helping her Uncle who is patriotic too, for Germany but neither cruel nor political, merely opportunistic.

This was the worst TV movie I had ever seen . The visuals were so dang choppy it made me want to watch the movie twice to have it at the highest frame rate possible. Also I did not believe the premise of this movie even as I kept thinking that they would make it into an actual TV show, but I guess it’s just not gonna happen. I still have not seen a movie in a theater that I really dislike as much as this one. It is just so dang boring and slow that I was kind of in shock to the end.

Three children are born during a solar eclipse and ten years later this has somehow caused them to grow up without consciences. As their simultaneous tenth birthday celebrations approach, they become cunning and calculating cold-blooded murderers. Nice-girl local teen Joyce Russel (Lori Lethin) finds herself confronting these little terrors when most others are falling for their angelic demeanors.Hearkening back to films like "The Bad Seed" and "Village of the Damned", this films' premise of evil children may not be wholly original but it's still pretty disturbing. All three of the child actors - Elizabeth Hoy, Billy Jacoby, and Andy Freeman - are chillingly convincing.

This is a new Barbie movie . The graphics were really good . They made the movie seem partially realistic . The voice actors did a really good job . And the actresses did a good job . The first movie was a commercial success and the sequel will probably do even better . It has a lot of really good action . The movie's story was based on true events . And all the characters did a lot for the character . They did a great job in acting . I'm not a fan of the movie but I am very happy with some of the characters and I liked some of the dialog .

As a parent of two girls ( 14 and 11 ) I have grave doubts about this show and all of the books written about it. It's not about being strong or being brave. It's not about making the best of a bad situation and being an individual in the process. It's about getting the best out of what you can and what you have to deal with. And to be completely honest, it's not really that interesting. I have to tell you, after watching it once, I can't remember a thing about it.

This was the first Chan film made by Monogram. What a come down from Fox values and standards! I was shocked when I saw my first Monogram after seeing the great Fox films. This is boring and uninspired with wild music playing as Chan calmly walks across the street. Chan is now working for the US Secret Service rather than the Honolulu Police Department. He is assisted by Benson Fong, who plays No. 3 Son Tommy for the first time. He also has a daughter along, Iris Chan, played by Marianne Quon. Mantan Moreland also makes his debut as Birmingham Brown.

This movie is a very enjoyable homage to the Bogart and other detective films of old . Robert Sacchi nails every aspect of Bogart in this film. He gives you all the details that you would want him to give and gives you a film that is just as exciting as it is entertaining. As you know, there are many actors who play Bogart and the film is based on the life of Bogart. Sacchi plays Bogart and his life was the subject of this film and it works very well. You get all the information that you need to know about his life.

The films use of blue-black and vibrant skin tones to create a noir-ish feel to this movie unfortunately do not translate to any other movie that I have seen but is a great idea nonetheless. It's kind of confusing to me at the moment but I am not sure how to interpret it at the moment, maybe it's me not being as sharp as I should be with these films, but in my humble opinion it was great and very dark and moody. If you have some feedback on my interpretation feel free to comment below or on the film forum.

Let 's get things straight . I was raised Catholic , and in a very religious family , and spent more than 10 years in Catholic schools, and I did well . I was a good student from the very beginning. I did very well in Catholic High School, and I did well in Catholic colleges , and in several Catholic Universities . Then I came out . I got a job , and I got married and moved to USA , and there I became a Muslim . I had no problems in my job , but in the company I did have problems.

This short subject gathered kudos from all kinds of places for its plea for religious toleration. After a session at a recording studio Frank Sinatra leaves and comes upon a group of kids beating up on another because he was Jewish. He lectured them as only an American icon could about the meaning of prejudice and what we had just fought for against the Nazis. The meaning could not be clearer.Both songs from this short subject were recorded and sold big for Columbia records. If You Are But A Dream and the song written for the film, The House I Live In.

Amazing , amazing , amazing . What more can be said ? Jacobi is the best Hamlet ever to grace the silver screen, it is a must see , must have on any theatre or concert tour , must buy your tickets in the theatre , and if there is a movie that you like , you should see it . I have seen it three times and it was the best of the three . Legendary hammy and arrogant horror movie star Conrad Radzoff (splendidly played with wicked sardonic aplomb by Ferdy Mayne) dies of a heart attack. A bunch of drama school students steal Radzoff's corpse from its crypt and take it to a rundown mansion so they can party with it. Radzoff comes back to life and picks off the rude youths for desecrating his grave. Writer/director Norman Thaddeus Vane concocts a fresh, original, and even pretty stylish spin on the usual body count premise, offers a neat evocation of the glitzy Hollywood milieu, and does a sturdy job of maintaining a pleasingly misty and spooky ooga-booga atmosphere.

Leni Riefenstahl would be embarrassed by the disgusting propaganda Moore tries to call "humor". That this movie, and Moore's other prevarications, actually attract admirers proves that, alas, it's possible to fool some of the people all of the time.Let's see if we can bait foreigners. Let's see if we can extol obsolete factories. Let's see if we can add to the sum of hatred in the world. Let's see if we can pretend we're funny. Let's see if we can out-isolationist Charles Lindbergh.

For me, reviewing movies is an extension of my love of film--and of horror cinema, in particular. The reviews I've written thus far have been for films that I love, respect, and admire, and I have eagerly rewarded them with glowing accolades and perfect-ten ratings. A life-long horror movie fan, it is a tremendous pleasure for me to be able to share with others my thoughts and ideas about great horror films, and to, hopefully, have a hand in exposing people to movies they may not otherwise seek out.

Imagine an exploitive remake of The Defiant Ones with a black chick and a white chick attached to each other. Set the story on some Caribbean island where the drug dealers rule and the revolution has arrived. And have the black woman be from Huggy Bear's stable of ladies and the white woman be a watered down Patty Hearst and you've got Black Mama, White Mama.In those waning days of the drive-in theater this item must have been a big old hit. All the hot buttons of the Seventies are pushed in this one.

I remember seeing this film when I was 13 years old and I fell in love with it and I was a big fan of the film and the characters I adored. My favorite character was Stacey (Heidi Holicker), because she made me laugh when she showed no interest in Fred (Cameron Dye) who really liked her and I was hoping that in the end that they would get together then her boring boyfriend, Ralphie (Christopher Murray)because he ignored her and hung out with his friends. I love the cast and the story.

Enormous suspension of disbelief is required where Will's "genius" is concerned. Not just in math--he is also very well read in economic history, able to out-shrink several shrinks, etc etc. No, no, no. I don't buy it. While they're at it, they might as well have him wearing a big "S" on his chest, flying faster than a jet plane and stopping bullets.Among other problems...real genius (shelving for the moment the problem of what it really is, and whether it deserves such mindless homage) doesn't simply appear /ex nihilo/.

Overall , a well done movie . There were the parts that made me wince , and there were the parts that made me laugh . there were some things that weren't funny , but the humor was definitely there , and some of the action sequences were funny , i could just feel the humor , and i think that was the reason why most people who went to the theater were laughing . it's not a terrible movie , but it was not a great movie . but it's still better than almost anything that's come out recently .

This self-important , confusing b+w `` film '' watches like an infant on a very bad acid trip . You can tell the film itself is made to look like it's supposed to be seen by children at an art school , or at the very least by adults with children . And that's not all . You can see what it takes to produce this sort of film . The film has no story . It is simply a montage . The camera simply shows images from around the world . And you can tell that all these images are made from very simple images that can be obtained with a common camera .

The Soap is an interesting movie and very brilliant at parts . You must watch it for its strong characterisation and for the brilliant dialogue. I was so bored after seeing it that I could have stayed a day longer in the cinema. There are so many things that I want to write on this but the best part of this soaps life is that it is great in it’s first few scenes and the rest is a very enjoyable movie. To be honest the plot is not much to speak about . I will try and give some insight to it by the end of this post .

I like Arnold, and I love the subject matter, but this was a very disappointing movie. When I first saw the previews, they were dark and ominous, and Arnold's name wasn't even mentioned. But I recognized him, which led me to believe that he was making a movie that had more of a serious, suspenseful mood. That it wasn't just another Schwarzenegger action vehicle (though I admit, most of his are pretty good!). He had, thus far, avoided movies with any real religious theme. And I was excited.

Whoa , this is one of the WORST movies I have EVER seen ! The packaging for the film is absolutely terrible. This is definitely a touching movie , and a great expression of Charles Darwins personal struggle . The movie is full of symbolism , symbolism is everywhere , even in the soundtrack ! !!! !!! !!! !!! !!! I saw it with my son and I was struck by how much of his pain and anger were mirrored by our own reactions to the situation that had been set into motion. His anger was directed at the government, his rage at the injustice he had witnessed and felt so powerless in . His frustration and frustration was reflected in our anger as well .

When King Kong stripped her of her top in the 1976 remake , I was breathless . I do n't know how many times I've gone to the bathroom after seeing that scene and not wanting to wait for the credits, but it never seemed like such a bad idea when it came to me. I had never seen the original movie and still had a lot of questions as to whether the film was the best version of King Kong I'd seen. I also didn't think I'd ever want to see the first film again after it turned out that the original film was a bit of a disaster.

In fact it was awful. The main chick in it who gets topless was obviously sleeping with the director at the time. It was shot at some warehouse most likely owned by family or friends. Also they chose not to bother coming up with a story. Sure these are ways to cut cost, but are they smart ways of keeping costs down? No they aren't. At the very least they could have found a middle school student in a "creative writing" course. Those kids may have at least had a lesson about story structure.

OK, this movie, was the worst display I have seen in years. The actors weren't to bad (I figured it was a b-movie so they were doing b-movie acting). Anyways, I watched this movie, thinking, OH COOL a UFO Sci-Fi movie. WRONG. It was just an excuse for radical Christians to push a message onto people. The last scene was extremely messed up. I can't understand why IMDb users would rate this movie 5.2/10? It really is great, very funny. I would strongly recommend this movie for all of you, adults, teenagers and especially children! The story is about a 14-year-old kid who always tell lie, at home and school. One day he had his homework of writing a 1000-word-story. But he didn't, so the teacher told him to write it and gave her in 3 hours, or he would have to go to Summer School. Yep, he wrote it in 2:45.

at the story . It is reality mixed with Americana- and very original.Emily Grace is a young girl tired of not being good enough and feeling like she is being scammed out of her future . When her family takes a vacation in the United States of America, they are introduced to a girl that will make their dreams come true ! It takes place in the city of San Francisco where they find the girl and her family but soon learn that they will not make it to the promised land and find that she is more than they can imagine .

I 'm not sure if this is a comedy or not , but I found it pretty comical . Isobel is the most popular girl in secondary school to me, and she knows it. I also think she is the smartest girl of her generation and she would always have a question about something. She doesn’t seem to like the popular girl because she is more intelligent. So I guess I have been spoiled with girls that are more popular than I, but I can see she is pretty cool in a different way. She is a good dancer, good listener, a good friend.

I love this movie , first and foremost because of Mark Wahlberg is in it and secondly because the end of this film was so sad and so heartbreaking to me, I hope that this doesn’t ruin anything else in the film . I hope you like it as well, I thought I would share my review of this one. A story that I never wanted to see was a film that I never wanted to watch , and I’m so glad that I had the opportunity to see it , and if you haven’t seen it I highly recommend you go see it.

Awesome Movie ! Great combination of talents ! I 'm a HUGE fan of David Duchovny and he is outstanding . He had a fantastic time and did a wonderful job . I would rate this as a 5 - Star ! It has all of the elements you would expect from a David Duchovny performance and it comes together seamlessly . It is one of the very best movies ever made . I have already seen this film twice on the big screen , so it will definitely be a treat for me and I can only imagine how much you all will enjoy this movie .

George Hearn really went all out and over the top which in this case was great . I 've heard some horror stories but I've never had the kind of terror that I had for the last time with this film. I found this film to be the most exciting and exciting and scary film I 've ever seen at the movies . I would recommend to anyone that has the chance . It is a scary film and one that I would definitely recommend to you and I know I 'm not the only one who will be saying that after watching this film

A great film, well directed and written.

I did have some expectations from this film because 1 . It was a Yash raj production 2 . When the first teaser was released, I was pleasantly surprised. It was a nice change from a lot of other Bollywood films that have been in development and production for a long time. 3 . It was a very fun movie and a very well shot one. 4 . I got to know a lot more about the movie's characters, story, the director and the producer. I was really entertained by the way the film was made.

Are sea side resorts the sad, dreary places they're always depicted as in movies and novels? Certainly this movie, along with the near-contemporary "Don't Look Now" depicts Venice as a particularly squalid and decadent tourist trap (for a more light-hearted approach, see "Just Married" with Ashton Kutcher and Brittany Murphy). Having never been to Venice I can't say for sure, but it does make a perfect setting for this somber but sumptuous spectacle from Luchino Visconti, one of the great stylists of world cinema.

The film is a joy to watch, not just for the plot, which is gripping, but also for the superb performances of the actors, Deneuve and Belmondo. Though considered a 'flop' on its first release it has become a critical success, and it is clear to see why. Deneuve's acting style suited the film brilliantly. she constantly gives the impression that she is holding back or hiding something, and her character in this film is. I will not spoil it with saying what, though it is divulged fairly early on. Belmondo is lovable as the fairly naiive but in love tobacconist.

This film proves a theory I have had for quite some time - in Australia , as long as a person knows the local dialect they can speak the language of their choice . It was not the case in England or in the USA. This may seem strange, but when you visit your native country it's a common experience to have a conversation in a language other than the one you were born in , and you can understand it, or at least you can understand it to the point of being understood if you're lucky.

Oh , the horror , the unspeakable horror of this film . If you can even call it a film . For some reason it makes me want to sit in the car on the street corner watching this thing play out in the dark . But , it's true . It's really a scary movie. And yes , I recommend you sit in a car if that's all you have , and you can see this movie in the dark. But , you do have the option of sitting in the dark to see this movie , and it is one of the scariest horror films ever made.

I was fortunate enough to catch a midnight screening of this movie tonight . I must say , I was amazed to see all the great performances and great actors. I am so glad that this movie has been selected for this year’s Best Picture Oscar . For me , I feel that the film is so much more than a romantic comedy . The film also deals with the issues of terrorism , religion , family, and the loss of innocence . I’ve always liked this movie as I found it very interesting .

This movie is very modern and forward . It is about 75 % in English . It is aimed at the young audiences. The plot is simple , there is only one main character , a teenager , who falls into a dangerous situation in a remote place and she has to save her family and her friends . The girl has a strong belief that she can make a new life and she is very brave . Kamal, a young man from the city of Jaipur , lives in his uncle's house . He loves to ride motorcycles .

The Australian public and the Australian film industry are often heard to complain that there are not enough great Aussie movies being made. While that is certainly the case with many other countries, it's worth noting that Australia has a much higher rate of movie production than the USA (and even New Zealand), and there's no denying that there are far more good movies out there. Australia's film production has been steadily growing in the last few decades, as shown by the fact that in 2014, the year of our last census, it was estimated to have about 5 per cent of world production of films.

This movie has an outstanding acting, by Marilia Pêra, and a stunning dicretcion by the argentine Hector Babenco. This is, in my opinion, the best Brazilian movie ever made. The movie was filmed with child from the 'favelas' , the brazilian ghetos. The children weren't actors and were casted by Babenco in the city of Rio de Janeiro. The story is about the criminal children that are arrested in the correctional prison, that looks much worse than Alcatraz. The children are constantly raped and beaten by the policeman. Unfortunately this is not purely fiction, in Brazil it does happen till today.

The most disturbing thing about this film is not that it 's a load of hogwash ( the CPUSA was a sham) but that it presents the real story as it is. The CPUSA has been trying and failing to present the real story for decades and the reason for the failures is clear and obvious. The real story and the one presented by the CPUSA is that of the Communist Party being controlled by a group of individuals, a faction or clique. What is most troubling is that the story is told and presented as a tale of power, lies, corruption, greed and betrayal.

In "Red Letters", Coyote is at the vortex of as a college professor who writes to a female prison inmate and gets more than he bargained for. There are two reasons to watch this flick...Kinski is one and Piven the other although it's difficult for their sparks to shine in such a complete directorial disaster. Everything is wrong with "Red Letters"...convoluted, lousy screenplay, camera, editing, and most of all acting which is subpar for Coyote, etc. Battersby has taken a story with potential and turned it into a seriously flawed and amateurish flick not worth the time.

I am a big follower of Indian Movies especially Malayalam and Tamil.Shame on India for not sending this movie as a box office blockbuster and for making so many Tamil movies. I am a big fan of this movie too, but I feel it should have not been made as box office blockbuster.The story of the movie was not very interesting and I feel it didn’t give much of an edge to the movie. The film was released on 29 March 2016 and got a decent response from the movie goer. But still this film was not a box office hit.

During filming, was Vanessa Redgrave taking mogadon? It was like she was reading from an autocue. I've seen more life in a wooden spoon. Or perhaps that was all part of the character? whatever, it was very very annoying, I kept wanting to shake the screen to hurry her up. I read the book a long time ago & didn't like much about it except that Septimus's descent into madness was very well done - but I don't think Rupert Graves showed this very well, his acting was all on the surface.

THE SCREAMING is a very low budget horror movie that was shot on video. It features passable acting, poor lighting, a weak story, and some of the worst monster effects I've ever seen. The plot has a college student being pressured to join a cult by his attractive landlord. The cult is a parody of Scientology with a book similar to Dianetics. This would have been a funny shot at that group were it not for a dumb script and the cheapness of the production. The monster effects look awful and the picture quality makes it feel like you're watching a home video or a public-service announcement.

Anastasia : The Mystery of Anna was a two-part star studded historical T.V . movie based on the Peter Kurth novel of the same name and the film was released on 13 and 14 August 2014 in Canada and the United States. The two-part film featured two of the best known Russian film directors of the day, Alexey Popogokin and Oleg Vengerov, as well as the young Russian actress Anna Koval, who was the lead actress in the movie. The story follows Anna's search for her missing father who disappeared at the age of one and whose remains were found six years later in an isolated location.

One of the worst films I have ever seen ! After watching it i walk out like , what happened to all those beautiful women who were in it ?! I mean i like the story so much, but there is just so much of it in this movie that one can just about see why it was made ! There is some really funny lines in it and some serious moments, but that is all in the film and it has nothing to do with the movie itself

I know I have said this before. It is one of those films that everyone has seen.

This one is a poor attempt at spinning the old `` cons turn good '' yarn , which we have seen all too many times over the last two weeks. And it may work, but only if we can manage to get a few more people in the room, and get on their nerves a little more. One of the most important problems in our current environment is the lack of communication. There are people in positions of authority and power who know and care nothing about the lives of their people. They care about themselves, not the people they are supposed to serve.

Mr. Bug Goes to Town was one of those films that I grew up hearing about , however a copy that I had never seen at the local library. I have however since been to the local library where this DVD was located and have been reading reviews of this film. Although this is not a documentary style film it does manage to tell its story fairly well even though the narration is somewhat forced. The film also does a fairly good job of telling us what the movie is all about without going overboard on the subject matter.

Eaten Alive plays out like a bad rehearsal for the following year 's Cannibal Ferox . The characters are universally awful. It's a shame too, because it's funny. And it's so bad, it makes me hope that it might actually be funny at some point. The thing is, I don't want to enjoy it. I don't even want to watch it in a theater because I'd rather read it. It's so bad, I could watch it in a movie theater at home and not be able to laugh while I watch it.

My one-line summary hints that this is not a good film, but this is not true. I did enjoy the movie, but was probably expecting too much.Adele, who is solidly portrayed by Susan Sarandon, did not come off as a very likable character. She is flighty and irresponsible to what would be an unforgivable degree were it not for the tremendous love she has for her daughter. This is the one thing she knows how to do without fail. Adele's daughter, Anna, is a sad girl who is so busy making up for her mother's shortcomings that she does not seem to be only 14-17 years old.

I admire Deepa Mehta and this movie is a masterpiece . I 'd recommend to buy this movie on DVD or blu ray

This was a very special film. It has so much depth and is full of life and drama. This is a good movie to watch for the lovers of action, thriller and Bollywood movies.I am not going to talk about the technical aspects here, I would rather go into the actual film itself, which is the best movie that you will never forget, and the one that is worth your time.

I still count `` Police Squad ! '' as the absolute funniest TV show of the 1980s . Somewhere , I know it, I'm laughing . Not at the show , I'm laughing . Of course, some of that was because the character of Inspector Morse wasn't based on anything other than a real person . He was an amalgamation of three different people , and it was only a matter of time before they went on to create their own TV series . For me, though , the character really came alive with the first season .

So keira knightly is in it ... So automatically we compare this film to attonement . Aside rom the fact it is so much like attion it is basically impossible to not be impressed by it . Not only is keira's character just as strong , but the chemistry is flawless . This film does a fantastic job of making you care about a young man , and his family. I agree with the previous posters on this one, I really enjoyed this film, though i have never seen it before, and was glad when i could go to it on DVD.

Nightkill stars Robert Mitchum as a world-weary private eye probing the case of a missing industrialist (Mike Connors). He is hired by Jaclyn Smith, the anxious wife of the missing man. What Jaclyn fails to inform Mitchum is that she knows full well her husband's whereabouts. After all, she was the one who helped her lover James Franciscus dispose of her wealthy hubby.What more would expect from a rotten slasher film with Robert Mitchum? Mannix goes western, monkeys are abused, models lean against classic cars, and Smith is constantly upstaged by Sybil Danning until a giallo style wrap-up brings the whole sorry mess to a bitter end.

i was one "chosen" to see this movie in a sneak preview.first you should know that this film is based on the video game "far cry", a for its time really good game (2004). second you should know that the regisseur of this flick is the great uwe boll. this is a man, who takes video games (dungeon siege, bloodrayne, postal, etc.) and makes movies out of them (VERY horrible ones....).i still remember when i saw boll's "the king's swords: a dungeon siege tail".

This is a decent movie . Although little bit short in time for me , it packs a lot of punch . The plot begins when a young man from a small town goes to live in a big city and he falls in love with a girl from a different class of people. It's a classic romantic-thriller , and it gets better and better as it progresses . The plot is quite straightforward , so it doesn't distract from the storyline . The script is quite good , if a bit stiff , and the cinematography is pretty good as well . One thing is a bit lacking .

Of all the directors ever to sit behind a camera Wellman could break your heart quicker than anyone . Even as he aged Wellman seemed to be more and more convinced of his own genius. Wellman, one of the finest directors ever to have worked on film , was born in Boston on February 3, 1884, the second son of a tailor. Wellman was the second of seven children, three of his brothers and sisters having preceded him. His mother was a French-Canadian lady, and his father’s family spoke French. He lived with his grandfather and uncle, both of whom were also well-known New England fabriciers.

This is a beautiful , yet simple movie about one man , driven to find an answer , an answer for his own question , which is why ? The question is - is the question the answer ? And that is why , it all starts with the little boy in the car . He had the answer , and he had it in the palm of his hand . Then suddenly he was alone in the room . He was all alone . All his friends were dead . All his dreams . All of his life , his memories . All his hopes for the future , all for himself .

This Blake Edwards film is n't too sure whether it wants to be a comedy , a drama or a drama. If it had to describe itself in three word descriptors it would be: "WTF? I didn't even know this movie was in production or anything!" And the reason why it isn't is because I haven't seen the film yet, so my review is written in a very light and vague manner. But I will say that the film's story is interesting and if you are interested in knowing more about the movie and why it is good, I suggest watching this film.

This film with fine production values features secrets and how friends use each other. Henry May Long is a very well-acted, dimly lit, depressing turn-of-the-century period piece about a friendship between a fatally ill man and a melancholy, indebted junkie. Talky drawing room dramas are not my cup of tea, and all the crying wears thin. Recommended if you like independent, slyly intellectual, slow-paced Merchant Ivory-type features. I suspected that the main characters were in love, but their connection was so intimated, it didn't really have the emotional impact of 'Brokeback Mountain.'

`` Yagyu ichizoku no inbo '' ( let 's just say `` The Shogun 's Samurai '' ) is somewhere in the middle, or at least somewhere near middle-ish. It's quite a good film, and the story is well done, but the music is a little thin. It's an unfortunate choice of music for a samurai story, as I think the soundtrack is one reason why it isn't so well-received. In short, the music is really good, and the sound-design is top-notch. The animation, by the way, is pretty much on par with a normal animated movie, which is great.

I 'm a large scarred heterosexual male ex-bouncer , ex-rugby player , and ex-boxer , and I love this movie.It is based on a true story , and it's about a young british boy who was born into a violent gang , and he grew up with no father or mother to give him love and affection .I don't really want to talk about the details , but the film is about the boy , and it is about how he grew up .I like the film , although I don't know how I could get more out of it.

This is the worst movie of all-time, no doubt, and Schindler's List, did in fact have more laughs. This, not only, tells you how unfunny this movie is and how great SL is, considering it's heartbreaking and contains 1 laugh. I wish I could meet "Yahoo Serious" so I could personally throttle him, for this and all the other very, very, very bad movies he's ever been in. There is also very few things to say about Australia, seeing as they like this stupid fruit.

Eddie Monroe is Hooooot. He is a great actor and I could be his girl anytime. He's so fine. I was so sad at the end. I'm not going to ruin the end but wow. Girls are so vicious. His girl was wrong. If Eddie was my man I would never disrespect. Those Mobsters were spooky. The moral of the story is Trust No One. Your friends will hurt u if they can. Oh and Eddie tell your girlfriend that yo mine, she should move ova! I would suggest seeing the movie. Why?

One of the last films DIRECTED by Lionel Barrymore, "Ten Cents a Dance" stars Barbara Stanwyck as the dance-hall girl "Barbara" in her sixth role. Stanwyck looks quite "plain-jane" in this one, and opens with her getting chewed out by the dance hall manager. Then along comes rich guy Bradley Carlton (Ricardo Cortez) who wants to sweep her off her feet. (Cortez and Stanwyck had made three films together in the 1930s.) Then she meets Eddie, who's very different from the dashing Carlton.

being a fan of Bela Lugosi , Boris Karloff , and Lon Chaney Jr i had to see this.what tripe. I saw this on a TV show last year and i was so sick when i walked in and saw this. I can't say it is one of the greatest movies i've ever seen but the acting, the production, the atmosphere of this one is some of the best that you'll see in a movie. I'm glad i saw this. If you've seen it just go to your favorite video store and rent this.

I tried. I really, really tried to think of something that would merit rating this higher than a two. It's not that I don't "get it" -- I'm a big fan of Asian cinema. The truth is, the movie is infantile in construction, long-winded, and painfully disjointed.I suppose that if you are of Alfred Hitchcock's school of thought "Don't tell them, show them," then you could try to appreciate this movie, but you would still be hard pressed.First of all, The Terrorizers tries stream-of-consciousness in the style of Jean-Luc Godard and fails in this.

I just recently stumbled upon this show when ABC family had an all day marathon before season 2 premiered. I remember seeing previews for the show back in 2007, and thought it would be short lived, and not very well written, because it was on ABC Family.Never doubt an ABC family show! This show surprised me in the best way possible. Not only is the show well written, story lines are realistic, funny, and enjoyable. I was expecting a lot of talk about relationships, something like "this guy dated that girl who dumped me for that kid...

This is one of the funniest movies I 've ever saw . A 14-year old boy Jason Shepherd wrote an article explaining his reasons for going into business to be a successful comedian. It's hysterical! I love it!! I thought you might enjoy the video! You may want to watch the trailer before reading further! I know I did. But I just thought you'd like to see. I know a lot of people who watch the video and want to read about the reasons Jason went into comedy. I wanted to make sure to include as much information as possible.

A criminally short lived show that went on to spawn three movie spin-offs (Naked Gun 1, 2 & 3), this is fast-paced, in your face, rapid fire comedy that has more hits than misses. Leslie Nielsen plays Detective Lieutenant Sergeant Frank Drebin, an incompetent Detective who bumbles and fumbles his way through cases, with the capable assistant of his boss, Capt. Ed Hocken.The story lines are spurious, at best, but it's deliberate, as the goodness here lies not in the storytelling, but in the weaving of a constant flurry of jokes along with some genuinely weird and wonderful characters.

I 'm a sucker for a decent superhero movie . ( I 'm not counting super bug budget , no budget for that )

If I had to pick the single best superhero film ever it would be Iron Man . While the rest were decent films , Iron Man had some brilliant ideas and came out ahead of the pack . I 'm looking at you , Batman . You 're the king of the world and have a ton of money , but all your films suck . Now you 've got a new toy . You 'll get a sequel , and the world will see you 've got a second chance .

Wesley Snipes is perfectly cast as Blade, a half human, half vampire known the daywalker. He has all their strengths and his only weakness is the thirst for blood. Since he teamed up with whistler (Kris Kristofferson) he has hunted down vampires who have lived amongst us unnoticed for centuries, but omnipotent overlord Deacon Frost (Stephen Dorff) is tired of living in harmony with the humans (Food as he calls them) and he plans to waken the blood god and take control of the world.This movie is well cast, written and directed; ensuring the viewer has a thrilling ride from start to finish.

A man kicks a dog 2 ' in the air.A woman kicks a cow out of her bed.A man kicks a woman.Two men kick a woman.A man punches a woman in the eye.A man punches a dog in the face.A man punches a cat in the stomach.A woman throws a dog on a man. One man kicks another man in the face.A man hits the man with his fist.A man hits the woman with a stick.One man hits a dog with a stick.A man knocks a dog out.A dog is kicked by a woman.Two dogs are hit by a man.A man bites a woman.

OK, first of all, who in their right mind would remake Hitchcock and second, who would do it shot for shot? I admit I had no intention of ever watching this movie for that very reason. The original Psycho is one of my favorite films ever and this just seemed like a degrading photocopy of it. I did watch it because my girlfriend wanted to compare it to the original and we both agreed less than five minutes into this crap that it was awful. First, as mentioned, they did it shot for shot. Where's originality?

I awarded this presentation 4 stars. They are all for the script, which has been butchered beyond recognition in places. What can possibly be said? They took one of the finest plays written in the last century and methodically robbed it of its heart, humor and humanity. I don't really blame the actors, who are probably doing their best with shoddy direction and incomplete characters (because the very complete characters of the stage version have had their insides -- and insights -- ripped out). I do very much blame the director, who seems to strain to find ways to undermine the script.

`` 2001 : A Space Odyssey '' is set in 2001 and the main character is HAL . A computer programmer is investigating an accident where HAL is involved. His research suggests that this was the first computer virus ever created, but he does not know whether the virus itself was responsible for the accident that killed his mother. As he continues his investigation, HAL's personality becomes increasingly odd and violent, leading the researcher to fear that HAL is a dangerous madman who will harm humanity and destroy the Earth. In the original script, the character was known as " HAL 9000 ."

If you 're in the middle of a ferocious war and it 's still not clear that you 're going to win, I can understand that. Even though it might not make sense to you at first. And even though you might not be sure what to do. But I can understand that. At least I think I can, because I have spent time in battle, and I know the feeling. "So I can tell you what my experience has been in war, because I've been in it. And I know what to do to help the people.

Although i watched this film by myself(thankfully), i still felt embarrassed while watching it. I was tricked into renting it by the reviews on the front cover, and the bloody/gritty camera stills on the back-which led me to believe it was some sort of documentary. These actors are laughable throughout the entire film, not convincing at all. The story involves an Italian Australian(?) gang, just fighting other gangs, and then running,fighting,repeat. Supposedly they train extremely hard, which makes them way better than other gangs.

this is the worst movie in the world . the only reason i gave it a 2 was because the plot was so confusing. I don't care if you give it one, i give it 3

I gave it a 2-3 because it is so bad. I hate how they changed the storyline and now it is really boring. They made this movie feel so bad and they should not bother with making it any better. I don't understand how they made it so boring, they were even trying to make this movie seem like a good movie. This movie is absolutely trash.

I have just caught this Movie on TCM, and can understand why George Murphy went into Politics if this was the best MGM could serve up to him. It is so slow-moving that the attempt to make it a real film-noir effort does not come off. It featured two of my favouriteplayers in Eve Arden (completely wasted) and Dean Stockwell(the best actor in the Film), but what really hit me was that the leading lady Frances Gifford went through some 90 minutes (it seemed longer!) without changing the expression on her face--her fainting scene was comical.

This is a poor , poor movie . Full of clichés , unrealistic moments : punching the air in celebration after being saved by an alien , the scene after the credits where he tries to take his clothes off , or the scene after he finally sees his wife and his children for the very first time . I don’t even need to say more. That said , the story is good . After all , it is a classic sci-fi adventure . But it fails to deliver on what it promises . Plot : A team of astronauts on an asteroid mining mission has been rescued by an alien.

I've seen several stage and film adaptations of Alice in Wonderland and this one has to take the cake as the absolute worst. My family bought the DVD unsuspectingly and couldn't even make it through the first half. I later went back and forced myself to watch the whole thing (it had been a Christmas gift to me) and was just appalled.The only redeeming factor (and it's hardly redeeming enough to save the whole show) is Mark Lin-Baker playing the Mock Turtle with a Yiddish accent. It's one of the few moments in the piece that has some real charm and can be taken somewhat seriously.

In Brooklyn, the nightclub dancer Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth) has a simple but happy life dancing in the McGuire's, owned by her boyfriend Danny (Gene Kelly). Rusty, Danny and Genius (Phil Silvers) have a ritual on Friday nights: they order oysters in a bar, trying to find a pearl. The life of Rusty changes when she participates and wins a contest to be the cover page of the Vanity magazine. She is invited to work in a huge theater in Broadway, whose owner proposes her.

this film sucks a big one . so many holes in the plot . if the devil is invincible , then why the devil's minions would not fight back if they could? they would. it is a bit sad to watch this movie , it has some great action , a bit of gore and lots of blood . i know what you are trying to say . but it all makes me want to see it more . i know you will not let me do this but you need to try it . it is an enjoyable movie . you will love it .

Director and playwright Richard Day adapted his own stage material for the screen , clearly inspired by Rock Hudson 's performance. As he has done in the past, Day has produced an all-star cast for his play, with stars including Jason Isaacs, Jeremy Northam, Jessica Brown Findlay, and Jason Bateman playing the parts of the lead male characters. The play's opening is scheduled to be held on November 23, but that is not the end of Day's plans for the production. After a press screening, he is set for a reading on November 30 and a Q&A afterwards.

Larry Bishop, the Writer/Actor/Director, focuses too heavily on the camera, music, and visuals. The film resorts to meaningless ramblings and vulgar monologues, which seem to have no purpose other than boring and irritating the audience. The actors experience a bumpy ride, from the film's start to finish, and are caught in one terrible smoke screen. The hell with the ride. The film is a bomb.The Victors are presented as weathered vigilantes, who seek their own form of justice for what they see as lawlessness. They are bikers, anti-heroes, and protagonists.

Max Cash a charter boat captain who works off the Caribbean island San Sebastian is hired by Sarah, who's looking for legendary boat, El Diablo and its stolen treasure that sunk out in the reef in the 17th century. But something seems to be protecting the whereabouts of the ship, as people who knew anything about it are being killed.I have to agree with those that were under the impression that this was going to be a horror feature. Instead what we ended up with was a low-rent, b-grade late 80s take on 1977 deep-sea adventure film 'The Deep', but with a baffling supernatural origin and an injection of mystery.

Dr. Marnie Bannister ( Magda Konopka ) is a horribly disfigured woman . When one of her colleagues discovers a photograph of her daughter, she realizes that it could be the key to her daughter’s long-term mental health. When her daughter is brought into the clinic for evaluation, it becomes apparent that not only will the young woman be severely mentally retarded but she will also likely end up being locked in her room for life . With the help of the team that has been assembled for her, the doctor is able to save her life .

Intelligent summary, isn't it?If Mad Max was something of a simple, straight forward, nothing special but nothing wrong either kinda film, they totally made up for it with it's sequel, The Road Warrior. So, in theory, with a third great film it would've been a great trilogy... now, it's not!Such a huge disappointment Beyond Thunderdome was! It's main premise is pretty cool, with an 'underworld' (think a mix between Metropolis and The Time Machine), but it all isn't carried out with too much conviction.

Cute Movie feel good movie I had never heard of this movie but ran across it while looking for something to watch on VHS. The film was an animated short that had a very colorful feel to it. The story was very interesting and had some really cool animation to it. This was one of a kind. I will be reviewing this film with a special emphasis on animation. I will give you a detailed review of how it turned out, so you can see if it's worth your time to see it or not. Synopsis:

The story is quite simple and simple.

If all movies had to be destroyed and only one could be spared , Death in Venice would have to be that movie! To make up for this lack of good films of the 60's and 70's , a whole host of lesser movies were produced during this period which are now lost. A few examples:

1. Death at Sea , a movie made between 1957-1960 and released in 1960, only one copy of which survived. It's a great look at life on the high seas during the age of sail. It had a cult following before it was made.

well , i may be bias as i grew up watching a VHS copy of this film that is now on DVD. but it still holds up quite well and has several great moments. In the early 90's, i had a friend who spent his entire weekend at a friends house, and this is when he showed me this. i've still yet to meet my friend that had a VHS copy of this, so i hope this is the case. i remember watching this with my parents as a kid and my brother as well.

The filmmaker stayed true to the most accurate account of the story published in 1894 which includes an 1846 manuscript by Richard Williams Bell (son of John and Lucy Bell and younger brother of Betsy Bell) titled "Our Family Trouble." To knowledge this is the only eyewitness account ever penned. The filmmaker should be credited for accuracy but there is little to say about the production and acting quality. The acting was theatrical and the sound and picture quality was extremely poor. It appears that the filmmaker simply shot scenes of the reported events that took place without incorporating or weaving them into a flowing plot or story line.

If you're like me and you occasionally enjoy watching terrible movies (I guess it's kind of like slowing down at a car crash), you can't do better than this! The plot is inane, the special effects are hilarious and the acting is some of the worst you'll ever see! 4 THUMBS DOWN! WOOOHOOOOOOOO!!! Seriously, I have no idea how the director and the "actors" can sleep at night! It's painful, and yet hysterically funny, to watch and I highly recommend it for those who want to punish themselves for something.

What I liked best about this feature-length animated film from 1941 is the great feel it gives for the early 1940s. It's the songs, the clothing, automobiles, buildings lingo of the day, etc. You feel like you've stepped back into time.From reading some of the reviews here, I see this was a hard-luck film, being released a couple of days before the Pearl Harbor attack. Wow, no one would be interested in going to the movies for a feature-length cartoon during those eventful and shocking days, I'm sure.

Another movie from Swedish hillbilly country , which is always the Northern part . If black people were shown this kind of violence , we’d kill them and kill them all. And we need to make sure the blacks know this is coming and that they are part of this. And we need to start a movement and stop this kind of stuff . As you know, the violence in Charlottesville is about white supremacy, about racism, about violence towards white people. And that’s only the tip of the iceberg. There is a lot of violence in the United States against African Americans.

I remember the events of this movie, the ill fated cruise of Donald Crowhurst in 1968, in the Golden Globe single handed around the world yacht race. I was a 13 year old, living in England. The previous year Francis Chichester (later Sir Francis; he was knighted for his exploits) had completed the first solo circumnavigation of the globe. I remember it mostly because we were given time off school to watch his return (on a grainy black and white TV!) and then his knighting by the Queen. It provoked a huge outpouring of patriotic fervor in the UK.

At the beginning of the movie, Ramgopal Verma says that "Sarkar" is his tribute to The Godfather. This one feels more like an insult. It pales terribly in comparison to the Coppola classic. Although no one was expecting Ramgopal Verma to fill Coppola's shoes, the movie did create a lot of expectation and buzz. Amitabh Bachchan plays "Sarkar", a character automatically drawing instant comparisons to Indian political party Shiv Sena's Supremo Bal Thackeray. Abhishek Bachchan plays his son Shankar who returns from abroad and gets caught up in Sarkar's politics at home.

Two years after leaving the small town of Grover's Bend due to encountering the Krites, Brad Brown returns to spend time with his grandmother in time for Easter. Meanwhile the Krite eggs begin to hatch. As they cause trouble in the town, Brown & the townsfolk, as well as the alien bounty hunters who have returned to finish the creatures must fight the bloodthirsty furballs before they wipe out the town.The original Critters was a minor attempt to rip-off the family-horror flick "Gremlins". It became a cult favourite on the video shelves & was successful enough to warrant a sequel.

This film stinks more than limburger cheese! If you find this at a garage sale, LEAVE IT THERE! I love Sandra Bullock and yet HATE THIS MOVIE... Although ashamed, I do own a copy, and the studio has changed the cover to play on the fact that Sandra Bullock is in this at all. They play it up to be "A Sandra Bullock Movie". She only has a small part in the whole movie and she does her best with that, but she is young and had not learned her talent yet. Well everyone has to start somewhere...

We 've all seen bad movies , well this one takes the cake . I 've seen that Junior movie in a couple of my classes so when I saw this , I knew it was a good movie and I had to bring it back for sure . The music and action scenes are amazing . After watching this I knew I had to watch it again. This movie is really scary but at the same time funny. This is a very scary and suspenseful movie about a girl who becomes a vampire and has to stay a virgin for a year and a half.

Got the chance to see this at a friend 's house today , and was impressed with what it achieved ! I am the type of person who is always amazed by technology and the things we can do now with technology, I am not sure if you know what I mean, but this is what I have been talking to my friend about , she is going to get her hands on it this evening , I am sure she will be awestruck ! It looks like someone from Microsoft, but i have never seen anything like this.

This was an interesting movie. I could have done without the bathroom scene and the seduction scene - EWWWW! Other than that, I loved the head-banging music this movie revolved around. Chris/Izzy's parents are AWESOME! They totally support their sons interests and believe in him enough to support him - now that is AWESOME!! What really surprised me was the Chris's realization at the end. It was not quite the "hollywood" ending on his road to self discovery. The overall rise to stardom and the fall of it was quite a roller- coaster ride.

This movie won a special award at Cannes for its acting and it's not difficult to see why. (A few spoilers - but for the ending, you'll have to watch the movie!) A simple story - in Moscow on the eve of war between Russia and Germany in WW II Veronika (Tatiana Samoilova) is in love with Boris (Aleksei Batalov) but they have a spat when she learns that he has enlisted in the army. Boris leaves for the front before Veronika can tell him she loves him. Boris is shot but his ultimate fate remains unknown to Veronika or his family.

Is this a good movie? No, certainly not. But for Jolie lovers it's must-have. Her non-polished acting and semi-nudity scene will please her fans for ages to come. The current rating however (3.2) is too low. The movie might lack a good storyline, and isn't a great sf-movie altogether but the acting is good enough (and like mentioned before, Jolie's acting is nice and raw), the movie is shot very direct, with a lot of close-ups. The scenery is bizarre. And last but not least, leaving van Damme out was a very good choice.

I have never been as surprised by a film that was this old . Only `` The Treasure of the Sierra Madre '' was not only so old it could not have been any longer produced, but was also so old it was more or less the first of many Hollywood horror films. It was produced by John Farrow (who, as I've written before, has been involved in a great deal of horror production since the early '90s), his son Christopher Farrow, and the screenwriting team of the two of them.

The threesome of Bill Boyd , Robert Armstrong , and James Gleason play Coney Island carnys vying for the hand-off. This is the beginning of what is to me a rather strange episode. But, if we are to get into that, let’s just take it one step further. Let’s get into what I am sure is happening. Coney Island is in a position of great need. Its attractions are all over the map. In some places there’s nothing. In others there is an entire amusement park or amusement park complex built around an attraction.

Eight Legged Freaks is a modern monster movie, like a remake of any of the old 'Attack of the giant [INSERT ANIMAL HERE]'-movies of the 50s, 60s and 70s. Or rather, it should have been more like a remake of the, instead of what is was. So, how is a monster movie done in the year 2002? Well, from the typical opening with some chemical making the spiders grow to huge proportions, they mix movies like Gremlins, Jurassic Park, Starship Troopers and flavor it with some parody like Scary Movie.

After their star cross-country runner dies after a race, the members of a track team are stalked and killed by a mysterious masked murderer seeking vengeance for the girl's death.From the beginning of this film, it was quite obvious it was not going to be very good (at least as far as true quality goes). The 'dramatic' track race at the end of the introduction scene was one of the least believable sporting events I've ever seen in a film. It would seem that the winner of the race had never actually run before in her entire life.

Yesterday I watched this tv production , and I was very disappointed.I did n't have big expectations when it was shown, but after watching this show, I was disappointed. It seems to me like it's all in favor of the government . All the criminals who are caught will be executed . No doubt it will be a war , but for how many years? It's like a horror movie , and I'm glad to see it. It's sad because I like the show . I like it, it was very good .

(WARNING - CONTAINS MILD SPOILER) A movie almost designed to make you pause and check your recollection of it - it's confined to an almost empty motel where the huge courtyard resembles a circus ring and the rooms seem like temporary withdrawal points rather than refuges; as the characters become increasingly preoccupied by the past, the present increasingly falls away, until the ultimate incendiary appearance of the Countess in the black Mercedes marks the fusion of reality and fantasy. Whether or not their stories are true, and whether Stanton is truly the father or just a crazy old man stepping into their stories, seems impossible to determine.

"Hood Rat" is absolutely terrible. This is a urban version of "Willard". I just can't believe this movie got made, let alone distributed. Someone in Universal Studios thought that people would watch and like this "movie". The only good thing in this is Ice-T as the landlord. He was funny. The one thing I hate in movies is sped up action. Once or twice is bad enough, but the WHOLE movie is like that. Every scene transition is some fast motion special effect. The director should be banned from making movies forever.

A great film. Every moment masterfully conducted by Toyoda and his crew. The actors give credible performances all around.The visuals are haunting,beautiful and sometimes hauntingly beautiful shots of the Japanese country and city landscapes.The sounds,courtesy of Japanese band 'Dig', are never overly edgy as one would expect from band-made soundtracks. It's strangely atmospheric and well suited to the scenes they're on. All in all, they worked everything out perfectly....Well, if they were to give any justice to the story, perfection is the only thing anyone could have accepted.

I saw this on the Accent Underground release with the short films . I found the film at first boring, then I watched it again , and it blew my mind. I thought it was really good, and so did it's fans. It was amazing. And I think I may have even watched the entire movie at least once. The only problem with this movie is that you have to sit there and wait for the credits, but that doesn't seem like too much of an inconvenience . I love the way it is set up.

I wo n't waste your time by describing the plot for this , the other reviewer already did this quite thoroughly , I will simply point you to it and you can read it for yourselves , or better yet go on youtube and watch their version of it or something. I have to admit that I absolutely loved this movie. Of course as I'm sure you know that "Malcolm's in the Middle" star Frankie Muniz, and the ever so sweet Amanda Bynes "The Amanda Show" starred in this children's comedy as two friends that I'm sure that we can all re-late to. The movie is about a boy Jason Shepard(Frankie) and his friend Kaylee(Amanda)going onto an adventure in Hollywood.SPOILERS AHEADAs it begins Jason is a typical 14 year old boy whom lies to get around every day life's problems.

Closet Land is an amazing, terrifying piece of cinema. It features only two actors in a single set, but never loses your attention. The set design is imaginative and troubling, the staging of scenes maintains your attention, while adding to your own sense of confusion and terror. The acting is outstanding, with Alan Rickman and Madeleine Stowe having the duty of carrying every scene.I first saw this film in 1991, soon after it came out on video. It didn't play in theaters where I lived; not surprising, given its political content. It should be seen, though.

(Contains really bad Spoilers) So what can I say about this....It's a really HORRIBLE and AWFUL movie! !.Too much CGI and special effects....you could tell how fake the ridiculous baby is! !.PLEASE at least go watch "Dungeons and Dragons" which is another terrible pile of TRASH.Son of the Mask makes Dungeons and Dragons way better!!! Uggg!!!!!!!!!!!! Pure Crap!!!!!!!!!!! !I Hate this Trash!!

`The Last Frontier' is a superior western that overcomes numerous deficiencies in weaving its tale of trappers Jed (Victor Mature), Gus (James Whitmore) and Mongo (Pat Hogan) and their relationships with the army, particularly Captain Riordon (Guy Madison), Colonel Marston(Robert Preston) and Corrina Marston, colonel's wife (Anne Bancroft). Hired as scouts after losing their supplies to the Indians, Jed, Gus and Mungo adjust to living the `civilized' life within a fort on the edge of the `last frontier.'

This can hardly be called a good movie, actually it's not even close. But I have to say, that there was a few things that made me... not laugh, not giggle, but something like that. The Resovoir Dogs parody was one of them. The rest are not important enough to be remembered.To be honest, I was a little disappointed by this movie. The plot sounded like an idea, but it quickly fell to the ground. The whole thing was just to messy and the actors where not good for the characters; most of them simply overacted.

The director Godfrey Reggio must be a very charming and persuasive man for this dreadfully botched project to have seen the light of day. Reggio's message, so powerful and resonant in his previous two Qatsi films, is hopelessly jumbled here. Athletes, equations, oceans, keypads, laughing heads, etc, mingle without purpose. The parade of banal imagery is mostly generic stock from Getty Images et al, and the heavy-handed digital manipulations are amateurish in the worst way imaginable. Surely someone involved (Steven Soderbergh, executive producer?)

At the same time John Russell was playing ranch owner Nathan Burdette , trying to free his no good brother. John and Nathan were the only two boys in the whole town of Red Rock Canyon. And John wanted to get them out of town before he was arrested. But then something unexpected happened:
The three boys and their older sister went to see their father, John Russell , who they thought they knew. And that was all it took. With the help of their father and John's brothers , the Russell boys
and their older sister were out of town and safe.

It´s all my fault. They all told me I should avoid seeing this movie because I´m a huge fan of the old TV-series. They were right. While production values are good and the actors themselves (including "don´t look now") Julie Christie aren´t that bad, the whole film displays a cheekiness and self-conciousness that clearly is without any justification. A comparison between the Karloff "Mummy" and "The Mummy Returns 2000" comes to my mind. In fact Belphegore 2000 owes much more to the new Mummy films than to the old series.

Naturally Sadie sucks big time, I have no idea what the people were thinking about when they wrote this garbage. This is not funny, its not cute in any way shape or form, its just disturbing and a waste of money. Sadie is such a bad actor. I lost all my brain cells watching this show, it honestly seemed that this show is forced, it was such a huge over hyped pile of crap.This show sucks.Its a waste of time, and money, don't bother watching this garbage. The characters are so stupid and ridiculous.

Being 15 myself I enjoyed this flick thouroughly ! ! I related to the character Ann August more than most of my younger friends but I also understood why she was such a strong character, I had to learn a lot to make the best out of the movie. I am not a movie buff at all (although I watched a lot of horror movies as a child and loved them very much) but I thought I would make a post about it. I have always been a big fan of horror flicks. In fact I have seen a lot of the horror movies on TV or in theatres.

If you want to see someone accidentally eat another man's testicle, or look at a row of pathetically fake hard-ons at a wedding, or listen to a man talk about how good it felt to have sex with a girl while she was throwing up, then this is the movie for you. Alternating, in neck breaking fashion, between romantic and gross out comedy, Tomcats is certainly interesting. The lovely Jaime Pressly plays the wife of Horatio Sanz(tell me another one) who is found in many silhouetted situations with other women, but there is, surprisingly, no nudity.

As a fan of author Gipharts lightheaded and humorous books ( of which Ik Ook van Jou is not the only example ) this series was well worth a look

There are also several series by the same author which are worth a look. In my opinion the best of them all is the series of ‘Namakami’ books by Mariko Hayami ( who also published the series ‘Fate’ by the same author ) The series was created in the ’90’s and the first book was published in the ’80’’s by Shueisha.

First of all , before I start my review , I just read every review for 'The Muppet Movie ' so far. It's been a while since I was a huge 'Muppets fan ,but I still love all of the Muppets on stage and screen. I don't know if anyone else has seen or seen 'Muppets From Space ', but I was a big fan when it came out. The movie came out in 1987 and was written, directed and starred by Jim Henson. Now, I don't know what I expected from the Muppets , but I was really hoping the movie would be great.

This is marvelous movie, about a soul of Ale. This is a journey to Ale's heart. I found it fascinating. The director did a great job. He makes the scenes talk. Especially on the silent scenes. The window of Ale is a great one. An the scenes when he lies in bed are one of the best directed scenes I have seen. Apart from directing. It has been a quite time I did not watch a movie about a soul. As a philosopher I can say that, this film proves that the age does not matter about your soul.

Deep Water (2006) ****"It is indifferent... it's there waiting for you to make one slip up." Those words (paraphrased) are perhaps the best sum up of the nature of the ocean I have ever heard muttered. Its furies are boundless, not least of which, her loneliness. Those words come from the mesmerizing and heartbreaking documentary Deep Water. It is the story of Donald Crowhurst, an amateur sailor who partook in the 1969 Sunday Times Race around the World. If you do not know his story, it may be best to stop reading now.

... with a 500 $ budget and a bottle of ketchup.If you are a fan of C movies with no subtitles, you will enjoy this movie. I hope my review is not biased, it was just an honest review. If you like C movies with good cinematography, this is the right movie for you! Overall this is my first review in this forum, I’ll just give you the review without any bias. *This movie was well made but I would say it lacked a certain touch of realism in certain scenes that would add to the movie rather than add realism.

I am a firm believer that a film, TV serial or any form of art should and would be fully appreciated once the timing factor- as to when written, produced or conceived-should be taken in to account.Yeh Jo hai Zindagi is one such series. I remember watching it in the mid-80's on TV and the re-runs via the video cassette libraries during early 90's. and laughing out loud and being addicted to it. That made me buy the full series DVD set and surprise of surprises- the comedy and the moments of the good 'ol days simply fell flat for me.

This movie is a disaster within a disaster film . It is full of great action scenes , which are executed well by the actors , but it lacks any emotional investment in the characters and its story. This is because it lacks any real heart of the story. There is no love or emotion in this film. This is a bad movie . It is filled with action and drama . But its story and characters are not interesting . There are some decent scenes in the movie but they lack any real human feeling or emotion in them .

it 's a real big bummer that people easily are able too make movies because of cheap digital video cams. I am not saying you guys need to be ashamed of yourselves. And, I’m sorry if you are not feeling that bad, but I hope that you realize that you are not the only ones. I hope to see you this year.

Absolutely the best thing I have ever seen on TV . It was both entertaining and informative . The reason the show has been such a success in this regard is that not only was the show very funny and intelligent , the show was also very informative . I have seen a few other shows that have done this and have not had as much success. The show was well done and very entertaining as well. I liked it too! It had a great mix of both sides of history. There was lots of humor, history, and drama.
