Now here is where this review takes a very different direction from the rest. . . I don’t see anything wrong with the movie at all .

I love watching Australian movies but this steaming pile of crap was just plain embarrassing . The DVD cover looked like it had been ripped straight out of an 80's horror flick. I could never watch this movie again. I've never understood why people say that horror movies are for the squeamish, and this movie was no different. If you're squeamish, then I'm sure you'll have a great time. If you aren't squeamish, then I sincerely hope you'll give it one more chance before giving up entirely.

THE AFFAIR is a very bad TV movie from the 1970s starring the then-husband-wife team of Robert Wagner and Natalie Wood. This is what happens when a pair of film stars decide to do a stupid and dangerous stunt in a very public place in the hope of getting some money out of some rich people. They are later arrested and fined, and then both are fined. The film opens in a town in France, where a group of young men – including Wagner and Wood – are out at a shooting range when they are told not to fire their weapons.

I can't believe I even tried to watch this filth. As an avid B-Horror movie fan, I was more than riveted at the prospect of this film by popular budget horror filmmaker Herschell Gordon Lewis. Unfortunately, right from the opening of the film, I could not, for the life of me, think of a worse movie than this. Okay , anyone looking to see a great work of art should NOT watch this film . A sophisticated film , but one which should be watched to the end . I have watched this film so many times in the past few years . I just watched it this morning . This film , in spite of being a big box-office success , seems to have been somewhat under appreciated in the last few years . It has received a lot of mixed reviews and a few bad reviews of it . This film doesn’t seem to be as good as the original but it seems to be a much better looking film .

Like a lot of people , I loved the original ; `` American Graffiti '' was one of the great movies that I saw when it came out ; and I thought it should have gotten an Oscar for the art department. It was a great time for all types of people, and that's what movies are all about : bringing the people who love to movies together. As you can imagine , I'm very proud of my work here. I am very thankful for all my friends and colleagues who support me through this great journey ; and they are always the first to support what we do !

There were a lot of dumb teenage getting sex movies of the 80s and a lot of slasher flicks but they were just as sick as the horror movies. But these were the movies that would make you cringe and laugh at the same time. The slasher flicks of the 80s were much worse than the ’90s slasher films and they still made you feel sick. They still made you laugh. But what made the ’90s and the 80s horror movies so much worse, is that it was the characters. The villains were the bad guys, it was the good guy, it was the hero.

This is really one of the worst movies i have seen in a while. It's not funny at all. It simply portrays a lower class Northern British setting. I find it a very sad film at parts, at others cuts are where they shouldn't be. One thing that really annoyed me was the close ups of pointless objects it really slowed down the pace of the movie. I only made it through the movie because i fast forwarded certain sequences towards the end.This movie completely loses the attention of the audience.

What on earth happened to RGV ? There are so many things wrong about this movie that one needs to do a serious study to see where it is coming from. So I thought I would write a review on it to see if others agree with me. So here goes.... This is a movie that is not really a good movie, but for me, the only way to sum up everything wrong about it would be to state that it is not a very good movie. I do not even know who wrote the movie. I have only seen the trailer.

If you find the depiction of violent murders and wanton police brutality expressed in a plot less film with glacial pacing and more a film with a message, you should go to see “The Dark Knight Rises.” “The Night Manager” is not the film that I would have expected to see, but it is still a damn good movie about a character who is willing to make the wrong choices in order to protect those who need protecting. The night manager, played by Christian Bale (“American Sniper”), is just that: a character.

I watch Lackawanna Blues every time it comes on. It brings back happy times for me. I grow up in a big city in the mid-west. It reminds me of when I was a child although my situation was a little different it feels the same. It makes me wonder if all we will ever know about families are lost. The big mama's of day are under the age of 55. Will they see know what it takes to be a inspiration to other. I hope that I was not the only one who loved this movie enough to relate it to their past.

I saw this movie yesterday and thought it was awful; it was pointless and just plain stupid. the supposed plot concerned a prospective bridegroom too caught up in the problems of the world to relate to his bride and the other people in his life. He disappears on his wedding day (in a tux no less) and hooks up with an assortment of weirdos.We saw it with a bus-load of people on the way down to Atlantic City and everyone agreed that it was a terrible movie. It was trying to be profound but it wasn't; it was stupid and offensive.

This movie certainly is a weird one to say the least. The basic plot is 3 old business associates invite 2 strangers into their home for returning a lost wallet with 10 bucks in it. The two whom show up fall in love. The 3 older business men die and come back as ghosts to try to help the two younger guests out. Okay so that may make sense but then we have 3 old guys whom apparently have some bread living together..slightly weird here...Harry Carey plays his part way off base you can't tell if he is a nice guy or really a prick.

Deep Sea 3D is a stunning insight in to an underwater world only a few have had the opportunity to experience firsthand. The experience will be both educational, and inspiring, and will leave you with an in depth understanding of how life on the bottom operates and why you should never dive there again. It is the story of what happens when we leave the confines of our houses, and go out into the deep to explore a place we are only just beginning to understand. We will dive beneath the sea to explore a world we don't know yet, but will find out what we have never seen.

Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd ... The strangest , most off-putting , but most wonderful Broadway musical . It was made for Broadway but not for touring, because the cast had to learn the songs and act in order to go on tour. It's been produced on Broadway three times, and it ran for over seven years before closing on June 28, 1971. I had never heard of the show but I knew I was going to see it, just because it was a musical. The show was based on a book written by the writer of The Producers.

I do n't know where to begin . Perhaps the whole idea of this movie was just a disaster waiting to happen after a series of miscommunications or bad luck. I'm sorry that i'm posting this on a message board and not my own site. The problem is that most people in this country are too stupid to read a plot summary before the movie begins. They think that this is a popcorn movie, like most movies are, and it's supposed to be entertaining from start to finish. Not to worry though. The plot summary was good.

You ca n't really blame the movie maker for glorifying Che because the industry is all about money . Most of the actresses I saw in the film are in their 20's and I saw the best acting that I'd seen in a long time. I just wish it hadn't taken so long, the picture looks amazing and the special effects are great. All in all a very good picture. Wow...you really need to rewatch this movie. I think you're the only one who saw this during the run.

I 'm really surprised seeing all these positive reviews for this movie . Do n't get me wrong , it is a good movie , a must see , but it has some negatives , in my opinion. 1) Not very original or unique plot . The book is quite interesting in the fact that it is a real person who has a lot of dreams and fears . But the plot , the characters and the story is very generic . There are some minor variations on the plot that add to the generic feel of the whole thing .

Okay, I grew up on Who, but haven't loved a Doctor since Tom Baker. Christopher Eccleston made me love Who again and I'll be furious with him forever for leaving. The writing is grand, the acting superb, the directing (which was dreadful in the old days) is just fantastic. I was very skeptical about this programme, and watched it merely out of being forced, but am now a huge fan and love it (I have a ringtone of a Dalek screaming "Exterminate" then).

One would have expected Hitchcock's return to major studio filmmaking to err on the side of chastened caution. Surely few expected his most riotous, unrestrained film, a gleeful melange of vicious black comedy, exciting suspense, mocking manipulation, and astonishing flights of fancy. But that is precisely what they got: STRANGERS ON A TRAIN.What is remarkable is how much Bruno's transgression disrupts the world of the film. Much has been made of the masterly crosscutting motif, but its immediate effect is to completely obstruct the straight line of progress Guy is making of his life, and hence the society he represents or is eager to join.

This episode was boring and was not even in the realm of horror, so far this season Masters of Horror has produced one really good episode...The Damned Thing...it is still early, I have faith that the episodes will get better. I admit that the vampire episode was okay but lacked a solid storyline. The episode about the couple catching the serial killer started out boring, but the last fifteen minutes was really good. Though, I am just plain out disappointed with the lack of originality and horror that the first season's episodes possessed. Please, save this season John Carpenter!

Eve is an eye opener , because of the great sceneries and the tech-no music in the backgrounds , we all want to know about Eve and how is she , and how is the movie about this. This is not a simple movie , this is a great sci-fi, adventure story, and the world is amazing. If you are not into sci-fi , then you should start with this movie. This movie is beautiful , it is the best sci-fi adventure , you should see it. The first time i saw it , i felt like I had watched a dream and a movie for real.

`` Down Periscope '' has been in our library since it first arrived in VHS . Since then , we've seen a few changes , but not many . We've managed to keep things updated and we've managed to improve on the quality of what we're able to do . +

+

+

+

We are happy to announce that '' Down Periscope '' is now in our Library ! We've seen many changes and improvements over the last few months as well as the fact that we are in the process of making it the best it possibly can be .

Imagine yourself trapped inside a museum of the dark middle Ages and a resurrected vampire and his maniacal sidekick are trying to tear your hair out and force you to do what the vampire wants. Are you brave or are you stupid? You don't know if you're going to survive the next few minutes or you could be dead in minutes. In the middle ages many of Europe's people had no access to modern technology like computers. They had to rely on their wits and the only way to keep from being eaten was to fight.

...the last time I laughed this much. It's a testament to the talent of Rowan Atkinson that he has managed to create a comic character with several layers and a clearly defined personality - without hardly ever speaking a word. The whole success of the program rests on Atkinson's shoulders, but he carries it with ease. Despite the fact that the show only ran for one season, anyone even vaguely in touch with pop culture recognizes the rubber-faced social 'tard, so great is the talent and effort put into the performance.

In this approximately 34-second Thomas Edison-produced short , we see Annabelle Moore performing the Loie Fuller-choreographed `` Serpentine Dance '' as her first step in what promises to be a very important new dance in the world of the musical theater. For those who are not familiar with Annabelle Moore, her character in this show might be as difficult to understand as her acting. For all of the dancing, the character seems to have no idea what to do with her feet. The dance is just too abstract for most people to comprehend. So it is not surprising that most people do not like it.

**Spoiler* It gives away the very irrelevant ending**At the beginning of this movie, there was a brief intro to the world of gore by the master of gore movies, H.G. Lewis. He talked about how this movie was lost, and then found years after the director's death. He also talked about how gore movies were measured by the amount of stage blood used in it. Blood Feast was a 2 galloner, 10,000 Maniacs was a 5 galloner. But, then he goes and claims that Dr. Gore was a 15 galloner.

Cute Movie feel good movie I had never heard of this movie but ran across it while looking for something to rent. I had high hopes for this movie based purely on Flex being in this movie. I have never seen him in anything not worth while. True to form this movie delivered for me. I enjoyed the story. The movie is full of great actors and actresses. The hilarious Tasha Smith, Essence Atkins and of course Tangi Miller. I really liked this movie a lot. I didn't give it five stars because it did not discuss certain issues that I thought the movie should have detailed.

What an awful movie . Full of cliches , perplexing scenes , very bad acting , and an atrotious script . The only thing that will bring it back into my life will be to rewatch this film and find a way to avoid it. This is the first time in my lifetime that I have seen this one. I had heard of it but it was too late for me to catch the last movie that I had watched. That was a few years ago when the movie was just released. I was really excited when I heard about the release of the film.

Pretty twisted Horror film , that has a few good moments here and there , with some creepy Blood transfusion scenes and a bunch of other good horror related scenes , not to mention an interesting story . A man wakes up in the woods with nothing but his wits , and the only clue he had left was his dog which was with him at the time he was bitten by a wolf . As time passed the man began to realize that his dog was not his dog , but the dog in question , and that it could not have been him .

Solo is a poor film - that can not be ignored . The acting for the most part is very good , and the story, while it is good , it is a little lacking in the story line. It has its moments , and it has it's flaws . The acting is one of the best I have seen for the past few years, and it has been quite well received by the critics . The story lines are entertaining , the special effects are well done, and there are some funny moments , but there are also moments where the story line gets boring .

What can be said about a movie about a cross dressing gangster ? Not that much . With the average rating of an R on Metacritic the movie has average reviews on IMDb . While there is not much more you can do , there is one very good movie that has a great story and good acting . But it is the story that is missing . This is a very good movie which you would not expect . The story is about a cross dresser and his gangster buddy . I am sure you would be very intrigued by this story .

This was a great movie, I would compare it to the movie The Game. You get to the end of the flick and cant move... your brain has been removed and shaken (not stirred) and put back in your head. Dont plan anything after this movie, you will need time to think about what just happened.Dont come to this movie expecting the Matrix style multi millions spent on special effects, this movies special effects come from the actors, they keep you involved, no, they suck you in and dont let go for the entire duration of the movie.

This must be one of the worse movies that I have ever seen . On a par with Blair Witch, I was not sure how much I could take. I knew I was going to give this one a 2.0 . I won't give anything else away, because this is just the beginning . I hope you watch this one because this is a movie that you can't put down . You don't have to see this one, I'll wait and see if anyone else finds it enjoyable. I'm giving it 3 stars because it is a movie that I don't think I could ever enjoy.

The characterization in this movie is among the worst I 've ever encountered . The dialogue is trite and clichéd . I am glad it is only a one-time exposure but the fact it is in the movie is just ridiculous . This is one of the few films I would not watch because it makes me sick. I think the only redeeming thing is that the ending was very touching. I am a huge fan of Disney and if I was given the chance to do this I would never give up on their films . I just finished watching the first episode.

I saw this movie for the first time when Quentin Tarantino showed it to a bunch of us at the Alamo Drafthouse in Austin. He prefaced it with how freaking awesome he thought he was and how funny it was and in the context of his explanation, it was HILARIOUS. I can see how it would be damaging to some audiences, and the subject is not funny at all, but there are at least three lines in the film that had me laughing so hard I thought I'd pee. They don't come until after the halfway point, but when they do, oh God...you will die.

This movie is a disaster within a disaster film. It is full of great action scenes, which are only meaningful if you throw away all sense of reality. Let's see, word to the wise, lava burns you; steam burns you. You can't stand next to lava. Diverting a minor lava flow is difficult, let alone a significant one. Scares me to think that some might actually believe what they saw in this movie.Even worse is the significant amount of talent that went into making this film. I mean the acting is actually very good.

Two years after 'Airplane ! ' took off , Jim Abrahams , Jerry and David Zucker cast one of its most memorable and iconic performances in 'HBO's "The Wire."' The show was based on a true story of a drug bust gone bad by a group of criminals known as the Vice Lords. "We had to do the whole episode with a gun," Abrahams says. "The Vice Lords were such a famous group, and we knew they would have guns, and I didn't know they would be armed.

In Moscow , the young couple Veronika ( T. Samojlova ) and Boris ( Aleksey Batalov ) are in deep crisis. After getting married , Veronika wants to spend her life in the West , while Boris feels he needs to live the life of an average Russian . The two friends meet again when Boris returns from Moscow , and decides to stay in Moscow . However , Veronika refuses to leave her family . Meanwhile , Boris’s younger brother Alexei ( Gennady Kostenko ) receives a call from his older sister , Nadezhda ( Tkachkov ) .

`` Eaten Alive '' goes down much easier than Ruggero Deodato 's `` Cannibal Holocaust , '' but it 's still a pretty good book about the human spirit in times of hunger. I like it. There are a few characters in there that have been written into my brain since I 've read this book, but the book itself is not about the characters, or the setting, or what you might call the 'real' events and characters that happened in Italy during this period. In fact, there is very little to say about Italian-American history outside of the characters and the events.

This was it ! i would have never expected the ending if i did n't already know the behind the scenes. i know it will not be like that in real life and it was not intentional but i had a great time watching this. also i could not have watched it through the internet due to copyright restrictions. and i would like to thanks all the fans who support us on the web, i am also glad to see we are getting new fans on this channel. also i thank you all for the kind wishes and good thoughts we have.

And one of 'em are bad movies. The title, as it turns out, refers to a killer of the human male variety, not fish. This is not the Dante-directed "Piranha" of '78 (which did have the fish) and is also known as "Piranha, Piranha." A trio of photographers, 2 men and a woman, hook up with a local hunter/trapper named Caribe somewhere in the Amazon jungle. Unfortunately, they are not familiar with the film resume of William Smith, who plays Caribe; otherwise, they would have known immediately he is the villain of the piece.

"Hollywood Cavalcade" is a mildly entertaining 1939 film starring two staples of the 20th Century Fox roster, Don Ameche and Alice Faye, and containing a couple of in jokes.The film concerns a Max Sennett type, Michael Connors (Ameche) who brings an actress to Hollywood, Molly Adair (Faye) and makes her a big silent comedienne, eventually moving her into more dramatic roles. He becomes extremely successful with her as his star. Obsessed with his work, he's absolutely shocked when she and her leading man (Alan Curtis) run off and get married.

The Calu-what now? Yeah, I thought it was a stupid name as well. Chris Carter remains blissfully unaware of the scum in his writing staff. Starting off with the usual cheery X-Files teaser (a baby getting run over by a train) this episode... well I can't really say it goes downhill because to be honest it was never going uphill. Poorly written, with us feeling no pathos for any of the characters (except maybe that baby at the start) the writer makes us hate characters before brutally killing them off, it's the worst technique ever.

We 've all got to start somewhere , it was in films like Escape In The Fog that somebody like Michael Caine did it for us , now that they are on the screen , we don't have to go through all that again , you know what I mean . We just want to get on with it and enjoy it . We have all got to have some laughs , even if it's just for 15 minutes or however long we are allowed to do this , and we have to have as many as possible , because we are in the business of watching movies .

I thought this movie was perfect for little girls. It was about a magical place where Genevieve and all her sisters could do what they wanted to do the most anytime they'd like. Most little girls would like this story, even though there is the thought of death in it. Although no one dies, the king almost does, but little girls would not understand it, so it adds up to make a perfect story. All the events add up, creating a great plot that can have a meaning if you dig deep enough.

It 's about jealousy , it 's about racism , it 's about manipulation , but the underlying message is a good one , it 's about what you 're thinking , not what 's being done , or what they 're telling you , not what 's real . I know how you feel
I know how I felt
I 'm the one that went down
I 've gone down on you . But you 're still up here , and that's what I want , for you to see
And I'm the one that goes down , and that's all I want .

I caught the first screening of Driving Lessons at the Tribeca Film Festival. Rupert Grint shows he can act past Harry Potter. Laura Linney is amazing as the overbearing mother. Julie Walters is hilarious as Dame Evie Walton, with a mouth worse than a sailor. I hope that this film is picked up by an American distributor so that everyone can see it. This film is not only about Driving Lessons, but life lessons. Ben (Rupert Grint) is torn between wanting to obey his overbearing mother and vicar father and wanting to live his own life.

The movie is apparently based on a popular French horror novel , by Arthur Bernède , from 1927 . Not much can be found about it online except for a very short synopsis . "In a small house in southern France, there are five young people who are living a quiet and secluded life, in spite of the presence of an invisible monster who has been living here for many years. The main character, a doctor, has an affair with the woman’s mother, who in return takes advantage of her husband’s weakness.

I'm not really sure where to begin. From start to finish, bad, stinky bad, like stepping into a port-a-john on a 100 degree day. If you force yourself to watch this as I did, keep some Vicodin handy for the pain. I will never understand how flicks this bad make it past the cutting room without the entire reel ending up on the floor. The movie is a cross between Gumby rides Pokey, meets the terminator, meets Wally Beaver playing cowboys and Indians without the cowboys. I've seen better animation in the original cut of the Blob.

It kicks you in the stomach. There are other films with more convincing characters, a more realistic story, and maybe even more depth concerning political invocations. But then again, most of these are not directed by Peter Watkins. Maybe the one true genius artist of British Film to emerge out of the 1960s, Watkins has made quite a bunch of rarely seen films that perfectly capture the spirit of the outer-aesthetic world - the world of political ongoings, social problems and governmental solutions. Thus, his work is probably less "filmic" than, say, political, which some may call a weakening of their inherent artistic quality.

The movie had no excitement and does not have anything to hold your interest. The movie had nothing exiting,funny,dramatic or romantic about it!!! How can a movie be romantic if the girl never gets a the right guy until the last seen in the movie, than the movie ends??? Maybe part II will be romantic, but somebody else will have to risk wasting their money! I have nothing else to say other than do not waste your time!!! The movie had nothing exiting,funny,dramatic or romantic about it!!!

Made with film stock left over from the production of Nana , 1927 's Sur un Air de Charleston is a beautiful film made from a single reel of film. A young girl (Charleston) is looking to leave her life of slavery but she is caught up in a world of prejudice and discrimination. The film follows her attempts to escape the prejudice and discrimination of her past. Sur Un Air de Charleston will have your jaw hanging open when you discover what the film was all about, and will leave you wanting to come and see this film.

This junk bore as much resemblance to the novel as a pickle slice does to a cucumber. The film makers took the Alamo section out of the book, made it into a movie, and said it was based on the book. Hah! Wonder what they did to induce Mr. Michener to endorse this piece of fluff? It was just another Davy Crockett, flintlock rifle, Santa Ana, 13 days of glory collection of poppycock. I almost started rooting for the mexicans, just to get the damn thing to end.

`` Landscape after a battle '' opens with escaping prisoners over a snowy field full of fences - in rather a strange place, at that. In fact, there are a couple of very well-written and well-written sequences to get you hooked, but they aren't quite enough to convince that you need to keep watching. You don't want to watch them, you want to keep reading them to understand better what happened. There are a few interesting sequences in this game, but they aren't what I'd call a must-see in this game.

I loved this show . Such talent ; and I am so disappointed that it is canceled , after only a year and half

I’m a huge fan of the show, and I just had to comment and give my opinion on the cancellation. I was very disappointed because I’ve watched the series for years, and I am very much in agreement with those who have written here who have said it is the best show on TV. I will be the first to agree, because it is one of the most compelling shows you will ever see.

Another sequel! Why on earth do they keep making these? This has got to be the weakest 'franchise' ever, yet it is still being funded and spawning sequels. SCARECROW GONE WILD - which I only watched so I could officially trash the whole series - brings back the evil straw-man who, again, butchers up some college kids... That's basically it. The acting sucks (as usual), the death scenes are beyond pathetic, and don't be fooled by the title, this thing doesn't have as much nudity as you may think.

Imagine the most cliche ridden b-movie horror plot you can. Add more plot holes than plot. Have it scripted by a 10 year old. Have the acting done by A-Level drama students faking really bad US accents (in the Isle of Man!) Add monster special effects that the lovers of B&W Dr Who shows will appreciate. Result: duff film. Throw in Samantha Janus taking her clothes off (make a point of this on the cover) and you'll probably sell enough copies to make a profit anyway!

"Mr. Bean", starring the legendary Rowan Atkinson, was a huge hit during its run in the 1990s, and I probably first saw it when I was around ten, shortly after it ended, so I was seeing reruns. I certainly wasn't much of a fan at the time, and didn't see too many episodes. I didn't really get into the show until my late teens, just a few years ago, which was when I finally watched every episode. Unlike before, it made me laugh many times, and since then, that has always been the case during repeat viewings of episodes!

when i first saw this movie i was literally rolling around on the floor laughing (especially when they were getting chased by the water, and when the guy drove through peoples gardens, i mean would it hurt to drive around the washing line?) the special effects! this movie clearly didn't have a big budget. either that or the guy left his toddler in charge of the controls. the water coming out of the damn looked like a close up of a can of beer that had fizzed up. what were the actors thinking? did they actually believe that it was a good movie?

Since THE MAGUS is a confusing puzzle that really has no solution, one should sit back and enjoy the scenery. Set on a "remote Greek island," it stars a very uptight Michael Caine as a teacher working at a school for boys who gets caught up in mind games with local wacko/mystery man Anthony Quinn and his daffy girlfriend Candice Bergen. Quinn, looking like Pablo Picasso with white hair and striped sailor shirt, is actually pretty good but Caine looks like he's ready to explode. Bergen, although stunning, should NOT put on a British accent EVER.

Got to confess right up front that I did n't watch this entire movie . I missed the first hour. I had to rewind it a few times just so I could keep up with the story, but I didn't get into it that much at that point. But, it still left me wanting more, and I'm hoping it's just as good as the first two movies. The first movie I've seen so far, I had no problem getting into it. From the moment I saw the trailer I really was hooked.

Given the acting roles he played in the 1940s ( Casper Gutman , Signior Ferrari , Mr. Peters , Jerome Cowan), his career as an opera singer has always been in a steady state since he started working in the 1960s. During that decade he performed all around Europe, but not much else. He didn't perform the big roles in the classics of the past, but he did sing many small ones. His last appearance on the scene was on the opera stage of the Met, where his singing was very good, but not great.

When I first watched this film , I thought that it would be rally good , because it featured my favorite actors , I think it’s something that I’m looking forward to watch more of because I really enjoyed this film and I’m glad that I saw it. It’s been a year now since this film was originally released, which has left a big gap for me, I was expecting to see some changes in the story and I was expecting this film to fall into the typical romance type of movie.

You could have put the characters on the island for any reason at all and had the same movie. The first one had an original story, the second stole one from King Kong, and in the end (I hope) of this trilogy the story seemed to have been bypassed altogether. Drop some people on an island full of dinosaurs and watch them run for their lives. That was about all there was to it. The special effects were decent but not worth 8 dollars. If you have a discount theatre in your local area, wait and see it for a buck.

Normally , I do not review online , but it 's Saturday and I 'm trapped in my room , with my laptop on the counter. So, I can do nothing , until it gets here! I 've been to my computer before , so I know how to get it to come up , but I do not know what to do from here ! So, please help . I want my laptop to come up on time , please ! Thank you . Well, if you don't have to, just make sure it comes up after you start the computer and you're connected to internet.

The Toxic Avenger , hideously deformed creature of super-human size and strength is back in this sequel that gets mostly better and more bizarre the second you get a close look. It all begins, as they say, with an evil clown. We first saw the clown in the first Deadpool comic in early 2014, right as he was making his way to China. It’s something you can see very well here, if you don’t want to buy the comic. If you buy the comic, you can also see a very well-done trailer.

After the failure of "Hellraiser III: Hell On Earth," the chapter that served as a kind of 'death blow' to the franchise, another embarrassing cheapo cash-in did not come as a surprise. An abysmal attempt to explain every single mystery of Pinhead and the puzzle box, covering literally centuries of history, in a film that runs UNDER 90 minutes... On display is sub-par to wretched acting, sup-par to wretched B-movie special effects, and a ludicrous and insulting attempt at dark humour, while STILL attempting to keep the whole project completely serious.

This is a fascinating documentary about a 15 year old black lad who is accused of murdering a tourist in a local park. I am not a criminal myself and I don't know why this documentary is being made. There seems to be much more to it. I just thought it was a little bizarre to see the same guy being questioned about this in an interview with the same journalist. For example:

The journalist says that he has seen the video. Why would he? The kid in the video says he doesn't remember that. What does this mean?

I've never understood this type of spoof movies. You get some serious/semi-serious movie that everyone knows about and takes the seriousness out of it through immature fart-jokes and such. We've seen it many, many times, and it's never really been funny. It's just an easy way to laugh at something you don't understand, in my opinion. This seems to be one of the more obscure and less liked of the genre, though I honestly don't see anything in this that is much worse than that of Spy Hard or Hot Shots.

When I first saw this movie , I had thought that it was going to be a terrible upset , and that there was no way it was going to win at the box office. I was wrong. I think if we had done this kind of film a few years back it would have been a great success . This movie has some of the best acting I've seen in a very long time , and that is saying a LOT . The whole cast is absolutely stunning , and they have a whole lot to do .

I actually liked this movie even though this movie seems to be so hated and i think it 's even more hated than the last one, it just sucks to watch, i feel for the girl who has to go through it, but the main problem is that it doesn't have much depth, its just like a standard action movie where the girl has to get to the point where the action gets really violent, and then when the action stops, the movie gets really dull. Also i have heard that this movie was the most popular movie that was banned at the cinema, which is also sad.

This movie was terrible . The acting was awful . The script was awful . What was even worse were the bad editing . The movie was like that . It felt like a bad movie because it was really bad . I just didn't get the joke. And it's really bad because of that . I wish there was more humor in it . I wish it had some good editing . But that is all I got . I hate the script . It just came out of nowhere . No one was really there to help me out .

This is a fantastic film. The acting is some of the best I've seen. Tatyana Samojlova is obviously very beautiful, and she automatically draws you into the film with her believable acting. The The cinematography was extremely ahead of its time. Watching it, I could see parallels of cinematography used today. This is truly a groundbreaking film. Because of the cinematography and acting, the audience can feel the change in tone from beginning to end as the tone in the environment in the movie changes. It's a very touching and powerful piece.

Gracie (Minnie Driver), a woman in her late twenties, is on a waiting list for a heart transplant. Bob (David Duchovny) has just had the tragedy of losing his wife in an automobile accident. One can guess the outcome. Gracie receives Bob's wife's heart, although they have no knowledge of each other....yet! A year later, Gracie is feeling like a new person while Bob is just beginning to think about his social life. When a friend sets him up on a blind date, Bob finds himself interested in the waitress, Gracie, at the restaurant where the date occurs.

OK, most of us agree that this is a weak attempt at a remake, but at the same time it's also a different movie in its own right. Don't get me wrong, 'American Werewolf In London' is a superior film, but 'American Remake In Paris' is a decent movie as well.First off, the only real similarities are the TITLE, 2 American BACKPACKERS, and WEREWOLVES. Other than those 3 things, 'American Remake In Paris' stands apart fairly well on its own with its special blend of humor, action/adventure, and horror.

Think Jumanji but with a death curse . A bunch of surfer dudes get their hands on a game that's supposed to be their only hope, but it turns out a bunch of strangers is actually going to be the game's only hope. A couple of years ago when I played Jumanji, it was something I would never get my hands on. I liked the idea of playing it on a giant board that you can walk around. I liked how you could move to your right and it would change the world. And it was fun.

OK , so maybe it 's because I 'm from the North East of Scotland and I talk just like them

It's just like you have a very similar accent to them, no doubt about it, but I have no clue as to what part of Scotland you come from

Click to expand...

No, I'm from Scotland, not North East, and I don't even have a Scottish accent at all. That's just the thing with accents, they're different for each individual. I don't know anything about where your family comes from though.

This movie is a must see for any war movie buff. One of the greatest movies of all time and loaded with great quotes such as:Kilgore: If I say its safe to surf this beach Captain, then its safe to surf this beach!Kilgore: Smell that? You smell that? Lance: What? Kilgore: Napalm, son. Nothing in the world smells like that. Kilgore: I love the smell of napalm in the morning. You know, one time we had a hill bombed, for 12 hours. When it was all over, I walked up.

Despite a small handful of nicely executed scenes , this entry ( the fourth ) feels tired . Toshiharu Ikeda , who’s been working in the genre for over two decades , is the main figure involved in this film , with Kenichi Kasai handling the rest. The story is mostly set in an unknown town in an unspecified world. A young man ( Shinnosuke Yamamoto ) takes his friend to visit him in the hospital. As they’re making their way up the path, he falls in love with the young lady ( Yuriko Tatsuta ) who is staying in their apartment.

This movie was alright . Mary-Kate and Ashley play twin sisters ( sorry for stating the obvious ) who against all odds manage to escape an abusive life in New York and reunite with each other in San Francisco. Both sisters are in love with the same guy but they don`t have the money to go to bed together. In the end they do it anyway and it`s the most incredible thing . The plot is well written with some funny lines . It`s a little bit too long but that doesn`t affect the overall quality .

...I can't believe there are actually people here who recommend this movie... This is such a slow POS going absolutely nowhere. Oh yeah OK it goes somewhere, but you see that coming from miles away. Acting: Really really bad, maybe the bartender was kind of OK. Editing: BAD! I suppose the editor was told "we need at least 90 minutes", cause half of all the scenes could have gone in the bin. Music: don't get me started on that, the lousiest score I've ever heard.

This movie was extremely disappointing , I thought it would be another 'marijuana comedy ' but do n't be mislead by its title , there are no laughs , and the story line has no real substance , I just wish it would have been a little shorter

I know that it's probably not the best thing that I have seen , but I'm glad I could watch it. I watched this one on Netflix because I was bored. I thought it would be an extremely funny movie about weed. I thought it would have some substance but it did not.

What on earth happened to RGV? There are so many things wrong about this movie that one needs to stop and decide where to start- first and worst - the music. Every scene was accompanied with this pretentious background music that was telling you the mood, quite pathetically, I might add. Secondly, the lighting - do we really need such dark scenes where we are wondering if the projector is still working? And finally - if you are going to Indianise the Godfather and Godfather 2 - please realize that a lot of us have seen in.

This is one awful movie ! ! Some people told me that it was not that bad actually but I have seen it twice ! ! First time I watched it at midnight I couldnt sleep , second time was in the morning I wanted to sleep ! ! But what the movie is all about ? ! ! I have never seen a movie which made me cry like this and I dont want to see it again ! ! In my opinion it's not a good movie because it is too much violence and it's too slow . ! !

Let me begin by saying that I had been eagerly anticipating this film 's release for awhile . After finally getting it for free on DVD a couple of years ago , I've been looking forward to watching it ever since . What makes 's release all the better ? 1. It's pretty much what I thought we were going to get . It's pretty much exactly the story we were all expecting . There's a few little things I was expecting that didn't quite deliver as I would've expected , and I'm not really sure what those reasons were . 2.

I saw this movie when I was about 12 when it came out . I recall the scariest scene was when the woman and the kids were running across the bridge while the man was in the other boat and he was trying to make his escape and he got caught and killed by the other guy. That guy was really crazy. I couldn't stand him so I just thought it would be a nice movie to see. I remember looking for a DVD and I looked at a lot of them but I never saw it again.

As someone who was in a Pan-Hellenic sorority , I was n't sure what to expect when I tuned into the Pan-Hellenic event at a local theater. My question was why. But I'm glad I checked in and made my choice. It's one of those events that I always feel the need for a day pass, but not when I want to meet people from all the different Greek organizations. I wanted to see if I would get any feedback on how it is being run. Would there be any groups that were more active than other parties?

Even if you're not a "theatre person," I highly recommend that you see this. Based off of a play of the same name by Christopher Bond (which, in turn, had been based off of an old London legend), Sondheim did a wonderful job bringing it to the musical theatre stage. The score is just amazing-- by far Sondheim's best, and probably one of the best scores written for a musical ever. The show was cast extremely well, my only complaint being of Betsy Joscelyn's portrayal of Johanna.

I wo n't spoil it for you . Although you probably could care less if it was spoiled ( you probably could care less because I don't care, so it would be rude if it was spoiling anything for you to care ) . But what's the problem with it? What's so special about it that needs to be spoiled? What is it that you're really afraid of? What is the reason you're afraid of it, and how should I help you overcome it? I can't really explain to you what is the reason for my fear .

What i hate most in this garbage is the arrogant attitude of the film makers and network execs who foist this nonsense on the public because they really think the audience is so stupid, so undeserving, so tasteless as to deserve these kind of cons. There is an inherent entertainment is seeing disaster movies and with the magic of today's CGI effects artists are given powerful tools to explore what before was denied them. With that allure we sat down to watch some mayhem and destruction. Well, guess what, the only mayhem we saw was in the ads touting next Wednesday's episode.

I saw this movie with my mother , and I loved it ! It was such a sweet story , and I wanted to read more. But, it took too long . I need to finish this book in the next year . I think it is a great story ! I can't wait to read the sequel. Thank you, for the opportunity to review this book! It was well worth the wait! It is the second in a series of three, set during World War I, and revolves around the fate of the men and women in the French Resistance.

Great 1980s Comic Strip comedy set in the South West of England. It is a tale of sex, drugs, cream teas and murder by the seaside. Adrian Edmondson, French and Saunders, Nigel Planer (hilarious in drag) and Robbie Coltrane play a part. Dennis (Edmondson) tries to impress girlfriend by boasting he is involved in a multi-million pounds drug deal. This leads to complications with hilarious results. I am trying to find out the original picture ratio for this film but it does not appear under 'Technical Aspects' of the IMDb site.

The first time I saw a commercial for this show was when my sisters were watching the Kim Possible movie and the trailer came on for the episode. It was very, very cool because I was like, "Oh my gosh! This is the show!" It was the first time people actually talked about anime, and I loved that. Now, I watch the show on occasion and there are times when I just go, "This is so awesome." It's like, "I wish I could just be a normal kid and watch this."

Are you kidding me ? The music was SO LOUD in this show I could often not even hear the music coming out the speakers. And that was my first show of this year too. The sound was terrible. I'm sorry, but I can't take any more music coming out of the speakers. This is what it sounded like:

I saw it, I enjoyed it, I wanted it to be there. What was so special about this show is that it really did not come out as much of a show as it could have, especially with the sound quality.

It starts out like a very serious social commentary which quickly makes one think of other Clark movies like Kids and even Superman II and Superman Returns. However, the more one looks at the film, the funnier it gets. The film starts off slow and builds to an unstoppable momentum which makes it a very enjoyable watch! Synopsis:

From Warner Bros comes the new and improved Superman, the most beloved and beloved of all superheroes, a man whose adventures have spanned decades, who has come to be known as one of the greatest super-men of all time.

This movie didn't do it for me, an avid SNL fan for the past 14 years. Jamie Gertz' portrayal was OK, but there was something so off-putting about the movie itself. The facts presented in the movie are totally skewed. But Merv Griffin produced it, so that would explain a lot. He was never on SNL, nor had anything to do with it. The points in her life when she was on SNL are backwards. When we first see her on SNL, walking through the studio with Lorne Michaels, the logo on the wall is circa 1988-1989, not 1975.

Solo is a poor film - that cannot be ignored. The acting for the most part is very wooden (the only exception is Adrien Brody's performance as Solo's creator Bill) and the story is slight enough that you would probably forget it WHILST you where watching the film. That said, such films are more about the action than the plot/acting and, as such, live or die by the action set pieces - that after all is the point of such films - to give 14 year-olds something to smile at whilst the adults watch films of actual substance.

Kazuo Komizu strikes again with `` Entrails of a Beautiful Woman '' , the sequel to `` Entrails of a Dog '' , which he co-wrote with Takeshi Obata . The movie is based off of the first novel of the series . The story starts off in an alternate timeline in which humanity has evolved to the point that they can control animals and humans can evolve to the point of being able to control people as well. The film also shows how the history of humans and humans evolves as the planet evolves and the world becomes aware that a group of humans that escaped from an experimental experiment have developed a new technology.

The plot has something about white hunters captured by a tribe of white women in the African jungle/ plains.Its a great movie and I loved it. I think its one of the best films i've ever seen! I've seen the trailer but I haven't seen the film yet. I think its something special and should be screened at some of your local cinemas. I'm still trying to find a good place where it can be shown at, though I did find one that screened it for a movie festival a while ago but it was too much of a hassle to show at a local theatre.

It was 1983 and I was 13 . I watched Valley Girl on HBO one night when my parents were out. They were going out of town, and I wanted to impress them. They had just moved to New Orleans from Chicago. It was the time before cable television became ubiquitous. When my father said, "You know you want to be in movies," I had to think about what he meant . . . I had read Valley Girl and I was fascinated by the concept of making a family. I was interested to see if my parents would let me go and do it .

I have seen this movie three times. Going back to VCR's, in the 1980's, and again on The Encor channel last night (Feb.11, 2010). Based on a true story which I remember being in the news, during the early 1980's, I've decided that I find it too disturbing to watch ever again. Yet it's hard to look away from a car accident. The creepiest character is Joshua John Miller, who plays Keeanu Reeves little brother. (The story this movie was based on can be found anywhere on the Internet -- just Google it.

Irvine Welsh's follow up to Trainspotting hits the screen as three short stories set in Edinburgh, all with a few of Welsh's trade marks, drug culture, depression, the working class and Hibernian football club. Uneasy to watch in places, it is no less than very well written, 2 of the stories having a darkly comic twist to them while the 2nd story a serious (and shockingly realistic) plot to it. Will not appeal to most, including myself to a point, but will no doubt adopt a cult following.

I thought Godzilla 2000 was the worst movie ever until I saw this monstrosity. My friends and I went to our local blockbuster and spent about an hour and a half looking for a movie. We could not find one since we have seen almost every movie created. We decided to look in the low budget horror section. We looked for the most attractive cover featuring scantily clad women. We finally decided on Last Slumber Party, THE. Whoops, we made a mistake. It seems as though this movie was filmed with the cheapest camera that could be found in K-Mart.

Wow. Just wow. Never before have i seen a horror movie in which it seemed like a bad self insert fanfic that somebody wrote one day in 20 minutes. And then i happened to come upon "Lady Frankenstein". This movie takes everything you know about Frankenstein and turns it completely upside down... and not in a good way. If you've seen this movie you either stumbled across it on Italian TV, or you have the dubbed version on the 50 Chilling Classics Box set like i have, as number 24. And lets just say there's a reason why these movies are here.

I just watched it for the second time today and I must say with all my heart it is about damn time they made a movie about us as people not as spiritual beings. Such a waste of human life as this story was maybe some good will come out of it. And Eric is hotter than ever. To often in the movies First Nations people are seen as other than everyday people. We are always portrayed as chiefs or medicine people. Hey we are just like everyone else. And this movie showed just that. We hurt when an injustice is done and we can win in quest for justice.

Corben Bernsen directed horror film about a chemical weapon being released in a sporting event and turning everyone in to a new form of mutated, zombie-like creatures. The film’s star is Robert Pattinson, who starred in both of the Twilight movies, but in this film he plays the character of Nick, who was an unwitting participant in a military experiment that mutated humans. The movie was released in theatres in 2013 and has had a successful theatrical run, as well as being adapted for the big screen, in a 2016 film starring Brad Pitt and Carey Mulligan.

This show started out okay , but then it turned into a nightmare . The worst part about it was that I would be sitting there doing my own thing , and all of sudden the song will stop , I would have no idea why, and then there would be silence. Then the song would start up again. And then it would start all over again, and you would be just sitting there watching all of the stupid shit that had happened. And that’s how it felt . There’s just something about it that I’ve never had anything like.

In a Morocco completely invaded by Europeans and Americans , in the beginning of the Twentieth Century , the Moroccan society became more and more secular, more and more individualist, less and less religious. In those days the most important symbol of a Moroccan Muslim was not the Koran , but the black cloth known as _barka_ , which is used in a variety of ways in the Morocco of the Twentieth Century : it is not only used as the symbol of Islam , it is also an important element in Moroccan cuisine . This article explains the evolution of Morocco from the medieval times to today.

Since the past couple of days I 'm really hooked on the `` Female Scorpion '' series and I keep reading the manga. I have read this manga before but I never know exactly what's going to happen. I found out that she can change her appearance to match her partner and get his attention. She can also do all this while she's keeping a low profile, just like the male scorpion and female tiger do. The male scorpion is able to transform into a female one and stay female. It seems like the female scorpion in the series is much stronger than the male.

With some films it is really hard to tell for whom they were made. Huevos de oro seems to aim at the well educated Spanish middle class. There must be many inside jokes in this movie which you will not understand if you are an outsider. This can be pretty annoying.Symbols and references to art and popular culture abound, the movie alludes to the work of Salvador Dalí, Luis Buñuel and the Surrealists in general, a certain infatuation with bidet baths seems to point to Duchamp's ready mades. What's more, the main character has also a knack for karaoke tapes with songs of Julio Iglesias.

'The Dresser ' is one of those films which are so perfect you really struggle to find something not to like,' said the actress, before adding, 'There's no way anyone could make it worse. There is no other film quite like it.' In the opening sequence of The Dresser, one of the most memorable images from the film, a girl dressed in red is being chased through the woods. She is eventually found by two men and the film's title is used with the tagline, 'The Dresser is a dresser.'

Wow ! Here comes another straight-to-video scarecrow movie to keep the cinematic masochists happy . If the cheap-looking opening credits have any indication, you'll be laughing your heads off the whole time. There's even a hint that this movie is a comedy. But wait, is it? I'm pretty sure the only laugh is coming from the kids, not from the scarecrow itself. I guess it's just a great way to get the kid to laugh and then go on to make the other kids laugh. That would be a good thing. I am so tired of watching scarecrow movies now.

While the prominent and over use of the play-like format is in total operation throughout the film , it is not until the last act that this play is introduced to the world, and the audience are not sure whether they should follow along or not. It’s also not until the climax of the film that we are given the first indication that this is not just another film about “play”. It’s not until the end credits of the film where we hear the famous line: “The play is just beginning”, that the audience finally get an indication of what is about to unfold.

This is a great little movie, full of interesting characters and situations. While not in the same class as some of the better-known movies of its time, it is still extremely watchable and memorable. The scene where Zachary Scott, sitting on a bus, casually steals the airman pin from the lapel of a coat thrown over the seat next to him, is terrific. It defines his character beautifully -- a guy who's so low, he'll purloin something of inestimable value to a war veteran, to use as a prop in his various charades.

Low budget mystery . A shot rattles out of the dark and a woman is seen running from that direction. She’s been hit but she is still breathing. There’s no sign of foul play. What happened to the victim? Is this the beginning of a nightmare that will end very soon? The woman is wearing an orange sweater and dark trousers and has a small dog running alongside her. This dog is not very big and the woman is walking with a big stick in her left hand. As she walks, she looks in both directions and then turns and looks at the dog.

As kids movie it is great. For the family it just sucks. I was truly hoping for something like the Goonies which is a great film for all ages. This movie was just geared too much to the kids with the silly script and characters calling each other little names like booger breath. ??? Alan Cummings was however a delight. And why do people compare Willy Wonka to this movie...just because there is a theme song closely resembling the Willy Wonka song doesnt make this film anything like Willy Wonka.

Now here is a movie that does something that hasn't been done in a long time. It take ten or so different elements that we're already familiar with (Vampires, martial arts, a techno beat, top-o-the-line special effects, etc. ), and turns it into something that feels brand new. In what could have easily been merely a combination of "Mortal Kombat" and "Buffy: The Vampire Slayer," Wesley Snipes (no favorite of mine since and mostly because of "Passenger 57") gives a really good turn as the half human/ half bloodsucker.

Naach A more detailed review can be obtained anywhere else in the web. This one is a good portrayal, although I do not agree with it entirely. Taran is a commercial guy and hence views from his angle only.Ram Gopal Varma (RGV, seems like a political party) has created a marvel in Rangeela, so this one seems like a pale reflection of that one in some parts... I'm not even going to compare Urmila and Anthara.. both are good! The former has better acting talent, although the latter is catching up nicely.Anyways, I like Anthara's character.

Well , the Sci-Fi channel keeps churning these turkeys out ... and they seem to get worse every time . Every time I get to see them I just think , "I can't believe they can be in so much trouble so easily . I wish they'd just go away and let us live our lives just the way we wish to ." Well , they are still on the channel and even I am still amazed . I'm sure I will have the chance to see one someday . I wonder if they have ever been killed in any way ?

I love Umberto Lenzi 's cop movies -- ROME ARMED TO THE TEETH is my favorite -- and his DESERT STORM series -- the most underrated of his body of work. They were always my favorite when I was a kid but haven't gotten the credit they deserve. Here are four of my favorite desert storms from the Desi series that are still available on DVD:

I have to admit that when I was a kid, I had a hard time imagining a world without sand. We lived in a desert in the Southwest so there were lots of sand storms.

This film reeks of production line planning. It appears like the filmmakers looked at recent hit movies, and threw spaghetti on the screen - Jimmy Stewart! June Allyson! Anthony Mann! Baseball! War! Baby! Airplane! - ROLL 'EM! - The film does address the age of the Stewart/Allyson performers; though, I'm certain we are still supposed to think they are much younger.There are messages in "Strategic Air Command" I found curiously shocking and offensive, but I'll stick with one truly wretched element: The happily married couple is challenged when Mr. Stewart's character makes an important decision without consulting his wife.

Having watched this movie several times , I have come to the conclusion that Milos Forman made a very daring choice to show a gay man kissing another gay man, and another gay man kissing a female. This leads me to the question: Is it okay? I have never seen this kind of thing in movies before and I think this was a great film to do that. I can see why people liked it. The kissing scenes were also very well done and the ending was also a perfect ending to this film.

Sorry I could n't disagree more , with the last comments . frankly I thought this was worse than Carry on . It was an excellent story , I thought it was really interesting and that it was really well written . I thought the setting was well thought out and well written and I was really happy with how it all concluded . If I'd have thought that the conclusion was really over the top I probably would have enjoyed it more. I thought it was a well written story . The only problem I had with the book was that it ended too abruptly .

This film has its detractors, and Courtney's fey dresser may offend some folks (who, frankly, need a good smack upside the head) -- but the film is top notch in every way: engaging, poignant, relevant. Finney, naturally, is larger than life. Courtney makes an ideal foil. I thought the performances to be terribly strong in both leads, and Courtney's character provides plenty of dark humor. The period is well captured, the supporting cast well chosen. This is to be seen and savored like a fine cordial.

As I said , sometimes low budget is good . You get to see a good movie without a lot of money , it’s better . I also do love to go to cheap places , I mean if you can afford it , there’s no point , it’s not good for you and you don’t like eating there . I’m a simple man , I can’t afford to have expensive places to eat , but I still go there . I remember I had a friend that used to go to the place where he used to go to eat .

Seymour Cassel gives a great performance , a tour de force . His acting as supposed washed up beach stud is great . He was at one point in his early 20s. This is great casting , but as a character he needs to show that he is not washed up he is still a man who knows what he wants and he is still a man who is not going to do what he doesn't want to do in life . He is not a role model. I really think he should be given a chance , he's not that old.

"Escape from Hell" is not made with enough artistry to disguise what it is: crass exploitation. The direction and writing are both sloppy: for example, the camera-work during the fight between Cintia Lodetti and Ajita Wilson is so bad that you can barely make out what's happening; also, if the alcoholic-but-kind-hearted doctor hadn't killed the warden, the guards would never have followed him and the girls after their escape - the "fake plague" plan had worked fine until then but he just had to ruin it.

When I was a little girl, I absolutely adored The Swan Princess, it was reliving the same fairy tales of Snow White, Sleeping Beauty, and Cinderella, the princess and her prince who saves the day is always a timeless story that will never die, well, hopefully. But I figured that I would check out the sequels for The Swan Princess to see what they were like and unfortunately, this is the typical cartoon sequel that just disappoints more than entertains. The only character I found still very amusing was the Queen, she was very funny in this movie and had the best part.

Some films are just plain silly beyond explanation . This is one of them . Words can not do justice to the absurdity of this film . I'll be honest, the whole thing looks like a parody of a British TV show . All the cast consists of the leading lady and her co-workers in a film set . The film seems to be a parody of a British TV show . It's set to air sometime in the month of August . This is the fourth movie of the year, but we are getting to know the cast a lot faster this year .

What I liked best about this feature-length animated film from 1941 is the great feel it gives for the early days of animation. It shows how early 20th century filmmakers were experimenting and developing new ideas to try out before they made their film, and how they did it on an industrial scale. We get to see how the animator's hand-drawn art style was being used to develop a new and exciting medium of animation for the American market. And I especially enjoyed watching how this film was made and what kind of production techniques were used to make it.

James Stewart plays Johnny Mason , lawyer . Carole Lombard is Jane Mason , wife . Lucile Watson the mother-in-law . There is a secret behind their marriage . Then she has to get him to marry her . But he finds it difficult to marry her . She tries to get him back by telling him that his wife is dead . That’s when she realizes that she still loves him , but he is married to his other woman . He is in love with her , but he is scared to let her know . She has to show him that he can trust her .

Everything you do in this world should make at least a little bit of sense . Unfortunately very little of it does. And that’s before you get into the philosophical questions of ethics and metaphysics. So to help people who have trouble with these questions, here’s some advice on the art of getting it right and making sense of your world. There are two schools of thought on how you should make sense of the world in the first place. One is known as Cartesian dualism, the other the materialist school of philosophy. They both share one thing in common.

Like the previous two 'Mad Max ' films , 'Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome ' is not exception to the violence and gore. This time, the film has to be taken more seriously. The scene where the characters are killed is one of the most bloody in the whole film. The blood splatter is well planned, but the scene with the character being shot to death is out of hand. At one point, you get the idea that someone is stabbing the protagonist with his bare hand. After this scene, the character's blood is not splattered on a plate but on a bed.

It 's astonishing that some people saw this as art . We saw it as a poorly filmed ( shaky ) drama about a family . This is not true . We are a family ! We are NOT a family drama ! That's why I was thrilled when this movie started to gain so much popularity. I was thrilled when it began getting good reviews. I was thrilled when it was nominated for 7 Academy Awards . And I was thrilled when the movie won 1. This is an honor for me that I was not expecting to receive. Well deserved !!

JURASSIC PARK III *___ Adventure Sam Nell (The Dish), William Macy (Happy Texas, Fargo), TZ(a Leoni (Family Man)A better title would be: ESCAPE FROM THE ISLAND OF REALLY MEAN DINOSAURS. But then no one would need to see the film. In this sequel, a rag-tag group pays a visit to the island of dinosaurs to rescue the teenage victim of a hang-gliding accident.ACCESS HOLLYWOOD reports JP3 began filming without a completed script. That explains why the film seems to have little or no purpose other than to demonstrate state-of-the-art special effects.

The subject matter was good , direction was OK. Mohanlal was efficient in his role as a Major . The film was interesting . The ending was very good , and I loved what happened to Ramdev. I liked the way the film ended and it made me wonder why the film wasn’t a superhit. I did not love the movie at all. But the director did great work and I enjoyed the acting. I felt like the movie was done at a professional level. I enjoyed the movie and will definitely watch it again. I like this one a lot.

I went to Crooked Earth to see a piece of New Zealand. What I found was a badly scripted and badly acted echo of the people I know.Great moments between characters  including many of Temuera Morrison and Lawrences Makoares scenes together  were often ruined by long and wordy monologues that the actors were forced to stumble through. Beautiful and ill-fitting phrases rattled away from Lawrence in particular as if he were the new Maori Messiah at his pulpit of beer crates.When watching any film with Maori actors, I've found that I can always pick a half dozen characters that remind me of someone in my life.

I was so looking forward to watching the documentary self-immolation of the mastermind behind Boondock Saints, one of the most aggravating and pointless movies I've ever seen. But the makers of "Overnight" - buddies (ex?) of the mastermind in question - also need to learn how to make a movie. Various unsavoury remarks, yelling obscenities into the phone, and enjoying his alcohol do indeed make Mr. Duffy look like a putz. But it doesn't shed any insight into why the guy got a contract in the first place, what his creative process or vision is - what's Boondock Saints even about?

Driving Lessons From the writer of the critically acclaimed films, Mrs. Brown and Charlotte Gray, Jeremy Brock brings a touching heartfelt dramedy starring Academy Award Nominees Julie Walters and Laura Linney and from the Harry Potter series, Rupert Grint. The beautiful portrait tells the story of Ben Marshall, (Rupert Grint) a seventeen year old boy being held captive in the heart of his religiously neurotic mother Laura (Laura Linney). After his school year ends he decides to take a job with a clever, free-spirited, and "heavy on the bottle" retired actress, Evie Walton (Julie Walters).

I just saw this movie. I liked the soundtrack.I saw first the trailer and was magnificent, like all Hollywood movies, they know how to sell.But the movie is almost awful, first 30 minutes are interesting, but then.... like almost all new movies they blow it up. I don't get the idea, why that kid died? ?Is a cliché, every nigga' movie must have a kid to be killed, and everybody must become good after his death.LOL.I don't understand what is the connection with the movie... And is so predictable, you know the end from the very first minutes.Nothing new in this movie.

Mr. `` Uwe Fail '' strikes again , transformed a classic game in a cheap piece of crap . Poor timing , and poor decisions , were the reasons the game fell apart from the very first play . The result was a complete debacle that is difficult to believe was not planned from the onset . Now , even if a game is poorly designed , I think that a lot can be gained from it , if not from a good game design . I really don't know what the designers were trying to achieve , or if they actually intended it to work .

Yahoo Serious is like a $3 bottle of wine - had no substance to begin with and just gets worse with age. This film proves he is completely toxic. We can only hope that this is his final film and that its serious lack of success will diminish his chances of obtaining finance for any future ventures. It is right up there with "Lightning Jack" and "Les Patterson Saves the World" as the most abysmal example of Australian comedy imaginable. How tragic it is that with so many infinitely superior comedic talents in Australia Yahoo is given such vehicles to express his brand of puerile school yard comedy.

Well I 'm not the world 's biggest Sondheim fan , so although I have the cast album and I love that song the lyrics are in French and not in English and it makes it very difficult for me to listen to that album . It just makes me wonder what I might have done for the best if I didn 't have to listen to it with my wife . I can understand why it 's a little difficult . I remember a while back an old friend of mine and I were on a drive together and he made a joke that it was going to end in disaster.

Well it is a good movie . However , you have to admit that Van Dame 's movies have n't been the usual hit with me . in fact, they have been one of those movies I have had my eye on for a while -- but haven 't seen , and now they're coming out soon . this movie starts out with a little girl being chased down a road by a man who thinks that he's the evil monster . he takes the girl and runs her over into the river in a boat .

I saw this on a screener DVD a couple months before it was released.I liked the main characters and the story. I found the ending to be interesting and the ending was well done. But some of the scenes seemed to drag on way to long and I think that some of the scenes might have had too many characters involved for me to be able to really enjoy this movie. I would have preferred if they had kept the character's of the main characters but I suppose that would be a difficult thing to do.

In 1968, Stanley Kubrick made this historic film masterpiece base on a book written by Arthur C. Clark. It was such an early effort to make a science fiction movie combined with scientific facts. His style of movie making is still fresh and intact.I have seen this movie more that half a dozen times and I even have a VHS copy of the movie in my library. CS3 class made me to see the movie again with another perspective: Who is HAL and what is he thinking?I enjoyed watching the movie again and tried to focus of HAL's dialogues throughout the second episode of the movie.

This movie is truly unbelievable , in every sense of the word . I could n't believe what I was seeing. It is a masterpiece of acting and the story is great. This movie has it all and I have never seen a movie like this one before , and I think I have seen one of these movies , and this is one of them. Bryan Cranston is one of the all time best actors of my lifetime . The entire movie is worth watching if you like that genre , but I can't help it, this movie is like nothing else I have seen.

Although i do n't like cricket at all and i have seen this movie 13 years ago , I still find it a great film and I would give this movie a 9 out of 10 !!!!!!! !!!!!!!!! !!! !!! This movie is about a guy who works in a bar in India. His life takes a twist when he is asked to go to England to meet an old friend and when he reaches England, he falls in love with the woman he will be living with.

The only reason there is a question mark in parenthesis is NOT because I have n't seen every film released by this studio. They are only films they have had released, and I have. I still have to review a bunch to see if any are worth buying. But you are right that there is no question mark because the studio has released ALL of them and in the last 5 years I have seen about 80 films from them and in that span of time almost ALL have been excellent films, and this is just not true of almost all the rest.

What can I say about this ? Such a big Prestige-Production - but in the End ? Wasted Time , Wasted Money , and Lost Customers. Prestige has a huge responsibility, to do the job, to give all its people the best tools, with the maximum possible attention to what it does. That's why they've spent the last 3 years building it. They've spent a hell of time building it. This is why they've wasted so much money. But, in the end, the people they've built it for deserve some kind words. But, why?

Donald Sutherland, an American paleontologist visiting England, picks up a hitch hiker one evening. Two years later, having discovered the man's address book in his car, he returns the book to the man's opulent home, only to find that the man's been hanged for murder. Nobody in or out of the family seems to care that the hitch hiker could not have committed the murder (of his own stepmother) because he was in Sutherland's car at the time of the crime.Sutherland is the man's alibi but he's turned up too late.

Set in the Philipines, Lethal Panther 2 is a dreary early-90s martial-arts action flick which sees a reckless cop hunting down the nasty criminals who killed his wife. A rather cheap looking production with almost no artistic merit, this film relies on the quality and quantity of its action. But whilst there is no shortage of fisticuffs, gun fights and explosions, the quality is just not there. The endless battles are desperately lacking in originality or excitement, with poor editing and mundane direction making this film a real chore to sit through.The usually impressive Yukari Oshima is totally wasted, with her natural athletic ability overshadowed by some excruciatingly bad wire-work.

How did this film get into the Berlin Film Festival ? I understand it got into the Panorama section , and then there is this special section dedicated to documentaries. Does it have to do with the documentary aspect ? What does it add ? Is there another documentary film festival in Germany ? It is in the top five in Berlin. I am not aware of any documentaries that got in the Panorama section. It looks like it was there at the time the film was announced. There are some documentaries in there that I don't know about.

I looked forward to watching this film since I loved the David Lynch version . In my first attempt at seeing it (as far as I remember, anyway) I remember that it started out with the music sounding a little different than I thought it would be, and then I got stuck in the story. I don't remember much of that part, other than Lynch getting shot and the ending was pretty much like I had expected it to be since I was a little disappointed that the film didn't start with a bang, instead seeming to take a longer time to conclude.

I went into this movie hoping for an imaginative twist on the Second Coming. Boy, was I ever wrong. BBC are dullards at pacing a movie, total idiots at creating suspense, fools at building intensity. And this movie is no exception to the rule of how much BBC sucks.Ugh, the pacing and time-wasting laborious dialogue was just painful to sit through. The first 30 minutes felt like 2 hours. I kept looking down at my watch wondering when the pointless, monotonous drivel would end. They wasted a perfectly good actor in the lead role, because the material is so lazy, and sloppily, written.
