This movie is about pathetic, spoiled, ego-driven winers who think they have something interesting to say, performed by pathetic, spoiled, ego-driven winers who think they are interesting. Straight from the coke-filled gutters of New York's arty farty incestuous drama scene.How so many viewers get tricked into making them think this carries any substance remains a mystery to me. Maybe they secretly long to belong too to this overpaid and overestimated 'actor guild' or maybe they have never seen a decent movie?Get out, put your hands in the dirty earth and get a real job.

This film makes several nods to various science fiction films . The prologue reminds me of the one for the original "Jurassic Park" (a film that came to me by chance) . In fact there are a few shots in this trailer that resemble the scene in which John Hammond, who's played by Gary Oldman, has just been killed by the creature at the end of the original movie "Jurassic Park" . So, I suppose this trailer has to be considered as a "kind of homage" to one of the few good Jurassic Park sequels .

This movie could have had a lot of potential . Certainly with today 's technology , one would expect real 3D action . The movie did not have that . The technology was not quite up to the job . The special effects of the movie did not show up on the big screen .The 3D effects on the big screen were not what one could call good . The 3D technology used by Warner Bros in this movie did not have the consistency that was required for a quality movie . Even with the special effects , one could not tell the difference between the real world and the special effects of the 3D world .

I've always enjoyed Frank Sinatra's music, and just recently I wrote a term paper about his life story. I've been fascinated by the life and legend of Ol' Blue Eyes. However, I've never seen any of his movies. So I wanted to see if his acting was as great as his singing. Well...it was! I was blown away by his performance in this movie! He really does a tremendous job as recovering heroin addict Frankie Machine, who's trying to put his life back together and audition as a drummer for a local band.

I did have a good time the first 45 min. or so, but then suddenly it was all down hill. The suspense somewhat started to get thin and the jokes somewhat the same all over. What kept it going were the good actors.But the problem with this film is that it is trying to be cleverly funny,like Tarantino and god is that outdated stuff. Tarantino being a bit overrated sometimes, this movie comes ten years too late. At best it is for teenagers, and I am sure many of them find the character of Johann funny, which he is for the first 30 min.

This was a great movie. It had one "sot-so-nice" outburst. Plus there were some very intense (drama) scenes which might make it inappropriate for younger viewers, under 6.For a under the radar film, the acting was quite enjoyable, and touched down in our family room for a near perfect landing. It held the attention of our whole family and we were kind of sorry to see it end.This movie had elements of spy kids with young people saving the day, but was given a somewhat more believable scenario. The dream scenes were a distraction at first, but did a great deal to establish the plot.

The Adventures of Hercules has to be one of the lamest excuses for a movie I've yet run across. You would have to look far and wide to find anything that approaches the level of ineptness on display in this movie. Acting  Bad. Editing  Bad. Direction  Bad. Special Effects  Bad and Laughable. Plot  Bad. Lighting  Bad. Cinematography  Bad. Costume Design  Bad and Silly. Everything Else  Bad. Watching The Adventures of Hercules is about as enjoyable as a root canal. Even for a fan of bad movies, it's a real endurance test.

Something of a disappointment . Lee J. Cobb is the anti-union head of Roxton Garments in New York . His father was a longshoreman . His mother worked at an auto parts factory . I suppose it's not really that surprising to hear about a poor man working for a rich man . I wish he'd stay home and help his family . And I hope the company is a little more creative . Maybe a little more creative would go a long way . But, as we've all heard, the real problem is unionization. I've always been opposed to unions.

This is the kind of movie which is loved by 50-year old schoolteachers and people who consider themselves aware in the first place (the latter, by definition, being old-fashioned). So for me it's just another case of a movie that was made by a company with no clue how to market a new product:

"It was a mistake, but not a mistake for the film industry, we should have known this was a commercial disaster. It seems to me that the studios and producers who made this movie should have paid closer attention when they went about making it.

It has been years since I have been privileged to see this movie on TV . I only wish I could get to sit in the theater seeing this on a big screen at a theatre with a sound track. The first time I saw it, I was very young. It is not that the movie itself is so dark, it is that the movie itself has so much darkness in it. It has many scenes of blood and evil. There are some scenes that are so dark that you will never forget it . This was a film that should have been left alone.

There's lots of ketchup but not a whole lot of sense in the supposedly explanatory third sequel, which piles on the naff visuals to no effect. Good old Alan Smithee directed this one, in which various members of the same family (all played, poorly, by Bruce Ramsay) are terrorised by Pinhead (Doug Bradley, wheeled out of mothballs for the umpteenth time). Peter Atkins tries to imbue his script with poetic touches but doesn't seem to realise that his dialogue is as deep and meaningful as a plate of sick.

This movie was definitely on the boring side. The acting was decent and the film looks pretty nice, the soundtrack is definitely for fans of Kenny G and Michael Bolton. Speaking of the soundtrack, I found it very ironic that a film about telling the truth and not stealing decided to use a song in it's titles that was a BLATANT RIPOFF of Paul Simon's "You Can Call Me Al" - except that they don't acknowledge it at all. Isn't there something a little hypocritical there? The scene that the main kid was in where he was mimicking a game show host was my favorite.

I saw this movie on television as SCREAMERS and loved it . I heard an interesting story about this film that I think everyone should know . In the end , this was the only film that really made me really care about the people who were killed . It was so heartbreaking and so tragic and yet there was also an uplifting message in the end . This is not only a message that people should be made aware of but also a way of telling our own stories , a message that should be more often seen and understood .

Formulaic to the max . Neither title reflects the serial 's actual content , `` Fighting Nazis in Morocco , `` nor was it at all a work that the author had intended to use as a novel. That is because, although it appeared as such, the text was in fact written by the German Nazi propaganda organization, the Abwehr , in response to an attempt to gather information about the movement from the Moroccan government . The novel was not, however, an official Abwehr publication , since it had not been published as such by the agency itself .

I remember when they made a big deal about this when it was coming out . They showed clips every time they did a trailer and it never really clicked . I think they should make it a little more interesting to watch it . I mean it’s great that they are coming with a feature where you can just pick the story and you can play it back or it’s just a fun feature to have but if they did a feature where people could watch the trailer and then watch the movie they would watch it more and it would make the movie better .

By Jove, what an unholy mess! Revenge, incestuous love, mechanical games-like fighting, ceaseless and utterly unnecessary violence, some primitive "music" hammering away at the bewildered victims, big "surprises" (which actually tend to be about as "revelatory" as The National Enquirer's headlines). Add some shoddy camera movements pretending to be stylish and creative and you've already impressed the crowds. This movie's totally undeserved popularity powerfully indicates the very low level pop sub-culture has succeeded not only in achieving in the last decades, but also in imposing as dominant taste on an impotent audience.

Dreadful . I hope I can save two hours of your life by warning you away from this . I’m still recovering from it . I hope you don’t try and read this . I wish you the best with it and it’s still a lot of fun and a lot of work to go over it . I’d like to get back to it again but I’d be afraid it might make me want to do this again and take a chance . I am a Christian and I still have my fears about hell but I do have a little hope .

Not too many people seem to know about this movie. Which is too bad because I think it's pretty good. Sure it is a bit cheesy at times and may have a predictable storyline. But the presentation of the movie is pretty well done. I think the casting is good with likeable actors/characters. Tom Selleck does a good job at playing a baseball player (go figure... not too much of a stretch I suppose) and Ken Takakura (from Black Rain) plays the chief (the coach of the Japanese baseball team). There isn't too much to complain about.

I've read the positive comments on this movie. I assume people who were in this movie must've come to this site to give it some good press because this was one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I always watch the whole film despite the quality or lack there of which explains why I watched this whole movie, but I don't think I laughed even once during the duration of this film. The jokes were mostly very bad, but when the jokes had some promise, the delivery was off.

After being off the air for a while, Columbo returned with some new made-for-TV mysteries that, while not being as good as the original series, are better than the shows that were done in the later '90s. "Murder Can Be Hazardous to Your Health" used the then (and I guess now, if you think about it) true crime shows as the situation for a murder. The murder is committed by a very successful, egomaniacal true crime show host, George Hamilton (in a nice bit of casting).

This movie was the biggest piece of garbage I've seen in a long time.It's marketed as as Sci-Fi when in fact it's nothing more than a Christian recruiting tool.It tells you quite a bit about the state of the Christian church, when they have to resort to deception just to get you to listen to their sales pitch. But then again what do you expect from an organization that would go through such great lengths to help protect such an enormous amount of child molesters in their organization.Religion is full of nothing but sexual deviants, hypocrites, and war mongers.

A friend brought me this movie and at first I was hesitating , the pace in the movie was so fast , a bit slow , a bit slow and then I realized that I’m going to see this film , and I don’t know , this film is amazing ! I’ll probably see this film over and over again . In the movie , the movie stars a lot of people who are not familiar with the characters , or at least they aren’t as familiar with the characters as the audience.

It seems whenever a mainstream film company wants to make a movies for teens it concentrates on only one thing: sex. Don't get me wrong, I'm no prude but the fact that these people seem to think getting my rocks off is all I'm interested in is highly offensive. Take The Convenant, a film that relies so heavily on you finding the main characters attractive it thinks it can get away without a plot and/or a script that wasn't written by a six year old. This is essentially The Craft with (supposedly) hot guys.

Mankind's Self awakening is the theme of "2001: A Space Odyssey", a process that unfolds along a space-time continuum. We "see" our primordial past, and we "infer" a cosmic future. The powers of intuition thus become the doors of perception, in our ongoing collective journey.From this transcendental perspective, a conventional, egocentric plot seems superfluous. Our frenzied conflicts and self-important dialogue are consumed in evolutionary change, and are irrelevant in a cosmos that is vast beyond comprehension. It's a tough lesson for a vain and aggressive species.

Superhero Movie ( 2008 ) is the most recent in the long line over `` parody '' movie movies which has been made here and abroad. It is being released in all over the country, and I am hoping this is the last one in which I shall be writing about the movie. I will try to give a bit more information about the movie but if the movie has been made in any other language, please feel free to let me know by leaving a comment or message in my website. The plot is simple: An American girl named Natalie is living in Europe.

I really enjoyed this movie. I have probably watched it 2 dozen times or more and still enjoy it. Being an old Navy guy, Im still stirred by the rousing rendition of Anchors Away! I also love the "McHales Navy" pirate atmosphere. I could have done without the female dive officer but Im just old fashioned I guess. She was still good to look at, lol, espesially after the crew got done with her laundry. The cook, sonarman, and electrician made the movie. Loved the salty old engineer and his first class PO too.

Wow -- this movie was really bad! You talk about formulaic, typical movie plot? Watching this movie was like hitting my head repeatedly against a brick wall. The transitions kept trying to be cool but failed. The plot twist at the end, where we find out who the bad guy is was unexpected, but doesn't make much sense until his monologue. Even then... The amount of gore in this movie doesn't help either. Are all of those images necessary? My last complaint is about the plausibility of chunks of the movie.

I have noticed that a lot of films that have been featured on "Mystery Science Theater" have received a tons of low ratings on IMDb. However, a few of the films featured on the films weren't that bad and it's not fair to rate a film that's been given the "MST" treatment--with the hosts making funny comments during the film. Now I am NOT saying that "The Girl in Lover's Lane" is a great film, but it's not nearly bad enough to merit its current IMDb score of 2.1.The film begins with Bix and Danny meeting.

You know sometimes you just got ta have it ? That 's how this movie is with me . I mean you know you have to make it work . I didn 't want it to just just be this one shot . I wanted this to be the first and last . That's why I didn 't really think that it would work , but I just know that it will because that's the way I feel about this , so you know I 'll be here . So you know I 'm gonna take a little break , so I'm gonna be here and see where the next one is .

This movie deserves a 20/10 if I could give one . `` THE HOLLOW '' is a great Hercule Poirot mystery that you would like to see more movies with. There is a mystery and then you have to figure it out. I think Poirot had it figured out by the end but I can't think of a better way to let him loose than by playing him as a man with a great mystery in his soul. I love watching this movie because it is well written, acted, directed by a great director. The story is great in a way.

Everything Is Illuminated A young Jewish American searches for the woman that helped his grandfather escape Nazi persecution while embarking on a dangerous journey across the ocean to Palestine. On December 8, 1935, the year before Kristallnacht, a young Jewish American college student sets off across the Pacific Ocean for Palestine with dreams of finding a woman who escaped Nazi persecution while traveling across the ocean. When he arrives in Palestine, the only person he could find in his search for the woman was an elderly woman with a reputation for helping other escapees, but he can’t bring himself to approach her.

From all of the Vietnam war movies this is probably the most frightening and disturbing and that is really saying something. I saw it in theatres in 1975, I saw it in a cinema the same day and it’s probably the best film I’ve seen to date about the horror of war and also the power of the government and the media to convince the public that what the Vietnamese were doing in Vietnam was all bad. It is a very disturbing film and you can see the horrors being carried out in the way they tell it in the film.

When I first saw this show i thought to my self " What is this!!!!!?" Its one of those shows where there is a perfect fake high school world with stupid problems that are considered "huge". Then there's Sadie. This complete misfit for her friends and well her family. Shes completely obsessed with nature not that thats a bad thing but she compares high school students to animals! like what is that!? also they made her another Lizzie Miguire clone ( yeah because the world definitely needs another one of those!)

Well the previews looked funny and I usually do n't go to movies on opening night especially with my kids. I was not in the mood. But I still went, and as usual it wasn't a great movie. I didn't find any redeeming value to the movie or the film itself. The ending was just awful and just about everything else in this movie was mediocre. I mean, really mediocre. I'm not talking about the acting or even the writing, I'm talking about the plot and how it's going to be handled.

River's Edge is an excellent film and it's a shame that it hasn't made more of a mark for itself in cinematic history. There were a number of gritty films based around school kids made in the eighties, but of all the ones I've seen; this is certainly the most nihilistic and disturbing. The film takes a storyline that is disturbing in its own right and adds the theme of teenage slackers and their uncaring attitude about things, which takes the story onto another level. The film works because the central story is interesting and it's played out by complex characters.

What I hoped for (or even expected) was the well known "stop motion" imagery and extreme slow motions, extreme zooms and all embracing fish eye takes. In short: The art of a) finding interesting Visual Events and b) capturing them in a way the human eye is not capable of, to be replayed so that the human eye can see. The stuff that made the other Qatsi's hits.I just wondered how the creation of the whole would fit the title.Having watched the movie I got the feeling that the focus in this third part was on the message and not on the wrapping.

Most of the positive comments posted here are as verbose as the movie! It takes a long-winded bore to appreciate a wordy and boring film, one supposes. Some have merely called the film "contemplative", meaning slow and devoid of plot, however, one Dutch reviewer hit the nail on the head: this is an important event turned into a dull film whose tone is set in the very first scene. Here a young couple is being shown an apartment by a Realtor who, predictably, talks non-stop and regardless of what else is going on.

After putting a mummy in a local museum goes through the cat-scan, a metal object in it's brain reacts adversely to the procedure, thus freeing the spirit,or phantom if you will, of the mummy, Belphegor. Due to convenient circumstances, Lisa, who lives close to the museum finds herself possessed by the evil spirit. Soon enough she's stealing the museum's Egyptian treasures out from under their nose. Detective Verlac comes out of retirement to catch the supernatural thief.This is a serviceable enough, if you haven't seen any other incarnations of "Belphégor" before.

This movie reminds me of 'Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind ' and 'Garden State ' not because of content but because of the art style, the atmosphere and the overall ambience. The movie is based on the book of the same name but the movie has different characters. There is a scene in which someone says the line 'It is too late', which is the final line of the original book of the same name and then the scene changes into something else and the person says "it is too late" again. Then the person says "It is not too late, there is no time".

I 'm sure there is a documentary amongst the ruins of this Yawn-fest somewhere , given enough time maybe the whole film would come to life! I can't help but think it was the first time we had seen a Yawn-fest where we had so much time on our hands we just had to turn up and see what was going on. We couldn't believe we were here, and I think all of us were a little queasy that we were all watching a film that had been so carefully crafted to make one of our favourites.

This is a wonderful comedy short--one of Keaton's absolute best. Through a long series of silly mistakes, Buster is mistaken for a wanted killer. And, as a result, most of the film consists of him running from the cops and one detective in particular. While generally I am NOT a fan of movies with a lot of chase scenes, this one is the absolute best as far as pure athletic and acrobatic ability. I have seen some that have had wilder stunts, but none where the star was so limber and able to move with amazing grace.

This has to rate as one of the cheesiest of TV shows in a long time.Jose Ferrer played the title role in the first-ever Spanish language version, with an all Spanish cast including:José María Martínez-Sáenz, Miguel Ángel Monegal, Josefina García, Diego Fernández, and Luis González-Reyes, among many others.The show premiered on August 3, 2009, and its last episode was broadcast in early November of the same year, before its finale on December 4. The series continued for a few seasons after its debut on the SciFi Channel.

Jingofighter I agree with some of your comments , but I have to disagree on a couple of things . First off , I have not been in your country since I was 15 , when I got sick and I thought I had typhoid . Now I have had a cold for 2 months , the fever has gone down and I have no chills or other symptoms of a flu , so I think this may be something that is going on here . Second off I have never been exposed to this virus . I have not gotten sick from it either .

Imagine every stereotypical , overacted cliche from every movie and TV show set on the streets of Brooklyn between 1930 and 1939. The Bronx, the Lower East Side, Coney Island are all in the frame. They’re full of the usual suspects: drug addicts, street-level hustlers and the likes of “the Big Cheese.”

In this era of overkill, that’s nothing new for New York, either. But there was a new character in the 1930s called the Big Cheese – a character so iconic in Brooklyn, he became an icon for the entire city.

One of the movies i just DID N'T want to see . I got it in the sneak-preview , but it didn't seem to have a lot of merit , so i decided to watch it on my own . The storyline was so convoluted that i didn't have a clue about how any of the characters were working together . I did see that the movie had a decent plot . i mean , it seemed like the only plot it had was the storyline . But that's not the problem . the problem was the characterizations .

Insanely well crafted mini-series.I recall seeing most of it twice when shown on American Playhouse on PBS. Was heavily promoted at the time. I believe it might have been one of the very early mini-series showing on PBS outside of the Masterpiece Theater series.The full length production was shown I believe only once during its first broadcast. Was 6-8 hours total. This length was edited down somewhat to 6 hours. Cut some interesting, but slow scenes.I am very much hoping that the folks holding its current rights do follow through and restore a complete, not edited version to DVD.

When I first saw this show i thought to my self `` What is this ! ! ! ! ! ? I have to see an episode of this series ! ! ?'' and to be honest it was just a waste of time. Well I wasn't so sure about this show. I've never been that into anime series. I watched a bit of some of the ones that I watched. I've seen most of the new anime. But this was just the first one that I watched, for me it didn't hold any interest.

I am sick of series with young and clueless people, talking about their "problems" all the time, self centered, boring and absolutely annoying (Popular; Dawson's Creek; Beverly Hills; etc). "Hack" is a breath of fresh air, with a great actor (David Morse), a completely different plot, credible people with REAL problems (thank God !!) and very, very good histories. I just love it!! I hope "Hack" will go on for a long time, because it is a great television series for grown up people, for a change.

OK, so this is horror? I get horror - but I don't get horrific. Black & white is artistic but too much black is overkill.....enough said about the lighting. The story - a serial killer ....... lot's of these around. It's been done in the past and yes, it will continue to be done.....but I hope not. My question is , when will the audience tire of reliving this maddening dilemma? I guess the director thought he would do something different - portray killing children. Well that's been done before too.

Sacchi is the best Bogart impersonator ever... dry and droll as Sam Marlowe. The music from award winning composer George Duning [From Here To Eternity, Picnic, The World of Suzie Wong], the cinematography of perfect locations [including the famous Ambassador Hotel] are all right on target as famous tv director Robert Day [Kojak, Streets of San Francisco, The Avengers] guides the most endearing group of well-known character actors through a spoof of every dark detective film every made. See this if you loved all the old serious flicks and have a sense of humor... this one is a hoot.

I don't know which was worse, the viewer's made dopes of, or the stars in this movie who look like dopes. Am I to believe that this woman raised this child for seven years, and never noticed the child was a bit dark ? Am I to believe her mother, her father, and her husband never once said, hmmm this child looks a bit dark ? Am I to believe when the courts ordered the mother to view the adopted parents records, that Lisa Hartman had this wow look on her face, when she told her mother, Christopher is half black !

Also titled -- > The Magical Castle -- > This one is a stretch . Why bother ? Why create a new form of "magic"? Well , I didn't. I just tried to get away with it. It was a mistake , I know, but there you go. :p

So in the beginning I just wanted to write about a place that I visit every once and a while . And that's about it. And then after a while, I really got the idea to create a whole story out of a place . So I went ahead and started it.

TART is the worst movie I 've seen this year , and that includes both the Affleck/J.Lo bomb GIGLI and the one about Michael Jackson's 'Trial by Jury' that I saw last year . The worst of the three was GIGLI, while the second one is about Michael Jackson's "Trial" that I saw before I went to see "Trial." I don't see why anyone is surprised at how awful this movie was. If you haven't seen it, then you should, if it's any comfort.

I believe I share the same psychological outlook on the world with Kieslowski. He is Polish, I am Dutch, yet we share a synthetic mind: the world is not void of the metaphysical amidst total coincidence. Hardly ruled by man or perhaps by a poet-prime minister, so that as a social and cultural 'low pressure area', Poland could play the role it did in WWII, being critical yet Christian towards the Jews but often not less critical toward oneself. There are innocence and guilt in Kieslowski's world view, as the symbols in Catholicism: the White versus the Black Madonna.

Once upon a time, way back in the 1940's, there lived an actress named Veronica Lake. A beautiful, talented young woman who was once in high demand for many big-budget, Hollywood pictures. Fast Forward to the late 1960's, age, alcoholism, and all-around bad luck has tarnished everyones favorite actress. Now a hasbeen, Miss Lake decides the time has come to follow in the foot steps of her peers(? ), Joan Crawford, and Bette Davis, and fall back on good ol' reliable Horror. But Flesh Feast? Really?

This is by far probably the worst film Al Pacino could have starred in . The movie had no real substance at all to it. I can only assume that they took a quick look at the screenplay and realized they needed to get Pacino involved in the story and give him some kind of dramatic moment in the movie so that his acting career could come to the forefront at the time. In fact that was probably the only thing that was in the script that Pacino really loved. So that is what the director did with the film.

I 'd heard about this movie , but did n't see it until my daughter , who saw it on the movie theater , said it was the best one she had seen , and i liked the ending . I 'm going to get it , I 'll watch it tonight after dinner . I 'm not going to watch it before bed , that is if my daughter and i dont get caught up , lol . I 'm so sick and tired of people complaining about the movie and how it is not the best one they have seen.

The DVD version we bought had Sandra Bullock on the cover , but we 've discovered it was a picture she was using for a movie she was in. Sandra Bullock is Sandra Bullock. The picture is from the video for the song "The Man I Love" from her movie "Anchors Away" which you can watch by clicking here . And here are our favorite Sandra Bullock Moments from the DVD:

- She says "you know you should do a song with your new husband, you know what you gotta do for him to be so excited about your new guy."

Worst movie ever seen. Worst acting too. I cannot imagine a movie worse then this. Nothing to see. No acting at all.T hey (actors) should look for another job. I cant't understand who was stupid enough to actually put money into this movie.I'm sorry for Eric Roberts. Must be tough...I cannot imagine how HUUUGE his mortgage must be to justify taking the job!The ladies in the movie...perhaps they better stick to XXX.As for the LEADING MAN...what a lead! He better be put on a lead and stay there!

i was a huge fan of this series . Yesterday i watched it again on DVD . I was apprehensive at first as i was told by my friend that i should wait till its out on Blu ray then it will be ok . But after a while i got to watch it and really liked it. I loved the story , music , action and the comedy . It was so different from what ever other anime i have seen . It is also very much worth watching and is a good entertainment . And i got to say this is the most interesting anime series i have ever watched .

I just realized why the colors and sets in "Sakuran" were so flashy and gaudy, and just painful to look at. The story is about a high-class prostitute known as an oiran in Japanese. Their kimono were always flashier and gaudier than other kimono so that the oiran would stand out. But the director, Mika Ninagawa, had to make sure that the director stood out even more than the main character, or even the story. What Anna Tsuchiya did in the movie just gave me the creeps. You couldn't call it acting.

First I must say that I enjoyed the first Underworld movie. I was intrigued and curious to learn about Vampires and Lycans and so forth. In this last part (hopefully) of the series I just feel sorry for how pathetic the vampires are. At least in the first part you had the tight leather clothes... now vampires seem like besieged victims of bad pest control problem. They look and act like haughty white pasty humans. Some ideas were neat... the whole thing with human nobles was interesting. Pity the acting was abysmal. The slave thingy too was feasible.Other things just hit me as pathetic.

I 'm from Texas so I thought I knew big hair , but the female villain in this movie had her hair pulled up to her neck so you couldn't see half of her. It's really weird. And I like her character, she looks like she could kick butt, and she can kick butt in her hair. Yeah, it was definitely a movie. I'd say it was just the right length and whatnot, but I'll have to see it again to really get an opinion about it.

. . . and that is only if you like the sight of beautiful woman with nice, bouncy jugs running around the so called African jungle. So no problems there for most males out there.I watched it as one of those bundled together package. Forget about the plot which is essentially just a flimsy storyline to get our heroine flashing her jugs on screen at every opportunity possible. Just to give you a sense, our heroine swings from vine to vine and climb on top animals at every chance possible for no good reason at all just to let you see her jugs at all angles.

This really is by far the worst movie I 've ever seen in my whole life ( I 'm approaching 35). It's too long, there are just too many plot holes for a single viewer to have any sort of rational basis for any of it. I've seen worse, most of it, but this really isn't up to the same level. I'm going to have to find another movie to watch. I agree, the most annoying thing about this movie is that there's not a whole lot to the story line.

Froggie is upset that he never has a big party like all the other kids . Spanky and the gang have their own party to go to . Then, he gets upset that he can’t do what they want and he has to go to the party to get it all done . . The movie was pretty good , but it was really hard to sit through it all. There is so much plot, but I never felt like it was all connected to each other. That is why I would recommend for you to watch it as soon as possible so you get a good idea of what happens.

I'm surprised to read all the positive comments on this movie. Even my 4 and 6 year old were bored. The chipmunks are cute...but the storyline is overly obvious. Not recommended for young ones with the least sophisticated tastes.We did hear a few laughs from the audience while we were in attendance; but I wondered why.I don't admit to ever being a 'chipmunks' fan, but I expected to be entertained. It's not even an 'escapist' movie as far as I can tell. Simply a heavy handed view of 'success too young spoils'.

I watched 40 minutes and couldn't bear it any longer  the television went off and I returned to some light reading "Lobotomy for Beginners".It was hard to say what aspect of this production was most displeasing - dialogue made up entirely of sound-bytes or the acting by numbers.It was difficult to determine the period in which the drama was supposed to take place. There were throw-away references to Lord Nelson and slavery but Edmund, the cleric-to-be, played by Blake Ritson was the only actor who one could believe inhabited the early 19th century.

A straight-forward X File that shows that action is always the equal of intelligence. Rob Bowman's direction is crisp and sharp, the episode looks just as fresh now as it did almost a decade ago. David and Gillian both give fine performances and both seem to relish the lack of baggage - it's a standalone X File that even non-fans could happen upon and enjoy. Junior Brown gives both the leads a run for their money during his scene with them, he's so convincing that you could believe the crew drove to the middle of nowhere and knocked on the first door they came to.

If you haven't read Tolkien's masterpiece; prepare yourself for maybe the best movie experience ever! If you have however... After having read the books several times, over many years, I have come to love the characters and story, and feel I Know it intimately. I have my own personal vision of The Shire, Hobbiton and the character-gallery. Thus for me the movie was a disappointment. Why? It dictates the appearance of the characters (unavoidably), it changes events, it removes important storyline, it removes not-so-important storyline.

OK , I saw this film through Mystery Science Theater 3000 , but I did see the movie , so I know all that is important.I saw this film on Friday . I saw it because I was at a midnight movie with my friends and I sat through it because it was a really good movie. What I saw was really cool, but there are not a lot of reviews of the film yet. I think this is the best it is going to get. I had never seen the movie and when I saw it , i thought , that this movie was awesome.

Kubrick may have been the greatest director of all times. He may have made more classics than anyone else. He may have been a perfectionist. But man, was his first attempt ever bad!Kubrick had good reason to try to make this film dissappear from the map: it looks like an Ed Wood film. It has strange narration, cheap shots, bad dialogue, ominous music reminiscent of your 50s sci-fi/horror flick, and what looks like relatives of the cast of "Reefer Madness" going insane for no reason.Sure, you can see an undeveloped Kubrick in there.

`` A research scientist is experimenting with human DNA in an attempt to create the perfect human being . His goal: the perfect genetic structure, or "perfect man" that no one has ever seen. And as the story begins, he's just one man on the way to creating such a perfect man. His DNA is being processed by a robot. Meanwhile, a scientist who has been working alongside his research has gone missing. Somewhere in this seemingly idyllic scenario, there's a problem. The robot has been programmed to replicate a man's DNA but has not been programmed to make the man.

Chris Penn is hilarious as the all-time stoner brother of Jeff spicoli . This movie is great because it was done right. It was made with a sense of fun and it has a lot of fun characters and comedy. It’ll make you laugh and make you enjoy yourself. I was a huge Jeff spicoli fan and I think that this movie will do the same for you. It’d be awesome for all ages. The movie has it’s humor in the early part. It goes from that to comedy and then it becomes serious again in the middle.

I usually spend almost as much time writing my reviews as I do watching the film , but with Today I'm going to focus on the film as a whole and not a single specific scene. Since I'm writing this review in my own words I felt it would be useful if I did the same thing for today's film, so I'm doing it with spoilers for those who want to skip today. With a title like this, you can bet that the film will get one hell of a response, even if you don't want to waste your time with it.

This is the worst exercise in middle class pretentiousness yet to hit our television screens. I unfortunately did not see it when it was first shown but paid for the joy of watching six hours of excruciating drivel - and I'm still waiting for the laughs to arrive. I love Tasmin Greig having been a big fan of both Black Books and Green Wing and therefore know that she is capable of the very best of comedy parts. However, she played this part as well as she was able considering the lack of any decent comedy material provided.

Tediously long dreary cinematic waffle. I couldn't believe how bad this film was. I watched it merely because of the numerous people who gushed about it on this site. Was I watching the same film? The entire episode is one-dimensional. Nothing that happened in Garps' past affected his (or anyone else's) future and no-one was affected by their past. I think it was Socrates who said about plays that if a scene can be removed from a play without having any effect, then it shouldn't be there.

This movie was bad on so many levels . The writing was horrible so even the best actors could not deliver . The story line was weak . The characters were not realistic . The acting was so bad that even I forgot some of them were actors .The storyline was so weak that it was boring and did not have any impact on the storyline . The story was so dull that it ruined the entire movie .The movie had so many problems that I cannot even describe what it was . There was too many flaws that made the movie to be an awful movie .

Nurse Charlotte Beale(the lovely Rosie Holotik)has arrived to Dr. Stephens' clinic for the insane prepared for a new job. What she doesn't expect is to find another supposed doctor in his position after Stephens is attacked by axe-wielding maniacal "judge" Oliver W Cameron(..in a running gag, anytime he confronts a situation out of his control, he retreats to repeating his name). That doctor is Geraldine Masters(Annabelle Weenick)who isn't sure about whether Beale is a proper fit for their establishment.

My mom and I, rented this movie. I mean, we love those type of Sci-Fi flicks, whether they be big Hollywood flicks or Indy flicks.But oh, we were fooled!! Two journalists are investigating a UFO abduction in a small city in Texas. Halfway through, all the sudden things get all christain on us. My mom and I believe in god and Jesus and the Devil, but the way this movie was preaching it, made it annoying. All I really have to say, is that we are Christian, but even we like to have fun.

This was one of the slowest movies I have ever had the displeasure of sitting through. After the introduction where we are given the backstory of "something" killing a couple people in a farm house, We are introduced to a white looser family that is moving to a farm - AND NOTHING HAPPENS for a looooong time. Then they meet this drifter who helps out on the farm AND NOTHING HAPPENS again for a very long time. Then FINALLY the girl of the family has some plotergeist stuff happens. Then some more happens, the drifter guy goes nuts and the movie ends.

Badly shot, badly edited, clumsy dialogue, flat characters, unsuccessful adaption of a novel. It doesn't really get much worse. Decent acting and good popcorn saved me for this hour and a half - felt more like three hours - of boredom. Occasional good one-liners.David is a dim-witted young man, who has never recovered from losing his brother at an early age. He puts his faith in a Chinese philosophy mumbo jumbo video, although that doesn't seem to help him much in real life. David is a member of a debt-collectors gang, where every member has an IQ below sea level.

It is by far the most definitive film on the police force which I have seen . Although not directed by a famous director it does the job . It gives a fair impression of the police work as I had seen it on television . It does not gloss over it as some of the earlier films have done . There are a few slight errors that do affect the overall picture . Some of the errors are minor while some make the movie look rather amateur . Overall it is a very interesting film which does not look like it was made by a film-maker who is looking to please the audience .

This is what Disney Channel shows to kids who are dumber than posts. It suits them well. It's not funny, the acting is the worst I've seen in many years, there are more stereotypes than there are actors, and everything about this show makes you groan and roll your eyes. Wanna know why? Not only is this show a waste of airtime, the lead "actress" Selena Gomez looks like a pig. Jake T. Austin's character needs some Ritalin. David Henrie's character needs to visit a strip club and get wasted.

I'm sorry to see that it has been rated that low by many people. The series started off very good and after the first season it wasn't that good.People tend to forget the beginning of something and only look at the end. This is not good to do, you should look at the total, not the end result. It is sad that a lot of the "usual" characters died but, damn, we had a lot of nice NEW characters.Please do not attach yourself to a few characters but attach yourself to the series, the plot.

Since I'd bought the DVD, I watched as much of this as I did out of a sense of obligation to my wallet.The plot has Kirk Douglas as a successful first novelist who hired Laraine Day as a secretary, falls in love, and marries her. Complications ensue.Douglas is usually thought of as an intense actor, given to heavily dramatic roles, sometimes hero, sometimes rat. He's not bad in this thoroughly comic part. The problem is that the part isn't particularly comic and neither is anything else.The plot rambles on.

I do not find this show at all funny . I actually think it is much worse than any of the others. It's more of a soap opera , than an animated cartoon . I think this show may have been more entertaining when it was in full cartoon form, not as it is currently , and it just does not make sense now . The only reason I did like the first few episodes is that I thought that the animation was excellent (as it was in all of the previous shows) and the music was wonderful .

I just watched the DVD of this award winning film . One Life Stand is a stark drama that through the power of its film language, delivers an extraordinary and powerful message to young people. The film, in a word, mesmerized me. It is so engrossing and powerful it will not leave you indifferent to the main characters and the message of the film. It’s a must watch for any film lover who has a love and passion for words. In my opinion this is one of the best documentary films that I have seen in years.

I saw this movie on TV and loved it ! I am a real disaster film fan , and this one is in my Top 5 films! I saw it about 5 times and i got it for free from my sister and I love it. You can also watch it on Netflix! This film was so good . It was not just one or two things , it had many themes and it gave you a good story! A great film . I really enjoyed it and the movie is really funny. This movie was really good . I would recommend anyone to watch it!

Set in Hungary in November 1956 , this is the story of a group of foreign nationals who were trying to escape from Nazi-occupied Budapest. It is set before World War II (1940-1945), the Cold War and the end of Communism in Eastern Europe. It features the escape of a Hungarian Jewish doctor, a young German man, and a young Swiss woman, who all try to escape from Nazi-occupied Budapest. The book also covers the experiences of the young German man's father, an elderly Jewish family, the escape of two Hungarian gypsies, and the experiences of a Hungarian Jewish refugee in London in the mid-1970s.

I won't waste your time by describing the plot for this, the other reviewer already did this quite well. I will however give you my opinion of this movie. This movie is basically anti japanese propoganda. The japanese are portrayed as incredably evil b**tards who have respect for nothing, as well as having very poor martial arts skills (groups of japanese men get there asses kicked by single women on more than one occasion.) The fact that the japanese fighters lose almost every (if not every) fight in the movie kind of takes away the suspense.

Fortunately, I haven't seen this film in a movie, big screen, just on a small screen on video. I doubt that I would have been able to sit through the film in a cinema and watch all the violence present in the film. After watching the first 30 minutes, I became both disappointed and curious.Disappointed because of the hard to follow story line, the hardly understandable screens, the huge amount of aggression - I still don't know why I had been shown the Daesu (main character) pulling out raw the teeth of another person, his beastliness on women, him cutting out his tongue.

This film has its detractors , and Courtney 's fey dresser may offend some folks ( who , frankly , don't know what Courtney is talking about ) But it's still a good flick , one that you have to sit through , in order to really appreciate what it was all about . There's alot about this movie that makes no sense, but the ending does , and makes sense, to me . And as for all that other crap , it isn't worth much anyway. It's really a fun little flick , you'll enjoy it , and there's really nothing to get too mad about.

Hehehe . This was one of the best funny road movies ever ! I laughed so I fell out of my seat and fell on the ground. The movie is absolutely worth watching. This film was made from the beginning to the end of the 1980s. This is one of those films that should be available on DVD. I don't have any problems with the plot, though. It's not one of those movies that you have to be bored out of your mind watching, but I would have liked it to be a lot more coherent and well made.

Thank God I have fast-forward . I think this is a movie about a guy who rises and falls . It’s not about the life of a young, idealistic boy. But, I can’t help but wonder what it might be like for his friends, family and the people with whom he grew up. I’ve always thought that the world was a bit unfair, but now I understand it a bit. That is, it was not intended that everyone would be ‘kind’ to one another, no matter how much they deserved it.

This was a modern TV classic ! The story goes like this , Bob has a girlfriend named Alicia . When he tries to get her , she leaves him and she does not tell anyone about their relationship . She says that she is going to a club . But the guy who works there says that she did not go to a club and she was not alone ! The guy then tells Bob that he has to find the person that she was talking about and he will do it if he can find her . Bob comes to his boss , and tell him that she is missing and he has to find her .

This is my favourite film and I think it is perfect. Unlike virtually any other film I can name, I never watch this film and think it would have been better if they'd changed this or that or whatever. Is this the definition of a work of art? I think so. Every brushstroke in Mishima is perfect and it all flows from the Schrader's script. I've always sort of liked Paul Schrader's work (you can't argue with Taxi Driver and Light Sleeper is an amazing film), but while his writing often seems to border on the bombastic, his directing style is usually non-existent.

`` Out to Sea '' is a fun movie starring that wonderful duo of Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau . The story follows a couple (Lemoine and Matthau) and their kids who are on vacation in Hawaii, but end up in some pretty big trouble! In the movie, it's a couple who get into a big boat and head into the big ocean. While out there, they get into a bit of trouble and they end up being caught. This is a fun movie and I highly recommend you check it out.

Very poor script and acting . I was very surprised that the director was able to convince his cast with just a handful of actors . This movie was a huge disappointment. 3 of 3 people found this review helpful. ! Great movie

10/30/15

Overall

Performance

Story

"Amazing performance by all the actors." This is a movie that should be seen by anybody who loves to see a well written movie. The story is a good one, and the acting is very good. If you are a horror fan, this movie is worth seeing. 1 of 1 people found this review helpful.

The movie was a pleasure to watch if you are a fan of the Stooges. The story is told from the point of view of Moe Howard and his relationships with his brothers Shemp and Jerome (Curly) Howard, also the life long friendship with Larry Fine. The movie deals mostly with the off camera high points and pit falls of the Stooges multi decade career. The casting director and makeup artist did a fair job of finding actors who resembled the famous ensemble. The actor who plays "Curly" Howard did a fine job of portraying the on camera antics of the most beloved Stooge.

Of course I am going to think it was a great movie. I recognized several people I didn't see during filming also. I was the one playing the guard about an hour into the movie in the death row exercise yard asking for a light for a cigarette. I also changed this one scene. They had originally had it set to go into the rec yard and straighten out the inmate and turn him around and walk him out. The Director said "It is taking to long, what would you do Gower."

I saw this film at the tender age of 18 with a group of friends . Its reputation had preceded it to the big screen and I hadnt seen any of the actual scenes, so when we heard the title I was intrigued. After watching the story I thought it might be a film I would like to see again. So I watched it a few days later. I think I liked it! It was very well written with a very good plot. The film starts with a couple in love and then goes on to tell you about their relationship and marriage.

So I caught this one afternoon as "What Lies Above" and actually watched it because the beginning was somewhat promising. The heroine, Diana Pennington, is a mountain climbing expert...but that doesn't help her when her fiancé Brian gets hurt on a climb. When she goes off to get help and returns, he disappears from the mountain, never to be seen again.Two years later, Diana is still a climber...but she won't go near Snowman's Pass. That is, until Curt Seaver appears and tells her that he can find the body of her lost fiancé with a new satellite program.

I think Hollywood should seriously consider NEVER doing another `` Biblical '' film again , if Noah 's Ark is ever made available for the average person , it would be the ultimate disaster. As I've mentioned before I've read quite a lot about how movies make money in the movies business. The way it works in the old days is that the studios bought out the rights to the story for a given period of time to the producers. That's why most of the time you hear about a film like the Bible having a big box office hit.

Set in Hungary in November 1956, this is the story of a group of foreign nationals who were trying to leave the country at the time of the Uprising.Once the airport is closed, the titular journey begins on a bus taking them to Austria. As would be obvious, they are stopped on their way which is where they come up against the almost faultless Yul Brynner whose military power as a Red Army Major was marked with loneliness, his internal struggle between right and wrong, his search for the truth and his need to feel emotions for other human beings.

This is a very, very odd film...one that is so odd it's best you just see it for yourself. The film begins with a jaded professor haranguing his class because the students have the audacity to not be as incredibly brilliant as he is! You can tell very quickly that this man is a total cynic--finding the value in practically nothing but sticking to his own inner sense of self-importance. Additionally, he seems tired and bored with the monotony of life.Later in the film, he walks into a bank robbery and manages to annoy the robbers so much that one of them shoots him in the head.

Despite having an absolutely horrid script (more about that later), this film is still vaguely watchable just because it stars two excellent actors, Barbara Stanwyck and Henry Fonda. Aside from one or two REAL stinkers, I'd probably watch just about anything with them in the film, as I am a huge fan of Hollywood's golden age of the 1930s and 40s. However, no matter how much I love their films, I just can't recommend this film.The movie begins with Fonda and Stanwyck on vacation at some ski resort.

While this movie did have a few scary moments (great use of music and film angles to build suspense), it's obvious director Ethan Wiley and scriptwriter Ellary Eddy didn't waste any time researching their subject matter; which also makes me question their claim that the exorcism scenes were overseen by a genuine Catholic bishop.Amongst the many inconsistencies: * Jacob the Roman Catholic priest, when we first meet him outside the church, is wearing an academic robe over his clericals rather than the typical alb, chasuble or surplice. Academic robes are commonly worn by Protestant ministers in liturgical denominations, not Roman Catholic priests.

Is it possible for a movie to get any worse than this ? There 's a bunch of apes wandering around, but you don't notice them at all. You have to zoom in to pick out their faces. Then zoom out again to zoom in further, and zoom out even further, to get some kind of picture of them. And you're only allowed to zoom out as much as a pixel. I mean, they're so big, and there are so many of them! But they're still not that big and all of a sudden you don't notice the apes anymore.

I would n't recommend this to anyone , except cinema-goers who like to laugh at a film , not with their faces. I dont know any of the writers , but i like to know what is happening. I never liked this film , but if you have to see a comedy , this is good . I dont know what a good film it is . The story is interesting but you just get confused , and forget about the jokes. The main problem is it was a remake of a movie, with the same actors . I like that this film has some funny parts .

This movie strayed too far from Straub 's novel for me to enjoy . Barely made it to the middle of its first hour. It was very predictable and not as entertaining as I might have hoped. If I had to choose one of Straub 's books to watch at the beginning of the film, I'd choose 'The Secret History of the Titanic' , because that's really the point of it all and it would have been the perfect start to the story. So sorry to say that. In conclusion, I'm sorry for the low rating - it wasn't meant to be and it wasn't enjoyable.

When I stepped into the theater , I thought this was going to be a great movie . And I thought it would have an amazing storyline . I was wrong . When I got home , I realized that this was the second worst movie I have ever seen ! And the best part is , it was my fault. If I had known , I would have made a movie about this. If I could do it again , I would do a lot better. There were a lot of very good aspects to this movie . There is a lot of heart in this movie.

Early talkie feature based on a popular stage play . A murder has been committed and a bunch of people from various backgrounds come together to find a body and to find out who did it . The show is based on a play in which a bunch of actors came together to come up with ideas and a few scenes for the show . The show has to be set in London in the mid 1980's . It has to be very realistic so that no one will find it to be a spoof . The concept is to get people to the scene where the murder has happened to find the killer .

This film is all right, fairly silly and to be taken lightly. But what I can't stand are the numerous heroes and that boy's ILLEGALY SENTIMENTAL comment near the end: "look, they all look the same". Isn't that by far passing the good taste standards? I thought it was revolting, as were the heroic, unselfish acts by some of the people in this film. I'm not saying it won't happen like that, but zooming in on all the bravery like that makes my stomach churn.

Mel Welles, you might remember him as Mr. Mushnick in Roger Corman's Little Shop of Horrors, directs this somewhat interesting yet wholly twisted tale of Dr. Frankenstein's daughter carrying on her father's work after his death and creating a creature not for its intellectual ability or its likelihood to be/do good but rather for its sex appeal. You see, Tania Frankenstein, though a doctor and scientist in her own right, is concerned with really nothing more than satiating her primal desires for the stable boy and making some super sex slave by using his body with the excellent brain of a man she does not love.

I watched this movie with big expectations . The blurb on the back indicated that this was going to be quite the roller coaster ride . After the first 15 or so minutes I didn't care whether or not it worked as I've seen the trailers for it all before . I was still a little worried . After about the second 30 minutes of the first part I knew that the plot was getting a little far fetched and the ending was going to leave many people scratching their heads wondering what happened . I can see what the author meant when he said that the ending was meant to be confusing .

This is another of Robert Altman's underrated films(let's be honest, the only movie he's made that really didn't work was Ready to Wear), and Sandy Dennis gives a spellbinding performance in it.She is far better here than she was in "The Out of Towners". The material, I will admit, is beneath the great director Altman and the extraordinary actress Dennis, but that hardly matters anyway.As long as there allowed to do their thing and do it well, just about any story will do.

This one is a hilarious diamond in the rough. The acting and plot aren't that impressive, but the lines just keep on coming. This catches a lot of flack because it seems at first glance like, well, a bad movie, but it's so kooky that you can't help but be amused. The spastic lightening quick dialog and quirky characters keep it going... I was especially fond of Sharon, the Canuck on Shrooms eh? However, the one that really stole the show was Richard's little brother Andrew (Ira Heiden), his high pitched whining was somehow endearing.

That 's how I was when I walked ( staggered ) out of this `` film '' . I could have sworn I was in control . . . I didn't know it . . . I only knew . . . . I was in no way in control . . . . And now I am in control of . . . . . And I can say I'm the one who started it all . . . . . All of this is about me . . . . . I'm the one who has gone on . . . And that makes the difference .

This movie was included in the Six Wives of Henry VIII BBC miniseries DVD. I loved those six movies. They were well-acted, well-scripted, and historically accurate. I did actually read Gregory's book and liked it well enough despite it's HUGE historical inaccuracies (I mean the whole fake homosexual angle with George Boleyn in particular), but this movie didn't even mention that. That angle was one of the pivotal points of the book. Above all this movie just leaves me asking "WHY?" Why do we see, as someone else aptly put, "The Real World: Tudor England"?

Very good film. Very good documentary.Very good to see those vermin detectives humiliated and found out as the bigoted, narcissistic, heartless swines their one eyed parents, community and environment raised them as.I tip my lid to Pat McGuinness. Can we get this decent human being on some kind of 911 commission or investigation? We need his integrity, endurance, intelligence, clarity and spirit fighting the rigged game that is world politics and big business.All the animals come out at night - whores, skunk pussies, buggers, queens, fairies, dopers, junkies, sick, venal.

It is not only difficult to comment separately on the three parts of Kieslowski's trilogy, it seems obvious that the filmmaker wants us to do just the opposite: view them in order, Blue, White, and Red, and consider them together as one complete work. It is true they are distinct stories with distinct themes: liberty, equality, fraternity, and each them is developed with unique applications of intrigue and artistry. They are each well worth seeing independently, but I believe they are best seen as one work.

Cheezy ? Yep . Poorly filmed ? You betcha . Zero budget ? They proudly claim it on their posters . I hope I can do the same . I've seen a lot of commercials and films on this very site . You think you know what you are about ? Not much to go on . A few of the characters are clearly not from this area , but I can't help thinking the guy who wrote this ad was hired by a local cable TV company , who has no idea . "I've got it right here" said the man at the front desk .

I was rather disappointed. The first Tetsuo made me an INSTANT Tsukamoto fan, from the first 5 mins of the film. It was fresh, innovative, and just.....different. I rather enjoy having a movie be in your face and push all those "make you squirm" buttons. Tetsuo did just that where for me, few movies can.For those of us who enjoy getting a breath of fresh air, those that appreciate those offbeat styles used that make indie films so worthwhile, Testuo II will likely be a disspointment.

This movie was a sicky sweet cutesy romantic comedy , just the kind of movie I usually dislike but this movie had a heart of gold . It’s about the first love of the world and it shows you the type of relationship a person will go through when they finally find someone and get married. I’ll be honest that I was a bit skeptical of this movie but I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked this one. It’s the type of movie that people will actually want to watch with their wife because of the romantic story it shares.

I saw this title again on Shemaroo . I also asked my nephew who was 17 to watch the same movie for the first time and tell me how he liked it. The movie is "Saving Private Ryan". He told me what he thought. I have never seen this movie so I am not sure if that counts as a first time, but I am sure glad he said so. It was worth the viewing for sure. This was definitely the movie that put me in the right mindset to learn how to drive and I will always be grateful that I got my first lesson.

I watched this movie on TCM last night , all excited expectation , having last seen it ( twice ) and I found I had a lot to learn. It did not seem to have anything new , it was just the same old story line of a beautiful young woman who wants a new car , with nothing to lose. However , I did find something that I had to say. There are two things that make me want to watch more movies . First of all , they are two of the best things to ever happen to me .

The final entry in the On The Buses trilogy sees the usual wasters go about their business in Wales. I feel sure the franchise could have continued, but Harold Pinter complained that the screenplays made him look bad in comparison, and so no more were made. It's actually less than two minutes before we get our first dollop of sexism - a woman running for the bus finds her breasts fall out of her dress for no reason whatsoever. Still, it does at least make Stan (Reg Varney) laugh - but then what doesn't?

Pure schlock from beginning to end . The average 12 year old might find that it has an interesting take on a subject matter they might have seen in movies. This is what the average teen would write if they saw a movie they liked. In fact, it is almost too much. So, it has to be something we don't understand, or we would not be writing it. These are the lines that should be in every script of a horror movie or a comedy, but they rarely make it in movies.

Pete 's Meteor . I seen this referred to as `` authentic '' and a `` gem . '' I have my doubts as to the veracity of any of these . I would be interested in hearing how people came to their conclusions . I have a question . What is the most popular version of the game? I haven't been able to track down any information on it . In terms of price, I'm not a major fan of the game . Some of my friends are . Not a huge fan . I have no intention of buying it .

Genius or utter madness? That depends on your interpretation of this film. I responded to it on the level of a self-aware "cop-movie parody", and I sincerely hope that was the intention as I don't see anyone taking it seriously! :-D Paul Rudd for one seems to be chewing up the scenery and really getting into the spirit of things! Is this film supposed to mark a departure for Rudd from his core background in the comedy genre? Some kind of insane attempt to reinvent him as a hard-boiled action star? I think not!

I saw this last week during Bruce Campbell's book tour. I thought it was amazing. Almost everything I would expect from a Bruce Campbell sci-fi movie. Its campy and very funny. Ted Raimi was also hilarious and extremely goofy. The plot is wacky, an American business man goes to Bulgaria and is killed. Stacy Keach plays a mad scientist who saves/brings Bruce Campbell back to life by implanting half of the brain of an ex-KGB turned cabbie. Bruce Campbell spends the rest of the film trying to avenge his death and has many internal arguments between himself and the KGB agent.

I am sorry to rain on everybody's parade. Just a little background about me: I like and know a lot about Asian cinema, especially Japanese, Chinese and Indian. Admittedly I am a novice when it comes to South-Korean cinema but, if this is the best of the best, sorry. I just want you to know that I am not at all narrow-minded when it comes to appreciating foreign movies and I do not fit the stereotype of the "dumb American" . . . well, not perfectly.I cannot believe the high praise this piece of nothing is bestowed upon.

Okay , sure , this movie is a bit on the hokey side . It 's difficult to take characters seriously in the first place . It takes some time before I start to warm to them . But what it does start to pick up from the start is that these characters are not very interesting characters . There is nothing new about them . You already knew them and their background . They are just plain annoying . They are not the main characters and not really interesting . They can 't even get through the first act . They are just irritating .

Based on a fairly bland `` best seller , '' this film - like most other Lifetime movies - played a lot like a big budget B-level action/thriller for the majority of its run. The plot itself is actually fairly light, with little to no dialogue. However, if you want the full movie, then it may well be worth picking up. I found it to be very boring, which isn't a surprise as you would think it is a Lifetime movie, and that it would be a little more interesting and watchable.

Jack Lemmon was one of the finest actors that had ever graced the screen. He could effortlessly switch from dramatic roles to comedic with ease, making most of his peers green with envy. While his performance in "Save The Tiger" is Oscar-worthy, I feel it was given to him as he had missed out on his other opportunities to win the award due to other, better roles that had preceded this current one.This is also one of those pretentious movies that comes out to basically showcase the talent of the cast, or in this case, one particular member.

This is one of those movies the critics really missed the mark on. This movie is practically McHale's Navy for the 90s or Police Academy at sea. Grammer proves he can play roles other than Frasier as he outwits and outfoxes the Navy in order to get his own sub. Rob Schneider is as wormy as usual, the same in every role he plays, and Lauren Holly is the local sexpot albeit with a brain. Ken Hudson Campbell is as funny as usual with almost every line a catch phrase. The movie has a wonderful intelligent plot and a non-predictable script that still surprises me every time I watch it.

For a really wonderful movie , you could also try seeing the movie about Saint Francis of Assisi - good choice for this holiday season, don't you think? Here's why:

The film is a lovely story of faith in the goodness of humanity, and the goodness of Jesus Christ. If the story was based on a true incident, it would be the story of a young man who made a mistake that caused great pain and loss to his family. And it would probably be the most human and compassionate film of the year, because of how it portrays Jesus' compassion towards the poor.

You know I only watched 15 minutes of this film, so I can't really describe how great it is. I mean the concept alone is so original and intriguing it just did not let me go. Then there is the mass of academy award winning people involved here plus the academy award nominated director. YOU JUST CAN'T miss. I mean imagine it is the middle of the night and you're not sleepy yet. This film comes on. You watch it and are shocked. It is so brilliant, so original it is so GREAT.

I must admit I wasn't expecting much on this movie. I was surprised I truly enjoyed it as much as I did. The script wasn't oscar material, but it wasn't horrible either. The acting was great by Mark Wahlberg. Jennifer Aniston had a great supporting role, and looked lovely as ever. What made this movie for me was the music. If you do not like 80's glam metal or hair bands, then you probably wont like this movie. Its all about being a rockstar. Some cliche's were present, but didn't bring down the movie at all.

The Governess was, by far, a very pitiful film. I do not use this word loosely, as it honestly was a poor excuse for a movie. I finished watching this feature with only one word on my mind  "why"? Honestly, you could use this question at the end of every scene of this film and it would seem like it fit. There were so many inconsistencies that lead to a lack of development (both in the story and in the characters) which ultimately lead to a very confusing film with actors walking through the motions instead of giving any explanation.

Because I would have never ever seen this movie through to the end . Although there are some , but I think the film is a little weak in places . The film is just not enough for me . I think it's not worth to buy or rent . There are some good songs . The film needs a bit of direction to make more sense . There is really something for everyone . This is for all fans of films like " The Godfather " , " King's Speech ". It should be in the collection of fans . I recommend this movie !

I 'm sorry but I just honestly can not see why anyone would actually like this . It 's stereotypical of this country to do this sort of thing. It 's supposed to be for people that can 't get out of a bad relationship and get out of a bad place, not for those of us that 're already out of a relationship. I 'd love to see this movie and get it on the big screen. But I 'm pretty sure it would not have the same response as it would have when it 's released. It 's hard to see the point.

I went out of my way to get this film, and was fortunate to get it on VHS. Being a big Gloria Grahame fan, it was an excellent addition to my collection. Other than that, I really cannot say a lot to recommend this picture. The plot is predictable (and weak) and the only interesting aspect of the film is watching Sterling Hayden get into deeper trouble with his own department. Ms. Grahame is always fun to watch (if you like her, as I do), but the dubbing of her singing hurts this picture a lot.

This movie is not just good , its amazing . Besides providing us with good performances , original plot , storyline and original theme this is a real masterpiece . The film is well written , the director of this movie was also good . I have a problem with this movie , it's not even close to what they had in mind , so i'm wondering if it is worth to watch . My friend has never watched this movie , but he told me the plot to it and it's pretty interesting. The story is pretty interesting. I'm just wondering how much this movie is worth ?

"Hey, I didn't order no cab!" "Yeah, well you got one..." What can I say about Hack...what a man among men. He was a heartened ex-cop turned cab driver with a heart of gold. If you were able to (and fortunately for America's TV viewers...one person per week was) penetrate the cold, hard surface of Hack's exterior, you got to see a caring man devoted to vigilante justice. The show was superb, I laughed, I cried, I smiled...all in the same episode.

As much as I love the story of David Copperfield, I cannot claim to have enjoyed this movie. It was probably the second worst movie I have ever seen. One problem I see is that the magnitude of the novel asks for a miniseries of several hours, rather than a regular movie. It is just impossible to capture a significant amount of the events that take place in the story in two hours. I dis not enjoy the brooding flashback format. It was disjointed and would be impossible for someone who did not already know the story to fully grasp.

You know , I really hate IMDb 's censor system , since my entire review is almost gone if you don't agree with their decision. I don't know why these people are saying this, but IMDb just censor the content that they don't agree with. I'm sorry if i offended them, but it really doesn't bother me , because they make money, and I can't give them anything to give up their money . This is an amazing movie! I was going through the IMDb listings, and the last movie I saw was this one, and I saw it again about a year ago!

Low-budget murder mystery about a Public Defender trying to clear his client of a murder the man had been convicted of for killing his pregnant girlfriend

A high-budget murder mystery movie is being produced in Hollywood by a small team of young writers/actors in the hope that it will help them make it to the big time. The project is called “Grave of the Fireflies” and it was created by a small team of talented writers, directors, and producers with very specific ambitions for the film. This blog will cover the project and the film itself.

(The beginning might be a spoiler...)"The Eye 2" is the sequel to "The Eye". It's about a pregnant woman who is able to see ghosts and spirits after an incident happened to her.The sound effects scared the hell out of me though momentarily but that's the only scary thing. Some of the scenes from the prequel are comparatively similar and repeated so the chilling effects certainly have chilled. "The Eye" has quite a frightening and indelible impression whereas "The Eye 2" is a forgettable horror-cum-drama film. Omit watching this.

One of the worst films I have ever seen! After watching it i walk out like, what happened? I am confused to this day, can someone explain that movie to me please? both the acting and picture quality are so bad ,you'll think you're watching someone's school project made with a home camcorder. First,I can not believe that how some people could give 10 star to this movie.Because,.it's unbelievably bad movie! This movie isn't scary at all! There is even no Typical horror clichés,too. The plot and acting of This movie was terrible.

After the across-the-board success of MY NAME IS BARBRA, CBS television permitted Barbra to create an even more elaborate follow-up as her second special. Streisand wisely knew, in order to follow in the ground-breaking success of MY NAME IS BARBRA, that her second special would indeed need to raise the bar even further in inventiveness and spectacle. Not surprisingly, she succeeded once again. Even more impressively, Streisand managed to mount this large production without sacrificing the intimacy and vision of MY NAME IS BARBRA.Once again, the special is divided into three distinct Acts.

This movie is simply bad. First of all the story is just weird and it's not good written. It leaves you with questions when you're finished. Sometimes that's OK, but not in this case.The acting is nothing to write home about. The adults does a OK job, but the kids, taken in consideration they are kids, does not a good job. I thought the lead role, Ian Costello as Mickey, was worst. Well, to be honest I'm not sure that was the lead role. Never quite figured who this movie was about.

This movie has got to be the biggest disappointment I 've ever experienced with a film . The acting is so weak that it was almost like the film was directed by a child . I could just about see what the characters were thinking , and they were really just walking the line of the story . I was hoping that there was a story going on, but it was very boring . I was also hoping that the film was going to be more of a mystery than what it was , but I think that this film is more about how people treat each other than anything else .

While watching BLACKWATER VALLEY EXORCISM, I encountered scenarios and dialog so incredibly bad that I was convinced that this was supposed to be a comedy.
