A few choice bits of dialog worthy of a belly laugh: "I ate a rabbit." "I TOLD you she was possessed!" "Are you telling me the Devil is in my daughter?! "There are many, many more, but you must discover these for yourself - if you dare.The story goes off into all sorts of directions and things happen that probably shouldn't and everyone seems to be a perv or psycho of some sort (even the Priest).

I really tried to like `` Saw . '' The story was good , and I admire the breakneck pace it set the pace with . But it had some serious flaws . Not that I didn't enjoy watching it . I will admit . It was more a matter of the pacing being too fast , too slow , or the story being too repetitive . It wasn't all that good . Still , it was interesting , and made me think , what if . . ? I found myself wanting to finish this series , as it kept on getting better .

I've been studying Brazilian cinema since 2004, when I stumbled onto "Cidade de Deus / City of God". Let me tell you something, this movie is probably as good or BETTER than "City of God".The acting, cinematography and music supervision make this movie a unique experience. I have not been to Brazil yet, but this movie presents the harsh reality that is beset before the citizens of São Paulo.I recommend this movie if you enjoy good cinema. This movie is disturbing and you may feel a bit despondent after watching it.Something you want to watch, but nothing you want to go to sleep on.

I first saw this film in 1980 and it touched a cord which reminded me of a more innocent time. The opening narrative, music and paintings by Norman Rockwell set the tone for me. You either love the movie or hate it. Jan Michael Vincent was at his all time best and portrayed Cpl Marion Hedgepeth in a most innocent and touching way. This movie is at the top of my all time favorites, a shame it isn't available on DVD or VHS anymore. The ending was also wonderful. John Hancock did a marvelous job of capturing the essence of the time.

This was pretty bad - from bad acting , bad technical details , bad camera shots , and bad audio , it's not worth it

Sebastian - 07.11.2018

I just love everything about this film... I had a great time filming it. I had fun with the script.... I really think it's a great film and will watch it again. I loved the soundtrack, and the way the cinematography worked with it... it just made me go "Oh yeah... this is what we wanted to do and it's good to hear it again".

I never fell asleep during a movie . Never . This movie did the impossible.While many people claim the superiority of this film , it should be mentioned that if you don’t want to see any violence or nudity it is best to turn it off as there is a scene where a woman takes a shower . All I can say is “How the hell can you watch this?”

And it’s probably a good time to be thinking . “What would I do?” And . . . what would you do? You can’t be all things to all people.

One of the best 'guy' movies I've ever seen has to be the Wind and the Lion. Gad, the scenes...Raisouli's bandits swarm over the wall... A staid British gentleman calmly gets up from tea with Candice Bergen and drops three of them with a Webley revolver in his coat. A whisper from the ghost of Empire... Lest we forget! Lest we forget!U.S. Marines coming ashore from the long, long gone _Brooklyn_. They were carrying Krags, it should have been Lees, but, oh wow.

Not good . Mostly because you do n't give a damn about what happens to all these people . Some will get sick and some will be hurt by all of this . . . you can't expect people to be fair and honest when they're not even listening to you . . You might as well give it up . . . the government is trying to put you out of business . . . I don't care what happens to me . but if you can't deal with my problems, then what the hell are you good for?

The positives : It 's shot pretty well . Has some interesting peripheral characters . Likable main character ( albeit at times a bit stiff ) . A very entertaining film . But the negatives : The main female character is quite stiff in most of her interactions, especially towards the beginning . I felt like I was reading a novel . At one point I felt like she wasn't as good as the male characters , but the male characters are quite amusing . The negatives : The script doesn't do the book justice . But I think that it is pretty well written and the movie has a lot of potential .

There seems to have been some money behind this film , but it would be impossible to imagine a film like this coming out this year . the picture has a great story , great acting , and good direction . the plot is well thought out and has a good balance between action and drama . the ending is well done . it is very hard for an action film to pull off the action and still have a good story , but in this case there is really no question about which direction you should go in . the story , like most of this kind , revolves around two brothers .

I very much enjoyed this movie and I think most fans of Lauren Ambrose will too. Her character is much softer than her role in Six Feet Under and all of the performances are strong. I especially enjoyed the way the role of Emily, a mentally challenged savant, was handled. Despite some other misinformed user reviews the role was performed accurately and without cliché by the actress, Taylor Roberts. Also a standout was Fran Kranz, whose natural ease well complemented the more season veteran actors. Although the direction hit a snag here or there it seemed the only problems were with an underdeveloped script.

I honestly do n't know what words IMDB will allow me to use in this review , as a result, I hope it's an open discussion . That said, here's a brief synopsis on the story . The story is about a group of college students that are having a little bit of fun in an old school setting. The movie focuses on four of the students . They have a group of friends with them in this classic school setting . This group of friends form a band , and it's not just a bunch of freshmen .

A film , first and foremost , should be good storytelling . It should be entertaining - and entertaining does not necessarily require being good - but it should make you smile or laugh or giggle or cringe or cry or want to throw things and/or hug or do whatever else you can in order to achieve the effect of “this is an amusing film, please go on” . But you also want to enjoy the experience. If you have seen the movie in the first place, and are enjoying it , that should be sufficient .

Pacino, and Maconadump really hit the mark with this stinker. I swear, I am an avid movie goer and fan. I have been a fan of most of the people in this abortion at one time or another. Until now. The story-crap The acting- crap(Rene Ruso-Major League was good) The plot-crap The subplot-garbage The teenage attempts to relate to sports betting-junkI have vowed to watch Romy and Michelle's High School reunion 2 times a day for the next seven days as my punishment for not turning this colostomy bag of a movie off after 10 minutes.

The best thing I can say about the American version is that Jane Turner and Gina Reilly must be raking in the dough, not only for writing this book and all of the other books we've done, but because they're bringing out all the other authors at conferences. You're lucky, you've got Jane. This year we have three new authors. They've all been very nice and helpful to me. And it's a pleasure to announce that Jane Turner has joined me here with her beautiful new book about the American Civil War, the War of Northern Aggression.

OK, Number one-this "film" is a "90's" version of a crappy show from the 70's that no one remembers! Number two-As soon as the movie started, I was confused, it was like I walked in halfway through the movie! There was no plot! it was very annoying! Horrible wardrobe! Call me crazy, but It's just not believable to me that little skinny Omar Epps can chase down a big grown man, without a gun, and scare him into talking! It's a ridiculous "plot".

Lt. Claude (Claudio Cassinelli) and several prisoners from his sunken ship wash ashore on an island owned by Edmond Rackham (Richard Johnson). Following a few random prisoner deaths, Rackham takes in Claude and his two remaining prisoners. Luckily for everyone, Barbara Bach just happens to be on the island too! Unluckily, there are some crazy fishmen who like to kill people.This Italian produced exploiter seems to have it all - a touch of CREATURE FROM THE BLACK LAGOON mixed with DR. MOREAU with a dash of WHITE ZOMBIE voodoo and Atlantis stuff.

Does anyone remember the alternative comedy show THE COMIC STRIP PRESENTS . One edition featured Charles Bronson ( Robbie Coltrane ) being interviewed about his new movie GLC :" It's about a man , an ordinary man whose wife and family gets wiped out by creeps and I have to hunt them down and kill them in a sadistic and graphic manner " " And after GLC what next for Bronson ? " " We're using a new angle . My family don't get wiped out but I go after creeps just the same " This accurately describes THE EVIL THAT MEN DO .

1st watched 7/29/2001 - 4 out of 10 (Dir-Mark Dindal): Fast-paced, frantic animation effort by Ted Turner's feature animation group plays a lot like tv cartoons and leaves a lot to be desired in the area of likeable characters, but definetly has extremely unlikeable villains. I'm not even sure why the kids would like this movie because there are so many references to old movie stars that kids know very little or nothing about. Mediocre effort at best despite raves on the box comparing it to Disney efforts like Aladdin and Lion King.

I picked this movie up because it sounded like a pretty decent flick , and I 've always been a sucker for the idea of the "bad man" who has his way with a little girl , who he wants to be his plaything. An untidy man, known as Bill, lives in a small dreary flat, with a poster of Marilyn Monroe on the wall, and his typewriter for company. Only the man can't think of anything to write. He wanders around the streets following people, just to see where they go. Maybe this will give him some inspiration to write. He begins to follow a well dressed man holding a bag. He follows him for a few days. While in a cafe, the well dressed man sits down at a table on the opposite side of Bill, and inquires why Bill is following him.

This film would be a great piece of history if in fact it was a real film of the Kennedy assassination. The are far too many mistakes in this film for me to point out. It is a film of the Kennedy assassination, but many of the important facts have been altered. There are missing scenes, and many of the scenes, after the president's limo passes the sign, don't fit in. Both Kennedys move noticeably slower then the other four people in front of them. Next time you watch this film look for things that don't add up, such as the Texas Gov.

This movie is a mystery. It's not scary, it's spooky. You'll probably jump at some points and for some of it you'll be scratching your head to figure it out. It unfolds its mystery through the main character Eve and her psychotic college project at an insane asylum, Don. He needs her to search for some clues to vindicate himself from murdering his mother, and once Eve agrees to help him, she completely opens up pandora's box and unleashes some very strange things, including Malachi. I won't go into Malachi, but I thought the way that played out was complete genius.

The Comebacks is a spoof on inspirational sports movies , and let me just tell you-it is not a good movie, and I will not even try to pretend that I have watched a good movie for a very long time. It is a dumb movie that should not be enjoyed by anyone, and probably will never be since it is full of stupidities. The movie opens with a scene showing that there were a number of famous athletes that were able to accomplish unbelievable things and come back and win the gold medal, including the late Muhammad Ali, Jackie Robinson, Jim Brown, Roy Rogers and Babe Ruth.

I have read almost all the books by now , and have seen the musical production in two different languages, and I have a very strong conviction that they will be the same. I have to say I think this production is the best musical that has been produced in Israel in over 20 years. As this is Israel, I also have to say the audience was superb, I felt like I was at home, and the audience seemed very satisfied. It was an enjoyable evening for all ages and people of all backgrounds, I could not imagine a better evening to come home to.

Just how bad? Well, compared to this movie, Cannibal Holocaust is Citizen Kane. There's the stilted acting, the atrocious dialogue, the half baked plot and like its companion piece way too much in the way of on screen animal slaughter that was actually done. Unlike Holocaust, Ferox is a straight forward movie. It doesn't pretend to be a pseudo documentary. In some ways that helps the production in that the film is very sharp and crisp compared to Holocaust's graininess. Unfortunately, we are once again given a group of people who are morally reprehensible.

This story had a good plot to it about four elderly men that share a deadly secret concerning a young, gifted girl. The story ended with a cliffhanger. I’m glad I read it but I’m worried that some readers may be offended or disturbed by the ending. If this story was to have such a bad ending would it be published? I would think that this type of story is a safe story to read. If an older man’s life is to end, the story should not be about death but instead be about what the man wants to do.

Although the plot of Cover Girl is very flimsy and tired, it does serve well enough as an anchor for the Kern and Gershwin musical numbers. Following her signature role in Gilda, Hayworth opted to star in this musical that seems tailor made for her. Besides looking as gorgeous as ever, she impresses with her dancing as well. Gene Kelly, who was on loan to Columbia from MGM, matches her in dancing and the sequence where he cavorts with his own shadow was nicely done. The supporting characters were also competently acted.

I saw this superb documentary at the Santa Barbara Int ' l Film Festival . It is extremely absorbing and very informative . It is also an excellent way of making a film about the history of the film industry . The film is very well made and quite funny . The documentary shows the history behind the production of films, and the way in which the film industry developed . It is a documentary about how the American film industry reached its current state. The film was made on a budget of $6.7 million and was made with the cooperation of around 100 companies.

As far as fake documentaries go (fakumentaries anyone? ), this one is up there with the best! It looks very real and that is what it aims for. One can only hope that a government like that doesn't exist! Looking for terrorists and interviewing people just like that? Of course the people interviewed all seemed to have the same (70s mentality): Screw the politicians and politics in general.

So well done . The photography , sound , music and the performances were the best . Korine 's established himself , by now , as a talented and impressive image-maker . The promotional posters for Mister Peepers were produced , along with its official soundtrack . The film was a box office success , grossing a total of $19.8 million in America . It also became the opening film of that year's Cannes Film Festival . In addition , Korine's other films were critically well received . Mister Peepers , his second feature , won a Directors Guild Award , while his third and final feature , , became a nominee for a Golden Bear . This was the year in which Korine was also introduced to American audiences .

I appreciate the effort that the filmmakers wanted to depict the story of Moses and the exodus of Israel , especially when it is so obvious that the story was told in a way that allowed Moses to be successful ,and that he could be victorious in conquering the whole of the Land of Israel . But I cannot help but wonder, if it was true, why did Moses get so many requests for the story of the Exodus? Why would any of the men in the army want to listen to the story of what happened on the day of the exodus?

This feels very stilted and patronizing to a great extent. The whole plot is extremely forced - especially the "gallant" effort to save the college from ruin, and the moralistic overtone (especially by the leading lady) grates a bit.But there are one or two comic moments that do help relieve the boredom, and the dancing is quite fun (especially for alleged amateurs - ha, ha! )The shop proprietor and the young guy doing spectacular tap dancing were particular highlights. And I liked Peter Hayes impressions of Charles Laughton and Ronald Coleman as well.

Ah! When good actors take on bland material! If you are thinking of this movie as a tight police thriller you may be disappointed. While the situations are very true to life, the plot proceeds at a very predictable clip and you can pretty well see what lays ahead way before the actors take you there. Many of the criminals and secondary figures are really just stereotypes in motion. Much of the dialog is just plain silly.But! If you love to see good actors rise above this kind of material and make something of it, then you will LOVE this movie!

One of quite a few cartoon Scooby Doo films , `` Scooby Doo and the Loch Ness Monster '' turns up at the end, but unlike in the cartoon , this one is not just an extra in the finale of the movie. In the actual film, it actually shows you how the monster moves in the real world . The film shows you the actual path it takes to get from the film set to the Loch Ness Monster , all through the real world . That was a really exciting movie to watch, as it is the first one to actually show you how it is done in the real world .

Definition of documentary : A work , such as a film or television program , presenting political , social , cultural , religious , national , religious , or similar views in a non-official way, without official recognition of such views or of the author or creator as a person , or without the official recognition of the authority of a government or authority on behalf of all the people of his or her country . Documentary is a word that has appeared many times in recent years, but it did not occur very often before the 1980s.

A CBS radio program entitled `` We the People '' assists in finding an American home for Vienna refugee Charles Burchard, who has spent most of the last 13 years living in the Dominican Republic. Charles is an American. His family has lived here all of his life. So, what will happen to him? CBS Radio News reporter, Ann Curry, asks Charles what will happen to his family. Charles Burchard: My daughter is still in college and her husband is unemployed. My daughter has a new house. My daughters are in the Dominican Republic working.

I 've been a fan of Larry King 's show for awhile , I think he does a terrific job of breaking the news in an interesting way, he makes the news look easy to understand. 1st watched 4/30/2009 - 4 out of 10 (Dir-John Waters): Corny Waters-like comedy musical with some funny scenes and good parts but it didn't make a whole worthwhile experience. John Waters directed this music-filled spoof of the fifties scene with Johnny Depp playing the title role. This movie is very similar with what he did with the 60's spoof entitled "Hairspray" but this one is not as effective. Some of the tunes are catchy, some of the characters are interesting in their quirky Waters-like way, and the portrayals are fine although sometimes overdone.

Definitely a movie for people who ask only to be entertained and who do not over-think their movies. Lots of action, lots of great dialogue (e.g. fun to quote), a little intrigue, and stuff blowing up all over the place. Samuel L Jackson and Geena Davis had great chemistry. Violent, but not gory. The fact that the female part was the competent action lead is a pleasant turn-about.Have seen the movie more than a dozen times and still enjoy it enough to put it back in my favorite films rotation every 3 or 4 months.

mondovino is a moving and rewarding documentary . in the world of wine there is a huge different between the way a bottle is presented when it comes off the shelf and how it's handled once it's opened...it's just the way it feels after the first sniff and the way it is received by the glass. I saw a lot of wine in the store today, and that was one of the things that really stood out - how the labels were displayed in the wine glass. You see the same thing on the store shelves in wine shops all over the world.

High school female track star dies of a blood clot after winning a race with the community in an uproar over sexual misconduct allegations

An athlete, a coach, and a coach's wife were charged with sexual misconduct by former high school track star Tameka Harris, who lost her Olympic gold in Rio de Janeiro. A community of athletes and coaches that grew up in Flint, Michigan called for justice after allegations that Harris and others had sexually assaulted female athletes surfaced online in the past few years. The allegations led to accusations of sexual misconduct in high schools across the nation, as well.

Can't say this wasn't made well. At a recent film festival the director admitted some scenes took 30 takes. And there isn't the slightest indication he didn't get exactly what he wanted. In the mid 1800s , Irishman Dennis Hopper ( as Daniel Morgan ) emigrates to Australia , seeking a share of the film industry that is booming in Australia . In order to realise his ambition, he goes to London to study the business of film making . On his return, it appears as though he has returned to his Irish roots , but soon after, finds himself in conflict with his father. In order to secure his future, he leaves Ireland and sets off in pursuit of his goal to work for the highest bidder as a screen actor .

See Three Colors: Blue and Three Colors: White. They are both wonderful films and will give an added dimension to the finale Three Colors: Red. Red is a fantastic film. It can be enjoyed in a single viewing, and indeed, the climax of the film is very powerful in that first viewing. But, watch it again. Once you understand the use of symbolism and character parallels in this movie, you will see new things with each viewing. With the first viewing you understand that the film is the work of a brilliant mind.

A remake can be successful . An adaptation can be successful . It is n't relevant whether its a remake or an adaptation of the story. If I am reading the story in question and the story does not concern itself with being a remake, then it makes no difference. The original story is a remake that can be successful, and an adaptation can be successful, it depends on the adaptee.

This film is about a bunch of misfits who are supposed to be assigned to a task that is expected of them by their parents, but they just don’t get it. And they go on to destroy everything they touch, including the people they were supposed to be helping. This film is not as bad as some of these films, like The Blair Witch Project. But it still doesn’t hold a candle to all the other shit that has been done on this subject. If you are in search of an entertaining, low-budget horror film, this probably won’t be your best option.

A suprisingly good film considering the circumstances of its production . Features performances from no-name actors that rival the top talent of today's acting world. I'm sure you won't disagree with any of the main actors. It's certainly not a film you want to put down until you have seen it once, but rather a film for people that don't normally consider themselves actors, and are drawn to the style of movies like this one . What I really love about this movie is that it doesn't have any real substance to it. What you are seeing is mostly the actors acting as actors.

Well, I didn't know what to expect from 555. Matter of fact, I had never even heard of it until a few months ago. But, being a collector of just about all types of horror I figured I would go ahead and grab this obscure 80's slasher.Basically the storyline has to do with a killer that kills every 5 years for 5 nights in a row. What the third 5 in the title means... nobody knows. Anyway, the killings start as the killer searches for young teenagers fooling around in obscure places. He decapitates the men and brutally knifes the woman to death.

For an indy film this is probably a bit better than a 3 out of 10 , but in general it's a 5. I am not fond of this film because it has all the makings to become one of the worst movies ever made. The film is slow and boring, but I don't like it for any of the reasons stated here. I would definitely recommend this one over most other indie films that are made this way and that's why I'm recommending this movie to the audience, because it just doesn't seem to do what it's made up to.

i don't really know where to start here.just imagine a movie that is so bad in every way from the acting to the props to the story that it makes you angry. This is one of the worst movies that i have ever seen and that is saying a lot because i have seen some bad ones. when i saw this movie i knew it was a blade knock off, but i thought that hey its got kung fu and vampires, a combination that i thought could not fail. That is until i popped this into my DVD player.

this is by far one of the most pretentious films i have ever seen . it is a tight slap in the face to a genre we all know and love but it does it so well and you feel like you are supposed to like it because you like slapstick and that’s fine , but this film is not for the faint of heart . There are moments here and there that will make you smile but there are other times that make you cringe as if you are watching a horror film , even though we all know it is not what we want it to be , but we can take it .

Stanwyck and Morgan are perfectly cast in what is, in many ways, a modern equivalent of Dickens' Christmas Carol in its sensibility. The success of the film depends on the casting of Sydney Greenstreet as the Alexander Yardley character. Yardley is the modern equivalent of Dickens' Scrooge in the way he exercizes control over his employees -- until the Christmas spirit overtakes him. The role is a 'walk in the park' for Greenstreet who had been one of the stage's great Falstaffs when he was part of the Lunts' company.

I have watched every version of this play that I can think of, including several on the stage, and Sir Derek Jacobi is absolutely the best Hamlet I have ever seen! He has the most wonderful voice for stage acting, and his expressive face will take you on a roller coaster of emotions throughout this play. The way in which he delivers his lines takes you on a journey through madness. He (as Hamlet)can in an instant be loving, soft and gentle and in another instant be raging against the hell that is his life.

The director is sweet , as is his co-directing wife Shira Geffen , but their movie sucks . It has an awesome premise and some really great acting . But they lack the creativity in the film . The screenplay is not very original, it's all based on facts, and it's nothing original. The director is not original , neither is Geffen . The best part about their movie is that all of them do a very good job in the film . If you like what they do in their movies , go and watch their movies , they are very good .

The real life case of an innocent First Nations chief ( the Indian ) by an Winnipeg city officer ( the policeman ) who has a vendetta against him

The Chief and I were just having a conversation about some stuff, and we were getting to talking about it, about where we stood on all the major issues. So this is the conversation we’re having here. And I’m sure the chief was talking to me at that same moment, talking about some of the major issues, and he asked me this question about some of the major problems that were being put forward.

I do not find this show at all funny. I actually think it is much worse than any of the other terrible Disney channel sit-coms right now. Charlotte Arnold is an interesting choice to play Sadie, because she can't act. The jokes on this show are terribly unfunny, and it makes it even worse when the only cast member that has a little bit (and I mean little bit) of acting talent is Justin Bradley as Sadie's brother Hal. Jasmine Richards and Michael D'Ascenzo portray Sadie's friends. There both really stupid and just terrible actors.

Okay , so Gus Van Sant wanted to remake Psycho in color so that he could bring it into modern times but the studio decided it would not work and he was never going to get the remake made. There is still a remake of Psycho coming out on DVD this summer that is based on Psycho 3 and I will post about that later. I’m also glad that this movie got such a good reception, it is well worth seeing. One of the more interesting things is that this is a sequel to Psycho and if you are not a fan I would recommend checking it out.

I watched this movie tonight and I do need to say that it is horrible! I expected it to be great, because you know, usually we don't have many movies about Asian vampires mixed with Asian culture; but already in the beginning it started in a bad way: the introduction of the movie seemed not to have an end! The plot is so weak and if you take the fights and the soundtrack off, you really don't have anything useful at all! The director of this film doesn't look to have some important notions about how much time to spend in introduction and flashbacks for example.

Thank god for this movie. It's a document of talent that, three decades later, seems even more unique and rare in retrospect.The music is just extraordinary, packed with so much talent in writing, performance, arrangement and production that it's absolutely infectious. The lyrics and vocal arrangements are incredible. The performances by under-appreciated talents like Nell Carter and Ren Woods uplift my spirit every time I hear them. While the film may be different from the stage version, I prefer the soundtrack to the cast album, which I find truly grating and under-developed.

I generally LIKE Sion Sono 's work , but this movie was completely retarded . But sadly , not retarded for me , because I know how dumb this concept is . In short , Sion Sono makes a movie with a good idea . But , after 2 hours , he can't come up with a good enough idea to make any sort of good story . So , he decided to dumb it down even further . Like in the case of this film . I can't really tell you exactly why I like it . It's kind of a tossup .

"The Love Letter" is a somewhat pleasant, very very low-key romantic comedy in which the use of just the right few words in a mysterious love letter unlocks the secret passions and longings of a sleepy sea-side town's inhabitants.It's not for all audiences. "The Love Letter", I feel, benefits from it's simple and quiet tone. Never intentionally wacky and phony like most romantic comedies it's quaint, picturesque, and comfy. However, for these exact same reasons, many viewers will be bored and disinterested.The cast is nice.

Sheltered young woman, home-schooled and possibly quite gifted, harbors a disturbed, overly-emotional side which comes to the surface after her absentee father pays her mother a visit, asking for a divorce. Directed by celebrated cinematographer William A. Fraker, this ill-titled psychological thriller falls into the trap that most films helmed by directors of photography find themselves in: each shot is composed for the utmost style, but at the sacrifice of fluid pacing and a tight, gripping narrative. Fraker (and his cinematographer, László Kovács) are very fond of gauzy whites and golden tones, giving the picture a burnished, tableaux feel.

As an ex (nuclear) submarine officer I must admit this is my favorite submarine movie (even exceeding Hunt for Red October). Someone knew something about submarines when they wrote the movie. OK - not realistic - but it is a comedy - and has all of the "inside jokes" from the submarine force. A great cast with the stereotypical uptight submarine guys on the "Orlando" and our heroes on the diesel boat. Definitely "DBF" by the way = that means diesel boats forever. But they want ten lines in order to post this - jees is the Admiral in charge here?

I admit - I was lured to this one from the hype - and I did n't stop to consider the quality of what I was going to get. My expectations were high for this one as it had become a regular fixture on my list and was a bit of a 'must-have'. But I was so taken by the design that I was reluctant to take any risks with my money, which I now regret. As soon as I started watching, I could see that something was going wrong. There are some things about this video which don't sit in line with my own personal taste.

I am from Romania ... and for that i apologize if my English is not so good.i just finished watching this movie and i must say that i am extremely disappointed. I always liked Wesley Snipes's movies but this one is terrible. I regret that I spent over 3 hours downloading this film. There are a lot mistakes in the film. For example, the stadium in the film is not Lia Manoliu. The name of the stadium is Ghencea. The name of the soccer team is called Steaua Bucuresti, not Uli.The scoreboard of the stadium is not capable of showing graphical images: video replays, live images etc.

A middle aged man , Robert Jordan , set in his ways , takes on a boy scout troop after the boy fails to do their chores . . . , and the rest of the troop are aghast. It's the kind of story that makes you just wonder why anyone would even try to live their lives. The first time I saw a movie with a character who wasn't quite a man-child, I thought "I want to punch that person!" I don't want to offend anyone - especially myself - by talking about how much I wish that were the case.

"Love Life" explores a very culturally relevant scenario of a marriage of convenience between a lesbian and a gay man. I found the subject matter compelling, even if the conflict was a bit forced and too easily resolved. For example, Thomas falls for Joe a little too quickly and conveniently for the plot. There are many continuity errors: one other user commented on different cars in the garage, Joe's glasses...the one that got to me the most was the fact Joe's facial hair configuration seemed to change from scene to scene.

This is a truly terrible sci-fi/horror film from 1957. In fact, despite Ed Wood, Jr.and his dreadful films getting a lot of publicity, this turkey is every bit as bad as the worst of Wood. Now the acting is a bit better than you'd find in the Wood epics (such as PLAN 9 and BRIDE OF THE MONSTER), but the special effects managed to be significantly worse than Wood's! However, bad movie aficionados will be happy to hear that it's so bad that it's still excellent viewing.

This is probably one of the worst movies I have ever seen! The plot revolves around a man named Luther who wears metal dentures, bites people on the neck, and walks around clucking like a chicken without the flapping of the arms. He also thinks he's a chicken.Sounds bizarre right? Well, to me, the more bizarre and weird the person is, the better. The more gore, the better and so on.The movie starts out with the board deciding if they want to release this maniac from their institution. They mention that he has created some dentures in prison that he used to bite people on the neck.

Valentine , a model in France is separated from her lover who is abroad , they plan to meet up for a date on their wedding day . But she can’t make it because he will not be there . She then becomes so desperate to see him that she runs away with a friend , who is there to accompany her . Meanwhile , he is in the middle of the war in Vietnam . They are forced to stay with their friend and her husband , who happens to be the chaplain of the unit . They finally manage to see each other and get married .

Leslie Nielsen hits rock bottom with this absolutely horrible comedy that is the worst mainstream film that I have ever seen in my life. (I mean really, how many times does this happen? Oh, never. I'm just saying. You get the idea.) I am sure I am not alone in my opinion that this is a complete disaster and has nothing to recommend it to anyone who has never seen even the slightest of the "good" movies out there. So let me explain why:

1. The movie itself is completely awful.

This movie certainly is a weird one to say the least . The basic plot is 3 old business associates reuniting at a lake house to find out what was really going on in the mysterious disappearance of 2 of them. The only person I can see in the story with any kind of interest is John F. Kennedy, and he is a great part of the narrative, but for the story itself it's all just weird. I'm sure I'm not the only one that enjoyed this film. If you like bizarre, strange and weird, you're going to love it.

(This review does not necessarily expose the plot of the movie, however it may change one's expectations of the movie and thus make for a less enjoyable experience.) Ever rented a scary movie, expecting to be on the edge of your seat in fear, and instead ended up howling in laughter at each and every stupid turn of the plot? This movie had so many opportunities to impress and actually scare the viewer. It was cut poorly and jumped around too much; making references to the past seem more like excuses as to why the plot was heading in its particular direction.

I thought the movie was sub-par. The acting was good but not great, the story was funny but did not come out that way. The director dropped the ball on this movie. It was not James (jim) or Tea. IMHO it was the music that killed it. There is a scene where things go down hill and Jonny Cash music is playing - man was that depressing (not funny) killed my mood. After that the movie could not recover. The deportation scene had potential funny situation, good acting good set up - I even smirked but the music again was unsuited to the scene.

I have seen this film probably a dozen times since it was originally released theatrically. Anyone who calls this movie trash or horrible just doesn't understand action films or recognize a good one. Perhaps to some the incidents and outcomes may seem far fetched, but in my opinion screenwriter Shane Black ( Lethal Weapon/ Kiss Kiss Bang Bang) crafted one of the most well thought out action adventures you will ever come across. Over the top or not this film flows like clockwork and the action just keeps coming. The final action sequence is one of the best I have ever seen in any film.

Oh dear! What can I say about Half Past Dead? I was really disappointed in it. I was thinking....A Steven Seagal movie! Cool! We'll get to see him kick people and flip people and break bones. We might even get to see him have a stick fight with somebody! Excellent!However, I was in for a rude awakening. This film can be summed up as follows:Take an episode of the A-Team, remove the lovable and roguish characters such as Murdoch, Hannibal, Mr T and Face.

This film is really really bad , it is not very well done and is a lack lustre attempt at horror , the only thing in it that is really good are the performances , especially in the third one , the third one should be rated higher , I am not saying that it has to be a classic , just that it deserves more recognition , I don't see a single thing here , I mean if you see something good in a movie you watch it , you watch it , and you are going to see that it is a horror movie , well that is it .

I just watched this movie last night . Within 30 minutes of the start , I was hoping it would get better than I was afraid it would. This film has some nice moments but they never really build up the tension to get me interested in it. The actors did a great job , but their characters are not very convincing . All I really want is for it to end so I can do something to help . This film will not be one of my favourite movies . I think I have seen everything this guy has ever done in this genre .

"Yagyu ichizoku no inbo" (let's just say "The Shogun's Samurai") is somewhere between horrifically boring and mind-bogglingly painful to watch. As an historical epic, it could have had so many more chances to be a rich saga... but it's really no more than just another cheap '70s action flick with a based-on-real-events story and an eyepatch-sporting Sonny Chiba. Before this movie's halfway point, I was even tempted to commit seppuku! The music is like a thousand dogs in heat wailing in your ears to a tune composed by Ennio Morricone (that's not an insult towards Morricone).

A total and absolute waste of time. Bad acting. Bad story. Predictable. Simple. Pathetic. After a while I was only watching to see what happens, since I'd already invested my time into it. Totally surprised Mrs Forlani played in a weak movie as this. Honestly - just don't bother. A total and absolute waste of time. Bad acting. Bad story. Predictable. Simple. Pathetic. After a while I was only watching to see what happens, since I'd already invested my time into it. Totally surprised Mrs Forlani played in a weak movie as this.

Stephen Sondheim's SWEENEY TODD: THE DEMON BARBER OF FLEET STREET opened on Broadway on 1 March 1979 with Len Cariou and Angela Lansbury in the leading roles. Although it swept virtually every award imaginable, the box office fell short of expectations and the original production ended its run at 557 performances. Fortunately, however, the play then went on tour--and along the way was captured on film. The result is a remarkable capture of the play featuring George Hern, who replaced Cariou, and Lansbury in a close approximation of the original Broadway staging.There is, however, a flaw.

MGM hodgepodge of Jimmy Durante throwing a big party for everybody in Hollywood . No major stars show up -- but it's a nice little surprise, and worth the time spent watching. Jimmy Durante and the Hootie and the Blowfish in Hollywood

From the moment the doors open, Durante and Hootie step out onto the carpet, you know it's going to be an entertaining evening. But the real action is to be found inside. Hollywood is full of celebrities and their entourages, all eager to get to the party, but not so much that it takes much time to figure out who's invited to which.

How do I describe the horrors?!!! First, some points: First, this review should be taken with a grain of salt -- I saw this over 20 years ago, when I was a boy, at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City.Secondly, I am giving away some scenes and plot points. However, it does not have much of a plot.Finally, I don't enjoy these type of art films anyway.This film was directed by proto-auteur Luis Bunuel. He was a surrealist and dadaist. These were modernist themes or movements popular critically in the 1920's and early 1930's.

This movie contains the worst acting performance of all time . Spilsbury lacks energy to say the least . Energy is essential in a comedy, not a tragedy, but he does not have any . This film is just like the ones you see on television, the ones with all the girls with blonde hair. That is why I liked it so much. And now I feel bad because the movie was not good at all , but because it was a horror film it did not deserve the attention it is getting . I am also very disappointed that there were not enough female roles in the film.

When moviegoers hear two popular villains/characters will be fighting , they flock to the theaters to see how the battle will end. Will one side be overpowered , or will both sides win ? And how will a single person be able to decide who will win ? It is a question that haunts all the moviegoers. And now , we will show you the best ways to know how the movie-goers will resolve their doubts , and finally end the action in their movie-going day. There are many things that you will need to consider before you decide which villains will be the victors in your movie.

Irwin Allen put all his talents behind this one : he 's co-screenwriter , producer and director of this cartoonish animated short. Allen has a keen grasp of science, and he brings that into the movie, as he has always been good at creating science fiction stories. The cartoon is a real treat for children, and Allen is a real character in this movie. Allen has done a few shorts for Cartoon Network before, including this one. The animation here is wonderful. The characters are a bit simplistic, but Allen has a knack for getting them to be believable.

Disney-like entertainment with some un-Disney-like moments of graphic violence and sexual references . Lousy comedy alongside cliché-ridden moralizing . Noah and the Whale is a terrible movie. You're supposed to see it once in a while if you have the time to stop by the theater, and even then it's just a boring movie about Noah and his wife and kids who live in a sea of plastic and fish . It's a terrible film, the worst animated feature film of the last decade, and the worst film of 2016 . It should have never been made.

Somehow , I really thought that I was going to enjoy this film because I love pictures with mountain climbing and in mountain climbing, you know, it's a great thing, it's really good for the environment. When we first see the movie we're told that the plot of the film revolves around three main characters. We're not really told exactly who they are. They're the three main protagonists. At the beginning, we start out with a character who has gone through so many experiences, he really didn't know the meaning of life.

Something strange is happening in Loch Ness. The water is crystal clear, nor cold. A giant robotic plastic monster emerges and kills Scots! What is this movie?! First, I love reading stories about Nessie, sea monsters in general. When i saw this for sale, i thought it was a cheap rip off of jaws. No. It was terrible! The story was pointless, acting was 100% garbage, the only up side was the cool mechanical Nessie they used. It was full of inaccuracy, wrong locations, and bad everything.

This film is absolute trash and proceeds to become even worse towards the , very protracted , end ! The plot of this film was very predictable , as the characters were not in the real world , it is a remake , it's just too predictable to make sense . The only reason for this film is because they couldn't make one . I couldn't wait for the end of this film as the ending left a lot to be desired . This film is completely predictable , boring , uninspiring . And worst of all , it's full of idiots .

I finally watched the third film in Mehta's trilogy: "Fire". To begin, I'd say that "Water" was the unquestionable masterpiece, on all levels. Fire comes next with Earth close behind in order of quality. Fire: there is so much going on in this film that I'll need a few more viewings to drink it all in. The writing is superb, the script creating friction that starts the entire process of "heat" from the beginning until the end when it really does erupt into a fire, the conflicts moving into complete rupture of relationships.

As embarrassing as it is to admit, I was listed as production manager on this film... my very first! As a matter of fact, it was the first feature film for almost everyone who participated. Watch carefully, and you even get to see me in one of the opening scenes, as a soon-to-be-murdered asylum attendant named... "Cely" (my own last name).Originally titled "Hostages" this picture was changed to "Another Son of Sam" by the Producer-Director who wanted to cash in on the serial killer in the news at the time.

This Blake Edwards film isn't too sure whether it wants to be a comedy, a drama or a musical. No matter, the sheer presence of Julie Andrews, is reason enough to see this comedy-drama-musical-spy spoof. Julie is beautiful and uses her many talents, throughout the film. Rock Hudson looks tired, but he's is more than fine, as Julie's romantic interest. Authentic World War I cars and planes, add to the appeal. Overall, the film is very entertaining. The DVD release is an edited (by Blake Edwards) version of the original release.

I have had the opportunity to catch this independent film and was impressed with it , despite the lack of budget the film has so far received very positive reviews from critics and audiences alike. This review is not exhaustive, as I will be reviewing this movie again in a different form. I have always been an avid fan of independent films. Not that there is anything wrong with that, as I have loved watching movies on tape, on my computer and in DVD’s, but I do enjoy watching them as they were meant to be seen.

This is by far the funniest sitcom that has ever aired on TV . I own all 9 seasons on DVD and it is one of the funniest sitcoms ever on TV. It is the perfect comedy and is one of the most underrated sitcoms of all time . Even the writers and directors did not see that it was going to get this much success. The plot is just about as funny as the characters themselves. It was one of the greatest television comedies ever and I am not going to forget it. I will forever hold this show in my memory as the best.

Dodgy plot, dodgy script, dodgy almost everything in fact. The most compelling performance is that of Joanna Pacula as Lauren, but even that does not rescue this pointless and nasty film. The director's implicit invitation to viewers is not merely to suspend disbelief but to suspend judgement.Presumably it is intended to be steamy and menacing, but although the film has its erotic moments they are few and far between. This sort of thing has been done better by lots of others. Don't go out of your way to see it.

Underwoods goofy story about a young man ( Arquette ) who convinces his friends that they should kidnap Frank Sinatra for the fun of it. However, Frank is very upset to be kidnapped and when they find out that he loves them, they let him go. This is in response to Sinatra's attempt to make them do something that they don't want to do. Arquette is not very bright and has no real talent. It is his own idea to kidnap Frank Sinatra, but he's not very intelligent and does not know how to use his own ideas to work out what he wants to do.

I watched 5% of this movie tonight and you may tell me that I need to see the whole movie to understand it, but frankly I don't think so.What the hell is the story in this movie? I saw a lot of people running around in a factory, shooting at everything around them.Where to start? Okay..1) They were shooting around the place as if it was the Terminator or something they were trying to kill. The entire place is made of metal, but not a single bullet sparked on the metallic surfaces.2) No ricochet.

Wow! Here comes another straight-to-video scarecrow movie to keep the cinematic masochists happy. If the cheap-looking opening credits don't tell you you're in for quite a ride, then the diabolically tragic "writing" sure will.A diabetic kid gets tied on to a legendary scarecrow as part of his initiation onto the baseball team. Then the scarecrow goes nuts and starts offing people. Need I say more? This movie consists greatly of cheap effects that makes it look like it was edited with iMovie (note that spooky color inversion) and actors who apparently weren't good enough to show up on some late-night Cinemax special.

If you loved the 1993 (erotic, sci-fiction)cyborg film "Nemesis", then you'll love this one. I loved it the minute the Elvis Pompadoured hero pulls out a samurai sword during a shoot-out. Like "Nemesis" its takes place in a post apocalyptic slum of the future. Both are police thrillers where the well armed hero must take on well armed rebels, to solve a conspiracy by the powers that be against the unwashed masses. but thats where the similarities ends. The ambiguous mayor in dead or alive tries to keep the masses sedate on the drugs he sells them.

I supposed 'Scarecrow Gone Wild' is a dull slasher flick. Yes, it have some good point, but it's a rehash from another flick. The acts is so awful nor the plot. The story goes from a legend about a living scarecrow on the cornfield. When an initiation become a prank and cause the life a boy in jeopardy, the scarecrow comes alive and start a killing frenzy. Sound familiar, right? It's derived from Scream, Friday the13th, Jeepeer Creepers, Children of the Corn, you name it! 'Scarecrow Gone Wild' is so below average film.

This film is one of the best of 1986 with creepy , yet intriguing performances from Crispin Glover and Dennis Haysbert . It is an unsettling film that explores issues of racism, class and sexuality in the South, while the film is also an examination of the nature of masculinity in the 1970's. The movie is also considered a cult classic, since it has become a cultural reference for black audiences in many parts of the country. The movie is one of my personal favorites and I’ll probably revisit it in the near future when I have some free time and the opportunity.

During filming , was Vanessa Redgrave taking mogadon ? It was like she was reading from an autocue . I think that’s very important, you’ve got to go with what you’re comfortable with , you can’t take it all in . And I’d seen her take the same look before in some of the other films and I really like that, it just gives a certain kind of energy to certain shots . Did you feel any kind of pressure to look as good as Vanessa Redgrave?

Have to agree that this movie and it 's talented director do not receive the plaudits they deserve . Here's my reasoning . The story itself does not appeal to me. It's just too predictable and dull. I did however find the director's direction interesting . It's a good use of silence that you can actually feel in a movie. Not to mention the cinematography. The camera work is beautiful and the soundscape is also very well done. It's not perfect in my opinion, but I found it a nice addition to the overall package .

Set in Venice mainly on the Lido, Visconti's "Death in Venice" is a triumph of filmmaking combining the excellence of Dirk Bogarde's characterisation and expert photography of the resort area in all its various daily moods. For those who love Venice, this is a film to cherish.Mahler's music frequently heard throughout the film heightens the drama. The mood it creates is not always happy. But then what else would you expect with a title like that?There is not a lot of dialogue in the film. Rather sparse in fact. It's mainly background noises and chatter and laughter among the hotel guests.

Its difficult to be too tough on Brad Sykes, a hard-working guy doing what he loves, there is an honesty about him that seems often lacking with other microbudget directors. Check out the minuscule crew credits on Camp Blood, there is none of the usual thanking everyone down to the pizza joint they ate in, its Brad and his buddies and thats it, no pretentious rubbish. Jennifer Ritchkoff isn't your average horror flick heroine, but does well enough for you to hardly notice, Bethany Zolt looks like a star and Joseph Haggerty is so funny it hurts.

Komodo vs. Cobra is not going to set the world on fire. It's not a hallmark of cinema history. What it is is a group of underfunded filmmakers trying to make another movie, make another paycheck, and continue to support themselves and their families. As such I give these efforts a lot of slack. I mean, come on, it has to be hard to be a Russian special effects technician. Not a lot of big budget films getting made there. BUT-- they are a dedicated bunch and more than willing to throw their all into whatever lame American monster flick needs affordable SFX.

If Christopher Nolan had made Memento before Following , then all of the flaws in Following would have been corrected and it could be considered a more polished, and better sequel. Unfortunately, the film was rushed to the deadline, with too few scenes completed, and with too much story crammed on the screen, to make an effective sequel. That’s probably because Memento wasn’t the sequel the Nolan needed to make. The filmmaker wanted to tell the story of a murder mystery that would play out through a character’s memory in real time as the memory of a crime is transferred to a new form.

Gene Roddenberry never let his fans down . His death ended Sci-Fi legacy that will never be matched . Earth was the last refuge of mankind. We were supposed to have a world to return to after the final battle. But now there’s no place left to return to. There were so many stories, so many hopes and possibilities, that it’s impossible to see the end of this war and the beginning of an entirely new one. And that’s why Roddenberry’s end came at the hands of an enemy that is beyond anything that we could ever have imagined.

Received this DVD from the ACCENT range which is a label which specializes in art-house flics, they released Irreversible and a range of Bergman's opus.The thing that struck me about Alex Frayne's strangely titled film MODERN LOVE is that it is an impeccable film that breathes with perfection and vision, a film that takes us into the mind of Mr Joe Average, replete with voices in the head, visions, and madness. It's set in rural redneck Australia, the film doesn't trivialise or praise the folks like so many Australian movies.

I 've been surprised by the enthusiastic response to this film . It seemed dull to me , much as I am with most Hollywood fare . It seemed like it had no life . It felt as if it had no substance . This was not a good movie for many reasons. My favorite scene , to me, was when Kevin is sitting in the hospital , he looks at the television, and sees an interview about him . That moment made me laugh . And I think that's what made the whole film that way. There was a disconnect with the viewer.

The film was half over before I managed to figure out what was going on . It 's a dog movie that is basically a remake of another dog movie . The film is directed by Mike Mills who also directed the first two James Bond films . I didn't know that this was his second film . Now you have a film about a kennel and it's dogs in it . I have seen other movies about dogs in their homes and their lives but never about dogs in a kennel in a film. I was expecting something with a lot more violence .

Bonny Hunt scores a coup with her directorial debut . Minnie Driver and David Duchovny have that indescribable something called chemistry, so naturally, they're the two leading men for this film. However, they may be the lead stars, and the other two characters may not be so well-defined. That's not necessarily a problem with this film, however. It's a very well-acted, well-acted film. Every moment is well-explained. And it's got a great performance from its lead, Minnie Driver. Not to mention that the director and the actors, David and Minnie, have something that the other two characters may not.

The first episode of 'Man to Man with Dean Learner' that just aired was at least up to scratch with most episodes of 'Garth Marenghi's Darkplace' and had me at "My Maisonette". Hope it keeps up the good work of 'faux terribles' on my TV. Richard Ayoade is one of the best in the new breed of "alternative comedy"(I hate this phrase but am too lazy too think of another one.) comedians on TV today.I'm glad that on a trip of local DVD retailers today "Garth Marenghi's Darkplace" was sold out across the board.

After seeing the Harry Potter movies , I 've been a fan of the trio actors Rupert Grint , Daniel Radcliffe and Emma Watson . The first time I see Emma Watson in an outfit that I think is perfect , her hair and eyes make me realize what I 've never really thought about her as a person before . This is because I love her . She is so feminine , yet so much more sexy in this outfit. She looks like a model , but her style makes you forget that it was only a model in real life .

Originally , the Spiders was planned as a four-part serial , and it shows . I dislike serials ; they can become tedious and have no real point. It's the same with this one, so I'm hoping it goes more smoothly. I'd also like to know what the story will involve in regards to The Spiders . It sounds a bit like it's about a new character who's in danger . What's his backstory? And who's going to be a part of this story? We've heard some about a new character on the show .

Move over Manos . Back off Boogens . It does n't take a Baby Genius to know that Malibu Beach isn't really as glamorous as it seems. As if that weren't enough, they're offering freebies to surfers, fishermen, joggers, beachcombers and bathers. In reality, Malibu is just a beach that happens to be popular. It isn't really the destination; it's simply the name for a small strip of beach on the northern tip of the island. It's got a lot of good waves but few people and lots of empty sand.

OK, I saw this film through Mystery Science Theater 3000, but I did see the movie, so I figured I would leave a comment on it. I just love once again how Joe gets stuck with the crummy roles while his brother and nephew's are just getting the Oscar winning roles left and right. Soultaker is technically what you would call the movie that was meant to be good. It seemed like the director and actors just took this movie extremely seriously and had very cheesy effects, a story that didn't make much sense, and not to mention pretty crummy acting abilities.

Do NOT avoid this movie. Simply because it is so bad that it is absolutely hilarious. It possibly is the worst movie I have ever seen but it was so bad that my friends and I were able to laugh at every single moment of this film. At times we actually debated whether it was this bad on purpose but we're pretty sure that it is not. Characters appear out of nowhere as if they have already been established, the scenery changes mid scene to this warehouse constantly, and the Vampire Assassin ends up having around 6 climactic fights with enemies before finally getting to the head vampire.

Although promoted as one of the most sincere Turkish films with an amateur cast, Ice-cream, I Scream is more like a caricature of sincerity.The plot opens with the dream of Ali, a traveling ice-cream salesman in a Western Anatolia town, in which he sees himself becoming successful using the same marketing methods of big ice-cream companies. He dreams of playing in his product's TV commercial with beautiful models in bikinis, dancing around him. As his dream turns into a nightmare, he wakes up with a big erection next to his gargantuan wife, who rejects to make sex with him for 6 years with no apparent reason.

I saw this film in the movie theater . I was taking classes at the Second City Chicago and of course, the film was a must see and I saw it a few years back in the theaters . There is one scene at the end where the director talks about how the audience got the feeling that it was his own life that we were watching and the film did a very good job . So, this was a good film and i saw it several times when i was younger . It was nice seeing it again and it gave me a better insight to how it all was done .

Maybe it was the fact that I saw Spider-man the day before I saw Duces Wild , but I do remember thinking that I was going to enjoy this movie at some point. The film was directed by Joe Letteri and written and directed by Frank Miller . There are two other Spider-man characters that I really liked as well, but in hindsight I don't feel that they were quite as important as Peter Parker himself. Peter Parker is an ordinary, average teenage boy living in a typical high school. Peter Parker has his life pretty much as normal as he can reasonably expect it.

Cruddy, innocent..no smoking, drinking or bikers, but Jeremy Slate (good actor) and Jocelyn Lane (good actress) make this moronically feasible for a bad biker flick, post-biker (exploit) time. They knew it, we knew it...Adam Roarke and Slate are wasted..but they lived on.A 3 out of 10. Best performance = Jocelyn Lane. Lane is the ONLY really to catch the final exploit biker film after RUN, ANGEL, RUN (which also has good actors - like Don Stroud, etc.). It was over. They knew it.

Chop Shop, the second feature from Ramin Bahrani, is a rare breed. It is an American film that tells a story not usually found in American cinema, the story of the of a minority living in poverty. It is a work of simple beauty. Shot on location in Queens, New York in the shadows of Shea Stadium, Chop Shop is neo-realism to the core. Featuring a cast of non-actors, it has more in common with Vittorio De Sica's classic Bicycle Thieves than anything made in the United States. There is no score or soundtrack, all the music and sounds are diagetic.

It's astonishing that some people saw this as art. We saw it as a poorly filmed (shaky hand-held camera and all), (generally) badly acted, unscripted mess that seemed more like a high school film project with the kids experimenting in black & white film making. Injecting mounds of poetry in place of a story does not an art film make. When we watched this in the theatre, people were starting to have fits of the giggles (us included) at the endless stupidity of this self-indulgent, meandering mess. And believe me, it does seem endless.

This movie does n't even have the saving grace of being so bad that its good . It is truly awful, and it deserves to be banned from all cinemas. The fact that a film that is based on actual events is this terrible should be the first clue that a filmmaker should be ashamed of their work, if they're trying to promote the "good old days", but this film is so poorly written, acted and filmed that I have no other words to express my disgust and disgust for it. Why are people giving this movie such low marks?

This is so bad it will be my contribution to the next bad movie party I go to. It is clear from the start that Steve Gutenburg was taking this role seriously.... the other principles were walking through their lines. I think they got a whiff of how much it stank early on and they were going through the motions for their paychecks. Sean Bean "acted" as usual but was spared sharing space on screen with any of the principles till the final scene where it was like an actor walking onto a high school stage that is how defined the contrast was.

Some of the secondary actors try , really hard . And camera shots in the desert are quite lovely . But what is truly amazing about these pictures , is that you have to imagine the whole thing to make it work . It takes so much patience . But it's so good . And I can't think of anything else that can make me happier . I'd love to see more like these . Thank you for the kind comments , they are much appreciated . Thanks for your review. I hope this won't be too confusing for you.

This film makes several nods to various science fiction films. The prologue reminds me of the one for the original theatrical version of THX-1138 (the trailer for BUCK ROGERS, here it was clips from some early Japanese SF TV show). Then the opening shot of the city in 2345 has the dragon blip flying overhead with a billboard, reminding one immediately of BLADERUNNER. The BLADERUNNER aspect comes evenmore pronounced when we meet the hero, who is called a Replicant (He is blond haired and is called Ryo, a homage to Roy Batty, Rutger Hauer's character in BLADERUNNER?).

You might think that a show about regular teens with superpowers would be interesting, but it's far from that. Take the concept for example: the main character(s) have a big secret that they hide from they're peers. It's just like Hannah Montana and That's So Raven. Next, the acting is just average. Selena Gomez seems to be half asleep through many scenes. Lastly, the jokes are either cliché or boring. If they're not using they're colorful, yet strange dialog to make us "laugh", they are throwing various props around the room.

To keep it as simple as possible . This is a very good show . That is well written , the script is not really too long . I really liked the way that you have been trying to add a bit of spice to it . The show itself is very interesting , it’s not that long and it’s a really good show . This show has potential for it to be one of those shows which everyone should watch for . The story and the way the characters are put together is really cool . I found the writing of the show to be really good .

The revisionist history -- making the evil Marquis de Sade a semi-heroic romantic -- is mind-boggling enough . But the real problem is more fundamental -- the nature of our national identity. As the recent presidential election demonstrated, even if we want to believe that the United States can be a "Christian Nation," we still have problems with the fact that it has become a Muslim Nation. It is, as we have seen, a nation that is, by all accounts, becoming more secular, more materialistic, more indifferent to its past, and more fearful of change.

Last night , I saw A PECK ON THE CHEEK ( KANNATHIL MUTHAMITTAL with English subtitles ) . Oddly , I have never seen Kannathil before , though I did watch a few short films on the Malayalam language. It has been a long while since I last watched this movie and this time I was so excited I didn't know what to think about the movie. KANNATHIL is basically a love story , between a middle aged man , who is in love with a woman and the love they share and the life they lead on the way to their happiness.

Okay , . so I went into this loving RuPaul . I still love him/her but think a little less of them . . I still think of their stuff and I still look forward to each of them performing their art form . . just not as much as now . . but that's OK because I love them so much that they dont deserve to go away . . or so they tell me . . but that's not the real me either . . lol . . you know . . . . I still do enjoy watching RuPaul do his thing . .

Back in August, '81 there was a country-ish buzz to movies, big hits like "Urban Cowboy", "Every Which Way But Loose", "Smokey and the Bandit" were all the rage. For that reason I suspect the producers of this movie chose "Honky Tonk Freeway" as the title hoping it would help the movie's box office receipts by drawing in that same "Urban Cowboy" crowd. Instead "Honky Tonk Freeway" bombed at the theaters and I suspect it do so in part by being burdened with a poorly chosen title.

Okay , I love this movie ! ! ! ! ! I watched it over and over again . It's the first movie I ever watched . I have been looking for a movie like the one above for a while . This movie is really cool ! I love it . And I'm sure you will like it . . . . ! ! ! ! ! ! . . . I have seen this movie many times . I really enjoy it . . . ! ! I'm not sure if it's the best . . . ! I love it !

Audrey, I know you truly cherish your husband Ted's memory but PLEASE do his legacy justice and heed his wishes. Dr. Seuss refused to license his characters during his lifetime for a very good reason. We beg of you to please stop cashing in on his stories, images, fantasies and characters. They are getting disemboweled by the powers that be of Hollywood and Broadway. The children of tomorrow will be stuck with these histrionic and grotesque interpretations that will forever pollute the loving warmth and innocence of his books.It is indeed your property to do with as you wish.

Sometimes it's hard to be a pirate...............but by golly Miss Jean Peters has a lot of fun trying - and it shows,particularly during her first spot of friendly swordplay with Blackbeard (Mr Thomas Gomez - eminently hissable)when the sheer joy of performing is plain on her face. With fifty years of hindsight Feminists seem intent on grabbing this movie as some sort of an anthem for the empowerment of women in a male - dominated society but I have serious doubts that either M.Tourneur or Miss Peters had any such concept in their heads at the time.

I never heard of Mishima before I watched this film and although parts of it are a little tedious, I still find myself drawn to watch it when it is repeated on the box. At the beginning of the film, we are told about a celebrated Japanese writer behaves like a lunatic and commits seppuku in public. As the film progresses you are gently inducted into twisted logic of Mishima's mind. The stages of his life are are presented in four chapters. Each chapter itself is a blend of two contrasting narratives, the first continues the story with scenes from Mishima's life and appear in black and white.

This was the worst TV movie I had ever seen. The visuals were so dang choppy it made me dizzy. I hated the constant zoom in and zoom out, and the frequent Black and White to Color switch. I also thought that The story didn't make any sense what so ever, and it was another clichéd Action Movie, with a hero a bad guy, and a few hostages. I could make a better movie than that with my own camera, why? I can hold it steady, something the director couldn't do.

Yah . I know . It has the name `` Sinatra '' in the title , so how bad can it be. :-(
I have just downloaded the source code of Sinatra . Now i'm going to see it in action right after my dinner. I'm going to start my server on my workstation. I have to set the environment variable :
export PATH=`pwd;$PATH`

to get a proper path to it. I do not understand where to find the full path to the server file. I think it's important to know where to find a path.

I caught this movie on local t.v . at about 4:30 a.m . I did n't have expectations for it . But I was very pleasantly surprised , considering it's not an original movie . This movie is not bad , just a bit predictable . And it's a little too long . This sequel to the previous one has some interesting plot points . There was one point in the sequel where i thought it was just going to take the same plot points that came before . But it didn't end up that way . The first one ended with me wondering " is this a continuation of the same story line ? "

Drawn by Pain is easily one of the best pieces of cinema I have ever seen . Here are my top 3 picks for this amazing movie. 1) The Black Tulip

By far the best film in my book, I’ve seen everything that comes along in this list. From the amazing visual effects and special effects, to the story that follows it, the entire film, this is simply a masterpiece. As far as the story goes, there are a lot of elements to this film that is so complex that I couldn’t possibly summarize it all.

I believe the reason this movie did not get the recognition it deserves is because of the many misconceptions of Darwin, pro and con. I would say the real man is depicted here without sterility. He is what he is. Although the movie is but a snapshot of the man the technique of storytelling expanded his life far beyond the years touched on in the movie. This is deep movie, a pondering of modern life and the way we think, and can provoke a study into the man whose thoughts (and other who used him) have certainly affected our lives.

Sci-Fi channel thinks this IS Sci-Fi ; it 's a shame . Big Bugs , Snakes , Mythical Beasties , Robots and Aliens are just some of the movies I love , but now I have to pay for a subscription for movies that have been cancelled . What is it about this channel that I need to subscribe for ? I don't like Sci Fi . The new Star Wars prequel trilogy is supposed to have been released on the 25th April and with the new The Force Awakens trailer I'm thinking that they are just trying to make some cash quick by the release of these new movies .

One of the more prominent/popular episodes , but clearly one of the worst . A red-shirt female falls for Khan , who is a “bad ass” who is willing to break his “bad ass’s rules” to get her into bed . As the episode progresses , she’ll start to question her life choice to begin with , and the episode goes downhill from there . I really didn’t have any enjoyment out of it . And the ending made me angry because it’s almost like she didn’t even think about how her life choice would affect them .

Jacqueline Hyde is a good quality film and does manage to be likable because of what it is. Everyone out there will like it! Sandwiched between the amount of breast shots, the times Jacqueline rubs herself, the various times Jackie spends chatting to herself and the times spent heaving in the Magdelena Mountains, this could create one hell of a dishwasher if your career were to end.Unlike most horror movies that take place in space or in some restless tranquility with ripe green apples, this one takes awhile to guzzle. The performing is good.

The movie was very good . I 'm an avid mystery fan and I usually figure out who is going to take out the killer in my books . All I have to do is figure out if he has a hidden camera or if I am missing something . But this time around I figured it out . It was easy to figure out and it was actually quite entertaining . In the movie, I was just about to give up and go to bed when the last scene hit and it left me in tears . It was almost as if the killer had actually killed me .

Ever once in a while I run into a movie that is so embarrassingly bad I wonder why movies exist. For the life of me I can’t figure out why this one makes me want to punch a guy in the face. I mean it’s such an embarrassing mess that I have to see it again. It’s such a shame because I love it. This movie is one of the most awful films that I have ever seen and I’m glad I can’t find out what went down in that movie.

I just realized why the colors and sets in `` Sakuran '' were so flashy and gaudy , and just thought that they would be perfect for you guys to play in. I am also very pleased with this set and think it would make a great gift set for someone. You should see the full set at my psp, they will be $5,99.00 . It looks sooo cool. Also I was wondering if you guys think it would be too much of a "deal" to put together all three sets. I know they are a "limited time offer", but that's not really their business.

This is a wonderful old fashioned Christmas favorite , which I try to catch on TV every year if I can. It's a simple recipe, but tastes as good as it smells. You'll find many variations and ingredients, so I thought I'd include this one. Enjoy! INGREDIENTS

Cinnamon Sugar

1 Cup Sugar

8 Eggs

1 Teaspoon Vanilla

2 Tablespoons Coconut Flour

4 Tablespoons Butter

2 Tablespoons Cinnamon

1/8 Cup Butter

4 Tablespoons Sugar

Preparation

Put the sugar, eggs, vanilla, oil, cinnamon, and butter into your mixer bowl. Beat the mixture for about a minute until the sugar has dissolved.

This is a total piece of crap. It is an insult to the awesome book by Frank Herbert. They have mangled the story and characters. The acting is average to bad. The only character done right and played well is Duke Leto, played by William Hurt. Unfortunately, he dies pretty early in the story and then its all downhill from there (not that its a very tall hill to begin with).The 1984 movie was directed by the legendary David Lynch. I was not overly impressed with the movie, but considering the technological limitations of the time, they tried their best.

Has anyone else noticed that this version is basically a scene-by-scene remake of the 1933 version , with some of the music cut in spots. It's actually quite well done considering how much of the music was taken from the 1933 version.
