Well, I've gotten a couple comments saying it's not an improvement, but it is very well done nonetheless. You know what this is, right? That's right, the first thing you do when you see the cover art, which is actually the original version, is "Oh, I remember that."

Frank Sinatra has one of his best roles as a reformed heroin addict coming back to his Chicago neighborhood after an extensive stay in a clinic. He plans to stay off the drug and find work as a drummer, but he can't avoid running into his old friends. He had been arrested originally not for any drug-related charge, but because he was caught dealing in an illegal poker game. His skill at poker has earned him the nickname of The Man with the Golden Arm, and the men who run the game, one of them being his former heroin connection, want him to deal again.

Tia Carrere was the reason I decided to watch this film, as neither the title, nor the cover would have been enough to make me spend my time and money on this film  which goes to show, me and everyone, that a DVD shouldn't be judged by it's cover. ***SPOILERS*** The film felt like it was trundling along, not really going anywhere for the moment  the awkwardness of Paul Faber (Zak Orth) around girls being almost too embarrassing to watch, and the fringe on the otherwise attractive Kirsten Beck (as Alexondra Lee) being too school-girlish to watch.

For Native Mongolian speakers the film lacked emotion and emphasis. Used too many non Native speakers especially Jamukha. Too many diversions from the actual history. Terrible terrible subtitle!!! I wonder where and who did that subtitle. It was both in English and Thai. I wonder how bad the subtitle was in Thai if the English subtitle was soooo bad! Described the one of the greatest leader's life very uninteresting. There are better films made by Mongolian directors with very low budget from 1980's. Honestly, I'm wondering if the film critics of Academy award is that lenient or what?

the fact that there was so much fuss is ironic , as the whole point of the programme was to expose this kind of behaviour and the fact that it has been going on for a long time , is only just starting to sink in . There is something very rotten in Denmark. I find it disgusting the way that a man with such a big dick can keep this sort of thing quiet and in a way it is disgusting to see this sort of thing being ignored. That’s what it has come to in Denmark.

When Jan Svankmajer lets his imagination run wild, get ready. You're in for dark, harrowing films like "Alice" and "Little Otik," or short gems such as "Down to the Cellar" and "Jabberwocky." All of those are excellent films that represent disturbing, surrealistic film-making at its best.On the other hand, when Svankmajer attempts to make a political statement of any kind, you're advised to leave the room in a hurry. Svankmajer's films in this vein tend to be both adolescent and preachy, presenting straw-man caricatures in repetitious fashion to express his pseudo-brilliant insights.

From the start of `` The Edge Of Love '' , the viewer is transported to the striking world of New York City in 1873. The central figure in the story is Edward Blake (Michael Caine), a wealthy young man who owns a string of mansions in the city. During his youth, Edward begins to fall for the daughter of a powerful family, played by Maggie Smith. Unfortunately, his interest in the woman quickly becomes an obsession, and he sets out to acquire the daughter in order to prove his worth as a man.

Jeff Fahey has such alert eyes and a smudgy , insidious smile that every character he plays seems villainous ; but there’s something under the surface, something ineffable about him that makes him relatable, and I can’t stop looking for more of that “character.”

At first glance, Fahey seems like one of the characters you’d have to play to win. He doesn’t talk much; he hardly says anything, and the only times we see him speaking come at the beginning of games. That makes him very easy to play with, as long as you want to keep the game interesting.

This film 's a big bore . It has a plenty of Predictable plots & endless sentiments from the start. However, the characters are pretty boring & it is the plot that takes away your interest. The acting was not as bad but it is a bit boring . It was well made , but didn't stand out . I liked this film , although it is not my favourite of the lot but it has a very interesting storyline and a decent amount of characters . Wednesday, 29 January 2015

A story set in the 70's. A young girl lives with her family and her sister.

Story involves ancient demon being released upon a small town on Halloween night . In all my life I have never had to fight a demon . . . I am not that lucky. I need to find a way to defeat it and end all the chaos and evil that it creates . . . a demon that is capable of killing a human . . . one that can destroy my entire world . . . and yet . . . I haven't fought a demon in a long time, not since my father killed it in the kitchen when I was a young kid .

Cowboys and Indians is an excellent film . The writing , acting , directing could not have been better . The story line is great . The music score , which is the best one that I've heard in many years is superb . If you dont mind at all , then I'd recommend it to you , and it will be a pleasure for you and your family to experience it. You will not have disappointed. I can't wait till I see my children's reactions, and they will be in awe of this wonderful film.

In Truffaut book-length interview with Hitchcock , it 's apparent that Big Al 's fear from the police dates back to his teenage years. The movie is about to start with a very similar sequence, which Hitchcock says he is not afraid to take as far as he possibly can. Big Al and his partner go undercover at a gas station to make a deal with an underworld figure, but there's a problem - they're being followed. It's not that the police are watching them. Their job is to do it.

While this movie did have a few scary moments ( great use of music and film angles to build suspense ), it was a very well made thriller. The performances were well cast, and the story of a man who loses everything and starts over was quite moving. I thought that it was well acted, and it was a nice change of pace from films like the original The Matrix, and it did a very nice job with the cinematography. I enjoyed it, and found it entertaining and a bit different from other thrillers at the time.

the first toxie film was dark , gory , and hillarious . This film is un-gory battles to cheezy jazz-pop , and you are not prepared to see how bad it is . This film was made by a director who had never had a film screened in his life . It is very hard to get this film into your head . It was very well made , but very poorly acted . It's a good film for the Halloween , but it could have done well in any genre . This is a horror film , and there was no need for the actors to dance .

I am utterly astonished at how over-rated `` Cemetery Man '' is among horror fans ! Now , I usually don't agree with Horror movies but I know what it feels like to watch a really good horror movie. I really liked it and I think that is why I was so excited when I first watched the movie. I watched it in theaters a few years ago when it came out. I am just not surprised that most horror fans are not going to care about it as much as I am. I am also not sure why they would think that there are not any true horror movie fans.

I didn't know what to expect from this hugely popular (and hilarious) Swedish comedy & satire team, as they released their first feature film. More broad satire? Well, we do get four contemporary, exceptionally memorable tales of family pains, generation gaps and fatherhood, in particular. But it's drama, thankfully, and what drama! Epic in its scope, as each episode is from carefully picked, geographically different parts of Sweden. But each story could seriously carry a whole movie, if expanded separately.It's dark, twisted, harrowing, yet massively entertaining and breathtakingly executed.

Predictable , cliche , unbelievable , boring ... what else can I say ? It 's only the caliber of people like you and a few like him that makes this world a place we can call home. I hope you see the error in your ways, because you know it and that is what is stopping us from moving to a different place and to a better world, where everyone can be happy and free . We have to fight for our freedom , but we can do that , and we will do it , together , one family ! We are one people , one family .

"Garden State" is another of these "indie"-type pictures that supposedly skimp on production values for the sake of giving the audience some real true-to-life human drama. Oddly enough, the production is very good, so are the performances (by some fairly big-name actors as well). Where the picture is lacking is in Zach Braff's script, which seems mostly culled from situations taken from other movies.When you're as young as Braff is, you haven't really lived enough to use the experience as film fodder. Braff's experience looks to be from watching movies, then repeating the same trite clichés in his own movie.

I seen this movie when it came out. I thought what an average movie. I have now realized that this director was ahead of his time. This is a great movie and great soundtrack. I have seen my share of rock films but although this is far from spinal tap (which I did not like)> This film does take us into the life of an 80s rocker wanting to be nothing but. This is nothing more than our inner child wanting to grow up and to be a *ROCK STAR* Yeah I said it.

Bronson took the money and ran with this film; he must have house payments like me! This low budget film made in Mexico reminds me of a few of those Italians stinkers from over seas. I heard, I do not know if this is true, but companies make these films in foreign countries for tax purposes. I believe this because why else would they make this film, it sure wasn't to make money. We had a whole lot of these Canadian made stinkers, because the government gave tax breaks to create a movie industry.

If any movie ever made Italians look bad, this is it.Duke Mitchell - what an A--HOLE. Duke Mitchell, I s--t on your grave. Seeing as practically every person gunned down in this film by the cowardly Mimi is either black or of some other racial or ethnic minority, it's hard not to become convinced that the guy ultimately owes his allegiance to the Ku Klux Klan or skinheads. Awww, but he doesn't shoot the little black kid in the elevator in the opening sequence, so that means he can't be all bad, right?

There must have been a lot of background info that was left out of the movie. In fact, in the film, the girl, Lizzy, didn't even appear depressed. She just seemed like a girl that went out of control when she finally got to college, mainly from doing drugs and drinking alcohol. That seemed to be her problem, not mental illness. Sure, she had emotional problems because her dad left and she barely saw him as a child, and her mom seemed a little out there.

This movie is funny if you 're the gentleman who was sitting about three rows behind me ( repeating every word ) when it came out. I'm sure that I would have laughed to death if I were still sitting in the audience. For those that didn't catch it on the big screen, I found the movie pretty good. I'm not so sure it's a good movie, but there's certainly something to the idea that men should not act like men, or at least act in an appropriate way to be a man. I really like this movie.

Writer-director Dean Bell offered many surprises and engaging moments in this modest yet compelling road film. His dialogue was snappy, and his use of very short flashback sequences was especially effective in the film's narrative structure.At the heart of the film is the character of Alice, who is running away from her New England past in a desperate effort to get to Florida. Along the way, she travels with a pair of eccentrics, Bill and Sandra, who incredibly make the attempt to groom Alice as a prostitute earning money at truck stops.As a newcomer performing in her first screen role, Emily Grace as Alice is sensational.

This was shown on a premium channel, so I didn't realise it was made for TV. Even so, I like some of the movies on lifetime (Lifestyle here in UK), but this was awful. The family were so cheesy, "Love you mum" "Love you even more honey" Then after they were broken into for the second time, 10 mins later, they were at it again, "Love you mum" big cheesy smiles etc... She phones her husband, and tells him not to bother coming home.

This was a fantastic movie about two people, one a young teenage girl, and the other, a middle aged man, who are each looking for someone to help them fulfill a certain emptiness left by former loved ones.Both actors give brilliant performances that various audiences can relate to. The script, although written by Gorman Bechard, seems as though it was written from a woman's point of view. And at the same time, men can relate to the male characters because of how well they were developed and described in the movie.The end of the movie has an unusual but powerful and unexpected twist that leaves you speechless.

* * Might contain spoilers * * Ok , lets conclude this movie in one word : bad . Two things you might not know about the film :1. This was supposed to be one of the better films of this year so far2. The film contains a lot of sub plots and things that can get confusing when you first start watching it . For instance , you are supposed to feel sad for the character , but it becomes very hard to figure out what is the point of this character . This movie is a lot of things to keep in mind :1.

Well , at least we have to acknowledge the big Hollywood horror-producers are finally getting smarter and more perceptive . In today's article I thought it was a good moment to discuss what makes for a good horror movie , and in case you missed the beginning article , why I call it "Hollywood Horror", you can read it here: http://www.horrornation.com/articles/what-makes-horror-good-films/ . I hope this article would help you make some sense of the horror movies and in the end , I hope this article would help you to understand "horror" to a greater degree .

I watched this movie again yesterday with a 20-year-old intern from my office (OK - it was the quiet day after Thanksgiving) and we both loved it. I love the unique plot, David Duchovny, David Allen Greer, and the way the dog keeps waiting at the door. Isn't part of each of us just like that dog after someone we love dies?I also love the old folks at the restaurant - they remind me of some of the older people around Southern New England, where your ethnic group is a very important topic of discussion.

Perhaps I missed something, but I found GOYA'S GHOSTS to be a tedious costume melodrama. As to the story it was trying to tell, I found that a confusing mish-mash that went off in all directions. And perhaps it should have been made by a Spanish director with the appropriate languages subtitled rather than in unconvincingly accented English. I can't judge the historical veracity of the story but it seemed to move along with a similar "artist's model's tragic fate" plot line as GIRL WITH A PEARL EARRING.

I rented this thinking it would be pretty good just by the cover of the movie case . Judge and all, I have not even seen it . I am going back after reading the movie descriptions to see if there is more substance or if I can find it elsewhere . If I can not find it anywhere I will definitely rent it again . I have not seen this movie and I am really liking it . I don't understand why you would rent a movie if it has such poor reviews but I have. . I do not understand why they do not have better reviews for this movie .

The film successfully gives a graphic portrayal of the suffering of forced sex labour , but nothing more . The sex industry in India has always had a terrible reputation on the global stage due to its poor treatment of the workers and their exploitation . The film portrays the horrific conditions in sex workers camps in India and how these workers were exploited for their sexual pleasure. The film focuses on the fact that the sex workers are forced to do what they are paid for. This film goes into details about how a man was killed for performing a sexual act.

A wasted effort . On the surface it 's a typical disaster movie : we 're involved in the lives of two people and the plot unfolds from one point to the next. I found this to be so unlike a lot of the films out there, which are always the point. There is one point of interest though, and it is the fact that the character of "the old man", is a character from the book, but not a real character. This gives a certain "closeness to the text" to the film which is really quite unique.

Nemesis Game is a mind-bending film filled with riddles , death , mystery , and philosophy . In it 's final scenes , the narrator , who we only know as ' nemesis ' tells the story of his life and gives the viewer a choice of the fate that befalls ' nemesis ' . From the first moments you get that it is meant to be a philosophical story . The story is about the quest for enlightenment . The goal is not to make you think of death . It makes you think about life , death and living . The whole movie is like an exercise in contemplation .

From the English accents to the so unnecessary violence after violence. Showing Moses as a murderer. People who actually believe in the Old Testament will just sit there and shake their heads. I am not a religious person at all. But even i felt as though the writers of this movie were trying to turn us all against God and the Jews.When Moses picked up that rock and threw the first stone at the woman to kill her for committing adultery. I wanted to stone the writers. I can't believe in this day and age that Hallmark and ABC (Disney) would attempt to show such garbage as this.

The basic plot is good and can be engaging. The music is so great that it became the theme music for the TV show IRON CHEF (though it is WAY overused and too intrusive in the movie). So, how did this movie end up so poor?!?! Well, the plot was about 95% predictable and the characters were about as 1-dimensional as possible. And the dialog?! What person would actually allow themselves to receive credit for coming up with the STUPID macho bull-crap that purports to be dialog? You get much greater realism from most cartoons!

You have to like baseball, and you have to at least sort of like Tom Selleck, but if you meet those criteria you should thoroughly enjoy this movie. Selleck plays former major league star who finds himself traded (?) to Japan as his career winds down. Really well thought out and fascinating look at Japanese customs and behavior. Great supporting performances by Selleck's manager ("Japan's Clint Eastwood"), his girl friend Takanashi, and his interpreter. The chemistry between Selleck and Takanashi works very very well, this is really a very nice romantic movie apart from the baseball.

This movie will not be considered for an academy award, but if you enjoy a movie that doesn't take itself seriously and just wants the viewer to enjoy for ninety mins it is not a disappointment. You'll enjoy a send up of Darth Vader for the villain (the breather), a female Batman for the heroine (but much cuter with much less costume), and a running joke that involves cigarettes and the police captain that's very funny. Not by any means a great cinematic achievement. But if you enjoy campy fun it was worth a viewing.

It was so disjointed - it seemed to jump from place to place - and the "thief" was obvious. It was a poor man's (not to mention high school) "Less than Zero". I would pass on this movie as it has very little to add. So many issues are left unresolved, and that's okay - but the fact that it jumps around to the point where you wonder what's exactly going on is terrible. The voice-over is needed because the movie doesn't work on its own. Avoid this movie, and watch something else about rich teen angst.

This movie is funny if you're the gentleman who was sitting about three rows behind me (repeating every punchline, laughing when there were no gags on-screen, and issuing a gravelly "haaaa" at every scene involving a computer or mobile device).For everyone else, it's a mean-spirited, bungled "comedy." The movie strictly follows the formula of the later "Scary Movie" films, as well as "Epic Movie" and "Meet the Spartans," though without the flood of heartless pop culture references that made the latter two so irritating.

I watched this movie with no idea what it was about beforehand. I was intrigued for the first whole hour. It was shaping up to be a great thriller. A very talented cast and good dialogue.Then it all fell apart for me at the sight of the first vampire. I couldn't believe my eyes.A great thriller was flushed down the toilet. The rest of the movie from that point was totally awful.I gave it 4 stars for the brilliant beginning alone. I think that's a little generous, but I was entertained for a while.

This is the sort of unknown and forgotten film one dreams about discovering in watching old videos. It is a superb comic gem with brilliantly funny writing, embedded in the marvellous array of characters, a wonderfully inventive and funny musical score, and witty, light direction from Montgomery himself. This is one to watch over and over. Montgomery is a bit part actor who finds himself assigned by his military reserve division to infiltrate a young debutante's home to discover the identity of her former beau, a suspected jewel thief. While the premise is rather preposterous, the results are hilarious.

no really , im not kidding around here folks , and i so cant believe how many people here have not heard about this , it wouldnt surprise me at all , i mean i can understand if you have a bunch of bad things happening to you with someone that you have been having an affair with , but this is not normal ? i dont think anyone here will be surprised by it , so why would i think that it wouldnt be happening to them , or that i would think that it wouldnt be happening to me ?

This is one of those movies that you just don't want to end. The characters are rich like a well woven tapestry. Colorful costumes, music and characters draw you in and tell a tale of the people that lived in a boarding house over the decades around the time of the civil rights movement and the Vietnam War. A young man is taken in by a dynamic, big-hearted woman that runs the house and these are stories based on his experiences.I couldn't believe this was a made for television film. It was so well executed.

Directed by Diane Keaton and adapted from a book by Franz Lidz . A young mother Selma Lidz ( Andie MacDowell) has a baby boy who was abandoned by his adoptive mother in the middle of a rainstorm when he was an infant. Desperate for her son's identity and her own identity, she returns to the city where she grew up to look for the boy. While searching the city, she meets other mothers who must do the same. They each have a child that they want to give up for adoption to a better life for them.

Ohhhh MAN this movie is awful! !This kind of tripe is what gives Canadian Cinema a bad name, or no name. Well, to be fair, I guess most Canadian movies give Canadian Cinema a bad name.Next to the characters (there's a couple that are the most grating in movie history), the most annoying thing is the editing and pace of the movie. It's like a drunken snail making its way to die.Thank goodness Melanie Doane is nice to look at. She's the only thing that kept me watching.

I loved the film `` Eddie Monroe '' . The film had all the components that kept me interested while waiting for the sequel. It was suspenseful to the end. One of the best things of the film is the great cast of characters with all the characters being great. The plot of ` " Eddie Monroe '' is basically the story of a small town police detective with a passion for a young woman and her child. The plot involves the relationship between a detective and this woman and a child. The film has a lot of suspense and mystery to it.

When I first saw this movie in the theater I was so angry. It completely blew in my opinion. I didn't see it for a decade then decided what the hell, let's see. I'm watching all hellraiser movies now to see where it went wrong. My guess is it was with sequel 5 that was the first to implement the whole "i am in a dream omg i see weird stuff, oh noes what is happening, oh its a dream, oh its not a dream, oh wait i see something spooky, oh never mind"-sucky storyline.

There is a LOT of repetitive dialogue in this movie about "cold spots" (signaling the presence of a ghost), and characters praying to surround themselves with white light to protect themselves. To recreate the feeling of the movie, I shall repeatedly make references to cold spots throughout this review. I'e seen worse movies than the St. Francisville Experiment, but this may be the most *forgettable* one of all ("it's getting cold!") Basically some 20-somethings spend the night at a haunted house. This is filmed as a supposedly true documentary.

`` What Alice Found '' is the greatest movie that nobody 's ever heard of ! I underestimated it when I saw it first ! I was surprised to see that I missed some great scenes but it made my heart swell ! I was very shocked that it took me a while to read it ! I didn't want to make it as long as possible as I didn't like to waste too much time on it !

'' What I've Found in my Life, ' is the greatest movie that nobody ever saw ! I didn't realize how much it could hold until I started it !

Well, I have to agree with the critics on this one, who all said "leave it alone." Why they had to make this re-make of the 1960 "Psycho," I don't know. My guess is they wanted to reach a new audience and thought color and modern-day actors were the answer, since those were the main changes. The dialog was the same and the story the same.On one hand, I applaud them for not making this over with a lot of profanity and nudity and making it a sleazy film.

Well , after seeing `` Beginning '' I thought why the hell they burned Schraders Version and did that poor bastard get the hell beat out of him. I didn't think I'd be able to get it and it took a good few weeks to download it, but I did , and here we are, I think I got all of the episodes. I can't remember everything. I only remember a couple , I can't seem to get to the others , I haven't found any that I can play with yet.

if u have n't seen Vijay in `` Ghillli '' , `` Gilly '' or `` Ghillie '' . go and look for them. you'll be amazed.

" " 'I''ve seen Vijay in ''Gilli'' , he has his eyes on '' Ghillli '' , you'll see ''Gilli '' as well , he's a great actor he's a great actor !

" " "And you see '' Gilly '' as well , he's a great actor too , you see '' Gilly ''

"" " ""I've seen 'Vijay'in ''Gilli'' '' and you can see ''Gilly'' too .

There is something that one of the characters (the aging film director who pretends to be dead) says which may summarize all the film: "In Italy it's the dead who rule". True! This is a country without a future, in the hands of old and jaded men. And Bellocchio's cryptic portrait of the country, pivoted on the apparently senseless story of a director who has to film marriage parties to earn a living, manages to say a lot about what is not working here. But foreigners may miss the point, as it's not clearly expressed.

You know, before seeing this film I had little sympathy for those caught up in criminal cases. I mean if they were arrested and charged, "they must have been guilty" I reasoned?I formed this opinion over some years. You see a good friend of mine once worked as a detective in some of the more seedy areas of Sydney. He frequently complained that his policing efforts were wasted due to 'bleeding heart' lawyers and magistrates. He would "bang the crooks up in the morning and they would be "back on the street by noon".

I just saw this on TCM tonight and was shocked at the over-acting by Jean Arthur. Her bugging her eyes out in surprise and just generally over-doing everything was not in the same style as Dietrich and Art Lund. Dietrich was marvelous in her restraint and comic timing. She being the best thing in this movie. The Wilder gags were flat and frankly more like something a freshman in college would write trying to "get away" w/being wicked,witty and dirty, but just sounded boring and not funny at all. It seemed the humor was being pushed too hard to be funny.

Dick and Jane Harper ( Jim Carrey , Téa Leoni ) wind up on the unemployment line when the corporation tries to put them back to work as janitors. But it’s all a scam: they’re being set up as part of a scam to get rid of all of the unemployed people, so they can make more money. The scam was run by Jim Carrey for many years. The scam is a fraud, which will result in people losing everything, and the corporation in the end doing nothing because they don’t have the means.

The first time I saw a commercial for this show was when my sisters were watching the Kim Possible movie. The commercial showed Sadie and her friend discussing the meaning of the word nothing.It is one of the stupidest commercials I've ever seen. Basically, they go back and forth with lines like "Nothing is a thing, so technically nothing is something,". When I saw that, I figured it would be yet another lame Lizzie Maguire knockoff by Disney. But I had no idea how bad.Fast forward about 3 weeks, when my sister turns on the T.V.

As a big Dostoyevsky fan , I had always been disappointed with Hollywood 's halfhearted attempts to get into the Dostoyevsky world. After reading his story of the peasant boy, "The Brothers Karamazov", and seeing his famous story of the murder in "The Death of Ivan Ilyich" (1864), I knew that there was more to Dostoyevsky than I had thought. So I searched the Internet for my first novel, "Murder in the Cathedral". It took a little longer than I had expected. On October 21, I submitted my manuscript, and it was turned down.

First , and foremost , I take issue to the title of this movie . 'Chupacabra ' is not a movie in the first and second person, it is a horror flick , a thriller , an urban horror . It's a horror film, a thriller , and an urban horror film . For that reason it is not only a good horror film, but it is a good thriller . What makes the film a great horror movie , is that it is the first horror film I've seen since my childhood . So first , let me go back to the story line .

This was a pleasant musical about the creation of the Moulin Rouge dance hall. In many ways, this reminds me of the Hollywood musicals of the 40s and 50s, in that it has many clichés leading up to the inevitable conclusion ("will the show STILL go on?"). While of course none of this is new, it was enjoyable and well made. The musical numbers at the end are frenetic and beautiful to watch. In many ways it reminds me of a sexier version of THE GREAT ZIEGFELD. In real life, Ziegfeld was quite the player but this was sanitized in the American film.

This is a joke , right ? This ca n't be a real film ? It 's not even a comedy , right ? If you put a comedy in that film , I would think that there is more going on. So, you are trying to tell the world how good you are by showing your comedy in this film. There are so many people who already know you, you don't have the guts to show it. I am going to leave the film alone, because it's not funny enough for me, but I want to see if we can get you to make this film.

This week 's surprise screening at GV turned out to be the horror movie The Nun ( La Monja ) directed by Gabino Estrada. I was not expecting anything else, not even this. The film had been screened a week earlier at the same theater as The Nun had been but I didn't know this. The Nun was very good, it was well worth the price of admission. Even with the high price, the film was a surprise. The story was about a beautiful girl, who falls for an American missionary who has adopted her.

This film is so 1980 's and that is what I like so much about it . It does an excellent job showing the different sides of the characters in this film and the relationships between the characters . I found the ending of the film to be really cool . But I must say that some of the acting in the film was quite below par I must say . I didn't mind that but the actors themselves did not do an adequate job . There are many great actors in this film that I liked . I think I liked the acting in most of the scenes .

This movie is Hilarious what is better than watching two creatures battle one another? GIANT cgi versions of these beasts which battle! However I do require one of the guns used in the movie. Because apparently they are using cheats. Count the amount of shots they use before having to...oh wait that's right they never have to reload. Regardless count the shots... it's hilarious.The sound effects used in the movie for the Komodo vary from a tiger to an elephant. Oh and did I forget to mention that apparently these GIANT Komodo dragons are stealthy as hell?

Can you people please stop believing everything this man says. Getyour facts straight before you start praising this liar. He's not evenfrom Flint. He just says that to keep his "blue collar" look. He's from a rich suburb next to Flint. I mean he went to a private school.His parents paid for him to go to school. Wow, that sure does seemlike they suffered a lot from Flint going to the dumps. He was also born in Canada. Oh wait, that makes him a Canadian citizen. I wish he would just move there.

I am sitting here writing this review and the movie's not even over yet. In fact, I just checked, and there are 45 more minutes to go. But no matter, there's no need to see it through to the end. I'll just write this review and laugh as the film plays in the background and stumbles onward to some kind of presumably horrible conclusion which I don't care to ever see or know.What accounts for my hostility to this movie? The characters are not believable. The plot is not believable. The pretentiousness of the movie is sickening.

If you enjoy riddles and suspense, you will enjoy this movie. Truth be told it was mostly the Adrian Paul part that got me to pick it up, I knew almost nothing about the movie beforehand. Plot is: Sarah (Carly Pope), a student of philosophy and metaphysics, starts playing a mysterious riddle game trying to figure out "the reason" and gets involved in "the game" by solving riddles. Vern (Adrian Paul) is a shop owner, also a riddle fanatic, and also gets entangled in the game.

This is another of those films I can remember from when I was a kid and I recently managed to track down and watch a copy of the DVD and find it online. This is my third time seeing this film and my favorite so far. This is one of the films that my wife and I have discussed the idea of watching together since I saw the film for the first time. We are pretty much in agreement with how we feel it should be. It’s not a particularly deep film. It doesn’t make you feel any sense of purpose or meaning.

I saw this version about a decade ago , and have been looking for it ever since . I just want to let you all know that i bought a copy from the library today. I like it a lot better than the other versions available. I have to say, there's just so much to love about it. I hope that you like it as well! There's nothing better than a nice quiet place to sit and study. It's rare to have someone sitting around the table and conversing with you. It's a great distraction, and it's always good to have someone else around.

Watching the preview of Armored I thought the movie was either going to be a very bad or a very good one. There was just too much potential in the opening of the movie that I didn't want to see taken away. It's a shame that this one wasn't as interesting as I would've wanted it to be, because I would've loved for it to be better. The movie has some great moments, I enjoyed the action sequences and those of us who have seen the movie in theaters have enjoyed the story. The film has a good cast.

Everything everyone has said already pretty much rings true when it comes to 'The Prey'. Endless nature footage, bad acting - Aside from these elements, this is a watchable film for slasher fans that in some cases, is considered a cult classic.Jackson Bostwick and Jackie Coogan play pretty well off each other. There's also a three minute banjo solo that shows off Bostwick's skill behind the instrument. Not too bad if I do say so myself.The last ten minutes of the 'film' are its saving grace. The ending still haunts me to this day.

Okay, anyone looking to see a great work of art should NOT watch this film. A sophisticated film connoisseur will no doubt be nauseated by the horrid production values and the sight of watching an excellent actor (Joseph Cotten) whoring himself out for a buck. Mr. Cotten must have either really needed the money or he was too senile to realize that the film was crap. The same phenomenon occurred with Dana Andrews, who late in his career appeared in the campy and awful FROZEN DEAD. I know Mr. Andrews was in the throes of alcoholism, but why did Cotten do this mess?

It may be , although there are still two or three I 've missed . This film constructs an interesting and compelling narrative of the way the West was lost as a people in the face of the Soviets . . . and then, in the wake of the Berlin Wall and the end of the Cold War in the 1990's, the West came to its own again . . . it also tells a story about those who have become the West . . . and how it all came to be. Although it's not always clear exactly who's speaking on the film .

What a mess--and I'm not referring to the "destruction" in the title. I could go on about the hackneyed plot, the lousy effects, the (actually notable) cast grimacing as they deliver the worst lines of their careers, etc. I'll just say there weren't any palm trees in Chicago the last time I checked, and leave it at that.Hmmm...need ten lines to get this posted on IMDb.. OK, well, I think a DVD release with outtakes could be interesting. Maybe Dennehy will reveal what favor got called in for him to appear in this thing.

Not the best plot in the world , but the comedy in this movie rules . Kelsey Grammar is wonderful actress and this movie has just enough laughs . It's not a masterpiece , but it has everything you could expect from the star of the movie . I enjoyed the film very much , I have not seen this one before . It was so enjoyable ! This film is available for free streaming , if you want to stream it , you can download it from our website

There are no comments yet for this film.

The most vivid portrait of small-town oddity I 've seen in a long time -and I 'm not just talking about the town itself but about its people

The story is told of how a man in a red suit, standing in the middle of a crowded street in a town far from home took a small coin from his jacket pocket and offered to share it with the people there in the street. "This is all I've got," said the man. "Give it to us all!" they shouted.

As far as fake documentaries go ( fakumentaries anyone ? ) , this one is up there with the best, if not the most realistic ( if not the most realistic ) in terms of how it depicts a historical event in the past, the only thing it lacks was some kind of a climax to it. Not being a historical historian, I haven't seen much of the film, but I think it could have made a decent documentary. It could have been more factual, but it's still pretty engaging. Of course, it does take itself way too far.

Why are there no good reviews ? Because this film is hysterically bad.Set in a Japanese prison camp in World War 2 Japan, this is based on a true story - the story of a Japanese soldier that was executed for stealing from a captured German pilot during a POW exchange in Hawaii in the 1940's. The Japanese soldier in question stole from the Germans because he thought the German officer was his friend. He then stole the Japanese pilot from the POW exchange. He stole from both sides and committed suicide after he realized he was wrong.

I really wanted to like this film , especially after all the buzz I 'd heard revolving around it . But when I sat down to read about it, the film seemed a lot less interesting than it should be . A few things that didn't go with my idea of what the story should be. The trailer
I really liked the first trailer . It was short, it showed you what the entire film was going to be , and it made me feel like there wasn't that much of a wait . I've been to other trailers, and I've never really gotten that impression before.

The 1998 version of "Psycho" needed to be set back in the 60's, rather than present day. The headliners would have done a good job with the setting. There were two scenes that just stuck out like a sore thumb. The first one was at the beginning of the movie when Marian Crane (Anne Heche) was sitting at her desk. Her boss took his client into his office because "it was air conditioning." I imagine that the majority of Arizona businesses have air conditioning. The other was the meeting of Lila Crane (Julianne Moore) & Sam Loomis (Viggo Mortensen).

I 've been strangely attracted to this film since I saw it on Showtime sometime in the early 80 's and I always thought it would be great to put it into a big screen in a big movie and it is. It's a very good movie with some great performances all around, a wonderful soundtrack, and a great love story. It's a really good movie. I would love it to be played in a movie theater because that would be so great. I don't know if anyone has ever seen it, but I would love to see a movie theater version.

"Yesterday" as a movie, is hard to rate. The cinematography is excellent and deserves a 9/10. The story is gritty and real and does not compromise. But the translation of the story to the screen through the actors did not match the camera work.As a person who was born and raised in Central Africa, I appreciated the authenticity of the film's look and the honest depiction of daily life for the Zulu. But this and the camera work are not enough to recommend the average viewer should see this film.

This odd little film starts out with the story of Bruno ( Alex Linz ) in a catholic school who is involved in a drug deal and he is kidnapped by two other kids that go by the nickname “Raspeals” (Gaby Hoffmann and Gaby Hoffmann Jr ). In the end of this film they convince him to go for a test drive of their stolen vehicle and it goes bad. This film is a comedy in its simplicity. There is one character, one actor and a story that can go on for a hundred and twenty five minutes.

I thought the this film had an interesting name and just might have proved thought provoking, but was I wrong. This film was boring, especially in the beginning and the middle parts. I cannot comment on the ending because I just couldn't stand watching the whole film. The premise of signing a student researcher just because he walks into your lab makes no sense. This student had an interesting type of moving robot in his apartment and sadly enough this non living thing is more interesting than the characters in this film. So if you are having trouble with sleep then I recommend that you rent this film.

Having enjoyed Neil Gaiman 's writing ( especially his collaboration with Yoshitaka Amano in `` The Dream Hunters '' ) for some years now, it's only logical that I would become a fan of his latest novel and, of course, to start reading it. And, truth to tell, to start it I did not even bother to search the web site. Neil's latest novel will not disappoint...

Gaiman's first foray into comics ( and the best comic I have read up to date in this genre ) is not exactly what one expects when you read a comic like this.

This rendition of `` Noah 's Ark '' has set Hallmark 's ( and Turner 's ) reputation back about 15 years. The story has been retold many times, and it is now an annual tradition, but it's not one I see many people do, since the images do not really do justice to the story or its setting. For that reason, this one is not for your family. But if you don't think you can handle the story, here it is anyway. You may have heard the story of the Flood, but that wasn't what we thought it was about.

Not the best of the WIP 's , but not the worst either . I honestly feel guilty laughing at the end of this, because this was so good, I wanted to read it over and over again . The story itself was good and I really enjoyed it, although there were a number of things I didnt like. For example the first half of the story was boring, the second half was sooo much longer that I felt I was going to have to skip to the last page of the book just to get it to end.

this film was probably the best `` scary film '' i 've seen in years . chilling might be a good descriptor , but i don't really feel it is . the only good thing going for this is , as far as a horror movie , it has a lot of potential to become a great movie . i'm a horror buff , not to the point of getting gagged at the theater . i love horror movies , and i enjoy this movie . it is , however , a rather slow , boring film .

While the prominent and over use of the play-like format is in total operation throughout the film, it is not however this that lets this picture down. Rather it is the unconvincing female performances and rather tedious script that the film so obviously relied on a little too much. With an idea that had potential, the simple plot is diminished still by Graham's failure to truly express the devastation her character so adamantly claims to experience. The use of improvised scenes by all the actors would not be such a bad idea if only the two leading ladies could take advantage of this privilege.

I 'm a fan of the horror movie , regardless of which hemisphere it comes from . I know what the movie is about and have a pretty good understanding of what is going on , but what makes this film so special ? It's actually one of those movies I can definitely recommend to anyone , regardless of what your particular horror sensibilities may be . It's just a really great horror movie . . . in fact, I'd recommend it . . . . . It's the first movie I've ever recommended . . . . to anyone . . . .

If I had to pick the most depressing movie , try to be suspenseful I 've seen it 'd be hard , the first two were very suspenseful , I like the third very much . The rest I can watch without any emotion . If I could choose one , it would be the first 3, because I think that is a very suspenseful movie in terms of suspense . I think that was suspenseful because the suspense comes from the fact that the girl is not going to get away and the killer can kill her . The last 2 were very suspenseful .

An untidy man , known as Bill , lives in a small dreary flat , with a poster of Marilyn Monroe on his wall , which has always been there. But the poster is always in shadow . It is evening, late afternoon, early evening. He has just finished cleaning his flat and is about to get dressed. There is a smell in the flat of smoke from a candle, and the smell is familiar to him, he knows it all too well. He goes to the kitchen and lights a cigarette and sits down at the table.

Yet another in the long line of `` Do n't '' films of the late 70 's and early 80s, this one actually did make some money. Maybe not a ton, but it's a film worth seeing regardless of how it plays. This time it stars the late, great actor Peter Cushing as an Irish soldier who is on his way home to his family on a trip he didn't make. But he gets caught in a snowstorm, so he decides to go home for the night. His family tells him they don't believe him. And so do they.

The beginning of the movie was confusing and the rest of it was predictable . It was just one of those things where you get to see the characters and you think, “This is great! How did they find this person so fast? This is how they make it all work.”

And I guess what I’m really asking myself is, what was that? Was it a coincidence or was there something interesting going on here? This movie is very, very funny, and very well-written. There are moments that are a little clunky and moments where I just find myself rolling my eyes.

Hope the summary line won't irritate you that much (it's a little homage to the Chappelle Show/Charlie Murphy, but also to the character Daywalker). But I'll try to put all the things I liked about the movie in one paragraph and everything I didn't like in another paragraph, so it will be easier to read! Let's start with the good things! The quote "strong bloody violence" (which is used by rating boards, to describe the content of a movie, does fit here very well. This is not a movie for kids!

I haven't laughed this much in a long time - or seen a film so ineptly made! Talk about so bad it made me laugh!Firstly, I estimate that for about 40 percent of the film's length, I couldn't tell what was happening, or indeed even what I was seeing. I can only describe the camera work as frenetic meets LSD. There are whole segments, minutes long, where all you can see are blurred flashes and fragments of cave wall, people and various other unidentifiable stuff.

As I looked at this movie once again, I think it belongs among Hitchcock's greatest films. The first time I saw it I was just blown away by the suspense, action and imagery. It has the gripping ending, the deranged murderer, the innocent man framed or victimized by circumstances, some great on-location shots, e.g. the Jefferson Memorial in Washington and Penn Central in New York. It also has great supporting actors with Hitch's daughter Patricia in the role of the younger sister to Ruth Roman and the stalwart Leo G. Carroll in another of his Hitchcock movies.

In a nutshell the movie is about a gang war in the 1950's. Leon, the leader of the Deuces, starts the gang after his brother OD's on "junk". He vows to protect the neighborhood. The leader of the rival gang is just getting out of prison and wants revenge.The movie didn't really do it for me. The "Good Guys" weren't any more good than the "Bad Guys". Very little was shown to suggest that the Deuces really cared for the community. I suppose the writers were going for realism here, but I just didn't care which side won.

Dire! Dismal! Awful! Laughable! Disappointing!Right, your trapped in "The Cave" with several "hard" Men and a Woman or two, your being systematically killed by "Something" and you STILL don't get to hear ANY naughty Grown Up words!!! A 15 Cert' here in England, and you could tell!The Egos of the "Macho Men" was just too much, pass the bucket I'm going to be sick.This movie should never be exposed to daylight and ironically, be kept in the darkest, deepest hole in the ground and be forgotten forever.

This film follows the life of a great guitar player, who wants to make it big but acts irresponsibly almost to the point of self destruction.I was expecting the usual Woody Allen witty dialogs, sarcasm and humour, but "Sweet and Lowdown" failed to provide any. The main character, Emmet Ray, is an egocentric, rude, irresponsible and hurtful man. He is so unlikeable, that I do not want to now about him, or care about him. I wonder why a film about him has to be made. The pacing of the story is slow, making the film a terrible bore.

First of all, just let me say this... Ghost Story....hello!? !If any of the other people who trashed this movie from beginning to end realized this fact, their reviews would have been very different. The fact that characters kept disappearing whenever the protagonist turned back to look, should have been a dead giveaway. This movie was not billed as a ghost story when you went to rent it in the video store, not even a hint, and that is the BIGGEST mistake that was made by the studio who marketed it.

I am 17 , and a biased Muppet fan , and while I love Treasure Island , Christmas Carol and The Muppet Movie , I have not yet caught up on the entire Muppets saga. I still remember the day I first saw The Muppets the movie. I can remember the theater was packed with people sitting in their seats waiting for the beginning to begin. As soon as the movie came on I started talking to my neighbor who is a Disney fan. He told me that if I could get me and my buddy to see the movie it would be worth my time.

Other reviewers seem to have held this film in high regard. For something made by an eighteen year old film student, I would say bravo, but that is not the case. If you want to watch a good movie about graffitti stick to the documentaries. It is filmed with the same quality as a digital home video. The two main characters are dismal actors and once again that would be okay if this were a student film. The plot follows a lonely artist who skateboards around Portland writing graffitti. He is joined by another and they skate around together creating art.

Treat Williams reached a degree of stardom with this movie, and really squandered it. Don't be led astray by his poor movie choices since. This movie really stands out. "Hair" is a musical that really deals with the attitude, and probably more so with the persona, of the famed peace movement of the 60's. There is a lot of spectacular music done in spectacular fashion. Unlike the music videos of the late 70's, 80's, and 90's, the video flashes coincide with the subject matter of the music.

So, this is the WORST movie you will probably ever see. It's up there with "Crossbones" and "Southern Comfort", but if your a bad movie fan like I am, this atrocity of a film will be the most fun you've had in years. WHY does the camera make old-school kung fu noises when it zooms? WHY does that random guy stuff a nascar commemorative plate in his bag? And who is he anyway? WHY do the vampires shoot lightning after they die? What is this? Highlander? Dracula McCloud? Who cares!

If we really want to get serious and find Osama Bin Laden, then we should take this stinker down to Gitmo and force the detainees to watch it. They'll be singing within minutes. Of course, I'm sure that making them watch this god-awful dreck violates the Geneva Convention in several ways. Look, my 5 year old daughter isn't allowed to watch TV at home. So take her to her grandparents or cousins and she's a little TV zombie. She got up and walked away after about ten minutes. That's how bad this is.

When a group of businessmen start dying in the presence of the mysterious Mr. Coulomb, FBI agent Dick Martin is assigned to the case. As the deaths continue to mount, Mr. Martin obviously isn't having much success. By the end of the movie, the strange truth is revealed, which I won't reveal here.One of the other users commenting on this states "This is a Classic film and should be ENJOYED and not picked apart". I'm sorry but I have to respectfully disagree with this opinion. It is "classic" only in that it is old, not in any sense pertaining to its quality.

Thank god for this movie . It 's a document of talent that , three decades later , seems even funnier and more poignant than it was a few years ago . there is , as far as i remember from the late eighties , no more than one good joke in the whole damn thing . if you want to hear a few , it is in my collection and i 'll put them here for y'all : ) . there are three really great jokes , but they 're in two distinct parts . the second one is the best : ) .

This movie is about pathetic , spoiled , ego-driven winers who think they have something interesting to say , performed well and even have an interesting story , and then watch their egos destroy the lives of their loved ones at the hands of other egos. It is so pathetic that you almost want it to stop , because there is no way that the story can go any other way! The story is written in the first person, so it feels like an autobiography that you are writing in front of the mirror. I feel like you are in the same movie, and you feel trapped .

When the Legends Die is a powerful, moving story of an orphaned Ute Indian who goes on to become Tom Black Bull, a champion bronc rider. Raised in the old ways, Tom is given a white man's name and must adopt the language and ways of the white man to live in that world. Bitter about the role he has been forced into, Tom finds fulfillment doing one thing, busting horses, riding them to death, in the rodeo. The movie has Richard Widmark in the role of Red, the man who befriends Tom and acts as his manager.

I heard legends about this `` film '' ( quotes used so as not to insult films ) for a long time. In this film, you see a small girl, who lives on the coast of Mexico, trying to get her life started. It is a long journey in the beginning, but she makes it! For the rest of the film I find myself going " WTF !!! " I don't think that the film will be for everyone and I am not recommending it. The movie is beautiful, but I wouldn't want to sit down and watch it while driving.

A magazine columnist who writes about life on her farm house when in fact she lives in a NY apartment must come up with a plan when she learns that her publisher and a war hero will spend Christmas with her. After a slow start, it turns into an entertaining little screwball comedy, thanks to a fine cast. In a big departure from her previous role as a femme fatale in "Double Indemnity," Stanwyck displays a nice comedic flair. Morgan is smooth as the affable war hero while Greenstreet is well cast as the publisher.

As embarrassing as it is to admit , I was listed as production manager on this film ... my very first script ever to be written and directed by a professional director and I had to do the work and find a place to stay to do the film. I had to find a studio for the shoot and then find someone to live with so we could do the filming and the final editing. I had to find a car and find a location to use for the shoot as I didn't own a car and I had to find a place for the crew to live in.

Having worked professionally with young girls on the run, I found this film surprisingly authentic. I would never have found it had a friend not loaned his videotape. There are classic themes here: Coming of Age, Mother/Daughter Estrangement, The Limited Choices of the Underprivileged, Who is the Good Samaritan, Tragedy is in Every Life & the many layers or relationships. Flashbacks are meaningful (when Alice acquires a gun we know she has some familiarity with how to use it) and it does not end in cliché. The cast really "sells" their roles.

I usually spend almost as much time writing my reviews as I do watching the film, but with Today You Die, I feel that doing so would be a criminal waste of my time.So here is a five minute rant about how bad this film is.There was a time in the mid-80s when a single look from Steven Seagal was enough to crack your ribs; a full on scowl could knock you off your feet. If he actually got a hold of you, he would snap you like a twig.These days, although he is still capable of doing considerable damage, he no longer looks the part.

Robert Aldrich 's brutal , quasi-black comedy `` The Grissom Gang '' , a reworking of the 1948 British film of the same name, was a huge hit at the time of its original release in 1948, and continues to attract many of its fans in the decades since. It was not until the mid-1980s that the title of the film's original source material was officially acknowledged. Aldrich began shooting the film back in 1951, but never completed it. The story follows the titular gang of Grissom brothers, along with several other gang members and associates, in the 1950s, when they were part of a nationwide crime organization.

The plot was not good.The special effects weren't.The acting was ... not very good at all.Like others , I felt the movie was rushed (I don't need to explain why...I think I may have seen the movie a few weeks earlier and it wasn't what I had expected). The cast is great, though. I really enjoyed them. I didn't think they had any chemistry with the other characters though. I didn't think they were believable in any scenes. I don't think they did their jobs as actors either, but some scenes did feel a bit rushed.

Disclaimer : During my ventures into foreign cinema , I have taken a liking to a wide variety of movies . However , there are a handful of movies that I have become obsessed with , from a technical aspect , I can’t pick a favorite. In the case of this review , my focus is more on the cinematography than story . There are so many ways to approach a film on its cinematography that it is very hard to pick one or two films to compare . The beauty of it is that you can choose any of them and find something you like .

A film, first and foremost, should be good storytelling. It should be entertaining - and entertaining doesn't necessarily mean "laughs", and it doesn't necessarily mean "light". It basically means you're not bored while watching it. As brilliant as 2001 may be, it is a difficult film to watch, especially for the current (video-game-playing/iPod fumbling) generation. Its slow pace and the sometimes intolerable amount of time it takes for an actor to perform a single action (e.g. the attempt to rescue the crew member floating in space) will stretch your patience.

The Nun is a revenge picture whereby a very strict nun is killed by her rebellious trailer trash charges and the only way to get rid of them is to get to know her. This is part one in a three part mini series, the last part will be coming out on the 29th of October. The last part will give us more of the story which will lead up to her demise. The first part was posted on the 27th of August 2015 and the last part will be out on the 29th of October and will give you a glimpse into what went down.

This movie actually almost made me cry.For starters the fake teeth. Then you spot a nice plastic or drawn set. To make it even more boring all the action is followed by a bright light flash. Then the talking: sound levels are so different, sometimes too hard, then too soft, never exactly good like in good movies. Also, it echoes so much that i think they had one microphone on the entire set. And to make matters worse, EVER heard of stereo? If the camera switches, the sound always stays centered.

The plot involves a new , hipper franchise barbershop that is moving across the street from Calvin 's barbershop . the new shop promises to be the greatest . heres hoping it happens . this is as great as this franchise is going to be . and i'm hoping to be the new best guy at the new place . i got a lot of new ideas for this new franchise . so this is gonna be so good . there are a lot of new guys , but there's one guy here that will really help the franchise to be even better than before .

Irwin Allen put all his talents behind this one: he's co-screenwriter, producer and director of this cartoonish "epic" about an atomic submarine and its efforts to reduce a ring of radiation circling the Earth. Potentially exciting story fails to take off, despite an eclectic cast. Varied players from Walter Pigeon and Joan Fontaine to Frankie Avalon and Barbara Eden are interestingly intermingled and provide a dash of color, but this soggy sci-fi is pretty cheesy. Good for a few stray laughs, but Allen didn't seem to know the difference between strong, solid adventure and campy nonsense.

This film tries to skewer the studio era in Hollywood and the morals of the 1950s. Guy Stone is intended to be a Rock Hudson type, but both the script and actor Matt Letscher end up channeling a smarmy, cruel, baritone-voiced version of George Hamilton instead, which makes for an unpleasant character.Guy Stone is such a reprehensible human being that the audience has trouble liking this waste of human skin. Unlike Hudson, who was sweetly promiscuous, Stone is a hateful person who knowingly uses and then throws away the sweet, handsome young men who share his bed every few hours.Veronica Cartwright is Jerry, Stone's celibate lesbian manager.

The Vietnam War era is certainly far before my time , but it has always interested me , and I am sure that I will always remember it fondly. As we all know, it has left a lasting legacy, and I am very proud to have been a part of that legacy. I don’t really consider myself a Vietnam war historian , I am rather a history buff, and I feel that I am as qualified as anyone to do so. In fact, I am probably more qualified to write a book on the war than anyone else who might write a book.

The St. Francisville Experiment claims "this ain't no walk in the woods", a direct slap in the face of Blair Witch. Where Blair Witch proved to be a film that overworked the viewer's imagination through simple suggestion, The St. Francisville Experiement overworks the viewer's patience. One must say, however, that this is destined to be a camp classic.Warning: Spoiler is forthcoming! !I viewed this movie in a local theater in which the movie's "paranormal consultant" Troy Taylor spoke about the making of the movie.

So bad , it 's entertaining , especially during cocktail hour , and believe me , you 'll need a few glasses of it . But for real , you 'll find yourself wondering why is that so hard to get , why it 's so expensive ? I mean I could of seen it in a restaurant for 5-6 dollars a plate , but it seemed a bit expensive for such a low price point . Then again there were a handful of restaurants that were willing to do a small takeout price , or at least I had seen them , they seemed like good places .

Barbara Stanwyck is a sheer delight in this wartime comedy , about a sailor invited to spend Christmas with a "lady of means" at her holiday home . She arrives, accompanied by her young daughter and her maid, with a gift basket which, it is revealed, contains a secret that she never intended to reveal . What is the secret ? And how does the young lady get rid of it? And how does it relate to the secret she didn't reveal ? And how will it affect the lady in her life ? And what is the lady's reaction when she realises the secret is not hers ?

If you want to see someone accidentally eat another man 's testicle , or look at a row of pathetically deformed genitals, that's just how you're going to do it. "What is this? Is it for food? Or is it something you should not be seen with?" reads a note taped to a door of a man's genitals that appeared on Wednesday in a case in the Central District Court. A man, named "Him," reported that he was bitten by an unknown attacker on March 22, 2012.

It is an interesting exercise to witness the early works of great artists. Sometimes, even without the 20/20 vision that hindsight offers you can see the cogs and wheels that make these people what they are. Following is one such look into the past of Christopher Nolan, one of the great time-warping story-teller of today.Christopher Nolan's style of film-making puts a great deal of emphasis on the delivery of the story. Although people might complain it relies too much on the back-and-forth shifting of time, I still find it fascinating to see how he uses that one technique differently each time.

I bought this film as I thought the cast was decent and I like Jennifer Rubin & Patsy Kensit.First off let me say the acting is not of a high standard. Stephen Baldwin makes his character look almost retarded at times and at other times morose. Patsy Kensit is so-so but not too convincing in some scenes, and the supposed poetry she spouts in a particular scene in her Hotel Room is utterly meaningless rubbish. Ms Kensit is certainly very suggestive and sexy here but ultimately I think Jennifer Rubin is by far the best in this film.

I thought I was going to see a UFO movie. Instead, I saw a movie that was trying to make the audience (me) make the decision to accept Christ in my life, or risk going to Hell. The whole UFO thing was one big red herring!!! The acting in it was pretty pathetic. In fact, it looked as though some people from an Evangelic Church just got got together and decided they wanted to make a movie. All the characters talked as though they were in church conversing with other church members. It wasn't real-life dialog at all.

Caught this film on TCM in the early A.M. It was amazing.Starting out slow but ominously.... Scott is a shady character who preys on women. In this case, two women who happen to be due an inheritance in Southern California.The sets of the beach and neighborhoods of the 1940's are original and intriguing. The title may have been more creative, but the theme and nefarious shadows of human nature are intriguingly exposed, almost in a Hitchcockian version.Scott reminded me of the character Uncle Charley in "Shadow of a Doubt", one of Hitch's reputed favorite films.

This is by far the funniest sitcom that has ever aired on TV. I own all 9 seasons on DVD and literally could watch them over and over. Anyone who does not find this show hilarious, heartwarming, entertaining, and laugh out loud hysterical, is crazy! Kevin James is absolutely one of the most talented comedians out there. My boyfriend and I love going to stand up comedy shows in Boston (where we live) and have seen Kevin James twice and his brother Gary Valentine (Danny) once. They are both so unbelievably talented and just plan smart with their work.

Dolemite is awesome . Rudy Ray Moore 's rhymin kung fu pimp with horrible choreographed action sequences is about as awesome as they come. It's not so much a film as a dance. It isn't so much about a story but about the choreography of a fight scene. It's about how much can be done with a dance movement. Rudy was not just an awesome choreographer he was a great choreographer. The whole time I was watching this film I was hoping he'd go down fighting. I couldn't get that out of my head. I was excited about the fights.

It starts a little slow but give it a chance . In the spirit of the `` Wackiest Ship in the Wackiest World `` I'm going to try something different . The Wacky and the wackiest ship of all. All I ask is for you to join me . . . I would like to invite any and every person who is interested in this challenge to join the fun. I am looking for anyone who is interested in this challenge on the site or in IRC . The challenge will have the theme of the month of February. 1.

Eddie Fischer was simply bad . Possibly the worst scene came early in the movie when he broke into a home, beat up the family of one of the children, and took all the food that they had put out the night before. You would think this would have been the first time he’s broken into somebody’s house, but after that you can see that it was only a few times in the course of his life before he finally put an end to those poor people and their family. There were so many scenes like this that it made it into a movie.

This movie tries its darndest to capture that classic bad canadian movie feel : '' quirky '' and obnoxious characters, a great story, and it is all made to make you wonder '' why is this guy still doing this in this country''. But you know what you can do when you find yourself in a place like this, with this kind of scenery, with this kind of atmosphere? You can '' get up and start writing a book.'' I think that is exactly what these people are doing with their lives.

Okay , make no mistake - this is a pretty awful film , but I actually thought it had a pretty good story. I mean, there are moments here and there that feel rushed, and not enough focus on how the plot is tied together. The script is good , but if I'm not mistaken it does not feel like it has much in it to tie everything together, even though I know the director has put alot into it. The ending is also a bit cheesy. And I can't really tell you how much of it I loved.

This new movie by Jeskid is awesome! Check it out and you'll be amazed. The story of Emily Waters, once a girl from a broken home, whose only means of escape from an abusive father was through her sketchbook. Until one night her drawings manifested into reality and saved her, and now using this power she fights against those who would do evil. Both live action film and hand drawn animation blend together to create a unique and original experience that will shake your soul and blow you away. The music is incredible as well, it really intesifies the emotional experience and draws you deep into the conflict.

This was an interesting movie . I could have done without the bathroom scene and the seduction scene - EWWWWW! - but they did a good job of building up the suspense. I enjoyed it and I have a few of the scenes, so it is on my shortlist for viewing. But I am not a fan of the movie overall . I liked it at first but I found myself wishing the movie went a little faster . If you liked it, it's on DVD, and if you don't, there are many, many other movies like this that you won't care for!

Red Skelton ( in his first starring role ) plays Wally Benton who plays 'The Fox ' on a radio-show called the Fox Hour. The Fox Hour airs every weekday morning from 9:30 to 11:30am in most areas. The series premiered in January 1964. In September of that year, the first episode was transmitted. The series was revived in May 1971. In January 1978, the series was transferred from CBS to ABC, for which the Fox Hour was cancelled. The show then began airing in syndication, from September 1979 to May 1981.

First of all , just let me say this ... Ghost Story .... hello ! ? ! If any of you out there want to help me out with this script I will really appreciate it. I have been doing this script for the last 2 years and would really appreciate it if people could give it a whirl and share their results with me ! I would really appreciate it !! I have also been thinking a lot about creating a short story script to use for a project I've been talking with a couple friends about and I'd really like to use this to create something.

While the premise of the film sounded unique and intriguing after watching the first 5 minutes of the film I could have stopped there and gone on with my life. She does get some interesting comments and reactions from her subjects, but not really enough to add to the validity of the film.I also felt she went a bit overboard with many things. If a guy said a filthy comment, grabbed her, or made some disgusting gesture to her, I would say go for it, bring him down, he's a pig.

I kept waiting for the film to move me, inspire me, shock me, sadden me in some way but it stirred none of my emotions. It just meandered along to the end. None of the characters seemed very unique or complex, they just seemed like actors reciting their lines. I think it could have been a better movie if the characters expressed more emotion. The only one who did and was believable was the veteran and he probably committed suicide just to get out of the movie as soon as he could. It was a waste of talent, film, their time, and mine.

This film is enjoyable if you like poverty row , public domain films from the first half of the 20th century. But it is more enjoyable if you like films of another era. It is a bit of a shock to me that a film like this has never been released on DVD. But it would be a lot more fun if it had been released on DVD, because it would make for a more enjoyable film. It would even give it more credibility if it was released on DVD. However, if it was released as part of a box set, it probably wouldn't make for much.

Ever watched something so awful you just have to keep watching to be sure it really is as bad as it looks? This is one of those films. It was slammed by the critics on it's release, not least for the way it was funded. I caught it on TV last night and gave in to curiosity.In the event, it is what it says on the box, no more nor less: low level humour, crudity, very much in the 'Carry On...' vein but with 'adult' language.

Mixed group of "experts" (explorers, divers and scientists) venture a mile underground and go another 2.4 miles underwater to a spot even more remote, where they find salamanders, giant albino moles (??) and some big, razor-fanged, winged, computer generated creatures lurking about. The cave is sealed off by a rockslide and then the monsters attack and start killing everyone off as they search for an exit. And that's all she wrote with this low-aiming effort that even fails to combine action, science fiction and horror on the most elementary of levels.

After seeing the Harry Potter movies, I've been a fan of the trio actors Rupert Grint, Daniel Radcliffe and Emma Watson; yet, we've been waiting to see if they would do other projects besides play the same characters year or every two years of the J.K. Rowling series. Mainly instead of a trio, the cameras and magazine articles concentrate more on Daniel and Emma, being that they're the leading male and only leading female in the saga leaving Rupert dead-end. No matter, every actor has a time to shine and Rupert's light hits him for once in this movie.

It's hard and I didn't expect it... But it's really the worst film, me and my wife saw. Awful dialogs that extend incomprehensibly through time without any apparent reason except to fill time. The storytelling doesn't follow a comprehensive intelligibly way everything is a mess. The action and the dialogs appear at jumps. The thing that disappointed me most was to see Dominique Pinon one of my French favorite actors involved in this uh I don't even know how to describe it without being polite The rest of the actors where at the most poor.

My first warning should have been that this dvd was on sale for $5.00. But since it featured Sandra Bullock, who I generally like, I bought it. My disappointment with the film began almost immediately. The dialogues are slow and stiff. The color is distorted. I kept adjusting the volume to hear the conversations. The acting is amateurish. Even the killing scenes are a failure. Twice, dead people moved their legs. When my cash-deficient daughter offered me a dollar to turn off the movie, I immediately and joyfully complied. This is an amazingly bad movie.

I saw this movie on a show that was showing bad B-movies and trying to get you to buy them. I have to confess, I was pretty shocked at how bad this was. It wasn't terrible, it's not even really that good, but I didn't see anything else that was even remotely bad that they were showing. I saw the trailers, but I didn't think anything was worth the time or effort, so I stopped watching it. However, I saw it when it came out and it made a lot of sense.

RIFIFI ( Jules Dassin - France 1955 ) To me , it seems a very risky idea to attempt a film on such an idea. So much of what I see on the news of the world is not true. It seems to me that there are some things that are not really true but I still feel like they are important. This is why we need to be able to see films that give a true account of what is going on in this day in order for us to know what to expect. A true film is the most truthful of all documentary films.

I used to think that it couldn't get worse that "Army of the Dead" but this load of crap makes the afore mentioned movie look like "The Godfather"!! The special effects are HORRIBLE (Makes the original Nintendo graphics look like HDTV). When it comes the acting, put it this way, I went to a play with my 6 year old niece in it and she gave an Oscar worthy performance, when compared to these D-List (and that's being kind about it) actors and actresses.
