I was a still photographer working in Europe the summer that Jim Salter shot the movie Three.I did some swell pictures for him, one of which I was told became the poster for the movie. I didn't see the film until years later. I thought it was bad. A pity, because the elements that went into it were compelling. Robie Porter's girlfriend was almast as beautiful as Rampling herself. Salter asked if I would stick around and be an extra cameraman so they wouldn't have to shoot everything twice. I said sure, but I had to return to NY, promising I'd be back.

Having enjoyed Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqatsi I was looking forward to this third part of the Qatsi trilogy and seeing what would be included. My expectations were not disappointed and it looks to be an interesting set. The first book in the Qatsi Saga was published in English in 2008. In 2014, there was a re-print in the UK, as well as a paperback and ebook version, and a re-release in the US. There was also a new hard cover edition. There have been no new Qatsi releases so far since then. QATSI

The QATSI is a series of four books, published in English in 2013 and 2014.

Like the beauty of the jungle, Jessica Alba's gorgeous smile and sultry looks loom over the film, but alas they are the only two things worth watching this film for. When in theory we should be watching for the narrative.The plot is thin on the ground, and hard to believe. As beautiful as Jessica Alba is, she doesn't add any of the spark that she injected into the credible 'Dark Angel' series. Since Dark Angel it seems that Alba has been reduced to mere eye candy(but what eye candy!

There is not much to say about this one except that it is probably the worst of the early spate of zombie movies (I may get to watch another one, REVOLT OF THE ZOMBIES [1936], before the month is out). For all star John Carradine's intention of building an army in the service of the Third Reich with them, they are not seen to do much at all! ; James Baskett (Uncle Remus from SONG OF THE SOUTH [1946]!) plays their leader, who also serves as Carradine's manservant.

Ohhhh MAN this movie is awful ! ! This kind of tripe is what gives Canadian Cinema a bad name. This movie was full of horrible scenes, disgusting acting, disgusting characters, poor writing, and no substance. It was not good and it is not getting any good reviews. The film was a complete waste of time and money. It is not worth watching for those who are looking for great entertainment and fun. If you're interested in reading a review, you can look at the one posted on the site. I don't have an online review, just a transcript.

I would like to know if "The Outsiders" (Australian TV series) will ever be released on DVD sometime in the future? And is the music (Title Theme) available on CD?There was only one series of 13 episodes of this drama and should have gone on to at least three or even four series in total.The Young German Actor in the series was also in a German TV series called "Black Forest Clinic" which aired here in the UK with English dialogue superimposed with the lip-sync. I look forward to hearing any comments from TV Industry personnel on the above questions, thank you in advance.

I 've seen various Hamlets , and I 've taught the play . As I watch Jacobi , I 'm not so sure what to think . The first thing that strikes me is the fact that the young girl , who seems to be playing a part, is not the daughter of the playwright 's brother. She is a member of a different generation. I think it is interesting , but I can see it as just another Hamlet . This one has a different cast . I would think that Hamlet's family would have more influence on the course of his destiny.

I found it almost impossible to empathize with Ricci's character in this film. If she was supposed to be a depressive, I think the screenwriter and director neglected to research depressives before making this film because Ricci's character was more a depiction of a self-centered, worthless sh!tbag than a victim and survivor of depression.The forced attempt at introspective narration was as ludicrous as the pained interactions between her and the people around her. Sorry but I couldn't buy it. This is straight to video schlock. I'm glad I didn't pay to see this.

JURASSIC PARK III * ___ Adventure Sam Nell ( The Dish ) , William Macy ( Happy Texas , Fargo ) and Peter Ustinov ( Downton Abbey ) star, and this weekend sees the three stars take a trip to New York. *

It sounds like it could be pretty good, but don’t take it from me; it could be bad. It’s the third installment of the three-part adventure series that will see an all-new cast. The show’s stars — William Macy , Sam Nell and Peter Ustinov — are looking to show off the rest of the team at the end of this series.

A very interesting plot of the film based on the novel "Waltz into Darkness" of the writer Cornell Woolrich. It is a drama rather than a film noir, which tries to send a message that love changes your own life, i.e. your love to any person and the love you received from him/her. A wealthy man really changed his life for love, while his partner finally understood that he was the only one that loved her. Belmondo played well as usual, while a somewhat still young Michel Bouquet played his eternal role of a detective or police agent.

I saw this film at the 2004 Toronto International Film Festival . Since I work in the wine business , I’m always interested to find new wines to try and this is a good reason to see a film I am already a fan of . I was expecting a bit more romance than what was there , although there were moments of suspense . And if I had to nitpick , I’d just have to say that the characters aren’t well-developed . It’s too much the same. But I’m always glad to see things like that in a film .

This movie is an example of small budget , ineffective star cast , weak storyline and poor entertainment . This movie is made up of two parts . The first part is great entertainment but the other part is just soo bad . The movie is not about how much you love your kids but how you want your children to have happiness and love for each other , no matter how you are feeling about it . This film was created for the kids to watch but I think its too much for them . Kids need to feel something for each other .

If you decide to watch Wild Rebels , do n't expect anything deep and meaningful . If you 're looking for an exciting, action-packed sci-fi flick, there's nothing in that genre that will satisfy you. But if you don't want to be left wondering what happens next , that's fine. Wild Rebels won't ruin the movie genre, but it won't leave you breathless either. That is if you're looking for a good, old-fashioned Sci-Fi movie that has a bit of humor and a whole lot of drama. Here's what Wild Rebels might have in it.

I have had more boring stretches of 80 minutes in my life , but none are coming to mind right now that I would rather go to a football match then go to church! There will be no other game on the TV in my life! That is the way I feel, and that is the way I will live my life , for the next few months! Monday, 3 April 2015

If you are a Christian you are well aware of the fact that God is love. All that is required to prove it is to be able to demonstrate how God is love.

No matter what other people have said you can't review this movie without comparing it to the original, if it existed on it's own it would be a 2-3 out of 5 film but it is a remake of a 4-5 out of 5 film and so has standards to live up to and we need to see if it reached those standards. If the film was a re-working or, as in Planet of the Apes, a re-imagining of the original you would be able to look at the film in it's own right, only referencing the original.

Director Kinji Fukasaku is perhaps best known, in his homeland at least, for his Japanese gangster films, a series with which this movie shares a number of characteristics. Violence and political intrigue are themes throughout both Shogun's Samurai and Battles Without Honor and Humanity, and both feature a lead character who finds his loyalties challenged by betrayals. Both films also feature a large number of characters who seem to have little purpose but to die, and since so little is done to develop them, their deaths have little impact when they do come. This film has other flaws as well.

I usually seek to find good in movies , even the bad ones.Unfortunately this movie is one where I fail. There is always that one moment that sticks out like a sore thumb ,but I think it wasn’t as effective as many of my favorites. This one isn’t that bad. What’s your favorite movie? A little about the movie. It opens with a couple walking out the front doors of their hotel. They have just come home for the day after a day of touring Europe and their friends and loved ones.

Brett Piper again makes a very good film that is trashed by the so called film `` experts . '' He is back with yet another film where he has to keep up with the plot of a film. He seems to like his work and that is why he continues with it. The plot is simple as he keeps repeating it. I would say it is a good plot and good film. I like a good plot, and this one is good. It is a good plot with good acting by the lead actors. The film has a good script and a decent cast.

Apparently SHRUNKEN HEADS was the last movie that Julius Harris had a role in . I have not seen all of his other movies, but I have seen parts of them. SHRUNKEN HEADS did not have a great reputation in the film world. I think the reason that he is so beloved in Hollywood and he is still a household name is because of his incredible work in films like THE STREET ON THE EDGE OF THE DESERT, the original STAR WARS, and I think it was THE MISSION OF RAPUNZEL that made him famous, along with his fantastic voice and acting work in films like THE HISTORICAL MISTAKES.

Oh f*cking hell, where should I start... First of all; this show is just another stupid American non-funny so called comedy which has pathetic acting and very very poor humor. The American way of laughing-track business makes the whole thing even worse. How come I can hear laughter, yet there's nothing funny happening? Pretty stupid, eh? This show is only for those American people who haven't ever heard that there are far more funnier, better and wittier comedies - not only in Great Brittain, but also in America (The Simpsons for example).

Is it possible for a movie to get any worse than this? There's a bunch of apes wandering about, mumbling b******, acting supposedly silly and we are supposed to laugh? There is no plot here to keep you going in the first place. Even when the women finally show up, there is no sign of improvement; the most expected things happen and by the time the film is over, you might be far asleep. Beware: this is not a trashy cult movie, this is trash -period!

In Reunion Island in the Indian Ocean , the owner of a cigarette factory Louis Mahé ( Jean-Paul Belmondo ) arrives at his factory, which has been taken over by the state. His former employees, who were workers of the previous regime, are waiting for him. He decides to stay for two days and to pay his taxes. But when he is invited to the main house of the local government, he decides to flee. The film opens with the sound of gunshots in the distance, and then, in the second and third scenes, the sounds of helicopters and tanks moving into the city.

I have to agree with the previous author's comments about the excellent performances and plot. Started watching this movie by accident...(lazy Sunday afternoon clicking channels to see if anything good was on)...and was mesmerized by Martin Sheen and Emilio Estevez. Wow! Gut wrenching! Kudos to everyone (have always admired Martin Sheen) but was particularly impressed with Emilio! Excellent job of acting and directing...simply superb! So why have I never heard of this movie before? I'll have to spread the news.

Great book, poorly done movie. Cheesy performances and contrived situations make this movie a sentimental bore-fest. Flat and uninspired work from most of the actors leaves this film in the After School Special category. No doubt there is a lot of talent to be tapped in this cast and crew but something went horribly wrong The very talented Gretchen Mol attempts to pull this film out of the mire but even she can't seem to rise above the silly dialogue. Feels like everyone just phoned it in. Even the makeup (Mulrooney ages 20 years over the course of the film) looks amateurish and crude.

For the first time in reviewing films , I found myself immediately uninterested in this story . I do n't know how much of the original story is retained from the theatrical version , I don't know who wrote the screenplay , I am not sure if they made any attempt to recreate the dialogue , but it wasn't necessary for this story , there were so many scenes from the original story that are not reproduced , they are all re-used. I understand why some of the actors were recut , but it should not have happened

I would have preferred a shorter film , just to keep the film length .

Crispin Glovers' way of acting (and not only his) is tremendous. You really want to believe him because his body language and performing fits the person perfect. He gives Layne this extraordinary bit of personality that makes this movie a cult. As well as Feck, which role is done very well by Dennis Hopper. It's about choosing the right or wrong side, without logical thinking about the scene. Friendship is more imported, and that's exactly what I think is what makes choices this difficult. Rivers Edge lets you experience this with serious tones and family mathers.

As was mentioned by others, could there be any other reason to see this film other than to see former "Wayne's World" star Mike Myers play a serious role? The story line is interesting but lacks development and is sabotaged by loose ends and bad characters. If there was any good scenic shots of Ireland then it would give it another reason to see it. But instead it focuses on a little normal village that is obviously surrounded by the 'green pastures' of the Emerald-Isle that are often shown in Irish films.

Mickey Rourke ( who was once a famous movie star ) plays Martin Fallon an IRA terrorist who accidentally blows up a school bus full of children who is so disgusted by his actions decides to leave the IRA and goes on the run in London !!!! MILD SPOILERS !!! !The movie's opening is rather disturbing as the lives of little children are ended in a fireball . Things like this happened throughout the 1970s and 1980s and into the 1990s in Northern Ireland which gives A PRAYER FOR THE DYING a stark realism . However as soon as Fallon decides he's going to give up violence ( What ?

I must have been in a good mood to give this shameful, predictable, embarrassing movie even a 3. What's wrong with it? Let's start with the gratuitous sex although I admit the rotational style of bonking was something I had not seen (nor experienced) before. And I guess they also saved a few bucks by showing the same sex scene three times. Then there are the inconsistencies. The "Oakville Tribune" seems to be in a green part of whatever town it was supposed to be. (Hamilton Ontario???)

Despite the all-star cast, this attempt at epic fails. It comes across as a set of flat cartoon stereotypes strung together by an all too, too clever social commentary. It's as if with every bit of dialogue and introduction to a new character the writer peeks out and says "Isn't that clever? Am I not smart? Isn't that biting social commentary?" And,sadly, the answer is always "Ummmm...no." Wearying self-absorbing stuff that is more like soap opera (in the worst sense of the term) than a movie...and an obvious attempt at television immortality.

This movie has a very deep look at the relationships between a mother who was raised in a Christian environment, and her daughter, who, as a young woman, was raised in a very traditional Christian environment and then she went through a period in her life where she was forced to come to a point of self-exploration and spiritual discovery. What I like very much about the relationship between the mother and daughter in this movie is this: it is not so much a spiritual relationship as it is a relationship of love and trust based on a very deep trust in God’s character.

I really like the show ! ! As a part of Greek Life , I can say that some things I didn’t like ,but there is great things in it ! What I like: – I really liked the characters. I like them. It was interesting to meet them. I’ve read a lot of books about their lives and I liked some of it and some of it, but I liked the book more than the characters. It’s a great story that you can pick up and learn from.

when this show first came to Disney, i love it started watching all the time. It quickly became one of my favorite Disney shows ever but this show somehow transformed into something that is disturbing and disappointing.I do now find any of the second and third season fun, they seem like a re-watch of some teens shows. I hat that garbage. The first season was very unique because it showed Sadie who loved science and animals and creatures. The first season was very entertaining. I mostly don't like the second season because of Ben. He annoys me and pisses the crap outta me.

I did have some expectations from this film because 1. It was a Yash raj production 2. When the songs were first shown on TV, they seemed catchy 3. The star(??!) cast was new. Well, I must tell u that I just couldn't sit through this movie. Uday, (with his red lips-what were the make up artists thinking???!) tries hard to look cool but fails miserably. I won't even get started on his acting (if u can call it that).

In Everything Is Illuminated, Elijah Wood plays Jonathan Foer, a Jewish American who is looking for the woman who saved his grandfather during WWII. In a sense, the woman that saved his entire family.This is a heart-felt tale about someone who is on a seemingly hopeless journey. A stranger in a strange land so to speak. Jonathan is not entirely prepared for this adventure, he sticks out like a sore thumb in the Ukraine (he would probably stick out like a sore thumb anywhere). But what he discovers is more, much more than he anticipated.

Even my five year old was bored.Very predictable , and overacted . This movie could n't make up it 's loss. I saw the second one too. The original one was a bit much for me. The third one was so much better .The first one was good enough for me but not really enough. The third was better.The fourth one had some really good stuff in it,but I felt the story was a bit overacted .I would re watch it again, but it is really hard to understand what is going on . In my opinion , the story is too long.

I found this an awfully disappointing experience! But I have appended a better option of similar style at the foot of this entry.This "Felicia's Journey" is intriguing. It has drama. But it is full of stereo-types! So it ONLY serves judgemental temperaments without concern for truer justice & fairness & truth, beyond black 'n' white judgements that fit 30-second ads of "NEWS" that dot our multimedia experiences everyday, especially news bulletins, true or misleading in such depictions! It is SO EXAGGERATED, it reminds me of the fairytale of "Little Red Ridinghood"!

Beautiful....that one word pretty much sums up this whole film. Everything from the cinematography, the directing, the acting.....brilliant. At any point of the film, you can pause it, and you will no doubt be looking at something mosaic or "artsy fartsy" as some people would say. I assure you, that after one viewing, "Bobbycrush" will be stuck in your head. I know this from first hand experience. Even the soundtrack is great. It goes together very well with the tone and pace of the film.

This is one of the best episodes from the entire X-Files series , creepy beyond words . The tension and fear is so well handled and the ending leaves the viewer breathless . What I liked most about it, was the characters that were introduced to the world, and how the way they were portrayed, they made sense . It was a very well crafted episode , and I hope you enjoy the rest of the series . I really recommend it, it is a great series , and one that should not be missed. This is a fantastic episode from the beginning of the series.

This is seriously the worst movie I have ever seen , right from the start the movie goes straight down to the point that you are not going to believe it , even after the first 5 minutes I was like “this is not a movie” and it kept going like that until the end. The story is just not going to make a lot of sense to anyone without knowing the story first , the story is just not very good. This is not the greatest film I have ever seen but I will give this a 10 out of 10.

The first thing you should know about `` Zipperface '' is that it was shot on video , so it has nothing to do with the movie and the story doesn't revolve around the character. There is, of course, a little movie-related trivia, but it's better to get it all out of the way now, so you can see the movie. The movie opens on a train heading north to Chicago , where the story takes place. There is a young woman whose life is completely different from what most people know.

NBC should be ashamed. I wouldn't allow my children to see this. I definitely would tell my church to stay away. This movie is proof as to why NBC has always been a 3rd rate network The producers, actors, and writers should get on their knees and beg God's forgiveness for making this work of fiction. There were no pirates. Noah's wife didn't parade around on the deck of the ark. The ark had NO deck. Lot wasn't even born when this event took place. Did anyone attached to this project try reading the Bible?

Countenance! Antoine Monot, in a copycat impersonation of Kevin Smith's Silent Bob, keeps asking for it, but writer/director Christian Zübert never listens. Zübert just can't say no to a joke, no matter how cheap. The best thing about this movie is its soundtrack. Of course, Joey Burns of Calexico and the divine Jonathan Richman, understated old-school bard of "There's something about Mary" fame, would grace any small-town dropout story. In visual allure, Stefan (Lukas Gregorowicz) looks cool enough riding his tan six-series BMW two-door, wearing aviator shades, going nowhere.

This movie has some good performances, as others have pointed out, but suffers (as others have pointed out, except for the people who apparently are either friends of the filmmaker or the cast to otherwise explain why they would deem this a "10") from some self-conscious and self-absorbed film school padding and excess plots. This is the type of plot that Sex In The City could handle in a half hour episode, so there was no reason for it to be even an 88 minute movie. A perfect example of wasted footage is the fast forwarding montage in the first third of the movie.

OK , this movie , was the worst display I have seen in years . The actors were n't to great , the sets were small , the scenes were weak , the story seemed like it was in its infancy . but I am so glad that it's here . I think that I might have had the best time I have had since I began watching this movie . and I don't want to hear any whining about how terrible it is . This is one of my all-time favorites . and it should be in all the dvds .

It might be that the film I saw was entirely different from the one that the others saw, however as the actors are the same I can only think that the cut I saw in Europe differed from the one circulating in the US.Anyway, this was the worst movie that I saw the past five years. (Closely followed by The Waterboy...)Why: Because in my opinion this director has taken elements from every thriller preceding this one, mixed them, put the in the wrong order with the wrong music and published it. (Examples: nothing happends, the music gets scary, and still nothing happends.

I'm trying to understand what people liked about MirrorMask. I am an avid film viewer and hobbyist film maker. As I was telling friends during my lunch hour, MirrorMask may well be my biggest movie disappointment of the year. Just like the short Moongirl, the film missed its marks. Several times during the movie it made attempts at humor. It sets you up for the laugh. Instead of making you laugh, it leaves you feeling empty. The jokes reminded one of the recent Star Wars films. They weren't funny unless you were five.

I watched this movie knowing that it would be awful , but damned if it did n't break new and exciting ground! This is one of the best movie I have watched this year. It has a great storyline, very well acted, very entertaining and has great scenes. The actors are all really good. I would highly recommend you to see this movie to your loved ones or yourself. Great job to make it a huge hit!!! It is a must see if you are a die hard fan of Korean dramas. Sang-ok is one of my favorites.

The third and final Female Prisoner Scorpion film directed by Shunya Ito. The series' star, Meiko Kaji, would complete the series in the fourth installment, Grudge Song, directed by the capable Yasuhara Hasebe (who also directed Kaji in the excellent Stray Cat Rock: Sex Hunter). The original Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion is one of my all-time favorites. The sequel, Jailhouse 41, is nearly as good. It's generally considered the best of the series, and I might agree, I think, if it ever gets a better release on DVD (the original, by Image, is very poor).

Is it really possible that so many people in this film believe that the girl is a witch? Just because she has dark hair and wears dark make up she is supposed to be a witch? And I got the impression that the film tries to present her as someone who is "different", someone nobody understands... She is just a teenager and some dumb girl in her high school says she is a witch and everyone believes her. Besides, Brandi is either portrayed very badly or the character itself is made to be so... Fake.

In Truffaut book-length interview with Hitchcock, it's apparent that Big Al's fear from the police dates back to his childhood. His father sent him to the police station carrying a note. The note said: "He's been naughty, imprison him for an hour." The policemen obliged and ever since Hitchcock has had a deep fear of being wrongly accused and taken by the police. "Strangers on a Train" is probably one of the best in his "wrongly-accused" series. The movie is based on a Patricia Highsmith novel. That's the same author who wrote the Ripley series.

`` Flashdance '' meets `` Meatballs III '' or maybe it should just be called `` Meatballs IV '' . This is not the game I was looking for. The gameplay is great but there is a big problem with the graphics. For starters the game looks old and ugly. To start the game you have to get through several levels until you get to a level where you have to shoot out the enemies. Once you do that your game becomes very challenging. I would recommend that you start playing with at least five players and have the game end after you finish playing with them.

The movie eXistenZ is about a futuristic video game on a `` pod '' system that is almost like virtual reality. The game is played by one player, which is controlled by an avatar that appears as a human or an android. The avatar is basically just a holographic image created in 3D by a game developer. eXistenZ features two very different protagonists. In one version, played by a man in his 20s, the avatar looks like an ordinary man. However, he is able to move his hands, talk, make gestures, and even talk to the player through an audio link.

Pete's Meteor. I seen this referred to as "authentic" and a "gem." I caught this movie on a Saturday afternoon. I kinda wished that I didn't.Apparently this was noted as being Mike Myers' first dramatic role. Unfortunately it had to be this movie. The first thing you'll notice that Pete's Meteor suffers from is a complete lack of plot. Or rather, a bunch of little subplots that aren't really connected and don't go anywhere. Young orphan Mickey lives with his younger brother and sister with their grandmother.

Writer/director John Milius takes a little-known incident from American history and extrapolates wildly in all the right ways. The result is a grand adventure tale that showcases two of its stars in memorable, larger-than-life roles: Sean Connery as the wily Arab sheik with an inexplicable Scottish brogue, and Brian Keith as President Theodore Roosevelt, itching for the chance to put that "big stick" to good use.Aided immeasurably by Billy Williams' glorious widescreen cinematography and a magnificent score by the always reliable Jerry Goldsmith, this early effort seemed the harbinger of a talent to rank with contemporaries Lucas, Coppola and Spielberg.

I recently got the movie and all I can say it is a good movie. There's a lot of famous Rome monuments and historical locations.It is from the same writer and director from The Da Vinci Code. Tom Hanks stars along with Ewan McGregor and Ayelet Zurer. The movie starts out with the space and time experiment in Sweden until one of the canisters is stolen by the church's most hated enemy the Illuminati. The plot is hard to discuss about without spoiling anything. Its a race all of Rome following the Illuminati trail to get to the Illuminati secret meeting place.

I logged on here right after watching this movie, feeling that it was so awful that at least its reviews might be entertaining. But all you miscreants appear to kind of like it. And so, since I want the job done right...From the opening shot, the movie establishes its contempt for the audience's attention span by showing an entirely unremarkable picture of an irrelevant bridge for a long, long time. Then it goes to some slow-motion skateboarding, which is at least a little bit cool, but then offsets that glimmer of excitement by overlaying the most repellent soundtrack song I've ever heard.

Mickey Rourke is enjoying a renaissance at the moment ... and fair play to him . I always liked his work and was never a huge fan of many of his movies. However, if you've never seen his work, it's something to check out and enjoy for the sake of it. He's in a whole different league as an actor. This is the type of stuff he's capable of doing with a voice. I like it. You'll be surprised when you hear about the new Mickey Rourke movie in the spring. What did they say at ComicCon?

Don't get me wrong, I assumed this movie would be stupid, I honestly did, I gave it an incredibly low standard to meet. The only reason I even saw it was because there were a bunch of girls going (different story for a different time). As I began watching I noticed something, this film was terrible. Now there are two types of terrible, there's Freddy vs. Jason terrible, where you and your friends sit back and laugh and joke about how terrible it is, and then there is a movie like this.

This is one of the worst movies I've seen in a while. The acting was just soooo bad. Anthonie Kamerling is usually a fairly good actor, but in this film, he sounded like he was reading his text from a piece of paper. Especially his voice over was extremely wooden. Beau van Erven Dorens was completely over the top as frat boy Fraser, although this probably had more to do with the crappy dialogue. 'Ik ook van jou' is an adaptation of a book, and it seem like the makers of the film forgot that film dialogue follows different rules than literary dialogue.

Man with the Screaming Brain certainly is n't a perfect movie , but I 'm pretty sure it was never intended for the general public to enjoy. The idea that an alien could have brain damage, and not die, would seem ridiculous to most, I know, but when you add it to this idea that it would be something as horrible as that... It was meant to be funny, which is fine, but it should never have been intended for everyone to laugh at its absurdity. There's something really sad about a movie that is a complete disaster from beginning to end.

Eight Legged Freaks is a modern monster movie , like a remake of any of the old 'Attack of the 50' monster movies that came before it. What is different is that it has no monster to scare you, it's about three guys in their early twenties who try to get to know each other before moving on to other things. This is the third film based off of the original story and it doesn't disappoint, though I'm not sure how many of the things they're doing are actually real.

One of the worst movie I have seen in 2009 so far: The story hesitates between a silly thriller or a dumb comedy.As nothings happens, the void is filled with long, boring dialogs that don't make any sense! The cast is famous but doesn't bring any emotions except to fast-forward the play! And it happens in a plush seaside hotel that looks really gloomy. In comparison, the one of the "Shining" is funfair! NB: a lot of users think that it is located in the French Riviera! They are wrong!

This film has it 's heart in the right place , but unfortunately , it is n't much of a comedy ! !!! It was ok at one point ,but as the plot goes on , it just falls apart ! I think what really makes the film enjoyable are the performances , even when the characters seem ridiculous , they still give it some charm. !!! This movie is definitely not for everyone , as some of the dialogue is rather ridiculous . !!! And there is no one in it who has any acting skills ! !!!

So well done. The photography, sound, music and the performances were the best. It's also an amusing story line that brings a smile to your face with each scene--I loved it and I'm a 60 year old heterosexual guy. Each character seemed to fit their part to a tee. It's the best performance that I've seen from Ms. Capshaw--she's been in more movies than I thought, but this was a wonderful achievement. I suppose it's a plus to have Spielberg money behind you allowing for a fat budget and all the best that money can buy technically.

Spoof films have come so far since Mel Brooks in 'The Producers' (1968) said "Don't be stupid, be a smartie. Come and join the nazi party". It brought us delightful films, such as 'Young Frankenstein', 'Airplane! ', and even 'Naked Gun'. But the good die young. Luckily, the genre managed to make it all the way up to the end of the 90's. And then... the Wayan's Brothers unleashed the apocalypse: 'Scary Movie'. Suddenly the word spoof was an innuendo for crude sex jokes.

The worst film I have seen in the last 12 months . The plot of the story was uninteresting , but the actors were so boring , I can not even describe how bad it was . The lead actor of the film was so forgettable . I had not seen a film like this before and I have been watching movies like this for a long time . I really hated this film . The story of the film was very interesting , but the acting was so bad . The actors were supposed to be very good , and they were not , they were just a bunch of bad actors .

This movie twists the facts of Anne and Mary's lives into something unrecognizable. To make Mary Boleyn, who in fact was a rather dim and foolish creature, and make her the "good" sister is just silly. It is Anne who was in fact the far more interesting character, and that is why it is her life, and not Mary's, that has been told so often.In response to an earlier review, I fail to see how Anne's life was so "criminal"... to me it's Henry who was the real criminal.

Boring as hell and kind of a chick flick.It's the story of a neurotic woman who struggles with the concept of marriage as a business arrangement, the romantic nature of a one night stand, and the uncertainty and pitfalls of true love.Many of the story's motifs are reminiscent of other recent KST movies (e.g. the English Patient), but have far less appeal.After the first half-hour I started checking my watch, wondering if I'd make it home in time to catch Leno on tv.I passed up "Gladiator" to see this!? !

This movie was cheesy and it was more than that . It was about this guy who gets a curse on him, and ends up in a parallel universe. This movie was really funny at the beginning, but it just went downhill after that . All throughout the movie this guy is in a really bad place and he just can't find out what he really is. At the end he dies. 4/10/10

Funny, sad, cute

This movie was very funny at the beginning, then it just became more sad and then it just went downhill and the ending was just cheesy.

( The beginning might be a spoiler ... ) '' The Eye 2 '' is the sequel to `` The Eye ``, and is set after the events of the first film. This sequel has more action, more action in more places, and even a few scenes involving sex (one or two) for those of you that are not old enough to be shocked by the sight of young children having sexual intercourse. The ending of '' The Eye '' wasn't what we were expecting, so '' The Eye 2'' is definitely not what anyone was expecting either.

To put it simply, this was a pompous piece of canine poopie. Overly stagey and everyone being the total melodramatic drama queen at every single moment. After a while, i was starting to wish that every character in the movie wasn't such a stuffed-up anal retentive.And, this movie has another one of those truly annoying things that has recently come into vogue and shouldn't have: all the scenes are in a sort of washed-out, blue-steel-greyishness. Hmmm, the last time i checked, candles and torches are quite capable of putting a fairly wide spectrum of colors.

With a cast like this , I knew the acting would be amazing . Still , I was cautious , because we are talking about two of the leading actresses of our generation. But we are talking about a talented actress of our era . So no matter what, I will give it a try. I don’t want to get hurt again. This time, it was very bad . I think there is one scene that sticks out for me , that I won’t regret . In fact , I think it is one of the greatest scenes of my career as an actor and director .

I loved this movie when it first came out ( but i was just 12 years old then - and still like it) and i still love it and would definitely recommend it to anyone out there who is into horror. the first time i heard it was on the radio and i didn't really remember it but it sounded like a lot of other movies i liked at the time, such as The Texas Chainsaw Massacre, Nightmare On Elm Street, The Exorcist and the rest. it was pretty good, but at the same time a bit silly.

Another nice entry in the Crime Doctor series [#4/10], with atmospheric almost noirish black and white photography and some splendid Spanish American backdrops and sets. And a more off-the-wall storyline too!A man who looks like the insane murderer of his first two wives is found dead in a locked room after a dramatic dinner party. The Crime Doctor is on the scene (ostensibly as a guest) to immediately and resignedly proclaim it murder, and so we are presented with a quite weird set of people to mull over, for one of them did the deed.

I have always loved old movies but this is one of my top ten favorites ... it has all the right elements of being a classic old movie, but it's really a modern movie with great acting and a really clever plot, not to mention the beautiful cinematography and some wonderful visual effects and effects editing .... and I love that the film is made in New Mexico and is set against a beautiful backdrop. For those who have not seen it, I highly recommend that you take the time to see it for yourselves ... It is not as well known as it deserves to be.

I was looking forward to The Guardian, but when I walked into the theater I wasn't really in the mood for it at that particular time. It's kind of like the Olive Garden - I like it, but I have to be in the right mindset to thoroughly enjoy it.I'm not exactly sure what was dampening my spirit. The trailers looked good, but the water theme was giving me bad flashbacks to the last Kevin Costner movie that dealt with the subject - Waterworld. Plus, despite the promise Ashton Kutcher showed in The Butterfly Effect, I'm still not completely sold on him.

Carole Lombard and James Stewart gamely try to inject some life and meaning into this bizarrely constructed film about the tribulations of a newlywed couple. The scenes play as if they were parceled out among various directors, each with a different goal. Some are Capra-cute, some screwball, some melodramatic, and some surprisingly noir. There's even an extended adventure sequence, when the plot suddenly focuses on a small plane flying through a blizzard. It's hard to say which scenes are the most incongruous, when the film as a whole is so erratic in tone, and the storyline not exactly believable.

Most of the critiques on this flick have been pretty damn accurate . It is an hour and half waste of a film . I liked it very much , but I just don't see it as anything other than a complete waste of $30 . At least this is one movie that could have been made for only $6 . This is one of those movies where if you could have made it for $10 it would have been a winner . This movie started out with some pretty good ideas . The plot is solid , and the characters are great .

There is a solid group of people that have lives like this girl going through the admissions process at school. The parental absence at all important junctures in Lauren Ambrose's school search provide admissions interviews only and draws the interviews with them at below transcript quality review that in 30 minutes sabotages four years of high school grading. The incident of anger in her mother obviously block a mothers display of possible physical abuse of her or her disabled sister at one time or another; thus masking her Mother's truer involvement in family losses.

This is such a fun and funny movie . Highly entertaining at all angles . It features an outlandish array of talent and brings out the best and worst in the actors . And as the title states , it's a comedy centered around a trio of women . It's a perfect example of what's wrong with modern day women . If you don't have the time or desire , you can watch the movie , as it's available on Netflix and you can order it from Amazon . As for those that don't have the time , the book is a great introduction to these characters and their struggles .

This third installment in the Scarecrow series is by far the best of the lot. I know, I know...but how good is it? Well, let's not be silly. It's still pretty bad, but by comparison to the first two, it's a fine film. Again shot on digital, with decent lighting and good camera work. ****SPOILER****When a college baseball team hazes new members, one is left in a diabetic coma. Of course, they abandon him in a cornfield, tied to a scarecrow.

Given the acting roles he played in the 1940s (Casper Gutman, Signior Ferrari, Mr. Peters, Jerome K. Arbutny, Ex-Superintendent Grodman, Count Fosco, Titus Semple) it surprises many of his fans to learn that originally Sidney Greenstreet made a name for himself in comedies in the West End and Broadway. He was usually such a total villain, or serious actor to the public that his comic talents were ignored. In fact he actually did make four comedy appearances (one a spoof of his villainous portrayals with his villainy partner Peter Lorre in a cameo appearance).

I watched this on HBO because it won the Oscar a week earlier. It compares favorably with fictional courtroom dramas.The story is of a 15-year-old black kid placed on trial for the Jacksonville, FL, murder of an elderly white woman based almost solely on the identification by the victim's husband and on a confession that the defense contends was coerced.About half the footage is of the trial; it's supplemented with footage of the defense lawyers (two public defenders) explaining their case, interviewing witnesses, and visiting key locations. This is edited with a minimum of needless repetition, and placed in logical order.

Watching this odd little adventure movie , it 's hard to believe that it was directed by the same man who directed that other movie , that one which was a masterpiece , but which has become a bit of a cult classic and one which should be in everyones DVD collection . The story is not well-known , but it 's one which could have made a great film and if the movie makers have done their work right . I will admit , the first half was a bit slow , but the second half was amazing . It had a perfect balance between the action and the suspense .

George Sluizer 's remake of his own - superior - film is a complete waste of time . Why was it even made ? Because it had no interest for most of the world - except a small handful that would watch it and then be told to watch it again because it was "great" and a "hit". The first five minutes of this film tell that story. The rest is filler - it's almost the same scene repeated twice without any change in the characters. The biggest problem with this film is the same as a lot of the other bad ones - it's a total bore.

It's not really about wine. No, Nossiter's real targets are those who would streamline and assimilate the peculiarities of local (wine) production for business purposes. To this end he has made an excellent, objective film. Spirited, bumptious, emotional and flawed independent wine producers are juxtaposed with media-finessed, anodynesprech Amercians and auld-Europeans: the art of wine-making against market-driven, laboratorised product manufacture. It's an open show that doesn't lead conclusion.Nossiter's film is occasionally infuriating to watch - cameras are neither concealed, nor steadicam, by any means.

This was a great movie , I would compare it to the movie The Game . You get to the end of this movie and you are done , and you know what, the film ends and it has nothing to do with the ending. I think a good movie should end in a good way . I think that The Game had the same ending. It didn't have to be as complicated , just the same . The ending of this movie makes it the best movie , because the ending makes it so much more entertaining .

The only reason I am giving a second star is for the first half of the movie. This was a good rendition of the story. I enjoy seeing a few fictional characters added to add some color to a well known story. But the second half was horrible!!! Yes there were violent aspects of this story. But the writers of this movie chose to only include the violence and forget about the good things God did for the Israelites. Towards the end of the movie Scott looked as though he were getting messages from the big giant head instead of talking and hearing from God.

Deep Water ( 2006 ) * * * * '' It is indifferent ... it 's there waiting for you .... you don 't ... you don 't .. you ... you ... it is there for you. In a way it doesn't matter where it comes from. It's just there for you.'' * ''You don't get it and you never will. It will never come into your world ... never. Never. You are the only one who has it. You are the one who has all the chances. You have no choice, and yet you do have a choice.''

This movie was made only 48 years after the end of the Civil War--most likely in anticipation of the 50th anniversary of the end of the war. In the film there are recreations of battles and the people of the era that look rather impressive and realistic. It also provides a different and more balanced view than just its contemporary, BIRTH OF A NATION--a patently absurd and racist film. Because of this, this short film would be excellent for use in the classroom to discuss the war and tell the story of a very young man that runs away to enlist as a drummer.

I would like to know the real name of the Lodge where scenes from the movie were filmed. It is truly beautiful and hearkens back to 20's and 30's architecture like the Hotel Del Coronado. I know it was on either Big Bear Lake or Lake Arrowhead and would like to hear if it is still in existence. As for the movie itself, it is truly amazing that Jane Wyman was even nominated for an Academy Award. This must have been a period when she was well liked by her Academy peers.

Overall, I give this film a decent 7.6. To start I'll say I love how the character was portrayed and adapted on to the screen. If you read comics occasionally or simply watch DVD extras you'll see the Blade character is drastically different from the one we see in the film. Among the changes, Blade is now most importantly half vampire, therefore acquiring "all of their strengths, but none of their weaknesses." The credit for this goes obviously to David Goyer, a fellow fan of the darker genre of comic books.

This cheapo remake of the terrific Five Star Final suffers from terrible acting. Humphrey Bogart stars as the manager of a sleazoid radio station that is desperate to boost sagging ratings. The owner decides to have a series of morality plays written about a famous murder case from 20 years ago. So they hire the fake preacher (Harry Hayden) to track down the murderess, who was acquitted and has been living quietly under a fake name. The preacher arrive on the daughter's wedding day, but the ruthless radio station refuses to back off exposing the mother and ruining their lives.Bogart is always good.

I do n't even know where to start . I did not like it . It did not behave like the others I played through . First game, I just wanted to see how the story would end. After the first battle and after the final boss, it was fun to play, but I didn't expect the ending that would occur after the first boss. After fighting through all the waves, I was disappointed to see that I would never have enough health to beat all the bosses. I just didn't see how the game was supposed to end.

My husband wanted to watch this film because the review in the paper said that it was better than Fatal Attraction. I was expecting a lot of sex and some action, and it ended up being all sex. I think it would have been much better if the movie had a couple of good scenes of romance. There's a scene where a girl tries to kiss a guy but the guy looks at her for too long and she backs away. I'd have loved it if he'd been able to say something to the girl to make her stop and think before she did something that would get him hurt.

Thomas Mann's controversial novel is the basis for the film "A Death in Venice. " Although in the book, the hero is an author, in the film the director Luchino Visconti who also wrote the screenplay, transforms him into a Composer. As such, the Author/Composer, Gustav Von Aschebach (Dirk Bogarde) on the verge of mental exhaustion is a burned-out artisan. After a long and successful career now seeks the peace and tranquility of a less hectic life. He decides to go on vacation to Venice where he hopes to rejuvenate his dwindling ambition.

"Tart" is a good illustration of old the Yogi Berra saying: "If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up someplace else". Writer/Director Christina Waye (in her first feature) has managed to make a $3 Million movie that ends up someplace else. "Tart" is either a coming of age story devoid of characters that a rational person can connect with, a black comedy without any humor, or a sexploitation movie without anything that is particularly sexy.Unlike the standard Swain film, "Tart" actually employed a competent and experienced production designer.

From the film 's first shot - Keira Knightley as Elizabeth Bennet wandering reading through a field at dawn , in New York - we are back at last with another new film in this season of the BBC period drama. And it features none other than Keira Knightley in her first starring role in this series. Keira Knightley plays Elizabeth Bennet in the BBC's period drama A Game of Thrones, set to begin filming in the spring of 2011. The first episode of the series, due for broadcast in Spring 2010, is due to begin airing in the autumn of this year on the channel.

I just saw this on TCM tonight and was shocked at the over-acting by Jean Arthur . Her bugging her and trying to get answers. That’s not acting. There are many ways for an actress to behave as an actor does. She may show more emotion, more concern, more fear, more vulnerability. But she may also be just being herself. And if she is acting, that is what people think she is doing. So if there is an acting quality in Jean Arthur’s behaviour, she is not necessarily acting.

At the bottom end of the apocalypse movie scale is this piece of pish called 'The Final Executioner ' ..... I don't even want to know how many people have watched this movie so it is one of those things that I am glad my friends don't really get that it is going to happen... I am not sure if anyone has watched this but it is something to look for in terms of movies that actually make you scared... I actually really enjoy these type of movies but I think that I am still in the "don't do this in public" stage with these type of films...

Charlie Chaplin responds to open auditions at Lodestone Studios . Rival Ben Turpin arrives at the same studio , obviously not prepared for the arrival of someone he doesn't recognize . Ben's assistant comes in and announces , " Mr. Chaplin wants to see Ben Turpin " . Ben comes to the podium , sits down , and says . Ben tells him , " Ben , I'm Ben Turpin . You probably know that." Ben Turpin says, " Oh yes . " Ben sits next to Chaplin . Ben introduces himself . " I'm an actor . "

I think that would have been a more appropriate title for this film , since it is padded to hell with spoilers. __________________

I hate spoilers. This is a movie I would gladly watch knowing every damn thing about it. I know that I'm the only one that would and so that's it for me. This is one of the hardest movies I have ever watched, the first time watching it I had such high expectations, and now I'm thinking that I'll have to rewind to the beginning just to enjoy the movie and understand what went on in the movie before this.

I have been watching movies from i think last 10 years , and I must say that i never felt that bad, which I felt after watching this extra large bore movie, it was bad, very Bad. There were songs & songs. Nobody should watch this movie. The director has shown Germans speaking English which is so rubbish. Germans does not speak English. & in one scene there was a white girl who asked Himesh for autograph. (Obv that he must have gave some money to her) In the promo they have shown prepare for Laughing riot.

Take it from me as a camera man who worked for Republic Studios from 1946 to 1950 and then Warners, and as the first director of the original “Superman, Batman & Robin” TV series that premiered on CBS in 1952: If the first three Supermen ever appeared on screen (Clark Kent, Hal Jordan, and Jor-El) the last one was in the early 1950s. It’s a sad fact of history that the earliest Superman movie to ever come off the screen was Superman and the Mole (1941).

It's hard to believe that there are some people out there in the world that actually think this is a worthy Charles Bronson vehicle. Bronson is a good actor that can do more than tote a gun and knock off bad guys. He was quietly moving in the TV movie "Yes Virginia, There is a Santa Claus" and showed a lot of class and style in the Sean Penn-directed "The Indian Runner".In "The Evil That Men Do", however, Bronson again plays a character that sees injustice and sets it right with fists, knives and, of course, guns.

The appeal of this film has to be the artsy Euro style , because there 's absolutely no substance . I would never watch this movie if I didn't love the story . I am a woman who loves to dress up in sexy outfits . And now I 'm in love with the beauty of a beautiful man , who 's not an actor . I want to make his life full of good food , beautiful women , good songs and lots of fun . Now I know it sounds easy , but that's all I got , I need that .

Another movie from Swedish hillbilly country, which is always the Northern part. If black people were shown this way, there would be shouts about racism and for good reasons.This is a farce and you are supposed to laugh at the "clever" farce clichés. But it's mostly tiresome. A gangster comedy, with the bad Russians (as always) and the bad (and stupid) Finns. And most stupid of all is of course the Norwegian, according to Stockholm prejudice.Andreas Wilson is the only one who tries to make a performance reminding us of reality. This is not funny.

This is a great little movie , full of interesting characters and situations . While not in the same class as the classics such as "The Sting " or "The Dirty Dozen", this movie is a solid entry point. It also does a great job in portraying the human character in all it's glory . Overall a very entertaining movie and worth seeing . I think it would make a good addition to the DVD shelf if you don't own a VHS. The audio quality is pretty good but the video is a little choppy on the DVD version.

The actors in this dark film are truly believable and well cast . The quality of the camera work makes for a well made and disturbing film . The use of close ups makes this film to be a good horror film . The story is a bit hard to follow with the fact that it is a true story that is very well told . I give this film 5 out of 5. This film is really well made and the performances were good for a horror film . I give this film 4 out of 5. I have been really enjoying all the Horror films I have been able to see this year .

The only thing it has to offer is the interesting opposites of Tru and Jack , their choices and viewpoints, their emotions. I’d say that Tru and Jack each have one side to them, and no other. But they don’t have other points of view, they have very few. I have one or two, but I don’t want them to get too attached, because I don’t know their future. They can only be so strong. And then they’re gone. And sometimes that happens, but not often.

Camp Blood is an absolutely atrocious slasher film. We're mixing Friday The 13th with the Blair Witch Project and adding....a killer in a clown mask.The budget for this film must have been very low, some of the actors played multiple parts and the camera used produced a picture equal to the colourised version of the original Night Of The Living Dead, which if anybody has watched that version will back me up that it is poor.This film was just so bad. There is nothing in the film even worth watching. The very fact I watched this all the way through stunned me.

I still remember when Frog Baseball first aired on MTV. In some sort of odd, surreal manner, the cartoon captured the stupid actions that I think every boy growing up in America engages in. I cringe now thinking about how I burned a crippled grasshopper using a magnifying glass, but it was interesting at the time for some reason. Growing up in the 1980s we all knew "stoners." These were the kids who wore Iron Maiden t-shirts to school, grew their hair long, had immature moustaches and were at least two inches taller than everyone else because they had flunked a grade or two.

Sorry to say but was disappointed in the film. It was very very rushed, as I suppose you can understand a movie length version of Pride & Prejudice would be and I felt that a lot of the major scenes were glossed over just to get through the story. As the movie is so rushed, unfortunately you don't get to really know about and feel for each of the characters much at all. Not only that, this movie is Boring. I say that with a capital B. 1/3 of the way through I started yawning and couldn't wait for the movie to be over.

First of all, the nature in the movie is beautiful, and there is a bit of Mongolian music. Well, the horses looked Mongolian and the camels, but that's about all what was Mongolian in it. Oh, Borte is played by a Mongolian actress, albeit a lame performance. But she is pretty, which redeems a bit the lack of performance on her part.But, I totally failed to understand what was the point of this painful-to- watch piece of 1.30 hour fantasy created by Mr.Bodrov. The plot totally lacked any sense of cohesion.

Imagine if you will : four teen students have an assignment to spend the night in a haunted house in a remote, haunted forest of a city. Each of them will have to solve a puzzle to be allowed in the building. In the end each will receive a reward, but each of them will have to solve the mystery in the most difficult way, and will have to be able to get inside the haunted house and open the hidden door to reveal a mystery. In the end will be a lot more than a simple mystery, because the mystery has to be found and unlocked by each of them.

The many other comments about the film say it all - just like to add that we showed it last weekend. It was an interesting film with a lot of characterisation and drama. The only thing I disagree with in the end was the ending (which I will go into in a minute). I would have liked to see it go deeper and develop the story a little more, but unfortunately I wasn't able to see it last night. I'm still a little sad about how it ended, though, because I had such a great time watching it and so many people really liked it.

25 August 2003 League of Extraordinary Gentlemen:Sean Connery is one of the all time greats and I have been a fan of his since the 1950's. I went to this movie because Sean Connery was the main actor. I had not read reviews or had any prior knowledge of the movie. The movie surprised me quite a bit. The scenery and sights were spectacular, but the plot was unreal to the point of being ridiculous. In my mind this was not one of his better movies it could be the worst. Why he chose to be in this movie is a mystery.

In my analysis of `` Trois couleurs : Blanc '' I wrote that its tone is much lighter than the work's predecessors. In fact it is quite different. In fact, I thought that it is closer to the work of Jean-Paul Rée, who wrote at a time when the subject had been taken up more seriously. But it seems that I was wrong, for this book is definitely closer to the work of René Roussel (1909 - 1973) than it is to that of René Lefèvre (1912 - 1991).

Since I am a fan of Natalie Portman, I had to see the movie. I enjoyed every minute of it. It plays out in a very sincere way. Throughout the whole movie at seemed as if Natalie was the mother and Susan was the mother. Susan's character kept making bad decisions and kept getting burned because of it.I heard that there was supposed to be a love scene involving Natalie and some-guy (he's in Outside Providence) but Natalie would only accept the script if that scene was removed. And I think that is great.

Deepa Mehta's "Fire" is groundbreaking, bold, and artistic. A masterful social commentary on the plight of the women from conservative, upper middle class Indian households, this is a film no one should miss. Shabana Azmi and Nandita Das give stellar performances by underplaying their characters as much as possible. A.R. Rahman's music is the work of the genius and almost plays the role of another character in the film. Mehta uses Rahman's score and together, they create such amazing sound montages that effectively portray the views of the world around Radha and Sita whenever they look to each other for support.

This may be the most tension-filled movie I have ever seen.In fact , it 's so nerve-wracking , I have no idea how much I will fall asleep. There are three scenes that I can only describe with the word 'horror' . I was in awe. I thought it was so amazing that I would cry , but it was no big thing . It starts on the last day before Christmas. My husband and I have planned this for a year and a half , because we really love eachother , and we can't wait until we see eachother on Christmas morning.

This is an example of why the majority of action films are the same . Generic and boring , there’s not much that you can do there . You have to create an original story in order to be successful . You don’t get sequels and you can’t make comedies because there’s nothing that can make it more enjoyable . There’s nothing that will give you a bit more of what you love about the genre . If you’re going to make a remake , it has to follow the original story line , the same story and the same characters .

The movie opens with Charlie (Jeff Daniels), a business man just finishing his lunch in a neighborhood deli. It appears he doesn't have enough cash to cover the check. Instead of reaching for his plastic, he furtively glances around to see if the coast is clear and ducks out of the place without paying. Unbeknownst to Charlie, "Lulu" (Melanie Griffith) had been observing him from the other side of the deli. "Lulu" is decked out in what passed for cool back in the 1980's with a brunette page-boy cut.

I have always loved bad creations, rhetorical criticism and my film professor validated that for me in college. This is not as bad as The Star Wars Holiday Special, there is nothing bottom of the lunchbox than that mistake. This The Fantastic Four film, complete with the I-have-no-idea-why-hes-excessively-tweaking-his-fingers Doctor Doom, is high on the list of colossal mistakes. Doom's dialogue "Kill him!...Let him go!" is classic as it is staggering in its hilarity. The editing is good, and the director of photography isn't half-bad...those are the up-sides.

I unwittingly walked into this `` trap '' of a movie.If I could turn back time or simply get a new phone and put a new screen on it, I would have made the same mistake.As I write this I have been asked to write my story, but I do not know anything about it. If it were to happen, the results would be the same, I know that now.The movie was supposed to be a story about the life of my mother, but it was basically about my dad. The director had to cut a lot of dialogue, so my mom would never learn what was said about her.

OK , Number one-this `` film '' is a `` 90 's '' version of a crappy show from the mid-'80s. I'm not gonna lie - this is kind of like a 90's remake of that same thing...sort of. The show was a bit of a flop because the writers were just plain lazy and they couldn't decide whether to keep it real or fake for the audience. I was watching it with my dad in the early '90's - we had a VHS tape. It wasn't really that great of a show but it was decent enough.

I enjoyed it. There you go, I said it again. I even bought this movie on DVD and enjoyed it a couple of more times. Call me old fashioned but I prefer movies like this to garbage like Die Hard 4 which hold up the box office and get critical acclaim just because you have some old guy saving America. Van Damme moves well for a guy of his age(47 I think), delivering kicks that reminds one of Kickboxer. If you like old school action and and explosions, this is the movie to watch.

Filmmaker Bryan Forbes, who once displayed a light, sardonic touch with beguiling material such as "Whistle Down the Wind" and the original "Stepford Wives", completely bottoms out here. Not only is his direction inept, he also sloppily adapted Sidney Sheldon's early novel; the results are atrocious. Roger Moore plays a psychiatrist framed for the murder of one of his patients; Rod Steiger, chewing the scenery, is a hot-under-the-collar cop (it's easily his most embarrassing performance). The only actor here to exhibit some life is Elliott Gould, who knows a thing or two about enlivening a bum script.

At first I didn't think that the performance by Lauren Ambrose was anything but flaky, but as her character developed the portrayal made more sense. Amy Madigan seemed too terse for her role and didn't really tie her daughter's characters together, even though it was apparent that her character was disengaged with the character played by Lauren Ambrose.Christopher Lloyd is a hit as usual and carried off his role to encourage the story line. His character development left the audience wondering why he was chastised by the younger characters and could have been accomplished more directly with The overwhelming glue to this somewhat vague story line was play by Taylor Roberts.

Anne (Natalie Portman) tells us about how much she hates her mother, Adele (Susane Sarandon). That's how the movie begins. Adele decided that her and her daughter were moving to California without asking anyone and leaving her husband without any reason. The story is about the relationship between the mother and the daughter. It's really deep and touching, thanks to the great work of the actresses. Natalie was nominated to a Golden Globe for that role. She is one of the most talented actresses I ever saw, and so is Sarandon.

( HR is what Himesh is called in the movie, I think he likes it too. ) It's amazing how intelligent people, talented even fall in to the same trap.I really like Reshamiya. It's amazing what he has done. No one in recent years has come back from the wilderness and made a mark for himself.And I truly expected a great film ( What with the budget of 50 Cr and the cute actress ). As intense as Reshamiya is I thought, he would excel at a sentimental and an emotional role. Ironically he is depicted the same but for what care?

i do n't really know where to start here.just imagine a movie that is so bad in every way from its acting to its production values to its visuals.this is the worst thing ever.its so bad it is laughable.i have never seen anything in my life that looked and acted like this.i am sure you will never watch this movie again.i urge you to boycott this film.this is a waste of time that you will not get and will only make you want to get better. I saw the movie in theaters and I am appalled at all the grossness.

it 's hard to make a negative statement here after all this raving about how great deed poll is , but I just think we need to just accept what we can and can not do on a personal level , but we don't see anything that would make me think otherwise . I really don't want to put words in anyone's mouth , but it seems as though they want to think this way is a good thing . The only difference is that if the people who do this think this is good , then they'll take action .

( Contains really bad Spoilers ) So what can I say about this .... It 's a really HORRIBLE and SAD SONG. Its pretty sad and sad I tell you what. But hey it 's all you can say at this point I guess, and it will probably make more sense when the story finally ends. ( I'm not quite sure how well it 'll be done )

So this is the story of how I ended up being a very bad boy .... I came to this blog to vent and rant on all the things that I thought were wrong with me .... And I found this.

Ants are shown in cartoons as being able to carry away chicken legs , watermellons , people , etc . They would kill a chicken if they got too close to an area where it's food source . Here are some of the things you might find inside a house . It's very likely you'll find a dead or dying cat on the ground where you live . You might find a dead cat ( or any animal ) in your garden . We've seen dead birds and snakes in gardens in the UK and I've also seen frogs in my own back garden .

I logged on here right after watching this movie , feeling that it was so awful that at least its plot was believable , I guess that is the last thing to do. But this review is a bit different from all these others because it is the kind of review that can be used as evidence in court. And it is not an opinion. It is the truth. For all those people that watched this movie and said that they didn't like it or that they didn't think that it was worth seeing, please, please, please, please, read the review.

This isn't "so bad it's good"--It's "so bad, it violates the Geneva Convention's prohibition on cruel and unusual punishment"! Only by reading the Synopsis can you even figure out the "plot" of this Straight to Video disaster. It's a hodge-podge of grainy stock footage spliced together with some of the all-time worst acting you'll ever have the misfortune to see. Comparing this incompetent, turgid, humorless mess to "Dead Men Don't Wear Plaid" is like saying that "Gigli" is like "Citizen Kane".

Very enjoyable 50's Western. I have it in my collection and recommend it to Western fans.Mostly Victor Mature's movie and quite well done in my estimation.He's a trapper who joins a frontier post as a scout. Red Cloud caught three of them on their land and took their possessions. They all joined as scouts after their loss.Victor has set his eye's on the Colonel's wife and lives life on the post without much regards to regulations.Action done quite convincingly but no great depth or much feeling to other characters.50's Westerns are my favorites and this slides easily to a satisfaction.

Though it 's better than most made-for-TV movies , `` Buried Alive '' is nothing more than a run-of-the-mill revenge thriller and not much more. The best thing about it, is how well it handles the characters in it, they are all pretty well cast and all are funny in their own different ways. And there is one great twist in this one. You know how when you get to a place where you are trying to solve a crime and you are faced with a dead body you can see the solution in the body ?

The Toxic Avenger, Part II starts with the startling revelation that after the Toxic Aveneger (John Altamura who was apparently fired during production & replaced with Ron Fazio) had rid his home town Tromaville of evil it actually became a nice place to live. This meant that Toxie had no use as a superhero anymore & now suffers from depression & a feeling of utter uselessness (just like directors Lloyd Kaufman & Michael Herz should feel like after producing this), Toxie now works as a concierge at the 'Tromaville centre for the blind'.

This is good movie that is flawed in many ways with low production. Martha Coolidge herself said she only had 350,000 dollars to work with. This is a movie that I loved growing up in the midwest. I remember friends and I having the nostalgia trip on this movie 10 years ago. Great things about this movie....Great cast with hungry actors and a hungry director. Bad points of this movie....To small of a budget calling for way too much improvisation. If Martha Coolidge had been given more money and time on this movie then the results would of been even better.

This is one of those movies that has everything in it. I don't think I would get tired of seeing it. Hopefully more movies like this one will be made in the future. The casting was perfect in all respects. In a sense, the song sung by Engelbert Humperdink "I Never Got to Say Goodbye", is the song come to life. You will most definitely laugh and cry throughout the entire scenario for sure. I'm just surprised that I had never seen it before this past weekend. I think that it's positively worth seeing, and your heart will be glowing.

This is another Sci-Fi channel original movie staring Rhys Davies where its hard to decide whats worse, the acting, or the writing/directing/producing (John Sheppherd helms all three. )Basic story: obsessed exobiologist captures chubacabra monster,smuggles it in a cargo container aboard a cruise ship it escapes and the blood bath begins. Clichéd sci fi cast of the sturdy captain with the beautiful daughter, handsome hero and mad scientist. Captian calls in a terrorist alert for the ship (since of course wouldn't believe a monster story. )No dramatic Helicopter drop of the Navy Seals here.

In Moscow, the young couple Veronika (T. Samojlova) and Boris (Aleksey Batalov) are in deep love for each other. With the World War II, Boris volunteers to join the army and is sent to the front on the day before Veronika's birthday, and they do not have the chance to say goodbye to each other. While waiting for news from Boris, Veronika is raped by Boris' cousin Mark (A. Shvorin) and they marry each other. However, Veronika does not forget Boris, and keeps waiting for him.

I watched this movie and all I can say is this...I am not a film student, nor am I some artsy intellect who tries to look for a deeper meaning into everything that I don't understand. However, IF I were to do that with this film, my thoughts would be...Yep! He's on drugs and I can picture it now...he was tripping one night and sat around with his buddies laughing and saying stuff like, hey...wouldn't it be funny if nuns really could fly?

Even if you 're not a `` theatre person , '' I highly recommend that you see this . Based upon the play and film, it 's a very moving and moving experience . I would have given it 4/5 stars .

" I was a big fan of the book in the beginning. It was great to see it adapted to the stage. The acting was so good and I didn't think it was that bad . I thought it was so funny and it was so well written. This was my first time watching the musical and I was really amazed.

I can only think of one reason this movie was released. To capitalize off the upcoming fame of Guy Pearce. This movie has no merit at all and needlessly trashes Errol Flynn's memory. The homosexual encounter was pure speculation. The disdain shown for Flynn in this movie is palpable. An easy way to slander an actor who died years ago. Horrible and embarrassing. Very disappointing. Don't waste your time on this utter trash. Watch My Wicked wicked ways if you want to learn about this fine actor or read his autobiography. This movie is NOT the way.

Okay, so this series kind of takes the route of 'here we go again!' Week in, week out David Morse's character helps out his ride who is in a bit of a pickle - but what's wrong with that!? David Morse is one of the greatest character actors out there, and certainly the coolest, and to have him in a series created by David Koepp - a great writer - is heaven! !Due to the lack of love for this show by many, I can't see it going to a season series - but you never know?

SPOILER ALERT ! ! ! ! This was my son 's review of the movie , which he wanted me to share with all of you here and there, because it is really good and I wanted to share it to you guys. So I thought why not start with a spoiler alert ? :)

This is another movie that is full of comedy and action and it is a fun watch and I'm really glad I saw it , and I really recommend to everyone who wants to have fun with this movie. The movie begins with a car accident where two teenagers have crashed at a local church.

Everything everyone has said already pretty much rings true when it comes to 'The Prey ' . Endless nature footage, lush cinematography, stunning locations and a fantastic cast all help to create an awesome movie. I have not seen this movie before but i will definitely be going and checking it out again. I am so excited for the new movie! I think it has it all. If you haven't caught it yet, I highly recommend doing so now. I think you will be pleasantly surprised. I am giving the new Prey movie a 7 out of 10.

Earth has been destroyed in a nuclear holocaust. Well, parts of the Earth, because somewhere in Italy, a band of purebred survivors--those without radioactive contamination--are holed up in a massive mansion surrounded by lush grounds, waiting for the next opportunity to go hunting for those with polluted blood. The Final Executioner is the story of one of their would be victims, Alan (William Mang, who looks, not surprisingly, a lot like Kurt Russell), and his efforts to take down the legally sanctioned hunters, who are led by Edra (Marina Costa) and Erasmus (Harrison Muller Jr. ).

Countenance ! Antoine Monot , in a copycat impersonation of Kevin Smith 's Silent Bob , keeps asking for it. Why does he do this?
