It’s the question on every writer’s lips, the one they’ve always wanted to know the answer to. So, the man has decided to put his money where his mouth is by setting this up, so to speak. But why is that, exactly? The answer, as you’re reading this article, is in the title, of course.

Even the trailer for this movie makes me cry , like the first time I saw this movie . Not sure if it's the film itself but I can't watch it anymore . I can't watch anything else because I'm afraid I won't see the end of the end . Not that I don't care to watch this movie now and then but I've never felt this way after watching this movie . I don't get it either but I don't really care either way . Maybe I am just not capable of understanding what it's about so maybe I won't like it .

What has Rajiv Rai done to himself? Once a hit director of films like Tridev and Vishwatama is now making one bad film after another. I was initially excited at the thought of Rajiv Rai returning to the action genre but that soon fizzled out. As a Rajiv Rai fan I thought I should at least give it a go but I left after an hour. One reason for me leaving the film so early so the amount of Paki- bashing in the film, this was not in Rai's previous venture.A lot of directors have tried Paki- bashing but I did not expect it from Rajiv Rai Another letdown was the music.

I'm almost embarrassed to admit to seeing CALIGULA twice. The problems with the production are almost too numerous to mention. The script is sub-standard (it's easy to see why Vidal tried to disown it). The direction is worse. Most of the movie consists of long shots inter cut with close-ups interspersed with cross cuts of mostly un-erotic porn (more prevalent obviously in the "uncut" version). The cinematography is especially sub par, giving the whole production a cheap washed-out look that undermines some of the elaborate set designs. The movie should've looked a whole lot better.

I went to see this film because it was recommended to my wife and she wanted to go.We were both under the impression that it was one of the classics of the genre and we did not believe that it was that bad.We didn't come away with an impression of any of the characters though, they really did nothing much. I would have liked the film to have lasted a bit longer as I think that the first hour was quite slow. I'm not even sure if the second hour is as good as the first, and I suspect that the third hour is not very good at all.

Despite some really scenic locations in the orient and some sporadically energetic music by Franco Micalizzi , this film does not feel quite as much like an adventure as the title might imply. That’s really the worst thing about it; the adventure is all around us. The film takes place during the Italian resistance to the Nazi war machine, which took place from July 1940 to May 1941. The story unfolds in a number of different locations. The first thing we need to note is the presence of a significant number of people. We do not see the bulk of them.

Horrible acting with the worst special f/x I've ever bore witness too. It's bad enough I wasted $3 to watch this crummy pile of crap, but it's the hour and a half time I lost that I could've been doing anything else like getting a root canal or volunteering for jury duty. Getting drunk couldn't even help this video.To put it bluntly, I sincerely believe I actually lost a few IQ points during the course of watching this idiotic piece of mind-numbing "work"! Perhaps I should have followed my own advice this time.

Ice the Limerick:A virus pulled out of the iceJust didn't know how to play nice.If infected you'll killBecause you are ill.The cure is to be infected twice.Ice is a great episode; one of the greats from season 1 that began shaping the show and if you ask me you really couldn't ask for much better throughout the entire series. It starts out with an awesome teaser which in my opinion is really one of the best teasers of the series also. A group of scientists in Alaska have drilled something out of the ice core which has for some reason caused them to kill each other.

Seriously I do n't get why people are all like `` Oh my God Step Up is the best movie ever!``. I mean this is a big budget film and you get a lot of plot lines going, so it doesn't sound like much but you get to see a lot of characters interact with each other and I think you have to give yourself some leeway, I mean it is a good thing to see what people go through, it's not really that big a deal to go and see a couple of movies.

My first post at the IMDb has to (unfortunately) be to warn others not to waste their time with The Cavern! There is no story, no character development, no scares, and no good lighting. It doesn't make any sense. If you enjoy bad acting, people running through small portions of caves, bouncing cameras posed at bad angles, and people screaming while the screen is in complete darkness, you'll love this movie. I could shut the lights off in my house and scream too, and I wouldn't have to pay for the rental.

This is an excellent film, but Momento (Nolan's other big budget film) is much better . I would recommend people go to see Momento and then if they like that, see this film. THe film is shot in black and white which I was a bit annoyed with at first but once into the film you understand black and white is the best way for the film to be seen. It is extremely gripping and reasonably easy to understand even though the way it is made is extremely clever. Elements of the storyline i think are a bit daft but the film is definitely worthy of a second viewing.

The plot for Black Mama White Mama, revolves around two female inmates, at a women's prison in the Phillipines. One Black, and one White. These two women, are thrown together in the prison. Pam Grier is Lee Daniels Lee is incarcerated in the hellish women's prison, for dancing as a harem girl. Lee's boyfriend owes her part of his profits, from his drug-dealing activities. Lee is mainly interested in breaking out of the prison to get hold of her beau's drug money, so that she can leave the Phillipines and assume a better life.

Warner Brothers produced this 3D extravaganza that was the biggest commercial success for westerns in 1953. Guy Madison leads a band of guardhouse soldiers and misfits to rescue two white women being held by Indians, which essentially all there is to this film. The 3D format was in its early stages as a Hollywood gimmick to compete with the growing popularity of home television, and the effects work very well here. The rescuers make off with the ladies and are pursued by the Indians until the white men make their stand at an island in a creek bed.

I do n't leave IMDb comments about films but this .... this film was bad . very bad . I have watched it again and again with a new set of eyes , and will never watch it again . Don't go to the cinema , just go out and buy a DVD and watch it on the video on your TV ... and if you dont like it , then go somewhere else ... and if you do like the movie , i suggest you go to your nearest DVD rental store . I just don't understand why people like this movie so much.

Having watched this movie several times, I have come to the conclusion that Milos Forman made a very daring decision to manufacture a muse for Goya, when the artist led what most would consider a tempestuous,passionate life while the French Revolution and the Napoleonic era raged across Europe, surely one that would have sufficient drama upon which to draw. While I do understand that Mr. Forman was relating in the microcosm of the tragedy of Ines' life the devastation of the world at that time, I was left feeling that there was just so much of Goya left out, so much of his humanity.

A lot of 'alternative ' comedy in Britain in the 1980s was insular , misguided , overly-political , and unfunny. In this episode I'm going to talk about that. I'm going to discuss a lot of the funny, silly, awkward things that were said and done during my youth in British comedy. A lot of the comedy that I saw in the 80s, especially in the late 80s and into the 90s was in a very narrow field. There was a very specific niche of British comedy that was very niche indeed. The British comedy scene in the 80s was very narrow.

I was so looking forward to watching the documentary self-immolation of the mastermind behind Boondock Saints , one of the most brutal games in all of gaming history. But I’m glad I didn’t go out and buy the DVD because I know that the film will be the one and only part of the film that will leave me wondering. I don’t see what the big deal is. People do this sort of thing in movies all the time just to shock the crap out of the audience, and they don’t get away with it as much in video games.

Now, I like the Bollywood films and I'm very glad they have recently gained success in the UK. However, Suneel Darshan's latest effort is a deeply flawed film from start to finish.The idea of a modern-Bollywood take on Amadeus was quite an exciting one, that is until the two supposed 'musicians' appear on the scene looking as if they have never touched a piece of manuscript in their lives. Upen Patel is a very good looking man, and the film plays to his narcissistic sensibilities, but he is never once believable as a modern Mozart.

This is the worst movie I have seen to date . 85 minutes of utterly bad acting , ( half of which is played by a woman ) and sub par story , nothing that really made sense to me , ( like the idea that someone is going to kill you in an alley , and it has to take a man to get your money ) so i was kinda hoping for some kind of twist or surprise like in the second Xmen , but no it only plays like its going to be an awesome movie , which is a bit of a bad thing .

This film is a very beautiful and slow film. There is nothing Hollywood about it. It is very danish and the characters are very real. It is the first danish film to take up this transsexual theme. It is really about love that has no gender. I would not say it is about lesbian love even though the two main characters (the transsexual veronika and Charlotte) are attracted to each other. It is a story about love and life.The story pretty much takes place in the two apartments. There is almost no background music, which makes it seem more real and intense.

A genuinely creepy ghost story, full of chills and sensuality, this movie just falls short of what it promises. It is apparently based on an old ghost story, and perhaps relies a little too much on a simple premise. For most of the way, its imaginative and genuinely gripping, but at the end its almost like Oshima just lost interest in it, and brought it to a rapid ending.The story is simple - a woman and her younger lover kill her husband so that they can be together. But their failure of nerve and his returning ghost condemn them to madness.

Johnny Crawford is great in this movie of a troubled teen coming of age in a generation that was in the middle of a cultural and spiritual upheaval. Billy Graham does a good job of portraying life in this sweet, sometimes corny, but all the way sincere flick. He gives us a look at not only the social scene but gives good, solid advice that holds true today about morals, decisions, the generation gap, teen dating, (some of the statistics that are given in this movie are astounding. They sound like today's stats).

I bought this video on a throw-out table at the video store expecting a good cast in what was touted as an award-winning Brit sex comedy. I guess I should have read the finer print. I rarely write a panning review, but here goes.These actors in gay roles really play games with your memories of a lot of far more worthy films. This comedy was a very cruel joke at the expense of the actors, the theatre-going public and of all the nice films that have contributed to their reputations.I repeat: is the joke about trashing the actors' other highly respectable on-screen personae with this scurrilously trashy flick?

i just glanced over another comment posted here in which the writer discusses the disturbing ways the teenagers in this book (and movie) deal with the issue of sexual identity and how they try to fit into the community. I can relate to much of it and it's a bit depressing. But, I do agree with you, that this is the first time that such a large portion of society (and the world as a whole) are put under the illusion that these teens are the same as us, when they are not.

Nothing about this movie is any good. It's a formulaic predictable "romantic comedy" geared to make females force their significant others to watch. In other words, it's a predictable chic flick that is neither comedic or romantic and is extraordinarily forgettable. If you like watching the same thing over and over then this movie will fit just perfect. I was also forced to watch this with my g/f at the time and it's no surprise we are no longer together. I enjoy great movies that are wonderful to watch, while she just wants to see the same thing over and over again just with different actors.

After watching this film , I thought to myself , they really glossed up Errol Flynn 's life ! The movie seems to show that Errol Flynn had his good points and there are other good reasons for him, but for me it looks like the film does not know what the real reason was for him. They made him look good, but Errol Flynn was real and a man and not a movie star. It's not fair. This film really is a movie for kids , but at times it just does not do Errol Flynn justice.

The film is a pathetic attempt to remake Ingmar Bergman's "Autumn Sonata"(1978) starring Ingrid Bergman,Liv Ullman and Erland Josephson.It did not take me more than 5 minutes to figure that out.It is time Film journalists like Khalid Mohammad took out time to do some creative thinking. It makes me sad when potentially good film-makers waste their talents by making substandard remakes of Hollywood and European films.You've got to give the film-maker something though. The film he picked for copying is one of Bergman's classics, and easily one of the finest instances of the portrayal of a strained human relationship in European cinema.

Was excited at the opening to hear part of "Chevaliers De Sangreal" but wanted more so I bought said Hans Zimmer piece. Possibly the most inspiring and beautiful 4 minutes of music ever written! This movie is an exciting thriller masterpiece even w/o the religious considerations. You get to tour the Vatican and parts of Rome with excellent cinematography. The opening at CERN where the "God Particle" or largest quantity of Antimatter is created with STUNNING visuals is an immediate clue which foretells the excellence of this movie. Who doesn't love Hanks?

This version of `` The Magic Flute '' is not only the worst production of Mozart 's great opera that has ever taken the stage, it's also the last one. In fact, the very last performance of Mozart's great work is not even the very last performance of his last opera. What happens to the piece, as we are about to find out, is just as important as the opera itself. The composer, Mozart, died of pneumonia in April 1780, just a little more than four months before the curtain went up on the curtain raiser to the final act.

After just viewing the movie, I must say this is one of the worst films I have ever seen. This takes my worst movie award away from Komodo, which is no easy feat. It is neither a porno nor a legitimate film and it gives them both a bad name. The acting, camera-work, plot, script, and sound are all awful. My personal favorite part of the movie is the duck asking the bartender if he has any grapes. Why was a joke such as this put in the film?

I had been looking forward to this movie since Lost World came out. It didn't bother me that Lost World wasn't as intellectual as the original, and here, I was just hoping for a good monster movie. It was all about "Dinosaurs eat people." However, it was disappointing even on that level.For starters, there were not enough people to eat, and while I'll keep it a secret how many people get eaten, it was not enough. Also, while there was no shortage of variety in the dinosaur community, there were not nearly "enough" dinosaurs.

This film was really terrible.However , it's worth seeing , as it features the worlds most unnecessarily extended sex scene ever. I mean , this thing went on for about 7 - 8 minutes (repeating the same 'moves' over and over), thats almost 10 % of the whole film! I haven't laughed as hard as I laughed at that for a long time.There were some seriously strange and pointless goings on in this film, but the one that I found funniest was when (for no reason whatsoever) a helicopter lands and 5 or 6 guys in orange suits run in to the complex near the end.

I happened across this movie while channel-surfing and it seemed to be yet another poorly- made Christian film about The End Times (which I find rather entertaining because they take themselves so seriously). To be fair, I only saw the last 30 minutes, so I missed the part about UFOs and the Sci-Fi stuff. But it was long enough for me to categorize it as an embarrassing and appalling representation of the Christian faith, as well as a rather pathetic film in any artistic sense.As a film, the script was terrible, the acting was mediocre, and the pacing was poor.

I can't believe the amount of reviewers who praise this as realistic. I'm a million miles from being an expert, and I'm never going to climb a mountain; but even the very basic knowledge attained from reading Into Thin Air, and watching Everest Beyond The Limit and a few other Everest docs meant that this film just got more and more ridiculous as it went on. There is some good climbing footage at the start; and when the billionaire mission leader asks early in the film "How much experience above 8000 metres do you have?

I attended a screening of 'The Cooler ' at the Toronto Film Festival this year . While the other reviews made it pretty clear that I was not interested in it, they were a bit more nuanced. After a while, they started talking about the characters, the story, the art direction, the cast and the production design, and all of those aspects started to click. It was a revelation for me as a filmmaker to realize that the story, the art direction, the cinematography, the music, the acting, everything, is completely and totally made by a group of people of color.

'The Mill on the Floss ' was one of the lesser novels by Mary Ann Evans , who wrote under the name Mary Ann M. Jones in her early years. It describes the lives of three women who live in a small isolated house in the Lake District. Its heroine, Mary, is the housemaid. Mary lives in constant fear that the landlord, who is a neighbour, would come round and force her to go to the lavatory. Mary is constantly worried that the landlord and his son would come round and murder her as they did so often during the early part of the book.

Part of the BBC filming of all of Shakespeare's classic plays, this version of Hamlet does nothing to dispel my particular impression that it is one of Shakespeare's most over-rated plays and Hamlet himself a not particularly moving and tragic character. I feel no sympathy for him, and I didn't after watching this.Even when you have great actors like the great Derek Jacobi in the role of the Dane, and Patrick Stewart as Claudius and Jonathan Hyde as Rosencrantz, it cannot disguise the lack of passion in the storyline. And when a good actor like Jacobi injects passion into it, he renders the entire role incomprehensible.

Another nice entry in the Crime Doctor series [ # 4/10 ] , with atmospheric almost noirish black and white photography and some interesting character development from the very beginning. This was a fun book to write and I am looking forward to this series to come! A very odd entry in this series. The photography was quite good, with a nice atmosphere, but nothing really stood out to me, and I didn't get much to like about the characterisation, except that it seemed the Doctor was becoming a better and a stronger character as the storyline progressed.

I have been a huge Errol Morris fan ever since I saw Thin Blue Line and heard it saved a girl's life. That's all I need to know. But what the hell is Morris' style? This is my first time hearing Morris' style, so if I'm pronouncing anything incorrectly, I apologize in advance. Here goes nothing:

He does a lot of different stuff:

* A lot of long, drawn-out movies. * A big chunk of music, most notably music from the 50s, 60s and 70s.

I 've never written a comment on IMDb before , but this movie was so bad it left me little hope of ever seeing it again . Not even worth seeing the trailer on IMDb , it’s not even on there. The movie was bad , I would not recommend it , I was so disappointed I left the theater before it was over . If you are at all concerned about quality, it’s worth noting that the DVD was made from the Blu-ray version and has all the same content on the disc as the one I saw.

I'm a large scarred heterosexual male ex-bouncer, ex-rugby player, and ex-boxer, and I love this movie.It's no "Mystic River." It's a piece of fluff. But there is room in life for fluff, and when that fluff is engagingly shot, well-acted by attractive, likable people, cleverly plotted and full of good dialogue, there's even more room for it.I'm not the biggest Tom Selleck fan. But he's good in this. So are Julianne Nicholson (love her bald head and freckles), Ellen Degeneres, Kate Capshaw and even Tom Everett Scott (That Thing You Do!

This film would be a great piece of history if in fact it was a real film of the Kennedy assassination or the events leading up to it. But it was not. This fictionalized film, like many others, was created with the intent to make it appear more “real” than it actually was. If the people creating the fake film knew any facts, there would not have been any need for the fake film. But if we go back to the original movie theater, we find there was no room to sit there and watch anything but the film as the movie itself was playing.

There is a serious scene in this movie. A scene that lets you know that his film won't be pulling many cheap punches. It takes place in a crowded train station and the protagonists are ambushed by assassins with automatic weapons. They make a break for it and just manage to get out in a hail of gunfire. The main hall of the train station is now filled with corpses of innocent people that were caught in the crossfire. Some would call that too sad and/or grim to put into what is supposed to be an enjoyable action flick. I call it honesty.

Daft potboilers don't come much dafter than this, but it's a Douglas Sirk movie which makes everything alright. Except in this case it doesn't. Based on a sanctimonious novel by the sanctimonious Lloyd C Douglas, (he wrote "The Robe"), and already filmed in 1935 with Irene Dunne and Robert Taylor, it's got more uplift than a cantilever bra.Rock Hudson is the arrogant playboy who not only feels responsible for making Jane Wyman a widow but later is directly responsible for the accident in which she loses her sight.

This is one of the best films I've seen in the last years.Belmonndo and Deneuve shine in their respective roles, he as a naive plantation owner and she as an enigmatic trickster.Words won't do this masterpiece justice,suffice it to say that this is a movie that explores the darker side of love and the pain,humiliation and capacity for self-delusion that go with it, although it's dressed as a film noir. Forget that feeble remake with Jolie and Banderas, see the genuine artticle instead and treat yourselves to some moments of great cinematic beauty.

Strange , often effective hippie zombie flick , starring the unforgettable husband/wife team of Alan and Anya Ornsby , this is a film that can not be missed . It’s a great way to relax and have a good time . If you love a good laugh, you’ve probably seen this film before , or you will in the near future . A zombie movie is not just a film with zombies , it’s about zombies , that’s it . This movie has zombies , all the time , all the time , all the time , all the time , and this is why .

This film is a work of pure class from start to finish, for a moment forget the famous 28 minute no dialog heist, forget that it's set in Paris and forget it's Noir. The film itself, the premise and the execution make this a pure gold experience.. it's sharp intelligent and thought through in great detail, just like the heist itself. It portrays real characters that are not only believable but whom you empathize with. It's a film that doesn't glamorize the notion of a robbery but shows it for what it is.. theft.

Forget the lousy acting, that can be forgiven in this sort of film. Or even the terrible, unnatural dialog and illogical events (if my subtitles actually reflected what was said). Far worse is the blatant absence of a skillful or experienced director who maybe took a holiday with the editor while the film was being made? Watching the film, it feels completely out of date even though it was 'only' made 7 years ago. A computer virus as a portal to the afterlife? lol? A dial up internetconnection? Clucky ghost images photoshopped on pictures ("He!

This is the sort of unknown and forgotten film one dreams about discovering in watching old videos . It is probably the first thing that popped into a viewer's mind when they saw the opening credits of this wonderful movie . This is an excellent little documentary about the whole process by a group of German filmmakers and cameramen . It goes in depth into the origins, development, etc of the production and editing of the movie and shows that some of the best German documentary films in history are based on just one of the most difficult and complex filmic techniques ever used to produce a documentary .

The movie is great for Venezuelan tourism, birds, birds and more birds. Only 1 piranha. Nice scenery. The only highlight was the alligator seen during a very long and boring motorcycle race. The end when Caribe drowns is a definite Hollywood prop. There is no definite storyline. It goes from Venezuelan scenery to a rip off of easy rider to diamond mining and a ruthless hunter going crazy for some reason who gets it in the end. A very low budget movie that could have been filmed anywhere with outtakes of Venezuela. William Smith is a very talented actor that has made some very good movies.

And one of 'em are bad movies . The title , as it turns out , refers to a killer in one of 'em who was in one of 'em. Not sure if he was real or fictional. :D

I watched it yesterday and it got me excited. There are so many parts you can laugh out loud in this film. I liked that there was a bit of satire in the story. That's how movies can do satire and have some real emotion in them (as long as you don't laugh out loud).

There are very few films that are able to tell such a complicated story on so many levels as well as the ones I want to tell here. There are many, many more films which could tell their story better, as there were so many of them back then, but I am not going to write about them here. I do not have the time and am not willing to spend the hours to find them. I am, however, going to write this review to show how I feel this film compares with others I have seen and why I like it the most.

I enjoyed it . There you go , I said it again . I even bought this movie on DVD and have it on dvd . And I was so glad when I watched this on the dvd , because it took me like 2 hours because of all the sex scenes , all the violence and everything else . It was so hot , so intense and so much fun ! I thought this movie was about a guy who has been locked up in a mental hospital for the past 15 years and was able to pull some strings with the help of his family and friends to escape.

First off let me say that this movie is nothing spectacular . The cast is like the saved by the bell kind of characters. They are all the same and we see their back story that is all about how they ended up in prison. I really thought that was the whole story of the movie but they didn’t give us anything new to say. They just rehash what was already said for the first 2 hours. I mean if you have to ask what the story is then why are you even watching the movie.

The plot of this movie is dangerously thin and the only "star power" if we can call it that consists of Joe Estevez. I don't know what is more shocking. The fact that this movie was made or the fact that some people actually gave good comments about it. If you ever see the cover of the video you'll be able to read them. Someone even went as far as saying that the actress/writer could be the leading lady of the 90's. Yeah! And Joe Estevez could have more money than his brother Martin.

I saw "Sweeney Todd" on Broadway in 1980. It starred George Hearn and featured most of the other cast principals who appeared in the national touring company production, which was videotaped for TV in Los Angeles in 1982. Last night I watched the new DVD release of the Los Angeles production, although I have owned the videotape for many years. The production and the performances could have hardly been better but the original tape's age showed because both the audio and video quality are below modern standards, even on a newly pressed DVD.

This movie is funny in more ways than one . It 's got action . It 's got humour . It ' s got a great story . It has a terrific score . But it's not as good a movie as its trailer suggests . The trailer, of course , doesn't help matters . The best movie is the movie . I saw it last night and found it to be an absolute riot. It has some very funny moments in the middle . Some very good moments in the end . But it 's got some pretty bad scenes in it .

For those that might send me nasty e-mails, shove it. There is a trend in Hollywood where those that create overly-quirky movies are instantly impervious to criticism. Garden State tends to be one of those movies. Sure, Zach Braff, star of a rather overrated sitcom, surprises people with some talent behind the camera, but that doesn't warrant the kind of praise that a film like this has been receiving. The story is often times too thin and shallow to provide any real insight. People have compared this film to The Graduate, but those type of people are the types that try to oversell independent cinema.

A fine line up of actors and a seemingly nice plot -- though not original -- promised me a nice surprise on Friday. The show was on the CW. This was the first episode of Arrow, a show that I've only just recently seen, and one that has never been on my list of favorite shows, let alone one that I've read or even reviewed. The show is written and directed by the talented David Nutter, who's also the creator, executive producer and show runner of such TV hits as The Walking Dead and the critically acclaimed The Americans.

I only heard about Driving Lessons through the ITV adverts, and to be honest, I didn't know how much I would like it. I switched on the TV last night and was totally surprised. Driving Lessons is a modest, simple film which draws you in right from the start. Rupert Grint plays the part of socially awkward teenager Ben brilliantly. He's definitely one to look out for in the future. Dame Eve Walton is played by the fabulous Julie Walters. I loved the simple plot and the way the actors portrayed their characters with great sensitivity.

OK so this is about 30 minutes of gore with no story whatsoever . There is no spoken dialogue , no music and there is literally not a single image . I don't know whether this was done as a joke or for the purpose of it being a horror movie or a horror film , or if it has been planned from the very beginning , but if you have been living on this planet for any amount of time , you know it's a stupid movie , and I'm not going to explain it to you . The movie starts with three guys in black suits carrying a coffin through the woods.

OK , this movie was n't good at all . Video games are n't what I would brag on if I wnt to play, and when I want to play a video games , it n't easy to play them . what happened with this movie , is it is good ? No . at the beginning , it has n't so much to offer . I do n't wnt to watch the entire movie , so if you are interested in it , i'll wait for you , but if you are bored with this movie , I do n't recommend to see this movie .

8/2008 . When I originally wrote my comments , shortly after first seeing this film , I took a critical view on it. It seemed like a typical horror film that was not very good. However, after seeing it again, it’s actually a great film. The only thing I really hated about the movie is the editing which I feel makes it look like a horror movie and it made the whole movie less effective than it already was. This is a very interesting concept and I hope that the director will come back to try and improve on it or even make it a horror/thriller movie again.

Dodgy plot , dodgy script , dodgy almost everything in fact . The most compelling performance is that of Joanna Lumley as Eloise. She’s brilliant. The way she walks up the stairs to her brother’s room. The way she carries herself. I have no idea where she was born but this was the best version of her I have ever seen. It was all very well done . She has an incredible voice, she sings with real conviction and you feel that the story is as important as her voice. And the way she carries herself on the stage is very convincing.

This is an astonishingly bad action film. I'd say its primary flaw is that it's BORING. Arghh! Funky wardrobes, retro chic set design, and decent cinematography cannot prevent this flick from being a snoozer. Mod Squad's second (major) flaw is its lack of character development--underscored by the actors' lack of talent. I tend to like Claire Danes's work so I was quite surprised by her non-existent performance in this film. Giovanni Ribisi is woefully miscast: how could his cotton-mouthed, bumbling acting style possibly fit into an ACTION flick?

Really ? Is this necessary ? How can somebody make such a film ? Disgusting ! ! ! Seteven Seagal , a great director, can't do this, can't be an actor in a film like this. It's a shame. I thought I was doing the right thing and that I should just put the trailer up. I didn't know how wrong I was. This is disgusting. This isn't a film by a "great director", this is a film with a trailer and without a film.

There 's not a dull moment in Francois Ozon 's `` Robe d'Ete '' . It 's surprising how much time it 's taking to do this. But don 't be misled. There is no boring moment, it 's just you, me, and the robot. This isn't a bad game, really. The player has a chance to build up their own character, a good one, if you will. There 's not a bad guy in there, just people and things you can use your robot to kill.

This movie was never intended as a big-budget film but was a cute little picture that pretty much anyone could enjoy. It probably won't change your life, but it is certainly charming and engaging.Clifton Webb plays a curmudgeon (that's certainly not new) who has a TV. However, his ratings are failing and he is worried about cancellation. So he decides maybe he is too out of touch with kids--as he and his wife have none of their own. So, he volunteers as a scoutmaster and regrets doing this almost immediately!

I seem to be disagreeing with a lot of folks here . but I really did not find this movie worth the money . the script by kim jong-soo was good , but the story , plot , acting , and acting in general is really bad . the acting in this film , and the music was good , but the plot , acting and acting in this film , is horrible . and as far as I can tell , not one line of the film is original . what happened was , this film was made based on an old novel . but it did not look good at all .

During an eight-year stretch of the 1980s when Charles Bronson made nine films , only one was released by a director he admired. In that movie, he was inspired by his father, a veteran of World War 2 who had served in the Royal Australian Air Force during the war. Charles was born on July 20, 1939, and was the second of three sons. He had an older sister. Charles was born in Perth, Western Australia, and was brought up in an Anglican home, attended public schools and was an altar-boy in a small Perth parish church.

Now out of all the shark movies I 've seen , this one takes the cake ! The plot of the story is simple enough. There is a shark out there that is killing people ! There is no reason why he needs to do this , the sharks nature is such that they are perfectly capable of avoiding the problem that is killing them . But when he gets the chance he decides to take advantage of the situation and try to kill a human ! He then decides to come after other humans as well , and that is where the problem comes in .

I saw this movie and I thought this is a stupid movie . What is even more stupid is that they make it so you can buy a movie that is not in the movie rental store. That is their fault, but they have no excuse for not giving a copy of the film to the movie theater that has been showing it for years. As for me I didn't care if the movie was not in the theater. I don't even think I would buy it if it was on VHS. I am going to watch it in the theater.

This was not a good movie!! Why do you people keep saying that? There is a nice little story going on and then some sexy girls and then BAM vampires!!! Why? Why are there vampires? Where did they come from? Also, what the hell?! There are all of these "super human" vampires but George Clooney and three other random guys dominate ALL of them. Quickly too. It's not like there was a long fight scene with lots of struggle. There was just three dudes from the bar killing these vampires like a fat man kills twinkies!

When a movie called Hell Ride comes out you expect a certain amount of biker cliché . With character names like “The Stalker” or “The Beast”, they are the standard biker trope of a bad guy with a “beastly” voice and bad intentions . Yet, that movie is actually a very interesting and enjoyable film that shows an alternate, more realistic version of the “beastly” biker stereotype. With that said, it can be difficult to see the difference between the fictional version of the beast and a “real” one in the real world, or even a “real” biker stereotype.

I think Walter Pidgeon was badly miscast in this film . Just not believable in the role . Barbara Eden as the mother was also a poor choice. I mean Pidgeon does a good job of acting his part, but I think this is the first time a woman in that role has ever played in a film. So I will take it as the director intended. I don't think a woman can act in a part of the film that requires that much muscle. I do agree, Barbara Eden is a poor choice for that part. And the mother is a poor choice.

This film started off really tense when a poor young boy is set upon by a pack of savage dogs. However, with the aid of a pair of cats and the arrival of his grandmother, it ends with the boy walking out of the situation alive and uninjured. This is not the first time that a film has tried to tell the truth about what it was like in the aftermath of natural disasters. But for many of today’s audiences, these are the last films made about the people caught in natural disasters, the ones that are still left behind.

Filmmakers made a rather boring everyman 's story look interesting and complex by focusing on his wife back at home. The fact that she's a journalist, on top of the fact that the director is the wife of the star of one of her most critically acclaimed films, should tell us that we don't have to worry about her being involved in the making of her film. The film, which also stars John Turturro, also includes some of the film's biggest stars of the '80s and '90s, including Cate Blanchett, Paul Bettany and Robert De Niro.

I see that C. Thomas Howell has appeared in many movies since his heyday in the 80s as an accomplished stuntman. As I recall, he was featured in many of the early '80s films and shows. He's been on TV for years. His work in the past few years, though, hasn't been nearly as well known, if at all. I remember that he was also one of my favorites. He was also in a great movie a couple of years ago in which I don't know the title. He played the part of one of the gangsters and he had a great face.

this movie is honestly the worst piece of rubbish i have ever seen. this is slow, plot less and boring. the cinematographer deserved to be shot. There were various aspects of unintentional comedy, one of which was Jared being oddly camp. Raised many laughs but also many yawns. don't watch with anyone, anytime any place. If u hate someone, recommend they buy or rent this. big waste of time and money. Thanks Gus Van Sant...not. i cant think of anything else to say except Don't ever see this movie, it will make u want to jump off a cliff.

I absolutely hated this movie . Even though the movie wanted to transmit some kind of social message , it didn’t come through for me . You see , this movie was made before the social media age . There are all these social networks out there and the people on them are supposed to be able to “share” what they are seeing . But in a movie like this , you have to have some kind of reason for people to want to share it with you . What the hell kind of movie was this supposed to be about ? .

I 'm a fan of the old SCTV show from the late 70 's and early 80 's and John Mahoney was the main star. I thought the episodes were pretty funny and I was just a fan. So when I heard there was a new SCTV revival on DVD I knew I would love this collection. I have been collecting SCTV DVDs ever since the show ran. They are all in nice packaging with nice artwork. A few shows have been reissued. I have a collection of the new DVDs and they are in nice packaging too.

I unwittingly walked into this "trap" of a movie.If I could turn back time or simply get a refund I would be happy.It was 7:30pm and Cinderella Man didn't start until 10pm so I rushed into the theater to catch the movie that started at 7:20pm...and I dare say God reached out his hand (or retracted it) and allowed me to punish myself for my film gluttony by sitting in for this film.It may be unfair to criticize a movie that was not targeted at my heterosexual male cohort, however, there is no excuse for lousy sound and video editing.

I Would have to disagree strongly with the previous lame comment. I watched this not expecting too much from it. The Fact is that the cast were superb, Especially The lead Teen Female. The dark sides of them all came through, all were messed up in an not obvious way. There was an underlying current which ran through the movie of teenage angst and sexuality. The serial killer role was played well also as you could feel he had gone through what they had as children. What this movie is, is a strong drama/thriller.

Koyaanisquatsi is simply the best film I've ever seen. It's a masterpiece where everything is at the right place. Some scenes are not "nice" or "beautiful", but the camera never peeks or intrudes. This is exactly what's happening here. The camera is used to intrude, to disgrace and to ridicule. There is no magic flow here, no sense of greatness or respect. Instead some scenes are cobbled together without greater purpose or plan. The music is disturbing. Just as I rated Koyaanisquatsi the best film ever made, this one is the worst.

There is something that one of the characters ( the aging film director who pretends to be dead ) says on the show and the viewer thinks, what is this thing that the character is saying? And then I think, what is the character talking about? A bit further down the rabbit hole it leads me to another rabbit hole and I can’t remember where the rabbit hole leads me to! But I think I will just keep going. So let’s do some digging and let’s get lost in this rabbit hole for a little bit.

I won't be too hard on this show because I enjoyed the first season, but then, things got worse. The concept is nothing special, just about a girl named Casey who is trying to cope with a new step-brother, Derek, and his loud, crude family, while she gradually forces her princess standards onto each of them.In season 1, the story was actually interesting. I liked Casey back then because she was smart, strong, independent, and conservative. She was well-mannered and deep. I felt bad when she was being harassed at her new school by her new step-brother.

There are no saving graces in this dreadful, stagey, boring snooze-fest, which brings to mind "The Ransom Of Red Chief"! Even though there are some big stars in this film, the acting is almost uniformly terrible. Glenn Ford, normally a laid-back kind of guy, hams it up with forced emotion. Donna Reed is so over-the-top as to prove laughable. Leslie Nielson is woefully miscast and is terrible. The son is such a repulsive little brat, I found myself rooting for the kidnappers. The only decent performance in this mish-mash is the relatively minor role of the butler.

This is an interesting movie . I think it 's very humorous , although the humor is very black . But I like it because it's good to see a different side of life . This is one of the most well done movies of this year . I think it does not need to be seen as a kid or young person , but as a grown-up . I really enjoyed the movie . I like the way it looks , I like the message it has for people , and I think it should be a very important movie .

This film takes a lot of liberties with the known historical facts.Even little things like Flynn licking one stamp after the other are taken for granted, to the point that they’re not even noted in the film’s narrative, which is one of several reasons this book was written: to be honest I really wasn’t too interested in the idea of Flynn licking stamps for the first twenty years or so of his life, after all he’d probably been a stamp collector since his first stamp came in!

Oh yes , I admit I have made myself guilty of the crime of seeing this piece of trash . I have read every word of this review and I know exactly what the review writer was saying . It is true that this book is very well done . I have enjoyed it from the beginning to the end . It is the way a book is supposed to be , with a strong plot line , it doesn't have to be the most original way , but to be able to make it interesting and to be entertaining . This story was a great plot line , which was the best for me .

The story told by The Cranes are Flying is not , admittedly , all that original . Young lovers are forced to fly away together to save their own lives . When one of the young men is fatally injured in the crash he is rescued by his beloved, but she is killed in the crash . After this, the young lovers are forced to travel on an island in the middle of nowhere to make a new start together . Now, they are facing a series of obstacles, but they have an alternative plan . They will take turns flying on the same boat .

Don ` t be fooled into thinking that this is a remake as in this years remake of THE TIME LAPSE. It’s not a remake at all! I believe the movie was actually directed by James Newton Howard, who directed many classic horror films including NIGHT OF THE COWLINGHAM COW BOY, NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD, and COLD BLOOD. I don’t remember any of these films coming out in ’94, except the first two. The new film has no connection with the first two or the third ones.

i was a huge fan of this series. Yesterday i watched it again on DVD. I was apprehensive about whether laughs would come or not? But in a few episodes i was laughing hysterically and some episodes were good. Acting wise Rakesh Bedi(Raja} & Satish Shah is brilliant whereas Swaroop Sampat is plain bad but I think she gets the job done. Maybe a better actress could have been used in place of her. This series shows what good, clean comedy is.If this series were to air in the current year I would have given it 9/10.

Earth has been destroyed in a nuclear holocaust . Well , parts of the Earth , because somewhere in Italy , millions of people are now starving to death for want of food and water . This was the point at which most people on earth died of starvation . For a long time , no-one really wanted to take responsibility of the problem, because then they would lose their power, but it is so obvious that the world would have no alternative but to solve the problem. After all , there are millions of years left to do the job.

Though I have watched Salò, I do not know if excrement tastes tart. If it does, this "film" is accurately titled. So much of roughage, so little substance, this is the celluloid equivalent of celery - only it does not cleanse the palate. It leaves the taste of wasted time in the mind's mouth, and if I could vomit this film and get back that expanse/expense I would. Detention was more exciting. The director should be forced to wear a dunce cap, and the Spirit of Ed Wood Jr. couldn't save this semi-professional projection from certain failure.

This gem captures early 80 's life brilliantly . As a grad '83 boymyself , I must say that Valley Forge is very different to what I remember from High School (I've been a grad for over 20 years, so I must have missed a lot by now!) Valley Forge was really quite a unique place to go. I really like how it has grown over the years. I do remember being at school on the weekends ,and it was a different place then . I loved that I got to explore my neighborhood and make some friends.

This movie , with all its complexity and subtlety , makes for one of the most thought-provoking short films I’ve ever seen. Not to mention, for some reason the film manages to stay on the cutting-edge of this generation of cinema. There’s even a music video made for this. So what’s the big deal? Why is the film so good, and why do I feel so strongly that we should all buy it? 1. There’s a reason that a lot of the greatest movies of the modern age were made in Europe.

I wasn't expecting much out of this movie and I was slapped in the face. Julie Walters, Rupert Grint, and Laura Linney perform wonderfully as the main characters in this movie. Any teenager can relate to parental control and the urge to come out as who you really are, which is basically what this movie is about. Ben (Rupert Grint) does this when he meets retired actress Evie (Julie Walters) and begins to express his ideas with words. He slowly but surely breaks out of his shell and becomes much less awkward.

Well I guess I know the answer to that question . For the MONEY ! We have been so bombarded by the media that we don’t even have a clue how we got there ! If it wasn’t for you guys and the great work you are doing, we would NOT have been in the position we would be today and that is why I am in so much trouble for doing this interview ! I just feel it is a very good thing that you guys have helped us achieve our goals so far !

This is , per se , an above average film but why in the name of Bog was it made for the masses in the first place? There is NO reason why the film was made. It’s not like they thought it would be made into a full length feature or anything. No they made it into a short film to try and get it into the movie market. Also it was a low budget picture. And it got made in a time where no studio would touch a film unless it was a big budget production.

Strange, often effective hippie zombie flick, starring the unforgettable husband/wife team of Alan and Anya Ornsby, this movie isn't as bad as most in its genre, but is still way high on the cheese-factor. Includes several bargain-basement zombies, outrageously campy dialogue, a scene-chewing performance by Alan Ormsby, several gay/kinky grave-robbers, and one straange soundtrack. Wife Anya puts on a performance that's so odd, one has to wonder if she's really acting at all. There are much worst pics of this kind during the era (look for any Al Adamson flic), but it's no Night of the Living Dead.

I would not recommend it whatsoever. It was like getting stuck in the middle row of a theater, so I couldn't leave, and watching a part porn movie (except they didn't take their clothes off - it was the body language and definitely the language). I have to say I was embarrassed. Filming was very low budget, no good dialogue. Yuck. Actors stunk except The two best characters who got killed off (?) and they were David Carradine and Dennis Hopper. It did smack of Kill Bill and that old movie with the two guys who ride the dessert on their chopppers.

This is one of the worst movies I 've seen in a while . The acting was just soooo bad. I would hate to meet any of the people that wrote this movie. The story was just so depressing. It had me in the theater from beginning to end. I think I lost $150 to $300 for this movie. I could have done worse. I have a feeling this is going to become a big hit with people, I think the director is going to have an impact on Hollywood movies for years to come.

Michael Bassett's film 'Solomon Kane' (based on the character of the same name created by Robert E. Howard) is a disappointing Fantasy Action-Adventure film, that despite having a few scenes of genius falls flat with its awkward pacing, poor characterisation and general dullness. Solomon Kane (James Purefoy) is a mercenary of Queen Elizabeth's army fighting in Africa, where he comes face-to-face with the Devil's Reaper  a demon who collects the Devil's debts i.e. souls  refusing to go to hell just yet, he evades the Reaper and starts a new life in an English monastery.

When the Legends Die is a powerful , moving story of an orphaned Ute Indian who goes on to become a hero fighting for his rights. “I love the Legends Die because, when I started it, it was just a game and it grew into something more,” said Jason, who is 22 years old at the time of the game’s initial release last September, but is now 23 years old. “I started playing this because it’s just such a great idea. The game has come a long way and I want to continue this story.

I was expecting a lot more of this film than what I actually got. The acting was just awful from everyone and the story was far from impressive. It took a lot of something I don't to even follow what was going because it was so jumpy. An example of the acting is when Paxton's character, Vann, is upset the South Vietnamese colonel for so he throws some of the sand from the "sand map". It was impossible to get any idea of what he was feeling and his actions were robotic.

What can I say about this movie , it really is one of the worst gay themed movies , ever . I hate the idea of it . But i guess this is the only gay movie that i will watch , so its worth it to me . There was a film i saw about 6 years ago called The Gay Movie . It was very bad . Anyway , i saw this movie when i was in university . I had seen this movie before it was released . There was a poster in the film that told you which movie was the first gay movie .

There are rumours that a fourth Underworld is going to happen. If so, than the third part, which is also a prequel, would be in the middle of the franchise. With prequels that succeed the original movies, you always ask yourself in what order should you watch the movies, so that it makes sense ...In this case, I guess it doesn't matter that much. The third Underworld movie isn't up to par with the other two. They had their obvious flaws too, but this one lacks a few things and it feels like a cash in.

Emilio Estevez takes the wonderful play HOMEFRONT and makes it into an engaging movie.THE WAR AT HOME has an exceptionally beautiful script, written and acted by one of the greatest of all the “new” young playwrights. I’m always impressed by Emilio’s talent, he has a knack for writing strong, complex characters that never seem to go out of control. He also has a great eye for characterizations and his ability to make a simple story a work of entertainment. This is a fantastic film and I’m looking forward to seeing more Emilio Estevez in theaters.

Ahh, nuthin' like cheesy, explopitative, semi-porn, masquerading as horror...This one stars Jaqueline Lovell(sometimes Sara St. James), the nubile starlet also seen in "Femalien", "The Erotic House of Wax", and that family favorite "Nude Bowling Party". She is now a fixture in Surrender Cinema's line-up of talentless cuties starring in pointless, soft-porn exploitation flicks. "Head of the Family" actually tries to be a real moovie. A con-man and a tramp try to get said-tramp's husband off-ed.

What ever happened to shows with united parental figures? The parents in this show are nearly as irresponsible as the children. Instead of punishing the youngest child for being manipulative, they let her get away with murder. They can't ever agree on a course of action when it comes to dealing with the children, and instead they do nothing. Yeah, great plan. Just ignore their behavior because they're "cute." This show tells the already manipulative preteens that watch it that the "divide and conquer" technique is the best way to get their parents to "cave."

As a geology student this movie depicts the ignorance of Hollywood . In the scene where the dog grabs the hand of the professor and asks him to give her the money she asks him to give her the paper he is holding. That's all we get. That's what we see of the whole movie. It is not shown what happens with the money. You will never get an answer about this. What we do see is the dog licking the hand that has been put in his hands. It's just a simple kiss.

i was having a horrid day but this movie grabbed me, and i couldn't put it down until the end... and i had forgotten about my horrid day. and the ending... by the way... where is the sequel!! !the budget is obviously extremely low... but ... look what they did with it! it reminds me of a play... they are basically working with a tent, a 'escape pod', a few guns, uniforms, camping gear, and a 'scanner' thing. that is it for props.

A very , very , very slow-moving , aimless movie about a distressed , drifting young man . Not sure if it has any meaning for you , or if it has meaning at all , I’ll have to wait till the DVD arrives to judge that . You see , this is a film that was directed by Paul Greengrass , so it will definitely have meaning for him . This film is set in the year 2025 , and it stars the late great , great , great , George Clooney and his wife Christy Turlington ( one of my all-time favorite actresses ! ) .

Although its plot is taken from the history of ancient Rome, 'Caligula' is not made in the style of sword-and-sandal epics like 'Spartacus' or 'Gladiator'. (That style of movie-making was out of favour in the late seventies). Rather, it more closely resembles a cross between a soft-core porn movie and a video nasty. At least, the shortened 150 minute version does. I have never seen the full 210 minute version, but to judge from the descriptions of it on this page, it would seem closer to a cross between a hard-core porn movie and a video nasty.

I got this movie as a buy one get one deal at troma.com with The Ruining ( which is n't available at Troma) but I saw it was made in Germany. I also saw the cover art as well as the poster. I liked it. The story was great and the special effects were very effective as well as it being a sequel. I would definitely re-watch this film and I am pretty sure I might watch it again but not like the movie I just saw, it would be a bit too long. I have to admit that I was a little disappointed in the story.

I 'm sorry , but I can not understand what people were smoking when they wrote how great they thought it was! They were smoking the product, which is a carcinogen! I guess that people should be more serious about what they are smoking. And I agree with you that the tobacco industry should put a price on their product (which they have not). They are making money from the smokers, but the people who think that the product is good, are the ones who are ruining the lives of so many people out there, and this is not helping them.

Wow , I was told this would be a B movie worth watching . I feel that I was misled . I do not wish to say that it is bad . I did not want to give spoilers , I only want to make it clear what I thought of the film . This is the movie I wanted to see from the start and it is one I will always look back on . I do have some minor gripes and complaints about the movie , though . One is the ending . While I can understand not getting the last act finished , the movie seemed rushed and unfocused , like it was lacking something .

At the time of this writing ( January 25 , 2006 ) , I am saddened to hear of the passing of my friend Michael. A true champion for the community and a good friend to many. A person I will always be proud of for his integrity, service to his community, dedication to his family, and service to his God. I will miss him very much. I am sorry to see his passing, but also proud to see him lead the way for many of the good, hardworking men & women who served our great nation.

I viewed the movie for a second time on September 30, 2006 and thought that it was even better than the first time I saw it. I thoroughly enjoyed the acting, especially "Uncle Benny". I thought that Fred Carpenter did an excellent job of writing and directing this film. The story line definitely kept your interest and I hope this movie makes it all the way to the top. I felt it moved very smoothly between scenes and the surprise twist at the end, well, lets just say I didn't see it coming.

Young , ambitious nurse Ms. Charlotee ( Rosie Holotik ) is sent to work at a mental asylum out in the countryside. While there she falls in with a group of patients who are looking for their missing mother. Ms. Charlote quickly finds herself involved with the group and she finds herself drawn into their world , finding herself struggling to fit in . One of the patients is Ms. Charlote's fellow nurse , who she finds to be a bit more of a nuisance . She soon starts to fall for the patient , only to find herself pushed to her limits as she struggles with the patient and the group .

The acting made you feel like you were watching a kindergarten play . The story is full of holes and there was no explanation for any of it. I could have watched that show for weeks in a row. It was so confusing. I feel you. I've seen all of those movies. I still don't get the ending. And when I think about what they were talking about, I realize I can't wrap my head around them either. It is one of the things I hate about sci-fi. There are so many mysteries that have no explanation.

The film deals with universal themes , mentioning no specific country as its context : it could happen anywhere -- at least in India , and it may have happened many times in the past in many parts of the world. But it's interesting to have a film that covers a wide spectrum of subjects, that is not simply an attack on India, or an Indian movie. I think that it does make some good points about the nature of our society. The movie has some great actors, and a great director, who makes sure that there is a lot of energy in every single shot.

no really, im not kidding around here folks, and i so cant believe how many people here have given it really really positive reviews! oh wait, its the IMDB comments section, silly me. its interesting to note that at this date, there have not been enough votes to give this film a rating out of ten, yet there are dozens of comments that rave about the film. what does this mean i wonder? anyway, the script IS terrible. character change their personality and motivation and actions every scene, in order to keep the movie running along at something that vaguely resembled a pace.

Director Jeremiah Checheck who brought us big budget debacles like `` The Avengers '' and the remake of `` Diabolique '' are teaming with director Michael Bay and actor Tom Hardy to bring you ``Saw 3D ». The three-part series also stars Bruce Willis. The movie is scheduled to be released this fall. ``I've got the team and I know the rules, so I'm going to try to break them all,'' said Bay. ``This is the biggest project I've ever been involved with. It's a big commitment, a big challenge.

If you are a Christian or a Jew hoping to see an accurate Biblical (or Torah) portrayal of the events in Exodus, you will be disappointed by this movie. In typical Hollywood fashion people who are not even in the Bible have been "created" for supporting characters and play a large role in the movie. Jethro's role is changed completely and he becomes nothing but an untrusting father-in-law instead of a Shepherd priest who gave Moses excellent advise. God is largely removed from the movie, and instead viewers are given the impression that Moses had to figure things out for himself.

`` Lets swap Murders- your wife , my father '' - seemingly innocent conversation between two strangers - Bruno Anthony Murders in the heart of the American suburbs where he was found. Murders was born and raised in the Chicago suburbs and has lived in various parts of the United States and Canada . He was born to a middle class family of Italian descent . His parents moved the family from Illinois to California , where they grew up , and were later sent to live in Wisconsin . Murders has two sisters and a sister who is married to a police officer .

I like Steve Buscemi . I like his work very much , both as an actor and a director . I’m not going to be able to afford his movies , but those who are can go see his movies . They’re worth seeing . I’d much rather watch him as a director . But he’s also a wonderful actor . He has an amazing voice . And his work on the TV shows is really amazing . But I don’t have it in me to see the movies. But if I were going to, I’d watch the movies with my friends .

I will never , ever forget watching this show around the age of 13 . Even at the young age of 26, I was able to not only watch a show in which my dad had appeared , but also to feel as though I had been a fan of his work all my life! And it was all thanks to my sister, my brother, my brother in law and of course my friends! The show itself was a wonderful experience and one that I hope to go back and watch one day , but this was the first show I watched that was based on my own imagination.

Don't get me wrong this was fun to watch. It has some nice animation with exception of an odd looking Bugs, and some nice music. And the standout scene was definitely Elmer, Bugs and Daffy's dance on the floor, that was such a nice and fun touch. As a matter of fact, the whole cartoon is nice to watch, but all in all it is not what I call exceptional like Carrotblanca. There are some very nice gags, but they have been used before I feel, and there wasn't much that I would deem hilarious.

This episode of Charmed changed everything ! The show is about to end it 's third season , and all the new characters are going to be introduced , which I really like. I also think that this show deserves a 5 star rating just for that . The show started in September , 2010, and finished in December, 2015. There's a lot to read about the story , the characters , the events and even the show itself . We will talk about it later when the new season comes . As you might remember , the main character , Charmed is named Lacy .

This is a crummy film, a pretender to a genre of surprise ending movies. And a genre that has been done so much better before. The plot limps along, with a predictable ending. (Yawn) The characters are unlikeable, and some are so unlikeable they are almost unwatchable. Matt Dillon, a fine, intense actor is totally miscast here and is stiff and mannered. The others are forgettable. Much of the dialog is sophomoric, again a pretender trying to be witty. I wouldn't hire the screenwriter to write my grocery list.

This is an excellent film , but Momento ( Nolan 's other big budget film ) is much better . In fact I saw it as a part time job on the side, but that was a while back , so I don't know who was directing it ! If you like action , it should appeal to those with a healthy appetite for popcorn . I like this, I am glad it's back , but it's not without a few flaws ( not that I have seen all of it ). But it is still a good film and worth the time.

Killer Flood: The Day the Damn Broke: 1/10: Finally a movie whose title is spoiler proof. Even by the low standards of disaster movies, excuse me allow me to correct myself, even by the low standards of made for TV disaster movies this is truly awful. Where do I begin? The dam modeler may have once seen a photo of a dam but I doubt it. Most dams, especially large ones that generate electricity have oh I don't know a power plant nearby, some sluice gates for water to run through, heck even a high tension electrical wire or two.

WARNING!!! SOME POSSIBLE PLOT SPOILERS, AS IF THAT WAS POSSIBLE!! !Okay, if you haven't figured out the plot yet, I am going to give it to you. Two couples head out to a camping site, but a clown masked killer shows up and causes all sorts of mayhem.Now it is time for me to give these couples some advice.1. Never, ever go to camp dubbed Camp Blood by the locals. 2. Don't have sex or make out in front of the killer. 3. Don't go chasing after the killer if he or she runs away.

1st watched 8/7/2004 - 3 out of 10(Dir-Brett Thompson): Silly, juvenile-focused movie about three kids being zapped into their favorite cartoon with their parents experiment. The script left much to be desired in this Hanna-Barbara like rip-off of some Saturday morning 'live-action with people in dinosaur costumes kids show' with some goofy cavemen hanging around. Nothing really to admire about this and nothing much to be said either. I'm just amazed I found this at a Blockbuster video store as bad as it was and the way the stores are ridding themselves of old VHS movies.

My friends and I saw this at the San Diego Black Film Festival. It was great. Stormy is a strong black woman and Nana reminds me of my grandmother. Rene is FINE!!! Seeing him take off his clothes was definitely worth the price of admission. Can someone forward me his contact info?My friend thinks Flex is the finer of the two. She's been a Flex fan for years though so she might be a little biased. The cousins were funny and just as trifling as Nana described them. LOL.I am looking forward to seeing this movie again when it comes to theaters.

This film has some flaws, and most of those flaws are a lack of anything happening. Possibly the greatest film to show the direness within Fly-Over Country, "Rolling Kansas" is a film in which nothing happens and you don't care about anybody. Like life, it starts, it moves, and then it ends. A few attempts at humor are made, but everything falls very flat. The occasional cameo just reminds the viewer that they could be wasting their life doing something besides watching this movie and the one rock song they bought and used at every single instance.Do yourself a favor and go see a good movie.

This is an unusual film because although it was made by Twentieth-Century Fox because it 's one of the few American films made in Britain, the director was American, and his name is George Stevens. He is credited as screenwriter with the title of "George M. Stevens". The film is directed by John Ford (died 1957) and is based on the story of a real person. It is one of those rare films with a British cast. In the film Stevens is the only actor not of British extraction.

If anyone tells you this picture is just terrific they probably have something to do with either making it or stealing it or both…

That was the picture of the last of the Great Pyramids, built for the Pharaoh Ramses III in 1350 BC. The Egyptians used them for all sorts of important purposes ranging from religious rites to power struggles and military campaigns. As you can probably imagine, nobody could agree on just where the two Pyramids were in relation to the city of Giza, which sat atop them. So they were divided up and each got a different name.

Dick and Jane Harper (Jim Carrey, Téa Leoni) wind up on the unemployment line when the corporation Dick works for is caught in a corruption scandal, and after desperately and unsuccessfully trying to find jobs, the duo turns to crime in order to get them out of poverty.I've always been a fan of Jim Carrey. It's been awhile since he has made a straight up comedy. The last one was Bruce Almighty which was pretty good. He has proved that he can do serious dramas but comedy is his real element. Fun with Dick and Jane proves that he still has it.

Six months after high-school sprinter Laura dies during a race, a killer begins to murder the rest of the track team using a variety of sports equipment as weapons: that's the daft plot of early 80s slasher Graduation Day, a lacklustre addition to the genre that offers very little in the way of style, originality or decent gore.What it does deliver, however, are some stunningly awful musical interludes, a few familiar faces (including an early appearance from scream-queen Linnea Quigley), and a smattering of nudity (a prerequisite of any slasher movie!

There's a certain irony in a parody of the Gothic genre being turned into a mess of clichés by filmmakers who either had no idea what the story's purpose was, or just didn't care. All of the hallmarks of your average family film are present- rambunctious younger siblings, a grumpy teenager who doesn't want to move, unsympathetic parents who are unable to see the apparition, and of course a romantic subplot. The movie has very little in common with Wilde's original story, which was largely written to poke fun at the melodramatic Gothic novellas that were all the rage at the time.

The makers ask for a huge suspension of disbelief , you grant them it in the hope that given a little time they will deliver the goods. It's an interesting way to try and make your life more comfortable without giving them too much trouble. If you're a gamer you don't get too excited about the possibility of these games coming to the platform because you're more interested in the game itself. It just makes you feel like you should be able to play it with a console, so you'll be fine.

I watched this movie three times at different ages of my life and always did enjoy it very much indeed. This Can-Can is an authentic explosion of joie de vivre, like Stanley Donen and Gene Kelly musical, but in French way. And a Jean Renoir nice tribute to his time, his friends, lovers, music and dances. It is at same time a show business chronicle of that age, full of affection and French mood. It is too a clear tribute to the Impressionism (people who likes impressionistic painters will like this picture).

I rented this type of "soft core" before, but I can honestly say, I wasn't expecting this to be in the same type as "Rod Steele: You Only Live Until You Die"--which was both sexy AND funny. It had a good script, a sincere leading man, and a sense of purpose. It also has Gabriella Hall who is hot. The reason why I didn't expect this movie, was because the box was missing the "Must be 18 to Rent" Sticker. I was looking for more "cheese" and less "cheesecake.

This movie is really bad. The hero can't play. You see too much that he learned his walking moves by heart. And believe me, he walks a lot. For 45 min, nothing happens. He only walks to places and gets out..... Like if the story was so short that they had to extend it by adding useless and boring "looks-like-a-suspens" scenes.Dialogues are very poor. I counted around a lots of "hello's" and few "hang on" on the 1st part.Blood is orange like the Mercurochrome you put on kid's blisters.

It 's really good to see Van Damme 's film are slowly getting better of late and especially compared to the previous ones he has made. His film is about a soldier and his love for his ex-wife. The film starts with a man being sent to the hospital for a chest X Ray. His wife tells him that the X Ray revealed that he has cancer. The soldier becomes so depressed. He then meets a girl who is his ex-wife's cousin. Her father, who was in Vietnam, has recently died. The two of them become best friends as the war is coming close.

Oh my God ... where to begin ? `` Chupacabra Terror '' is one of the worst B-Horror movies ever made. It is also one of the most expensive. It is not very well made and has very poor writing and poor effects. It is also not very good horror film. And it is made by a company with a bad reputation for quality of the horror movies. There are several people who have said that they had made the movie and then it became a flop, because of its horrible writing and horrible effects. It seems like that it does not have a good reputation at all.

I cant go for long describing this tittle, simply because I do not feel strong about it. I read a few comments and I see that only proud and patriotic Frenchmen seem to like it, that's all I can say...Boring Long Sometimes even stupid...p.s. 7.4 out of 10, the viewers must be going crazyI cant go for long describing this tittle, simply because I do not feel strong about it. I read a few comments and I see that only proud and patriotic Frenchmen seem to like it, that's all I can say...Boring Long Sometimes even stupid...p.s.

I ca n't believe that Isaiah Washington and Ice-T were in this mess ! The plot ( and I use this term loosely ) was too complex to have a simple answer ! They had to get to the core of the mess. I mean, look at it with a cold, straight-shooting, cold-case-inspection-and-confirm-thestery-is-there look. But then, why does it take this long? Because it takes time to make it look like something other than the way it is ! And I am not saying that they were careless or that there is something that they couldn't have done, either.

You Belong To Me was the final teaming of Henry Fonda and Barbara Stanwyck as a screen team and it was also their last big screen movie together as Fonda would die only three years later. Fonda would die in February of 1976. Stanwyck would become an active member of the American Film Institute and its Board of Governors after she would pass away in the summer of 1976. And a few years later she would become the first female member of the Academy Awards Committee. In addition to her work in the industry, Stanwyck also became the first person of African ancestry to join the Academy Awards Committee in 1973.

So, it's Friday night and you want to go watch a movie...all you want is something entertaining, not too artsy, or anything that might require a long night of philosophical discussions. So, you pay $10 to watch the Mod Squad. The trailer to this movie should have tipped me off, but come on...it's three of Hollywood's most beautiful people--eye candy. But that's about it...a string of moving Prada ads. And what did Hollywood producers forget? A plot. Why are these kids running around the streets after some unknown enemy?

I think my summary says it all . This MTV-ish answer to the classic Candid Camera TV show features a guy who gets into trouble by lying, breaking and stealing from people. But he doesn't care. It doesn't matter to him that everyone on his street knows who he is. He's the one who has to deal with the consequences of his dishonesty. And it's his honesty that helps him stay on top of the situation. What a guy! I love that they make you lie for them. It makes them feel good.
