OK so this is about 30 minutes of gore with no story whatsoever. There is no spoken dialogue, no subtitles, not even any real characters. You see three people in the entire movie (that are alive) and two are just there for very little reason. The main guy has no emotion and just mutilates corpses for no apparent reason. That is the entire movie. I love to see very gory movies, especially since in America real gore just isn't very common in modern movies. So yeah the gore effects were pretty cool. But it just isn't really disturbing.

This is without question one of the worst movies I have ever seen . However , it is also one of the best films I have seen. The plot is not as great as many of these films and the actors are not as good as others but the story is still amazing. There is however a slight problem that the ending does not go as you would like and you don’t understand why your friend did not turn and leave. This movie starts off with a man who has been a criminal for a few years now being released from the prison he was in for a minor assault.

I mean really, really, REALLY high and this movie has a shot at entertainment. I don't mean regular high, i mean the high where reading the phonebook would have you in stitches. otherwise save the time out of your life and go do something more constructive with it, like hitting your head on a brick wall and insulting your own intelligence. A complete waste of talent in some cases (Bernie Mac, John C. McGinley, Tom Kenny, and the master of hams Shatner) and exactly the kind of crap they deserve to make (the myriad of rappers who insist on making movies).

This is easily one of the best movies of the 1950s . Otto Preminger directed only four or five really excellent pictures . One of them was his last, "The Passion Play," with John Barrymore and Marlon Brando . "Passion" has never really been equaled in my opinion. The rest of them were far inferior. His "The Miracle Worker", "The Passion of Christ", "The Ten Commandments" and "Sunset Boulevard" are all among my favorites of all time. It's a very good movie but I don't think that I ever watched it in my whole life.

Just a few words: it's a good thing George A Romero is still among us cause if he were dead, he would be forced to rise from grave to vote against the people who made this 'political satire' And the saddest thing of all is that I actually agree with these people's sentiments. Yeah there's zombies in it and they do have a good reason to come back from beyond the grave: to vote. Oh, and one of them finishes off The Doctor from Startrek Voyager. That's about as scary as it will get, people.

I was actually around 13 years old camping near the McCloud River, near Shasta when this movie was being filmed. My family was paid to leave our campsite for the afternoon, when they filmed Vincent floating down the river. A little trivia...the scene where they pulled him out, was actually where he started his float down the river. And if the stunt man missed the netting, there was 20 foot waterfall about 1/4 mile down farther.Anyway...I watched it at the time, and didn't get it. It wasn't until years later when I saw the movie and actually understood the meaning of it.

Dear Readers, 2001: A Space Odyssey is Kubrick at his best...although I really can't say that as Space Odyssey is his only film I've ever watched. But still, it's a good film. Strange, but good.The movie is in three acts, much like the novel...which is unsurprising since the author wrote the screenplay. Anyhow, we first start out with the simple yet spectacular opening with Also Sparach Zarathustra blaring on the speakers. Then comes the boring beyond belief 'Dawn of Man' sequence.

This film is great! Being a fan of "The Comic Strip Presents..." I just knew I would love this film. And love it I do. I finally got round to buying a copy of this film early this year. However I was annoyed to find that it had been cut! So I'll keep looking at car boot sales for the original version.Anyway, the film is about Dennis Carter (Adrian Edmondson), who tries to impress his girlfriend (Dawn French) by claiming to be a drug dealer. However, Dennis is overheard bragging one night in the pub and nicked!

I only wish that I had the good sense to turn this movie off in the beginning when I knew what was going on. I think it's a terrible movie that's just not going to be my favorite. But, I think the beginning is a bit slow. It's like the movie doesn't start until about the third or fourth act. It's just frustrating. If you watch the whole thing, at least the second act would make for a great movie. I'll watch it later. It's the third act that's just...

Sandra Bullock is my favorite actress ..... But this movie was so horrible , I could n't help but chuckle to myself at the end! I was watching this movie when I came to the point where the characters started fighting in the middle of the scene. I've never watched that many fight scenes in one film before. I was wondering why the director had made such a horrible mess of it all and why he put so much emphasis on those scenes that the fight was actually happening. There were a few good ones throughout the entire movie but the acting was horrible.

This neo-film noir is one of a genre of late twentieth century American films that all seem to involve corrupt characters, fast cars, a ribbon of highway and, of course, plenty of guns wielded by people who appear never to have taken a gun safety course. The actors are the best reason to see "Black Day, Blue Night." There is the late, great J.T. Walsh ("Swing Blade," "Pleasantville," "Red Rock West," "The Last Seduction," and many more), who did many neo-films noirs (See also "Breakdown").

A BUSTER KEATON Silent Short.Poor Buster becomes THE GOAT ( `` scapegoat '' ) for a dangerous escaped murderer.This is a great story, not for the faint hearted, just for a good old fashioned adventure tale. You could be reading it right now... You know, with all the action, suspense... and danger... and suspense. But you are NOT, you are NOT reading it just for those elements. You ARE reading it... because it... is a BEAST of a story.... You don't read it just because the hero is named Buster Keaton.

The director of this movie is a famous french TV presenter , Patrick Sebastien . He likes music and humor and also loves to write. In this video he talks about his favorite TV shows and how he started to write his own comedy series, which you can find by clicking here. He also talks about what it's like to direct a series with an audience and why it's a great way for writers to work their way in. The show is made for a small audience of only 15-20 people . You can download it for free on this website .

Has this ever happened to you? I go into my local video store and see a few new arrivals in the "film noir" section. I spy a copy of a new arrival of a film I have never seen called NAKED ALIBI. Its from one of those mail order video companies that offers (mostly) "dupey" looking copies of hard to find titles. The description on the box sounds good. The film has players I like (Sterling Hayden, Gloria Grahame, and Gene Barry). So I take it home and watch it.

This is my favorite Renoir from the Fifties . It 's the story of how Henri Danglard built and launched his empire. Henri was a Frenchman from Lyon who had moved to Paris in 1923. He had worked at the French Ministry of War, and by 1929, he was working as an official at the Salon de la Dépêche, the official publication of the Académie Française, a prestigious French art and literature body. Henri and his wife Marguerite became very close to a young German woman named Elisabeth, and she was already well connected in France.

This is by far one of the best films that India has ever made . Following are the plus points and what the director has done so well to bring to the screen:

The first thing that one notices about this is that everything that happens and is seen in this movie is real and not a dream . You don’t have a whole bunch of CGI characters . This is something that many Indian films have tried to do. The first of which was Rajkumar Hirani’s Ramayan, and the second was Prasanna Kumar’s Kurukshetra, both of which were quite good but not real.

UK-born Australian helmer Alex Frayne calls for attention with his strange, necessitating a meticulous read, visually stunning Modern Love (2006). Following the steps of a man incapable of controlling a drastic personality change spurred by the death of a close relative pic offers a fascinating examination of human psychology. Distributed by Accent Film-Australia.John (Mark Constable), his wife Emily (Victoria Hill), and their son Edward (William Traeger) arrive in a small Southern town to take care of his deceased uncle's (Don Barker) property.

I am a fan of bad horror films of the 1950s and 60s -- films so ridiculous and silly that you could watch them and not feel sorry for them, which was what the filmmakers intended to do with them. In the case of the film that I'm talking about, I'm afraid that I do feel sorry for the characters, but not enough to change their minds in the way that the filmmakers had intended. I'm referring, of course, to the films made by John Stears in the early 70s. Stears was the writer/director of a trilogy of films, all featuring a female protagonist.

You know , before seeing this film I had little sympathy for those caught up in criminal cases . I felt like they deserved the punishment they received , I could even say it was unjust . This movie however , brought back the same emotion I had for the characters I grew up with , it brought them to the place they should have gone , which in my eyes was a place they deserved to be. It was a story about people in need , but it also felt like a story about people in recovery .

A thinly veiled attempt to push Hulkamania to the film going non-wrestling fan . What could be worse than Hogan in a tuxedo? A wrestler in a gorilla suit?!?! I love wrestling but I cannot stand Hulkamania! Hulkamaniac is a terrible character to watch and this film is trying to be like the WWE Network but I can’t stand it either! Hulkamaniac’s gimmick was to have him go ape for the whole movie. The only good thing about the film, and the gimmick, is his hair.

Age of Steel follows up the previous episode , Rise of the Cybermen , which was excellent in some respects, but in others didn't quite hit the heights of the last one. With the last episode we were shown what a Cyber-attack from the future would be like and there wasn't much time for the team to react and think as a result. We didn't need that for Rise of Steel, so we went into this episode with some of the characters still wondering where their team members were, if there was any change in their mindsets, and the knowledge that the situation was much, much more complex.

Poor Bela Lugosi . Just another day at work . A group of saboteurs attempting to disrupt the American war effort. And that’s only half of it . They’re not alone in their desire to sabotage – they have a lot of resources to go around. I have been waiting for the film to see if it is a sequel to The Terminator (1984). The first movie was quite good in my opinion but this film needs to go much further. The story and characters are well done and the story is quite fascinating.

"Down Periscope" has been in our library since it first arrived in VHS. Since then, we have acquired the DVD and a digital from Cinema Now.It is a quirky flick that does not go militarily overboard as either pro or con. It is first and foremost a comedy and as a vehicle for the main characters, I am quite surprised that a sequel has never been offered.The movie has gained a following that borders on a cult obsession, even among the very young. I became aware of this while visiting the USS Drum in Mobile, Alabama in 2002.

As a nice anecdote to one of the above comments: In was in Mumbai about two weeks before the release of this movie, I was approached -being white- to dub some of the lines of this movie in a recording studio.While I speak German as well, i was kindly asked to do all dubbing scenes in English, otherwise it would be too confusing for the Indian audience... So therefore, all Germans in this movie actually speak English! funny enough i did multiple characters, so if you would want to actually spoil some time by watching the movie again, listen carefully; all non-Indian characters are only done by 4 voices!

Heftig og Begeistret ( Intense and Enthusiastic ) is a documentary-like story of a male choir up in Berlevåg in Norway. As part of a yearlong tour they performed at several music festivals and schools, with a performance at an international music conference in Copenhagen, Denmark in 2013. Heftig og Begeistret was also broadcast to an estimated 2,100 Norwegian school children and their families in 2014. The documentary, produced by Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation in Norway, features choir members and their families, as they discuss the origins of the choir, the growth of the band and their personal experiences with music.

Six months after high-school sprinter Laura dies during a race , a killer begins to murder the rest of the women and girls, all of whom he believes are his sister-wives or sisters. After the first murder, they all begin to disappear, leaving the killer, now a woman, alone in the world of the living. She has to learn to respect the others if she hopes to live the life of an adult. After all the killings, the girl's father has to decide what to do in the face of the constant threats. His only daughter has been taken to an orphanage.

It starts a little slow but give it a chance. In the spirit of the "Wackiest Ship in the Arm" and the "Pink Sub" this movie is about a not so orthodox group engaged in not so orthodox methods to outwit everyone. Rob Schneider is priceless as a LT that takes himself way too seriously which results in a failed mutiny attempt and "pirate" crew makes him walk the plank. In contrast Kelsey Grammar(similar to Cary Grant)does not take anything to serious except the job. This movie is more about lines than plot.

What a great cast and what a pathetic attempt at a film . The script is full of holes from start to finish but I did enjoy the film so much that it is probably the best thing I have seen in a very long time. I know that it has many faults in it but that is just the way I roll. I like the characters and the plot and the story. I don’t think that there is anything that needs to be fixed or changed in the film except for the ending.

Ahh , nuthin ' like cheesy , explopitative , semi-porn , masquerading as horror ... This one stars Jaqueline Lovell , and has a very similar style. It is about a girl who becomes possessed by a demon after a sexual accident. In a story that is more like a horror film than a horror movie, her boyfriend, who knows what he's doing, is called in to help her get rid of the demon. It looks like her boyfriend is having a bad trip, but it's actually a trick. So yeah, this is one movie I don't want to see again.

i watched all of the doctor who episodes that my local PBS station played while growing up . ( got the DVD ) I didn’t know any of the doctors, and I had never seen any medical shows on TV. Now, as a physician who has taught medical courses to college students, I watch all of these medical shows because I know that these doctors are giving patients a better medical care than the ones that are watching on TV. To me, watching shows like this helps me learn more, and makes me want to be more knowledgeable.

This is one of the movies one has to start watching with an open mind. One knows it's going to about a mute, one could look forward to or be afraid for a lot of sentiment.Well, forget it. The movie starts with a little black humour, and then gets started. From then on its takes you on an ever frightening ride through the dark centers of Moscow. All right, it must be said: the unexpected twists are expected, and the mute is mainly used as a plot tool or fear builder.

If you Listen to Ween (The Pod, God/Satan), then you know what's going on with "Split" I found that watching the film under the influence of LSD helped to deal with Audio/Video tracers from fantastic editing job. The plot was only important from second to second. The acid helped to interact with the sounds, subliminal and general pace of this masterpiece. Don't bother writing about something out of your comprehension's reach...There just isn't enough of these great independent attempts at expression at it's most raw , amateur level.

This is one of the movies having made significant influence on me as a person . The sound tracks are really good too . LOL! I've always enjoyed this film but I always felt it was a little too long to be entertaining, not that it's not worth watching in a shorter time! P.S. This is not the first time you will see this movie in any theater because it is showing on TV. I'm glad to see you like the movie because it's not very well known! I'm surprised you liked it.

George Zucco was like Boris Karloff in the fact no matter how poor the film he appeared in was , it always sucked , and the best he did was look bad and make him look like a stooge, which is exactly what the studio wanted him to do. It’s like they never read the reviews or anything else about this particular movie. I can only assume they wanted him to come across as ‘realistic’ as well as ‘in the moment’ and they wanted it to look bad so that they could make millions of dollars.

Okay , so I love silly movies . If you enjoy silly sci-fi movies , over the top movies , I will love you ! I love sci-fi movies . I especially love space movies . This is the first one I have been to so I am sure I will come back and love this movie as much as the first . But I have a question that I am not sure are valid . This is the same question I got when I was in college , what does it mean for a movie to be realistic ? I asked some of the same question , but now in my 30s .

Dolelemite ( 1975 ) is a cult classic . Starring Rudy Ray Moore as the pimp superhero out to wrong a man and get revenge. It won two Academy Awards ( for Best Supporting Actor and Editing ) and was nominated for an Academy Award in the same year. Dolelemite’s main purpose is to make money from the pimp-hero’s violent acts. This film has been criticized for its violence, but in my opinion, there are worse films out there. In this essay I’m going to discuss what is wrong with Dolemite.

this film explores if not creates a whole new genre with perfect imperfection --- hilarity, truth, fun, talent and circumstance that make for MAGIC. from creative musical numbers to off the cuff comedy that incorporates actors at their very best, if i hadn't have known better, i would have thought there was an elaborate script here.what you get: a mighty wind meets conversations with god meets something so fresh and new and delightful that it becomes it's own entity.peters and fell both give stellar performances and reel you in immediately. the rest of the cast is also phenomenal.

I must give credit to Billy Dee for trying to pull this off. Knowing this was a blaxploitation film, I started my DVD with a certain expectation. I knew it would be low budget... the acting sub-par... but hoped for a few gems to be sprinkled throughout. If there were any diamonds or gems sprinkled within this film, they were successfully buried under tons and tons of coal... or perhaps overacting. As an actor and filmmaker, I cringed often when potential poignant moments were ruined with atrocious performances. Yet, I must admit, I could not look away.

I found this movie immensely interesting yet a little jaded , it talks of violence and what there doing , but then again that is what movies are for , and to be honest it wasnt too bad . If you dont mind it is available on amazon for the most part , or you can look it up yourself if you want . I didnt know this movie was so violent , but I didnt mind it . I guess if you are going to get upset then you shouldnt go ahead and watch , but that is what movies are for .

... now please move on because that 's getting on my nerves.Seriously , the man behind brilliant pieces like `` The Case Against Common Core'' or `` What Do They Really Know About Elementary Reading? `` is not a person of color (I would guess it is African-American ) so if you want to be a bigot, get the hell over it and stop making a fool of yourself with this man, he is a piece of work. He seems to think I am a piece of work because I am a non-racist white woman, well, so are most people, you know.

there is one of the best movies directed by andrzej wajda,that story told about young writer who is seekin' his place after a second war(he's survive german camp).excellent true atmosphere(action goes in camp for displaced placed),main hero(played by one of the best polish actor daniel olbrychski) finally fall in love ,but unfortunately his lady has been killed .there was beautiful scene,when he is talking with american soldier and says (about death his girl)"nothing is happen,simply you're shootin' to us now... he's condition of soul has been destroyed.

then the second half of this movie is hard to follow . I got the first part with the Spanish dub . The second half and the third and fourth are in English. It is difficult to find the exact words for the actors. You will find out more and more as you go further in this series . I have to warn you that if you want to give it a try and you like the way it's shot , I'd recommend you go for the second half if you want to check it out . I liked it because there are some good and funny bits in this movie .

Every time I see a film like this I get sick to my stomach . When I watch a movie with a great story I am usually amazed by the way it unfolds , I think about it for a while , I know that it will be a good movie , and it has great visuals and sound , but until the movie comes to life it makes me nervous , and I want to know why it has been a failure . I saw this movie a couple of years ago when I was in the midst of a very stressful time in my life.

Maybe we Aussies just have a totally different sense of humour and therein my lie the only problem here. I have a database of all the DVDs I own (including those received as gifts - which this was) and so, when entering a new one, I always refer to IMDb for such info as genre, runtime, director, leads etc. When entering this, I noted that it was a comedy and so I decided to watch it at a time when I wanted something light and a good laugh. Well, it was neither!

Down at the Movie Gallery , I saw a flick I just had to see . It looked like a horror movie, but was in fact a good one . The movie was “ Dead Alive ” starring Michael Myers from the classic slasher movie of the 80s . I have watched the original movie about 20 times, so this is a real treat . I’m so excited to see this movie now , I wonder if I can go back in time to when I watched it . I’m glad they made the film available on DVD .

This movie tries its darndest to capture that classic bad canadian movie feel:"quirky" and obnoxious characters (a few); "quirky" town with "quirky" folk; a "quirky" coffee shop or restaurant (coffee shop here); lots of shots of canadian stuff for postcards (ocean stuff here); lots of mention of "gotta get out of this town"; downright booooring.And it succeeds on all counts.Something to note, though. I couldn't figure out whether this movie was just trying to be post-Northern Exposure "quirky" comedy or something surreal like a drug-induced or psychotic hallucination.

While out divining for water , a young psychic woman named Jessica Burns ( Carolyn Kearney ) stumbles upon something she can't quite figure out; an object that has been left here in the desert. Jessica is brought to an old mansion in the desert, which was once a resort and is now a desert retreat. It seems to be haunted and she must find the person who left it . Jessica must use all her psychic powers to discover the truth. What is she to believe? Who is this girl, and where is she now? This is not an easy book to get into.

You have to be awfully patient to sit through a film with one-liners so flat and unfunny that you wonder why you ever paid for the tickets in the first place. That’s what the critics thought when “Gangster Squad” came out in 2015, and that’s essentially what “Bully” follows this week. You have no doubt seen the trailer for the film, but here’s how it looks: A man (Chad Michael Murray) goes from one job to the next and gets fired from three of them in a few weeks.

How can ANYBODY give this anything higher than a ' 1 ' ? I thought `` Manos , the Handsome Greek God , was the only one who could get anything out of this movie . I think they are all wrong , and the movie isnt what it purports to be , so , its the wrong guys who think they are getting it . ( and I dont get the hype about this , because Ive never liked this movie and have never even seen it)

I agree, it's not the movie and it never will be.

Ca n't say this was n't made well . At a recent film festival the director admitted some scenes took a lot of work . I can't remember precisely where I saw it. It's in my head now and I've been waiting a long time to tell anyone. I've been asked if it's good and if I've had a good experience working with it. Now I don't know. I saw a lot of the first two parts of the film and it's really exciting to be involved in the next phase of the production.

Blackwater Valley Exorcism is set on a small town ranch where teenager Isabelle (Kristin Erickson) is found wandering around covered in dog's blood. Her parents Ely (Randy Colton) & Blanche (Leslie Fleming-Mitchell) own the ranch & are deeply worried about their daughter, recently she has not been herself & is considered a danger to herself & other's. Ranch hand & ex-priest Miguel (Del Zamora) recognises Isabelle's symptoms as a possible case of possession & when she starts to speak ancient Latin in a strange voice he becomes convinced of it.

My wife spotted this film on the aisle at a local video store. From the cover it looked like a science-fiction film, but upon turning it over my wife saw Rebecca St. James was in the film, realized it was a Christian movie, and suggested we watch it. We are conservative evangelicals but we also know that "Christian" films have a poor reputation in the mainstream. Nevertheless, we decided to give it a screening.To be fair, there were a few things I liked about the film. The musical score - much of which was orchestrated - was quite good.

It could be easy to complain about the quality of this movie (you don't have to throw cartloads of money at a movie to make it good, nor will it guarantee that it is worth watching) but I think that is totally missing the point. If your expecting fast cars, T&A or a movie that will spell itself out for you then don't watch this, you'll be disappointed and dumbfounded.This movie was thoroughly enjoyable, kept us on the edge of our seats and made us really think.

This is a low budget , well acted little gem . Alice , a small town Massachusetts teenager , fed up with having to be on her own , finds solace in her family's farm . When the farm is raided by a band of thugs . Alice has a last minute chance to escape with her two young cousins . Unfortunately her plans are foiled . As the mob closes in Alice begins to wonder . Will she be able to save her siblings . Will she get to meet her new friends ...or will they be lost forever ?

I'm sure that any legitimate submariner would happily ship out on the USOS Seaview (yes, SOS...) Why, you could play full-court basketball in the torpedo room, it's so large. And how 'bout the bay windows in the bow, the better to see giant squids or minefields that appear out of nowhere? Did I mention the colorful mess-cook with the parrot on his shoulder? And the Admiral's stateroom with what appears to be a loft? Big bleeping sub...OK, OK...it's never gonna win any prizes for authenticity.

Ben Marshall , a teen ager from a religious background , is made aware about the financial situation at home by his parents. They want him to get work and support from his parents, but he has to do it himself as he is only 16. The pressure of being a teenager and all the expectations of the future force Marshall to work hard and succeed. This is a very hard reality for Marshall and his parents. Despite all his efforts to find a job, he only receives 15 dollars a day at the food store where he works as a cashier.

Just saw this movie on opening night. I read some other user comments which convinced me to go see it... I must say, I was not impressed. I'm so unimpressed that I feel the need to write this comment to spare some of you people some money.First of all "The Messengers" is very predictable, and just not much of a thriller. It might be scary for someone under 13, but it really did nothing for me. The climax was laughable and most of the audience left before the movie's resolution.Furthermore the acting seemed a little superficial.

I mean, come on! This movie had such nice potential but it's like they ran out of money to finish the script and just telegraphed the whole damn rest of the movie about 2/3rds of the way through. Characters start spouting this movies whole reason for existence to other characters who didn't ask for the information on extremely flimsy premises. They also fall into some stereotypical behavior because that must be what's expected in this genre of movie. It's really pretty sad because this movie could have been so much more.I was really hoping this would be a good movie.

When I saw the trailers for this movie, it looked like a good romantic comedy. I expected some light fluffy fun. Instead, I was bored and a little depressed.Honestly, there was no chemistry between the leads at all, and the movie had little, if anything, that was funny about it. The little girl was adorable - when she cried, I cried - but I thought they might have used someone a little bit younger in the role.Either way, the movie was filled with long, dull silences or swelling opera music.

Wow , I swear this has never happened to me before . I only watched `` Golden Temple Amazons '' a year ago . The only reason is , I knew I had to be there . My family had asked to come so we could watch it with my mom and sister . My parents were a bit nervous at first , I was in my room . But the moment they saw me , they started to cry . I cried with them for about a year . But now , I am finally going to see a show that I never dreamt about before .

This is quite possibly the worst film I have ever seen . I would think you could get that from the trailer, the music is horrible, the movie just plain doesn't do anything in it. There's also the fact that it's only two-thirds of an hour long, which means that there's probably not too many other good things to come out of it. What a terrible movie and a terrible trailer. I don't mind that the trailer was a horror movie but to have this horrible movie play out in the theatres is pretty sad.

This is by far the worst movie i have ever seen. Its been a few years since I saw it and nothing has come close since then and i doubt that there ever will be a movie produced that is as bad as this. It tries to make fun of a variety of different movies, for example 'Nell' (!) and instead of funny its just pathetic. Whatever you do, don't rent or by this garbage and if someone throws it at you....turn around and run the other way! !

Once upon a time , way back in the 1940 's , there lived an actress named Veronica Lake . Veronica Lake worked for some very big names in movies . She had a knack for stealing the film's scenes . Her talent made her a hot commodity for movie producers to exploit . One such producer was a Mr. George Stevens . George Stevens was in the movie business from the 1920's to the 1950's . His movie business consisted of producing, financing, and distributing horror films . One movie he never produced or distributed was the movie called The Curse of Niblina .

I am an avid Julie Andrews fan and I just watched this for the first time on DVD -- the movie was originally aired on ABC in the 70's or 80's, I think, and she was doing the show for CBS. So this movie is pretty fresh in my mind. I wonder what this was like for her in her youth, because it's not something that was ever shown on the television. I'm wondering if there's anything in that movie that we don't know already. As someone who loves to read, I don't think it is a bad film.

I 'm a next generation person ... i 've never saw the original doctor who but i have heard about this doctor who is really great i want to see him because he is really good and he is the doctor that i want to have because he is the best in the world . This is very interesting, I have been in the same situation for about 7 years, and i have always been sick with colds and allergies. I have been diagnosed with chronic fatigue syndrome. But now the doctors tell me i need to start taking meds that can cause depression and anxiety.

I've seen a few bad action movies in my days, but this one's just plain awful. I feel it's a waste of time to even write this but I'll make it short. Why this movie suck? here are 10 reasons: 1. Very amateurly directed and cut. 2. Bad bad bad acting of the whole cast. 3. Silly dialogs and too many clichés. 4. Too many plot holes, a lot of scenes don't add up. 5. Bad photographing (and a lot of continuity issues). 6.

Ok, if you like yer monster moovies sullen, stiff, starchy, and thunderously dull, but with lots of throttling, then head right for "Lady Frankenstein", a stagy, costumy Italian corpse-walker. Joseph Cotten("Citizen Kane")plays the crusty old Baron himself, and must have really needed to make that condo payment. Sexy Sarah Bay, who has played in cow-ntless European B-films, usually as Rosabla Neri, including "Hercules Against the Moon Men", plays his ambitious daughter, a surgeon in a ruffled prom dress.

I 'm not really sure where to begin . From start to finish , bad , stinky bad , like my breath is so awful that it makes your mouth hurt . This is how bad the odor is . And yes this is my very first trip to the beach , and I have never come this far up the beach before . I 'm not a big fan of eating raw oysters , I have had them once but I hate the smell , even after I washed them . I tried to eat one this morning , when I was walking to work , I was very happy I ate one because it was good .

Why is it that every time I mention this movie to somebody , I have to hear 10 minutes of the movie before I can really get a decent idea what is happening? The movie has been available online in a bunch of formats, including VOD, for over a year now. And while I haven't watched it with a lot of attention, and am a lot more interested in what the rest of you think about this film, it seems like it hasn't been a big hit in terms of ratings.

The filmmaker stayed true to the most accurate account of the story published in 1894 which includes an 1846 manuscript by Edgar Allen Poe’s friend William Wilson. Wilson wrote a story entitled “The Pit” (1846) based on an idea he had originally had for a “fictional volume of verse.” He used the idea as a way to get the attention of the publisher of a Poe book, who offered him a sum of money. The story has been a staple of ghost stories for years, especially for horror film. It is also in the works as a book.

Estevez , Martin Sheen and Kathy Bates are superb in this portrayal of a Vietnam vet home from the war with a new outlook on life and what it can lead to. It is very moving and touching. I’m sure you’ve heard the saying “If you can stand the taste of the blood, you can drink the blood’’. In a sense, it’s not true for every single human, or every human being for that matter. I’ve heard many people say it in the past.

Hahahahah Probably one of the funniest movies i 've even seen . Obviously this is n't intentional though . It's actually more like the funniest way of watching a movie in a theater . But if you are looking for comedy this movie is for you . The plot is a bit convoluted, but it has comedy in spades . The humor is a bit childish, but not bad . It's a comedy that you'll enjoy , no matter what age you are . The movie is well produced, and it shows that there are a ton of movies that will be good for comedy .

i was flipping through the channels and had to stop and laugh when i came across this movie . It was a good movie but not great and not for me. I didn’t really like it. I found myself laughing more than any other film I have seen this year. I was surprised the director was on the phone with his family to get the story started. I found myself laughing when i saw this movie and I found myself thinking how this would make for good family movies. This movie had to end, and it did end.

Based on the comments made so far, everyone seems to either hate this movie or love it. I think it would be fair to point out that although this is not a GREAT movie, it has its interesting moments. For one thing, it was filmed on location in Colorado (was it Breckinridge or Telluride? I can't remember, but it is in the credits). The location is absolutely stunning and spectacular. It's beautiful, even to me who lived in Colorado for several years.Next, it has Disney's penchant for wonderful character actors.

I waited a long time to finally see what I thought was going to be a fun caper flick and was shocked to discover shoddy direction, awkward dialogue, a lackluster pace, unmotivated slapstick gags and an overall coarseness that permeated the film throughout. Just not funny! The sets looked cheap, the costumes by the usually excellent Donfeld are garish and distracting. Even the title song is annoying. The whole children's book characters doesn't come close to representing the married couple whose life is turned upside down when he loses his job.

I suggest if you have already seen the original American Graffiti , do not see this movie . If you did then this review may be worth taking a look at but if you haven't . . .well , you may get a good laugh . I don't even know what I am going to say now . . . but I can't see the need to go into detail about this review without giving away a little of what I want to write about . . . so let me say first of all about the film itself . . . it is a very enjoyable film.

Yeah, what did I expect? I thought this would be a film about young adults at their turning-point in life, something like "Sonnenallee" or "American Pie", which I liked a lot. I wanted to see a funny film, perhaps with an ironic look on idyllic Wuerzburg. And what did I get?Attention, spoilers ahead!This film starts with a lengthy dialogue which gives you a good hint of what will inevitably follow: more lengthy dialogues. Sometimes I thought Moritz Bleibtreu might have forgotten his text and trying to hide that fact by improvising and just repeating what he was saying before.

After five years in prison, Tony le Stéphanois (Jean Servais) meets his dearest friends Jo (Carl Möhner) and the Italian Mario Ferrati (Robert Manuel) and they invite Tony to steal a couple of jewels from the show-window of the famous jewelry Mappin & Webb Ltd, but he declines. Tony finds his former girlfriend Mado (Marie Sabouret), who became the lover of the gangster owner of the night-club L' Âge d' Or Louis Grutter (Pierre Grasset), and he humiliates her, beating on her back and taking her jewels.

Badly shot , badly edited , clumsy dialogue , flat characters , unsuccessful adaption of a novel . It does not make for the best film , but that is precisely the point. It simply does not add up to the movie it was intended for, it is not as good as the book, but it’s certainly better than the book was. All I can say about this is, “Well, maybe you don’t like the film .”



The reason I say this is that while the book is good, I don’t want it to be the film.

I feel privileged to have accidentally seen this movie . I actually ran across this movie by accident . I was actually looking for a movie I could take my son on vacation in . I never had time to watch . So when I got to the theaters I decided to just go in and get it . I did this because I was on vacation from school and my son was supposed to come with me . I was not expecting to enjoy the movie . But I did and I was so happy with the movie I wanted to make sure I could bring my son to it .

Let me first state that I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this film . For the most part the actors do well . I’ve seen some good acting out of them, however there was a lack of a certain type and it didn’t end up matching up to the actors I thought they could be and I really had to work for it . I liked a few of the lines and some of the actions . However , in the end it was too much . I was hoping that the writing was going to do what it was supposed to and the characters would grow and develop through the story .

It seems at least vaguely possible that this movie provided a bit of inspiration for "The Sopranos," as its main character, Martin Blank (John Cusack) is a hit man who has so many issues from his past and his profession that he's in therapy trying to deal with it all. Everything finally comes to a head at his 10-year high school reunion. The problem was that by the time Blank got to the reunion I had stopped caring. Frankly, I found this movie a drag from start to finish.It had potential.

This film hits the heart with a reality like no other I have seen. It shows what us what we, in a democratic society, take for granted, and just what we are lucky enough not to be experiencing. The acting in the film is superb, sometimes you have to remind yourself that the movie is a dramatization, and not real life. Mr. Rickman does wonders with his role (as he does with all roles) making the interrogator fully dimensional and human. The set is incredible. It gives the feeling of 'in the round" theater.

`` Strangers on a Train '' was one of those film classics I had always heard about but somehow never really got. The story of a train ride from London to London, I think it was, is very good, with some great scenes in the middle, and some good scenes of London and the train. I was very glad to see the film again. The first time I saw this film I was 12. It was the weekend before it was released and I went to see it at a matinee.

Some people are born with mourning souls with their song sung singularly until they encounter another soul as tortured and/or as bitterly sweetly beautiful as their own and an unusual magic happens. YOU ARE ALONE is a brutally honest look into two tortured souls that intertwine for a moment of understanding and oneness only to be torn apart by the differences in the oneness between they're pain. Death is explored figuratively and literally. It is what happens when ones soul is dead or similarly too alive, too awake to reality. It is the life NOT which you imagined behind the eyes of passer-by's.

Normally, I do not review online, but it's Saturday and I'm trapped in my room, on a rainy day with nothing to do but watch sci-fi movies and Xena: Warrior Princess (I can't get the damned 'Joxer the Mighty' song out of my head, it's been there for the past ten years or so, just pops up randomly when someone(me) does something idiotic). If you have any complaints about this movie, and actually post them on the internet, do you have ANY idea how much of an idiot you look like?

Movie Title - TartDate of review - 5/26/02Year of movie - 2001Stars - Dominique Swain, Brad Renfro, Bijou Phillips (barely), Melanie Griffith (barely)NeCRo's Rating - 4 skulls out of 10May Contain spoilersPlotAn "outcast" Dominique Swain wants to be with the "in" group and so she abandons her real friends and joins them.......much annoying rich people talk occurs. Actingugh, I guess I got what I wanted in that Dominique was ok, but man, the rest of the cast besides maybe Brad Renfro were bad or at least not interesting or likable at all.

Look , do n't get me wrong I love independent films but COME ON ! I could barely sit through some of them as I didn't have much choice but to sit through a couple or three. I'm sure many people enjoyed the movies but I found them all too predictable. What happened to having a few good independent movies to watch every now and then? I've got nothing but bad taste but I won't be the only one that says it. I am glad this came up on this list. It's something that I should have asked, but I was not feeling the need to.

There is a difference between a `` film , '' and a `` movie . '' A film , regardless of what language , is basically a series of still shots and sound effects . A movie , regardless of what language , is basically a story based on a story and some dialog . In other words , ''a film'' is basically a story , a narrative . ''In the beginning . '' A story can be a story of a few words or a story with many many words . '' Films can be a film with no words .

Though it's better than most made-for-TV movies, "Buried Alive" is nothing more than a run-of-the-mill revenge tale. There are so many plot holes in this one, it makes you wonder why the screenwriters didn't go through a series of re-writes. The ending has a nice twist to it, but it's hardly believable.The acting by Jennifer Jason Leigh is terrific, as always, but Tim Matheson hams it up with cheesy one-liners that reminds one of Jack Nicholson in "The Shining". Don't bother with this one.

With its ww2 timing , falling in and out of love , and easy on the eye Kira , this game has it all. Kira and her crew are sent in to investigate the destruction of an ancient city. They encounter a large alien creature , who turns out to be an alien race in the employ of an alien race , the Krell . Kira tries to deal with the Krell in the hopes of getting to the truth of the events leading up to it. I think I have a bit of a bias with the plot of this game because I am a big sucker for sci fi.

Froggie is upset that he never has a big party like all the other kids. Spanky and the gang seek to remedy that by giving him a surprise party. Unaware that all the decorations and preparations are for him Froggy sabotages everything only to find out too late that the party is for him.Okay Our Gang comedy works in fits and starts. The bits work but I don't think it really works as a whole. Part of the problem is that we all know where this is going and since much of the humor needs to have some form of surprise for it to work the whole thing falls down.

This is a very modest , very lovely movie with a great score by Hoagy Carmichael and Frank Loesser with a fantastic cast. This is what the film is like. It has a great script, a great story, and lots and lots of characters and plot twists that you'll never believe were even part of the original script. This is not the original story. There is a very simple story behind the story and a few plot twists that will put you on your toes as the film progresses through the entire film.

Monster of Mexico I do agree is the weakest of the modern Scooby Doo movies , mainly because of the ending , but it's good in a way to set up the next couple of movies to come . . . and I still like it as a whole . . . The only issue I had with this movie is that I did not know it was called that before we started watching it . . . but it's still a great movie . . . especially if you get your kids to sit quietly in the theatre . . .

This is an excellent documentary about a story I hadn't heard about before. The first solo, non-stop sailing race around the world took place in 1968-69 and involved a handful of racers. It's a truly fascinating story about man vs. nature and man vs. himself. The story focuses on Donald Crowhurst, the tragic figure in this story. The film elegantly combines interviews with footage which was shot by the sailors themselves aboard their boats. The story is very suspenseful and sad as we learn the details behind the history of Donald Crowhurst. This is one of the best documentaries of the past few years.

I remember seeing this film when I was 13 years old and I fell in love with it and I haven't seen it since then, because I was too young to enjoy it. I've seen many other movies since then, but most of them are so bad that I just couldn't see them again. If I was to recommend a good remake, I would have to think of something similar to the original that's good. But what is? What is a remake? What is a "good" remake? The answer is, a remake is a remake is a remake.

This movie was, perhaps, one of the most unoriginal and unfunny films I've seen in a long, long while. To be fair, I was not expecting some revolutionary comic formula, but I was anticipating to at least be entertained. With such low expectations, how could I manage to be disappointed? Jim Carrey, possibly my favorite actor (not sarcasm), did little more than tread water in this film. He seems to have temporarily returned to his funny-face-making roots and created a character no different from his Fletcher Reede from Liar Liar.

That distinction has to go to THE DUNGEON OF HARROW . At least Ed Wood 's misguided attempt at making a haunted house was well-done. And for the record . . . The only movie I know about that makes sense of haunted houses is NIGHT OF THE THIRTEEN DEAD, and the only one of these that is truly original (and well-done) is THE BERKLEY HITCH-CAMPAGNA . And there it is again. I could go through every movie in the Horror genre that I haven't already seen. I would love to do it, I think. But I can't.

I LOVE Sandra Bullock-She 's one of my all-time favorite actresses-but this is a movie that she should have paid attention to during the filming. In fact, she should've been there for the movie, since it's a big movie and Bullock's name is in it. Bullock, who is actually quite good, is an actress in the mold of Meryl Streep (the best of them all), which is a great achievement in any genre. But what's the big story? Is there a major plot point that will stick with you?

I am a fan of bad horror films of the 1950s and 60s--films so ridiculous and silly that they are good for a laugh. So, because of this it's natural that I'd choose this film--especially because with John Agar in it, it was practically guaranteed to be bad. Sadly, while it was a bad film, it was the worst type of bad film--dull beyond belief and unfunny. At least with stupid and over-the-top bad films, you can laugh at the atrocious monsters and terrible direction and acting.

I was sorely disappointed in this movie. Twice I was temped to walk out because segments of the movie were so demoralizing and depressing. The movie has elements that allude to all the seamy things in life (pornography, murder, suicide, fornication, hatred, gang warfare). The graphic nature of the violence in this movie was particularly disturbing.And Richard Dutcher does a great disservice to the LDS Church in portraying missionary attitudes, commitment, spirituality, and obedience as unfocused and lackadaisical.My biggest objection to this movie, however, was that it is the exact opposite of a feel-good movie.Dutcher's God's Army One was okay.

`` Mishima : A Life in Four Chapters '' is a visually stunning production that handles complex issues with evocative simplicity - it's a film noir masterclass. The story is based on an actual case of a man found dead at his office, with a bloodied knife beside him, who turned out to be the victim of an attack in which he was slashed with a machete, the scene of the crime made explicit in the film, so that the reader is kept up to date on the details of the incident. Mishima's approach to the story is unique and powerful.

Police Squad! (1982) was a funny show that ended too soon. But I guess it had it's run before it got too repetitive and unfunny like so many American television shows. The geniuses behind this funny show were the team of Zucker, Abrahams and Zucker. Every since his straight act in the comedy hit AIRPLANE!, Leslie Nielsen has found a new career as a comedian. In this short lived t.v. series he had the chance to play the straight man in a wacky comedy once more. The bizarre titles to each episode gave away the ending.

Empire of Passion starts out deceptively - that is, if you're immediately expecting it to be a horror movie. It's like a riff on James M. Cain's The Postman Always Rings Twice, at first: Seki (Kazuko Yoshiyuki) is a mother of two and a dutiful, hard-working wife to rickshaw driver Gisaburo (Takahiro Tamura). But when he's not around, and she's at home with the baby, the feisty and aimless young man Toyoji (Tatsuya Fuji) comes around to bring some goodies for Seki... and a little extra.

It pays to watch Reader's Digest. Or Time, if it was the original source of the article that served as a supposed inspiration to Mani Ratnam to make this masterpiece. Based on a true story of an adopted girl who goes in search of her biological parents, Mr. Ratnam paints a classic that rivets as much as it rebukes, cherishes as much as it chastens and preaches as much as it practises.Where does one start? The foreboding gloom that precedes fresh strife in northern Sri Lanka? The chaotic household of a family headed by a firebrand engineer-author and 3 adorably naughty children?

I won't go into detail about why this movie deserves an awful rating, plenty of other people have already done that. Suffice it to say that out of the over 400 movies that I've owned on DVD, this is the ONLY one that I got rid of- it was so worthless that I couldn't see ever wanting to watch ANY of it again.However, I do have a comment on the ridiculously high average rating of 2.9 (as of 3-15-06). While skimming through the 4 pages of reviews I saw no rating higher than 3 stars.

OK, so I gotta start this review by saying i was really expecting to see this flick for months, i use to watch its trailer and think it looked really cool....little did i know that the only cool thing about this cliché-driven turd was precisely its trailer.At the cinema, i watched the first 3 frames of this movie and though to myself "no way this movie is so bad, don't be an idiot, give it a chance! you've only seen 3 minutes" while i rolled my eyes in shame.

"Rififi" is a terrific heist movie, and one from which subsequent heist films have drawn ever since. Jules Dassin had a feel for the seedy underworld in which these thieves live---you will not find here the Hollywood glamour of "Ocean's Eleven." The robbers in "Rififi" don't rob for the thrill, and they're not playing a game. They rob to survive, to pay for their children's upbringing, to prove to themselves and others that they still have something to offer the world. The much-lauded heist scene is a nail biter, filmed in virtual silence.

This is a wonderful comedy short -- one of Keaton 's absolute best . Through a long series of silly misunderstandings, Keaton is given the opportunity to get revenge on the bullies he has been bullied since childhood. This short really captures the joy and charm of the '90s. You can find Keaton 's entire short collection and many more of his other works on his Youtube channel. Also check out the trailer below:



I really like the ending where he learns how to act. It was a very touching short. I found it hard to leave the theater.

`` First Snow '' has an intriguing beginning . A traveling salesman has his fortune told by an old man who appears on a snow-covered mountain . As the story progresses, the man takes on the persona of the narrator, who then tells the reader that the entire story is true, but in a different way. The book moves forward quickly and with ease, giving the reader a sense of awe for what the narrator is saying and a sense of amazement as the snow falls on him . It is a book that anyone with a love of history and travel will enjoy.

Wesley Snipes latest straight to video film is a convoluted mess, horribly reminiscent of Steven Seagal's latest works. The script is horribly written and makes no account for the low budget it is and tries to be too clever for its own good. Sadly too, Snipes has fallen into the trap of having an ADR voice double doing much of his dialogue, and an entire narration that comes every now and again through points in the movie. It's sad to see a guy of Wesley Snipes talent doing garbage like this film, and producing a tired and clearly bored performance, barely bothered to produce his own dialogue.

While it's not "perfect", it's close. Love Barbara Stanwyck, SZ Sakall, Sidney Greenstreet, Dennis Morgan, Robert Shayne (Superman's police chief), the housekeeper, the waiter at Restaurant Felix, and the judge......I can go on and on. This movie has been part of my family's holiday tradition since I was a youngster, and my children grew up with it, too! "The baby swallowed the watch" was always my son's favorite line.Sexy Barbara Stanwyck in pants and gowns stole the show along with the cuddly, funny S. Z. Sakall.

I watched this movie a couple months ago when it first showed up on the shelves of Blockbuster . It's a really entertaining and funny movie, and it's got some great actors in the parts I thought I'd be better off not watching. I'm not sure I really care that much, but I can't help thinking that it's kind of weird to have your movie watched so many times before you've seen it in theaters. That's probably why I've had it sitting on my shelf for a couple years now.

THE SCREAMING is a very low budget horror movie that was shot on video . It features passable acting , but a very poor sound design , with a very boring plot . The movie follows the lives of three teenage girls who decide to get revenge against their father who has been doing a lot of bad stuff to them . The story of the Screaming begins on one of the main characters , and then jumps back and forth in time . This is a low budget movie about revenge , it is definitely very low , but is not that cheap either .

A girl named Isobel becomes possessed by a demon . The local priest ( who formerly dated Isobel 's sister ) helps her to escape to find the source of the demon . The next morning Isobel gets possessed by the demon . The demon comes to the village . It kidnaps the young lady and she's brought to it's lair in the jungle . She is then told by the demon to kill anyone who gets in the way . The village is attacked by Isobel's new enemy . The demon kills all of its enemies and takes the young lady as a prisoner .

What is about mathematical geniuses that get the critics juices flowing ? A BEAUTIFUL MIND wasn`t up to much in my opinion ( FELLOWSHIP OF THE RING deserved the Oscar that year ) while GOOD WILL HUNTING had several awards lavished on it undeservedlyFirst off is the script . When I attended film school I was told GOOD WILL HUNTING is a very good example on how not to start a script and the tutor was right . This movie lacks any type of opening hook and for the most part it`s very very slow .

Great book , poorly done movie . Cheesy performances and contrived situations make this movie a sentimental bore-fest . Flat characterizations and flat performances , especially by the lead actor and the lead actress . Poorly written , badly directed , with a poor story . Not even worth watching , and even less worth paying for

This review contains spoilers, click here to learn about the film

This movie has been criticized for not really doing much and for being overly predictable . I can agree that it's not really the best movie ever , but not a very bad one either . It's a fairly decent little film .

Anne ( Natalie Portman ) tells us about how much she hates her mother , Adele ( Susane Sarandon ) , and how Adele doesn’t believe that she should have a brother or a sister . Her sister and her family seem to be perfect parents, so Natalie tells us about her sister’s husband who she thinks is a good man . But, she doesn’t like her husband or her brother , but her husband . And, the brother in law is very nice . The movie ends with Natalie and Adele arguing about who should have the kids .

Admittedly , the only reason I watched this film -- since it 's been about a decade since it was released -- is because my dad got it from the video rental place that I work at. If I remember my memory correctly, it was in the early 2000s. I have no memory of the original release date of the film, and I don't remember seeing the film before, but I do remember that my dad owned a VCR from when I was a kid. Anyway, here we go with my memory of this wonderful film.

Stanley Stupid (Tom Arnold) and his wife, Joan, like to sleep in bed with their heads under the covers and their feet on the pillows. They have two equally challenged children, Buster and Petunia. One day, Mr. Stupid notices their garbage is gone again....there must be someone stealing it from the curb. He goes off in roller blades after the garbage truck. When he finally gets to the dump, he is startled to learn not only that "other folks garbage" has been stolen, too, but that there is a secret organization meeting at the landfill.

This is a difficult movie to watch , and would have been even more difficult had I known then that it wasn't going to end with a big bang and the credits rolling. At the time I thought it was great, but over time I realized that the first 20 minutes were the weakest portion, and it wouldn't make a big impact on my life until the second half of the film. I've watched the entire movie a couple times since, and still find it interesting and entertaining, but I'm afraid that I may never see the last half.

I went into this movie with an open mind. I had been too lazy to go to the video store to pick out a movie, and my friend returned with this. I promised him I wouldn't laugh at his choice, but within the first five minutes I told him I would have to take back my promise. We kept watching, just hoping it would get better, but no; a continual mind-rape followed.This "movie" was probably one of the worse ever committed to film, and surely deserves a place on the IMDb Bottom 100.

The most amazing film I have ever seen. I didn't read the programming and I just stumbled onto the movie by accident. I thought it was a real documentary and i felt sick at what I saw. I only found out it was a movie after it was finished and i looked on the web for more info about "punishment park" in the U.S. It felt incredibly real and it is easy to believe that this really has happened in the US if you are from Europe. I must admit that I felt really anti-american after watching the movie and before finding out that it didn't really happen that way.

I can't quite explain why I find this so alluring and "The Leopard" not; it may be because the focus here is on all that was great with that film, those intimate moments that Visconti can render so magnificently. Like that film, it has a majestically slow pace, but this time it isn't overlong. It's the kind of film where nothing happens but twenty minutes passes like that. I think that must be due in part to the way the film deals with flashbacks that act as their own mini-story.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in South Australia. It was published in 2005 and has since been adapted to television. Contents

Plot

The story is set at a mine, in the late 1980s, where there was a crew of miners missing. The miners come from a mining town in South Australia called Mount Gambier. They are called the Bone Snatcher, and are searching for a crew member, who was missing for two years. In the mining town there are two people who were involved with the missing crew.

First, what is really great about this movie: - Ryan Reynolds, great acting! There are very few actors I really like and for now he is one of them. He has an amazing skill to impersonate characters. - The soundtrack! Very good music played at the right time. - The idea of a nine lost in his own world, incapable of leaving. Still, I give it only a 3 out of 10 for certain flaws: - Horrible second part. It seems that the director was very eager to make something new, but despite of the efforts it was really boring - Very annoying character Melissa.

Ed ( Kel Mitchell ) is a teenager who lives for his job at Good Burger , a small but well-established local burger joint in rural North Carolina. It’s a quiet place, and he has barely been out of the house except to eat his lunch or go to school. It’s a typical North Carolina experience. One night when he’s just getting ready for bed he sees a shadow in the bathroom mirror. His face registers surprise. But when he turns, he sees a tall, thin boy dressed in black jeans and a white t-shirt and a baseball cap, standing behind him.

This movie really starts strong. We know that Roberts is an Atlanta hotshot sent to Australia to fix Coke's marketing problems. We also know he is an eccentric genius. Roberts' fine acting convinces us of this rather quickly.Unfortunately, the plot is so flimsy, that whatever fine character development has been achieved, it is negated by voids, inconsistencies, and downright boring film sequences.Usually, I am a sucker for bold and far out plots. Examples which I am fond of include, "Dark Star," "O.C. & Stiggs," and "Popeye."

Look , this film is terrible ... the `` plot '' involves twins who are neglected by their self-absorbed parents , and they find a way of getting by by killing people on their way home and leaving the body on a beach .... that is the worst plot idea ever ! You're right ! I was thinking this film was bad. I'm sorry I watched it, but I can't stop thinking of this film as being one of the worst I've seen in my lifetime. It could have been good, but the ending just seems like a complete waste.

This event defined an era of wrestling entertainment that, I believe, is not equaled today. The colorful characters - in their stereotypical garb - brought a certain charm to the show that has since been raped by society and overexposed. Wrestling had a bit of an innocence back then. A kid could watch it without watching an episode of Jerry Springer.Looking back now (I was 5 at the time), although I loved both Warrior and Hogan, I think I enjoyed Warrior more because of his mystique. Hogan was the branded hero who weilded an impressive public image.

This Gundam series only follows Gundam 0083 Stardust Memory . The story takes place during the same time line as the events in Mobile Suit Gundam . It starts off with some young pilots from the U.S. being tasked with destroying an unknown enemy base in space. Unfortunately, those pilots only know each other and there is no one to guide them through. However, one man is determined to learn the ways of fighting for the cause and become the next leader in the Gundam army. He is only in his for the good of all mankind. This story is mainly focused around the character known as Guts.

I think that would have been a more appropriate title for this film, since it is padded to hell and back with stock footage of various bugs and animals. I recently found The Prey in its original VHS 'big box' form and was very excited. I just LOVE finding old slasher films on VHS because the cover artwork is fantastic. Usually though, it turns out that the film itself is less than fantastic. The Prey is one of those films.To be fair, it started off OK, with the killer stalking the cliché teenagers in the woods.

Mr. Bean has always been my favorite. No matte how many times you watch the same thing, the show never gets monotonous or repetitive. Mr. Bean is one of the greatest comedians in the world who doesn't need to even speak to make people laugh. His gestures, his facial expressions and his face itself is so funny to watch. The situations which he faces on the show is simply hilarious and the way he handles them is even greater. There is simply no reason why this show shouldn't receive a 10 because it is fabulous.

Did people expect "Jurassic Park 3" to be full of surprises? Not one moment of it is worth it. Many elements could easily scare people out of the movies...and it's not the dinos! Tea Leoni...I think she's a great actress, but I'm sorry to say that this time she reached the bottom line. I wonder if she happened to strain a vocal chord while shooting the movie....Laura Dern...she's ok, but why not be more noticeable in the movie, maybe exchange smart dialogs with Sam Neil.

What a cast...and what a waste of it. Seriously, when a movie has Gabriel Byrne, Jamie Foxx, Thandie Newton, Stuart Townsend, Hal Holbrook, Melanie Griffith and Sylvester Stallone in it you would expect some quality. The movie is however one big mess with a unlikely story that can't seem to stop putting twist and turns in it. Yeah, I think that they thought they were really being clever with all of it.The story is not only messy and unlikely, it also isn't exactly terribly original. It uses elements from earlier and much better poker game based movies.

Hilary was great as julie , and Pat was once again magnificent as Mr. Miyagi , but there should have been more action sequences in this film, and if there were, the Japanese could have pulled it off. However, for the lack of it, it was nothing special. The movie could have been much better, and should have been much more action packed, if only they had done it. If you like action, you’ll love this film, but for the sake of my sanity, I had to give it a 3 star rating just for trying to be a modern day samurai movie.

Like the above poster, I got burned on the title thinking I was getting the other Piranha... This movie is everything the above poster said and worse... Poor camera, lousy acting and just plain horrid storyline...There was very little here that was even worth watching... How this movie even got released is beyond me. Make sure the movie you buy is the one you want... and not this one.The movie I bought was labeled "Piranha" and not "Piranha, Piranha!" which is what it actually is... This is the only way they sold this movie at all.Peace Out.

I must admit , ashamed though I am , that as an impressionable young teenager this below par horror-chiller was not something that I thought I would enjoy. In fact I don't think I would give a flying fck what I thought about it whatsoever (well not to say I don't think I would give a flying fck about it, I would just never admit it). The film has an interesting premise , a young girl is killed off by some bad guys , as you see her body in the basement , we can assume she has been taken over and murdered by the bad guys.

Boring movie . Poor plot . Poor actors . The movie happens in a room supposed to be in Morocco, but it turns out that the guy is in the middle of the Middle East... and that is not a pleasant experience. It is interesting, too, that this film is made by an English director and starring an English actor. I'm not sure I buy that it was really made in England, and not just for the sake of being a British movie about England and the English. One thing to note is that there are three different endings in the film.

This is a forgotten classic of a film, and Harmony Karin borrowed a ton from it for "Gummo". Gummo is good, River's Edge is way, way better. Its no secret that Keanu Reeves isn't the best actor whoever walked the earth. No, in fact, he's a horrendous actor. But, he was born for some roles: Ted Preston, Esquire from Bill and Ted, and his role in this film. He is perfect as a sort of good natured but very apathetic and confused teenager. Then there's Crispin Glover.

OK , it was a `` risky '' move to rent this flick , but I thought I had nothing better to do than watch it , as it wasn't one that I had seen before . I wasn't wrong , but I didn't have much of an appetite for a flick that I hadn't seen . This was a film with a lot to it . I watched it and enjoyed it , but it wasn't something that appealed to me . I had a tough time getting into it . A great script , with a great story , and a well written and produced film that was very entertaining .

I've just revisited this fondly remembered bit of cinematic madness from my early days, and must urge you to beg steal or borrow it.The story begins with a duel between a righteous Shaolin priest and our villain Abbot White, needless to say, Abbot White kicks Buddhist ass, and wages his campaign against Shaolin unhindered with the aid of his new ninja allies (a golden clad one who fights with a gold ring, a black clad one who fights with a spear, and my favourite; one who fights with a pair of knives who can disappear and reappear as a flying carpet).

OH MY God I am lost Now I know everything this guy does is Pointless R J A wrote at August 13th, 2006 (posting no. 881): What an awful experience. It looked like a bunch of 3rd graders stole a video camera, borrowed some old editing software from 1995, and played a joke on each other. Trash RGC wrote at August 1st, 2006 (posting no. 747): This movie is a piece of @$#@#@. It sucks Calling this a movie would be misleading.

I went to see this movie to kill some time . I remember Cole Hauser in `` Tigerland '' , a movie that made me think of the fact that I had no one that I knew to talk to. ( I mean I had a few friends that were there ) I was looking for a place that we could get together and have some time to talk. And I also wanted to talk with my friend that was with me all the while . So I went to the movie theater. I went in there and started to see who I could find to talk with.

At first I did n't think that the performance by Lauren Ambrose was anything but flaky , but as her growth continues I'm going to give her a chance. She has a decent range, great range, and she works her range really well. I think she would do very well in a pinch if you were willing to put in the extra hours of training, but you would also have to be willing to push her a bit if you are looking to push her harder. I think she would definitely be a hard hitter with a high strike out percentage and a high on base percentage.

This is without doubt the worst movie i have ever seen . And believe me , I have seen a LOT worse . It's just so sad . The dialogue was terrible , and while the plot moves along , it just drags it out . I really hate this movie . And while i enjoyed it , I didn't find the acting that i expected . This movie just doesn't do anything right , and i don't know why , because all the other things were just so bad . It was just so bland , and the actors just had no charisma or any charm .

Veteran TV director Ted Post treats us to a plodding , confused and ultimately pointless story lifted from Column B in The Big Picture. In fact, for some strange reason Post spends the whole episode trying to make it seem even more “bizarre” and “disappointing” than it had to be to be “good.”

I’d like to point out, though, that there’s nothing in the entire episode that actually needs to be said. The story is a very silly one. It’s so silly that it makes you want to laugh. A lot.

this is horrible film. it is past dumb. first, the only thing the twins care about is how they look and what boys like them. they are in 7th grade. not to say i am a prude or anything but it sends the wrong message to girls of all ages. being pretty and popular is not everything. but that is what the twins make it out to be. The plot is even worse. the girl's grandpa just happens to be the ambasitor(sp?) to France. He has a co-worker take the girls around paris and they meet two "cute french boys" with motorcycles.

A truly excellent look at the world and the realities of being a heroin addict. The movie is one that will hit much too close to home to those who were involved in the drug culture and have knowledge of what being(or being around) a heroin addict really is. Good movie, which will never truly be outdated. Excellent performances by all involved and the minimalist set is Preminger's way of showing how bleak a JUNKIE'S world can become. Worth a look--an education of sorts. The golden arm is a worried look at the truth of the underground life of pain a junkie lives in.

Honestly - this short film sucks. the dummy used in the necro scene is pretty well made but still phony enough looking to ruin the viewing experience. the Unearthed DVD is crisp and clear and I haven't made up my mind if this helps or hinders it. If the film was a little grainy it might have added some "creepiness factor" to what was going on. I have no idea why this film has so much hype surrounding it other than the subject matter - but to be honest the necrophilia scenes in films like NEKROMANTIK and VISITOR Q among others, are more shocking than in AFTERMATH.

This is possibility the worst and most disappointing film I have ever seen . I 've spent four years at the age of 30 and the worst I had to show at a film festival was a movie which made me cry tears of blood. Now at the age of 50 I have to see and endure the same type of film. This is a wonderful film, even if it is an American comedy. There are so many moments where you can tell that the film makers are having a great time. They are having a ball, but that is what makes them fun.

I saw this last night in Fort Lauderdale . In general it was funny and I liked the characters especially the lady in the black shirt. I can't say much about the film but it was a bit dark and I liked the music. It was an entertaining film and it is nice to see this kind of genre on screen again . I'm glad to see more of these kinds of films again. Keep up the great stuff. This was quite good as well, especially the ending and the ending of the song! I liked all the songs, especially the one with the lady!

This is a pretty simplistic romance. Girl finds boy, girl loves boy, girl loses boy, girl finds boy. Colleen Moore is the outstanding ingredient in this recipe, delivering a wonderfully varied dramatic/romantic performance, well deserving of an Oscar nom. Equally fine are the aerial combat special effects.Moore plays a French girl whose mother has turned over their field to a British aerial squadron during WWI. She is the "daughter of the regiment", loved as a little sister. Into this mix comes a fill-in for a downed flyer, Gary Cooper.

This is a romantic, albeit cheesy movie that is one of my all time favorites. It is one of the many CLASSICS of the 80's genre like "Pretty in Pink" or "Some kind of Wonderful".Nic plays the traditional punk guy in love with the traditional valley, preppy girl Julie. It is a heartwarming love story that makes you root for him to win the girl in the end.True, most of the acting sucks but ...I have been in love with Nic since seeing this in the theaters and have seen nearly every movie he's been in since.

The core issues at play ( God & Satan / Good & Evil ) can be & should be tremendously helpful to people, and should be used as the primary focus of Christian ministries. It is one of the main things that can be used to develop Christian discipleship and discipleship of others. In addition, this discussion of God and Satan is also one of the things the church can use to teach about how we live together as one body in the Body of Christ:

In 1st Corinthians 10:17-18, Paul is instructing the church about how we should relate to God.

Gritty drama? Emotionally powerful? Blah! The BBC has lost out big time to masterful productions such as The Wire, Sopranos and Carnivale from HBO. Okay, so the budget may be a lot smaller but 'The Street' last night was badly acted, predictable, unrealistic, stereotypical, insensitive and a big fat waste of time.
