An art teacher comes across an antique wooden bed made from gingko trees and puts it in his apartment , but it's too late because the house is haunted . The haunted house is haunted because of the girl who lives in it . Now, her ghost wants to see it again. The girl's family and friends want to have her spirit back, but there isn't time to find her in time. The girl is the only one to see the ghost, but there's only one way to solve the case.

One of the better movies to come out of the 1980's, this based-on-fact movie tells the story of a disturbed high school student who murders his girlfriend, leaves her naked body on a river bank, and brags about it later to his friends. What is just as bad is their inability to FEEL anything about it.Disturbing but incredibly compelling look at aimless and apathetic kids who have no respect for their parents or any sort of authority, who seem almost doomed to live lives of rebellion and recklessness. This drama hits hard and is impossible to forget.

After the success of Star Wars, there was a boost in interest in Sci-Fi movies. This was one of those cheap attempts to cash in quickly.A group of survivors from a spaceship land on a planet inhabited by stop-motion dinosaurs, where half of them are systematically killed off (the people not the dinosaurs). Porn-movie level acting. Cheap special effects, even for the time, although it looks like a lot of effort was put into them.Costumes were pure 1970's, as were the hairstyles. Ahh, the 70's. I expected a disco to break out at any minute.Nothing to really recommend in this film.

..."Flight of the Living Dead" sports production values that belie the substandard script from director Scott "I'm a producer, can'tcha tell?" Thomas and two hacks who shall remain nameless because I feel sorry for them having to attach those no-names to this turkey. Apparently actually shot on film, this direct-to-DVD release has almost nothing going for it that you haven't seen or heard a hundred times already.Despite the presence of a number of recognizable character actors like Richard "Three O'Clock High" Tyson, Erick "Stargate" Avari, and Raymond J.

Oh, there are many worse Wayne movies. This movie is edited poorly but it has a campy element that makes watching it enjoyable. The villain is an Anglo actor who sports ridiculous Mexican clothes and affects an over-the-top Mexican accent which is hilarious. The girl is dressed like a Jean Harlow wannabe, this is 1934 after all. At least the location shots are beautiful and enjoyable.Watch it and laugh. Don't expect a serious western, but rather a lightweight and superficial story with poor acting but occasional flashes of camp humor.

While many pass this off as a B movie it is, indeed, a first class comedy that is well-written and acted. Red Skelton is great as Wally Benton better known to radio fans as The Fox. Ann Rutherford is perfect as Wally's fiance Carol Lambert. Conrad Veidt leads a very well cast gang of criminals. I read one account of this movie which states that Vincente Minelli directed this film, not unless he changed his name to S. Sylvan Simon, who directed all three of the Fox movies. This is a very entertaining film made when imagination was encouraged.

It 's one of the imponderables of low-budget independent film-making that so many with so little in the way of a working budget could pull off a project that would seem to some as if it were going to take them to the moon. But here's the rub. As it happens I had the pleasure of speaking to a number of people who are film fans, writers, directors, production managers and all manner of other types. And in many cases, the people who are actually doing the work of making films and the people working behind the scenes are just as enthusiastic and committed as the film makers themselves.

This proves just how awful the WB Network was in the last few years of its existence . As a network, the station was so bad, it could be argued that the cable channels should be cancelled, as it didn't help the industry to attract any customers. It's just plain sad for us, and I feel like there's so much work I have to do from now on. I know there are others on here that feel the same way, and I hope that someday I will be recognized as someone that can help us.

This telecast of the classic musical `` Sweeney Todd '' does not do the production justice , but is still a terrific musical, and very entertaining. As the story progresses the movie goes back in time in the form of some of the early songs from `` Sweeney '' and the later scenes show the progression of this character from his early days on the streets to his days in the orphanage. The musical number \" \" \" \" \" begins with \" \" Sweeney\" and the audience is made aware of this character from the earlier scenes.

I enjoyed the Mr. Magoo cartoons I saw while growing up. And I enjoy Leslie Nielson's comic skills. So, I thought, this marriage must produce a funny child.I couldn't have been more wrong.This movie was just awful. I don't recall a single funny moment. This is one of the two or three times (in hundreds of films over the years) I've wanted my money back. You will leave this film dejected because you won't ever have that time back to use in a better way. In a comedy, the plot must draw in the viewer and serve as a framework for gags.

i just glanced over another comment posted here in which the writer discusses the disturbing ways the teenagers in this film use the body of their dead friend. one overlooked in this statement is perhaps the most unsettling of them all, no surprise it's what crispin glover's character (layne) does. he is thrilled over one of his friends murdering another friend of his, the killer's girlfriend. not because layne did not like this individual, rather he is excited about her death because it gives him something to do.

I saw this movie on the shelf at Blockbuster and thought it looked cool . The DVD case touted so-and-so (somewhat of course) but the movie in question looked awesome. I haven’t yet gotten my copy, but the movie looks like a great time, especially considering I’ll probably see it soon. The only problem is I can’t remember how it ended. Maybe it was during the movie that I went to bed? The plot is a little convoluted, so if I am correct, I may be in for a real headache.

I am a huge Eric Roberts fan, I collect his movies and so far has get to 60. But I´m honest to say that sometimes he really makes awful movies. But hey that´s why I like him - he is entertaining.But this one has to take the price, I can´t stop wonder why. Somehow they managed to get Eric and also Corbin Bernsen to the picture.While Bernsen is plain awful (I really don´t like him), Roberts manage to be the best thing in the movie (and that doesn´t mean much).

Although this series and the mini film in particular were very important at the time of release , I feel that it has been over done in comparison to the original. This is because it is a remake and not a prequel and that is why it was made a prequel and not a sequel. In this film there are more than a few familiar faces and it has all the hallmarks of being a great action movie. That being said it does have some flaws and this article is about those flaws. I think there are enough faults to write a whole separate article about them.

I do n't care what anyone else says , this movie is the worst piece of trash committed on film in history. You can blame the directors, but you have no evidence. No matter what you say, you don't care, and you still don't care enough. OK....so, by minute 15 in the film, there's still no dialogue.This film arrived to me in a padded sack from Down Under, with Sharpie encrypted info on the front. I am a programmer from a North American fest, and MOD LOVE was sent thru to me by our chief as a potential starter having preem'd at the far-away Moscow/Karlovy Vary interface.Straight away I thought "this film is not for us" (no dialogue by minute 15??) but kept watching anyway. Well, well, well.

Lackawanna Blues is a drama through and through . It details the life of a strong woman by the name of Rose, whose husband and children are all dead. She has a new husband who is not strong at all, and she struggles to raise the children as a single parent. The film focuses on her journey from the loss of both children to the eventual reunification of both families. It is a drama about a man who wants to be a father to his daughter and son, but can’t get it together to be with his own wife and child.

I can just picture how this movie came to be : '' So how else can we screw up our children's future?" That's exactly why this is the wrong place to discuss it. As a Christian, I feel a bit uncomfortable discussing a movie that has not yet been shown to a full audience. So while I can understand that it is important to let the movie speak for itself before discussing it, it is also important to let the people who have actually made the movie take the time to tell their story.

Let me get this out of the way before I trash this film : I love Park Chan-Wook 's work, but he has a tendency to make some questionable choices. For example, he did not really bother to research the historical accuracy of the film and how it came to exist, or how the story actually relates to other films. I'm also not sure if it was a mistake to leave out the backstory about the character, but I would still have liked to know about his past. So in a nutshell, it's not for everyone.

I remember being so excited on Saturday nights when I was a kid, waiting for Dr. Who. I thought it was the best show ever made. Then, I grew up, Dr. Who went off the air, and no one I knew had ever heard of it. Then I found out there was going to be a new series. I was a little nervous about it. Was it going to live up to the expectations I had carried around since I was little? Would they screw it up? Would the Dr. suck? Would his assistant suck?

Dante would of been mortified, if he knew that his masterpiece was being ACTED OUT PUPPETS!!! Also the actors who played the puppets are sell outs. Due to the fact that playing a puppet is not acting it is just basically doing nothing. No one really will care who the puppet was. people only care who played a major role in like an actual movie. this is just annoying how you could mock such an amazing man and his belief, by this dumb little movie. This should be a crime and.... I cant believe you would ruin a book like that.

The wind and the lion is a marvelous sweeping motion picture. It is a monument to what filmmaking once was but is no more.Connery, despite the thick scottish brogue, plays the Raisulu very well. He inspires the viewer in a way many lead characters cannot. Candice Bergen, in one of her early roles, is marvelous as the kidnapped socialite Mrs. Pedacaris, showing courage in the face of adversity (and plenty of humour as well). A marvelous film, rent or buy it and you won't be disappointed.

Oh , there are many worse Wayne movies . This movie is edited poorly but it has a campy element and that’s what you need . I saw the first half of the movie. It is still very funny but not as fun as the first one . I enjoyed the first one but the second one was better. I thought the plot was weak . But I still liked that movie . You need a good comedy for a comedy movie to be successful . My suggestion is to avoid comedy movies and try to watch movies with a message .

"Cat In The Brain" is a series of extremely violent sequences knitted together by a plot that feels more like an overview, describing director Lucio Fulci's most notorious years of film-making. The movie could also be seen as a dark comedy of sorts, effectively spoofing the various claims that violent cinema causes violence in real life. Fulci goes further than that, he casts himself as the star, the central figure of the film thus showing the audience who is the man behind all the cinematic gore. "Cat in The Brain" is not about presenting a clear story and following it.

I saw this movie once a long time ago , just once , and I did n't know where it was originally from , I guess I saw it maybe 10 times , because it made me laugh so hard that I forgot it was in English and I was so angry that I had to repeat it for the rest of the movie and that I still have not figured out why I was laughing like that , when it was supposed to make me cry like that , I was in high school at that time , so I wasnt that young to know what it meant .

This failed exercise in satire or commentary on the human condition easily earned a place as one of the 10 worst movies I've ever seen. I'm seriously considering buying a copy, if I can find one dirt cheap, to chase away unwanted company. It's honestly that bad. I view it as some kind of anti-personnel weapon. If you're the kind of person who just has to see a train wreck to witness the carnage, then this movie is a gem. Just to be fair, Kelsey Grammar's character has 1 line that almost works, but doesn't quite.

I feel that this movie is different from so many others in that it shows a family of girls who have grown up around a family of men who have abused and abandoned them. And I think it shows that we have to hold ourselves accountable for what we do to the next generation, or we will keep on doing the same thing to ourselves. It’s true, I know that. But I think that what happens in this movie is an important lesson, and something that we need to try to remember and think about as well.

Amazing, amazing, amazing. What more can be said? Jacobi is the best Hamlet ever to grace the stage and captures every inch of the character. Every nuance and element of Hamlet is depicted and depicted well. Some people have complained about his age, but you honestly cannot tell when watching the film. If anything, he looks drastically younger than 40. I only wish a more worthy Ophelia could have been found. Her acting is passable but she just doesn't look the part. The only real exceptional performances come from Jacobi and Stewart, who is a great Claudius.

This is indeed one of the weakest films based on Agatha Christie's work, a lifeless, muddled mystery that clearly lacks the grace (and the budget!) of its predecessors ("Death On The Nile", "Evil Under The Sun") and Donald Sutherland is a pale shadow of Peter Ustinov as far as screen detectives go (of course, he is playing a character much less interesting than Poirot). The film manages to coast as far as it does on the strength of Christie's plot alone (all her plots have a certain amount of inherent interest), but the direction is hopelessly flat.

Do n't get me wrong this was fun to watch . It has some nice animation with exception of an awkward moment near the end when one of the kids in his family starts crying when he gets a call on a phone and all of his relatives tell him to go get it and he cries harder and harder. There were some good character moments and a few funny moments in there. But it just lacked any of the depth we've come to love in some of the more recent animated shows. I'm a bit disappointed with what I've seen.

I really like this film because of all the stars and the dancing and the story that goes along with it. Rita Hayworth was at her most glamorous in this musical and the costumes were gorgeous. Although a musical, I thought Rita Hayworth did a fine performance of dramatic acting in this film as well. As far as her dancing, I think she was excellent. Even Betty Grable pretty much endorsed Rita's dancing in this film as she commented that Rita danced rings around her own dancing and let's face it, Betty Grable was an excellent dancer.

A couple of years before SCREAM spoofed the slasher/horror genre with savvy , self-conscious young things knowing every trick in the book, I started making films in the horror genre that were a lot darker and more serious than what you’d find on screen. And what’s worse, these were also much more popular than I could ever hope to be known as. I got to thinking that maybe it was time for me to try and change my path and do something a little different, to prove I’m better than I was. I thought I would do a dark and brooding horror film.

To tell you the truth , I do not speak Tamil , and I did not understand the film . But I liked it . But I felt the film should have made more impact . It is the kind of film that works for all age range . I was amazed by the director , directorial style , story line, direction, dialogues etc . Till the time I have watched the movie , I could not find the meaning of the story , and the meaning should be added in the future . It should be added that I did watch it and was very impressed .

I'd liked the Takashi Miike films I'd seen so far, but I found this pretty disappointing. I'd bought it, but I won't be keeping it.I saw it on the Adness DVD, which has just two episodes. In the first, a killer abducts women, cuts the top of their skull off to expose the brain, plants them in the ground up to their chin, and plants a flower in the brain. You can tell that from the DVD box. In the movie, the top of the head is digitally blurred out by TV static.

When I was a little girl , I absolutely adored The Swan Princess , it was reliving the same fairy tale that my older sister and I had seen and listened to growing up , and we all adored that film . but then one of the sequels came out , and my heart dropped into my feet , because I realised the film was going to become yet another remake , with the same original actors . now , I have to ask you , is there a reason I should watch the original again , rather than see a new version ?

Oh man, this movie was toe-cringing bad. Bad look, awful story...the list of good things is shorter than the list of bad things about this movie.Yes sure it's supposed to be a comedy and all but something tells me that this movie was supposed to be the real deal. The movie most certainly does not start of as a comedy but more as an adventurous movie with fun elements put in it. You can especially tells they were serious with this by the acting, that was in a serious and non-comical way, with the exception of a couple of over-the-top sequences obviously.

I remember watching this movie over and over again when I was a kid . I loved it . Whilst watching it with my son yesterday we had a great discussion about all things horror . We both watched it again , the next night , and we both agreed that we have never watched this movie with my son . The movie starts out pretty strong , and it’s not long before things get very dark . I’d say about 10/15 of the movie , but we were in a rush to watch it again .

Watched this months ago on Netflix Instant and left a review there.Let me say, most of the other reviews are very accurate. This movie was bad writing, bad acting and bad directing. In my Netflix review, I mentioned that I lost interest in the film and proceeded to wash the dishes and make a sandwich, yet still watching the movie from the kitchen. Filmmakers made a rather boring everyman's story look interesting and complex by focusing on his wife back at home. At the same time, we're exposed to a truly original, existential French loner. The film is more than a documentary. Hardly ever do I feel that I've experienced something that's accidentally profound, which makes it all the more profound.Film has visually interesting interior moments. Absolutely loved the journey the filmmakers took me on. (Quite a lot of Europeans in the credits). Hopefully, PBS will screen this so that it reaches a wider audience in the USA.

Not all movies are Oscar worthy but let's face it, sometimes these types of movies are more fun to watch and leave a longer and lasting impression. This one left me smiling and happy and I couldn't wait to hug my own son. Anyone who has had a pet (no matter what type) knows what it feels like to lose one. I believe most people would identify with Buddy almost losing his best friend who he raised from birth. Bruce Willis was great as the tycoon turned nice guy and Joey Lauren Adams was convincing as a good mother.

As other posters have commented this was a very very bad movie (keeping it kid friendly) FX was low class, they should of spent the $1 on a coke. As is typical with these D movies most victims die and leave a mystery except for one lucky soul and of course the lead. Hope the money was worth it for Boxleitner, really really big step down from Babylon 5. Nice to see what happened to Buck Rogers but damn this was low even for him. ' It was so bad and on the older actors you could even seem to tell that they thought it was bad also.

Deep Sea 3D is a stunning insight in to an underwater world only a few have had the opportunity to view first hand.From the opening sequence when a wave rushes towards the audience momentarily engulfing us in the ocean, the filmmakers make full use of the IMAX format. A jelly fish field appears to fill the whole theatre, a shark powers towards us, predators pounce from behind rocks and devour their prey. It is a beautifully captured under sea feast for the eyes.Our ears on the other hand, are not given the same treatment. The film is narrated by Hollywood stars Jonny Depp and Kate Winslet.

This film is bad. Not so bad it is good. Just bad. It is however hilariously bad. I watched it out of some morbid curiosity and never intend to watch it nor any other Chuck Norris film ever again. If you have to choose between this film and death, you should happily choose this film, however, as it is is a masterclass in terrible film making (hence the hilarity).It is a constant depression to me, as I grind away at my desk job, that some people get to be involved in movie-making and decided to produce things such as this.1 out of 10.

For once a sequel to `` The Karate Kid '' without Ralph Macchio ! Hilary Swank did an excellent job with Ralph, but he was not the most exciting thing about it. I liked the story, but I feel like Ralph is the least of my problems. So I decided to re-watch it and see how I liked it. The whole thing was too slow, and the ending was a little disappointing, but I think they will do it right. I can't wait to watch it with you. I watched it on the weekend.

I am the sort of person who never, ever watches animated movies, but I make an exception for Thumbelina and the Swan Princess. Being absolutely in love with the first installment of the series, I bought this and sat down to watch it with a very biased mind, determined to love it because I'd spent money buying it. I finished the movie, and all I can think is THE HORROR!!! I wanted to like it, I really did. I tried very, VERY hard to like it. But I couldn't enjoy a second of this grueling film.

This film is the most impressing turkish film that I have ever seen . Probably `` Okul '' is the most impressive film that you can make in the history of movies. If you are working on this film you should think about doing the same with the other two films too . This was a very difficult film to make especially with the technical aspects . This film is a must see in all of your movies ! I will be reviewing and posting my review after the film . It has to be a must see film as it has everything you want in it and more .

The Cat in the Hat is just a slap in the face film . Mike Myers as The Cat in the Hat was in it , but the film as a whole was awful . What was even worse is the fact that the movie was released on a Saturday morning. That's when the movie goes off the rails . I have to say , that's the worst movie that I have seen in the past few years. It wasn't the worst film I've seen, but it was the worst film I've seen all year.

I do n't understand why this movie was released , it looked like something that you show your mates after a drinking session in pubs or clubs or something . The only complaint that I have to make is that there was too much sex . It was a bit too much . There was no real intimacy in the way that there is with many of the gay films.

I am not sure who recommended Surveillance to me , but I think I have an idea : one of my favorite films is Surveillance and, at a point in my film career, I wanted to create a series of videos, one of which was based on this movie. It took a bit, but it was possible, I think. I don’t think this film would be a very appropriate movie to watch for anyone else, so I would suggest that you not watch this if you don’t want to.

i watched all of the doctor who episodes that my local PBS station played while growing up. go get your camcorder , your little brother , and the disturbing neighbor next door who throws boiling water on your face.”

within about 5 minutes in to the film the first fight scene i was watching i just could help but pointout the lack of tension in the scene the cameras crossing back and forth really shows he had no idea what he was doing, well actually the soundtrack shows that the best. i no its a low budget film and your not going to get top 40 songs but at least get music that goes with the scene that isn't actually that hard acting, well if i saw any i would gladly let you know.

The cast and crew of this cheap horror potboiler are more interesting than anything that occurs throughout the movie itself (which has, at one point, two scenes that are, at a glance, two minutes long). And, since it's made in the '90s, it is also, unfortunately, very, very cheap: $10 per ticket to see it. Still, the movie is a fun, low-maintenance horror comedy, if you like that sort of stuff, and I've enjoyed it quite a bit in the past.

The reality of the mafia environment is absolutely dog-eat-dog where a gangster will be killed for showing any sign of weakness. The only exception being if they are killed by a cop. I have even seen gangsters run in circles, turn their heads, and run back the other direction when the police show up. I was in Sicily in the mid-1990s when one such guy was killed for going to the police station and telling them that a fellow had stolen his gun. The cop looked over his shoulder and then just laughed at the guy and shot him in front of the entire crowd of people.

This has to be the worst movie i've seen this year.. and i watch a lot of cable. The "special effects" ( Spielberg would laugh his ass off ) are horrible, the yellow eye contact lenses are cute though.. I have to admin that i couldn't bear to watch it to the end.

Chris Morris ' Brass Eye TV series had always generated a large number of complaints , both from the audience and from management, but with the show now nearing the halfway mark in season 6, it’s time to put the complaints to rest. With that in mind, now is a great time to look at some of the highlights from this season. To begin with, it was always a case of “see you later” when talking about how much this show has improved, and this is no different, even if some of the criticisms of Brass Eye TV have been valid throughout this season.

Ok , when I rented this several years ago I had the worst expectations . Yes , the acting is bad, the story is horrible , I was expecting it to be very good , and the plot line was very interesting . Well , this was one of the worst disappointments I have experienced . I can't even say how disappointed I was , because I was expecting a good thriller . I've never been disappointed by a movie like this . I have read all of the review I've come across , and they all say that this is a very original story that could have made a good thriller .

Set in Venice mainly on the Lido , Visconti 's `` Death in Venice '' is a triumph of filmmaking in its own right , and for that the film has won the best director prize at Venice Film Festival twice. The movie is also a major success commercially and is among the best films of this year. The film has a worldwide gross of $9 million, and the total attendance of the film's 3 days in the US was about 10.7 million. The director's career began in 1960s when he was a graduate student at NYU , and he got a job directing a short film for the Student Union .

Rivalry between brothers leads to main story line . Navy Commander Chuck Prescott ( Marshall Thompson ) has developed the ability to project himself into anyone’s head, but this ability makes him very difficult to pin down and kill, so his friends at the US Marine Corps find themselves forced to rely on him to protect them from their former comrades. They have no idea that the enemy they face is also Chuck’s former brother-in-law. Chuck learns that he has enemies in his own camp: the people closest to him, but not his wife.

Laura Gemser plays a magazine photographer who is sent to Africa for a photo shoot. There she is met by a couple and other swinging couples. They all stay at this huge, very touristy hotel with a gigantic swimming pool. One night they have a pool party complete with "real live" native dancers. It's very un-politically correct and very kitschy. Later, Emanuelle finally has her photo shoot, which turns out to be in one of those drive-through, stay-in-your-car safaris (albeit the photography is gorgeous). Throughout the film, Emanuelle is going after every man she meets.

It 's hard to believe that a movie this bad could actually be released . The dialog was unnatural . It was like they were trying to act like teenagers . But that aside, this film is a complete mess. The actors just didn't have enough to make this film work . It didn't help that they had bad writing and terrible direction . If you love this film, you have to see it from the other end of the screen. There's nothing to look at or anything to enjoy . It's a film that's hard to watch .

Still have n't read a single Dan Brown book , but I watched all his movies adaptations . I woouldnt have any trouble finding it. this is an alright show to watch , its not the best nor the worst . I 've watched it twice, once on cable, once on VHS, and once on DVD . I have had the opportunity to catch this independent film and was impressed with it, despite the lack of excitement in the plot. The acting was very good by everyone involved. Amy Madigan played the part of a guilt ridden mother who is tired, yet well intentioned and determined to make up for her younger daughter's condition. Yet, in the process, she has neglected her older sister, who is more interested in playing with her savant-syndrome sibling and living in a world of escapism.The men in the movie are very powerful in their secondary roles.

This movie is great. 80's sleazy slasher movie about three kids born during an eclipse, so they kill everyone they see. The reason they kill makes practically no sense, but it just adds to the charm of this movie. And dang, these kids are crazy, especially Curtis. If you've seen the movie, you know who I am talking about. That kid's vicous! Although the movie doesn't have much gore, it is entertaining, and for some reason you kind of care about the characters. It also has some nice nudity.
