20 Years later and this movie still has echoes of its greatness floating around. Never has a movie surpassed Valley Girl's incredible soundtrack. The movie completely encapsulated the 80's to such a perfect degree that it could only be realized this many years later. Nicolas Cage at his best. A movie that just has so much character to it, that it makes you realize how sad hollywood has become (as far as quality goes). The special edition DVD is loaded with tons of extras and well worth it to purchase it as you'll have plenty of material to sift through.

Once again Bronson 's talent is mostly wasted on this shock value 1984 thriller which ( uncut ) is far from a great movie but I did find it very entertaining, especially if you like to watch films like this one. I have never seen the original 1984, so I just went with this remake that is more about plot, and some of the performances. The original 1984 had a very simple plot, but this one has more plot twists and turns. I am glad to see a remake of this movie is made, so this can go on the big screen for many more years!

I saw this film at school and absolutely loved it. Based on a true story, this is an absolutely splendid masterpiece of a film. Seriously, I couldn't find anything wrong with it. One definite plus is how it was filmed. Set in Morrocco in 1904, the Wind and the Lion is filled with stirring images like the Great Raisuli on horseback especially. The cinematography was faultless, the editing was crisp, the costumes were gorgeous and the scenery was breathtaking. And I have to mention the music from Jerry Goldsmith, it was phenomenal.

Oh, the horror, the unspeakable horror of this film. If you can even call it a film. This looks like some first-year art school project, hastily cobbled together.The "talents" here will subject you to a painful mix of under- and- overacting, and practically all the scenes were terribly contrived and pretentious.The film in no way reflects Malaysian culture or social conventions - nobody even talks that way over here. I live in Malaysia, BTW.Spinning Gasing seems tailor-made to pick up an award in the foreign film category of some western film festival. And unfortunately, that ploy seems to have worked.

The submarine used was NOT Varangian ! 'It ' was in fact two boats , P614 and P615 , both built at Kiel 's Flugstofftechnik 's ( Flottilienz ) plant. They are of the same construction, but P614 was the first to be successfully tested. It had been given a very special role. The German submarine, which had been in service since at least 1941, did not want to be forgotten. Therefore, it was decided to place the P614 in an isolated area of the Mediterranean, near Malta in order to keep it from the enemy's eyes.

Thank God I didn't buy this movie myself! I borrowed it from a friend who bought it out of sheer curiosity and of course after viewing it feel they should be reimbursed! This has got to be one of THE worse movies I've EVER seen! I do realize they couldn't have had much of a budget but I swear I could make a better movie than this staring my pets! The acting was horrible, so was the editing, the dialogue, EVERYTHING! It was so bad that it was seriously making me angry as I watched it!

My boyfriend and I went to watch The Guardian.At first I didn't want to watch it, but I loved the movie- It was definitely the best movie I have seen in sometime.They portrayed the USCG very well, it really showed me what they do and I think they should really be appreciated more.Not only did it teach but it was a really good movie. The movie shows what the really do and how hard the job is.I think being a USCG would be challenging and very scary. It was a great movie all around.

THE OTHER is a supposed "horror" movie made during the 1970s. It is not to be confused with the similarly titled THE OTHERS, which starred Nicole Kidman.The plot is as follows - a woman with strange supernatural powers teaches her twin grandsons something referred to simply as "the game". One of these twin boys - Niles - is supposed to be "good". The other one - Holland - is supposed to be evil.The idea sounds interesting enough as an abstract concept and the movie was adapted from a novel.

A antique shop-owner in NYC, played by Joanne Whalley(Valerie Alston)gets put on a US District Court jury, on a trial of a known Mafioso Armand Asante(Rusty Pirone), and most of this very slow-paced film revolves around attempts of Pirone attempting to get Whalley to acquit him of murder, by threatening to kill her son, and herself. Much action ensues, involving gruesome mob-rub outs, interspread with Willam Hurt as the go-between. Much of this silly, disjointed mess surrounds Hurt and Asante's obsession with Whalley, courtroom scenes that we've all seen time and again, and an ending that is unbelievable.

One of low budget horror schlockmeister actor, John Carradine's more animated roles as a implied Nazi scientist, who is turning humans into zombies to serve the Reich. Mindless scuffling brain dead, only able to obey the most simple of orders....bit like staff in McDonalds.Hitler isn't mentioned by name, since America wasn't at war at the time they was filmed, but it's pretty obvious who the bad guys are working for!There seems to be two types of zombies in film, the traditional voodoo type popular in the old black & white films of the 1930's and '40's.

If you are a Christian or a Jew hoping to see an accurate Biblical ( or Torah ) portrayal of Islam, the best way to go is to read a book of Torah yourself. Here’s why:

1) It’s much harder to argue with your own people than it is with others: They know better. You can never be sure if they’re actually reading your arguments or just playing along with you. 2) If they do actually read your argument, they will likely believe it, since they have so much religious trust.

I was impressed with this film because of the quality of the acting and the powerful message in the script. I would recommend this to people who are looking for something more challenging than they have to be. As always, a solid production. Randy

I saw this film in the theater and was a little disoriented at first with the dialogue that seemed to be going over the heads of most of the cast. I found it hard to understand all the dialogue, but once I started watching the scenes I realized that they were so well written and acted that you couldn't fault it for any of the problems.

I find it amazing , that so many people ( probably Poles ) have voted for this movie , giving us so much freedom to make a film like this. Thank you , thank you for the support. Thanks also for all comments , questions. I’m glad there are some who like it . This film was my first Polish production, and I am very thankful to all involved in this production , including the people I worked with during the whole process of shooting and the ones who helped to edit the film.

This film was a huge surprise to me while i watched it at Cinequest in the big California Theatre in downtown L.A. I never got to see it before it’s screening but it was a big draw for me with it’s great cast and storyline, I am so glad it didn’t come before! I highly recommend it to anyone who loves film noir!”

—

“Wow what a fantastic film this was. I had not heard of this until now and was very pleasantly surprised as this film blew me away with it’s outstanding cast.

Having loved Stephen King's novels and short stories for many years, I, like most reviewers, have been consistently disappointed in the adaptations to film from his printed works. A few notable exceptions are "Stand By Me" from "The Body", "Carrie" from the novel of the same name, and "The Shawshank Redemption" from "Rita Heyworth and Shawshank Redemption". This movie is by far the worst thing that has ever been produced with Stephen King's name attached to it in any way. It is no surprise that Mr. King has pretty much disavowed any connection with it.

...a true geek-girl's dream: high tech, high drama, smart guys, steamy sex, and large explosions. (VERY large explosions.) Sam Waterston is so natural in the role of Oppenheimer that tapes of the REAL Oppenheimer sound odd: apparently, he had a voice similar to Ronald Reagan! The triumph and tragedy of Oppenheimer is one of the 20th century's most stirring dramas, and this movie stands as a model of what docu-drama ought to be: the facts are allowed to speak for themselves, while the fictional parts are used to amplify and fill in the record, not to call attention to themselves.

This great film never showed up in my town , so actually I did n't have any opportunity to watch it , because it was banned for some time in the country where I live , so it's a bit difficult for me to find the original . I hope you enjoy it! It was one of the films I missed, because I lived abroad, but it was on the big screen here. There was an American version called The Best of Enemies , and there's a German version . I don't know whether it's worth watching the original, but you can't really complain.

The TV show was slow moving and the 'offbeat ' characters were sometimes irritating . Only through the miracle of internet streaming service do we have the show now. And now we have the season 2 premiere episode. It is the season premiere, which is always cool. But this season, a few things need to be addressed and I feel like I should address these things. So if you are watching the season premiere, or want to see what is to come, let me know, and give me your thoughts and suggestions, I am always open to anything.

In my opinion the directing, editing, lighting, and acting(minus Franco) were very good. I must admit, I was pleasantly surprised and impressed with this film. I wasn't expecting much, in way of camera angles, sound, etc, but in these areas the film wasn't bad at all.After seeing the film, I personally felt frustrated with both characters because I wanted so badly for these two characters to reach out to one another. And I felt like the Travis(Franco) character wasn't really affected or changed in the end after Terri commits suicide.

There was a time when not all animation was Disney or Pixar. Its so nice to see this wonderful film again and I actually got hold of a good, reasonable copy on DVD. Be careful as its out of the public domain and there are some really bad copies around.I got a very good copy by a company called Flashbacks and its quite good. In the old days I watched it on black and white on TV and its magic to see it in colour. Very much better than some would have you believe. The songs are delightful and the colour is great.

I think Trash really sucks. I watched it a couple of weeks ago and I haven't seen that kind of c**p at the cinema since Female Trouble by John Waters and that was even worse. The dialogues, the acting; it really stank, it was so bad it made me want to leave the cinema and ask for my money back. But actually I am glad I saw it, because then I could tell my honest opinion on it. One should see this film, even though it stinks.

I watched this movie recently mainly because I am a Huge fan of Jodie Foster's. I saw this movie was made right between her 2 Oscar award winning performances, so my expectations were fairly high. Unfortunately, I thought the movie was terrible and I'm still left wondering how she was ever persuaded to make this movie. The script is really weak. The story itself may have been somewhat believable if someone like Mel Gibson had played the role of the hit-man. The idea of Jodie running off with Dennis Hopper and his irritating accent was impossible for me to buy into.

This movie is a haunting telling of the life of the author and poet, Mishima. It jumps around through his past, through his last day, and through some of his stories but is expertly constructed as it moves from section to section. It captures the flavor of the man, his work and of his times...the difficult 1960s.I think the most wonderful parts (literally, full of "wonder") are the excerpts from his works. The sets (especially designed to work with the camera) are amazing....stylized, beautiful and effective.

I had to get this movie, since it didn't come to where I live. I waited patiently and it was worth the wait. I totally fell in love with this movie. The chemistry between Walters and Grint you could see, since they also worked together on the Harry Potter movies.The woman who plays his overbearing, righteous mother really had me convinced all right and how much of a hypocrite she is, I think she did a great job playing the role. I only wish we could of had seen the actually sex scene or more of it.

within about 5 minutes in to the film the first fight scene i was watching i just could help but i wanted to get to the bottom of it all and find out what had happened as well as hear what he had to say to her. i felt like i knew him. "I've watched it many times but can never seem to catch a break because I never do anything. I've been there for so long and I've seen this, but never knew it existed." In my opinion this is a very important film.

I have seen cheesy kung fu fight films . Living in Taiwan they come on in lieu of sitcoms in the late evening and are pretty entertaining for a couple of laughs. One thing about these fight films, they are very, very long. Some of the films have over 3 hours of screen time in them! That's not what I like about them. I like the idea of people getting paid for it, but for $2 a minute, I don't know how it's gonna go over, especially with such a large budget.

I saw the movie while I was in a class a few years back in high school. I thought it was a thought provoking movie that made you want to look into the power behind riddles. I think the type of people that wouldn't like this movie would be those who don't like solving things, or those who get frustrated when they can't solve riddles. its a good movie, based on a true story that happened in my home town of Toronto, Ontario. so if u want a real record of the things that happen in the alleys there, watch this movie.

Well , this movie is really `` PLUMPED '' HAHA Get it ? Thats kinda like the attitude of this movie that i am gonna hate it . I mean all of the girls are gorgeous and they have great expressions on their faces . However , i really don't like most of the songs that they are singing . And ofcourse , i find it boring . I really do . The acting is also bad , they do have great songs but not to the extent as this movie shows. All in all , if you are into these movies . You will really enjoy this movie .

I mean , come on ! This movie had such nice potential but it 's like they ran out of money and then they threw it all away like that. It's a shame , because I really liked that movie ! I think that it had some amazing performances , but unfortunately I couldn't finish the movie . I think it was a pretty good movie , but unfortunately , I just couldn't do anything more with it . Maybe it was the movie itself , maybe I just had bad expectations . Either way , I didn't get much of the movie , but I can still enjoy it .

Hey guys and girls! Don't ever rent, or may God forbid, buy this piece of garbage. I have rarely seen a film in any genre as bad as this one. The acting is actually worse than me and my friends did when we were 7 and in the 1.grade had to act in front of all parents and siblings. In fact, we would have been taken up to evaluation for the Oscars, if we were to be compared to the actors in Darkhunters. The story is terrible, the makeup is terrible, the filming is terrible, the set is terrible, the directing is terrible, etc.

An absorbing exploration of virtual reality, although it is not yet clear how much the director himself intended. This film deliberately takes you through several layers of artificial reality, leaving only subtle clues about which layer of virtual reality you are in, positing an ontological confusion for the viewer to ponder. Also can be seen as a satire of video games-- the whole movie though may fall into the fallacy of imitative form here. It seems unable to escape from the video game genre which it imitates; thus the satire becomes problematic.

... out of this movie.Sorry to say , this showed at the Cleveland International Film Festival . Our copy did not make it to you but this review is going to give you some more background information and give you a little taste of what you’ll be experiencing.There are a couple of ways to look at the film . The first is a simple one but it is one of my favorite things and this is one of the reasons why it’s the movie of the year . The second is a more analytical view and it’s one of the reasons I’m a big fan of movies .

I saw this on the Accent Underground release with the short films. I found the film at first boring and old fashioned and switched it off after the first hour - I was a little drunk and tired.I went to bed, and no kidding I had a nightmare about this film within half and hour of falling asleep. I couldn't stop thinking about why, so I got up, switched the TV back on, loaded the DVD and saw the rest of the movie.Well done Alex Frayne sir, you've managed to implant your film into this old, cynical movie goers head, and that takes doing.

Susan Sarandon . She made this movie for me . I 've never appreciated her acting more than as I did with her in it . this is actually an excellent movie . Sara is just great . She has such a lovely character . I 'm very pleased with her performance . I'm very, very glad I watched it . It will be one I will rewatch . there are a couple of minor things I wish she'd added more of in the movie but she's really got so much depth . I do, however, have a complaint that she doesn't give the character much character in her character .

Hollywood had a long love affair with bogus Arabian Nights tales but few of these products have stood the test of time. The story behind one of them is as intriguing as any of the other tales in the series. This film is a remake from the original movie “Arabian Nights” in which the story was adapted for cinema. Filmmaker and screenwriter Aziz Ghobadi says he made the original film because “I thought the movie did not have much to show but it had the power to change people’s perceptions of the movie.

I went to see this movie at the theater and paid money thinking it would be at least mildly entertaining. As I walked up the stairs to the balcony, all the lights went out and it began raining outside. I took my umbrella and stepped out into the storm to see a movie I didn't expect it to be much of a comedy. I had no choice but to stay in bed for about two hours because I didn't want to get soaked while I waited for the light to come on so I could get some sleep.

I spent many a sleepless night after watching 2001. Not only because of the psychological horror (of which 2001 is a masterpiece) but also because of the way it brought me (a restless soul) some clarity to the way I observe the universe. It changed my way of thinking in a very profound way. And after reading the novel (by Arthur C. Clarke) I found myself once again inspired (a writer as I am) by the level of imagination.The Space Odyssey is not something one can just "go and see".

This movie was really funny. The people that were expecting to see an Oscar worthy comedy, should get over themselves. This was a fun movie to see with interesting and funny characters, plot lines, dialog quotes and catch phrases. I rate a movie a 10 if I have bought the DVD, or in this case, the videotape, and have watched it many times, and in this case, still laugh out loud. I have about 12 movies in my collection with a rating of 10 and about half don't have anything do do with the Oscars.

I love Umberto Lenzi's cop movies -- ROME ARMED TO THE TEETH is my favorite -- and his DESERT COMMANDOS pretty much legitimized the Italian Euro War phenomenon by managing to actually be a pretty good movie. Give him guns, machines, some guys to run around talking tough and it's hard for him to miss.What a shame it is then to encounter his EATEN ALIVE and CANNIBAL FEROX. They could have been by anybody, really, and one watches them with a sense that he was under contract, was told what kind of films to make, was assigned a cast & crew and given a budget, deadline and script.

Ice the Limerick : A virus pulled out of the iceJust did n't know how to play nice.If infected you will have no chance. I'm sure I read some years back about an Irish person who found a lump in her breast, and then the lump grew, and after a couple of months the person thought it might be the same lump, but then the lump grew bigger. She didn't know how it grew or how it was spread. How did this happen? And what is the virus? And why did the person die? Click to expand...

Like some other people wrote, I'm a die-hard mario fan, and I loved this game. This game starts slightly boring, but trust me, it's worth it. As soon as you start, your hooked! The levels are fun and exiting. They will hook you 'till your mind turns to mush. I'm not kidding. This game is also orchestrated, and is beautifully done. To keep this spoiler free, I have to keep my mouth shut about details. But please try this game! It'll be worth it!Story: 9.9 Action: 10.1 (It's that good!)

Asmali Konak has arguably become one of the best TV series to come out of Turkey . With its unique combination of politics, history and suspense, it is an interesting series to look forward to in 2014. However, as you can imagine, the series’ success has also created a lot of attention on the series. The series was not always that successful for Turkey. When it first released on Turkey, it was a low rated series with low viewership. But now, the series has been seen on Turkey’s largest television network (Zorlu), and has become popular in its second season.

This film is enjoyable if you like poverty row, public domain films from the first half of the 20th century, or are a fan of amateur film-making. The film splices together public domain thrillers together along with newly shot scenes in which the "actors" (With the sole exception of Redfield doing a near dead on Lugosi rip, all of the "performers" are simply dreadful!) attempt to interact with the stock footage. The "New" footage is covered with digitally added film scratches, as is some of the already substandard old footage (??!!).

By the time the Hellraiser franchise was reaching it's forth film the premise was wearing a bit thin. Dr. Paul Merchant (Bruce Ramsey) is a scientist in the future, whom while prisoner regales his captor of the story of how his ancestors (all played by Ramsey) had first built the evil Lament Configuration puzzle-box that sets evil upon the world and how his bloodline had subsequent dealing with said box. The film is a awash with lack of continuity in regards to the other films and lack of coherency in this one.

I rated this movie a 3 and that was generous . The scenery is ponderous and gaudy , the acting is weak , the dialogue is incoherent and the characters are all over the place . The story is a farce and you will want to leave after seeing it . I rated this movie a 1 , and that is too bad , the acting is not bad , the dialog is good and the special effects were very well done . The story is just weird , and if you were a fan of the movie you will get bored very fast .

After seeing a preview for this film at my local mall where there is a stand for purchasing foreign films, I decided to give it a chance and see the movie. I was a little bit nervous because I am not very familiar with the film and didn’t know the details of the cast or anything. Well, I was not disappointed as the movie was well worth the effort. This movie is well worth seeing if you are a first-time film viewer. The cast of the film is great, which made for a fun movie experience.

Wow , Stella Shorts are great ! Lots of patrons from The State and Stella , the TV show . I thought , “what the heck ? I should make them myself!” So , here we go :

Materials needed are a pair of elastic band scissors , scissors , a pair of elastic cutters or a pair of scissors , scissors , an empty bottle and glue , glue , glue , glue . How to make these ? First, you need a pair of scissors. I got this idea from a TV show, they always talk about sewing with elastic bands , I just didn’t have any scissors .

One of the earlier reviews of this movie ends with `` Only for big fans of the lead actors or something of the like, the movie might just be good, but for most fans, it's the kind of movie that they'd rather go see on DVD. It really is a great film, if you get to see it. It's a tough, tough movie to describe, but I don't know that I can really lay it all out in two words. I'm kind of trying to say it's kind of like a movie that has some sort of cult following.

Just a great soundtrack . Really enjoyable music . Outstanding cast , great lead performance . Worth watching.Does n't really need a new release, but you will be impressed with the talent involved , the way the film was produced and the way they captured the essence of each of the characters. A must watch ! Great movie and I have never heard of any of the main characters! This is one of those movies where you think "What the hell?" and then go in expecting to find it to be just as great as the first movie in this series.

Well , I think I 've finally seen my last Woody Allen movie ! I read the review in the NYTimes, but I don 't feel that I can comment on that aspect of the movie. I have not watched the movie yet, but have been trying to get a hold of it. I will watch it, but if I am feeling brave enough, I will watch it as I am writing this.I am in my mid 40's , so maybe it will not hold up to my standards as well as some of the previous movies I have seen .

Jacqueline Hyde is a good quality film and does manage to be likable because of what it is . Everyone loves it . I'm sure that it will be a big hit . This is another great film, but it doesn’t stand out from the rest like the others. It's a bit predictable . Some of the acting is pretty good, though, and I have to wonder how many times they used the word “silly”. I think it's a classic of the '30s, and it has its own problems. But it's worth a viewing.

Dreamland started out moderately interesting but never went anywhere except Tedium city. A low rent affair with no name actors and laughable effects, not recommended for any reason. The best thing that could be said is it looks like they really filmed it on location in the Nevada desert. That's it, I can't think of one thing good besides that about this stinker. The finale is supposed to be some kind of revelation but falls flat like the rest. Oh, I thought of one other good point about this cheese, it clocks in at just over an hour although it still wears out its welcome long before then.

"Disappointing" is the best word I could think for this film, especially considering the glowing reviews it receives from some other users.One thing that really spoils the film is that it is unabashedly partial(in both senses of the word). Not only does it present a very selective description of the games (focussing as it does on the US athletics team) but it also contains several inaccuracies, most of which serve to exaggerate the difficulties the US team faced.What is even more disturbing is that all the omissions and mistakes (?

Okay , that was just brilliant . I wish that the rest of Season 1 had been this strong . I can just imagine how awesome this would’ve been if the first 10 episodes were this incredible . And I think you could see that as well . I have to believe that this has all of Season 1’s power and that’s awesome . I don’t know when or why Season 1 was canceled , but I always knew I would be waiting for Season 2 . How can you not watch a season of TV like this?

I can see that the ratings for this film are n't all that high for this film , so I'm hoping that with the next installment I might actually see this film in a theater. A few of my friends on the internet have seen this film and they say that it's quite good, which I found to be true. I'm a huge fan of Star Trek and when it comes to Star Trek, I can see why they put this film out. So if it isn't a fluke that I'm going to see it, I'm going to take my chances on it.

There was no need for this movie, plain and simple. The original, although hated by some, was something I found to be actually really entertaining, mainly because it was before Jim Carrey started to really lose his touch, and Cameron Diaz was, well, "Smoooooookin!" 'Nuff said. So why make a sequel/prequel thing? Honestly? Knowing that Jim Carrey wouldn't do it should've been clue enough that it didn't deserve to be created. But then they just make mistake after mistake. Jamie Kennedy. Why is this man still allowed to breathe?

I read a few reviews of the movie and got the impression that it was not as good as the previous Karate Kid installments. Although my favorite is still Karate Kid II, I felt this fourth installment of the movie series was consistent with the others and had some important lessons to share. Unlike the previous versions, the karate student is a female teenager who takes a somewhat different learning path, rather than a male teenager. Maggi finds this a little more challenging, but rises to the occasion. The plot twists are believable and predictable.

I just watched this move for the 5th or 6th time and am still in love with it. It still makes me cry and sing and worry and celebrate.I almost wrote Bonnie Hunt a letter to tell her how much I love it. David Duchovny's grief scene is so flippin real!!! Minnie Driver is so natural and honest. My favorite line is when Duchovny says "I miss Elizabeth but I ache for Grace". Oh man! I'm crying just thinking about it. ALSO... Bonnie Hunt and Jim Belushi are sooooooooooooo the perfect Chicago area couple!!

Philistines beware, especially American ones! This has all the elements you'll hate - a langorous approach to film language, a painterly sense of composition, an intense homoerotic focus to its elegant narrative, a wonderful and unusual use of music and, even worse, it's based on a story you'd probably hate as well... If, however, you do feel that films don't to have derivative plotlines, be full of action and crappy dialogue, don't need the visual grammar of MTV/TV Commercials, then watch this.

I enjoyed the acting in this movie. Except for the sister. She reminded me of Janice on Friends. I could never quite believe she was anything but obnoxious. My main problems with the movie were the anticlimatic ending and the execution scene with the sister and brother-in-law. The guy falling out of the exploding car? Maybe if his hand had been blown off and he ran to the mute for help and she kissed him and rushed him to a hospital, maybe then I could have gone for the ending. I think somebody needed to die in the execution scene.

Okay , When I bought this flick I though this got ta be the ultimate b-movie , space monkey landing , I don’t recall this being said , and I think you’ll find the same thing , as well , when you watch this , the first one , this movie was very well edited , I’d rather watch the first one , than watch this movie , so I hope you all like the movie , and I hope you all see it on your TV . What is this movie , the name of the movie ? What is the name of the main character ?

Being a former MST3k watcher, even I found this movie unwatchable. The awful attempts at humor-heck the awful attempts at acting. Nobody needs to read a harangue on this piece of junk.I just like how all the positive reviews were clearly written by cast members or family friends. Just click on their other reviews and wow--they are all reviewing Modern Vampires. Give me a couple of bucks and I can make a movie better than this. One of the most incompetent pieces of film-making I've ever seen and that's saying something.

We found this movie nearly impossible to watch . With such a super cast , it 's a shame that it is not more widely available . But the film is worth the effort to find it . I 'll give it a chance , hopefully it will be enjoyable . It does seem to have been done before . There was a remake , which I saw and found to be somewhat interesting , but not worth a review . And of course , there 's always the other remake . But this remake seemed like a good movie . And it is , from what I can gather , a good story .

11 years after this film was released only 5 people have reviewed it here on IMDb . There is a ton of criticism on it. I was not surprised to read about some negative reviews, I have had several. I have had many negative reviews for the movie and some positive ones. There are many different opinions here, it’s not a big secret that a movie is judged by many people. Some see it as a joke, others love it or hate it. I personally think it’s an interesting film.

This movie was outright painful for me to watch . I understand that indie films do not have the same critical cachet as Hollywood movies. But it seemed so out of place and at times it was hard to understand why any film would even make it this far out of theaters. I was so unhappy that I left it. I’ve seen movies like this before, especially by Hollywood, but never anything by independent. It’s a shame I didn’t get to see this one. The story of this movie is really really bad.

This TV series is about a foolish and unconventional English gentleman who gets up to all sorts of merry mishaps.I remember watching Mr Bean with my family back in 1990, when I was still a child. My family laughed so hard at every episode, and the contents of which still come up in our daily conversations twenty years later. The memorable scenes which are still in my head include Mr Bean attempting to get out of his car park, shooting out the lights, counting sheep, and him in the swimming pool. We bought all the Mr Bean videos on VHS, no mater how expensive they were.

This isn't exactly a complicated story. It's not a mystery, or a plot you have to spend time re watching because you missed an intrinsic part of the dialog. Claiming a movie has to be seen multiple times for you 'to get it' may apply to a very few films, however this isn't one of them. Those type of movies have substance and are so involving it's easy to miss an important portion of dialog, or a subtle nuance to plot details you may have overlooked. With Goya's Ghosts this doesn't apply.

This movie was one of the longest movie watching experiences of my life. While I like how the director, Chan-wook Park, handled the revenge, the move as a whole was TERRIBLE. Oldboy is only billed at 1 hour and 55 minutes long but it feels like it takes at least 3 and a half hours to tell this story. I will say that the English dubbing was done very well and the movie was easily understandable. I felt that some of the scenes were unnecessarily long and a lot of the dialogue repeated itself.

I watched the this the other night on a local station because I did n't feel like watching tripe like that lol. I'm actually glad I never watched it, cause I feel like I got spoiled by it in high school. When I was about 12 or so, I watched it one night, and I was like "Whoa, this isn't even bad, this is pretty good" lol, it wasn't terrible but it wasn't the best movie I'd ever seen. But I thought it had some good stuff in it and the music was very catchy.

This film tells the true story of escaped black slaves who found their own mountain-top commune as free men in New York City in 1890s, but who after their freedom decided to return home to help the cause of freedom. The Black Freedom Theater was started to provide the opportunity for African-Americans and other marginalized groups to act in concert with the civil rights movement. It would be one of the first black theater groups in America. It began with a small group of eight black and one white volunteers and lasted for seven years.

Thankfully you don't need a lot of "book learnin" to understand where this thing's going... Obviously a poverty row cash-in on Universal's big hit THE WOLF MAN (which was made just one year earlier), this finds the always-watchable George Zucco in another of his patented "mad doctor" roles as brilliant, vengeance-minded scientist Lorenzo Cameron. Cameron, who has set up shop deep in the swamp lands of what I'm presuming is the Louisiana bayou, is plotting revenge against four of his former peers who both humiliated him and forced him to resign from his previous job.

A group of four young men , attending a prestigious private school , belong to an old covenant that was born out of a religious revival of the 19th century. While the men were in school and college, a series of crises were unfolding in South America that would change the religious landscape of the continent and in turn alter the history of the Western Hemisphere and the Americas in general. The four young men of South America were also young men, but their time in South America was different. They were college students, and their time in South America was different from what their American peers were used to.

What an utter disappointment. Forget this abysmal film and get hold of the TV series instead. What on earth were they doing making the American president relatively sane? ALL the politicians should have been bumbling buffoons (Peter Cook is good as the British PM). It lacks the biting satire of the original, going instead for "lowest common denominator" slapstick. 1 out of 10 if I'm being generous! This is unfortunately yet another example of a remake which totally misses the point of the original, the difference with this one being that they were both written by the same people.

`` Mr. Bean '' , starring the legendary Rowan Atkinson , was a huge hit during its run in the mid-90s. In the mid-aughts, the character came into his own as a guest-starring character, such as on '' Scrubs , '' where he was played by comedian/actor Larry David . The character also came into its own on the hit sitcom '' Family Guy , '' where he and his son Fred were played by actor Neil Patrick Harris and his two sons by actress Kristen Schaal , a.k.a. Fred and Stewie . However, Mr. Bean did not appear again on the show, which ended after season 2 in 2004.

GOLD RAIDERS (1951)A dull western/comedy feature with the Three Stooges (including Shemp Howard at this point, who I've always enjoyed as the "third Stooge") doing their usual schtick, and directed by the normally dependable Edward Bernds, who also did some of their funniest classic shorts -- so one has to wonder, just what went wrong this time? The most probable answer is that what worked pretty good as a 15-minute two-reeler comes up as too much for a 55-minute feature film. Unlike so many of their classic short subjects, GOLD RAIDERS is not worth revisiting.

Put simply , this mini-series was terrible . Let me count the ways . 1 . Absurd plotting . 2 . Poor characterizations . 3 . Lack of depth . I can't say I blame them . The first thing that jumped out at me was that the first episode was the weakest. It was a very simple premise with a large number of characters. I felt like the writer was trying too hard. It also felt like it was taking too long. The second issue is that the characters lacked depth. There was no chemistry between characters, which was a major problem.

in his descriptions of CAA, platinum card lunches in Hollywood, psychoanalysis, a vacation in Provincetown he never took, and free trips to Nicaragua, financed by Columbia pictures.It sounds narcissistic, but Spalding Gray (possibly because of his unusual personality) ropes the audience in, laughs at himself (perhaps because he did not take the Hollywood thing oh-so-seriously) and gets us to care.This monologue is not just about "The Killing Fields", or "Swimming to Cambodia"; it is more a pastiche of events, as he sees them.

I found West Point to be an agreeable film , although I doubt that I would watch it again . I felt as if it was missing something , especially for a military film . The main characters were not portrayed well enough to make them seem very real , and I found it hard to believe that the film was set during the Vietnam War . There were some entertaining moments , although as I recall , there weren't too many . The only thing I will remember about the movie was the ending , which was not very dramatic , and seemed a little out of place for a Western .

Great party movie , following the adventures of Bill & Tom , two high school buddies at opposite ends of the country who find that their paths cross in a town they call home. They meet and fall in love. They travel back in time to meet the man that changed their lives. It is the story of two young men who find that they have the chance to change their life and find themselves in a very different place than they would have imagined. This movie is so well acted, directed and acted that I felt that it was as good as most of the westerns out there.

They used footage of some real protest spliced with some woman talking about a society with no men to make the point that women have to work to make money for a man. That's about as clear a comment on female power as they could make and still get away with murder. "I would have never thought that the woman would do that. Never. I think she will get the death penalty. If she is convicted," said defense lawyer John LaMonte, who is representing the man. The video was originally posted in July.

A real let down , the novel is such a brilliant stomach churning journey into madness but this made for a really awful film

You would have thought that a film directed by and starring Meryl Streep and directed by David Fincher would fare a lot better, with lots of great action scenes and beautiful locations. Well, sadly, that was not the case for The Girl. The story is based around the relationship between a young Jewish girl and her father (played by Meryl Streep) who is sent to an asylum for being a homosexual, to stay until he dies of AIDS, and that’s exactly what happens.

Animated shorts just do n't get much better than this wonderful Canadian film . This short feature is dripping with beautiful cinematography and music that really makes this a film that is definitely worth seeing . When I was a child, I used to watch the TV show Kung Fu. The show was called Kung-Fu in Canada and it featured some fantastic scenes of Canadian martial arts . One of these scenes was the battle between Bruce Lee and Bruce Lee's nemesis the Dragon . The battle was very exciting and full of energy . I remember being very enthralled by this show .

`` My Blue Heaven '' is boring . The plot is insipid ; the characterizations and dialogue stink ; the music is boring . It has a bad soundtrack . I like it but not much more . I would give it a 1/2 star if they would have made it a one-time-only album . This is not a movie I would recommend . I would have just given it a 1/2 . If you like action movies or suspense movies , you have to rent this one . If you like action movies or suspense movies you will like the movie . You will not enjoy this movie .

Even if you do not typically enjoy documentaries, odds are you will find this one fascinating. Not only does it have a well-mapped out plot that while easy to follow, contains its interesting detours; it also has a very strong emotional resonance, and not one that relies on a simple specific tone. Instead the emotions here are as profound and turbulent as the seas featured.That being said, if you know nothing of Donald Crowhurst and the 1968 single-handers boat race around the world...as was the case for me...please stop reading, and rent/view this film.

Reba sucks. It sucks hard. It's about this awful country singer attempting comedy. They might as well call this show "Generic", because that's what it is. It's dumb and generic. Reba, you're not funny, and I'm glad your retarded show was cancelled because you suck, and so does Brock, Barbra Jean, the red-headed teenager, that jockey guy, and the 12 year old who got knocked up. You all suck, and none of you are funny. Oh, and I heard a rumor that Reba is actually a gay devil-worshipper who idolizes Hitler and tortures animals.

This movie is #1 in the list of worst movies I have ever seen, with "Lessons for an Assassin" on the #2 spot.The acting is lousy (sorry, Sandra Bullock, but even your performance was horrible! ), the music score could have come from a bad x-rated movie and the story was downright ridiculous. It had this in common with a typical action movie: the dialogues were short and consisted mainly of one-syllable words. But contrary to the average action movie, there was no real action in this one.

There are so many things wrong with this movie that it is hard to pick just a few. Let's start with the silly and annoying songs. Like "Ride Little Cowboy" which just tended to accentuate the city-slickers look of Klinton Spilsbury. The silly kiddie cowboy songs going on in the background during the movie hurt any credibility or momentum that the story had going for it.I had seen the media hype before this movie was released, and I saw Klinton Spilsbury interviewed on various TV shows, and he had a very soft, sweet, lilting voice.

I watched 40 minutes and could n't bear it any longer  the television went off and I returned to the kitchen to fix some lunch. I thought I had seen what I needed to see. That is when it happened. I looked at my watch and saw that it was almost 7:50 A.M. I stood and walked out of the kitchen. As I left, a voice behind me said, You know, I have to go back to work. I'll call you if I get a chance. 

I smiled. I knew this voice.

The only reason i did n't delete this movie after 20 min is because we already wasted 20 minutes on a trailer for it... I hope you're not thinking I'm too stupid to recognize the trailer as a full blown trailer for it, as this is the exact kind of thing i've been complaining about on this board for a few weeks now. I don't care if the trailer was just a full trailer for it, or just a teaser for the actual film. The trailer looks the same way it always has. Just a trailer for a teaser.

My son Adam ( 5 years old ) is a big Scooby Doo fan . He like this film a lot . His dad also loves this film . He really loves this film . This movie makes you fall in love . This is one of the best movie I've seen in a long time . You have to see this movie . It is really amazing . This is a great animated film that was made by a very talented director . The storyline is well written . The dialogues are well written . The animation is perfect and the animation is great .

This is a movie that was probably made to entertain the middle school, early high school age kids. Maybe to them it's funny, they may possibly even see something scary in it. To me, the acting is poor, and plot is poor, there's just not much value at all for the adult viewer. I saw this film as weak and boring. At times there was the possibility that the movie could become interesting but it never really materialized. The creatures look pretty good but after seeing them for a few seconds, they don't seem to have any substance other than the look.

This is a really silly job of miscasting -- about as bad as Hepburn playing a Chinese woman in DRAGONFLY. I can't imagine why anyone would want to go see this movie, though. Yeah, but I'm guessing that the reason you wanted to see it isn't because you're curious about how it made the cut and how it came out. I saw it on VOD. It's not a great movie, I suppose. But it got a lot of favorable reviews, and was well reviewed. The reviews aren't always very balanced though.

I, like many this evening braved the frigid winter and long lines to see what I had anticipated to be one of the best movies of this year. However, I was left sadly wanting in many ways after the credits rolled. But to be fair, there were redeemable qualities (although very few). Let's start with what worked. First, the Lycans: on point in every way  from their terrifying physicality to their sheer ferocity. The action: sublimely visceral  when it did occur. Nighy/Victor and Sheen/Lucian: Perfect. Now, what did not (and there is plenty).

I 'm pleased that this was the work of foreign cinematographers because it ca n't be accused of unfair bias. That's why I always look at the credits before reviewing a film, since I'm always interested in finding out who the director is and how he or she got the idea for the movie, and whether or not the film follows the story exactly. My only complaint about this review was that the poster didn't tell us that this was the third and last installment of the franchise and there was still a chance to get all four films for free when it was released last year.

A very good film , focusing on a very important issue . Fetal alcohol syndrome is a very serious birth defect , but can be prevented , and there are many methods and products available . The film tells the story of a woman who wants to help others who have this disease . This film is available to watch online on your computer or mobile device . The film is very informative . It tells about what to do if you have Fetal Alcohol syndrome . The film also explains the effects of the syndrome and what it can be treated with .

Terribly disappointed with CITY OF MEN after being swept away by CITY OF GOD. Lost is the exciting and unpredictable storyline, and instead, in its place, is bland predictability with the obvious attempts at audience manipulation by a superficial pretentious production and distribution team. This story ended up feeling like a sappy soap opera rather than a gritty indie feature, which is what is should have been. This is what happens when distributors try to seek a wider audience (ridiculous sweeping shots of the Rio coastline, etc) at the expense of a gripping story and characters.

This movie is funny in more ways than one. It's got action. It's got humour. It's got attitude. It's got Dolemite's all girl army of kung-fu hos! And that's just what the movie offers as a film. It's also badly acted by some, the mic makes more than one cameo appearance, and some "punches" miss by feet. But when you make a movie this cool, who's got time to pay attention to those "details"? This movie rocks. Rent it tonight, if you can find it...

Son of the Mask is a terrible movie . I do n't like the baby and I do n't like the movie . I like it better as a stand alone . It is not your average horror movie, or even a horror film, in general . It does have horror in it of course, and it is not one of those slasher flicks that try to kill off all the other characters . It is, instead, a psychological horror horror movie . The premise of the movie is rather simple. It is a woman and her husband who are on a journey, trying to find their true selves .

As a geology student this movie depicts the ignorance of Hollywood. In the scene where the dog grabs the bone from inside of the burning house, it is less then a foot from lava which has an average temperature of 1,750 degrees Fahrenheit. This stupidity is witnessed again when "Stan" goes to save subway 4. His shoes are melting to the floor of the subway while the rest of the team is standing just feet away from the flowing lava. And to finish off this monstrosity of a film, they come up with the most illogical solution, stopping a lava flow with cement K rails.

I am a longtime fan of the original of this movie ( Bella Martha/Mostly Martha ) , and everything that it stands for - I just wish that the original would be as entertaining as this one, especially as a prequel, which would be better if there was still the "Bella/Bella Martha" sub-theme (and not just for that reason). I know it has been suggested that this one would make a good movie if it were not such a mess, and I agree, but I also believe that it might be superior if it were more like the original ( and it is the original ).

As a Genghis Khan "fan" I was looking forward to this movie. After devouring Conn Igguldens epic novels about Genghis and reading up on loads of historic records I feel I know something on the subject and was thrilled to share my knowledge with friends via this movie...That turned out a deception. This movie is practically made up from beginning to end. There are a few things that seem correct but mostly it is pure make believe of the writers. That does not have to be a problem, I like good entertainment just like anyone else unfortunately it is mostly boring.

While the new Pride & Prejudice film is gorgeous to view , and the soundtrack is lovely , we are left wondering why some of the things we've learned are so wrong. That is, of course, not to say that it is impossible to come up with a book that is both lovely and true to the spirit of the novel. Of course you can and it's a matter of finding the right combination of words and imagery to achieve that effect. For me, though, the problem is that so many of the novel's ideas seem to have been lost in translation.

The original Female Convict Scorpion is an all time masterpiece . The first sequel , Jailhouse 41 , was not a box office success because of the lack of character and plot . But the sequel was a massive success on the box office because of these two films . But in this sequel , jailhouse is not prison like it was before , which means that we have the freedom to do things that we never thought we were going to do . It also opens up the question of how a female can survive and be free. This is the second in the female prison Scorpion series, Jailhouse 40 .

There is only one reason this movie is watchable . Till Schweiger . He is such a good actor the film is entertaining and enjoyable . He did a great job in it and I can't wait to see his next role . The only reason I watched this movie is because it looks like an old classic which I thought was not going to end up to be any good . This movie reminds me of the old movie The Wild Geese, but in this movie, it seems like everyone is having fun and the movie is about to come to a conclusion .

Oh Gawd. I want to time travel back to Monogram Studios and throttle someone in their 2 room front office for this sloppy musical. It is one watt above flat-lining for 60 of its 61 minutes and then actually shows (for the one thin minute, spread in milli-second blips across the hour) that there is real life talent being badly photographed.I just don't see the point of going to some trouble to actually make this film that could easily be energetic and actually funny and allow lethargy to be the main thing on view.

Essentially plotless action film has two good guys (Fong and Roundtree) pitted against two bad guys (Mitchell and Pierce). Fong is perhaps the most uncharismatic action lead of the 80s, Roundtree's small part is a far cry from his "Shaft" days, and Cameron Mitchell adds another shameful role to his career, one to sit right next to his laughable turn in "The Toolbox Murders" (this man was a respected actor once, now he has come down to wearing flowers in his hair and complaining about people bleeding on his carpet).

First things first , I am by no means a picky movie watcher . I 'm not one of those guys that go and see every movie because I know that some movies are good and some movies are not but I have seen a good deal of movies and movies have some flaws . This movie is not one of the flops of my list . It has all the qualities of good movies that I liked . The film starts off as usual . I start out with an episode of The Office of The Week and we get some footage of the team going to work.

From the fertile imagination which brought you the irresistible HERCULES (1983), comes its even more preposterous (read goofier) sequel: right off the bat, we get another unwieldy "beginning of time" prologue which even contrives to completely contradict these same events as set up in the first film! ; a condensed montage of highlights from same is soon followed by a SUPERMAN-like scrolling credits sequence. Narrative-wise, here we have four rebellious gods who steal Zeus' seven all-important (but poorly animated) thunderbolts  a crime which, for one thing, sets the moon careening on a collision course with Planet Earth!

This is a very strange series with Dean Learner. I really didn't understand the guests. I knew they weren't serious but whether they were really them was unclear because...i guess i'm just that stupid. I don't know if this classes as a spoiler but the guests aren't real like in Ali g or anything they're played by one man or so i believe. I love the serious look that he's got going on. Its like that programme that was on on a Sunday morning that i forget the name of lol.

I don't think it really matters too much what the plot of this movie is about, the main thing you'll notice is the extreme amateurishness of the entire production. The acting is what you'd get if you chose people at random off the street. The sound is really annoying - a medicine cabinet closes with all the gusto of a gunshot going off in your ear, while at the same time the dialog is perhaps one-fifth as loud. Miscellaneous on-set noises dominate the soundtrack to a huge degree, with dialog taking a distant back seat.

Okay, I love this movie!!!!! I watched it over and over again. It is so hard to tell who the attacker is. You keep thinking it's one person, then another, then back to the first person, then another person. It is so suspense full you want to fast forward your TV to the end to see who it is.SUMMARY: Gail Osborne is raped and left at her home. She is in the hospital and begins to tell the story of how she was raped.

This film is undoubtedly one of the greatest landmarks in history of cinema . By seeing this film , we will realize that this is the most epic movie of our era . The story is based on one of the most famous books in the history of literature, namely the novel of short story, “Nights Like This” by Vladimir Nabokov. The author, Vladimir Nabokov used to spend a lot of his free time travelling from one hotel to another . The book of story, ”Nights Like This”, is one of the finest examples of the modern novel .

It's rare to see film that strikes out in every aspect but "Caligula" surely must hold this title. I'm not sure what is more horrendous; the violence, the sexual perverseness, the acting or the plot (or severe lack thereof).The two and a half hours basically follows the ascension of the infamous Roman Caesar "Caligula" to to throne in 37AD and shows the atrocities and perverseness he supposedly committed whilst in power. The acting is lifeless and dull - but that's just the tip of the iceberg.

The Toxic Avenger, hideously deformed creature of super-human size and strength is back in this sequel that gets mostly everything wrong. Toxie goes to Japan to find his father at the suggestion of his psychiatrist, whom is in cahoots with an evil corporation who just want the avenger gone to get a stranglehold on Tromaville in his absence. With new actors for Toxie and his girlfriend, who has a different name in this one, a much less grim, much more comical tone, and a plot line that can't hold a candle to the original.

Honestly , how hard can it be to make a good remake ? Obviously pretty hard ! I was soooo excited to see the original movie back in the 80s and had soooo many ideas for it, I think I had it down pat. I love how it is so simple. I also really liked how it was not like the 90s . I don't remember the music from the 80s , but now I'm pretty sure that music was the same and the movie wasn't like this ! I was very surprised by how good the remake is .

Franco films can be divided into 4 categories- the `` earlies '' ( often black and white and inventive ) are known as the classic style , the `` greats '' or `` modern '' is one of the films that came out in the last 100 years and is now considered by many as being the best and is a favorite of movie fans. The other 2 styles are the more stylized , such as The Bicycle Thief , or more stylized , such as The Wild Bunch . This year we had a few films that fit into the last type. The first of which is The Bicycle Thief .

I came across this movie back in the mid eighties as a teenager and it immediately became one of my favorite holiday and non-holiday films. As you can tell from the other reviews this movie has a very good story line and great actors signed on for it. Stanwyck is great as bride to be that is having second thoughts. Dennis Morgan's acting is strong also. He goes unnoticed in most films but was a very capable actor, check out KITTY FOYLE. In this film he plays the visiting sailor that woos Stanwyck away from her husband to be. This is a Christmas classic.

Down at the Movie Gallery, I saw a flick I just had to see. It looked like a fun low-budget horror/action/western that I could get into. Yeah, I knew it would suck, but I rented it anyway hoping for laughs. Only a few laughs were to be found. This was an extremely stupid movie. It begins with a bounty hunter, our protagonist, who is possibly the weakest main character in the history of film. He looks/acts like he could take on Chuck Norris, but he can't. His dialogue sucks too.

I cannot understand why this 1971 Hollywood production is currently only available through an Australian video company,but such is the unfortunate obscurity of this Peter Sellers classic(Leonard Maltin's Movie Guide continues to grant it the same BOMB review they gave it in the 1970's).With so many scene stealers on display,Sellers comes through with what may perhaps be his most hilarious role.It all begins with his discovery of a patient who expired at 11:15AM,but Sellers argues that the corpse is still living due to the fact that the new day doesn't start until noon!

The Toxic Avenger ... The idea of this movie is that a person that the common population would call this person has been elevated to a different level and it has affected his or her personality. It seems that the film would be about a person who has been changed by the treatment that they have gone through. So it's sort of like a movie about a person who has become what you call a mental patient or someone who has been treated in a mental institution or a person who is suffering from some mental illness and so forth.

Satya was excellent .... Company was just as good but more polished , probably owing to the money earned from their success. Thank you for making my life better ... You guys have given me so much support in my work. I really feel like I'm in a family. I just wanted to thank you for the opportunity to join your company.

Whilst this is most definitely a well crafted piece of film-making, it's thoroughly without any entertainment value whatsoever.If you're depressed already, this film will send you over the edge.If you're feeling somewhat depressed, this film will be just one more thing in your life to feel bitter about. You'll feel that it's just your luck to have chosen to watch a movie that turns out to be a complete waste of time.Otherwise you might be able to make it through this film unscathed (I didn't, BTW), safe in the knowledge that your life is so much better than Jim's.

To my eternal shame , I 've never seen a silent movie - not even the mother of all vampire movies! I never thought I'd see one where the audience was not screaming, as they were the first ones to jump on the screen! What made this movie so good was that each scene had such intense emotions and drama that it didn't feel rushed, and the audience knew when to laugh or scream! I really didn't expect to enjoy this movie, but this is what made me feel so good and thankful to see this movie!

I realize the line on my summary is not too polite.This film written & directed by Scott Caan & starring Giovanni Ribisi,Don Cheadle & himself runs a long 88 minutes.There is a dog in this puppy of a movie., he is cute.The movie opened in 2 U.S. theatres in late April 2007,for one week & grossed all of $ 914. A scientist ( George Zucco ) wants to create wolf men out of American soldiers to fight the Nazis , but his research goes wrong . When he finally discovers the truth , he learns that he must save his daughter and the lives of thousands of German soldiers in the name of science ( and his own survival ) , or it all goes up in smoke . The story follows George, a scientist working in Germany, who discovers a plot to kill the world's most famous scientists. He discovers that scientists are under attack, and an entire group is planning to murder his daughter and thousands of German soldiers.

Wow. What can I say? I was born in 1960. I love bad TV movies. Love them. I get involved. The works. I want to get involved. I'm spending time watching the thing. This movie could have had a lot of potential. Certainly with today's technology, one would expect real special effects. But movies are not made with special effects alone, of course acting is needed. This film lacked both!First, let me say to those who are upset with this not following the bible: why can't a movie take artistic license? Very good film . Very good documentary.Very good to see those vermin detectives humiliated and found out as the bigoted police do not take any justice in this case . This film gives a powerful testimony as to the true nature of India's Police. Very good and well worth the watch

It is an absolute disgrace that this film was not even screened in Tamil Nadu. All the people in Tamil Nadu and Kerala are outraged by this injustice! It is well written in Tamil with subtitles in Telugu and Hindi.

I really wanted to like this movie . Great cast  Walter Pidgeon in a role that reminds us of his work as Pee Wee Herman in The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, and James Earl Jones is pretty great too, though I have to say I don't feel he is as funny as I'd like. But what really got me was the special effects, especially the "Pee Wee" effects  a little too overdone. I do wish they would have come up with a new idea of what those effects could be done with.

This is the third movie in a month I have watched that did not go the way I expected. The first two being The Black Dahlia and Hollywoodland, neither of which gave any new ideas of who committed the crimes.I have always had a fascination with UFOs and was so excited to see a new movie on the subject of UFO investigation that was not a comedy. But after about 30 minutes, it all went horribly wrong.I could have stood for the acting, the camera angles, the stereotypes if only there was a good story about chasing UFOs, but none here.

This film is a nightmare ! The sensation you feel when you wake up from a nightmare is the same one you feel in real life. The moment you open your eyes is the same one that occurs after you go to sleep. When you see a horror film such as this , you don't know which horror you would like to be in . You would like to feel something more than just the horror , you'd like to find some kind of meaning behind it. Maybe the person in front of you doesn't want to die , because he feels he can't be saved.

A great performance by Emily Grace! I stumbled upon this movie while browsing my satellite listings and was curious by the summary of the plot giving by my satellite service provider. I was high entertained and had much compassion for the character "Alice" played by Emily Grace. The story had me guessing in what would happen to Alice and was not predicable. The overall story was refreshing and had some great twists to the supporting characters. The ending of the story ended on a rather fair way. I will purchase this DVD to add to my library.

I 'm sorry to see that it has been rated that low by many people . The series started off a lot better then . The first 2 seasons were really good . The second 2 seasons really were a downer . I have been a fan since I watched the first 2 seasons on Netflix. I really wanted to see more but it just wasn't on my radar . It was a nice change of pace . I was pleasantly surprised to see this series be rated higher . It seems to be getting some decent reviews . I don't have much information about the show .

The third entry in the "Stepford" franchise, but apparently the three made-for-TV obscure sequels are incredibly obscure and hard to trace down, whereas the 70's original as well as the blockbuster remake with Nicole Kidman are commonly known and very popular. I haven't seen either the early 80's "Revenge of the Stepford Wives" or the mid 90's "The Stepford Husbands", but this "The Stepford Children" is a quite charming and highly entertaining little film. It's basically the exact same film as the original; obviously less mysterious yet much cheesier and incredibly 80's to the nth degree.

Step Up is a fair dance film about some kids that get their big performance break. The film is average in every way with little more for the viewer. A jock fights external prejudices to become a dancer with an accomplished partner and a teach who sees something special. The acting was fine, but the dialog and directing had little to add to overcoming a predictable story. None the less you still feel quite good about the outcome of the film. There were some dark scenes and some typical generalizations about dancers that went a little overboard.

In order to pull off a job like this caper in Rififi ( e.g . The Score and its opines are available at: http://score.info ) and I am curious as to who has done this before and would be interested to share their methods of planning and setting up a successful rififi like caper in this fashion. I would also like to get your thoughts and opinions on what is needed to succeed as an individual or as part of an organization in this sort of situation. I am especially interested in who has succeeded in doing something similar and if there are lessons learned that can be shared.

I heard legends about this "film" (quotes used so as not to insult films) for a while, so when I finally got the DVD with it, I impatiently started watching it. By the end, I *had* to fast forward through just a few of the most moronic, ineptly made, nonsensical scenes of this pointless childish mess to make it end quicker.This may be the worst film I've even "touched" - and I used to be associated with Troma for a while. "Manson Family" makes the bottom of Troma's entries look like daring and groundbreaking art-house filmwork.

Well, after seeing "Beginning" I thought why the hell they burned Schraders Version and did that poor one. But now, after seeing "Dominion" I deeply understand this decision. Even they got it not much better.Sorry, but this movie is really crap. Some good moments, but a really boring story-telling and some major plot-holes are killing this movie.I thing the Exorcist-story has a lot and in a prequel on this you can built on a lot and give references the audience will like to see. But there is so much little of it in the movie.

A couple of clarifying comments are in order . Herschell Gordon Lewis contributed a brief introduction to the video release. I have edited the video release a bit so that some of his points could be attributed to me rather than just his words. The video is an overview of the study, and is not a full analysis, but it will give a basic outline of what the study was like to do, and why it was a success. It is very important to emphasize the study is not an endorsement for a religious viewpoint, it is a research project that attempts to investigate the issue from the scientific viewpoint.

First , what is really great about this movie : - Ryan Reynolds , great acting ! There are very very few actor that can give you such good performance as Ryan Reynolds and he can do that in this movie . He can also portray his character in a very cool way which can make your heart melt because you are very very fond of Reynolds character . If you have not seen him before , don't worry , you won't have to , this Ryan Reynolds was so handsome in that movie and his character in the movie was very charming .

I'm sorry, perhaps this is part of the wave of praise for fireman since 911, perhaps it's an old fashioned story, perhaps it's not meant to knock your socks off but I'm sorry, this film is awful. As in the title, cliché 49, I think it has at least that many clichés. It's a dreary story (impressive managing to be dreary when there's dangerous fires and lives being saved) about a fireman. And his dreary life, told in a pointless, 'scene from now' flashback to the past style.

Like the other comments says, this might be surprise to those who haven't seen the work of Jeunet & Caro or Emir Kusturica. But have you already seen Delicatessen, there is nothing new it this film. I thought Delicatessen was great when it came out, but this film just arrive too late to be of any interest. I don't think it's a worse film than Delicatessen but it's a bore to see it now, like it probably would be to watch Delicatessen again. There is really no point to the film, nothing that really matter or stays with you.

I read a lot of high hopes from readers of the book that this would be a faithful adaptation of the film, with the same characters and a few key differences; but the adaptation is completely different and, frankly, I’m disappointed in the lack of an original screenplay. There is an alternate version of “Odysseus” with a very different ending, and there’s no real reason to go with that one, so I’ll stick with “Odysseus.” But there’s no reason to rehash the plot of “The Odyssey,” either.

This Christmas gift arrived courtesy of TCM. We had never seen the film, even though we have seen most of the films of Barbara Stanwyck. This comedy made us laugh so much, that at times, we had to restrain ourselves, in order to hear the dialog.This is a movie that should be seen by people suffering from stressful situations, especially around Christmas. It would certainly lift one's spirits by just letting go. The movie would make a perfect gift in the form of a DVD, or a VHS tape.

Wow... I suspected this one to be bad... But now I find myself just at a loss for words... Honestly, no words of mine can do this movie any justice...I'll try to say something anyway...This truly is one unique gem. One of the worst kind.Lash La Rue - given his background as an actor - doing a whip-fight with a Toltec sorcerer-zombie during the movie's climax...??? A true stroke of genius, without a doubt.It rarely happens that I laugh out loud when watching a movie alone.

When the noble Hanabusa clan is decimated by the usurping Samanosuke clan, loyal retainer Kogenta (Jun Fujimaki) escapes with his lord's eight year old son, Tadafumi, and his daughter, Kozasa. They are sheltered by the priestess Shinobu (Otome Tsukimiya), who serves the Hanabusa clan's god, Majin, a vengeful spirit imprisoned in the giant stature carved into the side of a local mountain. Ten years later, Kogenta and Tadafumi (Yoshihiko Aoyama) seek vengeance against Lord Samanosuke (Yutaro Gomi), but are captured in the attempt, and sentenced to die.

My website ( www.theflickguy.org ) lists this pick as the worst movie of all time . Here is an excerpt of that article . In my opinion this is the most over the top ridiculous movie I’ve ever seen and, I repeat, the most over the top ridiculous movie I’ve seen. It is so stupid that I wonder if it would be even considered as one of the best movies of all time. The film has its moments, but it is simply impossible to comprehend the sheer stupidity that went into making such an awful movie.

I really do n't know why I 'm writting this . I think most people agree that this movie is terrible and people who have seen it agree on that as well . I have never seen this movie , so it would be great to hear any opinions on the same . I 've never read a book like this . I would have expected something much better , but I think there is something really wrong with what I have read . I love that this movie made such a huge impression . I have seen it several times and it is my favorite movie to have seen this year .

Given Christopher Nolan's string of successful films, it's a no brainer for me to want to check out his filmography watch his debut feature, which is shot in black and white back in England, running less than 70 minutes long, done with little budget, but containing all the hallmarks that has made him a master filmmaker and storyteller.Though short, the film is no less gripping with its meandering plot that will leave you guessing, because the premise doesn't even scratch the surface of this tale, which is pretty amazing considering the depth in the narrative's structure and characterization.

I recently saw Episodes 1-4, and now I can't wait for 5 & 6 to be available! (I've heard they are coming soon.) Commander's Log seems destined to become a cult hit among the university crowd and all others with a taste for quirky comedy. It's obvious that the budget was small, but the care taken in crafting the script is quite evident. In fact, the simplicity of the show allowed me appreciate the writing and the acting more. Bowlsby is a master of the put-down... I just wish I could remember all the best ones for later use on unsuspecting co-workers!

For a movie that gained so much recognition and appraise this spinoff to "Rosemarys Baby" is one big mistake. It starts off that Andrew/Adrian whatever his name is because he's so confused that he doesn't know who he is anymore runs away from a cult with his mother and soon is kidnapped by a strange lady that ends up taking care of him as if she were his mother. The acting is terrible as Andrew grows up in his twenties and looks terrible with his sunken in face, never ending grin and Dukes of Hazard clothes on looks more like a drunken has been than the son of Satan.

By far the most racist and ghettoish cartoon for children 7+ . Kids who watch this cartoon will most likely think that they are at the center of some terrible racist plot. What they're actually seeing are the stereotypes of black people used to justify slavery and the horrors of the Middle Ages. This is a cartoon that encourages and glorifies racism in young children. But, it's not just that, it's that it is being made by white cartoonists. This is an all out attempt to promote racist stereotypes about black and brown kids.

'Helen of Troy' follows the story of Helen and the outbreak of the Trojan War. This is more of a love story between Helen and Paris, who is shipwrecked and falls in love with Helen without knowing she is queen. The film portrays the couple as lovesick and wanting nothing more than to be together. (Other films and books have different portrayals of the characters, but in this one, they are simply hopelessly in love.) The film is pretty slow-moving in some places, but the battles and the detail to the scenery are done pretty well.

I watched this mini in the early eighties . Sam Waterson proved himself to be a great actor . In the early nineties the character became more of an enigma. There were a lot of movies made about him and he was used in a few of them . This movie was in a way different from the ones I've already shown. It was a bit shorter than the others and I liked the way the characters looked and the actors . This is a film for fans only and I don't recommend that anyone should try it .

Doe-eyed high school student Kathleen Beller is found beaten andraped in the opening scenes of this made for TV movie, “The First Deadly Sin,” and she’s just the girl we need for the sequel. “First Deadly Sin” finds Beller as a troubled high-school student whose first time getting laid ends badly.
