Her parents, who were in the habit of buying her pills to take them off her, finally realize that they’re about to see the truth about what happens to their daughter after she overdoses on her pills. So they decide to pay for the pills themselves.

I love Japanese movies -- having seen at least 100-200 . So it 's obvious I am not afraid of any Japanese movie that doesn't contain blood. That said I'm going to try and review a lot of those I love here. I will be reviewing a few Japanese movies where I feel they are superior to their English equivalents. For this I'm very biased and will be using my favorite films as I see them so that everyone can have their own opinions and enjoy them in Japanese. I think this is a great idea.

This amusing, sometimes poignant look at the Hollywood detective genre of the 1940's and 1950's stars Robert Sacci as an unnamed former cop who retires, uses his life savings to pay for plastic surgery to transform his image into that of his idol, Humphrey Bogart, then sets up shop as a private eye under the name "Sam Marlowe". Robert Sacchi, incidentally, is one of the rare few Bogart impersonators who got the lisp exactly right; more to the point, the body and facial language are there.

I must say I thought the show Greek would be really ridiculous and stupid . Since I am part of the family I can say that it was really funny, but as it is I could not take it seriously. As a fan I don't know how I would deal with them, but as an amateur, there is nothing better to watch on TV or on DVD than shows like these. I wish they would have shown more of the actual story line of the show. I was very disappointed that none of them could actually say a single sentence that I had not heard before.

This version of David Copperfield is dreadful from start to finish. I knew we were in for a wasted evening's viewing when a rather silly to the point of embarrassment Attenborough and Olivier camp it up as two baddies. It was all downhill after this. Aunt Betsy was adequate but had none of the eccentric flair she was noted for.The worst of the worst was the producer's choice for Uriah. This was the music hall version of this character, previously and admirably played by Roland Young. And what was all this self-absorbed Angst from David.

I found this film completely and utterly incomprehensible . I knew some of he facts about Caravagggio , but here the whole movie was just a mess. The story line is fantastic , but everything was just out of reach of comprehension . It's a real shame as this is a film that deserves to be remembered . I watched this movie twice and both times I didn't like it. It's a shame because this is an absolutely fantastic film. The characters and their interactions were awesome , the acting by the entire cast was wonderful , and the production values were amazing.

`` The death of a performer at a Broadway stage play brings a theatre critic and a police detective together to find out about a murder at the same time. Cast:

Michele Breckenridge as Detective Sgt. John Blake;

Gerald Freed as Dr. Charles Cramer. Plot:

John Blake is a young and naive police detective who comes to New York City and the theatre from a small town in Georgia. He has been called to the home of a man in a wheelchair for questioning. John is shocked when the man is killed at the same moment John arrives at the house.

As we are well aware , movies are not set out to be a direct incorporation of history , but they are often set out as a part of it. A film has a very specific, narrow view of history. If it is the story of a specific event it would be a very different experience for the audience. For this reason, films set out to relate historical events in a very particular way will often have very different films made to explain this specific event to the audiences of that film. I feel that this is an unfortunate side effect of film making.

I mean, nothing happens, 5 dumb kids go to Oklahoma to find a magical forest of marijuana... this could've been fun, if it hadn't been for the 5 worst actors in the world. And the dialogs weren't even half an inch of fun. The only thing that I almost showed my teeth of, was when the dumb cops stopped the teenagers in either Oklahoma or Kansas... The plot could have been fun, had it not been for abysmal interpretation. If you even think about watching this piece-of-crap movie, don't.

The Camals Are Coming is a rather disappointing British comedy from 1934. I purchased this because I like desert adventures and states on the box that it is a drama. It certainly isn't.It is about a couple who head for Egypt to capture some desert drug smugglers.This would have been much better if it had been done as a drama instead of a comedy, which lets it down a lot. It is quite silly in parts. Depsite this, there are some good action and location scenes.The cast is lead by Jack Hulbert with Anna Lee as the love interest.One viewing is enough for this movie.

`Rock star' is not on its way to any `stairway to heaven' category as one of the best rock films of all time, but it does make you `jump' from time to time because of its high-level energy. The film's theme is on a die-hard rock group fanatic who actually becomes the lead singer of his favorite band. The story is based upon the true story on what happened to the heavy metal band Judas Priest. If you think this movie is filled with a witty screenplay and intellect direction- then you got `another thing coming'.

Plodding, maybe that should have been the title. Bad dialogue delivered at a snail's pace. All the characters are single dimension with the exception of one. Unfortunately, that character has some of the worst lines and does not seem to fit into this cliché ridden two- hour drag. Having grown up in the seventies, this film is seriously lacking in detail, atmosphere and authenticity. Surprisingly, this was produced by Kelsey Grammar, someone who should recognize sharp dialogue and a consistent narrative in a script. Cameron Richardson is about the only element that lights up this film.

Yep . Those of my generation who grew up watching those old Sunbow cartoons were spoiled . The 80 's and 90's were some of my favorite decades of cartoon history . But as it turns out , The Sunbow 's not to be missed . This show was a blast . I've never been so nostalgic for a cartoon series . The Sunbow 's story line and characters made it even better . The animation and production value in this show was astounding . The fact that there were so many episodes to watch is what makes this show so much fun .

The mission to see the movie "The Cave" was a dream of a friend of mine after witnessing the highly dramatic trailer, full of flashes of a creature lurking in a cave, some young cave divers, and not much else. It's too bad that the movie didn't change much more than the trailer did.The immediate allure of a movie like this is the creature. What's he going to look like? Why does he live in a cave? How is this one supposed to be different from the other creatures we've been shown in movies like Alien and Predator and the Relic?

Ted Nicolaou made a lot of great horror and fantasy films. I am looking for all his films to see. I could not find this one for 3 year, until I unexpectedly found it in youtube. To tell the truth I wanted to see more ghosts and less talks here. It looks like in 1999-2001 Ted had a crisis , maybe in money. His features of this time look more like real low budget thrash z garbage movies. But I do not claim him to be a bad director this time . Everything happens.

This movie was sadly under-promoted but proved to be truly exceptional . Entering the theatre I knew nothing about the book. I read it for the movie. I was a little disappointed but I was surprised by how it turned out. I loved the story. It was a lot of mystery, and intrigue. It had a few twists but not a lot. The best twist in the film is when the killer is revealed. It's quite a shocking twist. I loved that too. I wish it would have been more twisty as the movie got to be more suspenseful.

It 's difficult to decide who or what is the target audience for this film . Jean-Pierre Limousin presumably had the most experience of all of the actors and directors . The film is about one of the most difficult things for a person to achieve in their own life . . . You have to know what it takes to get there , to do it , to achieve it. But there is no doubt that it is a very difficult thing . I found out about this film during the time I was working on the book, but I had no idea how difficult it was until I watched it on the big screen.

Do not see `` Mr . Magoo . '' It is one of the worst movies I have ever seen . I don't know how he did it but he did , I guess he wanted to make money . I have seen many good movies like that . But I never thought it was very interesting . If I am going to see a good movie I should go see it with a good person to talk about . If you go to a movie with a bunch of people talking about themselves , then you have a very dull movie . Mr. Magoo is a movie about a person .

You may be interested to know that BARRICADE was viewed as a failure by the studio and shelved for a long while. It has since been remade and is being re-released as a 3-in-1 package along with the re-release of STAR WARS EPIC 5 as a 3-in-1 collection. We've got it on YouTube. It's been around for quite a long time and there's a lot of nostalgia surrounding it. When you're watching the original release, you may have noticed that it was actually released back in 2004 and not 2003, which I find quite odd.

The TV announcer who introduced this late one Saturday night said it should have won Oscars. Quite a statement for a film I'd never heard of...though why I should have taken any notice of a TV announcer, I don't know. In the event, said announcer was talking tripe.It's a dreary, miserable movie that leaves a bad taste in the mouth. I couldn't get on with Hoskins' awful Burr-ming-gum accent. Can't see any advantage in it being set in the Midland's anyway. Unresolved threads abound...and I wouldn't normally mind this but half of them make no sense.

If good intentions made a film great, then this film might be one of the greatest films ever made. The film has great actors, a master director, a significant theme--at least a would-be significant theme, undertone of fifties existential world-weariness, aerial scenes that ought to have thrilled both senses and imagination, and characters about which one might deeply care. It is about patriotism and about patriotism in a healthy way.Not quite ten years after the film, I knew Air Force officers who taught my R.O.T.C. classes at university. They were intellectuals. They thought deeply about their work.

It could be easy to complain about the quality of this movie ( you do n't have to throw cartloads of adjectives around about how boring and bad it is, but it's really not that bad and I don't think you would be surprised by the fact that you don't see this movie every week). However, despite this, I would say that the movie is still worth it and that it is worth the price of admission. I think the acting is really good, the plot and characters really well written, the acting in the film is really good.

I recently got the movie and all I can say it is a good movie . There 's a lot in it. I like the writing style it has a good story and action. The director is good and the action is good. You can really tell they had good ideas for what they did. I don't know if they got it right. I think the acting was weak . I would give it a 4 star rating but I don't know if there is anything to be said about it. I hope that there is more out there though.

THE AFFAIR is a very bad TV movie from the 1970s starring the then-husband-wife team of Robert Wagner and Natalie Wood as hesitant lovers. She has polio and leads a reclusive existence as a pop song writer. He's an ambitious lawyer who is very outgoing and absolutely smitten with her. Their affair, such as it is, is doomed from the start, and she knows it, but goes along with it anyway. Two things to watch for if you are trapped into watching this: Wood's Jane Fonda hairdo that is never mussed, no matter what, and a tune she sings early in this dreadful flick.

The only good either of the Problem Child films caused was bringing together Amy Yasbeck and the late John Ritter as the two main stars and bringing in a bunch of newcomers to play a variety of supporting characters. The problem with the cast was they didn't fit together very well, especially when you consider how good the actors were, how they did their work and how well they performed it. They didn't have the right chemistry and the dialogue didn't flow well. The main reason I didn't like the film was that I felt it lacked any sort of emotional investment for what it was doing.

I have watched every version of this play that I can think of , including several on the stage , and can't understand why it is so controversial. What I would like to say is that, while I have seen every single version that I can think of, there have been at least two different sets of judges at every show I have seen. I was in the theatre that put together the first incarnation of the show (I think it was on a Saturday) and my seat had to be the last seat in the row behind the stage so I sat in the aisle.

I cant believe it ! I thought this is a good sequel when Jim carry in the film has a very good concept and I really liked this film, but I am a little dissapointed when this sequel is a complete mess. Jim should have never come out like this. But I guess they just had to make a sequel to the first film in the series because there was so much badness that had to be made for this. I'm just going to sit back and enjoy what they could have done. It's been a very long time since I saw this film.

I have to say this is better than most SyFy outings, but that isn't saying much.The plot is that someone buys a game that is made from the bones and skin of a dead witch from the Spanish Inquisition (and nobody ever expects the Spanish Inquisition!) He and his friends play the game, only to be interrupted halfway through when the friend who went on the beer run is killed in a way that the game predicted.What then follows are a series of kills that are typical for a movie like this, or any of the Final Destination movies.

This episode was boring and was not even in the realm of horror , so far this season Masters of Horror have not given me much horror , it seems the producers have put a lot of their time into the horror genre and that's why they should keep doing what they do, instead of creating new genres and new things to fill the void. This episode was a good idea, it brought back a good part of Masters of Horror with the story line, and it gave a good scare for the audience that was not in the room , that way I was not disappointed.

I loved the first movie , the second one was okay , disappointed John Cleese was n't jean bob anymore , and the last one - well, it was OK. I don't want to see the third one. But the last one I really liked. A lot. I enjoyed it a lot even though I think it was a bad one. I saw it with some friends about a week ago and was so disappointed by what I thought was a better movie. I saw it in 3D and it looked like crap.

Also titled--> The Magical Castle--> This one is a stretch. Why bother? Why create another rockbart and then add another story line that has nearly nothing to do with the play nor swan lake. Only some girlfriend of rockbart, the stolen book of forbidden arts and the original characters (not voices remain). Stripped to to its bares this is a continuation by a thread. Next thing you know some bird will have memorized the "forbidden arts" and Swan Princess 4: the magical bird will be born.

A satire about greed and money, what? There is more greed in the intentions behind this fiasco than in any of the themes they pathetically try to make fun of. Jim Carrey's reign was certainly short lived. He is an unbearable presence on the screen. The insincerity of his portrayal is nothing short of creepy. He produced this, this "masterpiece" as well, so he can't blame anyone here. "The number one comedy in America" shout the desperate TV adds. Of course, Jim Carrey was suppose to guarantee full houses but the game is over.

River 's edge is not a PLEASANT film to watch but it is an incredible one . Having viewed it on video this afternoon I'm going to say that the director is a great craftsman and in the same way a painter can be very good at colouring and colouring and making the viewer concentrate on his own vision as opposed to the image and the director has done this too, he has created a piece of visual art that is quite beautiful but at the same time in its own way, a work of art.

**Might contain spoilers**Ok, lets conclude this movie in one word: bad. Two words? Really bad. Now why do I think that? Let me explain. Guttenberg leads a special-ops team consisting of four persons that get assigned to retake an lethal virus after some arms-dealer stole it from a lab. They do this by attacking the arm-dealers in mid-flight and somehow gets back the virus after some fighting. However, suspicions arise about Guttenberg because one of the terrorist knew his name. After debriefing the team-members get attacked by unknown persons and everyone starts to suspect everyone else is involved.

Like a lot of the comments above me , also I though this was the average scifi movie , but it doesn't really have that. It's a bit more of a science fiction movie and a bit more like Star Trek in some way. So I thought why don't you watch this film? I don't know if it's the best or not, but it sure as heck has its moments and I would highly recommend it for anyone. It's very well made and I'd say this is a must see for sci fi fans.

Firstly, this is NOT an adaptation of a Stephen King book, short story, novella, or anything else. From EW's Web site, and their review on the show when it first aired, "...he never writes down to his audience, and he never betrays contempt for his subjects. His first original work for television, Stephen King's ''Golden Years'' (CBS, July 16, 9-11 p.m.), is no exception. "The series was apparently going to be (as others have mentioned) an ongoing series, which is why we never saw the ending after the cliffhanger they left us on.

Mind you , it 's not supposed to be , but it is . As a wee tot , I was given a teddy bear by my grandad , and he made it so small , but I still want to hold onto it forever , so here's one of my favourite images , I just love it : )

Thursday, 15 February 2013

This is just a couple of weeks ago that I started my journey back to school after having a break for almost 3 months . After that break , we had the whole Christmas holiday period to ourselves .

"Wagons East" is widely known as John Candy's last movie, as he died on the set. That's just what makes it so sad: not simply that Candy suffered a fatal heart attack, but that it was on the set of such a crummy movie. Seriously, I don't know what they were thinking when they came up with this piece of crap, but the flick has NO redeeming qualities. It's as if they took every unused script for stupid westerns and just mixed them together and filmed it.

A wonderful family movie & a beautiful horse movie. 75+ %entertainment. Casey, Buddy, Kelly Marsh are very interesting and lovable characters. The horses are real beauties.Has the horse racing as a backdrop for showing how luck is sometimes nothing but some good commonsense. Shows how kids can do stupid things for stupid reasons. Shows how adults can do stupid things for selfish reasons. The very realistically portrayed characters transform the unrealistic theme of the film into something everyone can relate to.Andrew Rubin puts in a wonderful performance as Buddy,the sensible elder brother.

`` Solomon and Sheba '' was the kind of film that you just had to go and see back in the old days. I think the audience has been kind of left behind by that but I think I think there's going to be a revival. A lot of people think they are going to be seeing a movie for a long time but, for me, this one is just so fresh and it's a great story. I think this film is going to get all of the accolades for the time it's being made, and it's very timely.

If you want to truly experience the magic (?) of Don Dohler, then check out "Alien Factor" or maybe "Fiend", but not this. Alien Factor is actually rather imaginative considering the low budget and it's fairly creepy, but "Nightbeast", which I guess is sort of an updating of Alien Factor, is just plain dumb. Actors sleepwalk through their roles, especially Mr. Monotone sheriff, and the monster is some dumb Halloween-mask kind of thing instead of the wildly imaginative (but kind of stupid) looking critters from Alien Factor.

The acting is awkward and creepy , and not in a good way ... at all . The writing , too . This was a movie that should have been rated higher and it failed miserably .. I don't think the film deserved the R rating either , it was a film that was just so poorly put together , the acting and directing was atrocious , and the script was full of the worst writing , and I just don't even want to think about what might be happening in the next 2 hours , it just wasn't up to the level to make this an enjoyable movie at all .

this movie was incredibly stupid with meaning what so ever . i fell bad for all the actors and actresses . ive heard it was a big bomb but i guess it was not. i would love to go back and watch the whole film again but i cant due to school. i cant even afford to go on a college tour . so . . . i guess im giving it a 3 . its a big bomb . ive never seen a movie like it . ive always hated movies and this film was so bad it made me hate movies .

As the title suggests there is a philosophical, meritocratic thread running through this film: if a man has the talent and looks to find his way into society and money what might be the outcome if he is denied it for failing to have the X factor? This question is unsatisfactorily dealt with in this adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's book and left me rather cold along the way.Matt Damon is the Ripley of the title and apart from blagging his way on a funded jaunt to Europe falls under the spell of his commissioned target, Dickie Greenleaf (Law).

It seems like an exciting prospect, a modern-dress "Othello" with Christopher Eccleston, who was so frighteningly good in "Shallow Grave" and (especially) "Jude," and Eamonn Walker, who brought such intensity and introspection to his pivotal role on "Oz." One would think them both natural Shakespeareans, but both performers misfire: Walker's Othello is a fairly cookie-cutter take on the part, with a whispery delivery that doesn't make much of an impact; and Eccleston hams it up appallingly as Iago, winking at the camera in almost an outrageous parody of the role.

I must admit that I didn't get around to seeing this movie in the theater. As it was released at the beginning of a summer blockbuster season, this cute little film couldn't help but get a bit lost in the shadow of multi-million dollar special effects movies, could it? "Return to Me" has a lovely and simple story at its core, and is extremely well-directed and written by Bonnie Hunt (who has been in a number of major pictures as an actress herself....along with this one!)

I saw this movie yesterday , and like most allrdy wrote `` i also expected a Steven movie '' , but this one isn't the worst film i ever saw. it's ok i suppose, not great, but still ok. and i mean that's just a very subjective opinion, so you can decide if i'm right or not. but this movie is ok atleast to me . i didn't see it the first time i saw it , but i've seen it a couple of times since then . i liked a lot , and i would not say i enjoyed the movie that much .

I just watched this yesterday and wanted to read other peoples scathing comments but found some high marks.WHAT ? ? Why ? What ? I do not see this as much of a "scandal" or a problem at all, especially if you are an employee who does not know the details of it and how it would affect her work or your career. It should be an eye opener to you. I think it's great if you work at a big company, but I also understand you are probably used to it.

Normally I don't bother wasting my time writing comments for junk like this that I forget almost as soon as I see it, but since I saw this movie just yesterday on one of the comcast Showtime channels (346, I think) I decided to make an exception.Besides the fact that I enjoyed watching Carol Alt, I can't give any rational reason why I watched this movie through to the end. I'm always amazed that good-looking women are willing to appear in awful movies like this, but I suppose she thought this movie would lead to something better.

This film is terrible - honestly. The acting is terrible, the script made me cringe, the effects are completely lousy (which I usually don't mind for older films, but this was made just two years ago), and everything about it just annoys me. A few friends go out on Halloween into the woods and meet a witch and her cannibal son. Of course, before that it has the cliché "You really believe that? Ha ha ha, it's just a story" routine dragged out for a while.

I was n't expecting much out of this movie and I was slapped in the face . Julie Walters , I don't know whether you saw my previous review on this film and I wasn't expecting to get much from it . I don't get why I got so much of a kickback from this film . I would recommend this movie to any film buffs . Even those who are into horror and I can say this I would recommend this to anyone . I would rate this a B . I thought I was going to get a C but it wasn't for nothing .

I had to watch this movie for a film class, I suffered the whole time through. I am not Asian but was still greatly offended by this film. The film's basis is racialism, overall minorities (Rex Harrison isn't even Asian!) are depicted in narrow-minded manner. The banning of the film in Thailand illustrates the degree inaccuracy and subjective portrayal of Asians. In addition, there has been critical attention given to Biography of Anna. Many critics argue that Anna added many fictitious events to her story to project herself in a good manner.

When you see Barry Corbin in the cast of a movie , you can never be sure if it will be because he is really good or because he's just Barry Corbin. The man has been cast in so many movies, that you can be sure that the person you're watching is the real Barry Corbin. And in this case, he is going to be the lead in the upcoming American comedy film called 'Snoop Dogg.' While the casting of his character, Barry Corbin, has been well-known, what is much less well-known is how Barry Corbin is going to use his abilities.

Van damme has done some great films over the years and this one hits a big ten in my books. It’s about a small town in Northern California that is run by an overzealous minister who has no interest in education. The town is just too rural and poor to have much of a future, so the pastor decides to set himself up as a modern day “Great American Dream” and start a school for poor kids. It starts small, but as the school starts to grow it becomes more and more ambitious.

Koyaanisquatsi is simply the best film I 've ever seen . It 's a masterpiece where everything is at the peak of its potential. The music is brilliant . It makes you forget that all of the plot and the characters are fictional . I 've said it before and I would say it again . If there is one film that made me want to watch it again , it was this movie . In a movie that I can watch over and over again without any problems , I recommend that everyone should go and see it . If you are a fan of movies .

While Disney have been THE animation studio for the past 70 years, there have always been rivals to their supremacy. When this review was written in 2009, for example, companies like Dreamworks and (to a lesser extent) Warner Brothers and Ardman, were bringing out animated movies that could be said to challenge the Disney dominance. Back in the beginning, in that late '30s and early '40s heyday when Disney was serving cinematic banquets like Snow White, Dumbo and Fantasia, the competition was provided by brothers Dave and Max Fleischer.

This movie made by the NFBC was made in honor of the Montreal Canadians dynasty years in the 50's,60's and 70's. My 5th grade teacher played this in class in honor of my 11th birthday in 1987 and also to celebrate my return from a serious facial injury in 1986. I have been a Canadians fan for 29 of my 30 years of life. on a scale of 1-10, I give this film a 117. All hockey fans should see this as I hope it will be placed in the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto and shown at the Bell Centre in Montreal or here in Edmonton at Rexall Place.

I only wish that I had the good sense to turn this movie off in the beginning when I knew it was terrible. Instead I gave it the benefit of the doubt and waited for it to get better. Don't make the same mistake I did. The title has nothing to do with the movie. The movie has nothing to do with the real world. The plot has nothing to do with a plot. The acting consists of a guy who wants to be John Cusack, but can't pull it off. The lead is a girl who tries to be Claire Daines.

`` Black Dragons '' is a second feature WWII propaganda film popular at the time . It 's not as good as the first, but still worth a watch. This was a very important movie in the early '30s propaganda movement and is an important part of the '40s propaganda movement . In this movie , there was a war going on . There was a great deal of fear for the Allies. This made them want to make sure that the Nazis would be defeated. They wanted this film made to keep the fear of war alive.

I really could n't get into this movie . The plot is some old woman has been torturing someone so she had to be sent to some place and she finds her way to the place and she starts torturing the person in the place until she gets to her destination . You know she gets out the place and she goes back in the person's life . and the person gets back in his life and then she gets out and goes to the person again and it goes on and this goes on and the person gets out and she goes back in the person and tortures the person even more .

This extraordinary pseudo-documentary, made in 1971, perfectly captures the zeitgeist of America today...which makes it all the more scary and relevant. "subversives" (college students, hippies, black activists, academics) are being rounded up by the government and given lengthy prison terms for what amount to thought crimes and social protest. As an alternative to life in prison, these convicted "criminals" are offered three days in "Punishment Park". Their objective inside the park is to make their way to the American flag where freedom awaits them. Not surprisingly, the Punishment Park option is a dirty lie.

I grew up in the 90s; therefore, you must understand that i witnessed firsthand the premiers of the greatest DCOMs. I was there when Brink! appeared, Zenon, Halloweentown, Johnny Tsunami, etc, These movies constitute my childhood. When these movies came on, not only myself but whoever I was watching them with would stand completely in awe for 1h30, talk about it for the week to come and catch it again the next weekend. I don't think words could express the amount of excitement Zoog Disney brought.

A buddy and I went to see this movie when it came out in 1980. It was playing in a huge theater and we were the only two people in the place. It lasted two days in the theater before they stopped showing it. It was so bad that we laughed all the way through it. Since that time, we rate movies based on Kill or Be Killed as the worst movie of all time. Like other reviewers have mentioned, it is so bad that it is funny. It isn't worth a second look that's for sure.

Greedy land baron in the tiny western town of Prairie City wants all the ranchers off their land , using the courts and threats of violence to make them leave. They don't know who he really is though, he claims to be a lawyer and they believe him. They've had a long history of feuds with a few ranchers, they're not happy and they don't know what they want. They think there's a war coming because of all that money they're earning on the ranch but they can't see how that will work out.

I'm sorry but I just honestly cannot see why anyone would actually like this. It's stereotypical and REAL homeschoolers are NOTHING like they were on this show!! Personally I'm glad it got canceled after the first few episodes. I mean, this kind of show would certainly be alright if everyone knew that homeschoolers weren't really like this, and the whole story was just for the show, but unfortunately not everyone is aware of this. If anyone out there that watched this actually believed this is what goes on in the life of a homeschooler, then I honestly feel sorry for them.

I watched this film with a sort of dangerous fascination, like a hedgehog trapped in the headlights. There is no doubt that (even if you enjoyed it) it's a bad movie, but the important question is why? It has a good cast; it's lively; it's prepared to tackle sex head on, with some of the characters actually getting some of it here and there, which is unusual for a British comedy. It also has Johnny Vegas and Mackenzie Crook, Marmite performers agreed but they've have had their moments in the past.What it's principally lacking is charm.

Jack Lemmon was one of our great actors . His performances in Days Of Wine And Roses , The Apartment , The Music Man and, of course, in the unforgettable and highly acclaimed The Dark Knight are all well-known and are worthy of recognition. What most of us don't know is that there was one more great part that he did for us. I was so interested in this one because of the fact that I had never seen the movie , and I needed to see it. Not only was the film brilliant , it was also very good , but the best of all was the performance of Lemmon.

Mishima is one of the greatest films ever made . Now I think Paul Schrader is the greatest screenwriter of the 20th century. Mishima is a true classic. I am going to be very frank with you here and I am asking all of you to be honest with me. We all like movies and we like to see movies that we like. But there are times that you have to see movies just to know what they are about and what the message is. We do like movies that have deep themes and meaning and that you can learn something about the characters from it.

Would it be too trite of me to create a review of just me saying the word `` STUPID '' into this post? Perhaps I could write something about the idea of STUPID -- that is, what it is, how it is defined, etc, but that wouldn't really be the point. The real point I want to get to is why I feel so strongly about the word STUPID. I see it everywhere. I feel that it is a word that I feel is being misused, that is, I do not fully understand why anyone would feel as I feel about the word.

Although Charlie Chaplin made some great short comedies in the late 1910 's , others do n't quite make it into my top three. For one reason or another , here is the list of Chaplin's comedies that were released during the late '90's, that I thought did not quite make it on my list. Some may have been funny , but I wanted them all to get a little bit of attention. Some of the films may be a bit too long for my list. So please do not be so hard upon me if I didn't include a Chaplin's comedy that I think deserves a spot.

If I were to pitch this movie idea to some Hollywood bigwigs , I 'm sure it would sound like a bad idea. The thing is , I am not worried about the marketing department. I am confident that if I pitch the movie concept , I 'm guaranteed a huge return on investment for the movie , I 'm pretty confident in my skills as a director , producer , and writer . And I 'm certain they would also love to get me to direct a movie. And they have heard of me . I can be very persuasive with them.

Disclaimer: During my ventures into foreign cinema, I have taken a liking to a wide variety of movies that span different genres that include horror, action, drama, comedy, and romance, to name a few. Thus, I have enjoyed the thoughtful, serious tone of dramas as well as the mindless, popcorn fun of action films. With a wide array of Chinese, Japanese, and Korean movies under my belt, I am confident in my ability to recognize bright spots in movies to appreciate and complement. Unfortunately, Ashes of Time has nothing to recognize.

First of all I hate those moronic rappers, who could'nt act if they had a gun pressed against their foreheads. All they do is curse and shoot each other and acting like cliché'e version of gangsters.The movie doesn't take more than five minutes to explain what is going on before we're already at the warehouse There is not a single sympathetic character in this movie, except for the homeless guy, who is also the only one with half a brain.Bill Paxton and William Sadler are both hill billies and Sadlers character is just as much a villain as the gangsters.

The Evil Below starts on 'The Straits of San Sebastian 1683' as the 17th century treasure ship the El Diablo sinks in a violent thunderstorm. Jump to 'The Straits of San Sebastian Present Day' where two divers are exploring the beautiful underwater coral reefs that are rich in wildlife, the come across the sunken wreck of the El Diablo & explore it but are attacked & killed by something that looks like a vicious eel. Captain Max Cash (Wayne Crawford) owns & runs a boat-for-hire named the 'Vagrant Viking' which caters for tourists who want to fish, dive & generally explore the islands.

Naturally Sadie is by far the worst show i have ever seen , it is such a piece of sh** and i do not believe that it has a plot , it really is so lame and i really dont like it . I would never watch another one , it is the worst thing i have ever seen , i will never buy another one and i have a feeling it will get cancelled i am really disappointed with it because i was expecting something better . I loved the show! But I would be very sad if it were to be cancelled.

One of quite a few cartoon Scooby Doo films, "Scooby Doo and the Loch Ness Monster" turns out to be entertaining, exciting, interesting, funny and also does a surprisingly good interpretation of the Highlands of Scotland. One annoying aspect of the film is the voices of many of the characters - American people trying to sound Scottish in this film are unfortunately not succeeding all that well (although some people do better Scottish accents than others).Daphne has come to the Highlands to see her cousin Shannon and the Highland games at Blake Castle.

This movie was terrible . It is not something that people should have to pay to see . It looks like a documentary which has just been done to make a buck . You do not want to see such a piece of work. Saw the trailer and didn't think it was that bad. But, I've watched a lot of these type of films, and I've never seen one that sucked so bad. If I saw that trailer again, I'd think it was an hour and a half too long to waste my time on.

I remember watching this mini-series the first time in 1984 with a growing sense of anger and indignation. Having read the comments on this title, I must agree with those from the people in Greece. This was produced to coincide with the 1984 Los Angeles Olympic Games and, to me, it seemed like nothing more than an exercise in jingoistic, flag-waving American nationalism in which the American athletes are glorified at everyone else's expense. Some other nationalities would have every right to feel deeply insulted at the way they were portrayed in this series.

This film, for what it was set out to be, succeeded. It's a short tragic film. Although my choice of film are ones that really develop characters and their relationships, this film is meant to just give a taste, leaving you with the "what happens next" factor. After watching it, I really was wanting more, more of the characters back story, what influences they had to make them into the people they were. I think thats what the makers intended the viewing audience to think. The acting is amazing.

...now please move on because that's getting on my nerves.Seriously, the man behind brilliant pieces like "My Own Private Idaho" and "To Die For" (and others not so brilliant movies, i.e. the unnecessary "Psycho" remake) started an experimental phase with "Gerry", which reached its peak with the thought-provoking "Elephant". "Last Days" had some interesting aspects but was very uneven, while "Paranoid Park", his new film, also has good-looking 15 year-olds walking around... and not much else.

I bought this film as I thought the cast was decent and I like Jennifer Rubin & Patsy Kensit.First off I am a fan of her films. She was a huge star for many years with her films like "Anchor" & "I'm Not There." After I started reading this book I realized there was something different about the plot of this movie. There was no love interest in this film at all. It was about a girl who gets involved in a man's secret life for him as an FBI agent. When I was reading about this I couldn't put it down.

This flick was the introduction for a lot of us to the works of K Gordon Murray. That's because it was easy to find. It was on every public domain label in the VHS era, and before that, a late night t.v. cult classic, double knee thigh slapper. Besides, HOW do you resist the title?For late comers, a brief explanation of it's merit: Florida wheeler dealer K. Gordon Murray imported Mexican horror films, dubbed them into English, then made a mint with them at the drive in.

I agree with the guy above, It is so funny I understand it all, but my friends just don't get it. Go to Japan and you will see a different movie after being there. When I met my girlfriends dad, at his home in Kanagawa. I swear I felt the same as Jack,. scared, but by the end of the day it was all good, so I give this movie a 10 out 10.I have watched it at least 30 times, taking it with me to watch on the plane flying to Japan next month.

Most of Chaplin 's most famous films are his full-length features . And , I assume most people have at least seen some of Chaplin's films . However , if you haven 't seen one of his feature films , you have likely not seen at all , and you might not be a Chaplin enthusiast . This is why I have compiled a list of ten Chaplin's films , so you can see some of his greatest film . 10. The Great Diversion
Chaplin 's first full-length feature . Released in September 1896 . The film was made to promote the then newly-launched Pan-America Express .

I have seen this movie 4 times in 5 months and i never get tired of it just because it is perfect. And it has also got the best film music ever and the best supporting roles ever written for a movie. I mean you just have to love Robert Duval , Marlon Brando , Martin Sheen and Lauerence Fishburne in this movie but specially Duval. I can not believe that Kramer vs. Kramer did win an Oscar in stead of this amazing war movie. So this is my conclusion if you take the director of the worlds greatest movie ( The Godfather ) and the best of Hollywood actors you can only succeed.

We all know what Chan-wook Park can do . If you have n't seen Oldboy ( or the sympathy trilogy , you are missing out ) you need to see the movie that is making waves in the box office . There is no other way to start a review on Chan-wook Park . So , without further ado , I am going to go and give it a go . And let me start with a statement that was made as the first movie was coming to theaters. For all those who watched the trailer , they should have a better understanding of what this movie was about .

I enjoyed the prequels , and found the relationship between Tucker and Chan previously hilarious . RH3 , however , wasn't all that much better . Tucker and Chan have been playing each other since Season 1 , and are a bit of a team, but they seem to be on a different page than in other episodes. This is because their relationship in the first season was such that they weren't allowed to have any conversations without Chan's permission. This means that the only thing they can have to talk about is their own relationship.

This movie , I would like to say , was completely great . I can see how many people would disagree with me because I can see that it is one of those movies where you really can tell if someone is enjoying it. The story follows a young boy who discovers that his family are in the possession of an evil spirit that is after their wealth and they are all going to die unless he can destroy it. But then his parents come to his rescue and you know there is going to be an ending to it but you don't care.

This movie was , of the 67 of 71 best pictures I have seen , by far the worst . If you don't have an interest in the movie , I don't blame you , because from the beginning to end it is a shoddy work of fiction . If it had been any good , it would have been more memorable and entertaining . This is the worst film that has ever existed . This is the most depressing I can remember . This is also the most pathetic that I've ever seen . Every scene is painful to watch , and I feel like a coward watching it .

The Detonator is set in Bucharest where some sort of ex CIA Government agent named Sonni Griffith (Wesley Snipes) has tracked down a arms dealer named Dimitru (Matthew Leitch), things go wrong though & Dimitru finds out that Sonni is working for the US Government. After a big shoot-out most of Dimitru's men have been killed by Sonni which the local Romanian police force are unhappy about, top man Flint (Michael Brandon) decides to send Sonni back to the US & at the same time protect a woman named Nadia Cominski (Silvia Colloca) who is also being sent back to the US.

A comedy that spoofs the inspirational sports movies , The Comebacks tells the story of an out-of-luck coach , Lambeau , who makes it to the pinnacle of the pro football world . The film is not a sequel to the film , No Way Out , which tells the story of an out-of-luck coach and his coaching career . This movie , however , is similar in many ways . In fact , much of the film consists of re-directings and re-tunes of music used in the earlier film . At the start of this movie , Lambeau , an overweight African-American coach , has become the coach of the Chicago Bears .

I 'm trying to understand what people liked about MirrorMask . I am an avid film viewer and hobbyist film fan. I'm not sure what you would call me for, but I'm certainly not a 'film snob' like many people would think I am. I enjoy a wide variety of movies. I think most of the people who read these forums probably have no idea what MirrorMask was and why it is one of the most widely used filters ever created. There are a few things that I like about it. It is so easy to use, there are so many ways to customize it.

This was a modern TV classic! The story goes like this, Bob has a girlfriend named Alicia. Bob and Alicia are in love and want to get married. Bob has a bud named Owen who he works with. Owen is jealous of Alicia. He likes hanging around with Bob. Now Owen hangs around with Bob AND Alicia. Bob and Owen have a secretary named Heather. Heather is very accident prone. She is also, if you haven't guessed it, is kind of lonely. She too hangs around with Bob and Alicia, and Owen.

Well , that was sure a waste of Dave McKean 's talents , was n't it ? Do n't get me wrong, I 'd still like to have a go with him , but that 's all ! I 'm just not going to get into trouble over it . It 's just not possible , not in my view . I 'm only going to be around here for as long as McKean 's going to stay around . I 'm not going to change my opinion . As I say , I 'm just not interested .

I watched this cooking show for a few times before I wanted to pull my hair out. Just one question.....Who CAN'T cook a slapped together plain meal in 30 minutes when everything you need is at hand, already bagged, sometimes pre-chopped and you have very little else to do except chop a few greens. Also, almost every cooking show on TV is 30 minutes and most of these chefs do all of their prep work (except for Sandra Lee), during their show. Oh and yep....they do full meals too.Love the comment by the guy who hated the "EVOO" comment.

For those viewers who thought the 1979 film "Alien" the first to depict a male Earthling being impregnated by a malevolent extraterrestrial, "Night of the Blood Beast," made 21 years earlier, may come as something of a surprise. In this film, America's first man in space crashlands back on Earth and, after examination, is thought to be dead. He later comes to again, only with a half dozen or so alien seahorse thingies growing in his abdomen. The mama (?) alien also pops up to terrify the small band of scientists who are observing our gravid hero, and she (?)

That's a weird, weird movie and doesn't deserve a better mark than David Lynch's one! The special effects are badly made, the actors are majorly bad actors and in this movie it's not about a race which is the minority of a planet and tries to fight against the dominators, but it seems to be a crazy movie, which pays homage to sect kind of organisations. That's surely not the will of Frank Herbert, the author of the six part epic! Check out David Lynch's one, that's the perfect tribute to the novels!

Barbara Payton is the suppose-to-be sultry sexy young hot Chickie wife of the geezer plantation owner somewhere in a jungley. She does not have a nice body. She has an amazing figure, but does not have any great figure to speak of. She also does not have good posture and has not been given any good make-up since she was a pre-pubescent child. She would like to be the next Cindy Crawford, but that is probably impossible since she will never be like Cindy Crawford, and the reason why Cindy Crawford could never be the next Cindy Crawford is because it’s just not going to happen.

All the criticisms of this movie are quite valid! It is pretty boring, and filled with all kinds of pointless ridiculous stuff. A couple exchanging nods over their "good grub." A medium shot of a desk as a phone rings until someone finally comes, sits down, and answers it at a pretty leisurely pace. Quadruple-takes or more when people look at things. Solitary banjo-tuning and playing, taking a break for a beer. Telling a joke to a fawn, about a big-mouthed frog trying to learn what to feed its babies, complete with many big-mouthed expressions (which are needed for the weak punchline).

New rule. Nobody is allowed to make any more Zombie movies unless they actually come up with an original idea.Sadly, this movie doesn't. They have the premise that Bounty hunters go out and kill Zombies and prove it by cutting off their fingers. Well, problems with that. Most people have ten fingers, why not just collect ten bounties for one Zombie? Why not just kill a regular person and pass that off as a Zombie finger? Not to mention the utter silliness of hunting zombies with a bolt action rifle.I sometimes think films like this are resume fillers for makeup and FX guys.

Most of other reactions by subscribers to this service were very apt, although that some found it slow or ambiguous puzzled me. Rather than ambiguous, it was complex and multi-layered in its meanings. One can see it as anti-war, because of the opening and closing scenes, and the folly of pretended grandeur, as how wonderful the cavalry men looked as they prepared for the great charge at Eylau, contrasted with its so horrible and disturbing conclusion, when we see the bloody uniforms, the boyish dead, etc--but chiefly, I see the film as about a moral man in an immoral society.

I caught this movie late night on TV , and was expecting a low-budget campy `` masterpiece '' , I was surprised by the high production values , I could not take my eyes off the actors , and the actors in particular . The entire film is shot in slow motion , but it works well , and keeps the story moving . One scene that stuck out the most to me was the opening credits of the film . I was wondering about how it would actually work in a movie theater , when my wife was complaining about how the film was slow .

This film basically try to portray the heroism of firefighters by making the whole movie revolve around a American dad with a good heart that puts others before himself. Now I know they try to show Jack Morrison(Joaquin Phoenix) as a typical American father that is a firefighter but like there is just nothing interesting in about him what so ever, thus when the movie gets to the climax there is just little to no emotion. This movie basically tries to make the life of a firefighter exciting but it just comes off as boring as any other jobs except you save lives or property by extinguishing the fire.

This is marvelous movie , about a soul of Ale . This is a journey to Ale 's heart . This film is not about me, Ale , but a journey of soul , of spirit . It is very well-made film , with a wonderful soundtrack , this film is definitely worth the watch . It is a great film , well worth the watch and you should watch , it is worth watching . This film will give you a great journey , it will give you a feeling of Ale 's soul , and it will give you that feeling of soul , soul that Ale gives .

Krajobraz po bitwie like many films of Wajda is, perhaps, not understandable for the "rest of the world". Story based on the few short stories of Tadeusz Borowski, who during WWII was the prisoner of Oswiecim, Dachau and Dautmergen camps. Borowski in his books describes inhuman life in the Nazi camps from the point of view vorarbeiter Tadek - porte parole of author who also was on the privileged position among the prisoners. Borowski was merciless for the humanity and merciless for himself. He describes the human history as the endless chain of exploitation and humiliation.

This is a pretty obscure , dumb horror movie set in the 1970s Everglades . It is really stupid and not well written , but it’s got a nice twist at the end. And I’m proud to see a film like this making its debut. The story is about a family in the Everglades of Florida who, after moving from a very rural area, decide to venture up the Everglades by boat, with the intent of making a fresh start. As they arrive, they find an abandoned building which, despite its decrepit state, seems to be well run.

I absolutely adored this movie. For me, the best reason to see it is how stark a contrast it is from legal dramas like "Boston Legal" or "Ally McBeal" or even "LA Law." This is REALITY. The law is not BS, won in some closing argument or through some ridiculous defense you pull out of your butt, like the "Chewbacca defense" on South Park.) This is a real travesty of justice, the legal system gone horribly wrong, and the work by GOOD lawyers - not the shyster stereotype, who use all of their skills to right it.

When Jan Svankmajer lets his imagination run wild , get ready . You 're in for dark , harrowing films. The kind that leave you with no choice but to see where the story ends up going. This ain't that kind of movie, of course. It may be the kind of movie that will keep your attention until the credits roll . And then you may want to see it again before it ends . . . but that's another thing. There's a very good chance you don't really want to see this movie again after the credits .

Big spoiler right here : this film is B ! A ! D ! But enjoy , it 's good , and that's all! The film was directed by the legendary George Lucas and stars Mark Hamill and Harrison Ford. After seeing the trailer, I wanted to know more, which I learned pretty much from the credits, including some info that was not directly stated. The movie is about two brothers who are stuck in a time machine and must stop the evil Emperor and his forces from destroying the Earth. It also stars Carrie Fisher in her last movie.

I received this movie as a birthday gift because all of my friends know I'm a big fan of low budget Horror flicks. Kaufman Studios have always made the cheesy gory flicks that delivered. I loved to watch their films at home on rainy nights with my family...until I saw Bugged...WHAT HAPPENED?This Movie started out with a pretty good concept about mutating bugs and even added some slick comedy but overall the writing is just bad and that was mistake number one. Ronald K. Armstrong should learn to first be a better writer before becoming a filmmaker.

at the story. It is reality mixed with Americana- and very original.Emily Grace is a young girl tired of her boring life working at a minimum wage job, in New England. Her sleazy boss propositions her- she quits and takes a little bit of cash from the register. Driving from New Hampshire to Miami, Florida, is not a short trip, and her Ford Escort dies out. She then meets a personable older couple, portrayed by Judith Ivey and Bill Raymond. They have an RV and graciously offer to help her out- it isn't safe for a girl to be alone on the road.

This is the worst exercise in middle class pretentiousness yet to hit our television screens . I unfortunately did not make it in time for the first episode of last week’s ‘Crisis in Needlespace’, but I’ll be watching the series in a couple weeks, and will have a chance to talk to the writer and executive producer of this ‘reality television’ series about it when it comes back on our screens. If you were a member of the media during these past several weeks, did it ever occur to you that you have been used by people to try and push your own agenda?

Gorgeous Annie Belle in her prime stars in this adventure/sex movie. She wears her hair in a buzz cut that is bleached platinum. She and her boyfriend are visiting some tropical Asian paradise. They have decided to keep an "open" sexual relationship, which is played out on their journey to find a secret society/tribe where the people live one year and then are reborn in some kind of ceremony. The scenery is gorgeous, deep vast green gorges and jungles are explored. The imagery is very similar to that of the movie "Black Emanuelle". It is rich and colorful.

The writers missed so many opportunities and created so many plot holes.Example : When Dave retrieved his keyboard from the car after leaving the station, why didn't he use his new keyboard and not the keyboard from the previous episode? When Dave was looking for something in a book, why didn't he look under the table? I love how they made that part in the second part so damn hard to understand. It is literally impossible not to understand the whole scene with the keys in the air. Oh, I know. I was going for that.

If you and your friends find as much humor and enjoyment from horrible acting, jokes, props, and overall film making as me and my friends, you need to rent this.From simply reading the tag line and seeing how not funny it is, you should assume more not funny, poor quality, great, hilarious content through out. Its a tale of some of kids who defy every law of physics and reality and fly back in time through a modern day big screen TV to a world of dinosaurs who eventually become their friends.

I was unsure what to expect from "driving lessons"- unsure whether Rupert Grint could carry such a role, but within the first few minutes I was completely hooked. All the way through, the music, acting and scenery were absolutely stunning. Julie Walters, as always, gave a superb performance as the eccentric old actress Evie, and Rupert Grint, equally as good,gave a fantastic performance as the romantic Ben.Right from the beginning, I was forced into involuntary cringes, bursts of laughter and swellings of joy as Ben broke free from his controlling mother and fought for his friendship with his only friend, Evie.

This is precious. Everything Is Illuminated is sweetly and sublimely funny from the first delicious line of dialogue. Oh, how I've been waiting for this to arrive in Austin. While Elijah Wood is charming as ever as Jonathan Safran Foer (the real-life author of the novel Everything Is Illuminated), it's Eugene Hutz (playing Jonathan's Ukrainian tour-guide and translator, Alex) who truly steals this film. Alex is a hip-hop-lovin' Ukrainian break-dancer who, along with his grandfather, helps Jonathan find the woman who saved Jonathan's grandfather's life during World War II.

Being a gay man who lived through the time period examined in this tedious documentary, I was eager to see how the subject matter was handled. Unfortunately, the film makers wasted what could have been an energetic and insightful opportunity to shed some light on our collective gay history. This film only concerns itself with the period within New York City, ignoring the rest of the country. While I spent a fair amount of time in NYC at that time, I can assure you that there was a gay life outside Manhattan!

Hard to believe - but it is! I shouldn't be surprised. Commercials try to show how unique and "funny" a show can be. Yet not only didn't the commercials announcing this new show have the slightest iota of humor to me, I've not spoken with anyone who found the commercials amusing, either.I don't recall ever seeing a pilot so devoid of cleverness, cuteness or humor. The characters were insufferable for the most part. Especially Selma Blair's (which is astonishing she would agree to be in a fecal sample of a show like this).

this is one of my favorite movies ever! along with casablanca and cannibal holocaust, this is near perfect cinema. rex allen narrates this wonderful tale of a cougar who just needs a little loving. contains action, adventure, suspense, comedy, and riverbed chaos! SEE THIS MOVIE IF YOU HAVE TO KILL TO DO IT!!! you will not find a better cat picture anywhere, with "cat from outer space" coming in as a not so close second. charlie's performance is magnificent. even includes animal cruelty and intense logging! gotta love disney, for all moral failures!

Your ability to enjoy The Ashes of Time may depend on our expectations before stepping into the theater . Even if you are a fan who has never seen it before, the way it was delivered by the British actors and the cinematography can still give you chills , if only because there is no way of knowing how the story unfolds before we see the credits roll . The way it was told, with the British actors playing their part, makes it feel very intimate , as if the audience were being invited , rather than being allowed to go and get their tickets and watch the game with them .

This was a great movie for being only 67 minutes long . There was an aspect of film-noir contained in the film as well as a dark humor in some scenes . The cinematography and sound effects were also great . And I really enjoyed the story of a young boy who comes back into his family from the past . The story was not overly sentimental . I thought it told the right things about the human condition . It would probably be a good movie for any age, but the young viewer may want to have some extra time to appreciate the story that was presented.

If good intentions made a film great , then this film might be one of the greatest films ever made. This movie is really good. But that's all I can say. This is a true gem of an adventure/adventurer/adventureteller. The story starts off in the late 1800's, when a bunch of men and women from all over America and Europe, are trying to leave their old lives and lives of comfort. They travel the country to see what they want, go to different cities, and do what they want.

Awful in a whole new way, ANYTHING BUT LOVE probably should be seen by movie buffs--if only as a cautionary measure that proves all that can go wrong with a "vanity" production. I am guessing a vanity production, since there is no other reason on god's green earth to cast as talent-free and not particularly attractive non-singer/actress as Isabel Gold in the leading lady role--vied for yet by the likes of "lookers" like Cameron Bancroft and Andrew McCarthy--except that she also helped write this bizarre little movie.

Just as a reminder to anyone just now reading the comments on this excellent BBC mini-series , published in 1981 by Granada Television, which was made for the ITV network, I have posted a link to the full text of the book at the bottom of my post. It contains a number of short essays by different writers of the time, including a number by my former teacher, Michael Gove, which give a glimpse into how television was viewed then, and how that viewing experience was very much influenced by contemporary attitudes to sex and sexuality.

How many movies are there that you can think of when you see a movie like this? I can't count them but it sure seemed like the movie makers were trying to give me a hint. I was reminded so often of other movies, it became a big distraction. One of the borrowed memorable lines came from a movie from 2003 - Day After Tomorrow. One line by itself, is not so bad but this movie borrows so much from so many movies it becomes a bad risk.BUT...See The Movie! Despite its downfalls there is enough to make it interesting and maybe make it appear clever.

`` Chupacabra Terror '' is saved from a ' 1 '' by the presence of Canadian cutie Chelan Simmons as she takes her first steps out into the world... This week on the show we're going to get to all the juicy stuff we haven't talked about yet. You'll also hear all the big stuff that has been on the radar for awhile now. We'll tell you about this one, this one, and this one. Then we'll talk about all the other great stuff that has been coming out lately that you may not have heard of yet.

A potentially good idea gets completely let down by a weak script which throws all credibility out the window leaving the actors very little to work with. Roth covers it up as best he can by being all mouth; Hurt has about as much menace as a fluffy bunny and Stamp can't seem to decide whether he's playing an ex-London crook or some toff straight off the playing fields at Eton. As for poor Laura del Sol she does what she can but her character is no more than every northern European's idea of the stereotypical Latino woman who's all pouts and hot temperament.

the movie is complete disaster. i don't know who write scripts for movies like this one, but i would definitely love to meet one of them and talk to him a little bit. perhaps script writers really don't know sh*t about situation in foreign countries in present or recent past? or they just don't give a damn and write everything that they think it's interesting.a great and everlasting formula with mad dictator + 1 lonely hero (an American of course) might seem like a good idea, but come on?!

This is a strong recommendation to anyone who reads this review who has never seen the film Total Reality, don't waste your time and money renting this poor excuse for a film. This is, without peer, the single worst movie that I have ever seen in my life. I had nightmares of this movie ever since I saw it. The acting was terrible, and any amateur film maker could make a more decent film. The film blatently rips off far superior sci-fi films, such as TimeCop or Total Recall (where the title seems to have been derived from).
