The final part of Kieslowski's trilogy based on the colors of the French flag finds the director at peace with the metaphysical and transcendent nature of the cinematic image. In Red, imagery is paramount, as well as the obvious but clever color coding. However, rather than adhering to empty aesthetic contrivances based on the 'cinema du look', Kieslowski's Red is a multi-layered, densely plotted meditation on the nature of fate and love. In Red, love and fate are intertwined but complex notions, dictated as much by the whims of human beings as the invisible parallel associations that seems to pass us by.

We've all seen bad movies, well this one takes the cake. I've seen that Junior movie box staring back at many times from my many journeys to the horror section at the local video store, and I was a little interested, it looks like it pays some homage to Texas Chainsaw Massacre, so I thought I'd get it. Mistake! Junior sucks hard, long, and with commitment. In other words it's really bad. Although it does win my award for most creative use of a bikini top. AVOID! !

I really liked the Far Cry game , nice graphics , good level-design , interesting and clever enemies , above-average voice acting. I also enjoyed the story, some parts of the game will stick out to you, but all of the story will make it worthwhile, and it's quite fun to learn the side plot, as it is not too repetitive. There were a few times when the characters could be a little overdramatic, but nothing that would distract me from what was happening, and that's what makes this story so interesting.

This movie was beyond awful , it was a pimple on the a * s of the movie industry . The only reason why this movie even made it to theaters was because of how badly the studio wanted to kill it. The film’s marketing was just horrendous . This is a “must see” movie but I have to say , it’s not that great of a film . The film is not good for anyone and I am sure there is a lot of stuff in it that would make it better . But all the trailers are just so bad .

The first time I saw this film I was a kid . I was ten years old when it was released, in a sense. It wasn’t until the 1980s that I had seen a wide range of films in a single sitting. There were many great films at the time but what was most impressive to me was that they all arrived in a single night! I was so impressed with this film, I decided at the age of eleven that I was going to see it again and again. This time, I would also see it on DVD.

Wow, I was really disappointed. I wasn't really planning on seeing this movie in the theater, and I wish I stuck to that plan. It really should be a made-for-tv movie. I was kind of excited to see it, as I'm a big fan of Fairuza Balk, but this movie didn't do her justice. Infact I'm a little disappointed with the acting all around. I have watch this movie almost every night that is was on HBO. It is of my opinion that it could have been successful in the theater, providing the advertisement leading up to it was top scale. I was thoroughly impressed with the actress who played Nanny. She is an outstanding actress. Of course, my favorite actor is Terrance Howard. He is a very understated actor and he deserves much more credit than he has received. Ebony magazine did do a nice article on him, giving him some of his due propers.

In the European TV industry , movies like this one are called `` stickers '' . TV stations buy them and put them in front of their audiences in a very special way . This story is really quite strange ! It's true that many TV shows and movies are made for the fans and they don't give any money for this : it's all done by people like you or me . But, they know that this is a really unique way to reach audiences. They also know that with the new digital TV , there are thousands of movies available for this very reason .

Oh f * cking hell , where should I start ... First of all ; this show is just another show that they do on the cheap. Chop Shop . Written and directed by Ramin Bahrani ( Man Push Cart ) . Bahrani specializes in character driven movies with a large ensemble cast that features a number of Oscar nominees , Academy Award nominees , Tony nominee , Golden Globe nominee . Based on the book of the same name by the author himself . Chop Shop is Bahrani's first film, but he is a writer first and foremost . This is the first film I've watched in many years where there were no credits , and most of the time you wouldn't know there is an actor who is playing a part .

My yardstick for measuring a movie 's watch-ability is if I get squirmy . If I start shifting positions and wiggling my hips or if I feel as if something's going to shift, I may not want to sit for the movie. I'll tell you this, I don't really like horror movies, even though I understand why people do like horror films. I'm just not into them. If I see one that I like I'm going to sit down and watch it, I'll be ok, but I won't be into it.

This film was utterly horrible. Stupid premise, and horrible acting by all. Whoever wrote this trash should be hanged. Reminds me of a hack student film, BUT WORSE. Who ever produced this should give up now. I know opinions are subjective and all, and some may think this "fantastic" as some think "Dune (1984)" was fantastic, well get off your horse and watch some real films. OK, the acting was tolerable, and with better direction could have been far better, but it didn't so it suffers.

Brett Piper again makes a very good film that is trashed by the so called film "experts." it is low budget, but fun, and the leading lady is very sexy. I wish i could see more of Irene Joseph. I always enjoy Brett Piper movies, and if you liked this I recommend Bite Me, Screaming Dead and anything else he has done.

CAUTION SPOILER: At the end of the movie it is announced that the bridge collapsed just a few days after it was captured. The impression is that the attack was all for nothing. In reality, taking the bridge at Remagen was the last important victory for the Western Allies. It was the crossing of the Rhine that the Allies had been trying to achieve for six months. Because the Remagen Bridge was taken, the war ended in just a few weeks.The bridge only need to last for a day after it was captured.

Swoon focuses on Leopold and Loeb 's homosexual relationship - a facet of the case that has been mostly (though not completely) ignored by media outlets. After the trial - in which the defendants were cleared of any wrongdoing - Leopold and Loeb appeared on CNN and other major networks. There was a lot of focus on their sex life, and the case seemed to be falling apart because of it. On CNN's Reliable Sources, host Don Lemon asked Leopold if he would still have the relationship with Loeb if he wasn't a pedophile.

The film Soultaker is essentially an older form Final Destination in which several car wrecked teens have their souls separated from their bodies as they try to reunite with their bodies in order to escape their final destination. This film seems to be a continuation of The Final Destination franchise in a way, so it’s worth keeping an eye on to see who gets to return to their body in the sequel. This movie looks like it could be really good, especially if they keep the same story in the sequels, which is always a good idea. What do you guys think?

Harmony Korine. I'm not sure what he was trying to do with this film. If it was to turn my good day feeling into a night of disturbing memories than I guess he succeeded.I know that there were big questions raised in this movie like, who are we really, what are we here for, is there really a God. All great questions, But I really don't think that is funny when you have the questions along side such tragedy. I'm all for real life being portrayed but come on.

First i got ta say that this film is way less pretentious than The Da Vinci Code . sure , there are a ton of similarities , but it is a well-written movie and it's not all that easy to read, and you'll be glad when you're finished because you feel like a new person . Â it is definitely more fun to watch than its source material . I'm going to begin by saying that I don't love this film and I don't know why . Â I watched it twice and was disappointed at parts .

Now for sure , this is one of the lightest-hearted stories that Bruce Willis has been in to date and this is just another step in his evolution as a character, a role that is sure to impress the fans and it has already begun with his latest movie "The Mechanic" that is slated for an August release. Bruce Willis as The Mechanic in the film which stars Joanna Lumley

In this story , The Mechanic , the character of the same name is set in London in the 1980's and while working at a garage, he is brutally murdered after being beaten up by his friends.

There were many 'spooky' westerns made in the 30s and early 40s, and although this has a strong beginning, it isn't one. Randy Bowers (John Wayne) stopping at a 'Halfway House' saloon, finds it to be full of dead bodies, the bartender's corpse draped over the bar holding a gun, eyes watching Randy from behind holes cut through eyes in a picture, and a player piano playing "The Loveliest Night of the Year." It was the result of a robbery by the Marvin Black gang, to get Ed Rogers' $30,000.

Ok, everybody agreed on what was the best season. The first. And killing off Boone was a bad desicion. Also killing off others was bad. Blame the directors and writers for it. Bad boys. BUT. I still think this is the best scifi series ever! Sorry guys I can't help it! I see that the quality of the series was decreasing after the first season. Still it's easy to accept Liam as the new main character, if you are over Boone. He is really... mysterious.

There is a point in the film where the female boss of the `` death machines '' ( a multi-ethnic group of terrorists) goes into a rage over how much her brother-in-law is taking out of the country. In the context of the movie, and the context of these terrorist groups, these people are just out to terrorize the whole world. I have to say it's very funny and funny in that context. The guy who runs an oil refinery in Yemen gets shot and killed by terrorists. The guys who do the bombings, or the ones who blow up other buildings, are terrorists.

Peter Strauss, by nature of appearing in mini-series and made-for-TV films, often gets an unfairly high proportion of bad reviews - Usually from casual observers who saw ten minutes of the film, having channel-hopped into it half-way through. Well, I've just read all the other 20 reviews for this film and am delighted to see not a single bad word said about The Jericho Mile - That should be enough to have you blasting out to buy this film! !Peter Strauss won an Emmy for his role in this film and watching it even once will show you why he deserved it so much....

This film SUCKS ! ! It looks like they just chose to place scenes together at random . Good gore but just like most of the flicks the gore is all over the place and it's like the director is trying to tell a story instead of giving the audience the story to read . It's also hard to read, it takes some time to figure out what is going on because it's in English but the dialogue is also in English. It would be better to have subtitles for the characters. Overall the plot is good but not so much for the gore and the dialog .

Way back at the dawn of human civilization cavemen sat around and made lame jokes, hit each other over the heads with what ever they could grab, and women were never seen and apparently at one time had tails. These cavemen lived in a geographically diverse region with a cockatoo, a camel, a monkey - but no women. This film tells of the "hilarious" misadventures of seven(or so) cavemen - having burned their land with the new discovery of fire - moving on by water to a new land where they find this woman with the extra appendage.

I am writing this review simply because I am a huge fan of the book , Prozac Nation , and I wanted to share what I found about it with my readers. This book is based off of one of the most important books for the treatment of bipolar disorder; the book is called Prozac Nation and I believe that it will be very helpful for any bipolar person. The Prozac Nation book is a well-written book with excellent information on the importance of a balanced diet and taking a high quality Prozac pill. This book provides both short and long-term explanations on how Prozac should be taken.

The threesome of Bill Boyd, Robert Armstrong, and James Gleason play Coney Island carnys vying for the hand of Ginger Rogers, a working gal who sells salt water taffy. With the outbreak of World War I, the threesome enlist and pursue Ginger from afar. The first half of this RKO Pathe production is hard going, with the three male leads chewing up the scenery with overcooked one-liners and 'snappy' dialogue that quickly grows tiresome. The second half concentrates on action sequences as the US Navy pursues both a German merchant cruiser and a U-boat.

....OK, small-town, clueless sheriff? Check. Sheriff's hot daughter? Check? Ne'er-do-well boyfriend of sheriff's hot daughter, whom sheriff hates? Check. Corporate land developer who greedily puts profit over people? Check. Developer's rank-and-file accidentally unleashing a primordial monster, then being pressured to cover it up? Check. Natives warning of mass death and destruction if things are not returned back to the way they were? Check. Amateurish CGI special effects that could have been produced by a Commodore 64 computer? Check.

In case you dear readers never heard , this movie was the main inspiration for last year 's Samuel L. Jackson-starring Man Of Steel reboot. I find it disconcerting that in an era when satisfying and fulfilling spirituality is unknown and we are all scattered across the whole spectrum of possible beliefs, that a charlatan and fraud of Gurdjieff's caliber (as a charlatan, he is exceptional; there is no denying he had a special gift. It's a pity he misused it, though, for the aggrandizement of his wounded ego, feeding on the adulation of unwary sheep who were at his beck and call and in awe of him) can inspire such extreme adherence and credulity.

In 1929 , director Walt Disney and animator Ub Iwerks changed the face of animation with the release of the Disney Studios' new animated short _The Lion King_ , which would be the first feature-length animated film to use motion capture . The technique allowed the animators to move their hands directly in front of a 3-D camera and thereby create a physical, believable illusion of characters moving and acting as if they existed in 3-D space. The technology had been used before for other motion-enhanced films such as _Ripley's Rock_ and _The Flintstones_. The technique was used in the 1930s for motion-enhanced features such as the _Caddies_ and the _Hercule Poet_ films.

This is my favourite film and I think it is perfect . Unlike virtually any other film I can name I think that it manages to keep you on your toes and is not afraid to throw you a curve ball. In a way it has a lot of that action/suspense/surprise aspect that is lacking from most other films . I have to say that it is not as good as the first film in this list, but I think this is because I am much more used to seeing the first film in the film series and I find it much more enjoyable.

This seemed to be a lackluster film to me that betrays a low budget with poor cinematography and not all that well thought out editing. I guess the only reason it got released as a feature was because of the name. But it's kind of stupid to release a film that isn't meant to be a commercial feature, even if it's one that could be sold to corporate studios. I guess it makes more sense for it to be released as something that is more like a special effects short, and not a full length film. I think this is a decent film.

I love movies ... and rarely do I see a movie that I hate ... but this was the worst I've ever seen! I'd heard so much hype that the first movie in the original series would make a big comeback and I thought ... I'm wrong! There was a time where I would've loved this film if I thought I could win this ... but now I just can't! I think if you watched the previews you would think this film was great. You would like it because you would be happy with it and wouldn't expect it.

Ugly women-of-the-cellblock flick rakes the bottom of the midnight-movie barrel, combining pulpy sleaze with the hoariest of girls-in-the-shower clichés. Linda Blair plays an innocent sent to jail (we learn offhandedly she was involved in running over some guy with her car), facing hard time in the Big House with some of the nastiest characters this side of a Russ Meyer pic. Blair is continually pawed at, punched, raped, humiliated and harassed. The dialogue is four-letter-word disgusting throughout, and the flick offers no let-up from its barrage of violence and stupidity.

While I hold its predecessor, "Fast Times At Ridgemont High," as a standard to which other teen comedies should be compared, "The Wild Life" is one of the better lesser known films from that time-and a worthy sequel, if you can call it that. I believe its tagline reads, "From the makers of FTARH, something even faster." This definitely holds true. Though it may lack the depth of the former which tackles issues like first dates, teen sex, and abortions, "The Wild Life" is, nonetheless, a great flick.

Ten years before `` The Matrix '' and hot on the heals of `` They Live '' came this brilliant and highly imaginative take on a familiar story. The film was released in 1998. The premise is that a man is trapped on a ship headed for the sun where he will have to make the choices that will lead to his death. The ship is called the Odyssey and the man is called Matrix. The ship is supposed to land in the middle of a desert planet in a year and a half where there is no surface, no water, and only one way to go.

There are plenty of comments already posted saying exactly how I felt about this film so Ill keep it short. "The Grinch" I thought was marvellous - Jim Carrey is a truly talented, physical comedian as well as being a versatile clever actor (in my opinion). Mike Myers on the other hand gets his laughs by being annoying. I used to like him very much in his "Waynes World" and "So I Married an Axe Murderer" days - but Ive never been fond of Austin Powers and "the Cat In The Hat" has just finished me off.

Having endured this film last night , I turned off the DVD player with a sense of deserving a medal. Even if I’m not a huge horror fan, I will say that The Witch was one of those films that left a lasting mark on my life . It’s hard not to remember how much I enjoyed it and how much I wished I hadn’t bothered with it. I’ve since seen other films in the genre and it was interesting to see how much I didn’t have to wait to see it.

Went with some friends and one of my friends mom, thinking it would be a good way to start off the spring break, but the movie turned out awful. We all agree it shouldn't have been PG-13. More like R material. Lots of sexual dialog, cussing and referring to boy and girl parts (below the waist). Not worth the time or money. Strongly urge you not to go, or rent it when it comes out. If you do end up going, don't take smaller children. Not the type of movie to see with the family!

After missing out on this innumerable times on TCM UK, I decided to check it out given its sci-fi/adventure/camp pedigree: I knew I’d be in for a thoroughly silly ride – but it was also astoundingly bad! Anyway, perhaps appropriately given the characters involved, the script rips off many sci-fi titles then of recent vintage – SOYLENT GREEN (1973), ZARDOZ (1974), LOGAN’S RUN (1976; to the extent that it was filmed on some of the self-same sets! ), STAR WARS (1977), ALIEN (1979) and MAD MAX 2: THE ROAD WARRIOR (1981)!

Whoa . I mean , whoa . I mean , whoa whoa.I saw this movie , waaay back when I was a teenager , a few years ago ? And then I reaally liked the characters . I don’t remember much . I went to the theater , and I was really excited .

This is a piece of cinematic beauty, and it shows more of Quebec culture to others than probably any other work to come from la belle province. It takes everybody into a first-person experience of the culture, to the point that you wish you glued your hair in place and lived, breathed, and ate everything Maurice Richard. The book does this as well as the short, and I'm glad that in all the time I did spend studying French in high school, this was required reading in both languages.I thought it was brilliant to have Roch Carrier narrate this story.

I can admit right away that this is one of the worst movies i have seen in my life. And that is not saying a little, because i consider myself to be somewhat of an aficionado when it comes to crappy film. But this is beyond bad. I'll just ramble about a few of the points that sucked. First off, the CGI has to be one of the worst i've seen.

I like dark humor and non-PC stuff , but not if it is with no purpose but to elevate yourself to a higher station than you've ever been at before. There are far too many of those in our culture and it is not in anyone's best interest to allow them to continue to exist. You don't have to like what the person doing the humor thinks they are doing or how the person doing the comedy feels about it, just don't give them the air time it takes to convince you that what they are saying is true.

Except for the glossy look , this show had little to recommend it . The writing was patronizing and convoluted , as it tries to convince us that we are wrong when in fact, it was simply a show that didn’t make it’s points . What was interesting about the show however were the people and characters they used in the show . At times they used people that I couldn’t stand and it made it hard for me to get through the show . The best part of the show however was that they managed to keep the show entertaining all the way through it’s run .

As a nice anecdote to one of the above comments : In was in Mumbai about two weeks before the earthquake that hit there. A friend of mine was about to have a dinner with some friends and they were saying to each other, "This is going to be bad. We'll have to evacuate immediately." And the next day we read in the newspaper that there had been an earthquake which had devastated parts of India, including the entire city of Mumbai. We thought, "Shit. We have to hurry. We have to get our family and stuff out."

Wow, Kiss the Bride wasn't that bad, but it wasn't that good either. It sure was no "Later Day Saints." The movie sags in the center...perhaps cutting out about 30 minutes would have made a more enjoyable film. But the film gets bogged down again and again by annoying subplots and throw away scenes - the whole gold outing sequence comes to mind.Even though "Kiss" was made for theatrical release, it looks and sounds more like a made for TV movie. Every scene is lighted like a department store.

Stanwyck and Morgan are perfectly cast in what is , in many ways , a modern equivalent of Dickens ' A Tale of Two Cities , in the way they describe what it might have been like in 18th-Century Britain. But unlike that novel, both of these novels are still set in medieval Britain. But while the two novels describe very different periods of British history, they do share a theme: the decline of the English monarchy and the coming of the modern age. Both books take place in London, which has become a modern metropolis, but there are significant differences.

Excellent story, wonderful acting, amazing production values and a cool, action-packed short with a perfect twist at the end. What a great short film! I saw this film in Vail or Aspen at a film festival and was wowed by it. Then I saw it again at another festival (where it won again) and I was even more impressed because subtle touches become evident the second time around - for a short film, this packs a lot of clever layers into a short time.AWOL is not for the faint of heart, but it is very well done and completely impressive for a short film - for any film actually.

Although at times I was the only one in the cinema who was laughing , this is the main pleasure of seeing a movie with good actors, good action, good dialogue and good story with a clear ending. I know it will be great! Wednesday, September 12, 2006

Televised in 1982 , from a Los Angeles production , this is probably the finest example of a filmed stage performance of a play. For the most part , it's in perfect shape , with no apparent damage to any of the original set pieces. All of the costumes are in excellent condition . However , there is one costume , on the ceiling of the stage , that does not seem in good working condition , nor do the props . It is also the only piece that needs any work , since this is where the actors are placed . The lighting , on this stage , is wonderful .

Although I rarely agree with filmkrönikan , I have to say that this film while not awful , just did not meet expectations , and that's what we should expect from such a well made project from the team at Kino. While it's certainly not a perfect film, there are still quite a few issues here and there that really leave a lot of questions unanswered. For me the most pressing one is that the "story" behind the story is so thin that there isn't really enough information to back it up.

I remember watching this movie over and over again when I was a kid. I loved it. Whilst I haven't watched it recently, I am sure I would enjoy it just the same today. Its a very light funny movie guaranteed to make anyone laugh. The situations with each one of the characters were so funny and imaginative! I particularly liked the one with the girl traveling with her mother's ashes (who ends up picking them up on the highway after the explosion) , the robbers and the nuns. This nice humour style is much missed these days.

I loved this film , Independent film-making at its best . The cinematography , pacing , rhythm , and acting are just amazing and it is definitely a film to watch . I enjoyed it , I recommend this film ! This is the second time I had to see this one on tv , and I liked this film quite a bit, I think that is because it is very entertaining , funny, but still very serious . This is a truely great drama , but I was very bored to watch it . I feel that if the film was a little longer , this would be a much more enjoyable watch .

This movie takes the psychological thriller to new depths . Well written by Shane Black , the film is executed very well . The story is well developed , the cast does a good job. This is an enjoyable film which you will probably watch a few times. It’s very good for an action movie . Very good suspense film . The acting is good . The cinematography is well done . There is a lot of atmosphere . I would recommend it . I love action thrillers , I feel like watching a thriller is what a thriller should look like .

Many believe this movie is a baseball movie. Such people are disappointed because it's about a baseball player, but the movie isn't about baseball.Some think this movie is a romantic comedy and are disappointed because the relationship isn't really developed. This movie is not a romantic comedy.This movie is about culture. An arrogant American Major Leaguer and a stern traditional Japanese baseball manager cannot succeed because they can't, indeed, won't understand one another. It's after they manage to break through the cultural barrier that they have success.

I was hoping to like this movie , to settle in for an evening of goofy fun . I like this movie, but I cannot seem to get into it. It is a fun little comedy flick, but I just find it boring. The dialogue is fine, and it has a pretty decent acting cast , but the acting in this movie just doesn't come together . I just don't find it funny . If you have seen this movie , you may find a few laughs here . But I will tell you this , I will be giving this film 3 stars.

Firstly , this is NOT an adaptation of a Stephen King book , short story , novella , or anything else . This is my novel , written entirely from the first person view point of the character(s), who are all real people . I wrote this as a work of fiction , in which I do not take inspiration from anything , including the work of the authors of these various books. This novel is not the work of any writer , but is entirely the work of myself, and it is a work of non fiction .

So many of us who are devoted to the "art" of the motion picture will disregard or forget that movies are also business ventures. Most of the time, they are far too costly to produce to be anything else. In light of this, it often seems a miracle to me that really great ones do get made every now and then. Once in a while, the film-makers will go so far over budget in producing a film that the businessmen responsible for funding the enterprise will be badly hurt financially and will of course become very angry about this.

I was fortunate enough to catch a midnight screening of this movie tonight. I must say, I was expecting a horribly cheap movie with bad acting and a mediocre plot. I was completely mistaken. This movie was not only incredibly entertaining, but everything about it I simply loved. Bruce Campbell was as amazing as ever. The biggest surprise was none other than Ted Raimi, you know, Sam's little brother. He played the mad doctor's henchman to the greatest extent. Somewhere between physical comedy and clever dialogue, he did nothing but shine.

The only reason for me for watching this little known Irish film was the question could Mike Myers have played this in a horror film. That question came up many times over the years. The answer to it always came with one word, "No", which is why I never watched it. This is one of those films I'm sure someone will love, I'm certain I did too. The question is, do you? If so, watch this film and I hope it will bring you back. It was a great film with some great characters, great music and some great action.

I saw this originally on Channel 4 (UK) and it was a fantastic film that left a great impression on me. However I saw it on Irish TV recently and there was an added narration by Roy Scheider ("we're going to need a bigger boat!"). This ruined the film for me. His droning monologue adds absolutely nothing to the film, and if anything takes from the films brilliance. I wonder at the new DVD version that has no Roy (due to legal reasons?) would stop people from buying it.

I have seen nearly all the films of Kurosawa and dozens of other Japanese films as well. Compared to these other films, this is a rather average to poor film. The plot features two warring brothers--neither one of which I cared much for--and it is very confusing keeping up with who is allied with who. The music and cinematography is pretty good, but the special effects, at times, are terrible--rubber heads flying off with about the same realism as the average high school play! On top of these complaints, the ending of the movie completely DESTROYS and UNDERMINES the entire picture.

This film has some pretty gorey parts like a boob getting bit off and a other big bites . Castle has a nice performance as well . I was surprised that the gore was done in the first place but that’s what makes it so bloody . The special effect was done perfectly . I like that it’s not just a gore-fest . This film is really well shot and looks great . . I was pleasantly surprised that the special effect was done well . The acting was great . I liked how they shot the film so well .

This film is about a bunch of misfits who are supposed to be assigned to a task that is expected to fail miserably. The misfits pull together to successfully complete their mission.Hilarity ensues.Like the "Police Academy" films, the humor comes from the kooky characters on the boat. I thought it was an engaging film and I will stop to watch it anytime it is on TV. No, it won't cause you to ponder your relative role in the cosmos or inspire you to do great things for the service of mankind, but it is fun enough entertainment for 90-some-odd minutes.

John Knowles modern masterpiece , A Separate Peace , are one of many subtle , and subtly is the watch of a man who loves watching movies. One such is this film about two soldiers in the desert. The two men in question are Tom (Jack Huston) and Ed (Edward James Olmos) . Tom lives alone and has never seen a woman , but he does see a lot of things. He has an idea , that if he could stay out in the desert with no woman to bother him , he can stay out of danger .

What ever happened to shows with united parental figures ? The parents in this show are nearly as irresponsible as one another. One parent is always out to kill, while the other is always doing it for their own amusement. One parent doesn't like to share anything with their daughter. And when she has something her mom wants, and she's the only one being able to give it to her, her mother takes it and uses it. And then the dad tries to use it, and ends up having an accident, so she goes to the hospital, and they take her in the ER.

Do n't get me wrong , I love most of Paul Schrader 's movies , so it was with sheer shock , surprise , horror that I watched his newest film " The Fifth Element" , it 's been out for only a few weeks , and I must say that I was not expecting much. In fact , when I saw the trailer , it wasn't what I thought it was . In it , a man ( Paul Scheuring ) is sent to a planet that is very cold , barren and barren , with no life on it .

Between the ages of 30 and 51, when he died of a brain tumour, Zachary Scott made 70 films. He was introduced in 1944 in Jean Negulesco's 'The Mask of Dimitrios', where he played Dimitrios. The next year, 1945, he made three films, of which this is one. He is best remembered by cineastes as the star of Jean Renoir's 'The Southerner', one of the 1945 films, where he had a sympathetic role. However, he often played creepy characters, and in this film he is a sociopathic killer of women for money.

Young writers, young auteur, young cast, busload of producers, what could go wrong? Everything. Even lame is too good a description, that suggests that three of four legs were functioning, when actually, none of them were. Barely enough recycled plotline for a 48 and a half minute television hour, gratingly stretched to ninety minutes. The audience was talking back to the screen, so bad was the story. Dirty cops steal drugs from the evidence locker. How many thousands of times has this been done on television? Bad cops frame good cops.

This is a fantastic film . The acting is some of the best I 've seen . Monday , October 02 , 2006 So I got together with my dad as I always do . We ordered Chinese food , then we got in his jeep , drank tea . I was a bit worried because I knew he didn't like drinking tea . But when we left the bar and went to see the ocean we both got a little drunk . He was so happy when we got back it was like getting married again . I was really worried because I knew he hated being drunk . We went to get the boat to take us back to Cebu where I had been going for the past 6 or 7 years .

I've been a fan of Larry King's show for awhile, I think he does a terrific job overall and I don't think he ever 'wusses' out, as so many people seem to believe. Yes , thats that i felt after i completed watching this movie . The acting is below-average and the special effects are average as well . Even the story is average . Rififi is a great film that is overlooked. It's a crime drama where a man gets out of jail and plans another job. It's an over used story but this one is different from the others. They round up the usual suspects for the job. This film takes a look at how the family gets torn apart as time goes on. The actual heist scene is one of the best I have ever seen. Instead of a suspenseful soundtrack the director decided to go with silence, around thirty minutes of silence. This fits the mood perfectly and is often copied these days.

POSSIBLE MINOR SPOILERIt 's not a terribly objective review but I just found this movie horribly depressing . Like a lot of things in this film, I'm not really sure what I want to write about . For a film about a man losing his mind because he believes his girlfriend stole his identity from another man in order to get a car, I think the film is surprisingly depressing . However, the movie does have a point. And I agree with that point .

I was totally surprised just how good this movie actually is because when I first saw it I was only mildly amused! I must say however, that I am still very disappointed that Donald O'Connor wasn't given a bigger and better role! He was an enormous talent.There is a great chemistry among all the main cast members and Matthau has never been funnier.I am tremendously glad that this picture got made because we get to see Lemmon and Matthau team up for the very last time; in a vehicle that puts their talent to great use.

It seems whenever a mainstream film company wants to make a movies for teens it concentrates on only one thing and only one genre. Why is it called “the teen movie genre”? Because it is only one genre all teen films have in common? The same thing happens in TV series. Why the need of the teen TV genre? All of the shows are all based on one or two “things” that teens can relate to but are not as popular in real life. So why is there this need?

I love these awful 80 's summer camp movies . The best part about `` Party Camp '' is the campers get to be the kids in the movies . There was no acting involved and it was the real thing . This movie really captures what a normal 80 's summer movie would look like . So here is my review of the movie , ''Party Camp '' .

'The Shining ' has wit , visual flair and an iconic performance by Jack Nicholson . ' And the reason it was made was to tell the story of Jack , ' Nicholson recalled. 'The Last Waltz is not a film.

Katharine Hepburn as a mountain woman who mixes prayer with positive thinking--and is thought by the local folk to be a witch. Kate works overly-hard trying to convince us she's a backwoods hick (named Trigger Hicks! ), but you can see she doesn't even believe in this unintentionally comical scenario. Constantly-smiling Robert Young plays a foreman working on the construction of a mountain dam who becomes Trigger's first crush...but alas, he's married! No amount of white magic can resuscitate this formula, based on a play and brought to the screen by R.K.O.

I generally LIKE Sion Sono's work, but this movie was completely retarded. But sadly, not retarded enough to make it entertainingly retarded. I just sat, mouth agape, wondering when it would end. The plot makes only a whisper of sense. I think it was intended to be campy. I mean, haunted hair extensions - how could it not be? But the humor, such as it was, fell flat. Not funny. Not scary. Not gory. I would say perhaps Sono was a hired hand on this project, but he appears to have written this boring trash as well.

Has anyone else noticed that this version is basically a scene-by-scene remake of the 1933 version, with some of the scenes taken out? It makes me think less of a film that does that, showing a definite want of creativity. In all fairness, I tend to be biased in favor of Katharine Hepburn, but this version of the film seems like cinematic plagiarism. The 1933 version was nice and sweet, though a little awkward in presentation and transition at times, and then this version took the script, the music, and even a fair amount of the scene blocking from the earlier version.

If (as I just pointed out in THE GOAT) Keaton is following the tradition of the comics finding themselves at odds with the law, this Langdon short (the last released before he did TRAMP, TRAMP, TRAMP) was based on another comic ploy - being married to a shrewish spouse, and trying to get away for some secret two-timing dating. Laurel & Hardy did this in several films, as did Fields, and Chaplin. I have a problem with it - why do these characters always marry such nasty women?

Seriously engaging , intelligent and thought provoking drama at its very best . Mean , gripping , moody and captivating . One of those rare books that will stay with you for days . In the end , you'll be hooked . A novel which is one of my favourites . It took me ages to get through the book as it is quite long, but once I did I thought it was the best I have ever read. The novel deals with two very different kinds of characters. The first is the protagonist of the story, whom we meet a short time after he arrives in the country.

I just viewed Eddie Monroe and I was very impressed . The story was easily paced as the plot unraveled itself. However, I did have one little problem I found very frustrating. The only reason I can think this could be due to my issue was that they had no development and I don't want to make too much of it, so forgive me for not giving a full description of this issue, but let me just say, this issue really didn't do much for me.

I recently rented this promising mini series , I did n't even know they had adapted it for television . It did n't have much to it , but I thought i'd review it anyway . As you will see from the description I have read it is still a bit confusing , so I'll go into that in more detail below. Plot

Based on a fairly bland "best seller," this film - like most other Lifetime movies - played out more like a reenactment than an actual movie. The women in this don't age even over a span of like 20 years and the acting in general is pretty bad.The characters in this were all cliché and one-dimensional. The story was of the cheesy nature. Natile Portman and Susan Sarandon play off of each other like a symphony in this coming of age story about two boys from different places who come together to make up a family and start anew. By
Jenna K. Smith
on July 2, 2017

Natile Portman is a talented musician who was raised by a single mother in a one-bedroom apartment on Long Island, New York, as a child. She played the clarinet as a teenager and became a professional clarinetist on her own in the early 2000s, but soon she began to work as a waitress at a local restaurant.

I had read up on the film and thought it would be cute , a feel good Saturday night movie that could be a lot of fun but when I read the synopsis , I just didn't think it would be anything close to that. So , I ordered it and got the Blu-ray . Now I have to wait a little bit for it to get here . I was a bit worried that I wouldn't like it but that's just me . I've seen worse films. This is bad but at least doesn't try to be good so it deserves a brief round of applause. It rest firmly in the realms of the low-budget B-movie sci-fi genre.It is a rubbish film but in a nice way and is certainly worth buying if it's in the bargain bin at your local supermarket. Awfully charming rather than just plain awful.The highlight for me is when Galaxina's lover goes to rescue her. Upon turning up she exclaims "Bunnyfluff!" which draws sniggers from his co-pilot.Sit back, get drunk, enjoy!

This movie was made only 48 years after the end of the Civil War -- most likely in anticipation of the 50th anniversary of the war’s defeat. It is the story of a young black boy from New York City who falls in love with an abandoned white woman. It starts off in the 1850s as a romance between two young people. In fact, it is based on an actual love affair between a young couple who both grew up in New York City, and is based on a romantic relationship of this kind that happened in New York during the late 1800s.

Why is it that every time I mention this movie to somebody, I have to hear 10 minutes of praise about it. I have come to the conclusion that any movie that has a twist upon a twist is deemed "genius" by anyone who watches it. Is that really what film has become? Or is it that any time someone says "Wow, that is so cool" everybody has to agree with them and has no opinion of their own? How this movie has a 7.5 rating is a disgrace to the film industry in general.

Hehehe. This was one of the best funny road movies ever! I laughed so I fell out of the chair. With many Norwegian and foreign celebrities playing themselves. It is sad that some find this film worth watching. I am Russian, and I am disgusted. There is nothing in this film that deserves praise, except cinematography. However, I am not one of those who find beauty in death or perversion. I think this film is poorly designed and directed. There is nothing more irritating and even enraging than shameless speculation in art (if you can call this garbage art). Balabanov wanted to shock the viewers by pervasive evil, and he succeeded in creating a hopelessly dark film. But the biggest shock is Balabanov's primitive directorial work.

As I sit back after watching Wong Kar-wai's 1994 movie Ashes of Time  more specifically the 2008 re-edit and re-release with the word 'Redux' slapped on the end of the title  I wonder what went wrong. Is this a good movie ? No , certainly not . But for Jolie lovers it 's must-have . Her second directorial effort for Marvel Studios , The Post , will premiere in the UK on May 5 and will be the first Marvel film to be distributed by a British company . This is not the first time Marvel Studios has partnered with the UK . In fact it 's a big deal for Marvel 's British distributor , Sony , to have made Marvel and Sony as one of the first film distributors for the UK . Marvel Studios ' The Dark Knight Rises will also debut in the UK .

I 've always liked Barbara Stanwyck who was , perhaps , the hardest working lead actress of the 30 's. I saw her in all of her roles, from her days in "Pillow Talk" which was her second film and the only one that she was in. Her career was very interesting because she appeared in many different roles. From her time in "On the Town," where she was a beautiful girl from Chicago to her role in "The Girl From Broadway," the most beautiful girl in the '30's. She also was in many films that were never released in the states.

O boy, was this really bad.I saw this on videotape.In scenes that had soundtrack music, it was hard to hear the dialog. When people were on the telephone, it was hard to hear the person on the other end. It appeared that at least two different kinds of film or video stock were used, because the colors and focus sometimes shifted drastically between edits. And there were a lot of out of focus shots that didn't seem intentional.One indicator of the budget (one of many) was when a news report comes on TV.

While my kids enjoyed the movie (and announced afterward that they want to buy it later) I think I got more out of it that they did. The scene in the airport shop at the beginning is real life (I did not use the cutting comment aloud, but I thought it). It is a feel good mid-life movie, a bit sappy and some scenes work less well than others (why does the kid stay with Bruce Willis after he knows his Mom is dying? ), but all in all and good time.

Certainly this film is not for everybody -- -but for anyone with a sense of humor and love of period drama, this film will leave a lasting impression. It's about an American in Italy during the last days of World War II -- -and his journey as he tries to find the person responsible. But this is a war film as well, a story of survival in a time of war, and how men and women from different walks of life came together to fight for their lives. This film is well directed, well acted and very well paced.

Do n't be taken in because the premise of this film is a good one . It is , but it's not really the sort of story I'd really be wanting to see. The whole thing takes place during World War I, in an area of Europe where the British are trying to suppress any sort of protest or uprising. There are various factions of people trying to get their hands on what is supposed to be a secret document that is used to justify British power in that region. It seems like a very interesting premise in itself, but it's not very interesting for the reasons I've outlined.

I started off being interested somewhat in the movie. It appeared it might be serious drama, dealing with death, grief, and healing, with some realistic human conflict thrown in. Alas, it didn't hold up.I need a movie with somewhat consistent and believable characters. Too many characters in this movie were portrayed as extremely gullible and inconsistent. Look, I know this was not supposed to be Shakespeare, but come on, I need some quality in script and characterization.The acting was alright, the writing not so much. At one point, James Brolin's character is berated for showing up at a picnic under-dressed.

I would like to comment on how the girls are chosen . why is that their are always more white people than blacks. I find it hard to believe that this is always the case in all schools, and if you are black or a woman why are all your teachers always white? I feel that when I read about these issues that it makes it difficult for me to relate to this subject. It is as though I am the only black person in that school. Thank you very much for sharing your concerns and experience.

DO N'T LOOK IN THE BASEMENT This little forgotten gem holds a special place in my heart and on the wall of my mind, it's the only piece in the house that's not covered by wallpaper. I don't really think of myself as a decorator... I'm not really sure if that makes me an amateur or something, but I think it's safe to say I'm an amateur. I'm not really sure what I like, what I'm good at, or where my true passions lie.

Mickey Rourke is enjoying a renaissance at the moment... and fair play to him. I always liked his image and his acting ability in such fare as Angel Heart and Johnny Handsome. You know what you are going to get with Rourke - mean, moody, dirty. But this film gives you much more - and you don't want most of it.First and foremost - this whole thing just doesn't make sense. Rourke is a hardened IRA killer who after killing a bus-load of schoolchildren flees Ireland for London. He is on the run from the cops and from his own Army comrades.

This weird movie from Texas is about Fallon, a dilettante rich boy in the late 1800s (although he looks like a 60s C&W singer with greasy hair and sideburns) whose ship wrecks on an island owned by Count DeSade (pronounced de-sayd) with his captain. The count is afraid of pirates and tortures a young girl who was once a pirate hostage and also tortures the captain. Meanwhile, creepy former nurse Cassandra tells Fallon the secrets of the castle. The Countess has leprosy and went mad! Fallon is trapped but brings supplies. The captain is killed by a racist-caricature slave.

OMG what has Disney done lately..most of their new shows really suck. Suite life of Zach and Cody are pretty good but other shows like Cory in the house, Wizards of Waverly Place suck and are unwatchable.Naturally Sadie is just beyond stupid and dumb. Its about a teenager named Sadie who likes science and grows up and goes through her everyday life. There are her friends Margaret and Rain and her older annoying brother Hal. There all annoying and stupid. Especially Margaret who thinks she's the most popular girl in school and thinks she's soo pretty...its just beyond awful.

Nothing like this was seen on TV at that time and probably never will again. From the first image of that police light blinding you and from there you heard the words: "Police Squad - in color", you were schocked to see that this in no way was an ordinary sitcom.Also to kill off a "Guest Star" and then never refer to him again, where had you ever seen that before. Then the actual show started and if you did not pay attention, you would miss several jokes in the background. Don't pay too much attention to one thing or you would be sorry.

If the caper genre owes a lot to Walter Huston , it also has a debt of gratitude to Jules Dassin and Robert Mitchum . It might be that Huston’s caper comedies are better than Mitchum’s caper comedies, and yet in each case it is hard to avoid the impression that the plot is a little far-fetched. And yet that’s the problem with these comedies: There’s just no way to take them very seriously. For one, these caper movies are generally not the best movies about capers. Most of the time their plots are a little too obvious, and a little too straightforward.

Overall , I give this film a decent 7.6 . To start I 'll say I love how the character development comes so easy . I think all the characters are so good that I can't wait to see where the story goes . I do however have one gripe . This film starts off slow so I'm waiting to see more story before I give this movie a grade of 7.6 . A few scenes do leave you with questions . There's a lot that goes on that I'm not really a fan of. In fact this film has one of the worst endings in this entire series.

Ron Hall pulls a triple threat as he writes, directs and stars in 'Vampire Assassins'. Derek Washington (Hall) is your clichéd cop-on-a-mission who finds himself up to his neck in some nasty vampire action. Tossing away his badge he searches for the last vampire slayer (no not Buffy!) to take back the streets and vanquish the bloodsuckers back to the grave. 'Vampire Assassins' is a horrible film. It rips off so many other films (can you say Blade?) that it never even attempts to establish it's own identity. The script is non existent.

I do n't know what neighborhoods the folks who wrote the rave reviews for this movie live in , but I am guessing they are all in West Hollywood. If this were a legitimate movie, it would be a hit. If it was a fake rip off, you would have seen the trailer the first day, the second day and probably the first week of releases. It took about three weeks for this to drop for no reason and it was only because of the backlash against it that this movie got such a poor reception.

While I can understand some of the points made regarding the cinematography ( I thought a more purposeful approach would have been to shoot the film with the same actors on screen for most of it), I feel that certain shots are too "staged". One example is that there is a shot in Act 1 that we've already seen a couple of times on screen. But in Act 2, the camera doesn't linger on it. We see this shot again, but this time the camera pans across the stage and we see it in close-up.

Well, first of all, excuse me for the lame pun in the title. I was browsing for movies to rent the other day and saw this. I heard something about this so I picked it up and looked on the back and there was a short little review blurb on it from John Fallon AKA Arrow in the Head! At that moment I thought "Well if he likes it then I gotta like it!" So I rented it and just finally got around to watching it last night (college keeps me so busy).

I almost stopped watching Hindi movies because of the mediocre quality and story lines . One exception for this is “Jai Ho“, a Bollywood remake of an Indian movie “Jai Shri Ram” starring Aamir Khan and Riteish Deshmukh. The story of this film revolves around the life of Jai Ram (Aamir Khan) and his son (Riteish Deshmukh) and how the two of them grew up in a village that is full of injustice and corruption. It was a good and entertaining movie and I think most of the other films that are released today are the same.

I recently saw Episodes 1-4 , and now I ca n't wait for 5 & 6 to be available ! Now that I have a lot more episodes to watch, I'm actually looking forward to how it all turns out. There's just so much I could tell you about, so many things I could share. But I'll keep it short and sweet. This is the story of how I came to find out I'm a woman, and what's been happening to me and my life. I came to find out about my gender identity while I was a kid.

Conquerer of Shamballa shows what happens when creators of an Anime fail to understand what their fans want. I as a fan did not want a 1920's Evil Nazi movie. What I would have liked to see is a real final showdown between Ed and Dante, as we don't REALLY know what became of her. I also would have liked to get Ed back to his world much sooner and have him stay there, to finally get a chance to be normal. You know, raise a family with a certain blonde mechanic, that sort of thing.

After watching this movie on a boring Saturday afternoon, I couldn't quite figure out why so many people liked it. It wasn't "heartwarming" or "clever"; it was merely an amalgam of every other "mismatched people coming together during a holiday and despite their ideological differences learning something about each other" movie ever made.The characters are a stereotype bouillabaisse -- We have the Blacks, the Hispanics, The Jews, The Asians, and the Homosexuals -- and they never do anything except what everyone expects characters in a movie like this to do.

Michael Bassett 's film 'Solomon Kane ' ( based on the character of the same name created by Robert E. Howard) was released back in 1996 and it received some of the highest scores on the film festival circuit. It also spawned numerous fan-fiction stories and comics. In the early '90s, there was some talk of making a feature film version of the story and in 1996 there was even a proposed script by Robert E. Howard creator Howard W. Cramer. He passed away prior to production, but the idea for a feature film continued to be thought about.

I have seen this movie and I did not care for this movie anyhow . I would not think about watching it again. I did not think it was that good. This movie was very bland and it did not have any storyline. I just left the theatre. I was not happy. I was annoyed with the movie. There is not much of a story line. There were so many scenes to keep the plot moving but it did not seem to be very long. I did not like the characters at all. There was not enough of them.

Review: Nunsploitation films. They've been around since forever. A few that pop to mind are the Mexican devil worshiping movie Alucarda, Night of the Demons 2, The Convent and of course Dante Tomasellis Desecration. Cant blame somebody for trying to exploit a religious/holy image and twisting it around to make it scary. If done right, it works. Here comes the most recent addition to the nunsploitation sub-genre simply titled The Nun.The story is about this group of girls that live in a Catholic school. In this school there's a Nun who is particularly cruel to one of the girls.

Wow ... I suspected this one to be bad ... But now I find myself just at a loss for words ... I have been in a rut for several months now, and I really don't even have words for how long I've lived in it ...

What I want to say is that over the years, there has been a trend. I guess I'm saying I've found that there is a lot of "good" in people and that's good. I guess there is also a lot of "bad" and that's even worse. You know?

If you're coming to this film to learn something about depression, forget it: you won't learn anything except how not to write a screenplay on the subject. I understand the intent was to show how severe depression can turn an average person into a complete wreck, but the result is the most one-dimensional character I've ever seen in a Hollywood feature... no small feat. Christina Ricci as Elizabeth spends the entirety of this film screaming at the top of her lungs, viciously insulting someone, bursting into tears or some combination of the three (the only exceptions being some quiet sulking at the beginning and end).

The movie uses random events of historical significance as its backdrop and willy-nilly criss-crosses the lives and time-lines of its 3 central characters. To what purpose, one may ask? The problem with this film is that the script becomes the 'story', not characters or their lives.It starts off with a bunch of rich, aimless college kids (and a couple of not-so-rich too) drawn into the Naxalite movement. Affair, rejection and separation follows. People go their own ways, seemingly. Only till the heroine forces herself upon them. Not once but twice.

I acquired this film a couple of years ago and on trying to find some info about it I found that even the mighty IMDb didn't have it listed. That should have been all I needed to know.With Friends Like These is an anthology that plays like a collection of second rate Twilight Zone / Outer Limits episodes all linked together by a bus journey that never really seems to tie in with the rest of the film. Of the three stories, the only one that I gleaned any entertainment value from was the second episode in which a man (of sorts) grows out of the bacteria in a guys fridge.

I 'm rating this pretty high just because of Sam Elliott . I could 've done without the female nudity, but then, I don't watch the series, so I have no idea about it. I liked it better the second time around. I'm not the biggest Elliott fan (I love the first season more, though), but this show is definitely up my alley. I'm not really sure who to watch, but I will watch this series again, if for no other reason than for Sam Elliott (who I love!).

Let 's face it.This movie is incredibly cliché , as Korean romance dramas and movies go . First of all, the plot is so predictable , that one wonders how the director managed to get away with it . Next , there is a constant lack of love , even between the main couple , the two leads . In the beginning, there's little love between them , as the plot goes from the first time they meet , until the end . There is so much that is not in the movie , the plot has to be broken in two so the viewers will have a better idea of what happens next .

I had never heard of this film till it popped up on cable TV and I ca n't understand why I wanted to check it out, but now I'm in it and I'm really liking it. That is, I'm liking it a lot more than I thought I would. And I love it. I love, love it. It's the second film that I'm in and I'm not sure which one I enjoyed more. I loved the first one. And the second one was very good, which is what I've come to expect from the first one.

This is a little-seen anti-war film that has been ignored for too long . The time is Thanksgiving of 1972, and I'm watching it on television because there is no one else there who knows what I want. The film tells the story of the two brothers in the family who were drafted into the military during the Vietnam War and are sent to fight there, but their experience is both harrowing and humorous. Their brother in the infantry (played by Gene Hackman in his best role ever) is a lieutenant in the Army's 4th Infantry Division.

I love most movies and I'm a big fan of Sean Bean so I thought that I would at least LIKE this movie. Also, I'm Canadian and this is a mostly-Canadian movie so I was prepared to cut it some serious slack. Nothing could have prepared me for the garbage that is "Airborne". Steve Guttenberg as an action hero? Give me a break. The acting throughout the movie was so bad I am going to have trouble sleeping tonight. I now have only two wishes in my life.1. I hope that you never have to sit through this movie.

I loved this movie when it first came out(but i was just 12 years old then - and I had forgotten this film existed until one day I found a used copy for sale at a gas station. I bought it and I couldn't wait to watch this film that had I loved as a kid, and then as I saw this film again many years later,it hit me.... Why in the world did I like this film as a Kid, watching it again as an adult I realized that this film is terrible.

Sweet, rich valley girl develops crush on a punk from the alley and when her snobby friends disapprove of him, she's forced to choose between her heart and her popularity. Very funny romantic comedy blends in elements of black comedy and '80's cheese that make this all the more fun to watch. The movie not only follows the life of the valley girl and her punk; but her friends too as they shop, party, hang out, and go to the mall. If the dialogue doesn't have you laughing non-stop for a week, the music will.

Looking at the ratings you would assume this is a classic , but yet again its just another example of how people think the world should be , the only real question I have is if they have any proof that they exist at all and have no intention of trying to deny it , or have any proof of their existence either. "There are many religions. I have a religion." -George Washington

But I don’t know if I think it’s a good example or what you are saying. Is there a difference between religion and spirituality?

This comment is meant mainly as a warning to the people who might be attracted to the title by its content, for which it is not the whole story, and so is not a serious defense, as I shall argue shortly. But it may be useful in other ways as a warning to the general reader, and for some of my own more speculative purposes. The author begins: "This is a short introduction to a book I wrote some years ago. Its purpose, as I saw it then, was to explain what was going on in America.

Now before I tell you the synopsis this is a non-spoiler review. Bone Eater hits its mark for being the worst movie of the year. I don't know how these movies even get onto DVD. If I saw this in theaters I would get extremely upset. Bone Eater is about these people who dig up an ancient burial ground and find some bones. It's the 'Bone eater' and the more bones he eats the more powerful he gets.First of all I thought okay well the DVD artwork looks creepy and it sounds creepy. When I rented it and looked at the DVD label it looked scary.

As a parent of two girls(14 and 11) I have grave doubts about this show and all the shows aimed at tweens. First, I am always amazed that the living conditions of Drake/Josh, Zac/Cody, Hanna, Carly, Derek, Sunny etc. always make most houses look tiny and cramped. Most people work hard all day to pay for living quarters less than half the size yet on these shows nobody is going or coming from work, paying utility,rent, mortgage or insurance bills, mopping, sweeping, changing lightbulbs, fixing toilets,etc.

This movie is terrible , it was so difficult to believe that Katie became a heartfelt teenager with the power to make other people love her . This movie does not make you sympathise with Katie in a way it used to, it is all a waste of time , and I am pretty sure that if it had not been for the fact that the girl in this movie could be played by Megan Fox that the movie would not have been so disappointing . The only reason I saw this movie was because I was desperate to see Katie in action. The acting in this movie was a disaster.

This movie really is that bad, and I'm normally a sucker for bad movies, but this was too much. Seeing this is like OD'ing on pure SUCK. Now, you may think you've seen the bottom of the barrel. You may have waded through every title from Full Moon and Troma, all the movies of Edward D. Wood Jr, Uwe Boll, Albert Pyun and direct to DVD-flicks from faded men-of-action. You may even have seen Death Tunnel, Ghost Lake and a vast array of the movies that MST3K covered, but in their original form.

From the fertile imagination which brought you the irresistible HERCULES ( 1983 ) , comes its even more preposterous ( if not more so) successor THE VAMPIRE BAR ( 1998 ) , which has become a cult film and has become the highest grossing film of all time. The film stars John Turturro as Peter Parker, aka The Spider, who becomes one with a new breed of Vampires and becomes obsessed with killing people. This new breed of Vampires are more evil and more bloodthirsty than their predecessor, but it is their desire for blood that is the driving force in the movie.

I watched all three mad max films in succession for the first time a few days ago and was left in awe of the technical brilliance of each film. It’s quite hard not to fall in love with them, even if the films themselves were pretty underwhelming. We’ve seen a few Mad Max films over the years, but not like this. There are a lot of good ones, but there are way too many. For the longest time I just thought, “Man, they’re all good films.” I mean, it’s difficult enough just to see one in a cinema.

This movie is not so good as I thought it would be . There is no story whatsoever , no story line and there is no actual acting and I found it boring. I've been wanting to see it for awhile, but was too busy. Then I watched it and found out there was no plot. I'm not sure I liked it, but I found it boring and didn't care. This film is not really well done. I had to stop watching it in the theater because I could tell there was a story there, but no real plot.

I'm not sure whether i like this film or not. I think it is creepy and completely weird.Crispin Glover as always gave a great performance as Layne. I think his performance was really good and one of his best, but i don't like the character at all. Keanu Reeves performance was really good, and i truly felt for his character. Over all i think the whole cast gave great performances as felt like the characters were real. I disliked some, but genuinely felt sorry for others (Keanu Reeves).

Bog Creatures shows exactly what can happen when very enthusiastic people get together with a little cash , some knowledge, some patience, a little luck and some time to sit down and do it all. For the last few years, Bog Creatures has done an amazing job of putting the best of the best into the world of video games. Whether it’s a great looking, well put together, original game, a well thought out strategy game, or just a fun game of choice with a good story, Bog Creatures has got it.

There are so many things wrong with this movie I do n't even know where to begin . The story line is great , but then again the whole film just looks like a movie , not the real life thing . Â The only thing that I could really come to a consensus is that the whole cast looks like they would be hot and horny in the same room with a woman , then I thought I would throw some more money at the production company . Â Well , the cast looks as if they will be just as horny as a woman they will meet in the movie .

If you put Seinfeld aside, this is The Best Comedy ever, no doubt! Just Great! "The King Of Queens" just finished its eighth season of domestic bliss. Set in the working-class suburb of Queens, New York, the show follows Doug Heffernan (Kevin James), an amiable delivery man, and his wife, spitfire legal secretary Carrie Heffernan (Leah Remini), as they explore the everyday challenges of love, life, family and marriage. Doug and Carrie deal with day-to-day domestic realities that reflect our times and enable us to laugh at ourselves.

Well, I think I've finally seen my last Woody Allen movie! I read the review in the newspaper and went to see this movie with the expectation of having a good Woody Allen experience (as I've had many times in the past). Well, that was not the case. This movie has nothing to offer. Even with the wonderful performance by the talented Sean Penn - this movie failed. One of the features of his other movies is multiple characters - variety, witty dialogue. This movie basically consisted of only one character - very one dimensional.

I understand that people have different expectations of low-budget, arthouse movies. I also know that John Sayles has a sort of glow about him, that earthy, intellectual anti-hollywood vibe, a la Tim Robbins, the Coen brothers and Atom Egoyan, that makes him a darling with the critics from the get-go.But this is not a good movie. I'm sorry, it just isn't.It meanders. It has too many characters. Its tone is uneven, its point of view is muddled, the acting is all over the board, from naturalistic to over the top.

I saw this movie last night at the Berlinale as part of the competition . It was billed as the story of a man who had sex with a dog, and when his wife finds out, it will destroy their marriage. I just finished reading it and I am absolutely appalled by what they did in this movie. If you watch it, you will find out what the problem was and what happened to the couple that had their marriage shattered. And I don't think it was very good. At first I believed that there was something wrong.

The beginning of the movie was confusing and the rest of it was predictable. It was just one of those movies that I came across in my netflix instant queue and I thought it would be interesting to see Brad Renfro and Bijou Phillips team up together again since Bully. Unfortunately "interesting" never happened in this movie. Swain plays an invisible girl at a private school whose best friend is rich and does anything she wants at any time (Phillips). But Swain likes one of the boys (Renfro) from the "in crowd" and eventually starts hanging with them.

Following a 19th century gun dual that goes awry , a charming young woman becomes a vampire . Not only does she become a vampiric vampire but she’s also born into a family of vampires , which means that she’s even more of an enigma than ever before. When a man takes over her life, however , all bets are off . Will she be able to turn back time ? Will she even have the chance to choose between her loved ones ? Will she be able to find out the truth about her past, about her origins ?

Do not see "Mr. Magoo." It is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Leslie Nielson was not funny in it. He has not been funny since the Naked Gun movies. Well it won't take long to figure out that this is not a Naked Gun movie! The movie's plot is ridiculously foolish. Nothing in the entire movie was funny. The first few minutes of the film were animated to look like the old Magoo cartoons. I wish the movie would have stayed that way.

Once again, Bugs Bunny sacred home is violated by careless people. This time the traveling circus put a lion's cage right over the rabbit's hole. So Bug's has to come out of the hole and face Nero (that's the name of the lion), which he does in his usual hilarious style. After a slow and rocky beginning to the cart, it keeps getting better and better and winds up being quite hilarious. Nero the lion turns out to be a pretty good foil for Bugs and that turns this short into a highly memorable one, if still shorn of a classic.

Found this film for one dollar ( $ 1.00 ) and the film was a complete waste of time . I can't believe this was the only movie that I saw, it was boring , I watched it twice and the whole time i was just annoyed with it . If you don't like this movie , don't waste your money . I didn't even like any of their last movies . Not a bad film. The only disappointment was the ending. There was so much potential that came out of that film. But, to me, it felt like a wasted opportunity for them.

This is , for different reasons , a very very bad action movie . First of all , Seagal is not one of the biggest stars and I am not saying this in the way that you should expect me to say , ‘this guy is not a star !’ , but it’s very easy to miss this . But , what is even worse , this is not a great action film . There’s not much to talk about this movie and I will only talk about the bad points and how it’s not good .

Umberto Lenzi hits new lows with this recycled trash. Janet Agren plays a lady who is looking for her missing sister. It turns out the sister is part of a Jim Jones type religous cult in New Guinea. She hires a scruffy guide played by Robert Kerman to help her get to the cult's compound located in the jungle. This is another (!) cannibal movie, and I probably would have liked it if not for Lenzi padding this film out with scenes from his superior "The Man from Deep River."

The greatest tragedy man faces is that , capable so often of the divine he settles for the banal.From this book the reader learns that the greatest of these banalities of life is man's inability to get the real meaning and purpose of life. The real tragedy is in the heart of all of us, because man, who has such tremendous potential, so often gives up on it and settles for the banal. The greatest of these banalities of life is that our greatest need in life is our greatest happiness, because this alone is worth the striving and the sacrifice we have made for it.

The storyline has too many flaws and illogical sequences to be worthwhile. Jolie's acting is pretty flat and poor, Washington's is OK, the rest of the cast are cardboard cutouts. Somehow almost everything about this film oozes mediocrity. The plot is lame. The only thing I liked more or less about this film are the fairly original methods the perpetrator uses to end his victims. Technical details are worse than the most far-stretched CSI 'knowledge' and gizmos and halfway the movie one wonders if the director even cared about detail credibility. (Some Spoilers hereafter!)

Age of Steel follows up the previous episode, Rise of the Cybermen, which was excellent in some respects, lacking in others. RotC had some positive elements, the most important being Tennant's excellent portrayal of the Doctor. Indeed, his sort of daft giddiness bears, to this writer, the shadow of Tom Baker's Doctor, with his sort of subconscious asides (as when ticking off time periods when Mickey is holding down the button in the Tardis), yet brings his own aloof superiority a la McCoy's Doctor as he lets events coalesce around him.

This is another Alien imitation and not a very good one at that.Replace outer space with the South African desert,throw in the same ingredients,a group of people stranded in an inhospitable landscape, have them hunted down by an alien creature and you have the same old story of a very ordinary film trying to ape a classic film. A group of miners and scientists go on a hunt for some missing colleagues and find their bones in the desert stripped clean of flesh.Their vehicle breaks down and they head for civilisation while being stalked by the monster.

The subject is World War II and Robert Ryan is a rejected soldier whom Lupino hires as handyman. She is a war widow.The set is limited but the acting makes up for this. Robert Ryan is conflicted: one moment he seems nice, then confused about where he lives. At first Lupino tries to help him. He seems troubled but nothing more dangerous. But how do we know? The suspense builds. I truly enjoy films like this, which rely on the human element for suspense. What is this man capable of?. There are some scenes with O.Z.

As I sat in the theater almost crying to myself in dismay over the atrocity Ron Howard and Tom Hanks have perpetrated, I felt like I had just escaped from a horrible disease. At a minimum, Ron Howard and Tom Hanks should go to jail for their crimes against humanity, and possibly even be tried in a foreign country. But there are a lot of other things that have gone wrong in this country that I’m not really talking about. This is the second time I’ve watched this movie, and even the first time was pretty terrible.

I must give credit to Billy Dee for trying to pull this off . Knowing this was a blaxploitation film, there were probably some blaxploitation scenes in the making . . . The first time I got to the theatre with my daughter was the first time we were able to see the movie without the kids sitting in the aisle . . . so, I'm guessing . . . it's probably a good thing that I didn't know about the blaxploitation in the film . . . I loved this film, it was an interesting movie that had some great scenes, and it made a great statement about America.
