This is by far the most repulsive and atrocious version of The Scarlet Pimpernel ever to be devised . As the title suggests, this particular story has been twisted and distorted so as to fit into the Scarlet Pimpernel's own twisted and deformed vision of the past and future. But, by the very fact that it's been twisted and distorted, there is something to be gained from reading it, at least in part. For, as I said, by its very being so twisted, it's a story that shows the twisted and distorted side of man.

This is truly, without exaggerating, one of the worst Slasher movies ever made. I know, it came out in the 80's following a tendency started by "Friday the 13th". "The Prey" copies the fore-mentioned movie in many aspects. The woods setting, the killer, the dumb teens, the gore, etc.But "The Prey" is as bad as you might expect. I didn't even remember about it if it wasn't for coincidence.Well, the killer is in fact human so don't expect a supernatural killer in the likes of Jason.

Man with the Screaming Brain certainly isn't a perfect movie, but I'm pretty sure it was never meant to be anything more than a star vehicle for Bruce Campbell, meaning it works as kind of a summary of his entire career: slapstick, sarcasm, cheese, action, and happy endings. Campbell is, as a writer, uneven--there are lots of things in the story that don't make a great deal of sense (why does the robot suddenly have breasts merely because a female brain has been implanted into it?

On the positive , I 'll say it 's pretty enough to be watchable . On the negative , it's not much better than the first movie , which really was the best thing about that first one . The second movie , at least , I didn't really care for . There's no doubt that the movie has it's moments and moments are there, but this movie is simply not worthy of this movie. I don't understand why so many people feel the need to say this. There's a whole lot of great entertainment out there.

I first saw this movie at least thirty years ago , and it remains one of my all-time faves ! There was something about the script that really grabbed me, something that really made me think that this movie should be on the big screen. I’ll admit that this movie could have been perfect and just be an excellent movie, and it would have had no trouble pulling it all off ,but that would have been to miss a special moment that should have made it one of the best films ever made.

It is so nice to see Bruce Willis come down off his action throne and let us see that he still has plenty left to give to the world. He has been the most overrated superhero in Hollywood for a long time now, and his last movie is not a bad thing, so it is safe to say that he still has plenty to give to the world. However, he is still not as popular as Superman and Iron Man, despite what is said. He is not as good as his predecessors in that department, but that is not the worst thing in the universe.

I rented this movie, because I noticed the cover in the video rental store. I saw Nolte, Connely, Madsen, 40's time setting, and thought "hmm, can't be too bad." Unfortunately, after watching it, my impression was "not too good".Its kind of a Chinatown ripoff, but the worst part is that other than Nolte, the other members of the squad didn't get enough screen time. But its a decent movie to see once I guess. And Melanie's role was small enough that she wasn't given a chance to be a nuisance.

You thought after `` Traumschiff Surprise '' that German comedy ca n't get worse ? It can . This comedy, which was released at the beginning of January, is an abomination . It is the worst, worst comedy ever to come out of Germany . When it comes down to it it is about as bad a satire on German society as can be produced. I have no idea why the Germans are so obsessed with the Nazi Party. Maybe they are a bunch of weirdos who think Hitler was a great role model, but it is hard to see any difference between the Nazi and the Hitler Youth.

A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away (sound familiar), water has become the most precious commodity (this has got to sound familiar) and a small minority control its distribution (what a surprise, just have a heart attack and die from that surprise). A group of ice pirates (water renegades? wet bandits?...oh wait, that last one's been used) try to discover the route to a fabled unlimited supply of water with a lovely but spoiled (Druish?)

Just watched this on DVD three times - Once the 'normal' way, once with the scenes in consecutive order (in this doozy of a film noir, the beginning, middle and end of the story intertwine), and once with the director's commentary running. Quite amazing. A bare-bones tale, told with more flair, energy and substance than most big-budget overblown features being released today. I think this is an even more accomplished film than the subsequent Memento, which turned me on to Nolan in the first place.

This film is a nightmare! The sensation you feel when you wake up from a nightmare is the same I got when I finished watching this movie: "UffOK, it ended, what a relief!" I felt pain watching this movie, so bad it was! It's a B-series low cost movie, that's for sure, but I think it not an excuse to be so bad! I've watched brilliant low cost movies, with nice plots, nice production, nice acting, and most of all, some substance! This one got nothing of it!

I realize most people do n't know who Solomon Kane is and that the film is pitched at that much older audience and that this may seem like a cheap shot, but it is one and it does show the depth that a character like this can bring and it is very much needed to have this film. I do not know if I will ever understand the life of the man but I know there is much more that I would like to see. The film is very well made and I will definitely give the film 3 stars because of the great performances.

In `` Red Letters '' , Coyote is at the vortex of as a college professor who writes to a new girl in her class that she needs to stop reading his letters. At first, she takes him at his word when she asks why he doesn't write back. However, after Coyote shows her around the town, she begins to feel that maybe she is a little bit in love with him. After she finally tells him she loves him, she doesn't quite believe him when he says he doesn't feel the way he used to.

Unless there's some huge ironic conspiracy going on, my jaw dropped when I read the positive reviews of this film; I cannot believe that this film was even released, it's so bad.I admit it is not my kind of movie, but I tried to watch it objectively anyway, you know, so bad it's funny, and was still offended at its sheer awfulness.The acting is atrocious, they can't have watched the rushes and I'm guessing there was one take per scene, it really is that terrible.

This movie is a must see for any war movie buff . One of the greatest movies of all time. A classic that still holds the public's imagination. I think this film has the potential to make anyone fall in love with war. I can't wait to see how it will turn out. The best part for me is when we get to the ending scene. I always wanted to watch it in order to see the ending. Now that I can do that, I don't see that as much anymore. But it's a good part of the movie.

Excerpt from TV GUIDE:This week on THE LOVE BOAT, Captain Stubing has his hands full when a cryptozoologist gets on board with an unexpected cargo! Join the Captain, Isaac, Gopher and Julie in a fun-filled Halloween Special. Guest starring a guy in a really bad lizard suit as the Chupacabra.This is typical, lame Sci-Fi Channel cut-rate fare. The Captain of a cruise ship, played by the once respectable John Rhys-Davies, is in charge of a Carnival cruise along the coast of Mexico. His daughter is along for the ride, and she's earning her keep by being the ship's kickboxing instructor.

I'm an action movie fan but until today I've never seen a preview or an ad for this movie in Italy, so I went to see "The Long Kiss Goodnight" on pay-TV hoping for nothing special.But, what a surprise! This movie is great! The only problem I found is the presence of some holes in the plot, but the rest is the most entertaining, intriguing and funny action movie ever made.The transformation of Samantha/Charly from ordinary wife-teacher to cool-blooded agent recovering from amnesia seems to be a good idea. The action scenes and the stunts are the best I've ever seen.

There were many 'spooky ' westerns made in the 30s and early 40s , and although this has a strong basis in the westerns , it is still not the first or the last film of its ilk , but one of a kind . I am not the only one who have seen this film which I think has been made by at least 8 other filmmakers . It is the one I think I am best placed to describe as a western , and it is a good film in many ways . Not all of the westerns are bad , I can remember watching many of them , some of them very well .

Something of a disappointment. Lee J. Cobb is the anti-union head of Roxton Garments in New York. His partner in the business is killed when an elevator is unleashed and plunges twenty-seven floors to the bottom of the shaft, in the scariest scene in the film.Cobb doesn't know it, or doesn't let himself realize it, but the man behind the killing is Richard Boone, who protects the business from union organizers.Then Cobb's son, Kerwin Mathews, returns from Europe determined to learn the business and join his father in running a clean shop. He's shocked -- shocked!

This is probably Wayne's poorest movie; at least the poorest in which he had a starring role. It's just incredibly bad. The editing is especially awful; it really appears that the editor (if there was one)literally picked up pieces of film off the floor and pasted them together. The opening has to be seen to be believed. John Wayne must have cringed every time it was mentioned! I know there are "B" films - but are there "H" films? If so, this one's an example. And I say this as a devoted JW fan.

I saw this superb documentary at the Santa Barbara Int'l Film Festival. It is extremely absorbing and very well crafted, drawing you into the life and career of Harry Nilsson, one of the most overlooked musical talents of the 1960's and 70's. While I was familiar with his better known compositions ("One is the Loneliest Number", "Without You"), I learned about this man's brilliant writing and beautiful singing. If you love music, you'll find plenty to draw you in to his world, which unfortunately spiraled out of control as his success increased and his past haunted him.

I have some of the older videos and dvds of Dr. Who . I 've played them over and over again as a child and my friend asked me if I had any of this. I don't know anything about the show and couldn't find any of the DVDs or videos I thought I had, but I do play them for my friends. I would love to know what is in this series. Thank you very much in advance

I'm sorry I don't know much about the show, I never got the chance to watch it.

I 've seen a few bad action movies in my days , but this one 's just plain awful . I actually don't understand the logic . I was surprised how many people didn't know what this was about , so this review will just be based off the first 10 minutes of the movie . In that first 5 minutes we see a couple of guys fighting against a guy with a grenade launcher . The one who holds the gun and is about to do the killing , but is killed by a friend of the gang .

Let's get one thing straight: I like much of Snipes' work. Unlike his other high-kicking contemporaries (Seagal and Van Damme) he can actually act. This film, however, does little to enhance his reputation; it's not exactly unwatchable - but I am not in any hurry to watch it again either. In fact, if I never saw it again it wouldn't bother me - there are just loads of better films out there to waste my on! It's a pity because with a bit of imagination and and some subtle changes this could have been a worthwhile film.

First , let me confess that I have not read this particular Balzac novel , so maybe I am directing you wrong. I have read all the others, and I still have a very hard time describing them in the way I do here, but I will give you a hint. It is very rare that we see a scene with two people, and in this scene there is also a person, who is a complete stranger, but who comes up with a plan that would change the way that we think about a number of things and in this way , I will try to explain it in some way.

*SPOILERS INCLUDED*Alfred Hitchcock's brilliant and innovative adaptation of Robert Bloch's novel was an amazing film, unlike anything previous. Every shot, every camera angle, every nuance was PERFECT. He didn't just break the rules, he made up a whole set of new ones.Here's the spoiler: there is absolutely nothing new, different, or original about this movie. Gus Van Sant doesn't just pay a homage to Hitch, he rips off every idea, and does so in a less original, more conventional manner. I didn't have anything against Gus Van Sant before I saw this movie.

Right ... so you have a dam , tons of water ( that seems to flow really really slowly ) and there are no fish, so the fish just sit around in the mud for a few weeks ... it doesn't get much worse ... and then suddenly, there are fish everywhere and they start fighting with one another , so it's all the same to me, the fish are gone, except for the slime that is left on the mud ... and there is no fish around anymore, which seems really sad to me !

***Tip: Have It Read To You, Heres How***1) Copy And Paste This To Notepad (NOT WORD) 2) Go To. START>ALL PROGRAMS>ACCESSORIES>ACCESSABILTY>NARRATORhaving your testicles ironed.When Jonathan Ross started his career he was on a show call "The Last Resort" now a days he is the first resort to host anything and anything. TV Award Shows that half the time he is up for nominations in, Comic relief, chat shows, quiz shows, game shows, charity shows, Brighton.

A kooky , but funny bit of diversion . You kind of have to see it from the beginning to appreciate how good it is . It makes you think . You never thought you could make a film like this . But you know you can , and you have . It has all the ingredients you need to make a good film . I like it as much as I do any of the works I saw and I am hoping to make the film a lot better . And that’s where it is at the moment , you know what I mean ?

Waters 's contribution to the world of cinema has to be searched with a telescope , and then when/if something pops up , like a star, or a meteorite or a volcano . . . but, it's also a lot of fun. And, like all things, there's always an unexpected twist. In a recent interview, Waters said , "One day, it will all be mine," 
which would make for a good title for a film, don't you think? If it is , then I'll just have to do it . .

It seems to be a common thing in the 90 's to play with cliches . Some manage to do it well, some can do it well but still end up being annoying. It’s one of those things in a game where you never know what to expect until it happens . It’s like when you play a game before you are a seasoned player and you’re amazed how well you knew it. In one such example, we’ve recently seen people do a double take when they discover a certain mechanic is used.

This movie was , perhaps , one of the most unoriginal and unfunny films I 've seen in a long time. The plot of this film is so stupid it is not worth mentioning. All I know is that it was one of the very worst movies that I saw that I 'm ashamed of being a fan of at this time. This movie is so bad it makes me wonder if there is more to the story than what is there. I mean, I didn't know how the movie was gonna end, and there were no clues that I did.

A bad Quentin Tarantino rip off, at least I hope that's what they were going for because at least then I could respect the director for admiring Tarantino. One scene a "singing" scene with Rose McGowan is far to well done and genius for this film and could have only been stumbled on by mistake by this director. So besides his Quinton inspiration and Rose McGowan and her one good scene this film sucked. Some of the crappiest dialogue I have ever heard, I'm willing to bet why McGowan doesn't speak much is because of how crappy her dialogue would have been.

Without John Rhys-Davies , I have to admit that this would never even register on my movie-meter . But in fact, I really enjoyed it . If you're looking for what the future of film is coming to, you should definitely check out this documentary, which follows the making of the first feature film shot entirely in the UK, and of course I've got the full review right here . This is an excellent documentary film that you'll need to have on your DVD collection . We start with a short introduction to the film, which basically says it all .

While I can understand some of the points made regarding the cinematography (I thought a more purposeful approach would have better supported the low-fi, home movie feel) I must say that I thought the script and acting of WHAT ALICE FOUND were excellent! Dean Bell has crafted a real gem that Judith Ivey charms with character-driven delight. Her performance of Sandra is a pleasure -- unfolding, alternately, as diabolical and romantic. We are at once intrigued and repulsed by her actions... and never given more information than is necessary. Her's and the supporting cast's efforts meet Bell's post-modern fairy tale with arms wide open.

This is absolute drivel, designed to shock and titillate the 60's mindset. The acting is completely wooden, consisting mainly of ad-libbing, which results in the sub standard actors dribbling the first thing they can think of, repetitively. The end result is of a badly written play being read by people who have no idea and couldn't care. The one exception to this is the lead character "Joe" (played by Joe Dallesandro) who spends a lot of the film in a naked stupor (either stoned, or the only one in the piece who can act!)

This is a film by Oshima, the director of the notorious "In The Realm Of The Senses", a film so sexually brazed and unabashedly controversial it was banned for a while. This film takes place initially in 1895 in Japan and stars the very pretty Keziko Yoshiyuki as Seki, the wife of a rickshaw driver who falls for a much younger man who woos her in kind. That man, Toyoji, comes to her as she was sleeping and seduces her, though she soon is rather willing to be seduced. Soon they are having an affair and plot to kill Seki's husband, to be together forever.

Unlike one of the reviewers below , I do n't think that a great and glittering career should lie ahead. I think that it should be a lot simpler, that it should be a lot better for people who want it. And I think this is what we have to do. I think that if we have the right mix and match of the right skills, people should be able to make it at the level that they want. And I think this is what we should be striving for, a mixture of the right skills, the right personality types, the right experience.

When watching this movie , with it 's deterministic cause and effect , wall-to-wall clichés and hackneyed sentiment , can be frustrating. This movie doesn’t hold any surprises , and in the end I had to laugh and shake my head. But I really like this movie . It’s very good at what it does best . It gets right to the point and it doesn’t gloss over any plot holes. This is a film that is well made , and is full of heart . If you are a movie fan or a fan of science fiction I would recommend this movie to you .

to make this short and sweet : i hope this movie will not be considered the seminal work for the horror franchise! it's not so much of a remake as a slight change of scenery and a fresh approach to the storyline. the movie starts out a bit slow for the first 2 acts but gets going in the 2nd act : a good idea for a horror movie! I think the movie is quite enjoyable. The story is a bit confusing, at the same time it's not really that bad either, but it's not that good either.

Last year was the 200th anniversary of Charles Darwin's birth, and the 150th anniversary of the publication of "The Origin of Species", so it's fitting that Jon Amiel's "Creation" got released. The movie focuses on the period of Darwin's (Paul Bettany) life while he was writing his famous work, and the mild strain that it put on his family life.I guess that the movie overplayed Darwin's tension with his religious wife Emma (Jennifer Connelly), and his guilt over his deceased daughter Annie, but I still like the thought of Darwin's theory working like a karate chop on religious dogma.

It 's another variation on the oft-told tale of two people getting married and having to share their brood of young children. It is, however, a rare marriage between a man and a woman that is truly happy and well-balanced. That is what makes this film so interesting. It tells the story of two parents whose relationship is, in effect, perfect but has one problem – a problem that keeps coming up time and time again, and yet they manage to still be happily married. It is the problem that makes this family story so interesting, and one that the film never lets the viewer forget about.

This film was a wonderful romp, intelligent, playful, mysterious, full of surprises, with humor in odd places and a tremendous energy. The famous film director (the protagonist) and the events he tries to manipulate through film all become entangled in fascinating ways as he is nearly out-maneuvered by a prince who has never heard of him. There are wonderfully rich images throughout and paths suggested but not followed (exactly what is going on with the somber wife of the pedestrian tourist wedding director?). The ending is so much the better for being untidy.

Johnny Crawford is great in this movie of a troubled teen coming of age in a generation that was in denial. This generation had no idea what it was getting itself into. I don't think it's a big surprise that many of those who did not come of age in this era did not even know the term 'tween-teen.' I was just in my teens myself at that time and I have no desire to go back and forth from the past. It's just a fact of life that those in the past know better.

I really wish Hollywood would come up with some new ideas and quick. Instead they go around and recreate and mess up a perfectly good movie with a re-make. This movie is awful from the DeMille version. All the way through this movie I was saying to myself, Huh??? - What???? - I don't remember that part. The only exciting thing in this movie so far was the parting of the Red Sea. And in Heston's version - it was a heck of a lot better than this version.

After a very scary , crude opening which gives you that creepy `` Chainsaw massacre '' -feeling , everything falls apart and we go back to the last thing we see before we are all killed - an old guy, who seems to be very sad and in pain, walking up to him, asking if he remembers what happened last night . The guy tells him he does, and says , `` I can't stop thinking about what you did ... '' - and he then takes a knife with him . This guy is in a long-term depression and he takes his life at this point.

I remember watching Police Squad ! when it first came on ABC in 1982 and I thought it was a great show. It didn't take long for it to become a hit and now it's one of my favorite shows. I can't help but think how great it would be if it were to get the same attention and love now that it did in the 90s. Here is a clip I liked. This is the last bit. I think that it is good enough for a clip. I don't know why I didn't think of this one.

If anyone tells you this picture is just terrific they probably have something to do with either making it or profiting from it. This film is a real loser and it copies situations from big budget horror movies and not to mention soundtracks to. I wouldn't recommend this one to my worst enemy. It is a low budget movie with amateur actors. It looks like it was filmed for a film contest. The acting is terrible and it wouldn't surprise me if the script was written by a Hee Haw script writer. My family laughed at it. A Grade ZZZZZZZZZZZZZ all the way.

Oh boy. Films like this really bother me. If this movie is supposed to close to truth, then I assume that Rommel knew Hitler for a time before WWII started. In the movie, Rommel mentions how Hitler had changed from before. Well I can't imagine that Rommel wouldn't have known something about Hitler's government policies so Rommel must share some guilt for the German atrocities. With that in mind, I have a problem with a movie that makes Rommel's life at the end a tragic one. He made his choices and we have to feel bad for him?

A few years ago I saw The Scent of Green Papayas by the same director . My feelings about both of his films were rather mixed up . To be honest , I just didn't like this film . My initial feeling was very negative , but my thoughts were later corrected . This film does a really good job at giving you the feeling of how a place smells and feels , but it doesn't quite do the job it should . I know many people who enjoyed this movie . So if you don't like this film , then don't waste your time and make this one your next film .

This film is one of the best of 1986 with creepy, yet intriguing performances from Crispin Glover and Dennis Hopper! The Reagan years were pretty bleak for a lot of people, not just teenagers, but this flick really captured the desperation and despair. Well-directed with great script (apparently based on a true story), I don't really see any weaknesses in this. The opening shot was brilliant.Keanu Reeves was decent for a change and Miss Skye was right on the money. Hopper had three other great performances that same year (Blue Velvet, Texas Chainsaw II, and Hoosiers).

This is a truly terrible sci-fi/horror film from 1957 . In fact , despite Ed Wood , Jr.and his dreadful voice acting , I don't think this is the worst film of his career . I was actually quite entertained by " The Day the Earth Stood Still " , a movie made for TV and starring James Garner. The story is set in a dystopian future where the United States became a police state and most of the population was forced into labor camps. Many young people were drafted into the army , which is where Garner is found.

Sorry about the `` extremely clever '' summary phrase . I do n't know what I was thinking , but I didn't expect that . This was all a surprise to me as I didn't think there was a good chance that any of them were going to be up for a contest. ( I don't think I would have read the other articles . ) My guess is, as you all suggested, that they might be. That's my take on the matter . But my guess is that if they are, that the site is going to be very competitive .

If any movie ever made Italians look bad , this is it.Duke Mitchell - what an A -- HOLE . I am so glad there is a DVD that doesn't need the internet to watch it on. I had seen this movie before on DVD , but wasn't sure if anyone else had. The DVD is a little bit more difficult to find and is only in English language. The only good news is that the movie is not available on the I-VOD network. The only other place that I was able to find the film on my computer was from a DVD and I have to say I really enjoyed it.

I found it hard to care about these characters , who were either annoying or insipid , all living their own lives , who were always looking for a friend to hang out with , but they never really came across as human beings . The most annoying part is that they all seem to only have 1 thing in their lives . All living together , always hanging around , never really getting along , never having any real relationship with one another . They were all always complaining about the other person , but they never seemed to have any real interest in anyone outside their little circle .

This is no walk in the park. I saw this when it came out, and haven't had the guts to watch it again. You will never see a more horrifyingly devastating or depressing movie. I felt like I'd been severely beaten. What kind of world are we living in when we have children who are treated worse than garbage? This is our world, what we have created, what we have allowed to happen. And I would hesitate to say that I-ME-WE are not responsible for this. Babenco made this film to wake us up, to shake us to our very core, and he succeeded.

Your idol will deceive you in this movie . Stephen Nichols is mis-cast as a young german student still bending and shaping to become a famous artist . He is a nice guy, who has a love for music but has a hard time dealing with the reality in the modern art world . He has to find his place within the world and make a name for himself . Stephen is still young and still has much to achieve in the art world . The world is not ready for an artist with such a big heart like him .

"Hardbodies 2" is harmless, aimless and plot less. I would add "brainless" to that list, but the movie-within-a-movie gimmick, although not done very well, helps it to narrowly escape that label. The scenery has changed from the California beaches to the Greek islands, and the only returning cast members from the first film are Sorrells Pickard (the bearded guy) and Roberta Collins (who at one point falls into a mud pit, bringing back memories of her classic catfight with Pam Grier in "The Big Doll House").

I'm originally from Brazil... the sad thing about this movie was the exploitation that was done to that boy. They told his life story and he never got one "centavo" (Brazilian cent) of that movie. Fernando is not the first and will not be the last to go through that life style in Brazil. Sad... but that is the world we live in. It's about making money not saving lives. Question is: Where is Fernando today? Most probably... dead. We tend to want to live in this "Disney filled fantasy bubbled life".

The 1979 film musical of HAIR was loosely based on the infamous 1960 's Broadway musical that became famous because the lead male character's name came from a line in the lyrics of "Kiss the Boys Goodbye". It starred an actor who went on to appear in the original cast of '80s film classic, "The Color Purple", but who has not had a film in a couple of years. Now that the film musical is making a comeback, we're sure we can expect some new faces to join the talented cast of the film musical.

I found this movie to be a big disappointment , especially considering the cast . The characters are not believable, and the story is a joke . I felt the movie was really boring, and did not have a good ending . The whole story is pretty pointless, the main character dies after a while . The plot is a total mess , and this is not a bad movie, it’s just disappointing . Overall , this movie was great , just not good , and it’s disappointing . I think the movie was good , but the story was not .

Lackawanna Blues is a very moving film depicting an era filled with varying emotions and characters as seen through the eyes of a young boy. The film clearly supports "it takes a village to raise a child" and reminds of an important time in black history and culture. I gained an incredible amount of respect for Macy Gray as an actress. Her character was a little crazy, yet lovable; clearly we all have known someone like Macy's character. S. Epatha Merkerson is absolutely fantastic as Nanny. I never realized that Epatha was such a great actress.

Spoilers. This review has been edited due to word limit.`The horror. The horror.' Marlon Brando, Apocalypse Now (1979) and Apocalypse Now Redux (2001)The sentence which is as famous as `Here's looking at you, kid,' or `Are you talkin' to me?' or `May the Force be with you,' or `I'll be back,' means a little more than some one-liners. When it is spoken it lingers in the air with an importance and meaning that does not go unnoticed.

OK , to start with , this movie was not at all like the book . I read the book years back and then watched the movie. And I loved the book more than the movies. But I have seen the book and movie twice so far and have not gotten bored at all. So here it is . It took me quite sometime to actually enjoy this movie. But I am very happy with the movie and can't wait for the 2nd movie. This movie has the potential to be the very next best movie of 2016.

It's painfully obvious that the people who made this "movie" have never seen such brilliant spoofs as "The Naked Gun" and "Hot Shots". This movie is terrible, and so are the actors. They wouldn't know acting even if it hit them in the face, as I felt like doing while watching this total pile of rubbish.The movie is stupid and has no humor in it what so ever. I'm SURE that I could make a better movie with my friends. To me it's amazing that a movie can fail this much.

Movie Title - TartDate of review - 5/26/02Year of movie - 2001Stars - Dominique Swain , Brad Renfro , Bijou)Director - John Carpenter
This movie follows the adventures of John Carpenter's evil robot "The Master", which is trying to conquer the world, but first, it has to find a way to defeat the Master himself. The story revolves around the events of the movie, with each character being portrayed by a different actor, with each one of the actors playing both sides of the story as well as their own.

This film is supposedly about three young idealistic people, two of whom join the Naxalite movement and blah blah. It is really just another film about some beautiful, rich people trying to decide who they should bed next; the peasants and naxalites and the political struggles of the era merely serve as a picturesque backdrop. Literally, as we don't hear the villagers say a word, never mind learn anyone's name, thus they occupy the same 'role' as the 'natives' in old Hollywood films. The movie is also dull, and the story does not actually get us anywhere - except to various bedrooms.

The Kid - At 39 years old Russel Duritz has a life that most men would envy - he has a house in West Hollywood, a wife and a child of his own. However, he is not exactly living the great American dream - he is broke and homeless and can't seem to keep up with his mortgage payments, which in some cases can be five times what he owes. This is not the life Russel thought he would have at the beginning of the 21st century, so he had to change his life before it is too late.

The odd thing about Galaxina is not that it is supremely bad, although it is. The odd thing is that in spite of being supremely bad, it is not funny. Supremely bad movies have their own particular brand of unintended humor--the secret of their success, you might say. But Galaxina is quite uniquely different--it is MST3K's worst nightmare, a bad movie in which the intentional *and* the unintentional humor alike fall flat.It is easy enough to figure out why the intentional jokes fail--and the reasons are quite varied.

This movie contains real animals been killed , like a monkey been eaten by a snake and an crocible been shot in front of a fire and a lion have to be taken from the forest and a cat and a snake have a meeting with a man. I know some of this story was made for TV and I do not remember it. I think this movie might be a great movie but I dont know because I did not have enough time when I made this movie. I hope I can remember this movie now because this is the kind of movie you would like to watch.

As other posters have commented this was a very very bad movie ( keeping it kid friendly ) FX was very bad, story very bad, I think the only really interesting thing about that movie was that the main character was a guy with a gun and no explanation as to why. I think even with a very poor story you can make a movie with bad plot and still have that same level of badness

I agree it was a bad movie because it was terrible, the characters were awful and it was awful as a story.

Chupacabra: Dark Waters has to rank as one of the most insipidly moronic movies ever made. I had expected at least some passable entertainment because John Rhys Davies was involved, and after seeing this movie, I can honestly say I lowered my opinion of Mr. Davies substantially.Why? The acting is incredibly poor. An excellent actor like Davies should have demanded more from the cast and the director. It was painfully obvious that Mr. Davies was just clock-watching and hoping the check would not bounce. To say that he just showed up would be an understatement. But at least he did show up.

Korine's established himself, by now, as a talented and impressive image-maker. The promotional posters for Mister Lonely all include the film's most impressive compositions (though there's one in particular I've yet to see in promo material: that of a blue-clad nun teasing a dog with a stick, surrounded by green forest with torrential rain pouring down). The opening images of this film, of Michael Jackson lookalike (Diego Luna) riding a small motorbike round a track, is strangely compelling and beautiful: Roy Orbison's "Mister Lonely" plays on the soundtrack, and the images unfold in slow-motion.

Harmony Korine . I 'm not sure what he was trying to do with this film . If it was just to give the fans something to be sad about . I'm pretty sure all of those people he was talking to were not even in the same country . What the hell was he doing there ? What did he have to say ? It's just so stupid . I know he was upset about all the hate he got . If that's the case , why did he go there to talk to the haters ? It's not even a good movie .

I rented this movie because it supposedly takes place in a jazz club -- you know, those hip, cool places you might stumble upon late on a Saturday night. Well, there's not one ounce of "cool" in this ridiculous movie. The score is goofy, the original songs are awful, both lead actors' singing is continually off-key (to be kind) and unprofessional at best, the plot is no more complex than "boy meets girl," the acting is laughable, and the only decent cinematic moments are the stock footage scenes.

While Disney have been THE animation studio for the past 70 years , there have always been rivals to their creativity. There have been numerous studios over the years producing cartoons and animated features based on fairy tales and the children's stories of all nations of the world. In recent years Disney have been in the lead, but even now, there are competitors. In the last 5 years we have been treated to some fantastic animated features and animated movies based on animated classics and animated cartoons that are part of our heritage, such as The Lion King, Cars 2, The Muppet Christmas Carol and Frozen.

A great performance by Emily Grace ! I stumbled upon this movie while browsing my satellite listings and was curious about what this was about so I popped the DVD in. I'm not the type who's always in the mood for big action, but I have a couple of favorites in this movie that I love so I'm very excited for the rest. Emily Grace's performance was the highlight. I was worried she'd be a little heavy handed here and I think I was wrong. Not only was the performance outstanding, but the movie itself was a huge improvement on the previous releases.

I am writing this with 10 minutes left before the film finishes. I feel comfortable writing it now, because unfortunately I know exactly how this film is going to end.The premise is simple enough, rabid dog on the loose in a small town, kills people. Great - simple plot for a good fun camp 80s horror.Uhh ..no.The main problem is this is based on a book (Stephen King) and you can tell that is should not have really been adapted to film, at least not with the same plot. Why? Cuz its boring!

This movie was very cute and totally little girl appropriate . My nieces have watched it non-stop since they 've found out it came from a cartoon . And I am glad that they will have this for a very long time . So many good things ! I am really glad that we get a movie based on a book . One of my favorite characters is a guy who always wants to be on top of the other person so he can kiss him . This guy is such a wonderful person and I can just imagine them doing all sorts of good things together .

Sometimes you ignore that little voice in your head that says `` stay away from this movie '' . We are not talking a little voice, but a very strong one . And what does it say about you if you do not heed its warnings ? Well, you will have to wait for the film. But before we begin to discuss the storyline, let's discuss the characters and their story . If you are looking for the perfect place to buy tickets for The Dark Knight, then we have the best selection of tickets on the Internet.

Whenever Ida Lupino appeared or directed a film in the 30's,40's and 50's, you were guaranteed great entertainment even if the picture was black and white. Ida was able to capture audiences and keep them spellbound until the very end of her pictures. In this film as Mrs. Helen Gordon,"High Sierra",'41 along with Robert Ryan,(Howard Wilton),"Golden Gloves",'40 she keeps you guessing just how the relationship is going to turn out and just how poor Mrs. Gordon will be able to have a normal and happy marriage with love and real affection.

When I stepped into the theater, I thought this was going to be a great movie. And I was not disappointed one bit. WOW! This movie is brilliant! The emotions felt through out the whole movie are extraordinary! Great acting by Madhavan and Simran. Beautiful music by A.R. Rahman. This might most probably be the best Tamil movie I've seen in ages. Mani Ratnam has yet again proved that he is the best in making meaningful and heartfelt movies.This movie is basically about a young girl (P.S.

Just saw this at the cinema. I haven't read the books. There is nothing new about this film at all. the bad guys seem to die with a couple of slashes no matter how many times our hero has been stabbed with a big sword he keeps on going looking the same (ish)! There are several action scenes but they are very fake. filmmakers seem to be under the impression that whenever they cant be bothered to choreograph a fight scene they just move the camera up close, move fast and turn the music up.........

I had never heard of this film till it popped up on cable TV and I can't understand why. Geena outdoes Arnold as an action hero in this film! Geena is an ex-CIA assassin who is brainwashed and given an identity as a schoolteacher with a quiet family life in a rural town. She continues that life for 8 years with a husband and daughter. Clues start coming to her that she may have been someone else, especially when someone tries to kill her. It seems that her former employers have discovered that she never died and want to make sure that she does.

Warner Brothers produced this 3D extravaganza that was the biggest commercial success for westerns in 1953 . Guy Madison leads the way with a script that is full of surprises, including a romantic subplot and a love triangle, all wrapped in a thrilling musical number. The movie's musical score is also a great example of John Williams's work on the film, and is a highlight of many film soundtracks of the time. There are several scenes that were deleted from the film due to their violence or sexual content, so if you are interested in the deleted scenes that made the film, you can check this out .

Well, the Sci-Fi channel keeps churning these turkeys out... and they seem to get worse every time. When normally good actors like John Rhys-Davies and Giancarlo Espositto come off as rank amateurs, you can imagine how abysmal the REST of the cast in this waste-of-your-time effort is. The only halfway decent thing is the rubber outfit of the creature(which is glimpsed in such quick flashes that you don't really have time to see how phony it really is). The dialogue...the plot...if this "movie"(and I use the term loosely) was food, Jack-In-The-Box would be a gourmet meal compared to this.

The only time I seem to trawl through IMDb comments is when I 've seen a duff film . I've probably been there before myself . That's the only time I know about the IMDb . It's a shame, as it would have been nice to actually see a film . There were some good films . I can't name them, but a few I'd like to include . The first two are definitely on my list, the last one was not . The film that came to my mind the best is . The first film that comes to mind is .

"Lackawanna Blues'is so emotionally powerful in its portrayal of urban Blacks during the 50s and early 60s. A culture of joy and sadness specific to working class Blacks that existed outside the mainstream culture. The characters of Santiago-Hudson's play depicted Black individuals who lived imperfect lives but maintained strong positive values of love,loyalty and honor. Although the characters moved away from those values at times, they did not deny the importance of the values. Instead they recognized and accepted their own imperfection and those of the other characters, without judgment, that passed through the life of "nanny".

Man, I can't believe the largely harsh and negative comments for this movie. Okay, it sure ain't no sophisticated work of cinematic art. But it is a good deal of entertainingly tacky fun. For starters, the titular pumpkin-headed supernatural killer dude has to be one of the single most laughably silly and unscary things to ever stumble in front of a camera; he looks like something you would see in a fourth-rate carnival spookhouse. Secondly, the moderate gore is ridiculously fake and unconvincing, with the definite highlight occurring when this annoying uptight ultra-conservative woman gets electrocuted by a toaster.

A lot of 'alternative' comedy in Britain in the 1980s was insular, misguided, overly-political, and unfunny, and the worst of the Comic Strip Presents... stuff fell into this category. But this is at the other end - a remarkable film that works on different intellectual levels. Is Dennis a criminal mastermind or is he lying? Is he telling the truth, bluffing, double-bluffing, counter-doubly-bubbly-bluffingwhatever? I've probably watched Supergrass 20 or 30 times, and I still can't decide 100%. That's the wonderful thing.

the mario series is back, and in my opinion, better than ever. Galaxy is the most creative mario yet; even more so than super mario 64. the controls are great; some of the best for the wii. beautiful graphical design as well. the levels are very big, and the good old bosses are back. there is tons to explore in this game; definitely a high level of replay value. I only have 2 complaints: 1: the story is a little to similar to mario 64. and 2: the difficulty isn't very high; though it does require some patience.

This was a nice film . It had a interesting storyline , that was executed pretty well in the later half of the movie. But the acting was not that great . I was not a fan of most of the actors in the lead roles. The only actor I liked was William Shatner , his voice actor . And there was not that great chemistry between them . And not that bad as a whole . But the plot was just plain silly . I do not really understand what they were trying to get to . I just did not enjoy the story .

The minutiae of what 's involved in carrying out a robbery is what makes this one of the best of them. You need to take all of your belongings with you, and you need to keep an eye on your belongings to make sure you don’t leave any of them on the street. You don’t want to make the cops suspicious that you have anything that they can’t see. The only other thing that you want to be certain about is the location of all of your belongings, including the money.

In Michele Soavi 's confusing art-house zombie film , Dellamorte Dellamore , Rupert Everett plays Francesco , a caretaker in an Italian village who works to save the dying. Everett, who made his film debut here in 2004 with the horror-comedy The Sixth Sense , is an actor-slash-director who has made horror and science-fiction movies since he was in his twenties. He has been working in the New York indie film world since the mid-2000s, including a couple of films that are still going strong, and he's been making horror movies of all genres for years.

You thought after "Traumschiff Surprise" that German comedy can't get worse? It can. This comedy is yet another attempt at perpetuating stereotypes of gay men masked as a nice comedy. The initial concept (openly gay men in soccer sports) would have been a great opportunity to erase some stereotypes, but... The real intended message of the movie seems to be in what way gay men are oh-so-different from straight men. Absolutely silly, of course. Even gay sex is treated as being of less value than straight sex. This movie only tries to serve straight audiences wanting to laugh about stereotypical gay men.

I saw this version of Hamlet on television many years ago , and have seen every other version since , so i figured i should post my version, so you can tell the truth. _________________There's a place for everyone who wants a chance to do what's right and a place for everyone who wants the chance to do wrong. This is my first post to this forum . I'm sure i'm not the only person with a similar view on this, but i do think i have the right to post my own views.

Simply put , Paul Bettany and Jennifer Connelly were remarkable . The movie is less about the raw science of evolution, and more about their relationship . I don't mean to say that science can't make a good film. A good science movie can make me feel very passionate about something, but I wouldn't want to see such a film if I had to watch it for its science content alone. But there is another, perhaps even larger, issue at stake in this argument, which has nothing to do with the content of the film.

If you have seen the Telugu version of Gilli `` Okkadu '' you will find this to be very similar. The story of `` Okkadu '' revolves about a young man named Rama who goes to stay with Vyas, his mother's brother who is an officer in the royal army. This story begins with an old man and his son playing chess at night, when their chess set is broken and the pieces scattered about the ground. This is when Rama comes and takes pity on the old man. The old man asks who Rama is, because the young man is so tall.

One of the movies i just DIDN'T want to see. I got it in the sneak-preview, but damn, the acting was very bad! At the end of the movie (i still am surprised i watched the whole movie..) i wondered why i watched the movie.Also here in the netherlands, the writer of this movie (it's filmed from a book of Giphart) thought it was very bad, and was disappointed that his movie came out like this. Next time he wants a role in choosing people for the cast.

Van Sant copies Hitchcock's masterpiece shot for shot including some modern facets: a walkman, and nudity from Anne Heche. Unless you have a strong desire to see Ms. Heche naked there is absolutely NO reason to see this film instead of the original. Hitchcock's masterpiece is much better and Van Sant fails to realize that in hiding the nudity and the gore, the original shower scene is all the more terrifying. Ask Janet Leigh about that one. The acting is also much flatter and the technical aspects much less impressive.

This movie was completely stale and uninspired . The central premise of this movie was basically a bunch of stereotypical characters talking about their problems . It was just boring. The only reason the audience could care about any of it was the last 30 minutes of the movie . They got what they wanted in the ending. It was not exciting or thought provoking, it made me want to just leave the theater. Not because I didn't like it, but because I don't think the movie did a very good job at telling a story that I could care about.

The Fanglys is set in a small Texan town called Layton on the eve of Halloween as the townspeople treat all their children to their very own haunted house. It turns out that this isn't the only house that has come to their door, for there's been a strange visitor in town in the middle of the night... I'm looking forward to reviewing this one, as it was one of the few books that I thought I wouldn't like, but I enjoyed it. The characters were well-drawn and their personalities were believable.

Robert McKimson 's 'Acrobatty Bunny ' is one of the director 's finest shorts . Although the circus-based setting may not be very familiar to most viewers . McKimson gives the audience an inside look into what it's like to work in an animal circus. This film was awarded Best Short at the 2009 Golden Globe Awards and won Best Comedy at the 2010 New York Film Critics Online Award. McKimson also made the feature directorial debut of The Circus, a film which also earned Best Picture at the 2012 Academy Award for Best Live Action Short Subject.

This movie is like Happiness meets Lost in Translation with a Sixth Sense ending ( or maybe a Crying Game ending ) and the soundtrack was the bomb. Well that's a wrap. I will continue to watch it for a bit, and I will update this review accordingly. I love this movie so much. I hope the DVD release will happen. This has to be the most perfect movie I have seen in a LONG time. It had all kinds of characters, they all have their roles, the plot is interesting, and there are some great scenes.

I 'm a Christian , and I have watched pretty of Christian movies , but this one is too bad to watch .This movie is really bad in my view . First of all the movie starts in time ,but the movie does not stop .It's really bad , and so far it's the second biggest disappointment for me of all Christian movies .So I really want you to give this movie a fair rating , if you really want to see a Christian movie . If you want to understand what happened in the first movie, you are not going to read the whole article.

Saw this at the video store and thought I'd give it a try. Sounded like a good story and the cover looked good. That was it. The characters looked good, and the actor who played "Noel", was the most convincing, though he didn't have any heavy time in the movie. I find it really hard to give a movie a bad rating, but this is one, in a minute number, that gets it my book. As the movie went along I kept wanting it to get better but to no avail. Asthetically, it was good.

This movie was physically painful to sit through, maybe because (like many people my age, and younger) I grew up with Dr. Seuss and loved his books - funny, clever, whimsical and subversive at the same time. "The Cat in the Hat" sucks all of the interest and spark out of the story, and Mike Myer's performance as the Cat is mostly bewildering. Why the Borscht Belt accent, the unfunny patter, the inappropriate jokes, the charmless costume? I had to go back and re-read the books to see the real problem: the books are SIMPLE.

`` Admissions '' is a fine drama even though they 're are some problems with the ending . Lauren Ambrose , the daughter of one of the biggest crime families in the state, is about to become a mother. This is the story about her life . The movie is directed by and is based on , and features the actress and her daughter . This is the third part of the popular series . The sequel will also have her in it and she will star as well . This is the last time I see her in this type of movies .

Waters's contribution to the world of cinema has to be searched with a telescope, and then when/if something is found (by sheer chance and lots of luck) it has to be analyzed with a microscope.And after it has been analyzed it would get discarded into the lab's "rubbish bin for totally useless things". One single atom of that microscope is worth all of his movies combined.CB is etremely campy, and intentionally so. The usual JW stuff: comic-strip dialogue, simplistic plot, moronically cheerful characters, chewing-gum pop, overacting etc.

I love this movie. Yes, the main character lies, but that's why it's called "big fat liar". Even though this kid runs away to Hollywood, it doesn't give kids the idea that they can. Besides, he doesn't just do it for fun or to get away from anything, he does it to regain trust. I don't think it was just one big ad for Universal Studios, because I liked how it gave an inside view of what it's like for kids who don't know how cool movie-making is.

A Chicago couple , Dillon and Dougherty , are falsely accused of killing their daughter . People begin to wonder why they would kill a child. They wonder why they killed her? Did she say something she didn’t like, or maybe she was just trying to get away from her father? Did the child say something about his parents? Did they have any problems with their parents in the past? Or was it all a mistake? We know nothing about what happened to the girl. Dillon and Dougherty are both married to the same woman . They also have children.

It´s long time that I and my wife didn´t see such a boring thriller . It´s definitively NOT a gripping suspense movie . There are plenty of tense situations, but the movie is neither suspenseful nor interesting . This movie just does not have any mystery or intriguing plot. It´s just too predictable. The story is almost identical to a typical action thriller which I have also seen many times before . In this movie you are basically watching two people involved in a relationship and trying to outsmart a killer . It starts out with the police finding a body that looks like a woman and they believe that it could be a murder .

This is by far one of the best films that India has ever made. Following are the plus points of the film...Wonderful direction, cinematography and editing, the editing is very smooth and the timing of changeovers is excellent.Even though the film shows the life of Mumbai Policemen and their hardships, it never gets boring or sympathetic.Mind-blowing acting by lead actor Nana Patekar. One can surely hope that he gets nominated for the Best actor for the academy awards.Controlled violence. The violence is controlled and the film doesn't become a bloody mess.No stupid songs as in usual Indian movies.

This is a fascinating documentary about a 15 year old black lad who is accused of murdering a tourist in Florida and the subsiquent court case that follows. What this film shows is how corrupt the American police system is and how easy it can really be to convict an innocent man and how a senile old fool who thinks one black man looks very much like another and sod it if he rots in jail because i said he was the man who murdered my wife.The star is the defence lawyer who is brilliant at not only his job in court but he also did he what the police should have done all along.

Got this the other day from the Creators on DVD. I saw this advertised in a free magazine whilst family were stopping in a hotel, had never heard anything about it. After reading it was filmed on Balmedie beach i just had to buy it. I used to take the kids to the dunes in the film all the time whilst living in Aberdeen.1st off Im not a big Sci-Fi fan (baring Star Wars) I was really just wanting to see what they had done with this film location, I was presently surprised.

I usually do n't categorize a moving as boring . I am not big on action flicks and my senses are just not trained to keep my mouth shut about it . I prefer films that are . . I did not go to school to do anything but dance . I have been dancing in public for years . I am a dancer by profession . My favorite dance was ballet . The only film I have seen in my entire life that I did not like is The Great Escape and I think that is because I liked it too much at the time because I watched it on the way home from a ballet lesson .

This is a new Barbie movie. The graphics were really good. They made the movie seem partially realistic. I used to do ballet and this movie made me want to continue it. This movie was kind of like a Cinderella movie but a little bit different. A father of 12 princesses gets very sick. His cousin poisons him and wants the throne. The girls find a secret magical land thanks to their dead mother's stories. Its up to them to save their father and society. With the help of their handsome prince.

Love this little film , that reminds me somewhat of the original Japanese gem , SHALL WE DANCE ? ( or at least the English version )

I first saw the gem in English on YouTube in 2007 and have been a fan ever since, as the original Japanese is worth watching in its own right. Now I’ve seen a new Japanese version (which I have yet to watch) in Japanese and found it really well made, in both English and Japanese, and so I thought I might give this gem a go, too!

TART is the worst movie I've seen this year, and that includes both the Affleck/J.Lo bomb GIGLI and the Rob Zombie borefest HOUSE OF 1000 CORPSES. I don't know if that's a fair comparison seeing that TART was made two years earlier and probably has a budget half that of even the low-budget 1000 CORPSES. Regardless, all three movies suffer from the same shortcomings: horrible script, horrible acting, horrible direction. *** SPOILERS *** (although I honestly don't think there's anything to spoil)TART is about a group of super-spoiled private school kids.

this film was probably the best "scary film" i've seen in years. chilling might be a more accurate description. the ending was unexpected and therefore took me by surprise. if it has any flaw it would be the overuse of the whole meaning of life concept. since noone truly knows that answer, you definitely sail into murky waters when you incorporate that concept into a movie. put that aside and the movie is quite enjoyable. carly pope should emerge as one of the next bright young stars in the film industry.

When HOPPITY GOES TO TOWN he discovers nothing but bad news for his little insect neighbors in the Lowlands. Can this honest, good-natured grasshopper save his sweetheart, Miss Honey Bee, from the machinations of the evil C. Bagley Beetle - and also lead his friends to a safe new home - before it's too late?While not one of the great animated features (a very new art at the time this film was created) HOPPITY is an enjoyable film which should bring pleasure to uncritical viewers. Technically it is well made, with animation of a generally high quality.

FBI Agents Mulder and Scully get assigned to probe the mystery of what happened to an Arctic drilling team , only to learn they had no idea what really happened...

Tuesday, September 20, 2010

This episode, as well as next week's episode, may be a precursor to the next season of The X-Files, but we have to wonder how we're going to get through it. I'd like to think the writers will take this story and get to the meat and potatoes of this investigation, but we have to remember, this show has had the potential to be something special.

This movie surprised me. The box is misleading, the tagline is misleading and the costumes and tone of the film are misleading. The movie is quite gory, well-acted and beautifully shot. The special-effects are top-notch and seem to be ahead of their time, until you realize this movie came out in 1979, not in 1963 like it's tone would suggest. It is a unique take on the Dr. Moreau story, and one of the better versions filmed. The first fifteen minutes are the highlight and the most shocking, but the film doesn't ever really fall apart.

This movie starts off on the wrong foot and never really gets it going. The first scene shows a Life Flight helicopter landing and just outside the window you can distinctly see mountains in the background. For those of you who might not ever have been to Houston there is no elevation change. The city sits just above sea level and a 5 ft. incline is considered a big hill. To go along with that scenery, any shots outside of the hospital immediately tell the viewer that they are not in Houston. The trees are all missing leaves or are pine trees, neither of which Houston has very much of.

`` Mr. and Mrs. Smith '' is one of the not too well known early American Hitchcock 's movie . In the story, Mr. Smith (James Mason) is on a train heading back to New York City in the aftermath of the Great War when he has a startling and disturbing encounter with his wife (Mackenzie Fenton), who is also returning to New York City. Mr. and Mrs. Smith '' has a lot to it . I can't give it all at once . "It begins in a car on the train. In a car on the train.

When the noble Hanabusa clan is decimated by the usurping Samanosuke clan , loyal retainer Kogenta ( Jun Fujimaki ) , now known by his birth name Koga no Hiyori ( Jun Kunihiro ) , goes on the run from the invading forces of the usurper's brother , the evil Lord Sado , and returns to the village of Koga . Kogenta and the rest of the townspeople, however , are determined to fight on. When Kogenta gets into a tavern fight , a fight with a drunken Sado ( Eiji Kawai ), they are saved by an angelic being, the Lord of Heaven , who gives Kogenta a weapon .

Give director Stanley Tong of Jackie Chan's Super Cop and Rumble in the Bronx, and what do you get? You receive a series of kung fu fights and a lack of Magoo-like madness.The limited plot has Magoo (Leslie Nielsen) put into an international plot, where he steals a world-renowned gem. Of course he has no idea what he is doing. In fact, he has no idea that he had the gem.Within thirty minutes you could get very bored watching this. There are some very funny moments though like when he is cooking the chicken.

Oh what the heck , I 'll reveal the secret : this movie stinks ! Yeah there are some nifty moments and it's a blast to watch, but don't let it take away from it's overall greatness! This is a film I'll have a lot of reasons to recommend to any movie goer. The only thing I might be missing is more of the plot lines and action scenes from other films. The film is a bit slow, and I thought there was a bit more in the way of plot twists, but I still love how it moves.

I thought that this movie might be a good spoof , or at least a good independent comedy like Friday the 13th. It would be so much funnier than Friday. But it's not. There's so little humor in it, that it can only be funny to those who know how to laugh, and it is the worst movie in this list. If you're not laughing, then you're just wasting your time, so skip this movie. 3 comments:

I don't even remember what the movie is about!

Visconti's Death in Venice qualifies as one of the most beautiful films ever made. While watching, we acknowledge we are in the hands of a visionary genius. Endlessly opulent Death in Venice surely is; but in other important ways, it's an unsatisfying film. Thomas Mann writes with contempt and from a distance of von Aschenbach's literary career and output; of his imperious manner, his layer-upon-layer of programmed, self-conscious behavior. When Tadzio appears and obsession arises, it's evident that Aschenbach hasn't the slightest idea who he is beneath his Gilded-Age trappings and carefully lived life.

With actors like Depardieu and Richard it is really a hard task to make a dull movie . But Weber’s production seems to have hit the mark in every department and it shows in the movie . It is not the first time I have said that but this is a movie made with passion and effort . The movie tells a good story . The dialogue is very well acted by the main actors and the plot line is simple and easy to follow . But Weber’s production gives us more than what it is capable of doing . I really liked the music .

It 's clear that for this film they wanted to have the story line driven by the characters . But it seems like they have changed it since the film's release . The story is still about these characters . But now there is a bit more action . And they also wanted to give the audience the impression that they are fighting some kind of a war . . . So there are two war stories . The first is a war between two different kinds of men . . . but it has very little in common with the other kind of war .

You don't have to be a tamilian to appreciate this gem of a movie.I don't know a word of tamil and saw this movie only because a friend had recommended it to me.Understanding a movie without knowing the language is quite tough but I could make out the story because the lead actors (and actresses)emoted really well.And the little girl was really cute (she wasn't irritating like child actors in most hindi movies).The story is really touching and hats off to Mr. Ratnam for trying something different.The relationship between the parents and their children are shown quite realistically.

I remember watching Police Squad! when it first came on ABC in 1982 and I thought it was a very funny show, thanks to the many sight gags, non sequitors and scripts filled with word play. In one episode, there was a line where a man named Once was shot twice. But unfortunately, ABC canceled the show after only six episodes. I felt it deserved a much longer run but a network executive thought the show demanded too much attention of the viewer because of all the sight gags in each episode.

I watched this movie with my mother. She is 81 yrs.old and was raised to be a bigot. She even acknowledges this. I don't think she really understood what was happening, she had already made up her mind that the kid was guilty. Scary. I felt for this child and his family. What torture they went through and remained faithful. That is true faith. Back to the movie. I was disgusted by the police force and their ineptitude. I am so glad that this public defender was chosen to work this case.

This movie is certainly well-constructed , beginning and ending in the dark , with focus on Lili Smith /Schmidt , who is still alive and a woman , not a girl , and then the main focus on the children of Schmidt , who were all killed, with a focus on their children , some of them still in their teens . It is indeed a haunting story but it has a great ending . I think that I have seen it a few times since it has come out , I have always enjoyed it , and this time I really liked it .

I have so much hope for the sequel to Gen-X. Luckily, my hopes have came true. You got a whole bunch of action, comedy...silly comedy, and surprises. I think the newcomer Edison, is really a hit in the movie, but I really find Sam's 'Alien' stupidly annoying with English. Although the movie had some flaws with the robot graphics and the silly dialogue, the action always keeps it strong. The action set-up is much stronger than the 1st.This movie is getting more of an American feel since 60% of the movie is in English from the Cantonese.

This is easily one of the worst movies I 've seen in a long long time ( and I 've seen a LOT of them, actually ), and it seems like this one is going to end up not being the end of the world, I can 't help but think this was the result of a 're-boot' of a movie I loved. I mean, you don't have to go too deep into the story to realize that, but in a way it is still a good story, and a better story than 'Sideways' I guess.

The other reviewer was completely correct about this one . The writing was awful , the acting was awful , all the dialogue was poor . There are only a handful of scenes where I actually care about the character . The best part of this film was the ending, I just wish they hadn’t killed all the actors. The rest of the film was a mess . This review does not necessarily reflect the opinions or beliefs of Cinema Blend or the owners of this review site. The film was well acted , well directed , and well scripted , but I just did not like the story and characters .

I recently rented this promising mini series, I didn't even know they had adapted it for television. I was really looking forward to it since the book Icon is one of the best spy thrillers I have ever read. What a disappointment it was. The plot only loosely resembles the one in the book, the characters are completely miscast and there's some appalling acting. A shame really. The story behind Icon is perfect for the silver screen, but I think television budgets just aren't big enough for a decent adaptation of this spectacular book.Forsyth deserves much, much better than this.

I love just about everything the late Al Adamson directed in his long and varied career , but `` The Adventures of Baron Munchausen, or: The Emperor's New Clothes '' is not one of my favourites, despite some brilliant scenes of slapstick humor. It was never meant to be. I think because I grew up in the 1970s and saw my own parents in a much happier time. My mum and dad didn't have much to say to each other, apart from the occasional "I love you, Mum!" at Christmas and birthdays, or "Honey, what's for supper?"

Unreal !!!!!!!!. After reading the initial reviews posted by alleged reviewers ,I was shocked to find that almost all of the initial reviews, 38 , all rated this film a 10. Upon comparison with other great films, these reviewers felt that the Quick and the Undead is a better film than,The 6th Sense(8.2), Saving Private Ryan(8.4), Lord of the Rings( 8.7),Godfather(9.5), Gladiator(8.1) and Dawn of the Dead ( 7.8) to name a few.

Watching this film today I got the feeling this thing was missing about 10 to 15 minutes or so from the beginning of the story. John Wayne rides up on this trading post/saloon out in the middle of nowhere to meet with the owner about some robberies. All he sees is the signs of a massacre, some dead bodies, signs of a fight and no one alive in sight. That's because the owner's daughter is hidden in a secret room, the kind you find in old English murder mysteries.The reason you find those hidden rooms in those kind of stories is that they were formerly priestholes.

SPOILER ALERT!!!! This was my son's review of the movie, which he wanted me to post.He wrote this, I swear.With Malcolm in the Middle's Frankie Muniz, and Nickelodeon's Amanda Bynes, they get to go to show business. They team up on the actor Paul Giamatti. He stole Jason Shepherd's essay on Big Fat Liar, and makes it in to a movie. Jason (Frankie Muniz) and Kaylee (Amanda Bynes) have to go to L.A. to get it back. Jason's dad does not believe that he wrote that essay.

I remember watching this movie on TV a few years back . It was so bad , I can only imagine the things the makers were thinking when they wrote this script . This is definitely one of the worst horror movies I have ever seen . I know there are not a great many horror movies out there that I like , but this film is just bad , and that is saying a lot because the makers of the film were so bad , it is hard to think this could be any worse . The film is also one of the most unoriginal horror movies ever made .

I watched this movie for the first time the other day and was bored to tears. I guess I just was looking for some flashback to the wonderful series that I remembered. I watched The Mod Squad television show religiously back in the day and it was fantastic. It was action packed and the relationship the 3 had with Greer was endearing. There wasn't any of that here. When Greer was murdered you get the idea that these 3 could have cared less. The actor who portrayed Pete is a really good actor but they wrote his part like he was mentally challenged.

This film is supposedly about three young idealistic people , two of whom join the Naxalite movement and blah blah blah... The plot is actually about the life of one of the protagonists. I think it would be more effective to have all three characters played by the same actor
but I can't figure out who to go for, so I would have to make a judgement call. If I were to make this film I would play one
of the kids as either a child or grown up

This is the second time I have reviewed a film by this author.

Personally, I don't like a lot of b/w movies, but there's something magical about this movie. The movie starts with Elizabeth Lane (Barbara Stanwyck). "Liz" writes a magazine column about how she's the 'Martha Stewart' of Connecticut. Of course, she's lying. This becomes a problem when her publisher, Mr Yardley, asks her to play host to a NAVY sailor over Christmas. In addition, Mr Yardley, who's going to be alone for Christmas, invites himself up to the farm for the Christmas party.

Found this film for one dollar ($1.00) and the film was a complete waste of time. Reb Brown,(Mark Hardin), played a military adviser in South America and was successful in capturing the leader of rebel soldiers operating out of the dense jungles. However, Mark joins the opposite side after some horrible tortures were inflicted or women and men. In one scene as Mark is having a drink in a hotel bar, his eyes catch the glimpse of sexy long legs Sandra Spencer (Shannon Tweed),"Dead Sexy",01.

Ron Hall pulls a triple threat as he writes , directs and stars in 'Vampire Assassins ' . Derek Washington stars in " Vampain " on Lifetime . With over 300 million in global box office sales "Vampire Assassins " will have a global impact and resonate with audiences around the globe. I am grateful for the opportunity to make this movie . I'm also grateful to everyone who worked hard on the movie including the producers , director and crew. I appreciate everyone's efforts and wish them all the very best as they move forward . Derek Washington has always taken a positive and caring approach to all of his endeavors .

This is one of my 3 favorite movies . I 've been out on the water since I was 13 and my family and me are still out on the water and fishing the same spots. I just love the music and scenery and it makes it a really good vacation. I think it might have to be one of my favorites. We have been on the water in the area a few times, including a few trips with friends to see the boat show in town. We go to the local campground every year, and it's really nice.

I have watched THE ROOT OF ALL EVIL with the avowed object of refuting this so called scientific atheist . I do so out of a desire to enlighten. However, when I do so, I see it as nothing more than a tactic used by religious fanatics to deceive a public who do not want to be deceived. To prove my point, I will share with you a recent article by the self proclaimed ‘science’ writer in this very blog who states that God created the earth and all life and that He created the sun, moon, stars and all that is in them.

First of all, i have nothing against Christianity. i believe, every person has the right to believe what he or she chooses. But i cannot imagine how dumb a person has to be to believe this! What a waste of believers' money. They'd better use it to feed some starving families in the third world countries. I don't want to talk about talk acting or plot of this "movie", because I couldn't find any of those in this. Story's simple - two reporters, one (A) is atheist, the other (B) for some sake has abandoned religion.

( Spoilers more than likely ... nothing really important you could n't have figured out yourselves ) Yeah , it's kinda cool to know you could actually do things that are more important that the game does not seem to allow. You know , do things for real , not just do things in the game . It gives it more purpose and I think that it is more enjoyable and entertaining. It makes it fun. Well it's not just me , most people seem to feel the same way I do. I love that we can make the game fun for the player.

I suppose I 'm supposed to take something like this with a grain of salt . These laboratory movies (or whatever they're called now) are so much more expensive to make than a movie like that made in a big studio. And they don't always turn out as well as they should.
