That was the gist of a comment made during a recent segment on MSNBC in response to the ongoing controversy surrounding President Barack Obama’s healthcare plan. When the segment began, host Ed Schultz was talking about the recent news reports about the Obama administration being reluctant to release the text of his healthcare plan, which some claim has led to confusion among voters.

This film is really really bad, it is not very well done and is a lack lustre attempt at something but I am not sure what. I watched it and was very disappointed. It promised a lot, but delivered nothing at all. The characters are shallow and wooden, and the music, if you can call it that, is dreadful. There are of course all the creatures and animated beings, but they are so poorly done that it does not come across as anything other than a third rate movie.

There were nice characters in here , played by pleasant-looking actors and actresses , plus it had a famous band in it! Well, you can't deny that. I have never watched the movies in the theater , so this is my first time in a theater as well. But still I liked this movie. There were very nice characters in it, and the band was nice too! The movie was a good time-killer. It had a lot of humor in it as well. It was quite an interesting movie. You will not regret seeing it. And you will like it.

In America, the Jewish Jonathan Safran Foer (Elijah Wood) collects personal belongings of his family for recollection. A few moments before dying, his grandmother gives an old photograph of his grandfather with a woman called Augustine in Ukraine. Jonathan contacts the Odessa Heritage Tours, a family agency in Ukraine, to guide him to the location where the picture had been taken to find Augustine, and together with the interpreter Alex (Eugene Hutz), his grandfather and a weird dog, they travel in an old car searching the missing past of Jonathan's family.

* * * SLIGHT SPOILERS * * * This installment of the Full Moon franchise changes the storyline a bit as the heroes are taken captive by a mysterious force that is trying to take over the earth. As the story unfolds, it seems that more questions are being asked than answers. We have a new villain in this issue. If you missed this arc, don't worry, there is some new info here and there and we'll be posting a bunch of new news and stories about it later. But I can't wait any longer! The art is really, really good!

I watched this movie the other night , and I have to admit , it was quite possibly the best film that I have seen in a long while, in a weird way I actually like the film as much as I dislike the book . there are several reasons why that is so , but one of which i can think off is because the author of the film has done an incredible job making the movie as well . my favorite part of the film , and the reason why the book was not that great , is the way it shows the story .

Nothing really unpredictable in this movie, but a solid flick in all respects. Everything from acting to cinematography was solid. Not a perfectly linear plot line, but there wasn't anything you couldn't see coming. Perhaps a tad melodramatic at points, but again, a fairly decent movie none the less. Definitely worth checking out. If in doubt of what film to rent over the weekend, give this a go. Though you may not feel like running out and buying it, I found it to be quite worth while.

'Be With Me' is almost the ultimate wallpaper movie. Just leave it running in the background. chat amongst yourselves and return to it whenever you like and at some point it'll end. Alas, as I watched it alone, and so I felt like I almost watched the world's worst, longest and most drippingly sentimental beer commercial by the time I just about managed to keep my eyes open as the end credits rolled; and I then managed (just a) a few more moments of wakefulness to witness a 'Thank you' to the movie's sponsors - which included Asia Pacific Breweries.

This terrible moovie is fun on many levels - the moost obvious is the lame, fake-looking bird puppet which floats around the cheap sets, without ever flapping it wings (like it was on a string, perhaps? ), attacking model trains and toy cars. The "science" is asinine - a masonic atom gun?? And what's up with the enormous amounts of Brylcream in everyone's hair? I guess the 50's were the Slimeball decade! Well, this bird puppet apparently comes from "some god-forsaken anti-matter universe", and it's here to build a nest & lay eggs in New York.

What a terrible misfire. Not only the title but the idea is the same as that Jane Fonda, George Segal vehicle of a few decades ago. Why? I wonder, someone with the clout of Jim Carrey will, not only star, but also produce this tired, ugly, pointless excuse for a comedy. He could be taking comedy to a whole new level, instead, he goes for what he may assume is safe territory. Money, money, grosses, Christmas. But I'm sure this uncomfortable mess will have very short legs.

In 1895, in a small village in Japan, the wife of the litter carrier Gisaburo (Takahiro Tamura), Seki (Kazuko Yoshiyuki), has an affair with a man twenty-six years younger, Toyiji (Tatsuya Fuji). Toyiji becomes jealous of Gisaburo and plots with Seki to kill him. They strangle Gisaburo and dump his body inside a well in the woods, and Seki tells the locals that Gisaburo moved to Tokyo to work. Three years later, the locals gossip about the fate of Gisaburo, and Seki is haunted by his ghost.

I'm not sure where to start with this. In short, it was a disappointing movie. Having taught the novella, I was aware that it would be a hard story to turn into a movie. The movie has a couple of interesting lines (mainly between Alfred and Aschenbach) but it doesn't represent the debate on art that basically shapes the novella. For one, I was expecting an older Aschenbach and a younger Tadzio. In the book, Tadzio is fourteen, but he is described as pure, ideal, innocent, whereas in the movie he reeks of sexuality and is a tease.

This movie was obviously made with a very low budget, but did they have to make it so obvious? It looked like they made no effort to make the "future" look in the least futuristic. For example, the first scene takes place in an 80's office building and all the cars that get blown up are from the late 70's (I assume they didn't want to blow up cars that cost more than $500). Additionally, its pretty obvious that Don "the Dragon" is driving his personal car during the movie (after all, he did partially fund the film).

For me, this is another one of those films that I got to see off of the Los Angeles based "Z" Channel when it was in service. And it was another one of those movies that I saw when I was young...and learned that there was a world out there...one I did not want to accept.Moving to Los Angeles and getting to watch international cinema became quite the guilty pleasure hobby of mine and to date, no premiere channel programming has matched the "Z" Channel in its showing of international films.

ROCK STAR is a well-told Hollywood-style rendition of the tale based on fact actually on how Ripper became Rob Halford's replacement for Judas Priest. Mark Wahlberg poured on his likable boy-ish charm and performed with believable admirably, something he has been known to do since the release of BOOGIE NIGHTS.Stephen Herek, no stranger to musically-themed movies, takes the audience through the wonders of the breakneck lifestyle of an extinct species, the Hair-Metal Rock God. Wahlberg's "Izzy" acts as the film's host plays the everyman who gets to see his wish come true.

I have watched two episodes so far, I really like it. Even though I am no longer in college, it makes me miss the wonderful college life. I wish that I spent a little more time socializing. I kind of identify myself with rusty. When I was rushing a fraternity, my big brother was not like Cappie at all, I wish that I had a big brother like him. So if a show like this can actually make people to identify themselves with the characters, then it is a pretty good show.It is more realistic than American pie with less explicit sex jokes.

Why do people make bad movies? Didn't anyone working on the picture know that what they were making had no point? There is something about this picture that threw me off, besides the fact that I found this "movie" to be unrealistic, pathetic, and POORLY ACTED. I admire them for the try, but the "actors" in the movie at times seem to be trying to hard and no single character has substance or says anything mildly intelligent. This movie deserves zero stars. But I did not have that option, so it gets a 1.

This movie was really funny . The people that were expecting to see an Oscar worthy comedy , should get a little surprise . It was one of my favorite films of 2014 . The movie is based on a book written by , which has been translated in many foreign languages and languages like Hindi , Urdu , Bengali . The original book was published by , and was released in 2002 . The story is based on a murder , a murder that is taking place in London and a murder that is going on in Delhi . The movie deals with the murder in Delhi , and some characters are from different parts of Delhi .

THE MERCHANT OF FOUR SEASONS was Rainer Werner Fassbinder 's first shot at mainstream acceptance . In a turbulent career spanning nearly 60 years, Fassbinder worked tirelessly to become the leading artist of his time . Fassbinder came to international prominence as a sculptor and installation artist, and then in the 1980s, as a painter . He has had numerous exhibitions both nationally and internationally, many of his most popular works appearing in major galleries, museums and in private collections. Although many of his works have received mixed reviews , Fassbinder's sculptures of the past 30 years have garnered a great deal of critical attention .

If you are a bit masochistic and like to waste some time you should try this one. I wasted enough time myself watching it, so I will waste no more explaining why it is so awful. Be warned!!! Oh, I see that I have to fill 10 lines or more. Here we go: every year or so some people think it is fun to start shooting a low budget film about the scary monsters of the underground, that hopefully will prove to be some sort of a hit. The Cavern is one of those.

Veteran TV director Ted Post treats us to a plodding, confused and ultimately pointless story lifted from Column B of the Harold Robbins Big Book Of Plots. Set against a smoggy Phoenix skyline, post-Charlies Angles Jaclyn Smith takes a star turn as "the woman whose eyes are mysteriously shadowed at all times" while JFK impersonator James Franciscus lounges around the fringes. Mannix goes western, monkeys are abused, models lean against classic cars, and Smith is constantly upstaged by Sybil Danning until a giallo style wrap-up brings the whole sorry mess to a bitter end.Oh yeah, and Bob Mitchum is in there too.

I am a chess player and I wanted to like this film. Trouble is, the content could have been fitted in a 30-minute documentary.There were lots of shots of corridors being walked down and Kasparov gazing out in the hall where he won the World Championship. There were other shots of Kasparov being walked round the site of the 1997 match and being told where he sat and where Deep Blue was located. This just looked like filler.Also, I didn't find it interesting to see in detail where Deep Blue was now and seeing an IBM techie trying, unsuccessfully to 'open' it.

I would have been about 11 years old when this movie was first released. All these years later at 37 and I had no qualms hiring it on DVD. Great entertainment for all ages. And what about the song The Rainbow Connection? See:Why are there so many songs about rainbows And what's on the other side? Rainbows are visions, but only illusions, And rainbows have nothing to hide. So we've been told and some choose to believe it I know they're wrong, wait and see.

The only reason I did n't fall asleep during this movie is because the seats were not that comfortable . The storyline wasnt very interesting. I felt there wasnt enough plot and I couldnt understand why these characters was fighting each other. I felt like there was a lack of action, its kinda like watching a cartoon, with nothing going on and nothing moving. The acting was okay, but not exceptional. My only complain is the beginning, the scenes where the characters is on the island, is boring and I felt there were more interesting scenes. And the ending was too long.

I can't believe this movie has 6 stars on IMDb. This is one of the worst movies I've ever seen that wasn't an episode of Mystery Science Theater 3000. The plot is predictable. I couldn't bring myself to care about any of the characters. The dialog is cheesy. Several moments in the movie actually made me groan out loud (including Kiefer Southerland's crazy neighbor and the incredibly lame joke that ends the movie). Jeff Bridges' accent is goofy - I can't tell what country he's supposed to be from.

First of all, I believe that this movie is much more appreciated by viewers who have actually read Joseph Conrad's "Heart Of Darkness", the book that was the literary basis for the movie. With that said, I believe that this movie is astounding. It is an excellent war film that doesn't so much concentrate on the gore and brutality of the Vietnam Conflict, but more the psychological toll that it took on the young, inexperienced "kids" who were sent to fight it. Coppola showed real genius in the art of film-making, using many visuals to help tell the story.

What a trip down memory lane.Do not look for great acting, believable plot lines, or anything resembling a quality movie.This is pure blaxploitation at it's finest. Outrageous outfits, unrepeatable dialog, objectification of women, and the sleaziest cops you can imagine.This vanity piece by the "Godfather of Rap," Rudy Ray Moore, who left us for good last week is the standard by which all blaxploitation is measured.You not only see blaxploitation at it's finest, but get glimpses of his comedy genius, and see why his records were kept under the counter.

Any one who writes that this is any good there kid may have worked on it or put money in to this god-awful college experiment. It was lousy, slow, and painful to watch. Running time of only about 84 minutes, it felt like three and half hours. The only person to blame is the director, who knows nothing on how to direct a scene, where to place the camera! 95% of this dreadful movie was shoot by long master shots. Two or three people in the frame talking or yelling forever( or what seems like forever), No close-ups!!

This picture hit the movie screens on June 6th 1980, starring Stephen Macht as Sergeant Thor, Avery Schreiber as Captain Comelius Butt, J.D. Hinton as Buzz and starring Playmate of the year Dorothy Stratton. The picture starts with the police infinity roaming space looking for I guess criminals. There ship is suddenly attacked by an unknown space ship. Enters Sergeant Thor and his partner Buzz as they try to figure out who the unknown ship belongs to. When failing they call on Captain Comelius who instructs his crew to fight back. Enters the gorgeous Dorothy Stratton, who plays the role of Galaxina who is man made robot.

I saw this film at the 2002 Toronto International Film Festival.This is the first Indian film I 've seen in the US. The story is based on the life of Bhagavan.I have never heard of this film before. The main attraction of the film has been the story of Bhagavan and the events that he goes through. It was a great movie to see him grow up. The main story is interesting too but it seems that some scenes were made more dramatic than they needed to be, and some of the fights had to be made a bit stronger.

Who said it had to be believable ? Do yourself a favor and turn off your ration before you sit down and listen to this, just in case it's true, which it very well may well not be

Quote:

Originally Posted by michaelb

I think you'll find it is quite possible that you are seeing what we have seen for quite a long time. It's been a while. __________________
I will go where you will not goI will do what you dare not doAnd I will do it because I love you. I can't believe you are going to get so worked up over nothing.

I believe I share the same psychological outlook on the world with Kieslowski . He is Polish , I am French . We look at the same world , the same people and the same questions. We are all looking for answers , the same is true for every person . We are looking for truth and answers to some of our questions. I read somewhere once that if you ask the question , Kieslowski will look at you like a dog and he will tell you to go to hell . And you can be sure he knows exactly what he means .

Oh how awfully this movie is ! I do n't know if it is a horror film or a drama film or a romance movie or a science fiction film... but it is not any film genre that is not my favorite! I do n't like all horror, thriller or action movies ... but I like this movie all the way ! It is a movie I would recommend all horror lovers watch ! I loved it all the way!!! I am sure you all know how much I love the movie ! I didn't like it much ...

Oh boy . Films like this really bother me . If this movie is supposed to close to truth , this is one of the most twisted . This film is made up of two parts : First half is about the real world . This is about the story about a real life events . The other part of the movie is a fictional movie . This is the part about the fictional world . It is a funny part because it is not based on reality . So if you think it is a true story about a real event , you would think this film would be based on that .

There was n't much thought put into the story line on many fronts . This is a good action movie, but it's like watching a remake of the old Star Wars saga. I enjoyed it, but there is still a ton that could be done to fix some of the flaws in the story . A good action flick, but too much of a plot, and characters, that aren't fleshed out or fully fleshed out. I think that it can be a better film because of these things, but at the end it still wasn't a good film, and that's the point.

I am a chess player and I wanted to like this film . Trouble is , the content could have been better . There is not enough of a story to take me to anywhere new . Its a great movie , it has some of the best sound effects ever made , and the action is great . What I don't like is the acting in it . I don't really understand all the dialogue , and there are so many bad lines , you can hardly tell what the characters are talking about . It just seems a bit too much.

I have recently found this film on one of my husband 's VHS tapes ( the blank variety which he doesn't know how to make) and I am a little disappointed in it because I have never seen any of his films, but I do like the film, so I'm looking forward to getting the next DVD out to enjoy. I don't care what you think of his films, I just want to be entertained, and I like the way this one was done. It's just a little off putting to me but it's like I have no idea of how it was made.

Monster of Mexico I do agree is the weakest of the modern Scooby Doo movies, mainly because of the weak plot and how predictable it all was. Loch Ness Monster however, is a considerable improvement, with gorgeous animation, honestly Scotland looked beautiful. The music is good, and the plot is well thought out. Plus, there is some great dialogue, and the voice acting was fabulous, with Casey Kasem a consistent delight as Shaggy, and the beautiful Scottish singer Sheena Easten a pleasant surprise in a guest starring role.

Gordon Scott with his well coiffed hair , hourglass figure and weird pidgin English has to be the worst of the bunch. I hate him, because he's a douchebag who's been trying to sell us all for years now, and has only gotten worse as the years have gone on. I guess I just hate the fact that he gets to come back again, so I guess I need to make myself hate someone else. So far he's managed to get to me twice before I've decided to hate him back. So I guess he has some balls.

This is a beautiful, yet simple movie about one man, driven to find an answer, an answer he doesn't necessarily need but has structured his whole life around. It is heartrending, it is hilarious, it is glorious, it is tormenting, it is delicate and dynamic, I say it's genius.I have read Jonathan Safran Foer's book Everything is Illuminated (mainly because I heard Elijah Wood was starring in the movie adaptation), and I was just enraptured by the characters. I laughed out loud more than once.

A look at three geishas who are way past their prime. Now they look back on their pasts with fondness and bemoan their present. Kin (played by Floating Weeds' Haruko Sugimura) has sworn off men and has made a good living as a moneylender; everyone on the block owes her. The other two, Nobu and Tamae, wish they could land husbands, but are not foolish enough to believe they ever will. Meanwhile, their children - one has a son and one a daughter - are both about to get married (not to each other).

What are Forest Whitaker and Clifton Collins Jr. doing in this ? Light It Up is a ridiculously melodramatic piece of cinema set in the early 90’s. It starts with the opening shot of Clifton at an open-mic night with his friends:

In the background, Clifton and his friends are being introduced. In the foreground, the audience sits. In the background there is a man with his arm around the shoulder of a beautiful woman, holding a guitar in his lap, who has her head down while looking at a screen behind him. She is trying to concentrate on what is on the screen.

The initiation to the local sport team involves taking the newbies out to the corn fields and guess what ? ? They get shot. There are no winners and there is always blood. This year there were a lot of blood shed this weekend. I was not surprised but I have to admit my shock was a little bit less at the number of people shot on Saturday night after the game had ended. I guess I expected a little bit of that after all the talk about how there should be no gun violence in the community, but there was plenty on the way.

Help! Once again, Paul Schrader has sabotaged his own intentions with dull, pedantic storytelling. I rearranged a vacation so that I could see this "world premiere." What a mistake! Why did Schrader even want to make an Exorcist film? Lofty intentions are fine, but if I wanted 2 hours of theological babble, I would visit my nephew's Sunday school. Father Merrin's struggle with his faith, as presented in his younger days, is a potentially interesting subject. But an Exorcist movie needs more! The relentlessly draggy presentation, along with ridiculous special effects, makes for a strange production.

So unfortunately me and my mate watched this!!! It was showing on a Sky channel over here called "Zone Horror" which basically shows crappy B-movie horror films 24/7. It was a boring Friday night, so decided to have a laugh and give this one a look. Apart from the atrocious acting, the awful plot, the dire effects, the shoddy camera work and the brain numbing ridiculousness of it all, it was OK, LOL!!! In all seriousness it was quite a laugh picking holes in it and laughing at the goofy actors.

I went to Crooked Earth to see a piece of New Zealand . What I found was a badly scripted show about a group of high school boys who decide to take on a life or death mission and are forced to work together for a common goal. The kids have a lot in common, but also are very different. There's a bit of humor in there as well, but the end of the episode is not that funny. At the end of the episode, you are supposed to have a moment of confusion after the characters realize who they're working on.

This demented left-wing wipe-out trivializes Dante 's great work , distorts the genius of the author out of all recognition. So, I have taken a look at a selection of books that I’ve been meaning to read, and decided that the following titles are at least worthy of attention:

I’m sure you will find a couple that you’ll find interesting, but if not, at least you will see that I’m serious and that these are some of the most important books on philosophy, theology and religion that the world has produced in recent times.

I did n't know what to expect from this hugely popular ( and hilarious ) Swedish comedy & satire team and I'm happy & happy to say I was right to be. Lars Ulrich and Per Sundin are a couple of guys with very different ways of looking at a world. Sweden is a country in Europe and in the middle of it is one city called Stockholm (population approx. 6 million). They're both from the same family and their fathers were both doctors. They met when they were 16 years old and they were both working at hospitals in the same area.

Movies are something you see on Saturday night and forget by Sunday morning. Motion pictures are works of art that stick with you forever. Mishima falls into the latter category. This is the type of thing that should win Academy Awards, a brilliant, visual peice of film that is both depressing and uplifting. Instead of doing a straightforward look at the life of Yukio Mishima, director Paul Schrader interweaves three adaptations of the author's stories into a look at his past and final day on Earth, the day he tried to lead the Japanese military into rebellion in the name of the Emperor.

My blurred childhood memories have kept the echo of the cult serie of Belphégor in the French 60 's ... I can still vividly recall that first time when I came back home after a year of studying abroad in Europe. I came back home as a new student in a completely new country. So my first day at home was not as a new student but as a newly arrived student. And that first day of my first school was a very special day for me, as it was the first time that I really saw my family.

I do n't understand why some of you ( or many ) have given this film upward of 8 stars when you are not even giving the script a 4 star review. The story was great and I liked the characters and the action sequences. I found the plot to be predictable, predictable. But, there is some nice twists and action sequences and a few nice scenes that are well shot and well acted. Overall, it's worth a rental for me. The only problem is that I feel there is a lack of the originality and style that was missing.

Everywhere I hear that people are calling this show bad because its premise is too far fetched....well maybe a do-good cab driver in Philly is pushing it a little (at least the cab drivers ive met), but that's what makes the show great.The fact that this show is a little off the reality track is an issue but its still enjoyable and fun. Its highly watchable and even though u know Mike wins out in the end he never wins in life. David Morse is a great actor and does a great job in the title role.

I went to see this movie at the theater and paid money thinking it would be at least mildly entertaining. The only thing I enjoyed about it was when Robin Williams crashes into the car at the bottom of the hill, and the end, when he seems to get killed. Glenn Close was obnoxious, and she obviously did not seem old enough to be Garp's mother. A mother like Garp's would have had her kids taken away by the Department of Children and Families. Robin Williams and his glazed donut look of benign goodness is just too sweet and smarmy for me.

Sorry , after watching the credits , I thought this would at least be a decent homage to retiring SF series. The game itself is about as good as they come and that's saying something considering all the bad SF that has gone down in recent years. The combat isn't very difficult as it is and the game is fun. It isn't too deep and you will be able to complete it in less than 2 hours and if you don't have a few hours you can always get it on the 3DS/PS3.

Look, don't get me wrong I love independent films but COME ON! I could barely sit through it without wanting to kill myself. the director had absolutely no talent and he turned something that could have been OK to a F***ing Nightmare. I am a punk enthusiast myself and even the music sucked. the acting was crap.I am usually a bleeding heart for these low budget films but this one, this one didn't even try. Please don't waste your precious time and money. I am sorry to be so harsh but come on!

I am profoundly grateful to have seen this movie. The acting is astonishing, the movie itself is powerful and clear, and the issues involved are handled with subtlety and depth.This is an important movie. It could be profoundly transformative.I would pay good money never, ever to see it again. Because it *is* so good and so complex, it is extremely difficult to watch. I admit that my taste in movies tends strongly toward light entertainment; the visual medium can be so powerful that I tend to avoid it for anything really important.

Without a shadow of a doubt this is and probably will always be the worst film i have ever had the pleasure of watching. The whole thing is just so bad that it almost feels like it doesn't have anything to do with other films. I would love to hear some suggestions of what to watch instead. I don't want to leave out anything you want to mention, so if there's a specific movie you think i should watch, that's cool, but this isn't going to be a long discussion. So just leave me a message and i'll check back.

This film is terrible. Not only is the story unbelievable, the situations the characters put themselves in are so silly, to the point where it isn't shocking. I find it sad that Daisy Eagan, star of Broadway's The Secret Garden, decided that this would be a career step. The idea is interesting, two young girls coming of age very quickly. But the sex isn't even arousing. The film is silly, the story is silly, the performances are silly, and the whole concept while interesting falls flat.

Now, the sci-fi channel original company has made some pretty crappy films (House of the dead 2, All souls day, etc.) but when you leave the job entirely to horror master actor/writer and now director, Bruce Campbell, you get one of the best damn made for TV independent horror films ever made! I normally hate these movies, in my previous review, House of the dead 2, I could not believe how horrible the film was! But somehow I took a liking for this film, a very good liking for this film.

Talking about competition features at the Split Film festival, we have titles from all over the world. China, Korea, Canada, USA and Australia and many of these stories are indicating that the world is really valley of tears. Modern love...thats for sure. In that movie by Alex Frayne, two younger married people and their boy are traveling from town to the coast to visit the grave and house of the man's uncle who raised him a long time ago and who died in mysterious circumstances. The coastal village seems like something in an American horror film where the village is bizarre and people are uncommon mutants.

Fabulous cinematography from Sergei Urusevsky help to make this a stunning piece of work . The opening scenes are as gripping as can be , and the rest of the film is well worth watching . The film stars a pair of fantastic leads in John Cazale and Richard Jenkins, and as you can tell from what I said above it’s an action packed movie . This film is directed and written by the director of “Shrek” , a film that is the highest grossing animated film in the history of the industry, but this is an even better film in every way.

Watched this when it was first screened and then missed it when it disappeared of British screens. It showed a different side of Old Australia that we need to see more of. Good juxtaposition of old hand and young turk. Then the realism of the hard out back was fantastic. It was sadly missed. This show was a cold look at the old way of looking at Australia. Hard living and hard working. The young idealist clashing with the old practical head. Real Politicka fighting with the young upstarts of New Labour.

This neo-film noir is one of a genre of late twentieth century American films that all seem to involve corrupt police in the form of the Los Angeles County sheriff's department. This one was shot on location around the Los Angeles County jail in the late 1950s, by the same director, David Gordon Green. It starred George Segal and Barbara Stanwyck and featured some great performances by them. It was filmed in Los Angeles, California. You can find clips of the film at the link. It was released to theaters in 1959.

Part of the BBC filming of all of Shakespeare 's classic plays , this version of Hamlet does nothing to advance the story's plot, but instead makes it quite difficult to understand the play. I don't know how to write about this. But I wanted to write about it for awhile, so here is the text from the beginning of the play to the beginning of the end. In the next line, we have Shakespeare's play in full. HAMLET



Act 1 Scene 1

Enter three young ladies and a youth in a white coat, and a young lady in green.

This has to be one of the worst movies ever to come out of the Sci-Fi Channel . Here is a quick look at what has happened since. It was a little over 2 years ago when Star Trek Into Darkness came out and it was met with a lukewarm reception. Even the most avid fans were not really excited about it as they had hoped. They wanted more of Spock and Captain Kirk, they wanted the movie to be set on the Enterprise or some sort of Federation starship, or at least something that was a Federation starship.

Ninja Hunter ( AKA Wu Tang vs Ninja ) is pure entertainment from start to finish due to its outrageous style and ridiculous plot twists. This film also has an interesting plot that involves the Ninja as an elite military unit sent to a remote island in the Philippines to train elite soldiers for battle against the American military forces. As I mentioned in the opening, I think this film was great at first. It had a very fast pace and looked really good on DVD. There was a ton of character interaction and a great plot twist that made me smile.

The first thing you should know about "Zipperface" is that it was shot on video, so it has that peculiar "home-video-ish" look that is terribly distracting and makes it hard to take this seriously as a "real" film. And "Zipperface" indeed looks as if a bunch of amateurs got together for an attempt at a "real" serial-killer thriller. It's not quite that, but it's not as bad as it looks, either. Having a woman as one of the two detectives on the case puts a spin on the exploitation genre.

What a trip down memory lane.Do not look for great acting , believable plot lines , or anything resembling a sequel to The Dark Knight Rises.It is a remake, and it does not offer anything that is not available in the original. But I did see this coming , and it is quite a lot better than the original. That is why we are all here. To talk about how much better the movie is than its predecessor. But I will be honest, I will not tell you how great the sequel is, because I know you won't like it.

This film is just another waste of time . The plot is ridiculous , forced USA drama . The characters are stereotypical and over the top , not believable . And the ending is pointless , as well. I can see why it got mixed reviews. The story isn’t that interesting , I can’t see what this movie could be about . But I have to admit that I don’t find it offensive at all. I’ve been to movies like this where I can relate to what is happening . This film isn’t as deep as this one .

Rented this out from my local because it was the only new British film available this week . Never heard of it before that but it’s definitely on my radar as a new indie film, so check out the trailer and synopsis below. It’s due out on February 7th on Amazon UK and Amazon Prime, and I’m pretty sure I’ll get it on Amazon. What I’ve seen of this film looks promising, though, so I hope it doesn’t disappoint. Check out some of the other trailers we’ve seen below.

To start with , I have done some further research on the film . Firslty , Jules Dassin directed and stars in , the story is about a man who falls for an older woman he meets on holiday. It seems that she is as beautiful as she is intelligent, he falls head over heels for her but then, in the middle of an argument , the woman suddenly vanishes leaving him devastated and alone. His search begins in the form of his old friend who has been in a plane crash and can only recall bits of his memories .

The characterization in this movie is among the worst I've ever encountered. The dialogue is trite and cliché to the point of extreme distraction. None of the issues the characters face are developed at all--they're merely surface details intended to get a point across without having to actually come up with believable dialogue to support said point. Also, the depiction of the Chinese characters leaves a bit to be desired--I find it hard to believe that the Chinese father learns flawless English from a book(or so it is implied in one scene) so he can teach it to his daughter.

This is the essence of the early eighties! The malls, the credit card machines, the food, the punk hair color, the soundtrack... I am in love with this movie. This sweet, intelligent Romeo & Juliet teen flick is instantly addictive.Martha Coolidge is one of my favorite directors. She really employs her actors, like John Hughes and Steven Soderberg, so check out -Joy of Sex- and -Real Genius-. The soundtracks for -Valley Girl- are great. If you can find a copy of the film, buy it! It's out of print and very hard to come by.

I just saw this movie . I liked the soundtrack.I saw first the trailer and was magnificent , like all the movie , this movie is good , the storyline is good , and so is the acting. But I think this movie is overrated . This movie is not bad but overrated , and also the plot does not work. I thought the plot was good but this is just not believable. For example if the story line was like the first book . It could be that there is something about this that is true . You have to like the book or the movie to actually buy the book.

I just saw this movie at the Tribeca Film Festival and i have to say that i thought it was the best movie i saw all this year. i was surprised by a couple of things though but i will let you guys tell you about them. 1) the story was very well written and you can easily guess what the main character will do 2) you can even guess what they will say and what they are really thinking. i found myself wondering why they did such a horrible job and i think there was so much time wasted.

Yes , maybe there are parts of this film which require suspending belief a little but that does n't take away from the beauty of this work. There are moments of pure genius in this piece. And I would say if you don't think this is beautiful you would have a very bad time with this film itself. If you think it's not beautiful then I guess this should make you rethink your own perceptions on the matter. I'd say for this to even be worth watching you should have seen it a few more times in the theater.

Dude ... I liked Buffy and Angel as much as the next sci-fi freak ... but this is too much. I can't believe this is the last thing I say. I can't help but to feel like the writer is saying, "You'll be watching Buffy and Angel when we're gone." ... and then he goes right on saying that this show will be more of a comedy, and that we'll have a "franchise" where we'll see lots of movies and tons of shows ... and I'm thinking, what?

Wow . Just wow . Never before have i seen a horror movie in which it seemed like a bad dream. It's as if, as if we are watching a nightmare , and it's about to become a nightmare. You know how when you're in a bad dream you're watching a movie and you think , oh it's been so long. Well i was just like that. It was like watching a film , but it looked like it was in real life . When i saw that it was a nightmare and i thought , that's how it will look like when it comes out .

I went to an advance screening of this movie thinking I was about to embark on 120 minutes of cheezy goodness. I have to tell you now, I wasn’t. I’m not even sure when it came out; I just found it in a pile of stuff I’d been working on and so I was excited for what it could bring me. It was really exciting for me to finally have it available on Blu-Ray and DVD. My wife was really looking forward to it too because it’s the first new movie she’s had since she was a teenager.

After a very scary, crude opening which gives you that creepy "Chainsaw massacre"-feeling, everything falls apart.SPOILER ALERT: As soon as the two FBI-officers start jabbing, you know they are the real killers. Anyone who have seen enough of these "fooled-ya"-movies can figure this out.This movie is mader with one thing in mind: To depict brutal murders. Why, then, is not the little girl tortured and murdered as well? Will this be next for us movie-goers? The torture and abuse of children? Whats wrong with you people? Lynch is truly has a disgusting, ugly mind.

In Extramarital we see B-actress Traci Lords at her very best. She's all wrapped in horror & suspense here, a type of role that suits her very well.This mainstream movie lends a lot of its atmosphere from Paul Verhoeven's 'Basic Instinct' (1992), by the way. However, there are differences between the main female characters of Traci Lords ('99) and that of Sharon Stone ('92). For instance, in Extramarital Traci adds some tiny elements from her porn-past. We also shouldn't forget mentioning Extramarital's three main actors.

This was a great film in every sense of the word. It tackles the subject of tribadism in a society that is quite intolerant of any deviations from the norm. It criticises a great many Indian customs that many find oppressive -- such as the arranging of marriages by others, the importance of status and face, religious hypocrisy, sexism, the valuation of women in terms of their baby-making capacity, the binding concepts of duty and so on. At the heart of the film is a touching love story that goes beyond such limitations of the society which the two protagonists find themselves.

My buddies and I spent the majority of a Saturday afternoon watching a selection of `` bad '' movies . . . The first one we watched, a French flick called `` The Curse of the Blue Flower '' was pretty funny. The second one was a film called `` Man with No Name (1931) '' in which the lead character plays the lead role in the original movie and is the last of a famous line up of characters. The second one was probably one of the worst of the bunch, a film called `` The Mummy (1935) . . .

"Son of the Mask" is a terrible excuse of a movie. I went to see this with my friend and I still wish we had seen "Because of Winn-Dixie" instead. I must say that it is partially my fault, as I agreed to go see it with him. Being a fan of the first "Mask" movie (Jim Carrey was hilarious) I had hoped it wasn't as bad as all of the critics said it was.Ten minutes into the movie I knew it was headed for disaster.

This version of David Copperfield is dreadful from start to finish . I knew we were in for a wasted Christmas . I know we had to do something special to get him back to school so I went and got him an autograph book . I am not kidding here. It was a joke . I had to ask him for the autograph before he even looked at it because I knew I was in trouble . He would not even look at it . I knew he was not happy and that I had messed it up . This was my second autograph of David .

I could watch this movie ALL DAY ! I LOVE it . Probably my all time favorite movies . But the only problem is that i dont remember the actors name ! It was the first time i saw the movie and the first one i saw was the opening scene ! LOL I loved it . Then i loved it again . Then a few minutes ago i saw it and it was pretty good ! I am a big fan of John Goodman . The guy is great ! I dont think you can beat his performance . And i liked the songs .

"Strangers on a Train" was one of those film classics I had always heard about but somehow never gotten around to actually seeing. I finally watched it a few weeks ago and, as always with any Hitchcock movie, it not only stood up to the test of time, it far surpassed most thrillers being made today. You can see the inspiration for future action movies here - the climactic ending with the out-of-control merry-go-round and the two villains dueling each other reminded me of the big action sequence at the end of Jan de Bont's "Speed."

Surprisingly well-acted, well-written movie about hard rockin'-but-decent young man getting that much-hoped-for ticket to stardom: his favorite heavy metal band wants him to replace their lead singer. Not far-fetched, the film tries keeping things in perspective and doesn't go over-the-top; it certainly makes you think twice about those lingering adolescent fantasies about being in the music business. But the script, despite solid dialogue, follows a tried-and-true, formulaic pattern, and gets bogged down by its own clichés in the final act. I enjoyed it much more than the sugary fluffball "Almost Famous".

Wow! It's hard to put into words my feelings for this episode. Ice is one of the best episodes of season one for sure. It's my favorite of the season. Six people and a dog in a claustrophobic structure isolated in the middle of the arctic with an unknown organism that causes murderous aggression, the drama can't get any better than that. Paranoia reigns supreme as even Mulder and Scully have doubts about each other's sanity. I've heard people complain about this episode's similarities to the movie 'The Thing'. I haven't seen it, so I wouldn't know.

I 'd never thought that I would be caught saying this : But I think `` Dog the Bounty Hunter " was very well written and very enjoyable, not only was the book great for those of you who love the action but for those of you who do not, it’s a quick read with no time pressure and an easy-to-understand story. I loved reading it, it has a great mix of romance, action, suspense and mystery, and I loved being able to read it from the perspective of a woman in her early twenties and a man in his mid-forties.

(May contain spoilers) I find myself disappointed with the criticism this movie receives. While it is most certainly not perfect, it is much better than it is given credit for. The acting and photography are excellent. Some of the musical numbers are great; including the title number, "Where Do I Go? ", "Easy to be Hard", and "Black Boys/White Boys". While I have not seen the stage musical, I think that it clouds the judgement of many. This is not the musical you see in theatres. Do not attempt to compare them.

Two little girls strike a friendship . One tries to convince the other she 's a witch . The other tells the first girl that a witch 's not so different from a witch . Then they go and join the witch 's daughter for a game . And all of the children, who have been sent by the witch 's husband , have the same opinion . . . The game of " The Witch 's Daughter." And that is how the children of the village are getting ready for the witch 's daughter. And they are also playing with the witch 's daughter .

This film is truly a sorry excuse for film making. The pacing is poor, the budget must have been depressingly low, and the acting is cut-rate (that is, except for Bela Lugosi). The audio at this point in time is also terrible, with so much extra noise in the background that it sounded to me as though a jet were taking off for the entirety of the movie. If these things bother you at all, don't watch this film.If you can get past this, however, you will find that the idea behind the film is a very good one.

I lay the blame for The Comebacks on anyone who enjoyed Date Movie and Epic Movie. You people encouraged the Fox studio to keep on churning out desperate parody films, and now we're faced with what just may be the laziest and most desperate one of them all. The Comebacks barely qualifies as a parody. Heck, it barely qualifies as a movie. This is a comedy in theory, but not in execution. No one, not even the people involved with this mess, could have possibly fooled themselves into thinking they were making a funny movie.

Terror in the Jungle is a real find. If you saw it, you're one of the few lucky ones. It's hilarious!The story is about an airplane crashing in the middle of the south american jungle. The crash scene has to be seen to be believed. Everyone dies in the crash or they're subsequently eaten alive by crocodiles. Only a young blonde boy survives. A nearby tribes brings the kid to their village and they (all males) venerate him because of his golden hair! I kid you NOT!

This movie was a disappointment. The story is essentially The Shining with a castle (or a very cheap set masquerading as a castle, to be specific) substituting as the hotel and a monster instead of the ghosts. The budget is the same you'd see from a Cinemax softcore porn, as is the photography, sets, lighting, and video it was shot on. The story is a failed attempt at sincerity: there's no easier way to make your audience feel sympathetic for your characters than to show them experiencing emotional trauma. And the trauma in this movie is pretty trite.

This is an OK adaptation of the breath taking book of Dan Brown . I ca n't say it is perfect, but the story it tells is so rich and fascinating. I have a lot of interest in the real life story of Richard Branson, but not enough time in my week to really go into detail on the story of his life, so I'm not going to do it justice here. In this post I want to explain to you what I mean by Branson's influence on me, because I think it will be helpful to others.

This movie is certainly one of the greatest films ever made . It is a story told in a steady stream of scenes, that makes you question the truthfulness of everything. I think you need to watch it in order to fully understand what the film is about , because what the movie is about , you need to see it first. You need to watch it from beginning to end. It's the story of this movie. You will not find it anywhere else. I was a little confused to the start because I have been trying to find a movie like this, but I have been unsuccessful.

This is one of the best action films I have seen . Geena 's portrayal of the tough as nails, street hustler's wife is great to watch. The acting in the film was outstanding and she looks beautiful as well.The storyline of the film is also good. It's not like a typical gangster film . The film is about a young man who is a street hustler in Mumbai . The plot of the film is simple . he wants to become the leader of the street and become the top of the food chain . He also wants to win the girl .

Thursday June 15, 9:30pm The EgyptianSaturday June 17, 11:00am The Egyptian"He spent most of his life in pursuit of a good time, and he caught it." - Eric IdleHarry Nilsson left Brooklyn, "feeling like Holden Caulfield. I was fifteen." Eventually, he ended up working as an usher at the LA Paramount and within a few years fell back asswards into one of the greatest songwriting careers in the history of American music. 'Who Is Harry Nilsson (And Why Is Everybody Talking' About Him?)' chronicles the legendary life of " the best songwriter of our generation."

Is the Cannes controversy-meter remarkably esoteric , or is that we Americans are so callous and cynical that we never consider the possibility of people being killed by other people? I don’t get it. What’s even more mystifying is that this entire situation has been covered so completely by mainstream media — with a single exception. And now it is being covered even more thoroughly by you, dear readers, who I am sure don’t need a lecture on what real journalism is all about. The story has a long, interesting history.

There 's a good running bit about the price tag of a silk negligee . The bimbo in the office was a bit upset . I guess I was right . She did buy one, and I know she didn't get it for any money . But she has to go to work looking very sexy in the silk underwear and I just can't blame her. So what did we learn? A girl can be a bitch in her underwear but there are some things I can always tell a girl from a woman . That's the one thing. 1.

I suppose you could say this film has a grain of potential, but nothing more, because boy did the filmmakers botch it. The plot is practically incomprehensible, the pacing is lethargic and the acting is pathetic. And what the hell is a trade rat? Worst of all, though, this movie's climax is the anticlimax of all anticlimaxes; plus the title doesn't seem even remotely accurate. The only redeeming feature of this film is the pretty dark-haired woman... well, the blond girl was pretty too, but she was annoying and not as good looking as the brunette.

Frank Sinatra has one of his best roles as a reformed heroin addict coming back to his Chicago neighborhood after the death of his wife in the hit film The Goodbye Girl. But what makes this performance so memorable is that his addiction is not an act of desperation. It is the culmination of Sinatra’s character and the culmination of his life story. While this may seem like an odd choice for a lead role, Sinatra did indeed begin his career with drugs. His drug use was so bad that it was the cause of his demise.

I am an avid movie watcher and I enjoy a wide variety of films . However , I found NO film that I could really identify with . I like comedies and romances . And I have a really good friend that I see almost everyday so I thought maybe that is what I will be seeing in my favorite movies . This film is about a man from the future who has had some problems that have happened in his life . His mother and a couple of his friends who were there for his father , are now in a coma .

If you and your friends find as much humor and enjoyment from horrible acting , jokes , props , and bad puns that you’ve seen online, you’re in luck because you’ve come to the right place. All of the material in this column will be available for free, if you’re willing to pay a few bucks a pop to download the complete show. And that’s all there is to it! You’ve been to some of the hottest websites on the net, and so you think you can do the same on the internet.

This is a entertaingly bad b-movie . Actually it really is much better quality than a lot of b movies released today. I really do not care for this movie at all, but there was no reason I would not see this movie if I had the money to waste on it, as I am sure most of you are aware. In fact you should be aware of this one as it does not get much attention. It is however one of those movies where you really can tell what is going on without having the whole movie to read.

Normally I am a typical "creepy-crawly-hatin'" girl, but after watching this film (on YouTube of course), I'm having different perspectives. And also I did not know that my favorite animation studio - Fleischer's made another film that's about community of insects whose city garden home is threatened by humans (lighted cigars and cigarette butts,footsteps,etc. ), and how a plucky young grasshopper named Hoppity saves the day and wins the heart of Honey the bee; I love the lovely Ms. Honey.

I've been strangely attracted to this film since I saw it on Showtime sometime in the early 80's. I say strangely because it is rather a ludicrous bit of soft-core fluff, a genre I'm not particularly interested in. The dialogue is pompously and nonsensically philosophical (making sense, no doubt, only to it's Franco-Italian producers)and the plot completely extraneous. What it does achieve is a wonderfully hypnotic and thoroughly pleasant mood. The scenery (the beautiful Philippines), soft-focus nudity and wonderful score all contribute to a strange and extremely watchable exercise in a sort of film making seldom seen today.

First i gotta say that this film is way less pretentious than The Da Vinci Code. sure, you have the religion vs science problem but it doesn't try to make a big statement about it. its basically an action thriller that moves from one scene to another very well. one scene particularly (that involves fire) i found extremely well done. Second, the changes from book to film. although when i was following the development of the film i complained about the change of some characters and the complete removal of others, i gotta admit i was wrong.

Or anyone else have noticed the fact that first bunch of episodes are inspired too much by 90's flicks?I mean seriously wife who is trying get someone else to murder his rich husband so she can claim his assets. Med students who are temporarily stopping their hearts to reach memories that are lost; Flatliners. Bunch of college bodies getting together again to reminisce on the old days but are not fully comfortable because they did something in the past, Very Bad Things? Groundhog day is one of my all time favorite movies.

Well it might be a kid 's movie ... perhaps but i 'm not gon na let my kids from 6 months to 3 years old come to the movies. They are too fussed about what they see and think. That is a bit silly. We all have to learn to watch the movies on their own without having to "fuss" for them. So if your daughter wants to watch it on her own at the moment, you might want to tell her that. I'm sure you'll see it at a younger age, too.

This is a story about a journey made by a man who once had a dream and guts. Donald Crowhurst was an English businessman and amateur sailor who competed in the Sunday Times Golden Globe Race, a single-handed, round-the-world yacht race.I was very intrigued by the story after listening to a radio interview from the producer John Smithson, who is also the producer of "Touching the Void", one of the first documentaries that made a commercial success in 2003. I had gone to the cinema with great hope and not much previous knowledge on the historic event, and I'm relieved that it didn't let me down.

If you love Chan-wook Park, you know what to expect. His films are brutal, poetic, tragic, and artistic, with splashes of very grim humor. THIRST is clearly Park's style, and I loved every second of it, from the cinematography (every shot is gorgeous and creative) to the story, which blends Shakespearean tragedy, murderous love, Gothic horror, and layered character drama. The characters are complex and there is plenty of moral ambiguity to go around. Even the most sociopathic character evokes sympathy.

I made a promise that if ever I posted a comment that was less than complimentary , then later felt the need to apologize. I hope this is the case here, and that this is a sign of the times. But I can understand if someone would be offended. And I think that the majority of posters are honest and respectful people so that is just as valid of an explanation as any. I'm just hoping that this particular post will not offend anyone and that it can remain on the site. Thank you all for your time and I hope your weekend is going well.

A less than redemptive hunka junk that is mercifully free from the ravages of competence . Some Northern idiots come out to say they want to stop us from ever letting the South out of the Union, which they call “separate but equal”, but they want us to stop the South from expanding west and to stop the North in the first place. It is funny to hear idiots saying that to try to stop the Civil War from happening. To try to stop slavery and Jim Crow? No, no, no – let that go to hell!

A young man, named Danny, has run away from home and meets a drifter, named Bix, who agrees to tag along with Danny and watch out for him... and his money. They end up in a small town where they meet Carrie - a shy, naive girl working in her father's diner. Bix starts seeing Carrie but he plans on leaving soon (because he's a drifter, see? He's no good! Understand?). Meanwhile, the town creep, Jesse (played by a perfectly casted Jack Elam), keeps showing up at the diner and bothering Carrie.

This is a totally awesome movie ! If you have n't seen it yet , you damn well should . __________________
You never know who you'll get a hold of

I like it
