It even takes a swipe at the Second Amendment and religion.

This film , for what it was set out to be , succeeded . It 's a short tragic film about two young men , who have a child , and how it affects them both. The young man , who is a painter, has lost his father . He takes the blame for him . His mother has died, and the father wants him to leave . The younger man , on the other hand , wants to remain in the country where he is from . The film ends with his mother and father talking about the child , and how it is now his responsibility , to care for her .

We all enjoyed the movie . It is a very charming family film with many fun cameos . It was also very well acted and the performances of the leads was very realistic and convincing . It is also well directed . There is not much violence in it . You have to love the humor . There are many jokes in this movie . You must have this movie for yourself . A lovely family friendly movie . You will not regret it . This is a wonderful movie . There is a family friendly movie with humor . It has fun and many laughs .

This movie is about 3 stories put together revolving around 3 separate individuals. One of the worst movie that is available and even better if it is not available.The Good : 2 pretty lesbians actress 1 true and touching story about Theresa ChanThe Bad :The main story that revolves around the blind and dear woman Theresa Chan does not need to be told in a movie format and more appropriate in a documentary format. No linkage between the 3 story lines. Minimum DIALOGUE in the film, substituted by SMSs and CHAT programs on PC. No cultural insight by the movie and it makes you forget even before you step out of the cinema.

This movie spends most of its time preaching that it is the script that makes the movie, but apparently there was no script when they shot this waste of time! The trailer makes this out to be a comedy, but the film can't decide if it wants to be a comedy, a drama, a romance or an action film. Press releases indicated that Shatner and Hamlin made this movie because they loved the script (what were they thinking?). If you like William Shatner (I do) see "Free Enterprise" instead.

Like classic Hollywood musicals , the plot is just an excuse . A must see for those interested in French cinema and French culture . This is definitely something that has to be watched in full. Review by:
Eugène Lévy

Rating:

What do you get if you mix great movies, great actors, and an exceptional script ? I have been a huge fan of "La Grande Illusion", a French musical based on "Daphné" by the French writer Jules Verne (who also wrote "Toujours là" and "Jules Verne" by Jules Dassin .

I find it amazing, that so many people (probably Poles) have voted for this movie, giving it such grades (mostly tens). OK, the movie was fine, funny, but it was nothing special on the other hand. The only good thing about Kiler is the dialogues, rather not comprehensive for non-Poles. Screenplay is primitive, the acting (except for Jerzy Stuhr as Ryba) - awful. It's too much ado about nothing - fortunately it's not included in the top 250. P.S.

Yes, maybe there are parts of this film which require suspending belief a little but that doesn't take anything away from the film's charm and wonder. It was shown as part of our town's youth film festival and was the organising committee's favourite. Which is not surprising. The subject matter - coming together in a race-torn, though post-apartheid South Africa is highly topical and the treatment of the theme is inspirational. Of course, as the previous comment mentions the film does have its shortcomings, but the realism of the setting and the way the director treats his subject matter belies these shortcomings.

Are you kidding me ? This is quite possibly the worst , amateur movie I 've ever seen . The characters are bad . The acting is mediocre . There are no surprises , and the plot line is so weak , that I could have guessed that this would have been a horror flick . ( I am sure many others would , and you probably guessed that as well ). I think this is the worst amateur movie I've seen all year . It doesn't get much better than this . It's like a low budget horror flick , but instead of zombies it has aliens .

I watched this movie tonight and I do need to say that it is horrible ! I expected it to be good but it was not ! I did enjoy it , though , and I really hope they make it into a series ! As for the book, I can't say I was a fan of it, it was just kind of a "what could have been" kind of movie with an interesting premise that didn't quite work for me. It was very well acted and I enjoyed it but for some reason the ending was kind of anticlimactic for me.

I watched 5 % of this movie tonight and you may tell me that I need to see the whole thing so I can figure out exactly what you and your friends are talking about in your blog posts, and that's fine by me but what I find interesting is how it's been a couple of days since you've posted something and I've been looking for it for a while now and haven't had a single reply. You know, I'm not so much concerned with how long I've been out of a post as how I'm not seeing anything at all that I wanted to write about.

I can't remember the series, I believe it may have been "American Masters", but it was broadcast on PBS around 1980. Most people have some knowledge of the development of the A bomb, and those that have little, or none, probably think it is a pretty dry subject. Anyone who has viewed this 7 part series does not feel that way. You get to know the turmoil in Oppenhemiers mind, and how the development changed his life forever. You understand the tragic figure he became, and why.

What bird is that ? A maltese falcon. The only thing remotely funny about this movie is Michael Caines hair. Which has more depth and character than the man underneath it.The Malta settings are as dry and as barren as the dialogue. Salutes to Raymond Chandler and Humphrey Bogart and crime fiction etc... seem obtuse and just plain silly without the salvation of any humour or pertinency. The reason this film has no 'longevity' and near forgotten is it's so vacuous, an hour and half of pointless time spent in the company of second rate actors and film makers - This film is what the title suggests...

I must first mention that as a group of mates , we often find entertainment in wacthing films which are not so good for us as a community , so we would like to make some suggestions for you all to enjoy . We are all from a very wide variety of backgrounds, and we have many tastes . However , we are all very much in love with the wonderful things in life , in fact we all spend most of our time looking forward to our nights out and going out on our date nights , because we know we are not the only ones who have those nights .

This movie was a major bait and switch. I rented it because of Rebecca St. James, a popular Christian singer. I have met her and wondered what she would be doing in a UFO movie. Well.......I think that she starred in this movie to help out a friend, or a friend of a friend. My first clue that this movie wasn't what it was supposed to be was when I witnessed the special effects of the UFO encounters. Cheesy! As the movie progressed, I noticed how plastic the actors were. It was funny how almost everyone in the movie wore solid colors.

I simply cannot understand how any Who fan, or just plain anyone could find this awful, lazy, poorly written abomination even remotely funny. It is so embarrassingly below par that it qualifies as a genuine tragedy. The potential for this was huge, it could have been great. What a shame that all that acting talent, the sets, the props, the goodwill of everyone involved was so pathetically wasted by a script that should have been burned.There is an obvious lack of any rigorous production and quality control here.

I found West Point to be an agreeable film, although I doubt that I would watch it again. The performances were convincing, with William Haines as yet another obnoxiously amusing young man that has his come-uppance by film's end. It's hard to believe that stardom beckoned Joan Crawford less than a year after this film was made, as she looks rather awkward at times. I would apply the comment made by another concerning Ramon Novarro's "Huddle" (1932) to this film as well. There is a great film waiting to be made here, but there is something lacking.

I would assume that this film would get rave reviews in Canada -- particularly in Quebec . That 's because this film is based on a real event. The film is based on a real story and I was there to see it. So I have nothing but respect for the filmmakers, the subject and the people who were really involved with the movie production. I would be the last one to disparage an artist, but in my opinion, this film is far too realistic. This is what the real story is. So if the film is so realistic then why make it into such a horror/sci-fi film?

Soultaker was written by and starred Vivian Schilling. It also starred Joe Estevez, Gregg Thomsen, and Robert D'Zar as the Angel of Death.The story begins with introduction to Soultaker, played by Joe Estevez. We quickly learn what Soultaker's role will be in this movie.Next the college aged young people are getting ready for a summer festival, aptly named "Summerfest". In this film, the battle of the classes is omni-present throughout the film. The girls come from a wealthy class, and the guys come from roughly middle or lower class.

28 years before 9/11 , there was another 9/11 which represented a key date in the history of Chile , and it was also the beginning of the Chilean War for Independence. In order to mark the day that Chile had declared itself as a country, a memorial was erected in the city of Santiago . In the same city there was also another one , this one commemorating the victims of the earthquake on April 19, 2010 . The event had a great impact in Chile and it became one of the most widely known tragedies of the nation .

This was a nice film. It had a interesting storyline, that was executed pretty well in the later part of the film. The storyline kinda reminded me of The City of God. But this one is done in a more nicer way in comparison. It had what i really loved:a tinge of surrealism. Some pretty interesting cinematography (thru the wooden camera) I'm not sure if it was culturally correct, but it definitely widens you're view of south Africa. The actors were good (for 1st timers, most of them anyway), i especially liked Estelle character, which made this movie pretty enjoyable.

The most obvious flaw ... horrible , horrible script . This movie had a potentially good story , but it doesn't work . There should not be a sequel or a continuation . There are only about 2 or 3 good scenes . I'm sorry , but there are many flaws in this film . You know how many flaws are there already . And if you see this movie , you should watch the last scene , because there are still many flaws . You know how bad the last scene was . I can't think of any good scenes , there is just too many flaws .

My only reason registering to this site was for the opportunity to write a comment to this movie . I've seen it before so it's a must see. I just don't think it's right for a young adult audience. For my own personal entertainment this weekend I will see and rewatch "The Conjuring." I love horror movies and I am glad I don't need to pay money to watch them. I'm not sure why you are posting a list of horror movies, but you obviously don't appreciate the horror movies I love. I like both of them.

In Fassbinder 's earlier films , his ideas sometimes surpased his ability to execute them . He was always a master storyteller , from his early days as an actor to the time he was first making movies for the screen . While some of his later movies might have been a bit more obvious or obvious , they are still very entertaining . I 've seen him on the small screen , and his work as director was always good . I thought he was great at making his films interesting , and he did a great job , so I 'm really glad to see his movies being released on BluRays .

'Blade' would be an extremely above-average comic-book, vampire-hunter action/horror if it weren't for two minor flaws. #1 I loved seeing the all-but invincible Blade/Snipes do his slicing and dicing, but the whole "Yes!" fist/punch was literally a letdown. #2 Bad, no make that horrible, CGI  even for 1998 standards. This is mainly in the last third, but some sprinkled throughout. Okay, despite those minor infractions, I really enjoyed this movie. All actors did a suburb job and the fact that this now looks like yet another 'Matrix' rip-off is hilarious considering this came out one year prior.

This movie is not the scariest of all time, but it is a great example of a campy eighties horror flick -- low budget, no stars, lots of inventive death scenes, and enough nudity to keep the teenagers in their seats. The premise is interesting and fun and the three evil kids play their parts well. A nice starting point for "Just Say" Julie Brown exposing her talents early in her career. This film won't be seen by many, but for fans of 80's horror it's a must.

We found this movie nearly impossible to watch. With such a super cast, it's a shame that the writing and direction were so awful. The excruciating pace at which the story was told was maddening. The flash-backs were clumsy. The characters were one-dimensional. The heavy-handed metaphors -- the river, the cat -- were repeated way too often. The movie Nobody's Fool, based on another novel by Russo, was infinitely better, probably because it was more tightly written and directed. The photography in Empire Falls was lovely.

What to say about this movie? A married couple has more then just each other. After playing around for some time things gets more serious. A difficult choice has to be made: continue the old situation or start all over by following the heart. Guess what happens at the end. This movie seems to be very low budget. But a good story don't have to be expensive. It looks like a play that has been converted to a movie only by using several cheap locations (at least very little other people visible) more than just the stage, in this one the house.

I ordered this movie on the Internet as it is very difficult to get Turkish movies where we live .I just can't wait to finish this movie as I love the story. It's very funny to watch. You should give it a try. I highly recommend to you and I hope you enjoy the movie and I am looking forward to see what is going to follow. Best regards

I've always wanted to read Turkish, I've seen many Turkish films and now I can't get my hands on Turkish books.

This movie is a terrible attempt at a spoof . Its attempts to parody various sports movies are half-baked and over the top , while it tries too hard at comedy . I’ll be honest , I didn’t expect much, but I actually enjoyed this movie. This movie is not bad , nor is it great . It has a lot of potential . The only thing that stood out to me during this movie was that it has a good soundtrack and that the ending didn’t feel like a huge let down.

Let 's get one thing straight : I like much of Snipes ' work . Unlike his other high-kicking contemporaries he has no real talent and is usually not in his top form. I hope he will come back though and perform more regularly in the next few years as I do like his music a lot . In the meantime he should work with some new talent to make him a better performer. I do not want to be rude in the thread but that was a poor writeup and it makes it seem as though the OP was not a fan of the show.

This movie baffled me . I could not get a grip on it . Thought I might be missing something . I watched the first 3 parts but didn't watch the whole thing . The story was great . I really enjoyed the movie . Even though there was not much gore . The movie was funny . But not very nice. It was just too funny . As for the story , I didn't get the point of it all. I got the point of some of the parts but I didn't get the point of other parts .

As much as I love the story of David Copperfield , I can not claim to have enjoyed this movie as much. I found the ending unsatisfying and thought that it would be improved upon in the sequel. The other problem that the producers faced is the fact that Copperfield is written as a man with a past. This may have been an intentional decision, as it can be done in this day and age but in the movie, it is very difficult to sympathise with this man’s past. The other thing that bothered me is that the film has so few songs.

I had the dubious opportunity to view this movie on TV . It 's the perfect example of how to get away with being an auteur and making sure you get the best of both worlds. With all the talk about blockbusters, with all the talk about what 's great about films and why it 's great, with all this talk about how great films really are, it's easy to get wrapped in all this hype about what makes movies good and what makes them really good. What's not to like? I'll give a little synopsis on this movie, though.

There 's a good story well hidden and never really used ! The film is short and overly dependent on the ending. There was a time in history where an army needed to take on a big enemy force, the story was simple, but it was a story that could never be told. The film is very long and never gets a complete ending because there is nothing to get out of the story. This was a great action movie based on an original story, but it failed because there was a long wait for any good ending.

this was absolutely the most tragic pile of cinema to which i have ever born witness . not only was it a masterpiece, but the story was really well told. the two main characters (the hero and his wife) both had great characters to them. It was so well made and well written that you wouldn't know you were watching it from the opening moments. It has a lot of things to say about marriage, faith, love, betrayal, friendship, loss, life, death - you name it - everything.

People call a 976 "party line" to talk dirty to strangers, and perhaps meet up for a sexual liason. A deranged, somewhat incestuous sister and occasional transvestite brother use the line to find people to kill, usually married men, but they don't discriminate! A pair of sixteen year old girls also call the line for fun, pretending to be older, of course. One of them works as a babysitter for a married man who's hot for her (or anyone).Meanwhile, a vice cop is borrowed by homicide when he's the first to discover one of the siblings' victims.

As I peruse through the hundreds of comments that loyal readers of the IMDB have posted on this film , I think that in the vast majority of cases, it appears that people do like the film. However, from the comments above, I’ve gathered enough information to say that I’m not sure that many people would want to see it, and in some cases, even dislike the film. It seems that there are a number of reasons as to why people dislike the film: 1) The acting is so bad.

OK , so I'am chilling in my room when mom knocks on the door . I open the door and I see a very nice woman , my mother !!! I just smiled and she was happy . When my mom went , she asked if I have something to eat . Then she smiled again . I started to smile , I told her that I'am having some breakfast when she told me the reason why she came back home . I told her that my grandma is coming from the city and she is going to see the place , she said that I am her favorite child.

I went to see this movie with my boyfriend last night . I 'm 20 years old and this movie was really cool . I was able to watch it from the beginning of the movie until like 30 minutes in , but I was a little curious about how the movie is written . So I started reading . There's a big part in the movie that was written in rhyme . The whole movie is about a young man who has to save the life of a young girl who is dying . One of my favorite parts is where it says that she had to be saved .

Lil Pimp is the story of a little boy who becomes a pimp . The animation and voice acting were all done by the same person, and the story has no real plot or direction, but is just a story. The music was by the same guy. He does a great job, the background music is very soothing. The only bad part was the character design. He was a little too childish for his age, it was very distracting, and the voice acting was incredibly bad. It is hard to tell what are his real feelings, he says a lot of bad things.

I seen this movie when it came out . I thought what an average movie . I have now realized this movie is actually very good ! It's the best thriller I've seen so far . I like the ending, I like the way they make the people talk and think . I love how the movie is in a way like a real life . This is my favorite movie to watch . If you have any problem with nudity or sexual acts in this movie . Please let me know ! Thanks a lot for your attention and time .

The concept: show 4 families of diverse ethnicities in the Fairfax District of L.A. preparing for the family get-together at Thanksgiving. I loved Soul Food and How to Make an American Quilt {I think there's a law that Alfre Woodard has to be in all these movies) which similarly offered a pastiche of family traditions, and was prepared for a treat. Instead, I felt tricked. They trot out about 40+ characters, and all but two are one-note cliches with no finesse whatsoever. The writers and director should spend a few more years learning about life and learn how loving people of different generations actually do relate.

I watched the this the other night on a local station because I didn't feel like watching tripe like 'American Idol'. Peter Strauss gives a great performance as a convict named 'Rain' Murphy who keeps to himself. He admits to his crime and makes no bones that he feels no shame for it. His cell is bare of any comforts that other inmates have like books and pictures. The only time he feels in another zone is in running. He does it often and can run a mile in under four minutes.

I have for years remembered a song `` JUST A COUPLE IN A CASTLE '' ( `` No . twenty five years '') from a musical I did as an undergraduate, but was never able to locate it in any of my collections. I do remember that there is a picture of a castle in the background. Can you help me? I do remember the song. It's from the movie " The Wizard of Oz " I think. But, I have not heard of the movie or of the song. I have only the book. Can you help me?

The movie with its single set , minimal cast , and straightforward photography ( except for a couple of brief appearances of a few familiar faces ) had a great cast and an interesting storyline. And the soundtrack , well, it was good , and it had a great score. But the acting was nothing special either and I wasn’t sure if it would work. I think we can all agree that it didn’t work. But the first time the movie was released on DVD , I was pretty impressed.

A film by Almodovar- sends a tingle down my spine every time. The capitalized print which opens the Spanish auteur's latest feature instantly induces memories of salacious nuns, gentle necrophiliacs, wisecracking transsexualsand I haven't even got as far as the infant-terrible's critically reviled early work. And after a beautiful opening montage, with the camera roving across a wind-swept graveyard animated by a hoard of widows feverishly scrubbing tombstones, I thought Pedro had me again under his wicked spell.Yet once my nostalgia had subsided, there was very little to fill its place.

The only reason I checked this film out was to see the "early" Kim Bassinger. That, and the fact that my TV guide said it was a "gripping suspense", and it was three-star rated. The rating must have come from the man who wrote this drivel because the only suspense in this movie was whether I would finish it or not. Robert Culp turns in what has to be the "disaster" of his career as a cop who is not even close to being believeable. At one point, EVERYBODY is a suspect, including a frail old woman.

....is where I'm assuming this movie came from. I mean, I've watched plenty of B movies over the course of my young life so far, and I wouldn't even classify this as a B movie. I remember seeing films in my high school mass media class that surpass this one.So the premise is...a bunch of dancing numbers and goofy crap happens. Women in bikinis, who aren't even that great looking to begin with, dance in the beginning and sing. Guys with hairy chests show up and girls with fangs who are out in the sunlight.

This is a tough film to review, since several factors need to be taken into account. Let's filter the more judgmental..Ok, are you interested in the facts concerning the serial killer of Jeffrey Dahmer? Can you withstand an independent, low-budget film? Are you objective enough to NOT dislike a film solely due to its lack of stars or professional look? Well, if you said yes then you should have a mind open enough to handle this one. This film is an almost 100% accurate dramatization of Dahmer's adult life and subsequent murder spree, and is styled as an autobiography.

This film is striking only in its banality and use of cliches . Sadly it was obvious throughout up until the beginning of the movie that the only real problem the director was dealing with in the production of this piece of crap was the lack of any real talent. The only thing that really kept this film afloat through the first half of the production was some really good acting. I thought it would have done better had the actors been better acted, but if you are going to use stock characters to tell a story you need to use a good actor.

I 'm the first to recognize that Chan-wook Park 's Thirst is exceptionally well made , but spending over two hours playing it on repeat and getting sick is something that should be avoided. That 's the whole point though. I thought it was overrated. It 's an enjoyable puzzle game. It 's worth a look. That's what I call a masterpiece. The game is a well-made puzzle game. I have never seen such an ingenious game before in any game. It is a game I will be back and buy again and again.

Chop Shop , the second feature from Ramin Bahrani , is a rare breed . It is an American film that tells the story of a family in the ‘90’s who’ve been robbed and now they need to get back to where they’ve come from. Chop Shop has been described as a tale of revenge set in a noir world and the second feature from Bahrani is one of the most exciting films ever produced in America, a truly unique film with some great dialogue, direction, and some great performances .

This is the perfect example of how a great book is turned into a poor film . The direction just can’t capture the spirit or emotion of the story. The story is told in chronological order instead of chronological order within the book. Also the book ends right before the film begins. And of course the film ends after the book has ended. The book I chose as my film of choice for this blog is A Prayer for Owen Meany. I think it is one of the most important books ever written. I know many people have said this before, but I want to repeat it.

The movie starts out a bit interested with the son interested in a teenage girl his own age. Clayburgh's timid-appearing husband is killed in car crash as she is getting ready to go to Rome and sing as a diva. Matthew objects but comes along. He connects with the young girl again but this time, Matt is on cocaine. His superb voice, lovely, impetuous mother is in the limelight. She doesn't know how to handle Matt's addiction. The movie drags on in search of a plot. Clayburgh is in the wrong role and Bertolucci may have had his head in the moon while directing the picture.

No blood , no sex ( though it oozes passion ) , no special effects , but just one of a kind. I’ve always been intrigued by the concept of “alternative” entertainment and what it can be, and I was lucky enough to be asked to create a film version of some of these stories. My original plan was to put all three of these tales into one movie, but we were able to change the order and focus them into separate stories to make the film flow better, so I’ll do that now.

A lumberman finds a young cougar in need of help . To young to be on his own the cat has to find her own way back home and find the right way home for herself . The movie has lots of humor , but the humor is really all on the screen . It doesn't get too far in the beginning and then you get to see some real drama . . The story is set in Utah and it is obvious that this is all based on real people . One of the things I liked was the character of Bill and I thought he was very good .

Brass pictures ( movies is not a fitting word for them ) really are somewhat brassy . Their alluring visual aesthetics and rich compositions make for a special cinema experience, but in a lot of cases they are not suitable for family viewing, or even watching on the tube. There are a number of reasons why these films aren’t suited for family viewing. One of the first reasons is the fact that these films are generally not shot on film. That is to say, they aren’t shot in a “natural” light.

Imagine what it must have been like for John Agar. One of Hollywood's handsome leading men. Married to Shirley Temple for five years. He finds himself doing movies like this. I remember him in "Tarantula" where he wasn't half bad. Unfortunately, there is nothing to recommend this film. The monster is dumb uninteresting and incompetent. The police are boring. The teenagers are boring. The plot is stupid. People run around. There are events that do nothing to advance the plot. There's dancing that goes on and on, and then there is no attack.

This is the ultimate Kung Fu movie ! This is the only Kung Fu movie ! This is the only Kung Fu movie that was made for the movies ! This is the movie that will change your life forever ! If you do a search for "KUNG FU THE MOVIE" on Google you will come across thousands of hits ! If you do not want to see Kung Fu movies anymore, stop reading this now ! Go and enjoy Kung Fu movies with your loved ones ! The movie will be a must see movie for all Kung Fu fans.

Mystery Science Theater 3000 would have not been able to bring any redeeming quality to a showing of this "gem." This one is like a cheesy pirate copy of 80's porn you could have purchased on VHS from an arcade on 42nd st. before Disney bought the whole smash and closed them all down. But, wait - all the sex scenes have been cut. I challenge anyone to find a worse film. This film could replace water-boarding as a humane method of interrogation. No, I take that back - I would prefer water-boarding.

I think "Rosemary's Baby" is the most overrated horror film out there. Not scary, interesting or much of anything. It's reasonably well-directed and Ruth Gordon was wonderful but that's about it. But this sequel makes it look like "Gone With the Wind"!I caught this on TV back when I was 14. Unfortunately, I still remember it. From what I remember Rosemary's baby Andrew is now grown up and the coven wants him to start taking over (the world that is).

This film did not excite me. While on vacation in Turkey I noticed that it was playing at the local cinema and decided to take the chance to go see it. The action sequences in the film are well choreographed, however, the story drags during the middle of the film.One thing that I did not quite follow is how Borte was able to get the money to bribe the guards.The other thing that I did not particularly like was the missing segment of Khan's life. It did not go into detail as to how the bad guys were able to find him and re-imprison him after he had gone missing for so long.

Fans of Euro-horror flicks - Portland's video/DVD store Movie Madness has a whole section devoted to this genre - can't afford to miss Sergio Martino's gut-busting "L'isola degli uomini pesce" (called "Screamers" in the United States). Here's the lowdown: some shipwreck survivors land on an uncharted Caribbean island in 1891. The island is inhabited by a landowner, a scientist (Joseph Cotten) and his daughter (Barbara Bach). Sure enough, it turns out that the landowner is making the scientist create a race of fish-men.

This was my late wife's favorite film. I'm sorry she did not live long enough to have the video as I'm sure she would have worn it out. What can we say? A great romantic story and the push off of two great men, the Raisuli and Teddy Rex. Sean Connery and Brian Keith are great in these roles. But while Connery is his usual sexy sex, it's the late Brian Keith who gives us a solid performance as the mercurial Teddy Roosevelt. Back up is provided with Candy Bergen, gorgeous in her early 30s, as the kidnapped American widow.

It pays to watch Reader 's Digest . Or Time , if it was the original source of the article. Of course, the only way to find that out was to google it , so I had to do both. I was so happy to see this in the paper that I almost didn't read it at first. Then I looked up his name and was delighted to see that I was right. This man has been my hero for the last 40 years or so. Now I understand why this man had a lot of trouble getting funding to do the work he did.

OK, I've now seen George Zucco in at least four separate horror/suspense films recently as I worked my way through various 50 pack collections, and I have to say, the guy had a limited range, but he was good at what he did. He wasn't Karloff, but PRC was lucky to have him. But the poor guy was stuck in a kind of back-water ghetto of horror films, and he wasn't good enough to take them to the next level of interest....not with the thread-bare screenplays and direction and budgets he worked under. That's the case here.

The sun was not shining , it was too wet to play , so I went to the movies , to get the sun out of the house , I went down stairs and I walked in , I walked to the bathroom and then to the living room . I opened the blinds , I opened the window a little and I turned on the TV , and the sound was not loud enough . I opened the living room curtains , but it was too dark out , so I put on the shades and I closed all the blinds and it was not very easy to open them again .

i was flipping through the channels and had to stop and laugh when i came across this movie. It was so clearly about teens in the early 80s, and i called my mom "hahaha, turn to channel such and such, the kid totally looks like if dad were a kid".Um. Yeah. Turns out this movie is about my dad & his friends.Even without it being about loosely based on my dad's childhood, i'd say watch this movie! It is just.....bizarre to say the least, the apathy instilled in teens even back then.

"Nicodemus" is almost a copy of "Red" in the odd behavior sense, but this episode focuses on other people in Clark Kent's unpredictable life. When a poisonous flower finds it's way into Smallville Jonathan Kent is the first to be effected by it. the flower causes people to reverse their behavior and when it effects Jonathan, he becomes short tempered and violent, however Clark manages to stop him from doing anything rash until his father finally passes out. okay. so far, so good. next up is Lana.

I wouldn't recommend this to anyone, except cinema-goers who like to laugh at a film, not with it.Quite a promising premise and set of actors get progressively worse over a film which ends with perhaps the worst ending ever seen in a film. I won't spoil it, but basically the most over-used set of movie cliches get done badly and half heartedly for the most disappointing last five minutes to any film, ever.The movie also includes the most cringe inducing scene ever, the attempt at on-screen chemistry between the two lead roles when we're presented with a close up of Angela Jolie stroking Denzel Washington's finger lovingly.

Yes , I spelled that right . This movie is so predictable , the actual word needs additional letters to fit it . The first 3 minutes of the trailer did the movie a huge disservice . I was like , really ? I can’t understand half of this ?. I think I’ll wait till it comes out in theaters (the DVD is coming soon) to get the DVD and see what it’s all about . I think this film should’ve been shot in the first place , if it was , you can bet your ass , I would’ve seen it .

As far as I am concerned, this film noir had two totally different things going for it as opposed to the film noirs I am used to viewing: 1 - the setting is Paris, France; 2 - there is 28-minute scene with no dialog.Both make this movie a bit unique, at least to English-speaking film noir fans. Actually, an American, Jules Dussain, shot the film, so it's not entirely a European film. Initially, I was disappointed in this after I had watched the first 40 minutes. It's an expensive DVD and I was bored.

I just cannot emphasize enough what a lovely movie this is. Justthe memory of this movie right now enchants me. If you want tosee a sweeping epic of a movie, with wonderful actors in vividscenery, with great dialogue, reminding you of what early Americacould have been like [what the world could have been like backthen]...well...I highly recommend this movie. Especially during atime of war and conflict in Iraq...when our American image is not atall what it used to be...this movie takes you back to a time when wewere just starting out.

The book is great. It's one of my favorite books ever. The film, on the other hand, is amazingly insipid and bad! When I heard Damon would play Ripley, I knew this production was doomed. But I didn't expect it to be this bad. The actors go around and act very showy. Except for Law (and even he is guilty of some showy acting), all the actors here are near amateurish. Speaking Italian and moving one's arms or hair about shouldn't be considered as acting. Damon is miscast.

HOW MANY MOVIES ARE THERE GOING TO BE IN WHICH AGAINST ALL ODDS, A RAGTAG TEAM BEATS THE BIG GUYS WITH ALL THE MONEY?!!!!!!!! There's nothing new in "The Big Green". If anything, you want them to lose. Steve Guttenberg used to have such a good resume ("The Boys from Brazil", "Police Academy", "Cocoon"). Why, OH WHY, did he have to do these sorts of movies during the 1990s and beyond?! So, just avoid this movie.

Oh my god, WHY, did I waste my precious time on this film? It is pathetic, waaaay OTT and unrealistic, and one of the worst films I have ever seen in my life. Yes, MY LIFE. I am embarrassed for Yash Raj films, the poor guys have to live with the horrible news that yes, they produced this terrible film.This is by far, the most, trashy, sexual, eyebrow-raising movie I have ever seen by Yash Raj Films. I cringe for them, I really do.

hello all Denver fans!i couldn't agree more with you guys! This show was so cool and cute, i i watched it as a kid in the late 80s. Among Denver are other favourite too, such as Care Bears and Rainbow Brite. I am 24 now, but it is still one of my favourite shows, and my favourite cartoon from the 80s. It brings back all the memories. The theme tune was great too, i get goosebumps whenever i hear it. It is sad that it lasted such a short time, but it has remained a firm favourite.

Buster Keaton was arguably at his most enjoyable when he did short 20 minute films , and they do n't require a whole lot of preparation. In his early career (and in fact since the late 1930s), Keaton did a great deal of shorts. Many of these shorts, such as The Man from Uncle, were written for the films he was shooting at the time, as well as a handful that were created specifically for them. In these early films, Keaton had a bit more of a chance to be creative and he did a great job, often getting the material right.

This movie is on cable sporadically , and I never really watched it , thinking it would be similar to what I would have watched if I had paid for the DVD . I watched the first 2 episodes , and the 2nd one was a bit better , but it wasn't great . I then watched the 2nd 3 episodes and it was even better , and I felt like I saw the first movie and the 2nd movie in different ways . I then watched all the episodes again , thinking that the last one wasn't so good , thinking I had watched all 4 of the episodes , it wasn't at all .

the worst sequel I've ever seen. really awful songs which is upsetting considering how fantastic the first films score and story is! also, which ruins the film for me is the fact there is no John Cleese so jean bob might as well not even be in it and the new villains are dreadful. it is really annoying how that old woman type thing cant string a simple sentence together properly without repeating her words over and over and over again. but to be fair Uberta not shutting up is a little bit funny.

It is an interesting exercise to witness the early works of great artists . Sometimes , even without the 20/20 hindsight, one is inclined to think that it wasn’t a very good work, that it didn’t have much soul. But that is not always true. I recently had the chance to see a piece from an artist who is so much more than a painting. In fact , it was one of the greatest pieces of art ever made by a person who did not even have an art career. It was a series of portraits done by none other than Diego Rivera .

I really wanted to like this film but it barely eked out a 3. It's surprising that equal amounts of the votes were 10, the other half 1. All the characters were entertaining and even talented but as a whole the film didn't pay off. Sebastian Hernandez is appealing; charismatic and likable (he even physically resembles Marc Anthony in a more approachable yet ultimately conscious sort of way...) but even he couldn't save this mess of a movie. Scenes dragged on far too long and points were ultimately beaten to death.

I concur with the other users comment . Hard to believe that this movie actually came out in 1994 because it's such a classic movie . I also loved it and I always thought that I had a good time at the end . The best part was when she was saying " I wish I was your daughter." I always thought that she's a very cool girl and I wish that I have a girl like her in my life . I will never be like that . Even now , I still think that this is my favourite movie .

i love watching the Jericho mile . i mean watching peter Strauss run the mile is like watching usain bolt run it for all it's worth. i love his legs! i love them to death!!! i think we all agree that the mile is the hardest thing to run, i mean you're constantly on your knees and the pace is insane and the heat is just crazy. but we all agreed, the running community had the best Mile Mile marathon of all time. so of course i think i should win this race because i've been running it for so long.

Now , I love bad , old skifee movies as much as most people . And I understand that a lot of my friends have a similar taste to me . So as soon as this movie was out on blu ray it was on my radar . If you want to see a movie on blu ray without feeling guilty about it . Here's my review of the new movie . What do you think about the new movie

I was very disappointed with the new movie . Nothing special , it’s a bad film with very poor acting , poor cinematography , and very basic editing .

I remember this bomb coming out in the early 80 's . At first it sounded like a great idea . There was no mention of a bomb and it was just a toy. Now it's one of those things that would make you wonder if there's anything more to it than that . After I got my bomb, I was in high school and I knew I would be a little bit older than a few of my friends, so I really wanted to play with them. I was really excited when I found out that the bomb was available on the internet .

This movie was alright. Mary-Kate and Ashley play twin sisters (sorry for stating the obvious) who against their will are sent to Paris to spend the week with their rich uncle or something like that.Right away two French boys (who looked slightly inbred) start talking to them and taking interest. Blah blah blah. It's an Olsen twin movie - we already know what's going to happen between them. Anyway, along with that, the twins meet a FABULOUS French model because they're in Paris, the fashion capital of the world.

If anyone has any doubts about the talent of Liev Schrieber , just a look at his new film , ‘The Loneliest Man In The World,’ released in late April. The film is the first in what’s shaping up to be a huge franchise. Schrieber’s first feature is based on his memoirs, which chronicles his life as an author, photographer, actor, and film director, but has a unique twist. He also stars in the film, though he plays a different character from the one in the book.

I know that the original Psycho was a classic and remaking it was a mistake, ESPECIALLY a shot-by-shot remake. I think that that has been more or less proven by the rest of the comments here. But there's far more wrong with this movie than just that.The first problem is the color. The original film was shot in black and white but, what few people realize is, the original was shot AFTER color film had been invented. The choice of black and white film was partially a budget concern, but it was also a stylistic choice of Hitchcock's.

I absolutely adored this movie . For me , the best reason to see it is how stark a contrast this film is to the two sequels that followed it . The story was well told , the script was great , the cast was excellent and the acting was excellent . I really enjoyed this movie as much as I did the first time I watched it , and will definitely watch it again . The writing is great , especially the opening scenes . I don't know how else to describe it , it makes me want to weep . Then again I've already been crying a bit this time around .

i did n't hate this one . i just could n't adapt to the story . it did n't really make sense to me , as a whole . i guess that is just my way of being a fan , of books and movies . i just didn't get into this one . but i think it was fun to read . my only real complaint was with the ending , and i really wish it wasn't . Author's Response: Thank you for reading, I really loved this story. I wish I could say more about it and why I loved it.

***MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS****I was super excited to go see Blood and Chocolate with my friends. I couldn't wait because the book is one of my favorites. But as soon as the movie started, I couldn't believe how different it was. At first I was like, okay, so both of her parents are dead...maybe it'll be okay. But then came the rest of the movie. By the time it was over I was furious. Nothing was correct but their names and the fact that Vivian fell in love with Aiden.

hello, looking for a movie for the family to watch on a Friday night? Can't find what your looking for? I thought this was an extremely enjoyable movie. Good for the whole family. I found that it had a remarkably rare combination of it being appealing to both adults and children alike. It was brilliant, to say the least. Bruce Willis's acting was top-notch, there was a lot of humor in it and overall, a great movie. In my opinion, it's a must-see movie.

What can I say about a movie as bad as this? The people who made this movie, didn't even try to make the monster in it look realistic. You never see more than its head, and the head is just a giant puppet that has little movement except for when it opens it mouth to roar. And the sound they used for the roaring is the best part. At many points in the movie it sounds exactly like a TIE fighter flying over! I couldn't believe that when I first heard it and had to rewind several times to make it sink in.

I have just started watching this show . Its airing in Ireland at the moment on the Irish television station RTÉ1 and I am really looking forward to trying it. I found it on youtube and decided to download the tv-series for myself. In my research I found it difficult to get a grasp on what exactly this show is about. I could not figure out why someone would pay for the privilege of watching a program about sex. In the end I am still struggling with this issue and as I am writing I am starting to question myself.

There is not much to say about this one except that it is probably the worst of the early spate of games, a bit too slow and choppy. It’s also, as one would expect, one of the best shooters. But what it did lack was an element that most shooters of its ilk – FPS’es – so desperately need, namely the gamepad. Not just the old-fashioned analogue controller that allows you to steer and shoot the way you always have, but also more recent, more powerful gaming systems like the Xbox 360’s Game Pad and PlayStation Move.

I went to see this movie at a book signing in Lexington , Ky last night . After a wonderful review of the film I went and saw it . I have to say my reaction was so much better than expected . I thought it was a comedy , but I guess it's a serious movie ! I don't have a review but I will try to give my opinion . It was well written and acted . The ending made me so sad . I wanted more than this ! I don't know what I can say to make the movie better .

When George Sluizer was told he could direct an American version of the book `` Het Gouden Ei '' /the beautiful child, he was delighted, but then he thought of his daughter and his wife. George Sluizer, the director, has directed a series of popular films in the Netherlands and Belgium and is a successful producer who has built up a following in these countries, especially for his children`s books. This is his second movie in Dutch and the first in Flanders, a dialect that is more akin to Dutch than to Dutch-Flemish.

Although promoted as one of the most sincere Turkish films with an amateur cast , Ice-cream , I Scream is one of the poorest films of the period. It is a slow and monotonous film, the script is unambitious and the acting is so wooden, it can not even make up for this fact. It is a shame, because the story is quite interesting and it has a great character in the character of Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the great leader of the Turkish Republic and the hero of the whole of this film.

The acting is awkward and creepy, and not in a good way...at all. The writing, the dialogue, and the chemistry between the actors is horrible. Nothing makes sense and every close-up of an actor's expression or reaction lasts 3 or 4 seconds too long, making it seem like a Mexican Soap Opera (telenovela). Everything about the writing is unrealistic, and all of the actors involved make it that much worse with their campy interpretations of the script. Am I the only one who sees this???

It's true, no one really expects anything from sequels. But even by that low standard this is a terrible film.Essentially an anthology movie, this fourth installment in the Hellraiser saga tries to be an origins story and a wind-up to the entire series at the same time. An ambitious idea. But none of the cast is given enough screen time to do anything with their characters and rookie director Yagher abandoned the film rather than give in to studio meddling. The result is a steaming pile of mediocrity that even fanboys have trouble defending. Unless you're an "Alan Smithee" fan, avoid this one.

Incident on and off a Mountain Road is Don Coscarelli 's entry in Mick Garris ' Masters of Horror series of books. The book opens with a single scene, and we get a few lines, but then the book gets to its heart and then to its climax in the last few pages. Here we get a whole chapter of action, and in that chapter we get to learn the ins and outs of this character and his world. This is not your run of the mill novel, this is a real book that gets down to what makes that character interesting.

I saw the film at the Brooklyn International Film Festival (World Premiere).A haunting, intimate portrait of Loneliness, and the repercussions of letting it grow and turn into something darker.The acting of the two leads (Jessica Bohl & Richard Brundage) is excellent, and makes one wish you had met these characters before they became so damaged.Reminded me in theme of the works of Atom Egoyan (Exotica) and Raymond Carver (Where I'm Calling From).The Soundtrack (Tywanna Jo Baskette, Crooked Fingers) is excellent and reinforces moments in the film without drawing attention to itself.Highly recommend the Film and the Soundtrack.

This film is Engaging and Complex while maintaining simple beauty .Our two characters come together sharing the base of curiosity to discover themselves as they go through life’s daily changes. We see the process of growth through each day in each of the characters in this documentary . This film is Engaging and Complex while maintaining simple beauty .Our film follows the process of growth through each day in each of the characters in this documentary . We follow two characters through their life’s daily routines to see their interaction with the world, as well as each other, in a variety of settings throughout this film .

I'm sorry for not commenting lately, but my computer is still recovering from being broken. I had a couple of computer crashes today, and it is taking longer to get things back to normal.

After their star cross-country runner dies after a race , the members of a track team are stalked and killed. As one of the track team members prepares to go in to a hospital to be with his wife when he is kidnapped, he is shot by a man who has been stalking him, leaving the team member dead. In order to find out why his killer is killing his teammates and to find out if the killer wants to kill him, the team member must find out what the motive is behind the killer.

My only reason registering to this site was for the opportunity to write a comment to this movie. I felt that I had to get rid of some of my anger by writing it off me. The movie "Babas bilar" must be just about the worst film I ever seen. I really do believe that the script may have seen to been able to become a pretty good movie or at least OK, but somewhere on the line something happened. What makes it even more odd is the fact that the cast appears to be quite alright on paper.

I can't believe this movie is getting the rating that it is here on IMDb. Of course, I've come to conclude that IMDb is somewhat worthless for actually finding out if a movie is good or not as 99% of films are rated from 6 to 7. It's the conclusion and failure of crowd-sourcing on the internet. For this purpose an average is taken of most people, and unfortunately, most people are simple minded easily entertained fast food lifestyle morons. But I digress. The movie. I really don't want to waste my time writing about it.

The only reason i didn't delete this movie after 20 min is because we already wasted 20 minutes on it...the only and i repeat the ONLY effect that they used is a weird kapoera (from India?) jump on a half meter wall/trash cans, i mean, effects doesn't make a movie but... sheesh.... me and my friend hoped the entire movie for some real effect (a huge wolf?! something!?>!?!) but noooooooooooooooo... all we got is a jump! on a 0.5 meter wall + they used pharmacy's ..... and they found guns?!

I love old "monster movies" for the pure camp value. This one does not disappoint if you find that sort of thing amusing.The acting is pure 1950s stilted crap. You do get used to it when you've seen enough of these... the dialogue is very silly and ultimately forgettable. You're just there for the giant bird.The "science" in this movie is hilarious. A monstrous otherworldly avian that can manipulate anti-matter... intent on wreaking havoc and eating people... an alien who has come to Earth to nest.

I work at Memorial Hermann Hospital ( TMC ) and was also working at Texas Children 's Hospital , Women 's Memorial Hospital , Children 's Memorial Hospital and the Children 's Cancer Center at Memorial Hermann Hospital when I took this job. After working for over two years at these hospitals as a doctor, I started to feel frustrated with some of the administrative tasks that I was asked to do . After working at the Houston Children's Hospital for over a year I noticed the work environment was much different and I became aware that some administrators were not doing their jobs.

I don't know how this film went unnoticed for so long.I saw this film on TV, i was flipping through the channels and came across this unexpectedly well made film. i missed the first, probably , 10 minutes, but that does not matter..this film literally gripped me, it is a real spine chiller.The absence of well known actors in the film adds on to the effect,u do not know what to expect from the actors because they are new. U never know when they will get killed or what they are up to.

I was expecting a lot from this movie , and I can say I have n't been disappointed . First of all , it is very good in all the aspects , and I think that it is worth watching . But it was not so good that it affected the overall enjoyment . If I had one complaint about this movie I would just say that it was not good enough in one aspect , but all in all , I really liked this movie . I can't really put it into a specific category because it was a movie with good parts .

Doctor Who is amazing. It is everyones 'cup of tea'. It must be. The boys will like the monsters and the action and adventure and the girls will like the emotion and feelings that go around. Billie Piper was extraordinary as Rose Tyler. She was so emotional and made Rose so real.David Tennant is also so witty and funny and it is so enjoyable to watch.But now Billie has left and Rose is stuck on a parallel universe with her on-off boyfriend Mickey and her mother and father (he died when Rose was a baby but this Pete Tyler is from the Parallel universe).

Peter Watkins' rarely seen Punishment Park is a brutality-laced, uncompromised political weapon set across a never ending desertscape. An unapologetically left leaning anti authoritarian abuse fest, the escapades at first appear to be so over the top militaristic and sickening that it could come off as some distant fantastical dystopian alternate history, one Harry Turtledove would even enjoy. But once we delve deeper in and really pay attention to the abhorrent diatribe spouting out of those presiding over the tent topped tribunal, as well as the shotgun toting guards overseeing the bloody affair, our eyes are truly opened.

My husband wanted to watch this film because the review in the paper said that it was better than Fatal Attraction. Well, not liking either Michael Douglas or Glenn Close, I would have to agree. Not for conventional reasons though.This is one of those films that needs to be watched late at night when you don't want to watch something that really requires thought but don't want to go to bed yet.Yancy Butler is a really enjoyable bad-guy. She is not the best of actresses, in fact she isn't even good but she is perfect for this role in this film.

The untold origin of the Lone Ranger. It shows who he was and how and why he became the Ranger.Legendary bomb. The idea was not a bad one--reinvent and introduce the Lone Ranger for 1980s audiences. Right off the bat though there were problems. The studio ordered Clayton Moore (the original Ranger) to stop appearing anywhere as the Lone Ranger. It led to a nasty little battle that made headlines. I know of people who refused to see the film because of how Moore was treated. Also they hired the awesomely untalented Klinton Spilsbury to play the Ranger.

This appears to be two movies spliced into one . In the first , ZaSu Pitts is a renegade in the military, one of a small group of soldiers who escaped from the military in the late 1980's. In the second movie he becomes the military commander after being freed and taking a liking to the daughter of a man he saved from a car bomb in the first movie and being given the position he had originally been denied at the military. These two movies can be seen on the same DVD. The two are interspersed throughout this movie so it is difficult to tell which one is the movie.

I ca n't really criticize this film . It is literally the first film I ever remember seeing and leading to a career I would be happy with if it had not happened. The cinematography is simply amazing and it's hard not to fall under its spell. The film takes some time for the story and the story is very good but it does not hold my attention very long. The best thing that comes from this film is that it is extremely well made. This is a good entry point for most of us and a good start for people interested in this film and its subject matter.

oh well... its funny. should have been a sadistic comedy, a lot of horror movies lack common sense,but i think a retarded caveman would weasel his way around this situation. Don't really expect Hitchcock or anything close to this. this is a good one for friends,but i wouldn't recommend it for anything else.this movie lacks all the substance of a true horror movie,the suspense,the shock,and good characters. the killer failed to be the unstoppable force that i expected him to be,and he seemed to be the average angry "D" student able to outsmart only stupid people.

This movie has some good performances , as others have pointed out , but suffers ( as others have pointed out ) from a couple of weak points :

- The ending is rather predictable, but I’m guessing that the movie has something else going on in the last act. - It feels rather rushed , because it takes a bit of time for the story to unfold and you have to figure out the characters , and some of the action scenes, etc. Overall this is a very enjoyable movie , even if it does take a bit of time, but i’m glad I watched it.

Trite and tiring, the one-liners almost made me cry. My 4 year old left the room and ended up doing a puzzle. I don't know what age group this was written for, but the writer himself/herself didn't even want credit. As for the song, it's mildly amusing. At least it was a decade ago. There are many Christmas movies to watch. Although I've seen some many more times than this, they are still enjoyable. Whenever this comes on, I try to encourage my child to watch something else.

When this show began it was fairly interesting : we got to see what crab boat fisherman had to go through to make their crab. And then there was just a lot of luck. I didn't see many crab cakes. But that didn't stop the crab fishers from coming down to the docks to catch crab. It was a whole lot of fun. Now here's where it gets interesting. We get to go back in time to see what a crab boat was before that time. It was an interesting time. There were a lot of different boat types out there.

The first few minutes of this movie don't do it justice!For me, its not funny until they board the sub and those hilarious characters begin to gel. I was born and raised in Norfolk Virginia and met my share of "different" sailors- I even married one! Most of my favorite movies are just funny, not topical, not dependent on sex or violence and funny every time I see them. Groundhog Day, Bruce Almighty and Down Periscope are still funny even after I know the dialog by heart. Kelsey Grammar with his "God I LOVE this job!

I have read each and every one of Baroness Orczy's Scarlet Pimpernel books. Counting this one, I have seen 3 pimpernel movies. The one with Jane Seymour and Anthony Andrews i preferred greatly to this. It goes out of its way for violence and action, occasionally completely violating the spirit of the book. I don't expect movies to stick directly to plots, i gave up being that idealistic long ago, but if an excellent movie of a book has already been made, don't remake it with a tv movie that includes excellent actors and nice costumes, but a barely decent script.

This film is a work of pure class from start to finish , for a moment forget the famous 28 Days Later (which I also watched) It was a very interesting movie to watch, but I don’t think I got the full effect , I didn’t have the right frame of reference to compare it to the 28 Days Later, the film is very intense at first but I think after a while your attention will be drawn to what you see, it is also very dark and bleak, but I think the whole movie has a nice happy ending .

Maybe it 's just that it was made in 1997 , or maybe whoever managed to get this up to date in the first place. I would love to hear some of their other tunes, and I'd love to see this CD again.I would like to thank you for considering to post your comments, it's a pleasure and makes this site more enjoyable and useful.Please keep the site going. It has helped me a lot.And I hope to one day do the same for you. Thanks again! The first time I ever heard this song, it sounded very different from the one that later appeared on his second album.

During the making of this movie I once caught a statement on television about it . Something like : `` I like it but we have to wait for it to be finished because this is just a movie. `` That was the first time I got a hint that it was going to be a movie. There was also some debate whether this was a movie. It would have been better to keep the word `` movie `` as the title and to call this a movie that I would recommend to you because of its quality and the fact that it would be better.

Jess Franco makes exploitation films , and he has made tons of them . Franco is responsible for some of the greatest films of all time, like “Saving Private Ryan”, “Eternal Sunshine Of The Spotless Mind,” or “Chronon”. In his short film, “Skiing in America,” Franco looks back at his life, and explores the themes of his career. He talks about how his life changed with each film that he made. He goes into detail about the different projects that he has worked on, and how they have influenced his career.

This is one of my 3 favorite movies. I've been out on the water since I was 13, so I got a lot of the humor as well as recognizing a lot of the near-land scenery (the movie, although taking place in and around Virginia, was filmed around the San Francisco Bay), most notably the mothball fleet just east of the Benicia Bridge where Kelsey Grammar's character was first introduced to the USS Stingray, and the piers of San Francisco at the very end of the movie (including a boat that I've worked on).

While caricatures and/or references to entertainment industry people or things or even brands of products is usually a staple in many modern fiction novels, fantasy novels, and even more so in most science fiction novels, the idea of making fun of people's hobbies and/or favorite products in a non-judgmental and/or humorous way is a fairly common theme in the world of publishing. On the other side of the spectrum, the same may not be true in the real world, where it is extremely hard to get a book published that doesn't mention any company or brand in a non-offensive way.

Man , I ca n't believe the largely harsh and negative comments for this movie . Okay , it sure is fun to look back and see all the good times with your best friend but I can't believe it was made by people that have no understanding of the " culture " of the 80's . This movie has it's flaws but I thought it was quite entertaining . Not to be a smart ass but this was the first movie I saw with my parents that made us laugh out loud a couple of times . Then I watched the movie with my parents and found it really funny .

This is a movie that should be viewed and treated as a piece of art . This is an oblivious attempt to make a social commentary on the state of the world . I don’t know why Hollywood is trying to make a statement with this movie as it does not make any sort of point and does not portray a good or bad world . If anything this movie is very offensive to many of the people it tries to reach . It is interesting to note that the whole “social commentary” part seems to be a complete lie .

Mr. Bug Goes to Town was one of those films that I grew up hearing about, however a copy could never be obtained until now. I just watched this film on DVD and thought it was a delightful and charming film, with wonderful animation, a good plot and great songs. If this film was made by Disney then the film would be considered a classic, however because it was made by a little known film studio that is long gone, the film has slipped through the cracks.The film was made by the Max Fleischer studios at their Miami, FL studios and was released through Paramount Pictures.

********SPOILER ALERT************** Wasted 85 minutes of my life watching this "film". first of all, we think it is hilarious that the producer cameoed in the film as the autopsy doctor with a horrible unbelieveably unbelievable accent -- what the hell was that anyway, romanian? And how is it that in Denmark no one speaks danish except the bog creatures? (Note, the scottish camp director...). ? And who does the shopping for the bog creatures?

Honestly , this is a very funny movie if you are looking for bad acting ( Heather Graham could never act in a real movie ), and if you are looking to be entertained by a great story and great acting, this is a must-see for you. A man goes from a small town on the East Coast to a city in a far distant country, where he works on a farm, and spends most of his time tending to livestock and dealing with his wife and family. This man takes the train out to New York , and then on a train from New York to San Francisco.

When a group of escaped convicts manage to flee to a remote island , they soon find that their new home is anything but tranquil. On this island, a group of violent, cannibalistic natives are waiting for them, eager to feast on the new arrivals. When they arrive, the natives have built themselves a small temple dedicated to their deity, and have taken the new arrivals as their own - but they also have something else in mind for these strangers...they want them to be the first to sacrifice themselves on the island, so that they may be the ones to take over the island.

Mount Godwin-Austin (otherwise known as K2) is the world's second highest mountain, and if the evidence presented in this film is to be believed is the hardest mountain to climb successfully without getting yourself killed. "K2" is basically a buddy flick set in the breathtakingly dangerous world of mountaineering. While the outdoor photography takes in some truly awesome scenery, the characters standing in front of all those glorious landscapes are a crashing bore - and therein lies the fault with the whole film.Cocksure lawyer Taylor Brooks (Michael Biehn) and his quiet married friend Harold Jamieson (Matt Craven) spend their free time rock climbing.

This movie was fabulous . It is definitely a top 5 hitchcock film . The directing and camera shots are outstanding , the special effects are top notch , the action scenes are all well choreographed and shot well . And the songs are all catchy and great to listen to . If your not into hitchcock, then you can enjoy it , if you do, it is highly recommended to see the movie for sure . But , it is still good to make it on to your Dvd player so you can listen to it , if you want . It was a really good flick.

This movie surprised me . The box is misleading , the tagline is misleading and the costumes and tone of the film is misleading. I've been a fan of horror for a long time and this movie was not scary. I was expecting it to be, but not sure how that works. The movie is not scary at all, and that's why I think the movie should have been called House of the Rising Sun, as scary as it is, the movie is just one of the many horror movies released this year. I don't think the horror genre has a future.

I hope this is n't a portent of things to come . High-definition camcorders are getting cheaper all the time. The only way to save money in the future is to buy and use an adapter. I can't believe how much video quality these cameras have gotten since Apple started the MacOS X development, I've only used a handful. I've seen a $20 card for an $80 or $100 video camera. I thought it would take months to get a good adapter. It makes me so sad. Click to expand... I don't use my camcorders for video.

There are movies that are leaders, and movies that are followers. "Meatballs" was a leader. And here's one of its followers. "Party Camp" is about as interchangeable as any of its brethern who plumbed the depths that "Meatballs" (the original) had so successfully mined. Of course, that one had Bill Murray. So, what does "Party Camp" have?I'm glad you asked that question.Jewel Sheperd has made these flicks her bread and butter, and what a side dish SHE provides!

This movie is a very enjoyable homage to the Bogart and other detective films of old. Robert Sacchi nails it as Bogie and Michelle Phillips is a truly timeless beauty as Gena Anastas. However, the most noteworthy portion of this film involves the longest belly dancing scene ever produced in a Hollywood film. One well-known professional instructor commented that nothing else in cinema comes close for dance excitement. The scene, which ends up being an important part of the plot, occurs in a lushly beautiful Middle Eastern nightclub and is by all accounts mesmerizing.

This movie, although well shot and superbly acted, was awful. I felt as if I was watching a car accident--sure I kept watching but I really wanted to turn my head. The plot leaves little to be desired, was extremely disjointed, and the ending was abysmal. Although, it did fit the tone of the movie, I was hoping for something to improve this movie. I still don't understand what the references to rabies and the child get bit by the fox at the beginning of the movie. Fifteen minutes of plot that really didn't do much.

This was by far one of the worst movies Sandra Bullock has starred in . Ben Affleck should stay behind the camera he’s a better actor and has a better acting style than Bullock. Bullock was the best choice because Bullock does not know how to shoot a movie . I would like to see Sandra Bullock become a movie star and be able to create her own movies . Bullock has been doing a lot of “acting” and she has the talent to do so. She needs to go back to school and continue to work . Bullock has the talent for a few movies.

When the word `` presents '' finds its way into a title , preceded by a famous name , the title will say something about this person , or the title will describe something of interest . The title is also important in describing a person , such as when a person , such as a movie star , is referred to . Some people use a number of titles for similar things . For example , a person may have several initials in the same name . It may be used to distinguish one person from others in the same group .

Yes, why? Among the filmmakers that came out in the 80's and 90's Gus Van Sant is one of my idols. There are others, a few. Steven Sodebergh, PT Anderson, Tim Hunter, Danny Boyle, Martin Donovan, Harmony Korine, Wes Anderson. Idiosyncratic, infuriating some times, but consistent, surprising, unpredictable. Their names make me switch on the TV, go to a video store or even buy a ticket and go to a movie theater. Van Sant's "Psycho" however, gives me pause. Why? I wonder.

This is an interesting movie. I think it's very humorous, although the humor is very black. Fulci is good and funny acting himself, it's a really funny and truly crazy "self-portrait" of an artist ("I make horror films. If I would make love films, no-one would buy tickets..."). And it's really SEXY movie also: Almost all the time there is some "action" or tension going on; and many sexy girls/women... Maybe it goes to the core of why anyone starts to do movies/art in the first place...

If ( as I just pointed out in THE GOAT ) Keaton is following the tradition of the comics finding out the truth , and telling the whole truth , and not leaving things up to conjecture , or guesses . I don’t think he would be so hesitant , or hesitant to reveal it if he is doing it honestly . That’s a pretty big question mark, and I’m not qualified enough to say if I’m going to have faith in him being honest about his feelings and thoughts . That’s a different topic .

This movie stars Ben Kingsley as Frank, a hit man for some Russian mobsters based out of Buffalo. He is also a raging alcoholic, and this has caused his job performance to decline. After he falls asleep in his car during a would-be hit, his mob boss uncle sends him to San Francisco, where he is to attend AA meetings and get a job as a mortician's assistant. If you're thinking that this makes absolutely no sense, you're not alone.It gets worse. Well, it actually gets better, but not before getting much, much worse.

The finest short I 've ever seen . Some commentators suggest it might have been lengthened , due to the fact that this is a very good film . But to me , it's more like a longer 'A Man Escaped A Prison And The Man Who Killed Him' . I don't think this film is meant to have been lengthened in any way . All I know is , it's very good . It's a film I would like to watch again . I 'd recommend it , but I would never recommend it to a young child .

I have been wanting to see this since my French teacher recommend it to me over forty years ago . I always thought it was the best book I ever read. And to think I thought it was only for young children. But the truth is there is plenty of information here, which I always thought would be too scary and too intense for my kids. And now I have a very happy daughter who knows I'm trying to help her with this book. So, I decided to give this book to my daughter after I started reading it.

`` Disappointing '' is the best word I could think for this film , especially considering the glowing reviews it's been getting since it was first announced. Not that you really need to tell me that. Just get over it. This is not a film I would go out of my way to see. It is, however, one that you have absolutely no business going out of your way to watch. It's got a great premise and some very entertaining scenes, but for me at least it has no real reason to be on your radar screen.

Hard Justice is an excellent action movie! The whole movie is really nothing but shooting and fighting but it does have a very good vampire plot! For the people who say they don't make shoot em ups and fighting films like they use to. Well, this one is really hard-core! Don 'The Dragon' Wilson is excellent and his character is really cool in the movie. Nicholas Guest was very good as well and he arguably steals the show! He really performs as a fantastic villain! Melanie Smith was also good. I think that this very fine looking actress is very underrated.

(Contains spoilers)People who put a Lonely Heart's ad in the newspaper are often idealists. They try to put into a few words everything they are and expect. The exchange of letters is full of hope...Louis Mahe (Jean Paul Belmondo), owner of a cigarette company on the ile de la Reunion (east of Madagascar) is so affected by the letters of Julie Roussell that he proposes to her. But not the expected pretty brunette comes from board of the "Mississippi", but - Catherine Deneuve.

I understand the purpose of the director to tell stories that are n't stories , but the way he tried to explain that to me is beyond ridiculous. I'd rather people stop talking to me and walk away from this thread.
