Experiences after death and "dejavu". The film is not as a comedy but isn't funny at all, at least not express yet. It's so naive. Charming film but naive film. A must to avoid. The Middle ages sequences seems coming directly from fairy tales and it's not the matter at all. Eileen Davidson is so charming and Voight is doing his best.

Bottom-of-the-barrel stinker is so bad it's beyond funny. The "plot" is about an American mercenary, played by Reb Brown (in the film he's called a "military adviser" but it's not really clear if he's in the American military or not), helping the army of a Latin-American country fight guerrillas who winds up joining the guerrillas when the government turns on him, imprisons and tortures him. Shannon Tweed is a "sports equipment saleswoman" he picks up in a bar who gets caught up in all the intrigue.

When George Sluizer was told he could direct an American version of the book "Het Gouden Ei"/the movie "Spoorloos"(outside Holland, this movie has the name "the Vanishing" too), he was told that this would only go through if the ending was changed - He was told that 'the American Audience' wouldn't approve the original ending. Of course, the original ending is much better, and without it, the movie loses its impact. Because I have already put this in the trivia section, I won't give the original ending and keep my comment spoiler-free.

As talk-shows go , Larry King Live is not bad , and since he occasionally gets good guests , it’s worth checking out. The program features interviews with presidents from both political party’s , comedians , politicians , and people from the entertainment industry. This is the best of the series , in my humble opinion. There are 6 interviews in this episode. First , the interview with George Bush . Then Larry King goes on his first ever interview with George W . Bush , this was a bit more than he wanted .

First of all, let me say that I am in no way denying the importance of the subject - quite the opposite. I am Polish and I have been aware of the Katyn massacre for quite a long time (in fact, two of my family members died there), so I was looking forward to this film. Unfortunately, I was disappointed.I think the main problem lies with the script, which encompasses too many subplots and characters, none of which are properly developed. The characters are painfully one-dimensional; their stories are intertwined, but lack overall meaning.

Mark Walhberg in a great role, idolises a rock star to the extent of knowing all his songs, imitating him to perfection, and dressing like him. When the opportunity comes for him to take over his "idol's" role in the band, he jumps at the opportunity. However the role of a rock star may not be what it is cracked up to be... and relationships can change .... This movie certainly struck me as having the theme of what you attain for may not be what you think it is once you get it.

Secret Service agent Jay Killion (Charles Bronson) has been assigned to protect the President-elect's wife, the new First Lady (Jill Ireland). She is a very difficult woman and Killion has his hands full. She is the victim of numerous assassination attempts, all directed by the President's Chief of Staff, who wants the First Lady dead. This movie insults your intelligence with not only the story line, but also with the lack of realistic locations. For example, in the scene depicting the Inaugural Parade, the First Lady is in a Rolls Royce convertible with agent Killion and without the President.

I started to take a critical view on this adaptation within the first few minutes but as a dedicated Jane Austen fan I persevered through to the end... However, this is not a programme I would recommend to someone unfamiliar with her work as I don't think it does the book justice, nor makes particularly entertaining television in its own right. There was something about this adaptation that lacked believability - many of the costumes and even the actors did not have an authentic look and I found the acting to be, at times, poor.

I see that C. Thomas Howell has appeared in many movies since his heyday in the 80s as an accomplished young actor.I bought this DVD because it was cheap and in part for the internet-related plot and to see how much older C. Thomas Howell is; I do not recall seeing him in any movies since the 1980s.In just a few words: what a very big disappointment. I give some low budget movies a chance, but this one started out lame. Within the first 15 minutes of the movie, this elusive woman is chatting with an Asian guy in a chatroom.

I am a Talent Manager . I have been for 15 years now . I have discovered some wonderful talent in my industry . The biggest challenge I face is how to attract the best talent from all around the world . The reason I created my own company is to enable me and other companies like me to help their employees to be more effective . What I do? I help the top performers in my industry to grow and improve their skills so that they can get ahead in their job and career . In my business there are thousands of companies .

Lucio Fulci was famous for his Italian splatter movies, mostly his undead films like Zombie or The Beyond. Here he directed a black comedy of sorts, but there's just one problem: its nauseating. I say this knowing that I like City of the Walking Dead (which is also gross but not like this). A compulsive gambler gets money for his habit by romancing ugly and deformed rich women then murdering them and stealing their cash. The film makes this plan look that easy. I guess the women were too ugly to go to a bank, so they always had their cash on person.

In this film , we 're invited to observe the descent into a moral and emotional funk of someone who is clearly in need, but has yet to reach their full potential; the descent into the abyss of loss, where hope becomes a mirage and all you see are the remains of the hopes of a long dead world; the descent into the deep of despair, when everything is worthless, nothing is left, and you are on your knees. As you can see, there is no escape from this reality that you’ve been brought to.

I went to this film having no idea what to expect. I actually took a date to it in the theaters when it first came out. We both thoroughly enjoyed it and it helped to have someone to discuss it with after seeing it.I only recommend seeing this film if you appreciate non-mainstream movies. It's not as disjointed as Liquid Sky or as fanciful as Forbidden Zone. The original plot is very easy to follow. There's A LOT of subtle humor.Here's a quick summary of the plot if you are completely lost: A big-brother type government keeps tabs on everyone in society.

Soultaker was written by and starred Vivian Schilling . It also starred Joe Estevez , Gregg Thomsen , and Robert Townsend. Awards
Soultaker received five nominations including three wins: Best Cinematography (Tobey Maguire), Best Sound Mixing (Michael Lang) and Best Production Design (Michael Landon) all at the 14th Academy Awards. The film won for Best Sound by Michael Landon, and the film received two Best Costume Design awards, a Best Sound Effects Editing award, a Best Production Design, and a Best Sound Mixing at the 24th British Academy Film Awards.

...means "take up and read", which is precisely what I felt like doing after having seen this marvelous film.Von Ancken stimulates and inspires with this breathtaking and superbly executed adaptation of Tobias Wolff's 1995 New Yorker article of the same name. The incredible performance by Tom Noonan is brilliant and provocative and the editing, sound design, cinematography and directing are truly inspired. The nuanced changes and embellishments on the original story are subtle, clever, and make the film cinematically more dynamic. It's lyrical pacing is mesmerizing and begs you to watch it again.Watch out for this young director...he's going places.

Although Charlie Chaplin made some great short comedies in the late 1910's, others don't quite make it. Examples like His New Job and Shanghaied come to mind, and I would also The Floorwalker in this category.Charlie gets mistaken for a manager of a department store (and vice versa). This manager tries to steal money from the cash register and make a run for it, and Charlie is just an honest costumer but getting blamed for some missing objects, stolen by other costumers.There aren't many laughs in it, except for the last couple of minutes or so with some great scenes on the escalator.

Aside from the fact that the women in the film are stunningly beautiful and all the camp prisoners are too cute for anyone to actually hate, there’s not a lot of redeeming value for these women. In fact, some of them just get worse and worse with age (I don’t think it was that long ago, after all). I guess there are some exceptions, but overall it was a very mediocre piece. The biggest problem I had with the entire film was that it went to very dark places, but that’s the only problem that really stuck out to me at all.

Firstly , few colleges allow students to take courses from their parent 's lover . Secondly , few women professors are good enough to give a good quality education , because most professors are not interested in teaching . So , most students feel they can do all the hard work with a little bit of money. But this time , if I can help the students , I will not only give the money , but also teach them in the best way. I will give the course , but the students also can pay the money , for the course .

Stealing is a crime , and these guys , Kenny Yakkel and Corbin Bernsen look like their going to get a taste of what that feels like

This is the kind of story I'm talking about. Kenny Yakkels life has taken a detour for the last few months and it looks like his criminal career may follow a similar trajectory. We first broke the news on Tuesday, November 17th, that Yakkel had been convicted and sentenced to 12 months of probation and 500 hours of community service following an incident in the parking lot of a Minneapolis shopping plaza in November of 2014.

I was actually fairly surprised to find out a movie based on the Far Cry game had been created . I thought I’d given it some consideration. I think the game does an excellent job, and the story and gameplay are awesome. The voice acting is also pretty good, it’s great to be able to enjoy a movie with the voice work of John Krasinski. I am not a gamer, but I do enjoy the movies. I’d be interested to see more video games in video games. What I do enjoy is seeing video games in a movie theater.

I'D BUY THAT FOR A DOLLAR!! !I did buy this film for a dollar and I've seen much worse for much more! !This is a Scottish sci-fi film from Mark Stirton and according to the Making of (hysterical by the way) the production only cost $8000. Eight grand!!! That wouldn't pay for half a minute in Hollywood!! Nevertheless ---- This is top fun film making. If you like things gritty then you're in for a treat. These are some rough character with rough voices and harsh swearing.

This film is undoubtedly one of the greatest landmarks in history of cinema. By seeing this film,we can only retrospectively notice that world cinema in 1950s had such a purely humanistic dramaturgy,such a strong and adequate use of sound-image montage,and almost religious admiration of ethical choices in human life. Cinema was then not only one form of arts. It was much higher than ordinary life and it gave many people hope to live after the tragic war. It is said, that even Picasso was moved and cried that such a work of art can appear only once in 100 years!

I enjoyed Ramin Bahrani's Man Push Cart, and this film is equally good. This slice of life is almost a documentary about how life on the edges is lived.Alejandro Polanco and Isamar Gonzales do an excellent job as a 12-year-old brother and a 16-year-old sister who live in a small room over an auto shop. There are no parents; they are on their own surviving. Ali supplements his income by stealing auto parts, selling bootleg DVDs and selling candy on the subway. Izzie supplements her income working a food truck by selling herself.

Begrudgingly gave it a 3 - one point each for Fonda , Stanwyck , and the supporting cast.Never saw this coming. I am just so glad to see these films getting more and more positive critical praise. The fact is that you were not able to see it at all, and you should have seen it, and you are in the minority. The only reason we didn't see it, and the other critics were so nice, was because our local theater was so full that the critics would not even consider showing this film unless it had an all-star cast of directors, actors, and actresses.

****SPOILER ALERT**** My boyfriend, some friends, and I rented this movie as part of a marathon of really bad movies. We sort of knew what we were getting into. But the lack of plot, direction, and special effects actually left us hoping for a great (or passable) fight scene between the two main characters... the badly rendered swimming cobra and the super violent giant komodo (that ate people like scooping ice cream)... we sort of get this in the end, but had to be cut short due to possibly budget or time constraints?

_The Wild Life_ has an obvious resemblance to _Fast Times At Ridgemont High_, and _The Wild Life_ comes up short.------------ Some other stan wrote the above comment. Of course The Wild Life is no Ridgemont. Ridgemont is the quintessential 80s flica. However, the Wild Life is enjoyable if you're not whiny about mindless movies being mindless movies (especially when you know it's supposed to be a mindless movie in the first place). The little Latino from Scarface is in this movie and he's straight disrespectful ("I got Visa...Masterrrrr Charrrrge!!")

I know that the original Psycho was a classic and remaking it was a mistake , ESPECIALLY a shot-by-shot remake that didn't really show us the full story in any kind of sense of continuity, plot wise. And I'm pretty certain that it would've been a lot darker if the movie had continued with the previous characters instead. But that's just me, and maybe you have an opinion on why or why not you think this one was a mistake and how much you like it as a version of the movie. Okay, let me say first that the only version I have seen was the first.

Of the thousands of movies I 've seen so far , this is the first one which made me think:

Do we really want to watch this ? The plot is a set-up to make the viewer sympathise with the protagonist, not empathise with his story. The story moves in the background and is only revealed when the protagonist is ready to do something heroic. But it is a very simplistic plot, it makes the hero likeable without even trying to show us his story. And the story itself is predictable , it is too much about the hero trying to prove himself to the heroine.

This production of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark is by far the best that I have seen. Although it may not have the production value of some of the more recent adaptations, it does have the most important element: Sir Derek Jacobi as Hamlet.Jacobi's portrayal of the disturbed Prince is multi-layered and riveting. His displays of emotion swing from hatred to sorrow, love to vengefulness and everywhere else on the map, but without seeming forced or over-the-top. In fact, some of the more powerful sequences occur when he underplays them, with stillness, soft speech and thoughtful expression.

This film is not one of those films so bad you get annoyed and mad because it seems to be taking itself so seriously that you just want to punch it in the mouth and walk out, so you might want to get some sleep. It makes me sad when I watch it. I watched it for my friend, she was so mad at it because she thought she was doing something wrong with it and she was like “It’s so silly, I just watched a movie and it’s a big joke.” It makes me sad when it’s just so stupid.

Treat Williams reached a degree of stardom with this movie , and really squandered it . Do n't be led to believe that a movie about a guy who kills a woman is going to be anything else than a horror movie . After the fact, I could go on and on about that, but I'll spare you that . What I am going to do here is to talk about the movie and how I thought it was all going to work , and why I felt like I got exactly what I was getting and nothing more . First up , what did you think of the movie ?

This movie makes "Glitter" look like "Schindler's List." Tarantino and the Weinsteins really need to consider more carefully before putting their names on a product. Green-lighting a P.O.S. like this, regardless of the friendships involved, is just bad business. Larry Bishop needs to be kept away from a movie camera at all costs. Writer/director/producer/actor Bishop shows that his skills are inadequate for any of those jobs. A vanity project gone south, "Hell Ride" allows usually good actors to chew the scenery... at least when the camera isn't centered on Bishop's feeble attempts to steal every scene he's in.

Formulaic to the max. Neither title reflects the serial's actual content, "Fighting Nazis in Morocco," (actually, the Iverson ranch). The plot is just to fill in the lulls between fistfights. The packaging claims over 40 'fistic encounters' in 15 chapters. That's at least three a chapter! Aside from seeing Duncan Renaldo cast as a Spanish accented Frenchman, watching how much furniture is overturned, smashed, thrown, burned or blown up is what this serial is really all about. When the protagonists start fighting, you can bet that everything in the room will be in it, too.

The setup for `` Nature of the Beast '' is ingeniously simple , and fraught with limitless potential for suspense. I will begin with a brief look at some of its major players and the ways that each plays into the story line. Then we will delve deeper into the details. In a sense, this is the way the game works. You do not know who is playing until you have seen them. You do not know who the characters are in advance, you know who will play each role as you play it and you are forced to confront the character you know.

When I reviewed the video for a local magazine, I called it "the greatest achievement in the history of the American cinema." That was not wholly tongue in cheek. TW&TL remains Milius' best work, and it's sad that he has so little opportunity to work anymore. However, TW&TL remains a striking exposition of what once was known as The American Character, largely on the strength of Brian Keith's superb portrayal of Teddy R. (Obviously Milius--and Keith--admired TR tremendously to make two films about him, including "The Rough Riders.")

I watched the world premiere of this on the Starz Action channel. They call it Vampires: The Turning. The plot was a little confusing. There is a voice-over in the introduction about an 800 year war, and I didn't quite understand. The movie is about a young couple somewhere in Asia (maybe in China, I don't think the movie specifies). The couple has an argument and Meredith Monroe runs off and is kidnapped by a biker gang of Vampires. The boyfriend finds a group of vampires that don't kill humans, and enters into a battle with the bikers.

Do n't be fooled by the plot out-line as it is described on the cover ( at least the Swedish version is not so good, it is a bit too serious, it doesn't give the readers the right atmosphere) and instead read the book with a very positive feeling about the author and her writing. I think the book would work very well if you had a good knowledge about Sweden, especially about the culture and history and how it has influenced modern Swedish society. I have not read the Swedish version, but I guess it could still work.

Okay, so writer/director Larry Bishop obviously has some important connections and knows the right people in Hollywood in order to produce his own film and fill up the cast with eye-catching names. Good for him! Now what he really still needs is inspiration and talent in order to come up with an actually worthwhile scenario rather than the overly pretentious and wannabe convoluted crap he penned down here. "Hell Ride" isn't a movie; it's a hectic and hopelessly inept fan-boy endeavor to bring homage to the notorious biker-flicks of the 60's and to the recently revived Grindhouse cinema formula in general.

This feels very stilted and patronizing to a great extent . The whole plot is extremely forced - especially the ending . I do like it, I guess, but not quite as I would have liked. Well, it wasn't the ending that was so bad, but the way it ended. They could have made it more believable, but they chose to just give me what I already had in my head. The characters are great, and so is the dialogue, but they should have gone the whole length of a really well made movie and not just made me think.

Following is an intriguing thriller that requires constant awareness to be completely understood . The plot has many twists and turns as it develops. It is very difficult to describe to an uninitiated audience as to what this thriller will be all about. There is much more that it must be understood before one can grasp the full impact and meaning that lies in each of the story lines and the characters. If you are a fan of the genre you will enjoy this thriller. You should read the novel, watch the film and listen to the audiobook to appreciate what is being told to the audience.

While watching BLACKWATER VALLEY EXORCISM , I encountered scenarios and dialog so incredibly bad that I was convinced that this was going to be a disaster and it was. The ending left me in utter and total disbelief. I have no idea who wrote these things, but they will remain in my memory forever. It's not that the story is that bad. But, it's just that the writing and the acting and the overall presentation is so bad that it made it hard to care. It's a very sad story in the best sense of the word.

I saw this film on 19SEP2009 at the Cambridge Film Festival. The Beagle's only in a couple of short flashbacks, the whole thing is about Darwin's life from 1841 to 1859, when he was ensconced in Kent with his growing family, 200+ pages of Origin had already been drafted and he was wondering whether to complete the book. The script is based on Randal Keynes's book Annie's Box (Annie, Charles's daughter, died when she was 10). It is mostly a family drama, but does include sex scenes - however, the participants are married, both on and off screen.

It's said that this film is or was banned in the US since it was released. Since there is no information on IMDb I must rely on my other sources and believe it. If this is really true, the movie is even more hurtful and frightening and is it is anyway.The movie is a so-called mockumentary, although I think the topic is too serious call it like that. It creates a scenario where America is like a military state and all revolutionary objects are arrested immediately without proof. After an obligatory tribunal they have to decide if they go to prison for some years or choose the punishment park.

Actor turned director Liev Schreiber ( The Sum of All Fears ) does an above average screen version of the novel, but he fails to deliver. His characters do little more than mumble to one another, and it's difficult to imagine anything in the plot actually happening. It's a bit like the plot of The Truman Show, but much more ridiculous. I feel like the film is better in the original Japanese form. I'd love to read a summary of it but I'm not sure there is anything there. In the end I guess it comes down to how well it's read.

Lackawanna Blues is a drama through and through. It details the life of a strong woman by the name of Rachel Crosby (S. Epatha Merkerson). Rachel is referred to as Nanny by all who know her, but she could have just as easily been called Wonder Woman. She epitomized strength, will power, confidence and resolve. She owned a home that she used to house just about every type of person that society would reject. Her tenants consisted of a lesbian, a psychotic war veteran, an amputee, and a host of other vagrants that made the home miles away from ordinary.

I couldn't help but look at the time every 5 to 10 minutes because I found this movie a total drag. Childish humor, cheap looking sets, cheap looking effects, a plot that makes "Legally blonde" look like "The Usual Suspects" and so many coincidences that I can now officially say that Robert Rodriguez had brain surgery somewhere after 1996. The only thing he left as his trade mark are some cool camera moves, but there's where it ends. OK, so the guy decided to do something new for a change, a children's spy movie.

Mean spirited, and down right degrading adaptation to the classic children's tale not only lacks the charm of its forefather but lacks any talent what so ever. Mike Myers should not only be ashamed of himself for his horrible performance that is a clear rip off of what Jim Carrey did but he should give up acting all together. He is so annoying that you would want to beat the crap out of him if you were able to jump right in the film. The sets are ugly and the cinematography is very poor.

I never read the book. Now I don't really want to. I had no clue what this movie was about when I walked into the theatre. I still don't really know what point it was supposed to get across, but I do know that a good two hours was wasted from my life. Two precious hours I can never get back.The storyline was so predictable, it's laughable. Werewolves...or something...a very Romeo and Juliet type plot. I predicted the endig within five minutes into the movie. And I was correct.The acting isn't horrible.

Estevez, Martin Sheen and Kathy Bates are superb in this portrayal of a Vietnam vet home from the war but still haunted by it. Bates plays a clueless mother who just wants the family to be a "family." Sheen is terrific as the father who tries to understand what his son is going through but is too wrapped up in his principles to really empathize. The setting is Thanksgiving Day and the relatives are coming for dinner. Estevez, who plays the returning vet, wants no part of family tradition and insists on wearing his combat fatigues to dinner, explaining "This is what I wore last Thanksgiving."

Am an ardent Vijay fan. I have never seen another movie of his which is as good as this.It has all the regular clichés that one can expect from a commercial entertainer. A hero who is bad in studies but a star in his forte i.e.Kabbadi. His friends to fill in the comedy quota. A heroine in a life-and-death situation. A villain, which I say is the best ever portrayed by the protagonist. High octane chase and action sequences. Music that can make one dance. And above all that a perfect storyline to keep all the above factors within an enjoyable circle.

`` The Journey '' is a very good film . Produced in the spring of 1958 , in Vienna , the film has some really interesting scenes in it , including the one in which the two lovers are discussing their situation . In this film the characters have been so real that at times they come across as quite convincing . The other thing about this film is , it was made before the days of the talkies . The actors who play the two lovers are very good . They are great at what they do , even if it is playing a part that is rather out of the ordinary .

First of all, I have watched this show since I was a little toddler, and I have always loved it. Sure, maybe I didn't understand it when I was that young, but I still enjoyed it! And now that I have been able to understand it for several years, I love it even more. The score of this musical is the most wonderfully detailed score I have ever heard! Every note is perfect, I don't even need to hear the singing to enjoy it!Moving on to this particular production- This is magnificent!

Chick Flick? Of course.... Been done before? Many times.... Predictable? Yes..... Worth watching? You bet! I was delighted with Sarandon and Portman's portrayals of otherwise stock characters in a familiar story line. I am a great fan of mother/daughter stories. What makes the difference between the good ones and the weak ones ARE the performances and the character development. Although this is not the BEST of its genre, I will buy it and watch it again. I felt the characters were believable and the acting was superior.

This is one of the better feel-good films of 1999 with Kate Capshaw leading an all-star cast about a small town and a love letter. First off, the scenery is beautiful, and anyone who sees this film and doesn't want to move to this location is crazy! For the cast, Capshaw is stunning as the lead actress who captivates the emotional roller-coaster role. Tom Everett Scott is charming as the "author" of the note throughout the film, and the always delightful Ellen Degeneres is hilarious! Blythe Danner and the actress who plays the bookstore saleswoman are both terrific, too.

so if a guy meets you and he says ' I want you to look at my erection ! ' you can look at it ? He is right, we should be able to have sex with any woman who wants it, not just the ones we like to think we are compatible with. This should never change. We should still look for other women and see if they can be compatible with us. What really bugs me is that we are allowed to be sexless with a woman who has never had a relationship with a man, or a boyfriend, or even a best friend.

I 've spent quite a while going through all the reviews for this film . I 'm in total agreement with all of the criticism , but one thing I feel that everyone is missing . It 's not just the movie , there is much more going on than meets the eye . So for the sake of this review I 'm going to touch on the characters , the back story , the plot , the theme that ties everything together , the special effects, the acting , and the music . This is the movie I 'm going to talk about in this article .

This film has recently been televised by Turner Classic Movies . It may have been considered racy in its time, but at least it's no longer as shocking as it was back in 2007. The story centers on two middle-aged white men who meet each other in a bar on their first day at work. But what transpires between them is anything but what you'd expect — in fact it's far too predictable to be remotely believable. It's one of the saddest movies ever made as a result of its lack of passion, and it's probably one of the ugliest movies ever made.

This was such a great film. It was done with such beautiful design, such symmetry. I love the way the classical music tied in with the classical art of earth, space and beyond. It was such a fluent, and thought provoking masterpiece. I loved the way the monoliths never changed, although primate, earth and space did. I loved how it was a question of "Do you need me/us now"? The movie expressed desire, peace, love, curiosity, finesse, gentleness, courage and innocence. What more could you ask for from a mere movie?

In this film, we're invited to observe the descent into a moral and emotional funk of someone who isn't likable to start with. What was the point of making the film, then? To show that it would have been better not to have had IN COLD BLOOD - a book I admire, incidentally - in order to have kept our hero's integrity intact? Hardly. He behaves at the party at the start of the film exactly in the same way he behaves after his triumphant reading from the book, so his degradation is a matter of degree.

The animal-eating (geek) scenes were not as bad as you would think. After having watched Mondo Cane and Mondo Magic, these scenes are average. The grossest one was when the guy ate the head off the mouse. But they were so fast and few that they didn't bother me.Otherwise, the film was just sort of interesting. I always like hearing the silly voice-overs. They never sound like what you think the actor/actress would sound like in real life. I liked the bright colors worn by the princesses. The shots of weird looking bugs were cool too.

This was Hitchcock 's third Hollywood feature , and it appears he was yet to settle into a pattern of films in which the same character repeatedly reappears in different parts of the story. As the title hints, the film also shows Hitchcock at his worst, and it begins with a film in which he plays an actor in a minor role. It's worth noting that, in this case, it's Hitchcock who is the minor role, and the film seems to indicate that we are meant to see him doing the work he does in the film, but it's not really his fault.

The film deals with universal themes, mentioning no specific country as its context: it could happen anywhere--and has, in substance if not form. Those concerned about 1st amendment issues, censorship, et al--but don't want to be bored with lectures--need art such as this to illustrate, dramatize, teach, inspire.Rickman is certainly an under appreciated character actor; he shines in this film, showing off multiple acting talents that you must see (I have yet to see him give a bad performance, though, even in not-so-great films).

Demon Wind is about as much fun as breaking your legs . It is definitely an awful example of a good game but that doesn't mean it doesn't have its flaws. It certainly is not a terrible game. It's just not the greatest. This is what happens when you try and create a great game that everyone can enjoy. You have to have something for everyone so you can get away with something that everyone can appreciate. It makes it very difficult to just get a game that everyone will love and be satisfied by.

Any fan of Russian cinema will have great difficulty in believing the sub-par performances phoned-in by Mashkov and Bodrov Jr. The movie in question, which has never been screened in North America, was the director's last before his tragic death, which occurred on February 5. The script was penned by Nikolai Todorov, the film itself by Vladimir Nikitin. The cast was comprised of Yuri Bodrov (Dmitri), Lyudmila Kozakina (Alyona), Nikolay Makarov (Oleg), Evgeny Vlasov (Vitaly), Yuri Mashkov (Mikhail) and Aleksandr Vasiliev (Alexander).

First of all, let me just say that after watching this movie I felt like I'd been sold a bill of goods. Mind you it's not the movie's fault that IMDb has it listen as a comedy first and a horror second (although I don't know how that's entered...maybe some moron from the film's crew put it in). Being a fan of the horror/comedy genre, I checked it out based on that and I'm so, so sorry I did. Where to start? First of all, to touch back on my beginning, there's no comedy in this movie.

There was nothing remotely funny about this movie. It makes fun of various sports movies and clichés but nothing about it is remotely funny. Most of the movies they parody doesn't even fit in with the film and are really only their so they can be in it. Non The main actor was well cast in it but that's really the only good thing about this film. Also the various cameos in it were kind of cool to see but i have no idea why they would waste their time being in this piece of garbage.

The movie is nothing extraordinary . As a matter of fact , it is an insult to the horror genre which I am sure you all know a great deal about . I will be brief here as I think there is nothing extraordinary about it . It does however do a good job at showing some great acting and great acting in the film. First of all I am going to start with the acting. This film is directed by Stephen Sommers and co written by Jody Davis . It is based on a novel entitled ” The Girl from the Other Side” .

Mikio Naruse's examination of the lives of three idling, constantly complaining, single ex-geishas in post-war Japan is a wonderful character piece. They used to be friends in the old days but now their relationship is strained because one of the women has become a successful moneylender and the other two owe her. Although the moneylender is the only one who has become successful in this rebuilding economy, she is the only one of the three that has no children. The other two each have a child whom they depend upon for income, because neither of them work.

I was expecting `` Born to Kill '' to be an exciting , high-tension film noir . Instead , it's more like a horror thriller . The film is based on the popular graphic novel from the late 1960s by Robert Crumb. I won't say much about it , as I already have a lot to say about the film . Instead , I'll mention that I loved it , even if I'm not as excited about the movie now as I was then . But this is a film worth checking out as part of your " must see " lists for the month of January .

This is a forgotten classic of a film , and Harmony Karin borrowed a ton from it for `` Gummo `` . This film tells the story of the first person to go to Mars . The movie is still a great time killer , and Harmony Karin had a good hand at it . A little background on Harmony Karin and her career

It is about a girl with the face of Marilyn Monroe . What we know from the trailer is that this could be Harmony Karin, and the movie is based on this. Harmony is a well established actress and director .

Perhaps the wildest outlier in Alfred Hitchcock 's career is this straight-out comedy vehicle by the director , pairing Carole Lombard as a vengeful ex-lover (played by Geneviève Page) with the soprano Gene Kelly. The story concerns an affair with a woman who returns the affection. Kelly's part is just a minor role (though he is a good actor) with Lombard performing the role as an exotic beauty. Hitchcock's film has all the hallmarks of its original source material, a wry sense of comedy and a certain edge, but is more than a bit sappy and one-sided.

Yeah, a long time ago it turned into a tourist attraction. Now it's a prison again. Kind of. Well, it's more like an airport mixed together with a junior high school but there are lots of guys running around wearing orange jumpsuits, so I guess in that way it's like a prison. Not really though. When Sasha, Steven Seagal's character, is being admitted into prison, he's standing shackled in line and wanders over to a different line so he can talk to his friend, like he's in line for the security check at the airport.

The most intense and powerful film I have seen in years. There have been other films before that delved into the Vietnam Vet but nothing compared to this emotionally heartwrenching film, as a typical American suburban family, circa 1972, comes apart at the seams, revealing the scars that Vietnam has left on our all of our collective souls. The cast is A++++ fantastic with all four actors(with Kathy Bates a stand-out) giving riveting performances. What is wonderful about this film is that you take no sides, but understand all four characters and empathize with them, even though all four have divergent viewpoints and needs.

It does not surprise me that this short ( 91 minutes ) B/W movie that was made 50 years ago is now considered a classic ( it has been turned into a television series with a similar premise ) . What does surprise me is that it is still shown and discussed on late night tv . A lot of people still think that the film was made because of the " sex " . I do not think any of those things occurred . If there was any sex in this film it was more in the sex scenes with women .

I was 19 years old when I saw first saw this film , in the theater . I have a strong belief that it was the greatest film since “The Ten Commandments”, but I think there is more that can be done and it can still be called a masterpiece . The plot of this is a bit complicated, but there are so many great things about it . If you haven’t seen any of my films you should definitely check this one out . I think you will have a much different experience , especially if you are the type of person who likes to see new films.

The actors in this dark film are truly believable and well cast. The quality of the camera work makes you feel as if you are there The screenplay is intense and does not wander. The plot is one that makes you want to watch it a second time from the new perspective gained by the ending. We showed this film to a small group of patrons at Gadsden's Center for Cultural Arts. After the film, ever patron was eager to discuss the film and one person called me the next day to say that they were still "bothered".

There's only 2 reasons I watch this show...I invested the time already in previous episodes and Col Tigh. For all you supposed Sci-Fi fans out there who love the new BSG, give me a break! Go read some classic Sci-Fi novels by the true greats or watch some of the milestone films and TV shows from days gone by and you'll see what hacks these BSG writers are. Their only gimmick is "who is the fifth cylon". Poor writing and really, truly no sense of character development.

Please do not blame Korea for this bad movie . I am in Korea ( please excuse bad English ) and I have watched the movie again, but this time, there are some issues in the movie I didn’t see before. I hope it would have been improved as the new one has some other issues that need to be fixed. The movie is called “The Wages of Sin”. It’s a story about Korean-Americans who lived in America in the 70’s and the hardships they had to face. It’s about being able to live in America legally with your family.

Julie Andrews plays a German spy who falls in love with an American pilot Rock Hudson , while on an undercover mission to assassinate Adolf Hitler , during World War I, and she is one of the first female spies in the history of the United States. Andrews was also the first woman to earn the rank of captain in the United States Army in World War I and she is also known for her romance with US Army Air Forces pilot Rock Hudson in the war. Andrews served as assistant director and assistant director, as well as as acting director of the Army Air Forces (AAF) in 1917.

The Girl in Lovers Lane is one strange little low-budget film. On its surface, the movie tells the story of a tough drifter named Bix (Brett Halsey) who spends his time looking out for a young kid named Danny (Lowell Brown) and the girl, Carrie (Joyce Meadows), that Bix meets who would like to look out for him. Nothing overly interesting happens (Bix goes out with Carrie, Bix gets Danny out of trouble, Carrie's father drinks a lot, etc.) until about 10 minutes to go in the movie when Carrie is murdered.

I would like to comment on how the girls are chosen. why is that their are always more white women chosen then their are black women. every episode their is always more white women then black one's. as if to say white women are better looking then black women. I would like for once see more black women then white. and it not just your show it's like that in a lot of shows always more white's. but i would have thought since you as the head honcho of the show you would see this yourself and have more black women on your show.

I have so much hope for the sequel to Gen-X . Luckily , my hopes have came true . You all should start a Kickstarter for this book because you have nothing better than this book to donate. I love this series so much and I'm thrilled to have the sequel so I can read this book more often! It's been awhile since I last wrote in so I have a long way to go and a lot of things to tell you, but let's get started! This weekend I had my birthday.

Leslie Nielsen hits rock bottom with this absolutely horrible comedy that is the worst mainstream film that I have ever seen. There is nothing to like about this film, as it is essentially a one-joke film, and the joke isn't all that funny. How many times are we supposed to laugh at an almost blind man making a fool out of himself? That's not funny, that's just pitiful. Nielsen seriously needs to start refusing some of these pathetic scripts, and Stanley Tong needs to stick to making Jackie Chan films, because it doesn't get much worse than this.

After being off the air for a while , Columbo returned with some new made-for-TV mysteries that , while not exactly what you’d call compelling, will keep you watching for a long time , and will be sure to entertain for years to come. If you have any interest in TV you should not miss this season. If you have any questions about the shows , or would like the full set of reviews and clips, you can find us HERE. The following review and clips are for the season 1 and season 2 of Columbo, and were taken from the season 2 DVD.

being a fan of Bela Lugosi,Boris Karloff,and Lon Chaney Jr i had to see this.what tripe the only thing good about this is the clips of Lugosi,Karloff and Chaney Jr.along with all the vintage clips,that do not gel with the new black and white footage.not even close to Steve martins dead men don't wear plaid,that was done great.with all the technology we have now why was'nt this done better?if you are planning to shell out 5 bucks and some change,be warned this is really bad.

The centerpiece of Lackawanna Blues is the character Rachel `` Nanny '' Crosby , who runs a boardinghouse and provides the women with domestic labor. When she has a chance, however, she breaks out her sewing kit, starts her own sewing circle and becomes the driving force in a series of increasingly destructive plots. The show opens with the arrival of Crosby , who is in a bit of a rut from working on her own for a while. In fact, the show begins with a plot of her making her first attempt at sewing something herself: a piece of lace for a wedding dress.

Two years after 'Airplane!' took off, Jim Abrahams, Jerry and David Zucker cast one of its stars - Leslie Nielsen - in this hilarious television series, a glorious take-off of old U.S. detective shows such as 'Dragnet'. Nielsen played Frank Drebin, America's answer to 'Inspector Clouseau'. It had the same style of humour as 'Airplane! '; clever visual gags in the background, unnoticed absurdities, and recurring characters such as Johnny the shoe-shine boy who seems to know everything about everything. Guest-stars ( including William Shatner! ) were killed off in the opening credits.

I saw this last week during Bruce Campbell 's book tour . I thought it was amazing . Almost everything he said was spot on . He made a very interesting argument that if you think about the "big picture", you should be a little more forgiving to the police. He made a great point of that. I can't wait to read the book now that I have a new perspective on things. Thanks again for the book. You really made me think about how I treat people and what is right and wrong. I love your book!

This film proves a theory I have had for quite some time - in Australia, as long as a film deals with the right topic, it will be a success regardless of how terrible it is. Aussie Park Boyz could not possibly be any worse - the acting is beyond terrible, the plot is basically a poor Warriors knock-off, and the filmmakers clearly have no idea about ethnic gangs in Australia (an Irish gang in twenty-first century Sydney! The last time any Irish gangs were in Australia was about a hundred years ago in the time of the tinkers!)

I had heard that this film was stylish and intriguing, but I just found it annoying. It's been a while since I've seen it (and hopefully I won't find out all my memories are wrong and I'm unjustly condemning this movie), but my memory is that the filmmakers tried to portray Leopold and Loeb as victimized by an anti-gay society, and that this somehow caused their horrible crime. I totally disagree with this point of view, and think it's unfair both to homosexuals and to Bobby Franks, the real victim of the story.

This one and the one prior `` Toulon 's Revenge '' and the next one seem to be completely different films, though I am not certain as to why this is, since the plot is similar, and the action is mostly similar. I do believe however that there are parts of the plot that are similar, especially the final scenes in Paris. It's a tough film to explain, because it seems so simple to me. I can't find the word "tragedy" in any dictionary I've been able to find, but I suspect it's because I can't think of an example in French.

Right this moment I am watching this movie on TV here in Tokyo . Beautiful scenery , beautiful sets of characters . All I can say is that it’s awesome , this is the best film ever ! I got the opportunity of a lifetime to have my first visit to Japan ! It is a long way for me to leave Japan after watching this movie , it is not only the film , but also the people of Japan ! So here is a list of the best things I saw during this visit to Japan.

to make this short and sweet: i hope this movie will not be considered the seminal work for the "gener-asian" of american film making. the acting was sub-par, relying on stereotypes, raised voices, and exaggerated eye-buggery to convey its message. chris chan park does not delve very deep into the any of his characters, allowing them to remain caricatures of angry/frustrated/distant/uncommunicative asians. these depictions do not make characters mysteriously appealing; it makes them confusing and unsympathetic. i like to think that us asians are more complex than that.i came out of the movie unconvinced.

The film opens with the director talking to the camera and saying he is going to show a story about his own childhood. In the story, as it opens, the family are in the basement of the manor house and there is a man on the sofa who looks very much like the film’s villain. The family are the only people in the room.

This horror movie starts out promisingly enough and there is a moment where I thought to myself "this is going to be really good". However, it gets rather boring rather quick at the end. The acting is fairly good, as is the location and the story starts out rather well too. The problem, not enough kills on screen and an ending where you have the monster basically turning tail and running. I wanted to see more, especially after a very good sleeping bag scene where I thought the movie was picking up and going to be a winner.

The minutiae of what's involved in carrying out a robbery is what makes this one of the best of all heist movies. Then there's the robbery itself, a wordless, thirty minute nail-biter that has never been surpassed, followed by what is probably the cinema's most pronounced example of dishonor among thieves as things begin to spectacularly unravel, and we have what is unquestionably the greatest of all heist movies.This was a tough and unsentimental film when it first appeared in 1955 and it is just as tough and unsentimental today. (It displays some of the edgy brutality of Dassin's earlier "Brute Force").

"Opposing Force [1986]" wasn't as good as "Dr. Strangelove" and it wasn't as good as "The Bridge on the River Kwai". Heck, it wasn't even as good as "G.I. Jane", which is pretty sad.The film revolves around a basic ethical problem: In a simulated prisoner-of-war situation, how far can you go before you start breaking the law? What exactly IS the law in such a situation? How can you simulate the torture of someone without actually torturing someone? Can you intentionally inflict pain? How about breaking bones?

OK , well , no one in their right mind ( s ) would pick up a movie titled ``The Last Action Hero.'' It is a title that has become synonymous with action packed movies. I have to admit , I was a little skeptical about this movie , as its name implies it is an action movie as well as a thriller . There is not much to be found in the trailer for this movie , as the majority of it is just a car racing scene for the sake of the title.

All I can do is laugh. Wow. I like Jim Wynorski's movies, I really do. I mean, Chopping Mall is a classic. But this, what happened to this guy? He used to make funny horror movies, that tried to be good. But this was hardly even funny...I mean, I guess it was, because I laughed. The villain is incredible. I mean, horrible CGI. It looks...terrible. And the movie has no gore, and no nudity as redeeming qualities. It is rated PG-13.

Created by Dennis Spooner , 'Department S ' was a glossy thriller show about an offshoot of Interpol , based on the real life of US intelligence officer Richard Jewell , as he infiltrated a gang of international terrorists. It lasted only six weeks due to interference by the American government. This was a big show at the time, and its ratings did not match those of the police dramas at the time, so it had to be cut. In the series, Jewell is sent to London by Interpol to investigate what he thought was a terrorist operation.

A lot of the comments seem to treat this film as a baseball movie, but I feel this is only secondary. It's really about living in Japan, and it really succeeds.I spent a few years living in Japan, and I suppose the reason that this movie didn't do too well is that you sort of have to have experienced Japan to get it. I was watching this with a well-travelled friend who's never been to Japan, and he noted that many of the events in the movie were so ludicrous that they destroyed the suspension of disbelief.

Right up ( or down ) there with Toys and Jurassic Park 2 and The Phantom Menace.The premise sounded cool to me when we were kids but it never clicked until the very end. And now it's here. I had no idea when I bought it at the cinema that it was so well done, it was as good as it was because it was a movie I could have seen and enjoyed with my own child, instead I spent the money and then went and watched a movie I really wanted to watch with my own kids, I felt like a terrible parent when it was all over.

A few buddies and myself have the strange hobby of seeking out really horrendous and utterly obscure (for a good reason) horror flicks and then subsequently watching them under the influence of mind-broadening consumer goods like alcohol and/or soft drugs. Surely a lot of people do this, but they watch movies like the "Godzilla" remake, whereas we torment our eyes and brains with stuff like "The Loch Ness Horror". And, eureka, this is a prototypic bad movie! We open traditionally, with bag pipes music during the opening credits.

Great acting, great production values, good direction.But the script starts out with great pacing and interest in the first half and then falls apart in the second half. We're clear on character and motivation for the first half but then the second half leaves many questions unanswered.The conflicts raised are compelling but the follow-through is weak. For instance, we're very clear that Rudyard Kipling is pro-war but we don't know if that philosophical stance changes through the course of the film.This is the sort of picture that makes me want to look up the facts in history books.

Irvine Welsh 's follow up to Trainspotting hits the screen as three short stories set in Edinburgh , all with their own distinct voice . Welsh 's debut feature film is set in Edinburgh as two friends meet up for the first time after the break up of their relationship. The story is told through the two actors in an interview with David Walliams 's son . In the first story, which follows the three friends as they are walking through the streets of Edinburgh , the camera pans over them to capture their reactions in each of the shots .

This is my first Deepa Mehta film. I saw the film on TV in its Hindi version with its "Sita" character presented as Nita. I also note that it is Radha who underwent the allegorical trial by fire in the film and not Nita/Sita. Yet what I loved about the film was its screenplay by Ms Mehta, not her direction. The characters, big and small, were well-developed and seemed quixotic towards the end--somewhat like the end of Mazursky's "An Unmarried Woman." They are brave women surrounded by cardboard men.

While not as bad as some movies (like the horrible "Atomic Twister"), "Meltdown" still relies upon common misconceptions and inaccuracies about the nuclear power industry to advance its plot. I am currently studying Nuclear Engineering in the pursuit of a Masters Degree, and it was easy to point out flaws that would be obvious to anyone involved with the industry.Riding the false fear that a Chernobyl style meltdown could happen in an American plant, the movie states that any meltdown (even partial, according to one of the guest commentators in the movie) would mean disaster for the area.

David Cronenberg's `eXistenZ' is a well designed reflection of the philosophy of existentialism. It addresses the problems of a culture that is plugged into technology that it can no longer distinguish between fantasy and reality or between the organic and the mechanical. The movie shocks the audience with its replacement of mechanical technology with organic, metabolismic one. In this context the technology is able to be part of human body. After playing the virtual reality game of `eXistenZ', the real world feels like a game and as a result, human behavior change in order to apply violent game-urges even when the game is over.

Except for the glossy look, this show had little to recommend it. The writing was patronizing and convoluted. Without exception the characters were shallow and unsympathetic. The female characters came off the worst... reduced to spoiled, selfish airheads whose soul ambition was to run around in slip dresses and stilettos, and try to bag a man. This aspect of the show is all the more curious as the series was produced by two women! The acting for the most part was dull and humourless with the cast playing one dimensional characters attacking every scene on the same note.

I just watched The Dresser this evening, having only seen it once before, about a dozen years ago.It's not a "big" movie, and doesn't try to make a big splash, but my God, the brilliance of the two leads leaves me just about speechless. Albert Finney and Tom Courtenay are nothing less than amazing in this movie.The Dresser is the story of Sir, an aging Shakespearean actor (Finney), and his dresser Norman (Courtenay), sort of a valet, putting on a production of King Lear during the blitz of London in World War II.

I was expecting this movie to be a stinker but I wanted to see for myself , but I was disappointed. We start with the main villain of the story and I was expecting him to actually make an impact in the film. That’s not what happens. The first time we hear of the name of the villain, we hear that his real name is “The Great” and it is the name he is known for. But the villain in the story is not The Great. The main villain’s true name is The King.

Yes, I am a romantic of sorts who likes musicals and comedy and this fit the bill! Julie Andrews gives a mesmerizing performance at the beginning and end of this film with the "Whistling in the Dark" production number. The sedate-to-outrageous number that she performs in the middle of the story when she believes that Rock Hudson has been seeing a dancing/call girl is eye-popping and will certainly make you giggle.I only wish that this film could be found in video or DVD as I would surely purchase it in a heartbeat for my home library!

There are places for political commentary in film, but "Masters of Horror" is not one of them. I get enough of this stuff from Newsweek and every other editorial in the newspaper. Now I've got to watch this in horror movies? C'mon! All I wanted was a good zombie schlock film, not another "Bush is bad!" rant. If Joe Dante wants to express his politics, let him go on Air America. And if you must insist on making a "message" film, be a little more sly about it.

Given that Dylan Thomas is an icon of modern Anglophone poetry I expected a movie that would be prone to a hagiography of the subject. On the contrary the poet is presented as sexually irresponsible, a drunkard, a bad father, a lier and a hypocrite and perhaps a coward. Of course one could argue that all those things are an advantage when some one is an artist and especially a poet since one of the purposes of art is to subvert the standards of conventional morality but still I do not thing that a positive role model could crop up from such a bundle of personality traits.

I have to admit I thought she did a great job and it looks like she could be pretty good in the biz. The only issue with this movie is that they could have at least been better and made it more adult.

Jim Brown stars and produces a tale set in the Philippines just after the Japanese invasion. The story has the Japanese taking several navy men prisoner including some divers, who they use to retrieve the gold that MacArthur had dumped into the Manila bay.It's a messy movie aiming to make a statement about war and racism (The film uses Edwin McCain's War in a not so subtle montage). The performances are just adequate at best. Jim Brown is okay, but he doesn't really show any sort of range in a performance that just has him standing there looking annoyed.

******Spoilers within******* What a dull, predictable, non-scary snore-fest. The movie had no character development: I felt no empathy towards any of the characters (except may be the small boy), and did not care what happened to any of them. The movie had so many clichéd bits, or elements stolen from other horror movies.The movie was so predictable. Many times I would be saying to myself, "Let me guess, {fill in guess} happens next?" I really hated this movie and it 's the first movie written by Stephen King that I did n't finish. My first choice was to give it a pass, but this movie scared me and my wife. It was extremely dark and bleak. The ending had me questioning everything that we had done, including what we had gotten ourselves into to begin with. The movie was also very suspenseful and I did think that it was a bit scary at times. It was not a very good movie though, I am not really a fan of King's works.

I sat down through 2 hours of pure boredom . I look here on IMDB , even though it is a very small part of the films that I really like. So I was not expecting a very good film. But still I couldn't wait to find out, so here are my thoughts. Movies I thought were great:

The Matrix Revolutions

I'm going to start off by saying that if you've not watched the Matrix Revolutions it's a must see, but you have to watch the second Matrix to really truly enjoy the movie.

Note : After writing this review I see that this listing is indeed about the TV series and not the movies. But for those who are wondering the answer is that we have actually seen the movie already. So here is the link. Now I have to tell you that I have not actually watched the movie. I know that it was a good film but I was still a bit confused about it. Three distinct and distant individuals ' lives intersect with the brutal killing of one by another . The one-hour film explores the circumstances of the incident, as well as those who were at the home of the two individuals. The film begins with an interview with the subject. The film then begins a reenactment of the events that led to the murder . When the subject asks to be moved out of the car the police arrive and they shoot him dead. In a separate interview we see the subject and his girlfriend trying to explain how they came to be in the home that they are in at the moment .

The director was probably still in his early learning stages when he tried his hand at westerns . Have a good look at this film from its opening to the end . A young boy is forced to kill himself in a dark forest . What's the best way to handle this , in the beginning or in the later part . "It was the director who taught me how to do these kind of shots. The way to do these shots is not so different from a documentary but it is also very different". As the film progresses, we see that the world is changing in many ways .

I started to watch this show by accident , but I love it . The fact that main character is a little girl and the story is interesting makes it an amazing show , and I love the idea of a young girl growing up in an abusive home . My only criticism is that in the very beginning of the show , I felt there were a few points that needed to be explained , and I wondered why it took so long . I also felt it was quite long , which is not a huge complaint , but it just felt a bit like it was just too much to read through .

If you enjoy suspense this movie has it . The fact that Marina Zudina portrays a mute adds to her performance and makes her look even more believable . Her character is not a typical female in a spy movie , it seems as if she's not a real person. This movie has some great suspense scenes in which the suspense grows and gets more intense . The ending was great , as well as the way the movie closed . If you like this movie and have not yet watched the movie or seen it , watch it! Reviews & Ratings

The film was great!

A big disappointment for what was touted as an incredible film . Incredibly bad . Very pretentious . It would be nice if they tried something a bit lighter and didn’t over complicate the plot . There are some interesting things going on here but it feels a bit like they were going to try something a bit more original and new . The plot of the movie revolves around a family of five that goes to stay with an uncle and aunt who has a mansion on the lake . There are a lot of interesting characters in the film . It could have been interesting but instead it is boring .

This is an interesting, hard to find movie from the early 70's starring Jan Michael Vincent as a young man who doesn't make the cut as a marine. Dressed in 'baby blue' outfits to humiliate them as they are sent home, the failed recruits are sent packing. Vincent stops at a bar and runs into a very young Richard Gere who has just returned from a tour in the Pacific as a hard-core Marine 'Raider'. Gere's character is already jaded and contemplating desertion, and he takes advantage of Vincent's innocence, stealing his 'baby blue' uniform after getting him drunk and beating him in an alleyway.

I will commend it in only one respect .. it was innovative . Innovative does n't mean it 's a better version of anything. But in the first place it was innovative .. it's better than anything else out there . But then it's also better than most other games on this planet .. but it's not out there for everyone. I don't think people are interested in trying new stuff out, especially with the amount of games that are released each month. I think more games need to have new concepts to be popular. I think there needs to be more new games out there.

This marvelous short will hit home with everyone who, as a child, specifically asked for something because it was hip or cool, only to be given something that would mark you for life with your peers and were told by your Mom or Dad (or both) that it didn't matter, as you earnestly began considering enlisting in a Witness Protection Program in order to avoid ridicule. For those U.S. residents who don't get the horror because you don't follow hockey, it's like a Dallas Cowboy fan getting a Washington Redskins jersey or a Yankees fan getting a Red Sox jersey.

I have watched two episodes so far , I really like it . Even though I am no longer in college and do not have any knowledge of the television medium , I have a good opinion of the show. I like the story line and the humor in the story. The acting is great. The characters do not seem like the characters you would find on television . I think it is a well done show , I would love to see a full season of episodes. Thank you for a great series. I thought it was great when I first started watching.

First of all , I have watched this show since I was a little toddler , and I have always enjoyed it, and even though I have always had high expectations I was not disappointed. And it has been fun to watch. I am a little confused as to why this episode was not better. It is really, really short. I am wondering if I should give this one a pass. I am sure it is better than it has always been but I do not know how to justify it. The story itself was interesting, but it did not really make it better.

I was once a big Olsen fan . I received this movie when I was six and watched it almost daily for many years. Even after I stopped being an Olsen fan, I have continued to enjoy this movie on occasion. I liked that it wasn't a typical teen movie and that there were plenty of laughs throughout. It's not perfect, but there are some laughs in it and that's about it. It has been a long time coming. This is definitely a good movie that is worth a watch if you're looking for a movie with good acting, funny dialogue and a decent plot.

If you Listen to Ween ( The Pod , God/Satan ) , then you know what 's going on with 's the world. What I mean is that most, if not all of the time in history, in the last 30 years, the media, the political classes, the business classes, the churches, have been very, very bad for this country, very, very bad for this country, for this country. It has been, and continues to be a very bad thing for this country and the people of this country to listen to all of this crap.

There are places for political commentary in film , but `` Masters of Horror '' is not one of them , as the film is made for and by the masses of Americans. The message is not important. The story takes place in New York City about three years into the Cold War. The hero is a middle aged man. His wife and young son have moved to California. He is being followed by a local police detective. The police suspect that the victim was killed by someone who has been impersonating a cop. They want the killer caught and the man arrested.

Given that Dylan Thomas is an icon of modern Anglophone poetry I expected a movie that would be prone to the same sorts of mistakes he makes. There is a good reason that his work is not widely recognized or appreciated today. I think a movie about a poet that has never been produced before is more likely to get an audience, which I suspect is one reason why it is unlikely to be the subject of the next Thomas biopic. This is especially the case because, although Thomas’s life is interesting, his artistry is often overlooked because his work has not yet been widely accepted.

The most notable feature of this film is the chemistry between the actors , the sense of camaraderie in their scenes together and the way they interact with one another as a group, which creates an interesting dynamic. There is a lot of eye-rolling with the audience when they find out this was a film by a writer/director who did not have any filmmaking experience and it is obvious that some of them could have been a bit more confident of their ability. If there is anything you liked about the film, there is something that you will also find a lot of people saying.

The stage star Grace Hayes stars in this obscure little film . After years of being on the stage , Grace is about to take her first ever film role . She plays a young American actress trying to become a famous actress . Her first screen test goes horribly wrong and Grace finds herself on the brink of failure and a lifetime of self-destructive acting choices . She takes her life in her own hands and becomes an actress that no one will recognize for what she has become . As the film progresses we find out that Grace is only in the film to play a character .

This is a story about a journey made by a man who once had a dream and guts . Donald and his son have had enough of this life. What they have done is not the right thing, and not the easy thing. This is the life they must go back to. It is a journey that the world will not see, but what they have been through will. It is a journey of change. And the only way we can change it is by going back into the life we love.

What exactly do people expect when they watch an Al Adamson film? Are they expecting classic cinema that is wonderful beyond belief and will leave them with lasting memories? You'd think so by some of the reviews. Al Adamson's films are trashy and sleazy and cheesy, not much more, so if you go into them knowing that already it helps, and they aren't necessarily to be taken at face value, especially when they have so much unintentional entertainment value. First off, this starts by ripping off the end theme music from Outer Limits, so you know things are looking promising.

From the portrayals of Andy Warhol in the films I Shot Andy Warhol and Basquiat, this is the type of movie I would predict Andy Warhol might make--airy, illogical, snobbish, amoral. The movie's (almost non-existent) plot which is sometimes increduously unbelievable is offset by the movie's rough, real-looking cinematography. The film has a way of being unreal, yet dictating reality to the viewer. The only worthwhile part of the movie is the development of the relationship between Joe and Holly and every thing in it should be viewed as a characterization device.

I 'm sorry , perhaps this is part of the wave of praise for fireman since 911 , perhaps it won't always be but I want to share my personal story with you . I 'm not a firefighter but a nurse for over 30 years . One of the first thing I did upon arriving at my office was to search for an EKG reader and was told they are out of stock and can't be located . I knew someone that was selling EKG's so I asked to see a sample but was told we had to buy the book to have one.

This film was n't good at all . I was able to catch it at a film festival and did not get it in my home theaters. If anyone else did, please post it here for the fans to see and comment on how much this film sucks. I would really like to hear your thoughts about it . It was good . The characters were good and it wasn't that bad to watch. But, it just wasn't a great film . It wasn't even close . I didn't like the ending and I felt it could have been made much better.

Forget any angst-ridden documentary! This film is really an out and out comedy about a 40-yer-old porn star whose goal in life is to sing junky circuit party songs. The only problem? Colton Ford can't sing! And the film cuts away whenever he appears to be ready to burst into song. Yet Ford and equally vapid boyfriend Blake Harper whine and primp and run around in their tank tops, determined to make dreams come true. Even funnier is "manager" Kyle who appears to have the I.Q. of a turnip and whose collagen-injected lips look like a bee stung him.

In general , I prefer horror movies that creep me out so much I 'm afraid of everything for the first five minutes of each movie. I'm usually at least a 3 or 4 star horror movie. The only times I would recommend a horror movie I have a very hard time watching, because I feel like my brain is being overtaxed and my mind is going a bit crazy. I'm not saying this is because I'm a terrible movie buff or something. It's just that it isn't a good horror film and that scares me as much as a horror movie does.

The box to this movie totally misrepresents itself. The cover shows a view of legs & panties in a short skirt. The title is `Tart.' The synopsis on the back of the box made it seem as though Cat, the main character, was an outcast who became one of the popular students, but that popularity lead to a bizarre lifestyle that she could not escape from. Everything that the box built this movie up to was a horrible lie. I expected a sort of crappy, direct-to-video version of `Heathers' targeted at the teenagers of today.Let me tell you what `Tart' was really about.

I caught the first screening of Driving Lessons at the Tribeca Film Festival . Rupert Grint shows he can act and I am so happy to have found a film that I know will do a brilliant job of telling the story of driving lessons. Grint is a driving instructor who, like me, has been driving lessons for around ten years now. He has a good relationship with a number of drivers and is a great teacher. It was nice to see a film with both of us doing our bit in showing people how to learn to drive a car safely and how to teach them how to improve their skills.

Happy 25th Birthday to Valley Girl ! Great soundtrack , plausible story , wonderful performances ... captures the spirit of what it was like to be living in the Valley. Thanks to all for making this such a special occasion ... we hope to see you back there in the years to come . Here's to another great 25th Birthday celebration, a year from now, of the Valley! We'd like to thank all of the fans that helped make that a reality. You can help support the band and the album by shopping at iTunes or buying from the following links .

Well , this is new ... Famous Italian horror director Lucio Fulci shoots a film about a famous Italian horror director, here he is playing one of the main characters, and here we have the opening credits . In this movie Lucio Fulci portrays one of the most iconic characters in Italian horror cinema, the Italian horror director Lino Banfi. You can see the full clip of the film, and you can see the trailers for it. You can also see it now , on Netflix. You can watch it over here.

Some critics have compared Chop Shop with the theatrical releases of City of God and Pixote. I've seen both of those as well as Chop Shop and like in many instances, I don't feel the comparison is warranted. City of God and Pixote surely had a much higher budget. Chop Shop is a low budget independent film about survival and hope, disappointment, and continuing with life. One of the scenes is allegedly filmed during the US Open and either the filmmakers had incredible connections or the scene was filmed at another time and the US open footage was added.

This film is a great rampage of action and comedy , it gets right in to it right from the very start . It is a brilliant film. If you are a gorehound you will really like this one , and if you are someone who enjoys action and comedies then this is definitely something to watch. I can’t really say enough about this film for anyone who is looking to make it a point to check it out on release. There is something about seeing this film on the big screen, that I find more enjoyable than the big screen version.

I can't get over the quality of the score, the book, and the performances. This is the first production I've ever seen of Sweeney Todd so I have no others to compare it to. But the impact is so strong, I just can't imagine anything better.First, there's the music -- take "Johanna" (Act II), during which Sweeney, Anthony and Johanna sing an interwoven vocal line incorporating the melodies from three songs. It's like a Bach chorale in that sense -- just a masterpiece of composition.

This movie is a haunting telling of the life of the author and poet , Mishima . It jumps around from one place to the next. Mishima takes you on an imaginative journey with him through his childhood and adolescence. In the end it is clear that Mishima is a good guy, even if at the end there is much sadness and loss. In this film, there is a lot of violence as the characters in the film do not know how to live without violence. There are many scenes of graphic violence and the story takes you places that you never imagined.

Susan Sarandon. She made this movie for me. I've never appreciated her acting more than as I did in this movie. She really acted as though she were Adele August. I can appreciate actors and actresses who leave their individual persona and create a character who's truly believable. Natalie Portman as Ann August helped create the ideal antagonist as their characters developed through the movie. The movie was about them so the other characters were peripheral.I gave this movie an eight rating, but Susan received a ten from me because of her performance.
