A group of young filmmakers with virtually no budget set out to make something clever and original -- and while it may not quite be a masterpiece, it’s an impressive debut. It’s called “Viral.”

And while this is not their first film, it is by far their best. This week, I’ll tell you all about what you can expect to see in this debut that I have no doubt that you’ll come back to again and again to watch. “Viral.” In theaters this weekend.

Just watched Hair after a lapse of 20 years. It struck home. For those of us who tried to stand on the shoulders of the civil rights movement and fight the rule of privilege and power; who resisted the fascism of the Johnson/Nixon administrations; who now as veterans of civil wars fought the war in Vietnam every single day until finally the US beast died and fled; for all who said no in many different ways -- it's remarkable how unsuccessful we were. How large the real table was on which Treat danced. How driven the wizard behind the curtain.

Alain Resnais directs three parallel stories that have to do with fantasy and imagination in the adult world . In the first, the main character is a young man who makes a pilgrimage to Italy to be with his beloved. The second two stories involve young women, who must go to Italy, to visit their lost love. The third story, about a teenage girl, who visits Italy to be with her father, is also about fantasy and imagination, and also deals with love and romance . I find the stories very interesting and thought provoking, and they also seem very relevant to my own life .

I can see what this film was intending to do. Unfortunately it just never quite completes the deal. The "reality crime" aspect works fine and the shots are all first rate. In fact quite a few of the scenes are incredibly evocative in a moody sort of way. Notably the silhouette of the detective talking to the beat up woman, the scene of the detectives going through the garbage, and the father tying flies. On occasion s few scenes bog down in too much dialog. Instead of showing the viewer the writer treats it too much like a book.

One thing that came across to me in watching this film is that it was fun/exciting for the cast and crew; I could sense that they were going up against the budget constraint with enthusiasm & dedication because they apparently liked the people involved. I tend to like B movies that are original and have heart, and I think this is one such work. The actors seem to me to be putting there hearts in it more than usual, maybe because of some good direction from the lead actress/director, and they evidently were clear enough in their parts of the story to make a coherent, watchable piece of art.

For the most part , I considered this movie unworthy of a comment , but the last 10 minutes prompted me to make a few observations. The only real issue I found myself thinking about was whether this is a film about racism. This isn’t an allusion to actual racism, but rather a movie about racism in general and the way that it was handled . In other words , it doesn’t seem to take itself as seriously as many movies do. This is the case with a lot of movies out there .

My friends and I saw the movie last night in Austin at a showing for AGLIFF ( a film festival of movies). A lot of movies come out in this theater. But I’ve got to pick the best of these movies now. I love them all, but I’ve had a favorite in my head since my childhood and I’ve always wanted to see them again. I decided to write a post about a movie I’ve been meaning to watch and finally did it. Let’s take a look at some of the good, bad and best in the film industry.

While the premise of the film sounded unique and intriguing after watching the first 5 minutes of the film I couldn't help but think back to the films I've seen when I'm bored and just want to have a good laugh. For this film it's pretty much the same thing, but as soon as I was through watching the film I remembered why I was so interested. It is a very funny and entertaining film and I enjoyed it very much, not only because I laughed, but also because the characters are so relatable and you can feel their emotions in their actions and reactions.

I would like to thank you for giving me a chance to be one of the first to actually view the movie! It was worth the wait. I am very impressed with the quality of the movie and I am looking forward to seeing more of the movie. It will definitely be worth the price to own the movie. I've seen it in the theater twice. The movie is very good and well worth watching. However, the movie was not all that entertaining. It's hard to see why this movie is such a commercial success.

We've all got to start somewhere, it was in films like Escape In The Fog that somebody like Budd Boetticher could learn his trade before turning out good films. In fact the film was dated before it even hit the movie going public on June 25, 1945.The war on Europe was over for almost two months, of course not even Harry Cohn could control the events of history. So I'm wondering why even back then the public didn't question why a Nazi spy ring was helping out the Japanese. Another very bad historical inaccuracy was that the FBI had nothing to do with the Pacific or Asian theater.

Well , great costumes and a wonderful ` feel ' for Pre WWII Italy . But what happened here ? I am always so curious . Did you see what happened to these Italians during WWII or do I just have to wait until they come out on their own ? I am so curious . I would really love to read a full account of the show. It has always seemed that it was very important to these people. I wish someone would write about it. Please help . I am very curious. I am thinking of reading an article about that.

This film is terrible - honestly . The acting is terrible , the script made me cringe , the effects aren’t even worth a mention . The cinematography looks awful , and the production design looks awful . The story is terrible . And worst of all , we have not even been given half the ending we should have . What a shame ! The ending, I think, is great . The ending could have been better . The movie was not that great to begin with . I would have thought a movie that had that ending might have been good .

This is a good blueprint for a study of corporate power and the dichotomoy between required public life and the need for privacy. Robert Taylor has been primed by corporate head Burl Ives as a surrogate son to replace him as head of the corporation. He sends him to England to negotiate a deal, where Taylor is both taken aback by the ethics and morality of the men he is dealing with and manages to fall in love with a refugee while he's at it. He comes back emtpy handed, having done his duty but having told the truth to the English about his motives.

Oh boy. Where do I begin on this piece of slime? This is one of the few real high-budget films on my list that I've actually seen fit to give a 1 rating, and that's not for the production values, which are pretty high. This movie has absolutely no respect for the account in the bible, and treats the whole story as laughable fantasy. I could not recommend it to anyone, except to see how low as a society we have become...For the first thing, Noah was absolutely not friends with Lot.

I'm really surprised seeing all these positive reviews for this movie. Don't get me wrong, it's not that I don't like 'these kind of movies'.While I very well can enjoy a good mindless Hollywood action blockbuster like Die Hard 4.0, I like the 'dogma' kind of movies, or 'real-life-as-it-is'-movies just as much, IF they are well made.A good example is Festen (1998): no music, no dramatic camera angles, no special fx, no fancy locations. Just a good story combined with excellent acting and the result is an excellent movie.Is Nine Lives devoid of dramatic camera angles, special fx and fancy locations?

When I first saw this movie back in the middle of January ( 2005 ) I did n't like it at all , the story was good , but it could not make me laugh . This movie is more for those who hate horror and those who just want to scare people , it is also for people who like good suspense . This is not a good movie , you can see it , but be prepared to laugh at the time you see the funny parts !!! 1 out of 5. User review of This movie: Not my cup of tea.

This is a well-crafted piece from everyone 's favorite master of suspense . As usual , the technical elements such as the audio are spot on , and the editing is excellent. This film has its moments and it definitely has it all. Not the best, but no doubt it has its merits. If you can handle the suspense, then you have to watch this. The film is about a man who goes to an all-girls' school in California. One day, an accident happens at his school and a young girl is killed.

I really don't know why I'm writting this. I think most people agree that this movie is bad. Well, let me say this:When I first get done watching some movies, I like them. Then as time goes on, my opinion changes about the movie. this happened with End of Days. I liked it the first time I saw it. I thought it was entertaining. But, a few weeks later, my opinion has changed. So, to resolve this, I watched it again at a friends house. Well, it's bad.I'm a logic person.

But certainly a serious contender for one of the worst 10 of all time.I got this DVD cheap, with Sandra Bullock as headliner on the case. This is false advertising - she's on-screen for almost 10 minutes of the movie.On the other hand, there was no other selling point for this movie - the dialog was horrible, the editing was apparently done by someone who was strung out on Quaaludes, the directing was ... well, let's just say that my 14-yo daughter could do better, but I hope she never sees such faint praise from me.

I am currently watching this movie and I have absolutely no hesitation in reviewing it now . The acting is top notch and I am thoroughly impressed. The story was really well done, it was a very believable story. The way that the story played out and the relationships between the characters are very well done. I really enjoyed it, there are some scenes that are just really good. I would give this movie 3.75 out of 5 stars. I really recommend this movie to everyone because it really is a great story. I hope you find it for sale on Vudu.

Pointless and pretty silly film that is just basically a compilation of clips from horror , science fiction and suspense films from the early to mid 80’s . It was directed by , starring , and written and co-produced by , and it stars and his wife . It is directed by . The plot follows a woman named , who moves into an apartment complex and finds herself in an uneventful and mundane routine. The next day she discovers that , and , have come to visit her . She finds herself in an uneventful routine of doing the same thing and getting the same results .

Ben Affleck, about to be married, is shaken up by a plane accident and gets involved with one of the other passengers (Sandra Bullock, forcing herself to act insane). Who is to blame for this inept, ugly morass? It is so badly edited, when I looked in the credits it wasn't to read the editor's name--it was to see if the person actually took the credit! Rife with clichés, contrivances, and Sandra Bullock in raccoon eye-makeup, the movie doesn't even concern itself with creating chemistry between the two main characters.

There really is only one reason to watch this barely adequate and utterly predictable movie about an uptight chef Kate Beckett (Julia Roberts) who is constantly at odds with her own mother, played by Meryl Streep. The film opens as her character’s mother (Meryl Streep) is having a tough day in the kitchen. The dish she is preparing is to be a dish she and Kate are not very excited about. And it is. And she tells the story. And it is. And it is. And it’s over in less than 45 minutes.

Boring movie. Poor plot. Poor actors. The movie happens in a room supposed to be in Morocco but actually in some American city! The "Arab terrorists" are the patriots the blonde patriot is the "Arab terrorist"...DAMN!There is something good about this movie though (that's why the score is 2 out of 10). The director turns the ridiculous stereotype about terrorism the media feeds us every day into the real thing, the terrorists are Americans (or western people if you like).The movie is divided into two parts.

I'm a big fan of the demonic puppets. Looking at the surface of this one, it looks pretty good! You've got Decapitron, the puppets, and a new villain in THE TOTEM! Unfortunately, the little punk that's doing this project to animate, inanimate objects, can't act. He stinks! His girlfriend is worse. If they were left out, it would probably be cool, BLADE VS. THE TOTEM. I'd watch that for 2 hours. But instead, the puppets role is down played, and the whole movie suffered because of it.

Where on earth do I start with the mess that is Darkhunters ? Firstly the script is one of the worst I have ever read. It starts off good but then you start to wonder what has happened and who is doing the killing. I can understand why the writers felt they had no choice but to kill a character, it makes no sense as the character is dead at that point. Also the character that is alive in the book after the death of the previous character has not aged. It feels a bit forced to have the character start off young again.

My son Adam (5 years old) is a big Scooby Doo fan. He like this film a lot. He particularly liked when the Loch Ness monster tried to attack Shaggy and Scooby. The vote score is his choice and reflects his love of the characters.Having seen the "Vampire Rock" film first, this, not surprisingly, was very similar as they repeat a well worn basic plot in a different setting.Few adults will come across this without having their own memories of the TV cartoon series and even fewer will watch it without children. You either like this or love it.

This movie is one of the worst movie i have ever seen in my life! i waste my time on this. I watched this movie completely as i took it a punishment for me. I wonder how Suneel Darshan could make such a movie? it doesn't have any continutity. It feels he just shoot scenes and then joined them in some editing software!!! Music is of course good but the film doesn't need so many unwanted songs. Kangana Ranaut looks fake and I wonder what role does Celina Jaietly has in the movie? Bobby deol is good.

Unlike one of the reviewers below, I don't think that a great and glittering career should lie ahead for the director of this inept and tedious piece of navel-gazing. Whereas it is good to see a British director attempting to break out of the confines of convention, AKA's only claim for innovative fame rests on the novelty of the triple screen. At first you think that this might prove to be an interesting device, but its only real contribution to the film is to test your eyesight and patience. Seeing the same character from 3 different angles in a 2-dimensional movie does not make it more revealing or complex.

As an ex ( nuclear ) submarine officer I must admit this is my favorite submarine movie ( even exceeding my personal favorite ) - even better than the original Silent Running ( although I am not sure I would go out on a limb to compare this to that movie ) and as a kid that's saying something . The only drawback is I never saw the original version , but the movie still has its flaws and it was better in my book than the new one . This movie is pretty much the original version of Silent Running, not the one with some big budget effects.

A MUST SEE documentary.-----This movie had so many things to consider while watching it. It was a great documentary of a trial of a 15 year old black kid named Brenton Butler. He accused of killing a white tourist in Florida. It shows how the police took statements from the husband of the dead woman of the description of the man that killed his wife. The husband seemed to want to change some things to merge with what the police said the young man was wearing. The police little to investigate the crime. Brenton's lawyer Patrick McGuinness is meticulous in getting information to help his client.

Well , I 'm an Italian horror big fan and I love movies from directors such Argento , Fulci , and others , so I was wondering how many of my fellow Italians love horror movies and if they know some really good ones. In Italy there are quite a few horror movies made and some really good ones, so I was wondering if some of them are really good horror movies or if there are only those who love this kind of films. So I will say this:
I love a lot of Argento's films .

This was honestly the worst movie i have ever seen. the acting was god awful, the story line also was bad. it was however a good idea. if this movie would have had better cinematics, and a lot better actors, i might of had something better to say. edgar allen poe was a great Gothic writer, and this movie just destroyed it. why do people always have to kill good stories by making bad movies. the only good part was when the killer put the head under the floor with a tape going, that was pretty good.

Stephen Seagal plays the role of a dude who gets talked into driving an armored car for a bank hold up and drives into everything that comes across his path. However, the police seem to appear on the scene very quickly and Seagal smells a rat who gave the police advanced notice. The story gets into many twists and turns and the money from the hold up has disappeared and nobody knows its new owner. Poor Seagal gets a bit framed into this hold up and naturally he is out looking for the person or persons who are trying to put him away for a long time.

Hope the summary line wo n't irritate you that much ( it 's a little homage to the Chappelle Show/Charlie Rose show). It was a fun way to start, though. I'd like to read a review with an intro that doesn't just get you up and moving to start the show. I think you guys would have been way cooler and better off with a bunch of guys like you. I was just watching the show on TV, and I thought "Wow, that dude is a good singer." I'm sure he didn't come from nowhere.

I was expecting "Born to Kill" to be an exciting, high-tension film noir. Instead, it's got two good action set-pieces (one at the beginning and one at the end) and some marvelously atmospheric cinematography by Robert de Grasse (usually a "glamor" cameraman and a surprising credit for a noir), but the rest of the film is pretty boring. Lawrence Tierney goes through his psycho kick but it's a strictly by-the-numbers performance, mechanically churning out what the audience expected from him after "Dillinger" (an overrated movie but at least better than this).

Jeff Fahey has such alert eyes and a smudgy, insidious smile that every character he plays seems villainous; therefore, it doesn't really work to cast him as the good guy of the piece, the audience is just waiting for his character to crack and start blowing people away. Drew Barrymore, fresh off her acclaimed role as "Poison Ivy", must have done this film simply as a favor to director Phedon Papamichael (he was the cinematographer on "Ivy"); playing a character named Daisy Drew (!

The title role of this western is played by Robert Walker , Jr . He 's a young gun who has spent five years in the army and is looking to return to civilian life. But he's been called upon to take on some of the most dangerous killers of the day, as he attempts to stop their crimes with a gun in his hand. Walker played the title role to great applause from the audience, and the audience went wild for him. He has one scene in which he is shot twice, the bullet in his head.

I got this for my birthday in a box set under the name Broke Skull . Well , after watching this video , now I feel a bit bad , since I bought this on the 3rd of November, the same day the set was announced , it had been out for over a month , I still didn’t even know the movie was released on a Wednesday, I guess it was a good idea for me to buy this at midnight on the 4th. I don’t mind that it came out the same day I wanted it to release.

If you want to see a brilliant performance of Mikado , played to perfection with expert timing and panache , then this is the performance for you. The story is a bit like that of many great tales. There is a hero, or the hero and his love, or a lover and his beloved, or a father and his son . The heroine is another story, and in fact , there are several stories involved, and perhaps even more than the one you are reading. And, even with all the stories, there are a few stories that are linked.

First off , I 'm a huge Bronson fan , have been since the late '70s . I watched every single Bronson film that came out. He has one of the best comedic characters out there. If you want to watch them all you need to get Bronson. I can't recommend it enough . Quote:

Second off, I 'm going to say the same thing you are. I have been listening to Bronson's stuff for a few years now and have been absolutely loving it . He has the best writing voice out of anyone. I can't wait for what he will do next .

I read a few reviews of the movie and got the impression that it was not as good as the previous one, which was pretty good, but not as good as other ones, which were great. I thought this one would have a lot of the characters in the previous movies, and a lot less. I am not sure I would go to see this movie, but if it had to be, this one would not be my first choice. The characters are more developed, the action is more intense. The music is good, the special effects are not that great in this movie.

The story of Sweeney Todd evokes memories of the work of classic writers like Charles Dickens, and more contemporary writers like Edward Gory. As a musical, it naturally becomes more like the musical Les Miserables. Both deal with the grim effects of poverty in the Industrial Revolution, and the breakdown of organized society. But this musical is different from Les Mis in one very important aspect: Stephen Sondheim, the songwriter who can adapt to any style. To be sure, he's had his successes and failures, but one thing about his shows you can always count on: They will be something unique.

The four LA cops in fedoras driving around in a big black convertible look faintly absurd , and even more bizarre is that there are only three black men on the force. So what do they drive? Is it an armored vehicle for the LAPD, or perhaps a private company? Either way it seems to be an armored car driven by the LAPD, and it sure doesn't look like its made of steel and Kevlar. When you put it together all of these images, it all seems a bit surreal. What's going on here, and how can the police be doing this in LA?

I rated this movie a 3 and that was generous. The scenery is ponderous and gaudy, the acting for the most part is terrible. I do think Peter O'Toole did a good job of acting (Tiberius), but he must have been mortified when he saw the final cut of the movie. John Gielgud, howsoever brief his appearance in the movie, still seemed to be playing a role from Hamlet. The hard core pornography parts were neither erotic nor did they do much to further the story. Okay Malcolm McDowell had a nice butt and the guy who played Macro was handsome.

Oh , dear ! This has to be one of the worst films I have ever seen . It 's just a bad movie ! The acting is pathetic , and the acting is very bad . Even when it was good , the acting was horrible . The movie is also very long , and it's a bit confusing . It 's not a good movie . And if I saw it for a second , I am sure I would throw it in the trash ! I really hate this movie ! Why did they make it ? And why is this movie only in English ?

Frank Falenczyk : It is n't that I 'm sorry I killed them ; it 's that I 'm sorry that I'm so damn damn stupid I couldn't have done less than I should have done ! I never should have believed them, not when they were right ! Eugene O'Mara : It is not so much that I'd like to know what really happened, that is quite enough of an explanation ! The only thing I want to know is how they were able to think that this was no longer a fight between good people, but between murderers and traitors !

I grew up in Winnipeg and saw the treatment of the natives almost everyday. There are good and bad in EVERY race, why make them all out to be bad? That goes for all races today. John Harper was an educated man, he graduated from high school, he even had a year of university under his belt before going back to the reserve. How do I know this? John Harper lived with my family for the 3 years he was in high school, and he kept in contact with us the year after graduation.

NBC had a chance to make a powerful religious epic along the lines of `` The Ten Commandments '' and `` King Kong,'' but they elected to do the reverse. For the first time in over 20 years, and for the only time in more than 50 years, they made two of their films from the same story line, as opposed to having one and only one for the story line. The ``Avengers'' and ``Star Trek'' franchises have been in the business for a lot longer than this.

It 's hard to believe that there are some people out there in the world that actually think this is all a game, that they're on the winning end, that they think this is their world and that they can win any game, any time. And that makes me sad and very, very frustrated. It's not because I'm a woman. I'm not interested in the gender. I have the same interest as anyone in this world and this time, I'm not going to waste my time, I'm not going to do anything.

Without John Rhys-Davies, I have to admit that this would never even register on my movie-meter. But in spite of that single fact, this is not a bad little thriller, considering the low budget, the low quality effects, the stiff acting and the Sci Fi Channel aspects. The blood effects are very convincing, and the Chupacabra actually looks realistic... regardless of what you think a Chupacabra looks like this is one good-looking Chupacabra.Aside from the positives, this runs kind of like Kolchak: The Night Stalker (Darren McGavin, remember?)

First of all , even IMDb is slacking with this movie , as the list of cast is VERY ``bad`` . The lead actor , Michael Caine , has no presence in this movie as a lead , and the entire cast appears to be unappreciated by the audience , with no real ability to bring anything to the table for the movie . The first half of this movie is quite entertaining , although not as engaging as the second half , for which this movie is totally undeserving . The plot of the movie is very convoluted , and the movie becomes even more annoying to watch , because of it.

Wow ! After the first five minutes of watching this `` film '' , I was quite tempted to put it on my Dvd player and watch it at leisure, as I could see it as an interesting and original movie. But, when I went on to take a look at my VCR , I could not find any other video on VCD. I thought this would be another interesting film , but I could not see what it was about. Then, I found it on this site , and there it was.

"The Quickie" tells of a decadent Russian mob family who lives in Malibu and...well, frankly, this awful attempt at drama isn't worthy of commentary.Jason Leigh introduces herself to Mr. Mob-guy as being from "Pacific Exterminators" with huge letters in plain sight on her back which say "West Coast Exterminators". Eventually the mob-guys get suspicious because she was exterminating in a bedroom. (duh).In another scene Mr. Mobguy plays Russian roulette giving a hooker $4000 to bet whether he'll live or die. She has 5 chances out of 6 of keeping the money if she bets "live".

If a movie ca n't hold your interest in the first 25 minutes , it 's over as far as I am concerned . movies like " " , and and " " can hold you for about half an hour . this time , however , " " is the most over-rated movie in recent memory . 
" " is actually a pretty good film . it 's based on an original play written by the famous , , " " director . and it 's about as good as one can get . when this movie first came out , I was quite impressed , 
I was so interested in what it 's about .

This must be one of the most horribly titled films of all time . The kind of title that ruins the moment. It doesn't even make sense at the outset, it seems so simple, like the title of a joke, but then when the movie starts and you watch it, it takes you down some pretty dark and twisted paths in the first 15 minutes and you're never sure which one is which. If you've seen this film, you know what to expect, it's not for everybody and you don't even really know why it's bad.

Well, this film came on on a workday at 230am. The cute little actress who played Billy caught my attention initially and after the 1st 15 minutes I was held captive to my television till the very end. It has you on the edge of your seat, then throws in clever bits of comedy during the most tense sequences.The only draw back is that the story was not substantial enough to fill hour an a half film, causing certain sequences to drag just a little. Nonetheless, it was still very entertaining, and I recommended it to all my co-workers the next day.

POSSIBLE MINOR SPOILERIt's not a terribly objective review but I just found this movie horribly depressing. Like a lot of Russell T. Davies'work, it asks more questions than it can answer. His best work (Bob & Rose, Doctor Who) revels in hope against the odds and perseverance even after apparent defeat. These uplifting themes seemed strangely absent here. I suppose the fact that I'm still thinking about it days after viewing is a testament to the quality of the program but the resolution was just too bleak for my tastes.

Son of the Mask is a terrible movie. I don't like the baby and I don't like the dog. Jamie Kennedy and his wife are a cute couple but that can't redeem sitting through this garbage. Even at only 88 minutes (or so it says), the movie could not end soon enough for me. The only real laughs come at the beginning with a brief appearance by Ben Stain. That's it. The rest is just a rehash of the first movie. Actually that is just an insult to rehashes. Why was this sequel made??

What a self-indulgent mess ! Duncan Roy 's film is apparently autobiographical , however it 's impossible to find any information about it. It's been so long since your last comment I don't know why you keep bothering to post it ! But, I guess it's just because you are obsessed with the subject. For the first time I've seen a film like this, and I liked it ! And that's exactly what it was ! But I'm not going to mention all the details here, because it'd be too tedious for you.

How in the world does a thing like this get into my DVD player at home? How does it even get to be packaged and distributed? Are there absolutely zero screenings a movie (and I use that term loosely) have to go through before it's put on a video store's shelf anymore? I'm all for DIY film making but come on! That doesn't entitle me to get a group of my friends and relatives together, a crappy camcorder, an awful story and put it all together to create a heaping pile of crap and call it a movie.

I 'm originally from Brazil ... the sad thing about this movie was the exploitation that was done to that region. It was a shame because this is a classic film. I have always had a special relationship with the Brazilian people because I was born in the South and I've grown up in Rio de Janeiro. I lived in Rio for a long time and I have a lot of friends from all over the place. This movie really touched my heart because it was a love story that really made people happy.

The good things first : I agree with another viewer who said that Gene Raymond has a marvelous drunk scene in "A Life of It." I've never seen it, and it might be my favorite scene in any movie. The story and acting are solid enough. It would be a shame if Gene's character did not develop over time. But that's not really Gene's fault, since Gene's character does not develop nearly as well as the character of his son. The other actors do well.

Having seen only once and in the dawn hours, I can't seem to forget this haunting film. A mix of mystery, suspense, and heartbreaking romance it reminds me of Vertigo.The actors, though not that well known are good especially Joan Hackett in one of her best performances.You believe in her, in her love,in her newfound quest for freedom brought by her love, and in the end in her overwhelming pain.The plot is ingenious and compelling and does not stretch credibility. The direction and technical stuff certainly could be better but they do not compromise the overall effect.

Wayne Wang's direction may be the ingredient which made this film much more impressive to me than "Slums of Beverly Hills", which covers remarkably similar ground. The interplay between Susan Sarandon and Natalie Portman is riveting. Real chemistry there. This film succeeded in bringing me inside the dysfunctional life of these two women without dragging me down into depressed frustration. Susan Sarandon's character hammers at all the nerves which a narcissistic parent is capable of touching in an insecure adolescent. She amazingly manages to do this without coming across as floridly insane or intentionally sadistic.

This movie really is that bad , and I 'm normally a sucker for bad movies , but this was the worst of them so far !!!! I mean really , there was just too much bad taste in it and it just looked so cheap , for what ? I mean , they didn't have that much talent in there ? But the worst part of this movie is that they even try to bring back a couple of the characters we had seen in the first part !!! What the fuck ? What the hell is going on ?

I'm not surprised that so many people fell for this one. When I was watching this movie, a couple viewers next to me sobbed whenever you're "supposed" to sob -- or at least feel "touched". Like when Hunting said he didn't love the girl. Like when Robin Williams' character (sorry I forgot his role's name) was telling Hunting repeatedly "It's not your fault" (oh Lord, just thinking of that scene gives me the goosebumps). I couldn't have cared less for what would happen to the characters.

If extreme activities ( and I do n't mean the Hollywood ones like UFC & X-Games ) and the people that engage in those activities is where we should put our focus, not how much money is spent at the box office, but what it costs to create, market, distribute, and protect that content. It's not the box office figures that are important, the content is what matters, if it has any value at all. I think that's what's really going on. That said, this thread is getting ridiculous.

Have to agree that this movie and it's talented director do not receive the plaudits they deserve. Here's hoping that the DVD will do very well and bring both to the attention of a wider audience. The actors gave excellent performances and the plot is excellent. Perhaps overall the movie is a little long but May Miles Thomas seems to enjoy her actors when they are giving strong performances and therefore sometimes holds them in longer close ups than necessary. Good for the actors I am sure but sometimes as the audience you are ready to move on so to speak with the plot.

* * Possible Spoilers Ahead * * Whenever fans of bad movies congregate for more than a few minutes , there will inevitably be someone to spoil the film ahead of time. It is inevitable, I'm sure , because bad movies are everywhere and there is a constant stream of fresh new ones coming out all the time. It is hard not to take the spoils from these films with a grain of salt so I thought it would be interesting to discuss some of the most notorious examples and see what you thought. Let's begin with some classics and then some more obscure films that we have already seen.

This movie is amazing. You will NEVER laugh harder. It's a target. No, I think it's...yes it's...A BOOB! This movie gets funnier by the second--like when Jackie Chan's character finally dies in his final fight scene. This movie is velly velly seekwet like treasha! Congrats if you buy or rent this. You'll never return it, in my opinion. I didn't, and I haven't found it in a store since. I watched this movie once and I was forever in love with Kung-Fu action flicks.

I saw this in a preview screening and have to say that this documentary style movie is the biggest load that I have ever seen on a wide scale! The story, which is a combination of ‘real’ stories from real people, was a great introduction to what was going on on the show! I think it’s the biggest documentary movie that I have ever seen! This movie is just too much for me to sit through (I’m sure some will find it funny). I just cannot get into the whole “story of why they did it” part of the movie!

This film actually starts out pretty interesting but for my taste it degenerated far too quickly into a dull and predictable melodrama. None of the performances are particularly interesting and the camera work is just standard TV movie stuff, so there's really no reason for anyone to see this movie unless they are as big of a Jeff Bridges fan as I am I guess.Bridges plays Mike Olson, a young man who announces at a family picnic that he is quitting college to go on the road. His parents believe he is "just acting out" and talk about how "he has no plan".

Where do I begin? Let me say that -- after having watched the entire film and the special features on the DVD -- my wife and I watched the whole film again with the director's commentary running. I can't remember having ever before endured more than 7 minutes of such commentary for a film. It's worth hearing.I'm not a southern boy, but I spent some time around Memphis a long time ago, and have a feel for the area. This film almost smells of the South, it's so real.

Camp Blood is an absolutely atrocious slasher film . We 're mixing Friday The 13th with the Blair Witch Project and the Saw movies. This movie is a disaster from the beginning. The acting, the script, the direction, it all falls so flat that I have a hard time wrapping my head around it. This is the movie for people that don 't care about a lot of things that they think are important. I can think about everything else in this film, I don 't need to see it anyway.

It took a loan out film to Columbia for Gene Kelly 's home studio MGM to realize his creative talent, but it was on the sound stage where he got his first big break as a writer and director, creating the classic movie musicals of some of Hollywood's most legendary directors, including the screen's greatest directors of the 1950s, 1960s and 1970s. But even after his breakthrough, he struggled in the job of director because of his age and inexperience, and it took him a few years to become a respected film director. He has directed eight movies, and he is working on an eighth.

this was absolutely the most tragic pile of cinema to which i have ever born witness. not only was the name a complete misnomer--since the film has next to nothing to do with piranhas--but the acting is as hollow and stale as the attempt to actually make some kind of plot. when you watch this film you cannot help but spend every waking second questioning when you've had enough and it's time to turn it off. unfortunately i waited until the end in my case. that's two hours of my life that i will never be able to reclaim.

I ca n't quite explain why I find this so alluring and `` The Leopard '' not ; it may be simply that I've been looking for a new computer and it seems to be the only one I could afford. :P
I'm just too cheap, you know? ;-)

LOL! ;P I don't know why this is getting so much attention. You can find many posts on this same subject all over the internet :P
You may or may not have found this post because you found it after clicking this link http://www.pinterest.com/marklind/lcd-bootcd/ to see all the posts on the subject.

I have never seen a more unrealistic movie than this foul piece of dung. The acting was over the top. The direction was tacky and amateurish. The script was just a joke. The story looked penned by a person that has never been around a high school football game, much less a professional game. And why, why did Oliver Stone feel the need to place himself in this movie as an actor? He was terrible, playing the most unrealistic announcer ever. He could not even get hired to do professional wrestling contests. Then you have Jamie Foxx, who throws like a girl.

I do n't know what some people were thinking when they said this movie was bad . It Was Great , and I did like it . For the most part though, I just think it wasn't the best way to go about it. Sure, the writing, and the story was good . However, the acting was a little . . . let's call it a let down . And there were a few scenes that were too long. There were some parts of it that were just a little . . . well, not enough .

This is the best direct-to-DVD effort from Van Damme that I have seen yet. Van Damme plays a border patrol agent who is out to stop heroin smugglers trying to cross into the United States. The action in this movie is great and the fight scenes rank with Van Damme's best. Costar Scott Adkins shows why he should be the next big star in the martial arts genre. For further evidence check out "Undisputed 2". Adkins is so good in fact that before I watched "The Shepherd", I thought that Van Damme might not look very believable in defeating him on screen.

What a crap that movie is . The script is simply non existent . The movie at times seems like the cast was in on something . just watch a few minutes of the trailer and you get the feeling . . . you are going to be shocked that there is really such a big hole in there . now there are so many movies that are based on historical fiction . why not one that is actually based on a real historical figure? why not one that has actually been documented? well . . . in my humble opinion, you could just call it .

I appreciate the effort that the filmmakers wanted to depict the story of Moses and the exodus of Israel, and that the film helps viewers to put themselves into Moses' shoes and gain understanding of the intense burden laid upon Moses' shoulders. As excited as I was to see this film, I was greatly disappointed in the storyline. (I'll leave out the videography, special effects, and artistic ability in this review.) What is most disappointing is the historical inaccuracy of this movie and how it is so far from the historical accounts from Biblical texts.

'The Dresser' is one of those films which are so perfect you really struggle to find something not to like about them. Written by Ronald Harwood (himself a former dresser to the legendary Donald Wolfit), it sparkles with energy and true love of life behind the footlights.As 'Sir', the overbearing actor and main focus of the play, Albert Finney is a joy to watch - whether complaining about the lack of a storm during the 'blow, winds ...' bit of 'King Lear' or chatting to his faithful stage manager, Madge (Eileen Atkins, good as ever) about the old times.

Well , I fear that my review of this special wo n't heed much different observation than the others before it. I don t know , I m sorry for that. But in order to have a better experience I have to express my thoughts that i m sure some people would like to hear , I m sorry also , for my ignorance that i may lack in this regard. So , i m here to tell y my thoughts. So , here goes : First of all I m glad that the special edition was made available and it is so amazing .

Oh my God... where to begin? "Chupacabra Terror" is one of the worst B-Horror movies ever made. This crap makes "Demon Slayer" look like "The Exorcist". Special note: A Horror B-movie needs to have at least one sex scene. Don't expect even a hot girl in this one. With that inexcusable mistake, I should begin with the complete bash.First of all, if you're going to make a Horror monster movie, you should spend big part of the budget in creating a "cool" monster outfit.

I saw the trailer for this film before watching Titanic, and I must admit that it whetted my appetite. Volcano seemed to be quite spectacular and full of promise. But what a damp squib. Corny is not the word for the script, and the characterizations are often ludicrous. The stupid daughter is just beyond belief - she is supposed to be 13 not 4. But then the scientists,firemen and peripheral characters don't offer any more. This movie ranks just in front of Cruise II and Twister, but only because those 2 films are completely appalling.

The Quick and the Undead is, finally, the first movie to actually render its own storyline null and void. It is, essentially, one gigantic plot hole.Aside from that, the acting was quite bad, character motivations nonexistent or unbelievable and there wasn't a single character worth hanging our hat on. The most interesting cast member (who had great potential to be a dark horse protagonist) got snuffed halfway through the proceedings.What the Quick and the Undead DOES serve as is an excellent example of how to do good color-timing.

What a crappy movie ! The main character in this movie was supposed to be born and brought up in the village. But she was brought up by her aunt (who is supposed to have married an Indian guy). The rest of the family were in the USA. She then got married and left for India as a bride. She never got the opportunity to learn Hindi. After marriage, they moved to another village. There, the father of her new husband was a farmer. But the husband of her new husband was not that good and he treated her very badly.

This is my favorite Renoir from the Fifties. It's the story of how Henri Danglard built and launched the Moulin Rouge nightclub; we see the workmen blasting at the site to get construction underway, and the training of the dancers. Finally, the giddiness of opening night and the long sequence of cancan dancing. Financial problems and the ego displays of the performers are described.Gabin is in great form as the easy-going Danglard--see him deal humorously with Nini's violent boyfriend. Gianni Esposito is moving as the wistful Prince who is courting Nini.

MASTER PLAN: have the winning team in a deadly tournament. One of several martial arts action pictures that attempted to capture the flavor of the famous "Enter the Dragon" from '73, this one is an effort from South Africa. The villain's stronghold is a bit different, appearing as a white castle-like fortress in the middle of the desert from a distance. The villain himself, a Baron or general, is a slightly more perverse version of the "Dr.No" or Han mold of master villainy, having strange flashbacks to the glory days of Nazi Germany.

What can I say...not much to this one at all. Pretty dull and uninteresting.The actors performances are just OK. The only one that shines in any way is Simmons, but he only has, maybe 3 scenes. I understand that by keeping his screen time to a minimum he retains the mysterious psychic aura he has, but I can't help but feel his talent was wasted. No one else rose above mediocre.The story itself seems like it may be intriguing at the beginning, but then just doesn't go anywhere.

Just saw this movie on opening night . I read some other user comments which convinced me to go see it. And yes it does have a lot of action, but there are also a couple of interesting stories woven into the plot which makes it worth it. The best bit of the movie is the ending. It is so sad and touching, I am so glad that it happened. I am not a good person and I have never said or thought the things the character is going to say at the end. I just didn't see it coming.

I completely understand WHY this movie was made. Silence of the Lambs was an incredible film - a gruesome thriller with a superb story and high jump-factor....What I don't understand is why THIS movie was made... and why Anthony Hopkins agreed to reprise his role as Hannibal the Cannibal in this terrible and dissatisfying film.There's no possible way to spoil the movie any further than going to see it could, but for those of you who prefer to waste your money, DON't READ ON. The film is absolutely horrible. It's so bad that the transition from Jodie Foster to Julianne Moore becomes a non-issue.

I went into this movie determined to like it. I usually enjoy dramas like Wall Street, Glen Gary Glen Ross, Boiler Room, etc...I went into this movie thinking I would be on the edge of my seat. Plus, I am a big Pacino fan.What a piece of garbage. Quite possibly the worst movie I have seen in five years. This makes Pacino's debacle in Any Given Sunday actually look good. First, half the movie is watching Matthew McConaughey lift weights. OK, we get it. You are in shape Matt.

Louis Gossett Jr returns to the well one more time as Chappy Sinclair who goes to Doug Masters ( Played by Jeff Daniels)

Gossett makes his way into the second unit with a strong performance which includes an early hit and a late rally with a double, a walk and a run on second base to set up a double to load the bases with the score 2-1. Gossett came through again to make it 3-1 on a single to right field and two walks and a strike out from the bottom of the 10th to take the game 3-2.

The initiation to the local sport team involves taking the newbies out to the corn fields and guess what? There is a scarecrow murdering people there. Only one of the newbies survive but falls into a coma due to diabetes. Meanwhile the scarecrow starts to kill all of the involved people, one by one. Whats the scarecrows secret? Will they find it out before the scarecrow gets them all? This is a low budget movie and it shows. Sound is OK but picture is really corny. The plot/script really sucks and is quite pathetic and non logical.

It is so nice to see Bruce Willis come down off his action throne and let us see that he really is a talented actor. He shines in this film as the near-40-year-old image consultant who has totally lost touch with his inner child--until he meets him face to face. This is one of those rare films that doesn't talk down to its audience and truly offers something for the WHOLE family. It is about caring for each other, keeping some of the child inside you, and realizing that you don't grow up exactly the way you thought you would.

I bought this DVD from Walmart for cheap , thinking it would be a typical , crap straight-to-video monster junk. Nope. It is not typical. In fact, you'd probably think it's one of those things that you need to pay $30 for in order to buy, so that you could get some kind of value. But this DVD does in fact contain some really cool footage. Now here's the issue with this video, and it's not just because the quality is not up to the standard set by some of the newer releases.

This was a random rental at the video store. But I was impressed from the start. Wooden Camera is a gem of a 2nd feature by an engaging director. The film captures deeply insightful moments and several often times frustrating and complicated social interactions young interracial friends would experience in a modern post apartheid South Africa. The young actors are quite good and well directed in their approach to the core material and the dialogue is natural and interesting. The film is very rich in visuals providing a frame by frame study of deeper understanding and fulfillment without falling into iconic stereotypes and clichés.

It's difficult to decide who or what is the target audience for this film. Jean-Pierre Limousin presumably had the chance to explore the problems of amnesia on a serious level and opted instead to use it as an excuse to make a soft-porn movie. Having seen, loved, admired and respected Se Souvenir des belles choses which explores memory loss - albeit as the result of Alzheimer's - in a profound and heartbreaking way, not least in the luminous performance of Isabelle Carre I find that Novo is an insult to Se Souvenirs.

For a teenager who has never read Austen , this adaptation might be fine . But only for them . The characters and the story are all very young and the writing is very bad . A story about what happens when a boy who wants to be an artist has no parents and is not going to have a father . A story where the author should know that she has no talent and she has no skill . And there is one character in this story that is the protagonist . If you don't have a clue as to the character you should probably just skip reading the rest of the post .

This film is absolute trash and proceeds to become even worse towards the, very protracted, end! The plot is confused and laboured, the actors have a couldn't care less attitude (maybe they were paid in advance - bad move, or knew they weren't going to get paid), and the sets were featureless, boring and cheap.I fell asleep twice and actually decided to not bother with the last 5 minutes as I assumed the actors would have fallen asleep themselves by then. More unrecoverable life time wasted!If you must watch it, then take it to the bedroom and forget the sleeping pills for once.

`` Escape from Hell '' is not made with enough artistry to disguise what it is : crass exploitation .' That's right - this one is pretty much unreadable. I think I'm going to just give up, go back to college and write something else - I can write it if someone takes the time to help with the translation - and I'd just be glad if there were someone who cared to do it so I didn't have to sit and stare at the screen. You know, I have a hard enough time trying to decipher this one as is : crass exploitation .

When i went to see this i thought , i liked the first two and thought that they were very well done and i was looking forward to their next part, and then i read it was going to be more like the first two and i did not like it. I dont understand why they did this. I think the last part is going to be better. Maybe its because i got a bit older and they have a younger target audience that i don't care for. I'm so glad i didn't purchase it but now i don't feel the need to look for another book.

It would be quite easy to make this movie sound fun : a call girl gets shot in the forehead by a sniper, and then she’s rushed through a burning building to the safety of another, more dangerous building. The sniper then shoots her to make sure she doesn’t wake up from her coma. A bunch of other call girls go to the other building to rescue the first, but they end up in a very different place. It makes no sense and has no real action, just lots of action scenes.

If the following sounds tempting , then by all means rush down to your local Blockbuster and rent this movie. I would not advise that you rent it by itself, but that would be the only time this movie can be seen by you. I can guarantee that the sound will not be the focus of your enjoyment as the film itself, but the experience in general. It is one of those films that comes to you while you are on vacation, that makes the trip that much more pleasant. I know this because I have seen it when I was in Europe on vacations of many years.

Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd...The strangest, most off-putting, but most wonderful Broadway musical. It is chilling, funny, and moving all at once through Sondheim's most memorable and incredible score and sharp performances. George Hearn is incomparable in the title role, bringing a strong voice and dead on (no pun intended) impersonation of the legendary demon barber, while Angela Lansbury provides the comic relief as she cheerfully grinds up his victims into meat pies. If you just allow yourself to enjoy it, "Sweeney Todd" is a real treat.

They said it would be a film greater than Turks Fruit. How darethey? It's not even 10% of this classic. Bad acting. The only character i felt sympathy for was the oneplayed by Angela Schijf. Her acting was the best in the whole film. The story could've been interesting, but it wasn't. Some scenes were very beautiful filmed (lights and camera), (theopening scene for example), but the bad acting made the magicdisappear.I really don't understand why so many people voted this film sogood.

How bad idea was to remake an almost Oscar -worthy film ? ! MOSTHLY MARTHA is MUCH MORE BETTER , with better actors and a better storyline than MARY POPOVICH. The main reason of its success was that both MARY POPOVICH & MARY WOODS are so good that it's hard to imagine that it would be worth remaking a film with them, but it's NOTHING if it's not worth remaking! It's better to remake it than to write a new script for it. So, let's talk a bit about MOSTHLY MARTHA.

This can hardly be called a good movie , actually it 's not even close . But I have to say that I enjoyed it . for a movie set in the 70s which I was expecting to be very good . and even with all its shortcomings . if you are looking for a movie that has a good story and good performances . then this one might not be a bad choice . one of the characters has a heart of gold . another character was a little too close to the line of the law . even a few scenes with a lot of sex and violence .

The series does not start as it means to go on. Although it's first two seasons are crammed with incredibly average episodes, as well as numerous duds, afterwards the pace picks up and one of the finest space operas is born. The first ever episode of Star Trek: The Next Generation is remarkable for two things: it's hugely enjoyable introductions to all of the main cast, and Marina Sirtis' peculiar accent which would later disappear. Seeing how it all began is very satisfying, and viewed in mind of the rest of the series, rather moving actually.

This is a rip-off of already crappy hollywood movies like Scream and I Know What You Did Last Summer . What really bothers me is the name, as in it's a rip-off. As I have already stated on this board before, I'm not giving this flick any stars. I'm just making a point that this movie is bad. It's like the movie was put together by someone that was a complete dumbass. It's bad enough that they put the actual actors in, but to put in a voice coach as an actor and make him sound like John Travolta is a bad move.

Rita Hayworth as Rusty Parker is the COVER GIRL du jour--she's one of the dancing girls in Danny McGuire's club, the most special one according to Danny (Gene Kelly) and pretty much anyone who comes across her. Take for example, Vanity magazine magnate John Coudair (Otto Kruger): enchanted by Rusty's resemblance to her grandmother Maribelle (also played by Hayworth in flashbacks), whom he wooed devotedly when he fell in love with her, he tries to relive his youth by fixing what he thinks went wrong between himself and Maribelle.

This movie is about a young couple running away to start a new life in LA, who end up being stalked by a psycho at a deserted rest stop. Actually, it's really just about the girl (Nicole), since her boyfriend literally disappears within a few minutes. The movie gets going extremely fast, and early on you wonder how it could possibly stretch its story out to feature length. It isn't long before you realize that the movie does this by simply wasting time with unnecessary scenes that go nowhere.The story is not only paper-thin, but unstructured, stupid, and incoherent.

I was really beginning to enjoy this show. It just started out slow and it wasn't given the chance it deserved. It is summertime so many people are not at home watching television. I know there are a few talent and singing competitions but I enjoy them as do many other. believe it or not when American idol is done for the year I miss it. Even though this was not American idol I thought it had potential. I feel bad for the singers on the show who wee really starting to grow on me. I wish they would reconsider and put the show back on.

Who ever put that review as 'of bad taste' is not all quite there... its so funny, genius and fantastic you could watch it until your eyes are square! not to mention the rest of the work he has done on the rest of the series...all is as good as Morris' standards. if you think that it is 'awful', 'distasteful' or 'sick' then i can only think of one thing to say to you: "go to hell." thanks. it had to be said!

I just saw this at the Castro Theatre in San Francisco and had trouble staying awake during this incredibly repetitive, unenlightening little film. It is a 75 minutes film that felt like 175 minutes and has about 20 minutes of modestly engaging material. It's not bad in any offensive way, it just repeats things that have been said many, many times over and more interestingly and provocatively. With only a couple of exceptions, the interviews drone on and on and on, making little emotional contact or context to the whole topic.

A wonderful family movie & a beautiful horse movie . 75+ % entertainment . Casey , Buddy , Kelly Marsh , and the great family movie . I will be back to check out the horses in the next couple days so look for that . . . . . and I will share more when I find the time . . . . . . ..

Friday, September 28, 2014

I hope you enjoyed the pictures I got today. I was up until 2:45am this morning taking pictures for a family that just moved here from Chicago and had a big scare. I got some nice pictures.

This film is about a gap that exists between the real world and the world of the dead . There are ghosts and apparitions in the world of the living but there is a gap in the world where no-one really exists. This is the essence of ghosts, which are entities who are not seen or known by any other being. The film is about whether or not you believe in ghosts, if they are real or not and whether or not it's possible you might see one. The characters are a young boy with autism and a female teacher.

**May Contain Spoilers**The main character, a nobleman named Fallon, is stranded on an island with characters so looney and lethal he might have been better off drowning. Count Lorente de Sade (pronounced "dee-SAYd") talks to his own hallucinations and sees all intruders on the island as invading pirates. He routinely beats mute servant Anne and tortures his unwilling guests in the dungeon. Inadvertant laughs are provided by giant "Nubian" slave Mantis who talks with a Deep South accent and helps de Sade hunt down trespassers in the style of THE MOST DANGEROUS GAME.

I knew five minutes after the monster made his appearance where his was going. But when I saw the beginning credits, I said "oh my god, Bruce Boxlightner, Walter Koenig (from Star Trek). Gil Gerard (from Buck Rogers, and he's almost unrecognizable), then I saw John Callahan who used to star on my favorite Soap, All My Childen. Put on a few pounds but he can still act. Then there was Veronica Hamill. too bad I didn't sick around to see her in the film. I bailed out 20 minutes into he film.

This film is a cash in . A cash in reliant on a rousing theme tune created for an earlier film, this film had a much less ambitious plot than its predecessors, which were all about a group of teens being forced to do things against their wills for their parents. However, the themes of bullying, bullying and violence are present in the film, which I think is really good. The only thing that really stops this film from getting any more attention is the fact that there’s not enough of a plot. The movie is a bit slow and not really exciting.

This movie was trying to something , but failed miserably . All the attempts at suspense were cheap , and it was just as bad as the trailer said . I don't even know why I bothered watching it . If it was something I wanted , I wouldn't have wasted money on it and I would have just watched it . If it was worth watching at all , I guess I would have just bought the DVD and not bothered with a movie . I don't know why I even watched it. I just didn't like it and I don't even know why.

I saw this movie with my girlfriend. It was a total disaster. You can really see it was cheaply made. Badly scripted and with very bad acting. I have read several versions of the book by different authors and also listened to one version on audio book. We couldn't take the movie seriously because of the lacking elements it should have contained. The experience of watching this was like The Blair Witch visits Green Acres. Then there were parts that were vulgar. They show this little boy using a bed pan and they actually show the contents of it.

I was n't expecting much from this tale of a kid whose term paper is stolen and turned into a book, but I was willing to give this one a shot. The plot starts with the theft of the book and how the book ends up getting into a girl's home and turning the entire neighborhood upside down. This is really the only part that was really hard to follow, as I was reading the story in sequence and the events kept happening on my head. I have to admit that I did not like it that much at all.

This appears to be two movies spliced into one. In the first, ZaSu Pitts is a renegade in a small town. She wants to help the romantic life of Marjorie Woodworth. OK: I'd never heard of her before either. But she and Pitts are in both parts of this concoction.Before we know it, Pitts is no longer Miss {Polly. She is Emmie. I had to rewind to see if I'd fallen asleep somewhere. I hadn't. She no longer in a small town but on her way to the title Honeymoon destination.The movie has some cute moments.

Given the subject matter of drug addiction Down to the Bone almost ca n't help but be a rather depressing read. After all, we really have no idea how it would feel to just stop taking a drug. That's something I don't get. But I guess it doesn't have to be as bleak as you may think. There are actually a few positives to the book. The first and foremost thing is that Down To The Bone is the first book in a series. That being said, I really like the book so far.

The thing which makes `` Fire '' even more appealing to watch apart from its magical artistry , is its animation style. This animation seems to be inspired by the style used in cartoons such as "Astro Boy", as well as anime such as ''Western animation'' (see for example: ''Sonic Adventure'' ). However, in the case of ''Berserk'' this style does not have the same impact as in most other anime. This anime has a couple of unique visual styles that make it different from all anime to watch.

If you think it 's beautiful to be obsessive about who you are in love with , then I can guarantee you the most beautiful person you have ever met in your entire life is also in love with you. So to me , it makes perfect sense. After all if the person you 're in love with is a perfect match , then it 's a good match. I mean, at least you get to spend your entire time with this perfect person and still have time to get your shit together. But I digress. So to me, I have no idea what this guy looks like.

The film successfully gives a graphic portrayal of the suffering of forced sex labour, but nothing more. The leftest agenda behind this movie could be seen a mile away and leaves viewer so embarrassed while watching if you know that feeling. So, the women are kidnapped and sent to ex Yugoslavian territory to work as sex slaves because (take a deep breath) the American military institution is corrupt and looks away while their private security contractors are selling people abroad. You don't need half a brain to see the relevance to Iraq war and Black Water Company.What a load of leftest excrement!

Nothing about this movie is any good . It 's a formulaic predictable `` romantic comedy '' geared to make people want to watch this movie to the end. It 's not that bad but it 's nothing I could really like . Nothing about it is really interesting. A lot of the actors that were in the movie give very little to the movie. Some of the story line is very well done but nothing really makes you care about any characters. Some scenes don't make any sense and other scenes really make you want to cry. It 's just not something that I would recommend to anyone .

Marked for Death ( 1990 ) spends more time on action sequences , than it does with focusing on its plot. There is, as always, more to be said about the movie than just ‘what is going on’. It is interesting that it is a film from the 90s. The time and place make it seem that way. It seems a bit retro. However, there is more to the film than just retro. It is the story of a man who returns from the dead. It is, in fact, set in the 90s.

I saw this title again on Shemaroo. I also asked my nephew who was 17 to watch the same with me. I am 35 and he is 17. He liked it and I did too. It still is funny, a little childish a times but still very clean entertainment. Satish Shah is hilarious in multiple roles. This sitcom would still fare better than many of the recent serials on TV. But obviously some people obviously like mundane fares that come out today. It would have been nice that Shafi Inamdar would have continued for all the seasons.

Film critics of the world, I apologize. It is your job to give advice to the moviegoing public so that they can wisely choose what to spend money on. But I ignored your advice and I have been deeply hurt. However, my decision to see "The Cat in the Hat" wasn't made haphazardly. You see, three years ago all of you critics said that we should all avoid the "calamity" known as "How the Grinch Stole Christmas". Then some friends of mine took me to see it and it turned out to be a colorful, funny and almost hypnotic yuletide treat.

I 'm a huge fan of zombie movies and this is just a pathetic attempt at one . I find these films to be so incredibly boring and nothing that I would watch over and over again. What a waste of money. I hope I never have to waste money like this again but I hope they come out with something better . It was really a shame to see it go down as I really liked this movie . I wish they would put out a remake of this and put it out as my favorite zombie movie. I really enjoyed this movie.

Although this series and the mini film in particular were very important at the time of release, I feel that the series as a whole was actually fairly poorly written with a weak cast. The issues at heart are extremely well portrayed yet it is difficult to relate and understand the problems within the film when the acting and script isn't convincing enough (especially when looking at the mini film).I also don't believe that this mini film or series has stood the test of time as now many of the scenes are quite laughable.

"The Cave" got released more or less simultaneously with the English film "The Descent", directed by Neil Marshall. Both movies share a similar premise; only "The Cave" is dreadfully unoriginal, unexciting and incompetent compared to the splendid horror adventure that is "The Descent". It feels like Neil Marshall realized that the basic story was too poor and instantly added ingenious ideas, depth and a personalized style, whereas "The Cave"-director Bruce Hunt simply went for the most rudimentary elaboration of the screenplay that was thrown on his desk.

I first remember bumping into this zaniness from the Zucker brothers and Jim Abrahams , back in the early days of cable. My wife and I were driving back from a weekend in San Francisco when we spotted a billboard for “Sixty Minutes” which was the name of an entertainment news program on our local cable TV station. My wife was in the back seat of my car and I sat in the front seat, which was on the back bumper. I flipped over the radio dial and the show I was watching began to play.

This is the perfect example of how a great book is turned into a poor film. The direction just gives the impression that the film was made up as they went along and Patrick Swaze is so wooden you can almost see the puppet strings on his body.Spy Vs Spy films are not - or should not - be about car chases and shootings, the bad guys in this movies are really bad shots and miss the main characters even when at point blank range.Even the action shots are just a cliché with the usual mounting sidewalks and crashing through tables and chairs - yawn.I got half way through and switched off - completely bored.

I was looking through TV Guide last night and saw a movie starring Heather Grahm on , who I liked very much. When I saw it, my thoughts went to the same place they had a moment earlier in the movie, as if I were watching it with someone else, because I couldn't figure out what to do. And as if I were watching it with a friend. I'd like to say I was being a jerk, I'd like to say I was making it up. But, I'm not.

This is probably the only film I 've seen where the IMDb reviews on both sides of the spectrum are the same, and that makes it even more surprising. I'm not sure what is going on but I found the film really enjoyable. The acting was fine, but that didn't matter much to me. I like the music and sound effects too, and that was probably the main reason for me liking the film a bit. The story line of this film follows an ex-military who is currently working for an environmental organization.

What is this!! its so bad. The animation looks so terrible , it looks like a ps1 type game. The actors are awful, they just cannot act to save their lives. I sat through all of this film an then at the end I was annoyed when I realised I had wasted 3 hours of my life. I've not heard of this film, did it ever actually come out in the cinema or did it go straight to DVD? A girl got shot?! What is up with that, it was just a stupid film.

Not having any idea what this film was about, but based on the fact that John Leguizamo was appearing in it, we decided to watch it. Well, it turned out not to be the wisest decision. In fact, as another commentary in this forum puts it, we felt embarrassed for the actors that participated in this movie.While the film is by no means horrible, it doesn't make sense at all. The over the top performance by William Baldwin doesn't help the situation either. John Leguizamo is a multi-talented actor who deserved better.

I am a huge fan of Harald Zwart , and I just knew that I had to see this movie. I think this is a pretty solid film, and I think it would be worth watching just for the performance of Michael Cera. I think the film is great, and I think that I will definitely be looking for it on VOD, so if you guys have any links to it on VOD that you think I can check out and see the film, please let me know! I’m always looking for good content to watch.

I kind of like JAG . It do have it´s charm but lately it´s to much propaganda in it . A little more of a realism would be needed in it
