I am sitting here writing this review and the movie 's not even over yet . In fact , I’m writing it just for today. I saw this film the other night , and I still remember the first time I saw the movie , I was like a kid in the first grade who had seen ‘Dil Chholao’ for the first time. And I loved ‘Dil Chholao’ , I just knew it would be the movie that would carry me through the years. And in my mind I can see myself watching this movie . So what did you think ?

Lame rip-off of THE QUATERMASS XPERIMENT (1955): the first half is deadly dull, even dreary - but the latter stages improve considerably with the scenes involving the rampaging 'monster'. In the accompanying featurette (a rather dry affair at a mere 9 minutes, when compared to the ones created for the other titles in Criterion's "Monsters & Madmen" set), director Day - who admits to not being a fan of the sci-fi genre - tries to justify the film's shortcomings by saying that he had a zero-budget to work with (where all the outer space scenes were composed of stock footage!

This has to be the worst movie i 've seen this year .. and i watch a lot of cable news .. but I'm going to have to give this one a miss because I've been watching The Bachelor for the past 5 weeks and have not seen any new episodes of it.. The Bachelor is the best show. If you're looking for a good show, there's no better one. It has a beautiful cast, great stories and the best judges. I'm hoping the season finale is on soon because it's a really good way to end it.

I am very open minded . I watch all kinds of programs to the end ... good or bad ... they are not important for me ... I am always looking for new information . I enjoy reading, reading books . I am a newbie in computers . I have learned a lot from my parents ... it will take time ... I want my daughter to have a happy childhood and learn lots of things for her future . I want to bring a smile to her face ... she will be a good wife .... so I have to do this . I am very independent.

This German horror film has to be one of the weirdest I have seen.I was not aware of any connection between child abuse and vampirism, but this is supposed based upon a true character.Our hero is deaf and mute as a result of repeated beatings at the hands of his father. he also has a doll fetish, but I cannot figure out where that came from. His co-workers find out and tease him terribly.During the day a mild-manner accountant, and at night he breaks into cemeteries and funeral homes and drinks the blood of dead girls.

I love these awful 80's summer camp movies. The best part about "Party Camp" is the fact that it literally has no plot. It simply drops a weak batch of "characters" into a location and then things occasionally happen. The cliches here are limitless (SPOILERS): the nerds vs. the jocks, the secret camera in the girls locker room, the hikers happening upon a nudist colony, the contest at the conclusion, the secretly horny camp administrators, and the embarrassingly foolish sexual innuendo littered throughout. The only cliche missing is the presence of Corey Feldman.

Five guys who were in the cub scouts together reunite years later to go camping. Were they run into their childhood nemeses as well as escaped convicts in this supreme unfunny supposed comedy. Most of the cast are content to simply phone it in, and don't really seem to care about the film in the least. The writers were so lazy that the names of the characters are, for the most part, the name of the actors that respectively play them. Richard Lewis's shtick gets really old REALLY quick. Even the late great character actor, Brion James can't save this stinker.

Trite and tiring , the one-liners almost made me cry . My 4 year old left the room and ended up yelling at me for a while. When I asked if I could read, I think the child was really angry and wanted to keep reading so I could get even more done. After the kid left the room, the teacher asked, "Well, what should I read?" "Let's read from the Bible!" was my response. The teacher was surprised and said, "If you like Bible, you will like this one."

Let me first state that I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this film. For the most part the actors and actresses looked their parts, and did fairly well in their roles, but the movie lacked any real plot. It seemed so wraped up in seeming 'wacky' that no interesting story ever shone through. Also, the camera work was often sloppy, attempting snatchlike camera work and failing miserably. Most of the time, shots meant to look cool ended up being confusing. Perhaps something was lost during translation, but some of the characters were just... stupid.

To paraphrase Thora Birch : `` I kind of like this movie . It 's the exact opposite of everything I like about horror films . '' But it's not a bad movie, and it's not a classic horror film. It's exactly what it should be, and it's far from the first time that the subject of haunted houses came to the forefront of a horror film. In fact, it happened so often, that the very first film of its kind is considered to be a classic, in its own unique way.

I would say this is a background movie. Play it the background as your tending to busy work (laundry, checking email, etc). I thought this was a film that was done before Amy Adams became successful after Enchanted. Wrong! It was done in 2009! The screenplay/script is pretty awful. I love musicals but the singing is just average and doesn't move the plot along. Ughh. It almost seems like it's a made for TV movie based on the cinematography. Am I watching a TV show? Even the secretary breaks out into song.

This is an OK adaptation of the breath taking book of Dan Brown. I can't say it is novel or very good but they made a movie that you can enjoy. Given the excellent story, the result could have been better though. The movie is pretty long but at the end I was feeling like some things were missing. Sound effects and sound tracks were very good. Acting was well done but the character development phase was very weak. For people who didn't read the book, things may look happening too quickly.

Maybe it was the fact that I saw Spider-man the day before I saw Duces Wild, but I do not think that there can be any excuse for this movie being as bad as it was. The cast was there to do it, but it seemed as if once they found them selves with a decent cast they had to try and make them fit into the movie. The only problem was that they did not fit. I did not like any of the characters and the story was sketchy at best. I left wondering why i spent my money on this movie.

I found the Movie very interesting . I really enjoyed the film the actors were great . It was entertainment . The plot was very interesting and the cast was great . I can recommend this film to all to watch . It was nice . I think that if you look at the movie I don't think you will find that many other movies are like it . I didn't think anyone could make such a funny story . The music was great and the actors were good . It is a film for all ages because the actors are kids with no experience like the adults .

Where would Hollywood have been without Fredric March as Robert Browning or Dennis Price as Lord Byron, famous lovers in their day? Even an actor as normally straitlaced as Michael Redgrave once brought some moody charm to a portrayal of W.B. Yeats. Writers' lives are an endless source of inspiration.But of all poets it was Dylan Thomas, the roistering, free-loving Welshman who enjoyed a pint or two (and drank himself to death in New York at the age of 39), who was closest in spirit to the film industry. During World War II, he produced scripts for British propaganda documentaries.

Buyer beware . The Alpha Video release uses a print that defies description . The movie was shot in color and looks amazing . I bought it for $13.99 . The movie came with a DVD and Blu-ray , but I think I got the Blu-ray and DVD from Amazon for $9.00 . The movie looks good, but it looks terrible on the disc . It looks like something was shot on the disc . There's a bunch of watermarks . The picture is grainy. I don't care for it , but the movie looks good from the description .

Once again , Doctor Who delivers the goods by the bucket load . It has humour ( `` You 're all wrong'') and a very interesting plot and it makes you laugh and think. In a world where everyone is on the same wavelength , it has more than its share of oddities and I could go on and on about it , but for now let me just say that this is very good, very well written and very entertaining. I have watched the entire episode and I think it is brilliant , with good performances and lots of great jokes.

I don't know where to begin. Perhaps the whole idea of this movie was just a disaster waiting to happen. There is nothing slightly humorous about a kidnapping. I don't know what was more offensive--the subject matter or David Arquette's "performance". It was like watching a bull get it's penis cut off, although I think the bull felt better afterwards. The filmmakers should find something about Sinatra other than his son's kidnapping to show (like, I don't know, his TALENT AS A SINGER!!!!).

I just saw a terrible film called The Sleeping Dictionary. One reviewer on Four Word Film Review (www.fwfr.com) got it right right when he wrote, "From A to Zzzzzzzzz." The story is about an English colonialist jerk that comes to Malaysia to "civilize the savages" so to speak and ends up falling in love with his sleeping dictionary. A sleeping dictionary is a native Malaysian prostitute fluent in English that services Englishmen colonialists and teaches them her native language in return for ... well the movie never really makes that clear, but I can only assume he gives her money or something.

This is the worst of the toxie series by far. The acting in Tokyo is horrible and you can understand them about half the time. The major problem with this film is all the sudden changes from the original. Like there's a different girl friend of toxie's in this one or it might be the same character just with a different name and played by a different chick. Why is this film made like a Disney movie. After about fifteen minutes it starts getting good with the gore and all. There's 2 awesome killings then the movie goes straight to poop.

This is just one of those films which cannot justify much of anything that happens. These people are going on a trek: the young girl wants to photograph animals. There really are no Piranhas, but I guess the psychotic hunter guy is the real piranha. Anyway, there are lots of animals and there is lots of driving. There is considerable anti-gun talk, but we all know where that is going. Toward the end, there's lots of action and a rape thrown in. Somebody must pay, and they do.

Most movies I can sit through easily, even if I do not particularly like the movie. I am the type of person who recognizes great films even if I do not like the genre. This is the first movie I could not stand to watch. Cat in the Hat is the worst movie I have ever seen--and I've seen a lot of movies. The acting is okay (Myers is good as the cat, it's just that he is REALLY annoying). The silly songs the cat sings were boring and monotonous, even for the children in the audience.

I've been surprised by the enthusiastic response to this film. It seemed dull to me, much as I enjoyed looking at Penelope Cruz, and the plot details often poorly worked out. It also seemed like an intensely sexist film: if the gender roles were reversed, almost everyone with any sense would be up in arms complaining the movie is intensely misogynist. It's not just that both the principal males are portrayed as complete jerks and sexual predators, but also that the women are portrayed as almost flawless, forming a utopian community which lacks conflict of any kind and which rests on relentless generosity and good humor.

From 2002 on Dutch cinema finally got better again. This movie is still part- and a schoolbook example of the bad period of Dutch cinema.The story is needlessly told in flashback style. All of the 'present' sequences set in France are completely redundant and add nothing to the story, emotions or power. For some reason European filmmakers often find it necessary to tell the story not chronological. I never understood why, or what the appeal of it is.The story self also isn't exactly the greatest. It isn't always clear were the movie is trying to go to and what it tries to tell.

I agree with all aforementioned comments. This show was a delight to watch. Funny, witty, terrific acting and zany sets. It's always a thrill to find a show that is smartly written, assumes the audience has brains and displays subtle humor. I would spend good, hard-earned cash money to see it again on DVD. And as long as we're requesting Smart Series That Never Got a Chance...How about DVD releases of Maximum Bob (another well written, odd duck show with a delightful cast of characters.) And add to the list...Middle Ages or Frank's Place.

That's all I can really say about this film. It's DBZ...like Tree of Might and The World's Strongest, it really...doesn't fit into the timeline for the show at all, though it is supposedly placed just before the beginning of the TV series. The action is pretty nice in general. The plot has a nice enough base, with a good background establishing why these guys hate each other and all. Pretty good in general, there... The problem is...there's a lot of really weird stuff. I mean, really weird stuff.

Roger Corman has enjoyed his shares of cinematic infamy in his illustrious low-budget career, spanning over 300 movies. While few (if any) would call him great, his films' obscure connections to underground culture (via reference, tribute, or influence) have ensured him a warped legacy of sorts. Throughout his career, he has also developed a bad habit of remaking his own films ("Piranha", "Humanoids from the Deep", "The Black Scorpion", etc. ), without improving on them in the slightest.

Throughout watching `` End of Days '' , I got the sense that the film makers were perhaps trying to create a feel-good movie to help sell the DVD release, but I was disappointed that they seemed to miss their mark in their storytelling skills. I mean, while I have seen and seen and seen, I am never going to say I "liked 'em or "didn't like them". While I have never really seen this movie, I have watched a few of the trailers and the opening and closing scenes. I am not so familiar with the plot and all of it is very cryptic.

River's edge is not a PLEASANT film to watch but it is an incredible one. Having viewed it many years ago I truly think it would still have the ability to shock were it to be re released or remade or something. Perhaps no movie ever made has captured the essense of young suburban inertia like this distrubing frightening movie. Given that this is based on a true story it is even more disturbing. Very well acted and just UNPLEASANT at many times to watch but also a little known masterpiece and a truely important film. Should be a mandatory to watch shown nationwide in all highschools.

I 'm not a movie snob . I 've liked lots of movies that critics hate , and I 've had a few. But I was a film buff growing up, so you don 't hear about me saying this , but I 'm a film lover . As a movie lover , I can get into the mood of the movie as well as the characters , the setting and all that . It is a good thing . And I 'm glad I got to see it , even though I know I 'll probably not remember every little thing about it .

I was expecting a lot from Mr.Amitabh Bachan 's role of SARKAR , but am disappointed . Being a Ramcharan fan, it seems he is being used as an actor to do his job. As I always say, good actor should do the role of hero , but he doesn't really have a role to play . If you ask me, the role has not been written in such a way so that it's easy for a person who is not an actor to handle. It's a character that's created by someone else in a different way.

Tyra Banks needs to teach these girls that it 's not all about being beautiful on the outside . The world isn't a reflection of what we are. You can still be good at everything and be beautiful. Just know what you're capable of, and know that what you do is beautiful. You can have everything. I agree, I don't understand how these girls can get so insecure about themselves. They are so vain and insecure. I've been in the business for a long time. In the beginning I was insecure about my looks.

This movie begins with a man who appears to be some sort of sports driver. He meets up with a gang which contains an arrogant boss, an obvious idiot, a fat boy who never speaks, and a woman who rotates between the three of them. The group which is called Satan's Angels, wants Rod, the driver, as their personal driver. He says no but then says yes after the authorities make him a spy to check on them. They rob a weapon shop in a ridiculously plot-missing scene.

I really do n't know much about the Marquis de Sade , not having read any of his book , so I was wondering is there any evidence that he killed himself? Is there any evidence to suggest he killed himself? No, because suicide is not an act of will, it is an act of the will, which is simply the result of a mental illness. Sade did not have this illness. He killed himself, and is dead. I don't see any evidence that he murdered himself, either. There are all sorts of things you can say about it, which are all false.

The main reason to check this one out is to watch Laura Gemser in all her glory.That 's reason enough for me to recommend the movie. It's definitely worth seeing, even if it's on a small screen - the cinematography is very well done. It's worth it for the acting, especially Laura's (which is great, in this case) and a couple of other small bits. Not only that but there's a great soundtrack to listen to during the movie as well as a great visual to view.

Lame rip-off of THE QUATERMASS XPERIMENT ( 1955 ) : the first half is deadly dull , even dreary - but then, why would anyone do a sequel to the original ? I was a fan back in the day , I got to see it twice , and I must say that it is quite well-done , not only that , but there is an intriguing story to follow , so if you've been looking for it, look no further, it's here, there's no point in wasting your time on this one , unless perhaps you are a fan of the series.

If this movie had been directed by a man , he would have been jailed . While Adrian Lyne was a fine actor , he couldn’t hold a job for very long . So , the director , Michael Curtiz , had to make the best decision for himself , and he took his own daughter to work with him . But , her friend , Anne Baxter , was pregnant and had to return home to have her baby . Michael took the child , and raised him . He later married , but , their marriage was a total disaster . The movie is about the couple and their son .

This film works on a lot of different levels. It's a profile of one very cool couple, a social commentary on aging and nursing homes, a love story, a musical. I've seen Uncle Frank a few times, and every time I watch it I'm not sure who to go call first--my parents, my wife, a friend I've lost touch with . . But it has a way of making you remember the most important relationships in your life--and want to reaffirm the ones that continue.

I'm not saying it because I think it's funny , but I'm going to say it to you to help you to understand, I am not here for the money or the glory. I'm here to do something that you should have done a long time ago. You know that you should have done something about it. I am not telling you anything because I think you ought to do something.

The inspiration for the `` Naked Gun '' movies casts Leslie Nielsen - who had only recently started doing comedy in movies - in a different role. The director wanted to see him in a smaller role and was initially concerned he would be playing an older character. As it turned out, his new movie was so successful that the director gave up on trying to get Nielsen to do a movie and started looking for someone else who could do the movie. In the end, it didn't take long to get him back to work, and the result was " The Naked Gun : The First 50!

This amusing , sometimes poignant look at the Hollywood detective genre of the 1940 's and 1950 's stars Robert Mitchum and Lee Marvin, as well as stars of the earlier genres of the 1940s , such as John Garfield, William Holden, and William Powell . Written by , , the book was adapted from a novel by . The book won the 1967 Pulitzer Prize for Drama . As a boy, Robert Mitchum would play his father and mother in a movie called "The Lonesome Pine" . He was a star in the motion picture era , but as a boy, he didn't understand why.

This is a very strange film , with a no-name cast and virtually nothing known about it on the web. So let's take a look at this film to see if I've been completely wrong or if there is some new info that was overlooked. The story is told from the point of view of four different characters in a train station in London. The first three tell stories from different perspectives about what they have gone through, while the fourth is the train driver's story. The story begins in the 1980s in London, as the city is experiencing a downturn in population and tourism due to the war.

This movie is all about reality, submarine warfare in WW2 was not a clean precise science. There were no computers giving exact enemy details, there was no precise instrumentation to 100% control the sub. Not all the crew went to fight with a song in their heart, and a smile on their dial.People with expectations of seeing a "pretty war" in this movie will be grossly disappointed, .............. GOOD, they deserve to be disappointed, they deserve to have reality shoved into their face.War is not clean, exact, fought by people about to break into song.

While this is horribly dated, I MUST insist...PLEASE, NO REMAKE! Frankly, it just won't help, as there's nothing which could be added or changed, contemporarily, to make this cinematically better.The novel upon which this is based, was atmospheric, well written, truly spooky work, but on film, it just doesn't translate. Most of King's written masterpieces fail to translate to film. I'm not sure why this is, but when you view this work, if you view it, you are likely to see just what I mean.

I am a gigantic fan of both Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi, but this movie is just not good. The reviewer below is entirely correct that the stunning imagery of the Detroit station is the first and last memorable scene in the film. I really, really wish I had left after that, instead of continuing to hold out hope throughout the film. Maybe my expectations were too high, but I felt let down.The score is almost completely a rehash of the previous two - not necessarily a bad thing if you're a fan, but there's only one piece that stood out to me as being fresh.

Mickey Rourke is enjoying a renaissance at the moment ... and fair play to him . I always liked his films and it's great to see him out there, even if in a new role . It's a pleasure to see him back in a new role . But what is really important is that he will be back to work after being out for so many years . This has to be seen by people who are used to seeing that he is one of the biggest stars in cinema today and he will continue to make good movies and good films .

I was shocked there were 18 pages of good reviews . This has to be one of the worst movies I have ever seen. The movie is absolutely awful. It was made to appeal to kids, and you really had to see the DVD to understand what was wrong with it. I will not go into details, but there are a lot of errors, a lot of unnecessary scenes, and the actors are terrible. It's hard to watch, and you really have to see it in order to understand the movie. If you're looking for something that will entertain your kids, pick something else.

I really wanted to like this film but it barely eked out a 3 . It 's surprising that equal distribution of film and video is so undervalued. I'm curious to see what you think and what it takes to get it seen by so many. What's your favorite film and what's your favorite movie of this decade? I'm not sure I agree with the first part. I think this film is pretty good. I just don't like the ending. But I did enjoy it, I had a good time, and the only reason I disliked it is that the ending is so abrupt.

I 've seen some Bible-based trash . This one tops it all . To make matters worse , it lasts for 24 hrs. I think it will last longer , but I guess you can always try it . If this one isn't the best you will find , try out the others that I 've posted and see if it makes you happier . You will probably be able to find one for less than this one , but some of them are more expensive . Anyway , you can always find some for less than this one .

Okay, now I know where all those boring cop/homicide TV shows came from. I do believe they can be traced back to this movie. "Scene Of The Crime" feels more like a TV episode, or an episode of a serial. Complete with stock characters and situations - the hotshot cop who clashes with his superiors... the aging cop who doesn't want a desk job, despite failing eyesight... the reckless rookie... the double-crossing dame, etc.I like many of the actors here, and they do a good job, but overall I found this movie dull as I'm not a fan of the genre.

As someone has already mentioned on this board, it's very difficult to make a fake documentary. It requires tremendous skill, pacing, patience, directorial 'distance,' a plausible premise, a narrative 'flow,' and REALLY believable acting (aka GREAT acting). Such is not the case with 'Love Machine'. It starts to show its faux hand about the 20-minute mark (with 60 minutes left to watch), and the viewer starts to realize that he or she is being taken in. It's downhill from there.Director Gordon Eriksen simply peaked too soon.

Very odd , this seems like a very average movie to me , if not slightly less . It is very odd that the main character gets a new girlfriend , they don't know what is wrong with the first one . A lot of movies seem to start off with a very good girl becoming a bad girl but this just seems like they start from a bad situation . I agree , I have a friend that has been in a serious relationship with a woman he has known for a long time , They have been together for a while and there's no trouble on that side .

Had the fun pleasure of viewing a new independent film called `` Half Empty . '' I usually go out to see films with friends, but this was my first trip to the theater, so I was really excited about seeing this particular movie. I had not been to the movies in a while, as my son had moved out and was living in Austin for the past few years. When we got off the elevator in the theater, I walked up to the theater and was immediately overwhelmed with how big it was. There were at least six screens, and the place was packed full.

Once again , Bugs Bunny sacred home is violated by careless people . This time the traveling circus put a little man trap in it . And now . . . The circus is back in town and this time it is a real circus ! They want to be famous ! I am not going to waste my money on a circus , just as they are not going to waste on me , so they should pay attention and make an effort . I think I can make a living at it . If this doesn't get a lot of publicity , I am afraid they may find themselves with no circus anywhere in town .

I had never heard about this film prior to coming across it as I was perusing the shelves at a flea market in South Africa which was packed with films like this. The film is based on a novel that I am sure has never been made before. Here are some reviews I have from people I know who have seen it before. I 've always enjoyed Frank Sinatra 's music , and just recently I wrote a term paper about his life and times , which you can find here if you're interested , and it's been pretty well received (I can't say the same about other terms, though , so I'm pretty happy about that)

I actually had the opportunity to go to his home town, New Jersey , with his brother , who told me the story of Frank having to be taken from the stage to a hospital bed after suffering a severe stroke .

Watched the director 's cut last night ... glad it was free rental , even a dollar would have been good. The film was shot in 4k and was shot in a 4k cinema. The film was shot using a Canon 7D and that is a good camera for this movie, the only issue is the lens. This is the first time I've seen a movie with a wide angle lens in a theater. The movie was shot using the Canon 70-200mm f/2.8L Lens. I don't think this lens will work with a theater screen unless you get a wide angle view.

I hate to admit it , but they were right to sack Schrader . The opportunity is here to build a long term relationship , which I believe is what he wants, not to bring in more money. I can see a few more players who will fit Schrader mold and be a nice upgrade to the offense, as long as the coaches continue to make him a part of their plans , and I hope he realizes this. I think that he has a legitimate chance to make a difference in the future of our franchise if he is allowed to be involved.

"2001: A Space Odyssey" is set in 2001 and the main character is HAL. A computer. That's right, a computer who talks and thinks entirely on its own. This was made in 1968 and to think by 2001 it would be conceivable that computers would talk is a joke. If this was in 3064, a talking computer that had emotions and made its own decisions would be considered just as moronic as this. There is nothing in this film that provokes any kind of emotion. It provokes two reactions and one is called: sleep.

This is most likely the best picture not many will see . It presented a culture in a real unhollywoodized way. I have seen this picture before. What makes it so great? Well, it was shot in the 70's and the movie is set in the 50's with the characters being middle aged (though, it would be surprising to see them in their 30s), so that is quite good. The cinematography is well done as well and the cinematography of the 70's movie era is quite nice to look back on, though, a bit dated now.

Well, this is about as good as they come. There are arguments about whether Hitchcock was only a "master of commercial suspense" or maybe a "compulsive technician" -- or was he really "deep." Nobody knows precisely what terms like that mean, but it's legitimate to ask if, at his best, he could not have been all three things at once.In this one he seems to be about at his peak. Hardly anything in it is accidental. It abounds with doubt, ambiguity, and wit.

I have seen both the MST3K version and the uncut version. I rather enjoyed it. Either way, it wasn't that bad of a movie. Sure it moved a bit slow at times. I liked it.As far as MST3K goes, they only did the movies they could get the rights for. Not all the movies they ripped apart where bad movies, it was just so easy to make fun of them. Take SoulTaker for example.Joe Estevez and Robert Z'Dar's characters where so inanimate and boringly silly I couldn't help but laugh. I couldn't take them seriously.

The film opens with the director talking to the camera and saying he is going to show a story about Brazilain street kids whose families live in poverty and must steal and kill to survive. In fact the main character (Pixote) was played by an actual street kid only 11 years old. What follows was one of the most brutal, depressing and horrifying film I've even seen. I saw it about 17 years ago (on a double bill with "Black Orpheus") and have never forgotten it. I don't think I ever want to see it again--it was just too much.

Until I did a Web search on "What Alice Found", I didn't realize that the name of the film is embedded in the title of one of Lewis Carroll's books. The book's complete title is "Through the Looking-Glass (And What Alice Found There)".The Alice of the film comes from a background quite different from that of Lewis Carroll's Alice. Her fresh and assertive character, however, is similar. The movie Alice begins as a young woman in New Hampshire who steals money from her ass-patting boss and takes off for Miami, vaguely planning to study marine biology and play with dolphins.

I 'm a big fan of surrealist art , but this film by Bunuel ( with some ideas from Dali ) is an exception. It's an extremely surreal film, but as you probably already guessed this is based on a true story . It's a well-written film, with a great cast and excellent direction . This is a story about a man who, after the death of his father, sets off to found a family . In the process of creating this film , it took a long time because it was a project that Bunuel started years ago and it had to be adapted into film.

In the ever growing film genre of comic book adaptations, Blade is by far one of the best realised, and most faithful (overall) to the source material.... given that the character has almost 30 years of history in the comics since his debut as a back up figure in Marvel's Tomb of Dracula, the writer took almost ALL of the characters and plot elements from the comic's history. While changes were inevitably made, the finer points of the film steamroll right over any criticisms. Don't let any of you friends tell you different: Blade is one fine film.

Jon Cryer reprises his role as a neurotic guy in Two and a Half Men , which he perfected in the TV series for the past eight years. I think he deserves to be in his own movie. He’s going to be a star. He won a Tony Award for his role as the titular character, as well as other awards, including a Best Actor Tony. He’s one of the few actors I can think of that doesn’t really need a lot of publicity. I think he’s great. He’s not a star.

I heard that after the first Oceans movie, the sequels begin to go downhill. I believe that this is not the case(at least not for this film). This movie is even better than the first film! The original crew returns three years after they successfully robbed Terry Benedict's casinos. Now, Benedict is visiting each one of them personally telling them to get the money back within two weeks. To do that, they must do a couple heists in Europe to get the money.The acting is very good. The all-star cast exceeded expectations.

I totally agree . This is `` Pitch Black underground '' and a well worn plot . The best scenes are from the first episode when she goes out for a walk and she goes into a bar. The only thing that could be better is if we could see some more scenes of her being a mother to a child . It was really nice seeing her and her family. I really liked this series. I am very excited to see how the story is going to continue . I also think it is a good example of how much a fan-favorite could get the show to be more mature and realistic .

How awful is it? Let me count the ways: 1) It is a bait-and-switch movie that starts out being about a UFO investigation, then turns into a high-pressure sales job for Christianity. C'mon! If the makers of this movie felt so strongly about their message, why disguise it? It annoys non-believers and pushes fence-sitters in the opposite direction. 2) It's not even a good sales pitch! If the characters in this flick asked me to go to church with them, I'd run like Hell in the opposite direction. They're scary!

Three American lads are backpacking their way around Europe, challenging each other to accumulate as many daredevil stunts and Hot babe lays as they can, But Andy seeks true love. He finds this during their bungee-jump attempt on the Eiffel Tower, when he comes across and breathtakingly saves a suicidal and heart-burstingly beautiful Julie Delpy. His attempts to find this girl and the secret he uncovers lead he and his friends into an fast paced adventure full of action, romance, gore, and inspired humor, without ever taking itself to seriously, or striving to be anything other than a wildly entertaining 90 minute ride.

This gem captures early 80's life brilliantly. As a grad '83 boymyself, I must say that Valley Girl (along with Fast Times atRidgemont High )stands out as the class of the teen sex filmgenre. The characters are accurate representatives of the era; thevapid mall chicks, pseudo punk rebels, preppy jocks are allrepresented here.I have seen this over ten times now. The music in the film was topnotch. Unfortunately, these tunes could were never as popular intheir era as those by arena cockrockers like Journey, Styx orLoverboy. Before the soundtrack existed, I searched out recordsand tapes (it was the 80's after all !)

Mankind 's Self awakening is the theme of `` 2001 : A Space Odyssey '' , a process that unfolds over decades and unfolds in different ways at different times (e.g. in different cultures). The process seems to develop over generations, from infancy through youth to old age. What is most striking is that this process does not simply happen; it is not the result of one single individual or even of one single individual's actions, but is the result of the interactions of individuals over generations. Even if this is the most striking result, however, the more fundamental question is how the process unfolds?

I saw this film at the 3rd Adelaide International Film Festival at the Palace cinemas, and was totally switched onto it in the opening five minutes. Thanks goodness for a film that ignores all the rubbish we often see in Australian films that seem to revolve around a)race b)gender and c) class, in favour of er...dare I say....jolly good cinema. The producer, a shy, slightly eccentric chap called Alex Frayne introduced his film, made with a bunch of his mates near the town he spent much of his childhood.

Let's face it, a truly awful movie, no...I mean a "truly" awful movie, is a rare, strange, and beautiful thing to behold. I admite that there is a special place in my heart for films like Plan 9 From Outer Space, Half Caste, Species, etc. And although I'm giving this film a 1, I highly urge anyone who enjoys a bad film for what it truly is (a bad film) to find a friend, snacks, something to drink, and make the special occasion it deserves out of: Aussie Park Boyz.

The pace of this movie is quite slow. It takes about 70 minutes to get Katie to China (which we know that she will) and leaves 30 minutes to wrap things up. I guess that the movie is a coming of age movie but the movie is full of stereotypes that are quite over the top:Katie - A beauty that realizes that looks, boys and shopping isn't everything. She realizes that she can "feel" and "see the real world".

Like a lot of the comments above me, also I though this was the average scifi movie, but unfortunately it was not. I found it rather patronizing, and indeed, preaching.But that is not the only comment. The scenes are very 'artificial' (not as in scifi, as I will explain a in a few moments). "Delusion" is what you experience when you watch this flick and then believe you saw something worthwhile. This flick, which tells of a trio of semi-psycho travelers who are up to no good somewhere in the CA desert, is amateurish and just plain stupid. The film suffers from an awful story, a lousy screenplay, and some terrible direction just to mention a few of the deficits. A special unit of four police detectives are dispensing justice in their own unique way in 1950s Los Angeles. Nick Nolte plays Max Hoover, the unit's lead officer and his partners are played by Michael Madsen, Chazz Palminteri and Chris Penn. Also starring are Melanie Griffith, Jennifer Connelly and John Malkovich among others. Quite an impressive list of names. Unfortunately that is the only thing even remotely impressive about this film.Our story begins when young Allison Pond, played by Connelly, turns up dead in a remote area of town currently under development.

I would give this a zero if they had that rating. Fun was no fun at all. I grew tired of the movie about ten minutes into but endured to the end thinking it had to get better - it did not. The others I watched this movie with also agreed. The acting was annoying. I am tired of Jim Carey's over the top ham acting. The supporting cast was no better. While this movie was a statement of corporate greed and the plight of the worker who gets stepped on when a large company goes under, the vehicle for this would have been better served another way.

This film hits the heart with a reality like no other I have seen . It shows what us what life is really really like and I am a very emotional viewer . The characters are very realistic . You can’t get bored watching it . I would recommend it to anyone , young or old . The film opens on a young boy in his twenties who has been diagnosed with autism . We then follow this boy as he becomes an autistic person in his own life , his mother is a teacher of autistic children, his father is an unemployed engineer .

Something not-so-great . `` Silence of the Lambs '' remains Demme 's only good film , and I 'm of that ilk . The story is so over-the-top farce it can 't be appreciated, let alone enjoyed . Yet, it is well worth your time . And the special effects are outstanding . The film is a horror story that should appeal to those who enjoy the genre : it 's not your run-of-'the-mill spook 's-n-scary story . This is a movie that deserves the widest theatrical release with the widest release it can 't be shown anywhere . And that 's not bad for a low budget horror flick .

This movie is an obvious rip-off of Underworld USA starring Cliff Robertson . You owe it to yourself to invest in a copy and see what you think. I don't have a copy of Underworld USA but it does seem to be an adaptation and I would think that the acting and some of the storyline would match up nicely with what we see in Underworld. It is a good movie with some really nice action sequences. But as a fan of Underworld I know it can be overrated and I don't recommend it.

Far from combining the best bits of Pontypool and 28 days this managed to ignore them . Whilst shamelessly copying their music, and making it sound like it was written in their home town of Manchester, there was some very good stuff on the EP. But I don’t know that I’d pay £7.50 a pop for any of the songs. “We want to take the time to do this, and we are really keen to work with the fans as a whole to create an album that will be for the masses. But we want to be transparent and honest with the fan as well.

This movie is one of my all time favorite movies and is what made me a lifelong Nicolas Cage fan. It stars an incredible cast of characters who make you care more for the characters than the acting, making this an action packed, fast moving thriller. This is the second film I’ve watched with my dad and my brother. We both enjoyed it. I don’t have any spoilers for this review as I’m not entirely sure how it’s supposed to work since there are a number of subplots I’m not going to comment on.

An unintentionally hilarious early talkie melodrama with Kay Francis as the Countess Balakireff chasing everything in pants . At the time, the play was so well written that it earned an Oscar for Best Original Screenplay. That's because it's so good, it was nominated, but lost to the other Oscar-snubbed melodrama The Best Years Of Our Lives. This is a terrific piece of screenwriting, so much so that when Francis won an Emmy in 2000 (for the original screenplay of Love Actually), her work was celebrated as much as her work on the show.

The Giant Claw is in fierce competition with films like, 'Robot Monster' and 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' for worst film of all time. A phony looking giant vulture attacks 'Lionel Trains' in this completely unconscious film. The script is so bad that everything the characters say to one another is ridiculous. It's no wonder that this film is a prime target in the movie, "It Came From Hollywood," where this gem is hammered for the line, 'A Bird As Big As A Battleship', with gleeful, endless needling.

Roger Corman has enjoyed his shares of cinematic infamy in his illustrious low-budget career , spanning over 300 movies . While his work remains a staple on the silver screen , one of his most celebrated projects is The Goonies ( 1985 ) , directed by John Hughes . The film was made in the time of the 1980s , during which a new wave of American and British independent filmmakers was taking over the silver screen . While the style was a departure from the traditional slasher sub-genre , The Goonies was one of a number of movies made during the era that made the horror genre as popular as it is in today’s climate .

Think 'Charmed ' with testosterone instead of estrogen and you get the general idea for this picture . A very masculine look. I have been obsessed with this picture from the beginning, because I feel like that is exactly what the world needs, right now, right? I think you can all agree with me, that it would make a wonderful book cover. This isn't even my first attempt at the look and I really want it to be one of the more successful books in the genre. I'm very much looking forward to working on it.

It 's hard and I did n't expect it ... But it 's really the worst film , me and my family were really excited ... I really hope they'll change something ... but I 'll give this a try , it 's good that it's here in the theaters and not on the Internet ... and if it 's not so much like the movie that I hoped for , I 'll still give it a shot , and I 'd like to see the ending of the film too, but I won't spoil it. I 'm also still not quite sure if it 's a good film or not.

Are you kidding me? The music was SO LOUD in this show I could often not even hear the dialog. And the music was nothing great. Anyone know what Jake's mother said when he walked in the door??? And the mushroom cloud looked pretty close to have so little instant devastation. Anyone research the effects of nuclear fallout before writing this one. I felt like a bunch of sit com actors were sent on location and didn't know what to do with dramatic dialog. And what does a Kansas teen know about shopping in Soho....couldn't we have had a better line here?

What a dreadful movie. The effects were poor, especially by todays standards, but that was forgivable. What was unforgivable was the terrible rehashing of every flood/dam breaks disaster movie ever made into this piece of trash. The acting was awful and I mean AWFUL. The point in the story where Michelle Green stops to rescue a dog from the approaching torrent was hilarious. They see the water approaching and run for their lives. (By the way they had to find a very old fat dog so as to not make Ms Green look to unfit).

I've seen all 3 now. I just can't believe how bad Naqoyqatsi is. Not in comparison to the others, but simply on it's own merit, or lack of. I can't understand how the average rating for this movie is over 6 out of 10. I gave the first 2 movies 8 out of 10. They were thought provoking and beautifully done. I gave this movie a rating of 1. If a 0 or negative number was available, I would have given it that rating instead. What a total waste of time it was watching this movie.

The TV show was slow moving and the 'offbeat' characters were sometimes irritating. Only through the miracle of fast forward was I able to make it through the first 2 hours. The write-up indicates that it's some kind of comedy/mystery but I didn't see much of either. If it really picks up after the first 2 hours, please let me know, because I doubt that I will watch the rest without a recommendation.This review is supposed to be without spoilers so I will continue in a vague, non-spoiler, fashion. I found the two main characters uninteresting and unsympathetic.

I love watching Australian movies but this steaming pile of crap was just plain embarrassing. The DVD cover looked promising but you know what they say, don't judge a DVD by it's cover. I also noticed that it won Best Actor for an award but the competition must have been really bad because the acting in this film is pathetic. It just seemed that the director thought he had enough talent to direct and act when he should really focus on one part of film-making and get it right before spreading himself too thin. The music was pretty ordinary.

I realise it's very hard to live up to the first The 10 Commandments movie (which was grandiose and personally not a Charleton Heston fan) but wow...this movie/mini-series was disappointing. Even the animated The Prince of Egypt was better.The one thing that threw me off was Ramses. Compared to Yul Brynner's version, Paul Rhys's version just seemed so weak and un-Pharoh like. The acting really wasn't that great. For a modern adaptation, I was expecting something better. It just didn't look as stunning visually as the first one.

Firstly this has nothing to do with the much better 18 weapons of Kung Fu starring Gordon Liu. I mention this as my Kung Fu Theater presents DVD has a totally misleading picture on the cover, the wrong plot on the back and goes on to mention (no idea why) The Young Hero starring Hwang Jang Lee. Apart from an introduction to the history of the 18 weapons style told by a monk to some children during the opening and the usual mysterious manual that everyone is after, the weapons never really appear again and the fights are all boxing style.

A recent re-issue of the French crime film ( original title 'Du Rififi Chez les Hommes ' ) , with an English version following soon, contains an interesting scene that takes up about five pages of screen time, and a few lines in the opening credits at the end. I'm not sure I understand the reference, or what the scene is referring to, as I can't recall the line that goes with it, but I'm a bit intrigued. I'd appreciate any thoughts or suggestions on this, or anything else this might be referencing, since I've always found it a bit odd and confusing.

Steven Segal's movie career is a tribute to horrible cinema. I have been tragically bored with every one of them as soon as I realized that they were even more unrealistic than Jean Claude VanDamme's. Has anyone else ever noticed that he never gets hit?! I mean, give me something to root for...a hard fought battle with a bad guy who's scary. TWENTY YEARS and he's still filming the same fight scenes. Fight scenes can often distract you from the fact that your hero cannot act. The boring choreography of a Segal film places his painful lack of acting skill in sharp relief.

* * Spoiler * It gives away the very irrelevant ending * * At the beginning of this movie , there was a moment where the film's main character was shot. I found that a bit too obvious. Also, the ending gave away an ending. 1. This is an adaptation of some kind or another. 2. The title refers to the fact that the hero is a child of the late, very rich and famous James Bond franchise, one of the most popular characters in modern times. The title also implies a kind of innocence and naivety. 4.

OK, so I'am chilling in my room when mom knocks on the door. I open the door and what do I see in her hands? "SLEEPY HOLLOW HIGH". I thinking it has to be an older horror movie, because there's noway anyone could be stupid enough to name a movie that after The blockbuster hit "Sleepy Hollow" starring Johnny Depp. But to my surprise the movie is at least two years older then the original. That alone should have stopped me from putting it into the V.C.R.

After seeing this film I felt sick to my stomach and if I had seen one more minute I would've vomited, so I don't want you to either. I'm giving this film a 5 because I thought it was pretty good, I like that a lot of the actors have good lines and the direction of the movie and the art work was really good too. I liked the acting as well as the cinematography. However, if I have to choose, I'd give this a 3 because it's quite slow to begin with and the ending was a little bit rushed.

The many other comments about the film say it all - just like to add that we showed it last week to around 30 at our Community Cinema, and it got an overall average score of 8.6. We'd 100% recommend it, then, for today's audiences, especially if they can see it on a real cinema screen, and can talk about it with others afterwards, as our audience did.The sheer power of the acting performances by the whole troupe was incredible and quite spellbinding. Of course, Finney and Courtenay were truly the stars. but everybody was thoroughly well cast.

Scarecrow Gone Wild starts as high school teenager Mike (David Zelina) & his mates decide to to give a 'hazing' to wimpish diabetic Sam (Caleb Roehrig) as an initiation of some sort. Mike & his mate decide to take Sam to a corn field, tie him to a cross next to a freaky looking scarecrow & leave him there all night, sounds like fun right? Well, things backfire when Sam goes into a diabetic coma after suffering from a hypo & the vengeful spirit of Sam passes into the scarecrow which comes to life & starts to hunt down the kids responsible for Sam's unfortunate life-threatening predicament.

If you came here , it 's because you 've already seen this film and were curious what others had seen so far. Well , here you can see all the reviews so far and how the film did. 1. "A Girl and Her Pig"

In this film, the protagonist, Astrid, is left alone in her apartment when her mother is out of town. So Astrid gets bored and tries writing a poem. One day Astrid is in a bar, talking with a guy, and the guy is trying to make a joke about being a writer.

Well , to each his own , but I thought Gibson 's Hamlet was the most god-awful rendition I had ever seen , and yet it made me laugh. Hilarious . I can't stand Shakespeare , I can't stand any of it. Now if we're talking about a good movie, I think it's Hamlet. I don't understand why everyone thinks it's better than the original. I'm an avid Shakespeare fan , but I think most of the films I can remember are horrible. I like both versions of Hamlet.

Even my five year old was bored.Very predictable, and overacted. This movie couldn't make up it's mind as to whether it was slapstick, or wry commentary on the state of "pee -wee" sports.Characters were underdeveloped, could have done more with the connection between father and son both coming from an orphanage.Did not like the reference regarding the goalie slipping the laxative to his teammate...very mean spirited for a kid's movie.Typical "Mafia" behavior was boring and stereotypical.The dog, however, was so darn cute!!! !

Since I am a fan of Natalie Portman , I had to see the movie . I enjoyed every minute of it . The director of the movie was very talented . The music score was a nice touch . There were a few actors in the cast who I liked . The film has no bad actors or actors in it . It is very funny . It really is one of the best romantic comedies of 2010 . You will enjoy this movie . You should watch this movie and watch it again and again . Don't you just love her ? Don't you just love her .

The girls might be prettier if you're their accompanist or a $#!+-faced onlooker. What I'm sayin' is that it'll take special circumstances for a non-whince reaction to this effort. The delivery of many lines appears to be distractingly unnatural for some actors. Lighting seems to be a problem, too, although failing eyesight may have accounted for my frequent squinting. And if you view this film, be open-minded enough to accept elements that no zoo or circus would reject: They are the above and below-ground creatures who feasted on dozens of campers near an empty Louisiana mansion.

Why bother , ITV ? Admittedly , Mansfield Park is the most difficult of the novels to `` get , `` but by the end you feel that you ``ve read it for yourself and that the author had some hand here , too. The problem is that you ''ve lost your `` way `` and you ''ve fallen back into what you know . That is why I am not surprised that they have not released this as an audio-book . The author is a genius . Mansfield Park ( , ) was first published in 1939 and has been described as a masterpiece of the period.

Ken Burns ' `` Baseball '' is a decent documentary ... it presents a clear origin of the game , and the history of American baseball. However, it isn 't a good film. There is no baseball player that plays on the game in this film. It is a fictional biography, and is based on the popular book '' ''A Day at the Baseball Field: The True Story of The Game that Changed America''. It was written by the journalist , and it has been made into a TV series . The TV series will air on ABC.

Flesh Feast starts at Miami Airport, ace reporter Dan Carter (Harry Kerwin, he is also credited as production designer) phones his mate Ed Casey (Phil Philbin) to let him know that he has just returned from South America where he has been investigating Carl Schuman (Doug Foster) & that he was onto a big story but while still talking on the phone he is stabbed in the back & killed. Schuman meets Dr. Elaine Frederick (Veronica Lake, she also executive produced) who has recently been released from a mental institution, together they discuss their grisly plans.

I still remember watching Satya for the first time. I was completely blown away. Here was a movie that was very different so from the other Gangster films that I had seen. So realistic, so Mumbaiyya and so believable. Despite "Company" (which was a very good effort) and "Vaastav" (more focused on the journey of the protagonist) which came close, no underworld movie could ever live up to Satya.When I watched Ab Tak 56 for the first time, I said to myself "Indian Cops have their own 'Satya' now".

This film could have been great- but was n't . Amongst the cesspool of talentless no-hopers and friends of the dead on this list, the one thing I'm sad to see pass away is John Carpenter. Not that he didn't deserve any accolades - he was probably one of the finest and most prolific horror directors out there. I don't think any of you could tell the difference between a horror director and a horror film- and so I'm not about to tell you. But he did make a few good horror films - and he made his own horror films.

From the makers of Underworld, we have, by far, the worst werewolf movie I have ever seen. It is basically a reconstructed version of Underworld, yet lacking vampires (not a big deal), cool effects (a BIG deal), and generally just about everything that can possibly be done right to produce a decent film dealing with lycanthropy (the biggest deal of them all!). A twenty-something lycanthrope chocolate maker named Vivian is currently residing in Romania ever since her family was hunted down and executed in front of her years ago in America for being werewolves.

Please...if anybody gets the chance to read this BEFORE watching the movie, if it can be called so, refrain from it... do not waste your time!!!! I too watched this film right after finishing the book, and was seriously disappointed... the main character is basically a new made up Fanny, for she shows NO resemblance whatso ever to the book...she's so lively and laughing all the time... if there was one thing the author wanted to set on this was that she was a very shy, introverted character.... please!!!!!

This thing , directed by french sensation Patrick Sebastien , is worst than all the turkeys that you may have in your face. In fact, the film seems to be a tribute to the film “A Christmas Story” , starring Johnny Depp. The title of the film, which was recently shown at Cannes, was inspired by the Christmas movie. However, what really gives the film its identity is not its plot but the way Sebastien and his collaborators use the elements of that other Christmas movie to build up a whole new story with which to make their movie.

This is one of the dumbest ideas for a movie. Remake a classic film shot-by-shot. I hope nobody tries this technique again. In 1998, "Good Will Hunting" director Gus Van Sant tried it by remaking Hitchcock's 1960 classic "Psycho" and failed miserably. What on earth was Van Sant thinking of? This remake doesn't even come close to topping the original. The few changes that were made here were no help. If you want to see "Psycho", the choice is obvious. See the original.

I 've discovered this movie accidentally and it was really a nice surprise . A Christmas Classic , it 's not as good as others like it . It was a bit slow in the beginning , the plot wasn't all that believable , but overall a good movie . The characters were good , but not great . This is one that will be on my favorites list , for a long time . A great Christmas movie , it has some great scenes and scenes to remember . I 'll probably watch it again , just because I 've seen it so many times , I can't take it away .

Nemesis Game is a mind-bending film filled with riddles, death, mystery, and philosophy. In it's simplest sense the film is about seeking answers and what happens when you've finally found them all. The search for answers leads Sarah Novak down a path that gets darker as it gets more compelling. The final answer seems more dangerous than it is worth, yet Sarah is so close to understanding it all. What would you do if you were offered the ability to finally make sense of the chaos of life?The movie was written and directed by Jesse Warn.

If you 're coming to this film to learn something about depression , forget it : you wo n't learn anything, there is nothing to learn, it isn 't worth it. Even when you know what to expect, it isn 't of any use to you. There 's no emotional value to what you do see, and so there 's no point to the film at all, and as soon as we get to the credits and there are no more credits, we're left to wonder : what do you think it is about ?

I am sure I 'm in the minority ( I know I am among my friends ) , but I don't like what we are doing. I just hope that it won't be long before people will understand that there is no point to be in this world until you learn to accept the things it offers. In the meantime, I will keep trying to find someone to blame so that I do not have to worry about it. "How much of your own soul is worth if you have to give it to somebody else?"

There are plenty of comments already posted saying exactly how I felt about this film so Ill keep it short and make it very simple:

I wasn't expecting this to be as good as it was, but I had no doubt I would enjoy it. I'm not going to get all teary-eyed over how this is bad, but I can't deny it is disappointing, and I'm going to hold my tears until the very end when it hits me. That's the way I want to see this film in the future.

If you took all the stock elements of a Shrek movie ( grumpy ogre , annoying donkey , cute kitty , happy ending ) and made it into a live-action short film, we're guessing that you might have seen a movie that did exactly what you're trying to replicate. So when you went and decided to do the same thing, what would you do? In this article I'll outline what I've found works best so that we can all make better short films. But before we begin I should mention that I do have a bit of a problem with this sort of thing.

This is a film that has to be taken in context. It shouldn't be seen unless you've seen the first two films, but the sort of people seeing this film will probably own the box set, or at least know someone who does. And you shouldn't go in expecting Blade Runner; the films budget doesn't stretch quite that far, and it's a far more zany ride.Essentially the film is a science fiction set in future Yokohama (shot in Hong Kong as is obvious) about a society where it's illegal to procreate.

We have a character named Evie. Evie just wants to be a good person. She's nice, friendly, smiles often, but is strangely brutally honest. Evie also has a secret. Her idiot-savant sister has been reciting original poetry, which is getting the community excited about the sister writing. Unfortunately, it's Evie's poetry. While their mother starts being happy again and the boy next door shows his interest in Evie, Evie just tries to figure out what she really wants to do.What to keep in mind while watching this movie is who Evie really is.

Once again , I 've been duped by seemingly intelligent reviews making seemingly intelligent comments about an obviously crappy movie. I'll get right into it. I think it's best to discuss the issue from an objective viewpoint. First of all, I'd like to make clear that I've read the movie thoroughly and the review by the person who gave it to me has been very fair and objective. I'll also say that I don't agree with some of his comments in this particular review, but that's not his point in particular, it's that people give bad opinions about movies on a regular basis.

Ordinarily , Anthony Mann made westerns with 'the big guys ' - James Stewart , Gary Cooper , Henry Fonda . Now 'the big boys ' are using the western genre to make films for the masses - Robert Redford , Brad Pitt , Clint Eastwood . The western genre is coming back to its glory days with a new generation of producers who are determined to bring back the form . One of those producers is Tim Moore , who , with his production outfit, FilmStruck, will be producing several new westerns that are directed by 'The Big Country' directors Tim Miller and Tim Sutton .

Although I saw this movie in Korea, in Korean, and therefore did not understand the language, images sure say more than enough. From what I can make of it, this is the story: Two superb sword fighters become friends in their service as the king's guard. One of them finds himself opposed to the ways of the king and starts assassinating important men. The other has to hunt him down. This movie is visually great. The swordfighting is great. And the movie has a gripping end. I just hope this movie will be marketed for the western cinema goers.

Mani sir as usual brings out another amazing story with Kannathil Muthamittal . Such an amazing relationship between parents and sons. Kannanthil is not only a great father, but a great businessman. In an interview with a local daily, he had said that he was not the only son of his in law, who had joined the army and was serving as a corporal in a company in the military . He added that if the company wanted him to quit his job to join them in his own right, he wouldn’t say anything. So what’s the problem?

We usually think of the British as the experts at rendering great adventure from the Imperial age , with the British Empire in its heyday of the second half of the 18th century , from 1805 to 1814, when it was the biggest and most powerful country in the world at that time. But that’s only a part of the story, or rather, part of a very specific story about how things developed in Britain from the late 17th century on. In order to see the ‘whys’ , we have to go back.

`` Rouge '' is part of a trilogy , but very much stands on its own . It is n't a sequel to the original either, a much darker story than the original. I really enjoyed this one. There are some very dark and disturbing moments , and the ending leaves a lot of questions . I would recommend that you check it out if you have an interest in horror movies . A few notes about the movie:

The story is told from multiple POV points , with many of the characters having very different backgrounds. I really liked how the story is handled .

This movie was pathetically awful. The sound was terrible, the action was ridiculous and the effects were nauseating. If you have a life don't see this movie, cause you will want to kill yourself. This movie totally rips off Blade (which is undoubtedly a really good movie...or trilogy I should say).I don't care who the actors are, this movie is just horrible. I watched 10 minutes of it and had to come to my computer and comment on how absolutely just bad this movie is. I actually don't know why my family is still watching it...oh wait, yes I do.

I came across this movie back in the mid eighties as a teenager and it immediately became one of my favorite classics of all time. I have read quite a few of the author's novels but have never read the original book. So for this post, I am doing my best to give you my thoughts. If you are looking for more than that, you may wish to check out my other reviews here. There are a couple of aspects that stood out to me while watching this movie:

First and foremost, the soundtrack, which I think is amazing.

Prue and Piper bring Dr. Griffiths to their home to save him from the Sauce's assassin Shax. While Phoebe looks in the Book of Shadow how to vanquish the demon, Prue and Piper fight and chase Shax on the streets to destroy him. However, they are filmed and exposed live in the television news as witches. They become national sensation with a crowd in front of their house. Phoebe trusts on Cole and goes to the underworld with Leo to ask him to summon Tempus and revert time while a fanatic woman shots Piper, who dies.

A virtual carbon copy of The Cave save for a fewer lower budget effects and a slightly different plot . I think that it will appeal to fans of The Cave, but only to a small extent. It doesn't seem like it's that much different from the movie, at least with the basic story. Maybe some people will find it funny as much as I did, but I don't have a lot of interest in seeing it, it's just a movie that I don't find that interesting and I don't know what I'm laughing at.

Just awful. It's almost unbelievable that, with characters and situations provided by Dashiell Hammett, such a plodding, passionless mishmash could result. But that's television for you -- filler between commercials. The first warning signal sounds from the fussiness of the period re-creation, which screams "1928" in banner type. Flivvers and touring cars, fedoras and waistcoats, cloches and speakeasy jazz (jarringly played) -- with all the attention paid to pointless, arty detail, the important matters get ignored.Like narrative clarity, or plausibility, or competent writing and acting.

Foolish hikers go camping in the Utah mountains only to run into a murderous , disfigured gypsy . The Prey series is the best-selling paranormal romance series for kids and adults, and it follows a group of people as they search for the supernatural . . . or the Prey, for short . . . . In this series, a group of young adults go on an unforgettable adventure in the American Southwest , where they must navigate a dangerous landscape that will test all their strengths and abilities . . . and it may be fatal for some . . . .

My girlfriend wanted to see this ( lol this is the case a lot ) ... so I rented it, had to watch the show. It was the first time, after watching all of the series, and I really enjoyed it. But, I had to wait an extra 1 hour for it to reair and I thought this was a good reason to keep it around for the next episode. I'm glad I watched it, it is good. I can watch it anytime I want. Maybe next time my boyfriend will let me watch it for free and then I'll go to the theater instead.

A magazine columnist who writes about life on her farm house when in fact she lives in a NY apartment with her boyfriend. This column is the product of many hours spent at the typewriter in front of her computer, writing down random facts and details of her life. It is written to make the point that she is in fact an average American lady, who happens to have been born and raised in rural Iowa. It is my hope to inspire you to be a better, more positive person by living your life the way you would like to live it.

This movie is so bad, they wouldn't buy it back at my local used CD/DVD store. I only own it because it came in a box set which I bought for the masterpiece "Deadfall". So I tried to sell it back to another store, that even bought back budget DVDs that you could buy for a dollar at a local store, but they wouldn't buy back Underworld either.

This is a horrific re-make of the French movie Ma Vie en Rose ( http : //imdb.com/title/tt0119590/ ) . The movie was made for children and the plot is a re-hashed version of a story from the Grimm fairy tale. The movie is really good, kids will enjoy this re-make and it won't get old for them. It's a good story that teaches kids about the world. The story was written in the mid 1900s by a French writer called André Gide. The plot was inspired by a classic French fairy tale. He changed the whole story slightly to make it a modern tale.

( This is a review of the later English release by Disney , featuring Alison Lohman , Patrick Stewart , Peter Dinklage , Anthony Hopkins , and Michael Gambon . ) Patrick Stewart is so much more than a handsome actor. He can act as well as any actor you’ve seen. He can play a wide variety of roles, from a tough but sensitive cop to an alcoholic rock star. I had the privilege of seeing him, and he was so good that I felt compelled to write this entire review on the spot. I had a great time.

This film works on a lot of different levels . It 's a profile of one very cool couple , a man and a woman who have lived through a lot of very different times . They have gone through various hardships but they have survived them . They have managed to maintain a very happy and stable relationship despite the challenges . This is all true and as it turns out , the relationship between them is more than just their two partners . This film is very well written . You feel like you are in love with these characters .

This made for TV film is about every cliché you can come up with for a disaster movie . The plot is basically a huge disaster involving a lot of death, mayhem, and destruction. At least it wasn't all destruction. It just wasn't that big of a mess. It was a good film , I thought, but not very good . The cast of characters were well cast and they had a good idea of what they were going to be doing and why they were in the film . I found this movie to be a good movie, I just wish there had been more action and explosions.

I'm not going to say the story of the movie as some people do. I'm pretty sure people who read this will know what the storyline is. I'm also not going to go on and on about everything thats wrong with this movie, because I'll be here for ages if I do. The storyline is typical, and the special effects are below today's standards. This is not a movie you should watch if you are a serious movie buff (as most of us here are) little things will annoy you the whole movie and ruin the experience.

1st watched 7/19/2003 - 1 out of 10(Dir-Brad Sykes): Ridiculously lame 3D movie which pretty much follows the plots of many 80's teen slasher flicks. Stupid kids go to a known murderous camp site, become hunted by an unknown masked man, and then we try to figure out who, if anyone, is going to live. We really don't care who's behind the mask but even that's not hard to figure out if you've seen any of these kinds of movies. What a waste of a 3D viewer despite somewhat decent 3D effects.

A few buddies and myself have the strange hobby of seeking out really horrendous and utterly obscure ( for a lot of people) pieces of art. We do this every year. We’ve collected and studied the best of what was ever thought of, from the early 20th century, through the 1960’s and the first half of the last century. Some of it’s really pretty good, some is just awful. Some pieces we find are amazing, some are bad, but all of them are worth checking out.

OhMyGAWD!!! THE MAGIC GARDEN is perhaps one of my most vivid '70s childhood memories. Two hippie chicks with ponytails, Carole and Paula would swing on swings, tell jokes they picked off the chuckle patch, dress up with costumes they found in a giant chest called The Storybox, and argue with a pesky pink squirrel named Sherlock that lived in one of their trees. They also could strum a mean acoustic guitar and sing a pretty melody. This was a great childhood show. Very 70s feeling. But that's the problem: They don't MAKE shows like this anymore.

Admirable but weak James Bond film mainly because both the hero ( Bond ) and villain ( Blofeld ) were too small in stature. This film is the only Bond film where Bond didn’t actually get the chance to become a great 007 ( Bond as he was in previous films, but with much more personality). The Bond in Skyfall is Bond as an ordinary 007, the same 007 in all the other films. The best Bond film so far has to be Quantum of Solace . It is so much more than the simple story of Bond fighting the bad guys.

From the crash of the opening theme , `` The Man With the Golden Arm '' is classic 1950 's rock and roll's first major hit with a song that not only reached the Top 20 but stayed atop the Billboard charts for nearly four months in a row. It's now one of the few songs in history to spend a month and a half atop the chart at least twice. It's a record not just of the music's staying power, but of the cultural impact rock and roll had for the next 40 years.

This film is replete with sentimentality, unprofessional flying that makes a pilot like me cringe, and irrelevant material. Why introduce Rachel, for instance? She has absolutely nothing to do with the film except to permit her "Follow Me" truck to run wild and crash into Dorinda's fence. That has got to be one of the stupider sequences among many in the film. Another is at the end when the aircraft (was it a B-26 or an A-26? --both designations are used in the film) is left with props whirling and no chocks in place.

This movie was physically painful to sit through , maybe because ( like many people my age , and younger ) I have a fear of spiders . It was painful to see spiders , but they made a good point . It doesn't matter what you see , or how far you are away, there is always one. My fear of spiders was not so much that they were a threat , but more that spiders could cause me physical pain. This may be true for everyone , but there are specific circumstances when it is true. I can tell you about an instance .

Having loved Stephen King 's novels and short stories for many years , I , like most reviewers , have not read all of them - and even then I have not read most of them all in all genres . I would just like to see this and I hope to hear from others, so that this blog will be of some help to some .

The film begins in Latvia just after WWI. Being a history teacher, I knew that multinational troops occupied much of Russia during this time. There was serious concern about the spread of Bolshevism and the troops were there ostensibly to protect their nations' interests. However, some times they flew missions or had armed conflicts with the Communist army, as the nations involved really wanted to see the so-called "Whites" win. However, the Whites were deeply factionalized--some wanting the return of a czar, some wanting a republic and some wanting something in between.
