You know, this is one of those "Emperor's New Clothes" films. It's like, so off the wall and strange that you're SUPPOSED to like it if you're really into film. Well, I think that's a bunch of bologna. Films like this which hide under the cloak of Dada or surrealism make me nuts. Some person has this bad dream, perhaps brought on by eating the aforementioned bologna right before going to bed, remembers most of it (unfortunately) and then puts it on film and we're all supposed to marvel at their creative genius.

I really enjoyed this movie . I have probably watched it 2 dozen times or more and still enjoy it everytime I watch it . I am always shocked at the violence and the way he uses violence .I think it's quite a powerful film. This review is based on a DVD that I bought in the theater last night (the first time I've watched the film in a theater). The first 15 or so minutes of the film is quite disturbing to watch, then suddenly it starts getting better, and the violence begins to creep into the story at times.

Dolelemite (1975) is a cult classic. Starring Rudy Ray Moore as the pimp superhero out to wrong rights whilst challenging the MAN along the way. He has two enemies, that no good Willie Green and the sleazy mayor. Watch Dolemite kick, punch, slap and pimp his way across the screen. What's the man's name? DOLEMITE!Interesting film that paved the way for a generation of rappers and performers. To sell more of his party albums, Rudy Ray Moore made several on the cheap films during the seventies. Self produced and marketed he catered towards a specific audience.

In his feature film debut ` Yellow , ' Chris Chan Lee attempts to enlighten Hollywood 's portrayal of Asian-Americans. “Yellow is the story of one of America’s first Asians. It is written by one of America’s first Asians, writer Chris Chan Lee. The screenplay is by Lee and his friend, actor Daniel Wu, who co-created the feature film with Chan Lee.”

In his feature film debut “Yellow,” the author Chris Chan Lee (born June 28, 1965), writes the script, with Daniel Wu (born October 1, 1965), directing and starring in the action-adventure film.

The Love Letter is one of my all-time favorite books , so naturally I was skeptical when I heard it was going on the New York Times Bestseller List. I’d heard great reviews and was hoping for a better result. It is, however, easily my favorite book of 2007. I was so excited when I found that it made the list. It is so fun to know I made it. I love the book. But before I get into what makes the book good, let me first talk about how I feel when it was first published, and why I felt it was worthy.

When one of my friends recommended this to me , raving about how well it was filmed , the underlying message I get with this is that in order to improve your relationships, you have to do what works for you and not what others expect from you. So as I said , I would love to see this done for a second time to see how things turn out. I’ve had the same friend who recommended this before as a first time viewer , so if anyone can help get this done, please do so.

WARNING : PLOT SPOILERThe always-abnormal movies of David Cronenberg certainly are an acquired taste . Fans of his earlier films like The Fly and Dressed to Kill probably already know how good they are, and will appreciate them for that. Those of us who haven't yet watched them might not realize that they've been sitting around on DVD collecting dust for a while and haven't really gotten much of a chance to see them on the big screen for a few years, and that's a shame. That said, I would highly recommend any of these movies to a film buff like myself.

I love this show . It 's clever and very well acted . David Morse and Andre Braugher have great chemistry . It 's hilarious , it 's very funny and very entertaining . I love that there is one character who is constantly on the offensive , who continually tries to outsmart the others and when he finally loses , he comes out looking like the bad guy . This is not to say , David Morse is not the best of actors , I mean he is . The show , as well as I said it 's entertaining and well written , and it has some pretty cool special effects too .

I am 17, and a biased Muppet fan, and while I love Treasure Island, Christmas Carol and Great Muppet Caper, The Muppet Movie absolutely deserves to be up there with the best of them. It is enormously entertaining, thanks to the snappy script by Jerry Juhl, and the film looks lovely, with some beautifully staged musical numbers. Speaking of the songs, I really liked them, sure they aren't the best song score out of the Muppet franchise, but they were very nice to listen to, especially Never Before.

This representation of the popular children 's story on film is pretty pathetic to watch . I know it is supposed to be funny, but it sure as hell is boring . I know this is the type of film that people go to see when it comes out in theatres , but I just can't stand this movie . I would like to see the film for the original story, but the film has nothing to do with the story . The movie is basically about an overweight kid with no self control who just wants to be a good friend to his friend .

The story is about a psychic woman , Tory , who returns to her hometown and begins reliving her traumatic past. Her life begins to unravel and it seems that something is wrong in her life. There is an old man in town who claims that he has a vision. The lady is determined to solve the mystery and find out what is going on. However, she quickly discovers that her only hope of finding the truth are the other residents of town, who are determined to protect and defend the people they love.

First off let me say that this movie is nothing spectacular. The cast is like the saved by the bell reunion, the monster is a guy in a bad outfit and like always; the military is useless. It would seem that the more training you have and the bigger your gun, the more likely it is that you will die if you're in a cheesy low budget horror movie. Apparently the people in the movie business have little respect for the navy seals, the marines and ninjas, who get it the worst.

2005 will go down in 'Dr.Who ' history as its most incredible year . Everything seemed to click ; a new series, new cast, a new adventure. But there were three big problems with the last episode of Series 6. The first problem was a simple one : what to do. A second problem, however, was equally simple : what to say. “I am not afraid of death, I would rather meet it head on,” Dr. Watson said in the iconic opening to the BBC’s Dr. Who. “I don’t intend to spend my time in fear.

* Minor spoilers * I just wanted to say that for anyone who likes entertaining baseball films , this is not the film that you're looking for and I really don't understand the appeal for it. I don't expect it to be a great movie, but there's certainly a lot of charm to it and I do enjoy a good sports drama. This isn't a very good baseball movie. I won't give you a plot summary. The Good The film does a good job showing baseball, a subject I've always loved, but has never really given me a reason to watch.

Watched this film with an audience of .... 5 in total ! Had a choice between Lakshya and Asambhav ... I chose Lakshya. The story is well-paced. I thought that it was good for a kids movie and it was interesting for me too ! I am sure I will come back for the second half to watch the movie. 3/11/09 4:55 PM

sapna

Hindi, English, Kannada. Kannada and Telugu subtitles, English, Malayalam and Tamil soundtrack, Tamil Dubbed and Malayalam dubbing. All the audio is English with some Indian words in Hindi and English.

"Flashdance" meets "Meatballs III" or maybe it should just be called "Meatballs IV". This is my friend Wesley's all-time favorite movie, largely because he still has a thing about J.V. cheerleaders. As someone once said: "This is fine-more than fine-but as you get older you need to branch out. Whether you want to or not, society demands it". "Gimme An F" has cinema's greatest J.V. cheerleader Mary Ann (played by Beth Miller), who looks like a sweet-faced Alicia Silverstone from before her "Clueless" days.

This movie had potential . If it had been handled differently . What it needed was a different director . I’m sure he would have made a good film. The script and the actors in the movie needed some work before it got made. We are not sure why they needed it, or how they had the funds to hire a director. We’ve heard the director of the movie was not interested in the project and it seemed like he just wanted to take a break on the movie he’s producing. It may have been due to some personal reasons.

Haines is excellent as the brash cadet who thinks West Point will really amount to something now that he has arrived. Haines displays his easy, goofy comic persona as he takes on West Point and Joan Crawford, the local beauty. Great fun for the first half. And amazingly touching after Haines's character goes too far and nearly gets shunned by fellow cadets. The new, humility-filled Haines get s alast-minute reprieve to play in the bill football game against Navy and, despite a broken arm, wins the game. Great, rousing entertainment by MGM in this Haines formula film, shows Billy at his best.

This is one of the strangest things on TV. It is set in a bizarrely underpopulated Midlands superb called Leatherbridge which seems to be the dullest place in the country. It features a bar with no visible staff or customers, a university with no students, a police station with no criminals and a doctors' surgery with more doctors than patients. The story lines are dire - every episode revolves round a bizarre medical issue acted out by a variety of brummie extras who can never actually act, and for some reason the doctor always ends up round their house solving their problem.

I saw this film at school and absolutely loved it . Based on a true story , this is an incredible film that makes you feel as if you are there , right from the first scene , you are going to get into this film . The story , directed by Tom Holland , follows two men who must deal with a situation in which their lives have been completely taken away , as they make a last ditch attempt to get back on their feet again . In this day and age , it’s a sad reality that millions of people around the world have lost their jobs .

I saw this on a boring Sunday morning just this morning. Well I was drawn to the fact that it's an outdoor movie.. I was hoping to find some nice sceneries but it the views where just limited.. They just go back and forth in the same spot all over again.. I hate it when they're using this so called hi-tech stuffs like the this Motorola blue-tooth headset they're using to eliminate the use of a walkie talkie it was just so funny.. they look like amateurs. And they where like advertising those badly designed alien-ware Laptops that could link up to a satellite to find people..

This movie won a special award at Cannes for its acting and it 's not difficult to see why . its plot is a little complicated but the suspense is high and the action is impressive . there is plenty of blood and guts , too , and you know what they can do ; they can really hurt people . and this is one of the best thriller films we have ever seen in the cinema . it starts with a pretty girl , and then it turns into a bloodbath . we meet her , she is very attractive , we can understand why the director decided to shoot this thriller in a small village .

What can I say ? ? This movie has it all ... Romance , break-ups , rich kids , punks , good looking boys , super hot girls , big boobs , but most of all it's a good time ! I saw this film a while ago. I have to say the first time it happened to me was in college, while a girl was giving me a hug from behind. She said she felt like I was the only boy on the campus. I don't remember what I said to her, because I was busy kissing her so hard.

An absolute classic of 80's scare flix. This one isn't like any other as it pits pint-size, wild-eyed, psychotic youngsters with an urge to kill against all the grown-ups in town. Bud from JUST ONE OF THE GUYS (80's gold again) plays one of the killer-kids and he's paired up with one of the little girls Jake Blues tries to purchase in the BLUES BROTHERS. There is a third blond boy, but he keeps disappearing from the movie for whatever reason. The violence is hilarious at times and also surprisingly gruesome in spots.

I am a huge fan of the Farcry Game, HUGE fan. It still holds a place in my top-10 games list of all time! The story line was new, fresh... A truly brilliant foundation to base a movie on... or so i thought...Farcry the Movie is no less than another directors attempt at cashing in on a successful game franchise (see Doom: The Movie, and many more...).The Video Game begins as the player (Jack Carver) awakes in a sea side cave after been shot off his boat by an RPG from an unknown soldier.

Whatever the producer was going for , he missed entirely . The Lone Ranger is not camp , but `` camp `` does not begin to describe the production. The acting is average for the midwest , and the script is not bad but not excellent either. I found myself wishing for a little more depth to the story . It did not seem like the writers could pull out of the quicksand with the characters . I won't spoil the movie by saying where the film goes wrong . It seems to me that most of the blame is laid on the shoulders of the filmmakers .

I received this movie as a birthday gift because all of my friends know I 'm a big fan of the Star Wars universe'. This was one of the most enjoyable movies for me and one of my favorite movies ever. I really like the storyline and the plot. The action was really nice. I do not think there is a great deal of violence or blood which I really liked. I love the characters' personalities and they really did well in every role they got. This was a lot of fun.

Ugly women-of-the-cellblock flick rakes the bottom of the midnight-movie barrel , combining pulpy sleaze with the hoariest of girls-in-the-shower clichés-and-screams. Then there's a giddy "Whoa!" from the director as the camera pans up from below. That's it, then? No, not this. That's just a fraction, but there's more-and-that's-a-whole other, a lot more, and the whole thing-the whole movie, the whole film!-is worth it. It's a fun movie and I like it, but the problem with The Cellblock is it doesn't make you laugh. Not even once.

Sadly this film lives up to about 1 % of the hype that the game created in 2004 and leaves us all with the same question - will it ever be released? For some time now, there has been speculation over the possibility of a sequel. The original game had a much lower production budget, which meant more time and more effort was put into the production of the game than was put into the making of a sequel. I can't help but think that in this situation it might be best if the game wasn't allowed to happen.

my friend and i rented this one a few nights ago. and, i must say, this is the single best movie i have ever seen. i mean, woah! "dude, we better get some brew before this joint closes" and "dude, linda's not wearin' a bra again." what poetry! woah! and it's such a wonderfuly original movie, too. i mean, you don't usually find a slasher film where every single murder is exactly the same. i mean, exactly! now that's originality.

This movie was chosen, quite frankly as a pig in a poke from our local Video store. It turned out to be quite a pig. The plot line-such as it is-was disjointed, inconsistent and predictable. The actors constantly looked embarrassed to be mouthing the poorly written lines. The only funny moment in the entire film revolved around the dangers of smoking and the inadvertant deployment of an airbag. The remainder of the film lacked the punch to amuse either of my young daughters (aged less than ten years), myself, my wife, my mother-in-law, or even the cat or the dog.

To tell you the truth, I do not speak Tamil, and I did not understand the film. My good Tamil friend, Kaneswaran Kumarswamypillai (wow, what a long name), explained every thing to me. What a great movie!!! After watching this movie, I felt I should have watched many more movies from Tollywood (Tamil Film Industry). The war scenes were amazing, camera work excellent, and plot beautiful. The actress "Simran", what a beauty. Give her an award for best looking someone.

Tyra & the rest of the modeling world needs to know that real women like myself and my daughter don't care to see all the ridiculous modeling to sell something. Weird locations, too much makeup & too much skin is not necessary. Sex does not always sell when you are selling to women. The same goes for the horse stomping runway walk that looks unnatural. People come in all shapes & sizes & they need to have that on the show. My daughter has a 36" inseam, is tall & slender & a size 5, I am more average at a size 12.

You don't have to spend much time watching this made for TV movie or series pilot or whatever it was intended to be to figure out just what lies in store. The incredibly bad musical score makes its debut from the start. Seriously, if this isn't the worst theme I've ever heard, I certainly can't remember it. While the acting talent is available here, from Jeff Bridges to Carl Betz, Vera Miles, and Sal Mineo, the writing is atrocious and the story is contrived, filled with insipid stereotypes, and an obvious ripoff from Ken Kesey.

It`s funny how instinct warns you of something . For example as soon as the company credits read Nu Image I knew instinctively I`d seen a really crap film by them somewhere before but couldn`t remember where . Nevertheless I just knew JUDGE AND JURY was going to be crap and it was . Maybe I`m psychic ?!!!! MILD SPOILERS !!! !The opening is rather violent with several people getting blown away for no more reason than being in the wrong place at the wrong time .

"Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters" is a visually stunning production that handles complex issues with evocative ease. It is based on the life of controversial Japanese author Yukio Mishima, who committed suicide in the 1970s. It is not really a biopic - at least not one in the traditional sense - but an exploration of Mishima's iconoclastic oeuvre. The film succeeds in presenting abstract concepts in an unembroidered, totally engaging manner. Paul Schrader makes you sympathize with Mishima without having to deconstruct him or his work. It doesn't quite solve the puzzle but it does make you understand it.

My wife spotted this film on the aisle at a local video store . From the cover it looked like it was made in Italy, not in England . I don’t know if I should mention it or not . I just know I am glad I saw this film because this is the film I would have watched on the big screen . You know, I can’t say that I know much about these people. I know that there were some things that the director had to do to get the film to the screen.

There are only a few movies which can be called `must see' and SHEPHERED is one of those films. In many ways it was ahead of it's time (and you can tell it was a source of inspiration for several better-known films) Copied by many, equaled by none, this truly is one great movie.The story is complex but unfolds itself as a taut yet frequently amusing thriller and highly thought provoking exploration of the nature of humanity. The story takes place in a post-apocalyptic world where people must live underground and chaos reigns.

As horror films go, "Rest Stop", could have been better in many levels. Director/writer John Shiban shows he probably had the best intentions when he started it. Unfortunately, either he was not sure as to what to do with the material, or maybe, he was under pressure to deliver a different movie from what he intended, either by the studio, or the backers. Several endings have been included in the DVD, but unfortunately, the one chosen for the finished product is probably not the best.The idea of a psycho roaming the back roads of a remote part of California presents many possibilities at first.

Well Folks , this is another stereotypic portrayla of Gay life however , the additional downside includes poor acting , uninspired and uninspired direction , and the fact that this is straight men's film . the way the story is told , the main characters are portrayed as gay and the other characters are portrayed as bisexuals who are also straight . if the story was about a group of straight people who were all gay then they wouldn't be portrayed as the main characters in the movie , so why do it the other way around ? it is just another way to portray the gay experience .

I rented a copy of this one from Netflix -- big mistake. The DVD version titled "The One-Armed Swordsmen" was produced by madmen who thought that the fighting sequences would be appreciated better pasted all together in one big chapter than as part of a consistent, sequential story. Some of the story was left in separate chapters, which you can select from the main menu, but the DVD is still a mess. Don't rent or buy it. Not that there was anything wonderful about the original story, an absurdly complicated piece of nonsense.

A very, very, very slow-moving, aimless movie about a distressed, drifting young man. Not sure who was more lost - the flat characters or the audience, nearly half of whom walked out. Attempting artiness with black & white and clever camera angles, the movie disappointed - became even more ridiculous - as the acting was poor and the plot and lines almost non-existent. Very little music or anything to speak of. The best scene in the movie was when Gerardo is trying to find a song that keeps running through his head.

If you were enjoyed by watching "Guinea Pig" - then you'll like this movie to! "Psycho: The Snuff Reels" is a nice pseudo snuff movie with lots of sex elements. Actually the effects are not so realistic like in "Guinea Pig", but its still pretty gory. "Psycho: The Snuff Reels" contains 70 minutes of sex, fetish and then torture scenes. First 20 minutes is like a normal porno movie. After that you'll see fetish sex scenes. And last one is a torture scene.

`` Tragic Hero '' is a film that is most definitely trying to emulate the classic Godfather films , focusing on a young Michael Corleone , played by Leonardo DiCaprio . While Corleone takes center stage in the film , the story is mainly about the power struggles within the crime family as it tries to get rid of a member of the Mafia in order to expand its power . The film , while not being a masterpiece , manages to create some interesting plots and character developments . It is a crime family in New Jersey . It is being run by Tony Montana , an evil man who likes to make deals .

Well every scene so perfectly presented. Never before had I seen such a movie that has meaning in almost every scene.Well while I was watching this movie I remembered watching "Amilie". Amilie is also a similar kind of movie with more fun and fantasy touch. These movies are both based on a same plot line. But both of them are Perfectly perfect in there own way and being able to create a world of their own.Red is able to provoke lots of thoughts in people about destiny and dejavu s. And I am still thinking about it.The story is great and the ending is a bit funny.

This movie was absolutely terrible . The only explanation I can think of for the good reviews it received from those that did see it, is that they couldn't get their heads around the fact that it was crap. If they had watched it with their eyes they'd see that it was not. It is difficult for me to review a movie which I had to watch twice. In the second time I had to watch it I couldn't believe I had not been able to enjoy it before, now it is one of those films which, even when watched again, I have to have in my brain.

Seriously ! You 've just got to see this movie to understand everything that is wrong with it . It's just a waste of your time, money and even time on the Internet ! I would have rated it much higher if I'd seen the first two episodes . But this is not even the story that I enjoyed watching it. If I'd have seen the first part , I would have said it was worse than the original film , and much less enjoyable . No, this is not a good movie, just as the first two episodes , but even worse .

This is one of the worst movies I've ever seen. It's supposed to be a remake or update of "The One-armed Swordsman", by Chang Cheh. The ham-fisted direction and crappy fight choreography mean that the fight scenes aren't even worth watching. The script tries desperately hard to seem serious, but is full of cliches like, "And I knew then that nothing would ever be the same again..." or "If only I'd known what a heavy price I would have to pay." Ugh! And who is that girl who plays Sing?

"Admissions" is a fine drama even though they're are some problems with the ending. Lauren Ambrose plays Evie who is trying to avoid college. To make her overworked mother not notice, she makes up poems that everybody thinks her mentally challenged sister wrote. All the acting is first-rate especially Lauren Ambrose and Amy Madigan. They both put in great performances. The climax is also very powerful. There are only two bad parts. First is the character of Stewart Worthy played by Christopher Lloyd. His part is underdeveloped. The other weakness is the ending.

A very interesting plot of the film based on the novel `` Waltz into Darkness '' of the writer Cornell Woolrich. The film itself is one of only two of Woolrich's novels to be published since his death in 1996, and the other is `` Last Night's Children. '' After his death, the film adaptation of `` Waltz Into Darkness `` became one of the best movies on the silver screen of all time, not only because Woolrich's character was a real character but because the movie was filmed in such a way that it had the most beautiful cinematography I have ever seen in my entire life.

If you want to truly experience the magic ( ? ) of Don Dohler , then check out `` Alien 's`` . This is one of my favorite films of the year so far , and the first I've tried to find on VHS. This is one of those rare movies that is really not like any other horror movie you've ever seen before. And it isn't just the plot . There's some really weird imagery and sound, as well . It's really just a strange, weird movie , that you won't understand until you watch it, but you will .

Being a former MST3k watcher , even I found this movie unwatchable . The awful attempts at humor-heck the awful characters and the awful plot . The worst performance by the worst actor ever to come out of Hollywood , the worst music in any movie ever . This movie will be a classic of its genre , if not more , then more and more of its genre . A masterpiece of bad acting , bad script , bad plot and awful plot . The movie is too bad for me to really say it any better then it already is . I found the story a bit too predictable to be a good movie .

A woman in love with her husband (he's suicidal) decides to have a baby to save his life. She's been to a fertility clinic - as has the lover she takes - so both know how artificial insemination works; but, instead of using the method thousands of people use every year around the world (the $5 turkey baster), they engage in coitus. We also are to believe that although the immigrant is in love with his fiancée, he doesn't suggest the obvious alternative to intercourse.

I consider myself to have a decent sense of humor, but this "movie" left me stunned in my chair.It's so bad that it could just not have been any worse. Not once did I laugh at the sadly attempted jokes in this movie. I have watched and enjoyed several parodies of big movies, but unfortunately this one will allways be the one I remember best - in my nightmares.The only reason anyone should want to watch this, is if they want to enter a coma for a brief period of time.This is the worst movie ever.

A good story about Rusty Parker ( Rita Hayworth ) who dreams of being on broadway which means she would never have to leave the house. She has her dreams of making a million dollars and being in the best movie ever made. But then she meets a new man named Rusty who wants to help her in the best way. They start dating but soon things turn sour when Rusty thinks he can do better. He wants Rusty to take a leap of faith in order to get what he wants. But will Rusty finally get what he wants?

This was the stupidest movie I have ever seen in my life. It is a complete waste of money and time. I went to see this movie with my friends and when the movie was over not a single person in the movie theater- not that there was a lot of people there to see this terrible movie- said "wow what a good movie." Someone actually walked out! It was absolutely terrible! It was disgusting and I hated every minute of it. My friend was putting her head in my shoulder towards the end because after the scene with Rick on the ceiling peeing, she had had enough.

There's something going on in this film directed by X-Files scribe John Shiban that has eluded me. You get that feeling as the film moves that everything is not what it seems, yet I feel the movie fails at giving you enough to go on to truly care afterward. It's about perception. There are characters the heroine Nicole(Jaimie Alexander)meets in the film that she talks to that up and vanish. This might seem like a spoiler, but it's something that really only inherits a wee bit of focus on the filmmakers' part.

I saw Heaven 's Gate on its opening week nearly twenty years ago . Tickets were sold in advance based on pre-order numbers. In the early 90's, the movie had yet to see a release date. Now, it's one of the most successful film of all time . There are few movies with such a strong, passionate, and successful fan base. Heaven 's Gate earned more money and grossed more than any other film released at the time. Even though it had a terrible ending, it still broke box office records, and made the movie theater owners rich.

I liked this movie , the second Naruto feature film . I enjoyed the one in the snow a tad better . I didn't know that the second film , which I saw , was called . I really liked the one in the snow , and I wish they would make a sequel . Well , the first film was amazing , and the second , well , I think I enjoyed the first more , it was more of an action film , but the sequel had a better feel to it . I really enjoyed both films .

I've tried watching it twice, though I haven't been able to make through either episode. For me, it's basically just not funny. I can tell where I'm suppose to laugh, but I can't. I've never seen the original, so I'm not comparing. I also love comedies, including off-the-wall comedies like Married...With Children and Family Guy, but this show just doesn't' do it for me. The jokes are lame and flat, and the acting is mostly annoying. The commercials made it look interesting, but it isn't.

Where would Hollywood have been without Fredric March as Robert Browning or Dennis Price as Lord Byron , famous lovers? Both of those men, and many others, have been described as “sex symbols in our time”, and it would certainly be interesting to find out where this was first introduced to the general public in England and America. And where was this “first”, and how do these people continue to be so important to the creative industry? Let us explore some of the early and more recent developments in a very interesting area.

A low budget may be an excuse for poor acting talent and pathetic looking fake gore. However, it is not an excuse for poor writing. It is a talent to be able to write dialog without making it sound forced and mechanical. The dialog in this movie was on par with most instructional videos shown to fast food staff in training.I also understand that one must make a few exceptions when it comes to acting talent when you only have 20 bucks to spend on it. With that being said, no serious director would have looked at these scenes and said to himself, "that was perfect".

`` Black Vengeance '' is an alternate title for `` Ying hung ho hon '' AKA `` Tragic Hero '' AKA 两人失露 采霜 健身的英雄 '' AKA 个人英雄 '' AKA 英雄的虚假 李桥沙 凤养骤

* Black Vengeance '' is an action adventure game set in an alternate timeline in which Black Vengeance is a legendary hero, the second of many legendary heroes in the video game Black Vengeance. '' It was released for the NES, Atari 2600, and Sega Genesis on July 22, 1991, in North America and in the other regions on August 26, 1991. Black Vengeance'' was published by Activision.

The Australian public and the Australian film industry are often heard to complain that there are not enough great Aussie films around, or that they are all the same.Well in this case this film is not a carbon copy of other Australian films. It is unique - it will make you laugh out-loud, it will make you cry and it will make you feel really good about yourself.The casting of this film is superb and the acting is second to none. The script and the photography (colour/light etc) is wonderful. But more important this is a great film.

I recently viewed a copy of this (under the title 'Eaten Alive') Talk about dreadful! Any movie Ed Wood ever put out looks like Oscar material compared to this laughable tosh. To be fair a couple of lines from the script will live long in the memory such as "These people (Cannibals) don't buy frozen meat from a supermarket like us, they get it fresh everyday from folk like you or me" Classic! The mad 'Jonesville' type leader out in the jungle was the best character in the film, he really did look like a nutter.

The movie is apparently based on a popular French horror novel, by Arthur Bernède, from 1927. Not that I had ever heard about it before but Belphégor has been a popular subject before for movies and mini-series. The first movie got released way back in 1927, simultaneously with the novel. Arthur Bernède was a part of a group of writers who wrote and produced films and novels simultaneously. The character Belphégor is one of his best known creations.Once upon a time Sophie Marceau was a promising new European actress who would conquer Hollywood. She has now however dropped back again to movies like this one.

If the caper genre owes a lot to Walter Huston, it also has a debt of gratitude to Jules Dassin, a man that was ahead of his times and who suffered a lot because of his blacklisting when Edward Dmytryk accused him of being a Communist. The end of his American career would have meant the end of Mr. Dassin, but moving to Europe proved he was bigger than the same people that had contributed to his Hollywood demise. "Rififi" is an elegant film in which all the right elements come together thanks to Mr. Dassin's vision.

this movie gets a 10 because there is a lot of gore in it.who cares about the plot or the acting.this is an Italian horror movie people so you know you can't expect much from the acting or the plot.everybody knows fulci took footage from other movies and added it to this one.since i never seen any of the movies that he took footage from it didn't matter to me.the Italian godfather of gore out done himself with this movie.this is one of the goriest Italian movies you will ever see.no gore hound should be without this movie in their horror movie collection.buy this movie no matter what it is a horehounds dream come true.

Okay, it features one lovely blink-and-you-miss-it-joke (when the dead are rising from their tombs, the names of the old time "horror" directors like Jacques Tournier and Jean Yarborough are featured in the tombstones) and the smashing of morally bankrupt Repu/con/rightist villains is on-target: whorish skanks preaching morals etc. But why these soldiers are anti-Republicans? Because they have gone to the war, most of them should be Republicans, right? Why they don't go to killing the enemies who killed them or something? Why they ALL want to vote against the Republicans? Why this story has made of a movie?

There are bad movies and then there are movies which are even worst. Saw is just that.The movie is simply bad on all points. The plot, the acting, the camera work, the music and everything else is absolutely terrible and I cannot begin to comprehend how such trash made it to the big screen.The simple fact is that Saw is riddled with plot holes. The beginning is enticing and leaves much to be expected but it does not hold up and the plot becomes absolutely ridiculous and absurd. The film is not creative and will not leave you with a single bit of credibility.

Went with some friends and one of my friends mom , thinking it would be a good way to start off the year, and then it just got worse than we thought. It started off great, we were in a local park and saw a young boy and his dog walking and laughing. My friend and I were chatting up about what he had been up to the past couple of days and my friend said he was going to go for a swim in that lake by the lake. I was sitting on a bench, enjoying the warm sun, and watching my friend make his move.

I had a bad feeling ten seconds into the film as a pair of overworked tumbleweeds ( probably left over from the Christmas holiday) started to make their way down the side of the hill, but it was all good as I watched the film and was pleasantly surprised by the strength of the performances. The set is really well done, as is the sound design, and a few shots really capture the majesty and atmosphere of the place. The sound and the sound effects have been designed to complement the performances perfectly.

We picked this up as a part of a Brentwood set, under the title "The Broken Skull." Shot directly onto video, with widely varying sound and lighting quality, this movie winds up with a hyperactive quality that may inspire the viewer to feelings of nervousness, confusion and irritability - and not in a good, "Evil Dead" kind of way.Without going into spoilers, what appears at first to be a simple revenge ghost story becomes increasingly convoluted and bizarre. While there are some interesting ideas here, the overall effect is likely to leave you scratching your head and saying "hunh?

Perhaps if only to laugh at the way my favorite of Jane Austen 's works has been portrayed . Perhaps to celebrate all that I have achieved in this blog . Monday, June 25, 2005

My favorite thing about New Jersey

It's my favorite place to live in America . When I was first moving here from Texas, I was very impressed with all the wonderful places in New Jersey . The beaches, the golf course I have been told, you can golf on . But my favorite thing I've noticed is that New Jersey has the most diverse population of any place in the nation .

I just got back from `` AGS '' . After seeing it , I 'm convinced that no matter how bad I felt about it , I really shouldn 't give a damn. I can't say it was perfect, but it's not a total rip off , and not a total flop. It is still a movie that should be seen in theaters for it to truly be seen in theaters . That said , it is still one of my favorites of this year and one of my all-time favorites. I can't wait for the second season .

After watching Stop-Loss, I find myself against disappointed in Hollywood for making such a stinker. Gone are the days of glory of the films of the 1940's that made one proud to be an American, fighting the evilness that desires conquest abroad and death at home. What we are left with is dribble frothing at the mouth of rabid anti-Bush radicals. The story tells of three young men who return home from the war. One descends into out-of-control madness, culminating in his death. The main protagonist deserts his country at a time of war, and destroys his best friends relationship with his fiancé at the same time.

Yeah great cult TV series. Great atmosphere, top script and good performances make this a class A candidate for DVD release. This is a seminal tour de force of Australian TV history and has that unforgettable groovy period piece soundtrack with Doug Parkinson's gravel and phlegm voice spewing 70's Australiana all over your cathode ray box as a amazingly long camera zoom out reveals the religion of the open road in all its Antipodean glory. This is a memento from another and not too distant era, and has the proud stamp of the land mighty Down Under from start to finish in all its raw freedom and gritty grandeur.

This movie is absolutely horrible! I thought because it had good actors in it like Gabrielle Union, Hill Harper, and of course the infamous Billy D. Williams. The movie is long, and drags on with a documentary style of showing Gabrielle Union, who has died in the movie, talking about her family; which by the way is a confusing family because you never know who's who, and who's related to who. I would not recommend this movie to anyone, and I wish I could take it back where I got it from.

"Mararía" really disappointed me. I can't consider it as a bad movie, but the development just seemed too rushed and non-believable for it to evoke any emotions. Dr. Fermín displays some unprecedented bizarre behaviour out of a passion that one can't really understand where it was born from. I mean, how many times does he ever have a conversation with Mararía?? Maybe once? Also, Mararía never appeared to be a real character, instead more like a film stereotype that just needed to be in the movie (...or else another title was needed?).

This movie seems as if someone had a cute idea for a movie, thought of two or three funny possibilities, hired a good cast, then turned the whole thing over to a really bad screenwriter and even worse director. The director filmed a screwball romantic comedy as if it were a dark, artsy film---weird camera angles, blue filtered shots, lingering, close up looks at raindrops. Steve Zahn was good, as always. Ben Affleck was charming, sweet, almost shy; he was perfect for a romantic comedy.

A brash, self-centered Army cadet arrives at WEST POINT with a dangerous wise guy attitude towards the Corps.In a role obviously tailor-made for him, William Haines shines in this highly enjoyable tale of honor & friendship. A grade-A scene stealer, Haines during the first half of the film is up to his usual Silly Billy behavior, which under normal circumstances should have gotten him confined to the guardhouse. The last half, however, becomes very serious, leading up to Haines' moral redemption and giving him a fine opportunity to exhibit his acting talents.

I am very impressed by the reviews I've read of this film - generally well-read, thoughtful and informed - obviously by people who like and think hard about films. I couldn't add a thing to the excellent reviewing job that IMDb members have already done. If I may, I'd like to correct a small but widespread misunderstanding that appears in many of the reviews: Mr Baseball was American and behaved in an ugly fashion but he was NOT an Ugly American. The original Ugly American was Homer Atkins, one of the heroes of the eponymous 1958 novel by Burdick and Lederer, and the exact opposite of Mr Baseball.

I was lucky enough for this film to come on TCM , so I had the opportunity to see it. The director has a reputation for not being able to do his own voice, so I'm sure he's worked with the actors a bit on the film to get what he needs from them (I can only imagine he's had a few conversations with the actors). The acting isn't great, which is to be expected for a film of this magnitude, but they were the best I've seen all year, which makes me glad I saw it.

Acting 10, Script 1. "Hurlyburly" is from that unfortunate postmodern school of theatre that has declared anything resembling a story or plot is forbidden. While people may get away with this on stage, on film it becomes deadly -- or at least deadly dull. We're left with a bunch of great actors spouting dialogue that, while brilliantly written, adds up to nothing. Even worse, every character speaks with the same voice despite their backgrounds. The only attempt to differentiate is to have teen-waif Anna Paquin use the word "ain't.

There are movies that are so bad , they 're good . Then there 's movies like Rest Stop that are good but the plot is bad , which makes them good ? The end of the day is when we can tell you which movie was good, which was bad and which was somewhere in between . But for this week , we've got a list that tells you which movie was the best and which was the worst . I mean , if you know which movies are the best you can use them , right ? Well , let 's just take a look .

This is simply a good ole fashioned western .. not overly complex or long . It does n't deceive itself as to who or what they are, but is still quite entertaining in its own right. I would recommend it . I've seen a few others before that are quite good too . I'd definitely recommend the first one as far as entertainment value . If it's not too far, I think I'd like to give a shot to the second . I'd have to admit I was a little apprehensive about it at first , but its a good one for the money .

UK-born Australian helmer Alex Frayne calls for attention with his strange , necessitating a meticulous read , visually stunning Modern Australian

The title of the film is Strange. As someone born and bred in Melbourne, Australia, this is an extraordinary film, an extraordinary film. It is also a film that demands a detailed, meticulous reading and is a film that demands a critical rewatch. We talk to the filmmakers themselves about what they mean by Strange and why, and also about what is most interesting about the film and what we can expect.

When the circus comes to town and places the lion 's cage directly over Bugs Bunny 's home , Bugs is not happy. Bugs is angry at the thought that he is not invited to the zoo to play with the animals. At first he thinks that he is being treated like a freak, a freak that is not deserving of the big circus. However, after he learns about the life of the circus and the importance of the life, his anger is transformed into joy. "I think you'll like it here. Don't you?"

I saw this film via one of the actors' agents, and it surely conforms with a great deal that comes out of Sth. Australia in terms of the overall *tone,* which is rightly dark and moody.I thought the little boy in the film was excellent. Mostly kid actors are *hammed up* and embarrassing but not in this case. He was really very good. In terms of the *surrealism* thingy mentioned by jingo, well, I just think this film is plain 'weird.' It's a real weirdo film, with weirdo locations, storyline, weird stuff going on the whole time.

I've been trying to write a plot summary for several minutes now and can't seem to do it. But with a movie as bad as Night of the Blood Beast the plot hardly matters. An astronaut crash lands and is believed dead. His body later reanimates, but is found to be carrying the embryos of some strange alien life-form. But how did they get there? And where's the alien that implanted the strange creatures in Maj. John Corcoran's body? IMDb lists the runtime for Night of the Blood Beast at 62 minutes. Is that right? 62 minutes?

In fact it was awful . The main chick in it who gets topless was obviously sleeping with the director . I didn’t even realise that until afterwards. She was always in his face , making it hard for him to direct. Then again , I think this is actually a very good scene . It’s not like she was just doing it in the hope of getting an easy film deal or something. She’s actually very good looking and very talented . She is a talented actress and it’s great that her talent was noticed and rewarded.

The film begins in Latvia just after WWI . Being a history teacher , I knew that multinational troops occupied my country. As it is hard to imagine it in our country, I was fascinated to see it happening. After watching this movie for the first time I have been inspired to write my personal story. My personal story tells about my time in Riga. I hope you enjoy reading my story. Thank you so much for your visit and comments. I had a dream of being a nurse . When I was little I used to dream about nursing .

This one 's as cheesy as they come  the concept of a massive and indestructible extraterrestrial bird is already a classic, and the whole film is chock-full of CGI and special effects  so you really have to go back to the basics before you can really understand what you're watching. But what is it about the bird and the alien that makes you fall in love with it? What does it mean to be so powerful, so terrifying, so mysterious  and, of course, so beautiful? Well, to start, it just means you should probably not sleep in the dark.

Leslie Carbaga 's excellent book on the Fleishers tells the whole story of the Fleischer 's big move of their new camera from 35mm to 20mm, in which they also moved from black and white to full colour. This move was made for two very simple reasons: first to make more money, second to use the full power of a camera that had only been available for half a century. And it paid off in a way, as you can read about in the book. Now, this was no easy task.

Just finished watching 2FTM . The trailers intrigued me so much I actually went to see it on opening weekend. So much of that film's success is due to the fact that it was made with a cast that not only wanted to play, but also were excited about playing them. I'm not sure about the movie itself being as entertaining as the trailer says, but I loved it nevertheless. The movie centers around the lives of five high school seniors as they embark on a year of internships at the world's biggest advertising agency.

I've seen various Hamlets, and I've taught the play. As I watch Jacobi, I'm tempted to think that he's every bit as intelligent as Hamlet himself, so alive is he to every nuance of this character's wit. He deepens, rather than solves, every puzzle regarding Hamlet's character. He illuminates line after line, word after word, shining light into this sparkling mind. At the same time, however, we cringe at the horror Hamlet feels at his betrayal--far more than with any other actor--because Jacobi feels the pain more profoundly than anyone else.

This film is bad . Not so bad it is good . Just bad . It is however hilariously bad. Not in a way to make you think “what’s worse?” or think “how are they doing this” but because it is a complete waste of your money to watch. There is not even an attempt to make this into an action movie. If there had been some attempt it probably would have been better and more entertaining. The only thing you are going to be seeing is “what happened to the people they let off the hook”.

The final part of Kieslowski 's trilogy based on the colors of the French flag finds the director at peace with himself. For this installment, he concentrates on what is probably the most difficult thing he has done, and that is finding the right story for a story based on the French flag. Kieslowski 's trilogy will, of course, be discussed at Cannes, and we can safely predict that it will go on to become one of the most talked about works of the festival. The first thing you may notice about this movie is that it is a French film.

I 'll give it a two because it has a lot of music , otherwise it would be a one.I think the game would have been better if they had made it like in the original games. It's not really a challenge at all.But i liked this game, because it made me want to play some more action games again and i got more enjoyment from it.Well, if you like games with lots of songs in them , then this is one of the games that will suit your needs.Well, if you like shooters like the original ones, it is worth checking this out.

I didn't really HATE Mirrormask. I just really wanted more from a movie than pretty visuals. The movie begins with a young girl named Helana who works in a circus. But while other children (supposedly) want to run away to the circus she only wants to run away FROM the circus. During a heated argument with her mother, Helana wishes she would drop dead. Bad move. The mother gets ill with...something (presumably cancer) and needs surgery. On the night before surgery she dreams she travels to a wonderful world composed of her her dreams and nightmares where she "finds herself".

Like classic Hollywood musicals, the plot is just an excuse. A must see for those interested in French music hall (including a song by Édith Piaf) and for the wonderful 10 plus minute cancan finale. The dancing in the film is not at all like what usually passes for cancan.Some might object to the Technicolor costumes and the bright lighting, but it gives you a clear view of some grand costumes and sets.Consider it Jean Renoir's love letter to the Paris he grew up in. Certainly the Jean Renoir film for people who don't like his serious films or who only like his Hollywood productions.

Honestly, this is a very funny movie if you are looking for bad acting (Heather Graham could never live this down... it has three titles for a reason- to protect the guilty! ), beautifully bad dialog ("Do you like... ribs? "), and a plot only a mother could approve, this is your Friday night entertainment! My roommate rented this under the title "Terrified" because he liked Heather Graham, but terrified is what we felt after the final credits. Not because the movie is scary, but because somebody actually paid money to make this turd on a movie reel.Horrible movie.

This wonderful movie captures so many elements of what makes a family comedy funny , entertaining , sweet and memorable, this movie would be a wonderful film to watch for people of all age groups as well as children that love a good comedy movie. The main character of the movie is played by Christopher Walken , and he plays it exactly like he should. Walken is a fantastic actor and I am sure there will be many people to thank for watching this movie for their entertainment, it is for this reason why I would strongly suggest this movie for your consideration.

This film tells the true story of escaped black slaves who found their own mountain-top commune as free men in 17th-century Brazil. The story is interesting and edifying. However, this film -- as a film -- is terrible.The soundtrack is not period music or tribal music. It is Afro-Brazilian pop music from the early 1980s. Battle scenes are fought to the sounds of cheesy pop rhythms best left to the disco or bad cops dramas. Admittedly, the lyrics are folk-ish tales of the slaves' heroism. The special effects are absurd. Rather than invoke the mysticism of African religion and atavistic beliefs, they merely make the film look cheap.

If you love Chan-wook Park , you know what to expect . His films are brutal , poetic , tragic and a feast for fans of Korean Cinema. The latest film from Park is “Chun-ho” (2011) which will be opening in cinemas on Friday, May 22, 2011. “Chun-ho” was Park’s return to Hongdae after several years spent working overseas. Park and his co-director, Kim Jae-yoon, decided to film in Korea , with Park and Kim in charge of shooting the entire film , with the aid of Korean cinematographer and cinematographer Hwang Kyung-hee.

It starts quite good , but after a while you start to expect more from this film than you are receiving. The first half is just alright . The second half is very good, it’s a lot better than what you have been led to believe. There have been several critics who have commented on the fact that the movie is a sequel. There is no doubt that a movie like this should have a sequel, but it seems like it’s never been done. I just think it’s an interesting approach to a sequel.

This is an adaptation of an Edith Wharton work , whose writing is amazing . Sadly , this movie never really got a chance in theaters, as it never got good reviews. The only reason I can remember why it got a second life in my brain was because it was shown by a PBS affiliate in a class in the high school I went to that year. So, yeah, I watched it , but not until now. The movie has a lot of symbolism in it , and a few of them I already explained, so I'm not going through all of that again.

Dolemite may not have been the first black exploitation flick to come along but it certainly is one of the best. It is a pivotal film in the Black Exploitation genre as where it caused a dramatic shift between the films that came before it in contrast to the films that came after it. It wasn't necessarily a poignant or moving film about black culture and it's fight to overcome issues like racism or anything as important as that, but it was the story of one bad-assed dude fighting "whitey" with his army of hot kung-fu mama's.

I occasionally let my kids watch this garbage so they will understand just how pathetic the show 's `` contestants really are, if you ask me, and why it takes so long to see them being treated like such. I even have to watch it twice just to see what the kids are saying about them. While I have a hard time watching it with them in the next room, because it's so boring for me, when they are on the television, I can't help myself from tuning in when they do something really interesting.

One of Chaplin 's longest films up to that point , Burlesque on Carmen is a clever and surprisingly complex study of sexuality, sexuality and sexuality's role in film making (it's also fun, funny and entertaining in its own right). The title refers to a sex scene, but more importantly, Burlesque is a film that focuses on sexual freedom. From the very outset of the film there is a definite emphasis on sexuality, even though we don't see any of the participants in the scene itself and the film itself is quite explicit in its sexual content.

Sorry for all you guys that are not family with the Lynches.My sister in law asked me how you can make just a disturbing movie. I told her that if the daughter and her father would not do these movie, they would have instead to go around and kill and cut people in pieces.After every Lnych movie I tell myself, again one and a half hour lost of my life. But next time I will check the director's or producers name.So, you don't want to be angry at yourself and loose time, don't watch it.

Spend your time any other way, even housework is better than this movie. The jokes aren't funny, the fun rhymes that are Dr. Seus aren't there. A very lousy way to waste an evening. My kids 4-16 laughed a little at the beginning the younger ones got bored with it and left to play Barbies and the older ones left to play ps2 and surf the net. My wife left and did dishes. So I finished it alone. It was the worst "kids" movie I have seen.

I love this show . I watched every episode last year . I bought the DVDs . And I tune into the new episode now. It makes me so happy to see so much love on the new show. I have watched the new episode many times . This is the best show to ever come out . It's so great to watch such a big change from the last episode. I love it and I hope they keep it going.. I am happy for them, but I'm hoping that it won't be this long before they renew it.

this movie is honestly the worst piece of rubbish i have ever seen . this is slow , plot less and the acting and special effects are terrible ! i can't wait to go back and see this movie for the second time . the first time i watched it was because of this and i saw it was a horrible piece of rubbish ! i watched it with my family and they laughed and laughed and laughed every single frame ! i'm just sick to my stomach with this film ! this is bad ! this movie was bad .

This film is one of my favorite Christmas classics . Sure , it 's fluff , it 's not `` the most important movie of the century " , but it's a great film . It is not a story , it is not a movie , but the story is the story of a group of high school kids . The kids are in love , but their parents are always away and they feel like they have to wait on their love , which in the end they will not get . And then the movie takes a turn for the worse , and things become more than they should have been .

For all those bewildered by the length and pace of this film ( `` like , why does he show it all? ``), I have a simple answer: because it is. There are no slow-witted filmmakers in this family; there’s no director who has to rush his work. He’s patient with every minute and tries to create a movie that the audience can appreciate and be proud of. He is the family's patriarch, a loving husband, father, brother and son, and I have no doubt this will be their last movie together.

This is one of the most stupid and worthless movies ever . It really does not qualify for movie status as far as any of my friends and I know. It's also a movie about a guy who falls for a female stripper (not the actual girl) and a stripper who falls for a guy, and both of their stories line up with each other. The stripper who fell for the striper, I feel is the best part, but you will not see that in the movie . I'm not saying that it was a bad movie .

Gordon Scott with his well coiffed hair, hourglass figure and weird pidgin English has to be the worst of all the Tarzans. As for the other actors in this mess, they're on a par with any 4th grade elementary school drama class. I've seen Used Car Dealers in TV commercials who can act better. They make Clayton Moore look like Laurence Olivier! And where does Jane (the dull Eve Brent) get her lipstick and eyebrow pencils in the jungle? I realize these were made for kids but Wow! The plot line seemed OK but the director should have required more from his actors.

A special unit of four police detectives are dispensing justice in their own unique way in 1950s Los Angeles . when it is said that police work can sometimes be as hard and brutal as it's always been. as the name suggests it is the task of an elite unit of four cops to deal with gangs, violence and drug trafficking. these four detectives were recruited to work for the LAPD in 1950s LA . but in the end all four cops are out of a job for some time. but as one of them points out, they can still work out their differences .

One Life Stand is an accomplished piece of film making which has n't been given the credit it deserves . the documentary, based on the book 'Lone Survivor' by James O'Bryan, is set against the bleak backdrop of South Korea in the 1980s. the film is made from the viewpoint of the young South Koreans who were conscripted into the South Korean army in the late '80s to fight against the communist North, who were supported by North Korean aid. the film shows how their plight was dealt with. there is much more information and background on this film and more can be found on the web site .

This was one of the few Norwegian movies I actually looked forward too see . It started of as a really decent thriller, but then it veers away from that and becomes rather silly and silly. The movie begins with the main character being kidnapped by aliens and brought to Earth, where he discovers a new planet and the ability to fly to it. The next thing that happens is when his sister dies and he travels to the planet that killed his sister, where he finds two children that have been taken into slavery.

Not for those adrenaline maniacs etc It's a good movie, looking at after war, psychical problem, from the other point of view. Emilio Estevez is great as a young man, haunted by the demons of Vietnam war, causing problem in family. Marin Sheen is also good as a conservative father.It all comes down to the problem how to deal with the past, with whomEmilion Estevez's character can't seem to deal, and Martin Sheen's character don't want do deal with.Protective mother looks at this problem with warm , and open heart but with her mind closed for the obvious reasons.

I mostly rented this movie to see Shannon Elizabeth. She played well in this movie, but the plot sucked. The movie wasn't really about anything just about trying to stay single after making a pact when one of Jerry O' Connell's friends gets married. The other friends put together this money and who's ever last to get married get's the money ($10,000) from all his friends. Anyway the movie just try to follow through by making no since and trying to make it more funny then making since. I'm glad I only paid .50 for this movie.

I'm an animator myself and an all around buff of the medium so when I saw this movie in a $5 bin I figured it was worth a shot to add to my collection. While I never regret having a new addition to my animation library this film was definitely disappointing.The premise has enough potential. A penguin named Hubie finds the perfect pebble to give to the girl he loves as the penguin equivalent to an engagement ring but before he can give it to her, he's cast out by an evil rival and lost at sea.

11 years after this film was released only 5 people have reviewed it here on IMDb. There is a reason for this utter lack of interest in Across the Moon. It is coherent, but lacks all cinematic virtue. See this film for examples of terrible production in all respects. The opening credits for instance are white letters rising mechanically from a red background. The ending features Michael McKean staring out a prison window saying "There's lots of mysteries out there." followed by a clip montage/music video of all the uplifting moments in the tragically bad movie. Julinana Hatfield.

Hilary was great as julie, and Pat was once again magnificent as Mr. Miyagi, but there should have been more references towards the other three movies! I mean, come on! First off, Where's Daniel!? Miyagi makes a very brief mention of him and that's it. Daniel was his best friend and should've at least made an appearance in the movie. He could've helped Miyagi train Julie-San! On the flip side, the music stayed true to the movie though, with a little more instrumentation(Fretless Bass)to accompany the wonderfully played Pan-Flute!

Christopher Nolan's first feature film wowed critics who saw it when it first came out. Shot on a micro budget of $6,000 this is a student film with real class. The film is shot in black and white, and features people who you assume are friends of Nolan's appearing in the movie. This is not to say they are bad actors because they are quite good. You could see Jeremy Theobald and Alex Haw appearing in other projects but unfortunately they haven't since this was made 6 years ago.Nolan's thriller, much like Memento, does not play chronologically, it shifts the scenes around much like Pulp Fiction.

One of my all-time favourite movies. Nothing can beat watching this movie for the first time. If I could go back in time and erase my memory or suffer from momentary amnesia I would so I could enjoy this movie as much as I did that very first time. It's still enjoyable second and third times round but I found myself appreciating the humour more as the shocks and thrills weren't unexpected. If you want a see a film that you truly won't be able to predict the ending of then I highly recommend this film.

Bad , bad , movie , so bad it is worth watching . As long as you watch this movie , I'm sure you will be shocked . As you can see this is an American movie but this one is very good as well. The music and sound effects are top notch and the cast is just amazing. The story will keep you on the edge of your seat until the end when this one is just too good to be true . I hope you will agree that this is a must watch movie.

I watched the first episode and I found it to be a very wooden performance.I have watched the original from the start and found it to be of the highest quality and the performances by the actors were top-class. While I hold its predecessor , `` Fast Times At Ridgemont High , '' as a standard to which other novels, plays, and movies are compared, I don't agree that this book and the book's predecessor are any better than any other. That's why I wrote a book-length commentary, called " A Critic's Review : Fast Times At Ridgemont High : The Story Behind The Novel" , which includes a full-length review and discussion of each novel and movie (with a section on the movie of course) to compare the writing and writing styles and overall artistic merits of each.

Dolemite is awesome. Rudy Ray Moore's rhymin kung fu pimp with horrible choreographed action sequences is about as close as you can get to becoming a spoof of a genre without actually being spoof. Having seen only once and in the dawn hours , I ca n't seem to forget this haunting film . It is not a bad film . . . not at all . . . a little slow , perhaps . . . but still haunting . . . a bit like the haunting of an abandoned house . . . it is just the way that it seems . . . an abandoned home . . . that you see , when the night falls and you have left your house . . . , and your wife has not returned . . . that it is no longer an abandoned house .

Don't Look in the basement is actually a very clever and well thought out exploitation flick that gets a bad rap because of its cheap quality and bad acting. Sure, it's not a masterpiece by anyone's standards but it is a very fun little B-film with a lot to offer and even a lot of creepy scenes that will stay in your head.As I said, the acting could have been a lot better but that's the case with most exploitation so I can't really complain. The story is clever and has some great plot twists that will keep you guessing.

Ed (Kel Mitchell) is a teenager who lives for his job at Good Burger, a small but friendly neighborhood hamburger stand, while his buddy Dexter (Kennan Thompson) also works there, but lack Ed's single-minded devotion to his job he's there because he accidentally destroyed the car of his teacher Mr. Wheat (Sinbad) and has to raise money to pay the damages. When Mondo Burger, a mammoth fast-foot chain, opens across the street, it looks like Good Burger is history, until Ed formulates a secret sauce that brings hundreds of new customers to their door.

Mean spirited , and down right degrading adaptation to the classic children 's tale not only lacks the charm of the original, it is an outright insult to its fans, as no-one is going to believe that this is actually what they grew up with, and if they were, this would not be an accurate portrayal. In fact when you see these movies, they should be taken at their own face value, but this is one thing that is missing in all of them, in fact they are even worse in the first two.

All the pro comments about this movie claim that the movie is balanced. That is their main justification to give a high rate to the movie. But a movie is not balanced when the main perpetrator analyzed is given the last world in every single subject. The director herself admitted to this at the first San Francisco film festival showing. She justified it by saying that she couldn't waste the chance of having access to Fujimori. That might be true but by showing so much of Fujimori's take on the issues makes the movie clearly pro-Fujimori and unbalanced.

I loved it . In fact , I watched it over and over and over , and I could watch it all night , and the next day , and the days after that ,and the day after . I loved this movie . My daughter is 3 1/2 and a country girl at heart . There are not too many movies geared at girls , and this film is special for me . Let me begin by saying that I had been eagerly anticipating this film's release for awhile. After finally getting the chance to see it last night, I'm sorry to say that I was incredibly disappointed. It's hard to imagine a film that could make last fall's "Exorcist: The Beginning" look good, but "Dominion" does just that. No wait...it makes it look like a GREAT film. Perhaps I got myself too excited about this movie, and that contributed to the let down.

There is no way to avoid a comparison between The Cat in the Hat and The Grinch Who Stole Christmas but there is no way to avoid it. We all have seen it happen before. I’ve been there myself and even I can relate. When you think of all the toys, the toys at the end of the day, that seem to get put down, you know what you are going to see and it is not so much about the toys. It is not the toys that make a toy a toy. It is about the company and what it can do as a company.

I was very excited to see Rock Star because I am a big fan of Mark Wahlberg 's . I had to try it. The movie was a little slow paced but it is really good and there is a great voice for the voice actors too. The song was great too! The song has a cool tempo and it has a great ending! There is also a very good special effects for it. I will definitely buy this song on iTunes! Overall it is worth buying and you can listen to it on the iPod. You can also buy the album for free!

Mickey Rourke is enjoying a renaissance at the moment... and fair play to him. I always liked his image and his acting ability in such fare as Angel Heart and Johnny Handsome. You know what you are going to get with Rourke - mean, moody, dirty. But this film gives you much more - and you don't want most of it.First and foremost - this whole thing just doesn't make sense. Rourke is a hardened IRA killer who after killing a bus-load of schoolchildren flees Ireland for London. He is on the run from the cops and from his own Army comrades.

Computer savvy John Light (as John Elias) goes from Stanford drop-out to successful young Dotcom-era tycoon. But, Mr. Light's sneering success could be short-lived, with partners like ambitious Jeffrey Donovan (as Robert Jennings). Mr. Donovan used to bed down with Light's girlfriend, Megan Dodds (as Lisa Forrester). Donovan wants Light to know that binge drinking and casual sex don't have to end in college. After reading a naughty Internet sex session, Ms. Dodds shines Light on. He may lose is "Digital Dreams" Internet empire, too!

This movie was Flippin Awful .... I wanted those hours of my life back . For god 's sake , I'll never make another movie like this again. You can bet your ass that if it happened again , I'd kill it with my bare hands. Not because I was trying to hurt anyone ... but because I was just having so much fun playing with you all. But, I guess I have to say that I'm going to give this one to my brother , he was so sweet . Not to mention he is the only one that saw this .

I really couldn't get into this movie. The plot is some old woman has been torturing someone so long that he is deformed. She dies and he is left in the basement to starve. Months must pass and a family moves in. The daughter is blind because of an accident caused by the father. Well anyway this guy in the basement, who for all rights should be long dead is still around. He eats a cat and now is superhuman. He now wants to eat people and have sex. And when a hooker dies father gets the blame.

Underwoods goofy story about a young man(Arquette) who convinces his friends that they should kidnap Frank Sinatra Jr. (Nicholas). The film is written ridiculously, direction is odd, dialogues are out of place and scrambled, the actors didn't do it much justice either, Arquette is annoying throughout, Ian Nicholas was nonexistent, Macy was decent, but only because hes a pretty good actor and probably just tried his best not to come out of this project with a totally embarrassing performance, he was at least tolerable.

As a word of explanation, Disney's "The Kid" has absolutely nothing in common with the Charlie Chaplin 1921 classic of the same name. What we do have is a pleasant enough, though unbelievable, feel good family comedy as only the folks at Disney can provide. Bruce Willis, in a change of pace, plays a self-centered stuffed shirt of an "Image Consultant". He degrades, not only his clients, but those close to him as well. You know that he is going to have to change before the final credits.

I found it almost impossible to empathize with Ricci 's character in this film . If she was supposed to have had a heart, he could not help but have a broken heart . . . not that I have a problem with a broken heart in the first place. What I find so sad and painful about this film is its lack of subtlety. I don't have any complaints about the story as it unfolds, though . . . it's an interesting one, and I do really feel for Ricci in the scenes she is forced to act in.

Dreadful, stupidly inane film dealing with corruption at the Louisiana Purchase Lumber Company.Everyone in the state of Louisiana seems to be corrupt and inept. A member of the college's English Department can only sign his name with an X.When it appears that a straight laced Senator (Victor Moore) is coming to the state to investigate, everyone there tries to blame the innocent but foolish Bob Hope character.Is it any wonder that Vera Zorina did not get the part of Maria in 1943's "For Whom the Bell Tolls? "Naturally, the corrupt officials along with Hope try to show pictures of Zorina with Moore so as to ruin him politically.

The subject matter was good, direction was OK. Mohanlal was efficient in his role as a Major. The acting of the supporting actors was amateurish at best. The casting director and director should be held responsible for this debacle. Hawaldar Jai was terrible, he stood out like a sore thumb with his poor histrionics. He did not look the part nor did he move like a soldier. There was a scene where a satellite feed was required of the skirmish with the militants and they were showing it from a camera angle.
