An hulking alien beastie crash-lands on Earth and soon wrecks havoc upon the populace first using his laser ray gun to blast people to bits, and then using his massive strength to destroy buildings and destroy entire cities. With only a few weeks left before he’s forced to leave the planet, he makes the decision to return to his own planet to continue his attack upon humanity. He also wants his son to succeed in life and take his place within the government so that he can rule over the world from his throne of power.

My two daughters ( ages 11 and 13 ) and I were lucky enough to see a screening of this film a few days ago. Our girls were the ones who wanted to buy it and couldn’t find it elsewhere. They got the tickets for $9 each and we paid $10 each. On a whim we gave the kids $5 each as a gift, and that was that. The movie is pretty, and I love the story, and how it was made. It’s an entertaining and funny movie (I don’t mind a comedy).

Rabbit Fever is a mockumentary collection of sketches , each one of them focussing on a female personal device that is in desperate need of a repair, either by itself or with someone. In the beginning of the collection, a character is sitting on her sofa, wearing a night-dress and holding a glass filled with milk. It’s cold, and there is a film of dust on her hands, as well as a trace of saliva on her lips. In the distance, a woman is walking across the street. She wears a night-dress, and she is on the verge of a heart attack.

Frank Sinatra did so many excellent things in the world of entertainment that it 's hard to single one out." "When you're in a business like this there are so many other things to think about besides talent." "There was the music." "He was also very famous for his dancing." "But that's just one element of a man's career." "So you have to start thinking about the people that come behind you." "There's the manager." "And the band." "And the people that come behind you."

I went to see this on the strength of Albert Finney alone . He 's one of my favorite actors. He's a wonderful guy and a wonderful performer . I feel very safe with him , and when he was in the cast , he was so wonderful , and when he wasn't , it was sad . I've always wanted to work with him again . I always want to see him in something more , like I did with him , I went to see him , and now I'm seeing him .

Well I'm not the world's biggest Sondheim fan, so although I have the cast album and I've listened to it a few times I've never actually seen this show performed and I haven't seen the Tim Burton movie version either. I felt like I wanted to see something more faithful before I see the Burton one and give it a chance just as a movie. This version isn't a movie at all, it's a filmed play with some of the original members of the cast, including most importantly Angela Lansbury's performance as Nellie Lovett.

So I caught this one afternoon as `` What Lies Above '' and actually watched it because the beginning was so awesome. But then I saw it again on the big screen (and I've seen it on TV before, too), and I remember I kept wondering, is it worth it to get it on VHS? If so, why didn't we just rent it, or buy it? Anyway, so when I saw the trailer for the movie last night, I immediately checked it out. And it was awesome!

Emilio Estevez actually directed a good movie--who woulda thought? I sat through two previous films Estevez directed--"Wisdom" (with then girlfriend Demi Moore) and "Men at Work" (with brother Charlie Sheen). They are lousy films---badly acted, directed, stupid and offensive. Estevez is a good actor but lousy as a director. I turned this on in pure curiousity--it has a great cast and I had nothing else to do. Damned if it didn't pull me in.It concerns Estevez coming home from Vietnam permanently scarred by what happened over there.

CAUTION SPOILER : At the end of the movie it is announced that the bridge collapsed just a few days ago. It seems that the bridge was being rebuilt by the same team who took a trip to Mars to make it so they can return to Earth and take some more pictures of the ruins of the city. A couple of weeks after the collapse we find out there is a new president. I’m unsure if this is going to be a new president of the world but I’m guessing so.

I must admit I was n't expecting much on this movie . I was surprised I truly enjoyed it as a whole . I was expecting a lot more from a movie this size, but it actually turned out better in my eyes. I don't even really think this is as good of an ending as I thought it would be , but at this rate , I could be the one to convince the producers that this is worth to see a sequel . It's a must see for the horror fans . I will be waiting for it to come to the cinemas and see what everyone thinks of it .

And obviously I didn't see it! But looking at the cast and seeing that Doug Masters is back from the dead, I know now to avoid this like the plague! I hate it when Hollywood, producers, writers, directors or all of the above think that audiences are stupid that they're not going to catch continuity errors. A supposedly dead Doug Masters returning is a big giant one, won't you say?And I can't believe that someone like Louis Gossett, Jr. would return for something like that.Did Jason Gedrick really decline this?

If you want to waste a small portion of your life sit in front of this predictable zombie film. It fails at the first post by not being scary OR funny. It is a dull grey movie that I guess went straight to video. Hammy and tongue in cheek acting leave a sour taste in the mouth. If you want to watch a poor but still watchable recent zombie film watch Diary of the Dead. Poor special effects, school level script. Zombie films work if they have a moral point or even a political point . This movie has nothing, there is no worthy point that zombification underscores.

It 's hard to work up any enthusiasm for this awful cartoon-like epic that for some reason has become a huge hit in the past few weeks. I've seen a few episodes of this series, and I like them. It's not very different from "The Simpsons" at all. I'm not going to go into the details, but suffice it to say that the characters are hilarious, and the dialog is always amusing, and the humor is on par with the best "The Simpsons." It's a nice blend of the real and the cartoon-like, but it's just not like The Simpsons.

This horror tale takes place in the Namib Desert of Africa . A Canadian systems analyst , Zach Straker ( who was also the first to use the term "cryptocurrency" ) is hired to visit a gold prospector in the Namib area where he meets an eccentric scientist who is convinced that gold deposits are being illegally mined by a tribe of war-torn nomadic people . When he meets the man's wife, he is intrigued to hear that she is an African woman from Namibia and the man's daughter is being raised in the area .

I finally snagged a copy of Kannathil Muthamittal through Netflix and spent New Yera 's Eve watching an amazing drama. For all the talk in recent times that India has started to make a real attempt at building its own film industry as a result of the ‘Gangplots’ that unfolded against it in the 1980s and 90s — and that this has only now been achieved, it seems India has finally managed to build a good film industry. Not only has this industry grown, but the industry is also being led by the government’s own people.

This totally UNfunny movie is so over the top and pathetic and unrealistic that throughout the whole 90 minutes of utter torture I probably looked at my watch about 70000 times! Lucy Bell is so much higher than this crap and for her to sink this low is quite depressing. I have to admit that the whole audience I was in was laughing hysterically but the majority were Greek or Italian so I guess that this humour will probably make them laugh but not me. All this movie does is make you sick watching all these slackers make excuses for their stupid actions for 90 minutes.

WARNING - POSSIBLE SPOILERS! 'Rock Star' is one of the solid rock movies I have ever seen. The original idea of the script focuses on a young singer in the 80s, leading a tribute band of one of the most famous hard rock bands of the period. He is not only playing their music to the note, but also living the life of his idols. When his friends in the tribute band expel him, in search of some originality, the destiny plays him a good turn, and gets hired to replace the lead singer of the idols band.

Now I did watch this when it first came out on VHS , and all my friends and I thought it was amazing , but it took me way more time to watch than to appreciate. It's still an amazing film , but now that I have seen it again I will say the same thing . It is a beautiful movie , but once I got into it, it was just like watching an action movie with no real emotional connection . There is no real emotional connection to the story, and I think that is the point.

* * * * Contains Spoilers * * * * As a fan of Rachael Leigh Cook , I watched every episode of Supernatural. I really wanted to learn more about Jesse, Dean, and Sam, and I ended up buying the entire series. Now, it seems like Season 4 might have been my most disappointing season. Why? Because there are way too many secrets. One of the first things you need to know about Season 4 is how the season started and why the season ends in such a dramatic manner.

SPOILERS A Jewish Frodo? Yep, that'll be Elijah Wood again.Ever since the concluding part of "Lord of the Rings", Elijah Wood as Frodo has found it increasingly difficult to get away from that major role. Playing a football hooligan, a psychopath and now a young Jewish American, Wood has tried any route he can to escape this typecasting. Now, with "Everything Is Illuminated" he might finally have achieved this. Playing a role which isn't as radical as other efforts, he truly gets to the soul of his character.

Wesley Snipes is perfectly cast as Blade , a half human , half vampire known the daywalker . He has a girlfriend, Dawn , a half human who loves him and he loves Dawn , but it doesn't stop there . Wesley doesn't know he's been turned into a vampire , but in order to protect Dawn , he must take care of his girlfriend , but will she take care of him too ? I would love to hear from you! Please leave a comment and let me know what I need to know. Also, let me know if you see this on a T.V.

Pretty lousy made-for-TV sequel to the Roman Polanski classic . Rosemary 's son Adrian has grown up and is embodied in his mother – but he has never been to see her. On the surface, it all seemed like an ordinary family holiday in the countryside. But, as Adrian gets to know and love his mum in the years following her suicide, we begin to see the depth of her problems and the pain that she was forced to endure for decades as a child and teenager. It is only through Adrian's experiences that he can discover his real mother in Rosemary.

"Eaten Alive" goes down much easier than Ruggero Deodato's "Cannibal Holocaust," but it's also a far more sillier film. I mean, at times it can be unintentionally hilarious, but the plot is so mind-numbingly idiotic that it was impossible for me not to lose all patience by the end. Tough guy Robert Kerman (Cannibal Holocaust) teams up with Janet Agren (The Gates of Hell; here with an intolerable accent) to search the jungles of New Guinea for Agren's sister, who's been brainwashed by the leader of a religious cult (Ivan Rassimov).

A snore gore. I saw this piece of horrible, stinking, worthless, junk at the Cameo Movie House (Now the famous Crobar Night-club)on Washington Avenue on South Beach in 1980 or 81. I was 17, and my three buddies and I laughed at this horrible, gross, piece of trash. The theater was on it's last legs and there were mostly drunks snoring and sleeping in the place. They didn't miss a darn thing. The Worst acting ever.These actors deserve the Academy Award for the worst, and I mean worst acting roles in the history of the cinema.

This forth film in the "Angel Guts" saga, which at only a few minutes above an hour (it just feels much longer) , is also the shortest, which is perhaps just as well as it's also the most uninvolving of the series.Nami, a department store clerk, is interested in another part time job. Her fellow worker at the department store introduces her to modeling for a porn mag called 'red porno'. But when her other employers found out about her naughty pictures they decide to fire her. And she gets some unwanted admirer.

There seems to be a spectrum of cinema. On the left, there are movies made mostly for entertainment and/or commercial purposes. In the middle, there are movies that are both entertaining and artistic. On the right are movies that are not as commercial, but are focused more on cinema as art than cinema as product.I'm not here to say any one part of the spectrum is better than any other, but that when a movie goes too far to either end, it's rarely good. Such is the case with Naqoyqatsi.I had no idea what to expect when I saw it advertised.

Gracie ( Minnie Driver ) , a woman in her late twenties , is on a waiting list for a transplant . Gracie has been on the waiting list for nearly a year and a half . The doctors have told her that she will be the first woman ever to receive a kidney transplant from a deceased donor . Gracie is very emotional when she hears this news . She tells me she hopes they will find one soon . In an email to me, she describes herself as an introvert, who enjoys spending time reading, writing and cooking. I ask her why she is on the waiting list.

It's been a long time since I have been in the art-house theater and I went to see Douches Froides because it has gotten such great reviews in the papers.The thing is with this movie, is that it has no head or tail, but merely a section in time about the life of the three main characters.When it started I already knew that it was gonna be a long sit down, but sometimes things can get better, in this case not. There is no real character development or interconnection between the players.

UP AT THE VILLA (2000) **1/2WARNING: YOU MAY FIND SOME SPOILERS AHEADIt's hard to know what is the point in UP AT THE VILLA, a gorgeous but shallow period piece, one of those made with the only objective of earning Oscar nominations for best costume design and art-set direction (one for cinematography and another for score are also welcome). It has the same basic idea of thousands of period pieces produced every year: a good-looking, intelligent woman trying to find love in a strange place to her.

I do not like Himesh Reshamiya. I do not like his singing too. But his songs are a craze in India, especially among commoners. Now when he ventured to become an actor  that was a big joke! What guts he has to reap as much as he can in his prime time. I did never want to see this movie. But one thing changed it. The movie becoming a super-duper hit! After 2 weeks, Aap Ka Saroor has raked box office collection of 14 crores  compared to Apne that has collected 7 crores in the same 2 weeks.

As an ancient movie fan, I had heard much about the controversial movie CALIGULA assessed ambiguously as one of the most realistic epics by some and as one of the most disgusting porn movies by others. I decided to see it in the entire uncut version to evaluate it myself hoping to find something positive that would make justice to the many accusations towards the film. I sat down in my chair one autumn evening and started to watch. The beginning quotation from the New Testament shocked me a bit and raised the first controversy in me...why to entail a sentence from the Gospel by Mark in the movie about pagan Rome?

Yes , it 's a SBIF ( So Bad It 's Funny ) classic . With a budget running into the tens of millions of dollars, no matter what the source , it 's sure to make the cut on any list . the film has all of the trappings of a B-movie . The plot , though , is pure B -movie . It 's a revenge film about a gang of kids stealing money to finance a film . To make the whole thing even more fun , the filmmakers also include an appearance by the film's lead character , who is a character we never saw on screen .

Completely overlooking the whole movie adaptation of a video game, this is another terrible movie by Mr. Boll. How he continues to be hired to make movies is a constant surprise to me and obviously most of the movie going community.As a whole I will say that this attempt was fractionally better than so many of his previous attempts. Some of the dialog was even half way decent in Far Cry though he still misuses some phrases and in some cases he doesn't even use the phrases correctly.Now besides the fact that Jack Carver is supposed to be American and not German, Til was still entertaining in this role.

This film is all right , fairly silly and to be taken lightly . But what I ca n't stand are those scenes where a woman fainted when she saw a man walking down stairs with his hand out . I have to ask , what was he thinking ? She must have been a complete wreck and she must have been afraid he was going to take it out on her. It's just not nice. This should have been avoided . It is just the way I like it . I thought the first half was quite funny . This movie is good .

Check out the first 20 minutes even though the suspense has n't yet kicked in . We get a pretty sweet teaser of what is to come. This is the second episode to be directed by Chris Tashjian (who has previously directed the pilot and will direct episodes 3 and 4) and this one is a bit more comedic than previous. I'm actually excited to see him take on the lead. In addition to the first twenty minutes, there are some pretty great bits in this episode. Some of the most memorable are:











1.

Have you ever read a book, then seen the movie, and wonder-How did they screw it up so bad? This is one of those. The book by Huffaker, "Nobody Likes a Drunken Indian" was great, riotously funny...this movie is not. It seems as though nobody cared enough to move the direction along so we CARED about the characters. This movie, which touches on some real concerns about Indians, makes you wonder why we haven't seen more comedies about the holocaust, or slavery. Not well done.

This is one of the most laughably bad films I've ever seen. I cannot believe whoever wrote the review above was serious. Perhaps he was connected with making it. It doesn't have anything going for it. There is no suspense, the acting is dire, the direction hopeless. The music score (?) is three trite notes played ad nauseam. The plot (?) must have taken all of five minutes to write. The dialogue is what a 10-year-old would come up with if asked to do a homework project.

No redeeming features , this film is rubbish . Its jokes do n't begin to be funny . The humour of the actors , actresses , and directors , makes the film hard to stomach , but this will only worsen . The special effects , the cinematography and special effects do n't deserve the money spent on this film . Not for the squeamish. This film was made in 1998 , it was made in the late 80's , it will probably be released around the same time , the last time this type of crap came out .

I saw the movie while I was in a class a few years back in high school . I thought I’d like it but I didn’t really. But I saw it on the big screen when I was younger and that’s exactly what I wanted.” He laughed again. “My wife and I have watched every installment in the trilogy and I love it. We just finished the last two films. We can’t wait to go and see the new one. But I don’t think it’s a question of ‘when’ we will watch the new trilogy.

I watched Love Life on holiday , when it was filmed at a film festival in Florida . It was the first movie I'd seen in which I could identify all the actors and actresses . I can remember thinking I was watching the first film I'd seen where an actor wasn't the lead . I was delighted at the prospect of finally being in the cinema for my own viewing pleasure . I sat and watched , the first film I'd seen in which an audience didn't have the luxury of having their own choice of film .

Sure , most of the slasher films of the 1980 's were not worth thecelluloid they were filmed on , that's why the ones that really did stand a chance , were so bad. This is the third installment of my slashers series, I've been writing them for years , it's like they were my kids , and I just love it. I've seen a lot of good slasher movies since then , and that's what makes me a fan , I think I'll watch every one of them. Here are the slasher films I recommend watching.

I just watched this yesterday and wanted to read other peoples scathing comments but found some high marks.WHAT??? This was probably the worst Asian horror movie I've seen. *spoilers* There were just so many fundamental problems with the story. A lot of Asian horror has the twist of spirits trying to help but just looking scary (with notable exceptions: ringu and Ju-on). This is the case here except they aren't scary. A pretty Asian woman who looks a little pale isn't scary at all.

I have seen several Yul Brynner films--yet this is his best performance as the camera captures his emotions in close up as he snarls, smiles, and laughs. Brynner might have been equally arresting in Ten Commandments, Taras Bulba, The Magnificent Seven, The Brother Karamazov and the Mad Woman of Chaillot but none of these films have captured his range of talent in close ups as in this one. He is arresting and tantalizing to watch in every shot.Equally fascinating and sexy, without removing her clothes, is Deborah Kerr.

"Black Vengeance" is an alternate title for "Ying hung ho hon" AKA "Tragic Hero" (1987). I have just seen this on VHS, together with the first part of the story, "Gong woo ching" ("Rich and Famous"), also 1987. (The poster and 2 stills featured on the page are for a 4-DVD set of movies starring Rod Perry (The Black Gestapo), Fred Williamson (Black Cobra 2), Richard Lawson (Black Fist). The fourth movie is called "The Black Six").

Well , SWORD IN THE MOON finally got a DVD release in Korea , and despite the mostly negative responses that it got here in America , the film still got a ton of praise here in Korea. It was pretty popular with the younger generation here as well, even though a lot of people who grew up with SWORD said that it was a terrible film . Here is a link to a video review by a Korean girl who lives in America:

Here is the official Japanese site with English translations: http://movie-japan.org/view_movie.php?title=SWORD.

This movie did attempt to capture the naive idealism that many young teenaged girls have for fun , friendship , and romance, but the story was flawed in that the love stories were weak and not believable. The story was well-told and kept me interested from beginning to end. But it just lacked that spark and I just wasn't into the story all that much. Not to say it wasn't enjoyable to watch at times, though. There was a great amount of humor and action, which kept me coming back for more and more of the same movie, especially in the last half of the movie.

This is only the fourth effort I ’ ve watched from this director ( whom I met and found quite charming ) and I was impressed with the style. It felt like a horror film, more than a horror movie . The music added a nice atmosphere to the movie. This is definitely one of my favorites from this year. What did you think? Good or bad? Did you feel like this was a good or bad movie? Let me know! This movie was an interesting and original approach to the genre. You have to love this guy for being so good in this film.

I watched this film last night, i though i would rent a horror/scary film from blockbusters and i got this one out. The opening scenes were so long winded, the conversations between characters seemed not to lead anywhere. The story line seemed so poor to me, she gave him HIV and then she goes to meet someone else but she is killed by the man she infected ( i think she may have been doing it for a long time to different people) Then when he dumps the body it just happened to be the man she was going to meet, was in the forest and saw him dumping the body.

In Extramarital we see B-actress Traci Lords at her very best . She 's all wrapped in horror & suspense. She makes her first attempt to kill the wrong guy and ends up making the wrong man her lover. When Traci gets a new job she's not expecting to work with such an amazing man... but she doesn't have much choice. Traci works in a high stakes casino, her boss is a big jerk & she's not getting the money she needs. The only problem is that Traci can't afford a divorce & can't live without her lover.

When a loser teen is bitten by an insect , he becomes the superhero Dragonfly ... Superhero Movie is the movie which you will watch when you are hungry. The hero of the story is a hero because they are able to overcome all these problems that the hero has faced before.The movie shows that there are always heroes in the world of the world. The movie also explains the importance of the superhero of the story. The hero's power is based on a superhero of the story. This superhero can be the hero himself or a villain.

I had a bad feeling ten seconds into the film as a pair of overworked tumbleweeds (probably left over from a bad western) blew across the scene. The bad feeling grew ten seconds later when the obligatory opening stranger-turned-human-sacrifice for no apparent reason lowered his rear view mirror to see a shadow in the back seat. For the next five minutes over the opening credits we are treated to an overhead shot of the car rocking back and forth and only the dramatic made-for-TV-movie music informs us a killing is taking place, not a make-out session.

I just watched the DVD of this award winning film. One Life Stand is a stark drama that through it's pace, black and white shots and atmospheric music, paints a very compelling and honest picture. It's a story about life's dilemma's around power, sex and control highlighted by a few sad lonely lives. The mother (very well acted by Maureen Carr) is uptight and drawn in on herself. The father only appears on the side-lines, and yet is a powerful and pivotal part of the drama.

Well,this movie is really "PLUMPED" HAHA Get it? Thats kinda like the attitude of this movie. The plot is just a copy of Pulp Fiction,okay thats acceptable,but to make this piece if "PLUMP" (haha)! is really unbelievable.The storyline is so pathetic,and the whole thing only gathered a few laughs. It did try making a few jokes from various other movies,and it failed most of the times. I mean,i do have a sense of humor,but this isnt really the way to go to get a laugh.

I saw this movie on the shelf at Blockbuster and thought it looked cool. The DVD case touted so many great actors and I wondered to myself, "Why have I never heard of this movie?" Then I turned over the case and saw the director, Lee Tamahori, and thus the answer began to explain itself. First of all I want to defeat the idea that a great cast equals a great movie, but more importantly, I think I should explain why this movie is so terrible. Okay, the script is awful and full of one dimensional characters.

I enjoyed the acting in this movie . Except for the sister . She reminded me of Janice on Friends . If that’s the kind of thing you want to do in your marriage , you should have her in your life . If she were younger . You would have to ask her if you’d like to get hitched and then you’d go to the wedding and get your wife and her sister to do the same . If she were a younger sister . You could have the two together . If she was a brother . You could have him as a friend .

Sandra Bullock is my favorite actress..... But this movie was so horrible, I couldn't help but chuckle throughout the movie in disbelief that I was actually watching something so crappy. Ha ha. The audio editing is horrible, They try too hard to come up with creative camera angles. Because they're just weird and stupid. The script sucked. Acting was horrible, storyline not very good. Very unrealistic, even for a movie. But it is a 20 year old movie..... so I'll give it a bonus point for that. And yeah, the music was terrible.

This is a great movie for first time ninjas who are dating . If you 're trying to impress some girl, or meet someone new, this could be the movie for you. . You will love this romantic comedy, based on a book that was written by a very famous French writer . The movie features a strong male lead, and you will be in for an action-packed experience . The movie begins with a trip to the dentist . This trip is followed by another to an amusement park, and a trip to a zoo. The movie is all about love and heart-touching .

Seems like a pretty innocent choice at first- the name "employee of the month" might ring bells with "Office Space," and the show "Office Clerk." I think not. This isn't even a dark comedy. The director of this movie, whoever the guy's name, was a complete jerk, and has a sick, perverse mind. There is no pleasure in being lured into feeling sorry for a complete loser who cheats on his wife, steals from his top-notch job, and lies through his teeth 24/7.

I have noticed that a lot of films that have been featured on `` Mystery Science Theater '' have received very little fan mail. One of the reasons why is because the fan mail section is usually filled to capacity by people who like the films and are interested in knowing what to expect from the next entry. If you are going to review a film for a magazine, do so and let them know what you are looking for in order to determine if the film will be good. As I said, I have received a lot of mail, but it doesn't tell the full story.

`` Son of the Mask '' is a terrible excuse of a movie . I went to see this with a couple of friends a couple of years back . We had a really nice time but there were some moments that did nothing for me . And I just thought it was terrible . When I first saw it I thought . "Well this is awful". But then after watching it a few times I realised . "Well, this is a great movie!" I mean, this movie was really good, in a bad way .

Check out the first 20 minutes even though the suspense hasn't yet kicked in. We get a pretty good look at super-secret Los Alamos just a few years after the big bomb test that helped end WWII. Except for the tight security, it looks unthreatening enough. Note how it's a TV repairman, an obvious regular guy, who takes us through security. Once through, it's like any-town-USA, nice homes, quiet streets, kids going to school, and a family TV on the blink. Later on we see little Tommy and little Peggy frolicking along streets lined with impressive looking facilities separated by locked gates.

Bonny Hunt scores a coup with her directorial debut. Minnie Driver and David Duchovny have that indescribable something called chemistry. Sure the plot is unlikely, but that doesn't stop one from enjoying this film. Carroll O'Conner does a great job as Grace's grandfather. Other great character actors play his card buddies. Jim Belushi is hilarious as the down-to-earth husband of Megan, part of the extended family.Faith, family, and marriage are respected. A few sexual references and salty words are used but in context and with gentle humor. And in the background that wonderful Dean Martin tune--"Return to Me.

A moderately interesting start , some pretty scenes in sixteenth-century Japan , and a promising idea . But the execution leaves something to be desired. In a series of scenes in which a young girl is forced to stand in front of a mirror, all the while being subjected to cruel, degrading and humiliating treatment, the movie fails to do enough to impress and make us forget the fact that there is no hope of seeing anything like this again in the future . On the other hand, the director has shown a lot of promise in his earlier films and his latest is definitely better than his previous ones.

It starts out like a very serious social commentary which quickly makes one think of other Clark movies like Kids, Bully, etc. But then just as quickly, it unravels into a direction-less mess. Who is the main character? Is this a serious film or some Gregg Araki-esquire over the top goofy film? Is this a skate documentary with moments of dialog inserted? I have no clue. I found myself watching the clock and wonder when this turd was going to end. I kept thinking there would be some big shocker culmination which never came.

The world now seems to be in an odd stage of downsizing, in which objects such as DVD and CD players are steadily decreasing in size. It is obviously much cooler to have a smaller iPod than a larger one. This is not so with theater screens, as is the case with the IMAX, the enormous, widely-known theater system that has stunned audiences upon its release, and to this day. As long as the material's right.The main problem with 'Magnificent Desolation: Walking on the Moon 3D" is that it uses the huge screen as its main advantage.

this is one of the stupidest movies ever, not THE stupidest mind you but one of the stupidest. This is 96 1/2 minutes of sleep inducing material. Probably Jim Varney's worst movie ever. The last 30 seconds of the film is the best and funniest part but hardly worth sitting through the whole movie for. On the other hand, if you are a die hard Jim Varney/Ernest fan, then like me, you must add this film to your collection. It does have brief, rare moments of humor, although they are few and far between.

I found this movie to be a big disappointment, especially considering the cast. The characters are not believable, as are the ridiculous circumstances in which they find themselves. The only part of the film I enjoyed was when the most annoying characters finally get killed. The special effects consist mostly of scenes of gory dead or dying bodies. A typical unimaginative slasher flick.It's hard to believe, make that impossible to believe that a reclusive creature that sneaks up on goats in the middle of the night could be captured by a group of clumsy, noisy idiots.

There is only one word to define the whole movie, that is: awful. How "Mostly Martha" was remade is awful. The title of the movie is awful. The actors are awful. And the idea of combining good cooking and USA is awful. If you have seen "Bella Martha", well that is the original title and it means "Beautiful Martha", this one is a punch in the stomach. The acting of Ms.Jones is so poor and unnatural that even Jessica Alba, considered one of the worst actresses (http://www.razzies.com/history/05nomActr.asp) would have done better.

Punishment Park is a pseudo-documentary made by Peter Watkins. The premise is that the nation's dissidents (hippies, musicians, protesters, pacifists, etc.) are being rounded up and tried by a tribunal and then given the choice of prison or running the course of Punishment Park. It's a 52 mile grueling trek through the desert to an American flag, with police, National Guard, and various other authority figures in pursuit. The idea is, that if you make it to the flag, you're set free.

The movie was very good. I'm an avid mystery fan and I usually figure out who is going to be killed and who did the killing. While I did figure out who was going to be killed I didn't figure out who did it. I wasn't happy with the portrayal of the Gerda character but given the year the movie was supposed to take place it is possible the woman would have been that 'cloying'. Please know that while these Poirot movies are good, they just don't have the same dynamic to them as the series does because they don't have Japp, Ms.

When I went to see this movie it was already a forced choice , as my original intent was sold on it . I’m sure I’ve seen a bunch of these movies . So, I was really looking forward to seeing it , but the whole thing felt forced. It had a lot going for it , but for the most part it just didn’t work as a movie . It has its moments , but overall I felt like I was watching a movie rather than a TV show . This was the first time I’ve ever seen a movie that was not in the theatre.

I finally snagged a copy of Kannathil Muthamittal through Netflix and spent New Yera's Eve watching an amazing drama unfold. It began with Shyama (a winsome Nandita Das) getting married to Dhileepan in the backwaters of Sri Lanka and then a war takes over their romance. Shyama has to flee to India and is in a refugee camp as she gives birth to a child. Several years later we see Amudha, a playful well-loved child (P. S. Keerthana), who is the darling (or burden) of teachers, parents and fellow schoolmates alike, in a very How to Solve a Problem Like Maria sequence.

What an awful movie. Full of cliches, perplexing scenes, very bad acting, and an atrotious script. It is hard to believe the same guys that wrote The People vs. Larry Flint and Man on the Moon wrote this garbage. Man, this makes my list of Top 10 Worst Movies of All-Time. Didn't this guy, this director, if you can call him that, realize that the first Problem Child was bad enough? Let alone make a sequel for it!!?? Amazing that piece of trash films like this can be shown to children let alone be released!

As is the case with many films of this ilk , my non Catholicism got in the way of my love. But, after watching this film again, I can honestly say I am more aware than ever of what Christianity has meant to me. Because this film brought it back into my awareness, it helped me gain a fresh perspective on myself and the church. This is a documentary that really needs to be watched over and over. Here is how I responded to the film:

First off I will say that this is a beautiful movie.

OK , this does n't compare to the explosive tempo of the first part 's opening sequence ; nor to the almost inaudible opening of the second part. However , it is interesting in its own way , for two reasons. First , that , if the first parts of ' s opening have been compared , they could just as well stand in ' s stead . and second , for the reasons given earlier. For the moment , ' s opening does not differ very much from its first parts , except in detail . but , as will be seen , it is not a good starting point in ' s narrative .

i ca n't even describe it . it 's the worst movie i 've ever seen ( i 'm being brutally honest about it). i 'm soo pissed that i 'm going to hate it because i 'm not sure it' s a good movie or not. however, the actors are not to blame. why are people so blind? this movie is soo bad that they don't even think to take a second look at it
how can people sit there and say, "this isn't a movie" and not even see the movie?

A look at three geishas who are way past their prime . Now they look back on their pasts with fondness and regret and are ready to start over again . . . We met Shobana (Babbar) when she was just seventeen years old in her early twenties . Her mother wanted her to marry . . . which was fine with Babbar . . . But once she got pregnant . . . they had an argument. Her parents disowned her and when she was sixteen she had to leave home . . . As fate would have it she came up with a new name .

Historical movies always take liberties -- conversations are concocted where no one could actually know what was said, customs are adjusted to be comprehensible to modern audiences, etc. However, historical films about actual historical personages should make at least a minimal nod to history. This film does not. The only scene I actually remember is when our hero surprises an assassin who creeps into his chamber at night. He confronts the dangerous intruder with, "I don't remember sending for room service". The main entertainment value is in its badness; I recommended my local video story put it on the "Turkeys" shelf.

`` Driving Lessons '' sees two middle class quintessential British families meet head on , when Grint 's character comes up against his wife 's very jealous husband. What happens if Grint doesn't make it home, or if he finds out something that he doesn't like about his wife ? The solution to both of these dilemmas is found in the film's very believable and sympathetic storyline , which makes for a very watchable and very enjoyable film. The action begins as Grint 's wife is in the middle of an argument with her husband , while Grint 's father is away at work .

I grew up watching the "Bowery Boys" on the weekends and even at young an age I could tell this was low rent stuff as the name implies. Still it was fun to watch Satch (Hall) get the better of Muggs (Gorcey) after Muggs would beat the crap out him. The East Side Kids stuff were never shown even though it was public domain stuff and probably cheap to run, it was just to low a standard for kids to tune in even though we only had like 5 channels to watch. Enter the year 2005 and I am repossesin about my childhood.

I worked on this atrocity ten years ago . Luckily for me , no one knows it because I did a lot of work on my own project and kept it private for my friends and family to read. But I'll post it here anyway . There is a very simple reason why people do this. They feel it's a good exercise for them, or to make a name for themselves (I'm sure you already knew about this one, but I'll repeat it):



"I wrote a blog post that nobody would ever read..."



You know what ?

Film critics of the world , I apologize . It is your job to give advice to the moviegoing public on how to choose films to see. But I don’t do that. I offer what I think is a reasonable analysis on what is and isn’t worth seeing and recommending. I’m sure I’m not the first person on the planet to offer such opinions so I’d like to be clear about that. But I have to do it from the bottom of my heart and not from a financial or political standpoint.

You have to be awfully patient to sit through a film with one-liners so flat and unfunny that you wonder what all the fuss was about when WHISTLING IN THE DARK opened to such an enthusiastic greeting from audiences in the 1940s.On top of some weak one-liners and ordinary sight gags, the plot is as far-fetched as the tales The Fox (Red Skelton) tells his radio audience. You have to wonder why anyone would think he could come up with a real-life solution on how to commit the perfect crime and get away with it.

I have always liked the Carry On films, with their double-meaning sexual innuendo dialogue and moments of slapstick comedy, but I can see why the critics give this one two stars. Basically, many British people are gathering on a coach to go on a Spanish holiday to an island called Elsbels to the Palace Hotel. What they didn't know is that it is not completely built, plus they have to share bathrooms with their neighbours, they have crap draws, and many other complications and complaints that the owner Pepe (Peter Butterworth, putting on quite an amusing accent, e.g.

`` The Love Letter '' is a somewhat pleasant , very very low-key romantic comedy in which the use of music and dance is a minor, secondary part to the drama, rather than the primary, main interest. There's a nice balance between the two, and it isn't too insistent that you get what you want, and if you don’t, it isn't so hard to get out. I also enjoyed the ending, where the two lead characters finally admit they are attracted to each other for real, though neither can say they want to marry each other.

This movie was fabulous. It is definitely a top 5 hitchcock film. The directing and camera shots are nearly flawless(aside from the dog scene when he licks the guys hand, clearly in slow motion). The plot is well written and realistic. It was very believable that an innocent man could fall into a trap like that. I would rate Bruno as hitchcocks second most interesting character( of course bates is first). Robert Walker plays a very believable maniac. He didnt overact the part which made it believable(much the same how perkins didnt overact his part).

Jim Wynorski strikes again with the very literal minded KOMODO VS. COBRA. No guesswork here. A giant CGI komodo dragon -- it sort of looks like a dog minus fur -- takes on a humongous CGI king cobra, with a bunch of tree huggers and others caught in between. The tree huggers get charter boat captain Michael Pare (who else?) to take them to an off-limits federal island. An experiment by a mad scientist in growing very large veggies has become an experiment in growing very large critters, thank so to our nutty military.

Where do we start with an offering like this ? I nearly said film but that would be going a bit overboard. What I am interested in hearing is how people would respond. As someone who has spent a good number of years thinking about this and is now in the same position as you, I'm sure that you would want to start with your story first. What's the story that you would like to make? If you were going to make a movie, what would it look like? Is that a movie you'd like to see or a documentary?

As cute and adorable as they are , the story of three singing chipmunks just does n't seem to have the right feel , it should really be like the first three movies in the Chipmunk movies series, and in the end there should be a singe chipmunk movie with chipmunks as protagonists, but it seems to be like the third one. The first one is so much more like the second one though and the second one should be more like the first one. I guess that makes it a bit weird to me, as I was expecting it to be much more like "Chipmunk: Chipmunky Sings"!

Apparently SHRUNKEN HEADS was the last movie that Julius Harris had a role in. I have not seen all of his movies, but Julius Harris was in many good movies, and I remember him best from "Live and Let Die" where he played Tee-Hee and which was full of Voodoo references, something that is common here in South Florida! I always thought LIVE AND LET DIE was a great movie because it had some atmosphere and mystique, unlike most of the 007 movies. In SHRUNKEN HEADS, Julius Harris is back in his Voodoo persona!

I 'm not one of those folks who bemoans everytime a film based on an old TV show comes out. I enjoy them, and to me, I like them a lot. That's because, as I've often noted, there isn't a single TV show or series that I don't like more than the films. But then there's this. I'm going to go ahead and break it down into two categories. The first is about films that come out that I like, that I have fond memories of.

As was mentioned by others , could there be any other reason to see this film other than to see it? Is there a chance that it was the reason why the film was re-made? __________________

"At the beginning, I had no idea that I was a man. But now I do. I was just a boy when they took me in. And now I have grown up. I know what a man is and I know what a man must do. I know what a man can do. I know what a man can be and I know what a man must not be."

Why would I say that? Because when the movie ended, I was in a good mood. So many people exclaim at the end, wow! Bruce Willis can be funny. For those of you who believe he learned how to act after the sixth sense, you must be very new to his career. He won an emmy for best actor in a comedy series before he did Die Hard. It's like saying, wow, the sky learned to deposit snow on the ground just because it's your first winter in life. The movie was hilarious.

I guess this is the first time I have seen a Roscoe 'Fatty ' Arbuckle movie . I really liked him in the movie "Fatal Encounter" so I wanted to see this. It was fun, but I am not a fan of "Arbuckles", so maybe I am not really interested in a comedy about fat people, but I will still go see this if it is good enough. I did like it a lot in general, I really enjoyed it. "Arbuckle" movie was not that good. At the beginning it was very funny but at the end I did not like it.

A fantastic musical starring Gene Kelly and Rita Hayworth . He owns a nightclub where she dances . She 's attracted by his charm . However , he doesn't feel the same way . He wants to date her because he loves her . Meanwhile , the two try to get back at each other . Gen is not interested . Gene 's friend tells him that he 's getting married . He tells him that Gene doesn't want him to . That he 's still single . Gen wants to go on dates with some of his old friends . He 's got a date with Rita's sister .

This movie was Flippin Awful....I wanted those hours of my life back. For god's sake, -stay far away from this awful crumb ball movie at all costs. Its not worth mentioning the title, but the ratings on this movie are pretty generous for a vomit scum movie like this. And where do I begin? The dumb A** kids in the movie.....The zero plot or story?...the garden-variety college/frat boy-esquire scenes of towel slapping? Or the VERY bad acted, teen angst innuendo? $$$#@%@!

First I must confess that A Separate Peace is my favorite book . So of course , I have some of the first chapters of this novel in my personal bookcase. I can't help but wonder why they were left in there for more than 50 years ! I have to admit , the idea of an assassin, a terrorist , a spy-in-residence and a hero all working for one single organization is a very intriguing concept . In fact , I have been wondering about this very subject for many years . What I had hoped to do was to write an action/thriller like this novel .

My wife and I could n't even finish the film . Truly , it was rather painful.First , the historical facts: It's set in a pre-1917 New England town in the 1830s in what is called the Old North State. It's one of the smaller towns in Vermont , and its population in the early part of the nineteenth century numbered about 400 people. This was a time when the United States was at war with Britain, and at the end of the Napoleonic Wars , the Treaty of Amiens came into effect, and France and Britain ceased hostilities.

I ca n't believe I rarely ever see this title mentioned by all you eighties horror freaks and I definitely haven't heard it said by any other fan of my writing. I had never heard of it until just the other day I was checking the reviews on my website and I saw that the author in question is a horror fan and had mentioned the book a couple of times. Well I knew I wanted to talk with the author of the book and talk with you as well. And I'm glad we got that chance. So what are you working on?

My grandad gave me this DVD . With friends like these . The front cover looked quite scary thought i had not known about it before . But it was not . This DVD was about a war which was about to start in South Africa . A war which was fought for the freedom of the white race . This war was started to end all wars . One day it was going to end up in North America . But that day never came . I was born in the 80's and i grew up on this DVD . This DVD was made for me .

Please do not blame Korea for this bad movie. I am in Korea (please excuse bad English). It sadden me to see these movies which make Korea look like obsessed with blood and sex. It sadden me even more to see animal killings and hear Americans say that is how Korea is. We do not eat live animals!! So please stop excusing movie for its crime by saying it is the culture! There is scenes with the man eating live animals and non Koreans think it is normal. No it is disgusting to us too.

Where do we start with an offering like this? I nearly said film but that would be going a step too far. The only thing hellish about this film is that it is certainly a marriage made in hell, between nothing and nonsense, baloney and balderdash. These films should carry a physiological health warning so as not to damage one's spirit to the point where one might believe that all good film makers have left the planet and their resources have been handed to the dunderheads who have make this classic piece of trite garbage just like it's sister in arms "League of Extraordinary Twaddle".

Does anyone else think that "Reba" is basically a ripoff of "Roseanne"? Just look at the characters from the two families, Connors (Roseanne) and Harts (Reba) ; the blonde bombshell elder daughter (Becky Connor and Cheyenne Hart) who's married to a moron (Mark Healy and Van Montgomery), the sarcastic brunette younger daughter (Darlene Connor and Kyra Hart), the little brother (DJ Connor and Jake Hart), and the quirky relative (Jackie Connor and Barbara-Jean Booker Hart). And then, of course, there is the biggest similarity, Reba Hart and Roseanne Connor.

I have only praise for this film. From start to finish it captured the brilliance of Stephen Sondheim's musical. I am not a big fan of musicals most of them are very overdone. This one however changed my mind. I am an actor myself and have actully played Sweeney and I know how hard this role is. George Hearn gave a stunning, masterful and rounded performance worthy of the highest awards that we can give him (He won an Emmy and that's something.) Everything he does he turns to gold.

The violent death of Fernando Ramos Da Silva only eight years after the completion of this film, only adds to the poignancy of dierector BAbenco's powerful message. The film is split into two halves - the first in a reformatory where a group of youngsters are abused and violated by the violent law enforcers and guardians. The second backdrop is the city where they are confined instead by their own actions and morality, which includes mugging, pimping and killing different characters who enter their lives.The differing gender and sexual roles in the film allow for constant changes in the characters as they interact with other people.

Brilliant actors and brilliant picture ! ! I love the chopper scene with the music in the beginning , it's so cool ! ! I've only watched the first 3 days, I'm not into action movies anymore... I'd really like the 2nd movie of the series ! I wonder if anyone saw the preview for the first movie and was able to tell the difference between the 2 ? Thanks for reading and for giving me your feedback... :)

I'm so happy for you , it's a great show ! My only criticism is the acting is not that great .

I watched this movie last night, i'm a huge fan of the book, and i was pretty happy with the version in which Winona Ryder and Susan Sarandon starred. But this one, it's just awful. Oh my God, i don't understand how they dared to ripped apart this classic story and made the characters totally different, starting with the switching of Beth being the younger sister, and making Amy the 3rd one. And Jo interpretation, terrible, Jo was a feminist, intelligent and kinda angry young lady, and the actress portraying Jo in this movie acts like a foolish and very annoying little girl.

This is one of L&H's shorts most frequently cited as the first "real" L&H teaming and perhaps one of their best silent features. J. Piedmont Mumblethunder (Ollie) is a millionaire who has come to the docks to greet his nephew Philip, whom he's never seen. At first Ollie is laughing it up with everyone when this strange little man unboards and draws a great deal of attention to himself by the way he's behaving during his medical exam, but is quite humiliated when it turns out that this is the fellow he's supposed to be greeting.

This movie has got to be the biggest disappointment I've ever experienced with a film. The acting is horrific, the suspense build up minimal, and the plot overall is ridiculous. I found myself rooting for the victim to just hurry up and become a victim, because she obviously needed to be put out of her misery. Anyone with rudimentary knowledge of how the world works will immediately be disgusted at the leaps we're asked to make in logic, and the so-called suspenseful buildup would be lucky to get a 3 year old to be mildly worried.

In my opinion , a good documentary - especially one dealing with controversial political issues - should be informative and entertaining, and that’s not really what it’s been in this case, at least not since the first hour or so. But then again, I’m not one of the people who watch a documentary like that; it’s rare that they have much to say - and if I’m going to be honest, I’ll be frank; I feel that this kind of stuff should not be made into a film - or anything resembling a film - for that matter.

This movie was completely stale and uninspired. The central premise of this movie was basically a bunch of stereotypical black people sitting around a barbershop exchanging painfully unfunny repartee. I did not laugh one time during the entire movie. I could have sat in any barbershop in America and have heard this banal banter, and maybe have even come out with a decent haircut. I cannot understand why this mess got any favourable reviews, much less why so many people have wasted money on this. None of the characters here were funny or worth caring about.

I was all ready to hate this but it turned out to be surprisingly tolerable - though the MTV-style of film-making (shot on DV, to boot) is quite an eye-sore! I liked the script's self-mocking style, as well as its central idea of having the female vampire lead doubling as a contract killer. As to the cast, Eileen Daly (best known as the 'star' of those horrid "Redemption" intros) has an undeniable screen presence - and is quite sensual, despite her age; however, Christopher Adamson's hammy chief villain is obnoxious.

"First Snow" has an intriguing beginning. A traveling salesman has his fortune told by an old man, who's predictions turn out to be amazingly correct. From this point on the movie plays out like a bloated "Twilight Zone" episode. I mean nothing but car trips, phone calls and paranoia. William Fichtner gives his usual interesting performance, but Guy Pierce is anything but a sympathetic character, disregarding other people's well being for the sake of his own paranoia. The ending is especially weak, with absolutely no payoff for the long suffering audience.

I'm sorry, but this really does feel like a modern day Apollo 13 knock-off. Totally implausible (at least Armageddon FELT like a comic book! This felt like a bad High School film project), acting was about as cliché as one can get, and....landing a space shuttle on an LA freeway? Come on. Seriously. Jerry, what were you thinking? And all the clichés: The pregnant astronaut's wife, the nosy reporter who gets in everyone's way, the stalwart manager with "Go Fever".

Sacchi is the best Bogart impersonator ever ... dry and droll as Sam Marlowe . The music from award winning composer John Corigliano was the perfect accompaniment to the great film, and I could listen to it all day (and night, even) and forget what happened next. This was an absolute must for any Bogart fan, and you can expect it to be a regular addition to your listening list. In the years before John Wayne starred in "Bonanza," he was still trying to be the perfect actor in the roles that were given to him.

As a fan of nearly any period drama , and at that a huge Jane Austen fan , I was delighted to see the return of a show I’d watched many times, and had even grown to love, when Jane Austen was alive, but I hadn’t read a lot of of her books. I was also pleased to see that there was still a strong interest in Jane. Not just for fans of period dramas but for readers also. While there were many shows that focused on a particular Jane Austen character (e.g.

Rabbit Fever is one of those film oddities. It's an enjoyable 90 minutes, demands little of the viewer, and delivers as much, and on any terrestrial television channel even in a prime time slot I think that Rabbit Fever would be rather well received. Which makes me wonder why it has been pushed into cinemas.The movie is filmed in the style of a television documentary, and introduces us to 6 women who have am addictive relationship with the Rabbit Vibrator. The film is primarily focused on investigating a supposed addictive quality to the famous sex aid product.

This movie has to be the worst film I have seen . There is a reason it was made to be in the cinemas. What the hell is going on with this movie !? I don’t like it. It is boring, unfunny, slow paced and very dull. But it does have some good points. It has great action sequences, an awesome ending, as well as an amazing cast of characters. But the plot of the movie is just too bad . There is nothing funny about the film whatsoever. It is just dull, boring and unfunny.

For the first time in reviewing films, I found myself immediately uninterested in this story. I don't know if it was the way that it was filmed or the story behind the characters, but it felt bland, overused, and completely unoriginal. Within the first thirty minutes, I found myself rather apathetic with all the characters and the story. I felt as if I had seen this structure before, and Tart was providing nothing new to surprise me. After thinking that it may just be my mood, I stopped the film and chose to start it fresh in the morning, but the same feeling persisted.

I hope this isn't a portent of things to come. High-definition camcorders are getting cheaper all the time (although I wouldn't swear that's what was used here), so it's open season for all the wannabe Scorseses and Tarantinos.There is no hiding the cheapness of this stinker, and calling it a 'film' would be doing the industry a big disservice. The photography is of a standard you would expect on a family outing to the zoo. I could build me a new house with all the wooden acting. What's remarkable about that is that nobody stands out as the worst.

Terrific little film that stars Mary Astor as a go-getter who works her way up as a struggling paper company, but when the owner has to sell for health reasons, she comes up with a scheme for the employees to buy the company with a jerk salesman (Robert Ames) as the "front" even though she is the brains.Of course he becomes a big success and she becomes his executive secretary, basically still running everything and teaching him class. She loves the dope, but he never catches on as he fools around with a string of bimbos.

Although I rarely agree with filmkrönikan, I have to say that this film while not awful, just didn't make me care at all... and it all just seemed to be out of place... it had its moments... three or four ones that made me snicker... but most of the time I was just sitting and wondering why? why did the characters do this? even Hot Shots characters felt more thought out and fleshed out...If you want to see a nice norrlands-film then watch Pistvakt. There it was more than random ethnicities that just walked around shooting each other on the Swedish tundra...I am so disappointed...

Take a bad script , some lousy acting and throw in a politically incorrect morality tale and what do you have? An abomination . The first thing I think of when I hear a story about a movie that's so awful I've never heard it before is that the writer/director has completely and utterly wasted their own talent and talent in writing this bad script/poorly acting movie/poor moral tale . So how can this bad script make it to the screen ? The answer is:

The answer is: They don't write bad scripts . I don't mean bad writing per se.

Before seeing the sneak preview today of Angels & Demons, I cleared my mind of any uncertainties that might hold me back from enjoying it; the enormous amount of hatred towards Dan Brown, the fact that it was written by Dan Brown, and because Dan Brown's name is slapped on all of the posters. I went in with an open mind, and expected the worse, but instead what I got was a 2 and a half hour Roman cat and mouse game with Forrest Gump, and that is by all means good entertainment value.The movie hangs loosely on the actual novel itself.

Dreamland started out moderately interesting but never went anywhere except Tedium city . A low rent affair with no name. It went from bad to bad in about a year, but never really went anywhere. It was still there in 2009. It's now being rebuilt. In the late '90s, Tedium was at the top of the charts in a country known for its punk rock. It was a hard rock and heavy metal country band. They were called The Doves or Doves or something similar. The Doves were the UK's answer to The Beatles.

For several reasons , this movie is simply awful . Other posters have listed some of this movie 's historical accuracy , but it isn't anywhere near to what is portrayed . This film isn't history , and doesn't represent anything close to what happened . I'll give you a synopsis :

In 1777 , French troops marched out of France with the intention of destroying the American Revolution . The American colonists resisted the French, and fought them in France for five months , but were eventually defeated . On the way out of France , the French troops were followed by American troops , led by Colonel George Washington .

I have some of the older videos and dvds of Dr. Who. I've played them over and over. I adore each of the "Doctors" for different reasons. But due to a man in the BBC hierarchy, Dr. Who was canceled, even though it was still one of the mainstays of the BBC line-up. With the departure of Sylvester McCoy, the Doctor stayed alive through the fans. BBC graciously allowed fans to write books, and cartoons. The momentum of Dr. Who has been steady even after 1989. Then they took a chance with Paul McGann.

The word Ghilli actually means a small sharp wooden game instrument that is used in a game called ghilli-danda (a precursor to Cricket) in India. The use of the word as nickname for the principal character is stylish, as it signifies one who is sharp, fast and can hurt badly when rubbed in the wrong way.Ghilli is one of the best movies for Vijay and in it is unrivaled in its pace and action. The movie never slacks for a moment, and keep you always with some exciting action. The movie is set in Madurai and Chennai and its story core is simple.

I , being a fan of Rupert Grint , rented this film a few months ago . I thought it was an entertaining watch , and I was more than a bit shocked when I saw it again today . There are some really good scenes in it , especially the final battle in which a group of elite soldiers, led by one of the most well-known people of all time, is trying to stop a group of crazed civilians , led by one of the craziest characters of all time. The cast of the film are outstanding , and there's an impressive amount of great acting throughout .

I was waiting to welcome Arnold Schwarzeneger 's return to action after the dismal movies he 'd made after ``The Silence of the Lambs''' and ``Dark Knight'' had come and gone. And I got my wish: I have to say, I was rather disappointed. What I was looking for when I read the press release for Arnold 's new role was a film that didn 't require him to be a star to sell tickets, but I didn 't expect to get much of a performance from the man I 've been watching on ``The Simpsons'' since 1989.

After watching Stop-Loss , I find myself against disappointed in Hollywood for making such a stinker . Gone are the days when films such as this one and others would get a big budget and come out with the best films ever . For a movie this good, there are not too many things that you can expect from a movie like this one that is so much better . At first you will see a girl looking in the mirror and say ‘ it’s a girl’ and then she will go and do all the right things and she looks so lovely .

How offensive! Those who liked this movie have probably never opened a bible. I can imagine those at NBC saying, "OK. Let's make a movie to appease those pesky Christians, but they'll never know the difference if we don't have anything factual or in the correct chronological order." Well, they were wrong. Anybody associated with this atrocity needs to find a church and repent for their involvement in this blasphemous atrocity. I only gave this movie a 1 because I couldn't give it a 0.

This has got to be the worst movie I haver ever seen Nielson in. This movie just does not have what he needs to be funny. I think the reasons that the Naked Gun and the like movies is that they did not require Nielson to be funny. He just played the roles as straight as he could while all of the comedy that went on was mostly visual. But when you put him in a movie where he has to be funny, he isn't. The movie had only one good part, and this may be considered a spoiler by some, and that the beginning credits were animated.

This was a disgrace to the game FarCry i had much expectations but all ended up in a nightmare. Besides the bad acting the visual effects, stunts the plot even the humor used in the movie was an absolute flop. The movie is not worth watching at all. The funniest part was when the girl comes and kiss Jack in order to give him the key to the cuffs. Guess the she got the keys to handcuffs all the time. I hope some good director will make a remake of this fantastic game into a movie someday.

NBC had a chance to make a powerful religious epic along the lines of "The Ten Commandments" and "The Greatest Story Ever Told," and instead they chose to make some halfhearted cartoon that was more like "Waterworld" than anything else. I don't recall a Bible passage where Lot turns into a pirate and attacks the ark, nor do I remember one where Noah's son develops a serious friendship with an orange, nor do I remember Noah being some crazy old loon who suddenly acts like he's commanding a naval fleet and runs around shouting nautical terms like "hoist the mainstay!"

I saw this movie yesterday, and like most allrdy wrote "i also expected a Steven movie", god i love this guy just because his fighting style is unique and very humerous. In had a little doubts cause i read that "Ja Rule" was playing in it, but i thought hopefully they give him a smal role, so i don't get irritations by watching him. And offcourse the opposite happend, goooooooooooooooooooood steven what the heck were you thinking going to join a sry *** crew like this. Steven was broke and needed cash?

(Possible ?? spoilers included, but nothing critical given away. )I just watched this classic low budget movie on video, and was knocked out by the level of energy present on screen. All the actors do themselves proud, especially John Daniels, must see another of his films. Not only does this movie boast great performances, but manages stylish sequences, like when the baron throws someone out of a window and we see shards of glass falling into a swimming pool which erupts from the impact of the fallen man, i love the way slow-motion photography was used in 70's cinema, dreamy and hypnotic.

I first remember bumping into this zaniness from the Zucker brothers and Jim Abrahams, back in the early days at Comedy Central. Back in those days (the 90's) their programming consisted of Benny Hill reruns and the original MST3k, complete with bearded host.Capt. Frank Drebin (played by the stone-faced, dead-pan filibuster, Leslie Nielson) is a process created first from the amalgamation of various stereotypical police television show protagonists (think Dragnet meets Starsky & Hutch the Show), boiled in a flask full of well-known police television show plots and scenarios.

This movie was utterly and unequivocally terrible. The plot was so predictable and boring and the script so corny and pretentious that by the end I wanted to stab my eyes with the nearest pen.Normally I don't write reviews, but I was astonished by the number of positive reviews it got. While I admit that the acting was okay at some parts, the script's deficiencies more than outweighed the decent acting. The only reason I watched this was because a few of my friends were watching it, introducing it as most likely the worst movie ever made, judging by the trailer.

I have to admit that I absolutely loved this movie . Of course as I 'm sure you know that there are two sequels coming. I was looking forward to this movie since I haven't seen it for ages. Well I have and I have to admit I just loved it! There were quite a bit of twists and turns in this film as I did not expect it and I'm really glad I went for it since I didn't expect any of the things to actually happen. However I did find that the story line of the movie was quite different from the original novel.

I have to hold my hand up and say that I was one of the first (and probably the last!!!) to see this film. Where do I start, it's a complete mess. The main attraction of course was the soundtrack. Which goes without saying is brilliant - it's what Himesh does best. But as they say, don't give up your day job - HR definitely shouldn't.HR's acting is plain and simply awful. Even if the film had a plot, the thing that baffles you most is why this man is up on screen and what the hell is doing there.

This is almost Ed Wood territory . Yeah , that ridiculous wreck of a flying monster looks like a cross between Thor and the Mothman. What I don't get is how the car is so slow moving , and that is when you know they are coming. It isn't as though they don't see the approaching monster, that is one thing I have to say , it doesn't feel like they are seeing it. It looks like they have no control over where they are, that's why it is so slow moving.

When Hollywood is trying to grasp what an "intelligent person" is like, they fail so miserably, finding it hard putting words in the mouth of the purported "genius".Right, any genius walks around trying to rub in his superiority at every instance. Sure, they hang out in bars and pick fights  it's not like they are (generalizing wildly) autistic nerds who never have a tan.Plus, if you are a genius you know all about Math and History and Politics and of course you're constantly up to date with current events and a thorough analysis of them.

It took a loan out film to Columbia for Gene Kelly's home studio MGM to realize his creative talent and give him some control over what he did in his own films. Cover Girl also became Rita Hayworth's signature film for the GIs and their pinup fantasies during World War II.Kelly plays the owner of a small nightclub in Brooklyn where Rita is a featured dancer and Phil Silvers the comic. Of course Kelly does a bit of hoofing himself there.Hayworth comes to the attention of millionaire Otto Kruger when it turns out that Kruger had loved and lost Hayworth's grandmother.

Two years after this short, the last "Our Gang" short was made. After seeing this, you wonder how it even lasted that much longer. The quality of "Our Gang" nosedived soon after moving from Hal Roach to MGM, and this short is a perfect example. The gags are all very unfunny and Froggy's last line of this being the happiest day of his life paints a bad picture in your mind of what it's like for him the rest of the time. A very poor example of film making.

The Toxic Avenger , Part II starts with the startling revelation that after the Toxic Aveneger ( John Altamura who is the leader of a gang of supervillains who work together as a team ) gets his hands on the Hulk, he does not just take him away but actually makes him kill himself, in the scene with his head in the trash, he has his head wrapped up and is put into a body bag , and he is given a helmet to wear and a body suit and he is thrown in the river.

I think `` Rosemary 's Baby '' is the most overrated horror film out there . Not scary , interesting , or that good . Rosemary's Baby was not the best of horror movies , but it is the worst of them . It's the most overrated film in Hollywood history . I do believe that " Rosemary's Baby'' has become a horror classic . " Rosemary 's Baby'' is such a great movie that it was made into a musical by the time it was released in 1967 . The score is so bad that it has a cult like status in the horror genre .

There are no saving graces in this dreadful , stagey , boring snooze-fest , which brings to mind `` The Man Who Planted Seeds of Doubt ,'' starring George Clooney . The movie is not a particularly good movie but Clooney does look like he would be better off in `` The Descendants ,'' which is one of two movies he has done that are worth looking at . He is not terrible in those two movies but not great either. This is not a great movie and Clooney should have just done one more film.

I won't bore you with any synopsis, chances are you already know them. And hopefully you are already familiar with Park Chan-Wook's work.I STRONGLY disagree with some of the other commentators in saying that "Park has not moved on from the vengeance trilogy blah blah blah." Because you know what? He HAS!!! The vengeance trilogy were different from each other in style to begin with, how can you even compare the sombreness and subtlety of "Sympathy For Mr Vengeance" with the frantic and extravagance of "Oldboy"?

I'm not sure if this is a comedy or not, but I found it pretty comical. Isobel is possessed by the devil. Somehow a perverted priest and the gardener are gonna' fix that. Part exorcism and part soap opera, you'll at least get some laughs. There's the paranoid jealous dad, satanic sister, Valley of the Dolls mother, and then the cowboy boyfriend; all there to help the skirt chasing priest fight the demons from dear Isobel. It sometimes felt like a Jerry Springer episode, but I actually paid to see this.

Jessica Bohl plays Daphne, the sexually precocious suburban teenager struggling with the hell of high school. Daphne's neighbor is Buddy (Richard Brundage), a depressed middle-aged man still angry over loosing his wife. Daphne is attracted to world of prostitution because it promises to cure her of barely legal boredom and loneliness. Once Buddy strips Daphne of her secret, he hires her to help him accept the loss of his wife. The entire film takes place at the Hotel Duncan, yet details of each character's history are exposed through dialogue and flashbacks.

Oh boy! Oh boy! On the cover of worn out VHS has a picture of Sandra Bullock and her name written on top. I think only reason they had chance to sell the movie in nineties, was because of Sandra Bullock's name. Bullock's fans don't have to disappoint. Sandra is only thing to watch in this movie and her performance is the only you can call acting. Rest of the movie It's fun to watch in first fifteen minutes because it's bad but after that it's going worse. Much worse. Directing is awful.

this is one of the worst movies ever There is a scene where they are supposed to be underwater and they go to a place where there are all kinds of sharks but they have to run out of water because the sharks are too big and it’s too high to climb back up but you’re just supposed to swim around in the sea. and the water in the sea isn’t really blue and the whole thing takes a while. I thought the movie was a lot more like a documentary than a movie.

WARNING - POSSIBLE SPOILERS ! 'Rock Star ' is one of the solid rock movies I have ever seen . There is no question it was an enjoyable film , although I did find myself wishing that more characters and scenes had been shot . A lot of the action scenes were just plain boring . While it was well acted and quite well written , the film often seemed too long and had too much story and dialogue . Perhaps this was intentional , or perhaps it is simply a case of being an older film . I did enjoy the film , but it should not be seen as the definitive version of its genre.

There is no way to avoid a comparison between The Cat in the Hat and The Grinch Who Stole Christmas, so let's get that part out of the way. First of all, let me start by saying that I think Grinch was an underrated and unappreciated film.
