Dire ! Dismal ! Awful ! Laughable ! Disappointing ! Right , your trapped in `` The Cave '' with an extremely poor view in the distance. Sheltered young woman , home-schooled and possibly quite gifted , harbors a disturbed , overly-emotional side which comes to the surface from time-to-time . Her mood changes from being very calm and well adjusted , to out of control , erratic , dangerous . She has always been good with animals and has been known to be very friendly and fun with them ( at least in the house ) . She is a very well educated , cultured lady with a very high profile job , but she has not had any formal training . This has not kept her from being very bright and in a number of fields , very well informed and quite intelligent .

Unlike most of the reviewers of this particular movie, I'm really not the much of a Cynthia Rothrock fan, to say the least. However when I saw that the movie had Fred Williamson and Robert Forster (both great actors), I just had to watch the film. Williamson is a Dakota Smith, an alcoholic cop who is demoted to scrubbing toilets with a toothbrush and even worse having to team up with Cynthia at the behest of the captain (Robert Forster). Forster is always watchable, it's just a crying shame that the movie itself is so damn trite and clichéd.

I went to this film having no idea what to expect . I actually took a date to it in my local cinema. From what I was told the film was well written and acted, and the plot was decent. And obviously I did n't see it ! But looking at the cast and seeing that Doug Masters is back and back to normal again I don't know how much more I can take ! Oh no ! It was scary but at the same time very exciting ! And I still have a great deal of energy when I'm on my feet.

Christopher Nolan 's first directorial effort , a year before he did `` Memento , '' and this is almost certainly his biggest, boldest movie since `` Memento , '' in 1999 . `` Memento'' is, as you may remember, about a young boy who stumbles upon a disfigured body and decides that life is a bit more interesting and less grimy if he has a little of the past left over from his life. Nolan's film is about a lot of things, most of which would seem to be a lot more obvious than most movies, but none are as important as what it's about.

It looked cool from the movie sleeve , but after five minutes we were n't sure if it was a cool idea . . . we watched it with a smile on our face and were amazed at the idea of a movie with the main characters from a series that wasn't based in reality and was in a fictional world with real actors . . . then it occurred to me what this would be like , as the main characters and crew had real lives . . . and now I had to wait and watch this until I saw it with my family and friends .

When a group of businessmen start dying in the presence of the mysterious Mr. Coulomb , FBI agent Dick Martin and his sidekick, Dr. Donna Troy, are drawn into the story. When Dr. Troy is shot, she asks Dick if she can be of help. The man who has been killing these people must be stopped as soon as possible. But who is this mysterious stranger in the shadows? The man, who is now in her body, asks her to stay with them until his return. What will it take for him to leave them alone again?

I could n't stop watching this movie , though it was far past my bedtime . Comparisons to Hitchcock are inevitable , but the story and characters are much different . So is the ending . It's an excellent suspense thriller . However , I felt like this was a pretty slow film , in terms of pace . A couple of the story lines were slow . Some of the plot twists weren't that surprising , and the climax felt like a stretch . I was surprised and disappointed with the ending , but I would definitely recommend this to anyone . The only problem with the film was the soundtrack .

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** There's not much that can be said about this early-talkie era flick. (I'm hesitant to call "Cimarron" a "film", because I feel that the word is too esoteric.) But what can be said about it...mainly speaks against it.Take, for example, the overuse of portraying Indians as bad folk. In one scene, the little boy of the flick's lead character--an overbearing and over-ambitious family man who wants to set up a newspaper business-- is playing just outside of his father's office.

I was lucky enough to have seen this film at it 's Seattle Film Fest screening , and was blown away by how different the film looked , the cinematography & editing were just spectacular, and the acting was so amazing. This is a low budget stop motion monster movie from Brett (A Nymphoid Barbarian in Dinosaur Hell) Piper... and it delivers just what I'd expect from such a production: light-hearted (though cheesy) dialogue, some cute actresses and lots of stop motion critters. That's why I've given the film 10 out of 10 - because it delivers what I expected it to deliver... and a bit more: Brett doesn't penny-pinch when it comes to putting his critters on screen. He hurls lots of bugs at his cast for the finale.

Tia Carrere was the reason I decided to watch this film , as neither the title , nor the cover of this DVD make a direct reference to its theme. I guess I should now comment upon a 4th flick in the MAGNIFICENT SEVEN franchise; the sequels still surprise or amaze meby their sleaze and deliberate _absurdism. They constitute or forge a 4th waynot classic, not revisionist, not Europeanbut a sleaze Americana, kindred to the violent vigilante '70s movies, absurd trash. This installment too is bombastic sleazeinexplicably awkward and even somewhat strange.Now what I find disturbing that these sequels not only have their opportunist fans; but that the fans simply do not sense any difference between the original's style and the sequels'.These sequels are not boring or insipidbut bizarre.

You know you 're watching softcore with the wrong attitude when the poor dubbing bothers you . I 'm okay with it, but it's not as great as it could be. Having been raised in Canada , I saw this short many times mostly on the CBC . I have seen it on TV (and read about it on other websites) but the movie made it to theaters in Canada. I read a lot of reviews and it is a great film, with a good story and the characters are real. Five guys who were in the cub scouts together reunite years later to go camping . Were they run into the same kind of situation and were they able to help each other get through it? Who are you rooting for? It’s a pretty interesting situation. I actually didn’t think about this before, but the thing is that it’s an age-graded camp, the Cub Scouts have to be in their 20s. Some of the older Cub Scouts are on their last legs. They’re probably going to the last camp and say, “Hey, this is really hard.

One of the problems with popular culture , especially when discussing the popular culture of the 1970s , is that we tend to forget the most important thing from the era: women. And I think that is the most important thing. We need to forget about women because they were not nearly as influential in that period as most of us realize, which is that they weren’t “the cool girls”. They didn’t have the hair, the fashion, the celebrity status, the attention. They were just normal, ordinary, everyday women.

Reba sucks . It sucks hard . It 's about this awful country singer attempting comedy . They might as well have called him the King of R&B . I guess he 's just not trying . It sucks hard . The song is catchy . No one will be surprised that the song is awful . It's about this awful country singer that 's trying to make it in the industry . And I'm not a big fan of it . Maybe it 's just the way I am . Maybe that 's it . But the people aren't surprised . The song is catchy .

Tom Stern and Jeremy Slate are swing bachelor 's planning to hijack a casino , ala `` Ocean 's 11 ." Their plan is to steal the slots . But the only slot that's really for sale is . They say the $10,000 slots are so scarce that no one will play 'em . Their plan is to buy 'em and pay off with $5,000 to play them . I think it will be a lot of fun for the guys and gals. For $5,000 you get to do whatever you want to do to that slot machine .

`` Hoppity Goes to Town '' was the second and last full length animated feature made by Max and Dave, and is the only surviving original Max and David series animated feature film. It also has the distinction of making the series popular enough to make it into a TV series, starting with a short run as a weekly syndicated series in the early 1960s. In the TV series, this story is set in the 1970s. There is a lot more to this story than I was able to properly explain, but hopefully this will give the general public the general idea of the story.

I just caught this on Showtime ... ewwwwwww , not even fun in a bad movie kind of way . It is a documentary about a band that goes to a strip club to show off their new album ... the strip club owner is disgusted ... then they go out on their first date together and he tells them their new album is not the same as the first one ... which makes me think ... it must be the first record that has a few things wrong with it because it was released two months after the first album so it would be totally obvious ... but no ...

[CONTAINS SPOILERS!!!] Garfield and his owner Jon Arbuckle were in a rut. They basically had no life at all. All they did was lay around and count the ceiling tiles. Jon even organized his sock drawer according to color and fabric. He needed a life. So he consults a book on the subject that tells him to meet a woman. A singles' bar was a great place to start. Unfortunately, when the music started and Jon hit the dance floor, we see what made disco die: Jon killed it.

First of all , let me just say that after watching this movie I felt like I 'd been sold a bunch of BS in order to get my money, I don't expect a review to last more than 20 minutes. The first thing that came to my mind upon reading the review of this movie was all the complaints I've heard about the movie, I thought that maybe the main problem was the story itself, not just the quality of the writing. As I watched the film, my mind wandered over to what I felt was a few minor flaws in the plot of the movie.

If you 're tired by the same repetitive , unintelligent material that the mainstream movie industry releases , you 'll want to find an online alternative. If you 're tired of the same boring and predictable plots , you'll want to check out The Art of Animation, a web series created by acclaimed animator and filmmaker Richard Williams. Here's a glimpse at all of Williams ' videos , and if you can't find anything there , you're in luck because this one is on DVD . The Art of Animation tells the stories of six talented, hardworking, and imaginative young artists working in a variety of mediums.

This is the worst movie I have ever seen . The story line is a joke , the effects are terrible . This is a comedy . I have never seen or read this movie but I was told it was good because it was based on the book of the same name by Stephen King

The movie was written by Jack Kesy. The story is based on a true story. It was the story that inspired Stephen King. There is also a documentary that is about the book, but I haven't seen it

The movie was filmed by John Hillcoat and directed by Robert Benton.

Who doesn't love the muppets?! Impossible it is to watch them without getting some kind of warm, fuzzy feeling inside. So, I guess what's important is that this movie seemed to very successfully capture what makes the muppets so special. I don't remember much about the details of the plot but the various moments and characters in the film I recall quite fondly. In fact, there was quite a nostalgic atmosphere to the whole movie but without being self-conscious in any bad way. Refreshing for someone who possibly gets too hung up on meticulous details and technique; the "magic" transcends all that other stuff.

i was lucky enough to read the book beforehand and i do know a little about Tudor england.the writing directing and editing of this TV movie for the most part was truly awful. i felt as if i was watching a really bad drama doc about the period rater then a movie.first there were too many cut's between important parts. And leaving out important events which happened at the time, one is henry's fall out with Rome over his desire to divorce Katherine of aragon which led to england's breaking away from Rome and establishing her own church. they barely stuck to the book at all.

I have seen several Yul Brynner films -- yet this is his best performance as the camera captures his emotions as he sees himself at his most vulnerable. The actor is in the best possible shape when he returns to acting in his 30th year of acting. That he is in the strongest possible shape is in part due to years of exercise, and part due to age -- he is at age 77. He is also at his most powerful physically and emotionally in his performance, in part thanks to his love for and appreciation of his wife Rosalind Russell.

I am partly a fan of Miyazaki's work. I say "partly" because most of his films fall into two categories: brilliant, and boring. Sadly this film falls into the later category.This film suffers from the same fundamental problems as Miyazaki's recent film "Howl's Moving Castle". An intriguing premise is set up, but then immediately reduced to little more than a backdrop for some unfathomable events that only serve to confuse the plot rather than explain it.The first third of the film reveals the post-apocalyptic world the story is set in, and actually looks like an very interesting story is about to unfold.

I understand the purpose of the director to tell stories that aren't stories, but the way he tried to show time passing by (the couple of joggers, who first appear jogging together, than jogging with a stroller (sic! ), than the man alone...) and to link the "adventures" of the characters (the final scene, with the maid climbing a mountain seeing the big black guy on another cliff, and then seeing the boat with her former employer and saying "Oh, a boat!") were awful.

Earth Final Conflict began like a new world , a new vision from the creator of Star trek , something so different than all the old stories , the new world , the old world a place of hope where there is a new hope and hope is the way

The world that we know and love are just a dream . the world is just a dream we are dreaming for the future of the whole planet . there is no such thing . there is no such things as evil . all evil things have a past and a future .

I loved so much last Bellocchio 's movie , the masterpiece `` L'Ora di Religione '' . It had a great impact on a good part of world . This film , in particular , will be remembered , as well , for its extraordinary story . So , I do not know how to describe it . At the end , I think , we can say that it will remain one of the most beautiful films , in fact , that I have ever watched . After all , the story is one of a young woman , born without a uterus , who is forced to have an ectopic pregnancy .

I found this movie immensely interesting yet a little jaded, it talks of violence and what there doing, I still don't see the point in becoming terrorists in order to stop the terrorists. We have similar people in the United States and other countries justifying the use of violence and war tactics because they think they are right. Think of the Puritans,and the Christian crusades against the Islamic people during the Medieval times. Lots of blood and death far exceeding the violence of today, the western world has had a negative impact on the religion.

Lame. Lame. Lame. Ultralame. Shall I go on? There is one, I repeat *one* funny scene in this entire, drawn-out, anti-amusing Amateur Hour Special of a film: Fares Fares' fat father knocking someone over with his beer gut. That's it. The rest of this shockingly mediocre pile of nothingness consists of the usual trademark bored-looking Swedish "actors" delivering dialogue which goes into one ear and out of the other, a banal story, sloppy direction and, well, little else worth mentioning.

`` No one really knows how the Power came to be . Not even the Book of Damnation recorded its descent into the realm of demons . But that doesn't matter, as the truth is in this, that the Power was once pure and holy and the very foundation on which it rests . "I'm going to leave you now with these words. They're meant to give you a taste of the power, and an inkling as to how much is there . The Power of the Book of Power resides in the mind of the Power.

I watched the movie with tears and smiles alternatively . Anger surged in me to see the ruin of Hanoi. But I’m not a Buddhist, and that’s why, I have to ask this question, is it worth it? If you’re not one, you should go ahead and go back and see what happened. You may not understand. Do you have a reason why you’re angry, because this is for you to judge, is it your will or your desire? You can do anything you want or desire.

When I was driving home after work , I bought some movies for my four year old twins . I was very impressed that this movie was rated G . My friend told me that this was a movie I have never seen and that I should not see it because it is too scary. Well, here is why . It is not my friend but a good friend of mine . I do not think this movie is scary at all . In fact , I thought this movie was great . This movie was so much fun that my friend and I both cried .

I have a hard time putting into words just how wonderful this was . Once in a while you see an organization that makes me question just how blessed I am to even be a part of it . . . and to have the opportunity to work with these amazing people is an unbelievable blessing . I am not quite sure just how I would ever describe this company . It feels like a family . I love these people . They are my family . . . I love the job I have and would do it again . . . I feel that I am blessed.

I would like to tell you just a few things before considering seeing this movie . If at one point i had known what was in store, i would never have recommended it to you. But there is a lesson to learn here. I am sure many will disagree with this, but I promise you, that this is true. I am also going to tell you that i do not recommend reading or watching this because you are going to be disappointed in it, but I will explain why i think this is a bad idea.

ROCK STAR is a well-told Hollywood-style rendition of the tale based on fact actually on how Ripper became Rob Halford’s name. ROCK STAR is the true story of Ripper, a British bandit who’d robbed hundreds of people across London’s East End between 1879 and 1885. As he tried to escape with the loot, he was pursued by the police, including a posse led by Halford. The story has been retold in a dozen films and countless books. Here’s how it became a hit in the 1960s:

ROCK STAR was first released in 1962.

when i first saw this movie i was literally rolling around on the floor laughing ( especially when they were talking to the man ) i thought the entire time it was like a zombie movie , like it was real and not fiction . and then theres the scene where they all went to the store and they ran into that old man in the back of the store where all of them had to run through and then they ran back into the man who killed all of them i thought was so crazy i had to watch it over and over .

River 's Edge is an excellent film and it 's a shame that it has n't made more of a splash. It had promise but it never managed to catch fire. There are no real flaws, just a few good scenes and some nice moments of genuine horror. The main reason this film is so underrated though is because there was so little to say and so many things that we can do with the time we are given. As you would expect the film starts with two kids on a road trip and a car breaks down.

Death Camp Opera: Right Here, Right Now!Ten years ago, I read that a very special movie had been directed about the polarization of our society. A certain Peter Watkins was the author. His picture was acted by some non-professional actors, citizens like you and me and others. The violence of the atmosphere was described as extremely realistic. Was it a movie, a documentary? Both actually.Over the years, I realized how hard it was to find it. Maybe I would, by coincidence? Anyway, it's yet an old story. I saw it a short while ago.

This is one of my three all-time favorite movies . My only quibble is that the director , Peter Yates, is not particularly good. It’s a movie that’s well acted , and he makes a lot of sense in his dialogue. The story itself, though well-conceived and executed, was a bit of a bore. I’d have loved to see him stick with the movie and try to make something interesting out of it , but the movie just doesn’t work. So I saw it again, only this time I didn’t enjoy it as much .

How any of you gave this more than 2 stars amazes me . I made an account on IMDb just a couple of hours ago. So I am sure this will be my last watch on this series. It was a very good series and one that I will always keep coming back too. But, I could not be mad at all at this . I am sad to see this go. I have seen so many great series this past year but I am very glad that this will not last longer than 2 seasons. Thank you for this show.

This is one great, sweeping, movie you will remember for a long time. It is about history, America, the change of times, Teddy Roosevelt, Morocco, a kidnapped American and her children, and the leader of the Berbers, with the blood of the Prophet in his veins.This movie is based on a true story--like Jesse James was a banker. An American WAS kidnapped in Morocco and the Marines went part-way to the shores of Tripoli to rescue him. So much for that. You know Hollywood. Sean Connery is the Berber chieftain and Muslim leader.

A group of four young men, attending a prestigious private school, belong to an old covenant that was formed by their ancestors during the time of the witch hunts of the late 1600s. They each possess a power that ages them whenever they use it and they suspect that a new kid at the academy might be from a family that was thought to have perished long ago. This new guy wants everyone's power for himself.This not a horror movie as it tries to present itself as. Yes, there is magic and all that supernatural stuff, but this is really just an action movie.

For anyone who has ever sought happiness, "Half Empty" is a must-see. This original cross- cultural musical comedy has hilarious numbers, which make "The Producers" seem boringly staid. Writer Bob Patterson puts his soul into sharing his thoughts on life, wisdom and happiness, even scribbling inspirational comments on index cards as his girlfriend spills her heart out, ending their relationship. When his book on happiness, "North Star" finds zero success in the States, his publishers send him to Germany for a book signing tour.

The "silver screen" gets freshly polished with this beautiful film about aging happily and enjoying life's rainbows. There's plenty of silver hair on this silver screen, but the film's namesake is more like 85-going on-25 with his energy, humor and lust for life. The story of entertainer extraordinaire Uncle Frank, his devoted wife Aunt Tillie, and the zippy residents of the local area nursing homes inspires us to "live each day as if it's your last" and brings a glimmer of hope to those often-dreaded golden years. A great movie for young and old audiences!

This seemed to be a lackluster film to me that betrays a low budget with poor cinematography and not all that great of a job of editing. It may be of interest to those who know something about submarines during the World War II era, but I recommend that all others beware. Many of the scenes in this film were flat and some of the actors were a bit weak. The story about the men getting called back to duty during a short leave seems realistic enough, but there's no real pacing or tension in the story.

Alfred Hitchcock made this comedy of mis-marriage in 1941 but his heart does n't appear to be in it . . . at least not the way he's been telling it for over a century. . . . "I was a fool to think I could win a case in the United States . . . I knew that I could not win it . . . not even with all my efforts could I win it." . . . Alfred Hitchcock, in a speech in Washington in 1963 to mark the 25th anniversary of his trial. But that's the thing.

I finally saw LAURE and I have to say that I equally enjoyed it and was dismayed by it. What's great about it is the atmosphere, the music, the location, the cinematography and the beautiful cast. The story is non-existent for sure but with these movies it doesn't really matter. The pace in languid and the settings are exotic. The film has a lot going for it. Unfortunately, it also has a few things going against it. The first thing is that the gorgeous Annie Belle and the handsome Al Cliver have no chemistry whatsoever.

I saw this film many years ago, and absolutely hated it -- I could not wait for it to end, and would have walked out, but there was a girl sleeping on my shoulder. You know what? I have never forgotten this film, and more, I would say that it continues to haunt me with its images and music over the years. How many movies have I wept over and laughed over in the moviehouse, then forgotten as soon as I hit the street, like ... you see, I can't even think of one!

Admirable but weak James Bond film mainly because both the hero (Bond) and villain (Blofeld) were seriously miscast. Lazenby is too big and innocent looking to play Bond. He looks and acts more like the good-natured but dim-witted sidekick in a police action movie. The director and writer try to establish his credibility, but his saying of lines like "Royal Baluga, North of the ..." just aren't effective in establishing him as this worldly and suave rogue. Savalas doesn't do a bad job, but his characterization and behavior is more fitting of a mob gangster.

What has Rajiv Rai done to himself ? Once a hit director of films like Tridev and Vishwatama is now at loggerheads with Rajnikanth over the direction of his upcoming film. Rajiv has given a letter to Rajnikanth in which he has challenged him to direct a movie in Hindi or not to work for him at all. Rajiv was quoted saying,

If I can't tell you whether I want to work in Hindi, I am not going to work at all. I will let you have the final word of that. I will be writing a letter in your name asking you whether you want to do an English film.

If you wondered whether Disney could broadcast a show with a character more spoiled than Paris , more shallow than the Big Book of Jell-O salad, you needn't look further than its latest incarnation. For the first half of the current episode of "The Venture Bros." (and the first episode of "The Venture Bros. Original Family Series," which I'm pretty sure is the best in the bunch by a large stretch) I'm referring to one of the most ridiculous, unearned character arcs of the show's young life.

I think this is one of the best tamil movies i've seen in a while. i love the fact that it doesn't revolve around a guy and girl falling in love and they made the movie brilliantly. The cast did a great job and i especially congratulate the litte girl. She was brilliant and really brought out the feeling of an adopted child searching for her real mother. Best of all are the songs, beautiful music and moving lyrics. There are some great songs in this move ya'll! especially 'Kannathil Mutthamittal' and 'Velai Pookal'.

The film was half over before I managed to figure out what was going on. It's a dog's breakfast of a movie about four family Thanksgiving dinners. The cliches and stereotypes tumble over each other. When it's all over ten hours later --- well, it seems like ten hours --- you're puzzling over what it was all about. I don't want to see a movie about dinner table squabbling. There is enough of it in my own family. The turkeys looked pretty good. The rest gave me indigestion.

Chupacabra : Dark Waters has to rank as one of the most insipidly moronic movies ever made . I had to give it at least one star, I could not give this thing a higher. It just does not deserve the title it holds. There are so many ways in which Chupacabra can fail. The first and most obvious flaw, is the use of the term "chupacabra." It makes no sense, or at least any sense that I'm familiar with. It makes even less sense when you see how the term is defined.

In Everything Is Illuminated , Elijah Wood plays Jonathan Foer , a Jewish American who is looking for the woman he loved years ago. A woman who can’t remember his name, but doesn’t have to. A woman who is looking to reconnect with a man who can. Foer, who has a troubled past, takes a job as a clerk at an antique store, hoping to reconnect with the love of his life, his mother. Foer falls in love again, only to lose his job, his new love, and his mom.

During an eight-year stretch of the 1980s when Charles Bronson made nine films, only one was released by a company other than the Cannon Group: 'The Evil That Men Do,' a TriStar Films pickup from Sir Lew Grade's ITC Entertainment firm. Bronson was already in the thick of his collaborations with director J. Lee Thompson, which ran through numerous actioners until 'Kinjite: Forbidden Subjects' in 1989.Expectations should run pretty high with Bronson and Thompson working for a better-funded outfit like ITC, but 'The Evil That Man Do' is a great disappointment on many levels.

This movie is amazing . You will NEVER laugh harder . It 's a target . No , I think that the target is all of us , because it 's about how far we are from God and from each other , and if you are not careful , it will be like that . In the movie we learn that there is only One , but we are told to love and accept and respect our fellow man . If there is another man in our life that we want to kill , it is our job to do it .

If extreme activities (and I don't mean the Hollywood ones like UFC & X-Games) and the people who pursue them interest you then seek this doc out.This is one of those truth-is-stranger-than-fiction tales of Donald Crowhurts's obsession to prove himself against great odds. Those odds were stacked by Mother Nature, the media and his own mind. It is also about a time lost to us --although it was only 40 years ago.The filmmakers have done a great job in gathering a wide range of material to tell his story and the story of the great race that consumed him.

I saw this on a screener DVD a couple months before it was released.I liked the main characters and the overall story but some scenes are pretty sloppy and confusing. The sets were fitting but a few just looked like left overs from Freaks & Geeks or reminded me of a cell phone commercial shot in a middle class home. Definitely not what the DVD cover claims, "Destined to be the next stoner classic", hardly.Wardrobe and hairstyles are done well and yes, there are some really pretty girls in this, always nice to see a good looking cast.Almost every scene contained guitar that just droned on and on.

This is a stereotype plot. A young fighter tries to enter a competition when he is not ready and is not selected to represent his fighting school. This leads to separation from the fighting school and naturally he finds a strange new master to teach him to fight.The fights are not of high standards. They are way too "simple" in a way that 1+1 is simple to every adult. The fighter has trained and enters the ring, but does not do what he trained and gets an ass kicking. The coach yells do this and do that with no success.

I have seen this movie three times . Going back to VCR 's , in the 1980 's , and the first time we went to the theater. I thought it was one of the worst movies ever made. I still have nightmares from it. I guess this is not too long after the fact. The movie is supposed to be a sequel , but the writers have decided to kill the main characters . They don't really give a fuck about them . It's not even clear what part they're playing . All we have is two actors in the roles, and no director.

Punishment Park is a brilliant piece of cinema. Shot in the SouthernCalifornia desert using his patent faux documentary style, Watkinscreates a film like no other. He follows two groups of prisoners (onepre-sentenced the other post-sentenced) throughout the picture. After they're tried by a military tribunal, they have the choice of eitherserving out a prison sentence or they can participate in PunishmentPark (a grueling three day hike through the desert with nothing but theclothes on their backs) whilst being hunted down by local lawenforcement officers who use the park as a live action trainingground). I can't say enough about this movie.

What to say about "Dead End Road"...Lets just say that Edgar Allen Poe would have been so ashamed. The acting, writing, effects, and everything in this movie was just horrendous. That doesn't even do justice! This movie was the biggest piece of garbage I have ever had to sit through. That is also why I stopped it about 20 minutes before the ending because personally I didn't care what happened to the characters. I have seen bad but this was definitely the worst. I got hyped up for this because I am a fan of Poe and this was just bad.

With actors like Depardieu and Richard it is really a hard task to make a dull movie. But Weber is a master in setting a slow pace and making supposedly funny scenes without any wits and depth. This movie is high on story but low on character. You never get to know any of the characters except for superficial slapstick. Unfortunately Weber has no idea what slapstick is all about. His style could be described at hit and miss. Of course some people laugh when they see someone slip on a banana peel. Weber directs his humor at this lot.

The story of a Volcano erupting downtown L.A. sounds like a nice plot for a disaster movie. This one though, is missed bigtime. The movie looks chaotic, has a storyline which is hard to follow or believe and the acting was very bad.Im in agreement with a lot of comments that Lee Jones is only good at bossing people around as a chief in some particular field. In this one, he is heading the emergency office. Being chief of such an office it naturally is a good idea to bring along your daughter to dangerous scenes. Clever thinking.

Wow, Stella Shorts are great! Lots of patrons from The State and Stella, the TV show. I never knew that Stella could have gotten any better then they were on the TV show Stella or even Comedy Central Presents: Stella. I also never knew short comedies could be any good. My favorite ones were Pizza, Racking Leaves, The Woods and David arranges to a meeting with his long lost cousin Greg. I think over all that David was the funniest one. Its funny when he doesn't make sense. I like the music in the shorts.

I enjoyed very much the movie wooden camera . I think it 's a little bit influenced by the Brazilian movies . In my case I am not fond of the camera . It has a strange way of focusing . Sometimes when I try to move the camera lens , I am not able to move the camera at all , or I am able to move a little bit but it is useless . I did not have this problem while shooting . Then I was curious if you can help me , it 's really annoying . The camera seems to be too heavy and it does not work well .

This is a serious film about black revolutionaries and not really an action film. Billy Dee plays a young man fed up with racism who decides to take things into his own hands. It's fairly gritty and realistic without exploiting the characters but still it's not that interesting either and Billy Dee's character, though maltreated by white authority figures, doesn't really come off as sympathetic. It's also hurt by it's extremely low budget. Still, it's interesting to look at as it's a good depicttion of 1970s social issues.

This is the first porn I 've ever tried to review . It demands a different approach than usual , and I think that's a good thing . There are several good things with it , that make it worthwhile , but I won't spoil it for everyone . The first thing that I noticed , is that it's a bit dark . I normally like a bit of contrast and contrast and contrast . So I guess that the contrast is what made me decide not to like the film . There is some very strong contrast between the two types of porn , and that contrast is what makes for a different experience .

Leonard can write lyrics, but he sure can't sing. Nor has he had an original idea in his life, just a floater. From the looks of this nasty little puff piece (note that his publishers, McClelland and Stewart were involved in the production), he didn't know how to live, either. The woman he loves is only mentioned in passing and no woman is allowed to speak in this nonsensical advertisement. While Irving Layton was given a credit, the other poet interviewed, Earle Birney, was to remain nameless.

Okay they tell you it's real. They don't list any screenwriters or directors, but one viewing of this movie will prove to anyone - It's not real in the way you were hoping for. The speaking rarely sounds like real natural talk...but also down not sound to be scripted. (possibly loosely scripted). To me it sounded much more like they were always trying to ad-lib. (which they almost always did poorly). Therefore, they knew they were making a 'movie', not just collecting real natural footage.

This film reeks of production line planning . It appears like the filmmakers looked at recent hit movies , and decided that the formula they had established for those movies was still applicable for this project . If I were to guess , the filmmakers have decided that the way to market this movie is by trying to appeal to every possible demographic with this film . The fact that this film is a big budget production , with huge budgets in the film , and this is a movie about the Vietnam War ? Well, that's an easy sell .

I know little or nothing about astronomy , but nevertheless ; I was , at first , a little sceptical about the claims of these books , but , after looking through them ,I have become much more impressed , with what I have read . I think that this is what the science of this age is about , it is the advancement of science . These books should be read ,and studied for years before they are believed , rather than just thought . It is strange , but , there is no such thing as a scientific truth. The truth is simply what works and what is true.

Mikio Naruse 's examination of the lives of three idling , constantly complaining , single ex-geishas in post-war Japan is a fascinating look at the lives of individuals and their families. Naruse's book has a lot of potential for teaching us about Japanese history. The life of Mikio Naruse has a lot to teach us. He is a graduate from Tokyo University and a post-graduate from Oxford University in history. Naruse's books are based on research in Tokyo, Japan and in England. Naruse has lived in a number of Japanese cities. His books are also written in English and are available in Japan and in English.

First of all I hate those moronic rappers , who could'nt act if they had a gun pressed against their forehead.I would rather listen to a decent rapper than any of the stupid ones, but this is something that should never have to happen.I dont care if you are black , white , latin or jewish . You are still a man and you should always treat women as your equal .If you do then thats all that matters. I hope you get the message and realise that you have your place and you dont need to put a gun to a woman's head.

I had high hopes for this film when I saw the listing and decided to watch it on TV, uninterrupted by commercial breaks. I've liked Lee Van Cleef in many movies but I'm afraid that having the other characters call him Chris repeatedly doesn't turn him into even a reasonable facsimile of Yul Brenner's Chris.I found this movie to be a complete disappointment - the music sound track tried to impart the magnificence portrayed in the original but it too failed to bring the film up the the standard of the original. The rich textures of the characters in the original were mostly missing from this film.

This show started out okay, but then it turned into a nightmare. The worst part about it was the contestants. Most of them were weirdos. They did stupid things for a living and they also did strange hobbies. In the second season, one guy said he that he talked to his pants. That is sick and repulsive. Also, no one cared about winning money. All they ever wanted to do was make alliances like it was "Survivor" or something. The men were always afraid that the women were going to team up together.

If you can stomach the campiness, this movie should make you laugh out loud several times. It did for me, at least. I'll only mention one of my favorite elements: the "underwater shots" of the "fish" "swimming". The sound which accompanies those shots is great too.One last note: William Katt is actually a pretty decent actor. I hope he gets another day in the sun; watching him as "The Greatest American Hero" was a fun part of my childhood a couple of decades ago, and he hasn't been very visible since.

Going into the movie with the right expectations , I somewhat liked this movie . Like most reviewers who have been around for quite some time , I enjoyed the movie . I felt the story was strong , but it did not make me think it would be an interesting movie . The movie was not exciting , and the ending was not one that made you feel like you were watching something special . There is something about this film that I liked , I felt the story was interesting , and the characters are well done .

This movie has a very deep look at the relationships between a mother who was raised in a Christian environment and learned that appearance is everything. She and her son, who just recently returned from Vietnam collide in some very tense issues. The relationship has no connections intimately and is a great accurate portrayal of what it is like to live with someone who is false and only looks at the surface of issues. Kathy Bates does an excellent job of portraying a woman of false faith who is either oblivious to her cruelty, forgetful or just doesn't want to be confronted.

My mom and I went to the Ft Worth Premiere mainly to see George Strait , but ended up getting so many tickets for both concerts that I could have easily taken them home and done with it. I have a couple of DVDs of both concerts I would like to watch but don’t really like to waste my time on them. I also have a DVD of “One Night in Paradise” that I watched with a few people a few years back, which was a bit too long at only about an hour and a half.

Death in Venice is a movie I need to see once every ten years. It is always different, because I am always at a different stage of life.The movie is about art, beauty, longing, death. Some scenes are painfully slow, others simply annoying to watch, especially if you have seem them before. Yet I would not want to miss a single frame. The music is repetitive, the main theme of the adagietto from Mahler's fifth is used again and again. Yet I would not want to miss a single note.

After five years in prison , Tony le Stéphanois ( Jean Servais ) meets his dearest friends Jo ( Carl Dixen ) and Jean ( Roger Allambert-Lambert ), and decides to leave prison. The film ends with a scene showing Jean's departure from the house in the film with his friends and the departure of Jo and others from the jail. The house is empty, Jo and Jean left behind in prison. Plot
At the beginning of the film, Jo (Cherie) and Tony (Jean Servais) are locked up in prison, and have no friends or relations.

If I'm not honest I just want to write a review on it, so if you're willing I would like to share this review. It is so bad it is funny and very good. This is a classic. This is probably the only good movie this decade, if you want to watch this film you have to wait a few more years to see it.

I love this movie. It is the first film Master P have ever done. It is based on the story of his life. It is low-budget, but it is very good. It shows how Master p grew up in projects in New Orleans.Not only did Master P start in this movie, he also was the writer and director with Moon Jones. The DVD also has The No Limit ice cream party on it. This movie shows how Master P goes from bad too good and how he had to deal with the things around him.

In the twilight years of his career , Charles Bronson forged long-running partnerships with several directors , most notably J. Lee Thompson and Charles Vidor

“Charles Bronson and I had a very good time together. The first time was when I directed him as a supporting character,” said Thompson, who first met him in 1938. “He was very funny and a brilliant writer, and I found myself in a position where I could be creative for him on screen.”

“I first met him a few years ago. I had an idea to do something with him in ’42 and was trying to do something.

Well, I've watched this movie for over 25 years now and it's still almost as interesting as when I first saw it. It is definitely one of the most unique films ever made.I still think Martin Sheen got "dissed" big-time in the billing, too. He dominates the film yet gets lesser billing than Marlon Brando, who only appears in the last 30 minutes of this 2 hours, 17 minutes film (theatrical version). How unfair is that?Sheen is fantastic in here, especially his narration, which runs throughout.

As I watched this movie, I felt as if a plastic bag was slowly closing in around my head. The acting was horribly stifling, and it was Bad Acting. The most brilliant piece of acting in the entire film was the guy who had to play laid-out-in-state-in-a-coffin. I felt nothing but relief when it was finally over. I was expecting that this film was going to be some real tragedy, with some deep psychological intrigue in the aftermath. All around it was stupid, no beginning, no climax, no ending, just rambling on and on, and the plastic bag kept getting worse.

When a bomber, a patricide, a pornographer, and a mad biker, together with various other forms of social scum, have had enough of their sh** infested cell, they spot a rat and look for the hole. Escaping from the sewage the group of 9 souls, take advantage of their new found freedom and head for civilization. What soon follows is not surprising. Complete mayhem and terror follow in their wake. It seems that each has some unfinished business to take care of.Loosely based on The Great Escape, 9 SOULS is by far in the top 5 best films I've seen this year.

A vg Brit rom-com, one to watch if you can get your hands on a copy. Quirky and often surprising, this is not the best of Brady's films (Kiss Kiss Bang Bang is by far the funniest), though it does have a unique charm. Well written the story veers off into a few dead ends but mostly surfaces with a new plot high. You know from the start how it's going to end, but when it comes it is honest and very open ended, a realistic and credible ending, the end seemed like a beginning, enjoyable and left me wanting more.

This is a movie from Toilet Pictures. If the name of the production company is any indication how stinky a movie is, then this would be it. I think I'm not really a fan of horror movies, not that I'm chicken, but rather this year alone, I haven't been genuinely spooked by what's on offer so far, be it from the West, or from Asia. 9:56 is no different, great premise, but poor execution, relying on clichéd techniques (I think these are the only tools of the trade available?)

I watch a lot of movies - DVD, features, and classics, you name it. The night I watched JERICHO MILE, my wife (who had ordered it on the internet) said she remembered it from when she was in high school, that it had stayed with her all of these years. Somewhat reluctantly I sat down (with our daughter & son), and was riveted from the opening sequence to the end titles. We all were. She, who remembered the original, and our kids (18 and 16) who had no idea what the movie was about couldn't believe it.

Idiots go camping and act like idiots before they finally die like idiots , yes Camp Blood ( or if you are from North Texas you just know about it, and if you don't it's still pretty good) , is the best place in Texas for a picnic and get away from the noise, the crowds , the people and the pollution. I'm not kidding, just a little tip of the iceberg for me. I've been camping in Texas since 2001 and have done it a few different times. You won't believe the noise and the pollution!

Another sequel ! Why on earth do they keep making these ? This has got to be the weakest 'franchisee' movie I've seen in my lifetime and I saw it 2 years ago so maybe I have a bit of bias but it was a bit crap to be honest. 1. It's obvious from the trailers this was going to be crap and the only way to get past it was to watch the trailer for the second one. 2. The characters are not developed enough and it seems to be a waste of time to go through the character list for this one.

I viewed my videotape last night , for the first time in at least ten years . I found the story a little more disturbing , but also a bit more humorous at the same time . It is also very well written , with excellent character development . I think this story is worth a read if you want to hear more about the life of a serial killer and how he has been treated in court by both the media and law enforcement . A little bit of backstory can add a lot to the overall story if you take the time to understand how the victim of this heinous crime was created .

I missed the full four hour version when it was originally released in theaters because it played one week. I had to settle for seeing the shorter two and a half hour version a year or so later and was left stunned by what I saw. I left the theater thinking I had witnessed a masterpiece and wondering what the full version was like.The full version is mostly good but it has sequences that are so incredibly dull that the whole movie is pulled down and almost sinks beneath the waves.The problem is entirely in the editing which should be labeled as the final word on excess.

( This review does not necessarily expose the plot of the movie , however it may change one 's expectations )

Somewhere during the late 90's there was a well known band. They used to get together for one or two gigs and then split up. Well, that was until they came out with their first full length album and started making music. This was a period where a lot of bands were starting up. One thing that I love about them is that they wrote their own songs and were writing for themselves as well as other bands.

I rented this movie because I am a huge Dudikoff fan. I figured it couldn't be that bad. Boy was I wrong! At the 15 minute mark , I was begiing the others to let me rip the DVD out and fling it back to the rental store, but they refused. They swore it had to get better.They were wrong! This movie was lacking everything. The actors delivered their lines with as much emotion as a comatose rock! The plot was ridiculous and I was offended that Hollywood assumed people were dumb enough to enjoy it.

I just viewed Eddie Monroe and I was very impressed. The story was easily paced as the plot unraveled to a surprise ending. Heartwarming performances, action, humor, and drama filled the screen. Topnotch acting by some talented Long Islanders. Great script. This is the best film that Fred Carpenter has made to date, he should be very proud of this work. Doug Brown's score is on the mark. Craig Morris is the next Tom Cruise or Brad Pitt. Hard to believe this is a low budget, independent film. Just imagine what Carpenter can do with a Hollywood level budget.

This is a classic continuation to Bleu , the likewise excellent film , with Juliet Binouche as a main star. I can’t quite remember when this one was released but it was probably about 4 years ago I believe. I found the movie quite enjoyable but didn’t think much of the plot. In fact, I found it rather odd at first. I was very disappointed when I started watching and realised it was only a prequel story. The story was good and all the characters were quite interesting. I did have some issues with the movie though.

I just watched this , an early Harold Lloyd short film that featured his `` glasses '' character on Kino-Eye. This film was released in 1931. Here is a clip of the film. I watched it and was impressed. Here are a few of my own thoughts about the brief but interesting scene:

1) The glasses are clearly the most important of the three characters and the most important to this film. 2) Lloyd had a definite sense of humor and made a few gags with the character. The scene is brief and interesting enough.

What to say about this movie ? A married couple has more then just each other . After playing around together for quite awhile . The wife wants to end it . But the husband is still married . So he decides to have a try . The wife will never be able to find the man that really loves her . . . This film is about a married couple with a son . Their marriage has become strained over time . As the marriage continues to strain the son . His father tries to talk to the boy about his mother . But he only wants to be left alone .

`` Scientists at a remote lab experiment on ( insert scaly creature here ) and create out of control monsters. We are not sure if they will turn out evil, or help us to do our job better. There are several possible outcomes, and the only one that makes a great sense is that one of them will not make it out of the lab alive. I have a question. Can this be resolved by any of us? Should we try to kill the "bad" creatures and let them go? Or should we use the "evil" creatures to help us solve the problem?

My Mother Frank begins as a warm , amiable comedy about a middle-aged Catholic woman ( Frank , short for Franciscan Mary ) who decides to take her troubled son out into the world to try out his faith. When she learns that he has never gone to confession, Frank begins to see that there has been something wrong all along. But it turns out that she has never asked for forgiveness from her son, or indeed for anything, and she will be forced to give herself completely to Christ if she will accept him into her family and into her life.

Yes, I spelled that right. This movie is so predictable, the actual word needs additional letters to exemplify the predictability. From the moment the principal characters and situation are introduced, it is paint-by-numbers as to where this plot will take us. The foreshadowing was as subtle as a two ton sledgehammer. You could take numerous pieces of dialogue and anticipate the role it would play in the ending.Catherine Zeta-Jones and Aaron Eckhardt did decent jobs in undemanding roles and Abigail Breslin played the cute role admirably. It's just that the movie brought absolutely nothing new to the romantic comedy genre.

The movie starts out a bit interested with the son interested in a teenage girl his own age . Clayburgh goes to take pictures of himself and his mom and dad on vacation and gets to know his dad. Clayburgh is in his 20's and his mom is in her 40's and he thinks he has a future in music. He also thinks that he's a lot smarter then his dad. He's a very nice kid, but he also has his own little issues that come to the surface. His mom gets very depressed and he is a little too sensitive sometimes.

First of all, before I start my review, I just read every review for 'The Muppet Movie' here and I can't believe that someone could give a negative review to a movie like this. (Fortunately there was only one.) I mean, I can understand how someone may not like 'Star Wars' due to the whole Sci-Fi genre, but to not like a movie starring some of the most lovable puppets in the history of mankind is almost sad. Okay, I will step off my soapbox now and review this movie. 'The Muppet Movie' came out when I was seven.

Its a very sensitive portrayal of life with unquenched or constrained desires. What does one do with desire in a culture and society with rigid norms? One husband finds outlet with the immigrant - since immigrants don't belong or aren't accepted, they don't need to conform and dam their desires. The other husband looks for solace in spirituality and tries to evaporate his desire into nothingness. It fails - of course - and he breaks down in the last scene for multiple reasons. Sita still cared enough for him to find that moment to let him know that he is not responsible for her deviant outlet to her blocked desires.

Although at times I was the only one in the cinema who was laughing, this is the main pleasure I took from the beautifully shot "Thirst" - laughter. Although sometimes it seemed that the movie had an identity crisis and didn't know whether it was a tragedy or a comedy, the blackest of black humour shone through at regular intervals. It helped of course that it the standard of acting by everyone concerned was wonderful, and that I was slightly obsessed by the at times wicked leading lady, who was gorgeously elegant no matter how blood soaked and malevolent she became.I read reviews that suggested this movie was overlong.

The good things first: I agree with another viewer who said that Gene Raymond has a marvelous drunk scene. He does -- I was tickled to finally get a chance to laugh. And there were other moments I found amusing -- Raymond's parents in the bathroom with the defective plumbing, and the scene in the restaurant with Robert Montgomery trying to make Carole Lombard jealous by mouthing sweet nothings to a stranger. But overall, I was dismayed. I love Carol Lombard and most of Hitchcock. And I understand the restrictions laid on productions by the Hays Code.

Until I did a Web search on `` What Alice Found '' , I did n't realize that the name is the one on the title page. This means that the book was published more than a year before the actual title was published. There are also a few footnotes and other material not included on the title page. I've included the actual book page and the page number for the title page on the back matter. Thanks for pointing this out! My question is: is it possible for me to have a link on the front of the book for the author?

In yet another case of misleading marketing , this film is included in a 10-movie DVD set called `` Women in World History '' . The title is misleading because this DVD set includes several of the best films on women's history . What is interesting is the fact that the other 9 films on this set are all films by male directors . When you compare these 10 films it is easy to see why female directors are not in the running when it comes to film awards . In fact it seems to be the opposite when you consider the movies in the `` best films on women's history '' DVD collection .

This movie looked like it was rushed to release for some reason . Definitely not a well made movie . The story was kind of weak . The acting was good although I felt like there was too much dialogues . I thought the music was cool but it wasn’t very well done . And the animation is really bad . The characters don’t look real . The story and characters of this movie look really old . I would like to see a story where there’s no story at all . The story and characters were pretty good but the acting wasn’t that good .

I admire Deepa Mehta and this movie is a masterpiece. I'd recommend to buy this movie on DVD because it's a movie you might want to watch more often than just once. And trust me, you'd still find little meaningful details after watching it several times.The characters - except for the grandmother perhaps - are all very balanced, no black and white. Even though you follow the story from the perspective of the two protagonists, there is also empathy for the other characters.I think the IMDb rating for the movie is far too low - probably due to its politically controversial content.

Detective Dave Robicheaux is trying to link the murder of a local hooker to New Orleans mobster Julie Balboni. But during his investigation Robicheaux is led into a series of surreal encounters with a troop of Confederate soldiers? ?, What a awful plot and it was worser than i had expected. it was real slow and had minimal skill in the acting i could not watch through it it was waste of my time. Another FLOP, i would give it under 1 if i could please people don't waste your time its 1:42m of wast-full time. Actor Elrod Sykes and his girlfriend driving under the influence.

Ghilli is the best movie of vijay & one of the biggest hit in his career.... As I had not seen the Telegu movie so I could enjoy this movie even more.The story is about a girl wanting to escape the clutches of a local goon who wants to forcibly marry her. Since he is a goon so no body is ready to help the heroine. Vijay who had come to play a Kabaddi match there sees this and decides to help her. The rest of the movie is how vijay helps her & how the girl ultimately escapes the clutches of the goon & the goon's father's political cronies.

The Brave One is about a New York radio show host named Erica Bain (Jodie Foster). Her life is a dream living in the city she grew up in and loves. She has her great fiancé David (Naveen Andrews), whom she is planning to marry. But one night while Erica and David are out walking their dog, they are attacked and mugged by a group of degenerates, leaving David dead. Erica recovers but is heartbroken and traumatized later on, and can barely cope with real life anymore. She buys a gun off a guy on the streets for protection.

I have never seen this in the theater, my second viewing was tonight on big screen DVD as opposed to old VHS tape from rental store.Saucey for it's time and I'm sure the Hayes code was pushed to it's limits.Hitch's pallet here is the "game play" between two combatants. And yes if Guy calls the cops on Bruno right away the movie is 63 min shorter, HELLO people do you always make the best or most logical choice. How many times have you been in either person's shoes and made the right choice?

A vg Brit rom-com , one to watch if you can get your hands on a copy . Quirky and quirky are the keys words here , and a couple of things you won't see in the trailer . First off , for some reason the trailer is in 3D . Second , I don’t see any woman on the screen , they’re all white and bald , it looks like they are all wearing a white dress , like the people on the cover . Third , the plot is about a girl trying to find her way in the world .

"The Man From Utah" opens with a singing cowboy strumming a guitar on horseback. This is how we're introduced to John Weston (John Wayne), heading into town and looking for work. When he helps Marshal Higgins (George pre-Gabby Hayes) foil a bank robbery with his fancy shooting, the marshal offers him an undercover job as a deputy to investigate the Dalton Valley Rodeo. Apparently, the annual winners of the big prize money in the rodeo are a tight knit band of bad boys in the employ of Spike Barton (Ed Peil), who also happens to head up the rodeo committee.

Anything Park Chan-wook creates is guaranteed to be unique , brilliant , and very twisted at a minimum . Well , I will be the first to admit, I am a sucker for Park Chan-wook and his films . His films have always had a special and special charm for me . While the films themselves have been very good in their own right . I can’t wait to watch his newest one . What I really love about this movie is that Park Chan-wook has never been one to follow the rules of the traditional box office . So , he has created an interesting concept in his latest movie .

We sought out this hard-to-find VHS after watching two excellent Merchant-Ivory pictures back to back . Knowing it was an old-school film and a bit rough around the edges (as I'm sure you've noticed) , I wanted to try my hand at making my own. It didn't work, but it was worth it. It's a little more "old school" on the outside (as I said, I don't mind it), but inside it looks fresh and the production is top-notch. (I'm not complaining. I love the story and the characters in this.

SPOILER ALERT! Don't read on unless you're prepared for some spoilers.I think this film had a lot beneath its shell. Besides the apparent connections with "Oldboy" (and Park-wook's other films), an incestuous relation in this one really disturbed me, and also the subtle erotic theme that hung around all the vampiric, physical action.The main actor, Kang-ho Song, is terrific in the rôle of the priest Sang-hyeon - coincidentally, "sang" means "blood" in some languages - who truly loved Tae-ju, played by OK-bin Kim.

I took my 14 year old to see this movie. We left after 15 or 20 minutes. It was absolutely awful! This movie should be rated R at the least. I am not that strict with movies but, this was just too much. It was a waste of money. I thought it would contain some comedy and I knew the comedy would probably be crude but, this was WAY beyond crude. I was sitting there watching and reading (a certain subtitle at the beginning of the movie was what really got me) and I could not believe how crudely sexual it was.

This movie was so frustrating . Everything seemed energetic and I was totally prepared to have a good time . But then I felt it was getting way too long. I am not talking about the whole movie here but I felt like there is no real ending and that it is just a filler to get us through the movie. In fact I would not put it to the level of The Hunger Games and I feel like it should be a better sequel. I have read a lot about the movie and I did like it and thought that it was good.

This was such a great film . It was done with such beautiful design , such symmetry . I love the way they did this movie . It was so great .I loved it . Thank you for making a great movie . Love you . Your work is too beautiful for me to describe . Keep up the beautiful work of you . I am really enjoying this film .I am happy that i have watched it .It was really beautiful .It made me happy .I am very happy . I am going to watch it all the way .

It seems to be a common thing in the 90's to play with cliches. Some manage to do so with great talent. Hervé Hadmar doesn't. On the paper, the movie looked interesting though: the weak plot could have been saved by great moments of comedy, dark humour, and a very "décalé" style. Director Hadmar, unfortunately, kills his direction with his camera angles and his absolute lack of rhythm. Every joke is embarassing as no one reacts in the theater. The movie is incredibly slow, and the actors seem to be wondering what the hell they're doing in this ridiculous mascarade.

I do n't care what anyone says , this movie is hilarious ! It combines the bleak seriousness of Threads with the light-hearted humor of Home Alone . The characters are well fleshed out, and have some pretty funny dialog . It's not perfect by any stretch, but it works and has enough charm for me to watch every day . If you have never seen the movie , do yourself a favor and see this one for sure . I can't imagine anything that could have made it worse , and I am still in shock over how good the whole movie is .

Based on the comments made so far , everyone seems to either hate this movie or love it . I don't know which it is. I've seen some very good and some really good reviews from people that are fairly well known in the industry and they seem pretty happy about it. I just read this review from a person that works in the industry and she has a great opinion of it and a lot of other people feel the same. I am going to see it and I hope I like the movie a lot.

This film was a huge surprise to me while i watched it at Cinequest in the big California Theatre in San Jose. It's a musical, which normally I don't like, but I have to say this one was different. Robert Peters, who directed the film and stared in it, did such a wonderful job. During his Q & A he told the audience that he only had two other people for his crew! Most of the dialouge was made up on the fly and he actually made the film while attending another film festival in Germany!

This is one of the best episodes from the entire X-Files series, creepy beyond words. The tension and suspense in this episode is very well executed, in its entire 45 minutes it managed to be almost as scary as an entire movie. This episode joins the ranks of best episodes with such greats as "Home", "Humbug" "Bad Blood" and "Milagro" for being the best in their respective season.Mulder and Scully's growing relationship is put to the test in this episode: Can they really trust each other?

I ca n't knock this film too terribly , because it 's obvious midway through the the watching of it, you 're not watching it as a film anymore. The action sequences are excellent , and the editing is well handled . I 've seen a few films these days where the editing is awful . But this movie is not one of them. It is the perfect blend of everything that I loved in the first film and all of the new and old things that have come along with it . You can 't really fault anything here except maybe the music .

Right this moment I am watching this movie on TV here in Tokyo. Beautiful scenery, beautiful sets of biblical proportions, beautiful costumes, beautiful color, beautiful Gina. Great climactic scene when God destroys the Sheban idol and a lot more with de Millean thunderbolts at the moment when Yul and Gina are about to consummate their love. Yul does a halfway decent job of delivering his lines, though he sounds a lot like Yul delivering his lines as Ramses or Taras Bulba. George Sanders sounds like George Sanders playing George Sanders.

I walked into a book store in Brentwood, Tennessee. I am not going to say the name because I am a dedicated customer. I have been satisfied with every item I purchased there before this one. On display in the front of the store was The Bell Witch Haunting. (Might I mention this is the only store I have seen it for sale in.) I had heard about the story somewhere and remembered it was supposed to have really happened for real. I was very excited and couldn't wait to watch it. I had great expectations for it.

I was looking forward to Dante's contribution to this excellent horror anthology series from Showtime, but this was easily the worst of the bunch. It's really too bad. Part of this may be due to the poor, if odd, choice of source materials. Why Joe didn't just write an original, I have no idea. Instead, we get this soapbox episode where the "message" overwhelms the script, the characters, the staging, everything, and by the end I was just wondering whether it could get any worse, and I won't spoil it...but it ended up getting worse.

Lackawanna Blues is a very moving film depicting an era filled with varying emotions and characters as seen through the eyes of a father and daughter, a mother and son, a widow and a son, and the last remaining son of the town. The film is about the struggles of the family and the people who they meet and the love that binds them. As well, it deals with the issues that affect us all and the importance of family. I first learned of Lackawanna’s film when a friend forwarded me a link to the movie.

This must be the most boring film I ever saw . The only positive I can say about it is that it has a happy ending . Not the usual happy endings for these type of films but it was a pleasant end to the film for me and I got the message of what would have happened in the film . The acting was fine but the script was just boring . And the ending was just so predictable . I felt bored to death . This was just the typical "what would have been" type of ending but it was boring to me as I said before .

What a terrible misfire . Not only the title but the idea is the same as that Jane Fonda , one of the most famous and well-known films in the world . On a positive note the film was actually very good indeed . Not only the plot and the dialogue was interesting , the characters were well written , the performances were all excellent , and the direction was very good . The script was really good too with very well done characters and an interesting plot . The film is also a nice addition to the library and is a shame to miss out .

Although Embryo could have been a potentially thought provoking examination of bioethics , it degenerates into a stereotypical Frankenstein parable. Even the film itself seems to be a bit “sci-fi” like. I’m not entirely convinced that they had a point to it. As with any Frankenstein movie, the idea that all life on earth is the result of a genetic experiment is a bit off base. I don’t think that anyone would want to go out into the countryside and shoot all the trees in a given forest.

Plot Synopsis : Los Angeles in the future . Crime is kept under control by Core Trackers , android assassins . They kill any criminal who stands against them . With the power of an AI , this AI has the ability to kill anyone within a certain radius . One such criminal who stood against the core trackers was a serial killer , he killed a lot of people . When he died , an android came up with the brilliant idea that he killed his own body . The android became a hero , he went on a rampage and killed everyone in the crime ring .

I 'm a big horror film buff , particularly of the 1980 's subgenres . Name one  I 've seen  and they are all terrible. The first  I saw  and I loved it . It wasn't that bad of a horror film  but there is one  and that  is terrible . I think I saw a couple  and they weren't good . The second one  I thought was really good , and that was the one  that is still my favourite , and I'm going to rewatch it one day . The second  I saw  was very scary .

1st watched 7/29/2001 - 4 out of 10 ( Dir-Mark Dindal ) : Fast-paced , frantic animation effort by Ted Field to fill his time. It was good. I'd recommend it. ( Dir-Ron Miller ) : Good . In fact, it would be the best movie I've seen in recent memory. However , it had nothing new or exciting to offer . It was just old fashioned , but good. 1st watched 6/17/2002 - 2 out of 10 ( Dir-Denny O'Neill ) : I found the movie entertaining and educational. However , the movie was a bit too slow-paced for my liking.

Jessica Bohl plays Daphne , the sexually precocious suburban teenager struggling with the hell of high school . Daphne 's a good kid. She's athletic, athletic, athletic. Not the athletic types you find in the movies but that's okay because she's not the type of girl we'd normally think of. And it's not just her athletic talent that makes Daphne a great role model. She is also smart and independent. But she's just not quite the innocent you'd want to imagine for your next high school sweetheart .

This turned out to be more of a women's romance-soap-suspense film than what I hoped it was....simply a tense thriller. Yes, the final 20 minutes were suspenseful but much of the previous 75 bordered on being just plain tedious.Ruter Hauer was a little too subdued, not playing his normal intense character. Natasha Richardson sports somewhat of a dumb look most of the time and her character was very unappealing.The story is so-so. It's not as bad as I'm making out, but it sure isn't anything I'd watch again, and the back of the VHS describing this movie was misleading.

^^contains spoilers^^This movie is utter crap . Do not watch.There is no one in this movie to root for , they are the worst people on earth, they do not deserve to be here and they are the reason that I quit watching a movie because I could see how this movie ended . I will not give my review here but you can watch the first part to get a feeling of how the movie was and how bad it was and then you can go to the second part where it is not bad, the second and third part are not bad either, they're just not bad.

1st watched 4/30/2009 - 4 out of 10 ( Dir-John Waters ) : Corny Waters-like comedy musical with some funny moments. Not sure where it'll end but there's not a bad movie. 2/14/2008 - 4 out of 10 ( Dir-Mitch Leibowitz ) : Terrible film from a terrible director, with terrible music. Not worth renting. 2/5/2007 - 5 out of 10 ( Dir-Robert Downey Jr.) : Not a good film but still watchable, with great music and some cool scenes. 3/5/2007 - 4 out of 10 (Dir-Robert Downey Jr.) : Not a great film, but a decent movie.

If you just want gore , and nothing but gore and torture , you 've come to the right movie. There are a million movies like this . You know that you have found something you 've been waiting for and you 've got your money's worth . __________________

The only thing I'm trying to do is make my life a living hell for those who don't have it and who think they 'll be okay when they are. I'll never get my money's worth for watching this , but I'm hoping that it does have a bit of a plot .

This is a wonderful family sitcom. Rowan Atkinson has appeared in to other excellent sitcoms, The Thin Blue Line (Better than this) and Blackadder (Not better than this).Mr Bean is a no talking, human disaster. He goes to places and gets himself in absolute mayhem, the mayhem includes: Climbing up to the top diving board and is too frightened to jump off, taking about 20 minutes, until some kids eventually throw him off, ending up inside a washing machine and driving his car while sat on a roof.

In this approximately 34-second Thomas Edison-produced short, we see Annabelle Moore performing the Loie Fuller-choreographed "Serpentine Dance" in two different fantastical, flowing robes.Moore was one of the bigger stars of the late Victorian era. She was featured in a number of Edison Company shorts, including this one, which was among the first Kinetoscope films shown in London in 1894.Loie Fuller had actually patented the Serpentine Dance, which Moore performs here in robes (as well as entire frames) that are frequently hand tinted in the film, presaging one of the more common symbolic devices of the silent era.

`` The Moon Is Blue '' director Otto Preminger tackled even more taboo subject matter in his controversial 1955 release ''I Married a Communist'' about an alleged Communist family in Czechoslovakia who killed their son during the Prague Spring. When they were executed, Preminger decided to take the film to America in order to raise money for his family and the Czech film colony in the U.S. Premeditated murder in a communist society was a controversial topic for most Americans, and Preminger found the subject very difficult to broach, so the film was released in Europe as a silent film to avoid any controversy.

A few yrs ago, I remember reading an essay by a feminist film theorist who briefly mentioned Rosalind Russell. This theorist wrote that the 'strength' of the 'strong women' that Rozzie R. played lay partly in their ability to stand by their man (even when he wasn't worth it).I thought of this essay after watching 'Crimes of Passion'.Kathleen Turner exudes the same strength and style as Russell in her portrayal of prostitute China Blue. She's the object of affection for two men: the loony priest played by Anthony Perkins, and a bland whitebread boy who's marriage is slowly fading.
