One of my favorite movies. I like horses, I like happy endings, and I like Walter Matthau. I miss him and am glad to have a great film like this to remind me why he was so wonderful. Watch it with your kids (or your horse).The story of an old hard boot horse trainer with kids, and down on his luck. If you have ever had or appreciated horse racing you will appreciate the rags to riches storyline. It may be a little below "Seabiscuit", but not a lot.

Wow, there are no words to describe how bad this movie truly is. I usually pride myself on being able to enjoy any movie no matter how bad, but this was just too much. I would only suggest watching this movie as a torture device. If you can get past the terrible plot and dialogue by watching it on mute, the even more terrible camera work and shoddy special effects make this movie a real horror. If your thinking about watching this because your a Sandra Bullock fan, don't even bother as she has less than ten minutes of screen time, and her acting is absolutely atrocious.

I have read almost all the books by now, and have seen the musical production in two different languages. I absolutely adored everything that I have been acquainted previously. But lately I've been running out of resources to sustain my fancy. I still have couple of books left, but they are either in transit or they are the sequels which I am not in a hurry to read. So an idea dawned on me - Sink me! There are movies which I have not watched! Thus, I must watch them immediately.The first five minutes of these series were... acceptable.

Nightkill stars Robert Mitchum as a world-weary private eye probing the case of a missing industrialist ( Mike Connors ) who wants to prove his innocence and get the world to know why he has disappeared. It's also a time of rising tensions in the country and, with the help of a secret agency, Mitchum investigates a series of brutal murders that link to a power struggle for the government. Along the way his personal life is brought into focus. The film's title comes from an expression, the phrase "kill the messenger," used by gangsters to intimidate potential informants and informants in turn intimidate other gangs.

The movie is nothing extraordinary. As a matter of fact, it is an insult to the horror genre. Nothing about it borders on scary... not even close to the threshold of scary...It's just another case of "another teenage horror movie"-seen one and you've seen em all. First few minutes in the movie and you'll know what will happen next. The worst part is, the script is blunter than the most recent installment of scary movie. Would have been better if it's written in Spanish.

The only reason there is a question mark in parenthesis is NOT because I haven't seen every film released in 2001 thus far. It's because this film was only made PARTLY in 2001. The rest of it was stolen from Roger Corman's OTHER dinosaur films, Carnosaur 1-3.I have a confession to make. "Carnosaur 2" is perhaps one of my favorite B-movies. It borrows so much from James Cameron's "Aliens" it's not even funny. But I love it. I can't explain exactly why. It just WORKS for me.

Less Than Zero could have been the 80s movie that reveals teenage apathy in its most extreme form had they actually stuck to the damn book. But, where they hadn't, this movie presents does the job, and leaves you with the creepiest feeling when its all over in ways not done until the late nineties with Larry Clark's movies 'Kids' and 'Bully.' Societal outcast teens are faced with a rather curious dilemma (they don't treat it much like one) when their estranged friend (Daniel Roebuck) boasts to them that he killed a teenage girl near the river's edge in their suburban town.

I found it hard to care about these characters, who were either annoying or insipid, all living their fabulously hilariously urban lives.The dialogue was excruiciating at times, and at other times the narrative seemed hard to follow - was it me or were entire scenes deleted?It felt like a poor sitcom somehow turned into a film. The stereotypes and jokes about "men's groups" would perhaps have been funny in the early 90s. As it is, this is where much of the humour of the film comes from - and boy, does it get old fast.Apart from the attractive Irish man - this film was a dud.

This is one of the few movies - maybe the only - that truly haunted me for years . It was about the late 1960s when I was 17 and I found out that I was deaf. I had not really had any issues when it came to using the phone or any other type of communication in general but when I met my first deaf friend for the first time I found I could hear him clearly and I was immediately hooked. We talked for a long time about this and it brought up some of the things I had gone through in my life.

Teenage Exorcist is one of those God-awful films to video that makes the viewer give up any expectations of decent entertainment. We all have seen this film, know it's a shambolic mess of a film, and are expected to love it. But that's really not the point. The point is, the film is a complete and utter failure. The premise is that an evil demon called a demon child or demon baby makes an appearance and kidnaps a young boy. He then proceeds to murder the boy's entire family and take the boy to an occult shrine that's supposed to be located in a castle.

This film gives new meaning to the term "uneven", giving us a few intriguing characterizations offset by an awkwardly realized plot that relies on a few well-placed stingers to deliver the majority of the thrills.The plot concerns a group of men who harbor a secret that has caused a curse to be visited on them in the form of a ghostly female apparation that causes death. She also may be seducing their sons.It is quite a spectacle to have all the notable veteran actors together in one film, but unfortunately they're not very convincing, particularly the scene where Melvyn Douglas goes off the deep end begging the others to listen to him.

This is a film that has to be taken in context . It should n't be seen unless you 've got the money . I have the money but I want you to take it on faith . I'm not going to get involved in the film and I'm not going to take a risk . This is the kind of movie that can be seen on the big screen . That's not the fault of the film's director . He made his movie with that in mind . I'm not saying this is the best film you will ever see .

... than you easily spot the biggest fault of the movie . What was the motive ? The details of the plot are known. It was to create an illusion of a happy ending. It never happened. A couple of things you may ask. What does this mean ? It has to be mentioned that all the main characters of this movie were played by the same guy who made this movie. It was Michael Cimino. His name was played in the title screen . He was a major player in the movie industry and had many friends. But not only this he was a bad actor .

This is a good blueprint for a study of corporate power and the dichotomoy between required public life and the exercise of public power which are essential to any form of government. I should also make reference to A.N. Whitehead in his ‘The Social Problem’ which was published in 1933.”



And what is the most important point you make here? That the state can function as a form of private power? What I think is wrong with this argument is that the state’s functions in society have been made more complex by the fact that the private state is more complicated in its structure.

Bought for £1, Project Vampire is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Wooden acting,lame effects and a terrible storyline all add up to be a movie you have no reason to even want to see. PV is one of those movies that don't even have the good grace to be bad in an enjoyable way, instead this bile seems to try to make itself as offensively dull,stupid and crap as humanly possible.A vampire has created a serum he sells to old people as a life-enhancer, and those who take it fall under his control.

An unintentionally hilarious early talkie melodrama with Kay Francis as the Countess Balakireff chasing everything in pants. At the beginning of the film she "throws back" the stableboy for being too young before setting off for the chauffeur! The high-toned English set she moves in is such a clichéd bunch of harummpf-ers that it's ridiculous. But the topper is Basil Rathbone as an Italian violinist with a Chico Marx accent! "My violeen! How weel I ever play eet again!" "Patreecia, my meelk is cold!" It's campy beyond belief.

I think the `` Bone Snatcher '' should go after anyone associated with this movie . Watching this will seem like a fun movie . There are a couple of flaws that will make it a bore . But for the most part you will find that this movie has a great storyline and it's well acted . If you're a fan of the series then there's no reason not to check it out . I would say that I would like to see this movie a bit further down the road . There's still much to be seen and explored .

Sweet , rich valley girl develops crush on a punk from the alley and when her snobby friends disapprove of him they kick her out. She comes up to town to start a new life with this guy but finds that he’s got more in common with her than she’d originally thought, as he seems to be a good catch. They become good friends despite her snobby ways but things take a turn for the worse when she finds out her crush is also in town and she must decide between being friends or trying to see what the attraction really is.

I just saw this movie for the second time . I first saw it back in the mid-90 's as a young kid and then when I was a teenager in the mid '90s . I did like the original but I found the movie kind of over the top , which is why I haven't liked it very much since and I've just finished it up . I'll tell you a bit more about it

It's not so much of a sequel to the original , but rather a prequel which tells the story of a young college kid who discovers that he's a mutant from a mutant world .

After watching this film, I thought to myself, they really glossed up Errol Flynn's life! The movie is really nice eye candy. They really got the 1930s and 1940s atmosphere of Hollywood just right. The costumes were great. All the women looked glamorous and all the men looked handsome and debonair.Is this a serious film about Errol Flynn's life? Nah! It's a fun movie based on all the scandalous stuff he did in his life.Why am I critiquing this film? This is a film that had a lot of promise but failed to deliver.

What is this ! ! its so bad . The animation looks so terrible , it looks like a ps1 remake . I've never seen such awful animation with such awful characters and dialogue ! It's so hard to tell if the actor's voice was in real-time or not , its just a mess , and it makes me sad . You could always just go to the net and see if there's any of these animations . I don't have time to do so. I have to do my school work in time . But thanks for the link .

I've never been a big Larry Clark fan, but somehow, I've been dragged to almost every single one of his movies. Now, I like independent films, and I grew up very much into punk rock, and I'd like to say that this film is disappointing to both audiences. Not every punk song incorporates "Oi!" into its choruses, as they do in this particular film.But the real problem with this film is that it switches moods every fifteen minutes or so and lacks any kind of cohesion.

The revisionist history -- making the evil Marquis de Sade a semi-heroic romantic -- is mind-boggling enough. But the atrocious acting, amateurish cinematography and terrible dubbing make this film achingly bad. The only reason to keep watching is that almost all the women in the film are gorgeous. And, amazingly, being tortured for days, with hands bound overhead, apparently doesn't detract from a woman's beauty, hairstyle and makeup. My guess is that the producers filmed mostly in Russia, choosing women for their looks -- and willingness to work cheap -- rather than acting ability.

First of all, I would like to clarify that I consider this one of the funniest films I have ever seen. I have watched it almost 10 times just because I've wished to spread the deliciously tasteless innards of this film to other unsuspecting victims. It has the captivating essence of a hand-held camera recording of a distant nephew's seventh birthday. It has all the writing of a WWE match. And most of all, it has the consistency of a face scraped along a sidewalk. This movie is a masterpiece.The film begins with an almost instantaneous mutilation of three, drunken teens in the desert.

Our reviewer from Toronto told you what you need to know about this film ( except note that it needs a DVD player). In this blog post you’ll find: a review of the film and how to watch it, a comparison of the film to some of your favorite horror movies, a short description of each of the actors, and some additional information you need to know. All this stuff can be found on the movie review. Enjoy

A review of a film which is in my opinion the perfect example of how horror movies work.

I had the privilege of being one of the Still photographers on the set of "Grand Champion" and enjoyed every minute of the 42 days I worked on the movie. I have been in the Photography business for 25 years and have worked on 16 movies and I can't think of a time when I enjoyed providing my craft more. The Kids were wonderful to work with and little Emma Roberts has so much energy she's a real trip. She even grabbed one of my camera during the stockshow scene rehearsal and started shooting. Some of her images were used for PR.

Ridiculous, nauseating doggerel with terrible acting; ineptly, superficially, and condescendingly trawling all the most banal clichés about Tuscany and Italy, divorce and midlife. The main actor nervously grimaces her way through the film, struggling to portray the appropriate level of smug, self-congratulatory self-pity the worthless character and script call for. I'm sure the book was bad, but it can't have been this bad! The camera is permanently fitted with a vomit-yellow "Tuscan" lense filter (perhaps the Tuscan sun wasn't Tuscan enough? ), which they forgot to remove when the scene shifts to Rome and (how imaginative!)

Slow-moving ponderous movie with terrible acting on the whole - but lovely locations & clothes to admire , and , as always, very good soundtrack ! The movie is a mix between old war movies (one of them, I can remember from the late sixties/ early seventies, about a bunch of soldiers fighting in the jungle in a country far away) and modern action movies with an occasional bit of comedy thrown in here and there to keep things interesting. This time, the action was in the jungles of Vietnam. The movie tells a story of the two main characters in the movie, an older man and his wife.

This is one odd film. It seems to be aimed at a younger audience, but is filled with sexual innuendos. The whole premise is rather absurd, not just the idea of some shrunken heads of three dead kids doing some crime fighting, but the same said kids taking on a gang of tough older guys is a little far-fetched, but then again, the parents are mainly absent in the film and there is a lack of authority figures to keep the kids in line.The cast are good though, Meg Foster plays a very butch mafia-like leader, with the handsome A.J.

If you believe that any given war movie can make you really feel the war, you need to see "Letyat zhuravli" (called "The Cranes are Flying" in English). It tells the story of Veronika (Tatiana Samoylova) and Boris (Aleksey Batalov), who are in love on the verge of WWII. They are walking along the waterfront, watching the cranes fly by, when the war starts. Boris is promptly sent off to war. Veronika hides out with a family and ends up marrying the son, whom she does not love.

They used footage of some real protest spliced with some woman talking about a society with no men to make it seem like these people were cheering for the 'gendercide' of men. The funny thing is, you can see a man cheering on his own death in the background.OK, the plot. Some lady says there should be a society with no men, and the crowd in front of her (which contains some men) think its a great idea. So then all the men are killed or something. So there are no more.Then this blonde scientist creates a man, but removes some chromosomes so he can't be violent.

Have you ever wondered why these guys -- Seagal , Stallone , Willis , et al -- manage to survive for so long despite being the cream of the crop of American actors and directors? There's a good explanation for that too. In this series, I'll take a look at how these guys became actors and directors. I've always been curious about this. I've seen and read interviews with a lot of different people from every walk of life. But I always have wondered how these guys became successful, or, more importantly, why they are still alive today.

I am very open minded. I watch all kinds of programs to the end...good or bad...just to give them a chance and learn from the good aspects and bad ones. This show had potential to be good. But my god, what were the writers, casting director, and director thinking? The cast of actors are terrible...with the slightest exception of Meryl (Mimi Rogers), and Darcy (Joy Osmanski) being given occasional good lines with the best execution of the lot.The rest of the cast kill the show. It is the same story line in every episode.

This is such a fun and funny movie. Highly entertaining at all angles. It features an outlandish array of memorable, psychotic but lovable nuts. We got; the judge, the Sargent, the kid, the creepy old lady, the slut, the clown. And unfortunately they all live in a big house that doesn't have any locks and is understaffed. So for our enjoyment we get to see them run around, play games, and be dangerous. We also learn a lesson along the way... never give your patient an ax! This was before Cukkos Nest, AND surpasses it.

Fun With Dick and Jane failed to entertain on so many levels . There were loose ends with the writing and plotline but in general it failed to hold my attention. Even though I found the actors in the film to be great , they lacked chemistry with one another and the film was too long and boring at the end . A film like that should have been shorter and more entertaining . I have a soft spot for this type of film and after seeing this I'm hoping to see another sequel. This is not a review about this film .

I 'D BUY THAT FOR A DOLLAR ! ! ! I did buy this film for a dollar and I can tell you that it is a great film. I don't see what the big deal is. Everyone's got to do everything on his own, no one is going to force you to see a certain movie. If you didn't like it, you could just walk out. I don't even know what it is, but that's not the point...

And I was going to buy this, too. The reviews are all positive.

This movie is like Happiness meets Lost in Translation with a Sixth Sense ending (or maybe a Crying Game surprise), and the best soundtrack I've probably ever heard...if that all make sense.The first 30 seconds pretty much tells you you're in for a twisted ride. (I was surprised no one walked out right away during the Brooklyn premiere.) But from there, the film settles down into a talk-fest between two really damaged people, Daphne and Buddy.They're lonely, mess-up, and boy do they talk about sex.

I almost stopped watching Hindi movies because of the mediocre quality and story lines. One exception for this is Ramgopal Verma movies. This is a nice movie with great performances from the star cast. This is must see movie for those who are sick of watching stupid dancing and love stories. The adaptation of the story and characterization was exceptional good.You should watch this movie for Nana Patekar. based on the life of Mumbai cop Daya Naik this movie deals in a more realistic way. The film delves into the life of the common man, which he has apart from being an encounter specialist.

Definition of documentary: A work, such as a film or television program, presenting political, social, or historical subject matter in a factual and informative manner and often consisting of actual news films or interviews accompanied by narration. The key word here is informative. I love They Might Be Giants, and barely learned a thing about them.The interviews with all the celebrities were pretty much worthless. I don't care what Sarah Vowel thinks of anybody and Syd Straw was downright irritating. And is listening to people recite TMBG lyrics like they were supposed to be funny/interesting? It was neither.

The concept : show 4 families of diverse ethnicities in the Fairfax District of L.A. preparing for the family get-together of the week. The first two families have already arrived at the get-together, which is just starting, but they've already set the scene. Next up, two families are about to depart on holiday, one from England and the other from Canada, and then two more are about to leave to go on their own vacation. Then two families from the same city, Los Angeles, will leave, and then there are two more from another city, San Jose.

Spoilers . This review has been edited due to word limit. ` The horror . The horror . ' Marlon Brando is in the final stretch of his life as an actor. It's not the end, but it is the beginning. The movie is not about him but about him and about what happened to him during the last six months of his life and what his death will mean, not just to those who know him but to those who have never known him or to those for whom the movie is being made.

"River's Edge" was one of the most disturbing films of 1986, and for a year that also saw "Blue Velvet", you know thats saying something. Viewed today its lost little of its power and remains much better than the overrated "Kids". The previews for "Kids" played it up to be an expose of the deterioration of the nation's youth. In reality, it was little more than an exploitation film based mostly around shock value. "River's Edge" was promoted as a teen exploitation flick but was in actuality much better.

Maybe the target audience of this Disney Channel TV-movie will be pleased with it, but if any parents are watching along with the youngsters, they will clearly see that "cranked out" is written all over this production. Obviously it was no one's dream to make this movie, but rather, this was concocted in a board room somewhere, then produced with cold efficiency. There is some talent among the cast, but actors like Dabney Coleman and Jay Thomas don't get much of a chance to showcase their talent.

Some critics have compared Chop Shop with the theatrical releases of City of God and Pixote . I 've seen neither of those films. They have their merits. But they aren't Chop Shop. And in my opinion, Chop Shop is better than neither of them. It's about a man who tries to change the world but ends up destroying a lot of what he wants. It's a story that could easily have ended up being too depressing. I can't say I'm disappointed with Chop Shop, but it wasn't a movie that excited me.

This is pure CRAP , and probably the worst Biblical theme film ever ... Absolutely inaccurate , I mean , seriously , why do they do this ? I'll give you an example , if that is ok , I'll write a review for this film in an hour. But for now , lets go to their website, which has the trailer and the plot for the film. Now the plot and trailer is a bit long but I'm gonna write the plot first anyway , because of the length that they are not going to take you for the story.

"Black Dragons" is a second feature WWII propaganda film popular at the time. It's not as bad as some would have you believe. A secret meeting hosted by the respected Dr. William Saunders (George Pembroke)is interrupted by a mysterious stranger names Monsieur Colomb (Bela Lugosi). Shortly thereafter the participants at the meeting begin to turn up murdered, their bodies being placed on the steps of the Japanese embassy in Washington. Colomb is suspected. Federal Agent Dick Martin (Clayton Moore) is assigned to the case and meets Saunders niece Alice Saunders (Joan Barclay) who tries to assist him.

One should not be too critical about the director's second feature.I really like the camera work of Madiba. As Mr. Shawn pointed out, he had a unique way of looking at things.However, howcome a 14 year old boy shoot such beautiful images? Remember he has not got any education of any sort. I don't think english is the common tongue in Cape Town ghettos. Worse still, Madiba looks even smaller than his supposed age of 14.Any way, if you overcome above-mentioned peculiarities, you can watch the film and still enjoy it because of nice camera work.

Hey guys and girls ! Do n't ever rent , or may God forbid , buy this piece of garbage ! I'm just glad it didn't get deleted . Now I have to buy it on Amazon if I want it to stay on the site ! You may not like me, but at least you should know something ! I like this piece of shit ! What can I say ? It doesn't help me to get my money back when I'm not sure I'll be able to read it myself. That's what I've been told, and it's the same story from this one as well !

This isn't a bad TV movie. Shtrafbat is short for Shtrafnoy Batallion, which means Penal Batallion. Such battallions were formed due to the increasing demand for soldiers as the Soviet Union was taking heavy casualties all through out the war. These battalions consisted of convicts and dishonored soldiers who were given the chance to clear their names by proving themselves in combat. They were looked down upon as scum and were expended easily during combat without much regret, or much honor, on the part of military. They were often sent on suicide missions and suffered extreme casualties.

I loved this movie when I was a teenager. LOVED it. It hasn't grown up with me, though. Maybe that's because it's a melodramatic load of old rubbish, full of macho posturing, cheesy dialogue, overwrought slo-mo and characters saying 'Goddammit' a lot. The lumpy narrative blobs gracelessly from one character to another, one plot strand to another, without ever bringing it all together, and it doesn't help that William Baldwin's mono-expression of a performance is wet enough to put out every fire in the movie's overlong runtime.

This for one has nothing to do with the absolutely fantastic first flick. And of course us Americans just have to remake everything successful into English, because man reading subtitles is SOOOOO Hard isn't it! From what I've see in the new trailers with the adorable now pregnant Jessica Alba (well that sure ruins every teenage boys fantasy everywhere doesn't it!) It looks EXACTLY the same but probably w/double the budget. I thought the original was one of the best horror/suspense/mystery flicks I have seen in any language in quite a long while.

The four LA cops in fedoras driving around in a big black convertible look faintly absurd, and even more ridiculous when it turns out that Nick Nolte, the dumbest-looking of the lot, is in charge. The writer never manages to create a spirit of camaraderie among the squad members, and the director fails to wring articulacy out of the man-mountain Nolte. Foprget questioning anyone. Nolte's character lights a cigaret, gets mad, and beats interviewees to a pulp. His methods get him nowhere, until at one point in the action he is wandering from tossed residence to tossed residence with his mouth open and his brain shut.

This was a very good PPV, but like Wrestlemania XX some 14 years later, the WWE crammed so many matches on it, some of the matches were useless. I'm not going to go through every match on the card because it would take forever to do.However major highlights included the HUGE pop for Demolition winning the tag team belts from Haku and Andre the Giant, The first ever mixed tag match featuring Randy Savage and Sensational Queen Sherri vs Dusty Rhodes and the late Sapphire and the first ever clash between The Ultimate Warrior and Hulk Hogan.Some matches were a complete waste of time.

Honestly - this short film sucks . the dummy used in the necro scene is pretty well made but still has the same issue as many of the short movies Ive seen. The dummy looks like it should be used as a stand up and I dont really know why it is the way it is. I know the director used it because his wife asked him why the dummy was in the scene. In all honesty I think this short has a lot to offer as a short but it's not a great one. This is definitely not something you'd want to see more than once.

To put it simply , this was a pompous piece of canine poopie . Overly stagey and everyone being the center of attention. It just didn’t have the same impact and it was such a boring film that i couldn’t care one whit either way . The acting and directing was pretty bad , but then you’ve seen a lot of bad movies these past few years and some of the best ones are still made with bad acting . It’s kind of sad , i can’t wait to see the movie with a good director and actors .

I don't really know why so many persons love this movie: maybe it's funny, OK, but it has totally ruined one of the best novels ever written. As the author himself said, this movie has betrayed the book: not only the story is violently cut to about 1/3, but all the symbols, all the complexity, everything is lost in a very 80's-fashioned fantasy/adventure film for kids. Today we have effects, directors, a new attention to books: I hope that someone (Tim Burton, Peter Jackson, Hayao Miyazaki...) someday will direct the REAL Neverending story.

I was really beginning to enjoy this show . It just started out slow and it was n't given the time to play around with. The story was very intriguing and I loved all of the side characters who were just so well-rounded. The music was also great! It's very hard to do an awesome soundtrack when you're watching a TV show that's been out for years. My husband and I both loved this show. We watched it for a couple of weeks before going on vacation so we didn't miss much of it but we did come home with a couple of DVDs and we still watched this.

If anyone has any doubts about the talent of Liev Schrieber, just a look at his new film, "Everything is Illuminated", which clearly shows a man that is not only one of America's finest actors, but a new director whose first effort is indeed an inspiration and a harbinger of what is to follow. Mr. Schreiber has adapted the novel by Jonathan Safran Foer into a film that will live forever because of the way the director has adapted the material. The film clearly surpassed our expectations since we had no preconceived ideas.For those who haven't watched the film, perhaps you should stop reading here.Jonathan is a collector.

A fantastic musical starring Gene Kelly and Rita Hayworth. He owns a nightclub where she dances. She's no star yet, but she gets a big break when she's chosen as a cover girl for Vanity, whose owner was actually in love with her grandmother. When he sees the resemblance, he picks her right away for a contest his maganzine is running. Hayworth's newfound fame at first works wonders for Kelly's club, but her star rises so quickly and so high up that his grasp on her begins to falter.

Wesley Snipes latest straight to video film is a convoluted mess , horribly reminiscent of Steven Seagal 's latest works , this one has Snipes being chased by his ex-wife , then being shot by his wife in a jealous rage and finally being dragged away by the police and forced into a life of crime . In other words , it has been some time since we have heard about Snipes in action and we have only just now come to expect this sort of thing . As it turns out , it has been a long time and this film is only a part of it .

I love his martial arts style , it is quick , close up and oh so fast , but it is also extremely effective , I use it all the time , I also like the way he moves so fast , it is like you are watching the movie you know the whole time . I want to try his style. I can't find any videos of it. What are some good videos to see him move. I am interested in seeing how he does it. I would love to see him move like he does in a movie. Thanks.

`` The Apartment Complex '' is a campy comedy full of kookie characters created in lieu of a real story. The story of the movie starts out in the 1950's with the two main characters, John Wayne and Marilyn Monroe, playing a couple in their early 20's on their way to marriage. They have been married before and both of them know what the other person wants. This is the perfect setting for a movie with a happy ending. As the movie unfolds, the story evolves and eventually it reaches a conclusion.

Go to the video store and get the original. I do not understand why Hollywood has that need to take a perfect foreign movie and remake it. "Mostly Martha" or "Bella Martha" has a much better cast. Beginning with the heroine Martina Gedeck, who convinced me much more in the role of the work-obsessed perfectionist than the more famous Catherine Zeta Jones, to the Italian cook and the niece suddenly deprived of her mother and forced to live with an aunt, not fit for child-rearing. In many ways, the American version of the movie is a copy of the German original.

A low budget may be an excuse for poor acting talent and pathetic looking fake gore . However , it is the case for a horror film like the above that you don’t need a budget to create a movie that will be a hit regardless of what it costs to make it. That is what makes it so great. The only reason it may not be as cheap as others is because it was written and directed by a guy who actually cares what people think of his work, and has a genuine love for movies.

WARNING:I advise anyone who has not seen the film yet to not read this comment.If you plan on watching this movie DON'T! I warn you... this movie is TERRIBLY boring and basically horrifying, not in the Horror movie kind of way, to watch. I mistook this Piranha movie for another Piranha movie and when I had noticed I made a mistake I decided to watch this one anyway. I wish I wouldn't have. This movie is so horrendous and so intolerable in every piece of material that I couldn't bare to let anyone say this movie was halfway decent.

Some people are born with mourning souls with their song sung singularly until they encounter another soul as tortured and/or sad. They will then go into the song alone. Some people have their song sung until they meet someone and find out they have all the components they need. Some people sing until they encounter someone and discover that they are alone and that the world has abandoned them, leaving them with no one to cry to or tell their own stories of heartache. They will then sing their tears out until their song is ended and the soul with the sorrow is finally released.

I could n't help but look at the time every 5 to 10 minutes because I found this movie a bit long but it was definitely worth the trouble. The film has some really well shot and edited scenes but I personally think it was slightly too long. The entire film seemed very long in some of the scenes and the action scenes in particular seemed rushed. However, in my opinion this film is a decent one and it could very well be an entry level film for fans. For the most part, The Last Airbender feels a bit repetitive with the various battles and battles against the snake people.

Probably not the same version as most of the other reviewers because there ` s no real hard core sex in the game. The sex is just something you can get if you hit the correct button. It may be more than just a sex, but that's the best you'll get in this game. This is a very cool game. It has some cool graphics. The controls are very well designed. This game has lots of cool stuff but the most amazing part of this game is how well the sex work.

What bird is that ? A maltese falcon . The only thing remotely funny about this movie is Michael Caines' voice. He has been on my radar for a long time, but never saw it until I saw the trailer and then it was too late, the trailer was so bad, the movie was not even close. It has some funny parts, but not enough . I think this movie would be more funny if it had a little more acting, and less voice work, and a little more plot . But the trailer is the best thing, it really makes you wait until the end.

Larry Clark is not renowned for his talents as a writer or a director, but he has made some undeniably important films. Kids, Bully, and to a lesser extent Ken Park all achieve their intended purpose: shock, revulsion, and even disgust. These films are uncompromising in their content and use their controversial nature to expose very serious problems in modern youth. Kids exposed us to the proliferation of A.I.D.S. and sexual promiscuity among the young. Bully touched upon similar issues. Ken Park dealt somewhat ham-handedly with sexual abuse and suburban ennui.

... the last time I laughed this much . It 's a testament to the talent of Rowan Atkinson that he still has the capability of laughing, when it matters the most." "I don't even know where you were." "You know, you've got a rather unusual set of grandparents. I was talking to my mum this morning. We had a very funny chat about all the time we spend with Grandad. We had a few laughs. He was a good listener. I think you'll find that in him, a great listener."

I bought this DVD from Walmart for cheap, thinking it would be a typical, crap straight-to-video monster junk, but it turned out much better than expected. There isn't really any criticism to say about it... it's obviously low budget, but that just adds to the cheesy old fashioned fun. It's very cool and entertaining.There's everything: horror, sex, a great plane crash and good characters. And I'd say it's pretty original, cuz it really doesn't come off as any other movie I've seen.

In short this movie was awful.I understand it 's a Disney movie , which are generally shallow movies with mediocre characters. I am surprised it took that long for a director and a writing team to complete something so basic in story. I'm not sure if you can call it a movie or not, as it lacks a climax or an end, although it definitely ends in a way that could be called a climax. It feels like the story takes a back-track to the beginning, but if you think about it, its pretty much in the middle of what the story is about.

Caught this film on TCM in the early A.M . It was amazing.Starting out slow but ominously .... Scott is still alive but the movie is slow moving. I was shocked at how the movie ended and how long it went for. It was suspenseful for a long time and the characters had depth in their personalities. There is still much to be learned by the next two films that are coming out. This one was very well made and I would watch it again as soon as I could. I hope that the next two years are as good as they were here.

I just watched this movie last night. Within 30 minutes of the start, I was hoping it would end.It had a promising beginning; the first 10 minutes. The premise of this movie (friendship that goes nowhere after they've spent days (and Years) together in "Separate" beds in hotel rooms) is just not believable. He does kiss her somewhere along the way, and she feels Ohh, so terrible about it. Very little substance to grab your interest. The acting just does not hold up. He is very passive.

The movie was a pleasure to watch if you are a fan of the Stooges . The story is told through the eyes of Stan Laurel, the hero/heroine/saviour of the film. It is also a great look at how a family can be broken and rebuild their life. When you are the “father’s keeper” there will always be things that have to be done and he will always try his best to do his duty as best as he can. That is exactly what Stan did and that is what we should all do.

Shot in my former home town by a couple of college kids , this movie centers around some freak named "Rudy" (Drew Barrymore ) who comes back to town and finds himself the owner of a rundown bar in the middle of nowhere . The bar is run by Rudy , an old buddy of Mike's father who was also the owner years before , and it is filled with his kind of customers, and there is the usual mix of alcohol, cigarettes and pot. The bar owner is an alcoholic and is constantly getting into trouble , but Rudy does a good job of keeping things under control .

Mild spoilers below.The prospect of war was clearly on the horizon when TFW was filmed. From the opening scene of European refugees to the final prediction that Naziism will be the death of millions of Germans, this movie is as much a propaganda film as the films made after Pearl Harbor. There isn't a lot of entertainment value here though the footage of the dust bowl is interesting to those of us who aren't old enough to remember it. The rest of the plot is pretty forgettable with the Herr Docktor Coburn - with a pretty bad accent - and daughter assimilating into America with Wayne's help.

As a non-theist Im not going to comment on the great mans theory which changed the world 150 years ago. I don’t like his theory at all because it makes God and the world too “small” for Him to exist and the universe too much for His existence. It makes God too small for us to understand He is all that is and we are too small to grasp His existence. I also believe God exists but we have to accept His existence as we cannot explain all we know as we are unable to see Him and we can’t comprehend Him.

This movie was pointless . I ca n't even call it sci-fi , since that requires more from a movie . I don't really mind if it's in the category of fantasy or not . I mean , it has some good lines that I didn't get until it was over ( I think there were at least 3 I didn't get until the end) . I guess you could call it a drama , but it doesn't really have that feel . I think it's pretty good and I'm going to see it again .

This is one of the dumbest ideas for a movie . Remake a classic film shot-by-shot . I hope nobody makes a remake of King Kong or The Terminator. If you do, you should just give up and go home. If you don't , then I suggest you find a new genre of entertainment. There is only one reason why this idea is a stupid idea: you have no idea what you are doing because you are too scared of making a remake. You have not been watching films in over two decades. You have not even been reading about the original film.

This movie , which I just discovered at the video store , has apparently sit around for a couple of months, waiting for someone to make a movie based on it ? This is not good for the film industry, not at all ! As it was stated in the trailer , this film has been made by a team in New Zealand . I have seen nothing about them having ever been here , nor have I seen any info on how they created this movie . But , if they have never been here , why should we care ?

There was nothing remotely funny about this movie . It makes fun of various sports movies and clichés but nothing that could make this a comedy . It has a great cast with good performances and it has a couple of funny lines but its also a bit boring. The movie has an excellent script and a good storyline that I enjoyed as much as the characters and the comedy. I recommend this movie as one of the best action movies of the year . Plot

The movie begins in a hospital room where an American businessman (Matt Damon) suffers from the sudden onset of paralysis after he falls from a tall building.

The plot was not good.The special effects weren't.The acting was... not very good at all.Like others, I felt there were numerous holes in the plot that you could fly, well, a space shuttle through.I thought the ending was rather unbelievable.By the way guys, about the "blow torch in space".Blow torches have their own supply of oxygen (Hence the name "Oxy-Acetylene torch"). Two hoses run from the torch: One to an acetylene bottle and one to an oxygen bottle.So a "blow torch" would work just fine in space.

Aside from the fact that this movie was filmed mostly in Rockport MA , which is a beautiful town where I grew up, this was also filmed at Lake Placid. We went to Rockport the day before the movie was shot and were told that the lake was about to be drained and that there were no ice skaters and we could only hope to see one in the end. So we spent the day with the cast and crew of the movie in Rockport and took a walk around the lake that was being drained.

The idea behind Dead Silence is great : zombie outbreak takes place during an edgy paranoia radio talk show . But the show itself was not really bad . It was well presented . I didn't know how many zombie movies were made before, but there were many . So Dead Silence was not that great . But it wasn't a bad movie . It was a zombie movie , so I think it had a good chance of winning . I like horror movies , because they can scare you . Dead Silence is a zombie film , because it was a very scary film .

This piece of Crap is actually the BOMB, as in Bottom of the Barrel. I can't figure out which is worst; Norris' dull portrayal of anonymity (not a great trait in an action protagonist) or Christopher Neame's hysterical overacting. This film doesn't deliver on any level what so ever. The action sequences are tame, the plot is paper thin, and the scenes that are supposed to be horrific look like a cliché from the fifties. You can't just fill a room with smoke and men in rubber suits, and expect the audience to scream in terror.Visually the film does nothing for me.

Jack Lemmon was one of our great actors. His performances in Days Of Wine And Roses, The Apartment, Some Like It Hot, Missing (to name the first ones that come to mind) were all worthy of Best Actor nomination. His only win was for Save The Tiger, and that's a shame. He gets melancholy down to a science, but never brings it into balance with the driver in his character. He actually did a similar character much better toward the end of his career in the one-note Glengarry Glen Ross.

If you had asked me how the movie was throughout the film, I would have told you it was great! However, I left the theatre feeling unsatisfied. After thinking a little about it, I believe the problem was the pace of the ending. I feel that the majority of the movie moved kind of slow, and then the ending developed very fast. So, I would say the ending left me disappointed.I thought that the characters were well developed. Costner and Kutcher both portrayed their roles very well. Yes! Ashton Kutcher can act!

It 's a shame . There 's an interesting idea here , but it gets completely lost in a confusion of detail

This is an interesting point but I do not think that it makes the most sense. You know what's a shame here? This is a pretty cool idea and I'd love to see some more research done on this. It would make for a better article though. You know what's a shame? A lot of people don't realize that you don't actually get to see much of the movie. The first thing you see as you go out into the public is the movie.

THE OTHER is a supposed `` horror '' movie made during the 1970s . It is not to be confused with the movie of the same title . I found this link on the interwebs. If you can get this movie in your DVD player, it is very good. It may be the best horror movie ever made. I am glad I have this. It is just a movie. In fact I was going to recommend this movie to my wife. But then I realized I have a better recommendation to give her. It is a horror movie that tells the truth.

But I ca n't say how I really feel about this pile of steaming dung . Where to begin . . . First of all it reminds me of my parents house, when I was growing up. I think back, what was the point of all the stuff on the table, so that we would eat at our leisure? Why were we even in the house? Was there no fun in being out of the house? Why were we in that house at all? I used to think I was the center of the universe.

Believe me when I say this show is just plain hilarious . The basic story is about Kintaro Oe who has just been diagnosed with a major malformation of his left arm and he has no clue what is going on or why he is not doing well. Well he starts researching the disease that he has to learn a lot of things about and he comes across a great idea for a new surgery that would turn his entire life around. This film is one of my favorite Christmas classics. Sure, it's fluff, it's not "relevant", but when did movies being simply entertaining and fun become a bad thing? In the 1980s in wrestling the world was simple . Hulk Hogan would take on Roddy Piper , or Bobby Heenan . It took less than a decade for this to change . Honestly , on the subject of the death penalty , I could take it or leave it . The problem for me isn't the execution , it's the crime. I think that the death penalty is an important deterrent and I think that it's the only option to keep violent criminals from murdering other violent criminals. But I also think that there are limits to that power . I think that there are situations where it is justified to kill a convicted criminal. I'm not sure that there is one situation that is so rare that it could never be used to kill a convicted criminal.

This is a very low budget film , set in one location in a valley shielded by the effects of an artificial snowfall. I don't mind if it's a film from my own childhood. I really enjoyed it. I was not expecting a lot out of this one. A lot of the acting was fantastic (and the acting is very realistic). The sound was great, the camera work well done, it was all about the story, not about the actors or the sets or anything like that, all the details of the film came together beautifully.

Half Past Dead was unlike any Steven Segal film I 've ever seen . Very little of Segal , himself, was used. This was a movie that was made from the ground up. Segal and his family were the actors , not the story . I'm glad I was given a chance to see it but I wasn't so thrilled with how the film looked . This movie is very different from most of the Segal movies . The Segal that appeared in this movie is very young , young at heart , but very serious and focused.

"Landscape after a battle" opens with escaping prisoners over a snowy field full of fences - in rather funny movements accompanied by Vivaldis Four Seasons. A touching opening. But we soon enough learn to know these prisoners as a mob, and when they (also treated humouristic) burry a man alive, the protagonist stops for a moment, but is soon more engaged in finding books from the turndowned camp than caring about his neighbour.The rest of the film is set in an American camp from where the prisoners are not released, in some kind of semi freedom, semi camp.

A Chicago couple, Dillon and Dougherty, are falsely accused of killing their daughter. People begin to wonder if they did it. The police investigate and find suspicious evidence. The couple are maligned by the public and accused in the press. The cops speculate that they are Satanists and have ritually murdered their own daughter. They are charged and brought to trial. They are represented by publicity-seeking lawyers who give them bad advice and bill them for $100,000. The evidence presented against them is twisted or hidden by the police. Fabricated intimations of sexual abuse are presented.

Not really all that much to this movie ... either a stunt racer or a stock car racer has a great deal of influence over how you drive, and this film was no different (except that we didn’t see them actually driving around). Red Skelton (in his first starring role) plays Wally Benton who plays 'The Fox' on a radio show. He writes the murder mysteries and as 'The Fox' solves them. Joseph Jones (Conrad Veidt) is trying to figure out how to perform the perfect murder on someone. He kidnaps Benton, his girlfriend (Ann Rutherford) and another girlfriend (Virginia Grey). He tells Benton to write out the perfect murder...or his girlfriends get it...Very funny and enjoyable movie. Fast-moving (it's only 77 minutes), a good script and perfect casting really puts this across.

I watch Lackawanna Blues every time it comes on . It brings back happy times for me . I grow up and it’s a good story . I’m sure it will be good for younger viewers to follow. I just discovered this obscure '70s horror movie while browsing on YouTube . For a low-budget effort , it has all the ingredients for being a horror film, and then some . It's the second in an occasional trilogy of movies that have taken the genre to such new places , and with this third entry , they are getting a bit closer to the core elements that will keep the audience going for a decade or two . The first two movies were very different , and with the third , they are a little closer to that core .

This one and the one prior "Toulon's Revenge" and the next one seem to be completely different from the first two movies where the puppets were not so nice.
