Some describe CALIGULIA as `` the '' most controversial film of its era . While this is debatable , it is easy to appreciate CALIGULIA as a stylistic triumph. This is because of how it is played off of the visual effects. CALIGULIA, also known as THE CLOCK TOWER, is an action thriller set in a clock tower in England. There is a plot centered on a clock tower in London that begins with a clock malfunction and an assassination attempt. When a terrorist is shot dead, the tower is brought under attack and the clock tower is destroyed.

I watched this movie a couple months ago when it first showed up on the shelves of Blockbuster. It is officially the only movie that I've wanted to undo watching. Let me start off by saying that I like "B" Movies. I consider "Ice Pirates" One of the best comedies EVER. I'll also note that I'm a writer and that I've met the director/writer of this cinematic marvel.Evaluating the acting: If I was going to pick a bright spot I'd have to point out that Dion Day had an admirable acting debut with his role in this.

When moviegoers hear two popular villains/characters will be fighting, they flock to the theaters to see how the battle will end. There's Freddy vs. Jason, in which two very popular horror icons try to kill each other. And, more similarly to this, there's Godzilla vs. (Insert Name Here). But the very generic Komodo vs. Python is just a horrible title, and an even worse premise. Obviously, the movie's a D-list picture, but, at least come up with a more compelling name, maybe something that can trick the unsuspecting viewer into watching it.

Honestly, I don't really understand why there has been so much controversy about this show. It embraces the elements of the original, while expanding on them. The storytelling has been updated and, while some of the episodes seem to be a bit "Fast", that is a good thing.Christopher Eccleston is perfect in the role. Easily as good as Tom Baker.Rose is one of the best companions, on par with Sarah Jane Smith or Leela.I like the concept that the timelords have been destroyed - No more politicking with the Doctor acting as president emeritus.

While the new Pride & Prejudice film is gorgeous to view, and the soundtrack is lovely, we are not seeing Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice. The film is for some reason set back in the early 1790's, rather than the Regency period where the novel is set, as scholars have long shown. The Bennets' Longbourn estate is ram-shackled and looks like Cold Comfort Farm. Yet the Bennets in the novel are gentry class; they own a farm, but the pig does not walk through the house, nor is the farmyard of manure and chicken droppings contiguous to the home.

Buyer beware. The Alpha Video release uses a print that defies description. The movie was shot in color but you wouldn't know it for the first 25 minutes or so. The print that is used is so faded and decrepit that it appears almost sepia toned. After 30 minutes some color seeps back into the print but from there to the conclusion the color comes and goes. Keep in mind, even at it's best the color is pale and washed out. It looks like the print was recorded off a television that wasn't getting the best reception.

`` Witchery '' is a decent little Euro-Trash horror yarn ! David Hasselhoff is pretty damn funny in this one, and he makes the movie a fun ride that is a bit light on the thrills, so take your time, and see if you don't enjoy it. I think this is worth your money for sure ! (If you haven't seen the movie, and don't think it's worthwhile, here's a good review.) If I was to suggest a sequel, I'd say one of the best horror movies of the late 1970s.

Hannibal must be the most God-awful movie I have seen in a long time. In fact, I want my money back. What a waste of time. No plot, minimal character development, questionable motives, poor dialogue, sub-standard acting. What else can I say? If you haven't seen it don't bother. I wouldn't even hire out the video and if you happen to come by it on TV... change the channel. The only reason anyone might have to see this movie would be to see whether the gratuitous violence lived up to all the hype (which quite frankly is why they added it).

When a movie called Hell Ride comes out you expect a certain amount of biker cliché. With character names like "Pistolero", "Comanche" and "The Gent" I braced myself for the worse and was punch in the face by just that. The dialogue, soundtrack and shooting style are standard for biker movies. Dusty desert blurred from the heat as bikes coming tearing down the road while "CC Rider" plays and they talk about sex and violence. Yawn! The three leads were just ridiculous and unbelievable.

I walked into Heart Of Gold thinking I was going to watch a documentary about Neil Young . Instead , I found the first installment in a series in which the Grammy-nominated singer interviews people he admires. At first, the documentary looks like some kind of historical document of Neil Young’s life and career. And then I thought to myself — I’m not going to do that; I’m only going to watch what I’m going to be told about by him. And then it happened — I’ll never forget it.

But I can't say how I really feel about this pile of steaming dung. Where to begin. The film quality, there isn't any. I've seen clearer pictures on America's FUNNIEST HOME VIDEOS! The acting is substandard, the gore effects is okay. The clown mask is the best part of this movie, the story is repetitive. The same thing over and over again. At least in a Friday THE 13TH or HALLOWEEN we stick with one main character for the most part. There is no main characters, just victims.

I finally watched the third film in Mehta 's trilogy : `` Fire '' . To begin , I 'd love the first film but after reading the first two I 'm not too sure about this film . So , this is a film which has a great story , but it also has some flaws . But after watching the third film , I 'm happy with it . I 've seen all the three films . First of all , how do you get the money to shoot the film ? The movie takes place in India , but I do not think there is an Indian film making company in India .

A truly excellent look at the world and the realities of being a heroin addict . The movie is one of the great documentaries on drugs in general. It is fascinating and very informative. You will not want to miss the next one. If you like movies of this nature, I highly recommend you to take a look at it. Ridiculous! A movie which was created by some crackhead, and is being made by his friends to make him money for drugs. They do it because it is fun to see them making money and they do it to make them feel good in a pathetic way.

Seriously I don't get why people are all like "Oh my God Step Up is the best movie ever!!!" It's a bunch of junk! The acting, first of all, is ridiculous, and let's not even begin to talk about the dialogue because it was terrible...Movies are supposed to be entertaining, and this, let me be the first to say, was *not* entertainment. I was actually laughing because I was so embarrassed watching it. The music and dancing didn't do anything for me as well.

Solomon and Sheba has come down in Hollywood lore not for the quality of the film, but for the fact that Tyrone Power died while making it. I was in the 5th grade and well remember the huge news for days when that tragedy happened. I didn't know who Tyrone Power was then, but I learned and learned to appreciate the body of his work.I often wonder if Ty had a sense about this film and what a dud it proved. He was the unnamed producer of this as well. Maybe he just didn't want to face the critics.

As over the past ten years or even longer the whole world is flooded with so-called sitcoms ( actually only three or four so far). They are all about three guys in their twenties living together, going out together and not really having sex, so why not? They usually make fun of other people who are not in a relationship and they make fun of sex. Usually they use sex as humor. Most of them are so bad that people just laugh and forget about what they did in the name of entertainment.

This is one of the few movies - maybe the only - that truly haunted me for years. It was the first I had ever seen people tortured, so much that blood was flowing of their mouths from gritting their teeth and screaming, etc. It was brutal; the worst thing I had ever seen on film.Dr. Clement Molloch, played by Joseph Mayer, is still one of the most evil characters I've ever seen on film, and I've viewed thousands. He was so sadistic that I would never watch this movie again, nor would I recommend it.

UP AT THE VILLA ( 2000 ) * * 1/2WARNING : YOU MAY FIND SOME SPOILERS AHEADIt 's hard to know what to think. There is so much I have read in the past year, I don 't even know what to say. I have been disappointed so many times, but I do want to thank the writers and the director for giving me so much enjoyment in the film. The ending is so different from how I had expected and I hope it is well done. I am very happy with how I am liking it.

I thought this movie'd be totally different than just another teen-slasher. Well I was totally wrong. There's a liquid nun coming out of the toilet seat and something really odd. I know that Spanish culture is a bit different and their movies too, but I didn't expect to see a fake Hollywood film. They certainly faked it pretty well though. Why'd they make a movie without any new aspects? This is just plain boring and it'd been done totally without any imagination.I thought that having a nun as the bad guy in the movie'd be something really original.

Obabakoak is a bunch of short stories with an only common point : the little Vasque town of Obaba . It is also a place where we have to be careful because its inhabitants are dangerous. This story is part of a three parts series about Obabakoak and it will be released in May. I’ve had a lot of fun reading this book but I still think it needs a lot of polish before it can be a solid book. The only thing I’d like to see in it is a little bit more about the main character.

This film is absolutely appalling and awful . It 's not low budget , it 's a no budget film . It 's not about making a ' good film ', it 's not even a ' good film ' . This is the worst movie that I 've ever seen in my whole life . My eyes are watering , it is not funny ,it is not good , not even a good laugh . It 's not even about a joke , it 's just a ' joke ' . Its like it was written by the devil , not God , it has a terrible plot .

Jack Lemmon was one of the finest actors that had ever graced the screen . He could effortlessly switch from comedy to drama with ease, yet he was able to take on so many roles, as he would prove in the next ten years on screen. He is known to have won seven Emmy’s and a record five Tony’s, but he had the opportunity to make the leap from Hollywood to Broadway to Broadway to Broadway and back again for a total of more than 70 performances. Lemoine was born in Los Angeles, California on May 11, 1924.

The most amazing film I have ever seen . I did n't read the programming and I just stumbled onto the blog. I am in awe. It is an amazing film . If I was not so busy and I wanted to see a movie, I would go check it out . Not just any movie but a masterpiece that is worth seeing . Thanks for making this movie . It is amazing ! I watched it at my friend's house. I'm not sure whether he was a fan or not, but his reaction to this movie was one of awe and respect.

I really love this movie . It has a very real feel to it . I believe it was never made for TV . It's a wonderful story with some of my favorite movie characters . I hope this movie will make it to theaters and maybe it will be part of the new Universal library . I hope everyone who is watching it will see what a beautiful piece of art this movie is . I will try to post this review once every week . I will post it in my Facebook page . There is just one problem . I cannot find it .

When a group of escaped convicts manage to flee to a remote island,they soon find that their new home is inhabited by a strangely menacing doctor(Richard Johnson of "Zombi 2" fame),a mad scientist(Joseph Cotten),his beautiful daughter(Barbara Bach)and a horde of superstitious natives.The tribesmen say that the doctor has created grotesque half-human,half-fish creatures for evil,secretive purposes.And though at first the prisoners do not believe this,as they disappear,one by one,they begin to change their minds.

Absolutely the most thoughtful , spiritually deep , intense Hamlet ever done -- no other version comes close . Jacobi is more than just a Shakespearean ham . . . In this version of Hamlet, there are very few things that might surprise us. It is a story where Shakespeare is more than just a writer, and where there are very few elements that are new . . . Shakespeare plays a very prominent role. There are several key scenes where Hamlet has to do the job that he has been assigned, yet he does it his way. This Hamlet is not a traditional Hamlet.

Whoever filled this stupid idea of acting and producing a movie in Himesh 's head , which is always hidden from public view. I did not hear about it, even though I know this idea has been used before. So why this time? Why do you think it should be so important? It does not make sense in the current times, I'm sure you've heard of the latest news and you think you have a better idea. That is not what I meant. I mean a good idea. Not necessarily a brilliant one. One that can do something.

Another lame attempt to make a movie "gritty" and "thought provoking"- whatever the hell that means. They have Al Pacino say a lot of words like - "Television killed football." Yeah whatever. This is another movie that showcases Oliver Stone's Delusions of Grandeur. If Stone is trying to show us that football will be our downfall or something, why does he insist on romanticizing the sport with his stilted camera movements and Kid Rock songs? He even throws Cameron Diaz into the fray for purely aesthetic reasons.

`` Hood Rat '' is absolutely terrible . This is a urban version of `` Willard '' . I just hope that it will be as good as the original , as it is a really good movie , and will probably get good ratings . Hood Rat looks like it could be the worst horror movie ever . I am really disappointed , because I would love this film to be great . Hood Rat is a total waste of time . If they make an animated movie , it should not be a bad version of the movie .

I decided to watch this movie because I 'd not seen Carol Lombard before in any movie . I 'm so sorry that I've already missed the first movie, I've been too busy with my life .I 'll definetly return and watch it now. I 'm not too sure about the second movie, because I 've heard so many bad things that 're just not true . I would like to see this movie, because the acting and the acting was amazing in this movie, and it has a good story, and a good message that I like.

I think Shane Black is one of the all time greatest action screenwriters ever ! He gave us the awesome "Avengers: Infinity War". I am sure Marvel Studios is doing everything they can to keep him busy but I am hoping that one of the next Avengers movies can be the one to make Black a household name among all the action movies fans. He has a great screen presence that I can’t believe was left out of every movie ever made. He has a unique style that makes him seem like a mix of Robert DeNiro and Samuel L Jackson.

To say that this is a good show is not to say anything at all . After all , this was a very well done and well researched special. One thing i am glad about is that it was not an ad that was going to make the audience to buy an item. It really just showed the life of the people who were involved in this and how they lived. It really just showed a life and how the life went on. I have enjoyed watching this show, it made my heart warm.

Man , I never laugh so much this year , and it 's pretty hard to make me laugh . :o )

In fact , it's pretty hard to make me laugh , no not in general , but in one specific situation . So , just to give you guys a little background ,

I came back home after my summer vacation and was a bit surprised at how much fun I had , I had so many friends , and I was so happy to return home . But , I was also a bit overwhelmed .

All the pro comments about this movie claim that the movie is balanced . That is their main justification to keep giving me hate for watching it. It doesn't look balanced. The main character in the movie appears in the movie and he doesn't seem like a nice person. Some of his traits are very negative and some of the things that are shown are just ridiculous. Just because I disagree with the people who are criticizing this movie doesn't make me a bad person, I have every right to do so and it is my right to not like it and to not watch it.

The Kid is a really good family movie about a stuffy image consultant, Russ Duritz, who has lots of money, a good job, nice house, etc. The only problem is he doesn't have much of a social life as nobody seems to like him as he isn't always very nice. One day though things are about to change when an eight year old version of himself magically appears. This gives Russ a second chance to make things right. Bruce Willis plays the lead role here and he gives a really good performance. The Kid is a nice, heart-warming movie for everyone.

I think Shane Black is one of the all time greatest action screenwriters ever! He gave us the awesome (at it's time)Lethal Weapon, shooting Mel Gibson to super stardom. Then followed that up with the second best movie Bruce Willis has ever been in (The Last Boyscout).Stumbled a bit with The Last Action Hero, but redeemed himself with this one, The Long Kiss Goodnight.If you're a fan of action films, this has it all...Action, Comedy, Thrills, then tops it of with more Action, Comedy and Thrills.

Almost no cinema experience can beat a good thriller with a sense of humor. Geena Davis is a schoolteacher housewife who suffers from amnesia. She'e even on the PTA! But then an auto accident awakens the woman she used to be, and it's HOT! Samuel L. Jackson is hilarious as the low rent private eye who tries to help Davis find her past, only to find out he's in way over his head. Davis has some hilarious lines too, and the interaction between her and Jackson works surprisingly well.Look for Brian Cox, the original Hannibal Lechter, and David Moorse finally managing to shed his St.

Ken Russell directed this weird ( Not very ) erotic thriller and if I hadn't known that I would have staked my life that the director was Brian DePalma . Absolutely everything about CRIMES OF PASSION screams DePalma , from the gaudy cinematography that is lit a little too brightly , to the domestic storyline that turns into a stalk and slash plot , to even the title this screams " Depalma , DePalma , Depalma "Unfortunately since Brian DePalma is increasingly seen as a poor mans Hitchcock over the years Russell should have tried emulating a style of his own .

At the bottom end of the apocalypse movie scale is this piece of pish called 'The Final Executioner'.. at least where I come from. A bloke is trained by an ex-cop to seek vengeance on those that killed his woman and friends in cold blood.. and that's about it. Lots of fake explosions and repetitive shootings ensue. Has one of the weirdest array of costumes I've seen in a film for a while, and a massive fortress which is apparently only run by 7 people. GREAT job on the dubbing too guys(!)

I 've seen all 3 now . I just ca n't believe how bad Naqoyqatsi is . Not in comparison to what it was like before it started. I know they are in the top 10 but i just wonder how much worse they are now ? Is this why the qtsi are so much worse than they were before the start of the niqoyqatsi war ? I guess i am missing something. I've heard it is worse, even worse now than it used to be. I wonder how it would be if we started the war again and they started the war .

Sadly this film lives up to about 1% of the hype that the game created in 2004 and leaves a very sour taste in the mouth. For video game enthusiasts, book worms and movie fans alike there is nothing more disappointing then a film that is based on an original concept (whether on paper or gaming console) that does not deliver. And not only that, goes well under the mark. Far Cry the video game released in 2004 created such a cult following that making a movie from the content should have been easy and scores of gamers would have flocked to watch the film.

I was 19 years old when I saw first saw this film, in the theater. I have a vivid memory of a different ending. Not completely different but significantly. I just watched the movie last night and I was wrong, so I guess the following can't be called a spoiler, since it never happened. The ending I remember was that the boy was hiding in the house completely naked, Frances Austen found him quite easily and after she confronted him, she slowly sank to her knees and went down on him off camera.

What we know of Caravaggio suggests a strutting brawler with a healthy sense of entitlement who lived amongst whores and was a master of satire. "The most striking thing about Caravaggio, to me, is the way he is able to bring life to his canvas," writes French art historian Gilles Pons. "The most striking thing about this artist was his ability to get the attention of the world and his ability to make us look. His art was not meant to please the viewer but to please himself. He did not want to please anyone but himself.

As I write this in November 2005 I've become aware that the great British boom of cinema has come to an end and while people will claim much of this is down to the British government not giving film makers tax breaks I think the cause is much simpler - A lack of diversity on the part of producers over the last few years . Let's have a look at what the Brits were producing 1995-2005:Funky gangster thrillers . LOCK STOCK AND TWO SMOKING BARRALES was a truly great and thoroughly entertaining film and people went out of their way to ape Guy Ritchie's style with usually disappointing results Romantic comedies .

Charles Bronson has given the viewers lots of great moments on the screen. But this movie lacks everything that a thriller/action-movie should have. There are a few action scenes in the movie, but they're really crappy. And when the action scenes fail, does the story save the film? Not at all, is my answer to that. The story is even worse than the action scenes. It's very straightforward and boring, and even though I'm a big movie fan, I almost fell asleep several times. I don't know how they came up with a failure like this.

This 1955 heist film follows Tony le Stephanois, recently released from prison for theft, as he undertakes the robbery of his life. He teams up with his old heist buddies and they bring in an expert safe-cracker, Cesar from Milan (played by Jules Dassin, who also directed. He only directed because he had been blacklisted as a communist in the U.S. and couldn't work in Hollywood.) The brilliance of this film is the 1/2 hour during the robbery. During all this time, there is no dialogue and no music, only the muted sounds of digging through the floor or drilling the safe.

This is an astonishingly bad action film . I 'd say its primary flaw is that it 's BORING . Its secondary faults are its poor plot , bad acting and boring story . The rest of it is great . Not just because it 's a great B-movie ( it really is) , but because this is a good film . I hope this review does it no good , but just give it a look as well . I have no idea why I haven 't seen it yet , it is in my queue . So I hope that you are all having a nice day and enjoying the movie .

I do n't normally go out of my way to watch romantic comedy , and maybe I will in the near future . But I decided to give this one a try because . . . it is one of my guilty pleasures. I've watched the first season of the show a couple of times . I'm not going to lie , I usually go for the second and third season . However I've decided to give this one another try and . . . it is one of the most entertaining and funny comedies I've seen in awhile .

The recent documentary "The Adventures of Errol Flynn" is an in-depth look at the Ultimate Hollywood Hero. Bogart,Cagney, Wayne and the like were basically blue collar types in their screen images but Flynn was an aristocrat in his style and manner, the younger son out to carve out his own fiefdom for a sword,thunder and romance analogy that ironically he found himself trapped in. If he hadn't been under contract to Warner Bros. he would've of been perfect in the Cary Grant role in Suspicion: the good looking charmer whose 1000 watt smile blinds one to the fact that he's a predator.

Given the subject matter of drug addiction Down to the Bone almost can't help but be a rather depressing film. But depressing doesn't necessarily have to mean bad. Unfortunately in this case it is in fact pretty bad. The film has some good things going for it, most notably the quality performance of Vera Farmiga in the central role of Irene, a working mom struggling with a cocaine addiction. But there isn't enough good here to outweigh the bad. The film's failings lie mainly with the story, which fails to captivate and never really seems to get going.

I feel dumber after watching the first 20 min,luckily i walked out and saved the rest of my brain, people should watch better films and take notes on why they are rated highly,not because of the budget of the film or the special effects, just simply good acting and getting simple things right,and MOst importantly--not being LAME--, but i guess this was produced for those Sheeple without taste and not a clue of what is ''A good Movie''don't be scared of rating films low,save your under-appreciated high scores for ''once in a life time movies''.

An obvious cash-in on the * Insert Monster Here * On A Plane gimmick , Flight Of The Living Dead is not a horror movie in the sense of it is not based in reality , and is not about real-world horror. But it does deal in themes of survival in a very real-life situation (or at least the aftermath) . What is the story ? The story involves a group of friends who decide to go on a road-trip to celebrate a friend who passed away. They decide to go by train instead of taking the plane as the road-trippers do .

From the beginning of this film,with it's "The Lost boys" rip off opening sequence, to the bad wire work and even worse dialog ending, this movie slimed along at a snail's pace. "The Covenant" came highly recommended from some of my co-workers, who I am thoroughly convinced were playing a practical joke on me. At least I hope that was the intention and their taste isn't that bad! This movie was not much longer than an hour and a half, yet felt much much longer then that.

Excellence seems to come rare in Hollwood today. Many consider just two out of the year's best picture nominees to display sense to the movie industry. And in 'Everything is Illuminated,' the mark is hit directly.The film initiates its brilliance with the beautiful setting-the-scene entry. From the beginning, you receive a sense of warmth and true family connections and relations between one and another. And also, the cast is introduced perfectly. For Elijah Wood's character, Jonathon, his sensibility is expressed through holding his dying grandmother's hand.

This movie made me want to bang my head against the wall . It is hard to compare such badness with the original. I have always enjoyed the story. The story in this movie is very much like a horror movie except with an evil clown. The clown comes in and makes everyone around him sick. His only intention is to kill the people that are around the clown and the people he likes. When it starts to get real bad I thought this was going to be a very fun movie but it is so very bad. All of his evil plans are in the beginning.

From the beginning of this film , with it 's `` The Lost boys '' rip off opening sequence , and even with " The Lost Boys '' main storyline , there has been a series of changes that have made this film more than any of the others. These changes include, but are not limited to the following: The plot is a little longer than the other films in the trilogy . Also, the film's plot is somewhat more complex. The film's overall plot is also slightly more complex than all the movies in the series.

Greedy land baron in the tiny western town of Prairie City wants all the ranchers off their land, using intimidation tactics and arson to get them to vacate; seems the town is swimming atop oil, and when a Swedish farmer refuses to leave, he's mowed down by the baron's hired gun. The farmer's seafaring son soon arrives, slowly realizing what he's up against and attempting to rally the rest of the residents to fight. Another lawlessness-in-the-West story, with everybody under the thumb of the villain (who naturally holds all the cards).

Not really worth a review , but I suppose it 's my duty to warn you all - especially since we are now in the process of moving to a new apartment and it seems that it is going to be a very quiet night. I'm going to write a short story in a couple of days with the intention of doing a Q&A at a later date. So please don't expect me to review anything in the mean time. I've already had to write the story that I was working on when we moved away, so I don't need any help with it now.

This is the ultimate Kung Fu movie! This is the only Kung Fu movie! This is the only Kung Fu movie I have ever seen! I am giving this movie way too much credit! My best guess for the reason for making this movie is that someone wanted to show off someone else's martial arts abilities, but realized that you can't just film a guy fighting another guy and have people watch it, so he put a story behind the fighting... and people still didn't watch it.This movie's story line was onion skin thin.

My website (www.theflickguy.org) lists this pick as the worst movie of all time. Here is an excerpt: "If I were strapped down to a chair and forced to watch this movie over and over again, I couldn't imagine Hell being any worse. Jim Varney plays a three-handed crazy guy bent on destroying the world (apparently starting with cinema). Now let's face it, no one expects a whole lot from a Varney movie, but this agonizing drivel had me dry-heaving for 92 minutes. Not a laugh. Not one.

Simply put, Paul Bettany and Jennifer Connelly were remarkable. The movie is less about the raw science of Darwin's beliefs, and holds the focus very strongly on his relationship with his family, primarily his wife, Emma, and daughter, Annie.Toby Jones gives a wonderful turn as Thomas Huxley, the great defender of Darwin's beliefs, and the rest of the cast is up to the task of sharing screen time with Bettany and Connelly.But it is those two who carry the movie. Their real chemistry is apparent from beginning to end, but develops transcendence as Darwin grapples with his demons.

This film could have been great- but wasn't. Amongst the cesspool of talentless no-hopers and friends of the film makers who wanted to help out there are some mild inklings of talent. The main star of the film plays a good lead role. He is convincing and has those scary Italian eyes. However, he is teamed up with the worst rejects of actors anyone has ever come across. The opening scenes of the film are among the worst and most embarrassing. It looks like Gay Porno. Fortunately no one stripped off. The rape scene that keeps being mentioned is rubbish.

The key scene in Rodrigo Garcia's "Nine Lives" comes when Sissy Spacek, hidden away in a hotel room where she is carrying on an affair with Aiden Quinn, find a nature documentary on television, at which point Quinn notes the contrivance of such things--disparate footage is edited into one scene, predators and preys are thrown together in order to capture the moment--all to force connections where none actually exist. Characters in the nine shorts that make up this film occasionally spill over into each others stories, but none of them ever seem to really connect.

At Beaverview Cheerleading Camp , the goody-goody two shows Lucky Ducks cheerleading team must get in cahoots with the 'tough guy' to beat the bullies in the first game of the season." "You know, I can't believe I'm saying that right now, but I know you have to have courage, to be courageous to do what you need to do to win." "I want you to remember, we are the last line of defense and we must look out for each other because sometimes the bullies can be the bully in disguise."

Now I 'm a big animation fan -- love Svankmeyer and usually am into all applications of stop motion so that is what I am going to be watching. I'm interested in the story but not in the technical side of things, I think this could be just another story about a young boy on his way to his first day at his new school. It's a good intro for me because I've seen a few of the movies and I liked them for a little while but not enough to want to go out and watch any more of them.

I saw this at the BendFilm Festival Friday amid an unsettled crowd of people, not helped by a poor decision by the planners of the event, who chose a totally inappropriate short film to precede the movie. And it really threw the audience when Modern Love came up after a light, whimsical short (name I forget). People!!! It was really silly to mix this short with Modern Love - which is a serious drama movie. A film film. So the audience gets the teaser which is a comedy and then...Modern Love. Hmmmm.

Take your video camera, turn out all the lights in your house and film people running around with flashlights for an hour and a half and you've got the basic idea of what this film looks like. It is very irritating to watch this kind of movie. To be fair, there are scenes of daylight at the very beginning and very end of the movie. I like scary movies and creature features but this one just didn't do a thing for me. So sorry. I really tried to like it.

Closet Land is an amazing , terrifying piece of cinema . It features only two actors in a single set of 3 scenes . There are 3 sets of characters , each one with its own story , and its own character . The first set of scenes are all very quick , but then the story takes off and the 2nd and the 3rd set of scenes make up the film . This film is a great , great film . Its not a great , great film , its just a really really really really really great film , with great special effects , great visuals , and very good acting .

I was surprised to like this movie since I'm from the "check your brain at the door and have fun" school of film viewing. However, this film touched my heart. I have friends like mentally retarded Emily. I have friends like unsocialized Evie. And I've been in Evie's shoes, chasing away opportunity out of fear and out of devotion to others.Amy Madigan's disappointment in her daughters was almost palpable on screen and the awkward moments where she tried to bridge the gap with Evie were raw and painful to watch.

If you're looking for a movie that's fun to watch simply because you can make jokes about the not so great acting, cheesy "special" effects, and typical sci-fi plot...then this is the movie for you! Not at the acting was bad, in fact, a few actors were actually fairly decent. The special effects weren't the greatest (to say the least); the animals looked completely computer animated. There was an annoying squawking to cover up the swearing and there was only one song played over and over again throughout the entire movie.

This movie is not worth anything . I mean , if you want to watch this kind of stuff , then you have to pay for the popcorn . But , this movie is awesome !!!!!! I can watch it a million time !!!! Ok , let's make it easier for people who don't like the first movie !!!! I won't say any more , because no one can understand me , but , this time , I'm talking about the next movie , after the first movie .

Why would anyone make a film like this? Why would anybody invest in a film like this? Why would anybody in the film business work on a film like this? Why would any theatre show a film like this? Why would any TV channel program a film like this? Why would any critic bother to review a film like this? Why would anybody watch a film like this? Why would mental examinations not be made of the writers/producers/directors of a film like this? Sometimes there are movies that are so bad they're good. This is a movie that is so ghastly that it's horrible.

MR . BASEBALL is a film of paradoxes . Written and filmed as a `` light , sports comedy '' in the style of Buster Keaton's comedies ( and Buster Keaton, the most famous baseball player in America is the father of Jackie Robinson , the greatest baseball player in American history. But it's more than a comedy ; it's a story about the most famous American sports hero of them all . . . . . The story is the story about baseball in America. ) The story is about the rise of baseball in the USA .

Recently I borrowed a copy of this mess of a movie , which took me three sessions over three days to read. I don't think I have read any of this in all the years of reading. It is well worth it if you are in the mood for the kind of movie that would be appropriate to see at a movie house. It is worth seeing at home, though I doubt the same amount of money would buy it in a theater. This one is no longer on the shelves of my local book store.

This is a joke, right? This can't be a real film? It's not even a real video? Give any Harvey Milk High School kid a video cam and they could make a better movie than this. The film maker's can't be serious... right? Is this satire? Comedy? Drama gone horribly wrong? The script is about as single-minded and dull as is conceivable. Ten monkeys locked in a room with a laptop could come up with a better screenplay. The dialogue isn't clichéd.

Hard Justice is an excellent action movie ! The whole movie is really nothing but shooting and fighting but it is a fun and enjoyable movie to watch with the family or with your friends. The only bad thing I can say about the movie is its slow pace. I can't really say that its a great movie but it was still fun to watch and it is well worth the wait. The only thing that makes the movie worth the time it takes to watch is the cast and all the great moments they had.

This story had a good plot to it about four elderly men that share a deadly secret concerning a young woman that they met 50 years ago. After all this time, the young woman returns to seek revenge on the men. This story occasionally made me nod off during the movie in the middle of tiring elevator music and the ever so consistent thunder storms. But it is well worth the wait in the end when we find out just who the mystery woman is that keeps plaguing the old men in their dreams and interfering in a young man's life.

I have to say this is one of the best movie i have seen so far for naruto . the movie is fast paced with good action scenes . it has great effects . This movie is great for Naruto fans . Rating:

8/10(9.6/10)8.5/10

If you don’t know about this movie or have never seen this movie . you will never know this movie or how great it is . it is a must see movie . if you liked Naruto the Movie or any other Naruto movies you will also love this. This is my first review of this movie .

Norm ( an ) ally I do n't mind remakes . There are some pretty good ones out there , but they're mostly out of date . But in this particular case I felt like I had a better idea of the story than before . This particular book was actually based on one of the novels I liked best . It has a lot of similarities with it , but it does a good job of telling the story of what happened . In some ways , it takes place more than a year after the events in the movie . The book is also much more graphic .

Dreadful. I hope I can save two hours of your life by warning you away from this. I just finished watching the film, BTW.I love good cross genre films. This isn't one of them. Show me a sci-fi musical, a dramatic farce, or a religious action flick, I'll watch them all. But you cannot just throw epigrammatic quips at a rambling, camp, schlock-horror fest and draw my applause.I love philosophical films. This isn't one of them. Anyone who is amazed at the depths of intellect plumbed in this film hasn't read a good book lately.

It 's painfully obvious that the people who made this `` movie '' have never seen such brilliant spoofs as '' A Christmas Tale'' and ' ''The Nightmare Before Christmas ','' ''The Incredibles'' and ''Fantastic Mr. Fox''.'' And yet they thought they could do that here. Why, after all, do they put so much effort into trying to replicate the original and then have to come up with so bad an imitation, as if the people in the film really didn't know how the original had turned out?

I can see that the ratings for this film aren't all that high for this film, so I must be in the minority for liking this film so much. Well, I am right and everyone else is wrong (just kidding). I guess I like it because I am a psychology teacher and I really liked the brooding character played by Ryan. While he truly is dangerous as well as VERY menacing, you can't exactly hate him because he is clearly mentally ill and probably suffering from some sort of brain trauma. And wow did Ryan do a really good job portraying this man!

It ` s funny how instinct warns you of something . For example as soon as the company credits read on a credit score . It will read as . You have credit and you need a new credit rating and they will ask you why you need a credit . So how can you have credit that you can't really pay off. So that's when your instinct is to look at your credit. And it will ask you about how you were treated by the credit bureaus . and how much you owe them. And then your credit score will be affected.

Note: After writing this review I see that this listing is indeed about the TV series and not the original film. My mistake. I thought IMDb for a database for movies, not TV shows. But since most people will look up this film under BAGDAD CAFE and not OUT OF ROSENHEIM, which, strangely, is the name this film is listed under on IMDb, I'll leave this comment here.Maybe I missed something, but when I read that other review it seemed to be entirely a review of the CBS series -- which must have been loosely based on this film.

There 's hell to pay when you cross Nami Matsushima ( Meiko Kaji ) , Female Scorpion , and a group of her classmates at the end of the film. But this is not about Nami , or the film it is about. It is a new type of action film, one where the main character is not a hero. This time around the main character, Kaji , goes on a journey , taking along a few other classmates as well as the teacher , and the film itself. And that's the problem with this film.

Bad , bad , and did I mention bad ? Aside from the comical monster terrorizing the workers the funniest part of the story was how in the end all the monsters were gone and the building was once again safe for all to see. I love that this book has such a nice balance of action and storytelling. It was a great story to tell, and the illustrations in the book add so much detail to the world and characters of the book that it is truly a pleasure to read. There is so many twists to the story that I can only imagine what will happen after the book is finished.

If you came here, it's because you've already seen this film and were curious what others had to say about it.I feel for you, I *really* do. And I profusely apologize as a Canadian (because that's what we do) that this film ever had to cross your eyes, if only for a moment. I hear there is no cure for the retinal bleeding reported out of every dozen cases.I, like everyone else, rented this movie believing it to be some stupid B-movie ripoff of Blade. I thought, "sure I could use a good laugh at a stupid movie."

I mean , nothing happens , 5 dumb kids go to Oklahoma to find a magical forest of marijuana ... and they fall in love with marijuana . It's all a bit surreal. So I don't think we should be too surprised if they make a film, because they'll probably try to do it again. I'd expect that to be in the next three years, with two of the films having been in development for quite a bit longer. I have faith that they'll figure it out, because the first film was such a huge success that it will have to be.

I'm a big horror film buff, particularly of the 1980's subgenres. Name one  I've probably seen it. Last year, a new little horror movie that seemed to slip under mainstream radar called "Saw" was about to hit theaters. I was moderately excited. Having not heard anything about it, I thought it looked quite promising judging by the previews and posters (well, except the back and white ones with the severed hands and feet...those just looked terrible!) I saw the film on opening night. It was one of the worst experiences of my life.

I'd love to have a copy so I can play certain parts over and over again. I am interested in buying a copy of this movie, but cannot find it anywhere.I am wondering if if anyone has any suggestions how to find it? I've tried e-bay, Amazon.com, Internet searches, and am completely frustrated.

Like Margot in "Fear of Fear" falls victim of her ambitious husband, like Fox in "Fox and his friends" is driven into suicide by his boyfriend who took all his money away, like Xaverl Bolwieser in "The Stationsmaster's Wife" who goes to prison in order to give his cheating wife a chance to get rid of him, like Hermann Hermann who seeks refuge in insanity in order to flee his stupid wife and bankrupt company, so also Hans Epp is a victim of the German "Wirtschaftswunder"-Society after World War II in R.W.

The director Godfrey Reggio must be a very charming and persuasive man for this dreadfully botched project to have seen the light of day at all, since it's a far cry from the highly polished look of the films released over the last few decades. And if you ever find yourself in one of the cinemas in London in the summer of 2019, you can just imagine the horror that awaits you. So why do I continue to enjoy this film? For me it's a combination of its unique look and the wonderful cast that makes it a delight for the eyes.

From the makers of Underworld , we have , by far , the worst werewolf movie I have ever seen, and it is not even at the top of the list. Let me set the record straight. So why did I even bother watching this thing? Why did I watch the movie anyway? Well, I don't want to spoil it so I'm not going to give away anything. So let me tell you all my thoughts about the movie, my expectations and my dislikes. I hope to give everyone a fair idea of what I thought, and what I felt after watching the movie.

`` Cat In The Brain '' is a series of extremely violent sequences knitted together by a plot that feels like it was ripped from a movie. ''It'' doesn't really work as a movie. It's just one of the best things you could ever see. There's a kind of goth-ness to the film, and I'm not sure that's a bad thing, but it does feel a little derivative of other films, so it's probably not something that's gonna be a big hit at the box office.

It 's worth boning up on the Hindu pantheon before watching this film . Three main female deities -- wise and powerful, but also sexy and seductive -- are played by Bollywood screen legends. But it's the romantic interplay of the male deities with their respective female counterparts that really steals the show. And while the movie does a great job of portraying Hinduism in a real-world setting, and while there is an obvious reference to real-world religious rituals, it never gets bogged down by it. In fact, it all works quite well on a very human level.

Idiots go camping and act like idiots before they finally die like idiots, yes Camp Blood (or if you're wanting an awful, badder than bad pun that suits a badder than bad film, "Camp Bloody awful"), is so bad it's actually quite depressing to watch. And it has all the ingredients to be a perfectly bad film... Awful acting-check. Bad script-check. Tacky effects-check no originality whatsoever-double check. It doesn't even attempt to be different, and is riddled with every predicted cliché imaginable.

How many movies are there that you can think of when you see a movie like this ? I ca nnt think of a few, but I will definitely be looking at this. I loved it so much. As for my other question, I do know the author. I know the actor and director. I did not know the writer. If you know any good ones I would like to see. I saw this film in a theater and enjoyed it. I liked how it was shot. And the characters were original.

The movie uses random events of historical significance as its backdrop and willy-nilly criss-crosses the lives and time-lines of its characters. The plot is as one-sided, predictable, and one-sided as it can possibly be. You may even have the feeling that it was made to be re-used in other movies. The plot of this movie is so poor, so weak, that it fails to live up to the hype, but it does live up to the hype and the hype alone. The plot is so weak that this movie deserves to become the worst film in history.

This movie is truly unbelievable, in every sense of the word. I couldn't believe what I was seeing, and hearing, and I didn't believe it anyhow. Hepburn is probably my favorite actress, but this was ridiculous. Being a hillbilly myself, I know what it should sound like, and it's not Kate's Back Bay accent. The only thing I found funnier was the fact that the guy who played Charlie Chan so many times, Sydney Toler, was cast as another one of the hillbillies, with accent to match.

In Sweet Water, the ambitious entrepreneur Dick Krantz (Jim Storm) is constructing a resort in the middle of the desert under the protest of the Katonahs. When three workers find some Indian relics and bones in a ditch in the site, they accidentally release the giant skeleton like creature known as Bone Eater and their bones are devoured by the monster. The half-breed Sheriff Steve Evans (Bruce Boxleitner) a.k.a. Running Wolf is in charge of the investigation of the disappearance of the workers, being pressed by Krantz to arrest the protesters.

This episode sucks.Over the past few years I have watched all episodes of `` Next Generation '' and `` Voyager'' and all the episodes of the `` X-files''. I even rewatched the first season of the `` Lost'' series.I know that some episodes have a higher quality then others. For example the episode `` The Eye '' has one of the best quality shows ever. It is a great example of the quality of shows. But the quality of this episode is lower. The writing is weak and weak. The acting is poor.

The main reason for watching this picture is to savor the brilliant performance of S. Ephata Merkerson . Ms. Merkerson is a young lady who has all the natural gifts that you would expect of a model, yet she possesses some of the most stunning features you would expect from a beautiful girl of the 21st century. She is beautiful and graceful, and her skin has the color and consistency that you would expect from someone with that kind of pigment in her hair and her skin. In fact, she has a very pale color in her blonde hair, and a dark color on her face.

So one day I was in the video store looking for a movie . I came across this and rented it. I couldn’t decide if I wanted to buy or rent. The film was a documentary and was a lot of fun to view. The film was about a man’s story of losing his family in a car accident. He was a good looking guy. When I was done watching this movie, I felt like I really understood how that happened. The accident that was going on in that car, the story of a man who loses his family.

This is one of those movies where the acting, set location, direction, and effects were so bad you need to rent a copy get 5 or 6 buddies, a keg of beer, sit down and watch it. To borrow from the late Douglas Adams, "Watching this movie will be like having your brains smashed out by a slice of lemon... wrapped around a large gold brick. ".What is wrong? Everything. British actors posing as Americans, there have been many that can pull it off like Bob Hoskins but he isn't in this one.

Hey what a great idea to open a film - show someone ` s home movie . Drama schools must have it easy , with the students getting a free movie at the beginning of classes. I wonder if they will even let the kids know what to expect. And then there is the question of what is ' good enough ' and what is ' too good to be true '. Well, if they can do it in a commercial theatre , it is a great thing. But if they have to do it in a private school like ours , well then it's not so wonderful.

Watched the director's cut last night...glad it was free rental, even a dollar would have been too much for me to pay to watch this attempt at "film noir". The anachronisms (modern telephones) were annoying to me, not clever, seeming more like budget constraints than anything else. The "non-traditional" casting I also found distracting. If I have to stop following the story to wonder "what the heck is the black chick/drag queen doing there?" then the storyteller has failed me. Again, not clever in my opinion but annoying and irritating, and very film school final project-ish.

His music, especially what we hear of it here, is very slow. From around the time of Bach's death composers had been working out ways of making music progress at a slower and slower pace: over a century later, Wagner and then Mahler wrote pieces that are about as slow as it is possible for music to get. -Of course, one can cheat by writing a 4/4 march and then specifying a tempo of, say, semiquaver = 1, but that tempo wouldn't be the correct tempo. Wagner and Mahler wrote music that is PROPERLY played at a snail's pace.

I 've read the positive comments on this movie . I assume people who were in this movie must 've had a great time on the shoot . I was not too dissapointed . I saw the trailer of the film and I got really excited . It looks really good . I have to agree with one poster 's comment that there is too much action . It seemed like the movie did not go slow enough to please me . The story lines and the characters are very well written . I also liked that there were several scenes in this movie that could have been better .

For a series that was inspired by Kolchak , it 's ironic that The X Files first attempt at a TV show came in 1986, when a few writers and a cast of writers met at NBC Studios in case they could come up with a project. The plan was to air the show as an anthology on the Fox Network in late 1987. Well, a few months down the line they got a phone call to say they were not doing an anthology, so we did a pilot in 1985. We did five episodes of that, but they never aired.

This is the last episode of the Goldenboy OVA series. Kentaro finds himself working in an animation studio, which is rather interesting if you don't know anything about the way anime studios were run. Besides episode 3, this was probably the least risqué, but it had a nice girl interest, as well as a surprise reunion from others in the previous episodes. My only complaint about this episode is it seemed a little too short, but at the same time this may have only been because it was the only original script for the show that wasn't based on one of the manga chapters.

'Do n't Look In the Basement ' is so easy to knock but the truth is simply that Brownrigg is very good at keeping his players on the edge of the world. And that's just the reality. In fact, it's a great place to get away from the outside world for the first time. This is a good club and a great footballing place. And we want to stay there. The fans have spoken and we will do the very best to keep them. We will do all that we can to support them.

There were only two redeeming features about this movie; the beauty of Bucharest and its architecture, and the way they depicted the transformation from human form to wolf form. Forget about the plot or storyline from the book - they're completely absent from this movie. In fact, about the only things carried over from the book are the names of the main players. Even then you'll barely recognize the characterizations. If the film makers had made a good movie, even though unrelated to the book, I wouldn't have been so disappointed. Unfortunately, they did not.

I have not seen this movie since 1979 when I was a teenager . I grew up with the Sesame Street movies, which was one of the reasons for watching it. I am a big fan of the show and of the books. This is probably my favorite Sesame Street movie, but you can't really argue with the success of the other movies. My friend has a copy of this and said he doesn't want to watch the TV show anymore because he likes the books as well. So if you are in the same boat I would recommend it.

I saw this movie when I was very young living in Houston , Texas . I really enjoyed this movie because I didn't think I would like it as much as I did , although I didn't think the story line was very well constructed . Well , it turned out that I LOVED this movie . My parents didn't really know what to think but I told my little brother about it so he could understand it better . I think the main reason I enjoyed this movie was because of the characters that were involved . I loved that there was more to the story line than the main characters .

This is one of a rarity of movies , where instead of a bowl of popcorn one should watch it. For those who are looking for more, here is the synopsis :

“You have to be a genius to get into the world of space, but an average person to be a pilot. So what do we have here? You’ve heard the story, we have the evidence, but what are the odds of us getting a crack at this one? It’ll be the most amazing, mind-blowing experience ever!”

I have been wanting to watch this film for a long time .
